MHB 1
1 .  O For a thousand tongues to sing 
My great Redeemer’s praise, 
The glories of my God and King, 
The triumphs of His grace!!
	 ~ 	1 . MEENYA ngyiramá apem matow ndwom
Meyi mo Pomfò ayɛw,
Makamfo me Hen N'enyimnyam,
N'adom no konyimdzi.

MHB 1
2 .  My gracious Master and my God, 
Assist me to proclaim, 
To spread through all the earth abroad 
The honours of Thy name.
	 ~ 	2 . Mo Wùra dɔyɛfo, me Nyankopon,
Boa m' ma mombɔ dawur,
Memfa Wo dzin n'enyidzi no
Mentahye mbea nyina.

MHB 1
3 .  Jesus ! The name that charms our fears, 
That bids our sorrows cease; 
’Tis music in the sinner’s ears,
’Tis life, and health, and peace.
	 ~ 	3 . Jesus! dzin a otu hen suro,
Ͻma ’werɛhow b՝ᴐ adze;
Ͻyɛ sanku wo abᴐn asom’,
Ͻyε nkwa nye asomdwee.

MHB 1
4 .  He speaks, and, listening to His voice,
New life the dead receive, 
The mournful, broken hearts rejoice, 
The humble poor believe.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔkasa, na wotsie Ne ndze a,
Ewufo nya nkwa bio,
Akoma wѐrɛhonyi dzi dɛw,
Hianyi bùrobùro gye dzi.

MHB 1
5 .  He breaks the power of cancelled sin, 
He sets the prisoner free; 
His blood can make the foulest clean, 
His blood availed for me.
	 ~ 	5 . Odwuruw bᴐn no tum koraa,
Otu daduanyi duam';
No bᴐgyaa tum san fifo ho,
Odzii nyim maa mo so.

MHB 1
6 .  See all your sins on Jesus laid: 
The Lamb of God was slain, 
His soul was once an offering made 
For every soul of man.	 ~ 	6 . Hom bᴐn nyina da Jesus do;
Wokum Nyame Eguambaa,
Wɔdze Ne kra so bɔɔ afɔr
Maa obiara ne kra.

MHB 10
1 . NOW, thank we all our God, 
With hearts, and hands, and voices; 
Who wondrous things hath done, 
In whom His world rejoices; 
Who, from our mothers’ arms, 
Hath blessed us on our way 
With countless gifts of love,
And still is ours to-day.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN akoma, nsa nye ndze
Yɛdze da nyame ase;
Ɔayɛ anwanwadze,
Wiadze dzi ho ehurusi;
Ofi hɛn na ne yamu,
Ɔdze dɔ akyɛ dze
Ehyira hɛen kwan nyina m',
Na ɔda ho yɛ hɛndze.

MHB 10
2 . O may this bounteous God 
Through all our life be near us, 
With eve- joyful hearts 
And blessed peace to cheer us, 
And keep us in His grace, 
And guild us when perplexed, 
And free us from all ills 
In this world and the next.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔkyɛso Nyankopɔn
Ɔnka hɛn ho daa nyina,
Ɔmfa ahotɔ krɔnn,
Ɔndom hɛn akoma daa,
Ɔnkora hɛn N'adom mu,
Ongya hɛn nkɔntɔnkye m',
Na ɔmpa hɛn mbusu,
Sesei na ndaamba so.

MHB 10
3 . All praise and thanks to God 
The Father now be given, 
The Son, and Him who reigns 
With Them in the highest heaven: 
The one, eternal God, 
Whose earth and heaven adore; 
For thus it was, is now, 
And shall be evermore. 	Amen.	 ~ 	3 . Ayεyi nye ndaase
Ɔnkã Nyame sor Egya,
Nye Ne Ba Kortonoo,
Nye Nyame Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn:
Ɔkorsa Nyankopɔn
Sor nye asaase sɔr No;
Mbrɛ ahyɛse ɔtse n'.	
Ɔtse dɛm afebɔɔ.    Amen.

MHB 100
1 . ONE there is, above all others,
    Well deserves the name of friend;
    His is love beyond a brothers,
    Costly, free, and knows no end:
   They who once His kindness prove,
   Find it everlasting love!
	 ~ 	1 . OBI wɔ hɔ a ɔkyɛn obiara, 
Ɔsɛ dɛ yɛfrɛ N'nyɛnko;
No dɔ kyɛn onua mpo no dɔ, 
Aboɔdzen, wɔnntɔ, onnyi ewiei;
Hɔn a wɔsɔ No dɔ n' hwɛ n', 
Hu dɛ ɔyɛ onnyiewiei dɔ.

MHB 100
2 . Which of all our friends to save us,
    Could or would have shed their blood ?
    But our Jesus died to have us
    Reconciled, in Him to God:
    This was boundless love indeed;
    Jesus is a friend in need.
	 ~ 	2 . Nyɛnko bɛn na ɔbɛgye hɛn a, 
Nkyɛ obotum ehue no bɔgyaa n'?
Naaso hɛn Jesus wui gyee hɛn; 
Ɔkaa hɛn nye Nyame bɔɔ m';
Iyi, dɔ a onnyi mbanano a;
Jesus yɛ nyɛnko mapa.

MHB 100
3 . When He lived on earth abasd,
    Friend of sinners was His name;
    Now, above all glory raisd,
    He rejoices in the same:
    Still He calls them brethren, friends,
    And to all their wants attends.
	 ~ 	3 . Ber a ɔbaa adasa wiadze no,
Ne dzin nye Abɔn Damfoedu;
Afei ɔwɔ N'enyimnyam mu,
Odzi dɛw wɔ dzin yi mu;
Ɔfrɛ hɛn 'nuamom, ndamfo,
Na ɔhwɛ hɛn ehiadze nyina.

MHB 100
4 . O for grace our hearts to soften!
    Teach us, Lord, at length to love;
    We, alas! forget too often,
    What a Friend we have above:
    But when home our souls are brought,
    We shall love Thee as we ought.

	 ~ 	4 . Nkyɛ hɛn akoma aagow!
Ewuradze, kyerɛ hɛn, yɛndɔ;
Hɛndze, ao, hɛn werɛ fir ntsɛ! 
Nyɛnko bi a yɛwɔ n' sor hɔ a!
Sɛ wɔdze hɛn 'kra ba fie a,
Yɛbɔdɔ Wo dɛ mbrɛ ɔsɛ.

MHB 101
1 . Rest of the weary, 
    Joy of the sad,
    Hope of the dreary, 
    Light of the glad;
    Home of the stranger, 
    Strength to the end,
    Refuge from danger, 
    Saviour and Friend
	 ~ 	1 . ABRƐFO ahomgye,
'Werɛhofo dɛw,
Ehufo enyidar,
Ɔhɔho ne fie,
Daa ahoɔdzen,
Mbusu m' guandɔbea,
'Gyenkwa, Nyɛnko.

MHB 101
2 . Pillow where, lying, 
    Love rests its head,
    Peace of the dying, 
    Life of the dead:
    Path of the lowly, 
    Prize at the end,
    Breath of the holy, 
    Saviour and Friend
	 ~ 	2 . Sundzi a ɔdɔ dze
Ne tsir to do,
Hɔn a woruwu asomdwee,
Ewufo nkwa,
'Hobrɛadzefo kwan,
Ewiei akatua,
'Hotsewfo ahom,
'Gyenkwa, Nyɛnko.

MHB 101
3 . When my feet stumble, 
   To Thee Ill cry,
   Crown of the humble, 
   Cross of the high;
   When my steps wander, 
   Over me bend,
   Truer and fonder,
   Saviour and Friend.
	 ~ 	3 . Sɛ me nan fintsiw a, 
M'bosu afrɛ W';
Abrɛfo ahenkyɛw,
Ɔsor mbeamudua,
Sɛ me nan fom a,
Bɔ mo ho ban,
Nokwafo, dɔfo,
'Gyenkwa, Nyɛnko.

MHB 101
4 . Ever confessing
    Thee, I will raise
    Unto Thee blessing, 
    Glory and praise:
    All my endeavor, 
    World without end,
    Thine to be ever,
    Savior and Friend.	 ~ 	4 . M'bɔbɔ W' dzin akyerɛ,
M'bɛma Wo do,
M'behyira W' mahyɛ W' 'nyam,
M'beyi W' ayɛw;
Mo ndwuma nyina,
Wiadze a onnyi ewiei,
 Meyɛ Wodze daa,
'Gyenkwa, Nyɛnko.

MHB 102
1 . Immortal love, for ever full, 
    For ever flowing free, 
    For ever shared, for ever whole, 
    A never-ebbing sea: 
	 ~ 	1 . BƐKYEBO Dɔ a daa ayɛ ma,
Daa nyina ɔpem kwa,
Wɔkyɛ ma obiara nya bi,
Ɔwɔ hɔ daa, ɔnnsa.

MHB 102
2 . Our outward lips confess the Name 
    All other names above; 
    Love only knoweth whence it came, 
    And comprehendeth love. 
	 ~ 	2 . Hɛn anofamfa bɔ Dzin no,
Dzin no sen edzin nyina;
Ɔdɔ nko na onyim mbrɛ ofi,
Na ɔtse ɔdɔ ase.

MHB 102
3 . We may not climb the heavenly steeps 
    To bring the Lord Christ down; 
    In vain we search the lowest deeps, 
    For Him no depths can drown. 
	 ~ 	3 . Bi a yɛnnkɔfow akɔ sor,
'Wuradze Christ aba famu;
Yɛhwehwɛ No wɔ bun mu kwa,
Bun biara nnkɛmen No.

MHB 102
4 . In joy of inward peace, or sense
   Of sorrow over sin,
   He is His own best evidence,
   His witness is within.
	 ~ 	4 . Asomdwee mu enyigye anaa
Bɔn mu awerɛhow,
Odzi N'ankasa ho dase,
Ne dasee wɔ No mu.

MHB 102
5 . For warm, sweet, tender, even yet, 
    A present help is He; 
    And faith still has its Olivet, 
    And love its Galilee. 
	 ~ 	5 . Dɛw mu o, nwen mu o, aber biara 
Ɔyɛ Ɔboafo kɛse;
Gyedzi da ho wɔ N' Olivet, 
Ɔdɔ wɔ N' Galilee.

MHB 102
6 . The healing of His seamless dress 
    Is by our beds of pain; 
    We touch Him in life’s throng and press, 
    And we are whole again. 
	 ~ 	6 . N'atar a wɔammpam mu ayarsa n',
Ɔbɛn hɛn yaw mpa mpo;
Yɛper na yɛdze hɛn nsa ka N',
Na yenya ayarsa.

MHB 102
7 . Through Him the first fond prayers are said 
    Our lips of childhood frame, 
    The last low whispers of our dead 
    Are burdened with His Name. 
	 ~ 	7 . Yedua No do dze hɛn mpaabɔ, 
Mbofra mpaabɔ mpo koraa;
Dza ewufo ka no berɛww mpo,
Ne dzin ahyɛ mu ma.

MHB 102
8 . O Lord and Master of us all, 
    Whate’er our name or sign, 
    We own Thy sway, we hear Thy call, 
    We test our lives by Thine. 	 ~ 	8 . Hɛn nyina hɛn Ewuradze na hɛn Wura,
Mbrɛ hɛn dzin tse biara,
Yedzi W'ekyir, yɛtse Wo frɛ,
Yɛdze W' sɔ hɛn bra hwɛ.

MHB 103
1 . O Lord and Master of us all,
    Whate'er our name or sign,
    We own Thy sway, we hear Thy call,
    We test our lives by Thine.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN nyina hɛn Ewuradze na hɛn Wura,
Mbrɛ hɛn dzin tse biara,
Yedzi W'ekyir, yɛtse Wo frɛ
Yɛdze W' sɔ hɛn bra hwɛ.

MHB 103
2 . Thou judgest us; Thy purity
    Doth all our lusts condemn;
    The love that draws us nearer Thee
    Is hot with wrath to them.
	 ~ 	2 . Ibun hɛn atsɛn, Wo krɔnkrɔnyɛ
Bu hɛn akɔndɔ nyina fɔ;
Yinom yɛ ebufuw ma 
Wo dɔ a Ɔtwe hɛn bɛn Wo no.

MHB 103
3 . Our thoughts lie open to Thy sight
    And naked to Thy glance
    Our secret sins are in the light
    Of Thy pure countenance.
	 ~ 	3 . Hɛn nsusui nyina da W'enyim;
Da W'enyim adagyaw,
Bɔn a yɛdze esuma nyina
Wo kan no hyerɛn do.

MHB 103
4 . Yet, weak and blinded though we be,
    Thou dost our service own;
    We bring our varying gifts to Thee,
    And Thou rejectest none.
	 ~ 	4 . Yɛyɛ mberɛw, yɛyɛ efurafo mpo a, 
Otwar dɛ egye hɛn som;
Yɛdze hɛn akyɛdze ahorow brɛ W',
Ɔwo nnkɔpow biara.

MHB 103
5 . Apart from Thee all gain is loss,
    All labor vainly done;
    The solemn shadow of the cross
    Is better than the sun.
	 ~ 	5 . Yekwetsir Wo a yɛhwer adze nyina,
Ndwuma nyina yɛ gyan;
Wo mbeamudua no sunsum mpo 
Ɔhyerɛn sen ewia.

MHB 103
6 .  Our Friend, our Brother, and our Lord,
     What may Thy service be?
     Nor name, nor form, nor ritual word,
     But simply following Thee.
	 ~ 	6 . Hɛn Nyɛnko, Nua na hɛn Ewuradze, 
Yensi dɛn yɛnsom Wo?
Nnyɛ dzin, nnyɛ som ho nhyehyɛɛ bi 
Dɛ W'ekyir a yedzi nko.

MHB 103
7 .  We faintly hear, we dimly see,
     In differing phrase we pray;
     But dim or clear, we own in Thee
     The Light, the Truth, the Way.	 ~ 	7 . Yɛnntse asɛm yie, yemmbu adze yie,
Yɛbɔ mpaa bi na bi;
Ɔwo nye Kan n', Nokwar n' na Kwan, 
Dɛ mbrɛ ɔtse biara.

MHB 104
1 . THOU great Redeemer, dying Lamb,
We love to hear of Thee;
No music’s like Thy charming name,
Nor half so sweet can be.
	 ~ 	1 . Pomfo kɛse, Nyame Eguambaa, 
Yɛdɔ Wo ho n-sɛm;
Ndwom biara nnyi hɔ a ɔyɛ dɛw
Dɛ Wo dzin nwanwa no.

MHB 104
2 . Our Jesus shall be still our theme
While in this world we stay:
We’ll sing our Jesu’s lovely name
When all things else decay.
	 ~ 	2 . Ber a yɛwɔ wiadze mu yi, 
Jesus nye hɛn nkɔmbɔ:
Na ndzɛmba nyina so sɛɛ a
Jesus bɛyɛ hɛ ndwom.

MHB 104
3 . When we appear in yonder cloud,
With all that favoured throng,
Then will we sing more sweet, more loud,
And Christ shall be our song.	 ~ 	3 . Da a yɛbɔfora esiarfo 
Wɔ sor man mu noho n'
Yɛbɛkam' yɛatow ndwom dɛɛdɛw,
Na Christ bɛyɛ hɛn ndwom.

MHB 105
1 . JESUS, the First and Last,
On Thee my soul is cast:
Thou didst Thy work begin
By blotting out my sin;
Thou wilt the root remove,
And perfect me in love.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, 'Hyɛse na Ewiei,
Me kra twer Wo nko ara;
Ɔwo pepaa mo bɔn
Dze hyɛɛ W'edwuma ase;
Ibotu m' bɔn ase

MHB 105
2 . Yet when the work is done,
The work is but begun:
Partaker of Thy grace,
I long to see Thy face;
The first I prove below,
The last I die to know.	 ~ 	2 Na esi m' pi wɔ ɔdɔ m'.

. Naaso edwuma n' sa a,
Na mama ahyɛ ase bio:
Emi W'adom dzifo,
Morohwehwɛ W'enyim;
Sɛ mosɔ hwɛ wɔ ha a,
Na muwu a, m'bohu Wo.

MHB 106
1 . JESU ! the very thought is sweet,
In that dear name all heart-joys meet;
But  sweeter than  the  honey far
The glimpses of His presence are.
	 ~ 	1 . JESU, Wo ho adwen mpo yɛ dɛw,
Dzin yi ma m'akoma nyina enyi gye;
Naaso sɛ yɛtse Wo nka a,
Ɔyɛ hɛn dɛw sen ewo mpo.

MHB 106
2 . No word is sung more sweet than this,
No name is heard more full of bliss,
No thought brings sweeter comfort nigh
Than Jesus, son of God most high.
	 ~ 	2 . Asɛm yi yɛ dɛw sen ndwom nyina, 
Dzin bi nnyi a nhyira wɔ m' sen no, 
Adwen bi mma hɛn ahotɔ dɛ 
Sorsornyi Jesus Nyame Ba n'.

MHB 106
3 . I seek for Jesus in repose,
When round my heart its chambers close;
Abroad, and when I shut the door,
I long for Jesus evermore.
	 ~ 	3 . Jesus mu na merepɛ ahomgye, 
Ber a ogyina m'akoma abow ekyir;
Wiadze ma motow N' abow mu a, 
Mo kɔn dɔ Jesus ma ɔbor do.

MHB 106
4 . With Mary in the morning gloom
I seek for Jesus at the tomb;
For  Him, with love’s most earnest cry,
I seek with heart and not with eye .
	 ~ 	4 . Anapa bɔw m' menye Mary
 Kɔhwehwɛ Jesus nda no do;
Mohwehwɛ No ɔdɔ mu a
Medze m'akoma, nnyɛ m'enyi.

MHB 106
5 . Jesus, to God the Father gone,
Is seated on the heavenly throne:
My heart hath also passed from me,
That where He is there it may be.
	 ~ 	5 . Jesus kɔ Nyame Egya Ne nkyɛn, 
Ɔtse sor ahengua no do;
M'akoma so efi mo mu

MHB 106
6 . We follow Jesus now, and raise
The voice of prayer, the hymn of praise
That He at last may make us meet 
With Him to gain the heavenly seat.	 ~ 	6 Dɛ ɔbɛyɛ a ɔnye N' bɛtsena.},

. Yedzi Jesus ekyir sesei,
Yɛbɔ mpaa tow ayɛyi ndwom yi
Dɛ ekyir no obehyira hɛn,
Nye No enya sor ahengua n'

MHB 107
1 . O JESUS, King most wonderful!
Thou Conqueror renowned;
Thou sweetness most ineffable,
In whom all joys are found!
	 ~ 	1 . O JESUS Ɔhen nwanwanyi!
Konyimdzifo a agye dzin;
Yenntum nnka mbrɛ isi yɛ dɛw,
Dɛw nyina wɔ Wo mu.

MHB 107
2 . When once Thou visitest the heart,
Then truth begins to shine,
Then earthly vanities depart,
Then kindles love divine.
	 ~ 	2 . Sɛ ehɛn akoma mu a,
Na nokwar hyɛ ase hyerɛn,
Wiadze egyangyandze fi hɔ
Na okenyan Nyame dɔ.

MHB 107
3 . O Jesus, Light of all below!
Thou Fount of living fire,
Surpassing all the joys we know,
And all we can desire:
	 ~ 	3 . O Jesus, wiadze yi mu kan!
Ɔwo, gya a onndum farbaa,
Esen dɛw a yenyim nyinara
Na dza yɛhwehwɛ nyina.

MHB 107
4 . Jesus, may all confess Thy name,
Thy wondrous love adore,
And, seeking Thee, themselves inflame
To seek Thee more and more.
	 ~ 	4 . Jesus, ma obiara mbɔ Wo dzin,
Ntonton W'anwanwa dɔ, 
Na wɔhwehwɛ Wo a, kenyan hɔn 
Ma wɔnhwehwɛ W' mbordo.

MHB 107
5 . Jesus, may all confess Thy name,
Thy wondrous love adore,
And, seeking Thee, themselves inflame
To seek Thee more and more.
	 ~ 	5 . Hɛn tɛkyerɛma behyira Wo daa, 
Ma yɛndɔ Wo nkotoo,
Na daa hɛn abrabɔ mu so
Yɛnda Wo su edzi.

MHB 107
6 . Abide with us, and let Thy light
Shine, Lord, on every heart;
Dispel the darkness of our night,
And joy to all impart.
	 ~ 	6 . Enye hɛn ntsena na ma Wo kan
Nhyerɛn akoma biara m';
Yi hɛn anago sum n' fi hɔ,
Na ma hɛn enyigye.

MHB 107
7 . Jesus, our Love and Joy, to Thee,
The Father’s holy Son,
All might, and praise, and glory be,
While endless ages run.  Amen.	 ~ 	7 . Jesus, hɛn dɔ na enyigye, 
Egya Ne Ba krɔnkrɔn,
Tum, ayɛyi, 'nyimnyam wɔ Wo,
Mbersantsen, mfesantsen.    Amen.

MHB 108
1 . JESU, the very thought of Thee
with sweetness fills my breast;
But sweeter far Thy face to see,
And in Thy presence rest
	 ~ 	1 . Jesu, Wo ho adwen nko mpo 
Dze dɛw hyɛ mo mu ma;
Na meba m' bohu W' enyim dze a,
Edɛw no bɔbor do.

MHB 108
2 . Nor  voice can sing, nor heart can frame,
Nor can the memory find
A sweeter sound than Jesus’s  name,
Oh Saviour of mankind!
	 ~ 	2 . O adasa hɛn Agyenkwa, 
Dzin biara nnto Wodze a
Yɛdze enyigye bɔtow ho ndwom,
Na yɛadwen ho dɔ mu.

MHB 108
3 . O Hope of every contrite heart,
O Joy of all the meek,
To those who fall how kind Thou art!
How good to those who seek!
	 ~ 	3 . O 'koma bobɔe n' Enyidar, 
Abrɛfo Enyigye,
Iye ma asehwefo na
Hɔn a wɔhwehwɛ Wo.

MHB 108
4 . But what to those who find? Ah! this
Nor tongue nor pen can show:
The love of Jesus, what it is
None but His loved ones know.
	 ~ 	4 . Na hɔn a wohu Wo nka dɛn? 
Wonnhu dza wɔnka mpo:
Hɔn a wɔtse Wo dɔ nko ara
Na wonyim ne dɛw no.

MHB 108
5 . Jesu, our only joy be Thou,
As Thou our prize wilt be;
Jesu, be Thou  our glory now,
And through eternity.    Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Jesu, yɛ hɛn enyigye ndɛ, 
Hɛn ndaamba akatua;
Jesu, yɛ hɛn Enyimnyam ndɛ
Na mfesantsen nyina.    Amen.

MHB 109
1 . JESUS, Thou Joy of loving hearts,
Thou fount of life, Thou light of men. 
From the best bliss that earth imparts  
We turn unfilled to Thee again.
	 ~ 	1 . Jesu, 'koma dɔyɛfo hɔn Dɛw, 
Adasa Kan, nkwa Nsunyiwa,
Wiadze mu ndzepa nntum mmee hɛn,
Yɛdze kɔm yɛdan ba Wo hɔ.

MHB 109
2 . Thy truth unchanged hath ever stood;
Thou savest those that on Thee call; 
To Them that seek Thee Thou art good, 
To them that find Thee, all in all
	 ~ 	2 . Wo nokwar si pi, ɔnnsakyer; 
Nyia ɔfrɛ Wo n' egye no nkwa;
Iye ma nyia ɔhwehwɛ Wo,
Nyia ohu Wo n' N' adze nyina.

MHB 109
3 . We taste Thee, O Thou living Bread,
And long to feast upon Thee still; 
We drink of Thee the fountain-head,
And thirst our souls from Thee to fill
	 ~ 	3 . Yɛsɔ Wo hwɛ, n-kwa Edziban, 
Na hɛn kɔn dɔ yeedzi bi daa;
Yɛnom Wo, n-kwa Esutsen,
Na hɛn kra pɛ ma wɔaahyɛ n' ma.

MHB 109
4 . Our restless spirits yearn for Thee,
Where’re  our changeful lot is cast; 
Glad when Thy gracious smile we see,
Blest when our faith can hold Thee fast.
	 ~ 	4 . Hɛn sunsum haahaa hwehwɛ Wo, 
Mbrɛ ɔbra dze hɛn si biara,
Eyaa W' ano hɛn enyi gye,
Yesuo Wom' a siar aka hɛn.

MHB 109
5 . O Jesus, ever with us stay;
Make all our moments calm and bright;
Chase the dark night of sin away;
Shed o’er the world Thy holy light.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 . O Jesus, nye hɛn ntsena daa, 
Ma hɛn mber pa na asomdwee;
Yi bɔn no sum nyina wɔ hɔ,
Ma Wo kan no nhyerɛn wiadze.    Amen.

MHB 11
1 . WITH gladness we worship,
rejoice as we sing.
Free hearts and free voices how
blessed to bring.
The old, thankful story shall scale Thine abode,
Thou King of all glory, most bountiful God.
	 ~ 	1 . YƐDZE enyigye sɔr, dzi dɛw, yɛtow ndwom,
Yɛdze hɛn siar akoma na hɛn ndze aba,
Ndaase asɛm dadaw no bodu Wo tsenabea,
Ɔwo a eyɛ enyimnyam Hɛn, Nyame yamuyiefo.

MHB 11
2 . Thy right would we give Thee true homage Thy due,
And honour eternal. the universe through.
With all Thy creation, earth, heaven and sea,
In one acclamation we celebrate Thee.
	 ~ 	2 . Dza ɔfata W' yɛdze ma W', enyidzi mapa,
Yɛnye W'abɔdze nyina, sor, asaase na po,
Bɔ m' dze W'ayɛyi ma W' wɔ wiadze mbea nyina,
Yɛdze ɔnosɛɛ tonton, huhor Wo daa nyina.

MHB 11
3 . Renewed by Thy Spirit, redeemed by Thy Son,
Thy children revere Thee for all
Thou hast done.	
O Father! returning to love and to light,
Thy children are yearning to praise Thee aright.
	 ~ 	3 . Wo Sunsum woo hɛn fofor, Wo Ba n' gyee hɛn,
Wo mba dzi Wo nyi wɔ dza ayɛ nyina ntsi,
Egya, Wo mba resan aba dɔ na kan m'.
Yɛreper atonton Wo dɛ mbrɛ ɔsɛ.

MHB 11
4 . We join with angels, and so there is given
From earth Hallelujah, in answer to heaven.
Amen! Be Thou glorious below and above,
Redeeming, victorious, and infinite Love!
	 ~ 	4 . Yɛka abɔfo ho na yɛtow Wo ndwom,
Alleluia! Amà asaase aagye do,
Amen! Enyimnyam nka Wo sor nye ase,
Domankoma dɔ a ɔpon hɛn, konyimdzifo!

MHB 110
1 . JESUS, lover of my soul, 
Let me to Thy bosom fly, 
While the nearer waters roll, 
While the tempest still is high: 
Hide me, O my Saviour, hide, 
Till the storm of life is past;  
Safe into the haven guide, 
O receive my soul at last. 
	 ~ 	1 . Jesu, me kra no Dɔfo, 
Ma munguan mbɛhyɛ Wo bom',
Ber a esu no repem yi,
Ber a ehum no rutu yi,
Me Gyefo, fa me hunta,
Ma ehum no mbɔ mbɛsen;
Gya me kodu berano,
Ao, ewiei no gye me kra.

MHB 110
2 . Other refuge have I none, 
Hangs my helpless soul on Thee; 
Leave, ah! leave me not alone, 
Still support and comfort me: 
All my trust on Thee is stayed, 
All my help from Thee I bring; 
Cover my defenseless head 
With the shadow of Thy wing.
	 ~ 	2 . Minnyi sumabew biara, 
Me kra twer Wo nkotonoo;
Mma nndan mo nkotonoo nngya,
Suo mo mu, kyekye mo werɛ:
Mo werɛ gyina Wo do,
Mo mboa nyina fir wo hɔ;
Fa W' atsaban kɛse no
Kata m' etsikwa yi do.

MHB 110
3 . Thou, O Christ, art all I want, 
More than all in Thee I find.
Raise the fallen, cheer the faint,
Heal the sick, and lead the blind:
Just and holy is Thy name, 
I am all unrighteousness; 
False and full of sin I am,
Thou art full of truth and grace.
	 ~ 	3 . Christ, morohwehwɛ Wo nko, 
Minya W' a menya adze nyina,
Ma mo do si, hyɛ me dzen,
Yɛ m' edur na gye me nkwa:
'Wo na eyɛ tseneneenyi,
'Midze, meyɛ brakyewnyi;
Bɔn na ahyɛ emi ma,
Adom ahyɛ wo so ma.

MHB 110
4 . Plenteous grace with thee is found, 
Grace to cover all my sin; 
Let the healing streams abound, 
Make and keep me pure within: 
Thou of life the fountain art, 
Freely let me take of Thee, 
Spring Thou up within my heart,
Rise to all eternity. Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Adom pii wɔ Wo nsam' a 
Ɔkata mo bɔn nyina do;
Ma nkwa nsu no ɔmpem mbra,
San mo ho na fa me sie:
N-kwa Nsunyiwa nye Woara,
Ma membɛsaw bi monnom,
Bra bɛtaa mo 'koma mu,
Taa mu kɔ mfesantsen nyina.  Amen.

MHB 111
1 . JESUS, these eyes have never seen
That radiant form of Thine;
The veil of sense hangs dark between
Thy blessèd face and mine.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, dɛm enyiwa yi nnhun
Wo frɔdɔɔ hyɛnhyɛnn no;
Adwen m' twamutam ayɛ sum ma
Munnhu Wo siar enyim n'.

MHB 111
2 . I see Thee not, I hear Thee not,
Yet art Thou oft with me;
And earth hath ne’er so dear a spot,
As where I meet with Thee.
	 ~ 	2 . Munntum nnhu Wo, munntum 
        nntse W' nka,
Naaso 'nye m' wɔ hɔ daa;
Asaase nnyi bea papa bi a
Menye Wo bedzi ehyia.

MHB 111
3 . Like some bright dream that comes 
         unsought,
When slumbers o’er me roll,
Thy image ever fills my thought,
And charms my ravished soul.
	 ~ 	3 . Dɛ mbrɛ moso daa a m'enyi nnda,
Ber a 'nyikom aka m' no,
Wo suban hyɛ m'adwen ma araa
Ma me kra nya ahotɔ.

MHB 111
4 . Yet, though I have not seen, and still
Must rest in faith alone;
I love Thee, dearest Lord, and will,
Unseen, but not unknown.
	 ~ 	4 . Kaansa munnhu Wo ma dɛm ntsi 
Meyɛ aweɔn gyedzi mu a,
Modɔ Wo, m'Ewuradze, m'bɔdɔ W';
Munnhu W', na minyim Wo.

MHB 111
5 . When death these mortal eyes shall seal,
And still this throbbing heart,
The rending veil shall Thee reveal,
All glorious as Thou art.	 ~ 	5 . Sɛ owu mua adasa enyiwa 'i
Ma m'akoma hianyi da a, 
Twamutam no bɛtsew ma meehu
W'enyimnyam dɛ mbrɛ ɔtse.

MHB 112
1 . BLESS the Christ of God;
I rest on love divine,
And with unfaltering lip and heart,
I call the Saviour mine.
	 ~ 	1 . MIHYIRA Nyame N' Christ;
Motwer Nyame dɔ no;
Na medze ano na akoma krɔnn, 
Gye Agyenkwa n' yɛ medze.

MHB 112
2 . His cross dispels each doubt:
I bury in His tomb
Each thought of unbeliever and fear,
Each lingering shade of gloom.
	 ~ 	2 . Ne mbeamudua n' tu ekyingye,
Misie ekyingye na suro,
Nye mbusu ho adwen a etsintsim
Nyina wɔ No wumaa n' mu.

MHB 112
3 . I praise the God of grace;
I trust His truth and might;
He calls me His, I call Him mine, 
My God, my joy, my light.
	 ~ 	3 . Miyi adom Nyame ayɛw;
Motwer N' nokwar, No tum n';
Meyɛ Nedze, ɔyɛ medze,
Nyame, me dɛw, me kan.

MHB 112
4 . In Him is only good,
In me is only ill;
My ill but draws His goodness forth,
And me He loveth still.
	 ~ 	4 . Yie nko na ɔwɔ No mu,
Bɔn nko na ɔwɔ mo mu;
Mo bɔn n' mbom twe Ne yie no pue,
Na ɔda ho dɔ me.

MHB 112
5 . 'Tis He Who saveth me,
And freely pardon gives;
I love because He loveth me,
I live because He lives.
	 ~ 	5 . Ɔno na ɔgye me nkwa,
Na ɔdze mo bɔn kyɛ m' koraa;
Mo dɔ N', osiandɛ ɔdɔ me,
Ɔtse ase 'i, metse ase.

MHB 112
6 . My life with Him is hid,
My death has passed away, 
My clouds have melted into light,
My midnight into day.	 ~ 	6 . Mo nkwa hyɛ No mu daa,
Mo wu etwa m' kɔ ampa;
Mo fua nyina anan ayɛ kan;
M'adzesaa adan adzekyee.

MHB 113
1 . WHEN morning gilds the skies,
My heart awaking cries:
May Jesus Christ be praised!
Alike at work and prayer
To Jesus I repair:
May Jesus Christ be praised!
	 ~ 	1 . SƐ anapa wi hyerɛn a, 
M'akoma nyan ka dɛ, 
Ayɛyi nka Jesus! 
Dwumadzi na mpaabɔ m',
Mokɔ Christ Jesus hɔ; 
Ayɛyi nka Jesus!

MHB 113
2 . Does sadness fill my mind?
A solace here I find-
May Jesus Christ be praised!
When evil thoughts molest,
With this I shield my breast-
May Jesus Christ be praised!
	 ~ 	2 . 'Werɛhow hyɛ m' adwen do a?
Minya akomatɔm ' ha
Ayɛyi nka Jesus!
Adwemfi hyɛ mo do a,
Medze 'yi tsew moho 
Ayɛyi nka Jesus!

MHB 113
3 . Be this, when day is past,
Of all my thoughts the last,
May Jesus Christ be praised!
The night becomes as day,
When from the heart we say:
May Jesus Christ be praised!
	 ~ 	3 . Sɛ adzekyee twe no ho a,
M'adwen nyina nyɛ dɛm;
Ayɛyi nka Jesus! 
Adzesaa dan 'dzekyee, 
Ber a yɛka n' hɛn akoma m';
Ayɛyi nka Jesus!

MHB 113
4 . To God, the Word, on high
The hosts of angels cry,
May Jesus Christ be praised!
Let mortals, too , upraise
Their voice in hymns of praise:
May Jesus Christ be praised!
	 ~ 	4 . Abɔfo tow ndwom sor
Ma Nyame, Asɛm no;
Ayɛyi nka Jesus! 
Nyimpa so mma ndze do
Wɔ ndaase nkwom mu dɛ 
Ayɛyi nka Jesus!

MHB 113
5 . Let earth’s wide circle round
In joyful notes resound:
May Jesus Christ be Praised!
Let air, and sea, and sky,
From depth to height, reply:
May Jesus Christ be praised!
	 ~ 	5 . Asaase mba nyina nka
Wɔ enyigye ndwom m' dɛ,
Ayɛyi nka Jesus! 
Mframa na po na wi
Mfi bun mu nkɔ sor dɛ, 
Ayɛyi nka Jesus!

MHB 113
6 . Be this while life is mine,
My canticle divine,
May Jesus Christ be praised!
Be this the eternal song
Through all the ages long,
May Jesus Christ be praised !  Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Ber a mowɔ nkwa mu yi,
Me Nyame ndwom nyɛ dɛ, 
Ayɛyi nka Jesus! 
Hɛn ndwom dabaa nyina mfir
Tsetse ɔdomakoma dɛ,
Ayɛyi nka Jesus!

MHB 114
1 . LET earth and heaven agree,
Angels and men be joined,
To celebrate with me
The Saviour of mankind;
To adore the all-atoning Lamb,
And bless the sound of Jesu’s name.
	 ~ 	1 . SOR nye asaase nyɛ kor,
Nyimpa na abɔfo mbɔ m',
Ma yenyi adasa
Agyenkwa n' ayɛw daa,
Na yɛntonton afɔr 'Guambaa n',
Na yenhyira Jesu Ne dzin.

MHB 114
2 . Jesus, transporting sound!
The joy of earth and heaven;
No other help is found,
No other name is given,
By which we can salvation have;
But Jesus came the world to save.
	 ~ 	2 . Jesus, dzin a ɔtahye! 
Ɔsor nye asaase dɛw; 
Yennya mboa beebiara,
Yennyi dzin biara so a 
Yɛnam do benya hɛn nkwagye; 
Jesus baa wiadze bɛgyee nkwa.

MHB 114
3 . Jesus, harmonious name!
It charms the hosts above;
They evermore proclaim
And wonder at His love;
‘Tis all their happiness to gaze,
‘Tis heaven to see our Jesu’s  face.
 	 ~ 	3 . Jesus, dzin dɛɛdɛw bi! 
Okenyan sor dɔm no;
Wɔpaa m' bɔ Ne dzin no,
No dɔ n' yɛ hɔn nwanwa:
Hɔn enyigye nyina nye dɛ wɔhwɛ N';
Hɛn heaven nye yehu N' enyim.

MHB 114
4 . His name the sinner hears,
And is from sin set free;
‘Tis music in his ears,
‘Tis life and victory;
New songs do now his lips employ,
And dances his glad heart for joy.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔbɔn tse Ne dzin no
Na onya ahotɔ;
Ɔyɛ ndwom wɔ n'asomu,
Ɔyɛ nkwa, konyimdzi;
Ndwom fofor hyɛ ne gyirama ma; 
Onya akoma mu dɛw, ɔsaw.

MHB 114
5 . Stung by the scorpion sin,
My poor expiring soul
The healing sound drinks in,
And is at once made whole:
See there my Lord upon the tree!
I hear, I feel, He died for me.
	 ~ 	5 . Bɔn tse dɛ abowa ka
M'akoma wufo n' a,
Ɔnom yarsa nsu n' bi,
Na onya yarsa hɔ ara;
Hwɛ m'Ewuradze wɔ dua no do!
Metse, mehu - owui maa me.

MHB 114
6 . O unexampled love!
O all-redeeming grace!
How swiftly didst Thou move
To save a fallen race:
What shall  I do to make it known
What Thou for all mankind hast done?
	 ~ 	6 . Ao, ɔdɔ nwanwa bɛn!
Ao nkwagye adom bɛn!
Mbrɛ 'dua baa ntsɛmara
Bɛmaa asehwefo do a!
M'bɛyɛ dɛn m'bɛma woeehu dza 
Ayɛ ama adsa nyina?

MHB 114
7 . O for a trumpet voice,
On all the world to call!
To bid their hearts rejoice
In Him who died for all;
For all my Lord was crucified,
For all, for all my Saviour died.	 ~ 	7 . Meenya totorobɛnto
Dze afrɛ wiadze nyina!
Maama hɔn akoma dɛw,
Nyia owui maa hɔn N' mu!
Wɔbɔɔ Ewuradze mbeamudua m' maa hɔn,
M'Agyenkwa wui maa hɔn nyina.

MHB 115
1 . MY heart and voice I raise,
To spread Messiah’s praise;
Messiah’s praise let all repeat;
The universal Lord,
By whose almighty word
Creation rose in form complete.
	 ~ 	1 . M'AKOMA na gyirama,
Mema do wɔ ayɛyi m'; 
Obiara ntonton Messiah;
Amanaman Nyame a
Ɔdze No tum-sɛm no
Bɔɔ wiadze wiee ma odzii mu.

MHB 115
2 . A servant’s form He wore,
And in His body bore
Our dreadful curse on Calvary:
He like a victim stood,
And poured His sacred blood,
To set the guilty captives free.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔfaa akowaa subea,
Na ɔsoaa hɔn mbusu
Wɔ No honam mu kɔr Calvary; 
Ogyinaa dɛ fɔdzifo,
Na okyii No bɔgyaa krɔnn
Dze maa mbratonyi fahodzi.

MHB 115
3 . But soon the Victor rose
Triumphant o’er His foes,
And led the vanquished host in chains:
He threw their empire down,
His foes compelled to own
O’er all the great Messiah reigns
	 ~ 	3 .  Katakyi no soɛɛr ntsɛm 
Atamfo n' do konyim m'
Na ɔtwee hɔn nkɔnsɔnkɔnsɔn mu:
Ɔbɔɔ hɔn ahenman,
Ɔhyɛɛ hɔn, twee hɔn baa
N'ahendzi ase, Messiah ase.

MHB 115
4 . With mercy’s mildest grace,
He governs all our race
In wisdom, righteousness, and love:
Who to Messiah fly
Shall find redemption nigh,
And all His great salvation prove.
\	 ~ 	4 . Jesus dze mbɔbɔrhu
Dzi No nkorɔfo nyina do
Wɔ nyansa m', ndzeytsenenee, dɔ m',
Nyia ɔba Messiah hɔ
Benya ɔgye mapa,
Na ɔagye No nkwagye n' ato m'.

MHB 115
5 . Hail, Saviour, Prince of peace!
Thy kingdom shall increase,
Till all the world Thy glory see,
And righteousness abound
As the great deep profound,
And fill the earth with purity.	 ~ 	5 . Agyenkwa, Asomdwee Hen! 
W'ahenman no bɛtserɛw,
Kɛpem dɛ yehu W'enyimnyam:
Ndzeyɛtsenenee bɔdɔr
Dɛ krɔnkrɔnyɛ ahyɛ wiadze ma

MHB 116
1 . SING we the King who is coming to reign,
Glory to Jesus, the Lamb that was slain,
Life and salvation His empire shall bring,
Joy to the nations when Jesus is King.

   Come let us sing: Praise to our king,
   Jesus our King, Jesus our king:
   This is our song, who to Jesus belong:
   Glory to Jesus, to Jesus our King.
	 ~ 	1 . YƐTOW Hen a oribedzi adze n' ho ndwom,
Nyimnyam nka Jesus, 'Guambaa a wokum No; 
N'ahendzi dze nkwagye ɔnye siar nam;
Aman nya enyigye, ber a Jesus dzi Hen.
Bra yɛtow hɛn Hen N'ayɛyi,
Jesus, hɛn Hen: Jesus hɛn Hen:
Hɛn a yɛyɛ Nedze n', hɛn ndwom nye dɛ:
'Nyimnyam nka Jesus, nka Jesus, hɛn Hen.

MHB 116
2 . All men shall be well in His marvelous light,
Races long severed His love shall unite,
Justice and truth from His sceptre shall spring,
Wrong shall be ended when Jesus is King.
	 ~ 	2 . Nyimpa nyina bɛtsena Ne kan nwanwa n' mu,
No dɔ bɛka amanaman abɔ m'; 
Nokwar na pɛrpɛr bɛpem efi No mu,
Bɔn ase botu, ber a Jesus dzi Hen.

MHB 116
3 . All shall be well in His kingdom of peace,
Freedom shall flourish and wisdom increase,
Foe shall be friend when His triumph we sing,
Sword shall be sickle when Jesus is King.
	 ~ 	3 . Ne nyina bowie yie, N'asomdwee ahendzi m',
Fahodzi benyin na nyansa etu mpon;
Tamfo bɛyɛ dɔfo, No konyim ntsi,
Nkrantsee dan ofowa, ber a Jesus dzi Hen.

MHB 116
4 . Souls shall be saved from the burden of sin,
Doubt shall not darken His witness within,
Hell hath no terrors, and death hath no sting;
Love is victorious when Jesus is King.
	 ~ 	4 . Wobeyi akra efi bɔn no mpokyerɛ m',
Ekyingye nnkɛyɛ N' asɛm no sunkamm;
Hɛll nnkɛyɛ hu na owu rinnya bɔr; 
Ɔdɔ dzi konyim, ber a Jesus dzi Hen.

MHB 116
5 . Kingdom of Christ, for thy coming we pray,
Hasten, O Father, the dawn of the day
When this new song Thy creation shall sing,
Satan is vanquished and Jesus is King.	 ~ 	5 . Yesɔr ma Christ N'ahendzi ne mbae no,
Egya, ma adzekyee no nyɛ ntsɛm mbra; 
Ma W'abɔdze fofor n' ntow hɛn ndwom yi,
'Bɔnsam dzi 'kogu na Jesus dzi Hen.

MHB 117
1 . HARK! The herald-angels sing 
 Glory to the new-born King, 
 Peace on earth, and mercy mild,
God and sinners reconciled.
Joyful, all ye nations ,rise, 
Join the triumph of the skies;
With the angelic host proclaim,
Christ is born in Bethlehem.

        Hark! The herald-angels sing
        Glory to the new-born King.
	 ~ 	1 . Tsie! abɔfo ruhua dɛ 
Wɔawo hɛn Hen nyimnyamfo n',
Asaase wɔ asomdwee,
Nyame na abɔn abɔm'.
Aman nyina, hom mfa dɛw
Nye sor abɔfo ntseatseam'
Hom nye hɔn mbɔm mpaa mu dɛ,
Wɔawo Christ wɔ Bethlehem.
Tsie! abɔfo ruhua dɛ 
Wɔawo hɛn Hen nyimnyamfo n',

MHB 117
2 . Christ, by highest heaven adored,
Christ, the everlasting Lord,
Late in time behold Him come,
Offspring of a virgin’s womb!
Veiled in flesh the Godhead see; 
Hail the incarnate Deity! 
Pleased as man with men to dwell,
Jesus, our Immanuel.
	 ~ 	2 . Christ a sorsor tonton No, 
Ɔdomankoma Ewuradze n',
Hwɛ N', ɔkyɛree mpo a ɔaba.
Ɔbaabun wotoam' ɔba!
Hwɛ, Nyame hyɛ nyimpadua!
Nyame a wɔayɛ N' onyimpa!
Ɔpɛ dɛ ɔnye nyimpa tsena,
Jesus, hɛn Immanuel.

MHB 117
3 . Mild He lays His glory by, 
Born that man no more may die,
Born to raise the sons of earth, 
Born to give them second birth.
Hail the heaven-born Prince of peace!
Hail the sun of Righteousness! 
Light and life to all He brings 
Risen with healing in His wings.	 ~ 	3 . Mbo, sor Asomdwee Henba! 
Mbo, Ndzeyɛts' enenee Ewia!
'Dze kan na nkwa brɛ wiadze,
Yarsa wɔ N' atsaban mu.
Ɔdze N' enyimnyam too nkyɛn,
Bae ma nyimpa eennwu bio,
Ma ɔaama asaasemba do,
Ma ɔaama hɔn awo-enu.

MHB 118
1 . O COME, all ye faithful,
Joyful and triumphant,
Come ye, O come ye to Bethlehem;
Come and behold Him
Born the King of angels:
O come, let us adore Him, Christ the Lord
	 ~ 	1 . Agyedzifo, hom mbra 
Dɛw na konyimdzi mu,
Hom mbra, O hom nyina mbra Bethlehem;
Hom mbra mbɔhwɛ dɛ
Wɔawo abɔfo Hen:
O hom mbra mma yɛntonton Ewuradze Christ.

MHB 118
2 . True God of true God,
Light of light eternal,
Lo! He abhors not the virgin’s womb,
Son of the Father,
Begotten, not created :
O come, let us adore Him, Christ the Lord.
	 ~ 	2 . Nyame mu Nyame, 
Kan a ofir Kan mu,
Hwɛ! oennkyir ɔbaabun n' awotoa;
Nyame ara ampa,
Wɔwoo N', na wɔannyɛ No;
O hom mbra mma yɛntonton Ewuradze Christ.

MHB 118
3 . Sing, choirs of angels,
Sing in exultation,
Sing, all ye citizens of heaven above,
Glory to God
In the highest:
O come, let us adore Him, Christ the Lord.
	 ~ 	3 . Abɔfo, hom ntow 
Ndwom ehurusi mu,
Sor ahemfiemba nyina ntow ndwom
Dɛ, Enyimnyam nyina
Nka Nyame wɔ sorsor:
O hom mbra mma yɛntonton Ewuradze Christ.

MHB 118
4 . Yea, Lord , we greet Thee,
Born this happy morning;
Jesus, to Thee be glory given,
Word of the father,
Now in flesh appearing:
O come, let us adore Him, Christ the Lord.	 ~ 	4 . Enyimnyam nka Wo, 
Yeyi Wo dzin ayɛw,
Jesus, Ɔwo a wɔawo W' n-dɛ da yi,
Ɔdomankoma Egya
N' asɛm ayɛ honam
O hom mbra mma yɛntonton Ewuradze Christ.

MHB 119
1 . ANGLES from the realm of glory,
Wing your flight o’er all the earth;
Ye, who sang creation’s story,
Now proclaim Messiah’s birth:
Come and worship, 
Worship Christ, the new-born King.
	 ~ 	1 . ABƆFO a hom fi 'nyimnyam mu,
Hom ntu mfa asaase do;
Hom a hom toow abɔdze awoo,
Hom ntow Messiah N'awoo ndwom,
Hom mbra mbɔsom,
Mbɔsom Christ, Ɔhen a wɔawo N'.

MHB 119
2 . Shepherds in the fields abiding,
Watching o’er your flocks by night,
God with man is now residing,
Yonder shines the infant Light;
Come and worship, 
Worship Christ, the new-born King.
	 ~ 	2 . Nguanhwɛfo a hom tsena sar do
Roweɔn hom nguankuw anago,
Afei Nyame nye nyimpa tse,
'Kɔkoaba Ne kan hyerɛn;
Hom mbra mbɔsom,
Mbɔsom Christ, Ɔhen a wɔawo N'.

MHB 119
3 . Sages, leave your contemplation’s, 
Brighter visions beam afar; 
Seek the great Desire of nations; 
Ye have seen His natal star; 
Come and worship,  
Worship Christ, the new-born King.
	 ~ 	3 . 'Nyansafo, hom mfi hom dadaw m',
Kan fɛɛfɛw bi wɔ ekyir;
Hom nhwehwɛ aman apɛdze,
Hom ehu N'awoo ho woraba;
Hom mbra mbɔsom,
Mbɔsom Christ, Ɔhen a wɔawo N'.

MHB 119
4 . Saints, before the altar bending, 
Watching long in hope and fear,
Suddenly the Lord, descending,
In His temple shall appear;
Come and worship, 
Worship Christ, the new-born King	 ~ 	4 . Afɔrmbukyia enyim ahotsewfo, 
Hom dze enyidr suro weɔn; 
Ewuradze besian efir sor
Epue N'asɔrdan m' awora!
Hom mbra mbɔsom,
Mbɔsom Christ, Ɔhen a wɔawo N'.

MHB 12
1 . PRAISE my soul the King of heaven,
To His feet thy tribute bring
Ransomed, healed, restored, forgiven,
Who like thee His praise should sing?
Praise Him! Praise Him!
Praise the everlasting King.
	 ~ 	1 . Me kra, yi ɔsor hen ayɛw, 
Fa w' ayɛdze bra N' enyim;
Ɔapon wo, dze wo bɔn akyɛ w',
Woana mbɔ nyi No ayɛw?
Yi No ayɛw!
Yi bɛkyebo Hen ayɛw.

MHB 12
2 . Praise Him for His grace and favour
To our fathers in distress;
Praise Him, still the same for ever,
Slow to chide and swiftto bless:
Praise Him! Praise Him!
Glorious in His faithfulness.
	 ~ 	2 . Yi N' ayɛw, Nadom na enyimpa 
Hwɛɛ egyanom ahohiam';
Yi No ayɛw, ɔnnsakyer da,
Ɔka enyim nyaa, ohyira ntsɛm:
Yi No ayɛw!
Nyimnyamfo wɔ nokwardzim'.

MHB 12
3 . Father -like He tends and spares us;
Well our feeble frame He knows;
In His hands He gently bears us,
Rescues us from all our foes.
Praise Him! Praise Him!
Widely as His mercy flows.
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔhwɛ hɛn, dze fir hɛn dɛ egya; 
Onyim hɛn mberɛwyɛ dodow;
Ɔma hɛn do dɔ mu ara,
Ɔgye hɛn atamfo nyina nsam',
Yi No ayɛw!
Dɛ mbrɛ N' adom pem mber nyina.

MHB 12
4 . Angels in the height, adore Him;
Ye behold Him face to face;
Sun and moon, bow down before Him;
Dwellers all in time and space,
Praise Him! Praise Him!
Praise with us the God of grace.     Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Sor abɔfo hom nhuhor No; 
Hom hu N' enyim na enyim;
Ewia, bosoom, hom nkotow, No,
Mber na mbea nyinam' abɔdze,
Hom nyi N' ayɛw!
Hom nye hɛn nyi Nyame ayɛw.    Amen.

MHB 120
1 . CHRISTIANS,  awake, salute the  happy morn,
Whereon the Saviour of the world was born;
Rise to adore the mystery of love,
Which hosts of angels chanted from above;
With them the joyful tidings first  begun
Of God incarnate and the Virgin’s Son.
	 ~ 	1 . O Christianfo, hom nnyan na adze akye, 
Anapa yi na wɔwoo Agyenkwa;
Hom nsoɛr na hom ntonton Nyame dɔ,
Esumasɛm a abɔfo tow ho ndwom;
Hɔn na wodzii kan kaa n-sɛmpa no,
Mbrɛ Nyame bɛbrae ma ɔbaabun woo N'.

MHB 120
2 . Then to the watchful shepherds it was told,
Who heard the angelic herald’s  voice: Behold,
I bring good tidings of a Saviour’s  birth 
To you and all the nations upon earth;
This day hath God fulfilled His  promised word,
This day is born a Saviour, Christ the lord.
	 ~ 	2 . N-guanhwɛfo a wɔroweɔn hɔn nguan no 
Tsee bɔfo huafo ne ndze dɛ ɔse:
Hwɛ, medze Agyenkwa N' awoo ho nsɛm
Bɔ hom na wiadze nyina amandzɛɛ;
N-dɛ Nyame apon N' anohoba,
Wɔawo Ewuradze Christ, hɛn Agyenkwa.

MHB 120
3 . He spake; and straightway the  celestial choir
In hymns of joy, unknown before, conspire.
The praises of redeeming love they sang,
And heaven’s whole orb with hallelujahs rang; 
God’s highest glory was their anthem still,
Peace upon earth, and unto men good-will.
	 ~ 	3 . Owiee kasaa n', nna sor adwontofo 
Dze enyigye toow ndwom fofor koraa,
Wɔkamfoo Nyame dɔ a ɔropon hɛn,
Na Alleluia gyigyee wim' nyina;
Hɔn ndwom nye dɛ, Enyimnyam nka Nyame,
Asomdwee na enyisɔ mbra nyimpam'.

MHB 120
4 . To Bethlehem straight the enlightened shepherds ran,
To see the wonder God had wrought for man :
Then to their flocks, still praising God, return,
And their glad hearts with holy Rapture burn;
Amazed, the wondrous tidings they proclaim,
The first apostles of His infant fame.
	 ~ 	4 . Hɔ ara na nguanhwɛfo n', kɔr Bethlehem 
Kɔhwɛɛ dza Nyame ayɛ ama adasa:
Wɔdze enyigye saan kɔhwɛɛ hɔn nguan,
Dɛ wɔda ho riyi Nyame ayɛw,
Yinom nye asomafo a wodzii kan
Wɔbɔɔ Abofra no ho nsɛm dawur.

MHB 120
5 . O may we keep and pounder in our mind
God’s wondrous love in saving lost mankind; 
Trace we the Babe, who hath retrieved our loss,
From the poor manger to the bitter Cross:
Tread in His steps, assisted by His grace,
Till man’s first heavenly state again takes place.
	 ~ 	5 . N-kyɛ  yaakaa Nyame N' anwanwa dɔ a 
Ogyaa N' ma ɔregye adasa nkwa;
Abofra a ɔama yeenya hɛn siar yi,
Yɛnhwɛ N' mbowadan mu nkɔ mbeamudua n' do:
Ɔmboa hɛn ma yentsia N' anamɔn mu
Nkodu adasa hɛn sor sibea hɔ.

MHB 120
6 . Then may we hope, the angelic  hosts among,
To sing, redeemed, a glad triumphal song;
He that was born upon this joyful day
Around us all His glory shall display;
Saved by His love, incessant we shall sing
Eternal praise to heaven’s almighty King.	 ~ 	6 . Dɛm na hɛn ho bɛtsew ma yaafora 
Abɔfodɔm yɛatow konyimdzi ndwom;
Nyia wɔawo N' n-dɛ enyigye da yi,
Ɔdze enyimnyam bɛhyerɛn hɛn ho nyina;
No dɔ bɛgye hɛn nkwa na yaatow ndwom
Afebɔɔ yɛakamfo sor Hen tumfo n'.

MHB 121
1 . ALL my heart this night rejoices, 
As I hear, far and near,
Sweetest angel voices:
Christ is born! their choirs are singing,
Till the air, everywhere,
Now with joy is ringing.
	 ~ 	1 . M'AKOMA dzi ehurusi enago 'i
Ber a ekyirkyir metse
Abɔfo ndze dɛɛdɛw n';
'Dwontofo n' tow dɛ, Wɔawo Christ!
Na enyigye ndwom dɛɛdɛw n'
Gyegye wimu nyina.

MHB 121
2 . Hark! a voice from yonder manger,
Soft and sweet, doth entreat:
Flee from woe and danger;
Brethren, come; from all doth grieve you,
You are freed; all you need
I will surely give you.

. Thee, O Lord, with heed I’ll cherish,
Live to Thee, and with Thee
Dying ,shall not perish,
But shall dwell with Thee for ever,
Far on high, in the joy
That can alter never.	 ~ 	2 . Tsie! Dzidzidaka n' mu ndze bi
Reserɛ bɔkɔɔ se dɛ:
Hom nguan mfi mbusu ho,
Nuanom, hom mbra, hom efi haw mu, 
Wɔagye hom; dza hom hia
Nyina mebɛma hom.

MHB 121
3 . Come then, let us hasten yonder;
Here let all, great and small,
Kneel in awe and wonder.
Love Him who with love is yearning;
Hail the star, that from far
Bright with hope is burning.
	 ~ 	3 . Afei hom mma yɛnyɛ no ntsɛm, 
'Kɛse na nkuma nyina,
Nkotow suro nwanwa m'.
Yɛndɔ Nyia dɔ ahyɛ No ma n',
Nhua Woraba a ɔdze
Enyidar rehyerɛn no.

MHB 122
1 . BRIGHTEST and best of the sons of the morning,
Dawn on our darkness, and lend us Thine aid;
Stars of the East, the horizon adorning,
Guide where our infant Redeemer is laid.
	 ~ 	1 . Adzekyee mba nyinara mu dansewa, 
Pa hɛn isum na fa wo mboa brɛ hɛn;
Boka nworaba a epue ma wim' atsew wann,
Gya hɛn kɔ mbrɛ wɔawo Gyefo ama hɛn.

MHB 122
2 . Cold on His cradle the dew-drops are shining;
Low lies His head with the beasts of the stall;
Angels adore Him in slumber reclining,
Maker, and Monarch, and Saviour of all.
	 ~ 	2 . N' adasoe do na bɔw rososɔ hyɛnhyɛnn; 
Nantwibuwm' na ɔdze Ne tsir ato komm;
Ɔda hɔ n' abɔfo ruhuahua no dɛ,
Adasa Yɛfo, Ɔhen na Gyefo.

MHB 122
3 . Say, shall we yield Him, in costly devotion,
Odours of Edom, and offerings divine,
Gems of the mountain and pearls			
    of the ocean,
Myrrh from the forest or gold from the mine?
	 ~ 	3 . Aso ampa dɛ hɛn so yɛbɛkyɛ No 
Edom nduhuam na asomfo akyɛdze,
Mbepɔw do mbobaa, po do nankyenema,
Kwaa mu wandze, daadzetsirmu sika?

MHB 122
4 . Vainly we offer each ample oblation;
Vainly with gifts would His  favour secure;
Richer by far is the heart’s adoration;
Dearer to God are the prayers of the poor.
	 ~ 	4 . Hɛn ayɛyɛdze piigyan nyina nnsɛ hwee; 
Akyɛdze biara nntum nnya N' enyimpa;
Akomam' ndaase na abɔbɔfo mpaabɔ
Som bo kɛsekɛse ma Onyame.

MHB 122
5 . Brightest and best of the sons of the morning,
Dawn on our darkness, and lend us thine aid;
Stars of the East, the horizon adorning,
Guide where our infant Redeemer is laid.	 ~ 	5 . Adekyee mba nyinara mu dansewa, 
Pa hɛn isum na fa wo mboa brɛ hɛn;
Boka nworaba a epue ma wim' atsew wann,
Gya hɛn kɔ mbrɛ wɔawo Gyefo ama hɛn.

MHB 123
1 . STILL the night, holy the night!
 Sleeps the world; hid from sight,
Mary and Joseph in stable bare
Watch o’er the Child beloved and  fair,
Sleeping in heavenly rest.
	 ~ 	1 . 'NAGO sɔnn, anago krɔnn!
Wiadze ada, esuma,
Mary na Joseph wɔ mbowa dan mu 
Roweɔn Dɔba fɛɛfɛw no a 
Ɔada sor ahomgye mu n'.

MHB 123
2 . Still the night, holy the night!
Shepherds first saw the light,
Heard resounding clear and long,
 Far and near, the angel-song,
Christ the Redeemer is here!
	 ~ 	2 . 'Nago sɔnn, anago krɔnn!
Nguanhwɛfo hun kan no,
Tsee abɔfo ndwom no ne ngyegyee,
Wɔ anoano nye ekyirekyir,
Christ hɛn Pomfo n' wɔ ha.

MHB 123
3 . Still the night, holy the night!
 Son of God, O how bright
 Love is smiling from Thy face!
 Strikes for us now the hour of grace,
 Saviour, since thou art born!	 ~ 	3 . 'Nago sɔnn, anago krɔnn!
Nyame Ba a ehyerɛn, 
Ɔdɔ reserew W'enyimdua mu!
Ma adom ber no mbra mbɔto hɛn, 
Agyenkwa a wɔawo W' ntsi!

MHB 124
1 . SEE, amid the winter’s snow,
Born for us on earth below,
See, the Lamb of God appears,
Promised from eternal years.

        Hail, thou ever-blessed morn!
        Hail, redemption’s happy dawn!
        Sing through all Jerusalem:
        Christ is born in Bethlehem!
	 ~ 	1 . Hwɛ, wɔawo Nyame Eguambaa a 
Wɔdze N' bɔɔ anohoba n',
Oesian aba asaase
Rebɛkyerɛ hɛn ɔsor kwan. 

      Ao, hɛn siar da, aba yie! 
      Hwɛ hɛn nkwahosan aba! 
      Tow ndwom twa Jerusalem: 
      Wɔawo Christ wɔ Bethlehem!

MHB 124
2 . Lo, within a manger lies
 He who built the starry skies,
He who, throned in height sublime,
Sits amid the cherubim.
	 ~ 	2 . Hwɛ, nyia ɔtse ahengua do 
Wɔ sorsor abɔfo ntam'
Nyia ɔyɛɛ wim' nworaba n',
Da mbowa dzidzidaka mu.

MHB 124
3 . Say, ye holy shepherds, say,
What your joyful news to-day;
Wherefore have ye left your sheep
On the lonely mountains steep?
	 ~ 	3 . Hom n-guanhwɛfo krɔnkrɔn, 
Hom dze asɛmpa bɛn nam?
Wɔyɛ n' dɛn na hom egya
Hom nguan wɔ haban mu yi?

MHB 124
4 . As we watched at dead of night,
Lo, we saw a wondrous light:
 Angels, singing peace on earth,
Angels, singing peace on earth,
Told us of the Saviour’s birth.
	 ~ 	4 . Esuom a yɛroweɔn no, 
Hwɛ, yehun kan nwanwa bi:
Abɔfo dze adwontow
Kaa dɛ wɔawo Agyenkwa n'.

MHB 124
5 . Sacred Infant, all divine,
 What a tender love was Thine,
Thus to come from highest bliss
Down to such a world as this!
	 ~ 	5 . O Akɔkowaba krɔnkrɔn, 
Wo dɔ yɛ nwanwa dodow!
Dɔ a ogyaa W' ma ifii sor
Baa wiadze a ɔtse dɛm yim'.

MHB 124
6 . Teach, O teach us, holy Child,
 By Thy face so meek and mild,
Teach us to resemble Thee
In Thy sweet humility.	 ~ 	6 . O Nyame Ba, Kyerɛkyerɛ hɛn 
Wo suban a ɔdwe  no,
Ma yensua Wo mbrɛhoadze,
Na yɛnyɛ dɛ mbrɛ Ɔwo tse.

MHB 125
1 . O LITTLE town of Bethlehem, 
How still we see thee lie!
Above thy deep and dreamless sleep
The silent stars go by:
Yet in thy dark streets shineth 
The everlasting Light;
The hopes and fears of all the years
Are met in thee to-night.
	 ~ 	1 . O Bethlehem kurow kakraba,
Hwɛ mbrɛ esi ada dzinn!
Bea a ada hatsee n'etsifi
N-woraba rikyin komm:
W'abɔntsen no do anago n'
Bɛkyebo kan n' hyerɛn;
Mber nyina enyidar na suro 
Dzi ehia wɔ Wo mu.

MHB 125
2 . O morning stars ,together
Proclaim the holy birth,
And praises sing to God the King,
And peace to men on earth;
For Christ is born of Mary; 
And ,gathered all above,
While mortals sleep, the angels keep 
Their watch of wondering love.
	 ~ 	2 . Anapa mworaba, hom mbɔ mu
M-bɔ awoo krɔnn n' dawur,
Na hom ntow ndwom mma Nyame Hen n',
Asomdwee nka asaase;
Na Mary awo ɔba Christ;
Nna abɔfo aboa ano wimu,
Roweɔn ɔdɔ nwanwa Ba no,
Ber a adasa so ada n'.

MHB 125
3 . How silently, how silently 
 The wondrous Gift is given!
 So God imparts to human hearts
 The blessings of His Heaven.
 No ear may hear His coming;
 But in this world of sin,
 Where meek souls will receive Him still
 The dear Christ enters in.
	 ~ 	3 . Akyɛdze nwanwa no wɔdze
Maa wiadze dzinn na komm!
Dɛm na Nyakoɔn kyɛ nyimpa
Siar akyɛdze fi sor.
Asowa bi nnkɛtse Ne mbae,
Mbom bɔn wiadze yi mu,
Abrɛfo a wɔgye No n' na
Christ dɔyɛfo n' to hɔn.

MHB 125
4 . O holy Child of Bethlehem, 
Descend to us, we pray;
Cast out our sin, and enter in;
Be born in us to-day.
We hear the Christmas angels 
The great glad tidings tell;
O come to us, abide with us,
Our Lord Emmanuel !  Amen.	 ~ 	4 . O Bethlehem Ɔba krɔnkrɔn,
Yeserɛ Wo, bra hɛn nkyɛn;
Pam hɛn bɔn na afei tsena hɛn mu;
Ma wɔnwo W' hɛn mu ndɛ.
Yɛtse Borɔnya abɔfo n'
Nka dɛ wɔrobɔ amandzɛɛ n';
O bra hɛn nkyɛn, nye hɛn ntsena,
Hɛn Wura Immuanuel.  Amen

MHB 126
1 . GIVE heed, my heart, lift up thine eyes:
Who is it in yon manger lies?
Who is the Child so young and fair?
The blessèd Christ Child lieth there.
	 ~ 	1 . M'AKOMA, hwɛ, ma w'enyi do:
Woana da edzidzidaka n' m' hɔ?
Woana nye Akɔkowa fɛɛfɛw yi?
Akɔkowa Christ siarfo n' nye No.

MHB 126
2 . Ah, Lord, who hast created all,
How hast Thou made Thee weak and small,
That Thou must choose Thy infant bed
Where ass and ox but lately fed?
	 ~ 	2 . Ewuradze a ebɔɔ adze nyina,
Mbrɛ esi ayɛ Wo ho keteseaba,
Dɛ ebɛyɛ W' dabew wɔ bea a
Nsoaso na anantwi dzidzi.

MHB 126
3 . Were earth a thousand times as fair,
Beset with god and jewels rare,
She yet were far too poor to be 
A narrow cradle, Lord, for Thee.
	 ~ 	3 . Sɛ wiadze ne fɛw yɛ mbordo,
Na sika na abopa anyɛ n' ma a,
Nkyɛ iyi mpo mmfata koraa dɛ 
Ɔwo Ewuradze bɛda hɔ.

MHB 126
4 . Ah, dearest Jesus, holy child,
Make Thee a bed, soft, undefiled,
Within my heart, that it may be
A quiet chamber kept for Thee.
	 ~ 	4 . Ao, Jesus Akɔkowa krɔnkrɔn!
Bra bɛhyehyɛ Wo mpa a ho tsew n'
Wɔ m'akoma bɔbɔfo m' ma
Ɔaayɛ mpiatun dzinn ama Wo.

MHB 126
5 . My heart for very joy doth leap,
My lips no more can silence keep;
I too must sing with joyful tongue
That sweetest ancient cradle-song:
	 ~ 	5 . M'akoma keka n' ho dɛw mu daa,
Na m'ano nnkɛyɛ komm bio da;
Medze dɛw m'bɔtow Wo ndwom daa,
Tsetse abagyegye ndwom dɛɛdɛw n'.

MHB 126
6 . Glory to God in highest heaven,
Who unto man His Son hath given;
While angels sing with pious mirth
A glad new year to all the earth.	 ~ 	6 . Enyimnyam nka Nyame wɔ sor,
Ɔno a ɔdze Ne Ba ama nyimpa,
Ber a abɔfo dze dɛw ma hɛn
Afenhyia pa wɔ asaase do.

MHB 127
1 . CRADLED in a manger, meanly
Laid the Son of Man His head;
Sleeping His first earthly slumber
Where the oxen had been fed.
Happy were those shepherds listening
To the holy angel’s word;
Happy they within that stable,
Worshipping their infant Lord.
	 ~ 	1 . NYIMPA Ba no dze Ne tsir too
Mbowa edzidzidaka n’ mu;
Ͻdaa wiadze ha Ne nda kan
Nguanhwɛfo no dze enyigye tsiee
‘Bͻfo krͻnkrͻn n’amandzɛɛ;
Hͻn a wͻwͻ nguambuw mu hͻ n’
Dze enyigye soom hͻn Wura.

MHB 127
2 . Happy all who hear the message
Of His coming from above;
Happier still who hail His coming,
And with praises greet His love.
Blessed Saviour, Christ most holy,
In a manger Thou didst rest;
Canst Thou stoop again, yet lower,
And abide within my breast?
	 ~ 	2 . Hͻn a wͻtsee Ne famu ha mbae
Nka n’ nyina nyaa enyigye;
Na hͻn so a wohuaa Ne mbae no,
Kamfo No dͻ n’, nyaa dɛw pii.
Agyenkwa Siarfo, Christ krͻnkrͻn,
Edaa mbowa edzidzibea;
Innkotum abrɛ Woho adze
Abɛtsena m’akoma m’?

MHB 127
3 . Evil things are there before Thee;
In the heart, where they have fed,
Wilt Thou pitifully enter,
Son of Man, and lay Thy head?
Enter, then, O Christ most holy;
Make a Christmas in my heart;
Make a heaven on my manger:
It is heaven where Thou art.
	 ~ 	3 . Ndzebͻn edzi W’enyim kan kͻ;
Akoma a wͻtoo mu pon n’,
Ana bɛhɛn mu mbͻbͻr mu,
Nyimpa Ba,dze Wo tsir ato?
Afei hɛn mu, Jesus krͻnkrͻn,
Yɛ Borͻnya wͻ m’akomam’;
Ma mo mbowa edzidzibea ndan
Heaven a Ͻwo wͻ hͻ no.

MHB 127
4 . And to those who never listened
To the message of Thy birth,
Who have winter, but no Christmas
Bringing them Thy peace on earth,
Send to these the joyful tidings;
By all people, in each home,
Be there heard the Christmas anthem:
Praise to God, The Christ has come!	 ~ 	4 . Ma hͻn a wͻanntse W’awoo ho
Nsɛmpa no nyinara no,
Wͻwͻmber dadaw m’ , nnyɛ Borͻnya m’,
Wͻmfa W’asomdwee mbrɛ hͻn,
Fa enyigye asɛmpa n’ brɛ hͻn,
Ma wͻntse Borͻnya ndwom no wͻ hͻ:
Yi Nyame ayɛw, Christ aba!

MHB 128
1 . A VIRGIN most pure, as the prophets do tell,
Hath brought forth a Baby, as it hath befel,
To be our Redeemer from death, hell, and sin,
Which Adam’s transgression hath wrapped us in.
       And therefore be merry, set sorrow aside;
       Christ Jesus our Saviour was born on this tide.
	 ~ 	1 . DƐ mbrɛ nkɔnhyɛfo kae no, ɔbaabun bi 
Awo Akɔkowaba; dɛm na osii,
Dɛ ɔmbɔpon hɛn owu, hɛll na bɔn a 
Adam ne mbrato dze furaa hɛn no mu.
       Dɛm ntsi hom enyi ngye, ntow awerɛhow ngu;
       Wɔwoo hɛn Agyenkwa Jesus Christ ber yi.

MHB 128
2 . In Bethlehem in Jewry, a city there was
Where Joseph and Mary together did pass,
All for to be taxed with many one moe,
For Caesar commanded the same should be so.
	 ~ 	2 . Na Jewfo kurow bi a wɔfrɛ n' Bethlehem,
Hɔ na Joseph na Mary nyina kɔsoɛe,
Ama wɔaakan hɔn na binom wɔ ɔtow ntsi,
Osiandɛ dɛm na Caesar hyɛɛ dɛ wɔnyɛ.

MHB 128
3 . But when they had entered the city so fair,
A number of people so mighty was there,
That Joseph and Mary, whose substance was small,
Could find in the inn there no lodging at all
	 ~ 	3 . Na wokodur kurow fɛɛfɛw no mu no,
Nna nyimpadodow ahyɛ hɔ nyina ma,
Ma Joseph nye Mary a wɔyɛ ehiafo n'
Ennya kwan biara wɔ ahɔhodan no mu.

MHB 128
4 . Then were they constrained in a stable to lie,
Where horses and asses they used for to tie:
Their lodging so simple they took it no scorn,
But against the next morning our Saviour was born.
	 ~ 	4 . Na okehiaa dɛ wɔkɔsoɛ edzdzidaka m'
Beebi a daa wɔdze anantwu na nguan gui:
Na wɔammfɛr dɛm famu famu tsenabea hɔ koraa,
Na n'adzkyee n' ara na wɔwoo Agyenkwa.

MHB 128
5 . The King of all kings to this world being brought,
Small store of fine linen to wrap Him was sought,
But when she had swaddled her young son so sweet,
Within an ox-manger she laid Him to sleep
	 ~ 	5 . Adasa nyina ahenfo Hen n' aba wiadze
Ndwera kakraba na wonyaa kyekyeer N' ho;
Na Mary kyekyeer ne Ba no ho wiei no,
Ɔdze No too nantwi edzidzidaka mu.

MHB 128
6 . Then God sent an angel from heaven so high,
To certain poor shepherds in fields where they lie,
And bade them no longer in sorrow to stay,
Because that our Saviour was born on this day.
	 ~ 	6 . Na Nyame somaa ɔbɔfo fii sorsor
Kɔr nguanhwɛfo ehiafo bi nkyɛn, wɔ sar do,
Kɛsee hɔn dɛ mma wonndzi awerɛhow bio,
'Siandɛ wɔawo hɛn Agyenkwa ndɛ da yi.

MHB 128
7 . Then presently after the shepherds did spy
A number of angels that stood in the sky;
They joyfully talked and sweetly did sing,
To God be all glory, our heavenly King.	 ~ 	7 . Amon mu hɔ ara na nguanhwɛfo no hun
Abɔfo dɔm kɛse dɛ wɔwɔ wimu;
Wɔdze dɛw kɛse kasae, toow ndwom dɛɛdɛw 
Dɛ enyimnyam nka Nyame hɛn sor Hen no.

MHB 129
1 . WHILE shepherds watched their flocks by night,
All seated on the ground, 
The angel of the Lord came down,
And glory shone around.
	 ~ 	1 . Anago bi na nguanhwɛfo 
Tsena fam' roweɔn hɔn nguan,
Ewuradze bɔfo fi sor bae,
Na kan hyerɛɛn hɔ nyina.

MHB 129
2 . Fear not ! said he; for mighty dread
Had seized their troubled mind:
Glad tidings of great joy I bring
To you and all mankind.
	 ~ 	2 . Ihu kɛse kaa hɔn n-tsi 
Ɔsee dɛ, Mma hom nnsuro:
Mebrɛ hom na adasa nyina
Asɛmpa a ɔyɛ dɛw.

MHB 129
3 . To you, in David’s town, this day 
Is born, of David ‘s line,
A Saviour, who is Christ the Lord;
And this shall be the sign:
	 ~ 	3 . Wɔawo Agyenkwa ama hom 
Wɔ David ahenkurowm',
Wɔawo Ewuradze Christ n-dɛ;
Yi na hom dze bohu N':

MHB 129
4 . The heavenly Babe you there shall find
To human view displayed,
All meanly wrapped in
swaddling bands
And in a manger laid.
	 ~ 	4 . Hom bohu dɛ Akɔkowaba n' 
Da mbowa dzidzidakam',
Hom bohu No nantwibuw mu,
Dɛ tam kyekye No ho.

MHB 129
5 . Thus spake the seraph; and forth-with
Appeared a shining throng
Of angels praising God, and thus
Addressed their joyful song:
	 ~ 	5 . Nyame bɔfo n' wiee dɛm ka ara, 
Na sor dɔm pii bae a
Wɔdze ndwom yii Nyame ayɛw
Enyigye mu see dɛ:

MHB 129
6 . All glory be to God on high,
 And to the earth be peace;
Good will henceforth from heaven to men
Begin and never cease! Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Enyimnyam nka Nyame wɔ sor, 
Asomdwee nka 'saase;
Nyame enyisɔ nhyɛ ase
Wɔ adasa mu ndɛ.   Amen.

MHB 13
1 . PRAISE the Lord! Ye heavens, adore him;
Praise him, angels in the height;
Sun and moon, rejoice before him,
Praise him, all ye stars and light.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆSORSOR, hom nyi Ewuradze ayɛw; 
Ewia, bosoom, dzi N'enyim dɛw; 
Nworaba, kan, hom ntonton No.

MHB 13
2 . Praise the Lord! for he hath spoken;
worlds His mighty voice obeyed;
Laws, that never shall be broken,
For their guidance he hath made.
	 ~ 	2 . Yi Ewuradze ayɛw na ɔakasa a, 
Wiadze tsiee ne ndze kɛse n'; 
mbrasɛm a wonnkobu do da, 
Wɔ hɔ ma hɛn akwankyerɛ.

MHB 13
3 . Praise the Lord! for he is glorious;
Never shall His promise fail:
God hath made His saints victorious;
Sin and death shall not prevail.
	 ~ 	3 . Yi Ewuradze ayɛw, nyimnyamfo no a;
 N'anohoba nnyɛ gyan da; 
Ɔama N'ahotsewfo konyim; 
Bɔn na wu nnkedzi nyim da.

MHB 13
4 . Praise the God of our salvation;
Hosts on high, his power proclaim;
Heaven and earth and all creation,
Laud and magnify his name!     Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Yi hɛn nkwagye Nyame ayɛw; 
Sor dɔm mpaa mu nka No tum; 
Sor na asaase nye abɔdze nyina
Ntonton No, nhuhor Ne dzin.   Amen.

MHB 130
1 . IT came upon the midnight clear,
That glorious song of old,
From angels bending near the earth
To touch their harps of gold:
Peace on the earth, good-will to men,
From heaven’s all-gracious King!
The world in solemn stillness lay
To hear the angels sing.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆBAA danafua kɔnnkɔnn bi
Abɔfo a woesian famu
Robɔ hɔn sika nsanku toow
Tsetse ndwom dɛɛdɛw n' dɛ 
'Somdwee na pɛpa nka adasa,
Omfi sor Hen hɔ mbra!
Na wiadze ntaa dzinn ara ntsie
Abɔfɔ hɔn ndwom no.

MHB 130
2 . Still through the cloven skies they come
With peaceful wings unfurled;
And still their heavenly music floats
O’er all the weary world;
Above its sad and lowly plains
They bend on hovering wing,
And ever o’er its Babel sounds
The blessed angels sing.
	 ~ 	2 . Wɔkɔr do ara fi sor sianee,
Wɔdze asomdwee sianee,
Na wɔtsee hɔn sorsor ndwom no
Wɔ fona wiadze yi m',
N'awerɛhow paprata no mu;
Wotuu faa kyinkyinii,
Wɔtoow ndwom n' ma wɔtsee no wɔ
Babel nkwaado nyina.

MHB 130
3 . But with the woes of sin and strife
The world has suffered long;
Beneath the angel strain have rolled
Two thousand years of wrong;
And man, at war with man, hears not
The love song which they bring:
O hush the noise, ye men of strife,
And hear the angels sing.
	 ~ 	3 . Wiadze ehu amandze akyɛr 
Wɔ bɔn na aperdzi ho;
Abɔfo ndwom dɛɛdɛw n' ekyir,
Bɔn etsim mfe mpenu;
Adasa roko ntsi wɔnntse
Dɔ ndwom a wɔdze ma, n';
O akofo, hom nyɛ komm ntsie
Sor abɔfo ndwom no.

MHB 130
4 . And ye, beneath life’s crushing load
Whose forms are bending low,
Who toil along the climbing way
With painful steps and slow-
Look now! for glad and golden hours
Come swiftly on the wing:
O rest beside the weary road,
And hear the angels sing. 
	 ~ 	4 . Hom a abrabɔ ahyɛ hom do
Ma ntsi hom kɔn ebu,
Hom a hom berɛ wɔ kwan do
Ma hom nntum nnantsew yie,
Hom nhwɛ! Engyigye na mber pa
Dze ntsaban reba ntsɛm:
O hom nhom wɔ ɔfona kwan n' nkyɛn 
Ntsie abɔfo ndwom yi.

MHB 130
5 . For lo ! the days are hastening on,
By prophet bards foretold,
When  with the ever-circling years
Comes round the age of gold.
When peace shall over all the earth
Its ancient splendours fling,
And the whole world give back the song
Which now the angels sing.	 ~ 	5 . Hom nhwɛ! Nda n' reba ntsɛntsɛm a
Nkɔnyɛfo aka n' dada;
Ɔdze mber pa a akyɛr no 
Bɛba ber pa no mu.
Asomdwee bɛba wiadze nyina,
Tsetse ahoɔfɛw n' epue;
Na wiadze nyina agye ndwom a
Abɔfo rotow no.

MHB 131
1 . THE first Nowell the angel did say 
Was to certain poor shepherds in 
       fields as they lay:
In fields where they lay a-keeping their sheep
On a cold winter’s night that was so deep.
       
         Nowell, Nowell, Nowell, Nowell,
         Born is the king of Israel.
	 ~ 	1 . BORƆNYA a odzi kan a ɔbɔfo no kae n',
Ɔkaa kyerɛɛ nguanhwɛfo bi a wɔwɔ sar do,
Nna wɔwɔ sar n' do rohwɛ hɔn nguan
Ɔpɛber 'nafua bi a nna awɔw aba.
    Borɔnya afe pa! Borɔnya afe pa!
    Wɔawo Israelmba hɔn Hen.

MHB 131
2 . They looked up and saw a star,
Shining in the east, beyond them far,
And to the earth it gave great light,
And so it continued both day and night.
	 ~ 	2 . Wɔhwɛɛ sor na wohun woraba a
Ɔrehyerɛn boka ekyirekyire,
Na ɔrema asaase kan kɛse,
Na ɔyɛɛ dɛm adzekyee na adzesaa.

MHB 131
3 . And by the light of that same star,
Three wise men came from country afar;
To seek for a king was their intent,
And to follow the star wherever it went.
	 ~ 	3 . Na enyansafo baasa bi nam
Woraba n' ne kan mu fi ekyirkyir bae;
Wɔbaa dɛ wɔrobɔhwɛ Ɔhen n'
Na woeetsin woraba n' do ekyinkyin.

MHB 131
4 . This star drew nigh to the north-west,
O’er Bethlehem it took its rest,
And there it did both stop and stay
Right over the place where Jesus lay.
	 ~ 	4 . Woraba yi kɔr kwaamu-anee
Siankaa Bethlehem do kakra;
Na ekyir no ogyinaa koraa
Wɔ beebi a Jesus da no.

MHB 131
5 . Then entered in those wise men three,
Full reverently upon their knee,
And offered there in His presence
Their gold and myrrh and frank-incense.
	 ~ 	5 . Enyansafo baasa n' hɛɛn mu 
Buu nkotodwe enyidzi mu ara;
Na N'enyim hɔ ara yɛɛ N' ayɛ: 
Sika, krɔbɔɔ na akyenkyendur.

MHB 131
6 . Then let us all with one accord
Sing praises to our Heavenly Lord,
That hath made heaven and earth of nought,
And with His blood mankind hath bought.	 ~ 	6 . Dɛm a wɔmma yɛmfa adwen kor
Ntow ayɛyi mma hɛn sor Hen no,
Ɔno na ɔmaa sor na asaase bae
Na ɔdze N' bɔgyaa tɔ adasa.

MHB 132
1 . AS with gladness men of old
Did the guiding star behold,
As with joy they hailed its light,
Leading onward, beaming bright;
So, most gracious Lord, may we
Evermore be led to thee.
	 ~ 	1 . DƐ mbrɛ tsetsemba no nam
Enyigye mu hwɛɛ woraba n'
Na wɔdze dɛw huaa ne kan a
Ɔhyerɛɛnee kyerɛɛ kwan n',
Ewuradze, dɛm na hɛn so
Wɔnkyerɛn hɛn kwan mbra Wo hɔ.

MHB 132
2 . As with joyful steps they sped,
Saviour, to Thy lowly bed,
There to bend the knee before
Thee ,whom heaven and earth adore;
To may we with willing feet
Ever seek thy mercy-seat.
	 ~ 	2 . Dɛ mbrɛ wɔdze dɛw tuu anan
Baa Agyenkwa Wo mpa ho ara
Bobuu ntwɛr wɔ Ɔwo a sor na
Asaase sɔr Wo W'enyim n',
Dɛmara na ma hɛn so
Nhwehwɛ mbɔbɔrhu egua n'.

MHB 132
3 . As they offered gifts most rare
At Thy cradle rude and bare;
So may we with holy joy,
Pure, and free from sin’s alloy,
All our costliest treasures bring,
Christ, to Thee our heavenly King.
	 ~ 	3 . Dɛ mbrɛ wɔkyɛɛ W' dza ho hia
Wo wɔ ehiafo mpa no ho n',
Dɛmara pɛr na hɛn so
Mfa dwɛw krɔnn a bɔn nnyi mu
Mfua hɛn aboɔdzendze mu,
Mbrɛ Wo Christ hɛn sorsor Hen.

MHB 132
4 . Holy Jesus, every day
Keep us in the narrow way;
And, when earthly things are past,
Bring our ransomed souls at last
Where they need no star to guide,
Where no clouds Thy glory hide.
	 ~ 	4 . Jesus krɔnkrɔn, fa hɛn si
Kwan tseabaa no mu daa daa, 
Na sɛ wiadze bɔ adze a,
Fa hɛn akra a woefi nsa n'
Kɔ bea a wonnhia wimu kwankyerɛ,
Bea a fua nnhyɛ W'enyimnyam do.

MHB 132
5 . In the heavenly country bright
Need they no created light;
Thou its light, its joy, its crown,
Thou its sun which goes not down;
There for ever may we sing
Hallelujahs to our King.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Ɔsor man hyɛnhyɛnn no mu
Wonnhia abɔdze kan biara;
Ɔwo nye n' kan, dɛw, abɔtsir,
Ɔwo nye n'ewia a ɔnntɔ da;
Yɛntow W'ayɛyi wɔ hɔ, 
Hallelujah nka hɛn Hen.   Amen.

MHB 133
1 . FROM the eastern mountains
Pressing on they come,
Wise men in their wisdom,
To his humble home;
Stirred by deep devotion,
Hasting from afar,
Ever journeying onward,
Guided by a star.
	 ~ 	1 . ENYANSAFO bi fii
Hɔn nyimdzee mu twae
Fii boka mbepɔw do 
Kɔr 'bɔbɔfo fie.
Nyamesom pa gyaa hɔn
Ntsɛm fii ekyirkyir,
Towee kɔr kan daa daa,
Tsiin woraba bi do.

MHB 133
2 . There their Lord and Saviour
Meek and lowly lay,
Wondrous light that led them
Onward on their way,
Ever now to lighten
Nations from afar,
As they journey homeward
By that guiding star.
	 ~ 	2 . Hɔ na hɔn Wura na
Gyefo brɛfo n' da,
Kan nwanwa a odzii hɔn kan
Wɔ hɔn akwantu mu n'
Bɔkɔ do ahyerɛn
Ekyirkyir aman do;
Ber a woraba no dze hɔn 
Resan akɔ hɔn nkyir.

MHB 133
3 . Thou who in a manger
Once hast lowly lain,
Who dost now in glory
O’er all kingdoms reign,
Gather in the heathen,
Who in lands afar
Ne’er have seen the brightness
Of Thy guiding star.
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔwo a da bi edaa
Mbowa edzidzidaka m',
Na sesei idzi hen
Nyimnyam m' aman do,
Boaboa wiadzefo a
Wɔwɔ ekyir n' ano,
Hɔn a wonnhun woraba n'
Kwankyerɛ kan no.

MHB 133
4 . Gather in the outcasts,
All who have gone astray,
Throw thy radiance o’er them,
Guide them on their way,
Those who never knew thee,
Those who have wandered far,
Guide them by the brightness
Of thy guiding star.
	 ~ 	4 . Boaboa tokyemfo ano;
Dɔnsuartɔfo no,
Tow Wo kan n' gu hɔn do,
Gya hɔn abamba;
Hɔn a wonnhun Wo no,
Hɔn a wɔato gon n',
Fa Wo woraba ne hyerɛn 
Gya hɔn abamba.

MHB 133
5 . Onward through the darkness
Of the lonely night,
Shining still before them
With thy kindly light,
Guide them, Jew and Gentile,
Homeward from afar,
Young and old together,
By thy guiding star.	 ~ 	5 . Gya hɔn fa sum kebii m',
Ber a obi nnkɔ mmba n',
Hyerɛn dzi hɔn enyim kan
Wɔ Wo dɔ kan n' mu;
Jewfo na Amamforafo,
Akobɔfo nyina,
Mbofra na mpanyin so,
Fa woraba n' gya hɔn.

MHB 134
1 . GLORY be to God on high,
And peace on earth descend:
God comes down, He bows the sky,
And shows Himself our Friend:
God the invisible appears:
God, the blest, the great I AM,
Sojourns in this vale of tears,
And Jesus is His name.
	 ~ 	1 . 'NYIMNYAM nka Nyame wɔ sor, 
Na asomdwee nsian asaase;
Nyankopɔn, dwir, konton wimu,
Na ɔkyerɛ dɛ ɔyɛ nyɛnko:
Nyame a yennhu No n'aba:
Nyame osiarfo, MARA
Aba nyinsu bɔnsa yi m'
Na Ne dzin nye Jesus.

Hom nhw sor na ase Wura a
Afei wɔyɛɛ No honam n'
Da mbowa edzidzibea.

MHB 134
2 . Him the angels all adored,
Their Maker and their King;
Tidings of their humbled Lord
They now to mortals bring.
Emptied of his majesty,
Of His dazzling glories shorn,
Being’s source begins to be,
And God Himself is born!
See the eternal Son of God
A mortal Son of man;
Dwelling in an earthly clod,
Whom heaven cannot contain.
Stand amazed, ye heavens, at this:
See the Lord of earth and skies;
Humbled to the dust He is,
And in a manger lies.
	 ~ 	2 . Abɔfo nyina tontoon
Hɔn Bɔfo na hɔn Hen;
Wɔdze hɔn Wura brɛfo n'
Ho nsɛm brɛɛ adasa.
Ɔtoo N'ahendzi no pan,
N'enyimnyam nwanwa n' hyerɛn, 
Nkwa farbaa no hyɛ ase;
Wɔawo Nyame ankasa!

MHB 134
4 . We,the sons of men, now rejoice,
The Prince of peace proclaim;
With heaven’s host lift up our voice,
And shout Immanuel’s name:
Knees and hearts to Him we bow;
Of our flesh and of our bone,
Jesus is our brother now,
And God is all our own.	 ~ 	4 . Hɛn nyimpa mba, yendzi dɛw, 
Mbɔ asomdwee Hen n' dawur,
Yɛnye sor dɔm mma ndze do
Mfa Immanuel dzin ntsea m':
Hɛn anan, hɛn akoma kotow N',
Jesus hɛn honam mu nyi n'
Yɛ hɛn Nua sesei ampa,
Na Nyame yɛ hɛndze.

MHB 135
1 . STUPENDOUS height of heavenly love,
Of pitying tenderness divine;
It brought the Saviour from above,
It caused the springing day to shine;
The Sun of Righteousness to appear,
And gild our gloomy hemisphere.
	 ~ 	1 . Ɔsor dɔ no ɔkrɔn dodow, 
Nyame Baatan N' ayamuhyehye;
Ɔdze Agyenkwa fi sor bae,
Ɔmaa da pa n' hyerɛɛn hɛn do,
Na tsenenee ewia no puei,
Bɛtseew hɛn sum wiadze enyi.

MHB 135
2 . God did in Christ Himself reveal,
To chase our darkness by His light,
Our sin and ignorance dispel,
Direct our wandering feet aright;
And bring our souls, with pardon blest,
To realms of everlasting rest.
	 ~ 	2 . Nyame daa edzi wɔ Christ mu, 
Dze Ne kan abɛpam hɛn sum,
Etu hɛn bɔn na enyifura,
Dze hɛn nan esi kwan pa mu;
Na hɛn akra a woenya fakyɛ,
Akɔ daa ahomgye man no '.

MHB 135
3 . Come then, O Lord, Thy light impart,
The faith that bids our terrors cease;
Into Thy love direct my heart,
Into Thy way of perfect peace;
And cheer the soul of death afraid,
And guide me through the dreadful shade.
	 ~ 	3 . Ewuradze, fa Wo kan bra, 
Gyedzi a otu hɛn suro no a;
Ma Wo dɔ nkitsa hɛn 'koma,
Gya hɛn kɔ W' asomdwee kwan mu;
Hɛn akra a wosuro wu dzen,
Gya hɔn twa no sunsuma mu.

MHB 135
4 . Answer Thy mercy’s whole design,
My God incarnated for me;
My spirit make Thy radiant shrine,
My light and full salvation be;
And through the shades of death unknown
Conduct me to Thy dazzling throne.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Ma W' adom ne nhyehyɛɛ nda edzi, 
Nyame a ɔbɛyɛɛ nyimpa maa m';
Mo sunsum nyɛ Wo fie krɔnkrɔn,
Yɛ me kan na mo nkwagye mu;
Gya me twa owu sum no mu
Kodu W' ahengua enyim hɔ.

MHB 136
1 . THE Maker of the sun and moon,
The Maker of our earth,
Lo! late in time, a fairer boon,
Himself is brought to birth.
	 ~ 	1 . EWIA na bosoom Yɛfo no,
Hɛn asaase yi Yɛfo n',
Hwɛ! Akyɛdze pa a ɔammba ntsɛm, 
Ɔaba ma wɔawo No.

MHB 136
2 . How blest was all creation then,
When God so gave increase;
And Christ, to heal the hearts of men,
Brought righteousness and peace.
	 ~ 	2 . Ber a Nyame maa yɛdɔree no,
Wiadze nyaa siar kɛse;
Christ dze tsenenee na asomdwee
Bɛsaa akoma yarba.

MHB 136
3 . No star in all the heights of heaven
But burned to see Him go;
Yet unto earth alone was given
His human form to know.
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔsor nworaba nyinara
Hyerɛɛn dze gyaa No kwan;
Naaso adasa nko na wɔmaa
Wohum Ne nyimpa su.

MHB 136
4 . His human form, by man denied,
Took death for human sin:
His endless love, through faith descried,
Still lives the world to win.
	 ~ 	4 . Adaasa poow Ne nyimpa su,
Naaso owui hɛn bɔn ntsi;
No dɔ a wɔnam gyedzi do hu n'
Da ho gye wiadze nkwa.

MHB 136
5 . O perfect love, outpassing sight,
O Light beyond our ken,
Come down through all the world to-night,
And heal the hearts of men!      Amen.	 ~ 	5 . O ɔdɔ mapa a yenntum nnhu,
Kan a ɔtra ntseasee,
Sian bra wiadze anago yi,
Bɛsa akoma yarba.

MHB 137
1 . IN the bleak mid-winter,
Frosty wind made moan,
Earth stood hard as iron,
Water like a stone;
Snow had fallen, snow on snow,
Snow on snow,
In the bleak mid-winter, 
Long ago.
	 ~ 	1 . AWƆW kɛse ber mu,
Mframa nwin bi bɔe;
Famu yɛɛ dɛ dadze,
N-su kyeen dɛ ɔbo;
Esukwankyɛba tɔɔ pii,
'Sukwankyɛba;
Awɔw kɛse ber mu,
Tsetseber mu.

MHB 137
2 . Our God, heaven cannot hold Him,
Nor earth sustain;
Heaven and earth shall flee away
When He comes to reign:
In the bleak mid-winter
A stable-grace sufficed
The Lord God Almighty, 
Jesus Christ.
	 ~ 	2 . Hɛn Nyame, sor nntum nnkora W',
Asaase so nntum;
Sor na asaase boguan
Ber a obedzi adze;
Awɔw kɛse ber no mu ',
Mbowadan mpo ye;
Ewuradze Nyame Tumfo,
O Jesus Christ!

MHB 137
3 . Angels and archangels
May have gathered there,
Cherubim and seraphim
Thronged the air;
But His mother only,
In her maiden bliss,
Worshipped the Beloved 
With a kiss.
	 ~ 	3 . Nna abɔfo ahorow
Pii etwa ehyia;
Cherubfo, Seraphfo
Wokyiin wɔ wimu;
Naaso Ne na nkotoo wɔ
Ne mbaabun ber m'
Dze ɔdwe mfewano sɔɔr
No Dɔba no.

MHB 137
4 . What can I give Him, 
Poor as I am ?
If I were a shepherd, 
I would bring a lamb;
If I were a wise man, 
I would do my part;
Yet what I can I give Him –   
Give my heart.	 ~ 	4 . Ebɛn na m'bɛma Wo
Emi hianyi yi?
Sɛ meyɛ guanhwɛfo a,
Nkyɛ m'bɛma 'guambaa;
Sɛ meyɛ nyansafo dze a,
Nkyɛ m'bɛyɛ m'dze;
Ebɛn mpo na m'bɛma?
M'akoma nko.

MHB 138
1 . LOVE came down at Christmas,
Love all lovely, Love divine;
Love was born at Christmas,
Star and angels gave the sign.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆDƆ siaan Borɔnya ber,
Sunsum dɔ a ɔyɛ fɛw;
Wɔwoo ɔdɔ wɔ Borɔnya,
Woraba na abɔfo kyerɛɛ dɛm.

MHB 138
2 . Worship we the Godhead,
Love Incarnate, Love divine;
Worship we our Jesus:
But wherewith for sacred sign?
	 ~ 	2 . Yɛsom Nyametsir no,
Nyame Dɔ a ɔyɛɛ Nyimpa; 
Yɛsom hɛn Jesus Christ;
Yɛmfa asɛnkyerɛdze bɛn?

MHB 138
3 . Love shall be our token,
Love be yours and love be mine,
Love to God and all men,
Love for plea and gift and sign.	 ~ 	3 . Dɔ bɛyɛ asɛnkyerɛdze,
Dɔ nyɛ wodze, nyɛ medze; 
Dɔ nka Nyame na adasa, 
Dɔ a ɔserɛ, kyɛ adze, hyɛ nsew.

MHB 139
1 . THE race that long in darkness pined,
Have seen a glorious Light;
The people dwell in day, who dwelt
In death’s surrounding night.
	 ~ 	1 . NYIMPA a wɔhyɛɛ sum mu kyɛree n'
Ehu enyimnyam kan no;
Hɔn a wɔtsenaa owu sum mu
Wɔ adzekyee kan mu.

MHB 139
2 . To hail Thy rise, Thou better Sun,
The gathering nations come,
Joyous as when the reapers bear
The harvest-treasures home.
	 ~ 	2 . Aman no boaboa hɔn ano,
Ba bohua W', sor Ewia;
Sɛ wɔba a, wɔdze enyigye dɛ 
Hɔn a wobu ndɔbaa.

MHB 139
3 . To us a Child of Hope is born,
To us a Son is given;
Him shall the tribes of earth obey,
Him all the hosts of heaven.
	 ~ 	3 . Wɔawo Enyidar Ba ama hɛn 
Wɔama hɛn Babanyin;
Ebusua nyina betsie No,
Sor dɔm nyina betsie N'.

MHB 139
4 . His name shall be the Prince of Peace,
For evermore adored,
The Wonderful, the Counselor,
The great and mighty Lord.
	 ~ 	4 . Wɔbɛfrɛ No asomdwee Hen,
Na wɔbɔsɔr No daa;
Ɔnwanwanyi, Ɔfotufo,
Ewuradze Tumfo pa.

MHB 139
5 . His power increasing still shall spread,
His reign no end shall know:
Justice shall guard His throne above,
And peace abound below.	 ~ 	5 . No tum bɔkɔ do atserɛw,
N'ahendzi nnkɔbɔ adze;
Pɛrpɛr botwa No sor egua n'  ho
Ma asomdwee eebu do ha.

MHB 14
1 . PRAISE the Lord who reigns above,
And keeps His court below;
Praise the holy God of love,
And all His greatness show;
Praise Him for His noble deeds,
Praise Him for His matchless power:
Him from whom all good proceeds
Let earth and heaven adore.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM nyi sor Hen no ayɛw,
Ɔkora N'aban wɔ ase;
Yi ɔdɔ Nyame n'ayɛw,
Da N'akeseyɛ edzi;
Yi N'ayɛw, Ne ndzeyɛɛ ho,
Kamfo No tum kɛse no:
Ndzepa nyina fir No ho,
Sor na asaase ntonton N'.

MHB 14
2 . Celebrate the eternal Go
With harp and psaltery,
Timbrels soft and cymbals loud
In His high praise agree:
Praise Him every tuneful string;
All the reach of heavenly art,
All the powers of music bring.
The music of the heart.
	 ~ 	2 . Hom mfa nsanku na ndwom pa 
Nkamfo daa daa Nyame n',
Akasaa na akyem ndze mbɔ m;
Nhur Ne dzin kɛse mo:
Nyia ɔwɔ ndze biara ntonton N';
Ɔsor edwindze nyina,
Hom mfa asokwadze nyina mbra,
Mbɔtow N'akoma m'ndwom.

MHB 14
3 . Him, in whom they move and live,
Let every creature sing
Glory to their Maker give,
And homage to their King:
Hallowed be his name beneath,
As in heaven on earth adored;
Praise the Lord in every breath,
Let all things praise the Lord.    
				Amen.	 ~ 	3 . Wɔmma abɔdze nyina ntow ndwom,
Mma Nyia wɔtse No mu n',
Wɔnhyɛ hɔn Bɔfo enyimnyam,
Wongu N'enyim ebiritsi:
Hom ntsew Ne dzin ho wɔ ase,
Dɛ mbrɛ wɔyɛ no wɔ sor;
Wɔmma abɔdze nyina ntonton 
Ewuradze aber nyina.   Amen.

MHB 140
1 . GOD from on high hath heard;
Let sighs and sorrows cease;
The skies unfold, and lo!
Descends the gift of peace.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME fi sor atse;
Hom ngyaa nkrumsi nyina;
Na hom nhwɛ, wimu ebue!
'Somdwee akyɛdze n' esian.

MHB 140
2 . Hark! on the midnight air
Celestial voice swell;
The hosts of heaven proclaim
God comes on earth to dwell.
	 ~ 	2 . Tsie! Sor abɔfo ndze 
Gyegye anafua esuom; 
Ɔsor dɔm tsea mu dɛ, 
Nyame aba asaase do.

MHB 140
3 . Haste with the shepherds; see
The mystery of grace:
A manger-bed, a child,
Is all the eye can trace.
	 ~ 	3 . Ka nguanhwɛfo no hɔ 
Kɔhwɛ adom esumasɛm;
Dza enyi hu nyina nye
Ɔba a ɔda nguambuw m'.

MHB 140
4 . Is this the Eternal Son ,
Who on the starry throne
Before the worlds begun
Was with the Father One?
	 ~ 	4 . Nnyɛ Oyi nye Ɔdomakoma Ba a
Ɔtse sor ahengua n' do,
Nyia wonnyaa mmbɔɔ wiadze n'
Ɔnye Egya no wɔ hɔ n'?

MHB 140
5 . Yes, faith can pierce the cloud
Which shrouds His   glory now,
And hail Him God and Lord,
To whom all creatures  bow.
	 ~ 	5 . Gyedzi Wura, mununkum a 
Odura N'enyimnyam ho n'
Hua Ewuradze Nyame,
Nyia abɔdze nyina kotow N'.

MHB 140
6 . Faith sees the sapphire throne,
Where angels evermore
Adoring tremble still,
And trembling still adore.
	 ~ 	6 . Gyedzi hu ahengua n', 
Bea a abɔfo wɔ afebɔɔ;
Abɔfo ho popo,
Wɔdze ahopopo sɔr N'.

MHB 140
7 . O child! Thy silence speaks,
And bids us not refuse
To bear what flesh would shun,
To spurn what flesh would choose.
	 ~ 	7 . Akɔkowa, Wo kommyɛ n' 
Kyerɛ hɛn dɛ yɛmpow
Dza honam pɛ biara,
Yennkyir akɔndɔbɔn.

MHB 140
8 . Fill us with holy love,
Heal Thou our earthly pride;
Born in each lowly heart,
For ever there abide.  Amen.	 ~ 	8 . Fa dɔ krɔnkrɔn mee hɛn,
Yi hɛn ahantan kɔ;
Hɛn akoma brɛfo biara m',
Na tsena mu afebɔɔ.

MHB 141
1 . TO us a child of royal birth,
Heir of the promises, is given;
The invisible appears on earth,
The Son of Man, the God of heaven.
	 ~ 	1 . WƆAWO adehyeba ama hɛn, 
Wɔdze anohoba Dzifo am;
Nyia wonnhu N' boka asaase do,
Nyimpa Ba n', Ɔsor Nyame no.

MHB 141
2 . A Saviour born, in love supreme
