He comes our fallen souls to raise;
He comes his people to redeem
With all His plentitude of grace.
	 ~ 	2 . Wɔawo Agyenkwa, dɔ kɛse mu,
Ɔaba rebɛma famufo do;
Ɔaba dɛ ɔdze N'adom kɛse n'
Robɔpɔn No nkorɔfo nyina.

MHB 141
3 . The Christ, by raptured seers foretold,
Filled with the eternal Spirit’s power,
Prophet, and Priest, and King behold,
And Lord of all the worlds adore.
	 ~ 	3 . Christ no a wɔhyɛɛ No ho nkɔm no,
Sunsum No tum no hyɛɛ No ma
Ma ɔyɛɛ Nkɔnhyɛnyi, Sɔfo, Hen,
Nye ɔsor wiadze nyina Wura.

MHB 141
4 . The Lord of hosts, the God most high,
who quits His throne on earth to live,
with joy we welcome from the sky,
with faith into our hearts receive.	 ~ 	4 . Dɔm Ewuradze, sorsor Nyame,
Igyaa W'ahengua baa wiadze;
Yɛdze dɛw ma Wo akɔaba
Gyedzi mu to hɛn akoma mu.

MHB 142
1 . LET earth and heaven combine,
Angels and men agree,
To praise in songs divine
The incarnate Deity,
Our God contracted to a span,
Incomprehensibly made man.
	 ~ 	1 . MA asaase na sor mbɔ m'
'Bɔfo na nyimpa mpen,
Wɔntow ayɛyi ndwom
Mma Nyame a ɔbɛbrae; 
Hɛn Nyame adan Noho nyimpa,
Yennkotum atse iyi ase.

MHB 142
2 . He laid His glory by,
He wrapped Him in our clay;
Unmarked by human eye,
The latent Godhead lay;
Infant of days He here became,
And bore the mild Immanuel’s name.
	 ~ 	2 . Ogyaa N'enyimnyam hɔ,
Ɔhyɛɛ hɛn honam bi, 
Ɔda hɔ no, nyimpa
Ennhu N' dɛ Nyame Ba a;
Ɔbɛyɛɛ akɔkowa wɔ ha,
Na wɔtoo No dzin Immanuel.

MHB 142
4 . He deigns in flesh to appear,
Widest extremes to join;
To bring our vileness near,
And make us all divine:
And we the life of God shall know,
For God is manifest below.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔdɔ a wonntum nnhwehwɛ m' 
Na ɔdze Agyenkwa aba;
Adom no bor nyimpa
Nye abɔfo adwen do;
O Nyame, ma yenhu no dɛ
Hɛn Nyame Noara ɔabɛbra.

MHB 142
5 . Made perfect first in love,
And sanctified by grace,
We shall from earth remove,
And see His glorious face:
Then shall His love be fully showed,
And man shall then be lost in God.	 ~ 	5 . Ɔpeen dɛ ɔba honam m',
Dze sor na ase abɔ m';
'Bɛda hɛn bɔn edzi,
Ma yaayɛ Nyame dze;
Na yaabɔ Nyankopɔm do bra,
'Siandɛ Nyame ada edzi wɔ ha.

MHB 143
1 . GOOD Christian men, rejoice
With heart and soul and voice!
Give ye heed to what we say: News! News! 
Jesus Christ is born to-day.
Ox and ass before Him bow,
And He is in the manger now:
Christ is born to-day.
	 ~ 	1 . CHRISTIANFO pa, hom mfa
Akoma, kra, ndze ndzi dwɛ! 
Hom ntsie dza yɛreka yi;
Nsɛm! Nsɛm!
Wɔawo Jesus Christ ndɛ da 'i,
Nantwi na asoaso kotow N'
Na ɔda mbowa edzidzidaka m';
Wɔawo Christ ndɛ da 'i.

MHB 143
2 . Good Christian men, rejoice
With heart and soul and voice!
Now ye hear of endless bliss: Joy! Joy!
Jesus Christ was born for this.
He hath oped the heavenly door,
And man is blest for evermore.
Christ was born for this.
	 ~ 	2 . Christianfo pa, hom mfa
Akoma, kra, ndze ndzi dɛw!
Nkyii hom ntsie dɛw a ɔmmbɔ adze;
Dɛw! Dɛw!
Dɛm ntsi na wɔwoo Jesus,
Oebue sor abobow no,
Na woehyira nyimpa afebɔɔ
Wɔwoo N' wɔ yi ntsi.

MHB 143
3 . Good Christian men, rejoice
With heart and soul and voice!
Now ye need not fear the grave: 
   Peace ! Peace! 
Jesus Christ was born to save; 
Calls you one,  and calls you all, 
To gain His everlasting hall.
Christ was born to save.	 ~ 	3 . Christianfo pa, hom mfa
Akoma, kra, ndze ndzi dɛw!
Onnhia dɛ hom suro wumaa:
'Somdwee!
Wɔwoo Christ dɛ ɔmbɛgye nkwa;
Ɔfrɛ wo, ɔfrɛ hom nyina,
Hom mbɛtsena Ne nkyɛn afebɔɔ;
Christ baa bɛgyee nkwa.

MHB 144
1 . MY song is love unknown;
My Saviour’s love to me;
Love to the loveless shown,
That they might lovely be.
	O who am I
	That for my sake,
	 My Lord should take
	 Frail flesh ,and die?
	 ~ 	1 . MO ndwom nye dɔ a wonnyim a 
M'Agyenkwa dze dɔ me;
Ɔdɔ hɔn a wɔnndɔ N',
Ama hɔn so eenya dɔ.
Woana nye me
Na emi ntsi
Mo wura bɛyɛɛ
Nyimpa na owui?

MHB 144
2 . He came from His blest Throne,
Salvation to bestow:
But men made strange, and none
The longed-for Christ would know.
	   But O, my Friend!
	   My Friend indeed,
	   Who at my need
	   His life did spend!
	 ~ 	2 . Ofi N siar 'hengua
Do dze No nkwagye bae;
Na adasa ennhu
Christ a yɛahwɛ No kwan n';
O me nyɛnko pa!
Me nyɛnko pa,
Ohiaa me no,
Ɔfɛɛm m' No nkwa.

MHB 144
3 . Sometimes they strew His way,
And His sweet praises sing;
Resounding all the day,
Hosannas to their King.
	   Then :Crucify!
	   Is all their breath,
	   And for His death
	   They thirst and cry.
	 ~ 	3 . Sɛ odu mber bi a,
Wɔdze berɛw sɛw No kwan m';
Wɔtow ayɛyi ndwom,
Hosanna ma hɔn Hen.
Afei wɔdɛ;
Bɔ No mbeamudua m'!
Wɔtseatseaa mu
Dɛ wonku No.

MHB 144
4 . Why, what hath my Lord done?
What makes this rage and spite?
He made the lame to run,
He gave the blind their sight.
	    Sweet injuries!
	    Yet they at these
	    Themselves displease,
	     And ’gainst Him rise.
	 ~ 	4 . Ebɛn na mo Wura ayɛ? 
'Bɛn ntsi na wɔtan No?
Ɔmaa mbubua nantsewee,
Enyifurafo hun adze,
Wopiraa No!
Wentwiwentwi
Sii hɔnara ntamu
Wɔsoɛree tsiaa N'.

MHB 144
5 . They rise and needs will have
My dear Lord made away;
A murderer they save;
The Prince of Life they slay.
	   Yet cheerful He
	  To suffering goes,
	  That He His foes
	  From thence might free.
	 ~ 	5 . Wɔsoɛr, na wɔka dɛ 
Wɔmfa mo Wura nkɔ;
Wɔgye owudzinyi nkwa
Na woku nkwa Hen no!
Ɔdze enyigye
Hun amandze,
Ma N'atamfo
Eenya ahotɔ.

MHB 144
6 . In life, no house, no home
My Lord on earth might have;
In death, no friendly tomb
But what a stranger gave.
	 What may I say?
	 Heaven was his home;
	 But mine the tomb
	 Wherein He lay.
	 ~ 	6 . Mo Wura ennya ofie
Wɔ asaase do anntsena m';
Owu m' oennya wumaa,
Gyedɛ dza ɔhɔho mae.
'Bɛn na menka?
Sor nye Ne fie;
Naaso medze
Nye bea a ɔdae no.

MHB 144
7 . Here might I stay and sing,
No story so divine;
Never was love, dear King,
Never was grief like Thine!
	  This is my Friend,
	  In whose sweet praise
	  I all my days
	  Could gladly spend.	 ~ 	7 . Ma mentsena ha ntow ndwom,
Asɛm biara nnhia dɛm;
Ɔhen, dɔ na yaw bi
Nnyi hɔ a ɔtse dɛ Wodze n'.
Me Nyɛnko nye N',
Medze enyigye
Beyi N' ayɛw
Mo nkwa nda nyina.

MHB 145
1 . WHAT grace, O Lord, and beauty shone
Around Thy steps below;
What patient love was seen in all
Thy life and death of woe!
	 ~ 	1 . OWURA, ahoɔfɛw bɛn na annhyerɛn
Wɔ W'anan ho wɔ ha?
Ɔdɔ na yaw bɛn na Wo nkwa
Na wu mu annda edzi?

MHB 145
2 . For ever on Thy burdened heart
A weight of sorrow hung,
Yet no ungentle, murmuring word
Escaped Thy silent tongue.
	 ~ 	2 . Awerɛhow adzesoa durdur, 
Daa W'akoma do daa,
Naaso ehwinhwin biara emmfi
W'anomu emmpue ara da.

MHB 145
3 . Thy foes might hate, despise, revile,
Thy friends unfaithful prove.
Unwearied in forgiveness still,
Thy heart could only love.
	 ~ 	3 . W'atamfo bɛtan W', ayaw Wo,
W'anyɛnkofo apow Wo:
Ennkɛberɛ dɛ edze bɛkyɛ hɔn,
Na akɔ do adɔ hɔn.

MHB 145
4 . O give us hearts to love like Thee,
Like Thee, O Lord, to grieve
Far more for others’ sins, than all
The wrongs that we receive.
	 ~ 	4 . Ma hɛn akoma yɛndɔ dɛ Ɔwo, 
Na Ewuradze, yendzi yaw 
Kɛse mma binom bɔn ma ɔnsen
Dza wɔyɛ dze tsia hɛn n'.

MHB 145
5 . One with Thyself, may every eye
In us, Thy brethren, see
The gentleness and grace that spring
From union, Lord, with Thee.	 ~ 	5 . Hɛn a yɛyɛ Wo nuanom yi, 
Ma yɛnhwɛ adze dɛ Ɔwo,
Yenhu ahobrɛadze na adom a 
Ofi hɛn nye W' koryɛ m'.

MHB 146
1 . JESUS, who lived above the sky,
Came down to be a man and die;
And in the Bible we may see
How very good He used to be.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS a ɔtse sor noho 
Bae bɛyɛɛ nyimpa na owui;
Nwoma Krɔnkrɔn no mu yehu 
Mbrɛ osii na ɔyɛɛ papa.

MHB 146
2 . He went about-He was so kind-
To cure poor people who were blind;
And many who were sick and lame,
He pitied them and did the same
	 ~ 	2 . Okyiin mbeambea, ɔyɛɛ ayamuyie, 
Ɔmaa enyifurafo hun adze
Ayarfo na ebubuafo,
Ohun hɔn mbɔbɔr saa hɔn yar.

MHB 146
3 . And more than that, He told them, too,
The things that God would have them do;
And was so gentle and so mild,
He would have listened to a child.
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔkaa nsɛmpa no so kyerɛɛ hɔn,
Dza Nyankopɔn pɛ dɛ wɔyɛ;
Ɔkyerɛɛ ɔdwe maa obiara,
Ma nkyɛ obetsie mbofra mpo.

MHB 146
4 . But such a cruel death He died!
He was hung up and crucified;
And those kind hands that did such good,
They nailed them to a cross of wood.
	 ~ 	4 . Naaso ohun owu yaayaw bi!
Wɔsɛɛn No wɔ mbeamudua do;
N-sa pa a ɔdze yɛɛ papa n',
Wɔdze mprɛgow bɔɔ m' wɔ dua do.

MHB 146
5 . And so He died — and this is why
He came to be a man and die;
The Bible says He came from heaven,
That we might have our sins forgiven.	 ~ 	5 . Nwoma Krɔnkrɔn ka dɛ ofi sor
Bɛyɛɛ nyimpa ama oeewu;
Ma wɔdze hɛn bɔn aakyɛ hɛn;
Iyi ntsi na ɔbaa wiadze.

MHB 147
1 . WHEN the Lord of Love was here,
Happy hearts to Him were dear,
Though His heart was sad;
Worn and lonesome for our sake,
Yet He turned aside to make
All the weary glad.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆDƆ Wura wɔ ha no,
'Nyigye akoma soom No bo, 
Odzii yaw daa dze;
Hɛn ntsi ɔyɛɛ ankonam,
Naaso ɔdze too nkyɛn maa
Aberɛfo enyigye.

MHB 147
2 . Meek and lowly were His ways;
From His loving, grew His praise,
From His giving, prayer:
All the outcast thronged to hear;
All the sorrowful drew near
To enjoy His care.
	 ~ 	2 . N'akwan yɛɛ ahobrɛadze;
'No dɔ gyee hɛn ayɛyi,
N'adɔe,, hɛn mpaabɔ;
Tokyemfo nyina betsiee No;
Awerɛhofo twee bɛɛn No 
Benyaa awerɛkyekyer.

MHB 147
3 . When He walked the fields, He drew
From the flowers, and birds, and dew,
Parables of God;
For within His heart of love
All the soul of man did move,
God had His abode.
	 ~ 	3 . Ber a ɔnam haban mu no, 
Ɔhwɛɛ nhyiren, nnoma na buw, 
Buu Nyame ho mbɛ;
Na No dɔ akoma m' kasa
Kaa nyimpa mba hɔn akra;
Hɔ na Nyame wɔ.

MHB 147
4 . Fill us, Lord, with Thy deep desire
All the sinful to inspire
With the Father’s life;
Free us from the cares that press
On the heart of worldliness,
From the fret and strife.
	 ~ 	4 . Owura, fa Wo pɛ ma hɛn,
Ma yɛmfa Egya N' nkwa nkenyan 
Abɔnfo nyina;
Gye hɛn fi wiadze haw a 
Ɔhyɛ hɛn akoma do kɔ 
Berɛ na aperdzi m'.

MHB 147
5 . Lord, be ours Thy power to keep,
In the very heart of grief
And in trial, love;
In our meekness to be wise,
And through sorrow to arise
To our God above.    Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Ewuradze ma yensie
Wo tum wɔ awerɛhow mu,
Wo dɔ wɔ haw mu;
Yennya nyansa, botooyɛ m',
Na yemfi awerɛhow mu 
Nsoɛr nkɔ Nyame hɔ.

MHB 148
1 . WE saw Thee not when Thou didst come
To this poor world of sin and death,
Nor e’er beheld Thy cottage home
In that despisèd Nazareth;
But we believe Thy footsteps trod
Its streets and plains, Thou Son of God.
	 ~ 	1 . YEENNHU Wo  aber a ebaa
Bɔn na wu wiadze yi mu no,
Yeennhu Wo wɔ Wo fie no mu
Wɔ Nazareth ekùraase ho;
Naaso, Nyame Ba, yɛgye dzi
Dɛ enantseew n’abɔntsen do.

MHB 148
2 . We did not see Thee lifted high
Amid that wild and savage crew,
Nor heard Thy meek, imploring cry:
Forgive, they know not what they do!
Yet we believe the deed was done,
Which shook the earth and veiled the sun.
	 ~ 	2 . Yeennhu Wo ber a nyimpa bɔn
Maa Wo do sɛɛn hɔ wɔ sor no;
Yɛanntse ahobrɛadze ndze nò a
Edze sèrεe: Egya fa kyε hɔn.
Naaso yεgye dzà ɔmaà asaase
Wosowee na sum dwirii no dzi.

MHB 148
3 . We stood not by the empty tomb
Where late Thy sacred body lay,
Nor sat within that upper room,
Nor met Thee on the open way;
But we believe that angels said:
Why seek the living with the dead?
	 ~ 	3 . Yeenngyina ndà a atɔ pan no ho,
Beà a Wo fun krɔnkrɔn no dae no,
Yɛanntsénà abansor no mu hɔ bi,
Yeennhu Wo petee mu hɔ so;
Mbom yεgyé abɔfo n’ nsεm n’ dzi dε:
Hom hwehwε ’nyikamfò ewufo m’?

MHB 148
4 . We did not mark the chosen few,
When Thou didst through the clouds ascend,
First lift to heaven their wondering view,
Then to the earth all prostrate bend;
Yet we believe that mortal eyes
Beheld that journey to the skies.
	 ~ 	4 . Yεannhyε nyimpa kakra no nsew,
Hɔn a wohun dε efoow sor n’;
Wɔdze ahobow hwεε sor hann,
Na wobutuuw famù wɔsɔɔr Wo;
Naaso yεgye dzi dε nyimpa
Enyi hun mbrε isii kr sor.

MHB 148
5 . And now that Thou dost reign on high,
And thence Thy waiting people bless,
No ray of glory from the sky
Doth shine upon our wilderness;
But we believe Thy faithful Word,
And trust in our redeeming Lord.	 ~ 	5 . Na afei idzi hen wɔ sor,
Na ’fi ho hyira Wo nkòrɔfo,
Na kan biara mmfi hɔ nnsian mmba
Mmbεhyerεn wɔ hεn sar yi do;
Naaso yεgye W’anosεm dzi,
Yεtwer hεn Pomfo Ewùradze.

MHB 149
1 . AND didst Thou love the race that loved not Thee?
And didst Thou take to heaven a human brow?
Dost plead with man’s voice by the marvelous sea?
Art Thou his Kinsman now?
	 ~ 	1 . ANA edɔɔ nyimpa a wɔanndɔ Wo no?
Ana 'dze nyimpa enyim fowee kɔr sor? 
Edze nyimpa ndze serɛɛ wɔ po no ho?
Eyɛ n' busuanyi ndɛ.

MHB 149
2 . O God, O Kinsman ,loved, but not enough!
O Man, with eyes majestic after death!
Whose feet have toiled along our pathways rough,
Whose lips drawn human breath!
	 ~ 	2 . O Nyame, hɛn Nua a yɛanndɔ Wo yie!
O Nyimpa, W'enyim baa nyam owu ekyir!
Ɔwo a enantseew nkɔntɔnkye kwan do,
Iguu ahom dɛ nyimpa!

MHB 149
3 . By that one likeness which is ours and Thine,
By that one nature which doth hold us kin,
By that high heaven where, sinless, Thou dost shine,
To draw us sinners in;
	 ~ 	3 . Hwɛ ɔsɛ a yɛnye Wo sɛ no ho,
Hwɛ su kor a ɔma yɛnye W' bɔ ebusua,
Hwɛ sor a bɔn nnyi hɔ a Ɔwo hyerɛn hɔ ho
Na twe hɛn abɔnfo kɔ m'.

MHB 149
4 . By Thy last silence in the judgment hall,
By long foreknowledge of the deadly tree,
By darkness, by the worm wood and the gall,
I pray Thee visit me.
	 ~ 	4 . Hwɛ Wo kommyɛ wɔ asɛndzii hɔ no,
Hwɛ dua do wu a inyim dada no ho,
Hwɛ sum, bɔwen na bɔwema no ho,
Meserɛ Wo, bɔhwɛ me.

MHB 149
5 . Come, lest this heart should, cold and cast away,
Die ere the Guest adored she entertain—
Lest eyes which never saw Thine earthly day
Should miss Thy heavenly reign.	 ~ 	5 . Bra, na annyɛ a akoma nwinwin no
Bowu ansaana no Hɔhoe n' aba m';
Annyɛ a enyi a oennhu Wo wiadze no
Runnhu Wo sor ahendzi.

MHB 15
1 . PRAISE to the living God!
All praised be His name,
Who was, and is, and is to be.
For aye the same!
The one Eternal God
Ere aught that now appears:
The First, the Last, beyond all thought
His timeless years!
	 ~ 	1 . NHYIRA nka tsease Nyame!
N-hyira nka Ne dzin,
Ɔwɔ hɔ na ɔda ho wɔ hɔ,
Ɔtse dɛm daa!
Daapem Nyame kor no
Afei oeyi Noho:
Ɔwo nye Ahyɛse na Ewiei,
Onnyiewiei nye W'.

MHB 15
2 . Formless, all lovely forms
Declare His loveliness;
Holy, no holiness of earth
Can His express.
Lo, He is Lord of all!
Creation speaks His praise,
And everywhere, above, below,
His will obeys.
	 ~ 	2 . Onnyi bɔbea naaso
Abɔdze nyim N'adɔe;
Krɔnkrɔnnyɛ mu a, wiadze nnkotum
Akyerɛ Nedze n'.
Ɔyɛ adze nyina Wura!
Abɔdze yi N'ayɛw,
Beebiara ɔsor nye ase
Ye N'apɛdze.

MHB 15
3 . His Spirit floweth free,
High surging where it will:
In prophets word He spake of old,
He spaketh still.
Established is His law,
And changeless it shall stand.
Deep writ upon the human heart,
On sea, on land.
	 ~ 	3 . No Sunsum no pem kwa
Kɔ beebiara a ɔpɛ:
Oduaa nkɔnhyɛfo do kasae,
'Da ho kasa.
Ne mbra nsem no etsim,
Na ɔrennsesa da,
Wɔakyerɛw no nyimpa akoma do,
Po, asaase do.

MHB 15
4 . Eternal life hath He
Implanted in the soul
His love shall be our strength and stay.
While ages roll.
Praise to the living God!
All praised be His name,
Who was, and is, and is to be,
For aye the same.     
      Amen.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔdze onnyiewiei nkwa ahyɛ
Ɔkra biara mu ma;
No dɔ bɛyɛ hɛn ahoɔdzen,
Daa nyinara.
N-tonton nka Nyame!
N-tonton nka Ne dzin,
Ɔwɔ hɔ na oda ho wɔ hɔ,
Ɔtse dem daa.     Amen.

MHB 150
1 . THOU didst leave Thy throne 
And Thy kingly crown,
When Thou camest to earth for me;
But in Bethlehem’s home
Was there found no room
For Thy holy nativity:
O come to my heart, Lord Jesus,
There is room in my heart for Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . Igyaa W' ahengua 
Na W' ahenkyɛw so,
Ber a 'baa wiadze wɔ me ntsi n';
Na woennya kwan wɔ
Bethlehem fie hɔ,
Amma Wo wiadze ha ne mbae:
Ao, bra m' akomam', Ewuradze,
Ɔkwan wɔ m' akomam' ma Wo.

MHB 150
2 . Heaven’s arches rang
When the angels sang,
Proclaiming Thy royal degree;
But of lowly birth didst 
Cam’st Thou, Lord, on earth,
And in great humility:
O come to my heart, Lord Jesus;
There is room in my heart for Thee
	 ~ 	2 . Sor nyina gyigyee 
Ber a abɔfo toow ndwom
Bɔɔ W' adehye dzin no dawur n';
Na mbrɛadzem' ara
Na, Ɔsor Wura,
Ebaa asaase do ha:
Ao, bra m' akomam', Ewuradze,
Ɔkwan wɔ m' akomam' ma Wo.

MHB 150
3 . The foxes found rest, 
And the birds their nest,
In the shade of the cedar-tree;
But Thy couch was the sod, 
O Thou Son of God,
In the deserts of Galilee:
O come to my heart, Lord Jesus;
There is room in my heart for Thee
	 ~ 	3 . N-sɔ wɔ etu, 
Na nnoma berɛbuw,
Wɔ nkyindur no nwin ase;
Na Wo mpa nye dɛtse,
O Nyankopɔn Ba,
Dɛtse, wɔ Galilee sar do;
Ao, bra m' akomam', Ewuradze,
Ɔkwan wɔ m' akomam' ma Wo.

MHB 150
4 . Thou  camest, O Lord,
 With the living Word,
That should set Thy people free;
But with mocking scorn 
And with crown of thorn,
They bore Thee to Calvary:
O come to my heart, Lord Jesus;
Thy cross is my plea.
	 ~ 	4 . Ao, Ewuradze, 
'Dze nkasɛm no bae,
Dza nkyɛ ɔbɛma fahodzi;
Na wɔdze atwetwesi
Na nsoɛ katraka
Wosunsum Wo kɔr Calvary:
Ao, bra m' akomam', Ewuradze,
Ɔkwan wɔ m' akomam' ma Wo.

MHB 150
5 . When the heaven’s arches ring,
 And her choirs shall sing, 
At Thy coming to victory,
Let Thy voice call me home, 
Saying :Yet there is room,
There is room at My side for thee!
And my heart shall rejoice, Lord Jesus,
When Thou comest and callest for me.	 ~ 	5 . Sor bɔwosow bio 
Na abɔfo atow ndwom,
Ber a 'bɛba konyimdzi mu n';
Ma Wo ndze mfrɛ me fie
Dɛ, Kwan da ho wɔ hɔ,
Kwan da ho wɔ me nkyɛn ma Wo!
Na, mo Wura, m' akoma bedzi dɛw
Ber a 'bɛba na ebɛfrɛ me n'.

MHB 151
1 . WHO is He, in yonder stall,
At whose feet the shepherds fall?

     ’Tis the Lord! o wondrous story!
     ’Tis the Lord! the King of Glory!
     At His feet we humbly fall;
     Crown Him, crown Him Lord of all.
	 ~ 	1 . Woana na n-guanhwɛfo 
Kotow No mbowadan mu hɔ n'?

         Ewuradze a! O anwanwasɛm! 
         Ewuradze a, Enyimnyam Hen n' a. 
         Yetwa hwe N' ananadze; 
         O wɔnhyɛ No abɔso Hen.

MHB 151
2 . Who is He, in yonder cot,
Bending to His toilsome lot?
	 ~ 	2 . Woana na oridzi edwin 
Wɔ dan kakraba mu hɔ n'?

MHB 151
3 . Who is He, in deep distress,
Fasting in the wilderness?
	 ~ 	3 . Woana na ɔrekyen kɔm, 
Ɔreper wɔ sar do hɔ n'?

MHB 151
4 . Who is He that stands and weeps
At the grave where Lazarus sleeps?
	 ~ 	4 .	Woana na orusu wɔ 
Lazarus ne nda do hɔ n'?

MHB 151
5 . Lo, at midnight, who is He
Prays in dark Gethsemane?
	 ~ 	5 . Woana na ɔrobɔ mpaa 
Esuom wɔ Gethsamane n'?

MHB 151
6 . Who is He, in Calvary’s throes,
 Ask for blessings on His foes?
	 ~ 	6 . Woana na ɔserɛ nhyira 
Ma abɔn wɔ Calvary do n'?

MHB 151
7 . Who is He that from the grave
Comes to heal and help and save?
	 ~ 	7 . Woana na oefi ewufom' 
Roboa hɛn, regye hɛn nkwa n'?

MHB 151
8 . Who is He that from His throne
Rules through all the world’s alone?	 ~ 	8 . Woana na No nko dzi Hen 
Sor na asaase nyina do n'?

MHB 152
1 . WHAT means this eager, anxious throng,
Which moves with busy haste along,
These wondrous gatherings day by day?
What means this strange commotion, pray?
In accents hushed the throng reply:
Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.
	 ~ 	1 . Na nyimpa a wɔayɛ petsee yi, 
Wɔnam ɔhyew do yi, ase ɛ?
Ebɛn nye adzekyee ehyia yi?
Wentwiwenti 'i ase nye dɛn?
Okuw n' sii ndze adze buaa dɛ,
Narazeth Jesus na ɔresen n'.

MHB 152
2 . Who is this Jesus? why should He
The city move so mightily?
A passing stranger, has He skill
To move the multitude at will?
Again the stirring tones reply:
Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.
	 ~ 	2 . Jesus nye woana? Ɔyɛ dɛn 
Na ɔbɔ kurow ebutuw dɛm?
Ɔkwantsennyi a ɔresen,
Ɔdze bɛn twe nyimpa pii yi?
Awɔse ndze no buaa bio dɛ,
Narazeth Jesus na ɔresen n'.

MHB 152
3 . Jesus! ’tis He Who once below
Man’s pathway trod, ’mid pain and woe;
And burdened ones, wherever He came,
Brought out their sick, and deaf and lame:
The blind rejoiced to hear the cry:
Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.
	 ~ 	3 . Jesus! 'No na ɔbaa wiadze 
Boduaa mbusu kwan yi mu bi n';
Wɔdze ayarfo nyina brɛɛ No,
Etsitsifo ɔnye mpakye:
'Nyifurafo dze dɛw tsiee ntseamu n':
Narazeth Jesus na ɔresen n'.

MHB 152
4 . Again He comes! From place to place
His holy footprints we can trace,
He pauseth at our threshold—nay,
He enters—condescends to stay;
Shall we not gladly raise the cry?
Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔreba bio, fi ha kɔ ha, 
Yɛtse N' anamɔn wɔ mbeambea,
Oegyina hɛn abobowano,
Ɔahɛn dɛ ɔrobɔsoɛ hɔ;
Ana hɛn so yɛnnkɛpaam' dɛ,
Narazeth Jesus na ɔresen n'.

MHB 152
5 . Ho! all ye heavy laden, come,
Ye wanderers from a Father’s face,
Return, accept His proffered grace;
Ye tempted ones, there’s refuge nigh-
Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.	 ~ 	5 . Ao o! akobɔfo, hom mbra; 
Fakyɛ nye ahomgye wɔ ha;
Hom a hom efi Egya fie,
Hom nsan mbra bio mbɛgye N' adom;
Amandzehufo dɔbea nye 'i-
Narazeth Jesus na ɔresen n'.

MHB 153
1 . JESUS, Thy far-extended fame
My drooping soul exults to hear;
Thy name, thy all-restoring name,
Is music in a sinner’s ear.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, Wo nka a atahye no, 
Me kra enyi gye dɛ ɔtse;
Wo dzin a ɔma ahoɔdzen no,
Ɔyɛ dɛw wɔ abɔn asomu.

MHB 153
2 . Sinners of old Thou didst receive
With comfortable words and kind,
Their sorrows cheer, their wants relieve,
Heal the diseased, and cure the blind
	 ~ 	2 . Awerɛkyekyer nsɛm na ayamuyie 
Dze gyee tsetseber do abɔnfo; 
Hɔn werɛ kyekyee, nyaa dza wohia;
Sa ayarfo yar, bue efurafo enyi.

MHB 153
3 . And art Thou not the Saviour still,
In every place and age the same?
Hast Thou forgot Thy gracious skill,
Or lost the virtue of Thy name?
	 ~ 	3 . Ana ennda ho nnyɛ Agyenkwa
Wɔ beebiara na mber nyina? 
Wo werɛ efir W'adom akyɛdze n',
Anaa ayew Wo dzin pa no?

MHB 153
4 . Faith in Thy changeless name I have;
The good, the kind physician, Thou
Art able now our souls to save,
Art willing to restore them now.
	 ~ 	4 . Megye Wo dzin a ɔnnsesa n' dzi,
Eyɛ yarsafo a Wo yamu ye;
Itum dɛ egye hɛn akra nkwa,
Epɛ dɛ eyɛ hɔn fofor.

MHB 153
5 . Wouldst Thou the body’s health restore,
And not regard the sin-sick soul?
The  sin-sick  soul Thou lov’st much  more,
And surely Thou shalt make it whole.
	 ~ 	5 . Ana egye nyimpadua nkwa
Na ennhwɛ ɔkra a ɔyar?
Ɔkra yarfo a edɔ n' kɛse n'
Na ebɛma oeenya ahoɔdzen.

MHB 153
6 . All my disease, my every sin,
To Thee, O Jesus, I confess;
In pardon, Lord, my cure begin,
And perfect it in holiness.	 ~ 	6 . Jesus, medze me yarba
Na mo bɔn nyinara brɛ Wo,
Hyɛ ase sa m' yar wɔ fakyɛ mu,
Na mindzi mu krɔnkrɔnyɛ mu.

MHB 154
1 . I HEARD the voice of Jesus say: 
Come unto Me and rest;
Lay down, thou weary one, lay down 
Thy head upon My breast!
I came to Jesus as I was, 
Weary, and worn, and sad;
I found in Him a resting- place,
And He has made me glad.
	 ~ 	1 . Metsee dɛ Jesus ne ndze se: 
Bra Mo hɔ na bɔhom;
Ɔwo a aberɛ fa wo tsir,
Bɔto Mara Mo bom'!
Mokɔree dɛ mbrɛ metse ara,
Maberɛ, Mo werɛ ahow;
Minyaa ahomgye wɔ No mu,
Na ɔmaa m' enyigye.

MHB 154
2 . I heard the voice of Jesus say,:
Behold, I freely give
The living water; thirsty one,
Stoop down, and drink, and live!
I came to Jesus, and I drank 
Of that life- giving stream;
My thirst was quenched, my soul revived,
And now I live in Him.
	 ~ 	2 . Metsee dɛ Jesus ne ndze se: 
Ɔwo a sukɔm dze wo,
Hwɛ, mema n-kwa nsu no kwa,
Bɔ wo mu adze nom bi!
Mebaa Jesus hɔ mobɔnoom
N-kwa esutsen n' bi;
Mo nsukɔm gyaae, me kra nyaa nkwa,
Na afei metse No mu.

MHB 154
3 . I heard the voice of Jesus say:
I am this dark world’s Light;
Look unto Me, thy morn shall rise,
And all thy day be bright!
I looked to Jesus, and I found 
In Him my Star, my Sun;
And in that light of life I’ll walk,
Till travelling days are done.	 ~ 	3 . Metsee dɛ Jesus ne ndze se: 
Emi nye wiadze Kan:
Hwɛ Me na adze bɛkye wo,
Wo kwan mu bɛyɛ kann!
Mohwɛɛ Jesus na minyaa N' ma
Ɔyɛɛ ewia maa me!
N-kwa Kan yim' na m' bɛnantsew
M' akwantu nda nyina.

MHB 155
1 . HEAL us Immanuel; hear our prayer;
We wait to feel Thy touch:
Deep-wounded souls to Thee repair;
And, Saviour, we are such.
	 ~ 	1 . IMMANUEL, sa hɛn yar, tsie hɛn,
Fa Wo nsa no ka hɛn;
Akra epirafo yɛba Wo hɔ,
Agyenkwa, yɛtse dɛm.

MHB 155
2 . Our faith is feeble, we confess;
We faintly trust Thy word:
But Wilt Thou pity us the lest?
Be that far from Thee, Lord.
	 ~ 	2 . Yɛpaa m' ka dɛ hɛn gyedzi suar,
Yɛnngye W' asɛm nndzi yie;
Na ebɔhwɛ yi ho anaa?
Ɔmpar Wo, Ewuradze.

MHB 155
3 . Remember him who once applied
With trembling for relief;
Lord, I believe! with tears he cried,
O help my unbelief!
	 ~ 	3 . Kaa nyia da bi ɔdze nyinsu,
Na ahopopo serɛe,
Ɔtseaa m', Ewuradze, megye dzi;
O boa m' ma mengye ndzi.

MHB 155
4 . She, too, who touched Thee in the press,
And healing virtue stole,
Was answered: Daughter, go in peace,
Thy faith hath made thee whole.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔbaa no dze ne nsa kaa Wo,
Na ɔtwee ayarsa tum n';
Esee n' dɛ; Fa asomdwee kɔ, 
Wo gyedzi agye w' nkwa.

MHB 155
5 . Like her, with hopes and fears we come,
To touch Thee, if we may:
O send us not despairing home,
Send none unhealed away.    Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Yɛdze enyidar na suro ba,
Bɛka Wo do dɛ ɔno;
Yeserɛ W', mma yɛmmfa hɛn yaw
Na hɛn yar nnsan nnkɔ fie. 	Amen.

MHB 156
1 . O THOU, whom once they flocked to hear,
Thy words to hear, Thy power to feel;
Suffer the sinners to draw near,
And graciously receive us still
	 ~ 	1 . Ɔwo a wɔpemee betsiee Wo, 
Wotsiee Wo nsɛm, wɔtsee Wo tum;
Ma abɔn kwan ma yɛmbɛn Wo,
Na gye hɛn adom mu ara.

MHB 156
2 . They that be whole, Thyself hast said,
No need of a physician have;
But I am sick, and want Thine aid,
And want Thine utmost power to save.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔwoara na aka dɛ, 
Primprimfo nnhia oduyɛfo;
Emi meyar, mihia Wo mboa,
Mihia Wo tum a ɔgye nkwa n'.

MHB 156
3 . Thy power, and truth, and love divine,
The same from age to age endure;
A word, a gracious word of Thine,
The most inveterate plague can cure.
	 ~ 	3 . Wo tum, nokwar na nyamedɔ, 
Tsim hɔ mbersantsen mfesantsen;
W' asɛm, W' adom asɛm kor mpo,
Otu yarba dzendzen biara.

MHB 156
4 . Helpless howe’er my spirit lies,
And long hath languished at the pool,
A word of Thine shall make me rise,
And speak me in a moment whole.
	 ~ 	4 . Kaansa makyɛr esu yi bo, 
Ma mo sunsum nntum nnka noho a,
W' ano kasa bɛma masoɛr,
Ɔbɔbɔ  m' esu ntsɛmara.

MHB 156
5 . Make this the acceptable hour;
Come, O my soul’s physician, Thou!
Display thy sanctifying power,
And show me Thy salvation now. Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Ma dɔnhwer yi nyɛ ɔgyeber; 
Ao bra, me kra no Duyɛfo!
Da W' ahosan tum no edzi,
Ma munhu Wo nkwagye n' sesei.     Amen.

MHB 157
1 . JESUS calls us! o’er the tumult 
Of our life’s wild restless sea,
Day by day His sweet voice soundeth,
Saying : Christian ,follow me-
	 ~ 	1 . Jesus frɛ hɛn! Sɛ hɛn bra po 
Wor mpo a, yɛtse Ne ndze,
Ne ndze dɛɛdɛw n' gyigye daa daa,
Ɔse: Christian, ka Mo do.

MHB 157
2 . As, of old ,apostle heard it
By the Galilean lake,
Turned from home and toil and kindred ,
Leaving all for His dear sake.
	 ~ 	2 . Tsetseber do asomafo n' 
Tsee wɔ Galilee po do n',
Wogyaa ebusua, fie nye edwuma,
Kɛkaa' No a wɔdɔ No n' do.

MHB 157
3 . Jesus calls us from the worship
Of the vain world’s golden store,
From each idol that would keep us,
Saying : Christian, love Me more!
	 ~ 	3 . Jesus frɛ hɛn mma yɛnnsom 
Wiadze mu ndzɛmba huhuw;
Ɔhwɛ ndzɛmba a wɔsom hɛn bo a,
Ɔse: Christian, dɔ M' kyɛn hɔn.

MHB 157
4 . In our joys and in our sorrows,
Days of toil and hours of ease,
Still He calls ,in cares and pleasures,
That we love Him more than these.
	 ~ 	4 . Enyigye nye awerɛhow mu, 
Dwumadzim' nye ahomgyem',
Ɔda ho frɛ hɛn dɛ yɛndɔ N'
Ma ɔkyɛn adze nyina.

MHB 157
5 . Jesus calls us! By Thy mercies,
Saviour, make us hear Thy call,
Give our hearts to Thine obedience,
Serve and love Thee best of all.	 ~ 	5 . Jesus frɛ hɛn! O Agyenkwa, 
Yɛserɛ W', ma yɛntse Wo frɛ n',
Hɛn 'koma nyɛ setsie mma Wo,
Yɛndɔ W' nkyɛn adze nyina.

MHB 158
1 . THOU say’st : Take up thy cross,
O man, and follow Me.
The night is black, the feet are slack;
Yet we would follow Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . ESE, onyimpa ba,
Fa w' mbeamudua dzi M'ekyir, 
'Nafua yɛ sum, anan mu agow, 
'So yebedzi W'ekyir.

MHB 158
2 . But, O dear Lord, we cry,
That we Thy face could see:
Thy blessèd face one moment’s space—
Then might we follow Thee.
	 ~ 	2 . Ewuradze pa, yɛserɛ
Dɛ ma yenhu W'enyim,
Yehu W'enyim ber tsiabaa mpo a;
Na yebedzi W'ekyir.

MHB 158
3 . Dim tracts of time divide
Those golden days from me;
Thy voice comes strange o’er years of change;
How can we follow Thee?
	 ~ 	3 . Mber a no mu yɛ sum 
Etwa mber pa no ntamu;
M-fe rugu m' n', Wo ndze sesa; 
Yɛnyɛ dɛn ndzi W'ekyir?

MHB 158
4 . Comes faint and far Thy voice
From vales of Galilee;
Thy vision fades in ancient shades;
How should we follow Thee?
	 ~ 	4 . Yɛtse Wo ndze wɔ ekyir, 
Fi Galilee bɔnsa m'; 
Tsetse nwin ka W'edwuma hyɛ; 
Yenyɛ dɛn ndzi W'ekyir.

MHB 158
5 . O heavy cross—of faith
In what we cannot see:
As once of yore Thyself restore,
And help to follow Thee
	 ~ 	5 . Gyedzi mbeamudua durdur 
Wɔ dza yenntum nnhu n' mu; 
Yi Woho kyerɛ dɛ mbrɛ eyɛɛ n', 
Boa ma yendzi W'ekyir.

MHB 158
6 . If not as once Thou camest
In true humanity,
Come yet as Guest within the breast
That burns to follow Thee.
	 ~ 	6 . Sɛ ammba dɛ nyimpa, 
Dɛ ebaa ber bi no a, 
Bra bɛtsena akoma a ɔper 
Dɛ obedzi W'ekyir.

MHB 158
7 . Within our hearts of hearts
In nearest nearness be;
Set up Thy throne within Thine own;
Go, Lord-we follow Thee.	 ~ 	7 . Fa hɛn akoma nyina
Na bɛn hɛn mber nyina,
Bra bɛtsena Wo nkrɔfo mu; 
Kɔ, yebedzi W'ekyir.

MHB 159
1 . ONE who is all unfit to count
As scholar in Thy school,
Thou of Thy love hast named a friend-
O kindness wonderful!
	 ~ 	1 . OBI a ɔmmfata koraa 
Dɛ ɔyɛ Wo suanyi n',
Edze Wo dɔ afa n'nyɛnko; 
Ao, ayamuyie nwanwa!

MHB 159
2 . So weak I am, O gracious Lord,
So all unworthy Thee,
That e’en the dust upon Thy feet
Outweighs me utterly.
	 ~ 	2 . Adom Wura, meyɛ mberɛw,
Na memmfata koraa;
Wo nan adze huntuma no
Mpo ye sen me koraa.

MHB 159
3 . Thou dwellest in unshadowed light,
All sin and shame above-
That Thou shouldst bear our sin and shame,
How can I tell such love?
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔwo etse kan kɛse mu,
Bɔn na 'nyimguase nnyi m';
Dɛ bɔsoa hɛn bɔn, 'nyimguase;
M'bɛyɛ dɛm dɔ n'?

MHB 159
4 . Ah, did not He the heavenly throne
A little thing esteem,
And not unworthy for my sake
A mortal body deem?
	 ~ 	4 . Ana oemmbu No sor ahengua
Dɛ adze tootooba,
Dɛ obegya hɔ wɔ 'dasanyi a 
Mennsɛ hwee koraa yi ntsi?

MHB 159
5 . When in His flesh they drove the nails,
Did He not all endure?
What name is there to fit a life
So patient and so pure?
	 ~ 	5 . Wɔdze mprɛgow bobɔɔ N' honam m', 
Ana oennhu amandze?
Dzin bɛn na ɔsɛ abotar
Na ɔbra krɔnkrɔn yi?

MHB 159
6 . So, Love itself in human form,
For love of me He came;
I cannot look upon His face
For shame, for bitter shame.
	 ~ 	6 . Ɔdɔ ankasa bɛyɛɛ nyimpa, 
Mo ho dɔ ntsi na ɔbae;
Munntum mma m'enyi do monnhwɛ
N'enyim, 'nyimguase ntsi.

MHB 159
7 . If there is aught of worth in me
It comes from Thee alone;
Then keep me safe, for so, O Lord,
Thou keepest but Thine own.	 ~ 	7 . Sɛ adze pa bi wɔ mo mu a,
Ofi Woara Wo nkyɛn,
Ntsi Ewuradze, fa me sie
Ma menyɛ Wodze koraa.

MHB 16
1 . RAISE the psalm: let earth adoring,
    Through each kindred, tribe, and tongue,
    To her God His praise restoring.
    Raise the new accordant song.
    Bless his name, each farthest nation;
    Sing his praise, His truth display:
    Tell anew His high salvation
    With each new return of day.
	 ~ 	1 . MA ndwom do: na asaase ntonton,
Wɔ ebusua na kasa m',
M-fa N'ayɛyi nsan mma No,
Ma ndwom a ɔfata no do.
Amanaman, hom nhyira Ne dzin;
Hom mma No nokwar nda edzi:
Na adzekyee biara hom nka
No nkwagye no ho asem.

MHB 16
2 . Tell it out beneath the heaven,
    To each kindred, tribe, and tongue,
    Tell it out from morn till even
    In your own exhausted song:
    Tell that God for ever reigneth,
    He, who set the world so fast,
    He, who still its state sustaineth
    Till the day of doom to last.
	 ~ 	2 . Hom nka no wɔ wi yi ase,
Wɔ ebusua na kasa m',
Hom nka mfi anapa ma nwin ndwe
Wɔ ndwom a ɔmmbɔ adze da m':
Hom nka dɛ hɛn Nyame dzi hen,
Ɔno na obɔɔ wiadze ntsem,
Ɔda ho ara hwɛ wiadze do
Kesi da a ɔsɛɛ bɛba.

MHB 16
3 . Tell them that the day is coming
    When that righteous doom shall be:
    Then shall heaven new joys illumine,
    Gladness shine o’er earth and sea.
    Yea the far-resounding ocean
    Shall its thousand voices raise,
    All its waves in glad commotion
    Chant the fullness of his praise.
	 ~ 	3 . Ka kyerɛ hɔn dɛ da no reba a 
Wobobu wiadze atsɛn:
Ɔsor enyimnyam bɛhyerɛn,
'Saase, po bɛyɛ ahomka.
N-yew, epo a ɔrowor no
Bɛba ne ndze mpempem do,
Na epo asorɛkye nyina
Beyi Nyankopɔn ayɛw.

MHB 16
4 . And earths fields, with herbs and flowers,
   Shall put on their choice array.
   And in all their leafy bowers
   Shall the woods keep holyday:
   When the Judge, to earth descending,
   Righteous judgment shall ordain,
   Fraud and wrong shall then have ending,
   Truth immortal truth shall reign.     Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Asaase do mfuw na nhyiren,
Bofura hɔn atam pa,
Na kwaamu ndua nyinara na
N-haban bɛyɛ kusuww:
Sɛ wiadze Otsɛmbuafo no
Bobu atsentsenenee no a,
N-sisi na bɔn bɔbɔ adze,
Afei nokwar bedzi hen.  Amen.

MHB 160
1 . THOU art the Way: by Thee alone
From sin and death we flee:
And he who would the Father seek
Must seek Him, Lord, by Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆWO nye Kwan n'; yeguan fi bɔn 
Na wu ho ba Wo nkyɛn; 
Na nyia ɔhwehwɛ Egya no, 
Ɔsɛ dɛ ɔfa Wo do.

MHB 160
2 . Thou art the Truth: Thy word alone
True wisdom can impart;
Thou only canst inform the mind,
And purify the heart.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔwo nye Nokwar: W'asɛm nko 
Na ɔkyerɛ nyansa mapa;
Ɔwo nko na ekyerɛ adwen
Na etsew akoma m'.

MHB 160
3 . Thou art the Life: the rending tomb
Proclaims Thy conquering arm;
And those who put their trust in Thee
Nor death nor hell shall harm
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔwo nye Nkwa: nda a woebue do n'
Ka Wo konyim tum no;
Hɔn a wɔdze hɔn werɛ hyɛ Wo mu n', 
'Wu na hɛll nnkɛhaw hɔn.

MHB 160
4 . Thou art the Way, the Truth, the Life:
Grant us that Way to know,
That Truth to keep, that Life to win,
Whose joys eternal flow. Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Ɔwo nye Kwan, Nokwar na Nkwa n';
Boa hɛn ma yenhu Kwan n', 
Yensie Nokwar no, na yeenya
Nkwa a ne dɛw pem daa no.     Amen.

MHB 161
1 . TELL me the old, old story 
Of unseen things above,
Of Jesus and His glory, 
Of Jesus and His love.
Tell me the story simply, 
As to a little child;
For I am weak and weary,
And helpless and defiled.
      
        Tell me the old, old story,
        Of Jesus and His love.
	 ~ 	1 . Ka 'sɛm dadaw no kyerɛ me, 
Sunsum ndzɛmbam' asɛm,
Dza ɔfa Christ N' enyimnyam ho
Dza ɔfa No dɔ so ho.
Ka 'sɛm no pefee kyerɛ m' dɛ
Ereka kyerɛ abofra;
Na meyɛ mberɛw na mafona,
Minnyi ahom, mo ho fi.
Ka 'sɛm dadaw no kyerɛ me, 
Jesus no dɔ ho asɛm.

MHB 161
2 . Tell me the story slowly,
 That I may take it in,
 That wonderful redemption, 
God’s remedy for sin.
Tell me the story often,
For I forget so soon;
The early dew of morning 
Has passed away at noon
	 ~ 	2 . Tɔ w' bo ka 'sɛm no kyerɛ me, 
Na meetum medze esie-
Nyame No werdam kɛse a
Ɔdze yɛ bɔn edur.
Si do mber pii ka kyerɛ m'
Na meyar awerɛfir;
Ahanamakye bɔsu
Ewia fir a ɔpa.

MHB 161
3 . Tell me the story softly, 
with earnest tones and grave;
Remember ,I’m the sinner 
whom Jesus came to save.
Tell me the story always,
If you would really be
In any time of trouble
 A comforter to me.
	 ~ 	3 . Ka 'sɛm no bɔkɔɔ kyerɛ me, 
Nwinwin mu dɛ ehiasɛm,
Kaa dɛ meyɛ bɔnyɛnyi a
Jesus bɛpeer mo nkwa,
Ka 'sɛm no mber nyinara,
Sɛ epɛ ampaara
Dɛ ema m' akomatɔm'
Wɔ ahokyer ber biaram'.

MHB 161
4 . Tell me the same old story 
when you have cause to fear
That this world’s empty glory 
Is costing me too dear.
Yes, and, when that world’s glory 
Shall dawn upon my soul,
Tell me the old, old story-
Christ Jesus makes thee whole !	 ~ 	4 . Ka ' sɛm kor n' ara kyerɛ me, 
Aber a isuro dɛ
Wiadze enyimnyam huhuw n'
Ridzi m' adwen dodow.
Nyew, na ɔsor n' enyimnyam
No so regye mo do a,
Ka 'sɛm dadaw no kyerɛ m' dɛ,
Christ Jesus bɔ w' esu!
Ka 'sɛm dadaw no kyerɛ me, 
Jesus no dɔ ho asɛm.

MHB 162
1 . THOU  art my life; if Thou but turn away,
My life’s a thousand deaths: Thou art my way;
Without Thee, Lord ,I travel not, but stray.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆWO nye mo nkwa; sɛ ekɔ gya me a,
M'abrabɔ 'wu ara nko; Ɔwo nye m' kwan;
Mennya Wo a, m'bɔfom kwan m'akwantu mu.

MHB 162
2 . My light Thou art; without Thy glorious sight
My eyes are darkened with perpetual night:
My God, Thou art my way, my life, my light.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔwo nye m' kan; mennya W'enyimnyam kan a,
'Sum kebii bɛma n;enyi ayɛ kusuww;
Me Nyame nye mo kwan, n-kwa, na kan.

MHB 162
3 . Thou art my way; I wander, if Thou fly:
Thou art my light: if hid, how blind am I!
Thou art my life: if Thou withdraw, I die.
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔwo nye m' kwan; ekɔ gya me a, meyew;
Ɔwo nye m' kan; isuma a, munnhu adze!
Ɔwo nye m' nkwa: etwe Woho a, muwu.

MHB 162
4 . Disclose Thy sunbeams; close Thy wings and stay;
See, see how I am blind, and dead, and stray,
O Thou that art my light, my life, my way !	 ~ 	4 . Yi Wo nserɛmɛn kyerɛ m'; enye me ntsena;
Hwɛ, munnhu adze, mewu, m'afom kwan;
Ɔwo nye me kan, mo nkwa na mo kwan!

MHB 163
1 . DEAR Master, in whose life I see
All that I would, but fail to be,
Let Thy clear light for ever shine,
To shame and guide this life of mine.
	 ~ 	1 . MO Wura, Ɔwo a Wo bra m' muhu
Dza ɔwɔ dɛ meyɛ 'so munntum;
Ma Wo kan krɔnn no nhyerɛn daa,
Nhyɛ me bra fɛr, nkyerɛ me kwan.

MHB 163
2 . Though what I dream and what I do
In my weak days are always two,
Help me, oppressed by things undone,
O Thou, whose deeds and dreams were one !	 ~ 	2 . Me mberɛwyɛ ntsi mo nsusui
Na me ndzeyɛɛ nntum mmbɔ mu nnsaa;
Ɔwo a W'adwen na W' nyɛe yɛ kor,
Boa me ma menyɛ dza munntum.

MHB 164
1 . BEHOLD a little child, 
Laid in a manger bed;
The wintry blasts blow wild 
Around His infant head.
But who is this, so lowly laid?
’Tis He by whom the worlds were made.
	 ~ 	1 . HWƐ! Abɔdomaba
Da mbowa edzidzidaka m';
Na ɔpɛ mframa nwinwin,
Ɔbɔ fa ne tsir ho.
Na woana nye Nyia ɔda hɔ n'?
Ɔno nye Nyia ɔbɔɔ wiadze 'i.

MHB 164
2 . Alas ! in what poor state 
The Son of God is seen;
Why doth the Lord so great 
Choose out a home so mean?
That we may learn from pride to flee,
And follow His humility.
	 ~ 	2 . O tsebea bɛn nye no,
Na yehu Nyame ba 'i? 
'Bɛn ntsi na Nyame so
Bɔsoɛ fie tantan yi m'?
Ama yeeguan efi ahantan ho,
Na yeedzi N'ahobrɛadze ekyir.

MHB 164
3 . Where Joseph plies his trade,
Lo! Jesus labours too;
The hands that all things made 
An earthly craft pursue,
That weary men in Him may rest,
And faithful toil through Him be blest.
	 ~ 	3 . Mbrɛ Joseph yɛ n'edwuma n',
Hwɛ! Jesus so wɔ hɔ;
Nsa a ɔyɛɛ adze nyina
Dzi wiadze edwin daa, 
Ma abrɛfo aahom wɔ no mu, 
Na anokwafo benya nhyira.

MHB 164
4 . Among the doctors see
The Boy so full of grace;
Say, wherefore taketh He 
The scholar’s lowly place?
That children boys, with reverence meet,
May sit and learn at Jesus’ feet.
	 ~ 	4 . Hwɛ Abofra n' dɛ ɔdze adom
Tse abemfo n' finimfin!
'Bɛn ntsi na ɔtse hɔn mu,
Ber a ɔkrɔn sen hɔn?
Ama Christian mbofra dze obu
Esua wɔ Jesus n'ananadze.

MHB 164
5 . Christ, once Thyself a boy, 
Our boyhood guard and guide;
Be Thou its light and joy, 
And still with us abide,
That Thy dear love, so great and free,
May draw us evermore to Thee.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Christ, ayɛ abofra pɛn;
Hɛn mbofraber m' Gyafo
Na hɛn kan nye hɛn dɛw;
Na kɔ do nye hɛn ntsena.
Ama Wo dɔ kɛse a wɔnntɔ n'
Aatwe hɛn abɛn Wo daa daa.

MHB 165
1 . FORTY days and forty nights
Thou wast fasting in the wild,
Forty days and forty nights
Tempted, and yet undefiled:
	 ~ 	1 . Idzii mbuada adaduanan 
Adzekyee nye adzesaa,
Adaduanan wɔ sar no do
Wɔsɔɔ Wo hwɛe na annyɛ bɔn.

MHB 165
2 . Sunbeams scorching all the day,
Chilly dewdrops nightly shed,
Prowling beasts about Thy way,
Stones Thy pillow, earth Thy bed.
	 ~ 	2 . Ewia sii Wo do adzekyee, 
Bɔw tɔɔ Wo do anago,
Mbowa abɔyafo paar wo ho,
Edaa fam', isum ɔbo.

MHB 165
3 . Let us Thy endurance share
And from earthly greed abstain;
With Thee watching unto prayer,
With Thee strong to suffer pain
	 ~ 	3 . Ma yɛnsɔw Wo bene no bi, 
Yɛmpow wiadze edzifodze;
Na yɛnye Wo nweɔn mpaabɔm',
Nye Wo nsɔw yaw ahoɔdzenm'.

MHB 165
4 . And if Satan, vexing sore,
Flesh or spirit should assail,
Thou, his vanquisher before,
Grant we may not faint nor fail.
	 ~ 	4 . Sɛ abɔnsam dze ebufuw 
Toa honam anaa sunsum,
'Wo a edzi no do nyim pɛn,
Dom hɛn mma yaannhwe ase.

MHB 165
5 . So shall we have peace divine;
Holier gladness ours shall be;
Round us too shall angels shine,
Such as ministered to Thee.	 ~ 	5 . Nna yebenya W' asomdwee; 
Dɛw krɔnkrɔn bɛyɛ hɛndze;
Dɛ mbrɛ abɔfo soom Wo n',
Wɔbɛhyerɛn hɛn so hɛn ho.

MHB 166
1 . IT fell upon a summer day,
When Jesus walked in Galilee,
The mothers from a village brought
Their children to his knee.
	 ~ 	1 . OSII wɔ ɔhyew-ber bi mu,
Ber a Jesus nenaam Galilee;
Abaatan fi nkuraase nkuraase
Dze hɔn mbofra brɛɛ No.

MHB 166
2 . He took them in His arms, and laid
His hands on each remembered head;
Suffer these little ones to come
To Me, He gently said.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔgyee hɔn too N'abaw mu sɔnn,
Dze Ne nsa totoo hɔn tsir do;
Ɔkaa berɛww dɛ, Hom mma mbofra n'
Kwan ma wɔmbra me nkyɛn.

MHB 166
3 . Forbid them not; unless ye bear
The childlike heart your hearts within,
Unto My kingdom ye may come
But may not enter in.
	 ~ 	3 . Mma hom nnsiw hɔn kwan; gyedɛ hom
Nya mbofra akoma wɔ hom mu
Ana hom aba M'ahenman m',
Ɔno hom runntum nnhɛn m'.

MHB 166
4 . Master, I fain would enter there;
O let me follow Thee, and share
Thy meek and lowly heart, and be
Freed from all worldly care.
	 ~ 	4 . Mo Wura, mepɛ dɛ mokɔ hɔ; 
O mindzi W'ekyir nye Wo nkyɛ 
W'ahobrɛadze, botoo akoma n',
Mompow wiadze ndzɛmba.

MHB 166
5 . Of innocence, and love, and trust,
Of quiet work, and simple word,
Of joy, and thoughtlessness of self,
Build up my life, good Lord.
	 ~ 	5 . Wo dɔ, gyedzi, adwenmutsewee,
'Dwuma pa, kasafua a ho tsew,
Enyigye a pɛsɛankonya nnyi m',
Ewuradze pa, yɛ m' dɛm.

MHB 166
6 . All happy thoughts, and gentle ways,
And loving-kindness daily given,
And freedom through obedience gained,
Make in my heart Thy heaven.
	 ~ 	6 . Enyigye adwen na akwan pa nyina m',
Ma me ɔdɔ ayamuyie daa;
Menam setsie m' nya fahodzi,
M'akoma nyɛ W'ahenman.

MHB 166
7 . O happy thus to live and move!
And sweet this world, where I shall find
God’s beauty everywhere, His love,
His good in all mankind.
	 ~ 	7 . O memfa enyigye ntsena ase,
Nkyir wiadze dɛw, na mubohu
Nyame N'ahoɔfɛw wɔ beebi a 
No dɔ ye wɔ nyimpa m'.

MHB 166
8 . Then, Father, grant this childlike heart,
That I may come to Christ, and feel
His hands on me in blessing laid,
Love-giving, strong to heal.    Amen.	 ~ 	8 . Egya, ma m' dɛm mbofra akoma 'I, 
Ama meetum aba Christ hɔ; 
Ma maatse Ne nsa nka wɔ m' do,
Wɔ nhyira, dɔ na ayarsa m',    Amen.

MHB 167
1 . FIERCE raged the tempest o’er the deep,
Watch did Thine anxious servants keep,
But Thou wast wrapped in guileless sleep,
Calm and still.
	 ~ 	1 . EHUM dzendzen tuu po no do,
W'esuafo dze suro weɔnee,
Naaso Ɔwodze, ada koraa;
Komm na dzinn.

MHB 167
2 . Save, Lord; we perish! was their cry.
Oh, save us in our agony!
Thy word above the storm rose high-
Peace, be still!
	 ~ 	2 . Wɔtseaa m; Jesus, gye hɛn, yɛrehera!
O gye hɛn haw yi mu!
W'asɛm no boor ehum no do;
Ɔtaa dzinn.

MHB 167
3 . The wild winds hushed, the angry deep
Sank like a little child to sleep,
The sullen billows ceased to leap,
At thy will.
	 ~ 	3 . M-frama dzendzen no gyaae bɔ,
Po taa dzinn dɛ abofra a ɔada;
Asorɛkye dzendzen no gyaa bu,
Wɔ Wo pɛ m'.

MHB 167
4 . So, when our life is clouded o’er,
And storm-winds drift us from the shore,
say, lest we sink to rise no more:
Peace, be still!   	 ~ 	4 . Ntsi sɛ ɔbra ehum rutu hɛn
Na asorɛkye twe hɛn fi mpoano a, 
Mbrɛ yɛnnkɛmem n', ɔyɛ a ka dɛ 
Komm na dzinn.

MHB 168
1 . LORD! it is good for us to be
High on the mountain here with Thee:
Here in an ampler, purer air,
Above the stir of toil and care
Of hearts oppressed with doubt and grief,
Believing in their unbelief,
Calling Thy servants all in vain
To ease them of their bitter pain.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, oye dɛ yɛnye W'
Tsena sor ha bepɔw yi do,
Wɔ mframa pa dɛɛdɛw yi mu,
Ɔtra akoma a wɔtseetsee hɔn;
Ekyingye, berɛ na hɔn yaw yi m', 
Wɔtwer hɔn ara hɔn ekyingye;
Kwa ara na efrɛ Wo nkowaa
Dɛ womfi hɔn yaw wenwen n' mu.

MHB 168
2 . Lord! it is good for us to be
With Thee, and with Thy faithful three:
Here, where the apostle’s heart of rock
Is nerved against temptation`s shock;
Here, where the son of thunder learns
The thought that breathes, the word that burns,
Here, where on eagles’ wings we move
With him whose last, best word is love.
	 ~ 	2 . Ewuradze, oye dɛ yɛnye W'
Na W' nokwafo baasa n' tsena
Ha na asomfo nya ahoɔdzen,
Dze ko tsia nsɔhwɛ no mbusu;
Ha na Nyankopɔn Ba no sua
Nyansa a mu dɔ na asɛm a ɔdzɛw;
Ha na yɛnye Nyia N'asɛm yɛ 
Dɔ n' yetu wɔ nkɔr ntsaban do.

MHB 168
3 . Lord! it is good for us to be
Entranced, enwrapped, alone with Thee,
Watching the glistening raiment glow
Whiter than Hermon’s whitest snow,
The human lineaments which shine
Irradiant with a light divine,
Till we, too, change from grace to grace,
Gazing on that transfigured face
	 ~ 	3 . Ewuradze, oye dɛ yɛnye W'
Bɔ mu kyekyer yɛ kor ara;
Kɔ do hwɛ Wo ntar hyɛnhyɛn a
Ɔhoa sen Hermon do fufuw n';
Nyimpadua no n 'akwaa n' so dze,
Sunsum kan kyerɛn kesi dɛ 
Hɛn so yebenyin wɔ adom mu,
Ehu enyim a asakyer no.

MHB 168
4 . Lord! it is good for us to be
Here on the holy mount with Thee,
When darkling in the depths of night,
When dazzled with excess of light,
We bow before the heavenly voice
Which bids bewildered souls rejoice:
Though love wax cold, and faith grow dim,
This is My Son: o hear ye Him !	 ~ 	4 . Ewuradze, oye dɛ yɛnye W'
Tsena bepɔw krɔnkrɔn yi do;
Yɛhyɛ sum kebii bi mu o,
Yɛhyɛ kan hyɛnhyɛn bi mu o,
Yɛkotow ɔsor ndze krɔnn a
Ɔma akra a wɔabɔm dzi dɛw,
Kaansa ɔdɔ tu na gyedzi sa a:
Me Ba nye yi; Hom nyina ntsie No.

MHB 169
1 . MY  Saviour, Thou Thy love to me
In shame, in want, in pain, hast showed; 
For me, on the accursed tree, 
Thou pouredst forth Thy guiltless blood; 
Thy wounds upon my heart impress, 
Nor aught shall the loved stamp efface.
	 ~ 	1 . M’AGYENKWA, Wo dͻ a ewͻ ma m’,
Akyerɛ wͻ   enyimguase m’,hia m’,
Yaw m’,
Ama m’ wͻ mbeamudua no do;
Ikyii Wo bͻgyaa a ‘fͻdzi nnyi m’ n’,
Ma W’epirakur nka m’akoma a
Hwee nnkotum asesa no da.

MHB 169
2 . More hard than marble is my heart, 
And foul with sins of deepest stain; 
But Thou the mighty Saviour art, 
Nor flowed Thy cleansing blood in vain: 
Ah, soften, melt this rock, and may 
Thy blood wash all these stains away
	 ~ 	2 . M’ Akoma yɛ dzen sen ͻbo,
Bͻn nkekaa dzendzen asɛɛ mu;
Na Ͻwo yɛ Agyenkwa tumfo,
Na Wo bͻgyaa krͻnn no mmpem kwa;
Ao! Gown a nan dɛm ͻbo yi na
Wo bͻgyaa nhohor dɛm ͻbo yin a
Wo bͻgyaa nhohor dɛmnkekaa n’.

MHB 169
3 . O that I, as a little child, 
May follow Thee, and never rest 
Till sweetly Thou hast breathed Thy mild 
And lowly mind into my breast! 
Nor ever may we parted be, 
Till I become as one spirit with Thee.
	 ~ 	3 . O emi a metse dɛ abofra
Bɛka Wo do a monnkͻhom da;
Kɛpem dɛ dɛw mu ebͻhom
W’ adwen pa no egu mo bo m’;
Anaa dɛ yɛnnkɛpaapaa m’ da,
Dɛ menye Wo yɛ kor sunsum m’!

MHB 169
4 . Still let Thy love point out my war; 
How wondrous things Thy love hath wrought! 
Still lead me, lest I go astray; 
Direct my word, inspire my thought; 
And if I fall, soon may I hear 
Thy voice, and know that love is near.
	 ~ 	4 . Ma Wo dͻ nkͻ do nhyrɛn mo kwan m’
Ndzɛmba nwanwa a Wo dɛ ayɛ n’!
Kͻ do kyerɛ m’ kwan amma maannyew;
Kyerɛ m’ dza menka, Kenyan m’adwen,
Na sɛ mohwe ase a, ma mentse
Wo ndze, munhu dɛ ͻdͻ  abɛn.

MHB 169
5 . In suffering be Thy love my peace, 
In weakness be Thy love my power; 
And when the storms of life shall cease, 
Jesus, in that important hour, 
In death as life be Thou my Guide, 
And save me, who for me hast died.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Me haw m’ Wo dͻ mma m’ asomdwee,
Me mberɛwyɛ m’ Wo dͻ mma m’ tum;
Ber a ͻbra n’ehum begyaa n’,
Dɛm dͻnhwer soronko no mu,
Wͻ wu m’, dɛ eyɛ nkwa no, gya m’;
Gye me nkwa, Ͻwo a iwui maa m’.  Amen.

MHB 17
1 . MEET and right it is to sing,
    In every time and place
    Glory to our heavenly King,
    The God of truth and grace:
    Join we then with sweet accord,
    All in one thanksgiving join:
    Holy, holy, holy Lord.
    Eternal praise be Thine.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆSƐ na ɔfata adwontow, 
Ber na bea biara mu,
Enyimnyam nka hɛn sor Hen,
Nokwar na adom Nyame:
Hɛn nyina dze ndze dɛɛdɛw
Bɔ m' wɔ ndaase kor mu dɛ;
Krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, Ewuradze,
Ayɛyi nka Wo daa.

MHB 17
2 . Thee the first-born sons of light,
    In choral symphonies.
    Praise by day, day without night,
    And never, never cease;
    Angels and archangels all
    Praise the mystic Three in One,
    Sing, and stop, and gaze, and fall
    Overwhelmed before thy throne.
	 ~ 	2 . Hom adzekyee m-bakan,
Hom mfa hom ndze dɛɛdɛw
Nyi No ayɛw mber nyina,
Na mma ɔmmbɔ adze da;
Abɔfo na akɛse nyina,
Hom nyi Ɔkorsa ayɛw,
Hom ntow ndwom na hom ntwa nhwe
N'ahengua no enyim.

MHB 17
3 . Vying with that happy choir,
   Who chant thy praise above,
   We on eagles’ wings aspire,
   The wings of faith and love:
   Thee they sing with glory crowned,
   We extol the slaughtered Lamb;
   Lower if our voices sound,
   Our subject is the same.
	 ~ 	3 . Yenye sor adwontofo a 
Woyi W'ayɛw wɔ sor,
N-kɔr atsabandofo,
Gyedzi na dɔ ntsaban:
Wɔtow Wo ndwom 'nyimnyam mu,
Ma Eguambaa a wokum Wo;
Sɛ hɛn n-dze kɔ famu a
Dza yegyina do yɛ kor.

MHB 17
4 . Father, God, thy love we praise,
    Which gave Thy Son to die;
    Jesus, full of truth and grace.
    Alike we glorify;
    Spirit, Comforter divine,
    Praise by all to thee be given;
    Till we in full chorus join,
    And earth is turned to heaven.    Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Egya, yɛkamfo Wo dɔ a
Ɔmaa Wo Ba n' bowui;
Adom na nokwar, Jesus,
Wo na yɛntonton Wo;
Sunsum, Ɔwerɛkyekyefo,
Obiara nyi Wo ayɛw;
Nkpem dɛ yɛbɔtow ndwom,
Na asaase adan ɔsor.   Amen.

MHB 170
1 . O THE bitter shame and sorrow,
That a time could ever be
When I let the Saviour’s pity
Plead in vain, and proudly answered:
All of self, and none of Thee!
	 ~ 	1 . ENYITO na awerɛhosɛm nye 'i,
Dɛ mber bi a etwa mu no,
Mopoow m'Agyenkwa Ne frɛ a
Ɔdze mbɔbɔrhu frɛɛ me no;
Mubuaa dɛ, medze moho!

MHB 170
2 . Yet He found me. I beheld Him
Bleeding on the accursed tree,
Heard Him pray: Forgive them, Father!
And my wistful heart said faintly:
Some of self, and some of Thee!
	 ~ 	2 . Naaso ohun me, muhun N' dɛ 
'Rikyi bɔgyaa mbeamudua n' do,
Ɔbɔɔ mpaa; Egya, fa kyɛ hɔn!
M'akoma gyee do kakraabi;
Medze moho kakra maa N'.

MHB 170
3 . Day be day His tender mercy,
Healing, helping, full and free,
Sweet and strong, and, ah! so patient,
Brought me lower, while I whispered:
Less of self, and more of Thee!
	 ~ 	3 . Daa nyina No mbɔbɔrhu no
Kɔr do maa me ayarsa,
Dze abotar brɛɛ me adze;
Na afei mekaa no berɛww dɛ
Medze me fa kɛse ma W'.

MHB 170
4 . Higher than the highest heaven,
Deeper than the deepest sea,
Lord, Thy love at last hath conquered;
Grant me now my supplication:
None of self, and all of Thee!  Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Egya, Wo dɔ a ɔkrɔn sen sor,
No mu dɔ kyɛn po no bun n',
Afei edzi m'akoma do nyim;
Afei tsie mo ntotɔserɛ,
Medze moho nyina ma W'.  Amen.

MHB 171
1 . Jesus, I will trust Thee, trust Thee with my soul;
Guilty, lost, and helpless, Thou canst make me whole.
There is none in heaven or on earth like Thee;
Thou hast died for sinners, therefore, Lord, for me.

   In Thy love confiding, I will seek Thy face,
   Worship and adore Thee for Thy wondrous grace.
   Jesus, I will trust Thee, trust Thee with my soul;
   Guilty, lost, and helpless, Thou canst make me whole.
 	 ~ 	1 . Jesus, motwer Wo, medze me kra twer Wo, 
Fɔdzifo a mayew, 'Wo na 'botum agye m',
Obi nnyi sor anaa ase a ɔnye W' sɛ;
Ɔwo wui maa abɔn, Ɔwo wui maa me. 

    Motwer Wo dɔ no na mohwehwɛ W' enyim; 
    W' adom nwanwa no ntsi na muhuhor Wo. 
    Jesus, motwer Wo, medze me kra twer Wo, 
    Fɔdzifo a mayew, 'Wo na 'botum agye me.

MHB 171
2 . Jesus, I will trust Thee, trust Thy written Word;
Since Thy voice of mercy I have often heard.
When Thy Spirit teacheth, to my taste how sweet,
Only may I hearken, sitting at Thy feet.
	 ~ 	2 . Jesus, m' bɔtwer Wo, m' bɔtwer Wo Kyerɛwsɛm; 
Osiandɛ matse Wo mbɔbɔrhu ndze no.
Wo Sunsum kyerɛkyerɛ m' a, ɔyɛ m' dɛw dodow,
Ma mentsena W' anan ho ara mintsie.

MHB 171
3 . Jesus, I will trust Thee, pondering Thy ways,
Full of love and mercy all Thine earthly days:
Sinners gathered round Thee, lepers sought Thy face,
None too vile or loathsome for a saviour’s grace.
 	 ~ 	3 . Jesus, m' bɔtwer Wo, mobɔdwen W' akwan do, 
Ewɔ wiadze n' eyɛɛ dɔ nye mbɔbɔrhu,
Ndzebɔnyɛfo fɔɔr Wo, 'kwatafo hwehwɛɛ W',
Hɔn mu biara ho annyɛ Agyenkwa nkɔw.

MHB 171
4 . Jesus, I will trust Thee, trust Thee without doubt;
Whosoever cometh Thou wilt not cast out:
Faithful is Thy promise, precious is Thy blood—
These my soul’s salvation, Thou my Savior God.	 ~ 	4 . Jesus, ' bɔtwer Wo, mennkɛgye Wo kyim da, 
Obiara a ɔba Wo nkyɛn no emmpam no.
W' anohoba si pi, Wo bɔgyaa som bo;
'Wo nye me kra no nkwagye, me nyankopɔn.

MHB 172
1 . WITH glorious clouds encompassed round,
 Whom angels dimly see,
Will the Unsearchable be found,
Or God appear to me?
	 ~ 	1 . NYIA mununkum esuma No 
Na abɔfo hu N' wusuww,
Ana wobohu dza wonnhu?
Na mehu Nyankopɔn?

MHB 172
2 . Will He forsake His throne above,
Himself to me impart?
Answer, Thou Man of grief and love,
And speak it to my heart!
	 ~ 	2 . Obegyaa N'ahengua wɔ sor
Na ɔdze Noho ama m'?
Bua m', Ɔwo dɔ na yaw Nyimpa,
Kasa kyerɛ m'akoma.

MHB 172
3 . In manifested love explain
Thy wonderful design;
What meant the suffering Son of Man,
The streaming blood divine?
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔdɔ krɔnn mu ara kyerɛ Wo 
Nhyehyɛɛ nwanwa no mu;
Ebɛn ntsi na ikyii Wo bɔgyaa,
Ɔwo Nyimpa Ba a aberɛ.

MHB 172
4 . Didst thou not in our flesh appear,
And live and die below,
That I may now perceive Thee near,
And my Redeemer know?
	 ~ 	4 . Ana ammba hɛn honandua mu
Ammbɛtsena na ennwu ha? 
Ama meehu Wo dɛ abɛn, 
Na meehu mo Pomfo.

MHB 172
5 . Come then, and to my soul reveal
The heights and depths of grace,
The wounds which all my sorrows heal,
That dear disfigured face.
	 ~ 	5 . Afei bra na beyi adom
No bun, no krɔn kyerɛ m';
Wo pirakur a ɔsɛɛ W'enyim,
Eso otu m'awerɛhow n'.

MHB 172
6 . I view the Lamb in His own light,
Whom angels dimly see,
And gaze, transported at the sight,
Through all eternity.	 ~ 	6 . M'bohu 'Guambaa Noara Ne kan m', 
'No a abɔfo hu N' wusuww n',
Na medze dɛw kɛse ahwɛ N'
Onnyiewiei nda nyina m'.

MHB 173
1 . WOULD Jesus have the sinner die?
Why hangs He then on yonder tree?
What means that strange expiring cry?
Sinners, He prays for you and me:
Forgive them, Father, O forgive!
They know not that by Me they live.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS pɛ dɛ abɔnfo wu?
'Bɛn ntsi na ɔsɛɛn dua no do?
No wu ntseam' no ase nye dɛn?
Ɔbɔɔ mpaa maa abɔnfo nyina;
Fa kyɛ hɔn, Egya, fa kyɛ hɔn;
Wonnyim, Me ntsi na wɔtse ase.

MHB 173
2 . Thou loving, all-atoning Lamb,
Thee - by Thy painful agony,
Thy sweat of blood, Thy grief and shame,
Thy cross and passion on the tree,
Thy precious death and life - I pray:
Take all, take all my sins away !
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔdɔfo pa, hɛn Mpataguan,
Enam W'ahoguan yaawaw n' do,
Bɔgya a ikyii na Wo yaw pii n',
Wo mbeamudua do owu yaayaw no,
Wo wu na nkwa a ɔsom bo ntsi,
Meserɛ, fa mo bɔn nyina kɔ.

MHB 173
3 . O let me kiss Thy bleeding feet,
And bathe and wash them with my tears!
The story of Thy love repeat
In every drooping sinner’s ears,
That all may hear the quickening sound,
Since I, even I, have mercy found.
	 ~ 	3 . Ma memfew Wo nan ho bɔgya
Na memfa me nyinsu nhohor;
Wo dɔ asɛm n' si do ka bio,
Ma abɔn nyina aso ntse,
Ma obiara ntse ndze a okenyan,
Ama meenya ehumbɔbɔr.

MHB 173
4 . O let Thy love my heart constrain!
Thy love for every sinner free,
That every fallen soul of man
May taste the grace that found out me;
That all mankind with me may prove
Thy sovereign, everlasting love.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Ma wo dɔ nhyɛ m'akoma do,
Wo dɔ a wɔdze ma abɔnfo kwa;
Ma akra a wɔahwe ase nyina
Eehu adom a ɔgyee me no,
Na adasa nyina nye me eehu
W'adehye dɔ a onnyi ewiei no.

MHB 174
1 . I MET the good Shepherd
But now on the plain,
As homeward He carried 
His lost one again.
I marveled how gently
 His burden He bore;
And ,as He passed by me,
I knelt to adore.
	 ~ 	1 . MIHYIAA Guanhwɛfo pa n',
Sesei ɔwɔ sar do,
Nna ɔso Ne ba a ɔayew
No rokɔ fie bio.
Ɔyɛɛ me nwanwa dɛ
Ɔsoaa no bɔkɔɔ;
Na ɔpaa mo ho no,
Mubuu ntwɛr sɔɔr No.

MHB 174
2 . O Shepherd, good Shepherd, 
Thy wounds they are deep;
The wolves have sore hurt Thee,
In saving Thy sheep;
Thy raiment all over 
With crimson is dyed;
And what is this rent
They have made in Thy side?
	 ~ 	2 . Ao, Oguanhwɛfo pa!
W'epirakur mu dɔ,
Mpataku n' piraa Wo,
Eregye Wo guan n';
Hwɛ mbrɛ bɔgya ayɛ
W'atar no mu kɔɔ!
Na Wo mfem akam yi
So ase nye dɛn?

MHB 174
3 . Ah me! How the thorns
Have entangled Thy hair,
And cruelly riven
That forehead so fair;
How feebly Thou drawest
Thy faltering breath;
And lo, on Thy face
Is the shadow of death.
	 ~ 	3 . Ao, hwɛ mbrɛ nsoɛ n' esi
Abebar Wo nhwi,
Na afei awowɔ Wo,
W'enyimdua fɛɛfɛw n'!
Hwɛ mbrɛ egye ahom a
Ɔnnyɛ yie koraa;
Na hwɛ, owu sunsum
Agyegye W'enyim.

MHB 174
4 . O Shepherds, good Shepherd!
And is it for me
This grievous affliction 
Has fallen on Thee?
Ah, then let me strive,
For the love Thou hast borne,
To give Thee no longer
Occasion to mourn!	 ~ 	4 . Ao, Oguanhwɛfo pa!
Ɔyɛ emi ntsi na
Yaw kɛse a ɔtse dɛm
Aba Wo do yi.
Dɛm a na ma memper
Wɔ Wo dɔ no ntsi,
Mma minnyi W' awerɛhow
Dabiara da bio!

MHB 175
1 . WEEP  not for Him Who onward bears
His cross to Calvary;
He does not ask man’s pitying tears,
Who wills for man to die.
	 ~ 	1 . Mma nnsu mma Nyia ɔso mbeamudua 
Dze rokɔ Calvary no;
Ɔnnserɛ dasanyi ne nyinsu,
Ɔapen dɛ obowu.

MHB 175
2 . The awful sorrow of His face,
The bowing of His frame,
Come not from torture or disgrace:
He fears not cross nor shame.
	 ~ 	2 . Yaw huhu bi a atow N' enyim, 
Oegura ne nyimpadua n',
Mmfir amenhyɛ anaa 'nyimguase:
Onnsuro mbeamudua n'.

MHB 175
3 . There is a deeper pang of grief,
An agony unknown,
In which His love finds no relief-
He bears it all alone.
	 ~ 	3 . Yaw wenwen a ɔbor do yi, 
Ahoguan a ɔnnka,
Dza Wo dɔ nnya mu ahotɔ yi,
Wo nko so ne nyina.

MHB 175
4 . He sees the souls for whom He dies
Yet clinging to their sin,
And heirs of mansions in the skies
Who will not enter in.
	 ~ 	4 . Ohu akra a hɔn ntsi oruwu 
Dɛ wɔtar hɔn bɔn ho,
Hɔn a ɔsor-man dzi wɔ hɔn
Wɔmmpɛ dɛ wɔhɛn mu.

MHB 175
5 . O may I in Thy sorrow share,
And mourn that sins of mine
Should ever wound with grief or care
That loving heart of Thine. Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Ao, ma menye Wo ndzi Wo yaw, 
Munsu dɛ emi mo bɔn
Bepira Wo dɔ akoma,
Dze yaw bɛhyɛ Wo do.   Amen.

MHB 176
1 . MAN of Sorrows! what a name
For the Son of God, who came
Ruined sinners to reclaim!
Hallelujah! What a Saviour!
	 ~ 	1 . Yaw Nyimpa! Wɔnhwɛ dzin bi a 
Wɔdze frɛɛ Nyame Ne Ba a
Ɔbɛgyee adasa nkwa
Alleluia! Ɔgyefo bɛn a!

MHB 176
2 . Bearing shame and scoffing rude,
In my place condemned He stood;
Sealed my pardon with His blood:
Hallelujah! What a Saviour!
	 ~ 	2 . Wɔhyɛɛ N' fɛr, woyii N' ehi, 
Wɔdze m' afɔdzi soaa No;
No bɔgyaa sii m' fakyɛ pi:
Alleluia! Ɔgyefo bɛn a!

MHB 176
3 . Guilty, vile, and helpless we;
Spotless Lamb of God was He:
Full atonement-can it be?
Hallelujah! What a Saviour!
	 ~ 	3 . Yedzi fɔ, hɛn ho yɛ nkɔw 
Na Ɔno nye mpata-guan:
Bo adwe koraa!- aso ampa?
Alleluia! Ɔgyefo bɛn a!

MHB 176
4 . Lifted up was He to die.
It is finished! was His cry;
Now in heaven exalted high:
 Hallelujah! What a Saviour!
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔsɛn wimu na owui, 
Ɔkaam' dɛ, Afei mewie!
N-dɛ wɔakrɔn No wɔ sor
Alleluia! Ɔgyefo bɛn a!

MHB 176
5 . When He comes, our glorious King,
All His ransomed home to bring,
Then anew this song we’ll sing:
Hallelujah! What a Saviour!	 ~ 	5 . Na hɛn Enyimnyam Hen n' ɔba 
Ɔbɛfa No nkorɔfo kɔ a,
Ber n' yɛbɔtow ndwom yi bio:
Alleluia! Ɔgyefo bɛn a!

MHB 177
1 . AH, holy Jesu, how hast Thou offended,
That man to judge Thee hath in hate pretended?
By foes derided, by Thine own rejected,
 O most afflicted.
	 ~ 	1 . Aa! Jesu krɔnkrɔn, ebɛn na ayɛ, 
Na nyimpa dze enyitan bu Wo fɔ yi?
Atamfo si W' atwetwe, wodze apa W',
Ao, mandzehunyi.

MHB 177
2 . Who was the guilty? Who brought this upon Thee?
Alas, my treason, Jesu, hath undone Thee;
’Twas I, Lord Jesu, I it was denied Thee:
I crucified Thee.
 	 ~ 	2 . Woana dzi so? Woana dze yi baa Wo do? 
Ao, Jesu, mo bɔn na ɔabɔ W' mbusu yi;
Mara a, Wura Jesu, emi na mepaa W':
'Mi mobɔɔ W' mbeamuduam':

MHB 177
3 . Lo, the Good Shepherd for the sheep is offered;
 The slave hath sinned, and the Son hath suffered;
For man’s atonement, while he nothing heedeth,
God intercedeth.
	 ~ 	3 . Wodze Guanhwɛfo n' abɔ afɔr ama nguan n'; 
Akowaa ayɛ bɔn, Ba n' agye ho ntsea;
Ber a nyimpa noara no nkwagye nnyɛ n' asɛm,
Nyankopɔn per no.

MHB 177
4 . For me, kind Jesu, was Thy incarnation,
Thy mortal sorrow, and Thy life’s oblation;
Thy death of anguish and Thy bitter passion,
For my salvation.
	 ~ 	4 . 'Mi ntsi, Jesu pa, na ebɛyɛɛ nyimpa, 
Wo wuyaw wenwen, na wo nkwa afɔrbɔ;
Wo wum' ahoguan, W' amandzehu yawyaw,
'Mi mo nkwagye ntsi a.

MHB 177
5 . Therefore, kind Jesu, since I cannot pay Thee,
I do adore Thee, and will ever pray Thee,
Think on Thy pity and Thy love unswerving,
Not my deserving.     Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Dɛm ntsi, Jesu pa, dɛ murunntum kaw tua 'i, 
Muhuhor Wo, mobɔsɔr ama Wo daa,
Hwɛ W' ayamuhyehye na Wo dɔ a ɔnnsakyer,
Nnyɛ dɛ mefata.

MHB 178
1 . WHEN my love to Christ grows weak,
When for deeper faith I seek,
Then in thought I go to thee,
Garden of Gethsemane!
	 ~ 	1 . DƆ a mowɔ ma Christ mu gow a, 
Mohwehwɛ gyedzi mapa;
Na adwen m' mokɔ turo n' mu,
Gethsemane Turo no mu.

MHB 178
2 . There I walk amid the shades,
 While the lingering twilight fades,
See that suffering, friendless One,
Weeping, praying there alone.
	 ~ 	2 . Hɔ menatsew no nwin mu,
Ber a ewia akɔtɔ;
Hwɛ 'Baako a ohu amandze n',
No nko rusu, rubɔ mpaa.

MHB 178
3 . When my love for man grows weak,
When for stronger faith I seek,
Hill of Calvary! I go
To thy scenes of fear and woe.
	 ~ 	3 . Dɔ a mowɔ ma nyimpa m' gow a,
Mohwehwɛ gyedzi a ɔyɛ dzen a, 
Mokɔ Calvary koko ko,
Bea a suro na awerɛhow wɔ.

MHB 178
4 . There behold His agony,
Suffered on the bitter Tree;
See His anguish, see His faith,
 Love triumphant still in death.
	 ~ 	4 . Hwɛ yaw ɔtsee wɔ hɔ a!
Ohun amandze wɔ dua n' do;
N'ahoguan na ne gyedzi,
'Dɔ edzi konyim wɔ wu m'.

MHB 178
5 . Then to life I turn again,
Learning all the worth of pain,
Learning all the might that lies
In a full self-sacrifice.
	 ~ 	5 . Medan ba abrabɔ ho bio,
Muhu yaw no bo a ɔsom,
Muhu tum biara a ɔwɔ a,
Medze moho bɔ afɔr.

MHB 178
6 . And I praise with firmer faith
Christ who vanquished pain and death;
And to Christ enthroned above
Raise my song of selfless love.	 ~ 	6 . Na medze gyedzi a otsim
Nye dɔ ma ayɛyi ndwom do,
Ma Christ a oedzi owu do,
Ma Christ a wɔakrɔn N' wɔ sor.

MHB 179
1 . PLUNGED in a gulf of dark despair
We wretched sinners lay,
Without one cheerful beam of hope,
Or spark of glimmering day.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN abɔnfo a yɛyɛ mbɔbɔr
Daa sum na ibun mu,
Bea a enyidado bi nnyi,
Na adzekyee nndu hɔ.

MHB 179
2 . With pitying eyes, the Prince of peace
Beheld our helpless grief;
He saw, and - O amazing love!
He flew to our relief.
	 ~ 	2 . Asomdwee Hen n'dze ayamuhyehye,
Ohun hɛn kɛse n';
O anwanwa dɔ bi a onyae a! 
Ɔyɛɛ ntsɛm bɛgyee hɛn.

MHB 179
3 . Down from the shining seats above
With joyful haste He sped,
Entered the grave in mortal flesh,
And dwelt among the dead.
	 ~ 	3 . Osiaan fii sor ahengua n' do
Dze enyigye yɛɛ ntsɛm bae,
Dze nyimpadua hɛɛn wumaa mu,
Na ɔtsenaa ewufo mu.

MHB 179
4 . O for this love let rocks and hills
Their lasting silence break,
And all harmonious human tongues
The Saviour’s praises speak !
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔdɔ yi ntsi ma obotan 
Na akoko ngyaa kommyɛ, 
Na nyimpa tɛkyerɛma nyina
Nyi Agyenkwa n' ayɛw.

MHB 179
5 . Angels, assist our mighty joys,
Strike all your harps of gold;
But when you raise your highest notes,
His love can ne’er be told.	 ~ 	5 . Abɔfo, hom nye bɛn ndzi dɛw,
Hom mbɔ sika sanku;
Na hom pegya hom ndwom wɔ sor a,
Mma wonntum nnkyerɛ da.

MHB 18
1 . LET us, with a gladsome mind,
   Praise the Lord, for he is kind:
         For His mercies aye endure,
         Ever faithful, ever sure.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM mma yɛmfa enyigye adwen
Nye Ewuradze ayew, na oye:

MHB 18
2 . Let us blaze His name abroad.
    For of gods he is the God:
	 ~ 	2 . N'ehumbɔbɔr tsim hɔ daa,
Osi pi yɛ nokwar daa.

MHB 18
3 . He with all commanding might,
    Filled the new-made world with light:
	 ~ 	3 . Yɛmfa Ne dzin no ntahye,
Ɔyɛ enyame mu

MHB 18
4 . All things living He doth feed.
   His full hand supplies their need:
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔno na ɔhyɛɛ ma kan
Baa wiadze a wɔayɛ n' fofor n'.

MHB 18
5 . He His chosen race did bless
    In the wasteful wilderness
	 ~ 	5 . Ɔnyɛn atseasefo nyina,
Ɔma hɔn dza wohia nyina:

MHB 18
6 . Let us, with a gladsome mind,
    Praise the Lord, for He is kind:	 ~ 	6 . Ohyira hɔn a ɔapaw hɔn
Wɔ sar a etwie no do:

MHB 180
1 . THERE is a green hill far away,
Without a city wall,
Where the dear Lord was crucified
Who died to save us all.
	 ~ 	1 . Kokwaa bi wɔ ekyirkyir noho, 
Kurow bi ban ekyir,
Hɔ na wɔsɛɛn Ewuradze a
Owui dze gyee hɛn nkwa n'.

MHB 180
2 . We may not know, we cannot tell
What pains He had to bear;
But we believe it was for us
He hung and suffered there.
	 ~ 	2 . Yennkotum yeehu, yɛakyerɛ yaw 
A ɔsɔwee no dur;
Na yɛgye dzi dɛ hɛn ntsi na
Ɔsɛɛn hɔ na owui.

MHB 180
3 . He died that we might be forgiven,
He died to make us good,
That we might go at last to heaven
Saved by His precious blood.
	 ~ 	3 . Owui ma yeenya bɔnfakyɛ, 
Owui ma yaayɛ yie,
N' adehye bɔgya n' aagye hɛn,
Ewiei n' yaakɔ sor manm'.

MHB 180
4 . There was no other good enough
To pay the price of sin;
He only could unlock the gate
Of heaven, and let us in
	 ~ 	4 . Obi nnyihɔ a oye dɛ Ɔno 
Na oeetua  bɔn ho kaw n';
No nko na otum bue sor abow n'
Na ɔdze hɛn kɔ mu.

MHB 180
5 . O dearly, dearly has He loved,
And we must love Him too,
And trust in His redeeming blood,
And try His works to do.	 ~ 	5 . O, ɔdɔ bɛn na ɔadɔ hɛn 
Otwar dɛ yɛdɔ N' bi,
Yɛtwer No bɔgyaa a ɔapon hɛn n',
Yɛper yɛ no ndwuma.

MHB 181
1 . LAMB of God, whose dying love
We now recall to mind,
Send the answer from above,
And let us mercy find;
Think on us, who think on Thee;
And every struggling soul release;
O remember Calvary,
And bid us go in peace !
	 ~ 	1 . Nyame Eguambaa, yɛrekaa, 
Wo dɔ a woepira no n',
Fi sor noho gye hɛn do,
Na bohu hɛn mbɔbɔr:
Kaa hɛn a yɛdwen Wo ho;
Na gye kra biara a ɔreper;
O, yɛserɛ W', kaa Calvary,
Na ma yɛnkɔ asomdweem'!

MHB 181
2 . By thine  agonising pain
And  sweat  of blood, we pray,
By Thy dying love to man,
Take all our sins away:
Burst our bonds, and set us free;
From all iniquity release;
O remember Calvary,
And bid us go in peace !
	 ~ 	2 . W' amandzehu yayaw no, 
Wo bɔgyaa fifir no,
Wo dɔ a ɔmaa iwui ntsi,
Yɛserɛ W' , yi hɛn bɔn kɔ;
Bubu hɛn mpokyerɛ mu na
Gye hɛn emumuyɛ nyinam';
O, yeserɛ W', kaa Calvary,
Na ma yɛnkɔ asomdweem'!

MHB 181
3 . Let Thy blood, by faith applied,
The sinner’s pardon seal;
Speak us freely justified,
And all our sickness heal;
By Thy passion on the tree,
Let all our griefs and troubles cease;
O remember Calvary,
And bid us go in peace !      Amen.	 ~ 	3 . Gyedzi mfa Wo bɔgyaa no 
Nsɔw hɛn bɔfakyɛ ano;
Si n' pi dɛ woebu hɛn bem,
Yɛ hɛn yar nyina edur;
W' amandzehu wɔ dua n' do
Ntsi, twa hɛn yaw nye fona do;
O, yɛserɛ W', kaa Calvary,
Na ma yɛnkɔ asomdweem'!

MHB 182
1 . WHEN I survey the wondrous cross
On which the Prince of glory died,
My richest gain I count but loss,
And pour contempt on all my pride.
	 ~ 	1 . Moto m' enyi hwɛ anwanwa dua a 
Enyimnyam Hen no tɔɔr do n' a,
M' adze pa biara mummbu n' hwee,
M' ahopɔw nyina yɛ m' nkɔnkɔw.

MHB 182
2 . Forbid it, Lord, that I should boast,
Save in the death of Christ my God:
All the vain things that charm me most,
I sacrifice them to His blood.\
	 ~ 	2 . Mo Wura, ɔmpar me dɛ m' botuw, 
Gyedɛ m' Agyenkwa No wu  mu:
Egyangyandze a modɔ kɛse n',
Mobɔ n' afɔr ma No bɔgyaa.

MHB 182
3 . See, from His head, His hands, His feet,
Sorrow and love flow mingled down:
Did e’er such love and sorrow meet,
 Or thorns compose so rich a crown ?
	 ~ 	3 . Hwɛ mbrɛ yaw na ɔdɔ rosɔn 
Ne tsir, Ne nsa, nye N' anan ho:
Dɛm dɔ na yaw yi mmbɔɔ mu pɛn,
Na nsoɛ kyɛw yi bi nnsoaa bi da.

MHB 182
4 . Were the whole realm of nature mine,
That were an offering far too small;
Love so amazing, so divine,
Demands my soul, my life, my all.	 ~ 	4 . Wiadze nyina yɛ medze mpo a, 
N-kyɛ ɔyɛ akyɛdze a osuar koraa;
Dɔ nwanwa yi, Nyame dɔ yi,
Gye me kra, mo nkwa, m' adze nyina.

MHB 183
1 . IN the cross of Christ I glory:
Towering o’er the wrecks of time,
All the light of sacred story
Gathers round its head sublime.
	 ~ 	1 . CHRIST Mbeamudua no mu na mutuw;
Obunkam dza asɛɛ nyina do,
N-kwagyesɛm ne kan nyina
Gyina ne tsir fɛɛfɛw no do.

MHB 183
2 . When the woes of life o’ertake me,
Hopes deceive, and fears annoy,
Never shall the cross forsake me:
Lo ! it glows with peace and joy.
	 ~ 	2 . Sɛ abrabɔ mu yaw to me,
Enyidar sa na suro ba a,
Mbeamudua no remmpa me da;
Ɔdze asomdwee na dɛw hyerɛn.

MHB 183
3 . When the sun of bliss is beaming
Light and love upon my way:
From the cross the radiance streaming
Adds more luster to the day.
 	 ~ 	3 . Sɛ enyigye ewia dze kan
Nye dɔ hyerɛn wɔ mo kwan do a,
Mbeamudua no hyerɛn ka ho
Na ɔma da n' kan yɛ kɛse.

MHB 183
4 .Bane and blessing, pain and pleasure,
By the cross are sanctified;
Peace is there that knows no measure,
Joys that through all time abide.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔsɛɛ, nhyira, yaw na enyigye,
Wɔtsew ho wɔ mbeanudua n' mu;
Hɔ asomdwee no, wonnsusu,
Enyigye a ɔwɔ dɔ daa a.

MHB 183
5 . In the cross of Christ I glory:
Towering o’er the wrecks of time,
All the light of sacred story
Gathers round its head sublime.	 ~ 	5 . CHRIST Mbeamudua no mu na mutuw;
Obunkam dza asɛɛ nyina do,
N-kwagyesɛm ne kan nyina
Gyina ne tsir fɛɛfɛw no do.

MHB 184
1 . THE royal banners forward go;
The Cross shines forth in mystic glow;
Where He in flesh, our flesh who made,
Our sentence bore, our ransom paid:
	 ~ 	1 . AHEN frankaa no dzi enyim 
Mbeamudua n' hyerɛn kwan nwanwa do;
Mbrɛ Nyia ɔyɛɛ hɛn n' bɛyɛɛ honam,
Ɔsoaa hɛn afɔdzi, tuaa hɛn kaw.

MHB 184
2 . Where deep for us the spear was dyed,
Life’s torrent rushing from His side
To wash us in that precious flood,
Where mingled water flowed, and blood.
	 ~ 	2 . Bea a hɛn ntsi wɔwɔɔ no nkaamaa n'
Na nkwa esutsen fi ne mfem' pem; 
Bɔgya na nsu a edzi afora
No mu na wɔahohor hɛn ho.

MHB 184
3 . Fulfilled is all that David told
 In true prophetic song of old:
Amidst the nations, God, saith he,
Hath reigned and triumphed from the tree.
	 ~ 	3 . Dza David kae nyina baa mu
Wɔ tsetse nkɔnhyɛ ndwom no mu;
Nyankopɔn kaa wɔ amanaman m'
Dɛ ofi dua n'do edzi konyim

MHB 184
4 . O Tree of beauty, Tree of light!
O Tree with royal purple dight!
Elect on whose triumphal breast
Those holy limbs should find their rest:
	 ~ 	4 . O ahoɔfɛw dua, o kan dua!
O dua a wɔahyɛ ndwom no ahentar!
Dua soronko konyimdzifo a 
Honam krɔnkrɔn n' bɔhoom wo bom'.

MHB 184
5 . On whose dear arms, so widely flung,
The weight of this world’s ransom hung:
The price of humankind to pay,
And spoil the spoiler of his prey.
	 ~ 	5 . W'abasa a atserɛw mu n' do
Na wiadze nkwagye durdur sɛn,
Na woetua adasa tsir kaw,
Na wɔasɛɛ ne sɛɛfo no so.

MHB 184
6 . To the, eternal Three in One,
Let homage meet by all be done:
Whom by the Cross thou dost restore,
Preserve and govern evermore.  Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Wɔmfa enyidzi a ɔfata nyina
Mma Ɔdomankoma Ɔkorsa;
Hɔn a enam Wo mbeamudua n' do
Agye hɔn n', kora, dzi hɔn do daa.

MHB 185
1 . AT the cross, her station keeping,
Stood the mournful mother weeping,
Where He hung, the dying Lord;
For her soul of joy bereavèd,
Bowed with anguish, deeply grievèd,
 Felt the sharp and piercing sword
	 ~ 	1 . ƆBAATAN werɛhonyi dze su
Gyinaa mbeamudua no ase,
Mbrɛ Ewuradze a oruwu n' sɛn;
Nna ne kra enyigye asa,
Ahoguan ama no werɛ ahow,
Ɔtse afowa a ehwira N' mu n' nka.

MHB 185
2 . O how sad and sore distressèd
Now was she, that mother blessèd
Of the sole- begotten One;
Deep the woe of her affliction,
 When she saw the crucifixion 
Of her ever- glorious Son.
	 ~ 	2 . Ao, ɔbaataan siarfo! Afei
Mbrɛ yaw na awerɛhow ato no a!
Ne Ba a ɔwoo n' kor no ntsi:
Ɔhwɛ n'enyimnyam Ba no a
Ɔsɛn mbeamudua do no a,
Na yaw kɛse aka no.

MHB 185
3 . For His people’s sins chastisèd,
She beheld her Son despisèd,
Scourged, and crowned with thorns entwined;
Saw Him then from judgment taken,
 And in death by all forsaken,
Till His Spirit He resigned.
	 ~ 	3 . Ohun Ba a woebu N'enyimtsia,
Wɔaka N' mpire, asoa N' nsoɛkyɛw,
Wɔ No nkorɔfo hɔn ntsi.
Ɔhwɛɛ N' kɛpeem dɛ wobuu N' fɔ!
No wu mu obiara paa No,
Na ogyaa No sunsum mu.

MHB 185
4 . Jesus, may her deep devotion
Stir in me the same emotion,
Fount of love, Redeemer kind,
That my heart, fresh ardor gaining,
And a purer love attaining,
 May with Thee acceptance find.     Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Jesus, ma n'etuhoakyɛ no 
Nkenyan me ma menyɛ dɛm bi;
Dɔba, Pomfo yamuyiefo,
Nkyɛ m'akoma eenya hyewbɔ fofor,
Na ɔdɔ mapa aahyɛ mu ma,
Ama meenya Wo nkyɛn kwan.

MHB 186
1 . O LOVE divine! what hast Thou done?
The immortal God hath died for me!
The Father’s co-eternal Son
Bore all my sins upon the tree;
The immortal God for me hath died!
My Lord, my Love is crucified.
	 ~ 	1 . Onyame dɔ! 'bɛn na ayɛ 'i? 
Bɛkyebo Nyame ewu ama m'!
Egya No domankoma Ba N'
Soaa mo bɔn nyina wɔ dua n' do;
Bɛkyebo Nyame ewu ama m'!
Mo Wura, mo Dɔ, wɔabɔ N' mbeamuduam'.

MHB 186
2 . Behold Him, all ye that pass by,
The bleeding prince of life and peace!
Come, sinners, see your Maker die,
And say, was ever grief like His?
Come, feel with me His blood applied:
My Lord, my Love is crucified:
	 ~ 	2 . Akwantsemfo nyina hom nhwɛ 
N-kwa na Asomdwee Hen ruwu!
Abɔn hom Bɔfo na oruwu 'il!
Aso yaw bi nye Nedze 'i sɛ?
Hom nye m' mbɔsɔ No bɔgyaa nhwɛ:
Mo Wura, mo Dɔ, wɔabɔ N' mbeamuduam'.

MHB 186
3 . Is crucified for me and you,
To bring us rebels back to God:
Believe, believe the record true,
Ye all are bought with Jesu’s blood,
Pardon for all flows from His side:
My Lord, my Love is crucified.
	 ~ 	3 . Woeku No ama wo nye me, 
Ma yɛnye Nyame abɔ mu:
Hom ngye Nsɛmpa n' ara ndzi dɛ,
Jesus bɔgyaa pon hɛn nyina,
Fakyɛ pem Ne mfem' ma obiara;
Mo Wura, mo Dɔ, wɔabɔ N' mbeamuduam'.

MHB 186
4 . Then let us stand beneath His Cross,
And gladly catch the healing stream,
All things for Him account but loss,
And give up all our hearts to Him;
Of nothing think or speak beside:
My Lord, my Love is crucified.	 ~ 	4 . Wɔmma yɛnko dua n' n' ase ha, 
Yɛmfa dɛw ndɔw yarsa nsu n' bi,
Yembu adze nyina ahwerdze,
Yengyaa hɛn akomam' mma No;
Mma yɛnndwen hwee, yɛnnka  hwee, dɛ
Mo Wura, mo Dɔ, wɔabɔ N' mbeamuduam'.

MHB 187
1 . O COME and mourn with me awhile;
O come ye to the Saviour’s side; 
O come, together let us mourn:
Jesus, our Lord, is crucified.
	 ~ 	1 . Hom mbra ma yɛnka mmɔm kakra; 
Hom mbra Agyenkwa Ne nkyɛn ha;
Hom mbra ma yɛmbɔm', yɛnka mmɔm:
Hɛn Wura Jesus, wɔabɔ N' mbeamuduam.

MHB 187
