2 . Have we no tears to shed for Him,
While soldiers scoff and Jews deride?
Ah! look how patiently He hangs:
Jesus, our Lord, is crucified.
	 ~ 	2 . Worisi No atwetwe yi, 
Ana yennkosu ama No?
Ao! hwɛ mbrɛ ɔayɛ komm sɛn hɔ:
Hɛn Wura Jesus, wɔabɔ N' mbeamuduam.

MHB 187
3 . How fast His hands and feet are nailed,
His throat with parching thirst is dried!
His failing eyes are dim with woe:
Jesus, our Lord, is crucified.
	 ~ 	3 . Wɔbɔɔ Ne nsa nye N' anan mu 
Ne men mu wewee, nsukɔm twaar No!
Mbusu dze sum hyɛɛenyi do:
Hɛn Wura Jesus, wɔabɔ N' mbeamuduam.

MHB 187
4 . Seven times He spoke, seven words of love;
And all three hours His silence cried
For mercy on the souls of men:
Jesus, our Lord, is crucified.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔkaa ɔdɔ nsɛm mpɛn esuon; 
Ndɔnhwer ebiasa na ɔtaa dzinn
Serɛɛ mbɔbɔrhu maa adasa:
Hɛn Wura Jesus, wɔabɔ N' mbeamuduam.

MHB 187
5 . Come, let us stand beneath the cross;
The fountain opened in His side
Shall purge our deepest stains away:
Jesus, our Lord, is crucified.
	 ~ 	5 . Ma yengyina mbeamudua n' ase, 
Na bɔgya a ofi Ne mfem' no,
Ɔbɔhor hɛn ho bɔn nyina:
Hɛn Wura Jesus, wɔabɔ N' mbeamuduam.

MHB 187
6 . A broken heart, a fount of tears,
Ask, and they will not be denied;
A broken heart love’s cradle is:
Jesus, our Lord, is crucified.
	 ~ 	6 . Koma bobɔe na nyinsuwa, 
Wɔmmfa nnkam hɔn a wobisa;
Dɔ ahyɛse nye 'koma bobɔe:
Mo Wura Jesus, wɔabɔ N' mbeamuduam.

MHB 187
7 . O love of God! O sin of man!
In this dread act Your strength is tried;
And victory remains with love:
For He, our Lord, is crucified.	 ~ 	7 . Onyame dɔ! nyimpa no bɔn! 
Munnsu 'i asɔ hom tum ahwɛ;
Na Nyame dɔ edzi konyim:
Hɛn Wura Jesus, wɔabɔ N' mbeamuduam.

MHB 188
1 . ALL ye that pass by,
To Jesus draw nigh:
To you is it nothing that Jesus should die?
Your ransom and peace,
Your surety He is:
Come, see if there ever was sorrow like His. 
	 ~ 	1 . HƆN a wotwa mu nyina
Wɔntwe mbɛn Jesus;
Ɔnnyɛ hom asɛm dɛ Jesus wu anaa?
Ɔyɛ hom asomdwee,
Hom kyigyinafo;
Hom mbra mbɔhwɛ dɛ yaw bi nye Nedze n' sɛ a.

MHB 188
2 . He dies to atone
For sins not His own;
Your debt He hath paid, and your work He hath done.
Ye all may receive
The peace He did leave, 
Who made intercession: My Father, forgive!
	 ~ 	2 . Owu dze pata
Binom hɔn bɔn koraa;
Wo kaw no oetua, na ɔayɛ w'edwuma n'.
Obiara benya
Asomdwee a ogyaae;
Ɔno na ɔserɛɛ dɛ: M'Egya, fa kyɛ hɔn.

MHB 188
3 . For you and for me
He prayed on the tree:
The prayer is accepted, the sinner is free.
That sinner am I,
Who on Jesus rely,
And come for the pardon God cannot deny. 
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔsɔree dua n' do,
Dze maa emi na ɔwo; 
Woetsie mpaabɔ n', ɔbɔnfo afa n' ho edzi, 
Ɔbɔnfo n' nye emi,
Na motwer Jesus,
Bɛgye fakyɛ a Nyame nnkotum dze akam.

MHB 188
4 . My pardon I claim;
For a sinner I am,
A sinner believing in Jesus’s name.
He purchased the grace
Which now I embrace:
O Father, Thou know’st He hath died in my place.	 ~ 	4 . Megye me fakyɛ,
Meyɛ ɔbɔnfo;
Ɔdzebɔnyɛnyi, megye Jesus dzin dzi.
Ɔtɔɔ adom a\nAfei mesuo m' yi;
O Egya, inyim dɛ obowui maa me.

MHB 189
1 . THRONED upon the awful Tree,
King of grief, I watch with Thee;
Darkness veils Thine anguished face,
None its lines of woe can trace,
None can tell what pangs unknown
Hold Thee silent and alone;
	 ~ 	1 . WƆAKRƆN W' nyimguase dua n' do,
Awerɛhow Hen, menye W' weɔn;
Sum gye W'enyim a atow no do,
Obi nntum nnhu Wo yaw no;
Obi nntum nnkyerɛ amandze a 
Wo nko rosɔw no komm no.

MHB 189
2 . Silent through those three dread hours,
Wrestling with the evil powers;
Left alone with human sin,
Gloom around Thee and within,
Till the appointed time is nigh,
Till the Lamb of God may die.
	 ~ 	2 . Eyɛɛ komm ndɔnhwer ebiasa n',
'Nye sum mu etumfo dzii aper;
Nyimpa bɔn daa Wo nko do,
Sum etwa Wo ho nyina ehyia,
Kodu dɛ aber n' bodu
Na Nyame Eguambaa ewu.

MHB 189
3 . Hark that cry that peals aloud
Upward through the whelming cloud!
Thou, the Father’s only Son,
Thou, His own Anointed One,
Thou dost ask him-can it be:
Why hast Thou forsaken Me?
	 ~ 	3 . Tsie Ne nkekam' dzendzen no a
Odua munumkum mu kɔ sor!
Ɔwo a 'yɛ Egya n' Ba kortoo n',
Ɔwo a Noara asera Wo ngo,
Ɔwo na ibisa No dɛ:
Ebɛn ntsi na apa me?

MHB 189
4 . Lord, should fear and anguish roll
Darkly o’er my sinful soul,
Thou, who once was thus bereft
That Thine own might ne’er be left,
Teach me by that bitter cry 
In the gloom to know Thee nigh.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Ewuradze, sɛ yaw nye suro
Dze sum kata me kra do a,
Ɔwo a edzi emia dɛm pɛɛn,
Ma Wodze annka ekyir n',
Da Wo su wenwen n' mu kyerɛ m',
Na meehu dɛ ebɛn m' sum m'.

MHB 19
1 . PRAISE, O praise our God and king!
 Hymns of adoration sing;
            
For his mercies still endure
Ever faithful, ever sure.
	 ~ 	1 . Wonyi Nyame Hen ayɛw! 
Wɔmfa ayɛyindwom mbrɛ N';

      N' ehumbɔbor tsim hɔ daa, 
      Osi pi yɛ nokwar daa.

MHB 19
2 . Praise Him that he made the sun
 Day by day his course to run;
	 ~ 	2 . Wonyi N' ayɛw: ɔayὲ ewia, 
Dὲ ɔkɔ aprɔw daa daa nyina:

MHB 19
3 . And the silver moon by night,
 Shining with her gentle light;
	 ~ 	3 . Na eso ɔayɛ bosoom, 
Ma odu anafua a ɔhyerɛn:

MHB 19
4 . Praise Him that he gave the rain
 To mature the swelling grain;
	 ~ 	4 . Wonhyira N' dὲ ɔtɔ nyankom, 
Ma ɔma edziban fifir:

MHB 19
5 . And hath bid the fruitful field
 Crops of precious increase yield;
	 ~ 	5 . Na ɔma asaase pa so 
Oyi no ndɔbaa ma hɛn:

MHB 19
6 . Praise him for our harvest store,
 He hath filled the gamer floor;
	 ~ 	6 . Ɔama buber so aba, 
Ɔahyɛ hɛn asan mama:

MHB 19
7 . And for richer food than this.
 Pledge of everlasting bliss:
	 ~ 	7 . Ɔama edziban a ɔsen dɛm, 
Daa daa dɛw ho ahobadze:

MHB 19
8 . Glory to our bounteous King!
 Glory let creation sing,
	
 Glory to the Father, Son,
 And blest Spirit, Three in One.	 ~ 	8 . Enyimnyam nka, Hen dɔyɛfo 
Abɔdze nyina ntow enyimnyam,

      Enyimnyam nka Egya, nye Ba, 
      Nye Sunsum, Ebiasa Kor.   Amen.

MHB 190
1 . O PERFECT  life of love! 
All, all is finished now, 
All that He left His throne above
To do for us below.
	 ~ 	1 . O ƆDƆ bra mapa!
Dza ntsi ogyaa N'ahengua
Wɔ sor bɛyɛɛ maa hɛn wɔ ha n',
Ne nyina abɔ adze.

MHB 190
2 . No work is left undone 
Of all the Father willed;
His toils and sorrows, one by one,
The scriptures have fulfilled.
	 ~ 	2 . Dza Egya n' pɛ nyina, 
Edwuma n' biara annka, 
Ne berɛ na yaw, ɔyɛɛ n' nkorkor;
Kyerɛwsɛm no ahyɛ ma.

MHB 190
3 . No pain that we can share
But He has felt its smart;
All forms of human grief and care
Have pierced that tender heart.
	 ~ 	3 . Hɛn yaw biara nnyi hɔ a
No so ɔammfa mu bi;
Nyimpa yaw na adwen nyina
Ehwira N'akoma mu.

MHB 190
4 . And on His thorn-crowned head,
And on His sinless soul,
Our sins in all their guilt were laid,
That He might make us whole.
	 ~ 	4 . Ne tsir do nsoɛ kyɛw no, 
Na Ne kra a bɔn nnyi mu;
Ɔsoaa hɛn bɔn na afɔdzi nyina,
Na ɔama yeedzi mu.

MHB 190
5 . In perfect love He dies;
For me He dies, for me!
O all-atoning Sacrifice,
I cling by faith to Thee.
	 ~ 	5 . Owuu ɔdɔ mapa m';
Owui, owuu maa me!
Afɔr a ɔpata bɔn nyina,
Metetar Wo gyedzi m'.

MHB 190
6 . In every time of need,
Before the judgment throne,
Thy works, O Lamb of God, I’ll plead,
Thy merits, not my own.
	 ~ 	6 . Ohiaber biara mu,
Atsɛmbugua n' enyim,
Nyame Eguambaa, Wo ndwuma no 
Na hwɛ ho gye me nkwa.

MHB 190
7 . Yet work, O Lord, in me,
As Thou for me hast wrought;
And let my love the answer be
To grace Thy love has brought.   Amen.	 ~ 	7 . Mo Wura, yɛ mo mu edwuma,
Dɛ mbrɛ ayɛ ama m', 
Na ma mo dɔ nyɛ mbuae mma adom a 
Wo dɔ dze aba no.

MHB 191
1 . GOD of unexampled grace,
Redeemer of mankind,
Matter of eternal praise
We in Thy passion find:
Still our choicest strains we bring,
Still the joyful theme pursue,
Thee the Friend of Sinners sing,
Whose love is ever new.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME a W'adom nnyi nhwɛdo,
Adasamba Gyefo,
Daa daa ayɛyi ho asɛm, 
Yehu W'amandzehu m';
Yɛda ho tow W' ndwom dɛɛdɛw, 
Yɛda ho yɛwɔ dɛw mu,
Yɛtow Abɔn Adamfo ndwom,
No dɔ yɛ fofor daa.

MHB 191
2 . Endless scenes of wonder rise
From that mysterious tree,
Crucified before our eyes,
Where we our Maker see:
Jesus, Lord, what hast Thou done?
Publish we the death divine,
Stop, and gaze, and fall, and own
Was never love like Thine!
	 ~ 	2 . Yehu daa anwanwadze
Fi nwanwa dua no do,
Yehun dɛ wɔbɔɔ N' mbeamudua m',
Bea a yehu hɛn Bɔfo;
Owura Jesus, ayɛ dɛn?
Yɛbɔ Wo wu ho dawur,
Yegyina hwɛ, kotow, gye to m'.
'Dɔ bi nntse dɛ Wodze.

MHB 191
3 . Never love nor sorrow was
Like that my Saviour showed:
See Him stretched on yonder Cross,
And crushed beneath our load!
Now discern the Deity,
Now His heavenly birth declare!
Faith cries out: 'Tis He, 'tis He,
My God, that suffers there !	 ~ 	3 . Ɔdɔ nye awerɛhow bi nnyi
Tse dɛ m'Agyenkwa dze n';
Hwɛ, ɔda mbeamudua no do!
Hɛn adzesoa ahyɛ No do;
Hom nka dɛ N'awoo fi sor!
Hom nhu dɛ ɔyɛ Nyame;
Gyedzi tsea m' dɛ, ɔyɛ Ɔno,
Me Nyame a ohu amandze!

MHB 192
1 . RIDE on, ride on in majesty!
Hark! all the tribes Hosanna! cry;
O Saviour meek, pursue Thy road
with palms and scattered garments 
strowed.
	 ~ 	1 . Ko do  kɔ kan ahentum mu! 
N-tar saw abowa no do;
Tsena do, na eyɛ Ɔhen mu,
David ne Ba, wiadze Gyefo.

MHB 192
2 . Ride on, ride on in majesty!
In lowly pomp ride on to die;
O Christ, Thy triumphs now begin
O'er captive death and conquered sin.
	 ~ 	2 . Ko do  kɔ kan ahentum mu! 
Ɔwo na Sion rotweɔn Wo;
Wɔdze n-tar nye mberɛnkɔnson
Egu Wo kwan mu dɛ fa do.

MHB 192
3 . Ride on, ride on in majesty!
The wingèd squadrons of the sky
Look down with sad and wondering eyes
To see the approaching sacrifice.
	 ~ 	3 . Ko do  kɔ kan ahentum mu! 
Ɔkatakyi, hell ne sɛɛfo;
'Wo na ibue sor ahenman
To hɔ petee ma Wo nkorɔfo.

MHB 192
4 . Ride on, ride on in majesty!
Thy last and fiercest strife is nigh;
The Father on His sapphire throne
Expects His own annointed Son.
	 ~ 	4 . Ko do  kɔ kan ahentum mu? 
Dɔmtutuw fi sor rohwɛ Wo,
Dɛ 'rokɔbɔ afɔr huhu
Ana akɔko W' ahengua do.

MHB 192
5 . Ride on, ride on in majesty!
In lowly pomp ride on to die;
Bow Thy meek head to mortal pain,
Then take, O God, Thy power, and reign.	 ~ 	5 . Ko do  kɔ kan ahentum mu! 
Wiadze nyina hɛn Enyidar!
Dzi nyim, brɛ hɛn 'komatɔmu,
Ndzeyɛtsenenee, ɔdɔ, nye siar.

MHB 193
1 . BEHOLD the Saviour of mankind
Nailed to the shameful tree!
How vast the love that Him inclined
 To bleed and die for thee!
	 ~ 	1 . Hwɛ adasa hɔn Agyenkwa 
Wɔ enyimguase dua n' ho!
Dɔ a ɔkaa N' ma okyii bɔgya
Wui maa wo n' so so pa!

MHB 193
2 . Hark, how He groans! while nature
       shakes,
And earth's strong pillars bend;
The temple's veil in sunder breaks,
The solid marbles rend.
	 ~ 	2 . Tsie, ɔrepen! abɔdze rihim, 
Asaase rowosow;
Asɔrdan mu ntwamutam atsew,
Abotan repaapaa.

MHB 193
3 . 'Tis done! the precious ransom's
       paid;
Receive My soul! He cries:
See where He bows His sacred head!
He bows His head, and dies!
	 ~ 	3 . Oewie! wer a ho hia n' ɔatɔ; 
Ɔrekam', Gye Mo sunsum!
Hwɛ mbrɛ ɔabɔ Ne tsir adze,
Ɔabɔ n' adze ewu!

MHB 193
4 . But soon He'll break death's
       envious chain,
And in full glory shine:
O Lamb of God, was ever pain,
Was ever love, like Thine?	 ~ 	4 . Na obobu wu apon mu ntsɛm, 
Na ɔahyerɛn enyimnyamm';
Nyame Eguambaa, yaw bɛn a,
Dɔ bɛn nye Wodze sɛ?

MHB 194
1 . Go to dark Gethsemane,
Ye that feel the tempter's
power;
Your Redeemer's conflict see;
Watch with Him one bitter hour;
Turn not from His griefs away:
Learn of Jesus Christ to pray.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM nkɔ sum Gethsemane, 
Hom a ɔsɔhwɛfo n' haw hom;
Hom nhwɛ hom Gyefo No ko,
Hom nye No nweɔn dɔnhwer kor;
Mma hom nndan mmfi Ne yaw ho;
Hom nhwɛ Jesus nsua mpaabɔ.

MHB 194
2 . Follow to the judgement-hall;
View the Lord of Life arraigned.
O the wormwood and the gall!
O the pangs His soul sustained!
Shun not suffering, shame, or loss:
Learn of Him to bear the cross.
	 ~ 	2 . Dzi ekyir kɔ atsɛmbu da n' mu;
Hwɛ Nkwa Wura a wɔakyer no,
O bɔwen na bɔwema!
O ɔhaw a Ne kra hunii a!
Mma nnguan yaw na enyimguase;
Sua No soa mbeamudua no.

MHB 194
3 . Calvary's mournful mountain climb;
There, adoring at His feet,
Mark that miracle of time,
God's own sacrifice complete.
It is finished! Hear the cry: 
Learn of Jesus Christ to die.
	 ~ 	3 . Fow Calvary awerɛhow koko n';
Kɔkotow N'ananadze,
Hwɛ anwanwadze a osii,
Nyame abɔ afɔr ewie,
Tsie! Ɔreka m' dɛ oewie!
Sua Jesus hu mbrɛ wowu.

MHB 194
4 . Early to the tomb repair
Where they lay His breathless clay:
Angels kept their vigils there;
Who hath taken Him away?
Christ is risen! He seeks the skies;
Saviour, teach us so to rise.	 ~ 	4 . Dzi ekyir kɔ nda n' do ntsɛmara, 
Beebi a wɔdze fun no toe;
Abɔfo tse hɔ roweɔn;
Woana abɛfa No kɔ?
Christ asoɛr! Ɔpɛ akɔ sor;
Gyefo, kyerɛ hɛn ma yɛnsoɛr.

MHB 195
1 . HE dies ! the Friend of Sinners dies!
Lo! Salem's daughters weep
around!
A solemn darkness veils the skies,
A sudden trembling shakes the
ground:
Come, saints, and with your tears
bedew
The Sufferer, bruised beneath 
your load;
He poured out cries and tears for you,
He shed for you His precious blood.
	 ~ 	1 . OEWU! Abɔn Adamfo ewu!
Hwɛ! Salem mbabaa rusu No! 
Isum akata sor enyi,
Asaase wosow awerɛfir m;
Ahotsewfo, hom mbosu No,
Ohun amandze soaa hom adzesoa
Ɔtseaa m' na okyii nyinsuwa maa hom,
Ohuee No bɔgyaa gui maa hom.

MHB 195
2 . Here's love and grief beyond 
degree:
The Lord of Glory dies for man!
But lo! what sudden joys I see:
Jesus, the dead, revives again!
The rising God forsakes the tomb;
The tomb in vain forbids His
rise!
Cherubic legions guard Him home,
And shout Him welcome to the 
skies!
   	 ~ 	2 . Ɔdɔ na yaw a onnyi kabea,
Enyimnyam Wura wu ma adasa!
Naaso hwɛ dɛw kɛse a menya!
Jesus a owui n' enyan bio!
Nyankopɔn asoɛr efi nda m';
Nda enntum annkora No do!
Abɔfo mpempem hyia No kwan,
Wɔyɛ no akɔaba kɔ sor.

MHB 195
3 . Break off your tears, ye saints, and
tell
How high your great Deliverer 
reigns;
Sing how He spoiled the hosts of 
hell,
And led the monster death in
chains.
Say: Live for ever, wondrous
King!
Born to redeem, and strong to
save!
Then ask the monster: Where's
thy sting?
And: Where's thy victory, boast-
ing grave? 	 ~ 	3 . Ahotsewfo, hom ngyaa su na
Hom nka dɛ Gyefo no dzi hen;
Hom ntow ndwom d ɛ ɔasɛɛ hɛll dɔm n',
Ɔdze owu too mpokyerɛ mu.
Hom nka dɛ: Ɔhen, tsena ase daa!
Wɔwoo Wo Gyefo hoɔdzenfo!
Ɔsɛɛfo, wo tum no wɔ hen?
Ntuw wumaa, wo konyim n' wɔ hen?

MHB 196
1 . WE sing the praise of Him who died,
Of Him who died upon the cross:
The sinner's hope let men deride:
For this we count the world but loss.
	 ~ 	1 . Yɛtow ayɛyindwom kamfo 
Jesus a owuu mbeamudua do n':
N-dzebɔnyɛfo enyidar;
Ne ntsi yemmbu wiadze yi hwee.

MHB 196
2 . Inscribed upon the Cross we see
In shining letters: God is love.
He bears our sins upon the tree:
He brings us mercy from above.

The Cross-it takes our guilt away;
It holds the fainting spirit up;
It cheers with hope the gloomy day,
And sweetens every bitter cup.
	 ~ 	2 . Ne mbeamudua no kyerɛ petee 
Ma yehu dɛ Nyame nye dɔ:
Ɔsoa hɛn bɔn wɔ dua no do;
Ɔdze Nyame adom brɛ hɛn.

MHB 196
4 . It makes the coward spirit brave,
And nerves the feeble arm for fight;
It takes its terror from the grave,
And gilds the bed of death with light.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔma ohufo mbanyinndam; 
Ɔhyɛ okotoo dzen ma ɔko;
Ɔma kan hyerɛn hɛn wumpa do,
Mma yennsuro samanadze.

MHB 196
5 . The balm of life, the cure of woe,
The measure and the pledge of love, 
The sinner's refuge here below,
The angels' theme in heaven above.	 ~ 	5 . O Jesus, Wo mbeamudua no yɛ 
Ɔbra ne dɛw, mbusu n' edur
N-dzebɔnyɛfo guandɔbea:
Abɔfo kamfo Wo dɔ daa.

MHB 197
1 . BENEATH the Cross of Jesus
I fain would take my stand-
The shadow of a mighty rock
Within a weary land;
A home within a wilderness,
A rest upon the way,
From the burning of the noontide heat
And the burden of the day.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS mbeamudua n' ase
Na mepɛ dɛ migyina;
Ɔbotan kɛse bi nwin mu, 
Asaase a etwee do;
Ofi bi a ɔwɔ sar bi do,
Ɔkwan m' ahomgyebea,
Ewia ketee ne hyew ano,
Na da no n'adzesoa.

MHB 197
2 . Upon that Cross of Jesus
Mine eye at times can see
The very dying form of One
Who suffered there for me.
And from my striken heart, with tears,
Two wonders I confess-
The wonders of redeeming love,
And my own worthlessness.
	 ~ 	2 . Jesus mbeamudua no do
M'enyi botum ehu
Nyimpa kor a oruwu no,
Ohun amandze maa me,
Mifi m'akoma m' kyi nyinsu,
Ka anwanwansɛm ebien;
Anwanwa dɔ ɔgyee me;
Na fata a memmfata.

MHB 197
3 . I take, O Cross, thy shadow,
For my abiding-place!
I ask no other sunshine than
The sunshine of His face;
Content to let the world go by,
To know no gain nor loss-
My sinful self my only shame,
My glory all-the Cross.	 ~ 	3 . O mbeamudua, wo nwin ase
Bɛyɛ me tsenabea!
Mimmbisa ewia ne kan biara
Dɛ N'enyim kan no nko,
Mo bo dwe dɛ migyaa wiadze,
Minnya adze, mohwer adze,
M'enyimguase ara nye mo bɔn,
M'enyimnyam nye mbeamudua n'.

MHB 198
1 . NEVER further than Thy Cross,
Never higher than Thy feet;
Here earth's precious things seem dross,
Here earth's bitter things grow sweet.
	 ~ 	1 . YƐRONNKƆ nngya Wo mbeamudua,
Yerimmfi W'ananadze;
Wiadze mu ndzepa nnsɛ hwee,
Ndzɛmba a ɔyɛ wen ha yɛ dɛw.

MHB 198
2 . Gazing thus our sin we see,
Learn Thy love while gazing thus;
Sin which laid the Cross on Thee,
Love which bore the Cross for us.
	 ~ 	2 . Yɛhwɛ ha a, yehu hɛn bɔn, 
Yɛrohwɛ yeesua Wo dɔ;
Bɔn a ɔmaa wɔbɔɔ W' mbeamudua m',
Dɔ a ɔsoaa mbeamudua n' maa hɛn.

MHB 198
3 . Here we learn to serve and give,
And, rejoicing, self deny;
Here we gather love to live,
Here we gather faith to die.
	 ~ 	3 . Ha, yesua ɔsom na ɔma, dzi
Dɛw dɛ yɛapa hɛnho ekyir;
Yenya ɔdɔ tsena ase ha,
Ha yenya gyedzi dze wu.

MHB 198
4 . Symbols of our liberty
And our services here unite;
Captives, by Thy Cross set free,
Soldiers of Thy Cross, we fight.
	 ~ 	4 . Fahodzi ho nsɛnkyerɛdze
Na hɛn som wɔ ha ka bɔ m';
Wo mbeamudua n' gyaa adaduafo.
Yɛyɛ mbeamudua n' ho akofo.

MHB 198
5 . Pressing onwards as we can,
Still to this our hearts must tend;
Where our earliest hopes began,
There our last aspirings end.
	 ~ 	5 . Yɛkɔ enyim dɛ yebotum,
'Yi na hɛn akoma hwehwɛ;
Bea a hɛn enyidado hyɛɛ ase,
Hɔ na yenya dza yɛpɛ.

MHB 198
6 . Till amid the Hosts of Light
We, in Thee redeemed, complete,
Through Thy Cross made pure and white,	
Cast our crowns before Thy feet.	 ~ 	6 . Na yɛaka Kan Dɔm no ho,
Wo mu wɔagye hɛn koraa;
Wo mbeamudua n' tsew hɛn ho,
Dze hɛn ahenkyew gu W'enyim.

MHB 199
1 . JESUS, keep me near the Cross;
There a precious fountain,
Free to all, a healing stream,
Flows from Calvary's mountain.

        In the Cross, in the Cross,
        Be my glory ever;
        Till my raptured soul shall find
        Rest beyond the river.
	 ~ 	1 . Jesus, fa m' sie mbeamudua n' ho, 
Hɔ na nsu a ɔyɛ edur n'
Fi Calvary koko no do
Pem kwa ma obiara.

       Mbeamudua n' mu, mbeamudua n' mu, 
       Na menhyehyɛ moho, 
       Nkɛpem dɛ me kra bɔhom 
       Wɔ esutsen n' ekyir hɔ.

MHB 199
2 . Near the Cross, a trembling soul,
Love and mercy found me;
There the bright and morning star
Shed its beams around me.
	 ~ 	2 . Mbeamudua n' ho na dɔ na adom 
Too me kra bɔbɔfo;
Adzekyee Nworaba hyɛnhyɛnn n'
Ne nserɛmɛn hyerɛɛn mo do.

MHB 199
3 . Near the Cross: O Lamb of God,
Bring its scenes before me;
Help me walk from day to day,
With its shadow o'er me.
	 ~ 	3 . Dza osii mbeamudua no ho n', 
Nyame Eguambaa, yi kyerɛ m';
Ao, boa me ma mennantsew
No nwin ase daa daa.

MHB 199
4 . Near the Cross I'll watch and wait,
Hoping, trusting ever,
Till I reach the golden strand,
Just beyond the river.	 ~ 	4 . M' bɔweɔn matweɔn mbeamudua n' ho, 
Mahwɛ kan ekodu
Sika man no n' esuegya
Wɔ esutsen n' ekyir hɔ.

MHB 2
1 . ALL people that on earth do dwell, 
Sing to the Lord with cheerful voice: 
Him serve with mirth, His praise forth tell; 
Come ye before Him and rejoice.
	 ~ 	1 . NYIMPA a hom wᴐ wiadze nyina,
Hom mfa enyigye ndze ntow ndwom:
Hom mfa nyi Nyankopᴐn ayεw;
Hom mbra N'enyim hom mbedzi dεw.

MHB 2
2 . The Lord, ye know, is God indeed; 
Without our aid He did us make: 
We are His folk, He doth us feed; 
And for His sheep He doth us take.
	 ~ 	2 . Ewuradze yε Nyame ampa;
Ͻnoara na ᴐyεε hεn;
Yεyε Nedze, ᴐnyεn hεn daa;
N’edzidzibea do nguan nye hεn.

MHB 2
3 . O enter then His gates with praise; 
Approach with joy His courts unto; 
Praise, laud, and bless His name always, 
For it is seemly so to do.
	 ~ 	3 . O hom nhεn N'aponkεse mu;
Hom mbedzi dεw N'abanguado;
Hom nyhira N', nyi Ne dzin ayεw;
Na hεn Nyame fata ndaase:

MHB 2
4 . For why? The Lord our God is good; 
His mercy is for ever sure; 
His truth at all times firmly stood, 
And shall from age to age endure.
        	Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Osiandε Ewuradze yε pa;
N'ehumbᴐbᴐr so tsim hᴐ daa;
No nokwardzi si pi ampa,
Na ᴐnnkᴐbᴐ adze ara da.	Amen.

MHB 20
1 . COME, o come, in pious lays
    Sound we God Almighty's praise;
    Hither bring. in one consent.
    Heart and voice and instrument:
    Nor a creature dumb be found,
    That hath either voice or sound.
            Let those things which do not live
            In still music praises give.
	 ~ 	1 . AHOTSEWFO, hom mbra,
Hom nyi Otumfo n'ayɛw;
Hom mma yɛnyɛ adwen kor,
Akoma, ndze na akyen:
Abɔdze biara ntow bi,
Obiara nnka n'ano nnto m'.
Wɔmma ndzɛmba a wonnyi nkwa 
So mfa kommyɛ ntow ayɛyi.

MHB 20
2 . Come, ye sons of human race,
    In this chorus take your place;
    And amid the mortal throng
    Be ye masters of the song.
    Let, in praise of God, the sound
    Run a neverending round,
           That our song of praise may be
           Everlasting, as is He.
	 ~ 	2 . Adasamba so hom mbra,
Hom mbra ma yɛntow ndwom pa;
Na beebi a nyimpa ehyia n',
Hom ndzi adwontow enyim.
Hom mma Nyame ayɛyi 
Ndwom a ɔmmbɔ adze da do:
Ama hɛn ayɛyi ndwom
Aayɛ bɛkyebo dɛ Ɔno.

MHB 20
3 . So, from heaven, on earth He shall
    Let His gracious blessings fall;
    And this huge wide orb we see
    That our song may over-climb
    All the bounds of place and time,
           And ascend from sphere to Sphere
           To the great Almighty's ear.	 ~ 	3 . Dɛm ntsi ofi sor dze nhyira
Bogu asaase nyina do;
Na wiadze tɛtɛr a yehu
Yɛ adwontofo asɔrdan kor;
Yɛbɛma hɛn ayɛyi ndwom
No atra mber na mbea nyina,
 Na afow edu sorsor
Otumfo kɛse n'asomu.

MHB 200
1 . O JESUS, my hope,
For me offered up,
Who with clamour pursued Thee
to Calvary's top,
The blood Thou hast shed,
For me let it plead,
And declare Thou hast died in Thy
murderer's stead.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS m' enyidar,
Wɔdze Wo maa me,
Dede na wɔdze dzii W'ekyir 
   kɔr Calvary do,
Bɔgya a ekyi no,
Ma ondzi mma me,
Ɔmpaa m' nka dɛ ewu ama Wo 'wudzifo no.

MHB 200
2 . Come then from above,
Its hardness remove,
And vanquish my heart with the
sense of Thy love;
Thy love on the tree
Display unto me,
And the servant of sin in a moment
is free.
	 ~ 	2 . Afei fi sor bra,
Yi m'akomadzen,
Fa Wo dɔ kɛse no bedzi 
M'akoma do;
Wo dɔ wɔ dua n' do n',
Da n' edzi kyerɛ me,
Na bɔn akowaa m'benya me fahodzi ber no.

MHB 200
3 . Neither passion nor pride
Thy Cross can abide,
But melt in the fountain that
streams from Thy side:
Let Thy life-giving blood
Remove all my load,
And purge my foul conscience, and
bring me to God.
	 ~ 	3 . Ahantan yɛ adze a
Wo mbeamudua no mmpɛ;
Na ɔnam bura a ofi Wo mfem' no mu,
Ma Wo nkwa bɔgya n'
Nyi m'adzesoa nyina,
Na ɔntsew me tsibowa ho, mfa m' 
   mbrɛ Nyankopɔn.

MHB 200
4 . Now, now let me know
Its virtue below,
Let it was me and I shall be
whiter than snow;
Let it hallow my heart,
And throughly convert,
And make me, O Lord, in the world
as Thou art.
	 ~ 	4 . Afei ma munhu
N'ayamuyie wɔ ase,
Ma ɔnhor mo ho na m'bɔhoa dɛ 
   esukwankyɛba,
Ma ɔntsew m'akoma m'
Na ɔnsesa me,
Owura, yɛ m' dɛ mbrɛ etse, wɔ wiadze yi mu.

MHB 200
5 . Each moment applied
My weakness to hide,
Thy blood be upon me, and always
abide:
My Advocate prove
With the Father above,
And speak me at last to the throne
of Thy love.    Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Ber biara medze
Me mberɛwyɛ suma,
Na ma bɔgya no nyɛ mo ho edwuma dabaa;
Me Dzimafo, fa m'
Kyerɛ sor Egya n',
Na ewiei no twe me bɛn W'ahengua no ho.

MHB 201
1 . THERE is a fountain filled with blood
Drawn from Immanuel’s veins;
And sinners, plunged beneath that flood,
Lose all their guilty stains.
	 ~ 	1 . Bura bi wɔ hɔ bɔgya ma, 
Wɔtwee n' Immanuel mfem',
Na ndzebɔnyɛfo bɔtɔm' a,
Wɔyew hɔn ho fi nyina.

MHB 201
2 . The dying thief rejoiced to see
That fountain in his day;
And there may I as vile as he,
Wash all my sins away.
	 ~ 	2 . Owifo no ɔdze dɛw hun 
Bura n' wɔ n' aber do;
Hɔ na kaansa mo ho yɛ nkɔw a,
M' bɔhor mo ho bɔn nyina.

MHB 201
3 . O dying Lamb! Thy precious blood
Shall never lose its power,
Till all the ransomed Church of God
Be saved to sin no more.
	 ~ 	3 . Nyame Eguambaa, Wo bɔgyaa 
No tum ɔnnkɛpa da,
Gyedɛ W' asɔrmba nyina enya nkwa,
Mma wɔnnkɛyɛ bɔn bio.

MHB 201
4 . E’er since, by faith, I saw the stream
Thy flowing wounds supply,
Redeeming love has been my theme,
And shall be till I die.
	 ~ 	4 . Ofitsi dɛ me gyedzi hun 
Esu a ofi Wo mfem',
Onyame dɔ ayɛ mo ndwom,
Na ɔbɛyɛ edu wum'.

MHB 201
5 . Then in a nobler, sweeter song
I’ll sing Thy power to save,
when this poor lisping, stammering tongue
Lies silent in the grave.	 ~ 	5 . Na owu ma me gyirama 
Yɛ komm da dɛtsem' a,
Me kra bɔtow ndwom dɛɛdɛw bi
Akamfo Wo wɔ sor.

MHB 202
1 . O SACRED Head once  wounded,
With grief and shame weighed down,
How scornfully surrounded
With thorns, Thine only crown!
How pale Thou art with anguish, 
With sore abuse and scorn!
How does that visage languish
Which once was bright as morn!
	 ~ 	1 . O tsir Krɔnkrɔn, wopiraa Wo, 
Yaw mbordo hyɛɛ Wo do,
Wɔdze nsoɛ yɛɛ W' ahenkyɛw
Dze sii Wo atwetwe!
Mbrɛ W' enyim esi atow,
Ɔnam ahoguan ntsi;
Enyim a nkyɛ ɔkyɛn wi,
Hwɛ mbrɛ oesi enyam.

MHB 202
2 . O Lord of Life and Glory,
What bliss till now was Thine!
I read the wondrous story,
I joy to call Thee mine.
Thy grief and Thy compassion
Were all for sinners’ gain;
Mine, mine was the transgression
But Thine the deadly pain.
	 ~ 	2 . Enyimnyam nye nkwa Wura, 
Dɛw krɔnkrɔn bi a nkyɛ ewɔ a!
Mekenkan nsɛm nwanwa yi a
Dɛw ka m' dɛ 'yɛ medze.
W' awerɛhow n', W' ayamuhyehye n',
Abɔn nya mu mfaso;
Emi mbom na motoo mbra,
Ɔwo na inyaa wuyaw.

MHB 202
3 . What language shall I borrow 
To praise Thee, heavenly Friend,
For this Thy dying sorrow,
Thy pity without end?
Lord, make me Thine for ever,
Nor let me faithless prove;
 O let me never, never 
Abuse such dying love!
	 ~ 	3 . Minya gyirama wɔ hen 
Dze eyi Wo ayɛw
Wɔ W' amandzehu wu yi,
Wo tsema a ɔmmbɔ adze yi?
Mo Wura, fa m' yɛ Wodze koraa;
Mma memmpa W' ara da;
Pa gu ma m' dɛ m' betsiatsia
W' anwanwa dɔ yi do!

MHB 202
4 . Be near me, Lord, when dying;
O Show  Thyself to me
And, for my succour flying,
Come, Lord, to set me free:
These eyes, new faith receiving,
From Jesus shall not move;
For he who dies believing
Dies safely through Thy love.
                                Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Muruwu a, mo Wura, bɛn me; 
Ao, yi Woho kyerɛ m'
Ao, tu faa bra bohwim me,
Bɛgye m' fi mbusu nsa;
Gyedzi ntom' mma n' enyiwa
Ontsim Jesus Wo do;
Na nyia owu gyedzi mu n'
Wo dɔ ma owu sɔnn.   Amen.

MHB 203
1 . HOW shall a sinner find
The Saviour of mankind?nCanst Thou not accept my prayer?
Not bestow the grace I claim?
Where are Thy old mercies?
 All the powers of Jesu’s name?
	 ~ 	1 . BƆNYƐNYI bɛyɛ dɛn 
Ehu adasa Agyenkwa? 
Innkotum etsie me mpaabɔ? 
Eremmfa W'adom nndom me?
W'ehumbɔbɔr no wɔ hen?
Jesus dzin tum no wɔ hen?

MHB 203
2 . I will not let Thee go
Till I Thy mercy know;
Let me hear the welcome sound,
Speak, if still Thou canst forgive;
Speak, and let the lost be found;
Speak, and let the dying live.
	 ~ 	2 . Meremma nnkɔ ara da,
Gyedɛ mehu W'adom;
Ma mentse ndze dɛɛdɛw no,
Kasa, sɛ ennkɛfa akyɛ a;
Kasa, ma wonnya dza ayew,
Kasa, ma ewufo nnyan.

MHB 203
3 . Thy love is all my plea,
Thy passion speaks for me;
By Thy pangs and bloody sweat,
By Thy depths of grief unknown,
Save me, gasping at Thy feet,
Save, O save Thy ransomed one.
	 ~ 	3 . Wo dɔ na meserɛ,
W'amandzehu dzi ma m';
Yaw na bɔgya a ikyii no,
Awerɛhow kɛse a idzii;
Meda W'ananadze, gye me,
Gyefo, gye nyia apon no.

MHB 203
4 . What hast Thou done for me?
O think on Calvary!
By Thy mortal groans and sighs,
By Thy precious death I pray,
Hear my dying spirit’s cries.
Take, O take my sins away !  Amen.	 ~ 	4 . 'Bɛn na ayɛ ama me? 
O dwen Calvary ho!
Nyimpa apen a isii n',
Muguan toa Wo wu kɛse n',
Tsie me kra wufo no su,
Yi, o yi mo bɔn fi hɔ!    Amen.

MHB 204
1 . CHRIST the Lord is risen to-day; 
                                     Hallelujah !
Sons of men and angels say:
                                     Hallelujah! 
 Raise your joys and triumphs high:
                                     Hallelujah!
Sing, ye heavens, thou earth reply:
                                     Hallelujah!
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE Christ asoɛr ndɛ: 
Alleluia!
Nyimpa nye abɔfo ka:
Alleluia!
Hom mma dɛw na ehurusi do:
Alleluia!
Ɔsor ntow, wiadze ngye do:
Alleluia!

MHB 204
2 . Love’s redeeming work is done, 
 Fought the fight, the battle won,:
Vain the stone,  the watch, the seal;
Christ hath burst the gates of hell:
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔdɔ edzi dwuma no;
Ɔako, oedzi nyim koraa:
Ɔbo nye aweɔmfo n' yɛɛ kwa;
Christ efi samanadze:

MHB 204
3 . Lives again our glorious King;
Where, O death, is now thy sting? 
Once he died our souls to save:
Where’s thy victory, boasting grave? 
	 ~ 	3 . Hɛn enyimnyam Hen tse ase;
Owu, wo hwirom wɔ hen? 
Prɛko na owui gyee hɛn: 
Owu, wo konyim wɔ hen?

MHB 204
4 . Soar we now where Christ hath led, 
Following our exalted Head: 
Made like Him, like Him we rise; 
Ours the cross, the grave, the skies:
	 ~ 	4 . Wɔakrɔn hɛn Wura Christ wɔ sor;
Yedzi N'ekyir rokɔ hɔ;
Yɛtse dɛ Ɔno a, yɛbɔsoɛr;
Mbeamudua n' nye sor man n' hɛndze a:

MHB 204
5 . King of glory! soul of bliss!
Everlasting life is this, 
Thee to know, Thy power to prove, 
Thus to sing, and thus to love:	 ~ 	5 . Hɛn enyimnyam Hen siarfo!
N-kwa a onnyi ewiei nye dɛ
Yehu Wo, yɛtse Wo tum,
Na yɛkamfo, yɛdɔ Wo.

MHB 205
1 . JESUS Christ is risen to-day,
	Hallelujah!
our triumphant holy day,
	Hallelujah!
who did once, upon the cross,
	Hallelujah! 
suffer to redeem our loss,
	Hallelujah! 
	 ~ 	1 . Jesus Christ asoɛr n-dɛ, 
	Hallelujah! 
Hɛn konyim dapɔn krɔnkrɔn, 
	Hallelujah!
Ogyaam wɔ Mbeamudua no do, 
	Hallelujah!
Dze poom hɛn a yɛayew no, 
	Hallelujah!

MHB 205
2 . Hymns of praises let us sing,
Unto Christ, our heavenly King, 
Who endured the Cross and grave, 
Sinners to redeem and save. 
	 ~ 	2 . Wɔmma yɛmfa ayɛyindwom,
Ntonton Christ, hɛn sor Hen a, 
Ɔsɔɔw Mbeamudua nye wumaa, 
Dze poon abɔn gyee hɔn nkwa n'.

MHB 205
3 . But the pains that He endured,
Our salvation hath procured; 
Now above the sky He’s King,
 Where the angels ever sing: 
	 ~ 	3 . Na amandze a ohunii n', 
Ɔdze nkwagye abrɛ hɛn; 
Afei odzi hen wɔ sor, 
Mbrɛ abɔfo tow ndwom daa.

MHB 205
4 . Sing we to our God above,
Praise eternal as His love,
Praise Him all ye heavenly host,
Father, Son, and Holy Ghost ! 	 ~ 	4 . Yɛntow ndwom mma hɛn Nyame, 
Nkamfo No dɔ afebɔɔ, 
Ɔsormba, hom nyi N' ayɛw, 
Egya, Ba, Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn.

MHB 206
1 . CHRIST  is risen! Hallelujah!
Risen our victorious Head.
 Sing His praises! Hallelujah!
Christ is risen from the dead. 
Gratefully our hearts adore Him,
As His light once more appears,
Bowing down in joy before Him,
Rising up from grief and tears.

       Christ is risen! Hallelujah!
       Risen our victorious Head. 
       Sing His praises! Hallelujah!
       Christ is risen from the dead. 
	 ~ 	1 . Christ asoɛr o! Hallelujah! 
Hɛn konyim adamfo asoɛr.
Wonyi N' ayɛw! Hallelujah!
Christ asoɛr ewufo mu.
Hɛn 'koma dze ndaase tonton N',
Dɛ Ne kan ahyerɛn bio;
Yɛdze dɛw bu ntwɛr wɔ N' enyim,
Yɛsoɛr fi yaw na nyinsuam.
 
   Christ asoɛr o! Hallelujah! 
   Hɛn konyim adamfo asoɛr. 
   Wonyi N' ayɛw! Hallelujah! 
   Christ asoɛr ewufo mu.

MHB 206
2 . Christ is risen! All the sadness
Of His earthly life is o’er,
Through the open gates of gladness
He returns to life once more;
Death and hell before Him bending,
He doth rise, the Victor now,
Angels on His steps attending,
Glory round His wounded brow. 
	 ~ 	2 . Christ asoɛr! No wiadze abrabɔm' 
Awerɛhow nyina abɔ adze,
Ɔnam enyigye mbotsen mu
Asan aba nkwa mu bio;
Owu na hɛll akotow No;
Ɔasoɛr, oedzi konyim ndɛ
Abɔfo dzi N' ekyir roweɔn N'
'Nyimnyam abɔ N' abɔtsir.

MHB 206
3 . Christ is risen! Henceforth never
Death or hell shall us enthral,
 We are Christ’s, in Him for ever
We have triumphed over all; 
All the doubting and dejection
Of our trembling hearts have ceased:
’Tis His day of resurrection,
Let us rise and keep the feast.	 ~ 	3 . Christ asoɛr! ofitsi ndɛ dze 
Owu na hɛll remmen hɛn,
Yɛyɛ Christ dze, Wɔ No mu na
Yeedzi adze nyina do nyim;
Ekyingye na mbɔbɔryɛ nyina
Na suro abɔ adze;
Ndɛ da yi nye No wusoɛr da,
Hom mma yɛnsoɛr yɛnhyɛ fa.

MHB 207
1 . CHRIST the Lord is risen again;
Christ hath broken every chain:
Hark, the  angels shout for joy,
Singing evermore on high:
	            Hallelujah! 
	 ~ 	1 . Ewuradze Christ asoɛr bio; 
Christ ebubu mpokyerɛ nyinam';
Tsie, abɔfo robɔ se,
Rotow ndwom wɔ sor daa daa:
                          Hallelujah!

MHB 207
2 . He who gave for us His life,
Who for us endured the strife,
Is our paschal Lamb to-day;
 we too sing for joy, and say:
	              Hallelujah! 
 	 ~ 	2 . Nyia ɔdze No nkwa maa hɛn n', 
Ɔno a hɛn ntsi ɔsɔɔw ko n'
Ɔyɛ hɛn Mpataguan ndɛ;
Hɛn so dɛw tow ndwom dɛ:
                          Hallelujah!

MHB 207
3 . He who bore all pain and loss
Comfortless upon the Cross,
Lives in glory now on high,
Pleads for us, and hears our cry:
	            Hallelujah!
 	 ~ 	3 . Nyia ɔsɔɔw obene nyina 
No werɛ hoow wɔ mbeamudua n' do n',
Ɔtse enyimnyam' wɔ sor ndɛ,
Odzi ma hɛn, tsie hɛn su.
                          Hallelujah!

MHB 207
4 . He whose path no records tell,
Who descended into hell, 
Who the strong man armed hath bound,
Now in highest heaven is crowned.
	            Hallelujah!
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔno a wɔnnto No kwan dzin, 
Ɔno a osianee kɔr hɛll,
Nyia katakyi too n' mpokyrɛ n'
Ndɛ wɔasoa N' 'henkyɛw wɔ sor.
                          Hallelujah!

MHB 207
5 . He who slumbered in the grave
Is exalted now to save;
Now through Christendom it rings
That the Lamb is King of kings. 
	             Hallelujah!
	 ~ 	5 . Ɔno a ɔdaa nda n' mu n' 
Wɔakrɔn No dɛ ɔngye nkwa;
Ndɛ wohua N' Christianman mu
Dɛ Eguambaa N' yɛ ahemfo Hen.
                          Hallelujah!

MHB 207
6 . Now He bids us tell abroad
How the lost may be restored,
How the penitent forgiven,
How we too may enter heaven:
                                 Hallelujah! 
	 ~ 	6 . Ndɛ ɔse yɛmbɔ n' dawur 
Mbrɛ abɔn besi enya nkwa,
Mbrɛ nnuhofo enya fakyɛ
Mbrɛ hɛn so bɛyɛ ahɛn sor,
                          Hallelujah!

MHB 207
7 . Thou, our paschal Lamb indeed,
Christ, to-day Thy  people feed;
Take our sins and guilt away,
That we all may sing for aye:
	             Hallelujah!	 ~ 	7 . Hɛn Mpataguan N' nye W' ampa 
Christ, nyɛn Wo nkorɔfo ndɛ;
Yi hɛn bɔn na hɛn mfom kɔ,
Ma hɛn nyina atow ndwom dɛ:
                          Hallelujah!

MHB 208
1 . THE day of resurrection !
Earth, tell it out abroad;
The Passover of gladness,
The Passover of God! 
From death to life eternal, 
From earth unto the sky,
Our Christ hath brought us over
With hymns of victory.
	 ~ 	1 . OWUSOƐR da no nye yi, 
Wiadze nka wɔ mbea nyina;
Ahosɛpɛw Apaho,
Nyankopɔn Apaho n';
Yefi wu mu kɔ nkwa mu,
Yefi asaase kɔ Sor,
Hɛn Christ dze konyimdzi ndwom,
Na ɔdze hɛn aba.

MHB 208
2 . Our hearts be pure from evil,
That we may see aright
The Lord in rays eternal
Of resurrection light,
And, listening to His accents,
May hear, so calm and plain,
His own All hail! and hearing,
May raise the victor -strain.
 	 ~ 	2 . Hɛn akoma mu ntsew bɔn ho,
Ama yeehu adze yie;
Ewuradze a ɔwɔ daa kan m';
Ɔwɔ owusoɛr kan m',
Na yetsie Ne ndze no yie a,
Yetse n' pefee, bɔkɔɔ,
Nedze nyina bɔ ose a wɔtse, 
Wɔtow konyimdzi ndwom.

MHB 208
3 . Now let the heavens be joyful;
Let earth her song begin;
The round world keep high triumph,
And all that is therein;
Let all things seen and unseen,
Their notes of gladness blend:
 For Christ the Lord is risen,
Our joy that hath no end.	 ~ 	3 . Afei ma ɔsor enyi ngye,
Ma asaase ndwom nhyɛ ase;
Wiadze tɛtɛr ndzi konyim,
Na dza ɔwɔ mu nyina;
Dza wohu na dza wonnhu
Ntow enyigye ndwom pa:
Na Christ Ewuradze asoɛr,
Hɛn dɛw a onnyi ewiei.

MHB 209
1 . ON wings of living light,
At earliest dawn of day,
Came down the angel bright,
And rolled the stone away.

     Your voices raise with one accord
     To bless and praise your risen Lord.
	 ~ 	1 . N-KWA kan ntsaban do,
Anapa tutuutu,
Na ɔbɔfo no bae
Bepireew ɔbo n' fii hɔ.
    Hom nyɛ kor mma hom ndze do yie,
    Ntonton Nyia ɔasoɛr efi owu m' no.

MHB 209
2 . The keepers, watching near,
At that dread sight and sound
Fell down with sudden fear
Like dead men to the ground:
	 ~ 	2 . Aweɔmfo a wɔbɛn No n'
Hun kan n', tsee ndze nwanwa n',
Suro m' wotwaa hwee famu birim!!
Woguu famu dɛ ewufo.

MHB 209
3 . Then rose from death’s dark gloom,
Unseen by mortal eye,
Triumphant o’er the tomb
The Lord of earth and sky!
 	 ~ 	3 . Na Ɔnodze ɔsoɛɛr bum
Fii ewufo nda mu a 
Enyiwa ennhu No,
Sor na asaase Wura.

MHB 209
4 . Ye children of the light,
Arise with Him, arise!
See how the Daystar bright
Is burning in the skies!
	 ~ 	4 . Ne kan ho mbofraba,
Hom nsoɛr, hom nye No nsoɛr;
Hwɛ mbrɛ woraba no 
Rehyerɛn wɔ wimu hɔ!

MHB 209
5 . Leave in the grave beneath
The old things passed away;
Buried with Him in death,
O live with Him to-day!
 	 ~ 	5 . Oegyaa ndzɛmba adadaw
Nyinara wɔ nda n' mu;
Wosie ɔwo na Ɔno a,
'Nye no ntsena nkwa mu.

MHB 209
6 . We sing Thee, Lord Divine,
With all our hearts and powers, 
For we are ever Thine,
And Thou art ever ours. 	 ~ 	6 . O Ewuradze krɔnkrɔn,
Yɛtow Wo ndwom ndɛ da 'i, 
Yɛdze hɛn akoma nyina 
Ma Wo, eyɛ hɛndze.

MHB 21
1 . The God of Abraham praise
Who reigns enthroned above.
Ancient of everlasting days
And God of love.
Jehovah! Great I AM!
By earth and heaven confessed;
I bow and bless the sacred name
For ever blessed.
	 ~ 	1 . KAMFO Abraham Nyame,
Nyia odzi hen wɔ sor,
Nyia ofi tsetse tse ase,
Ɔdɔ Nyame.
Nyame Kɛse MARA! 
Sor na asaase gye to m';
Mokotow hyira dzin krɔnkrɔn n'
Wɔ afebɔɔ.

MHB 21
10 . The God who reigns on high 
The great archangels sing; 
And, Holy, holy, holy, cry, 
Almighty King. 
Who was and Is the same, 
And evermore shall be; 
Jehovah, Father, Great I AM, 
We worship Thee.
	 ~ 	10 . Nyame a odzi hen sor,
Bɔfo mpanyimfo tow;
Wɔtsea m'Krɔnkrɔn, Krɔnkrɔn, Krɔnkrɔn,
Ɔhen Tumfo!
Mbrɛ ɔtse n' ɔnnsesa,
Na ɔbɛyɛ dɛm daa:
Jehovah, Egya, Kɛse MARA,
Yɛkotow Wo.

MHB 21
11 . Before the Saviour's face 
The ransomed nations bow; 
O'erwhelmed at His almighty grace, 
For ever new: 
He shows His prints of love, 
They kindle to a flame, 
And sound through all the worlds above 
The slaughtered Lamb.
	 ~ 	11 . Agyenkwa n'enyim hɔ,
Hɔn a wɔapon hɔn kotow;
N'adom kɛse tɔ hɔn bobor,
Daa daa nyina:
Ɔkyerɛ No dɔ akam,
Wokua ogya no mu,
Wɔpaa m'ka wo wiadze nyina,
Eguaambaa no.

MHB 21
12 . The whole triumphant host 
Give thanks to God on high; 
Hail, Father, Son, and Holy Ghost!
They ever cry.
Hall, Abraham's God, and mine I join the heavenly lays; 
All might and majesty are Thine, 
And endless praise. 
	Amen.	 ~ 	12 . Konyimdzi dɔm nyina
Da ɔsor Nyame ase,
Hua Egya, Ba nye Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn!
Wɔtsea mu daa.
Hua Abraham Nyankopɔn!
Meka ɔsorfo ho;
Ahoɔdzen na tum nyina yɛ W'dze,
Ntonton a ɔmmbɔ adze.     Amen.

MHB 21
2 . The God of Abraham praise.
At whose supreme command
From earth I rise, and seek the joys
At His right hand.
I all on earth forsake
Its wisdom. fame, and power
And Him my only portion make,
My shield and tower.
	 ~ 	2 . Kamfo Abraham Nyame,
Ɔno a ɔhyɛ mbra,
Mosoer fi famu hwehwɛ enyigye
Wɔ Ne nyimfa.
Mopow wiadze nyina:
Ne nyansaa, dzin na tum,
Na medze No ye me kyɛfa,
Me kyɛm, m'aban.

MHB 21
3 . The God of Abraham praise,
Whose all-sufficient grace
Shall guide me all my happy days
In all my ways.
He calls a worm His friend,
He calls Himself my God;
And He shall save me to the end
Through Jesu's blood.
	 ~ 	3 . Kamfo Abraham Nyame,
Nyia N'adom no dɔɔ so;
Obegya m'menyigye nda mu,
M'akwan nyina m',
Ɔfrɛ sunsuma N'afɛ,
Frɛ Noho me Nyame;
Na ɔnam Jesus bɔgyaa do
bɛgye me nkwan.

MHB 21
4 . He by Himself hath sworn,
I on His oath depend:
I shall, on eagles' wings upborne.
To heaven ascend;
I shall behold His face.
I shall His power adore,
And sing the wonders of His grace
For ever more.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔaka Noho ntam bi,
Migyina Ne ntam no do:
Wɔbɔsoa m' ɔkɔr ntsaban do,
Afow akɔ sor;
Hɔ na m'bohu N'enyim,
Mibedzi No tum nyi,
Na matow N'adom nwanwa ho
Ndwom afebɔɔ.

MHB 21
5 . Though nature's strength decay,
And earth and hell withstand,
To Canaan's bounds I urge my way
At His command
The watery deep I pass.
With Jesus in my view;
And through the howling wilderness
My way pursue.
	 ~ 	5 . Sɛ bɔbea ahoɔdzen sa,
Na asaase wɔ hɔ a,
Canaan nkowaa do m'enyi kyerɛ
Wɔ N'asɛm ntsi.
Menam n-su bun mu,
M'enyi tsim Jesus do;
Na menam sar huuhu no do a,
Mokɔ mo kwan.

MHB 21
6 . The goodly land I see,
With peace and plenty blest;
A land of sacred liberty
And endless rest:
There milk and honey flow,
And oil and wine abound,
And trees of life for ever grow.
With mercy crowned.
	 ~ 	6 . Muhu asaase pa a
Nhyira pii wɔ do no;
Asaase a fahodzi na daa
'Homgye wɔ do:
Numfunsu, wo, pem do,
Ngo na nsa ebu do,
Na nkwa ndua nyin prɔmm wɔ do daa,
Mbɔbɔrhu mu.

MHB 21
7 . There dwells the Lord our King, 
The Lord our Righteousness, 
Triumphant o'er the world and sin, 
The Prince of Peace; 
On Zion's sacred height 
His kingdom still maintains, 
And glorious with His saints in light 
For ever reigns.
	 ~ 	7 . Ewuradze Hen tse hɔ,
Ewuradze hɛn Tsenenee,
Oedzi wiadze na bɔn do nyim,
Asomdwee Hen;
Zion bepɔw no do,
N'ahendzi tsim hɔ daa,
Ɔnye N'ahotsewfo hyerɛn kan m',
Odzi hen daa.

MHB 21
8 . He keeps His own secure, 
He guards them by His side, 
Arrays In garments white and pure 
His spotless bride: 
With streams of sacred bliss, 
With groves of living Joys, 
With all the fruits of paradise, 
He still supplies.
	 ~ 	8 . Ɔhwɛ Nedze do yie,
Ɔkora hɔn ntar pa fitaa dɛ
N'ayefor pa:
Ɔdze nsu a woehyira do,
Ɔdze ndua a ɔyɛ fɛw,
Ɔdze Paradisè nduadzewa,
Nyina ma hɔn.

MHB 21
9 . Before the great Three-One
They all exulting stand, 
And tell the wonders He hath done, 
Through all their land: 
The listening spheres attend, 
And swell the growing fame; 
And sing, in songs which never end, 
The wondrous name.
	 ~ 	9 . Korsa kɛse n'enyim
Wogyina ruhuhor No,
Na woka anwanwadze a oaye,
Hɔn asaase do:
Ɔsormba no tsie bi,
Wɔma Ne dzin tahye;
Na wɔtow ndwom a ɔmmbɔ adze da,
Dzin nwanwa no.

MHB 210
1 . Christ Jesus lay in deaths strong bands,
    For our offenses given;
    But now at Gods right hand He stands,
    And brings us life from Heaven.
    Wherefore let us joyful be,
    And sing to God right thankfully
    Loud songs of Hallelujah ! 
                                  Hallelujah ! 
	 ~ 	1 . 'WU ahoma kyekyeer Jesus ho
Wɔ hɛn nyinara bɔn ntsi;
Afei ogyina Nyame nyimfa,
Ofi sor dze nkwa brɛ hɛn,
Ntsi ma hɛn enyi ngye yie;
Yɛmfa ndaase ntow Nyame ndwom,
Alleluia ndwom dzendzen!
	Alleluia

MHB 210
2 . It was a strange and dreadful strife
    When life and death contended;
    The victory remained with life;
    The reign of death was ended.
    Stripped of power, no more it reigns,
    An empty form alone remains
    His sting is lost for ever.
              	 ~ 	2 . Ɔyɛ aperdzi a ɔyɛ hu,
Ber a nkwa na 'wu dzii aper;
Naaso nkwa dzii konyim nwanwa!
Owu n'ahendzi bɔɔ adze,
Wɔagye ne nsamu tum nyina;
Ne nyimpadua nko na aka;
No bɔr etu afebɔɔ.
	Alleluia

MHB 210
3 . So let us keep the festival
    Where to the Lord invites us;
    Christ is Himself the joy of all,
    The Sun that warms and lights us.
    By His grace He doth impart
    Eternal sunshine to the heart;
    The night of sin is ended.
	                 Hallelujah !  
	 ~ 	3 . N-tsi wɔmma yendzi afahyɛ n',
Ewuradze to nsa frɛ hɛn;
Christ ankasa nye hɛn enyigye
Na ewia a ɔhyerɛn hɛn do;
Ɔnam N'adom no do ma
Akoma nya onnyiewiei kan;
Bɔn anafua no etwa m'.
	Alleluia

MHB 210
4 . Then let us feast this Easter day
    On the true Bread of Heaven;
    The Word of grace hath purged away
    The old and wicked leaven.
    Christ alone our souls will feed;
    He is our Meat and Drink indeed;
    Faith lives upon no other.
 	                      Hallelujah ! 


	 ~ 	4 . 'Wusoɛr da 'i hom mma yɛnhyɛ fa 
Wɔ nokwar sor Edziban n' ho;
Adom asɛm no ahohor
Etsiɔdzen mbɔrkaw dadaw n',
Christ nko bɛnyɛn hɛn akra,
Ɔyɛ hɛn edziban nye nsa;
No nko do na gyedzi gyina
	Alleluia!

MHB 211
1 . LOW in the grave He lay,
Jesus ,my Saviour;
Waiting the coming day,
Jesus ,my Lord. 
    Up from the grave He arose,
    With a mighty triumph o’er His foes;
    He arose a Victor from the dark domain,
    And He lives for ever, with His saints to reign:
    He arose! Hallelujah! Christ arose!
	 ~ 	1 . ƆDAA nda no mu komm,
Jesus, m'Agyenkwa,
Rotweɔn adzekyee no,
Jesus, mo Wura.

MHB 211
2 . Vainly they watch His bed,
Jesus, my Saviour;
Vainly they seal the dead,
Jesus, my Lord.
 	 ~ 	2 . Ɔasoɛr efi nda no mu,
Oedzi N'atamfo nyina do nyim;
Ɔsoɛɛr dɛ konyimdzifo fii samanadze,
Na ɔtse ase daa nye N'ahotsewfo dzi hen:
Christ asɔɛr! Hallelujah! Christ asoɛr!

MHB 211
3 . Death cannot keep his prey,
Jesus, my Saviour;
He tore the bars away,
Jesus, my Lord.	 ~ 	3 . Wɔweɔɔn Ne nda no gyan,
Jesus, m'Agyenkwa,
Wɔtoow Ne nda no kwa,
Jesus, mo Wura.

MHB 212
1 . WELCOME, happy morning! Age to age shall say:
Hell to-day is vanquished; Heaven is won to-day!
Lo! the dead is living, God for evermore!
Him, their true Creator, all His works adore!
       
       Welcome, happy morning! Age to age shall say.
	 ~ 	1 . ENYIGYE da, akɔaba! Mfesantsen nyina nka;
Wɔaka owu ahyɛ, yeenya ahenman n' ndɛ!
Ewufo tse ase, Nyame tse hɔ daa!
Abɔdze hɔn Bɔfo pa a hɔn nyina sɔr No
   Enyigye da, akɔaba! Mfesantsen nyina nka.

MHB 212
2 . Earth with joy confesses, clothing her for spring,
All good gifts returned with her returning King;
Bloom in every meadow, leaves on every bough,
Speak His sorrows ended, hail His triumph now.
 	 ~ 	2 . Asaase a oenya efuw fofor no ka dɛ, 
No Wura No soɛr n' dze akyɛdze pa nyina ba; 
N-kyɛkyɛr do nhyiren, ndubaa do nhaban,
Dze kyerɛ dɛ N'awerɛhow etwa m' oedzi nyim.

MHB 212
3 . Thou, of life the Author, death didst undergo,
Tread the path of darkness, saving strength to show;
Come, then, True and Faithful, now fulfill Thy Word;
’Tis  Thine own third morning: Rise, O buried Lord!
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔwo a eyɛ nkwa Mafo faa owu mu,\
Efaa sum kwan n' do dze kyerɛɛ Wonkwagye tum;
Afei Nokwafo, dzi W'anohoba n' do,
Wo ndaansa da nye yi; Ewuradze, soeɛr.

MHB 212
4 .  Loose the souls long prisoned, bound with Satan’s chain;
All that now is fallen raise to life again;
Show Thy face in brightness, bid the nations see;
Bring again our daylight; day returns with Thee.	 ~ 	4 . Siansian akra a wɔdeda Satan mpokyerɛ m'
Fa hɔn a wɔahwe ase nyina bra nkwa mu bio;
Fa W'enyim ne hyerɛn kyerɛ, ma aman nyina nhu;
Ma adze nkye hɛn bio, 'Wo na edze da pa ba.

MHB 213
1 . THINE be the glory, risen, conquering Son,
Endless is the victory Thou o’er death hast won;
Angels in bright raiment rolled the stone away,
Kept the folded grave- clothes, Where thy 
       body lay.

     Thine be the glory, risen, conquering Son,
     Endless is the victory Thou o’er death hast won
 	 ~ 	1 . ENYIMNYAM nka Wo, Ɔba a asoɛr,
Edzi owu do konyim a onnyi ewiei,
Abɔfo a wɔhyɛ ntar hyɛnyɛn pireew ɔbo n'.
Bea a edae no na wɔdze Wo ntar no gui.
     Enyimnyam nka Wo, Ɔba a asoɛr,
     Edzi owu do konyim a onnyi ewiei.

MHB 213
2 . Lo! Jesus meets us, risen from the tomb;
Lovingly He greets us, scatters fear and gloom:
Let the Church with gladness, hymns 
       of triumph sing,
For her Lord now liveth, death hath lost its sting
	 ~ 	2 . Jesus rihyia hɛn, ɔasoɛr efi nda m';
Ɔdze dɔ kyia hɛn, oyi suro na awerɛhow;
Ma asɔr no mfa enyigye mbɔ ose,
Osiandɛ Ewuradze tse ase, owu nnyi tum.

MHB 213
3 . No more we doubt Thee, glorious Prince of life;
Life is nought without Thee; aid us in our strife;
 Make us more than conquerors, through 
        Thy deathless love:
Bring us safe through Jordan to Thy home above.	 ~ 	3 . Yɛnngye Wo kyim bio, o n-kwa Wura;
Boa hɛn na sɛ innyi mu a, ɔbra nnyɛ yie;
Fa Wo daa dɔ no yɛ hɛn konyimdzifo;
Fa hɛn twa Jordan kɔ wo sor fie hɔ sɔnn.

MHB 214
1 . AWAKE, glad soul, awake, awake!
Thy Lord has risen long;
 Go to His grave, and with thee take
Both tuneful heart and song.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆKRA siarfo, nyan ɛ, nyan ɛ!
Ewuradze asoɛr dada; 
Fa ehurusi ndwom kɔ Ne nda n' do,
W'akoma bedzi dɛw.

MHB 214
2 . Where life is waking all around,
Where love’s sweet voices sing,
The first bright blossom may be found
Of an eternal spring.
	 ~ 	2 . N-kwa rinyan nyimpa nyina yi,
Ɔdɔ ndwom gu do yi,
Wobenya nhyiren fɛɛfɛw bi 
Wɔ nkwa bura no do.

MHB 214
3 . The shade and gloom of life are fled
This resurrection day;
Henceforth in Christ are no more dead,
The grave hath no more prey.
 In Christ we live, in Christ we sleep,
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔbra mu sum kebii n' apa,
N-dɛ wusoɛ da yi;
Christ mu, ewufo nnyi hɔ bio,
Adakamaa nnyi tum.

MHB 214
4 . In Christ we wake and rise;
And the sad tears death makes us weep,
He wipes from all our eyes.
 	 ~ 	4 . Yɛtse Christ mu, yɛda Christ mu,
Yenyan, yɛsoɛr Christ mu,
Na nyinsuwa yaayaw a owu ma n',
Christ bɛpepa ne nyina.

MHB 214
5 . Then wake, glad heart, awake, awake!
And seek Thy risen Lord;
Joy in His resurrection take,
And comfort in His Word.
	 ~ 	5 . Dɛm a ɔkra siarfo, nyan ɛ!
Par w' Ewuradze a ɔasoɛr n'; 
Nya enyigye wɔ No wusoɛr mu,
Awerɛhyɛm' wɔ N'asɛm m'.

MHB 214
6 . And let thy life through all its ways
One long thanksgiving be;
Its theme of joy, its song of praise—
Christ died, and rose for me.	 ~ 	6 .  Akwan nyina m' ma w'abrabɔ 
Nyɛ ndaase afebɔɔ;
W'enyigyesɛm, W'ayɛyi ndwom,
Christ wui na ɔsoɛɛr maa m'.

MHB 215
1 . THE strife is o’er, the battle done;
Now is the Victor’s triumph won;
Now be the song of praise begun:
		Alleluia!
	 ~ 	1 . Ɔko kɛse no abɔ adze; 
Afei hɛn Sahen edzi nyim;
Wɔnhyɛ ehurusi ndwom n' ase: 
	Alleluia!

MHB 215
2 . The powers of death have done 
       their worst,
But Christ their legions hath dispersed;
Let shouts of holy joy outburst:
		Alleluia!
	 ~ 	2 . Owu hyehyɛɛ no dɔm petsee, 
Na Christ abɔ hɔn apetse;
Wɔmbɔ se ntow enyigye ndwom: 
	Alleluia!

MHB 215
3 . The three sad days have quickly sped;
He rises glorious from the dead;
All glory to our risen Head:
		Alleluia!
 	 ~ 	3 . Aweɛhow ndaansa no etwam'; 
Ɔasoɛr konyim mu efi wum';  
Enyimnyam nka Hen tseasefo n'; 
	Alleluia!

MHB 215
4 . Lord, by the stripes which wounded Thee,
From death’s dread sting Thy servants free,
That we may live and sing to Thee:
		Alleluia !	 ~ 	4 . Ewuradze, W' amandzehu ntsi, 
Gye Wo nkowaa fi wu no bɔr mu,
Ma yeenya nkwa, yaatow Wo ndwom:  
	Alleluia!

MHB 216
1 . JESUS lives! thy terrors now
Can ,O death, no more  appal us;
Jesus lives! by this we know
Thou, O grave, canst not enthral us.
		Hallelujah.
	 ~ 	1 . Christ tse ase! afei Owu, 
Wo hu nnkotum etu hɛn bo;
Christ tse ase! yi ma yehu
Dɛ samanadze nnkɛmen hɛn.
                        Alleluia!

MHB 216
2 . Jesus lives! To Him the throne
High o’er heaven and earth is given;
We may go where He is gone,
Live and reign with Him in heaven.
		Hallelujah.
 	 ~ 	2 . Christ tse ase! sor nye asaase 
Tum nyina wɔdze ama No;
Hɛn so yɛbɔkɔ Ne nkyɛn,
Yɛnye N' ekedzi Hen sor hɔ.
                        Alleluia!

MHB 216
3 . Jesus lives! for us He died;
Hence may we, to Jesus living,
Pure in heart and act abide,
Praise to Him and glory giving.
		Hallelujah.
	 ~ 	3 . Christ tse ase! hɛn ntsi owui; 
Dɛm ntsi yɛbɛtsena ama No,
Yɛatsew nyɛe nye adwen ho,
Yɛdze hɛn bra eyi N' ayɛw.
                        Alleluia!

MHB 216
4 . Jesus lives! our hearts know well
Nought from us His love shall sever;
Life, nor death, nor powers of hell,
Part us now from Christ for ever.
		Hallelujah.
	 ~ 	4 . Christ tse ase! yenyim ampa 
Dɛ hwee nnkɛpaa hɛn No dɔ ho;
Wu o, n-kwa o, samanadze o,
Nnkɔtwe hɛn efi No ho da.
                        Alleluia!

MHB 216
5 . Jesus lives! Henceforth is death
Entrance-gate of life immortal;
This shall calm our trembling breath
When we pass its gloomy portal.
		Hallelujah.	 ~ 	5 . Christ tse ase! afei owu 
Yɛ onnyiewiei nkwa abotsen;
Yi bɛka hɛn bo atɔm',
Ber a wu no sum bɔtɔ hɛn.
                        Alleluia!

MHB 217
1 . YE humble souls that seek the Lord,
Chase all your fears away;
And bow with rapture down to see
The place where Jesus lay.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM akra a hom hwehwɛ Ewuradze,
Hom ntow hom suro nyina ngu;
Na hom nkotow na hom mbɔhwɛ
Bea a wɔdze Jesus toe.

MHB 217
2 . Thus low the Lord of life was brought,
Such wonders love can do;
Thus cold in death that bosom lay,
Which throbbed and bled for you.
	 ~ 	2 . Dɛm na wɔbrɛɛ N-kwa Wura ase,
Dɛm na ɔdɔ tum yɛ;
M-fe a okyii bɔgya maa wo n',
Daa owu mu ara komm.

MHB 217
3 . But raise your eyes and tune your songs;
The Saviour lives again:
Not all the bolts and bars of death
The Conqueror could detain.
	 ~ 	3 . Hom mma hom enyi do, hom ntow ndwom;
Agyenkwa n' tse ase bio;
Owu dadzeban nyinara
Enntum annkora No.

MHB 217
4 .  High o’er the angelic bands He rears
 His once dishonored head;
And through unnumbered years He reigns,
Who dwelt among the dead.
	 ~ 	4 . Ne tsir a woemmbu no bi no,
Ɔakrɔn n' wɔ abɔfo do;
Nyia ɔnye ewufo tsenae no 
Dzi Ne hen afebɔɔ.

MHB 217
5 . With joy like His shall every saint
His vacant tomb survey;
Then rise with his ascending Lord
To realms of endless day.	 ~ 	5 . Ahotsewfo dze enyigye
Bɔhwɛ Ne nda pan n' mu;
Wɔnye hɔn Wura bɔsoɛr akɔ
Kan a ɔmmbɔ adze n' mu.

MHB 218
1 . THE foe behind, the deep before,
Our hosts have dared and passed the sea;
And Pharaoh’s warriors strew the shore,
And Israel’s ransomed tribes are free.
	 ~ 	1 . EKYIR tamfo, enyim bun a,
Hɛn dɔm dze 'kokodur etwa po n';
Na Pharoah dɔm atotɔ mpoano,
Na Israel enya fahodzi.

MHB 218
10 . His right arm is o’er us,
 He our guide will be:
 Christ hath gone before us;
Christians, follow ye! 	 ~ 	10 . Ne nyimfa wɔ hɛn do,
Ɔbɛɛkyerɛ hɛn kwan;
Christ edzi hɛn enyim kan,
Christianfo nka N' do!

MHB 218
2 . Lift up, lift up your voices now!
The whole wide world rejoices now!
The Lord hath triumphed gloriously!
The Lord shall reign victoriously!
	 ~ 	2 . Hom nyina mmema hom ndze do!
Wiadze nyina abɔ m' ridzi dɛw!
Ewuradze edzi konyim!
Ewuarde bedzi hen daa daa.

MHB 218
3 . Happy morrow,
Turning sorrow
Into peace and mirth!
Bondage ending,
Love descending
O’er the earth!
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔkyena hɛn yaw\nBɛdan enyigye,
Asomdwee bɛba!
Nkowaasom bɔ adze,
Ɔdɔ bɛba
'Saase do !

MHB 218
4 . Seals assuring,
Guards securing,
Watch His earthly prison:
Seals are shattered,
Guards are scattered;
Christ hath risen! 
	 ~ 	4 . Wɔasɔw ano,
Aweɔmfo weɔn
N'efiadze nda no;
Wɔasɛɛ nsɔwano n',
'Weɔmfo apetse,
Christ asoɛr ndɛ!

MHB 218
5 . No longer must the mourners weep,
Nor call departed Christians dead;
 For death is hallowed into sleep,
And every grave becomes a bed.
	 ~ 	5 . Onnyi dɛ abefo su bio,
Wɔfrɛ hɔn a woetwa m' ewufo;
Na owu adan hɛn n-da,
Na adakamaa biara adan mpa.

MHB 218
6 . Now once more
Eden’s door
Open stands to mortal eyes;
For Christ hath risen, and man shall rise!
	 ~ 	6 . Prɛko bio
Eden pon
Ebue ama nyimpa ehu;
Christ asoɛr, na nyimpa so bɔsoɛr!

MHB 218
7 . Now at last,
Old things past,
Hope, and joy, and peace begin;
For Christ hath won, and man shall win!
	 ~ 	7 . Afei koraa,
Dadaw twa m',
'Nyidar, dɛw, 'somdwee, hyɛ ase;
Christ edzi nyim, yebedzi nyim.

MHB 218
8 . It is not exile, rest on high;
It is not sadness, peace from strife;
To fall asleep is not to die:
To dwell with Christ is better life. 
	 ~ 	8 . Nnyɛ ndɔmmum, ahomgye wɔ sor;
Nnyɛ awerɛhow; 'perdzi m' komm;
Ebɛda nn-kyerɛ dɛ ewu,
'Bɛtsena Christ mu nye ɔbra pa.

MHB 218
9 . Where our banner leads us,
We may safely go; 
Where our Chief precedes us,
We may face the foe.
	 ~ 	9 . Mbrɛ hɛn frankaa gya hɛn n',
Yɛbɔkɔ sɔkyee;
Mbrɛ hɛn Hen dzi hɛn kan n',
Yebehyia tamfo n'.

MHB 219
1 . GOD is gone up on high,
With a triumphant noise;
The clarions of the sky
Proclaim the angelic joy!
     Join all on earth, rejoice and sing;
     Glory ascribe to glory’s King.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME dze konyimdzi
Ndwom afow kɔ sorsor;
Ɔsor totorbɛnto
Da abɔfo dɛw edzi!
   Hom nye wiadze nyina mbɔ m' ndzi dɛw
   Hom mfa enyimnyam nhyɛ Enyimnyam Hen.

MHB 219
2 . God in the flesh below,
For us He reigns above:
Let all the nations know
Our Jesu’s conquering love!
	 ~ 	2 . Nyame a nna ɔyɛ nyimpa,
Odzi hen sor ma hɛn;
Hom mma aman nyinara nhu
Hɛn Jesus konyim dɔ n'.

MHB 219
3 . All power to our great Lord
Is by the Father given;
 By angel hosts adored,
He reigns supreme in heaven:
	 ~ 	3 . Egya n' dzi tum nyina 
Ama hɛn Ewuradze;
Abɔfo tonton No,
Odzi hen daa wɔ sor.

MHB 219
4 . High on His holy seat
He bears the righteous sway;
His foes beneath His feet
Shall sink and die away:
	 ~ 	4 . N'ahengua krɔnkrɔn n' do
Odzi tum tsenenee mu,
N'atmfo bɛmemem,
Ewuwu N'ananadze.

MHB 219
5 . His foes and ours are one,
Satan, the world, and sin;
But He shall tread them down.
And bring His kingdom in:
	 ~ 	5 . Yɛnye N' wɔ atamfo kor,
'Bɔnsam, wiadze, nye bɔn;
Na obetsia hɔn do
Na ɔdze N'ahendzi aba.

MHB 219
6 . Till all the earth, renewed
In righteousness divine,
With all the hosts of God
In one great chorus join.	 ~ 	6 . Kɛpem dɛ afei wɔayɛ 
Wiadze bea a ɔtsen fofor n',
Yɛnye sordɔm aabɔ m'
Atow ayɛyi ndwom.

MHB 22
1 . COME, let us all unite and sing-
God is love!
While heaven and earth their praises bring-
God is love!
Let every soul from sin awake,
Each in his heart sweet music make,
And sweetly sing for Jesu's sake
God is love!
	 ~ 	1 . HOM mbra ma yɛmbɔ m'yɛntow ndwom:
Nyame yɛ ɔdɔ!
Sor na asaase mfa ayɛyi mbra:
Nyame yɛ ɔdɔ!
Ɔkra biara nnyan mfi bɔn mu,
Ntow ndwom dɛɛdɛw wɔ n'akoma m',
Na Jesus ntsi ɔntow ndwom dɛ:
Nyame yɛ ɔdɔ!

MHB 22
2 . O tell to earth's remotest bound-
God is love!
In Christ is full redemption found-
God is love!
His blood can cleanse our sins away;
His Spirit turns our night to day,
And leads our souls with joy to say-
	 ~ 	2 . Hom nka no wiadze beebiara:
Nyame yɛ ɔdɔ!
Yenya hɛn nkwagye wɔ Christ mu:
Nyame yɛ ɔdɔ!
No bɔgyaa hor hɛn bɔn nyina;
No Sunsum dan hɛn sum no kan,
Na ɔma hɛn kra dze dɛw ka:
Nyame yɛ ɔdɔ!

MHB 22
3 . How happy is our portion here
God is love!
His promises our spirits cheer-
God is love!
He is our Sun and Shield by day,
By night He near our tents will stay.
He will be with us all the way-
God is love!
	 ~ 	3 . Mbrɛ hɛn kyɛfa dua yɛ enyigye a!
Nyame yɛ ɔdɔ!
N'anohoba ma hɛn enyigye:
Nyame yɛ ɔdɔ!
Adzekyee ɔyɛ Ewia na Kyɛm,
Anagò ɔbɛn hɛn ntamadan,
Ɔbɛka hɛn ho aber nyina:
Nyame yɛ ɔdɔ!

MHB 22
4 . In Zion we shall sing again-
God is love!
Yes, this shall be our highest strain-
God is love!
Whilst endless ages roll along,
In concert with the heavenly throng.
This shall be still our sweetest song-
God is love!	 ~ 	4 . Yɛbɔtow ndwom bi wɔ Zion:
Nyame yɛ ɔdɔ!
Nyew, yɛbɛtsea mu atow ndwom:
Nyame yɛ ɔdɔ!
Ber a mbersantsen rutwa m' akɔ,
Ɔnye ɔsor dɔm nyinara,
Yɛbɔkɔ do atow ndwom dɛɛdɛw
Nyame yɛ ɔdɔ!

MHB 220
1 . GOD is ascended up on high,
	                Alleluia.
With merry noise of trumpet’s sound,
	                Alleluia.
And princely seated in the sky,
	                Alleluia.
Rules over all the world around.
	                Alleluia.
	 ~ 	1 . NYANKOPƆN afow kɔ sorsor, 
Alleluia!
Ɔdze totorbɛnto dɛw ndze, 
Alleluia
Na ɔtse N'ahengua m' wɔ sor, 
Alleluia!
Odzi wiadze nyinara do, 
Alleluia!

MHB 220
2 .  In human shape and flesh He went,
Adornèd with His passion’s scars,
Which in heaven’s sight He did present
More glorious than the glittering stars.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔdze Ne nyimpadua kɔree, 
Alleluia!
N'amandzehu 'piretua wɔ n' ho, 
Alleluia
Ɔdze kɛkyerɛɛ ɔsor mba no, 
Alleluia!
Ɔyɛ enyimnyam sen nworaba. 
Alleluia!

MHB 220
3 . Lord, raise our sinking minds therefore
Up to our proper country dear,
And purify us evermore,
To fit us for those regions clear.	 ~ 	3 . Dɛm ntsi Ewuradze, bue hɛn adwen m',
Alleluia!
Kɔ hɛn man ankasa no ho,
Alleluia!
Na dwira hɛn ho afebɔɔ,
Alleluia!
Ma yaafata bea krɔnkrɔn no.
Alleluia!

MHB 221
1 . HAIL the day that sees Him rise,
		Alleluia !
Ravished from our wistful eyes!
		Alleluia !
Christ, awhile to mortals given,
		Alleluia !
Reascends His native heaven.
		Alleluia !
	 ~ 	1 . Hwɛ da a Christ fowee kɔr sor; 
	Alleluia! 
Ma hɛn enyi egyina N' 
	Alleluia!
Ɔannkyɛr adasamba nkyɛn, 
	Alleluia!
Na ɔasan kɔ no sor fie.  
	Alleluia!

MHB 221
2 . There the pompous  triumph waits:
Lift your heads, eternal gates;
Wide unfold the radiant scene;
Take the King of Glory in !
	 ~ 	2 . Wɔrotweɔn wɔabɔ No se:
M-botsen n' mma hɔn tsir do; 
Hom nyina mbuebue petee, 
Ma Enyimnyam Hen n' nkɔ mu.

MHB 221
3 . Him thougt highest heaven receives,
Still He loves the earth He leaves;
Though returning to His throne,
Still He calls mankind His own.
	 ~ 	3 . Kaansa ɔahɛn ɔsor mpo a,  
Ɔda ho dɔ nyimpamba; 
Ɔasan kɔ N' ahenguam' mpo a, 
Ɔda ho frɛ hɛn Nedze.

MHB 221
4 .  See ! He lifts His hands above;
See! He shows the prints of love;
Hark! His gracious lips bestow
Blessings on His Church below.
	 ~ 	4 . Hwɛ! ɔama Ne nsa do sor,  
Hwɛ! No dɔ epiratua n'; 
Tsie! N' anofamfa kasa 
N-hyira gu N' Asɔr do.

MHB 221
5 . Master, parted from our sight
High above yon azure height,
Grant our hearts may thither rise,
Following Thee beyond the skies.	 ~ 	5 . Hɛn Wura, sɛ afow kɔ sor,  
Afa wim' ekyir noho a, 
Ma hɛn so hɛn akoma 
Nka Wo do nkɔ Nyame manm'.

MHB 222
1 . OUR Lord is risen from the dead!
Our Jesus is gone up on high !
The powers of hell are captive led,
Dragged to the portals of the sky.
	               Hallelujah !
	 ~ 	1 . HEN Ewuradze asoɛr efi wu m'!
Hɛn Jesus afow akɔ sor,
Ɔafa hɛll etumfo n' ndɔmmum
Dze hɔn kɔ sor abobowano.
Hallelujah!

MHB 222
2 . There His triumphal chariot waits,
And angels chant the solemn lay:
Lift up your heads, ye heavenly gates;
Ye everlasting doors, give way 
	               Hallelujah !
	 ~ 	2 . No konyim tseaseanam tweɔn hɔ,
Na abɔfo tow ndwom kamfo N'
Ahenman m' mbobow hom mbuebue,
Hom tsetse apon, hom nyina mbuebue.
Hallelujah!

MHB 222
3 . Loose all your bars of massy light,
And wide unfold the ethereal scene:
He claims these mansions as His right;
Receive the King of glory in !
	                       Hallelujah !
	 ~ 	3 . Buebue Wo ndadzeban nyina,
Na hom mma sor hyerɛn nda edzi;
Adan akɛse 'i yɛ Nedze,
Hom mma Enyimnyam Hen n' mbra mu.
Hallelujah!

MHB 222
4 . Who is this King of Glory? Who?
The Lord that all our foes o’ercame,
The world, sin, death, and hell o’erthrew; 
And Jesus is the conqueror’s name.
		Hallelujah !	 ~ 	4 . Woana nye Enyimnyam Hen yi?
Nyia oedzi hɛn nyina atamfo do n',
Oedzi wiadze, bɔn, wu, hɛll do;
Konyimdzinyi n' dzin nye Jesus.
Hallelujah!

MHB 222
5 . Lo! His triumphal chariot waits,
 And angels chant the solemn lay:
 Lift up your heads, ye heavenly gates;
 Ye everlasting doors, give way!
		Hallelujah !
	 ~ 	5 . Hwɛ! No konyim tseaseanam tweɔn,
Na abɔfo tow awɔse ndwom';
Ahenman m' mbobow' hom mbuebue,
Hom tsetse apon, hom nyina mbuebue.
Hallelujah!

MHB 222
6 . Who is this King of Glory? Who? 
The Lord, of glorious power possessed;
The King of saints, and angels too,
 God over all, for ever blest!
		Hallelujah.	 ~ 	6 . Woana nye Enyimnyam Hen yi?
Ewuradze, 'nyimnyamfo tumfo n';
Ahotsewfo nye abɔfo Hen n';
Adze nyina do Nyame siarfo. 
Hallelujah!

MHB 223
1 . SEE the conqueror mounts in triumph,
See the King in royal state
Riding on the clouds His chariot
To His heavenly palace gate;
Hark, the choirs of angel voices 
Joyful hallelujahs sing,
 And the portals high are lifted
To receive their heavenly King.
 	 ~ 	1 . Hwɛ Konyimdzifo n' afow sor, 
Hwɛ Hen n' ahyɛ N' ahentar
Dze Ne tseaseanam fua do
Rokɔ No sor ahemfie;
Tsie! sor adwontow kuw ruhur
Hallelujah enyigyem',
Na sor mbotsen no ebuebue
Regye hɔn sor Hen akɔm'.

MHB 223
2 . Who is this that comes in glory,
With the trump of jubilee?
Lord of battles, God of armies,
He has gained the victory;
 He who on the Cross did suffer,
 He who from the grave arose,
 He has vanquished sin and Satan,
 He by death has spoiled His foes.
	 ~ 	2 . Woana na ɔreba 'nyimnyam mu 
Ma ehurusi mbɛn ka do 'i?
Ɔko Wura, dɔm Nyankopɔn.
Ɔno na oedzi konyim
Ɔno a ɔsɔɔw mbeamudua do fona
Ɔno a ofi ndam' soɛree,
Ɔaka bɔn na Satan egu,
Nam wu do asɛɛ N' atamfo.

MHB 223
3 . He has raised our human nature
In the clouds to God’s right hand;
There we sit in heavenly places,
 There with Him in glory stand:
Jesus reigns, adored by angels;
 Man with God is on the throne;
 Mighty Lord, in Thine ascension
We by faith behold our own.
 	 ~ 	3 . Ɔama hɛn nyimpasu no do 
Fi fuam' kɔ Nyame nyimfa;
Ɔsor hɔ na yɛbɛtsena,
Yɛnye N' egyina 'nyimnyam mu:
Jesus dzi hen, abɔfo sɔr N';
Nyame Nyimpa tse ahenguam'
Ewuradze Tumfo, Wo sorkɔm'
Yɛdze gyedzi hu hɛndze.

MHB 223
4 . Glory be to God the Father;
Glory be to God the Son,
Dying, risen, ascending for us,
Who the heavenly realm has won;
Glory to the Holy Spirit;
To One God in Persons Three
both in earth and heaven,
Glory, endless glory be!    Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Enyimnyam nka Egya Nyame; 
Enyimnyam nka Nyame Ba a,
Oewu, ɔasoɛr na ɔafow sor,
Ɔno a oenya sor ahenman n'
Enyimnyam nka Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn;
Nye Nyame Baasa Kor no
Enyimnyam a onnyi ewiei nka
Hɔn wɔ sor nye asaase.

MHB 224
1 . THE golden gates are lifted up,
The doors are opened wide;
The King of Glory is gone in
Unto His Father’s side.
	 ~ 	1 . Sika mbotsen no ebuebue, 
Kwan ada mu petee;
Enyimnyam Hen no ahɛn mu,
Ɔkɔ N' Egya Ne nkyɛn.

MHB 224
2 . Thou art gone up before  us, Lord,
To make for us a place,
That we may be where now Thou art,
 And look upon God’s face.
	 ~ 	2 . Ewuradze, edzi hɛn kan, 
'Rekɛpɛ hɛn tsenabew,
Ama yeekefir mbrɛ ewɔ,
Na yeehu Nyame enyim.

MHB 224
3 . And ever on our earthly path
A gleam of glory lies;
A light still breaks behind the cloud
That veils Thee from our eyes.
	 ~ 	3 . Dɛm n-tsi enyimnyam hyerɛn 
Hɛn kwan do wɔ asaase;
Fua a osiiw W' hɛn enyi do n',
Kan fi sor hotse no.

MHB 224
4 . Lift up our hearts, lift up our minds:
Let Thy  dear grace be given,
That, while we wonder here below,
 Our treasure be in heaven:
	 ~ 	4 . Ma hɛn 'koma nye adwen do, 
Fa W' adom pa n' dom hɛn,
Na yɛnenam asaase ha 'i,
Hɛn 'koradze ada sor.

MHB 224
5 . That where Thou art at God’s right hand,
 Our hope, our love, may be.
Dwell Thou in us, that we may dwell
For evermore in Thee. Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Na hɛn enyidar na dɔ eegyina 
Nyame nyimfa mbrɛ 'tse n'.
Tsena hɛn mu na ndaamba hɛn so
Yaatsena Wom' afebɔɔ.   Amen.

MHB 225
1 . CHRIST, above all glory seated!
King triumphant, strong to save! 
Dying, Thou hast death defeated;
Buried, Thou hast spoiled the grave.
 	 ~ 	1 . CHRIST, etsé enyimnyam nyina mu;
Hen katakyi a egye nkwa!
Wo wu edzi owu do konyim,
Wosiee Wo, n’ asɛɛ ‘Wumaa.

MHB 225
2 . Thou art gone where now is given,
What no mortal might could gain,
On the eternal throne of heaven,
In Thy Father’s power to reign.
 	 ~ 	2 . Sesei akͻ beebi ekenya
Dza adasa tum nnkenya;
Este bɛkyebo ahengua n’ do.
‘Dzi hen W‘Egya No tum mu.

MHB 225
3 . There Thy kingdoms all adore Thee,
Heaven above and earth below;
 While the depths of hell before Thee
Trembling and defeated bow.
	 ~ 	3 . Ha W'ahenman nyina nkotow Wo,
Heaven na asaase nyina,
Na hell bun dzé ahopopo twa
Hwe W’enyim wͻ nkogu mu.

MHB 225
4 . We, O Lord, with hearts adoring,
Follow Thee above the sky;
Hear our prayers Thy grace imploring,
Lift our souls to Thee on high.
	 ~ 	4 . Ewuradze, hɛn akoma mu tonton
Pem dzi W’ekyir kͻ sorsor;
Yeresérɛ W’adom yi tsie hɛn,
Twe hɛn akra kͻ W‘ nkyɛn sor hͻ.

MHB 225
5 . So when Thou again in glory
 On the clouds of heaven shalt shine,
 We Thy flock may stand before Thee, 
 Owned for evermore as Thine. 
	 ~ 	5 . Ntsi sɛ ehyérɛn W‘enyimnyam no mu
Bio sor mununkum no mu a.
Ma Wo nguan yengyina W'enyim
De yɛyɛ Wodze daapem.

MHB 225
6 . Hail ! all hail! In Thee confiding,
Jesus, Thee shall all adore,
In Thy Father’s might abiding
With one Spirit evermore !    Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Wonhua Jesus! Yegye Wo dzi,
Dɛ aman nyina bͻtonton Wo,
Ͻwo a enye Sunsum kor tse
W’Egya No tum mu daapem.

MHB 226
1 . LOOK, ye saints! The sight is glorious,
See the Man of Sorrows now,
 From the fight returned victorious;
Every knee to Him shall bow.
Crown Him crown Him!
 	 ~ 	1 . 'HOTSEWFO, hom nhwɛ enyimnyam dze n'!
Hom nhwɛ yaw Nyimpa n' sesei,
Oedzi nyim ɔko n' mu aba fie;
Nkotodwe nyina nkotow No,
Wɔnhyɛ N' ahenkyɛw! Ahenkyɛw 
Fata Konyimdzifo N' tsir.

MHB 226
2 . Crown the Saviour, angels, crown Him:
Rich the trophies Jesus brings;
In the seat of power enthrone Him,
While the vault of heaven rings.
Crown Him, crown Him!
 Crown the Saviour, King of kings.
	 ~ 	2 . Abɔfo nhyɛ Gyefo ahenkyɛw;
Ɔdze empirenyimdze aba;
Wɔmfa No nsi tum egua n' do;
Ber a heaven rowosow yi,
Wɔnhyɛ N' ahenkyɛw! Gyefo no,
Ahemfo Hen no ahenkyɛw.

MHB 226
3 . Sinners in derision crowned Him,
 Mocking thus the Saviour’s claim;
 Saints and angels crowd around Him,
 Own His title, praise His name.
 Crown Him, crown Him,
Spread abroad the Victor’s fame.
	 ~ 	3 . Abɔn nam atwetwesi m' hyɛɛ
Agyenkwa no ahenkyɛw;
'Hotsewfo na abɔfo hyia N' ho,
Bɔ No abɔdzin, yi N' ayɛw, 
Hom nhyɛ N' ahenkyɛw na hom nhua N',
'Hemfo Hen, ewuranom Wura!

MHB 226
4 . Hark, those bursts of acclamation;
Hark, those loud triumphant chords;
Jesus takes the highest station:
O what joy the sight affords! 
 Crown Him! crown Him! 
 King of kings and Lord of lords! 	 ~ 	4 . Tsie dodow osebɔ kɛse n';
Tsie hɔn konyimdzi ndwom no;
Hwɛ, Jesus ekedzi sorsor;
Mbrɛ iyi si ma dɛw a!
Hom nhyɛ N' ahenkyɛw na hom nhua N',
'Hemfo Hen, ewuranom Wura!

MHB 227
1 . CONQUERING Prince and Lord of glory,
Majesty enthroned in light;
 All the heavens are bowed before Thee,
Far beyond them spreads Thy mighty;
Shall not I fall at Thy feet,
And my heart with rapture beat, 
Now Thy glory is displayed,
Thine ere yet the worlds were made?
	 ~ 	1 . KONYIMDZI Hen, 'nyimnyam Ewuradze,
Woesi Wo hen wɔ kan mu;
Ɔsor nyina twa hwe W'enyim,
Wo tum tserɛw kɔ ekyir;
Onnyi dɛ mohwe W'enyim,
Na m'akoma bɔ hwinhwim, 
Ber a W'enyimnyam a ofi tsetse n'
Afei woeyi akyerɛ yi.

MHB 227
2 . As I watch Thee far ascending
To the right hand of the throne,
See the host before Thee bending,
Praising Thee in sweetest tone;
Shall not I too at Thy feet
Here the angels’ strain repeat,
 And rejoice that heaven doth ring
With the triumph of my King?
	 ~ 	2 . Sɛ mohwɛ Wo a 'rofow wɔ ekyir
Kɔ ahengua n' n'enyimfa,
Hu dɔm a wɔrokotow W'enyim
Dze ndze dɛw riyi Wo ayɛw a, 
Onnyi dɛ W'ananadze
Ha motow abɔfo ndwom n' bi,
Na midzi dɛw, sor wosow
Wɔ me hen No konyim mu?

MHB 227
3 . Power and Spirit are o’erflowing,
On me also be they poured;
 Every hindrance overthrowing
 Make Thy foes Thy footstool, Lord!
Yea, let earth’s remotest end
To Thy righteous scepter bend,
 Make Thy way before Thine plain,
O’re all hearts and spirits reign.
	 ~ 	3 . Tum na Sunsum a ebu do no,
Bi nhue ngu mo so mo do;
Mo Wura, sɛɛ akwambew nyina,
Yɛ W'atamfo ananadzegua!
Mpo, ma wiadze ano noho
Ntse Wo tum tsenenee no,
Ma W'enyim kwan nyɛ petee;
Dzi akoma nyina do hɛn.

MHB 227
4 . Lo! Thy presence now is filling
All Thy Church in every place; 
Fill my heart too; make me willing
In this season of Thy grace;
Come, Thou King of glory, come,
Deign to make my heart Thy home,
There abide and rule alone,
As upon Thy heavenly Throne!  Amen.
					Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Hwɛ, W'ahom rehyɛ W'asɔr a ɔwɔ,
Mbeambea nyinara no ma;
Hyɛ mo so m'akoma ma, na
Minya pɛ W'adom ber yi;
Bra, Ɔwo enyimnyam Hen, bra,
Fa m'akoma yɛ Wo fie;
Tsena m', na Wo nko dzi hen hɔ
Dɛ Wo sor ahengua n' do!   Amen.

MHB 228
1 . HAIL,Thou once despised Jesus!
Hail, Thou Galilean King!
Thou didst suffer to release us;
Thou didst free salvation bring.
Hail, Thou agonising Saviour,
Bearer of our sin and shame!
By Thy merits we find favour;
Life is given through Thy name.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS 'Wo a wobuu W' nyimtsia, mbo!
Galilee Hen, yɛma W' mbo!
Ihun amandze dze poon hɛn;
Edze nkwagye brɛɛ hɛn kwa,
Agyenkwa mandzehufo, mbo!
Esoaa hɛn bɔn na hɛn fɛr!
Wo ndwuma pa m' yenya enyimpa;
Yenya nkwa wɔ Wo dzin mu.

MHB 228
2 . Paschal Lamb by God appointed,
All our sins on Thee were laid;
By almighty love anointed,
Thou hast full atonement made:
All Thy people are forgiven
Through the virtue of Thy blood;
Opened is the gate of heaven;
Peace is made ’twixt man and God.
	 ~ 	2 . Nyame N'afɔrbɔ Eguambaa,
Wɔdze hɛn bɔn nyina soaa Wo;
Enam ɔdɔ kɛse do na
Ebɔɔ werdam pa maa hɛn;
Wo nkorɔfo nyina enya bɔnfakyɛ,
Ɔnam Wo bɔgyaa no ntsi;
Woebue heaven abow n' petee;
Somdwee wɔ Nyame na nyimpa m'.

MHB 228
3 . Jesus, hail! enthroned in glory,
There for ever to abide;
All the heavenly host adore Thee,
Seated at Thy Father’s side:
There for sinners Thou art pleading,
There Thou dost our place prepare,
Ever for us interceding,
Till in glory we appear.
	 ~ 	3 . Jesus, enyimnyam Hen, m-bo!
Ewɔ enyimnyam m' afebɔɔ;
Ɔsor dɔm nyinara sɔr Wo,
Etse Egya N'abanyimfa;
Ewɔ hɔ na idzi ma abɔn,
'Siesie tsenabew pa ma hɛn;
Idzi ma hɛn afebɔɔ, kɛpem
Dɛ yepue enyimnyam mu.

MHB 228
4 . Worship, honour, power, and blessing,
Thou art worthy to receive;
Loudest praises without ceasing,
Meet it is for us to give.
Help, ye bright, angelic spirits!
Bring your sweetest, noblest lays;
Help to sing our Saviour’s merits,
Help to chant Immanuel’s praise !	 ~ 	4 . Ɔsom nyimnyam, tum, na nhyira
Efata dɛ egye ne nyina;
Ayɛyi kɛse a ɔmmbɔ adze,
Ɔsɛ hɛn dɛ yɛdze ma,
Sor abɔfo hyɛnhyɛnn, hom mboa!
Hom mfa hom ndwom dɛɛdɛw mbra;
Hom nsuo m' yɛntow ndwom mma 
Gyefo n',
Hom nsuo m' yenyi Immanuel ayɛw!

MHB 229
1 . YE faithful souls who Jesus know,
If risen indeed with Him ye are,
Superior to the joys below,
His resurrection’s power declare.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM nokwafo a hom nyim Jesus,
Sɛ hom nye N' asoɛr ampa ara a,
Hom akyɛn asaase do dɛw,
Hom nda No wusoɛr tum n' edzi.

MHB 229
2 . Your faith by holy tempers prove,
By actions show your sins forgiven,
And seek the glorious things above,
 And follow Christ, your Head, to heaven.
	 ~ 	2 . Hom mfa abotar nkyerɛ hom gyedzi,
Ndzeyɛɛ m' hom nkyerɛ fakyɛ a hom enya,
Hom nhwehwe sor enyimnyamdze,
Na hom nka tsir Christ do nkɔ sor.

MHB 229
3 . There your exalted Saviour see,
Seated at God’s right hand again,
In all His Father’s majesty,
In everlasting pomp to reign.
	 ~ 	3 . Hom bohu Agyenkwa n' wɔ hɔ,
Dɛ ɔtse Nyame abanyimfa
Wɔ N'Egya n'ahentum nyina mu,
Na obedzi hen afebɔɔ.

MHB 229
4 . To Him continually aspire,
Contending for your native place;
And emulate the angel choir,
And only live to love and praise.
	 ~ 	4 . Hom nhwɛ No na hom nsuasua No,
Ndzi aper hom sor fie no ho;
Na hom nsua sor adwontofo n',
Hom ntsena, hom ndɔ, hom nyi N' ayɛw.

MHB 229
5 . For who by faith your Lord receive,
Ye nothing seek or want beside;
Dead to the world and sin ye live,
Your creature-love is crucified.
	 ~ 	5 . Hom a hom dze gyedzi agye Ewuradze n',
Mma hom nnhwehwɛ biribiara bio;
Hom nwu mma wiadze na bɔn nyina,
Hom wiadze dɔ n' wɔabɔ n'
mbeamudua m'.
