MHB 229
6 . Your real life, with Christ concealed,
Deep in the Father’s bosom lies;
And, glorious as your Head revealed,
Ye soon shall meet Him in the skies.	 ~ 	6 . Wɔdze hom nkwa sumaa Christ mu,
Wɔ Egya No bo mu sɔkyee;
Dɛ mbrɛ Sahen nyimnyamfo n' kae n',
Hom behyia No wimu ntsɛntsɛmara.

MHB 23
1 . King of glory, King of peace,
I will love Thee;
And that love may never cease,
I will move Thee.
Thou hast granted my request,
Thou hast heard me;
Thou didst note my working breast,
Thou hast spared me.
	 ~ 	1 . NYIMNYAN HEN, Asomdwee Hen,
Mobɔdɔ Wo;
Na dɔ no rommbɔ adze da,
Meserɛ Wo.
Ɔwo ama m' m'ebisadze,
Ɔwo etsie me;
Ɔwo hun mbrɛ mo bɔn tse,
Dze mo ho akyɛ m'.

MHB 23
2 . Wherefore with my utmost art
I will sing Thee
And the cream of all my heart
I will bring Thee.
Though my sins against me cried,
Thou didst clear me;
And alone, when they replied.
Thou didst hear me.
	 ~ 	2 . Medze me nyimdzee mapa
M'bɔtow Wo ndwom,
M'akoma m' ndzepa nyina
Medze bɛma W'.
Kaansa mo bɔn kaa m'tsiaa m' mpo a,
Esaan mo ho;
Wɔpraa ano guu mo do no,
Ɔwo 'tsiee me.

MHB 23
3 . Seven whole days, not one in seven,
I will praise Thee;
In my heart, though not in heaven,
I can raise Thee.
Small it is, in this poor sort
To enrol Thee:
E’en eternity's too short
To extol Thee.	 ~ 	3 . N-da esuon na nnyɛ da kor,
M'beyi W'ayɛw;
Mudu sor mpo a, m'akomam'
M'bohuhor Wo.
Osuar, na ɔmmfata de
Medze ma Wo;
Onnyiewiei mpo yɛ tsia dɛ
Wɔtonton Wo.

MHB 230
1 . REJOICE and be glad! the Redeemer has come:
Go, look on His cradle, His cross, and His tomb.

        Sound His praises, tell the story of 
            Him who was slain;
        Sound His praises, tell with gladness 
            He now liveth again.
	 ~ 	1 . DZI dɛw mbordo ara! Hɛn Pomfo no aba;
Kɔhwɛ N'adasoe, mbeamudua na Ne nda.
   Yi No ayɛw; bo Nyia wokum No no ho dawur;
   Yi No ayɛw; fa dɛw ka dɛ ɔtse ase bio.

MHB 230
2 . Rejoice and be glad! it is sunshine at last;
The clouds have departed, the shadows are past.
	 ~ 	2 . Dzi dɛw mbordo ara! Wimutsewee n' asan aba;
Mununkum no apa, sunsuma no kɔ.

MHB 230
3 .  Rejoice and be glad ! for the blood has been shed;
Redemption is finished, the price has been paid
 	 ~ 	3 . Dzi dɛw mbordo ara! Wɔaka bɔgya n' egu, 
Woewie werdam no bɔ, kaw no so woetua.

MHB 230
4 . Rejoice and be glad! now the pardon is free;
The just for the unjust has died on the tree.
	 ~ 	4 . Dzi dɛw mbordo ara! Yeenya fakyɛ no kwa;
Tseneneenyi ewu ama abɔn wɔ dua no do.

MHB 230
5 .  Rejoice and be glad! for the Lamb that was slain,
 O’er death is triumphant, and now liveth again.
 	 ~ 	5 . Dzi dɛw mbordo ara! Na Eguambaa a wokum No n',
Oedzi owu do konyim na ɔtse ase bio.

MHB 230
6 . Rejoice and be glad! for our King is on high;
He pleads now for us on His throne in the sky.
	 ~ 	6 . Dzi dɛw mbordo ara! Hɛn Hen no wɔ sorsor;
Ofi No sor ahengua do dzi ma hɛn

MHB 230
7 .  Rejoice and be glad! for He’s coming again;
He cometh in great glory, the Lamb that was slain.	 ~ 	7 . Dzi dɛw mbordo ara! Siandɛ ɔbɛba bio;
Eguambaa a wokum No n' bɛba enyimnyam m'.

MHB 231
1 . AWAY with gloom, away with doubt!
With all the morning stars we sing;
With all the sons of God we shout
The praises of a King,
	   Alleluia!
Of our returning King. 
	 ~ 	1 . Egya, hyɛ Wo Ba enyimnyam, 
Yɛ dza Ne mpaabɔ bisa n':
Ma Kasamaafo no mbra,
Fa Werɛkyekyefo n' ma hɛn
Yɛnam gyedzi do regye N',
Jesus dzin ntsi, fa N' ma hɛn.

MHB 231
2 . Away with death, and welcome life;
In Him we died and live again;
And welcome peace, away with strife!
For He returns to reign.
	   Alleluia!
The Crucified shall reign.
 	 ~ 	2 . Yɛnam gyedzi do bohu 
Na yɛatse Sunsum no nka;
Ɔdze N' adom nye No dɔ
Bɛtsena hɛn akoma mu:
Hɛn mboa nye papa nyina
Pem fi No nkotoo mu ba.

MHB 231
3 . Then welcome beauty, He is fair;
And welcome youth, for He is young;
And welcome spring; and everywhere
Let merry songs be sung!
	   Alleluia!
For such a King be sure!	 ~ 	3 . Ennkɔsɔw asɛm n' ano, 
'Wo, nokwafo, yamuyiefo?
Ennkɛma Werɛkyekyefo n'
Abɛtsena hɛn 'komam' daa?
Ɔyɛ dɛn ara a 'dze N' bɛma:
Christ Kaa dɛ edze N' bɛma ampa.

MHB 232
1 . ENTERED the holy place above,
Covered with meritorious scars,
The tokens of His dying love
Our great High-priest in glory bears;
He pleads His passion on the tree,
He shows Himself to God for me.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN Sɔfopanyin dze N' akam,
No dɔ a ɔyɛ wu n' ho nsewhyɛ;
Ɔsɔɔw no enyimnyam mu no,
Kɛhɛɛn ɔsor krɔnkrɔnbea hɔ;
Ɔdze Ne yaw serɛ wɔ dua n' do,
Yi Noho kyerɛ Nyame ma me.

MHB 232
2 . Before the throne my Saviour stands,
My Friend and Advocate appears;
My name is graven on His hands,
And Him the Father always hears;
While low at Jesu’s cross I bow,
He hears the blood of sprinkling now
 	 ~ 	2 . M' Agyenkwa gyina ahengua n'enyim,
Ogyina dɛ m' Nyɛnko, Dzimafo;
Woekrukye me dzin wɔ Ne nsamu,
Ɔno na Egya n' tsie No daa;
Ber a m'kosɔw Jesus mbeamudua n' ho n',
Ɔtse bɔgya ne mpetsee no.

MHB 232
3 . This instant now I may receive
The answer of His powerful prayer;
This instant now by Him I live,
His prevalence with God declare;
And soon my spirit, in His hands,
Shall stand where my Forerunner stands.	 ~ 	3 . Mubotum enya No tum mpaabɔ n'
Ho mbuae ha sesei ara mpo;
Ɔno ntsi metse ase sesei,
Meka dɛ ɔtse Nyame mu;
Ɔrennkyɛr, me kra a ɔwɔ N' nsamu n'
Begyina bea a me Kandzifo n' gyina.

MHB 233
1 . JESUS, to Thee we fly,
On Thee for help rely;
Thou our only refuge art,
Thou dost all our fears control,
Rest of every troubled heart,
Life of every dying soul. 
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, yεba Wo hɔ,
Hεn enyi da Wo mboa do;
Wo nko nye hεn guandɔbea.
Ebrε hεn suro nyina adze;
Akoma biara ahomgye.
Ɔkra a oruwu biara nkwa.

MHB 233
2 . We lift our joyful eyes,
And see the dazzling prize,
See the purchase of Thy blood,
Freely now to sinners given;
Thou the living way hast showed,
Thou to us hast opened heaven.
 	 ~ 	2 . Yεma hεn enyi do,
Dze hwε akatua no,
Hwε Wo bɔgyaa atɔ hεn n’,
Edze ama abɔn kwa;
Ɔwo akyérε nkwa kwan no.
Ebue ɔsor ama hεn.

MHB 233
3 . We now, divinely bold,
Of Thy reward lay hold;
All Thy glorious joy is ours,
All the treasures of Thy love;
Now we taste the heavenly powers, 
Now we reign with Thee above. 
 	 ~ 	3 . Yεdze akokodur
Krɔnkrɔn gye akatua n’;
W’enyimnyam dεw yε hεndzc,
Wo dɔ egyapadze nyina;
Afei yεsɔ sor turn hwε,
Yεnye  Wo dzi hen wɔ sor.

MHB 233
4 . Our anchor sure and fast
Within the veil is cast;
Stands our never-failing hope
Grounded in the holy place;
We shall after Thee mount up,
See the Godhead face to face.	 ~ 	4 . Yeatow hen sekyε dzen
Wɔ twamutam no mu;
Hεn enyidado a ɔmmpa n’
Si pi wɔ Krɔnkrɔn -bea hɔ;
Yebedzi W'ekyir afow
Ekohu Nyame N’enyim.

MHB 234
1 .  NOT all the blood of beasts
On Jewish altars slain
Could give the guilty conscience peace
Or wash away our stain.
	 ~ 	1 . Mbowa a Jewfo dze bɔɔ afɔr, 
Hɔn bɔgyaa nyinara
Nn-kotum ama etsidaa,
Anaa ɔatsew hɛn ho.

MHB 234
2 . But Christ, the heavenly Lamb,
Takes all our sins away;
A sacrifice of nobler name,
And richer blood, than they.
	 ~ 	2 . Christ, sor Eguambaa n' dze, 
Oyi hɛn bɔn nyina;
Afɔrbɔdze a ɔwɔ dzin,
Na ɔsom bo kyɛn hɔn nyina.

MHB 234
3 . My faith would lay her hand
On that meek head of Thine,
While as a penitent I stand,
And here confess my sin.
 	 ~ 	3 . Me gyedzi nsa bɛda 
W' etsifi pampam' hɔ,
Ber a medze nnuho gyina ha
Mereka mo bɔn yi.

MHB 234
4 . My soul looks back to see
The burden Thou didst bear
When hanging on the accursed tree,
 And knows her guilt was there. 	 ~ 	4 . Me kra twa n' enyi hwɛ 
Dza obuu Wo kɔn a,
Ohu dɛ n' afɔdzi ka ho
Ma 'sɛn mbusu dua n' do.

MHB 235
1 . I KNOW that my Redeemer lives-
What joy the blest assurance gives!
He lives, He lives, who once was dead;
He lives, my everlasting Head.
	 ~ 	1 . MINYIM dɛ mo Pomfo tse ase,
Dɛw bi a siar awerɛhyɛmu yi ma a!
Nyia owui no, ɔtse ase,
Ɔtse ase dzi mo do hen daa.

MHB 235
2 . He lives, to bless me with His love;
He lives, to plead for me above;
He lives, my hungry soul to feed;
 He lives, to help in time of need.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔtse ase dze No dɔ hyira me,
Ɔtse ase, dzi ma me wɔ sor;
Ɔtse ase, nyɛn me kra daa daa;
Ɔtse ase, boame ohia ber m'.

MHB 235
3 . He lives, and grants me daily breath;
 He lives, and I shall conquer death;
He lives, my mansion to prepare;
He lives, to lead me safely there.
 	 ~ 	3 . Ɔtse ase na ɔma m' ahom daa, 
Ɔtse ase, m' bedzi owu do;
Ɔtse ase risiesie fi ma m',
Ɔtse ase, 'dze m' bɔkɔ hɔ sɔnn.

MHB 235
4 . He lives, all glory to His name;
He lives, my Saviour, still the same;
What joy the blest assurance gives,
I know that my Redeemer lives!	 ~ 	4 . Ɔtse ase, 'nyimnyam nka Ne dzin,
Ɔtse ase, m'Agyenkwa daapem;
Dɛw a siar awerɛhyɛmu yi ma a!
Minyim dɛ mo Pomfo tse ase.

MHB 236
1 . With joy we meditate the grace
Of our High- Priest above;
 His heart is made of tenderness,
 And ever yearns with love.
 	 ~ 	1 . YƐDZE dɛw dwen hɛn Sɔfopanyin
No mu adom no ho;
N'akoma yɛ mbɔbɔrhu nko,
Na ɔkyerɛ ɔdɔ daa.

MHB 236
2 . Touched with a sympathy within,
He knows our feeble frame;
He knows what sore temptations mean
For He has felt the same.
	 ~ 	2 . Ehumbɔbɛr ahyɛ N' mu ma,
Ntsi onyim hɛn mberɛwyɛ nyina;
Onyim dɛ mbrɛ nsɔhwɛ so tse,
'Siandɛ ɔafa mu pɛn.

MHB 236
3 . He in the days of feeble flesh
Poured out his cries and tears;
And, though exalted, feels afresh
What every member bears.
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔwɔ honam a ɔyɛ mberɛw mu n',
Osui na okyii nyinsu;
Ɔwɔ sor dze, naaso ɔtse
Ma No nkorɔfo adzesoa.

MHB 236
4 . He’ll never quench the smoking flax, 
but raise it to a flame; 
the bruised reed He never breaks,
nor scorns the meanest name.
	 ~ 	4 . Onnkodum ntɔn bi a ɔrehyew,
Mbom ɔbɛma adzɛw;
Onnkobu ndzembir a akonton,
Onnkobu obi 'nyimtsia.

MHB 236
5 .  Then let our humble faith address
His mercy and His power:
We shall obtain delivering grace
In the distressing hour.	 ~ 	5 . Afei dze ma hɛn gyedzi nka 
No mbɔbɔrhu, No tum;
Yebenya ɔgye adom no
Ahokyer ber no mu.

MHB 237
1 . THERE is no sorrow, Lord, too light
To bring in prayer to Thee;
Nor is there any care too slight
To wake Thy sympathy. 
 	 ~ 	1 . OWURA, 'werɛhow bi nnyi hɔ a osuar
Dɛ yɛdze brɛ W' mpaabɔ m';
Na dadwen bi nnyi hɔ a osuar a
Onnkenyan W' mbɔbɔrhu.

MHB 237
2 . Thou, who hast trod the thorny road
Wilt share each small distress;
The love which bore the greater load
Will not refuse the less.
 	 ~ 	2 . Ɔwo a afa ɔhaw yi mu,
Bɔhwɛ hɛn ahohia m' bi;
Ɔdɔ a ɔsoaa adzesoa kɛse n'
Bɔsoa dza osuar so.

MHB 237
3 . There is no secret sigh we breathe,
But meets the ear divine;
And every cross grows light beneath
The shadow, Lord, of Thine.
 	 ~ 	3 . Ɔpen biara nnyi nsumaa mu a
N'aso krɔnkrɔn no nntse,
Na mbeamudua biara yɛ har
Wɔ Wo sunsum ase.

MHB 237
4 . Life’s ills without, sin’s strife within:
The heart would overflow,
But for that love which died for sin,
That love which wept with woe.	 ~ 	4 . Ɔbor bɔn, honam aperdzi,
Na akoma so do;
Dza ɔboa hɛn nye ɔdɔ a owui,
Ɔdɔ a ɔdze yaw sui.

MHB 238
1 . MY faith looks up to Thee,
Thou Lamb of Calvary,
 Saviour divine:
 Now hear me while I pray;
 Take all my guilt away;
 O let me from this day
 Be wholly Thine.
	 ~ 	1 . Me gyedzi tsim Wo do, 
CalvaryEguambaa,
Gyefo Krɔnkrɔn:
Morosɔr yi, tsie me;
Yi mo bɔn nyinara;
Ma ofir ndɛ menyɛ
Wodze koraa.

MHB 238
2 . May Thy rich grace impart
Strength to my fainting heart, 
My zeal inspire;
As Thou hast died for me,
O may my love to Thee
Pure warm, and changeless be,
A living fire.
 	 ~ 	2 . Ma W' adom kɛse no 
N-hyɛ m' akoma dzen,
Ma menyɛ ndam;
Dɛ mbrɛ iwui maa me n',
Ao, ma mo so mo dɔ
Ɔmfram dzendzen mma Wo
Na mma ɔnndan da.

MHB 238
3 . While life’s dark maze I tread,
And griefs around me spread,
Be Thou my guide;
Bid darkness turn to day,
Wipe sorrow’s tears away,
Nor let me ever stray
From Thee aside.
 	 ~ 	3 . Menam bra sum mu yi, 
Na yaw etwa mo ho 'i,
Woara kyerɛ m' kwan;
Ma sum ndan adzekyee,
Pepa me nyinsuwaEso mma monntɔ gon
Mimmfi Wo nkyɛn.

MHB 238
4 . When ends life’s transient dream,
When death’s cold, sullen stream
Shall o’er me roll,
Blest saviour, then, in love,
 Fear and distrust remove;
 O bear me safe above,
A ransomed soul. Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Ber a bra bɔbɔ adze, 
Na owu n' esutsen
Bɛpram mo do n',
Ao, m' Agyenkwa siarfo,
Pa m' suro na ekyingye,
Fa me kra a apon no n'
Kɔ sor fie sɔnn.   Amen.

MHB 239
1 . LORD Jesus, think on me,
And purge away my sin;
From earthborn passions set me free,
And make me pure within.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, dwen mo ho,
Na hor mo bɔn nyina;
Yi me fi wiadze akɔndɔ ho,
Na ma mo mu so ntsew.

MHB 239
2 . Lord Jesus, think on me
With care and woe opprest; 
Let me Thy loving servant be,
 And taste Thy promised rest.
	 ~ 	2 . Ewuradze, dwen mo ho,
Dadwen ahyɛ mo do;
Ma menyɛ W'akowaa dɔfo,
Na minnya W'ahomgye.

MHB 239
3 . Lord Jesus, think on me,
Amid the battle’s strife;
 In all my pain and misery
 Be Thou my health and life.
 	 ~ 	3 . Ewuradze, dwen mo ho,
Wɔ ɔko aperdzi mu;
Me yaw na m'awerɛhow nyina mu,
Yɛ m'ahoɔdzen, mo nkwa.

MHB 239
4 . Lord Jesus, think on me,
Nor let me go astray;
Through darkness and perplexity
Point Thou the heavenly way.
 	 ~ 	4 . Ewuradze, dwen mo ho,
Na mma mommfom kwan;
Sɛ sum dwir me dɛn ara mpo a,
Kyerɛ me ɔsor kwan.

MHB 239
5 . Lord Jesus, think on me,
When flows the tempest high: 
When on doth rush the enemy, 
O Saviour ,be Thou nigh.
	 ~ 	5 . Ewuradze, dwen mo ho,
Sɛ ɔbra ehum tu me a,
Sɛ ɔtamfo n' tow hyɛ mo do a,
Agyenkwa, twe bɛn me.

MHB 239
6 . Lord Jesus, think on me, 
That, when the flood is past,
I may the eternal brightness see,
And share Thy joy at last.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Ewuradze, dwen mo ho,
Na esuyirii no twa mu a,
Meehu kan a ɔwɔ hɔ daa no,
Na menye Wo edzi dɛw. Amen.

MHB 24
1 . O GOD my strength and fortitude,
In truth I will love Thee;
Thou art my castle and defence
In my necessity.
	 ~ 	1 . AHOTSEWFO, hom mbra,
Hom nyi Otumfo n'ayɛw;
Hom mma yɛnyɛ adwen kor,
Akoma, ndze na akyen:
Abɔdze biara ntow bi,
Obiara nnka n'ano nnto m'.
Wɔmma ndzɛmba a wonnyi nkwa 
So mfa kommyɛ ntow ayɛyi.

MHB 24
2 . When I beset with pain and grief,
Prayed to my God for grace,
Forthwith my God heard my complaint
Out of His holy place.
	 ~ 	2 . Adasamba so hom mbra,
Hom mbra ma yɛntow ndwom pa;
Na beebi a nyimpa ehyia n',
Hom ndzi adwontow enyim.
Hom mma Nyame ayɛyi 
Ndwom a ɔmmbɔ adze da do:
Ama hɛn ayɛyi ndwom
Aayɛ bɛkyebo dɛ Ɔno.

MHB 24
3 . The Lord descended from above,
And bowed the heavens high,
And underneath His feet He cast
The darkness of the sky.
	 ~ 	3 . Dɛm ntsi ofi sor dze nhyira
Bogu asaase nyina do;
Na wiadze tɛtɛr a yehu
Yɛ adwontofo asɔrdan kor;
Yɛbɛma hɛn ayɛyi ndwom
No atra mber na mbea nyina,
 Na afow edu sorsor
Otumfo kɛse n'asomu.

MHB 240
1 . O word of pity, for our pardon pleading,
   Breathed in the hour of loneliness and pain;
   O voice, which through the ages interceding,
   Calls us to fellowship with God again.
	 ~ 	1 . O MBƆBƆRHUSƐM a ɔserɛ ma hɛn,
Wɔka no ankonamyɛ na yaw ber mu;
O ndze a ofi tsetse, odzi ma hɛn
Frɛ hɛn dɛ yɛnye Nyame mbɔ mu bio.

MHB 240
2 . O word of comfort, through the silence stealing,
    As the dread act of sacrifice began;
    O infinite compassion, still revealing
    The infinite forgiveness won for man.
	 ~ 	2 . O awerɛkyekyesɛm a wɔka n' bɔkɔɔ,
Ber a wɔhyɛɛ afɔrbɔ huuhu n'ase,
Ɔwo a eyɛ ehumbɔbɔr, eda ho kyerɛ 
Bɔnfakyɛ a edze dom nyimpa mba

MHB 240
3 . O word of hope to raise us nearer heaven,
    When courage fails us and when faith is dim;
     The souls for whom Christ prays to Christ are given,
    To find their pardon and their joy in Him.
	 ~ 	3 . Enyidado asɛm a edze hɛn bɛn sor,
Ber a akokodur na gyedzi apa hɛn n',
Akra a Christ sɔr ma hɔn no yɛ Christ Nedze,
Wobenya fakyɛ na dɛw wɔ No mu.

MHB 240
4 . O Intercessor, who art ever living
    To plead for dying souls that they may live,
    Teach us to know our sin which needs forgiving,
    Teach us to know the love which can forgive.	 ~ 	4 . O Odzimafo a etse ase daa daa,
Eserɛ ma akra ewufo eenya nkwa;
Ma yenhu hɛn bɔn a ohia bɔnfakyɛ,
Ma yenhu ɔdɔ a otum dze bɔn kyɛ.   Amen.

MHB 241
1 . O SON of Man, our hero strong and tender,
Whose servants are the brave in all the earth,
Our living sacrifice to Thee we render,
Who sharest all our sorrows, all our mirth.
 	 ~ 	1 . O NYIMPA Ba, Gyefo katakyi brɛfo a 
Wo nkowaa nye asaase do ebirfo!
Yɛdze hɛn afɔrbɔ enyikan brɛ Wo,
Ɔwo a inyim hɛn yaw na hɛn dɛw nyina.

MHB 241
2 . O feet so strong to climb the path of duty,
O lips divine that taught the words of truth,
Kind eyes that marked the lilies in their beauty,
And heart that kindled at the zeal of youth. 
	 ~ 	2 . Anan a ɔyɛ dzen na otum dzi dwuma,
Anofamfa krɔnkrɔn a ɔkaa nokwar n',
Enyi a ɔhwɛɛ nsukookoo n'ahoofɛw,
Akoma a odzii dɛw mbabun ahoɔdzen ho!

MHB 241
3 . Lover of children, boyhood’s inspiration,
Of all mankind the Servant and the King;
 O Lord of joy and hope and consolation,
 To Thee our fears and joys and hopes we bring.
	 ~ 	3 . Mbofra hɔn Dɔfo, Ɔwo a ikenyan mbofra,
Adasa nyina mu Akowaa na Ɔhen,
Ɔwo dɛw, enyindar, akomatɔmu Wura!
Yɛdze hɛn suro, dɛw na enyidar brɛ Wo.

MHB 241
4 . Not in our failures only and our sadness
We seek Thy presence, Comforter and Friend;
O rich man’s Guest, be with us in our gladness,
O poor man’s Mate, our lowliest tasks attend.	 ~ 	4 . Nnyɛ hɛn asehwe na awerɛhow nko mu
Na yɛhwehwɛ W', Ɔwo Boafo, Nyɛnko,
Adzefo hɔn Hɔhoe, hɛn enyigye m' bɛn hɛn
Ehiafo Adamfo, bra hɛn dwumadzi m'.

MHB 242
1 . COME, Thou long-expected Jesus,
Born to set Thy people free,
From our fears and sins release us;
Let us find our rest in Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . BRA, Jesus a yɛatweɔn Wo akyɛr,
Wɔwoo W' dɛ bɛgye W'nkorɔfo;
Yi hɛn fi hɛn suro na bɔn mu,
Ma yeenya ahomgye Wo mu.

MHB 242
2 . Israel’s strength and consolation,
Hope of all the earth Thou art;
Dear Desire of every nation,
Joy of every longing heart.
	 ~ 	2 . Israel 'hoɔdzen na awerɛkyekyer,
Wiadze nyina enyidar nye W';
Wiadze nyina ahwehwɛdze,
Akoma biara enyigye.

MHB 242
3 . Born Thy people to deliver,
Born a child and yet a king,
Born to reign in us for ever,
Now Thy gracious kingdom bring.
 	 ~ 	3 . Wɔwoo W' dɛ bɛgye Wo nkorɔfo,
Wɔwoo Wo abofra Ɔhen,
Wɔwoo W' ma eedzi hen hɛn mu daa,
Fa W'ahendzi n' bra sesei.

MHB 242
4 . By Thine own eternal Spirit
Rule in all our hearts alone;
By Thine all-sufficient merit
Raise us to Thy glorious throne.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Fa Wankasa Wo Sunsum no
Bedzi hen hɛn akoma m';
Dua Wo dzibew abɔso n' do ma
Hɛn do kɔ W'ahengua n' do.  Amen.

MHB 243
1 . JESUS, the Conqueror, reigns,
In glorious strength arrayed,
His kingdom over all maintains,
And bids the earth be glad.
Ye sons of men, rejoice
In Jesu’ mighty love;
Lift up your heart, lift up your voice,
To Him who rules above.
	 ~ 	1 . KONYIMDZIFO n' dzi hen,
Wɔ ''nyimnyam ahoɔdzen m',
Odzi hen aman nyina do;
Ɔma wiadze enyigye,
Nyimpa mba,, hom nczi dɛw 
Jesus dɔ kɛse n' mu;
Hom mma hom akoma, na ndze do
Mma Nyia odzi hen wɔ sor n'.

MHB 243
2 .  Extol His kingly power,
Kiss the exalted Son,
 Who died; and lives, to die no more,
High on His Father’s throne;
Our Advocate with God,
He undertakes our cause,
 And spreads through all the earth abroad
 The victory of His cross. 
	 ~ 	2 . Yi N'ahentum ayɛw,
Hua ɔba a wɔakrɔn No n',
Owui, ɔtse ase, onnkowu bio,
Ɔtse N' Egya egua do;
Nyame m' hɛn Dzimafo,
Odzi hɛn asɛm ma hɛn,
Na ɔdze Ne mbeamudua n' konyimdzi
No tahye mbea nyina.

MHB 243
3 . Courage ! your Captain cries,
Who all your toil forknew:
Toil ye shall have; yet all despise,
 I have o’ercome for you.
 This is the victory!
 Before our faith they fall;
Jesus hath died for you and me;
Believe, and conquer all !	 ~ 	3 . Hom Sahen se, Hyɛ dzen!
Ɔno a onyim hom berɛ;
Hom bɛberɛ dze; hom mbu n'anhwer;
Medzi nyim ama hom,
Konyimdzi no nye yi!
Wɔhwɛ hɛn gyedzi enyim;
Jesus ewu ama me nye wo;
Gye dzi na dzi konyim.

MHB 244
1 . HE head that once was crowned with thorns
Is crowned with glory now;
A royal diadem adorns
The mighty Victor’s brow.
	 ~ 	1 . TSIR a wɔdze nsoɛ hyɛɛ n'ahenkyɛw n',
Wɔahyɛ n' enyimnyam kyɛw;
Ahenkyɛw na afei wɔdze
Ahyɛ konyimdzifo n'.

MHB 244
2 . The highest place that heaven affords
Is His, is His by right,
The King of kings, and Lord of lords,
And heaven’s eternal Light.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔsor dzibea a ɔkrɔn koraa
Yɛ Nedze, odzi wɔ N';
'Hemfo Hen, ewuranom Wura,
Ɔsor man mu kandzea.

MHB 244
3 . The joy of all who dwell above,
The joy of all below
To whom He manifests His love,
And grants His name to know.
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔsor atsefo nyina dɛw,
Asaase mba nyin dɛw,
Hɔn a oyi No dɔ kyerɛ hɔn
Na ɔma wohu Ne dzin.

MHB 244
4 . To them the cross, with all its shame,
With all its grace, is given,
Their name an everlasting name, 
Their joy the joy of heaven.
	 ~ 	4 . Wɔdze mbeamudua nye n'enyiwu,
Nye n'adom nyina ama hɔn;
Hɔn dzin yɛ dzin a ɔwɔ hɔ daa,
Hɔn dɛw yɛ ɔsor dɛw.

MHB 244
5 . They suffer with their Lord below,
They reign with Him above;
Their profit and their joy to know
The mystery of His love. 
 	 ~ 	5 . Wɔnye hɔn Wura hu amandze ha,
Wɔnye N' dzi hen wɔ sor,
Hɔn enyigye nyina nye dɛ
Wɔbɛtse No dɔ ase.

MHB 244
6 . The Cross He bore is life and health,
Though shame and death to Him; 
His people’s hope, His people’s wealth
Their everlasting theme.	 ~ 	6 . Ne mbeamudua n' yɛ nkwa na ahoɔdzen,
Eso ɔyɛ wu na fɛr;
No nkorɔfo enyidar na ahonya,
Dza wɔdwen ho daa nyina.

MHB 245
1 . HAIL to the Lord’s Anointed;
Great David’s greater Son!
Hail, in the time appointed,
His reign on earth begun!
He comes to break oppression,
To set the captive free,
To take away transgression,
And rule in equity.
 	 ~ 	1 . HUA Nyia Ewuradze asera n;
David ne Ba kɛse n'!
Hua N'! Ber a wɔahyɛ n' Hen mu, na
Ɔhyɛɛ ase dzii hen ha, 
Ɔbae bɛsɛɛ n-hyɛdo,
Bɛgyee adaduafo,
Ɔbae beyii bɔn fii hɔ,
Dze pɛrpɛr hyɛɛ anan m'.

MHB 245
2 . He comes, with succour speedy,
To those who suffer wrong;
To help the poor and needy,
And bid the weak be strong:
To give them songs for sighing,
Their darkness turn to light,
Whose souls, condemned and dying,
Were precious in His sight.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔba ntsɛm dɛ ɔbɔboa
Hɔn a woruhu amandze;
Dɛ ɔbɔboa ehiafo,
Mberɛwyɛfo enya ahoɔdzen;
Hɔn apensi adan ndwom;
Hɔn sum adan ekan,
Hɔn a hɔn akra ruwu n,
Wɔsom bo wɔ N'enyim.

MHB 245
3 . He shall come down like showers
Upon the fruitful earth:
Love, joy, and hope, like flowers,
Spring in His path to birth:
Before Him on the mountains,
Shall peace the herald, go;
And righteousness in fountains,
From hill to valley flow.
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔbɛba dɛ mpetsema
Abɔfɔw asaase;
Ɔdɔ, dɛw enyidar, nhyiren
Bedzi N'awoe enyim;
'Somdwee bedzi N'enyim kan
Abɔ No dawur yie;
Na tsenenee bɛtsen dɛ nsu,
Fi bepɔw do esian.

MHB 245
4 . Kings shall bow down before Him,
And gold and incense bring;
All nations shall adore Him,
His praise all people sing;
To Him shall prayer unceasing
And daily vows ascend;
His kingdom still increasing,
A kingdom without end.
	 ~ 	4 . Ahemfo bɔhwe N'enyim,
Dze sika, nduhuam aba;
Aman nyina bɔtonton No,
Nkorɔfo beyi N'ayɛw;
Mpaabɔ a ɔmmbɔ adze da
Bɔfow edu N'enyim;
N'ahendzi bɛyɛ kɛse,
Ɔnnkɔbɔ adze da.

MHB 245
5 . O’er every foe victorious,
He on His throne shall rest;
From age to age more glorious,
All-blessing and all-blest.
The tide of time shall never
His covenant remove;
His name shall stand for ever,
His changeless name of Love.	 ~ 	5 . Ɔdze N'ahengua besi 
N'atamfo nyina do;
Mfesantsen nyina ɔbɛyɛ
Onyimnyamfo, Siarfo,
Mbersatsen so runntum nnyi 
N'ahyɛmu mmfi hɔ da;
No dɔ dzin a ɔnnsesa da n'
Bɛtsena hɔ daapem.

MHB 246
1 . EARTH, rejoice, our Lord is King !
Sons of men, His praises sing;
Sing ye in triumphant strains,
Jesus the Messiah reigns !
	 ~ 	1 . HOM ndzi dɛw, hɛn Wura yɛ Hen!
Nyimpa mba, hom nyi N' ayɛw,
Hom ntow ndwom wɔ konyimdzi m',
Jesus Messiah dzi Hen!

MHB 246
2 . Power is all to Jesus given,
Lord of hell, and earth, and heaven,
Every knee to Him shall bow;
Satan, hear, and tremble now!
	 ~ 	2 . Wɔdze tum nyina ama Jesus,
Hɛll, asaase na sor Wura,
Kotodwe biara bɔkotow N',
'Bɔnsam tse a, no ho wosow.

MHB 246
3 . Angels and archangels join,
All triumphantly combine,
All in Jesu’s praise agree,
Carrying on His victory. 
	 ~ 	3 . Abɔfo nyina ka bɔ m';
Konyimdzi mu wɔyɛ kor,
Wɔtow Jesus N'ayɛyi,
Wɔtoa No konyimdzi n' do.

MHB 246
4 . Though the sons of night blaspheme,
More there are with us than them; 
God with us, we cannot fear; 
Fear, ye fiends, for Christ is here ! 
	 ~ 	4 . Sɛ sum mba ma mbusu ba a,
Hɔn a wɔka hɛn ho sen hɔn;
Nyame ka hɛn ho, yennsuro,
Christ wɔ ha ntsi abɔn nsuro.

MHB 246
5 . Lo ! to faith’s enlightened sight,
All the mountain flames with light; 
Hell is nigh, but God is nigher, 
Circling us with hosts of fire.
	 ~ 	5 . Hwɛ! Gyedi gya no redzɛw
Wɔ bepɔw no do nyina,
Nyankopɔn bɛn hɛn sen hɛll,
Ɔdze ogya etwa hɛn ho.

MHB 246
6 . Christ the Saviour is come down,
Points us to the victor’s crown,
Bids us take our seats above,
More than conquerors in His love.	 ~ 	6 . Agyenkwa Christ aba famu,
Ɔkyerɛ hɛn konyim ahenkyɛw n;
Ɔma hɛn egua wɔ sor,
Yɛyɛ N' dɔ m' konyimdzifo.

MHB 247
1 . REJOICE, the Lord is King!
Your Lord and King adore;
Mortals, give thanks, and sing, 
And triumph evermore:
 
    Lift up your heart, lift up your voice;
    Rejoice; again I say, Rejoice.
	 ~ 	1 . Dzi dɛw, Nyame yɛ Hen! 
Kotow w' Ewuradze;
Ɔdasanyi, tow ndwom,
Na dzi dɛw daa nyina:

   Ma w' akoma nye wo ndze do; 
   Dzi dɛw, mese wo dɛ, Dzi dɛw.

MHB 247
2 . Jesus the Saviour reigns,
The God of truth and love;
When He had purged our stains,
He took His seat above:
 	 ~ 	2 . Agyenkwa Christ dzi hen, 
Nokwar nye dɔ dzi wɔ n';
Ɔhoor hɛn ho fi no,
Ɔgyee egua wɔ sor:

MHB 247
3 . His kingdom cannot fail,
He rules o’er earth and heaven;
The keys of earth and hell
Are to our Jesus given:
	 ~ 	3 . N' ahendzi mmbɔ adze da, 
No tum wɔ sor na ase;
Wɔdze samandze;
Saafee ama Jesus:

MHB 247
4 . He sits at God’s right hand,
Till all His foes submit,
And bow to His command,
And fall beneath His feet:
 	 ~ 	4 . Ɔtse Nyame nyimfa 
Kɛpem dɛ N' atamfo
Bɔbɔ hɔn mu adze
Edzi N' ahyɛdze do:

MHB 247
5 . He all His foes shall quell,
Shall all our sins destroy,
And every bosom swell
With pure seraphic joy:
 	 ~ 	5 . Obedzi nyim ewie, 
Oetu hɛn bɔn nyina,
Ma dasanyi biara
Eenya sor enyigye:

MHB 247
6 . Rejoice in glorious hope;
Jesus the Judge shall come, 
 And take His servants up
To their eternal home:
 
     We soon shall hear the ’archangel’s voice;
     The trump of God shall sound, Rejoice!	 ~ 	6 . Dzi dɛw enyidadom'; 
Hɛn Jesus bɛba bio
Abɛfa hɛn akɔ
Hɛn domankoma fie:

MHB 248
1 . JESU, the word bestow,
The true immortal seed ;
Thy gospel then shall greatly grow,
 And all our land o’erspread ;
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, ka asɛm no,
Nokwar aba a onnwu n;
W'asɛmpa no bɛtserɛw kɛse
Wɔ hɛn asaase do nyina.

MHB 248
2 . Through earth extended wide
Shall mightily prevail,
 Destroy the works of self and pride,
 And shake the gates of hell.
	 ~ 	2 . Wiadze afanan nyina
Obedzi konyim yie,
Ɔbɛsɛɛ hɛn honam ndwuma,
Ɔawosow hɛll mbobow.

MHB 248
3 .  Its energy exert
 In the believing soul;
 Diffuse Thy grace through every part,
And sanctify the whole;
	 ~ 	3 . Ma W'ahoɔdzen no nhɛn
'Kra gyedzinyi biara m';
Ma W'adom n; ngugu beebiara,
Na ɔntsew ne nyina ho.

MHB 248
4 . Its utmost virtue show
In pure consummate love,
And fill with all Thy life below,
And give us Thrones above.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Ma Wo su pa nda edzi
Wɔ ɔdɔ krɔnkrɔn mu;
Fa Wo nkwa n' hyɛ hɛn ma wɔ ha,
Ma hɛn ahengua wɔ sor.  Amen.

MHB 249
1 . IN the Name of Jesus
Every knee shall bow,
Every tongue confess Him
King of Glory now.
’Tis the Father’s pleasure
 We should call Him Lord,
 Who from the beginning 
 Was the mighty Word.
 	 ~ 	1 . JESUS Ne dzin no mu
'Biara bobu ntwɛr,
Obiara bɛka dɛ
Ɔyɛ Enyimnyam Hen,
Ɔyɛ Egya Ne pɛ
Dɛ yɛfrɛ N' Owura,
Nyia ahyɛse n' ɔyɛ
Tum Asɛm pa no.

MHB 249
2 . Humbled for a season,
 To receive a name
From the lips of sinners
 Unto whom He came,
Faithfully He bore it
Spotless to the last,
 Brought it back victorious,
 When from death he passed. 
 	 ~ 	2 . Wɔbrɛɛ N' ase kakra
Ma oeenya abɔdzin
Efi abɔnfo ano,
Hɔn ntsi na ɔbae;
Ɔfaa mu nokwar mu
Dze kodur ewiei,
Na oduaa owu mu
Puee konyimdzi mu.

MHB 249
3 . Name Him, brothers, name Him,
 With love strong as death,
 But with awe and wonder, 
 And with bated breath; 
 He is God the Saviour, 
 He is Christ the Lord,
 Ever to be worshipped,
 Trusted, and adored.
	 ~ 	3 . Enuaam, ɔdɔ dzen mu,
Hom mma N' dzin kɛse,
Hom mfa suro na ahobow
Na ahopopo;
Ɔyɛ Nyame Agyenkwa,
Ɔyɛ Christ Owura;
Ɔsɛ dɛ yɛsɔr No,
Twer No daa nyina.

MHB 249
4 .  In your hearts enthrone Him;
There let Him subdue
 All that is not holy,
All that is not true;
 Crown Him as your captain
 In temptation’s hour;
 Let His will enfold you
 In its light and power.
	 ~ 	4 . Si No hen W'akoma m',
Ma ondzi dza ho
Nntsew na ɔnnyɛ nokwar,
No so nyina do;
Ma ɔnyɛ wo Sahen,
Wo nsɔhwɛ ber mu;
Ma Ne pɛ nka wo mfua,
Wɔ kan na tum mu.

MHB 249
5 . Brothers, this Lord Jesus
Shall return again
With His Father’s glory,
 With His angel train;
 For all wreaths of empire
 Meet upon His brow,
And our hearts confess Him
King of Glory now.	 ~ 	5 . Enuanom Jesus yi
Ɔbɛsan aba;
Ɔdze N'Egya enyimnyam
Na N'abɔfo dɔm;
Wɔdze aman abɔtsir nyina
Bɛhyɛ N' ahenkyɛw;
Hɛn akoma gye No to m'
Dɛ ''Nyimnyam Hen ndɛ.

MHB 25
1 . ROUND the lord in glory seated,
Cherubim and seraphim
Filled Ilis temple, and repeated
Each to each the alternate hymn:
       Lord, Thy glory fills the heaven,
       Earth is with its fullness stored:
       Unto Thee be glory given,
       Holy, holy, holy Lord!
	 ~ 	1 . CHERUBIM na seraphim nyina,
Etwa ehyia Ewuradze ho,
Wɔahyɛ N'asɔrdan no mu ma
Oyi ka a na oyi agye do:

MHB 25
2 . Heaven is still with glory ringing.
Earth takes up the angels' cry,
Holy, holy. holy, singing,
Lord of Hosts, the Lord most High:	 ~ 	2 . W'enyimnyam ahyɛ ɔsor ma
Wiadze esi ne sibea:
Ɔwo na yɛdze enyimnyam ma W',
Kronkron, kronkron, Ewuradze!

MHB 25
3 . With His seraph-train before Him.
With His holy church below,
Thus unite we to adore Him.
Bid we thus our anthem flow:
	Amen.	 ~ 	3 . Enyimnyam regyegye wɔ sor, 
Asaase gye ndwom no do,
Wɔtow no dɛ, krɔnkrɔn, 
krɔnkrɔn Dɔm Ewuradze a ewɔ sor:

MHB 250
1 . SALVATION! O the joyful sound!
What music to our ears!
 A sovereign balm for every wound,
A cordial for our fears.
   Glory, honour, praise, and power,
      Be unto the Lamb for ever!
   Jesus Christ is our Redeemer:
     Hallelujah, Praise the Lord.
	 ~ 	1 . N-KWAGYE ! O enyigye ndze!
Hɛn asomu ndwom dɛɛdɛw!
Seradze a wɔdze yɛ epirakur do 
Dza ɔdwedwe hɛn suro.

MHB 250
2 . Salvation! O thou bleeding Lamb,
To Thee the praise belongs;
 Salvation shall inspire our hearts,
And dwell upon our tongues.
	 ~ 	2 . Enyimnyam, ayɛyi nye tum
Ɔnka Eguambaa n' afebɔɔ!
Jesus Christ nye hɛn Pomfo no, 
Alleluia ! Yi N' ayɛw.

MHB 250
3 . Salvation ! Let the echo fly
The spacious earth around;
 While all the armies of the sky 
Conspire to raise the sound.	 ~ 	3 . N-kwagye ! O Eguambaa pa!
Ayɛyi yɛ Wodze;
Nkwagye bekenyan hɛn akoma,
Na atsena hɛn gyirama do.

MHB 251
1 . OMNIPOTENT Redeemer, 
Our ransomed souls adore Thee;
 Whate’er is done
 Thy work we own,
 And give Thee all the glory;
 With thankfulness acknowledge
 Our time of visitation;
 Thine hand confess,
 And gladly bless
 The God of our salvation.
	 ~ 	1 . OTUMFO Kɛse, Pomfo,
Hɛn akra a apon hɔn tonton Wo;
W'edwuma a ayɛ
Yɛgye to mu,
Yɛdze enyimnyam nyina ma W';
Yɛdze n-daase gye hɛn
Nserahwɛ ber no to mu
Yɛgye W' nsaano 
Edwuma to m',
Hyira hɛn, nkwagye Nyame.

MHB 251
2 . Thou hast employed Thy servants,
And blessed their weak endeavours,
 And lo! in Thee
 We myriads see
 Of practical believers;
 The church of pardoned sinner 
 Sing all day long
 The gospel song,
 And triumph in Thy favour. 
	 ~ 	2 . Edze ndwuma ahyɛ Wo nkowaa nsa,
Ehyira hɔn mbɔdzen do;
Na hwɛ, Wo mu
Yehu dɔm pii,
Agyedzifo a atsew hɔn ho;
Ndzebɔnyɛfo a 'dze akyɛ hɔn
Yi hɔn Gyefo no ayɛw;
Wɔtow ndwom daa,
Asɛmpa ndwom n',
Dzi nyim wɔ W'ayamuyie mu.

MHB 251
3 . Thy wonders wrought already
Require our ceaseless praises; 
 But show Thy power,
 And myriads more
 Endue with heavenly graces.
 But fill our earth with glory, 
 And, known by every nation,
 God of all grace
 Receive the praise
 Of all Thy new creation.  Amen.	 ~ 	3 . W'anwanwadze a ayɛ ewie
Fata hɛn daa daa ayɛyi ;
Na kyerɛ Wo tum,
Fa sor adom
Hyɛ nyimpa dɔm ma mbordo;
Fa nyam hyɛ hɛn asaase ma,
Na ɔman biara nyim Wo yi,
Adom Nyame,
Gye ayɛyi a
W'abɔdze fofor dze ma W'.  Amen.

MHB 252
1  . GOD is with us, God is with us,
So our brave forefathers sang,
 Far across the field of battle
 Loud their holy war- cry rang;
 Never once they feared and faltered, 
 Never once they ceased to sing: 

      God is with us, God is with us,
      Christ our Lord shall reign as King ! 
 	 ~ 	1 . NYAME ka hɛn ho daa nyina,
Ndwom a hɛn egyanom towee nye n',
Ber a wɔwɔ akono ekyirekyir;
Hɔn ko ndwom krɔnkrɔn n' gyegyee;
Woennsuro na wɔanntɔ dɔnsuar,
Woenngyaa dɛ wɔtow ndwom dɛ.
    Nyame ka hɛn ho daa nyina,
   Christ hɛn Wura bedzi Hen!

MHB 252
2 . Great the heritage they left us,
Great the conquests to be won,
 Armèd hosts to meet and scatter,
 Larger duties to be done.
 Raise the song they nobly taught us,
 Round the wide world let it ring: 
	 ~ 	2 . Wogyaa hɛn egyapadze kɛse,
Ɔwɔ dɛ yedzi konyim,
Dɔm a ɔwɔ dɛ yɛbɔ petse,
Dwuma kɛse a ɔwɔ dɛ yedzi;
Yɛntow ndwom a wɔkyerɛɛ hɛn no
Mfa ntwa wiadze nyina ho.

MHB 252
3 .  Speed the cross through all the nations,
 Speed the victories of love, 
 Preach the Gospel of redemption
 Wheresoever men may move;
 Make the future in the present,
 Strong of heart, toil on and sing:
 	 ~ 	3 . Hom mfa mbeamudua n' nkyin mbea nyina,
Hom mma ɔdɔ ndzi konyim,
Hom nka ɔgye ho asɛmpa n'
Beebiara a nyimpa bɔkɔ;
Hom ntwe ɔkyena mbra enyim,
Hom mmia hom enyi ntow ndwom:

MHB 252
4 . Soon the struggle will be over,
 Soon the flags of strife be furled;
 Downward from his place, defeated,
 Shall the enemy be hurled;
 Onward, then, with ranks unbroken, 
 Sure of triumph, shout and sing:	 ~ 	4 . Ɔnnkɛkyɛr ɔkɔ no botwa,
Yebenyam aperdzi frankaa n,;
Atamfo a yeedzi hɔn do n'
Boguan efi akono;
Hom nkɔ kan, hom nntsetsew hom mu,
Hom ntsea m' ntow konyimdzi ndwom.

MHB 253
1 . BREAK, day of God, O break,
 Sweet light of heavenly skies!
 I all for thee forsake, 
 And from my dead self rise:
 O Lamb of God, whose love is light,
 Shine on my soul, and all is bright.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME adzekyee, bra!
Ɔsor kan fɛɛfɛw pa,
Migyaa ne nyina mu ma W',
Mosoɛr fi mo mu pirim;
Nyame Eguambaa a Wo dɔ yɛ kan,
Hyerɛn me kra do na ɔnyɛ kann.

MHB 253
2 . Break, day of God, O break!
 The night has lingered long;
 Our hearts with sighing wake,
We weep for sin and wrong:
O Bright and Morning Star, draw near; 
 O Sun of Righteousness, appear.
	 ~ 	2 . Nyame adzekyee, bra!
Adze asa akyɛr;
Yesi nkrum wɔ hɛn mu,
Yesu wɔ hɛn bɔn ho;
O Anapa Woraba, twe bɛn;
O Tsenenee Ewia, pue na hyerɛn.

MHB 253
3 . Break, day of God, O break!
 The earth with strife is worn;
 The hills with thunder shake,
 Hearts of the people mourn:
 Break, day of God, sweet day of peace, 
 And bid the shout of warriors cease!
	 ~ 	3 . Nyame adzekyee, bra!
Wiadze aberɛ aperdzi;
Aprandaa him akoko,
Nyimpa akoma werɛ how;
Nyame adzekyee, asomdwee da, bra,
Na ma akofo dede no ngyaa!

MHB 253
4 . Break, day of God, O break,
 Like to the days above! 
 Let purity awake,
 And faith, and hope, and love:
 But lo! we see the brightening sky;
 The golden morn is drawing nigh.	 ~ 	4 . Nyame adzekyee, bra
Dɛ sor adzekyee no!
Ma krɔnkrɔn no mbra,
Gyedzi, enyidar na ɔdɔ;
O hwɛ, yehu dɛ wimu rehyerɛn!
Ampa fɛɛfɛw no rebɛn.

MHB 254
1 . HARK what a sound, and too divine for hearing,
 Stirs on the earth and trembles in the air!
Is it the thunder of the Lord’s appearing?
 Is it the music of His people’s prayer? 
	 ~ 	1 . TSIE, ndze bi nye yi, ɔyɛ krɔnkrɔn dodow,
Ɔwosow asaase na mframa mu!
Ewuradze aprandaa na orupue yi?
No nkorɔfo mpaabɔ ndwom nye yi anaa?

MHB 254
2 . Surely He cometh, and a thousand voices
Shout to the saints, and to the deaf are dumb;
Surely He cometh, and the earth rejoices, 
Glad in His coming who hath sworn: I come! 
	 ~ 	2 . Ampa, ɔreba na ndze mpempem tseatsea m'
Kyerɛ ahotsewfo ma mmum mpo tse;
Ampa, ɔreba na asaase dzi dɛw,
Hɔn enyigye wɔ ne mbae m' : Mereba.

MHB 254
3 . This hath He done, and shall we not adore Him?
This shall He do, and can we still despair?
 Come, let us quickly fling ourselves before Him,
 Cast at His feet the burden of our care.
	 ~ 	3 . Iyi na ɔayɛ, na yɛnnkɔtonton No?
Ɔbɛyɛ yi, ana yɛbɛpa abaw?
Bra ma yɛnyɛ ntsɛntsɛm yentwa nhwe N'enyim,
Yɛmfa hɛn dadwen nto N'anan adze.

MHB 254
4 . Yea, through life, and death, through sorrow
        and through sinning
 He shall suffice me, for He hath sufficed:
 Christ is the end, for Christ was the beginning,
 Christ the beginning, for the end is Christ.	 ~ 	4 . N-kwa, owu, awerɛhow na bɔn mu no,
Ɔbɔdɔɔ me so 'siandɛ ɔdɔɔ so;
Christ nye ewiei osiandɛ nna ɔyɛ ahyɛse,
Christ nye ahyɛse, na ewiei nye Christ.

MHB 255
1 . WAKE, awake, for night is flying!
The watchmen on the heights are crying:
Awake, Jerusalem, at last!
 Midnight hears the welcome voices 
 And at the thrilling cry rejoices:
 Come forth, ye virgins, night is past!
 The Bridegroom comes, awake,
 Your lamps with gladness take;
Hallelujah!
  And for His marriage feast prepare,
 For ye must go to meet Him there.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAN, nyan, na anafua repa!
Aban do aweɔmfo no retsea m';
Jerusalem, afei dze nyan!
Esuom tse akɔaba ndze no,
Na ɔma hɔn enyi gye mbordo;
Mbaabun, hom mbra na adze akye!
Ayeforkun n' aba,
Hom mfa hom nkandzea no;
Halleluya!
Hom nyɛ krado mma Ayeforhyia n',
Na ɔwɔ dɛ hom kɔ hɔ kekyia N'.

MHB 255
2 . Zion hears the watchmen singing,
And all her heart with joy is springing;
She wakes, she rises from her gloom;
 For her Lord comes down all glorious,
 The strong in grace, in truth victorious.
 Her Star is risen, her Light is come!
 Ah come, Thou blessèd One, 
God’s own belovèd Son; Hallelujah!
 We follow till the halls we see 
 Where Thou hast bid us sup with Thee.
	 ~ 	2 . Zion tse aweɔmfo ndwom no
Na n'akoma dzi dɛw papaapa;
Onyan, ɔsoɛr fi no sum mu;
Na no Wura sian ba enyimnyam mu,
N'adom nye No nokwardzi dzi mu;
No Woraba epue, ne Kan aba!
Bra, Ɔwo a woehyira Wo,
Nyame No dɔ Ba no;
Halleluya!
Yedzi W'ekyir kohu dan a 
Enye hɛn bedzidzi mu no.

MHB 255
3 . Now let all the heavens adore Thee,
 And men and angels sing before Thee,
 With harp and cymbal’s clearest tone;
 Of one pearl each shining portal,
 Where we are with the choir immortal
 Of angels round Thy dazzling throne;
 Nor eye hath seen, nor ear  
 Hath yet attained to hear
 What there is ours; 
But we rejoice, and sing to Thee 
 Our hymn of joy eternally.	 ~ 	3 . Afei ma ɔsor nyina ntonton Wo,
Nyimpa nye abɔfo ntow Wo ndwom;
Hom mfa sanku a ɔyɛ dɛw;
Hom mfa bobaa hyɛnhyɛnn nkɔ hɔ,
Beebi a yenye adwontofo a wonnwu,
Abɔfo a woetwa ahengua n' ho;
Enyi nnhunii, aso
So mpo nnyaa nntsee nn-siei,
Dza ɔyɛ hɛndze;
Naaso yedzi dɛw na yɛtow
Wo hɛn dɛw ho ndwom daa nyina.

MHB 256
1 . THERE’S a light upon the mountains,and 
      the day is at the spring,
 When our eyes shall see the beauty
and the glory of the King:
 Weary was our heart with waiting, and the night -watch seemed so long;
 But His triumph day is breaking and we hail it with a song.
	 ~ 	1 . EKAN bi wɔ koko no do na da no yɛ adzekyee,
Ber a hɛn enyi bohu ahoɔfɛw Hen no N'enyimnyam;
Yɛberɛe wɔ hɛn atweɔnee m', yɛweɔnee kɔr ekyir dodow,
Naaso No konyim da no reba na yɛdze ndwom behyia N'.

MHB 256
2 . In the fading of the starlight we may see the coming morn;
 And the lights of men are paling in the splendors of the dawn:
 For the eastern skies are glowing as with light of hidden fire,
 And the hearts of men are stirring  with the throbs of deep desire.
	 ~ 	2 . Woraba kan a ɔrepa no mu yehu dɛ adze rekye;
Nyimpa hɔn kandzea ayɛ kusuww wɔ adzekyee hyɛnhyɛn n' mu;
Na boka wimu regyegye ber a nsumaa mu gya rehyerɛn n'
Ma nyimpa akoma dze ɔpɛ kɛse rowosow yi.

MHB 256
3 . There’s a hush of expectation, and a quiet in the air; 
 And the breath of God is moving in the fervent breath of prayer: 
 For the suffering, dying Jesus is the Christ upon the throne,
 And the travail of our spirit is the travail of His own.
	 ~ 	3 . Enyisun kommyɛ bi ɔnye dzinnyɛ bi so wɔ wimu
Na Nyankopɔn ahom bi keka no ho wɔ ndam mpaabɔ m',
'Siandɛ Jesus a oruwu n' nye Christ a ɔtse egua n' do
Na hɛn sunsum n'amandzehu yɛ No so N'amandzehu.

MHB 256
4 . He is breaking down the barriers, He is casting up the way;
 He is calling for His angels to build up the gates of day: 
 But His angels here are human, not the shining hosts above; 
 For the drum -beats of His army are the heart-beats of our love.
	 ~ 	4 . Orububu mpampi nyina egu, orubue kwan no mu;
Ɔrefrɛ N'abɔfoe no dɛ wombuebue adzekyee mbobow n';
Mbom ha abɔfo no yɛ nyimpa, nnyɛ ɔsor dze a 
wɔhyerɛn no a,
Na No nsordaafo akyen ndze nyɛ dɛ dza hɛn akoma bɔtow.

MHB 256
5 . Hark! we hear a distant music and it comes with fuller swell;
 ’Tis the triumph- song of Jesus, of our King, Immanuel:
 Zion, go ye forth with joy to meet Him;
and, my soul, be swift to bring
 All thy sweetest and thy dearest for the triumph of our King! 	 ~ 	5 . Tsie! Yɛtse ndwom fi ekyirkyir, n'ano dzen ara na ɔyɛ,
Ɔyɛ Jesus hɛn Hen Immanuel no konyimdzi ho ndwom;
Zion, soɛr na kehyia No; na me kra, wo so yɛ ntsɛm fa w'
Ndwom a ɔyɛ dɛw mapa, na ɔsom wo bo, brɛ hɛn Hen!

MHB 257
1 .  O COME, O come, Immanuel,
 And ransom captive Israel, 
 That mourns in lonely exile here
 Until the Son of God appear.

         Rejoice! Rejoice! Immanuel
         Shall come to thee, O Israel.
	 ~ 	1 . O bra, O bra Immanuel, 
Na bɔpɔn ndɔmmum Israel,
Ɔka mmɔn ananabea ha
Kodu dɛ Nyame Ba bɛba.
 
Dzi dɛw! Dzi dɛw! Immanuel 
Bɛba wo nkyɛn, O Israel.

MHB 257
2 . O come, O come, Thou Lord of might,
 Who to Thy tribes, on Sinai’s height,
 In ancient times didst give the law
 In cloud, and majesty, and awe.
	 ~ 	2 . O bra, O bra, Wura Tumfo, 
Ɔwo a tsetse n' edze mbra
Maa mbusuakuw wɔ Sinai do
Wɔ fua, hu, nye ahentum mu.

MHB 257
3 . O come, Thou Rod of Jesse, free
Thine own from Satan’s tyranny;
 From depths of hell Thy people save,
And give them victory over the grave. 
 	 ~ 	3 . O bra jesse Poma, bɛgye 
Wo man fi Satan tum ase;
Gye Wo nkorɔfo fi hɛll bun mu,
Ma hɔn konyimdzi wɔ wu do.

MHB 257
4 . O come, Thou Day-spring, come and cheer 
 Our spirits by Thine advent here;
 Disperse the gloomy clouds of night, 
 And death’s dark shadows put to flight
	 ~ 	4 . O bra, Adzekyee Woraba
Ma wo mbae nkyenyan hɛn sunsum;
Bɔbɔ anago sum hwetse,
Bɔ owu sunsuma petse.

MHB 257
5 . O come, Thou Key of David, come,
 And open wide our heavenly home;
 Make safe the way that leads on high,
 And close the path to misery.	 ~ 	5 . O bra, David Saafee, O bra, 
Bue hɛn sor fie pataa ma hɛn,
Yɛ kwan a wɔdze kɔ sor n' sɔnn,
Na siw dza ɔdze mbusu ba n'.

MHB 258
1 . THOU art coming, O my Saviour,
Thou art coming, O my King,
 In Thy beauty all- resplendent,
 In Thy glory all- transcendent;
 Well may we rejoice and sing;
 Coming! In the opening east
 Herald brightness slowly swells;
 Coming! O my glorious Priest,
 Hear we not Thy golden bells?
	 ~ 	1 . Ɔwo reba, reba ampa;
Yebehyia Wo wɔ kwan do,
Yebohu Wo, yebohu W' yie,
Yebehyira W', yɛbɛma eehu,
Hɛn akoma nnkotum aka;
Ndwom dɛɛdɛw na yɛbɔtow,
Yɛdze hɛn dɔ bɛma Wo,
Yɛbɔtow ayɛyi ndwom
Wɔ Woara W'ananadze hɔ.

MHB 258
2 . Thou art coming, Thou art coming;
We shall meet Thee on Thy way,
 We shall see Thee, we shall know Thee,
 We shall bless Thee, we shall show Thee
 All our hearts could ever say;
What an anthem that will be,
 Ringing out our love to Thee,
 Pouring out our rapture sweet,
 At Thine own all- glorious feet.
 	 ~ 	2 . O hɛn Wura dɔfo, hɛn dɛw nye
Yehu W' dɛ eyɛ ɔhen!
Tɛkyerɛma nyina tonton Wo dzin,
Yɛbɔ anosɛɛ dze ɔsom,
Enyidzi, nyam na nhyira brɛ W';
Hɛn Ewuradze na Nyɛnko,
Ɔhen a wɔasam mu eyi,
Wiadze ekyirkyir nyina,
Wɔhyɛ W' enyimnyam, sɔr Wo!

MHB 259
1 . AND art Thou come with us to dwell,
 Our Prince, our Guide, our Love, our Lord?
 And is Thy name Emmanuel,
 God present with His world restored?
	 ~ 	1 . ANA aba rebɛnye hɛn atsena,
Hɛn Hen, hɛn Gyafo, hɛn Ewuradze?
Ana Wo dzin dze Emmanuel,
Nyame nye Ne wiadze abɔ m'?

MHB 259
2 . The world is glad for Thee! The rude
 Wild moor, the city’s crowded pen; 
Each waste, each peopled solitude,
Becomes a home for happy men.
 	 ~ 	2 . Wiadze enya Wo ho enyigye!
Hamu na kurow minstsiminti;
Amamio do na mbrɛ hɔ yɛ 
Kɔnn bɛyɛ tsenabea ama nyimpa.

MHB 259
3 . Thou bringest all again; with Thee
Is light, is space, is breadth and room
For each thing fair, beloved, and free,
To have its hour of life and bloom.
	 ~ 	3 . Edze hɔn nyina aba bio;
Wo mu wɔ kan, bea na ahom
Ma dza oye, yɛ dɔ, dzi n' ho do,
Ma wɔdze eenya nkwa prɔmprɔmyɛ.

MHB 259
4 . Each heart’s deep instinct unconfessed;
 Each lowly wish, each daring claim;
All, all that life hath long repressed
 Unfolds, not fearing blight or blame. 
	 ~ 	4 . Akoma biara n'esumasɛm;
Apɛdze na etumayɛdze;
Dza ɔbra mmpotsi ho nkyerɛ nyina
Da edzi dɛ onnsuro afɔbu.

MHB 259
5 . Thy reign eternal will not cease;
Thy years are sure, and glad, and slow;
Within Thy mighty world of peace
The humblest flower hath leave to blow.
	 ~ 	5 . Wo daa ahendzi nnkɔbɔ adze;
Wo mfesi pi, yɛ dɛw, na nyaa;
W'asomdwee wiadze kɛse 'i mu
Nyiren kumaa biara hyerɛn.

MHB 259
6 . Then come to heal Thy people’s smart,
And with Thee bring Thy captive train; 
 Come, Saviour of the world and heart, 
 Come, mighty Victor over pain.    Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Afei beyi Wo nkorɔfo yaw,
Na fa Wo ndɔmmum ka Wo ho;
Wiadze na akoma Agyenkwa,
Bra, yaw do konyimdzifo, bra.   Amen.

MHB 26
1 . YE holy angels bright,
Who wait at God's right hand,
Or through the realms of light
Fly at your Lord's command,
Assist our song.
Or else the theme
Too high doth seem
For mortal tongue.
	 ~ 	1 . ABƆFO a hom hyerɛn a
Hom gyina Nayme nyimfa,
Na sɛ hom Wura hyɛ hom a,
Hom tu fa kan mu no,
Hom ennsuo mu a,
Yerunntum nntow
Ɔsor ndwom a 
Ɔyɛ dzen no.

MHB 26
2 . Ye blessed souls at rest.
Who see your saviour’s face,
Whose glory, ev'n the least
Is far above our grace.
God's praises sound,
As in His sight
With sweet delight
Ye do abound.
	 ~ 	2 . Hom akra a hom rohom,
Hom hu hom Agyenkwa enyim,
N'enyimnyam m' dza osuar mpo
Bor hɛn adom do koraa.
Hom ntow ayɛyi
Ndwom mma Nyame,
Dɛ mbrɛ hom yɛ
Wɔ N'enyim no.

MHB 26
3 . Ye saints, who toil below,
Adore your heavenly King,
And, onward as ye go,
Some joyful anthem sing;
Take what He gives,
And praise Him still
Through good and ill,
Who ever lives.
	 ~ 	3 . Hom ahotsewfo pa a 
 Hom berɛ wɔ asaase do,
Hom ntonton hom sor Hen,
Ber a hom kɔ kan no;
Hom ntow dɛw ndwom,
Hom ngye dza ɔma.
Yie muo, bɔn mu o,
Hom nyi N'ayɛw.

MHB 26
4 . My soul, bear thou thy part
Triumph in God above.
And with a well-tuned heart
Sing thou the songs of love.
Let all thy days
Till life shall end,
Whate'er He send.
Be filled with praise.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Me kra yɛ w'afamudze,
Dzi konyim Nyame mu,
Na siesie w'akoma.
Wo nkwa nda nyina
Kesi ewiei,
Dza ɔma biara.
Yi No ayɛw.	Amen.

MHB 260
1 . MINE eyes have seen the glory of the coming of the Lord:
 He is trampling out the vintage where the grapes of wrath are stored;
 He hath loosed the fateful lightning of His terrible swift sword:
 His truth is marching on. 
	 ~ 	1 . M'ENYI ehu Ewuradze Ne mbae no ho enyimnyam;
Orikyi nsa beebi a wɔdze ebufuw wenyin gu n o;
Oesian Ne nkrantsee hoɔharfo huuhu no n'enyinam no
No nokwar no ritsim.

MHB 260
2 . He hath sounded forth the trumpet that shall never call retreat;n He is sifting out the hearts of men before His judgment seat:
 O be swift, my soul, to answer Him; be jubilant, my feet!
 Our God is marching on. 
	 ~ 	2 . Oenya obɔ totorbɛnto a ɔnnkɛsam akofo ekyir da,
Ɔresa nyimpa akoma mu wɔ 
N'atsembugua no enyim;
O me kra, yɛ ntsɛm kɛma no mbuae;
M'anan, huruhuruw!
Hɛn Nyame rutu ntsen.

MHB 260
3 . In the beauty of the lilies Christ was born across the sea,
 With a glory in His bosom that transfigures you and me:
 As He died to make men holy, let us live to make men free,
 While God is marching on. 	 ~ 	3 . Wɔwoo Christ sukooko fɛɛfɛw no mu wɔ po ekyir hɔ,
Ɔwɔ 'nyam wɔ No bo mu a ɔbɛsesa emi nye ɔwo;
Owui tseew nyimpa ho ntsi ma
yɛntsena ase mma hɔn ahotɔ,
Ber a Nyame rutu ntsen.

MHB 261
1 . LIGHT of those whose dreary dwelling
Borders on the shades of death,
Come, and by Thy love’s revealing
 Dissipate the clouds beneath; 
The new heaven and earth’s Creator,
In our deepest darkness rise,
Scattering all the night of nature,
Pouring eyesight on our eyes.
	 ~ 	1 . HƆN a wɔda wuso Kandzea,
Bra na fa Wo dɔ n' dɛpam
Owu nye no sum kebii no,
Ma mununkum no nhwetse;
Sor na asaase fofor Bɔfo,
Soɛr wɔ hɛn sum kebii mu,
Na hwetse abɔdze sum nyina,
Na ma hɛn enyi nhu adze.

MHB 261
2 . Still we wait for Thine appearing; 
Life and joy Thy beams impart, 
Chasing all our fears, and cheering 
 Every poor besnighted heart: 
 Come, and manifest the favour
 God hath for our ransomed race;
 Come, Thou universal Saviour,
 Come, and bring the gospel grace.
	 ~ 	2 . Yɛrotweɔn Wo mbae no ara;
Wo kan mbrɛ hɛn nkwa na dɛw,
Ɔmpam nhɛn suro nyinara,
Ɔmfa dɛw nhɛn hɛn akoma m'
Bra na bɛda enyimpa no a
Nyame dze ma adasa edzi;
Bra, wiadze nyina Agyenkwa,
Fa asɛmpa adom no bra.

MHB 261
3 . Save us in Thy great compassion,
O Thou mild, pacific Prince;
Give the knowledge of salvation, 
Give the pardon of our sins: 
By Thy all-restoring merit
Every burdened soul release;
Every weary, wandering spirit 
 Guide into Thy perfect peace.  Amen. 	 ~ 	3 . Fa W'ehumbɔbɔr no gye hɛn,
Ɔhen a edwe koraa;
Ma hɛn n-kwagye ho nyimdzee
Fa hɛn bɔn nyina kyɛ hɛn,
Na W'amayɛ adom no ntsi
Soɛ akra a wɔaberɛ nyina;
Sunsum a wɔnenam nyina
Gye hɔn kɔ W'asomdwee mu.  Amen.

MHB 262
1 . ALL thanks be to God,
 Who scatters abroad,
 Throughout every place,
 By the least of His servants, His savour of grace.
 Who the victory gave, 
The praise let Him have,
 For the work he hath done: 
All honour and glory to Jesus alone! 
	 ~ 	1 . NDAASE nka Nyame,
Ɔno na ɔpetse
N'adom beberee no
Gu No nkowaa a wɔwɔ wiadze nyinara do 
Nyia ɔma konyim n',
Hom nyi No ayɛw,
Oewie dwuma n' dzi;
Enyidzi nye enyimnyam nka Jesus nko!

MHB 262
2 . Our conquering Lord
Hath prospered His word, 
Hath made it prevail, 
And mightily shaken the kingdom of hell. 
His arm He hath bared,
And a people prepared
His glory to show,
And witness the power of His passion below.
 	 ~ 	2 . Hɛn konyim Wura
N'asɛm edzi mu,
Ɔnoara edzi nyim
Na ɔawosow hɛll ahenman no dzendzen,
Oeyi N'abasa,
Oesiesie No dɔm;
Ɔakyerɛ N'enyimnyam
Dze edzi N'amandzehu tum ho dase.

MHB 262
3 . He hath opened a door
To the penitent poor,
 And rescued from sin,
 And admitted the harlots and publicans in;
 They have heard the glad sound, 
They have liberty found 
Through the blood of the Lamb,
And plentiful pardon in Jesus’s name. 
	 ~ 	3 . Oebue abobow n'
Ama ehiafo,
Ɔagye hɔn wɔ bɔn m',
Ɔama ndwaman na atowgyefo aba m';
Wɔastse enyigye ndze,
Woenya fahodzi,
Eguambaa n' bɔgyaa m';
Woenya fakyɛ pii wɔ Jesus Ne dzin mu.

MHB 262
4 . And shall we not sing
 Our Saviour and King?
Thy witnesses, we
With rapture ascribe our salvation to Thee.
Thou, Jesus, hast blessed,
And believers increased,
 Who thankfully own 
 We are freely forgiven through mercy alone. 
	 ~ 	4 . Ana yɛnnkɔtow
Hɛn Agyenkwa Hen ndwom?
Yedzi Wo dase,
Yɛdze enyigye dze hɛn nkwage to Wo do,
'Wo Jesus, ehyira,
Agyedzifo adɔr,
Na yɛdze ndaase
Ka dɛ mbɔbɔrhu m' nko na wɔdze akyɛ hɛn.

MHB 262
5 . His Spirit revives
His work in our lives, 
His wonders of grace,
So mightily wrought in the primitive days. 
O that all men might know
 His tokens below,
 Our Saviour confess,
And embrace the glad tidings of pardon and peace!
	 ~ 	5 . No Sunsum kenyan
No ndwuma wɔ hɛn mu;
N'adom anwanwadze n',
Ɔyɛɛ no tsetseber mu ma ɔboor do,
Nkyɛ nyimpa eehu
Ne nsɛnkyerɛdze no,
Wɔaagye hɛn Agyenkwa n',
Na woeefua fakyɛ na asomdwee nsɛmpa n' mu.

MHB 262
6 . Thou Saviour of all,
Effectually call
The sinners that stray;
And O let a nation be born in a day! 
 Then, then let it spread 
Thy knowledge and dread,
Till the earth is o’erflowed,
And the universe filled with the glory of God.  Amen. 	 ~ 	6 . Hɛn nyina Agyenkwa,
Erefrɛ abɔn a
Wɔafom ɔkwan no;
O ma wontum nnya ɔman kor wɔ da kor!
Na afei ma Wo
Ho nyimdzee ntserɛw
Wiadze mbea nyina,
Na Nyame enyimnyam nhyɛ wiadze nyina ma.   Amen.

MHB 263
1 . SEE how great a flame aspires,
Kindled by a spark of grace!
Jesu’s love the nations fires, 
Sets the kingdoms on a blaze. 
To bring fire on earth He came; 
Kindled in some hearts it is:
O that all might catch the flame, 
 All partake the glorious bliss ! 
	 ~ 	1 . MBRƐ ogya kɛse n' si dzɛw a!
Adom nserama na ɔsɔe,
Jesus dɔ tɔ aman mu,
Ma ne nyina dzɛw framfram,
Ɔdze ogya baa wiadze;
Wɔsɔɔ no wɔ akoma m',
O nkyɛ nyimpa nyina eenya gya n'\n
Na woeenya enyimnyam dɛw n' bi.

MHB 263
2 . When He first the work begun, 
 Small and feeble was His day: 
 Now the world doth swiftly run, 
 Now it wins its widening way; 
 More and more it spreads and grows
 Ever mighty to prevail; 
 Sin’s strongholds it now o’erthrows,
 Shakes the trembling gates of hell.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔhyɛɛ edwuma no ase n',
Nna wonnyaa nntsee Ne nka;
Sesei asɛm no etu ntsen
Na ɔretserɛw kɔ mbea pii;
Ogu do petse na onyin
Kɔ ahoɔdzen konyimdzi mu;
Obubu bɔn akoban,
Wosow hɛll aponkɛse n'.

MHB 263
3 . Sons of God, your Saviour praise! 
He the door hath opened wide; 
He hath given the word of grace,
Jesu’s word is glorified; 
Jesus, mighty to redeem,
 He alone the work has wrought; 
 Worthy is the work of Him,
 Him who spake a world from nought. 
	 ~ 	3 . Nyame mba, hom nyi Agyenkwa ayɛw;
Oebue abow no petee,
Ɔaka adom asɛm no,
Wɔahyɛ asɛm n'enyimnyam
Jesus wɔ tum dɛ ɔgye hɛn,
Ɔno nko dzii dwuma no;
Nyia N'asɛm bɔɔ wiadze no,
N'edwuma nyina dzi mu.

MHB 263
4 . Saw ye not the cloud arise, 
 Little as a human hand?n Now it spreads along the skies, 
 Hangs o’er all the thirsty land:
 Lo! the promise of a shower
 Drops already from above; 
 But the Lord will shortly pour 
 All the Spirit of His love !	 ~ 	4 . Ennhu mununkum kumaa
Dɛ nsakum a ɔwɔ wimu no?
Sesei ɔatserɛw wɔ wimu,
Kata asaase nyina do
Hwɛ! Anohoba mpetsema
Fi sor rososɔ dada;
Ɔnnkɛkyɛr na Ewuradze ehue
No dɔ Sunsum no nyina!

MHB 264
1  . LO! He comes with clouds descending,
 Once for favoured sinners slain;
 Thousand thousand saints attending,
 Swell the triumph of His train: 
        Hallelujah !  
 God appears on earth to reign. 
 	 ~ 	1 . Hwɛ! Ɔdze mununkum risian, 
Nyia da bi ɔtɔɔr hɛn ntsi n';
Ahotsewfo mpempem ka ho,
Dzi N' ekyir kumbɔɔ reba:
Alleluia!
Nyame reba ebedzi hen.

MHB 264
2 . Every eye shall now behold Him 
Robed in dreadful majesty; 
Those who set at naught and sold Him,
Pierced and nailed Him to the tree, 
 Deeply wailing, 
 Shall the true Messiah see.
	 ~ 	2 . Enyienyi nyina bohu No 
Dɛ oewuna ahentar wusuww;
Hɔn a woemmbu N' bi, wɔtɔɔn No n',
Wopirapiraa N', bɔɔ N' mbeamudua mu n'
Wobotwa ewuo,
Da a wobohu Messiah n'.

MHB 264
3 . The dear tokens of His passion
 Still His dazzling body bears,
 Cause of endless exultation
 To His ransomed worshippers:
 With what rapture
 Gaze we on those glorious scars!
 	 ~ 	3 . N' amandzehu ho nsɛnkyerɛdze 
Da ho ara wowɔ No ho;
Dza N' asomfo a wɔapon hɔn no
Dzi ho ehurusi daa n';
Yɛdze dɛw bɛn
Bɔhwɛ enyimnyam etua n'.

MHB 264
4 . Yea, Amen ! let all adore Thee,
 High on Thy eternal throne; 
 Saviour, take the power and glory,
 Claim the kingdom for Thine own; 
       Hallelujah !
 Everlasting God, come down !	 ~ 	4 . Ɔnyɛ hɔ! nkorɔfo nyina mbu W' ntwɛr 
Wo domankoma ahengua n' enyim;
Gyefo, gye tum na enyimnyam no,
Gye ahendzi n' yɛ Wodze;
Alleluia!
Onnyiewiei Nyankopɔn, sian!

MHB 265
1 . LIFT up your heads, ye gates of brass, 
Ye bars of iron, yield,
And let the King of Glory pass;
 The Cross is in the field.
	 ~ 	1 . MBOBOW pa, hom mma hom tsir do,
Ndadzeban, hom mbuebue,
Mom mma Enyimnyan Hen no mbɛsen;
Mbeamudua n' wɔ akono.

MHB 265
2 . Ye armies of the living God,
 His sacramental host, 
 Where hallowed footsteps never trod, 
 Take your appointed post. 
 	 ~ 	2 . Tseasefo Nyame N'akofo,
No nsordaafo krɔnkrɔn,
Hom ngyinangyina hom gyinabea,
Mbrɛ anan nntsiaa hɔ da.

MHB 265
3 . Though few and small and weak your bands,
 Strong in your Captain’s strength, 
Go to the conquest of all lands;
 All must be His at length.
 	 ~ 	3 . Hom suar na hom ahoɔdzen suar dze,
Hom Sahen N'ahoɔdzen m',
Hom nkedzi nyim nsaase nyina do;
Ne nyina bɛyɛ Nedze.

MHB 265
4 . O fear not, faint not, halt not now;
Quit you like men, be strong;
To Christ shall every nation bow, 
 And sing with you this song: 
 	 ~ 	4 . Mma hom nnsuro, hom nntɔ bahaw;
Hom nko dɛ mbarimba;
Aman nyina bɔkotow Christ,
Nye hom atow ndwom yi.

MHB 265
5 . Uplifted are the gates of brass;
 The bars of iron yield; 
 Behold the King of Glory pass!
The Cross hath won the field. 	 ~ 	5 . Ayewa mbobow n' ebuebue;
Ndadzeban n' ebuebue;
Hwɛ, Enyimnyam Hen no resen!
Mbeamudua n' edzi nyim.

MHB 266
1 . FROM north and south and east and west,
 When shall the peoples, long unblest, 
 All find their everlasting rest,
 O Christ, in Thee?
 	 ~ 	1 . FI kwaam' 'naafo, boka, na anee,
Dabɛn na hͻn a wͻahwer nhyira
Hͻn nyina benya daa ahomgye
Wͻ Christ Wo mu?

MHB 266
2 . When shall the climes of ageless snow
 Be with the Gospel light aglow,
 And all men their Redeemer know,
 O Christ, in Thee? 
	 ~ 	2 . Dabɛn na 'sukwankyɛba man
Dze Asɛmpa kandzea bɛdzɛw
Na nyimpa eh nyina hͻn Pomfo
Wͻ Christ, Wo mu?

MHB 266
3 . When on each southern balmy coast, 
 Shall ransomed men, in countless host,
 Rise, heart and voice, to make sweet boast, 
 O Christ, in Thee? 
	 ~ 	3 . Dabɛn na anaafo mpoano nyina
Mu dͻm a wͻapon hͻn nyinara
Bͻsoɛr na wͻahoahoa hͻnho
Wͻ Christ Wo mu?

MHB 266
4 . O when in all the orient lands,
 From cities white and flaming sands,
 Shall men lift dedicated hands,
 O Christ, in Thee?
	 ~ 	4 . Dabɛn na boka nsaase n' do
Anhweahyew nkurow mu nyimpa
Bɛna hͻn nsa do wͻ som mu.
Ama Wo, Christ?

MHB 266
5 . O when shall heathen darkness roll
Away in light, from pole to pole,
 And endless day by every soul 
Be found in Thee? 
	 ~ 	5 . Dabɛn na wiadzefo befi
Sum no mu aba kan no mu,
Na ͻkra biara benya daa
Kan wͻ Wo mu?

MHB 266
6 . Bring, Lord, the long- predicted hour,
 The ages’ diadem and flower,
When all shall find their refuge-tower
 And home in Thee.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Ewuradze, ma nkͻnhyɛ ber n’ mbra;
Tsetse ahenkyɛw na nhyiren n’.
Obiara benya guandͻbea.
Fie wͻ Wo mu.

MHB 267
1  . LORD, her watch Thy Church is keeping;
 When shall earth Thy rule obey?
 When shall end the night of weeping? 
 When shall break the promised day? 
 See the whitening harvest languish, 
 Waiting still the labourers’ toil; 
 Was it vain, Thy Son’s deep anguish?n Shall the strong retain the spoil? 
 	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, W'asɔr no roweɔn;
Dabɛn na wiadze betsie W'?
Dabɛn na anafua su botwa?
Bɔhyɛ da n' bɛba dabɛn?
Hwɛ dɛ ndɔbaa ber enya edu
Rotweɔn apaafo n' ara!
Wo Ba N'ahoguan no yɛɛ kwa?
Hoɔdzenfo mfa asadze.

MHB 267
2 . Tidings, sent to every creature, 
 Millions yet have never heard; 
 Can they hear without a preacher? 
 Lord Almighty, give the word:
 Give the word; in every nation
 Let the gospel trumpet sound, 
 Witnessing a world’s salvation 
To the earth’s remotest bound. 
 	 ~ 	2 . Wɔdze nsɛmpa n' ama obiara,
Naaso mpempem nnyaa nntsee koraa;
Obi annka a, aso wɔbɛtse?
Owura Tumfo, ka asɛm no;
Ka asɛm no; aman nyina mu,
Ma asɛmpa abɛn nhɛn;
Ngye wiadze nyina nkwagye
Dase nkesi wiadze ano.

MHB 267
3 . Then the end: Thy Church completed, 
 All Thy chosen gathered in,
 With their King in glory seated, 
 Satan bound, and banished sin; 
 Gone for ever parting, weeping,
Hunger, sorrow, death, and pain:
 Lo, her watch Thy Church is keeping;
 Come, Lord Jesus, come to reign!   Amen.	 ~ 	3 . Ewiei no, W'asɔr dzi mu a,
Hɔn a eyi hɔn nyina bɛba m'
Nye hɔn Hen n' atsena 'nyimnyam mu,
Wɔakyekyer abɔnsam na bɔn;
Osu, ɔkɔm awerɛhow,
Owu na yaw nnyi hɔ bio;
Hwɛ! W'asɔr so roweɔn ara;
Owur Jesus, bedzi hen!

MHB 268
1 . LIGHT of the lonely pilgrim’s heart,
 Star of the coming day,
 Arise, and with Thy morning beams
 Chase all our griefs away.
 	 ~ 	1 . Kwantunyi ankonam ne kan, 
Adzekyee Woraba,
Pue, na tow W' anapa nserɛmɛn n'
Fa pam hɛn yaw nyina.

MHB 268
2 . Come, blessed Lord, bid every shore
 And answering island sing
 The praises of Thy royal name,
 And own Thee as their King. 
 	 ~ 	2 . Ewuradze siarfo, ma mbeambea 
Na nsupruw nyina ntow
Ndwom nyi W' adehye Dzin ayɛw,
Wɔmfa Wo nyɛ hɔn Hen.

MHB 268
3 . Bid the whole earth, responsive now
 To the bright world above, 
 Break forth in rapturous strains of joy 
 In memory to Thy love. 
	 ~ 	3 . Ma wiadze nyinara a afei 
Wɔasɛ sor man hyɛnhyɛnn n',
Wɔmma ehurusi ndwom do
Wɔmfa nkaa Wo dɔ no.

MHB 268
4 . Jesus, Thy fair creation groans -
 The air, the earth, the sea -
 In unison with all our hearts, 
 And calls aloud for Thee. 
	 ~ 	4 . Jesus, W' abɔdze risi nkrum- 
Asaase, Po, nye wim'-
Wɔnye hɛn akoma yɛ kor
Kekam' dzendzen frɛ Wo.

MHB 268
5 . Thine was the Cross, with all its fruits
 Of grace and peace divine;
 Be Thine the crown of glory now, 
 The palm of victory Thine.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Mbeamudua n' n' adom, n' asomdwee 
Ne nyinara Wodze a,
Afei enyimnyam ahenkyɛw n'
Na konyim n' nyɛ Wodze.    Amen.

MHB 269
1 . SAVIOUR, we know Thou art
 In every age the same: 
 Now, Lord, in ours exert
 The virtue of Thy name;
 And daily, through Thy word, increase
 Thy blood-besprinkled witnesses.
	 ~ 	1 . AGYENKWA, yenyim dɛ 
Ennsesa ara da;
Afei fa Wo dzin no
Mu ndzepa hyɛ hɛn mu,
Na dabiara dua W'asɛm do
Ma Wo bɔgyaa adasefo ndɔr.

MHB 269
2 . Thy people, saved below,
From every sinful stain,
 Shall multiply and grow,
 If Thy command ordain;
 And one into a thousand rise, 
 And spread Thy praise through earth and skies.
	 ~ 	2 . Wo nkorɔfo a agye hɔn
Efi bɔn nkekaa mu n',
Sɛ ehyɛ dɛ ɔmbra mu a,
Wɔbɔdɔr na woenyin,
Na ankor bɛyɛ apem asoɛr
Eyi W' ayɛw wɔ ase nye wimu.

MHB 269
3 . In many a soul, and mine,
Thou hast displayed Thy power;
But to Thy people join 
Ten thousand thousand more,
Saved from the guilt and strength of sin,
In life and heart entirely clean.    Amen.	 ~ 	3 . Ada Wo tum edzi
Wɔ emi na akra pii mu;
Na nyimpa mpemmpem so
Abɛka Wo nkorɔfo a
Agye hɔn bɔn afɔdzi mu n' ho,
Wɔ nkwa na akomamutsewee mu. Amen.

MHB 27
1 . ANGELS holy.
High and lowly.
Sing the praise of the Lord!
Earth and sky; all living nature;
Man, the stamp of thy Creator.
Praise ye, praise ye God the Lord!
	 ~ 	1 . ABƆFO krɔnn,
'Kɛse, nkumaa,
Hom ntow Ewuradze ayɛyi!
Sor na ase, na abodze nyina.
Nyimpa, abɔdze mu dansewa,
Hom ni Ewuradze Nyame ayɛw!

MHB 27
2 . Sun and moon bright
Night and noon-light.
Starry temples, azure-floored;
Cloud and rain, and wild wind's madness.
Sons of God that shout for gladness,
Praise ye, praise ye God the Lord!
	 ~ 	2 . Wi, bosom hyɛnn,
Sum, ewiaber,
Wimu a nworaba ayɛ ma;
Mununkum, n-su na ehum,
Nyame mba a wɔtsea m' enyigye 'm,
Hom nyi Ewuradze Nyame ayɛw.

MHB 27
3 . Ocean hoary.
Tell His glory;
Cliffs, where tumbling seas have roared.
Pulse of waters, blithely beating.
Wave advancing, wave retreating.
Praise ye, praise ye God the Lord!
	 ~ 	3 . Po do fitaa,
Ka N'enyimnyam;
Abo a epo afa do,
N-su a ɔkɔ sor ba famu bio,
Asorɛkye ba enyim san ekyir,
Hom nyi Ewuradze Nyame ayɛw.

MHB 27
4 . Rock and highland.
Wood and island,
Crag, where eagle's pride hath soared;
Mighty mountains, purple-breasted,
Peaks cloud-cleaving, snowy crested,
Praise ye, praise ye God the Lord!
	 ~ 	4 . Botan, kokwaa,
Kwaa na supruw,
Ɔkɔr n' srɔnsrɔmbea a ɔpɛ;
Mbepɔw atsentsen a wɔyɛ kumbɔɔ,
Mbepɔw a etsifi sukwankyɛ
Hom nyi Ewuradze Nyame ayɛw.

MHB 27
5 . Rolling river.
Praise Him ever.
From the mountain's deep vein poured;
Silver fountain, clearly gushing.
Troubled torrent, madly rushin.
Praise ye, praise ye God the Lord!
	 ~ 	5 . Nyew, esutsen,
Yi N'ayɛw daa,
Ifi bepɔw tsirm' sianee;
Nsunyiwa hyɛnhyɛnn a rowora,
Ehum dzendzen a rutu huu huu,
Yi Ewuradze Nyame ayɛw.

MHB 27
6 . Praise Him ever.
Bounteous giver;
Praise, Him, Father. Friend and Lord!
Each glad soul its free course winging.
Each glad voice its free song singing.
Praise the great and mighty Lord!
	Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Yi N'ayɛw daa,
Odomfo pa a;
Yi Egya, Domfo Ewurade ayɛw!
Ɔkra biara a rofow kɔ sor,
Menba a dze dɛw tow ndwom biara,
Yi Ewuradze tumfo ayɛw.  Amen.

MHB 270
1 . MY heart is full of Christ, and longs
 Its glorious matter to declare!
 Of Him I make my loftier songs,
 I cannot from His praise forbear;
 My ready tongue makes haste to sing
 The glories of my heavenly King.
	 ~ 	1 . CHRIST wɔ m'akoma mu pɛ dɛ 
Ɔka N'enyimnyamsɛm no kyerɛ!
Motow No ho ayɛyi ndwom,
Munntum dɛ migya N'ayɛyi,
Me gyirama yɛ ntsɛm na ɔtow
Mo sor Hen N'enyimnyam ho ndwom.

MHB 270
2 .  Fairer than all the earth-born race,
 Perfect in comeliness Thou art;
 Replenished are Thy lips with grace,
 And full of love Thy tender heart:
 God ever blest ! We bow the knee,
 And own all fullness dwells in Thee. 
	 ~ 	2 . Wo ho yɛ fɛw kyɛn adasa nyina,
Idzi mu wɔ frɔdɔɔ mu so;
W'anomu nsɛm yɛ adom ara nko,
Na ɔdɔ ahyɛ W'akoma m' ma;
Nyame Siarfo! Yɛkotow Wo,
Na yɛka dɛ amayɛ dzi wɔ W'.

MHB 270
3 . Gird on Thy thigh the Spirit’s sword,
 And take to Thee Thy power divine; 
 Stir up Thy strength, almighty Lord,
 All power and majesty are Thine:
 Assert Thy worship and renown;
 O all-redeeming God, come down!
	 ~ 	3 . Fa sunsum afowa bɔ W' ntoa
Na fa Wo tum krɔnkrɔn n' kitsa;
Nu W'ahoɔdzen m', Owura Tumfo,
Gye som na abɔdzin no, Wodze a,
Da Wo som na Wo dzin edzi,
Dodow Pomfo Nyame, sian famu!

MHB 270
4 . Come, and maintain Thy righteous cause,
And let Thy glorious toil succeed;
Dispread the victory of Thy Cross,
Ride on, and prosper in Thy deed; 
Through earth triumphantly ride on,
And reign in every heart alone.   Amen. 	 ~ 	4 . Bra na bɛyɛ Wo tsenenee ndwuma,
Na mma Wo berɛ no nnyɛ gyan;
Ma Wo mbeamudua no konyimdzi n'
Ntserɛw wɔ wiadze mbea nyina;
Kɔ kan konyimdzi m' wɔ wiadze
Na dzi hen akoma nyina mu.  Amen.

MHB 271
1 . CROWN Him with many crowns,
The Lamb upon His throne;
 Hark! how the heavenly anthem drowns
 All music but its own:
 Awake, my soul, and sing
 Of Him who died for thee,
 And hail Him as thy matchless King
 Through all eternity.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM nhyɛ Eguambaa N' 'henkyɛw 
Wɔ N'ahengua no do;
Tsie! Sor ndwom n'ahyɛ ndwom nyina do,
No ndwom n' nko na wɔtse,
Me kra, nyan na tow ndwom
Ma Nyia owui maa wo n',
Na hua N' dɛ ɔyɛ wo Hen tsitsir
Wɔ mbersantsen nyina mu.

MHB 271
2 . Crown Him the Lord of life,
 Who triumphed o’er the grave,
 And rose victorious in the strife
 For those He came to save;
 His glories now we sing
 Who died, and rose on high,
 Who died-eternal life to bring, 
 And lives, that death may die.
	 ~ 	2 . Hom nhyɛ nkwa Wura 'henkyɛw, 
Nyia odzii owu do nyim,
Na odzii konyim wɔ aperdzi mu,
Maa hɔn a ɔbɛgyee hɔn n',
N'enyimnyam na yɛtow;
Owui na ɔfoow sor,
Ɔdze onnyiewiei nkwa brɛ hɛn;
Oedzi owu do, tse ase.

MHB 271
3 . Crown Him the Lord of peace,
 Whose power a sceptre sways
 From pole to pole, that wars may cease,
And all be prayer and praise:
 His reign shall know no end,
 And round His pierced feet
 Fair flowers of Paradise extend
 Their fragrance ever sweet.
	 ~ 	3 . Hom nhyɛ asomdwee Hen;
Ɔatserɛw N'ahendzi mu,
Wɔ mbea nyina ma ko abɔ adze;
Na asɔr na ayɛyi etsim,
N'ahendzi nnkɔbɔ adze,
Na N'epiranan no ho n',
Paradise nhyiren fɛɛfɛw gugu,
Na oyi hua daa nyina.

MHB 271
4 . Crown Him the Lord of love;
 Behold His hands and side,
 Those wounds, yet visible above,
 In beauty glorified:
 All hail, Redeemer ,hail!
 For Thou hast died for me:
 Thy praise and glory shall not fail
 Throughout eternity.    Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Hom nhyɛ No ɔdɔ Hen;
Hom nhwɛ N' nsa nye Ne mfemu
N'ekur a wɔda ho hu n' sor no,
Wɔahyɛ no enyinmyam,
Hom nyina nhua Pomfo n'!
Ɔwo iwui maa me;
W'ayɛyi na Wo ''nyam nnkɛpa
Wɔ mbersantsen nyina mu.   Amen.

MHB 272
1 . JESUS shall reign where’er the sun
 Doth his successive journeys run;
 His kingdom stretch from shore to shore,
Till suns shall rise and set no more.
	 ~ 	1 . BEEBIARA mbrɛ ewia ɔhyerɛn, 
Jesus twa dɛ obedzi hen;
N' ahendzi tsen fi pomu' du pomu',
Gyedɛ ewia fir dɛ ɔnntɔ bio.

MHB 272
2 . For Him shall endless prayer be made,
 And praises throng to crown His head;
 His name like sweet perfume shall rise
 With every morning sacrifice.
 	 ~ 	2 . Asɔr nyina wɔbɛyɛ ama N', 
Na wɔdze ayɛyi ebu N' kyɛw;
Ne dzin, tse dɛ eduhuam a,
Nye afɔr nyina botu akɔ sor.

MHB 272
3 . People and realms of every tongue
 Dwell on His love with sweetest song; 
 And infant voices shall proclaim
 Their young hosannas to His Name.
	 ~ 	3 . Nkorɔfo na ngyirama mpem nyina 
Dze No dɔ ho ndwom dɛɛdɛw mu;
Na mbofra so ma hɔn ndze do,
Wɔtow Hosanna ma Ne dzin.

MHB 272
4 . Blessings abound wherever He reigns;
 The prisoner leaps to lose his chains;
 The weary find eternal rest;
 And all the sons of want are blest.
	 ~ 	4 . Mbrɛ odzi hen n', nhyira ahyɛ ma, 
Wotu adaduafo apo;
Afonafo nya daa ahomka;
Na ehiafo so, wohyira hɔn.

MHB 272
5 . Where He displays His healing power,
Death and the curse are known no more; 
In Him the tribes of Adam boast
 More blessings than their father lost.
	 ~ 	5 . Beebiara mbrɛ ɔkyerɛ No tum, 
Wu na mbusu fi hɔ koraa:
No mu na nhyira a Adam yeew no n',
Ne mbanana nya ma ɔbor do.

MHB 272
6 . Let every creature rise, and bring
 Its grateful honors to our King;
 Angels descend with songs again,
 And earth prolong the joyful strain.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Wɔmma abɔdze nyina nsoɛr 
M-fa ayɛyɛdze mbrɛ hɔn Hen;
Sor abɔfo mfa ndwom nsian bio,
Na asaasemba so nsuo mu ntow.    Amen.

MHB 273
1 . COME down, O love Divine,
 Seek Thou this soul of mine,
 And visit it with Thine own ardour glowing;
 O comforter, draw near,
 Within my heart appear, 
 And kindle it, Thy holy flame bestowing.
	 ~ 	1 . O Nyame Dɔ, sian famu, 
Bra bɔhwehwɛ me kra,
Fa Woara Wo hyew dzendzen bi n' bɔsoɛ mu;
Kyigyinafo e, twe bɛn!
Bopue m' akoma mu,
Na ma Wo gya krɔnkrɔn no mbɛfram me kra.

MHB 273
2 . O let it freely burn,
 Till earthly passions turn 
 To dust and ashes, in its heat consuming;
 And let Thy glorious light
 Shine ever on my sight,
 And clothe me round, the while my path illuming.
	 ~ 	2 . Ma ɔndzɛw ara yie, 
Nkodu dɛ ɔbɛhyew
Wiadze akɔndɔ nyina ma ɔaatɔ nso;
Na ma W' enyimnyam kan n'
Ɔnhyerɛn m' enyim daa,
Ɔnhyerɛn mo ho nye mo kwan mu nyina.

MHB 273
3 . Let holy charity
 Mine outward vesture be,
 And lowliness become mine inner clothing;
 True lowliness of heart,
 Which takes the humbler part, 
 And o’er its own shortcomings 
 weeps with loathing.
	 ~ 	3 . Na ma ɔdɔ krɔnkrɔn 
Ɔnyɛ m' egudo atar,
Na ma menhyɛ ahobrɛadze wɔ ase;
Ahobrɛadze 'koma a,
Ɔdze noho to famu,
Na ɔdze nyinsuwa kyir noara n' esintɔ.

MHB 273
4 . And so the yearning strong,
 With which the soul will long,
 Shall far outpass the power of human telling; 
 For none can guess its grace, 
 Till he become the place 
 Wherein the Holy Spirit makes His dwelling.	 ~ 	4 . Dɛm yi na ɔbɛma 
Akɔndɔ dzendzen a
Me kra benya no nnkenya kabea mpo;
Mbrɛ n' ahoɔfɛw bɛyɛ n'
Obi runntum nnkyerɛ
Gyedɛ Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn ayɛ n' ne tsenabea.

MHB 274
1 . LORD, we believe to us and ours
The apostolic promise given;
 We wait the Pentecostal powers, 
 The Holy Ghost sent down from heaven.
 	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, Yɛgye dzi dɛ
'Dze asomafo bɔhyɛ n' ama hɛn;
Yɛhwɛ Pentecost tum no kwan,
Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn a edze fi sor n';

MHB 274
2 . To every one whom God shall call
 The promise is securely made; 
 To you far off - He calls you all; 
 Believe the word which Christ hath said:
	 ~ 	2 . Obiara a Nyame bɛfrɛ no n',
Anohoba no yɛ nedze;
Ɔfrɛ hom a hom wɔ ekyirkyir,
Hom ngye dza Christ aka no ndzi.

MHB 274
3 . The Holy Ghost, if I depart,
 The Comforter, shall surely come,
 Shall make the contrite sinner’s heart
 His loved, His everlasting home.
	 ~ 	3 . Sɛ minya kɔ a, Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn
Ɔwerɛkyefo no bɛba,
Ɔdze nnuhofo akoma
Bɛyɛ Ne tsenabea daa nyina.

MHB 274
4 .  Assembled here with one accord,
 Calmly we wait the promised grace,
 The purchase of our dying Lord:
 Come, Holy Ghost, and fill the place.
	 ~ 	4 . Yɛabɔ ɔnosɛɛ ehyia ha
Rotweɔn adom anohoba n';
Hɛn Wura a owui n' N'atɔdze;
Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, bɛhyɛ ha ma.

MHB 274
5 . If every one that asks may find,
 If still Thou dost on sinners fall,
 Come as a mighty rushing wind; 
Great grace be now upon us all.
	 ~ 	5 . Sɛ obiara a obisa benya,
Na eda ho si abɔnfo do a;
Bra dɛ ehum a ɔyɛ dzen,
Adom kɛse, bogu hɛn do.

MHB 274
6 . Behold, to Thee our souls aspire,
And languish Thy descent to meet:
 Kindle in each the living fire, 
 And fix in every heart Thy seat.   Amen. 	 ~ 	6 . Hwɛ, hɛn akra per hwehwɛ Wo,
Rotweɔn dɛ ibesian daadze;
Kenyan Wo gya no wɔ hɛn mu;
Na bɛtsena akoma biara m'. Amen.

MHB 275
1 . JESUS, we on the word depend
Spoken by Thee while present here: 
 The Father in my name shall send 
 The Holy Ghost, the Comforter.
 	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, yɛdan W'asɛmpa no a
Ekae ber a ewɔ ha no dɛ;
Me dzin m' Egya no bɔsoma
Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, Werɛkyekyefo n'.

MHB 275
2 . That promise made to Adam’s race, 
Now, Lord, in us, even us, fulfil;
And give the Spirit of Thy grace,
To teach us all Thy perfect will.
	 ~ 	2 . Adam asefo anohoba n'
Owura, ma ɔmbra mu mma hɛn;
Na ma hɛn W'adom Sunsum no,
Ma ɔnkyerɛ hɛn wo pa no.

MHB 275
3 . That heavenly Teacher of mankind,
That Guide infallible impart,
To bring Thy sayings to our mind, 
And write them on our faithful heart.
 	 ~ 	3 . Fa adasa sor Kyerɛkyerɛfo
Kwankyerɛfo pa no ma hɛn;
Ɔmbɛkaa hɛn Wo nsɛm nyina,
Na ɔnkyerɛw wɔ hɛn akoma do.

MHB 275
4 . He only can the words apply
 Through which we endless life possess;
 And deal to each his legacy,
 His Lord’s unutterable peace.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔno nko na obotum dze
N-kwasɛm no edzi dwuma,
Na ɔama obiara asɛdze,
Nyankopɔn daa asomdwee no.

MHB 275
5 . That peace of God, that peace of Thine,
O might He now to us bring in,
 And fill our souls with power divine,
 And make an end of fear and sin. 
	 ~ 	5 . Ɔwo na Nyankopɔn asomdwee n',
O nkyɛ afei ɔdze aabrɛ hɛn,
Na ɔdze sor tum aahyɛ hɛn ma
Na oeetu suro na bɔn ase!

MHB 275
6 . The length and breadth of love reveal,
 The height and depth of Deity;
 And all the sons of glory seal,
 And change, and make us all like Thee.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Ma yenhu ɔdɔ ne trɛ, no war,
Na Nyame No krɔn na No bun,
Na hyɛ 'nyimnyam mba n' nyina nsew,
Na ma yɛnsakyer nyɛ dɛ Ɔwo.  Amen.

MHB 276
1 . WHEN  God of old came down 
      from heaven,
In power and wrath He came;
 Before His feet the clouds were riven,
 Half darkness and half flame.
 	 ~ 	1 . TSETSEBER a Nyame siaan wiadze n', 
Ɔbaa n' tum nye ebufuwm';
Fua bɔɔ apetse N' ananadze,
Fa yɛɛ sum, fa daan gya.

MHB 276
2 . But when He came the second time,
 He came in power and love; 
 Softer than gale at morning prime
 Hovered His holy Dove.
	 ~ 	2 . Na ne mprɛnu no a ɔbae no, 
Ɔbaa n' tum nye dɔ mu;
Bɔkɔɔ kyɛn anapa mframa
Nna Ebubur Krɔnkrɔn n' bae.

MHB 276
3 . The fires that rushed on Sinai down 
In sudden torrents dread 
 Now gently light, a glorious crown, 
 On every sainted head. 
 	 ~ 	3 . Ogya a osiaan Sinai do no 
Ɔframee ma ɔyɛɛ hu,
Ɔdaan enyimnyam ahenkyɛw
Wɔ ahotseweefo tsir do.

MHB 276
4 . And as on Israel’s awe-struck ear
