 The voice exceeding loud, 
 The trump that angels quake to hear,
 Thrilled from the deep, dark cloud:
 	 ~ 	4 . Na dε mbrε Israel dze hu
Tsee ndze kεse mbordo n’,
Abεn a abᴐfo mpo suro,
Gyigyee fua kebii mu.

MHB 276
5 . So, when the Spirit of our God
 Came down His flock to find,
 A voice from heaven was heard abroad, 
 A rushing, mighty wind.
	 ~ 	5 . Dεm na hεn Nyame no Sunsum
Bodwiir no nguankuw do n’,
Wᴐtsee ndze fi sor wᴐ mbea nyina,
Dε mframa a ᴐyε dzen.

MHB 276
6 . It fills the Church of God; it fills
 The sinful world around; 
 in stubborn hearts and willsn No place for it is found.
	 ~ 	6 . Ͻhyε Nyankopᴐn N’Asᴐr ma,
Twa bᴐn wiadze yi ho hyia:
Gyedε ntsintsiman ‘koma nko
Nna onnya no mu kwan.

MHB 276
7 .  Come, Lord; come ,Wisdom, Love, and Power;
 Open our ears to hear;
 Let us not miss the accepted hour;
 Save, Lord, by love or fear. Amen. 	 ~ 	7 . Ewuradze, bra, Nyansa, Dᴐ, Tum,
Bue hέn aso ma yεntse;
Mma ᴐgyeber yi mmpa hεn ho,
Dᴐ mu o, suro mu o, gye hεn. 	Amen.

MHB 277
1 . GRANTED is the Saviour’s prayer,
 Sent the gracious Comforter; 
 Promise of our parting Lord,
 Jesus now to heaven restored.
	 ~ 	1 . WOETSIE Gyefo Ne mpaabɔ,
Wɔasoma Werɛkyekyefo n';
Hɛn Wura N'anohoba,
Ber a ɔrokɔ sor no.

MHB 277
2 . Christ, who now gone up on high
 Captive leads captivity;
 While His foes from Him receive
 Grace that God with man may live.
 	 ~ 	2 . Christ a afei ɔkɔ sor
Ndɔmmum mu na odzi kan;
N'atamfo nam No do nye
Adom nye Nyame tsena.

MHB 277
3 . God, the everlasting God,
 Makes with mortals His abode;
 Whom the heavens cannot contain,
 He vouchsafes to dwell in man.
	 ~ 	3 . Nyame, 'domankoma Nyame,
Ɔnye adasa tsena;
Dze nyimpa yɛ N'atsenae;
Abɛtsena nyimpa mu.

MHB 277
4 . Never will He thence depart,
 Inmate of an humble heart;
 Carrying on His work within,
 Striving till He casts out sin. 
	 ~ 	4 . Nyia ɔtse akoma brɛfo mu n'.
Onnkefi hɔ akɔ ara da,
Ɔreyɛ edwuma hɛn mu
Kɛpɛm dɛ obotu bɔn.

MHB 277
5 . There He helps our feeble moans,
 Deepens our imperfect groans, 
 Intercedes in silence there,
 Sighs the unutterable prayer.
	 ~ 	5 . Hɔ ɔboa hɛn apensi,
Hɛn nkrumsi n' so omia mu;
Odzi ma hɛn komm wɔ hɔ,
Ogu ahom gu mpaabɔ do.

MHB 277
6 . Come, divine and peaceful Guest,
 Enter our devoted breast;
 Life divine in us renew,
 Thou the Gift, and Giver too !   Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Bra, Sunsum Hɔho botoo,
Bɛtsena hɛn akoma mu;
Kenyan Wo nkwa wɔ hɛn mu,
Eyɛ Akyɛdze n' na Mafo.    Amen.

MHB 278
1 .  AWAY with our fears,
 Our troubles and tears:
 The Spirit is come,
 The witness of Jesus returned to His home.
	 ~ 	1 . FA hɛn suro na haw,
Na hɛn nyinsuwa kɔ;
Sunsum no aba,

MHB 279
1 . O HOLY Spirit, God,
All loveliness is Thine;
Great things and small are both in Thee,
The star-world is Thy shrine.
 	 ~ 	1 . SUNSUM Krɔnkrɔn, Nyame,
Ahoɔfɛw yɛ Wodze;
Dza ɔso na dza osuar nyina wɔ W' mu,
Wimu yɛ W'asɔr dan.

MHB 279
2 . The sunshine Thou of God,
 The life of man and flower, 
 The wisdom and the energy
 That fills the world with power. 
	 ~ 	2 . Ewia a ofir Nyame,
Nyimpa na nhyiren nkwa,
Nyansa na ahoɔdzen a ɔdze Wo
Tum hyɛ wiadze nyina ma.

MHB 279
3 . Thou art the stream of love,
 The unity divine;
 Good men and true are one in Thee,
 And in Thy radiance shine.
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔwo nye ɔdɔ bura,
Koryɛ Nyame nye wo;
Apapafo yɛ kor Wo mu,
Na wɔhyerɛn Wo kan mu.

MHB 279
4 . The heroes and saints
 Thy messengers became;
 And all the lamps that guide the world
 Were kindled at Thy flame.
 	 ~ 	4 . Ahotseweefo na
Wɔbɛyɛɛ W'asomafo;
Na kandzea a wɔkyerɛ wiadze kwan n',
Wɔsɔɔ no Wo gya n' mu.

MHB 279
5 . The calls that come to us
 Upon Thy winds are brought;
The light that gleams beyond our dreams
 Is something Thou hast thought.
 	 ~ 	5 . Nkra a ɔba hɛn nkyɛn no
Nam Wo mframa mu ba;
Kan a ɔhyerɛn hɛn adaaso ekyir no
Yɛ biribi a adwen ho.

MHB 279
6 . Give fellowship, we pray,
 In love and joy and peace,
 That we in counsel, knowledge, might,
 And wisdom, may increase.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Yɛserɛ fɛkuwbɔ,
'Dɔ, dɛw na asomdwee mu
Ma yeenyin nyimdzee na ahoɔdzen m',
Na Wo ho nyansa mu.  Amen.

MHB 28
1 . ALL creatures of our God and King.
Lift up your voice with us and sing:
Alleluia, Alleluia!
Thou burning sun with golden beam,
Thou silver moon with softer gleam:
           O praise Him, O praise Him,
           Alleluia, Alleluia, Alleluia!
	 ~ 	1 . Hɛn Nyame N' abɔdze nyina, 
Hom mma hom ndze do nye hɛn ntow
Alleluia, Alleluia!
Ewia hyeehyew, 'hyerɛn dɛ sika,
Bosoom nwinwin, 'tse dɛ dwetε,
      Yi N' ayɛw, yi N' ayɛw 
      Alleluia, Alleluia, Alleluia!

MHB 28
2 . Thou rushing wind that art so strong.
Ye clouds that sail in heaven along,
O praise Him. Alleluia!
Thou rising mom. in praise rejoice.
Ye lights of evening, find a voice:
	 ~ 	2 . M-frama a itu ehum dzendzen, 
Esuwusiw a esen wimu,
Yi N' ayɛw, Alleluia!
Bosoom, fa enyigye yi N' ayɛw,
N-woraba, hom mbɔ hom ndzem'
      Yi N' ayɛw, yi N' ayɛw 
      Alleluia, Alleluia, Alleluia!

MHB 28
3 . Thou flowing water, pure and clear.
Make mu sit: for thy Lord to hear,
Alleluia, Alleluia!
Thou fire so masterful and bright.
That givest man both warmth and light:
	 ~ 	3 . N-su krɔngyenn a erepem, 
Tow ndwom ma w' Ewuradze ntse,
Alleluia, Alleluia!
Ogya hurenhuren a eyɛ dzen,
'Wo a ema nyimpa hyew na kan,
     Yi N' ayɛw, yi N' ayɛw 
     Alleluia, Alleluia, Alleluia!

MHB 28
4 . Dear mother earth. who day by day
Unfoldest blessings on our way.
O praise Him, Alleluia!
The flowers and fruits that in thee grow.
Let them His glory also show:
	 ~ 	4 . Asaase pa a Nyame ama 
Daa daa iyi siar ma ne mba,
Yi N' ayɛw, Alleluia!
Wo mu nhyiren nye nduaba so,
Womfifir nkyerɛ N' enyimnyam, 
    Yi N' ayɛw, yi N' ayɛw 
    Alleluia, Alleluia, Alleluia!

MHB 28
5 . And all ye men of tender heart.
Forgiving others, take your part.
O sing ye, Alleluia!
Ye who long pain and sorrow bear,
Praise God and on Him cast your Care:
	 ~ 	5 . N-korɔfo a hom 'koma dwe nyina, 
Na hom dze bɔn kyɛ, hom so mbra,
Hom so ntow Alleluia!
Amandzehufo, 'werɛhofo,
Hom nyi N' ayɛw, mfa ne nyina nsoa N',
    Yi N' ayɛw, yi N' ayɛw 
    Alleluia, Alleluia, Alleluia!

MHB 28
6 . And thou, most kind and gentle death,
Waiting to hush our latest breath.
O praise Him, Alleluia!
Thou leadest home the child of God,
And Christ our Lord the way He hath trod:
	 ~ 	6 . Ao, Owu, yamuyiefo a edwe, 
'Wo a itwa hɛn owu ngyam do,
Yi N' ayɛw, Alleluia!
'Wo na 'dze Nyame mba kɔ fie,
Hɛn Wura Christ faa wo kwan n' mu:
   Yi N' ayɛw, yi N' ayɛw 
   Alleluia, Alleluia, Alleluia!

MHB 28
7 . Let all things their Creator bless.
And worship Him in humbleness.
O praise Him, Alleluia!
Praise, praise the Father, praise the Son,
And praise the Spirit, Three in One:	 ~ 	7 . Ndzɛmba nyina nhyira Bɔfo n', 
Wɔmfa mbrɛhoadze nkotow No,
Nyi N' ayɛw, Alleluia!
Wɔmfa ayɛyi mma Egya, nye Ba,
Nye Sunsum no, Ebiasa Kor, 
   Yi N' ayɛw, yi N' ayɛw 
   Alleluia, Alleluia, Alleluia!

MHB 280
1 . I WANT the Spirit of power within, 
 Of love, and of a healthful mind:
Of power, to conquer inbred sin;
 Of love, to Thee and all mankind;
 Of health, that pain and death defies,
 Most vigorous when the body dies.
	 ~ 	1 . MOHWEHWƐ Sunsum tum wɔ m' mu,
Ɔdɔ na adwen pa dze n' bi,
Tum a medze bedzi bɔn do;
Dɔ a medze bɔdɔ W' na adasa
Ahosan a yaw nntum nnka no,
Na owu mu mpo ɔyɛ dzen.

MHB 280
2 . When shall I hear the inward voice
Which only faithful souls can hear? 
 Pardon, and peace, and heavenly joys
 Attend the promised Comforter:
 O come! and righteousness divine,
 And Christ, and all with Christ, are mine. 
 	 ~ 	2 . Dabɛn na mebɛtse ndze no,
Dza anokwafo nko tse no?
Fakyɛ, asomdwee na enyigye
Nye Ɔwerɛkyekyefo no nam;
O bra, na tsenenenee krɔnkrɔn
Christ na N'adze nyina bɛyɛ m'dze.

MHB 280
3 . O that the Comforter would come !
 Nor visit as a transient guest,
 But fix in me His constant home,
 And take possession of my breast,
 And fix in me His loved abode,
 The temple of indwelling God.
 	 ~ 	3 . O nkyɛ Werɛkyekyefo no aaba
Na oeenntwa mu aannkɔ ara da,
Na mbom ɔaayɛ N' tsenabew wɔ m' mu
Ma ɔmfa m'akoma nyɛ Nedze,
Na ɔmfa No dɔ n' ntsena mo mu
Ma menyɛ Nyame W'asɔrfi.

MHB 280
4 . Come, Holy Ghost, my heart inspire!
 Attest that I am born again;
 Come, and baptize me now with fire,
 Nor let Thy former gifts be vain: 
 I cannot rest in sins forgiven ; 
 Where is the earnest of my heaven ? 
	 ~ 	4 . Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, kenyan m'akoma,
Dzi dase dɛ wɔawo m'fofor;
Fa ogya bonuma me sesei
Amma W'akyɛdze aannyɛ gyan,
Munnkotum atsena bɔnfakyɛ m' daa;
M'bɛyɛ dɛn akɔ heaven hɔ?

MHB 280
5 .  Where the indubitable seal
That ascertains the kingdom mine ?
The powerful stamp I long to feel,
The signature of love divine:
 O shed it in my heart abroad , 
 Fullness of love, of heaven, of God.    Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Nsewhyɛdze a ɔkyerɛ dɛ 
Meenya ahenman no wɔ hen?
Mepɛ dɛ m'tse nsɔwano n' nka,
Onyame No dɔ nsewhyɛ no;
Hue ɔsor dɔ amayɛ no
Gu m'akoma mu nyinara.  Amen.

MHB 281
1 . GO not, my soul, in search of Him,
Thou wilt not find Him there, 
Or in the depths of shadow dim,
Or heights of upper air. 
	 ~ 	1 . ME kra, mma nnkɔhwehwɛ No koraa,
Innkohu No wɔ hɔ;
Onnyi asaase ase sum mu,
Onnyi ɔsor mframa mu.

MHB 281
2 .  For not in far-off realms of space
The Spirit hath His throne; 
In every heart His findeth place, 
And waiteth to be known. 
	 ~ 	2 . Sunsum no egua nnyi ekyir,
Na ɔbɛn hɛn wɔ ha ara;
Ɔwɔ akoma biara mu;
Na ɔtweɔn dɛ wobohu N'.

MHB 281
3 .  Thought answereth alone to thought,
And soul with soul hath kin; 
The outward God he findeth not,
Who finds not God within.
	 ~ 	3 . Adwen nye adwen dzi ehyia
Na ɔkra nye ɔkra bɔ awɛ;
Nyia ɔnnhwehwɛ Nyame Noara n' mu n',
Onnkohu N' ara da.

MHB 281
4 .  And if the vision come to thee
Revealed by inward sign,
Earth will be full of Deity,
And with His glory shine.
	 ~ 	4 . Na sɛ enyidoadzehu no,
Fi wo mu ara ba a,
Nyame N' Sunsum bɛhyɛ wiadze ma,
Na N'enyimnyam bɛhyerɛn.

MHB 281
5 . Thou shalt not want for company, 
 Nor pitch thy tent alone ;
 The indwelling God will go with thee, 
 And show thee of His own.
	 ~ 	5 . Ɔwo rinnhia mfɛfo ara da,
'Rennyɛ ankonam da,
Nyame a ɔtsena hɛn mu n' bɛka w' ho,
Na ɔakyerɛ wo dza ɔpɛ.

MHB 281
6 . O gift of gifts ! o grace of grace, 
That God should condescend 
To make thy heart His dwelling-place
 And be thy daily Friend ! 	 ~ 	6 . Akyɛdze mapa nye adom,
Dɛ Nyankopɔn bɛpen
Ayɛ w'akoma N'atsenae,
Na ɔayɛ wo Nyɛnko!

MHB 282
1 . SPIRIT of wisdom, turn our eyes 
From earth and earthly vanities 
 To heavenly truth and love; 
 Spirit of understanding true, 
 Our souls with heavenly light endue
To seek the things above.
	 ~ 	1 . NYANSA Sunsum, yi hɛn enyi
Fi wiadze egyangyandze do
Kɔ ɔsor nokwar do;
Nokwar ntseasee Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn,
Fa W'sor kan no hyɛ hɛn akra ma
Wɔnhwehwɛ ɔsor ndzɛmba.

MHB 282
2 . Spirit of counsel, be our guide;
Teach us, by earthly struggles tried,
Our heavenly crown to win: 
 Spirit of fortitude, Thy power 
Be with us in temptation’s hour,
To keep us pure from sin.
	 ~ 	2 . Sunsum fotufo, kyerɛ hɛn kwan;
Dua aperdzi do kyerɛkyerɛ hɛn 
Ma yennya sor ahenkyɛw;
'Kokodur Sunsum, fa Wo tum
Ma hɛn wɔ hɛn nsɔhwɛ ber mu,
Na ɔmma yengyaa bɔn yɛ.

MHB 282
3 . Spirit of knowledge, lead our feet 
In Thine own paths, so safe and sweet,
By angel footsteps trod; 
Where Thou art guardian true shalt be, 
Spirit of gentle piety, 
To keep us close to God.
	 ~ 	3 . Nyimdzee Sunsum, gya hɛn anan
Fa W'akwan a mbusu nnyi m' no do,
Mbrɛ abɔfo fa no;
Hɔ na ebɛyɛ hɛn hwɛfo sɔnn,
Ɔdwe Sunsum a eyɛ krɔnn,
Ama yaabɛn Nyame.

MHB 282
4 . Through all our life be ever near,
Spirit of God’s most holy fear,
 In our heart’s inmost shrine; 
 Our souls with awful reverence fill, 
 To worship His most holy will, 
 All-righteous and divine.
	 ~ 	4 . Nyankopɔn suro ho Sunsum, 
Hɛn abrabɔ nyina mu, twe bɛn,
Wɔ hɛn akoma mu;
Fa obu krɔnkrɔn hyɛ hɛn akoma m',
Ma yɛnsom No, yendzi Ne pɛ
Tsenenee turodoo n' do.

MHB 282
5 . So lead us, Lord, through peace or strife,
 Onward to everlasting life, 
 To win our high reward:
 So may we fight our lifelong fight, 
 Strong in Thine own unearthly might,
And reign with Christ our Lord.    Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Gya hɛn asomdwee na ɔko m'
Kodu nkwa a onnyi ewiei no mu,
Na yeenya hɛn akatua;
Ama yaako hɛn bra mu ko,
Yaayɛ dzen wɔ Wo tum no mu,
Yɛnye Christ eedzi hen.

MHB 283
1 . OUR blest Redeemer, ere He breathed 
His tender last farewell, 
 A guide, a Comforter, bequeathed
 With us to dwell.
 	 ~ 	1 . Ansaana hɛn Gyefo siarfo 
Nye hɛn ridzi mpaamu n',
Ogyaa hɛn Ɔkwankyerɛfo dɛ
Ɔnye hɛn ntsena.

MHB 283
2 . He came in semblance of a dove,
 With sheltering wings outspread,
 The holy balm of peace and love 
 On each to shed.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔbae wɔ ebubur suban mu, 
Dɛ ɔatrɛ n' atsabanm',
Ɔdze dɔ na asomdwee boguu
No nkorɔfo do.

MHB 283
3 . He came in tongues of living flame, 
 To Teach, convince, subdue;
 All-powerful as the wind He came, 
As viewless too. 
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔdze ogya ngyrama bae dɛ 
Ɔrebɛkyerɛkyerɛ hɛn;
Ɔtse dɛ mframa, ɔyɛ dzen,
Na wonnhu so.

MHB 283
4 . He comes sweet influence to impart, 
A gracious, willing guest, 
While He can find one humble heart 
 Wherein to rest. 
	 ~ 	4 . 'Koma biara a ɔbrɛ adze n', 
Ɔba bɛtsena mu hɔ,
Na ɔdae ahom dɛɛdɛw bi
Dze gye no do.

MHB 283
5 . And His that gentle voice we hear,
 Soft as the breath of even,
 That checks each fault, that calms each fear, 
 And speaks of heaven. 
	 ~ 	5 . Ne ndze na yɛtse no bi 
Dɛ ewimbir mframa n';
Osiw mfomso kwan,
Ka sor ho nsɛm.

MHB 283
6 . And every virtue we possess,
And every conquest won,
 And every thought of holiness, 
 Are His alone. 
 	 ~ 	6 . Papa biara a ɔwɔ hɛn ho, 
Konyim biara a yedzi,
Adwen krɔnkrɔn biara a yenya,
Ofir Noara.

MHB 283
7 . Spirit of purity and grace,
  Our weakness ,pitying, see; 
 O make our hearts Thy dwelling-place, 
 And worthier Thee. Amen. 	 ~ 	7 . Ahotsew nye adom Sunsum, 
Hwɛ hɛn mberɛwyɛ tsemam';
O tsena hɛn 'komam', na yɛ ma
Ɔmfata Wo.    Amen.

MHB 284
1 . FATHER, if justly still we claim
 To us and ours the promise made,
 To us be graciously the same, 
 And crown with living fire our head.
	 ~ 	1 . EGYA, sɛ ampa yeda ho
Gye anohoba n’ yɛ hɛndzé a,
Adom no so bɛyɛ hendze,
Na ogya n’ bɛyɛ hɛn ahenkyɛw.

MHB 284
2 . Our claim admit, and from above
 Of holiness the Spirit shower,
 Of wise discernment, humble love, 
 And zeal, and unity, and power. 
 	 ~ 	2 . Gye hɛn adzesérɛ yi to mu,
Fa Wo krͻnkrͻnyɛ gu hɛn do,
Ma hɛn nhumu, ahobrɛadze, dͻ.
Nsiyɛ ͻnye koryɛ na tum.

MHB 284
3 . The Spirit of convincing speech,
 Of power demonstrative, impart,
 Such as may every conscience reach,
 And sound the unbelieving heart. 
	 ~ 	3 . Ma hɛn sunsum a oyi atsɛn,
Ma hɛn tum a wͻdze kyerɛkyerɛ,
Na eedu tsibowa biara mu,
Na aaka akoma a ͻnngye nndzi.

MHB 284
4 . The Spirit of refining fire,
 Searching the inmost of the mind,
 To purge all fierce and foul desire,
 And kindle life more pure and kind. 
	 ~ 	4 . Sunsum a ͻtsew ogya ho,
Dza ahwehwɛ adwen mu no,
Dza oyi akͻndͻbͻn nyina
Na ͻma yɛbͻ bra krͻnkrͻn.

MHB 284
5 . The Spirit of faith, in this Thy day, 
 To break the power of cancelled sin, 
 Tread down its strength, o’erturn its sway, 
 And still the conquest more than win. 
	 ~ 	5 . Gyedzi sunsum, Wo ber yi mu
Bubu ͻbͻn no tum koraa;
Fa W‘ahoͻdzen n'tsiatsia no do,
Na dzi no do konyim koraa.

MHB 284
6 . The Spirit breathe of inward life, 
 Which in our hearts Thy laws may write; 
 Then grief expires, and pain, and strife:
 ’Tis nature all, and all delight.    Amen. 	 ~ 	6 . Sunsum a ͻma hɛn ahom,
Dza ͻkyérɛw mbra wa hɛn akoma m',
Awerɛhow, yaw na aperdzi,
Na abͻdze nyina enyigye

MHB 285
1 . O BREATH of God, breathe on us now, 
 And move within us while we pray; 
 The spring of our new life art Thou,
 The very light of our new day. 
 	 ~ 	1 . NYAME ahom, hom gu hɛn do,
Sɛ yɛbɔ mpaa a, ka hɛn ho;
Ɔwo nye hɛn nkwa nsunyiwa,
Hɛn da fofor ne kan nye 'Wo.

MHB 285
2 . O strangely art Thou with us, Lord, 
 Neither in height nor depth to seek: 
 In nearness shall Thy voice be heard; 
 Spirit to spirit Thou dost speak. 
	 ~ 	2 . Hɛn Wura, yehu dɛ 'ka hɛn ho,
Yɛnnhwehwɛ W' krɔn anaa Wo bun:
Yɛtse Wo ndze dɛ ebɛn hɛn;
Sunsum kasa kyerɛ sunsum.

MHB 285
3 . Christ is our Advocate on high; 
 Thou art our Advocate within: 
 O plead the truth, and make reply
 To every argument of sin. 
 	 ~ 	3 . Christ nye hɛn Dzimafo wɔ sor,
Ɔwo na idzi ma hɛn ha;
Yɛserɛ Wo, gyina ma nokwar,
Yi bɔn asɛmbisa nyina ano.

MHB 285
4 . But ah, this faithless heart of mine! 
 The way I know, I know my guide:
 Forgive me, O my Friend divine, 
 That I so often turn aside. 
	 ~ 	4 . O m'akoma kyingyefo yi a!
Naaso minyim mo Kwankyerɛfo;
Me Nyɛnko krɔnkrɔn , fa kyɛ me,
Sɛ mpɛn pii medan fi Wo ho a.

MHB 285
5 . Be with me when no other friend 
 The mystery of my heart can share; 
 And be Thou known, when fears transcend, 
 By Thy best name of Comforter.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Ka mo ho ber a nyɛnko biara
Nntum nnhu m'akoma m' esumasɛm,
Na sɛ suro mpo hyɛ hɛn do a,
Ma yenhu W', Ɔwerɛkyekyefo.

MHB 286
1 . HOLY Spirit, hear us; 
 Help us while we sing; 
 Breath into the music 
 Of the praise we bring. 
	 ~ 	1 . SUNSUM krͻnkrͻn, tsie hɛn;
Boa hɛn adwontow m’,
Hom gu hɛn ndaase ndwom a
Yɛdze kamfo W’ mu.

MHB 286
2 . Holy Spirit, prompt us 
 When we kneel to pray;
 Nearer come, and teach us 
 What we ought to say. 
	 ~ 	2 . SUNSUM krͻnkrͻn, kaa hɛn
Wͻ hɛn mpaabͻ mu;
Bɛn hɛn na kyerɛ hɛn
Dzà ͻwͻ dɛ yɛkà.

MHB 286
3 . Holy Spirit, shine Thou
 On the Book we read;
 Gild its holy pages 
 With the light we need. 
 	 ~ 	3 .  SUNSUM krͻnkrͻn, hyerɛn 
Nwomà a yɛkenkan do;
Ma kan a yehia daa
Ͻnhyerɛn wͻ do.

MHB 286
4 . Holy Spirit, give us
 Each a lowly mind; 
 Make us more like Jesus,
 Gentle, pure, and kind. 
 	 ~ 	4 . SUNSUM krͻnkrͻn, ma hɛn
Ahobrɛadze adwen;
Ma yenyɛ dɛ Jesus,
Yɛmbrɛ hɛnho adze.

MHB 286
5 . Holy Spirit, brighten
 Little deeds of toil; 
 And our playful pastimes 
 Let no anger spoil.
 	 ~ 	5 . SUNSUM krͻnkrͻn, hyerɛn
Hɛn ndwuma nkumaa do;
Na hɛn agodzi mu,
Mmà ebufuw nnsɛɛ no.

MHB 286
6 . Holy Spirit, help us 
 Daily by Thy might,
 What is wrong to conquer,
 And to choose the right.  Amen. 	 ~ 	6 . SUNSUM krͻnkrͻn, boa hɛn,
Fa Wo tum kɛse n’;
Ma yenyi bͻn akwa,
Na yenyi dzà oye.     Amen.

MHB 287
1  . HOLY Ghost! my Comforter,
 Now from highest heaven appear, 
 Shed Thy gracious radiance here.
 	 ~ 	1 . SUNSUM, mo Werɛkyekyefo! 
Fi sor noho dwir hɛn do,
Tow Wo kan hyerɛn hɛn do.

MHB 287
10 .  May we live in holiness, 
 And in death find happiness, 
 And abide with Thee in bliss.   Amen. 	 ~ 	10 . Ma yɛntsena krɔnkrɔnyɛ mu, 
Na dom hɛn asomdwee wu,
Na fa hɛn kɔ Wo dɛw mu.        Amen.

MHB 287
2 . Come, to them who suffer dearth,
 With Thy gifts of priceless worth,
Lighten all who dwell on earth!
	 ~ 	2 . Ehiafo hɔn Boafo, bra! 
'Wo a ema sor ahonya,
Akoma nyina kan, bra.

MHB 287
3 . Thou, the heart’s most precious Guest,
 Thou, of comforters the best,
Give to us, the o’er-laden, rest. 
 	 ~ 	3 . Ɔwerɛkyekyefo kɛse, 
Bɔsoɛ hɛn akoma mu,
Na ma yennya W' asomdwee.

MHB 287
4 . Come ! In Thee our toil is sweet, 
 Shelter from the noonday heat, 
 From whom sorrow flieth fleet.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔfona mu ahomgye,
Ahohyehyem' ahotɔ,
Bra beyi hɛn nyinsuwa mu.

MHB 287
5 . Blessed Sun of grace, o’er all
 Faithful hearts who on Thee call
 Let Thy light and solace fall. 
	 ~ 	5 . Siar Ewia! yɛserɛ Wo, pue; 
Fa Wo kan nye Wo ntseasee
Hyɛ agyedzifo mu ma.

MHB 287
6 . What without Thy aid is wrought, 
 Skilful deed or wisest thought,
 God will count but vain and nought.
	 ~ 	6 . Sɛ Ɔwo ammboa hɛn a, 
Yɛbɔ mbɔdzen dɛn ara a,
Ne nyinara bɛyɛ gyan.

MHB 287
7 . Cleanse us, Lord, from sinful stain,
 O’er the parched heart O rain !
 Heal the wounded of its pain.
	 ~ 	7 . Hohor hɛn mu fi nyina, 
Fɔw hɛn akoma a woetwie,
Yɛ sunsum pirafo edur.

MHB 287
8 . Bend the stubborn will to Thine,
 Melt the cold with fire divine,
 Erring hearts to right incline. 
 	 ~ 	8 . Ma asoɔdzenfo nyɛ Wo pɛ,
Bɔ hɔn a wɔyɛ hyew,
Fa akobɔfo bra fie.

MHB 287
9 . Grant us, Lord, who cry to Thee,
 Steadfast in the faith to be,
 Give Thy gift of charity. 
	 ~ 	9 . Dom agyedzifo nyina, 
Ma wontsintsim Woara,
Ma hɔn Wo dɔ akyɛdze n'.

MHB 288
1  . HOLY Spirit, truth Divine,
 Dawn upon this soul of mine; 
 Word of God, and inward light, 
 Wake my spirit, clear my sight. 
 	 ~ 	1 . SUNSUM Krɔnkrɔn, Nokwafo,
Yi Woho kyerɛ me kra;
Nyame asɛm na hɛn mu kan,
Nyan mo sunsum, bue m'enyi.

MHB 288
2 . Holy Spirit, love Divine,
 Glow within this heart of mine,
 Kindle every high desire, 
 Perish self in Thy pure fire. 
	 ~ 	2 . Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, Nyame dɔ,
Hyerɛn m'akoma yi mu,
Kenyan apɛdze biara,
Hyew honam ndwuma nyina.

MHB 288
3 . Holy Spirit, power Divine, 
 Fill and nerve this will of mine;
 By Thee may I strongly live, 
 Bravely bear, and nobly strive. 
	 ~ 	3 . Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, Nyame tum,
Ma minnya akokodur,
Ma minnya ahoɔdzen ntsena ase,
Memfa ndamyɛ ndzi aper.

MHB 288
4 . Holy Spirit, right Divine, 
 King within my conscience reign;
 Be my law, and I shall be 
 Firmly bound, for ever free. 
 	 ~ 	4 . Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, Nyam' tsenenee,
Dzi hen wɔ me tsibowa do;
Yɛ mo Wura, na mebɛyɛ
Wodze koraa, m'bɛyɛ 'dehye.

MHB 288
5 . Holy Spirit, peace Divine,
Still this restless heart of mine,
 Speak to calm this tossing sea, 
 Stayed in Thy tranquillity.
	 ~ 	5 . Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, 'somdwee krɔnn,
M'akoma etsidaa pa,
Kasa ma po yi ntaa dzinn,
Ma ɔntsena W'asomdwee mu.

MHB 288
6 . Holy Spirit, joy Divine,
 Gladden Thou this heart of mine; 
 In the desert ways I’II sing: 
 Spring, O Well, for ever spring! Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, Nyame dɛw,
Fa dɛw hyɛ m'akoma mu;
Mobɔtow ndwom wɔ sar do;
Nsunyiwa, O Nsubura, pem daa.   Amen.

MHB 289
1 . SPIRIT divine, attend our prayers 
 And make this house your home; 
 Descend with all your gracious powers;
 O come, great Spirit, come! 
 	 ~ 	1 . Nyame sunsum, tsie hɛn mpaabɔ, 
Fa dan yi yɛ wo fie,
Fa W' adom no tum nyina sian;
Bra, Sunsum kɛse, bra.

MHB 289
2 . Come as the light: to us reveal
 Our emptiness and woe;
 And lead us in those paths of life 
 Where all the righteous go.
 	 ~ 	2 . Bra dɛ ekan: ma yenhu hɛn 
Mbɔbɔryɛ na mbusu
Na fa hɛn dua ɔbra kwan a,
Atseneneefo nyina duam'.

MHB 289
3 . Come as the fire, and purge our hearts 
Like sacrificial flame;
 Let our whole soul an offering be 
 To our Redeemer’s name. 
	 ~ 	3 . Bra dɛ ogya, bɛtsew hɛn ho, 
Dɛ afɔrbɔ gyaframee;
Ma hɛn kra nyina nyɛ afɔr
Mma hɛn Pomfo Ne dzin.

MHB 289
4 . Come as the dew, and sweetly bless 
 This consecrated hour; 
 May barrenness rejoice to own 
 Thy fertilizing power. 
	 ~ 	4 . Bra dɛ ɔbɔw, na dɛw mu ara 
Hyira ber krɔnkrɔn yi,
Ma dza etwie ndzi dɛw dɛ onya,
Wo prɔmprɔmyɛ tum no.

MHB 289
5 . Come as the dove, and spread Thy wings,
The wings of peaceful love; 
 And let Thy church on earth become 
 Blest as the Church above. 
	 ~ 	5 . Bra dɛ ebubur, tserɛw  W' atsabanm' 
Asomdwee dɔ atsaban n';
Na ma W' asɔr a ɔwɔ asaase
Nyɛ siar dɛ sor Asɔr n'.

MHB 289
6 . Come as the wind, with rushing sound 
 And  pentecostal  grace, 
 That all of woman born may see
 The glory of Thy face. 
	 ~ 	6 . Bra dɛmframa a ɔdze twitwi 
Na Pentecost adom,
Ma hɔn a Ɔbaa awo hɔn nyina
Eehu W' enyimnyam no.

MHB 289
7 . Spirit divine, attend our prayers; 
 Make a lost world Thy home; 
 Descend with all Thy gracious powers; 
 O come, great Spirit, come. Amen.	 ~ 	7 . Nyame Sunsum, tsie hɛn mpaabɔ; 
Yɛ wiadze a 'ayew Wo fie;
Fa W' adom No tum nyina sian;
Bra, Sunsum kɛse, bra.   Amen.

MHB 29
1 . ALL things praise Thee; Lord most high;
Heaven and earth and sea and sky.
All were for Thy glory made,
That Thy greatness thus displayed
Should all worship bring to Thee;
All things praise Thee: Lord, may we.
	 ~ 	1 . NDZEMBA nyina nyi Ewuradze ayɛw;
Sor na asaase, po na wimu,
Eyɛe hyɛɛ Woho enyimnyam,
Dze daa Wo kɛseyɛ edzi
Yɛdze som nyina brɛ Wo;
Yɛnye adze nyina yi W'ayɛw.

MHB 29
2 . All things praise Thee; night to night
Sings in silent hymns oi light;
All things praise Thee; day to day
Chants Thy power, in burning ray;
Time and space are praising Thee,
All things praise Thee: Lord, may we
	 ~ 	2 . Adze nyina yi W'ayɛw 'nago,
Wɔtow kan adwom kommyɛ mu;
Woyi W'ayɛw 'dzekyee nyina,
Ewiaber wɔkyerɛ Wo tum;
Ber na bea riyi W'ayɛw,
Yɛnye adze nyina yi W'ayɛw.

MHB 29
3 . All things praise Thee; round her zones
Earth, with her ten thousand tones.
Rolls a ceaseless choral strain;
Roaring wind and deep-voiced main,
Rustling leaf and humming bee,
All things praise Thee: Lord, may we.
	 ~ 	3 . Ndzɛmba nyina bɔ m' yi W'ayɛw,
Wiadze ne ndze ɔpedu
Ma ndwom a ɔnnsa da do;
Mframa na po a ɔrowor,
Nhaban na ndowa hɔn dede,
Yɛnye adze nyina yi W' ayɛw.

MHB 29
4 . All things praise Thee; high and low,
Rain and dew and seven-hued bow,
Crimson sunset, fleecy cloud,
Rippling stream and tempest loud;
Summer, winter, all to Thee
Glory render: Lord, may we.
	 ~ 	4 . Ndzemba nyina nyi W' ayɛw,
N-su, ɔbɔsu, nyankopɔn,
Ewia a 'rokɔtɔ na fua,
N-su a ɔrepem na ehum;
Twaber na ɔpɛber so,
Yɛnye hɔn hyɛ W' enyimnyam.

MHB 29
5 . All things praise Thee: gracious Lord.
Great Creator, powerful Word,
Omnipresent Spirit now
At Thy feet we humbly bow.
Lift our hearts in praise to Thee;
All things praise Thee: Lord, may we.	Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Adom Wura yeyi W' ayɛw,
Bɔfo Kɛse, tum Asɛm,
Sunsum a ɔwɔ beebiara,
Yɛkotow W'ananadze,
Yɛma akoma do yi W' ayɛw. 
Yɛnye adze nyina yi W' ayɛw.  Amen.

MHB 290
1 . GRACIOUS Spirit, Holy Ghost,
 Taught be Thee, we covet most,
 Of Thy gifts at Pentecost,
 Holy, heavenly love. 
	 ~ 	1 . O ADOM Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn,
Hɛn enyi ber Wo nkyerɛkyerɛ,
Wo Pentecost akyɛdze,
Ɔsor dɔ krɔnkrɔn.

MHB 290
2 . Faith that mountains could remove,
 Tongues of earth or heaven above, 
 Knowledge, all things, empty prove 
 Without heavenly love. 
 	 ~ 	2 . Gyedzi a otutu nkokwaa,
Ɔsor na ase ngyirma,
Nyimdzee nyina yɛ adzegyan,
Sɛ ɔdɔ nnyi mu a.

MHB 290
3 . Though I as a martyr bleed,
 Give my goods the poor to feed,
 All is vain if love I need; 
 Therefore give me love.
	 ~ 	3 . Sɛ muwu atɔfowu,
Medze m'ndzɛmba ma ehiafo,
Na ɔdɔ nnyi mu a, ɔyɛ kea,
Ntsi ma me ɔdɔ.

MHB 290
4 . Love is kind, and suffers long,
 Love is meek, and thinks no wrong, 
 Love than death itself more strong:
 Therefore give us love. 
 	 ~ 	4 . Bra dɛ ɔbɔw, na dɛw mu ara
Hyira ber krɔnkrɔn yi,
Ma dza etwie ndzi dɛw dɛ onya,
Wo prɔmprɔmyɛ tum no.

MHB 290
5 . Prophecy will fade away,
 Melting in the light of day; 
 Love will ever with us stay:
 Therefore give us love. 
 	 ~ 	5 . Bra dɛ ebubur, tserɛw W'atsaban m',
Asomdwee dɔ atsaban n';
Na ma W'asɔr a ɔwɔ asaase
Nyɛ siar dɛ sor Asɔr n'.

MHB 290
6 . Faith, and hope, and love we see,
Joining hand in hand, agree;
But the greatest of the three,
And the best, is love. 	 ~ 	6 . Bra dɛ mframa a ɔdze twitwi
Na Pentecost adom,
Ma hɔn a ɔbaa awo hɔn nyina
Eehu W'enyimnyam no.

MHB 291
1 . GRACIOUS Spirit, dwell with me!
 I myself would gracious be,
 And with words that help and heal 
 Would Thy life in mine reveal, 
 And with actions bold and meek
 Would for Christ my Saviour speak.
 	 ~ 	1 . SUNSUM Domfo, nye me ntsena!
Emi so m'bɛyɛ adom ba,
Na medze nkuranhyɛ nsɛm 
Bɛda Wo bra edzi mo mu,
Na medze ɔbrɛfo ndzeyɛɛ
Bɛkasa ama m' Gyefo Christ.

MHB 291
2 . Truthful Spirit, dwell with me! 
I myself would truthful be, 
 And with wisdom kind and clear
 Let Thy life in mine appear,
 And with actions brotherly 
 Speak my Lord’s sincerity. 
	 ~ 	2 . Sunsum Nokwafo, nye m' ntsena!
Mo so m' bɛyɛ nokwafo.
Na medze nyansa mapa
Bɛda Wo bra edzi mo mu,
Na medze enuadɔ ndzeyɛɛ
Beyi m' Wura N' nokwardzi akyerɛ.

MHB 291
3 . Tender Spirit, dwell with me!
I myself would tender be:
 Shut my heart up like a flower 
 At temptation’s darksome hour;
 Open it when shines the sun, 
 And His love by fragrance own.
 	 ~ 	3 . Sunsum Brɛfo, nye me ntsena!
Emi so m' bɛyɛ brɛfo;
M'akoma bɔmonsom dɛ nhyiren
Wɔ nsɔhwɛber sunkamm n' mu;
Obobue ber a ewia abɔ,
Na m' benya No dɔ no huam.

MHB 291
4 . Mighty Spirit, dwell with me!
 I myself would mighty be,
 Mighty so as to prevail 
 Where unaided man must fail, 
 Ever by a mighty hope
 Pressing on and bearing up. 
	 ~ 	4 . Sunsum Tumfo, nye me ntsena!
Emi so m' bɛyɛ tumfo,
Medze tum bedzi konyim
Ber a nyimpa ahom dzi kogu;
Medze tum enyidado
Bɔkɔ enyim daa egyina.

MHB 291
5 . Holy Spirit, dwell with me! 
 I myself would holy be; 
 Separate from sin, I would
 Choose and cherish all things good, 
 And, whatever I can be,
 Give to Him who gave me Thee.	 ~ 	5 . Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, nye me ntsena!
Emi so m' bɛyɛ krɔnkrɔn;
M'bɛtsew moho efi bɔn ho,
M'bɔtɔ akɔ dza oye nko ho,
Medze dza m'benya biara
Bɛma nyia ɔdze W' maa me.

MHB 292
1 . COME, Holy Spirit, heavenly Dove,
With all Thy quickening powers; 
 Kindle a flame of sacred love
 In these cold hearts of ours.
 	 ~ 	1 . SUNSUM Krɔnkrɔn, sor Ebubur, bra,
Fa Wo nkenyan tum nyina,
Sɔ ɔdɔ krɔnkrɔn gya n' ano
Hɛn akoma nwinwin yi m'.

MHB 292
2 . In vain we tune our formal songs,
 In vain we strive to rise;
 Hosannas languish on our tongues,
 And our devotion dies. 
	 ~ 	2 . Yɛtow hɛn daa daa ndwom no kwa,
Yɛper dɛ yɛsɔr kwa;
Hosanna nenam hɛn anomu,
Na hɛn ayɛyi ewu.

MHB 292
3 . And shall we then for ever live
 At this poor dying rate ?
 Our love so faint, so cold to Thee, 
 And Thine to us so great ! 
	 ~ 	3 . Na yɛbɛtsena owu gyangyan
Tsebea yi m' afebɔɔ?
Hɛn dɔ yɛ mberɛw, ɔyɛ nwin ma W',
Wodze n' so ma hɛn dɛ!

MHB 292
4 . Come, Holy Spirit, heavenly Dove, 
 With all Thy quickening powers; 
 Come, shed abroad the Saviour’s love, 
 And that shall kindle ours.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, sor Ebubur, bra,
Fa Wo nkenyan tum nyina;
Fa Agyenkwa N' dɔ n' petse hɛn do!
Na onkenyan hɛndze.  Amen.

MHB 293
1 . CREATOR Spirit; by whose aid
 The world’s foundations first were laid;
 Come, visit every waiting mind,
 Come, pour Thy joys on human kind; 
 From sin and sorrow set us free, 
 And make Thy temples worthy Thee.
 	 ~ 	1 . SUNSUM Bɔfo; Ɔwo a ahyɛse
Etoow wiadze fapem n' pintsinn,
Bra adwen a ɔrotweɔn biara mu,
Fa W'enyigye ma adasa,
Gye hɛn fi bɔn na awerɛhow mu,
Na ma W'asɔrfi mfata Wo.

MHB 293
2 . O Source of uncreated heat,
 The Father’s promised Paraclete,
Thrice holy Fount, thrice holy Fire,
 Our hearts with heavenly love inspire; 
 Come, and Thy sacred unction bring 
 To sanctify us while we sing.
 	 ~ 	2 . Ɔhyew a wɔammbɔ farbaa,
Kyigyinafo a Egya n' dze maa hɛn,
Bura na gya krɔnkrɔn mprɛnsa;
Fa sor dɔ kenyan hɛn akoma;
Bra, na fa Wo ngo krɔnkrɔn no
Bɛtsew hɛn ho ber a yɛtow ndwom.

MHB 293
3 . Plenteous of grace, descend from high,
Rich in Thy sevenfold energy; 
Thou strength of His almighty hand
 Whose power does heaven and earth command,
 Refine and purge our earthly parts,
 And stamp Thine image on our hearts.
 	 ~ 	3 . Ɔwo a adom ahyɛ W' ma, fi sor sian,
Fa Wo mpɛn esuon tum no bra,
Ɔwo nye No tum nsa ahoɔdzen a 
Odzi sor na asaase do tum;
Guar na tsew hɛn nyimpadua ho,
Na fa Wo su hyɛ hɛn akoma m'.

MHB 293
4 . Create all new; our wills control,
Subdue the rebel in our soul; 
 Make us eternal truths receive,
 And practise all that we believe ; 
 Give us Thyself ,that we may see 
The Father and the son by Thee.
	 ~ 	4 . Yɛ ndzɛmba fofor hyɛ pɛ do,
Brɛ hɛn akra asoɔdzenfo adze;
Ma hɛn nsa nka daa nokwar no,
Yɛmfa hɛn gyedzi nyɛ edwuma;
Fa Woho ma hɛn ma yenhu,
Egya na Ba no wɔ Wo mu.

MHB 293
5 . Immortal honour, endless fame, 
Attend the almighty Father’s name; 
The Saviour Son be glorified,
Who for lost man’s redemption died;
 And equal adoration be,
 Eternal Comforter, to Thee.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Enyimnyam nye abɔdzin a ɔnnsa
Ɔnka Egya Tumfo Ne dzin;
Wɔnhyɛ Agyenkwa, Ba enyimnyam,
Nyia owui dze gyee nyimpa nkwa n',
Na Wo so n-tonton nka Wo,
Ɔwo daa Ɔwerɛkyekyefo.  Amen.

MHB 294
1 . COME holy celestial Dove, 
To visit a sorrowful breast,
 My burden of guilt to remove,
 And bring me assurance and rest!
 Thou only hast power to relieve 
 A sinner o’erwhelmed with his load, 
 The sense of acceptance to give, 
 And sprinkle his heart with the blood.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆSOR Ebubur krɔnkrɔn, bra,
Bɛsera akoma werɛhonyi,
Beyi m'afɔdzi adzesoa,
Na fa awerɛhyɛmu brɛ me !
Wo nko na ibotum asoɛ
Ɔbɔnfo a no bɔn ahyɛ n' do,
Ama wɔaagye no ato mu,
Dze bɔgya n' aapetse n'akoma m'.

MHB 294
2 . With me if of old Thou hast strove,
And strangely withheld from my sin, 
 And tried, by the lure of Thy love,
 My worthless affections to win; 
 The work of Thy mercy revive, 
 Thy uttermost mercy exert,n And kindly continue to strive, 
 And hold, till I yield Thee my heart.
 	 ~ 	2 . Sɛ tsetse n' enye me peree,
Dɛ ebɛgye me efi bɔn ho,
Ebɔɔ mbɔdzen dɛ edze Wo dɔ
Bɛdaadaa me na atwe me a,
Kenyan W'ehumbɔbɔr ndwuma;
Ma Wo mbɔbɔrhu no ndɔɔ so,
Meserɛ, kɔ do na dzi aper
Kodu dɛ m'begyaa mu ama W'.

MHB 294
3 . Thy call if I ever have known, 
 And sighed from myself to get free, 
 And groaned the unspeakable groan,
 And longed to be happy in Thee; 
 Fulfil the imperfect desire, 
Thy peace to my conscience reveal,
The sense of Thy favour inspire, 
And give me my pardon to feel. 
 	 ~ 	3 . Sɛ matse Wo frɛ no pɛn a,
Na misii nkrum dze gyee moho a,
Mepeen ɔpen a onnyi kabea,
Na pepɛɛ Wo mu enyigye a,
Hyɛ me pɛ a onndzi mu no ma;
Ma me tsibowa nhu W'asomdwee,
Kenyan me ma munhu W'adom,
Na ma mentse bɔnfatsɛ nka.

MHB 294
4 . If when I had put Thee to grief,
 And madly to folly returned, 
 Thy pity hath been my relief, 
 And lifted me up as I mourned; 
 Most pitiful Spirit of grace, 
 Relieve me again, and restore,
 My spirit in holiness raise, 
 To fall and to suffer no more.  Amen.  	 ~ 	4 . Sɛ mama Wo werɛ ahow a,
Na medzi nkwaseasɛm ekyir a,
W'ehumbɔbɔr no agye me,
M'awerɛhow mu epegya me a,
Adom ehumbɔbɔr Sunsum,
Ma me ahotɔ bio, na gye
Mo sunsum wɔ krɔnkrɔnyɛ mu,
Ma n' do mma onnhu amandze bio.  Amen.

MHB 295
1 . SPIRIT blest, who art adored 
With the Father and the Word
One eternal God and Lord:
Hear us, Holy Spirit. 
	 ~ 	1 . SUNSUM siarfo a wͻsͻr Wo
Ka Egya na Asɛm no ho,
Nyame na Ewuradze kor:
Sunsum Krͻnkrͻn, tsie hɛn.

MHB 295
10 . Holy, loving, as Thou art,
 All Thy sevenfold  gifts impart; 
 Nevermore from us depart:
 Hear us, Holy Spirit.   Amen. 	 ~ 	10 . Ͻwo a eyɛ ͻdͻ krͻnkrͻn,
Ma hɛn W’akyɛdze nyina;
Mma mmfi hɛn nkyɛn ara da;
Sunsum Krͻnkrͻn, tsie hɛn.

MHB 295
2 . Holy Spirit, heavenly Dove, 
Dew descending  from above, 
 Breath of life and fire of love: 
 Hear  us, Holy Spirit. 
	 ~ 	2 . Sunsum Krͻnkrͻn, sor Ebubur,
Ͻbͻsu a isian fi sor, ’
N-kwa ahom, ͻdͻ gya:
Sunsum Krͻnkrͻn, tsie hɛn.

MHB 295
3 . Spirit,guiding us aright,
 Spirit, making darkness light,
Spirit of resistless might: 
 Hear us, Holy Spirit. 
	 ~ 	3 . SunSum a ekyerɛ hɛn kwan,
Sunsum a ema sum yɛ kan,
Obi nntum nngyina Wo tum ano:
Sunsum Krͻnkrͻn, tsie hɛn.

MHB 295
4 . Thou whom Jesus from His throne 
 Gave to cheer and help His own, 
 That they might not be alone: 
 Hear us, Holy Spirit. 
 	 ~ 	4 . Wo a Jesus fi N’egua do
Dze Wo mae dɛ bͻboa hɛn,
Amma yaannyɛ ankonam;
Sunsum Krͻnkrͻn, tsie hɛn.

MHB 295
5 . All our evil passions kill;
 Bend aright our stubborn will; 
Though we grieve Thee, patient still: 
 Hear us, Holy Spirit. 
 	 ~ 	5 . Ku hɛn akͻndͻbͻn nyina;
Hyɛ hɛn asoadzen pɛ do;
Yesérɛ W’ nya abotar ma hɛn:
Sunsum Krͻnkrͻn, tsie hɛn.

MHB 295
6 . Come, to raise us when we fall; 
 And, when snares our souls enthrall, 
 Lead us back with gentle call:
 Hear us, Holy Spirit. 
	 ~ 	6 . Yehwe ase a, ma hɛn do,
Na hɛn kra tͻ efir mu a,
Fre hɛn bérɛww bra Wo nkyɛn bio;
Sunsum Krͻnkrͻn, tsie hɛn.

MHB 295
7 . Come, to strengthen all the weak;
 Give Thy courage to the meek; 
 Teach our faltering tongues to speak:
 Hear us, Holy Spirit. 
 	 ~ 	7 . Bra bɛhyɛ mbérɛwyɛfo dzen;
Ma abrɛfo akokodur,
Kyérɛ hɛn ma yɛnkasa yie:
Sunsum Krͻnkrͻn, tsie hɛn.

MHB 295
8 . Come, to aid the souls who yearn
 More of truth divine to learn,
 And with deeper love to burn: 
 Hear us, Holy Spirit. 
	 ~ 	8 . Bra bͻboa akra a wͻpɛ
Esua Wo nokwar mapa n’,
Na woenya ͻdͻ pa no;
Sunsum Krͻnkrͻn, tsie hɛn.

MHB 295
9 . Keep  us in the narrow way;
 Warn us when we go astray; 
 Plead within us when we pray:
 Hear us, Holy Spirit. 
	 ~ 	9 . Fa hɛn fa kwan tseabaa n’ mu.
Sɛ yɛfom a, bͻ hɛn kͻkͻ;
Yɛbͻ mpaa a, serɛ ma hɛn.
Sunsum Krͻnkrͻn, tsie hɛn.

MHB 296
1 . HOLY Spirit! pity me, 
Pierced with grief for grieving Thee;
 Present, though I mourn apart, 
 Listen to a wailing heart.
 	 ~ 	1 . SUNSUM Krɔnkrɔn, hu m' mbɔbɔr,
Midzi yaw dɛ mafom Wo,
Murusu sesei yi dzi,
Tsie akoma a orusu n'.

MHB 296
10 . O be merciful to me, 
 Now in bitterness for Thee. 
 Father, pardon through Thy Son 
 Sins against Thy Spirit done.   Amen. 	 ~ 	10 . O hu me mbɔbɔr ara,
Afei midzi mo mu yaw,
Dza mayɛ etsia Wo Sunsum n',
Egya, fa kyɛ m' wɔ Ba n' mu.  Amen.

MHB 296
2 . Sins unnumbered I confess,
 Of exceeding sinfulness;
 Sins against Thyself alone, 
 Only to Omniscience known;: 
	 ~ 	2 . Mo bɔn a ɔdɔɔ so pii n',
Meka ne nyina kyerɛ Wo;
Dza mayɛ etsia WO nko n',
Enyianyiakwa, Wo nko nyim.

MHB 296
3 . Deafness to Thy whispered calls, 
 Rashness midst remembered falls, 
 Transient fears beneath the rod, 
 Treacherous trifling with my God;
 	 ~ 	3 . M'aso esiw wɔ Wo frɛ ho,
Me per mu mohwe ase daa,
Fa W'aba puw me kakra,
Na mammfa Nyame enndzi agor.

MHB 296
4 . Tasting that the Lord is good, 
 Pining then for poisoned food;
 At the fountains of the skies
 Craving creaturely supplies; 
 	 ~ 	4 . Metakyeer edziban bɔn ho;
Masɔ ahwɛ dɛ Ewuradze ye;
Mema m'enyi do hwɛ wimu
Dze hwɛ dza Bɔadze bɛma.

MHB 296
5 . Worldly cares at worship-time;
 Grovelling aims in works sublime; 
 Pride, when God is passing by; 
 Sloth, when souls in darkness die; 
 	 ~ 	5 . Wiadze dadwen hyɛ som ma;
Botae hun ka dwumadzi hyɛ,
Ahokyerɛ, ber a Nyame bɛn;
Akwadwer, ber a sum mba wu.

MHB 296
6 . Chilled devotions, changed desires,
 Quenched corruption’s earlier fires:
 Sins like these my heart deceive, 
 Thee, who only know’st them, grieve. 
 	 ~ 	6 . 'Sɔryɛ nwinwin, apɛdze
Duum prɔwee gya tantan no;
'Mumuyɛ daadaa m'akoma,
 Ɔhyɛ Ɔwo a 'nyim n' awerɛhow.

MHB 296
7 . O how lightly have I slept
 With Thy daily wrongs unwept,
 Sought Thy chidings to defer,
 Shunned the wounded Comforter:
 	 ~ 	7 . O mannda papa biara,
Dɛ mennsu mo mfom pii n' ho,
Mannhwehwɛ W'enyimtwuw no,
Mebu enyi egu Sunsum n' do.

MHB 296
8 . Woke to holy labours fresh
 With the plague-spot in my flesh; 
Angel seemed to human sight,
Stood a leper in Thy light. 
 	 ~ 	8 . Minyan dwumadzi fofor do,
Yardɔm no wɔ mo wer mu;
Nyimpa enyi do sor bɔfo,
Kwatanyi wɔ Wo kan mu.

MHB 296
9 . Still Thy comforts do not fail,
Still Thy healing aids avail; 
 Patient inmate of my breast,
 Thou art grieved, yet I am blest. 
	 ~ 	9 . Ma m' W'awerɛkyekyer no daa,
Dom me W'ayarsa no daa;
Soɛ mo mu abotar mu,
Idzi yaw, eso hyira m'.

MHB 297
1 . COME to our poor nature’s night
 With Thy blessèd inward light,
 Holy Ghost, the Infinite,
 Comforter Divine. 
 	 ~ 	1 . FA Wo mu nhyira kanea no
Bra hen su sunkamm no mu,
Sunsum Krͻnkrͻn a ’dzi mu,
’Wérɛkyekyer Nyame.

MHB 297
2 . We are sinful—cleanse us, Lord; 
 Sick and faint—Thy strength afford;
 Lost, until by Thee restored, 
 Comforter Divine. 
 	 ~ 	2 . Abͻnfo Wura, guar hɛn;
Yɛyar, yeafona, hyɛ hɛn dzen;
Yɛayew, gyedɛ etsen hɛn,
’Wérɛkyekyer Nyame.

MHB 297
3 . Like the dew Thy peace distil; 
 Guide, subdue our wayward will,
 Things of Christ unfolding still, 
 Comforter Divine. 
	 ~ 	3 . ‘W'asomdwee ba dɛ ͻbͻw:
Kyerɛ, hyɛ hɛn pɛ a ayew do,
Kͻ do bue Christ mu ndzɛmba,
’Wérɛkyekyer Nyame.

MHB 297
4 . Gentle, awful, holy Guest, 
 Make Thy temple in each breast; 
 There Thy presence be confessed,
 Comforter divine. 
 	 ~ 	4 . Damfo a edwe krͻnkrͻnyi:
Si W’asͻrdan hɛn akoma m’,
Boa hɛn ma yɛntse Wo nka,
’Wérɛkyekyer Nyame.

MHB 297
5 . With us, for us, intercede,
And, with voiceless groanings, plead 
 Our unutterable need, 
 Comforter Divine. 
 	 ~ 	5 . Dzi ntamugyina ma hɛn daa,
Na yɛmfa ndzé a wͻnntse mper
Hɛn ehiadzé a yenntum nnka.
’Wérɛkyekyer Nyame.

MHB 297
6 . In us Abba, Father! cry, 
Earnest of the bliss on high,
 Seal of immortality, 
 Comforter Divine.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Abba, Egya yɛtsea mu,
Ma yenya ͻsor hyira,
Onnyiewie ahyɛnsew no,
’Wérɛkyekyer Nyame.

MHB 298
1 . LORD God the Holy Ghost, 
In this accepted hour, 
 As on the day of Pentecost,
 Descend in all Thy power.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME Sunsum Krͻnkrͻn;
Ber a ͻsɛ yi mu,
De mbrɛ Pentecost da n’ yɛe no,
Fa Wo tum nyina sian.

MHB 298
2 . We meet with one accord  
 In our appointed place, 
 And wait  the promise of our Lord, 
 The Spirit of all grace. 
	 ~ 	2 . Yɛdze koryɛ dzi ehyia
Wͻ bea a ahyɛ ama hɛn,
Yɛtweͻn hɛn Wura anohoba n’,
Adom nyina Sunsum no.

MHB 298
3 . Like mighty rushing  wind 
 Upon the waves beneath, 
 Move with one impulse every  mind,
 One soul, one feeling breathe. 
	 ~ 	3 . Dɛ ehum kɛsé a ͻrobͻ
Wͻ asorɛkye n’ase,
Dze tum kenyan adwen nyina,
’Kra, atsenka ahom kor.

MHB 298
4 . The young, the old, inspire
 With wisdom from above;
 And give us hearts and tongues of fire,
 To pray and praise and love.
 	 ~ 	4 . Fa nyansa fi sor hyɛ
Mbaabun nye mpanyin ma;
Ma hɛn ’gya akoma nye gyirama,
Mfa nsͻr, nyi ayɛw, mfa ndͻ.

MHB 298
5 . Spirit of light explore, 
And chase our gloom away 
 With lustre shining more and more,
 Unto the perfect day.
 	 ~ 	5 . Ekan Sunsum, hwehwɛ
Na pam isum fi hͻ;
Fa ahoͻdzen hyerɛn daa daa,
Kɛpem da pa no mu.

MHB 298
6 . Spirit of truth, be Thou 
 In life and death our guide; 
 O Spirit of adoption, now
 May we be sanctified.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Nokwar Sunsum, gye hɛn
Wͻ nkwa nye owu mu,
Sesei, Sunsum a awo hɛn,
Boa hɛn ma hɛn ho ntsew.

MHB 299
1 . COME, Holy Ghost, all-quickening fire,
 Come, and in me delight to rest; 
 Drawn by the lure of strong desire, 
 O come and consecrate my breast; 
 The temple of my soul prepare, 
 And fix Thy sacred presence there.
 	 ~ 	1 . BRA Sunsum Krͻnkrͻn, hyewbͻ gya,
Bra na fa dɛw bͻhom mo mu;
Dɛ pɛ dzendzen atwe W' aba 'i,
O bra bɛtsew m'akoma ho.
Si me kra m' asͻrfi wͻ hͻ.
Na fa W'nhotscw su tsim ha. '

MHB 299
2 . Eager for Thee I ask and pant; 
 So strong, the principle divine 
 Carries me out, with sweet constraint, 
 Till all my hallowed soul is Thine; 
 Plunged in the Godhead’s deepest sea,
 And lost in Thine immensity. 
 	 ~ 	2 . Mehaahaa bisa Wo dodow;
Sor ahom a ͻyɛ dzen yie,
Twe m’ pue ahotͻ dɛɛdɛw mu
Kɛpem dɛ me kra ayɛ Wodze;
‘Korsa po bun emunam mo do,
Na mayew Wo kokrokoyɛ m’.

MHB 299
3 . My peace, my life, my comfort Thou,
 My treasure and my all Thou art; 
 True witness of my sonship, now
 Engraving pardon on my heart,
 Seal of my sins in Christ forgiven,
 Earnest of love, and pledge of heaven.
	 ~ 	3 . M’asomdwee, mo nkwa, m’ahotͻ,
M’akoradze nyina nye Woara,
M‘abayɛ ho dasefo pa,
Kurkye fakyɛ wͻ rn‘akoma m’,
Christ ntsi wͻdze mo bͻn akyɛ m’,
Dͻ ho enyimia, sor abͻbaado.

MHB 299
4 .  Come then, my God, mark out Thine heir,
 Of heaven a larger earnest give;
 With clearer light Thy witness bear,
 More sensibly within me live;
 Let all my powers Thine entrance feel,
 And deeper stamp Thyself the seal.    Amen. 	 ~ 	4 . Me Nyame bra, kyérɛ Wo wuodzi,
Ma n' enyimia kɛse wͻ sor, ,
Ondzi Wo ho dase pefee,
Ma mentse Wo nka wͻ mo mu,
Ma mo tum nyina nhu dɛ aba,
Na Woara yɛ dɛ nsͻwano pa.

MHB 3
1 . Before Jehovah's awful throne,
All nations, bow with sacred joy;
Know that the Lord is God alone;
He can create, and he destroy.
	 ~ 	1 . AMANAMAN, hom mfa dew nkotow 
Jehova ahengua huuhu enyim;
Hom nhu Ewuradze nko dɛ Nyame;
Ɔno na ɔbɔ na ono na Osɛɛ.

MHB 3
2 . His sovereign power, without our aid,
Made us of clay, and formed us men;
And when like wandering sheep we strayed,
He brought us to his fold again.
	 ~ 	2 . N'ahentum no, onnhia hɛn mboa;
Ɔdze dɛtse nween hɛn nyimpa.
Yɛtse dɛ nguan a yɛtɔɔ gon n';
Ɔdze hɛn baa nguankuw n'mu bio.

MHB 3
3 . We'll crowd thy gates with thankful songs;
High as the heavens our voices raise;
And earth, with her ten thousand tongues,
Shall fill thy courts with sounding praise.
	 ~ 	3 . Yɛdze ndaase ndwom fum W'apon m',
Yɛma hɛn ndze do wɔ sorsor,
Na asaase dze ngyirama ɔpedu,
Dze ayeyi hyɛ W'abangua ma.

MHB 3
4 . Wide as the world is thy command;
Vast as eternity thy love;
Firm as a rock thy truth shall stand,
When rolling years shall cease to move.
				Amen.	 ~ 	4 . W'ahyɛdze tserɛw tse dɛ wiadze
Wo dɔ so kodu mbersantsen,
Wo nokwar betsim dɛ botan,
Kodu Mbersantsen mfesantsen.

MHB 30
1 . FROM glory to glory advancing, we praise Thee, O Lord;
Thy name with the Father and Spirit be ever adored.
From strength unto strength we go forward on Sion’s highway,
To appear before God in the city of infinite day.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, yefi enyimnyam m'kɔ'
 nyimnyam m' yi W'ayɛw;
Ntonton nka Wo dzin, ɔnka Egya
nye Sunsum no so,
Yefi ahom mu kɔ ahom m'
nantsew Zion kwan do,
Dze kopue Nyankopɔn enyim
wɔ kurow a adze nnsa mu da m'.

MHB 30
2 . Thanksgiving and glory and worship, and blessing and love,
One heart and one song have the saints upon earth and above.
Evermore, O Lord, to Thy servants Thy presence be nigh;
Ever fit us by service on earth for Thy service on high.
 			Amen.	 ~ 	2 . Ndaase na enyimnyam, na ɔsom,
na nhyira nye ɔdɔ,
Akòma kor, na ndwom kor ;
  Nà ase nye sòr ahotsewfo wɔ,
O Ewuradze, daa daa nyina twe bɛn
W’asomfo,
Dua hɛn wiadze som do
    Siesie hɛn ma Wo sor edwuma.

MHB 300
1 . BREATHE on me, Breath of God;
Fill me with life anew,
 That I may love what Thou dost love,
 And do what Thou wouldst do.
 	 ~ 	1 . Nyame ahom, gu mo do; 
Hyɛ mo mu nkwa fofor,
Ma mondɔ dza Ɔwo edɔ
Na menyɛ dza eyɛ.

MHB 300
2 . Breathe on me, Breath of God,
 Until my heart is pure; 
 Until with Thee I will one will, 
 To do and to endure.
 	 ~ 	2 . Nyame ahom, gu mo do; 
Ma m' akoma mu ntsew,
Kɛpem dɛ menye W' nya pɛ kor
Dze sɔw fona, dze bɔ bra.

MHB 300
3 . Breathe on me, Breath of God,
 Till I am wholly Thine;
 Until this earthly part of me 
 Glows with Thy fire divine.
	 ~ 	3 . Nyame ahom, gu mo do; 
Ma menyɛ Wodze koraa,
Kɛpem dɛ me nyimpadua mpo
Nyame kan bɛhyerɛn mu.

MHB 300
4 . Breathe on me, Breath of God: 
 So shall I never die, 
 But live with Thee the perfect life
 Of Thine eternity.  	 ~ 	4 . Nyame ahom, gu mo do; 
Nna munnkowu ara da,
Na mbom menye Wo bɛtsena ase
Mber a onnyi ewiei mu.  Amen.

MHB 301
1 . ON all the earth Thy Spirit shower;
 The earth in righteousness renew; 
 Thy kingdom come, and hell’s o’erpower, 
And to Thy sceptre all subdue.
	 ~ 	1 . PETSE Wo Sunsum gu asaase,
Asaase mfa tsénenee mfafor,
W’ahendzi mbra, ͻnka hɛll nhyɛ,
Na W’akomfowa mbrɛ dͻm nyina adze.

MHB 301
2 . Like mighty winds, or torrents fierce,
 Let it opposers all o’errun; 
 And every law of sin reverse, 
 That faith and love may make all one.
	 ~ 	2 . Ma ͻnyɛ dɛ ehum dzendzen
Mbͻ mfa atamfo nyina do,
Ͻnsakyer bͻn no kwan biara,
Ma gyedzi na dͻ nka hͻn mbͻ m’.

MHB 301
3 . Yea, let Thy Spirit in every place
  Its richer energy declare;
  While lovely tempers, fruits of grace,
 The kingdom of Thy Christ prepare.
	 ~ 	3 . Nyew, ma Wo Sunsum beebiara
Ͻnda N‘ahom kɛse n’ edzi,
Ber a ndzeyɛɛ pa, adorn n’aba
Risiesie Wo Christ N'ahenman.

MHB 301
4 . Grant this, O holy God and true!
The ancient seers Thou didst inspire;
 To us perform the promise due;
  Descend, and crown us now with fire.    Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Yɛ adom, nokwar Nyame krͻnkrͻn!
Ikenyaan tsetse adzehufo,
Hyɛ anohoba n’ ma ma hɛn,
Sian, fa gya soa hɛn ahenkyɛw.

MHB 302
1 . FATHER of mercies, in Thy word
 What endless glory shines!
 For ever be Thy name adored 
 For these celestial lines.
	 ~ 	1 . Mbɔbɔrhu Egya, W' asɛm mu 
Enyimnyam ahyɛ ma!
Abɔdzin nyinaa nka Wo dzin
W' adom nsɛmpa yi ntsi.

MHB 302
2 . Here may the wretched sons of want
Exhaustless riches find;
Riches, above what earth can grant,
And, lasting as the mind.
	 ~ 	2 . Ha na akɔhweaban nyina 
Nya ahonya mbordo;
Ahonya a bi nnyi wi ase,
Otsim hɔ afebɔɔ.

MHB 302
3 . Here the fair tree of knowledge grows,
And yields a free repast ;
Sublimer sweets than nature knows
Invite the longing taste.
	 ~ 	3 . Ha na nyimdzee nduadzewa fifir 
Ma hɔn a kɔm dze hɔn;
Edziban pa a wiadze nnyi bi,
Rotweɔn nyia no kɔn dɔ.

MHB 302
4 . Here the Redeemer's welcome voice
Spreads heavenly peace around ;
And life and everlasting joys
Attend the blissful sound.
	 ~ 	4 . Ha na hɛn Pomfo N' ndze dɛɛdɛw 
Ka asomdwee kasa;
Na nkwa na dɛw a onyi ewiei
Wɔ Ne nsɛm nyinaa mu.

MHB 302
5 . Divine instructor, gracious Lord,
Be thou for ever near ;
Teach me to love Thy sacred word,
And view my Saviour there.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Kyerɛkyerɛfo pa, adom Wura, 
Bɛn Wo ba daa nyinaa;
Kyerɛ m' ma mondɔ W' asɛmpa,
Na munhu m'Agyenkwa.    Amen.

MHB 303
1 . O WORD of God incarnate,
 O wisdom from on high,
 O Truth unchanged, unchanging, 
 O Light of our dark sky,
 We praise Thee for the radiance
That from the hallowed page,
 A lantern to our footsteps,
 Shines on from age to age.
	 ~ 	1 . AO, NYAME Asɛm a abɛbra,
Ao, Nyansa a ifi sor,
Ao, Nokwar a 'nnsesa da,
Ao, hɛn wimu kadoo kan!
Yehuhor W' wɔ Wo hyerɛn ho,
Ifi siar bea ayɛ
Hɛn anamɔn ne kanea,
Hyerɛn fi ber to ber.

MHB 303
2 . The Church from her dear Master
 Received the gift divine,
 And still that light she lifteth,
 O’er all the earth to shine;
 It is the golden casket 
 Where gems of truth are stored;
 It is the heaven-drawn picture
 Of Christ, the living Word;
	 ~ 	2 . Asɔrfi no Wura dɔfo
Nsamu nyaa sor akyɛdze,
Ɔda ho ama kan no do,
Ɔnhyerɛn wiadze nyina do,
Ɔyɛ sika adakaba;
Wosie mpɔkowa pa wɔ m',
Ɔyɛ Christ nkwa asɛm no
N'ahenman mu mfonyin.

MHB 303
3 . It floateth like a banner 
 Before God’s host unfurled;
It shineth like a beacon
Above the darkling world;
It is the chart and compass
That ,o’er life’s surging sea,
Mid mists, and rocks, and quicksands,
 Still guides, O Christ, to Thee.
	 ~ 	3 . Orinyam tse dɛ frankaa,
Wɔ Nyame dɔm enyim,
Ɔhyerɛn tse dɛ ogyaabaa
Wɔ wiadze no sum do;
Ɔyɛ akyerɛkwan nwoma
Wɔ bra po pramee do,
Kusukuukuu, ɔbo, anhwea o,
Christ, wɔdze ba Wo nkyɛn.

MHB 303
4 . O make Thy Church, dear Saviour,
  A lamp of burnished gold,
 To bear before the nations
 Thy true light as of old;
O teach Thy wandering pilgrims
By this their path to trace,
Till, clouds and darkness ended, 
They see Thee face to face.	 ~ 	4 . Gyefo pa, yɛ W'asɔrfi
Sika kanea hyɛnhyɛn,
Ɔmfa Wo nokwar kan no
Nkyin aman do dɛ tsetse,
Ma W'akwantufo a worikyin
Mfa yi nhwehwɛ hɔn kwan,
Nkodu dɛ fua, sum bɛpa,
Wobohu W' 'nyim na enyim.

MHB 304
1 . FATHER of all, in whom alone
  We live, and move, and breathe,
  One bright celestial ray dart down,
  And cheer Thy sons beneath.
	 ~ 	1 . NYlMPA nyina Egya, Wo nko mu na
Yɛtse, kͻ ba, gu ahom,
Sor kan séremen kor na osian famu
Bɛsɛpɛw Wo mba ho.

MHB 304
2 . While in Thy word we search for Thee-
   We search with trembling awe-
 The wonders of Thy law.
	 ~ 	2 . W'asɛm mu na yɛhwehwɛ Wo,
Yedze hu hwehwɛ Wo,
Bue hɛn enyi na ma yenhu
Wo mbra m' anwanwadze.

MHB 304
3 . Now let our darkness comprehend
 The light that shines so clear;
 Now the revealing Spirit send,
 And give us ears to hear.   Amen.	 ~ 	3 . Afei ma hɛn sum no nkata
Kan a ͻhyerɛn guam’ n’ do;
Afei soma Sunsum kyérɛkyérɛfo n’,
Bue hɛn asomu ma yɛntse.

MHB 305
1 . COME, Holy Ghost, our hearts inspire,
 Let us Thine influence prove,
 Source of the old prophetic fire,
 Fountain of light and love.
	 ~ 	1 . Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, bra hɛn 'komam', 
Ma yɛntse Wo tum no,
Wo na tsetse wɔdze W' hyɛɛ nkɔm,
Na kan na dɔ fir Wo.

MHB 305
2 . Come, Holy Ghost, for moved by Thee 
 Thy prophets wrote and spoke ;
 Unlock the truth, Thyself the key,
 Unseal the sacred Book.
	 ~ 	2 . Bra, na Ɔwo na nkɔnhyɛfo n' 
Dze W' kyerɛwee, dze Wo kae;
Bue nokwar no, Ɔwo nye saafee n',
Tsew nwoma krɔnkrɔn n' ano.

MHB 305
3 . Expand Thy wings, celestial Dove,
 Brood o’er our nature’s night;
On our disordered spirits move,
And let there now be light.
	 ~ 	3 . Sor Ebubur, trɛ W' atsabanm' 
Wɔ hɛn isum no do,
Butuw hɛn kra no sum no do,
Na ma hɔ ɔnyɛ kann.

MHB 305
4 . God, through Himself, we then shall know,
If Thou within us shine,
And sound, with all Thy saints below,
The depths of love divine.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Sɛ 'hyerɛn hɛn mu a, yɛnam Nyame 
Nankasa do bohu N',
Na yɛnye Wo mba nyina esusu
Onyame dɔ no bun.   Amen.

MHB 306
1 . COME, divine Interpreter,
Bring us eyes Thy Book to read,
Ears the mystic words to hear,
Words which did from Thee proceed,
Words that endless bliss impart,
Kept in an obedient heart.
	 ~ 	1 . ASEKYERƐFO Krɔnkrɔn, bra,
Ma hɛn enyi mfa nkan Wo nwoma;
Aso ntsie esumasɛm no,
Nsɛm a ofi Wo nkyn ba,
Nsɛm a ɔma onnyiewie nhyira,
Yɛkora no setsie akomam'.

MHB 306
2 . All who read, or hear, are blessed,
If Thy plain commands we do;
Of Thy kingdom here possessed,
Thee we shall in glory view;
When Thou com’st on earth to abide,
Reign triumphant at Thy side.	 ~ 	2 . Hɔn a wɔkan, tsie yɛ nhyira mba,
Sɛ wodzi W'ahyɛdze do a;
W'ahenman n' yebenya n' ha,
Na yeehu W'enyimnyam no,
Sɛ eba bɛtsena ase ha a,
Yenye W'eedzi hen konyim m'.

MHB 307
1 . THE Spirit breathes upon the word,
And brings the truth to sight;
Precepts and promises afford
A sanctifying light.
	 ~ 	1 . SUNSUM n' gu ahom gu asɛm n' do
Na ɔma nokwar da edzi;
Afotu nye anohoba ma
Kan a ɔma ahotsew.

MHB 307
2 . A glory gilds the sacred page,
Majestic, like the sun:
It gives a light to ev’ry age;
It gives, but borrows none.
	 ~ 	2 . Enyimnyam hyerɛn nwoma no do
Hyenhyɛnhyɛn dɛ ewia,
Ɔma hɛn wɔ ber biara mu,
Noara dze ma, ɔmmfɛm.

MHB 307
3 . The hand that gave it still supplies
The gracious light and heat;
His truths upon the nations rise;
They rise, but never set.
	 ~ 	3 . Nsa a ɔma no gu do ma
Adom kan nye ɔhyew,
No nokwardzi soɛr aman do,
Wɔsoɛr na wɔnntɔ da.

MHB 307
4 . Let everlasting thanks be Thine
For such a bright display
As makes a world of darkness shine
With beams of heavenly day.
	 ~ 	4 . Ma ndaase a onnyi ewiei nyɛ Nedze
Wɔ dɛm kan hyɛnn no ho,
Dɛ ɔma wiadze sunkamm hyerɛn
Fi sor adzekyee nserɛmɛn m'.

MHB 307
5 . My soul rejoices to pursue
The steps of Him I love,
Till glory breaks upon my view
In brighter worlds above.	 ~ 	5 . Me kra dzi dɛw dɛ ɔbɛka
Nyimpa a modɔ No n' do,
Kodu dɛ m'bohu enyimnyam
Wɔ sor man fɛɛfɛw n' mu.

MHB 308
1 . LORD, Thy word abideth,
And our footsteps guideth:
Who its truth believeth
Light and joy receiveth.
	 ~ 	1 . Ewuradze, W' asɛm tsim, 
'No na yɛhwɛ nantsew,
Nyia ɔgye no nokwar
Nya kan nye enyigye.

MHB 308
2 . When our foes are near us,
Then Thy word doth cheer us,
Word of consolation,
Message of salvation.
	 ~ 	2 . Atamfo ba hɛn do a, 
W' asɛm yi hyɛ hɛn dzen,
Awerɛkyekyer nsɛmpa,
N-kwagye amandzɛɛ.

MHB 308
3 . When the storms are o’er us,
And dark clouds before us,
Then its light directeth,
And our way protecteth.
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔbra n' ehum tu hɛn, 
Na sum gye hɛn do a,
Ne kan hyerɛn ma hɛn,
Na ɔkyerɛ hɛn kwan.

MHB 308
4 . Who can tell the pleasure,
Who recount the treasure,
By Thy word imparted
To the simple-hearted?
	 ~ 	4 . Woana botum akyerɛ 
Ahotɔ nye dɛw a
W' asɛmpa yi dze ma
N-tsetsekwaa nyinaa?

MHB 308
5 . Word of mercy, giving
Succour to the living;
Word of life, supplying
Comfort to the dying.
	 ~ 	5 . Ehumbɔbɔr nsɛmpa, 
Ɔboa atseasefo;
N-kwasɛm, ɔkyekye
Hɔn a wɔda wuso werɛ.

MHB 308
6 . O that we discerning
Its most holy learning,
Lord, may love and fear Thee,
Evermore be near Thee!      Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Ewuradze, ma yenhu 
No mu adzesua krɔnkrɔn n',
Na yaadɔ, yeesuro Wo,
Daa nyinaa yaabɛn Wo!   Amen.

MHB 309
1 . BREAK Thou the Bread of Life,
O Lord, to me,
As Thou didst break the loaves
Beside the sea:
Beyond the sacred page
I seek Thee, Lord;
My spirit pants for Thee,
O Living Word!
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, bu nkwa
Paanoo n' bi ma m',
Dɛ mbrɛ ibubuu bi mu
Po no ho no;
Nwoma krɔnkrɔn n' no mu
Na mohwehwɛ W',
Mo sunsum per hwehwɛ W',
O nkwa Asɛm!

MHB 309
2 . Thou art the Bread of Life,
O Lord, to me,
Thy holy word the truth
That saveth me:
Give me to eat and live
With Thee above;
Teach me to love Thy truth,
For Thou art love.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔwo yɛ Nkwa Paanoo,
Ewuradze ma m'
W'asɛm nye nokwar no a
Ɔgyee me no
Ma menye Wo ndzidzi
Nnya nkwa wɔ sor;
Kyerɛ m' ma mondɔ W' nokwar
Na Ɔwo nye ɔdɔ.

MHB 309
3 . O send Thy Spirit, Lord,
Now unto me,
That He may touch my eyes,
And make me see:
Show me the truth concealed
Within Thy Word,
And in Thy Book revealed
I see the Lord.	 ~ 	3 . Owura, ma Wo Sunsum
No mbra mo do,
Na ɔnka m'enyiwa,
Na meehu adze;
Kyerɛ m' W'asɛm mu nokwar a
Ehuntsa no,
Nwoma a eyi akyerɛ n' mu
Muhu Ewuradze.

MHB 31
1 . GOD reveals His presence:
Let us now adore Him,
And with awe appear before Him.
God is in His temple:
All within keep silence,
Prostrate lie with deepest reverence.
Him alone
God we own,
Him our God and Saviour.
Praise His name for ever.
	 ~ 	1 . Nyame da Noho edzi:
Hom mma yɛntonton No,
Yɛmfa enyidzi mbra N'enyim;
Nyame wɔ N'asɔrfi m'.
Hɔn a wɔwɔ m'nyina nyɛ komm,
Yɛmfa enyidzi ntwa nhwe N'enyim.
'No nko nye
Hɛn Nyame, Hɛn Gyefo:
Yi Ne dzin ayɛw daa.

MHB 31
2 . God reveals His presence:
Hear the harps resounding,
See the crowds the throne surrounding;
Holy, holy, holy!
Hear the hymn ascending,
Angels, saints, their voices blending.
Bow Thine ear
To us here	
Hearken, O Lord Jesus,
To our meaner praises.
	 ~ 	2 . Nyame da Noho edzi:
Tsie, wɔrobɔ nsanku,
Hwɛ, dɔm n' etwa ahengua n' ho ehyia.
Krɔnkrɔn, Krɔnkrɔn, Krɔnkrɔn,
Tsie dɛ ndwom n' rofow sor,
'Bɔfo, hotsewfo tow ndwom n'bi.
Kyɛn W'aso 
Tsie hɛn ha;
Ewuradze Jesus, tsie
Hɛn ayɛyi a ɔmmfata.

MHB 31
3 . O Thou Fount of blessing,
Purity my spirit;
Trusting only in Thy merit,
Like the holy angels
Who behold Thy glory,
May I ceaselessly adore Thee.
Let Thy will
Ever still
Rule Thy church terrestrial,
As the hosts celestial.   Amen.	 ~ 	3 . Ɔwo nye nhyira Bura,
Bɛtsew mo sunsum ho:
Memfa mo werɛ nhyɛ Wo nko mu,
Tse dɛ abɔfo krɔnkrɔn a
Wohu W'enyimnyam no,
Ma montonton Wo daa daa nyina.
Ma Wo pɛ 
Nhyɛ W'asɔr
Wɔ asaase yi do
Dɛ mbrɛ ɔtse wɔ sor.  Amen.

MHB 310
1 . WHEN quiet in my house I sit,
Thy Book be my companion still,
My joy Thy sayings to repeat,
Talk o’er the records of Thy will,
And search the oracles divine,
Till every heartfelt word be mine.
	 ~ 	1 . BER a metse me dan mu komm.
Wo Buukuu n‘ nko nyɛ me damfo.
We nsem ne nkaakaa ye me dɛw.
Meka Wo pɛ a wͻakyérɛw n’ ho asɛm,
Na mohwehwɛ sor esumadze m’
Kodu dɛ m’benya akomatͻm'.

MHB 310
2 . O may the gracious words divine
Subject of all my converse be!
So will the Lord His follower join,
And walk and talk Himself with me;
So shall my heart His presence prove,
And burn with everlasting love.
	 ~ 	2 . Ao, nkyɛ Wo sor adom nsɛm no
Aayɛ botae wͻ me nsɛm nyina m’!
Na m‘bɛyɛ Ewuradze kadofo,
Na ͻnye m’ bɛnantsew akasa;
Dɛm na m'akoma bohu No,
Na ͻdze dͻ adzɛw dabaa.

MHB 310
3 . Oft as I lay me down to rest,
O may the reconciling word
Sweetly compose my weary breast!
While, on the bosom of my Lord,
I sink in blissful dreams away,
And visions of eternal day.
	 ~ 	3 . Mpɛn pii a meda morohom no
Ao nkyɛ W'abodwee kasa no
Aama mo bom' akomatͻmu!
Ber a motwer m' Ewuradze,
Rotͻ nkom, moroso siar daaso
Na da a onnyiewiei ho nyikyerɛ.

MHB 310
4 . Rising to sing my Saviour’s praise,
Thee may I publish all day long;
And let Thy precious word of grace
Flow from my heart, and fill my tongue;
Fill all my life with purest love,
And join me to the church above.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 . M‘benyan atow Gyefo ayɛyi n’
Na daa m'bͻbͻ ne nyina dawur,
Na ma W’adom kasa pa no
Mpem W'akoma mbra me gyirama do,
Fa dͻ mapa hyɛ me bra ma
Na fa m’ ka sor Asͻr no ho.

MHB 311
1 . THY faithfulness, Lord, each moment we find,
So true to Thy word, so loving and kind;
Thy mercy so tender to all the lost race,
The vilest offender may turn and find grace.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, yehu Wo nokwar no daa,
W'asɛm yɛ nokwar, yɛ dɔ na ayamuyie,
W'ehumbɔbɔr tsen du akra a ayew nyina do,
Ɔbɔnfo kɔbesae dan benya W'adom.

MHB 311
2 . O let me commend my Saviour to you,
I set to my seal that Jesus is true:
Ye all may find favour who come at His call;
O come to my Saviour! His grace is for all.
	 ~ 	2 . O ma menkamfo m'Agyenkwa mma wo,
Misi mo bo ka, Christ yɛ nokwafo;
Hɔn a wɔgye Ne frɛ do nyina benya nkwa,
Bra m'Agyenkwa hɔ, N'adom du obiara do.

MHB 311
3 . To save what was lost, from heaven He came:
Come, sinners, and trust in Jesus’s name;
He offers you pardon, He bids you be free:
If sin be your burden, O come unto Me!
	 ~ 	3 . Ofi sor bɛgyee hɔn a wɔahera nkwa;
Abɔn, hom mbra mbɛgye Jesus dzin ndzi;
Ɔdze bɔn kyɛ, ɔma obiara fahodzi;
Sɛ bɔn nye w'adzesoa a; O bra Me nkyɛn ha!

MHB 311
4 . Then let us submit His grace to receive,
Fall down at His feet and gladly believe:
We all are forgiven for Jesus’s sake;
Our title to heaven His merits we take.	 ~ 	4 . Dɛm a hom mfa ahobrɛadze ngye N'adom,
Twa hwe N'ananadze, gye No dɛw mu;
Yenya bɔnfakyɛ koraa wɔ Jesus dzin mu,
N'ahonya nye hɛn abɔdzin a yɛdze kɔ sor.

MHB 312
1 . BEHOLD the Lamb of God, who bears
The sins of all the world away!
A servant’s form He meekly wears,
He sojourns in a house of clay;
His glory is no longer seen,
But God with God is man with men.
	 ~ 	1 . HWƐ Nyame Eguambaa a ɔsoa
Wiadze nyinara bɔn fi hɔ!
Botoo, ɔfaa nkowaa suban
Na ɔtsenaa dɛtse dan mu;
Na yennhu N'enyimnyam no bio,
Nyame nye nyimpa bɛtsenae.

MHB 312
2 . See where the God incarnate stands,
And calls His wandering creatures home! 
He all day long spreads out His hands,
Come, weary souls, to Jesus come!
Ye all may hide you in My breast;
Believe, and I will give you rest.
	 ~ 	2 . Hwɛ bea a Nyame-nyimpa gyina
Refrɛ N'abɔdze a ayew wɔ fie!
Da biara ɔtserɛw Ne nsamu,
Akra a wɔaberɛ, Jesus frɛ hom!
Hom mbra mbɔhom wɔ Mo bo mu;
Gye dzi na m'bɛma w' ahomgye.

MHB 312
3 . Sinners, believe the gospel word,
Jesus is come your souls to save!
Jesus is come, your common Lord;
Pardon ye all through Him may have,
May now be saved, whoever will;
This Man receiveth sinners still.	 ~ 	3 . Abɔnfo, hom ngye nsɛmpa n' ndzi,
Jesus rebɛgye hom akra!
Jesus aba, hom Wura nye no;
Hom nyina benya fakyɛ wɔ N' mu,
Nyia ɔpɛ biara benya nkwa;
Nyimpa yi da ho gye abɔn.

MHB 313
1 . TO God be the glory! great things He hath done!
So loved He the world that He gave us His son;
Who yielded His life an atonement for sin,
And opened the Life gate that all may go in.
     Praise the Lord! Praise the Lord!
     Let the earth hear his voice!
     Praise the Lord! Praise the Lord!
     Let the people rejoice!
     O come to the father through Jesus the son;
     And give him the glory! great things 
           He hath done!
	 ~ 	1 . Enyimnyam nka Nyame! Ɔayɛ adze kɛse!
Ɔdɔɔ wiadze ara ma ɔdze N' Ba maa hɛn;
Ɔno a ɔdze No nkwa bɔɔ werdam maa abɔn,
Na obuee nkwa abotsen dɛ obiara nhɛn mu;

Yi N'ayɛw! Yi N'ayɛw!
Ma adasa ntsie Ne ndze!
Yi N' ayɛw! Yi N' ayɛw!
Ma nkorɔfo ndzi ehurusi!
Ao, dua Ɔba Jesus do bra 
Egya No hɔ,
Na hyɛ No enyimnyam !
Ɔayɛ adze kɛse!

MHB 313
2 . O perfect redemption, the purchase 
           of blood!
To every believer the promise of God;
The vilest offender who truly believes,
That moment from Jesus a pardon receives.
	 ~ 	2 . Ao, nkwagye a odzi mu, bɔgya atɔdze!
Gyedzinyi biara nya Nyame anohoba n';
Abɔn mu ɔbɔn biara a ɔgye dzi ampa n',
Aber no ara onya Jesus hɔ fakyɛ.

MHB 313
3 . Great things He hath taught us, great 
      things He hath done,
And great our rejoicing through Jesus the son;
But purer, and higher, and greater will be
Our wonder, our rapture, when Jesus we see.	 ~ 	3 . Ɔakyerɛ hɛn adzeson ! Ɔayɛ adze kɛse!
Yɛnam Ne Ba Jesus do dzi dɛw mbordo;
Wɔbɛsan hɛn ho koraa, na wɔbɔkrɔn hɛn,
Hɛn ahodwiriw na enyigye ber a yehu Jesus!

MHB 314
1 . COME let us sing of a wonderful love,
Tender and true;
Out of the heart of the Father above,
Streaming to me and to you:
Wonderful love
Dwells in the heart of the Father above.
	 ~ 	1 . Ma yɛntow anwanwa dɔ bi ho ndwom, 
Nokwar ɔdɔ a,
Ɔdɔ a ofi Sor Egya N' akomam'
Rehyɛ adasamba ma:
Anwanwa dɔ
Ɔwɔ hɛn Ɔsor Egya N' akomam'.

MHB 314
2 . Jesus, the Saviour this gospel to tell,
Joyfully came;
Came with the helpless and hopeless to dwell,
Sharing their sorrow and shame;
Seeking the lost, 
Saving, redeeming at measureless cost.
	 ~ 	2 . Jesus, Agyenkwa n', dze dɛw sianee bae 
Bɛkaa 'Sɛmpa n';
Ɔduaa N' amandzehu pii do hwehwɛɛ
Hɔn a hɔn enyidar asa n'.
Hɔn a wɔayew n',
Otuaa kaw mbordo na ɔgyee hɔn nkwa.

MHB 314
3 . Jesus is seeking the wanderers yet;
Why do they roam? 
Love only waits to forgive and forget;
Home, weary wanderers, home!
Wonderful love
Dwells in the heart of the Father above.
	 ~ 	3 . Jesus da ho hwehwɛ hɔn a wɔayew n': 
Wokyin yɛ dɛn?
No dɔ pɛ dɛ ɔkata hɔn bɔn do:
Afonafo, hom mbra fie!
Anwanwa dɔ
Ɔwɔ hɛn Ɔsor Egya N' akomam'.

MHB 314
4 . Come to my heart, O Thou wonderful love.
Come and abide, 
Lifting my life till it rises above
Envy and falsehood and pride;
Seeking to be
Lowly and humble, a learner of Thee.	 ~ 	4 . Anwanwa dɔ, bra mo so m'akomam', 
Bra bɛtsena hɔ:
Tsew me kra ho na oeefi dza ɔnntsenm'-
Enyiber nye atorsɛm mu.
Ahobrɛadzem'
Na mepɛ dɛ mepɛ Wo suanyi bi.

MHB 315
1 . HARK ! the gospel news is sounding : 
Christ hath suffered on the tree ;
Streams of mercy are abounding ;
Grace for all is rich and free.
Now, poor sinner,
Look to Him who died for thee.
	 ~ 	1 . TSIE ! Nsɛmpa ndze no regyegye;
Christ atseetsee dua no do;
Ehumbͻbͻr nsu repem weͻͻ;
’Biara nya adorn bafuu kwa.
Nkyii, bͻnyɛnyi,
Hwɛ Nyia owui maa wo No.

MHB 315
2 . O escape to yonder mountain ! 
Now begin to watch and pray; 
Christ invites you to the fountain, 
Come, and wash your sins away :
Do not tarry,
Come to Jesus while you may.
	 ~ 	2 . Ao, guan kͻ ekyir koko no do!
Nkyii hyɛ ase weͻn na sͻr;
Christ frɛ wo nsunyiwa no ho;
Bra bͻhohor wo bͻn no,
Mma nnyɛ ekyim,
Bra N‘ hͻ bér a ibotum yi.

MHB 315
3 . Grace is flowing like a river ;
Millions there have been supplied ; 
Still it flows as fresh as ever
From the Saviour’s wounded side : 
None need perish ;
All may live, for Christ hath died
	 ~ 	3 . Adom repem de esutsen;
Ͻama ͻpepé enya bi;
Ͻda ho ara repem krͻngyee
Fi Agyenkwa mfe m‘ ‘piratua m’:
’Biara nnkɛehéra;
Christ ewu, hom benya nkwa.

MHB 315
4 . Christ alone shall be our portion ;
Soon we hope to meet above,	
Then we’ll bathe in the full ocean
Of the great Redeemer’s love ;
All His fullness,
We shall then for ever prove.	 ~ 	4 . Christ nko na ͻbɛyɛ hɛn kyɛfa,
Ͻrennkyɛr yebehyia m' sor,
Nkyii yeboguar po kɛse n’ mu.
Wͻ Pomfo kɛse No dͻ mu,
N‘amayɛ nyina
Na vebeyi akyerɛ.

MHB 316
1 . WE have heard the joyful sound:
Jesus saves! 
Spread the tidings all around:
Jesus saves!
Bear the news to every land,
Climb the steeps and cross the waves;
Onward! ’tis our Lord’s command:
Jesus saves!
	 ~ 	1 . YƐATSE enyigye ndze bi;
Christ gye nkwa!
Ma enyigyesɛm yi mpetse;
Christ gye nkwa!
Fa asɛm no kɔ mbea nyina,
Fow mbepɔw na twa po so;
Hom nduom! Ewuradze ndze nye n';
Christ gye nkwa!

MHB 316
2 . Sing above the battle’s strife:
Jesus saves!
By His death and endless life,
Jesus saves!
Sing it softly through the gloom,
When the heart for mercy craves;
Sing in triumph o’er the tomb:
Jesus saves!
	 ~ 	2 . Tow ndwom ma ɔmbor ɔsa n' do;
Christ gye nkwa!
No wu nye onnyiewie nkwa ntsi
Christ gye nkwa
Tow no bɔkɔɔ wɔ sum no m';
Ber a akoma hwehwɛ ehumbɔbɔr;
Tow konyim wɔ owumaa do;
Christ gye nkwa!

MHB 316
3 . Give the winds a mighty voice:
Jesus saves!
Let the nations now rejoice:
Jesus saves!
Shout salvation full and free
To every strand that ocean laves-
This our song of victory,
Jesus saves!	 ~ 	3 . Hom mma ehum no ndze kɛse;
Christ gye nkwa!
Aman nyina mbɔ ose sesei;
Christ gye nkwa!
Tsea m', nkwagye a odzi mu, wɔnntɔ,
'Dze ma wiadze mbea nyina-
Hɛn konyimdzi ndwom nye yi;
Christ gye nkwa!

MHB 317
1 . WHOSOEVER heareth! Shout, shout the sound;
Send the blessed tidings all the world around;
Spread the joyful news wherever man is found:
Whosoever will may come.

       Whosoever will! whosoever will!
       Send the proclamation over vale and hill;
       Tis a loving Father calls the wanderer home:
       Whosoever will may come!
	 ~ 	1 . OBIARA a ͻtse n‘, ͻmma ndze no do!
Mfa nhyira nsɛmpa no ntsérɛw wiadze nyina;
Tsérɛw ’nyigyesɛm wͻ mbea a nyimpa du n’ nyina:

    Obiara a ͻpɛ n’ ͻmbra.
    Obiara a ͻpɛ n’! Obiara a ͻpɛ n’! 
    Ͻmbͻ dawur n' wͻ mbͻnsa na
    nkokwaa do;
	Egya dͻfo no refrɛ’ akobͻfo fie;
	Obiara a ͻpɛ n’ ͻmbra.
Obiara a ͻpɛ n’ ͻmbra.

MHB 317
2 . Whosoever cometh need not delay;
Now the door is open, enter while you may;
Jesus is the true the only Living Way:
Whosoever will may come.
	 ~ 	2     
. Obi a ͻreba n’ mma ͻnnyɛ ekyim,
Bér a abow no ebuei yi hɛn mu ntsɛntsɛm;
Jesus nye nokwar no na nkwa kwan no;
Obiara a ͻpɛ n’ ͻmbra. '

MHB 317
3 . Whosoever  will,  the promise is secure;
Whosoever will,   for ever shall endure;
Whosoever will!, ’tis life for evermore;
Whosoever will  may come.	 ~ 	3 
. Obiara a ͻpɛ n’, ’nohoba n’ si pi,
Obiara a ͻpɛ n’ betséna dabaa wͻ hͻ,
Obiara a ͻpɛ n’ benya nkwa a onnyi ewiei:

MHB 318
1 . SOULS of men, why will ye scatter
Like a crowd of frightened sheep?
Foolish hearts, why will ye wander
From a love so true and deep?
	 ~ 	1 . NYIMPA mba, ebɛn ntsi na hom,
Hwetse dͻ nguan a wͻaba hu’i?
Nkwasea, ebɛn ntsi na horn kyin
Fi dɛm nokwar dͻ yi ho?
Wͻ Ewuradze Ne dɛw mu.

MHB 318
2 . Was there ever kinder shepherd
Half so gentle, half so sweet,
As the Saviour who would have us
Come and gather round His feet?
	 ~ 	2 
. Oguanhwɛfo bɛn na ͻdwe
Wͻ ehumbͻbͻr na adͻe ho,
Dɛ Agyenkwa a ͻbɛma
Yɛabɛtséna N'ananadze?

MHB 318
3 . There’s a wideness in God’s mercy
Like the wideness of the sea;
There’s a kindness in His justice
Which is more than liberty.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyame ehumbͻbͻr a ͻtsérɛw,
Tse dɛ epo tɛtɛr no a
Ayamuyie bi wͻ ne pɛryɛ m‘,
Ͻsen fahodzi koraa.

MHB 318
4 . There is welcome for the sinner, 
And more graces for the good; 
There is mercy with the Saviour; 
There is healing in His blood.
	 ~ 	4 
. Etuuyɛ wͻ hɛ ma abͻn.
Na adom pii ma apapafo;
Agyenkwa n’ wͻ ehumbͻbͻr,
Ayarsa wͻ No bͻgyaa m’.

MHB 318
5 . There is plentiful redemption
In the blood that has been shed;
There is joy for all the members
In the sorrows of the Head.
	 ~ 	5 
. Nkwagye pii wͻ hͻ ma hɛn wͻ
No bͻgyaa a wohuei gui n’ mu;
Edɛw wͻ hͻ ma hɛn nyina
Wͻ Jesus amandzehu m’.

MHB 318
6 . For the love of God is broader
Than the measure of man’s mind.
And the heart of the Eternal
Is most wonderfully kind
	 ~ 	6 
. Nyame No dͻ no, ͻtserɛw
Sen nyimpa n’adwen nsusui.
Na 'Domankoma N’akoma m’
Wo ayamuyie nwanwa.

MHB 318
7 . If our love were but more simple, 
We should take Him at His word, 
And our lives would be all sunshine
In the sweetness of our Lord.	 ~ 	7 
. Sɛ ͻdwe wͻ hɛn dͻ mu a,
Nkyɛ yɛbɛgye W‘asɛm edzi,
Na hɛn bra nyinara bɛhyerɛn

MHB 319
1 . WEARY souls, that wander wide
From the central point of bliss,
Turn to Jesus crucified,
Fly to those dear wounds of His:
Sink into the purple flood;
Rise into the life of God.
	 ~ 	1 . AKRA 'werɛfo a hom kyin
Fi nhyira finimfin no,
Hom nkɔ Jesu a wɔsɛɛn N' hɔ,
Hom nguan nkɔ N'epirakur ho;
Hom ntɔ ahosan nsu n' mu;
Hom nsoɛr nkɔ Nyame nkwa mu.
Wɔ enyimnaym dɔ asetsena mu.

MHB 319
2 . Find in Christ the way of peace,
Peace unspeakable, unknown;
By His pain He gives you ease,
Life by His expiring groan:
Rise, exalted by His fall;
Find in Christ your all in all.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hwehwɛ asomdwee kwan Christ mu,
Asomdwee a onnyi kabea;
Ne yaw no ma w' ahotɔ,
Ne pen a ɔdze ruwu ma w' nkwa;
Ma N'asehwe no mpegya w',
Ma Christ nyɛ wo adze nyina.

MHB 319
3 . O believe the record true:
God to you His Son hath given.
Ye may now be happy too,
Find on earth the life of heaven,
Live the life of heaven above,
All the life of glorious love.	 ~ 	3 
. O hom ngye nokwasɛm n' ndzi;
Nyame dze Ne Ba ama hom,
Afei hom so enyi bɛgye;
Hom nnya sor nkwa wɔ ase,
Hom ntsena sor abrabɔ n' mu,

MHB 32
1 . LORD of all being, throned afar,
Thy glory flames from sun and star;
Center and soul of every sphere,
Yet to each loving heart how near.
	 ~ 	1 . ABƆDZE Wura a idzi sor hen,
W'enyimnyam wɔ ewia na nworaba m';
Eyɛ adze nyina ne farbaa,
Naaso ebɛn hɔn a wɔwɔ dɔ.

MHB 32
2 . Sun of our life. Thy quickening ray.
Sheds on our path the glow of day:
Star of our hope, Thy softened light
Cheers the long watches of the night.
	 ~ 	2 . N-kwa Ewia a ikenyan hɛn
Ma adzekyee kan hyerɛn hɛn kwan mu;
Hɛn enyidado Woraba,
Wo kan no hyerɛn hɛn sum mu.

MHB 32
3 . Our midnight is Thy smile withdrawn,
Our noontide is Thy gracious dawn,
Our rainbow arch, Thy mercy's sign;
All, save the clouds of sin, are Thine.
	 ~ 	3 . Sɛ imuna a, hɛn bra yɛ sum,
W'adom gye a, na hɛn ewia epue;
Wo nyankontɔn kyerɛ ehumbɔbɔr,
Bɔn da nkyɛn a adze nyina Wodze a.

MHB 32
4 . Lord of all life, below, above,
Whose light is truth, whose warmth is love,
Before Thy ever-blazing throne
We ask no luster of our own.
 	 ~ 	4 . Ase nye sor nkwa nyina Wura,
Wo kan nye nokwar, W'ewia n', dɔ a;
W'ahengua hyɛnhyɛnn enyim no,
Yɛnnhwehwɛ hɛnankasa hɛn kra.

MHB 32
5 . Grant us thy truth to make us free,
And kindling hearts that burn for Thee.
Till all Thy living altars claim
Une holy light, one heavenly flame.
                                         Amen.
	 ~ 	5 . Ma Wo nokwar n' nyɛ hɛn adehye,
Nkenyan akoma a ɔhwehwɛ W',
Kɛpem dɛ W'asomfo benya
Kan krɔnn na sor gyaframee kor.
                  		Amen.

MHB 320
1 . ART thou weary, art thou languid,
Art thou sore distressed?
Come to Me, saith One, and coming,
	               Be at rest!
	 ~ 	1 . Ana ahaw, na aberɛ, 
Na wo kɔn ebu?
Tsie! Obi dɛ, Bra, na m' bɛma w'
Ahomgye.
Bua dɛ, Nyew!

MHB 320
2 . Hath He marks to lead me to Him,
If He be my guide?
In His feet and hands are wound prints,
	               And His side.
	 ~ 	2  
. Ana akam bi wɔ No a, 
Medze m' bohu No?
N' anan ho, Ne nsam', nye Ne mfem'
Wɔ epiratua.

MHB 320
3 . Hath He diadem, as Monarch,
That His brow adorns?
Yes, a crown in very surety,
	But of thorns!
	 ~ 	3 
. Ana kyɛw bi so N' a ɔma 
Ɔyɛ dɛ ɔhen?
Nyew, ahenkyɛw ara ampa;
Na nsoɛ dze a.

MHB 320
4 . If I find Him, if I follow,
What His guerdon here?
Many a sorrow, many a labour,
	Many a tear.
	 ~ 	4  
. Sɛ muhu N' n a meka No do a, 
Ebɛn na m' benya?
Amandzehu, nye ɔfona,
Nye nyinsuwa.

MHB 320
5 . If I still hold closely to Him,
What hath He at last?
Sorrow vanquished, labour ended,
	Jordan past .
	 ~ 	5 
. Sɛ menngyaa dɛ meka No do a, 
'Bɛn na nkyii m' benya?
Ɔfona, nye yaw, nye Jordan
Botwa mu.

MHB 320
6 . If I ask Him to receive me,
Will He say me nay?
Not till earth and not till Heaven
Pass away.
	 ~ 	6 
. Ana mese N' dɛ ɔngye m' a, 
Ɔbɛse m', Oho?
Dabi; gyedɛ sor nye asaase
Etwam' kɔ.

MHB 320
7 . Finding, following, keeping, struggling
Is He sure to bless?
Saints, apostles, prophets, martyrs,
	Answer, Yes !	 ~ 	7 
. Muhu N', ka No do, meper a, 
Obehyira  m' ampa?
Ahotsewfo nye asɛnkafo

MHB 321
1 . LORD, I hear of showers of blessing,
Thou art scattering, full and free;
Showers, the thirsty land refreshing;
Let some drops now fall on me;
                                Even me.
	 ~ 	1 . Ewuradze, matse nka dɛ 
'Rowora nhyira nsu pii,
Edze rofɔw daadze a oetwie,
Ma bi nsosɔ mo so do,
                   'Mi dɛm yi.
Dua mo so do yi kyerɛ,

MHB 321
2 . Pass me not, O gracious  Father,
Sinful though my heart may be;
Thou might’st leave me, but the rather
Let Thy mercy light on me.
	 ~ 	2  
. Mma mmpa mo ho, dɔyɛfo Egya,
