M' akomam' wɔ bɔn so ampa;
Ɔfata dɛ igya m' hɔ dze,
Na fa mbɔbɔr hu me so,

MHB 321
3 . Pass me not, O gracious Saviour;
Let me live and cling to Thee;
I am longing for Thy favour;
Whilst Thou  art calling, O call me.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mma mmpa mo ho, Agyenkwa brɛfo, 
Ma mondɔ Wo na mentar Wo;
Mo kɔn adɔ W' enyimtsewee;
Ber a 'refrɛ yi frɛ me so,

MHB 321
4 . Pass me not, O mighty Spirit,
Thou canst make the blind to see;
Witness of  the Saviour’s merit,
Speak the Word of power to me.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mma mmpa mo ho, Sunsum tumfo, 
'Wo na ibue furafo enyi;
Jesus Ne yie ho Dasefo,
Ka tum kasa n' kyerɛ me so,

MHB 321
5 . Love of God so pure and changeless,
Blood of Christ so rich, and free,
Grace of God so strong and boundless,
Magnify them all in me;	 ~ 	5 
. Nyame dɔ krɔnn a ɔnnsaker, 
Jesus bɔgyaa a ɔsom bo,
Nyame adom a ɔmmbɔ adze n',

MHB 322
1 . SINNERS Jesus will receive;
Sound this word of grace to all
Who the heavenly pathway leave,
All who linger, all who fall.
      Sing it o’er and over again:
      Christ receiveth sinful men;
      Make the message clear and plain:
      Christ receiveth sinful men.
	 ~ 	1 . Jesus gye ndzebɔnyɛfo; 
Bɔ adomsɛm yim' kyerɛ
Hɔn a wofi sor kwan mu,
Wɔahwe ase, reyɛ ekyim. 
Si do tow, si do tow bio; 
(Si do ara tow, Si do ara tow)
Christ ɔgye ndzebɔnyɛfo
(Christ ɔgye ndzebɔnyɛfo)
Amandzɛɛ n' ma wɔntse ase;
(Amandzɛɛ n', kyerɛ mu yie)
Christ ɔgye ndzebɔnyɛfo.
Ɔnye m' bɛhɛn sor man mu.

MHB 322
2 . Come, and He will give you rest;
Trust Him, for His Word is plain;
He will take the sinfulest:
Christ receiveth sinful men.
	 ~ 	2 
. Bra, ɔbɛma W' ahomgye; 
Twer No: N' asɛm si no pi:
Ɔgye abɔn mu abɔn;
Christ ɔgye ndzebɔnyɛfo.

MHB 322
3 . Now my heart condemns me not,
Pure before the law I stand;
He who cleansed me from all spot
Satisfied its last demand.
	 ~ 	3 
. M' akoma mmubu me fɔ bio, 
Mo ho san wɔ mbra n' enyim;
Nyia ɔhoor mo ho fi no
Apata mbra no koraa.

MHB 322
4 . Christ receiveth sinful men,
Even me with all my sin;
Purged from every spot and stain,
Heaven with Him I enter in.	 ~ 	4  
. Christ ɔgye ndzebɔnyɛfo, 
Emi mpo a mo bɔn dɔɔ so;
Me nkekae nyinaa botu;

MHB 323
1 . COME, sinners, to the gospel feast,
Let every soul be Jesu’s guest;
Ye need not one be left behind,
For God hath bidden all mankind.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM mbra nsɛmpa aponto ase,
Abͻn, Jesus to nsa frɛ hom;
Mma obiara nnka ekyir ’siandɛ
Nyame afrɛ adasa nyina.
Tséna ase ma Nyia owui maa obiara n’.

MHB 323
2 . Sent by my Lord, on you I call;
The invitation is to all:
Come, all the world; come, sinner, thou!
All things in Christ are ready now.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hom mbra, mo wura somaa m’ hom hͻ,
Ͻto nsa frɛ nyimpa nyina:
Obiara mbra, abͻnfo mpo,
Christ mu ndzɛmba nyina ayɛ krado.

MHB 323
3 . Come, all ye souls by sin oppressed,
Ye restless wanderers after rest,
Ye poor, and maimed, and halt, and blind,
In Christ a hearty welcome find.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hom mbra, akra a bͻn retseetsee hom,
Ekyimafo a horn hwehwɛ ahomgye,
Ehiafo, mpakye, efurafo,
Akͻaba wͻ Christ mu ma hom.

MHB 323
4 . His love is mighty to compel;
His conquering love consent to feel,
Yield to His love’s resistless power,
And fight against your God no more.
	 ~ 	4 
. No dͻ kɛse no hyɛ obiara,
Bra bͻsͻ konyimdzi dͻ n’ hwɛ;
Gyaa woho ma No dͻ tum no,
Na mma nnko nntsia wo Nyame bio.

MHB 323
5 . This is the time; no more delay!
This is the acceptable day;
Come in, this moment, at His call,
And live for Him who died for all.	 ~ 	5 
. Aber no nye yi, mma nntwentweͻn!
Ewuradze da a ͻagyé ato m’ nye’ i;
Ͻfrɛ wo aber yi, bra mu,

MHB 324
1 . COME, ye sinners, poor and wretched,
Weak and wounded, sick and sore;
Jesus ready stands to save you,
Full of pity, joined with power: He is able,
He is willing; doubt no more.
	 ~ 	1 . Abɔn, 'kɔbesaefo, hom mbra, 
Bahatɔfo, epirafo,
Jesus rotweɔn agye hom nkwa;
Tsema na tum ahyɛ N' ma;
Ɔyɛ Tumfo
Ɔpɛ, mma hom nngye kyim bio.
na otum yɛ abɔn yie.

MHB 324
2 . Come, ye needy, come, and welcome;
God’s free bounty glorify;
True belief and true repentance,
Every grace that brings you nigh.Without money
Come to Jesus Christ and buy.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hom mbra, akɔhweaban, hom mbra; 
Hom nhuhor Nyame ayamuyie,
Nokwar gyedzi, nnuho mapa,
Adom a ɔtwe hɛn bɛn N',
Wɔmmfa sika,
Bra Jesus hɔ bɔtɔ bi.

MHB 324
3 . Come, ye weary, heavy- laden,
Bruised and broken by the fall;
If you tarry till you’re better,
You will never come at all:
Not the righteous-
Sinners Jesus came to call.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hom mbra, hom a hom kɔn ebu, 
Hom a asehwe epira hom;
Sɛ hom rotweɔn ayɛ yie ana a,
Hom nnkɛba dabiarada;
Nnyɛ atsenenee a,
Abɔn na Jesus bɛfrɛe.

MHB 324
4 . Let not conscience make you linger,
Not of fitness fondly dream;
All the fitness He requireth
Is to feel your need of Him: This He gives you;
‘Tis the Spirit’s rising beam.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mma tsibowaba nnyɛ w' mma nkyinkyin, 
Mma emudzi nnyɛ w' adwendwen,
Emudzi a ɔregye ara nye,
Ibohu wo hia a ihia N':
                   'Yi ɔdze ma w';
Ɔyɛ Sunsum 'napawi.

MHB 324
5 . Lo! the incarnate God, ascended,
Pleads the merit of His blood;
Venture on Him, venture wholly;
Let no other trust intrude:
None but Jesus 
Can do helpless sinners good.	 ~ 	5  
. Nhwɛ! Nyame-nyimpa N' afow sor, 
Gyina No bɔgyaa do dzi ma W',
Fa woho ma N', fa ma N' koraa;
Mma adwen fofor nntwa ntamu!
           	Jesus nkotoo

MHB 325
1 . O come, ye sinners, to your Lord,
In Christ to paradise restored;
His proffered benefits embrace,
The plenitude of gospel grace:
	 ~ 	1 . ABƆN, hom mbra Ewuradze nkyɛn,
Christ mu paradise wɔ hɔ bio;
Suo ndzepa a ɔdze ama w' no mu,
Adom nsɛmpa a onnyi kabea.
Na sor kommyɛ dɔ ne nyina.

MHB 325
2 . A pardon written with His blood,
The favour and the peace of God,
The seeing eye, the feeling sense,
The mystic joys of penitence;
	 ~ 	2 
. Fakyɛ a wɔdze No bɔgyaa akyerɛw,
Nyame asomdwee bata ho;
Enyi a ohu, nka a ɔtse
Esumasɛm nnuhu a ɔyɛ dɛw.

MHB 325
3 . The godly grief, the pleasing smart,
The meltings of a broken heart,
The tears that tell your sins forgiven,
The sighs that waft your souls to heaven;
	 ~ 	3 
. Nokwar yaw a no ho yɛ har
Ɔmaa akoma a ebubu nan,
Nyinsu a ɔkyerɛ dɛ wɔdze akyɛ w',
Ahomgu a ɔdze wo kra kɔ sor.

MHB 325
4 . The guiltless shame, the sweet distress,
The unutterable tenderness,
The genuine, meek humility,
The wonder—Why such love to me?

The o’erwhelming power of saving grace,
The sight that veils the seraph’s face;
The speechless awe that dares not move,
And all the silent heaven of love. 	 ~ 	4 
. Bemdzi enyito, dɛw atsetsee,
Ayamuyie a onnyi kabea,
Ahobrɛadze a ɔdwe mapa
Kyerɛ anwanwa dɔ wɔ mo do.

MHB 326
1 . SINNERS, obey the gospel word:
Haste to the supper of my Lord!
Be wise to know your gracious day;
All things are ready, come away !
	 ~ 	1 . ABϽN, hom ntsie asɛmpa n’; hom
Nyɛ ntsɛm mbra m‘Ewuradze pon ho!
Mfa nyansa nhu hom adorn da n’;
Biribiara ayɛ krado‘ hom mbra!
’Wufo asoɛr, woehu hͻn a wͻayew.

MHB 326
2 . Ready the Father is to own
And kiss His late-returning son;
Ready your loving Saviour stands,
And spreads for you His bleeding hands.
	 ~ 	2 
. Egya no ayɛ krado dɛ
Ͻbɛfew N’ammbantsɛm ba ano;
W’Agyenkwa ayɛ krado dɛ
Ͻdze Ne nsamu bͻgya kyerɛ w'.

MHB 326
3 . Ready the Spirit of His love
Just now the stony to remove,
To apply, and witness with the blood,
And wash and seal the sons of God.
	 ~ 	3 
. No dͻ sunsum n' ayɛ krado
Dɛ ͻbegye dza ͻyɛ dzen no,
Na ͻdze bͻgya n’ edzi dase,
Na ͻahor Nyankopͻn mba ho.

MHB 326
4 . Ready for you the angels wait,
To triumph in your blest estate;
Tuning their harps, they long to praise
The wonders of redeeming grace. 
	 ~ 	4 
. Abͻfo ayɛ krado rotweͻn
Edzi nyim wͻ wo siar fi n' mu;
Woesiesie nsanku na ayɛyi
Wͻ nkwagyé adorn nwanwa no ho.

MHB 326
5 . The Father, Son, and Holy Ghost
Is ready, with their shining host:
All heaven is ready to resound:
The dead’s alive, the lost is found !	 ~ 	5 
. Egya, Ͻba, Sunsurn Krankran,
Nye dͻm a wͻhyérɛn ayɛ krado;
Sor nyina robͻbͻ ose dɛ

MHB 327
1 . SINNERS, turn; why will ye die?
God, your Maker, asks you why:
God, who did your being give,
Made you with himself to live;
He the fatal cause demands,
Asks the work of His own hands:
Why, ye thankless creatures, why
	 ~ 	1 . ABϽN, hom nsan, hom wu dɛn?
Bͻfo n' bisa hom siantsir;
Nyame no a ͻmaa hom nkwa n’,
Na ͻmaa hom nye No tsénae n',
Obisa hom, N’abͻdze,
Siantsir a ͻwͻ dɛ horn wu;
Bͻnnyiayɛfo, ebɛn ntsi a?
Dɛ hom pow No dͻ, hom wu?
Hom bͻhow Nyame werɛ ewu?

MHB 327
2 . Will ye cross His love, and die ?
Sinners, turn; why will ye die?
God, your Saviour, asks you why:
God, who did your souls retrieve,
Died Himself, that you might live;
Will you let Him die in vain?
Crucify your Lord again?
Why, ye ransomed sinners, why
Will you slight His grace, and die?
	 ~ 	2 
. Abͻn, hom nsan, hom wu dɛn?
Hom Gyefo n' bisa siantsir,
Nyamé a ͻpoon hom akra,
Na owui ma hom nyaa nkwa no;
Na hom bɛma oewu gyan?
Hom asɛm hom Ewuradze bio?
Abͻn a wͻapon hom, ebɛn
Ntsi na hom pow N'adom wu?

MHB 327
3 . Sinners, turn; why will ye die?
God, the Spirit, asks you why:
He who all your lives hath strove,
Wooed you to embrace His love;
Will you not His grace receive?
Will you still refuse to live?
Why, ye long-sought sinners, why
Will you grieve your God, and die ?	 ~ 	3 
. Abͻn, hom nsan, hom wu dɛn?
Nyame Sunsum bisa dɛm;
Ͻno a ͻkoe gyee hom daa nyina,
Fofͻͻw hom baa No dͻ ho n',
Ana horn nnkɛgye N'adom n'?
Hom bɛda ho apow nkwa?
Hom a wͻahwehwɛ hom daa.

MHB 328
1 . COME unto Me, ye weary,
And I will give you rest!
O blessed voice of Jesus,
Which comes to hearts oppressed!
It tells of benediction,
Of pardon, grace, and peace,
Of joy that hath no ending,
Of love which cannot cease.
	 ~ 	1 . ABAHATƆFO, hom mbra,
M'bɛma hom ahomgye!
O Jesus Ne siar ndze no a,
Wɔtse n' yaw akoma m'!
Ɔka nyira fakyɛ na
Adom, asomdwee na
Dɛw so a ɔmmbɔ adze da,
Wo dɔ a onntwa m' da n' mu.
Dɔ kɛse a ɔmmbɔ adze da.

MHB 328
2 . Come unto Me, ye wanderers,
And I will give you light!
O loving voice of Jesus,
Which comes to cheer the night!
Our hearts were filled with sadness,
And we had lost our way;
But Thou hast brought us gladness,
And songs at break of day.
	 ~ 	2 
. 'Kyimakyimafo, hom mbra,
Na mebɛma hom kan!
O Jesus No dɔ ndze no a,
Ɔma dɛw wɔ sum mu!
Yaw hyɛɛ hɛn akoma ma,
Nna yeenya afom hɛn kwan;
Na Ɔwo abrɛ hɛn enyigye,
Ɔma yɛtow ndwom daa.

MHB 328
3 . Come unto Me, ye fainting,
And I will give you life!
O quickening voice of Jesus,
Which comes to aid our strife!
The foe is stern and eager;
The fight is fierce and long;
But Thou hast  made us mighty,
And stronger than the strong
	 ~ 	3 
. Hom mberɛwyɛfo, hom mbra,
Na mebɛma hom nkwa!
O Jesus Ne ndze a ɔbɔ hyew,
Na ɔboa hɛn aperdzi m'!
Ɔtamfo n'enyi aber;
Ɔko n' yɛ hu na ɔwar;
Ɔwo ayɛ hɛn akatakyi,
Na ahoɔdzenfo mbordo.

MHB 328
4 . And whosoever cometh
I will not cast him out!
O welcome voice of Jesus,
Which drives away our doubt,
Which calls us very sinners,
Unworthy though we be
Of love so free and boundless,
To come, dear Lord, to Thee.	 ~ 	4 
. Na obiara a ɔba no,
Monnkɔtow no akyen!
O Jesus, akomatɔm' ndze a
Otu hɛn ekyingye;
Ɔfrɛ hɛn abɔnfo yi
Dɛ yensi m' mbra Wo hɔ,
Kaansa yɛnnsɛ, yɛmmfata a,

MHB 329
1 . YE neighbors and friends of Jesus draw near:
His love condescends by titles so dear
To call and invite you His triumph to prove,
And freely delight you in Jesus’s love.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS N'adͻfo nyina, hom ntwe mpin,
No dͻ brɛ n' ho adze wͻ abͻdzin enyim,
Dze frɛ horn dɛ hom mbͻsͻ No konyim n’ nhwɛ,
Na hom ndzi dɛw wͻ Jesus No dͻ n' mu hͻ.
		Amen.

MHB 329
2 . The Shepherd who died His sheep to redeem;
On every side are gathered to Him
The weary and burdened, the reprobate race;
And wait to be pardoned through Jesus’s grace.
	 ~ 	2 
. Guanhwɛfo a owui dze gyee No nguan;
Abahatͻfo a wͻaba asesa
Etwa Wo ho ehyia akwan nyina do;
Rotweͻn bͻnfakyɛ wͻ Jesus N’adom mu.

MHB 329
3 . The blind are restored through Jesus’s name,
They see their dear Lord, and follow the Lamb;
The halt they are walking, and running their race;
The dumb they are talking of Jesus’s grace.
	 ~ 	3 
. Efurafo nam Jesus dzin mu hu adze,
Wohu hͻn Wura, ka Eguambaa No do;
Mpakye nantsew, tutu mbirika, si mpire;
Mmum kasa ka Jesus N’ adom no ho, asɛm.

MHB 329
4 . The deaf hear His voice and comforting Word,
It bids them rejoice in Jesus their Lord:
Thy sins are forgiven, accepted thou art;
They listen, and heaven springs up in their heart
	 ~ 	4 
. Etsitsifo tse N’akomatͻm’ ndze n’,
Ͻma wodzi dɛw wͻ Jesus hͻn wura m’;
Wͻdze w’ bͻn akyɛ wo, wͻagye w’ ato mu;
Wotsie na sor pue wͻ hͻn akoma mu.

MHB 329
5 . The lepers from all their spots are made clean,
The dead by His call are raised from their sin;
In Jesu’s compassion the sick find a cure,
And gospel salvation is preached to the poor.
	 ~ 	5 
. Wͻma akwatafo nyina ho san,
Ewufo tse Ne ndze soɛr fi hͻn bͻn m’;
Jesus N’ehumbͻbͻr m’ ayarfo bͻ esu,
Na wͻka nkwagye nsɛmpa n’ kyérɛ ehiafo.

MHB 329
6 . They seek Him and find: they ask and receive
The Friend of mankind, who bids them believe: 
On Jesus they venture, His gift they embrance,
And forcibly enter His kingdom of grace.
	 ~ 	6 
. Wͻhwehwɛ N’ wohu N’, bisa, hͻn nsa ka;
Adasa Adamfo, ͻma wͻgye N’ dzi:
Wͻdan kͻ Jesus do, wͻgye“N’akyɛdze, 
Na medzé enyimpi kͻ N’adom ahenman m’.

MHB 329
7 . O Jesus, ride on till all are subdued,
Thy mercy make known, and sprinkle Thy blood;
Display Thy salvation, and teach the new song
To every nation, and people, and tongue. Amen.	 ~ 	7 
. O Jesus, per dzi nyim, W’atamfo do.
W’adͻyɛ nda edzi, Wo bͻgyaa mpetse;
Da Wo nkwagye n' edzi, kyérɛ nyimpa nyina,
Na ngyirama nyina ntow ndwom fofor no.

MHB 33
1 . INFINITE God, to Thee we raise
Our hearts in solemn songs of praise;
By all Thy works on earth adored.
We worship Thee, the common Lord;
The everlasting Father own,
And how our souls before thy throne.
	 ~ 	1 . ONNYIEWIEI Nyame, yɛma hɛn
Akoma do tow ndwom yi W' ayɛw;
Wo ndwuma a ɔwɔ asaase nyina tonton W',
 Yɛsom Wo , nyimpa nyina Ewuradze;
Hɛn domankoma Egya nye Wo,
Yɛkotow wɔ W'ahengua enyim.

MHB 33
2 . Thee all the choir of angels sings.
The Lord of hosts, the King of kings;
Cherubs proclaim Thy praise aloud,
And seraphs shout the Triune God;
And: Holy, holy, holy! Cry,
Thy glory fills both earth and sky!
	 ~ 	2 . Sor abɔfo tow W'ayɛyi,
Dom Ewuradze, ahemfo Hen;
Cherubimfo paa m' yi W' ayɛw,
Seraphfo tsea m', 'Korsa Nyame!
Wɔtsea m', Krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn!
W'enyimnyam hyɛ sor na ase ma.

MHB 33
3 . God of the patriarchal race,
The ancient sears record thy praise.
The goodly apostolic band
In highest joy and glory stand;
And all the saints and prophets join
To extol thy majesty divine.
	 ~ 	3 .	Hɛn tsetse egyanom Nyame,
Tsetse nkɔnhyɛfo yii W' ayɛw,
Asomafo krɔnkrɔn kuw no
Gyina hɔ enyigye na enyimnyam m';
Ahotsewfo na nkɔnhyɛfo n'
Bɔ m' yi Wo tum kɛse n' ayɛw.

MHB 33
4 . Head of the martyrs noble host,
Of thee they justly make their boast
The church, to earth’s remotest bounds,
Her heavenly Founders praise resounds;
And strives, with those around the throne,
To hymn the mystic Three in One.
	 ~ 	4 . Atɔfo nyimnyam kuw ne tsir,
Wɔdze Wo hoahoa hɔnho daa;
Asɔr a ɔwɔ wiadze afanan nyina,
Yi no sor Farbaa no ayɛw;
Na wɔnye ahengua ho dɔm no
Per tow ndwom ma Ɔkorsa no.

MHB 33
5 . Father of endless majesty,
All might and love they render thee;
Thy true and only Son adore.
The same in dignity and power;
And God the Holy Ghost declare,
The saints’ eternal Comforter.	 ~ 	5 . Egya a W'ahendzi mmbɔ adze,
Wɔdze tum na dɔ nyina ma Wo;
Wɔtonton Wo Ba kortoo no,
Ɔnye Wo kyɛ enyimnyam na tum;
Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn no ma yehu
'Hotsewfo daa 'Wer ɛkyekyefo n'.
   Amen.

MHB 330
1 . O JESUS, Thou art standing
Outside the fast-closed door,
In lowly patience waiting
To pass the threshold o’er.
Shame on us, Christian brothers,
His name and sign who bear,
O shame, thrice shame upon us,
To keep Him standing there!
	 ~ 	1 . O JESUS, Ͻwo gyina
Pon a wͻatow m' ekyir,
Na 'rotweͻn abotar mu,
Dɛ ebɛhɛn akͻ m’.
Fɛr nka hɛn Christian 'nuaam a
Yɛsoa Ne dzin nsɛwhyɛ n’;
Fer, o fɛr nka hɛn mprɛnsa ,
Dɛ yɛma ogyina hͻ.

MHB 330
2 . O Jesus, Thou art knocking;
And lo, that hand is scarred,
And thorns Thy brow encircle,
And tears Thy face have marred.
O love that passeth knowledge,
So patiently to wait!
O sin that hath no equal,
So fast to bar the gate!
	 ~ 	2 
. O Jesus, Ͻwo robͻ m',
Hwɛ, Wo nsa n' ho wͻ tua.
Na nsoɛ kyew bi hyɛ Wo tsir;
Nyinsu asɛɛ W’enyim.
O ͻdͻ a ͻtra ntseasee,
Ͻtweͻn abotar mu!
O bͻn a onnyi saso,
Ͻtow abotsen mu.

MHB 330
3 . O Jesus, Thou art pleading
In accents meek and low,
I died for you, my children,
And will ye treat me so?
O Lord, with shame and sorrow
We open now the door;
Dear Saviour, enter, enter,
And leave us nevermore.    Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. O Jesus, Ͻwo resérɛ
Wͻ ahobrɛadze mu;
O Me mba, muwui maa hom,
Na horn bɛyɛ Me dɛn? '
Ewuradze, fɛr na yaw mu,
Afei yebue abow n’
Agyenkwa dͻyɛfo, bra m’,
Mma nngya hɛn hͻ ara da.   Amen.

MHB 331
1 . BEHOLD Me standing at the door,
And hear Me pleading evermore,
With gentle voice: O heart of sin,
May I come in? May I come in?

    Behold Me standing at the door,
    And hear Me pleading evermore: 
    Say, weary heart, oppressed with sin,
    May I come in? May I come in?
	 ~ 	1 . HWƐ! Mowɔ abow no ano,
Na tise Mo ntotɔserɛ yi,
Me ndze bɔkɔɔ se; Akoma bɔn,
Ana membra m'? Ana membra m'?
      HWƐ! Mowɔ abow no ano,
      Na tise Mo ntotɔserɛ yi,
      Akoma brɛfo a bɔn ahyɛ ma,
      Ana membra m'? 
      Ana membra m'?
Ana membra m? Ana membra m'?

MHB 331
2 . I bore the cruel thorns’ for thee,
I waited long and patiently:
Say, weary heart, oppressed with sin,
May I come in? May I come in?
	 ~ 	2 
. Mosoaa nsoɛ ahenkyɛw, wo ntsi,
Motweɔɔn mber tsentsen abotar m';
Akoma brɛfo a bɔn ahyɛ ma,
Ana membra m? Ana membra m'?

MHB 331
3 . I would not plead with thee in vain;
Remember all My grief and pain!
I died to ransom thee from sin,
May I come in? May I come in?
	 ~ 	3 
. Monnkɔtotɔ aserɛ wo gyan;
Kaa M'awerɛhow na Me yaw!
Muwui gyee hom fii hom bɔn mu,
Ana membra m? Ana membra m'?

MHB 331
4 . I bring thee joy from heaven above,
I bring thee pardon, peace, and love:
Say, weary heart, oppressed with sin,
May I come in? May I come in?	 ~ 	4 
. Medze dɛw fi ɔsor brɛ wo,
Nye fakyɛ asomdwee na dɔ;
Akoma brɛfo a bɔn ahyɛ ma,

MHB 332
1 . BEHOLD! a Stranger at the door!
He gently knocks, has knocked before:
Has waited long, is waiting still:
You treat no other friend so ill.
	 ~ 	1 . HWƐ! Hɔho bi wɔ abowano!
Ɔrobɔ m' berɛww, ɔabɔ mu pɛn;
Ɔatweɔn akyɛr na ɔrotweɔn,
Nnyɛ nyɛnko bɔn biara dɛ Ɔno.
Adasa nyina nyɛ N'ahenman.

MHB 332
2 . But will He prove a friend indeed?
He will; the very Friend you need;
The Man of Nazareth, ’tis He,
With garments dyed on Calvary.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ana ɔbɛyɛ nyɛnko pa?
Ɔbɛyɛ nyɛnko ara ampa,
Nazareth Barimba n' ara a;
Wɔdze Ne ntar nuu bɔgya mu.

MHB 332
3 . Admit Him, for the human breast
Ne’er entertained so kind a Guest;
No mortal tongue their joys can tell
With whom He condescends to dwell.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma ɔmbra m' 'siandɛ adasamba
Anngye hɔho dɔyɛfo enyi;
Hɔn a ɔnye hɔn tsena no,
Gyirama nnkotum aka hɔn dɛw.

MHB 332
4 . Yet know, nor of the terms complain,
Where Jesus comes, He comes to reign; 
To reign, and with no partial away;
Thoughts must be slain that disobey.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mbom hu na mma nnhwinhwin yi ho,
Bea a Jesus kɔ no, odzi hen,
Odzi hen na ɔnnkɔ obiara afa;
Hɔn a wonntsie n', ɔwɔ dɛ wowu.

MHB 332
5 . Sovereign of souls! Thou Prince of Peace
O may Thy gentle reign increase!
Throw wide the door each willing mind;
And be His empire all mankind.	 ~ 	5 
. Akra hɔn Hen, Asomdwee Hen,
O ma W'ahendzi nyɛ prɔmprɔm!
Adwen biara mbue abow n' kɛse,

MHB 333
1 . COME, let us, who in Christ believe,
Our common Saviour praise,
To Him with joyful voices give
The glory of His grace.
	 ~ 	1 . Bra ma hɛn a yɛgye Christ dzi 
Ntonton hɛn Agyenkwa,
Yɛmfa enyigye ndze nkamfo
N' adom enyimnyam no.
Nyɛ ɔdomankoma dɔ.    Amen.

MHB 333
2 . He now stands knocking at the door
Of every sinner’s heart; 
The worst need keep Him out no more,
Or force Him to depart.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ogyina bɔnyɛnyi biara 
N' akoma ekyir robɔm';
Nyia ɔasɛɛ koraa nnyi dɛ ɔpam N' bio,
Anaa ɔyɛ ma ɔkɔ.

MHB 333
3 . Through grace we hearken to Thy voice,
Yield to be saved from sin; 
In sure and certain hope rejoice,
That Thou wilt enter in.

	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛnam adom do tsie Wo ndze, 
Pen do dɛ yi hɛn bɔnm',
Yesi pi dzi dɛw enyidarm',
Dɛ Ɔwo 'bɛhɛn mu.

MHB 333
4 . Come quickly in, Thou heavenly Guest,
Nor ever hence remove;
But sup with us, and let the feast
Be everlasting love. Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Bra mu ntsɛmara, sor Hɔho, 
Na mma mmfi ha nnkɔ da
Nye hɛn ndzidzi, ma edziban no

MHB 334
1 . THERE were ninety and nine that safely lay
In the shelter of the fold;
But one was out on the hills away,
Far off from the gates of gold,
Away on the mountains wild and bare,
Away from the tender Shepherd’s care.
	 ~ 	1 . EDUOKRON akron n' na wɔda sɔkyee
Wɔ hɔn nguambuw n' nwin ase,
Na kor efir edzi koko n' do,
Efi siar abow n' ho koraa,
Wɔ botan kɛse kwawee no do,
Efi Guanhwɛfo No dɔ n' ase.
Dzi dɛw, Ewuradze dze no reba.

MHB 334
2 . Lord, Thou hast here Thy ninety and nine;
Are they not enough for Thee?
But the Shepherd made answer: This of Mine
Has wandered away from Me;
And although the road be rough and steep,
I go to the desert to find My sheep,
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewuradze, W'eduokron akron n' wɔ ha;
Ana wɔnndɔɔ so mma Wo?
Guanhwɛfo no buaa dɛ, Medze yinom
Atɔ dɔnsuar efi me nkyɛn;
Kaansa kwan no kyeakyea, yɛ kronn mpo a,
Mokɔ sar no do kɔhwehwɛ Mo nguan.

MHB 334
3 . But none of the ransomed ever knew
How deep were the waters crossed,
Nor how dark was the night the Lord passed through
Ere He found His sheep that was lost.
Out in the desert He heard its cry,
Sick and helpless and ready to die.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hɔn a wɔapon hɔn n' mu biara ennhu
Mbrɛ esu n' si na ɔdɔ,
Na sum bi a Ewuradze faa mu n' yɛɛ kapee,
Ansaana oruhu No nguan n',
Ɔtsee no su wɔ sar no do hɔ,
Dɛ ɔyar dzendzen a orubowu.

MHB 334
4 . Lord, whence are those blood- drops all the way
That mark out the mountain’s track?
They were shed for one who had gone astray,
Ere the Shepherd could bring him back.
Lord, whence are Thy hands so rent and torn?
They are pierced tonight by many a thorn.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ewuradze, bɔgya a ɔsosɔ kwan m'
Wɔ koko do no fi hen?
Wokyii bɔgya n' maa nyia ɔtɔɔ gon no,
Ansaana wɔdze no resan,
Ewuradze, Wo nsamu piratua n' fi hen?
Anafua yi na dɔm pii piraa me.

MHB 334
5 . And all through the mountains, thunder- riven,
And up from the rocky steep,
There rose a cry to the gate of heaven:
Rejoice ,I have found My sheep.
And the angels echoed around the throne:
Rejoice, for the Lord brings back His own.	 ~ 	5 
. Sor bobɔ mu wɔ akoko nyina do,
Na mbotantsim sorɔnsorɔmbea
Hɔ na su fii kɔr sor pon ano;
Dzi dɛw, mehu Mo guan no,
Abɔfo tseatseaa mu wɔ ahengua n'ho;

MHB 335
1 . PASS me not, O gentle Saviour,
Hear my humble cry;
While on others Thou art calling,
Do not pass me by.

     Saviour! Saviour!
     Hear my humble cry,
     And while others Thou art calling,
     Do not pass me by.
	 ~ 	1 . Mma mmpa mo ho, Agyenkwa brɛfo, 
Tsie mo mbɔbɔr su;
'Reyaa W' ano kyerɛ binom,
Mma mmpa mo nko ho.

  Agyenkwa, Agyenkwa, 
  Tsie mo mbɔbɔr su!
  Na 'refrɛfrɛ m' asɛfo yi,
  Mma mmpa mo nko ho.

MHB 335
2 . Let me at Thy throne of mercy
Find a sweet relief;
Kneeling there in deep contrition,
Help my unbelief.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mbɔbɔr ahengua enyim ha 
ma m' akomatɔm';
Mokosɔw ha awerɛhow mu
Na pa m' ekyingye.

MHB 335
3 . Trusting only in Thy merit,
Would I seek Thy face;
Heal my wounded, broken spirit,
Save me by Thy grace.
	 ~ 	3 
. Motwer Wo yie no nkotonoo, 
Mohwehwɛ W' enyim;
Yɛ mo sunsum pirafo edur,
Nam W' adom do gye m'.

MHB 335
4 . Thou the Spring of all my comfort,
More than life to me,
Whom have I on earth beside Thee?
Whom in heaven but Thee?	 ~ 	4 
. M' aweɛkyekyer n- sunyiwa, 
'Wo 'kyɛn me nkwa mpo;
Mowɔ woana wɔ ase ha,
Anaa sor dɛ 'Wo?

MHB 336
1 . IN loving-kindness Jesus came,
My soul in mercy to reclaim,
And from the depths of sin and shame
Through grace He lifted me.

    From sinking sand He lifted me;
    With tender hand He lifted me;
    From shades of night to plains of light,
    O praise His Name, He lifted me!
	 ~ 	1 . AYAMUYIE mu na Jesus bae
Bɔpoon me kra mbɔbɔrhu mu,
Fii 'nyimguase na bɔn bun mu,
Nam adom do gyee me.
       Ɔmaa mo do fii anhwea mu
       Ɔdɔ nsa na ɔdze twee me,
       Fii isum mu kɔr ekan mu;
       Yi N'ayɛw, ɔmaa mo do.
Otwaar dɛ ɔma mo do.

MHB 336
2 . He called me long before I heard,
Before my sinful heart was stirred;
But when I took Him at His word,
Forgiven, He lifted me.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔfrɛ me ber a nna minnyim,
M'akoma bɔnfo nnyaa nnyanee
Na minnyaa nntsin N'asɛm do no,
Ɔdze kyɛɛ m', maa mo do.

MHB 336
3 . His brow was pierced with many a thorn,
His hands by cruel nails were torn,
When from my guilt and grief, forlorn,
In love He lifted me.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nsoɛ piinara wowɔɔ N' tsir ho,
Mprɛgow dzendzen bobɔɔ Ne nsamu,
Ber a ofi dɔ kɛse mu
Gyee m' afɔdzi na yaw m'.

MHB 336
4 . Now on a higher plane I dwell,
And with my soul I know ’tis well; 
Yet how or why, I cannot tell,
He should have lifted me.	 ~ 	4 
. Afei metse sorsor noho,
Me kra m' muhu dɛ oye koraa,
Naaso minnyim siantsir biara a

MHB 337
1 . God loved the world of sinners lost
And ruined by the fall;
Salvation full, at highest cost,
He offers free to all.
     O ’twas love, ’twas wondrous love,
     The love of God to me;
     It brought my Saviour from above,
     To die on Calvary.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME dɔɔ bɔn wiadze a ayew
Na asehwe n' asɛɛ no n';
Nkwagye a odzi mu, som bo,
Ɔdze ma hɔn nyina kwa.
   O ɔdɔ a, anwanwa dɔ a,
   Nyame dɔ a ɔwɔ ma m';
   Ɔdze m'Agyenkwa n' fi sor bae
   Ma obowuu Calvary.
Christ hɛn Hen Ewuradze m'.

MHB 337
2 . E’en now by faith I claim Him mine,
The risen Son of God;
Redemption by His death I find,
And cleansing through the blood.
	 ~ 	2 
. Medze gyedzi gye N' dɛ medze,
Nyame Ne Ba a ɔsasoɛr,
No wu no enya apon me
No bɔgyaa ahor me.

MHB 337
3 . Love brings the glorious fullness in,
And to His saints makes known
The blessèd rest from inbred sin,
Through faith in Christ alone.
	 ~ 	3 
. ‘Dɔ dze ‘nyimnyam emudzi n’ ba,
Ma N’ahotsewfo hu
Siar a ofi bɔn ho ɔgye mu
Wɔ Christ gyedzi nko mu.

MHB 337
4 . Believing souls, rejoicing go;
There shall to you be given
A glorious foretaste, here below,
Of endless life in heaven.
	 ~ 	4 
. Akra agyendzifo dze dɛw kɔ
Hɔ na wo so benya
Enyimnyam nkahwɛ ase ha,
Wɔ sor nkwa a onnyi ewiei mu.

MHB 337
5 . Of victory now o’er Satan’s power
Let all the ransomed sing,
And triumph in the dying hour
Through Christ, the Lord, our King.	 ~ 	5 
. Wɔmma hɔn a wɔapon hɔn nyina
Nhua 'bɔnsam do konyim,
Nye owu ber mu konyimdzi wɔ

MHB 338
1 . Rescue the perishing, care for the dying,
Snatch them in pity from sin and the grave; 
Weep o’er the erring one, Lift up the fallen,
Tell them of Jesus the mighty to save.
      Rescue the perishing, care for the dying;
      Jesus is merciful, Jesus will save.
	 ~ 	1 . Per gye hɔn a wɔreyew, 
Tse ma hɔn a woruwu,
Hwim hɔn fi bɔn na adakamaa mu:
Su ma dza ɔafom kwan,
Ma asehwefo do,
Se hɔn dɛ Jesus tum dɛ ɔgye nkwa.

   Per gye hɔn a wɔreyew, 
   Tse ma hɔn a woruwu,
   Jesus yɛ mbɔbɔrhu, ɔbɛgye nkwa.
Se kobɔfo n' dɛ Gyefo n' wui maa no.

MHB 338
2 . Though they are slighting Him, still He is waiting,
Waiting the penitent child to receive.
Plead with them earnestly, Plead with them gently:
He will forgive if they only believe.
	 ~ 	2  
. Sɛ wɔmmfa N' nnyɛ hwee mpo a, 
Ɔda ho rotweɔn.
'Rotweɔn ɔba a oenu noho n' ɔagye n'.
Enye hɔn nka n' ka pa,
Enye hɔn nka n' berɛww;
Sɛ wɔgye dzi ara a ɔdze bɛkyɛ.

MHB 338
3 . Down in the human heart, crushed by the tempter,
Feelings lie buried that grace can restore;
Touched by a loving heart, Wakened by kindness,
Chords that were broken will vibrate once more.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ abɔnsam daadaa 
'Nyimpa n' akoma a,
Nyame N' adom twe n' ekyir a ɔyɛ:
Eyɛ no ayamuyie,
Ekyerɛ no Wo dɔ a,
Dza nkyɛ ɔnntse no afei ɔbɛtse.

MHB 338
4 . Rescue the perishing-Duty demands it;
Strength for thy labour the Lord will provide;
Back to the narrow way, Patiently win them;
Tell the poor wanderer a Saviour has died.	 ~ 	4  
. Per gye hɔn a wɔreyew: 
Dwuma 'i da wo do;
Ewuradze bɛma w' ho ahoɔdzen.
Frɛ hɔn ma wɔnsan mbra,
Fa abotar twe hɔn;

MHB 339
1 . COME, O Thou Traveller unknown,
Whom still I hold, but cannot see!
My company before is gone,
And I am left alone with Thee;
With Thee all night I mean to stay,
And wrestle till the break of day.
	 ~ 	1 . BRA, O kwantunyi a minnyim Wo,
Ͻwo a motwer Wo ’so munnhu W’!
Mo nkorͻfo edzi m’enyim kan kͻ,
Afei aka emi na W’ nko;
Menye W’ bɛtsena anafua ’i nyina
Edzi aper kɛpem adzekyee.
Wo su na Wo dzin nye Ͻdͻ.

MHB 339
10 . The Sun of Rightiousness on me
Hath risen with healing in His wings;
Withered my nature’s strength, from Thee
My soul its life and succour brings;
My help is all laid up above:
Thy nature and Thy name is Love.
	 ~ 	10 
. Tsenenee Ewia no dze ayarsa;
Epue, ahyerɛn wͻ mo do,
Mo honam mu ahom asa;
Na me kra no nkwa fi Wo hͻ:
Mo mboa nyina wͻakora n’ sor.
Wo su na Wo dzin nye Ͻdͻ.

MHB 339
11 . Contented now upon my thigh
I halt, till life’s short journey end;
All helplessness, all weakness, I
On Thee alone for strength depend;
Nor have I power from Thee to move:
Thy nature and Thy name is Love.
	 ~ 	11 
. Mayɛ apakye mpo a, mo bo dwe
Kesi ͻbra kwantsiaa yi ewiei;
M’awerɛhow na me mberɛwyɛ mu
Wo nko W’ nkyɛn na minya ahoͻdzen;
‘Nngya me ma minnkyinkyin gyan kwa,
Wo su na Wo dzin nye Ͻdͻ.

MHB 339
12 . Lame as I am, I take the prey,
Hell, earth, and sin with ease o’ercome;
I leap for joy, pursue my way,
And as a bounding hart fly home,
Through all eternity to prove
Thy nature and Thy name is Love.	 ~ 	12 
. Meyɛ mbérɛw ’so mikyir sɛɛfo n’,
Midzi hɛll, wiadze na bͻn do:
Midzii dɛw huruw, tu mo kwan,
Medze twitwi kͻ fie dɛ ͻtwe
Mfesantsen nyina dze akyerɛ dɛ

MHB 339
2 . I need not tell Thee who I am,
My misery and sin declare;
Thyself  hast called me by my name,
Look on Thy hands, and read it there:
But who, I ask Thee, who art Thou?
Tell me Thy name, and tell me now.
	 ~ 	2 
. Onnhia dɛ m'bɛka m' nyimpa ban,
M’esumasɛm na mo bͻn akyérɛ W’,
Ͻwo a abͻ me dzin afrɛ m’,
Hwɛ Wo nsamu’ na kenkan no hͻ;
Mibisa W’ dɛ Woana nye W’ koraa?
Ba Wo dzin kyerɛ me seseiara.

MHB 339
3 . In vain Thou strugglest to get free;
I never will unloose my hold!
Art Thou the Man that died for me?
The secret of Thy love unfold:
Wrestling, I will not let Thee go,
Till I Thy name, Thy nature know.
	 ~ 	3 
. Kwa na reper agye Woho,
Minnkegyaa Wo mu ara da!
Ͻwo nye Nyia owui maa me n’;
Ma munhu Wo nsumaa mu dͻ n’
Méreper, minnkegyaa W’ ma aakͻ da,
Gyedɛ muhu W’ dzin na Wo su.

MHB 339
4 . Wilt Thou not yet to me reveal
Thy new, unutterable name?
Tell me, I still beseech Thee, tell;
To know it now resolved I am:
Wrestling, I will not let Thee go,
Till I Thy name, Thy nature know.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ana Wo dzin a wͻmmbͻ no
Ennkɛda n’ edzi akyerɛ m’?
Meserɛ Wo, ka kyerɛ me;
Mepɛ dɛ muhu no sesei.
Meréper, minnkegyaa W' ma aakͻ da,
Gyedɛ muhu W’ dzin na Wo su.

MHB 339
5 . What though my shrinking flesh complain,
And murmur to contend so long?
I rise superior to my pain,
When I am weak, then I am strong;
And when my all of strength shall fail,
I shall with the God-man prevail.
	 ~ 	5 
. ‘Bɛn ntsi na mo honam a ͻhwer
Bͻkͻ do enhwinhwin daa dɛm?
Mobor me yaw do ka n’ hyɛ koraa,
Me mbérɛwyɛ mu na meyɛ dzen.
Na sɛ m'ahoodzen nyina pa a,
Menye Nyame Ba n’ bedzi nyim.

MHB 339
6 . Yield to me now; for I am weak,
But confident in self-despair 
Speak to my heart in blessings speak,
Be conquered by my instant prayer;
Speak, or Thou never hence shalt move,
And tell me if Thy name is Love.
	 ~ 	6 
. Fa Woho ma m’, na meyɛ mberɛw,
Ha migyina abagura mu daa;
Kasa, na hyira m’akoma,
Yɛ aso rna n’enyiber mpaabͻ.
Kasa, ͻno nnkefi ha akͻ,
Na rna munhu dɛ eyɛ dͻ.

MHB 339
7 . ’Tis Love ! ’tis Love! Thou diedst for me!
I hear Thy whisper in my heart; 
The morning breaks, the shadows flee,
Pure, universal Love Thou art;
To me, to all, Thy mercies move:
Thy nature and Thy name is Love.
	 ~ 	7 
. Ͻda ntsi Ͻwo wui maa me!
M’akoma tse W’ano wasa;
Adze akye ma sum apa,
Wiadze nyina eyɛ ͻdͻ krͻnn;
Ihu nyimpa nyina mbͻbͻr:
Wo su na Wo dzin nye Ͻdͻ.

MHB 339
8 . My prayer hath power with God;
the grace
 Unspeakable I know now receive;
Through faith I see Thee face to face,
I see Thee face to face, and live!
In vain I have not wept and strove:
Thy nature and Thy name is Love.
	 ~ 	8 
. Me mpaabͻ du Nyankopͻn enyim,
Na minya adorn a onnyi kabea;
Gyedzi m’ muhu W’ enyim na enyim,
Muhu W'enyim na minya nkwa!
Mennsu ara kwa, na mammper kwa:
Wo su na Wo dzin nye Ͻdͻ.

MHB 339
9 . I know Thee, Saviour, who Thou art,
Jesus, the feeble sinner’s Friend; 
Nor wilt Thou with the night depart,
But stay and Love me to the end;
Thy mercies never shall remove?
Thy nature and Thy name is Love.
	 ~ 	9 
. Agyenkwa, minyim mbrɛ etse,
Jesus, ͻbͻn bafan Adamfo;
Mma mmfi me nkyɛn adzesaaber mpo,
Tsena na dͻ me kͻ ewiei;
Wo mbͻbͻrhu mmpa ara da,
Wo su na Wo dzin nye Ͻdͻ

MHB 34
1 . IMMORTAL, invisible, God only wise,
In light inaccessible hid from our eyes,
Most blessed, most glorious, the Ancient of Days,
Almighty, victorious, Thy great name we praise.
	 ~ 	1 . BƐKYEBO, a wonnhu Wo, O Nyansabuakwa!
Nyame, kan a yɛmmbɛn na isuma mu;
Osiarfo, Nyimnyamfo, O Tsetse Nyame!
Otumfo, Katakyi, yɛkamfo Wo dzin.

MHB 34
2 . Unresting, unhasting, and silent as light,
Nor wanting, nor wasting, Thou rulest in might;
Thy justice, like mountains, high soaring above
Thy clouds which are fountains of goodness and love.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔwo 'nnhom, emmpɛ ntsɛm, eyɛ kan nwanwa;
Innhia hwee, emmpɛ hwee, idzi hen tum mu;
Wo pɛrpɛr dɛ bepɔw a ɔkrɔn kɔ sor,
Wo fua yɛ ayamuyie na dɔ nsunyiwa.

MHB 34
3 . To all, Thou givest-to both great and small;
In all Thou livest the true life of all;
We blossom and flourish as leaves on the tree.
And wither and perish-but naught changeth Thee.
	 ~ 	3 . Ema obiara nkwa, akɛse na nkumaa;
Na nkwa nyina ewɔ mu, nokwar nkwa nye Wo;
Yefifir yɛ prɔmprɔm dɛ ndua do nhaban,
Yenyinyam, yewuwu; Ɔwo nnsakyer da.

MHB 34
4 . Great Father of Glory, pure Father of light,
Thine angels adore Thee, all veiling their sight;
All laud we would render; O help us to see:
Tis only the splendor of light hideth Thee.
	 ~ 	4 . Egya Onyimnyamfo, Kan Egya mapa;
W'abɔfo hyɛ kata hɔn enyim tonton Wo;
Enyimnyam nyina sɛ Wo; boa hɛn ma yenhu;
Kan fɛɛfɛw ara na ɔdze Wo suma hɛn.

MHB 34
5 . Immortal, invisible, God only wise,
In light inaccessible hid from our eyes,
Most blessed, most glorious, the Ancient of Days,
Almighty, victorious, Thy great name we praise.  Amen.
	 ~ 	5 . Bɛkyebo, a wonnhu Wo, O Nyansabuakwa!
Nyame, kan a yɛmmbɛn na isuma hɛn;
Osiarfo, Nyimnyamfo, O Tsetse Nyame!
Otumfo, Katakyi, yɛkamfo Wo dzin.

MHB 340
1 . COME, O Thou Traveller unknown, 
whom still I hold, but cannot see!
My company before is gone,
And I am left alone with Thee;
With Thee all night I mean to stay,
And wrestle till the break of day.
	 ~ 	1 . BRA, ao, Kwantunyi nanaben,
Meda ho kura W’ na munnhu W’ !
Mo dͻm n’ edzi m’enyim kan kͻ
Ma ͻaka mo nko wͻ Wo nkyɛn;
Wͻ nkyɛn na anago yi m’bɛtsena,
Yeedzi aper ekodu adzekyee.
Wo su na Wo dzin nye Ͻdͻ.

MHB 340
2 . In vain Thou strugglest to get free;
I never will unloose my hold!
Art Thou the Man that died for me?
The secret of Thy love unfold:
Wrestling, I will not let Thee go,
Till I Thy name, Thy nature know.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ereper kwa dɛ befi nsa,
Monnkͻgow me nsamu ara da,
Ͻwo nye Barimba a owui maa me n’?
Da Wo nsumaa mu dͻ n’ edzi;
Ereper, minnkegyaa W’ ma aakͻ,
Gyedɛ muhu Wo dzin, Wo su.

MHB 340
3 . Yield to me now, for I am weak,
But confident in self-despair;
Speak to my heart, in blessings speak,
Be conquered by my instant prayer;
Speak, or Thou never hence shalt move,
And tell me if Thy name is Love.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nkyii suo mo mu, na mayɛ mbérɛw, ,
Mowͻ awérɛhyɛm’ wͻ m’abagura m’;
Kasa nhyira m’ kyérɛ m’akoma,
Me mprempren mpaabͻ mpuhim Wo;
Kasa, ͻno nnkefi ha akͻ, 
Ka kyérɛ m’, sɛ Wo dzin nye Ͻda a.

MHB 340
4 . ’Tis Love ! ’tis Love! Thou diedst for me!
I hear Thy whisper in my heart;
The morning breaks, the shadows flee,
Pure universal Love Thou art;
To me, to all, Thy mercies move:
Thy nature and Thy name is Love.	 ~ 	4 
. Ͻdͻ a ! Ͻdͻ a ! Iwui maa me!
Metse dɛ ’wasa m’akoma m’;
Adze kye, sunsum twa m’ hwew hwew,
Awͻmbea Ͻdͻ mapa nye Wo;
Ihu emi na obiara mbͻbͻr:

MHB 341
1 . WHEN shall Thy love constrain,
And force me to Thy breast?
When shall my soul return again
To her eternal rest ?
	 ~ 	1 . ABER, bɛn na Wo dɔ
Bɔtwe m' afam Wo bom'?
Me kra bɛsan dabɛn akɔ
N'ahomgye a onnyi ewiei m'?
Mebu W' konyimdzifo.

MHB 341
2 . Thy condescending grace
To me did freely move;
It calls me still to seek Thy face,
And stoops to ask my love.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wo penkyɛr adom no
Ekyerɛɛ n' wɔ mo do kwa,
Ɔfrɛ m' dɛ monhwehwɛ W'enyim;
Kotow bisa mo dɔ.

MHB 341
3 . Lord, at Thy feet I fall!
I long to be set free;]
I fain would now obey the call,
And give up all for Thee.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mokotow W'ananadze !
Mo kɔn dɔ fahodzi,
Meper dɛ nkyii mitsie Wo frɛ
Na mopow adze nyina ma W'.

MHB 341
4 . To rescue me from woe,
Thou didst with all things part;
Didst lead a suffering life below,
To gain my worthless heart.
	 ~ 	4 
. Epow adze nyina
Dze agye m' efi mbusu m',
Esɔɔw bene wɔ ase ha,
Dze agye m'akoma huhuw.

MHB 341
5 . My worthless heart to gain,
The God of all that breathe
Was found in fashion as a man,
And died a cursed death.
	 ~ 	5 
. M'akoma huhuw ne ngyee
Maa abɔdze nyina Nyame
Ɔbɛbraa dɛ ɔdasanyi
Na owuu mpaa kwan do.

MHB 341
6 . And can I yet delay
My little all to give?
To tear my soul from earth away,
For Jesus to receive?
	 ~ 	6 
. M'bɛda ho ayɛ ekyim dɛ
'Dze biara a mowɔ ma n',
Motwe me kra fi wiadze ho
Ma Jesus Ne nsa aka?

MHB 341
7 . Nay, but I yield, I yield !
I can hold out no more,
I sink, by dying love compelled,
And own Thee conqueror.	 ~ 	7 
. Oho, migyaa m', migyaa m'
Moronnkora do bio,
Dɔ a oruwu n' ka m' hyɛ bun m',

MHB 342
1 . COME, let us to the Lord our God
With contrite hearts return;
Our God is gracious, nor will leave
The desolate to mourn.
	 ~ 	1 . BRA ma yɛmfa akoma bobɔe
Nsan nkɔ Ewuradzi hɔ;
Hɛn Nyame yɛ domfo, ɔremma
Ankonam nnkyi nyinsu.
Anago awerɛhow n'.

MHB 342
2 . His voice commands the tempest forth,
And stills the stormy wave;
And though His arm be strong to smite,
’Tis also strong to save.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ne ndze tram ehum a orutu,
Ɔma ehum no yɛ komm;
Kaansa ɔdze nsa dzendzen tsea a,
Otum so dze gye nkwa.

MHB 342
3 . Long hath the night of sorrows reigned;
The dawn shall bring us light;
God shall appear, and we shall rise
With gladness in His sight.
	 ~ 	3 
. Anago m' yaw akɔ do akyɛr;
Wipuei bɛbrɛ hɛn kan;
Nyame bɛba, na yɛbɔsoɛr
Enyigye m' wɔ n'enyim.

MHB 342
4 . Our hearts, if God we seek to know,
Shall know Him and rejoice;
His coming like the morn shall be,
Like morning songs His voice.
	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn akoma m' yɛpɛ ehu Nyame a,
Yebohu N' yeedzi dɛw;
Ne mbae bɛyɛ dɛ adzekyee,
Ne ndze dɛ anapa ndwom.

MHB 342
5 . As dew upon the tender herb,
Diffusing fragrance round;
As showers that usher in the spring,
And cheer the thirsty ground.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ɔtse dɛ ha momon do bɔw,
Otu nka huan petse; 
Dɛ mpetsema a ɔdze adɔwber ba,
Ma bea a oetwei dzi dɛw.

MHB 342
6 . So shall His presence bless our souls,
And shed a joyful light;
That hallowed morn shall chase away
The sorrows of the night.	 ~ 	6 
. Ne mbae bɛhyira hɛn akra,
Na ɔahyerɛn enyigye m';
Dɛm siar adzekyee no bɛpam

MHB 343
1 . WHEREWITH, O God, shall I draw near,
And bow myself before Thy face ?
How in Thy purer eyes appear ?
What shall I bring to gain Thy grace ?
	 ~ 	1 . AO NYAME, hen na montwe mbɛn
Na mombɔ m' adze wɔ W'enyim?
Ihu me dɛn wɔ W'enyi do?
Memfa bɛn mbra mbɛgye adom?
Jesus, Wo mpaabɔ rennyɛ gyan.

MHB 343
2 . Whoe’er to Thee themselves approve
Must take the path Thy word hath showed,
Justice pursue, and mercy love,
And humbly walk by faith with God.
	 ~ 	2 
. Dodow a wɔfata W'enyim,
Wɔ dɛ wɔfa W'asɛm kwan do,
Wotsiw pɛrpɛr, wonya tsema,
Nye Nyame nantsew berɛww gyedzi m'.

MHB 343
3 . But though my life henceforth be Thine,
Present for past can ne’er atone;
Though I to Thee the whole resign,
I only give Thee back Thine own.
	 ~ 	3 
. Kaansa me bra nkyii ayɛ Wodze a,
Sesei 'bra nntum mmpon dza ɔasen,
Kaansa mapow ne nyina ama Wo a,
Woara Wodze, mesan dze ma W'.

MHB 343
4 . What have I then wherein to trust?
I nothing have, I nothing am;
Excluded is my every boast,
My glory swallowed up in shame.
	 ~ 	4 
. Bɛn na mowɔ a wɔdze werɛ twer?
Minnyi hweeara, mennsɛ hweeara,
M'ahopɔw mpo wommbu no hwee,
Enyimguase amen m'enyimnyam.

MHB 343
5 . Guilty I stand before Thy face,
On me I feel Thy wrath abide;
’Tis just the sentence should take place;
’Tis just - but O Thy Son hath died!
	 ~ 	5 
. Migyina W'enyim dɛ midzi fɔ,
Muhu W'ebufuw wɔ mo do,
Ɔtsen dɛ atsɛmbu nkɔ do,
Na ɔtsen dɛ Wo Ba ewu.

MHB 343
6 . Jesus, the Lamb of God, hath bled,
He bore our sins upon the tree;
Beneath our curse He bowed His head;
’Tis finished! He hath died for me!
	 ~ 	6 
. Jesus Eguambaa ekyi bɔgya,
Ɔsoaa hɛn bɔn wɔ dua no do,
Hɛn mpaa ho ɔbɔɔ Ne tsir adze,
Oewie! Oewu ama emi.

MHB 343
7 . See where before the throne He stands 
And pours the all-prevailing prayer,
Points to His side, and lifts His hands,
And shows that I am graven there.
	 ~ 	7 
. Hwɛ mbrɛ oesi gyina ahengua enyim
Rowora konyimdzi mpaabɔ no!
Ɔdze Ne mfem' na Ne nsa kyerɛ,
Na wɔayɛ mo mfonyin wɔ hɔ.

MHB 343
8 . He ever lives for me to pray;
He prays that I with Him may reign:
Amen to what my Lord doth say!
Jesus, Thou canst not pray in vain.	 ~ 	8 
. Ɔtse ase daa, ɔserɛ ma me,
Ɔsɔr dɛ menye N' bedzi hen;
Amen wɔ dza Ewruadze se n' do,

MHB 344
1 . JESUS, the sinner’s Friend, to Thee,
Lost and undone, for aid I flee,
Weary of earth, myself, and sin;
Open Thine arms, and take me in!
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS ndzebɔnyɛfo Nyɛnko, 
Muguan hwehwɛ mboa fi Wo nkyɛn ,
Maberɛ wɔ wiadze ɔnye bɔn;
Tserɛw Wo nsamu na gye me.
Iyi nko beyi bɔn akwa.

MHB 344
2 . Pity, and heal my sin-sick soul;
’Tis Thou alone canst make me  whole;
Fall’n, till in me Thine image shine,
And cursed I am, till Thou art mine.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛ me kra a ɔyar no edur;
Wo nko na 'bɛma meedzi mu,
Mahwe ase na wɔadom me
Kɛpem dɛ Wo su n'hyerɛn mo mu.

MHB 344
3 . At last I own it cannot be
That I should fit myself for Thee:
Here then to Thee I all resign;
Thine is the work, and only Thine.
	 ~ 	3 
. Afei mehu dɛ mankasa
Munnkotum afata ama Wo;
Ntsi migyaa ne nyina m' ma Wo;
Edwuma no yɛ Wo nko dze.

MHB 344
4 . The mansion for Thyself prepare,
 Dispose my heart by entering there;
’Tis this alone can make me clean,
’Tis this alone can cast out sin.	 ~ 	4 
. Wankasa si ɔdan no mu,
To m'akoma pan na hɛn mu;
Iyi nko bɛma mo ho atsew,

MHB 345
1 . DRAWN to the Cross which Thou has blessed 
With healing gifts for souls distressed,
To find in Thee my life, my rest:
Christ Crucified, I come!
	 ~ 	1 . MBEAMUDUA a woehyira do ase
Na akra a wɔahaw nya ayarsa,
Wo mu minya nkwa nye ahomgye;
Christ a iwui, maba!
Christ a iwui, maba.

MHB 345
2 . Stained with the sins which I have wrought
In word and deed and secret thought,
For pardon which Thy blood hath bought:
Christ crucified, I come!
	 ~ 	2 
. Bɔn a mayɛ no wɔ adwen, nyɛe
Na kasa mu aka mo ho;
Meserɛ Wo bɔgyaa ne fakyɛ;
Christ a iwui, maba!

MHB 345
3 . Weary of selfishnesss and pride,
False pleasures gone, vain hopes denied,
Deep in Thy wounds my shame to hide:
Christ crucified, I come!
	 ~ 	3 
. Maberɛ, pɛsɛankonya na
Enyigyehun a ɔmma enyidar,
W'epirakur mu na musuma;
Christ a iwui, maba!

MHB 345
4 . Thou knowest all my griefs and fears,
Thy grace abused, my misspent years;
Yet now to Thee with contrite tears:
Christ Crucified, I come!
	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔwo nyim me yaw na suro,
W'adom na me mfe a masɛɛ;
Afei fa nyinsu tsew mo ho;
 Christ a iwui, maba!

MHB 345
5 . I would not, if I could, conceal 
The ills which only Thou canst heal,
So to the cross, where sinners kneel:
Christ crucified, I come!
	 ~ 	5 
. Sɛ mubotum mpo a, meremmfa
Me yar a Wo nko sa no nnsie,
Mokotow mbeamudua n' ase;
Christ a iwui, maba!

MHB 345
6 . Wash me, and take away each stain,
Let nothing of my sin remain; 
For cleansing, though it be through pain:
Christ Crucified, I come.
	 ~ 	6 
. Guar m' na hohor me nkekaaba,
Mma mo bɔn biara nnka mo ho;
Yaw mu mpo na mo ho san yie;
Christ a iwui, maba!

MHB 345
7 . To be what Thou wouldst have me be, 
Accepted, sanctified in Thee,
Through what Thy grace shall work in me:
Christ crucified, I come!	 ~ 	7 
. Mepɛ maayɛ dza Ɔwo pɛ,
Agye m' atsew m' ho wɔ Wo mu,
Ɔnam dza W'adom yɛ m' mu ntsi;

MHB 346
1 . O JESUS, full of truth and grace,
 More full of grace than I of sin,
Yet once again I seek Thy face;
Open Thine arms, and take me in,
And freely my backslidings heal,
And love the faithless sinner still.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, nokwar na adom ahyɛ W' ma,
W'adom bor mo bɔn nyina do,
Naaso meda ho hwehwɛ W'enyim;
Bue Wo nsa na yɛ me etuu,
Na ma mensan mbraWo hɔ bio,
Na kɔ do ara dɔ bɔnyɛnyi.
Na maammfom Wo dabiara da.  Amen.

MHB 346
2 . Thou know’st the way to bring me back,
My fallen spirit to restore:
O for Thy truth and mercy’s sake,
Forgive, and bid me sin no more;
The ruins of my soul repair,
And make my heart a house of prayer.
	 ~ 	2 
. Inyim mbrɛ ibesi dze m' asan,
Na agye mo sunsum a ahera;
Wo nokwar ehumbɔbɔr ntsi,
Fa kyɛ m' na mma mennyɛ bɔn bio;
Yɛ mo sunsum pirafo edur,
Na yɛ m'akoma mpaabɔ fie.

MHB 346
3 . The stone to flesh again convert,
The veil of sin again remove;
Sprinkle Thy blood upon my heart,
And melt it by Thy dying love; 
This rebel heart by love subdue,
And make it soft, and make it new.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma ɔbo akoma nyɛ dɛ honam,
Yi bɔn nkataenyim no fi hɔ;
Fa Wo bɔgyaa guar m'akoma,
Dua Wo dɔ no do yi fi hɔ;
Hyɛ etuatsew akoma yi do,
Yɛ no botoo, yɛ no fofor.

MHB 346
4 . Ah! give me, Lord, the tender heart
That trembles at the approach of sin; 
A godly fear of sin impact,
Implant, and root it deep within,
That I may dread Thy gracious power,
And never dare to offend Thee more.	 ~ 	4 
. Ao, Ewuradze, ma m'akoma a
No ho popo wɔ bɔn enyim;
Ma me bɔn ho nyameuro,
Dua no mo mu ma ɔngye ndwow,
Ama meesuro Wo tum no,

MHB 347
1 . COME, O Thou all-victorious Lord,
Thy power to us make known;
Strike with the hammer of Thy word,
And break these hearts of stone.
	 ~ 	1 . O KONYIM Ewuradze, bra,
Ma yenhu Wo tum no;
Fa W'asɛm no bɔdobaa no
Bubu akoma bo yi.
Na fa hɛn kɔ sor fie.   Amen.

MHB 347
2 . O that we all might now begin
Our foolishness to mourn,
And turn at once from every sin,
And to our Saviour turn!
	 ~ 	2 
. O nkyɛ hɛn nyina ahyɛ ase
Eesu wɔ hɛn gyim ntsi,
Na yeefi bɔn nyinara ho,
Aasan hɛn Gyefo nkyɛn!

MHB 347
3 . Give us ourselves and Thee to know,
In this our gracious day; 
Repentance unto life bestow,
And take our sins away.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma yenhu hɛnho nye Wo ara,
Wɔ hɛn siar da yi mu;
Ma hɛn nnuho a ɔkɔ nkwa mu,
Na yi hɛn bɔn nyina.

MHB 347
4 . Conclude us first in unbelief,
And freely then release; 
Fill every soul with sacred grief,
And then with sacred peace.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma yengyaa hɛn ekyingye no,
Na ma hɛn fahodzi;
Fa yaw krɔnn hyɛ ɔkra biara mu,
Na ma n' asomdwee krɔnn.

MHB 347
5 . Impoverish, Lord, and then relieve,
And then enrich the poor; 
The knowledge of our sickness give,
The knowledge of our cure.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ewuradze, ma hia ndwir hɛn,
Na afei ma hɛn ahonya;
Ma yenhu hɛn nyarba nyina,
Na yenhu n'ano edur.

MHB 347
6 . That blessed sense of guilt impart,
And then remove the load;
Trouble, and wash the troubled heart
In the atoning blood.
	 ~ 	6 
. Ma hɛn afɔdzi ho nyimdzee,
Na yi adzesoa n' fi hɔ;
Tseetsee na hor akoma a ahaw n' ho
Wɔ nkwa bɔgya no mu.

MHB 347
7 . Our desperate state through sin declare,
And speak our sins forgiven;
By perfect holiness prepare,
And take us up to heaven.  Amen.	 ~ 	7 
. Ma hɛn bɔn tsebea yi nda edzi,
Ka dɛ wɔdze akyɛ hɛn;
Fa krɔnkrɔnyɛ siesie hɛn koraa,

MHB 348
1 . SAVIOUR, Prince of Israel’s race,
See me from Thy lofty throne;
Give the sweet relenting grace,
Soften this obdurate stone!
Stone to flesh, O God, convert;
Cast a look, and break my heart!
	 ~ 	1 . O AGYENKWA, Israel Hen,
Fi Wo sor ahengua do hwɛ m',
Ma W'adom dɛɛdɛw mapa n'
Ngow me dɛm ɔbotan yi;
Nyame, dan bo yi honam,
Hwɛ m' na bubu m'akoma.
Jesus a wɔ bɔɔ N' mbeamudua m' n'!   Amen.

MHB 348
2 . By Thy Spirit, Lord, reprove,
All my inmost sins reveal,
Sins against Thy light and love
Let me see, and let me feel;
Sins that crucified my God,
Spilt again Thy precious blood.
	 ~ 	2 
. Fa Wo Sunsum ka m'enyim
Ma mo bɔn nyina nda edzi,
Bɔn a otsia Wo kan na dɔ;
Dza ɔbɔɔ me Nyame mbeamudua m' n',
Ma munhu na mentse nka;
W'adehye bɔgya n' mpem bio.

MHB 348
3 . Jesu, seek Thy wandering sheep,
Make me restless to return;
Bid me look on Thee, and weep,
Bitterly as Peter mourn,
Till I say, by grace restored,
Now thou know’st I love Thee, Lord!
	 ~ 	3 
. Jesus, hwehwɛ W' nguan a wokyin,
Ma memper dɛ mebɛsan,
Ma monhwɛ Wo na munsu
Wenwennwen dɛ Peter ara,
Kɛpem dɛ W'adom bɛgye m',
Na inyim dɛ modɔ Wo!

MHB 348
4 . Might I in Thy sight appear,
As the publican distrest,
Stand, not daring to draw near,
Smite on my unworthy breast,
Groan the sinner’s only plea,
God, be merciful to me!
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma mumbopue W'enyim ara
Dɛ towgyenyi bɔbɔfo n',
Memmfata dɛ mebɛn Wo;
Bɔ m'akoko a ɔnnsɛ yi do,
Bɔnyɛnyi totɔserɛ dɛ;
Nyankopɔn, hu me mbɔbɔr!

MHB 348
5 . O remember me for good
Passing through the mortal vale; 
Show me the atoning blood,
When my strength and spirit fail;
Give my gasping soul to see
Jesus crucified for me !  Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. O kaa me korakora,
Ber a menam 'wu bɔnsa mu;
Ma munhu mpata bɔgya n';
Sɛ m'ahoɔdzen nyina sa a;
Ma me kra a ɔabɔm yi nhu

MHB 349
1 . JESUS, if still that same Thou art,
If all Thy promises are sure,
Set up Thy kingdom in my heart,
And make me rich, for I am poor,
To me be all Thy treasures given,
The kingdom of an inward heaven.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, sɛ etse dɛmara a,
Sɛ W'anohoba nyina tsim hɔ a,
Ma W'ahendzi mbra m'akoma m';
Yɛ m' 'dzefo na meyɛ hianyi;
Fa W'akoradze nyina ma me,
Minnya sor ahenman mo mu.
Ma w'enyi do na 'nnkosu bio!.

MHB 349
2 . Thou hast pronounced the mourners blest;
And lo, for Thee I ever mourn:
I cannot: No! I will not rest,
Till thou, my only rest, return;
Till Thou, the Prince of Peace, appear,
And I receive the Comforter.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ehyira hɔn a hɔn werɛ ahow;
Na hwɛ, daa meka Wo ho mmɔn;
Munnkotum ahom ara da
Kɛpem dɛ 'bɛma m' ahomgye;
Ɔwo a eyɛ asomdwee Hen n' bɛba
Na meenya Ɔwerɛkyekyefo n'.

MHB 349
3 . Where is the blessedness bestowed
On all that hunger after thee?
I hunger now, I thirst for God;
See the poor fainting sinner, see,
And satisfy with endless peace,
And fill me with Thy righteousness.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nhyira a wɔdze ma hɔn nyina a
Wɔdze kɔm hwehwɛ Wo n' wɔ hen?
Nyame ho kɔm na nsukɔm dze m';
Hwɛ dzebɔnyɛnyi a ɔahaw no,
Ma me asomdwee a ɔmmbɔ adze
Na fa Wo tsenenee hyɛ me ma.

MHB 349
4 . Ah, Lord ! If Thou art in that sigh,
Then hear Thyself within me pray;
Hear in my heart Thy Spirit’s cry,
Mark what my laboring soul would say;
Answer the deep unuttered groan,
And show that Thou and I are one.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ewuradze, sɛ etse me yaw a,
Mifi mo mu bɔ mpaa a tsie;
Tsie W' Sunsum Ne ntsea m' m'akoma m',
Hyɛ dza me kra reka no nsew;
Ma m'apensi no ho mbuae pa
Na kyerɛ dɛ Ɔwo na emi yɛ kor.

MHB 349
5 . Shine on Thy work, disperse the gloom,
Light in Thy light I then shall see;
Say to my soul: Thy light is come,
Glory divine is risen on thee,
Thy warfare’s past, thy mourning’s o’er;
Look up, for thou shalt weep no more !	 ~ 	5 
. Hyerɛn W'edwuma do na pam sum,
Hyerɛn Wo kan mu ama meehu;
Se me kra dɛ: Wo kan aba,
Nyame enyimnyan ahyerɛn wo do,
W'akodzi nye awerɛhow etwa m';

MHB 35
1 . FOR the beauty of the earth,
For the beauty of the skies,
For the love which from our birth
Over and around us lies,
Gracious God, to Thee we raise,
This our sacrifice ol praise.
	 ~ 	1 . ASAASE n'ahoɔfɛw ntsi,
Osian wimu ne fɛɛfɛw ntsi,
Ɔdɔ a ofi hɛn awoo m'
Ɔabɔ hɛn aprɔw ntsi:

Ɔdomfo Nyame, yɛdze
Hɛn ayɛyi afɔr yi brɛ Wo

MHB 35
2 . For the beauty of each hour
Of the day and of the night.
Hill and vale, and tree and flower,
Sun and moon, and stars of light:
	 ~ 	2 . Adzekyee na adzesaa mu
Dɔnhwer biara ahomka ntsi,
Kokwaa, bɔnsa, dua na nhyiren,
Ewia, bosoom, nworaba kan:

MHB 35
3 . For the joy of ear and eye,
For the heart and mind's delight
For the mystic harmony
Linking sense to sound and sight
	 ~ 	3 . Asowa na enyiwa ho dɛw,
Akoma na adwen mu dɛw 
Sunsum mu koryɛ a ɔka
Tsibowa na adzehu bɔ m' ntsi:

MHB 35
4 . For the joy of human love,
Brother, sister, parent, child,
Friends on earth and friends above,
For all gentle thoughts and mild:
	 ~ 	4 . Adasamba hɛn dɔ ntsi,
'Nua, 'kyerɛbaa, ɔwofo, ba,
Asaase, sor anyɛnkofo
Hɔn ho nkaakaa pa no ntsi:

MHB 35
5 . For each perfect gift of Thine
To our race so freely given,
Graces human and divine,
Flowers of earth and buds of heaven:
	 ~ 	5 . W'akyɛdze a odzi mu biara a 
Edze ama hɛn mbasantsen,
Honam na sunsum mu adom,
Asaase na sor nhyiren ntsi:

MHB 350
1 . WITH broken heart and contrite sigh,
A trembling sinner, Lord, I cry;
Thy pardoning grace is rich and free:
O God, be merciful to me!
	 ~ 	1 . Medze akomá a yaw ahyɛ n' má, 
Ewuradze na merefrɛ Wo;
W'adom ehumbɔbɔr ká pii;
Me Nyankopɔn, hu me mbɔbɔr.
Nyankopɔn na oehu m' mbɔbɔr.

MHB 350
2 . I smite upon my troubled breast
With deep and conscious guilt oppressed;
Christ and His cross my only plea:
O God, be merciful to me!
	 ~ 	2 
. Motwe me nsa hwe mo bo do, 
Afɔdzi á ɔyɛ dur ahyɛ m' do;
Christ na Ne mbeamudua nye mo sú;
Me Nyankopɔn, hu me mbɔbɔr.

MHB 350
3 . Far off I stand with tearful eyes,
Nor dare uplift them to the skies;
But Thou dost all my anguish see;
O God, be merciful to me!
	 ~ 	3 
. Migyina ekyir nyinsu egur m' 
Munntum mma m'enyi do wɔ sor;
Wo na ihu me yaw nyina;
Me Nyankopɔn, hu me mbɔbɔr.

MHB 350
4 . Nor alms nor deeds that I have done,
Can for a single sin atone:
To Calvary alone I flee;
O God, be merciful to me! 
	 ~ 	4  
. Nyɛ ayamuyie na ndzepa a mayɛ 
Na obotum etua bɔn kor kaw;
Calvary nkotoo na muguan kɔ
Me Nyankopɔn, hu me mbɔbɔr.

MHB 350
5 . And when, redeemed from sin and hell,
With all the ransomed throng I dwell,
My ruptured song shall ever be:
 God, has been merciful to me!	 ~ 	5 
. Wonya pon me bɔn nye hɛll m' a, 
Ma menya adehye dɔm n' kɛtsená a,
M'abɔdo ndwom daa bɛyɛ dɛ,

MHB 351
1 . HEAR Thy welcome voice
That calls me, Lord, to Thee, 
For cleansing in Thy precious blood 
That flowed on Calvary.

     I am coming, Lord, 
     Coming now to Thee: 
     Wash me, cleanse me, by the blood
     That flowed on Calvary.
	 ~ 	1 . METSE Wo ndze dɛɛdɛw n' 
Ewuradze, dɛ erefrɛ m'
Ma maatsew moho, wɔ bɔgyaa a
Ɔpem Calvary do n' mu.

    Ewuradze, maba! 
    Maba Wo hɔ ndɛ! 
    Guar m', tsew mo ho, wɔ bɔgyaa a 
    Ɔpem Calvary do n' mu. 
Nye Ndzeyɛtsenee!

MHB 351
2 . Though coming weak and vile,
Thou dost my strength assure;
Thou dost my vileness fully cleanse,
Till spotless all, and pure.
	 ~ 	2 
. Kaansa meba mberɛwm' a, 
Woara bɛhyɛ me dzen:
Ebɔhor mo ho bɔn nyina
Ma mo ho aatsew koraa.

MHB 351
3 . ’Tis Jesus calls me on
To perfect faith and love,
To perfect hope and peace and trust,
For earth and heaven above.
	 ~ 	3 
. Jesus, 'Wo na efrɛ m' 
Kɔ gyedzi na dɔ mu;
Ema m'enyidado asomdwee
Wɔ ha a wɔdze kɔ sor.

MHB 351
4 . ’Tis Jesus Who confirms
The blessed work within,
By adding grace to welcomed grace,
Where reigned the power of sin.
	 ~ 	4  
. M'akomam' siar dwuma n' 
'Wo na ehyɛ no ma;
Edze adom gu adom do
Ma ɔhyɛ bɔn tum do.

MHB 351
5 . All hail! atoning blood!
All hail! redeeming grace!
All hail! the gift of Christ our Lord,
Our Strength and Righteousness !	 ~ 	5 
. Wonhua Jesus bɔgyaa! 
Wonhua Jesus N'adom!
Wonhua Jesus, hɛn Ahoɔdzen

MHB 352
1 . OPPRESED with sin and woe,
A burdened heart I bear;
Opposed by many a mighty foe:
Yet  I will not despair.
	 ~ 	1 . BƆN na mbusu hyɛ m' do,
Ama m'akoma ayɛ dur,
Atamfo pii soɛr tsia me a,
Mennkɛpa abaw ara da.
Me Nyame bɛgye me.

MHB 352
2 . With this polluted heart,
I dare to come to Thee-
Holy and mighty as Thou art-
For Thou wilt pardon me.
	 ~ 	2 
. Murunntum mmfa akoma a 
Aprɔw mmba W'enyim koraa,
Ɔwo a eyɛ krɔnkrɔn, tumfo,
Edze bɛkyɛ m' ara.

MHB 352
3 . I feel that I am weak,
And prone to every sin;
But Thou who giv’st to those who seek,
Wilt give me strength within.
	 ~ 	3 
. Minyim dɛ meyɛ mberɛw,
Na meyɛ bɔn daa nyina,
Ɔwo ema hɔn a wɔhwehwɛ,
Ebɛma m' ahoɔdzen.

MHB 352
4 . I need not fear my foes;
I need not yield to care;
I need not sink beneath my woes,
For Thou wilt answer prayer.
	 ~ 	4 
. Munnkosuro m'atamfo;
Mirinngyaa mu mma ɔhaw, 
Mennkɛma awerɛhow ahyɛ mo do;
Ibetsie me mpaabɔ.

MHB 352
5 . In my Redeemer’s name,
I give myself to Thee;
And all unworthy as I am
My God will welcome me.	 ~ 	5 
. Mo Pomfo Ne dzin mu,
Medze moho ma Wo;
Sɛ memmfata dɛn ara mpo a,

MHB 353
1 . JUST as I am, without one plea
But that Thy blood was shed for me,
And that Thou bidd’st me come to Thee,
     O Lamb of God, I come!
	 ~ 	1 . Mbrɛ metse yi ara, minyi hwee ka 
Dɛ wɔkaa Wo bɔgyaa gui maa m',
Na efrɛ m' dɛ membra Wo nkyɛn,
Nyame Eguamba, maba!
Nyame Eguambaa, maba!

MHB 353
2 . Just as I am, and waiting not
To rid my soul of one dark blot,
To Thee whose blood can cleanse each spot,
     O Lamb of God, I come, I come!
	 ~ 	2 
. Mbrɛ metse yi ara, monnkɔtweɔn dɛ 
Mara meper tu me kra ho fi,
'Wo na Wo bɔgyaa tum tu fi,
Nyame Eguambaa, maba!

MHB 353
3 . Just as I am, though tossed about
With many a conflict, many a doubt,
Fighting and fears within, without,
O Lamb of God, I come!
	 ~ 	3  
. Mbrɛ metse yi ara, kansa aperper 
Ɔnye ekyingye piinara
Ko nye suro amen me mpo a
Nyame Eguambaa, maba!

MHB 353
4 . Just as I am, poor, wretched, blind; 
Sight, riches, healing of the mind,
Yea, all I need in Thee to find,
O Lamb of God, I come!
	 ~ 	4  
. Mbrɛ metse yi ara, hianyi, furafo; 
Enyiwa ɔnye ahonya,
Dza mihia nyina wɔ Wo mu,
Nyame Eguambaa, maba!

MHB 353
5 . Just as I am, Thou wilt receive,
Wilt welcome, pardon, cleanse, relieve;
Because Thy promise I believe,
O Lamb of God, I come!
	 ~ 	5  
. Mbrɛ metse yi ara, ebɛgye m', 'beyi m', 
Edze bɛkyɛ m', na atsew mo ho
Megye W'anasɛm dzi n-tsi
Nyame Eguambaa, maba!

MHB 353
6 . Just as I am-Thy love unknown 
Hath broken every barrier down-
Now, to be Thine, yea, Thine alone,
O Lamb of God, I come!
	 ~ 	6  
. Mbrɛ metse yi ara, Wo dɔ kɛse n' 
Ebubu mpampi nyina mu,
N-kyii m'bɛyɛ Wo nko Wodze,
Nyame Eguambaa, maba!

MHB 353
7 . Just as I am, of that free love
The breadth, length, depth, and height to prove,
Here for a season, then above,
O Lamb of God, I come!	 ~ 	7 
. Mbrɛ metse yi ara, adehye dɔ n' 
Ne trɛ, no war, no bun, no krɔn,
M'bɔsɔ wɔ ha na sor mahwɛ

MHB 354
1 . No, not despairingly
Come I to Thee;
No, not distrustingly 
Bend I the knee:
Sin hath gone over me, 
Yet is this still my plea:
Jesus hath died.
	 ~ 	1 . OHO, nnyɛ abagura mu
Na meba W' hɔ;
Oho, nnyɛ ekyingye mu
Na mubu ntwɛr;
Bɔn ebu mo do dze,
'So 'yi nye m' ntotɔserɛ;
Jesus ewu.
Hwee nnyi hɛn ntamu.

MHB 354
2 . Ah ! mine iniquity
Crimson hath been,
Infinite, infinite,
Sin upon sin:
Sin of not loving Thee, 
Sin of not trusting Thee,
Infinite sin.
	 ~ 	2 
. Aa! M'emumyɛ no
Ayɛ adaaben,
Onnyi mbanano so,
Bɔn ebu do;
Bɔn a ɔanndɔ Wo mpo,
Bɔn a ɔanntwer Wo na
Onnyi mbanano.

MHB 354
3 . Lord, I confess to Thee
Sadly my sin;
All I am tell with Thee, 
All I have been:
Purge Thou my sin away, 
Wash Thou my soul this day;
Lord, make me clean.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, yaw mu
Meka mo bɔn;
Meka mbrɛ metse kyerɛ W'
Mbrɛ m'tse biara;
Hor mo ho bɔn nyina,
Guar me kra ndɛ da yi,
Ma mo ho ntsew.

MHB 354
4 . Faithful and just art Thou,
Forgiving all;
Loving and kind art Thou 
When poor ones call:
Lord, let the cleansing blood, 
Blood of the Lamb of God,
Pass o’er my soul.
	 ~ 	4 
. Nokwafo, pɛrpɛr nye W',
'Dze kyɛ obiara;
Dɔfo yamuyiefo nye W';
'Frɛ abɔbɔfo;
Owura, ma Wo bɔgyaa n',
Nyame Eguambaa bɔgyaa n',
Ɔmpem me kra m'.

MHB 354
5 . Then all is peace and light
This soul within;
Thus shall I walk with Thee, 
The loved Unseen;
Leaning on Thee, my God, 
Guided along the road,
Nothing between.	 ~ 	5 
. Ɔkra a ɔda mo mu 'i wɔ 
'Somdwee na kan;
Na menye W' bɛnantsew,
Dɔfo a yennhu W';
Motwer Wo, me Nyame
Gye me fa kwan no do a

MHB 355
1 . WEARY of earth and laden with my sin,
I look at heaven and long to enter in;
But there no evil thing may find a home,
And yet I hear a voice that bids me Come!
	 ~ 	1 . MABERԐ asaase na bͻn adzesoa,
M'enyi tua sor, na mo kͻn dͻ, m‘bɛhɛn m’;
Hͻ adzebͻn biara nnkenya tsénabea,
Naaso metse ndze bi se me dɛ: Bra!
Akyɛ m’ dza  ͻso ’i, mo so m’ dͻ nyɛ kɛse.   Amen.

MHB 355
2 . So vile I am, how dare I hope to stand
In the pure glory of that holy land,
Before the whiteness of that throne appear?
Yet there are hands stretched out to draw me near.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ͻbͻn a ͻtse dɛ emi, m’besi dɛn enya
Enyidar egyina bea krͻnkrͻn  no do?
M’besi dɛn ekopué ahengua fufuw n‘ ho?
Naaso abasa pii atsen rotwe m' kͻ hͻ.

MHB 355
3 . The while I fain would tread the heavenly way,
Evil is ever with me day by day;
Yet on mine ears the gracious tidings fall:
Repent, believe, thou shalt be loosed from all! 
	 ~ 	3 
. Bér a meper dɛ mubodua sor kwan mu n’,
Bͻn ammpa mo ho adzekyee nyina,
Naaso adom nsɛm no gu m'asowa m’ daa:
Nu woho, gye dzi; wobeyi w’ efi m’.

MHB 355
4 . It is the voice of Jesus that I hear
His are the hands stretched out to draw me near,
And his the blood that can for all atone,
And set me faultless there before the throne.
	 ~ 	4 
. N-dzé a metse no yɛ Jesus Ne ndze;
Ne nsa na ͻtsérɛw mu dɛ ͻrotwe m’ no,
Na No bͻgyaa na ͻgyé obiara nkwa,
Na migyina ahengua n’ enyim a mo ho asan.

MHB 355
5 . ’Twas he who found me on the deathly wild,
And made me heir of heaven, the Father’s child,
And day by day, whereby my soul may live,
Gives me His grace of pardon, and will give.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ͻno no ohun me wͻ owu sardo n’,
Ni ͻyɛɛ m’ owuodzi wͻ sor Egya N’ Ba mu,
Na daa nyina beebi a me kra bɛtséna no,
Ͻma m’ N’adom fakɛe n’ na ͻdze ma m’ daa.

MHB 355
6 . O great Absolver, grant my soul may wear
The lowliest garb of penitence and prayer,
That in the Father’s courts my glorious dress
May be the garment of thy righteousness.
	 ~ 	6 
. O bͻnfakyɛ ’Damfo, ma me kra nhyɛ
Mbrɛhoadze, abotar na mpaabͻ atar,
Ama Egya N’abangua do n’, m’atar pa n’
Aayɛ Wo tséneneebea do hͻ atar.

MHB 355
7 . Yea, Thou wilt answer for me, righteous Lord:
Thine all the merits, mine the great reward;
Thine the sharp thorns, and mine the golden crown,
Mine the life won, and thine the life laid down.
	 ~ 	7 
. Nyew, ’Wo na ibeyi ano ama m’, tsénenee Wura:
Ndzépa nyina Wodzé a, medze yɛ akatua;
Wodze nsoɛ kyɛw a, medze sika' ahenkyɛw a;
Minya nkwa, Ͻwo dze Wo nkwa ato hͻ.

MHB 355
8 . Nought can I bring Thee, Lord, for all I owe,
Yet let my full heart what it can bestow;
Like Mary’s gift, let my devotion prove,
Forgiven greatly, how I greatly love.	 ~ 	8 
. Kaw a medze W’ yi murunntum nntua ho hwee;
Naaso ma dza ͻwͻ m’akoma m’ biara
Mary ’kyɛdze n', ma mo som nkyérɛ;

MHB 356
1 . GREAT God of wonders! all Thy ways 
Display the attributes divine;
But countless acts of pardoning grace
Beyond Thine other wonders shine:
     Who is a pardoning God like thee?
     Or who has grace so rich and free?
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME nwanwanyi! W'akwan nyina
Da Wo ho abɔdzin n' edzi;
Fakyɛ adom a onnyi kabea
Bor W'anwanwadze nyina do:
        Fakyɛ Nyame bɛn tse dɛ Ɔwo?
        Anaa woana wɔ adom yi bi?
Dɛ sor adwontow kuw n' ara!

MHB 356
2 . In wonder lost, with trembling joy
We take the pardon of our God;
Pardon for crimes of deepest dye,
 Pardon-from an offended God ! 
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔyɛ nwanwa; yɛdze enyigye
Nya hɛn Nyame hɔ bɔnfakyɛ;
Hɛn adaaben bɔn ho fakyɛ,
Fakyɛ a Jesu bɔgyaa tɔe a!

MHB 356
3 . Pardon-from sin of deepest dye !
Pardon-bestowed through Jesu’s blood !
Pardon-that brings the rebel nigh!
	 ~ 	3 
. Fakyɛ a ofir Nayme a yɛafom N',
Hɛn bɔn kebii no ho fakyɛ a,
Dza Jesu bɔgyaa ntsi yenya a!
Fakyɛ a ɔdze etuatsewfo ba a!

MHB 356
4 . O may this strange, this matchless grace,
This God-like miracle of love,
Fill the wide earth with grateful praise,
As now it fills the choirs above !	 ~ 	4 
. Nkyɛ adom a wɔto n' abaw a onnhyia 'i,
O dɛm Nyame anwanwa dɔ yi,
Dze ayɛyi aahyɛ wiadze ma,

MHB 357
1 . JESUS, in whom the weary find 
Their late, but permanent repose,
Physician of the sin-sick mind,
Relieve my wants, assuage my woes;
And let my soul on Thee be cast, 
Till life’s fierce tyranny be past.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS a abrɛfo nya hɔn
Ahomgye a odzi ewei Wo mu,
Adwembɔnfo hɔn duyɛfo,
Bɔhwɛ me hia nye me yaw nyina;
Na ma me kra mbɛda Wo do,
Kodu dɛ atsetsee botwa m'.
Ma mentsena Wo dɔ mu daa.

MHB 357
2 . Loosed from my God, and far removed,
Long have I wandered to and fro,
O’er earth in endless circles roved, 
Nor found whereon to rest below:
Back to my God at last I fly,
For O, the waters still are high!
	 ~ 	2 
. M'abɔ ko efi Nyame nkyɛn,
Midzi ɔbra mu akɔnaaba,
M'ekyima mbea nyinara do,
Naaso mennya etsidaa koraa;
Metu faa aba me Nyame nkyɛn,
O nsu no da ho eyir tɛntɛnn.

MHB 357
3 . Selfish pursuits, and nature’s maze,
The things of earth, for Thee I leave;
Put forth Thy hand, thy hand of grace,
Into the ark of love receive,
Take this poor fluttering soul to rest,
And lodge it, Saviour, in Thy breast
	 ~ 	3 
. Mibegyaa pɛsɛakonya mu,
Na maaba Wo hɔ nye me pɛ;
Tsen W'adom nsa fa suo mo mu,
Kɔ ɔdɔ apam-daka n' mu,
Agyenkwa, gye ɔkra brɛfo yi,
Na ma ɔnhom wɔ Wo bo mu.

MHB 357
4 . Fill with inviolable peace,
Stablish and keep my settled heart;
In Thee may all my wanderings cease,
From Thee no more may I depart;
Thy utmost goodness called to prove,
Loved with an everlasting love.	 ~ 	4 
. Fa asomdwee a ɔnnsesa da
Hyɛ m'akoma mu ma ɔnhom;
Ma m'ekyimakyima nyina ntwa,
Na mma ommfi Wo nkyɛn ara bio;
Na ma monsɔ W'ayamuyie nhwɛ,

MHB 358
1 . DEPTH of mercy! can there be
Mercy still reserved for me?
Can my God His wrath forbear?
Me, the chief of sinners, spare?
	 ~ 	1 . MBƆBƆRHU bun donkonn no,
Mbɔbɔrhu wɔ hɔ ma me?
Me Nyame No bo adwe
'Mi ndzebɔnyɛfo hen ho?
Hwɛ na bubu m'akoma.

MHB 358
2 . I have long withstood His grace,
Long provoked Him to His face,
Would not hearken to His calls,
Grieved Him by a thousand falls.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mesiw N'adom kwan akyɛr,
Meyi N'ebufuw akyɛr,
Ne frɛ n' mammfa annyɛ asɛm;
M'asehwe ahaw No akyɛr.

MHB 358
3 . Whence to me this waste of love?
Ask my Advocate above!
See the cause in Jesu’s face,
Now before the throne of grace.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔsɛɛ dɛm dɔ 'i mo ho dɛn?
Bisa sor Kasamaafo n',
Hwɛ siantsir nyina wɔ N'enyim,
Wɔ adom ahengua enyim.

MHB 358
4 . There for me the Saviour  stands;
Shows His wounds and spreads His hands.
God is love; I know, I feel;
Jesus lives, and loves me still.
	 ~ 	4 
. Agyenkwa n' gyina hɔ ma m';
N'etua ɔkyerɔ tserɔw Ne nsamu,
Minyim dɔ Nyame nye ɔdɔ;
Jesus tse ase da ho dɔ m'.

MHB 358
5 . Jesus, answer from above:
s not all Thy nature love?
Wilt Thou not the wrong forget,
Suffer me to kiss Thy feet?
	 ~ 	5 
. Jesus fi sor noho bua;
Na nnyɛ ɔdɔ nye Wo wu nyina?
Ana Wo werɛ mmfir ndzebɔn?
'Pen dɛ mefew W'anan ho?

MHB 358
6 . Pity from Thine eye let fall,
By a look my soul recall;
Now the stone to flesh convert,
Cast a look, and break my heart.	 ~ 	6 
. Meserɛ dɛ hu me mbɔbɔr;
Hwɛ me kra na frɛ no bra;
Ma ɔbo no ndan honam,

MHB 359
1 . Out of the depths I cry to thee,
Lord God! O hear my prayer!
Incline a gracious ear to me,
And bid me not despair:
If thou rememberest each misdeed,
If each should have its rightful need,
Lord, who shall stand before thee?
	 ~ 	1 . MIFI bun no mu su frɛ Wo,
Ewuradze, tsie me mpaa!
Adom ntsi yɛ aso tsie me,
Mma minnya abagura;
Sɛ itsin emumuyɛ do a,
Na obiara nya n'akatua a,
Woana begyina W'enyim?
Efi hɔn bɔn nye awerɛhow m',

MHB 359
2 . ’Tis through thy love alone we gain
The pardon of our sin;
The strictest life is but in vain,
Our works can nothing win;
That none should boast himself of aught,
But own in fear thy grace hath wrought
What in him seemeth righteous.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wo dɔ nkotoo mu na yenya
Hɛn bɔn ho mpatadze;
Ɔbra pa biara mpo yɛ gyan,
Hɛn ndwuma nyina nnsɛ hwee;
Na obiara eenntuw noho,
Na ɔdze suro aagye W'adom,
Eehu dɛ tsenenee fir Wo.

MHB 359
3 . Wherefore my hope is in the Lord,
My works I count but dust;
I build not there, but on his word,
And in his goodness trust.
Up to his care myself I yield,
He is my tower, my rock, my shield,
And for His help I tarry.
	 ~ 	3 
. M'enyidar wɔ Ewuradze mu,
Mubu m'edwuma huntuma,
N'asɛm nko ara na motow do,
Na motwer N'ayamuyie,
Na medze moho hyɛ Ne nsamu,
Ɔyɛ m'aban, botan nye kyɛm,
Na No mboa na motweɔn daa.

MHB 359
4 . And though it linger till the night,
And round again till morn,
My heart shall ne’er mistrust Thy might,
Nor count itself forlorn.
Do thus, O ye of Israel’s seed,
Ye of the Spirit born indeed,
Wait for your God’s appearing.
	 ~ 	4 
. Na sɛ ɔkyɛr ma adze sa,
Ma adze kye bio so a,
M'akoma renngye Wo tum kyim
Na onnya abagura,
Israel mba, iyi na hom nyɛ,
Hom a Sunsum no awo hom,
Hom ntweɔn hom Nyame Ne mbae.

MHB 359
5 . Though great our sins and sore our wounds, 
And deep and dark our fall,
His helping mercy hath no bounds,
His love surpasseth all:
Our trusty loving Shepherd, he
Who shall at last set Israel free
From all their sin and sorrow.	 ~ 	5 
. Hɛn bɔn so, yeepira dodow,
Na yɛahwe ase sum mu;
No mbɔbɔrhu mboa nnyi ekyir,
No dɔ so kyɛn ne nyina,
Hɛn Guanhwɛfo pa a yɛtwer No,
Ɔno a ekyir 'i ɔbɔpon Israel

MHB 36
1 . HOLY, holy, holy, Lord God Almighty!
Early in the morning our song shall rise to thee;
Holy, holy, holy merciful and mighty,
God in three Persons, blessed Trinity!
	 ~ 	1 . Krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, Otumfo Nyankopɔn! 
Hɛn ndwom bɔfow edu Wo nkyɛn anapahema;
Krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, mbɔbɔrhufo, tumfo,
Nyame Baasa Kor, Ɔkorsa siarfo!

MHB 36
2 . Holy, holy, holy; all the saints adore Thee,
Casting down their golden crowns around the glassy sea:
Cherubim and seraphim falling down before Thee.
Who wert, and art, and evermore shalt be.
	 ~ 	2 . Krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, ahotsewfo sɔr Wo, 
Wɔtow hɔn sika nhenkyɛw gu ahwehwɛ po n' ho;
Cherubim nye Seraphim twa hwe W' enyim ara,
'Wo a obi annyɛ Wo, na itsim hɔ daa.

MHB 36
3 . Holy, holy, holy; though the darkness hide Thee,
Though the eye of sinful man Thy glory may not see,
Only Thou art holy: there is none beside thee.
Perfect in power, in love, and purity!
	 ~ 	3 . Krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn; sɛ sum dze  Wo suma, 
Na dasanyi a omuo hu W' enyim a ɔnnyɛ mpo a
Wo nko na yɛ krɔnkrɔn, obi nnka Wo ho bio,
Wo tum, Wo dɔ, Wo krɔnkrɔnyɛ dzi mu!

MHB 36
4 . Holy, holy, holy, Lord God Almighty!
All thy works shall praise Thy name in earth and sky and sea;
Holy, holy, holy, merciful and mighty,
God in three Persons, blessed Trinity!	Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, Otumfo Nyankopɔn! 
W' edwinsa beyi Wo dzin ayɛw wɔ mbea nyina;
Krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, mbɔbɔrhufo, tumfo,
Nyame Baasa Kor, Ɔkorsa siarfo!   Amen.

MHB 360
1 . Happy the man that finds the grace,
The blessing of God’s chosen race,
The wisdom coming from above,
The faith that sweetly works by love.
	 ~ 	1 . SIARFO nye nyia oenya adom, 
Oenya Nyame nkorɔfo nhyira,
Na nyansa a ofi sor ba,
Na gyedzi a ɔyɛ dɔ edwuma.
Nyansa, Christ na Sor yɛ adze kor.

MHB 360
2 . Happy beyond description he
Who knows ’The Saviour died for me!
The gift unspeakable obtains,
And heavenly understanding gains.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyia onyim dɛ Agyenkwa n' wui ma no n'
Wɔ enyigye a onnyi kabea;
Onya akyɛdze a wonntum nnka,
Onya ɔsor ntseasee no so.

MHB 360
3 . Wisdom divine ! Who tells the price
Of wisdom’s costly merchandise?
Wisdom to silver we prefer,
And gold is dross compared to her.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔsor nyansa! Woana botum
Akyerɛ mbrɛ osi som bo?
Yɛpɛ nyansa kyɛn dwetɛ koraa;
Sika mapa nnye no nnsɛ koraa.

MHB 360
4 . Her hands are filled with length of days,
True riches, and immortal praise,
Riches of Christ, on all bestowed,
And honour that descends from God.
	 ~ 	4 
. Nkwa tsenenee ahyɛ Ne nsamu ma,
Ahonya pa a wɔkamfo daa;
Christ mu ahonya a ɔdze ma hɛn,
Na enyimnyam a ofir Nyame.

MHB 360
5 . To purest joys she all invites,
Chaste, holy, spiritual delights;
Her ways are ways of pleasantness,
And all her flowery paths are peace.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ɔfrɛ hɛn nyina kɔ dɛw mapa m',
Ahosan, krɔnkrɔn, sunsum m' dɛw;
N'akwan nyina yɛ enyigye akwan,
N'atsempɔn fɛɛfɛw yɛ asomdwee.

MHB 360
6 . Happy the man who wisdom gains,
Thrice happy who his guest retains;
He owns, and shall for ever own:
Wisdom, and Christ, and Heaven are one.	 ~ 	6 
. Siarfo nye nyia ohu nyansa,
Nyia ɔdze n' sie n' nya siar mbordo;
Odzi wɔ N', ɔbɛyɛ N'dze daa;

MHB 361
1 . WHERE shall my wondering soul begin?
How shall I all to heaven aspire?
A slave redeemed from death and sin,
A brand plucked from eternal fire,
How shall I equal triumphs raise,
Or sing my great Deliverer’s praise?
	 ~ 	1 . Hen na me kra a nwanwa aka n' 
Ɔnhyɛ ase nhwɛ sor adze nko?
Onya a mefi wu na bɔn nsa,
Gyantsia a woeyi m' daa daa gya mu,
Minsi dɛn ntonton mbrɛ ɔsɛ,
Minyi Gyefo kɛse n' ayɛw?
Hom mbra, mo nuanom, hommbra fie!

MHB 361
2 . O how shall I the goodness tell,
Father, which Thou to me hast showed?
 That I, a child of wrath and hell,
I should be called a child of God,
Should know, should feel my sins forgiven,
Blest with this antepast of heaven!
	 ~ 	2  
. M'Egya, ao, minsi dɛn menka 
Yie a edze ayɛ me yi?
Dɛ hɛll na ebufuw nyimpa
Wɔafrɛ mo so Nyame ba bi;
M'bohu, m'bɛtse mo bɔnfakyɛ,
Ha ara m'benya sor enyigye!

MHB 361
3 . And shall I slight my Father’s love?
Or basely fear His gifts to own?
Unmindful of His favours prove?
Shall I, the hallowed cross to shun,
Refuse His righteousness to impart
By hiding it within my heart?
	 ~ 	3 
. Aso m'bɔpow m'Egya no dɔ? 
Munnkobu N'akyɛdze no bi?
Aso m'beyi N'adom emuo?
Mbeamudua krɔnkrɔn n' no pow ntsi,
Aso ne tseneneesɛm no
M'bɛkam do wɔ m'akoma mu?

MHB 361
4 . Outcasts of men, to you I call,
Harlots, and publicans, and thieves!
He spreads His arms to embrace you all;
Sinners alone his grace receives;
No need of Him the righteous have;
He came the lost to seek and save.
	 ~ 	4 
. Wiadze ntɔmpam', awartofo, 
Epoobɔfo, nwifo,hom ntsie!
Ɔrotweɔn ayɛ hom etuu;
Abɔn na N'adom gye hɔn sie;
Apaafo nnyi No ho hia;
Ɔbae bɛgyee dza 'ayew n' ara.

MHB 361
5 . Come, O my guilty brethren, come,
Groaning beneath your load of sin!
His bleeding heart shall make you room,
His open side shall take you in;
He calls you now, invites you home:
Come, O my guilty brethren, come!	 ~ 	5  
. Hom mbra, mo nuan'm afɔdzefo a 
Bɔn adzesoa retseetsee hom!
Kwan wɔ ne pirakur nom' ha,
Jesus ne mfem' tokura nom'
Ɔfrɛ hom ndɛ, afɔdzifo e!

MHB 362
1 . AUTHOR of faith, eternal Word,
Whose Spirit breathes the active flame;
Faith, like its finisher and Lord,
To-day as yesterday the same:
	 ~ 	1 . GYEDI Farbaa, bɛkyebo Asɛm,
