No Sunsum hom ogyaframee;
Gyedzi a ɔtse dɛ no Wura,
Ɔtse dɛm ndeda, ndɛ na daa.
Ma dasanyi hu Nyankopɔn.

MHB 362
2 . To Thee our humble hearts aspire,
And ask the gift unspeakable;
Increase in us the kindled fire,
In us the work of faith fulfil.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn akoma brɛfo hwehwɛ Wo,
Ɔserɛ akyɛdze a onnyi kabea;
Ma Wo gya no ndzɛw wɔ hɛn mu,
Na wie gyedzi edwuma n' wɔ hɛn mu.

MHB 362
3 . By faith we know Thee strong to save;
Save us, a present Saviour Thou!
Whate’er we hope, by faith we have,
Future and past subsisting now.
	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛgye W' dzi dɛ itum gye nkwa,
'Wo nye sesei Gyefo; gye hɛn!
Gyedzi ma yenya dza yɛpɛ,
Ndɛ dze, dza etwa m' na dza ɔbɛba.

MHB 362
4 . To him that in Thy name believes
Eternal life with Thee is given;
Into himself he all receives,
Pardon, and holiness, and heaven.
	 ~ 	4 
. Obiara a ɔgye Wo dzin dzi n',
Onya Wo hɔ onnyiewei nkwa;
Na onya akyɛdze nyina ma noho
Fakyɛ, krɔnkrɔnyɛ nye heaven.

MHB 362
5 . The things unknown to feeble sense,
Unseen by reason’s glimmering ray,
With strong, commanding evidence
Their heavenly origin display.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ndzɛmba a adwen nntum nnhu nyina,
Na onntum so nntse ase koraa n',
Dasegye dzendzen a odzi mu
Kyerɛ dɛ hɔn ntuadze fi sorsor.

MHB 362
6 . Faith lends its realising light,
The clouds disperse, the shadows fly;
The Invisible appears in sight,
And God is seen by mortal eye.	 ~ 	6 
. Gyedzi tow ne ntseasee nserɛmɛn,
Mununkum hotse, sum guan fi hɔ;
Na Nyia ohunta no da edzi

MHB 363
1 . SPIRIT of faith, come down,
Reveal the things of God;
And make to us the Godhead known,
And witness with the blood.
’Tis  thine the blood to apply,
And give us eyes to see
Who did for every sinner die
Hath surely died for me.
	 ~ 	1 . GYEDI Sunsum, sian bra,
Yi Nyame kyerɛ hɛn;
Na ma yenhu Nyametsir no,
Mfa bɔgya n' ndzi dase,
Fa bɔgya no sera hɛn,
Ma hɛn enyiwa nhu dɛ 
Nyia owui maa abɔnfo no,
Oewu ama m' ampaara.
Na ɔma wodzi mu ɔdɔ m'.   Amen.

MHB 363
2 . No man can truly say
That Jesus is the Lord,
Unless Thou take the veil away,
And breathe the living word;
Then, only then, we feel
Our interest in His blood,
And cry, with joy unspeakable:
Thou art my Lord, my God!
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyimpa biara nntum nnkyerɛ 
Dɛ Jesus nye Ewuradze,
Gyedɛ enyido abon n' efi hɔ,
Hom asɛm tseasefo n' do;
Ɔno yebohu dɛ
Bɔgya n' yɛ hɛn akyɛdze,
Na yɛdze dɛw aka mu dɛ
Ɔwo nye m' Wura, Nyame!

MHB 363
3 . O that the world might know
The all-atoning Lamb!
Spirit of faith, descend, and show
The virtue of His name;
The grace which all may find,
The saving power impart;
 And testify to all mankind,
And speak in every heart.
	 ~ 	3 
. O nkyɛ wiadze eehu
Mpata Eguambaa no !
Gyedzi Sunsum, sian famu beyi
Ne dzin mu tum n' kyerɛ;
Adom a nyimpa bohu,
Nkwangye tum a wɔdze ma;
Kasa kyerɛ adasa nyina,
Kasa akoma biara mu.

MHB 363
4 . Inspire the living faith,
Which whosoe’er receives,
The witness in himself he hath,
And consciously believes;
The faith that conquers all,
And doth the mountain move,
And saves whoe’er on Jesus call,
And perfects them in love.    Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Nyan gyedzi tseasefo n'
Ma obiara a ne nsa ka n';
Nyan dasedzi wɔ no mu daa,
Na ɔgye dzi ampa;
Gyedzi a odzi konyim,
Na otutu nkokwaa no,
Ɔgye obiara a ɔfrɛ Jesus nkwa,

MHB 364
1 . AH ! whither should I go,
Burdened, and sick, and faint?
To whom should I my troubles show,
And pour out my complaint?
	 ~ 	1 . AO! Henfa na monkɔ?
M'adzesoa, yar na ɔberɛ;
Woana na menka m'asɛm nkyerɛ n',
Mfa ayawdzi nto n'enyim?
O ma ɔnyɛ hɔ mma m'!   Amen.

MHB 364
2 . My Saviour bids me come;
Ah! why do I delay?
He calls the weary sinner home,
And yet from Him I stay!
	 ~ 	2 
. M'Agyenkwa pa frɛ me;
Ebɛn ntsi na mekyɛr?
Ɔfrɛ ndzebɔnyɛfo kɔ fie,
Naaso motwetwe m' ho.

MHB 364
3 . What is it keeps me back,
From which I cannot part,
Which will not let my Saviour take,
Possession of my heart?
	 ~ 	3 
. 'Bɛn ayɛ m' akwambew a
Munntum mmfi ho koraa yi?
Ebɛn na ɔmma m'Agyenkwa mmfa
M'akoma nntsena mu?

MHB 364
4 . Some cursed thing unknown
Must surely lurk within,
Some idol, which I will not own,
Some secret bosom-sin.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ndom bi a minnyim na
Ɔwɔ m' mu rehaw me,
Ohonyi a munntum nntow nnkyen,
Ayɛ bɔn bɔ mo bo.

MHB 364
5 . Jesus, the hindrance show,
Which I have feared to see;
Yet let me now consent to know
What keeps me out of Thee:
	 ~ 	5 
. Jesus, yi akwambew a 
Musuro dɛ mohwɛ n' kyerɛ m';
Mepɛ dɛ muhu dza osiw
Me Wo nkyɛn kwan no ndɛ.

MHB 364
6 . Searcher of hearts, in mine
Thy trying power display;
Into its darkest corners shine,
And take the veil away.
	 ~ 	6 
. Akoma m' hwehwɛfo,
Hwehwɛ m'akoma mu;
Hyerɛn no dodoo mu nyina,
Na yi ntentan n' fi hɔ.

MHB 364
7 . I now believe in Thee
Compassion reigns alone;
According to my faith to me
O let it, Lord, be done !  Amen.	 ~ 	7 
. Afei megye Wo dzi,
Eyɛ mbɔbɔrhufo;
Ewuradze, hwɛ me gyedzi,

MHB 365
1 . GOD of my salvation, hear,
And help me to believe;
Simply do I now draw near,
Thy blessing to receive:
Full of sin, alas ! I am,
But to Thy wounds for refuge flee:

 Friend of sinners, spotless Lamb,
 Thy blood was shed for me.
	 ~ 	1 . MO nkwagye Nyame, tsie me,
Boa me ma mengye ndzi;
Merba Wo nkyɛn ara
Maabɛgye Wo nhyira;
Bɔn ahyɛ me ma dodow,
W'epirakur nye mo guandɔbea,
      Eguambaa, abɔn Damfo,
      Wɔkaa W' bɔgyaa gui maa m'.
Dɛ m'benya tsenabew wɔ sor.

MHB 365
2 . Standing now as newly slain,
To Thee I lift mine eye;
Balm of all my grief and pain,
Thy grace is always nigh:
Now as yesterday the same
Thou art, and wilt for ever be:
	 ~ 	2 
. Migyina ha dɛ woepira m',
Mema m'enyi do hwɛ W';
M'awerɛhow, me yaw seradze,
W'adom bɛn me daa nyina;
Dɛ mbrɛ etse ndeda no,
Etse dɛmara daapem nyina.

MHB 365
3 . Nothing have I, Lord, to pay,
Nor can Thy grace procure;
Empty send me not away,
For I, Thou know’st, am poor:
Dust and ashes is my name,
My all is sin and misery:
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, menndze hwee a
Medze bɔtɔ W'adom;
Meyɛ hianyi dze naaso,
Mma memmfa nsapan nnkɔ;
Meyɛ huntuma nye nso,
Me ndzeyɛɛ nyina yɛ bɔn nko.

MHB 365
4 . No good word, or work, or thought
Bring I to gain Thy grace;
Pardon I accept unbought,
Thine offer I embrace,
Coming, as at first I came,
To take, and not bestow on Thee:
	 ~ 	4 
. Nnyɛ asɛmpa anaa adwen pa
Na medze aba ha;
Fakyɛ a munntum nntɔ a,
W'akyɛdze na megye,
Maba dɛ nkan n' misii bae n',
Mebɛgye, nnyɛ dɛ mebɛma W'.

MHB 365
5 . Saviour, from Thy wounded side
I never will depart;
Here will I my spirit hide
When I am pure in heart:
Till my place above I claim,
This only shall be all my plea :	 ~ 	5 
. Agyenkwa, mirimmfi W' mfem'
Pirakur nkyɛn nnkɔ da;
Ha na medze m' sunsum sie,
Ber a m'akoma m' tsew yi,
Iyi nye m'aserɛdze

MHB 366
1 . JESUS ! Redeemer, Saviour, Lord,
The weary sinner’s friend,
Come to my help, pronounce the word,
And bid my troubles end.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, Agyenkwa, Owura,
Abɔn 'brɛfo Nyɛnko,
Bra bɔboa me, ka asɛm no,
Na m'awerɛhow mbɔ adze.
Ɔatsetsew ne nyina mu.

MHB 366
2 . Deliverance to my soul proclaim,
And life, and liberty;
Shed forth the virtue of thy name,
And Jesus prove to me!
	 ~ 	2 
. Paa mu ka nkwagyesɛm, nkwa na
Fahodzi kyerɛ me kra;
Jesus, da ndzepa a ɔwɔ Wo dzin
Mu no edzi kyerɛ m'.

MHB 366
3 . Faith to be healed thou know’st I have,
For thou that faith hast given;
Thou canst, Thou wilt the sinner save,
And make me meet for heaven.
	 ~ 	3 
. 'Nyim, mowɔ gyedzi a ɔsa yar,
Ɔwo na edze ama m';
Ewɔ tum dɛ egye abɔn nkwa,
Na ama maasɛ sor.

MHB 366
4 . Thou canst o’ercome this heart of mine,
Thou wilt victorious prove,
For everlasting strength is thine,
And everlasting love.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ewɔ tum wɔ m'akoma do koraa,
Wo konyimdzi da edzi,
Na daa nkwa m' ahoɔdzen mapa
Yɛ Wodze daa nyina.

MHB 366
5 . Thy powerful Spirit shall subdue
Unconquerable sin,
Cleanse this foul heart, and make it new,
And write Thy law within.
	 ~ 	5 
. Wo Sunsum a tum wɔ mu no
Dzi akomadzen biara do;
Tsew akoma daadaafo n' ho,
Na kyerɛw Wo mbra n' wɔ mu.

MHB 366
6 . Bound down with twice ten thousand ties,
Yet let me hear Thy call,
My soul in confidence shall rise,
Shall rise and break through all.	 ~ 	6 
. Sɛ ɔbra homa kyekyer me mpo a,
Ɔwo ma mentse W' ndze;
Me kra dze akokodur bɔsoɛr

MHB 367
1 . DAY after day I sought the Lord,
And waited patiently;
Until He bent down from His throne,
And hearkened to my cry.
	 ~ 	1 . MOHWEHWƐƐ Ewuradze dabiara,
Misiee abotar tweɔɔn No;
Kesi dɛ ɔbɔɔ No mu adze
Na otsiee mo sufrɛ.
Nye dɔ dwen nyimpa ho.

MHB 367
2 . He drew me from the fearful pit,
And from the miry clay;
He placed my feet upon a rock,
And led me in His way.
	 ~ 	2 
. Oyii m' fii amona donkonn mu,
Fii atɛkyɛ so mu;
Dze me nan sii ɔbotan do,
Na ogyaa me No kwan do.

MHB 367
3 . He taught my soul a new-made song,
A song of holy praise,
All they who see these things, with fear
Their hopes to God shall raise.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔkyerɛɛ me kra ndwom fofor,
Ayɛyi ndwom krɔnkrɔn;
Hɔn a wohu ndzɛmba yi nyina
Dze suro bɔtwer Nyame.

MHB 367
4 . Most blessed is the man whose hope
Upon the Lord relies;
Who follows not the proud, nor those
That turn aside to lies.
	 ~ 	4 
. N-hyira aka nyia ɔwɔ 
Enyidar wɔ Ewuradze m',
Na onndzi ntsɛntsɛnfo ekyir,
Na ɔmman nnkedzi ator.

MHB 367
5 . O Lord, what wonders hast thou wrought,
All number far above:
Thy thoughts to us-ward overflow
With mercy, grace, and love.	 ~ 	5 
. Ewuradze anwanwadze bɛn a!
Wonntum nnkan, nntum nnsusu;
Edze mbɔbɔrhu nye adom,

MHB 368
1 . ARISE, my soul, arise,
Shake off thy guilty fears;
The bleeding sacrifice
In my behalf appears;
Before the throne my Surety stands;
My name is written on His hands.
	 ~ 	1 . SOƐR, me kra, soɛr gyina,
Tow w'afɔdzi suro gu;
Na emi ntsi na okyii
No bɔgyaa dze bɔɔ afɔr;
'Dzimafo gyina 'hengua n'enyim, 
Ɔakyerɛw me dzin wɔ Ne nsa ho.
Metsea m', Egya, Abba, Egya!

MHB 368
2 . He ever lives above,
For me to intercede,
 His all redeeming love,
His precious blood, to plead;
His blood atoned for all our race,
And sprinkles now the throne of grace.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔtse ase wɔ sor hɔ,
Odzi ma me wɔ hɔ;
Ɔdze No nkwagye dɔ
Nye No bɔgyaa serɛ;
Bɔgya a ɔpon adasa nyina n'
Petse adom ahengua n' ho.

MHB 368
3 . Five bleeding wounds He bears,
Received on Calvary;
They pour effectual prayers,
They strongly speak for me:
Forgive him, O forgive! they cry?
“Nor let that ransomed sinner die!“
	 ~ 	3 
. Epirakur enum
Na onyaa wɔ Calvary;
Wɔbɔ mpaa dzendzenndzen
Dze serɛ fakyɛ ma me,
Wɔtsea m' dɛ, Fa kyɛ n', o fa kyɛ n'!
Mma ɔbɔn a wɔapon no yi nnwu.

MHB 368
4 . The Father hears him pray,
His dear Anointed One;
He cannot turn away
The presence of His Son:
His Spirit answers to the blood,
And tells me I am born of God.
	 ~ 	4 
. Egya n' tsie Ne Ba a
Ɔasera No ngo N' mpaabɔ;
N'abadaa burbur No,
Onntum mmfi Ne Ba n' nkyɛn;
No Sunsum ma bɔgya no mbuae,
Dɛ Nyame awo me ɔba.

MHB 368
5 . My God is reconciled,
His pardoning voice I hear,
He owns me for His child,
I can no longer fear,
With confidence I now draw nigh,
And, Father, Abba, Father, cry!	 ~ 	5 
. Menye Nyame abɔ m',
Metse Ne fakyɛ ndze n';
Ɔdze m' ayɛ Ne ba,
Dɛm ntsi munnsuro hwee;
Medze awerɛhyɛm' pinkyɛn;

MHB 369
1 . THEE, Jesu, Thee, the sinner’s friend,
I follow on to apprehend,
Renew the glorious strife;
Divinely confident and bold,
With faith’s strong arm on Thee lay hold,
Thee my eternal life.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, ndzebɔnyɛfo Adamfo,
Midzi W'ekyir a, mutu ehu;
Kenyan enyimnyam ko n';
Menya sor awerɛhyɛmu,
Medze gyedzi krɔnkrɔn suo mu;
Ɔwo nye me daa nkwa.
Bra bɛfa me kɔ ntsɛm.  Amen.

MHB 369
2 . Prisoner of hope, to Thee I turn,
And, calmly confident, I mourn,
And pray, and weep for Thee;
Tell me Thy love, thy secret tell,
Thy mystic name in me reveal,
Reveal Thyself in me.
	 ~ 	2 
. Enyidar Daduanyi, suo m' mu;
Medze me yaw nyina ba Wo nkyɛn,
Dze mpaabɔ su frɛ Wo,
Ka Wo dɔ nsumaa m' nsɛm kyerɛ m',
Ma wonhu Wo dzin wɔ mo mu,
Da w' ho edzi wɔ me mu.

MHB 369
3 . Descend, pass by me, and proclaim,
O Lord of hosts, Thy glorious name-
The Lord, the gracious Lord,
Long-suffering, merciful, and kind;
The God who always bears in mind
 His everlasting word.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sian, pa mo ho na paa mu ka,
Ewuradze, bɔ W'enyimnyam dzin n',
Domfo Ewuradze,
Wo penkyɛr, tsema na ayamuyie;
Nyame a daa nyina ɔkaa N'asɛm,
N'asɛm a onntwa mu da.

MHB 369
4 . Plenteous he is in truth and grace;
He wills that all the fallen race
Should turn, repent, and live;
His pardoning grace for all is free;
Transgression, sin, iniquity,
He freely doth forgive.
	 ~ 	4 
. N'adom nye nokwardzi dɔɔ so,
Ɔpɛ dɛ adasa asehwefo
Bɛsakyer enya nkwa;
Ne fakyɛ nye adom, ɔdze kyɛ;
Hɛn mfom na emumuyɛ nyina
Nyame dze kyɛ hɛn kwa.

MHB 369
5 . Mercy He doth for thousands keep;
He goes and seeks the one lost sheep,
And brings His wanderer home;
And every soul that sheep might be:
Come then, my Lord, and gather me,
My Jesus, quickly come!	 ~ 	5 
. Ohu mpempem mbɔbɔr daa nyina,
Okyin hwehwɛ oguan a ɔayew n',
Na ɔdze no san ba fie;
Ɔkra biara nye dɛm oguan n';
Ewuradze Jesus, meserɛ Wo,

MHB 37
1 . Hail! holy, holy, holy Lord!
Whom One in Three we know;
By all Thy heavenly host adored.
By all Thy church below.
	 ~ 	1 . KRƆNKRƆN, krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, Nyame! 
Ɔwo a 'yɛ Baasa Kor,
Ɔsor dɔm nye ase Asɔr
Nyina bɔ m' tonton Wo.

MHB 37
2 . One undivided Trinity
With triumph we proclaim;
Thy universe is full of Thee.
And speaks Thy glorious name.
	 ~ 	2 . Yɛdze konyimdzi paa mu ka
Ɔkorsa kor a wɔnnkyɛ m';
Ahyɛ wiadze nyinara ma,
Na ɔka W' enyimnyam dzin n'.

MHB 37
3 . Thee, Holy Father, we confess,
Thee, Holy Son, adore,
Thee, Spirit of truth and holiness,
We worship evermore.
	 ~ 	3 . Yɛgye Wo to m', Egya krɔnkrɔn,
Yɛtonton W', 'Ba krɔnkrɔn;
Nokwar Sunsum na krɔnkrɔnyɛ,
Yɛsɔr Wo daa nyina.

MHB 37
4 . Three Persons equally divine
We magnify and love;
And both the choirs ere long shall join,
To sing Thy praise above.
	 ~ 	4 . Nyimpa Baasa a hom yɛ Nyame,
Yɛtonton hom, dɔ hom;
Na adwontofo nyina bɔbɔ m',
Atow hom ayɛyi so.

MHB 37
5 . Hail! holy, holy. holy Lord,
Our heavenly song shall be,
Supreme, essential One, adored
ln co-eternal Three. 	Amen.
	 ~ 	5 . Krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, krɔnkrɔn, Nyame! 
Hɛn sor ndwom bɛyɛ yi,
Ɔno a ɔkrɔn, 'sɛ dɛ wɔsɔr N'
Wɔbɔ m' yɛ Baasa Kor. Amen.

MHB 370
1 . JESU, Thy blood and righteousness
My beauty are, my glorious dress;
Midst flaming worlds in these arrayed,
With joy shall I lift up my head.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, Wo bͻgyaa na tsenenee,
Nye m'ahoͻfɛw na m'efuradze;
Mohwɛ W’ nantsew wiadze hyeehyew m’,
Medze dɛw bɛma me tsir do.
Jesu, nye W’ bͻgyaa na tsenénee.

MHB 370
10 . O let the dead now hear Thy voice,
Now bid thy banished ones rejoice,
Their beauty this, their glorious dress,
Jesu, Thy blood and righteousness !	 ~ 	10 
. O ma ewufo ntse Wo ndze
Na hͻn a wͻapon hͻn ndzi ehurusi,
Hͻn ahoͻfɛw nye efuradze,

MHB 370
2 . Bold shall I stand in Thy great day;
For who aught to my charge shall lay?
Fully absolved through these I am,
From sin and fear, from guilt and shame, 
	 ~ 	2 
. Medze akokodur begyina
Pintsinn, Wo da kɛse no mu;
Woana bͻbͻ sombo etsia m’?
Mefi bͻn, suro nye afͻdzi mu.

MHB 370
3 . The holy, meek, unspotted Lamb,
Who from the Father’s bosom came,
Who died for me, even me, to atone,
Now for my Lord and God I own.
	 ~ 	3 
. Eguambaa krͻnkrͻn a ͻdwé a
Ofi Egya No bo mu bae,
Bɛyɛɛ mpataguan wui gyee me n’,
Ͻno nye mo wura, me Nyame.

MHB 370
4 . Lord, I believe Thy precious blood,
Which at the mercy-seat of God
For ever doth for sinners plead,
For me, even for my soul, was shed.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ewuradze, megye dzi dɛ Wo
Bͻgyaa a ͻsom bo na ͻsérɛ
Nyame ahengua n’ enyim no,
Wokaa gui maa emi dɛm ’i me kra.

MHB 370
5 . When from the dust of death I rise
To claim my mansion in the skies,
 Even then this shall be my plea-
Jesus hath lived, hath died for me!
	 ~ 	5 
. Sɛ mosoɛr fi owu huntuma m’
Kͻ sor kɛgye me dampan no a,
Hͻ m'asɛm nyina bɛyɛ dɛ,
Jesus na owui dze maa me!

MHB 370
6 . Jesu,be endless praise to Thee,
Whose boundless mercy hath for me,
For me and all Thy hands have made,
An everlasting ransom paid.
	 ~ 	6 
. Jesus, ayeyi nka Wo daa,
W’ehumbͻbͻr a ͻmmbͻ adze da,
Nye dza Wo nsa ayɛ nyina
Abͻ werdam ama me kra.

MHB 370
7 . Lord,I believe, were sinners more
Than sands upon the ocean shore,
Thou hast for all a ransom paid,
For all a full atonement made.
	 ~ 	7 
. Ewuradze, megye dzi dɛ
Ndzebͻnyɛfo dͻͻ so koraa
Sen mpoano anhwea nyina dze,
Naaso etua kaw apon hͻn nyina.

MHB 370
8 . Ah! give to all Thy servants, Lord,
With power to speak Thy gracious word,
That all who to Thy wounds will flee,
May find eternal life in thee.
	 ~ 	8 
. Ao, Ewuradze, ma Wo nkowaa nyina
Tum ma wͻnka W’adom ho nsɛm,
Ma nyia ͻba W’epirakur ho
Eenya onnyiewiei nkwa wͻ Wo mu.

MHB 370
9 . Thou God of power, Thou God of love,
Let the whole world Thy mercy prove!
Now let Thy word o’er all prevail;
Now take the spoils of death and hell.
	 ~ 	9 
. Onyame Tumfo, Nyame dͻ,
Ma wiadze nhu W’ehumbͻbͻr!
Ma W’asem ndzi tum obiara m’.
Fa owu na hɛll dͻm no ndͻmmum.

MHB 371
1 . AND can it be that I should gain
An interest in the Saviour’s blood?
Died He for me, who caused His pain?
For me, who Him to death pursued?
Amazing love! How can it be
That Thou, my God, shouldst die for me!
	 ~ 	1 . NA ɔbɛyɛ dɛ mibenya
Mfaso wɔ Agyenkwa bɔgyaa m'?
Owui maa 'mi a ne yaw fir m' yir,
Maa 'mi a mitsiiw No kɔr wu mu n'! 
Anwanwa dɔ! Ɔyɛ dɛn yɛ
Dɛ Ɔwo, me Nyame, wui maa m'?
Nam Christ do gye ahenkyɛw no.

MHB 371
2 . ''Tis mystery all ! The Immortal dies:
Who can explore His strange design?
In vain the first-born seraph tries
To sound the depths of love divine.
''Tis mercy all! Let earth adore,
Let angel minds inquire no more.
	 ~ 	2 
. Esumasɛm a! Nyame bowu;
Woana tum hwehwɛ N'akwan mu?
Kwa na seraph a odzi kan n'
Ɔper hwehwɛ nyamedɔ bun n',
Mbɔbɔrhu a! Asaase nhua,
Mma abɔfo nnhwehwɛ mu bio.

MHB 371
3 . He left His Father’s throne above-
So free, so infinite His grace-
Emptied Himself of all but love,
And bled for Adam’s helpless race.
Tis mercy all, immense and free;
For, O my God, it found out me!
	 ~ 	3 
. Ogyaa N'Egya 'hengua wɔ sor -
N'adom mbordo ɔdze ma kwa-
Ɔpoow ne nyina gyedɛ ɔdɔ,
Wui maa adam afɔdzifo,
Mbɔbɔrhu a! Ɔso, wɔnntɔ;
Ao, me Nyame, ɔtwee me puei!

MHB 371
4 . Long my imprisoned spirit lay
Fast bound in sin and nature’s night
Thine eye diffused a quickening ray-
I woke, the dungeon flamed with light;
My chains fell off, my heart was free,
I rose, went forth, and followed Thee.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mber pii mo sunsum daduanyi
Daa bɔn mpokyerɛ na anago sum m';
W'enyiwa toow kan nserɛmɛn
Gyegyee fiadze hɔ, minyanee;
Mo mpokyerɛ gui, minyaa ahotɔ,
Mifiir edzi, midzii W'ekyir.

MHB 371
5 . No condemnation now I dread;
Jesus, and all in Him, is mine!
Alive in Him, my living Head,
And clothed in righteousness divine,
Bold I approach the eternal throne,
And claim the crown, through Christ, my own.	 ~ 	5 
. Afei munnsuro afɔbu bi;
Jesus, No mu dze nyina medze a;
Metse No mu, me Tseasefo a
Ɔdze sor tsenenee efura m',
Medze 'kokodur bɛn ''hɛngua n',

MHB 372
1 . THE God of love, to earth He came
That you might come to heaven ;
Believe, believe in Jesu’s name,
And all your sins forgiven.
	 ~ 	1 . Ɔdɔ Nyame baa wiadze ha, 
Ma 'wo aakɔ sor manm';
Gye dzi, gye Jesus Ne dzin dzi,
Na 'benya bɔnfakyɛ.
Afei wo kra ho asan.

MHB 372
2 . Believe in Him that died for thee,
And, sure as He hath died,
Thy debt is paid, thy soul is free,
And thou at justified.	 ~ 	2 
. Gye Nyia owui maa wo n' dzi, 
Ampaara, oewu yi
Wo kaw n' woetua, woebu wo bem;

MHB 373
1 . Lord, I was blind: I could not see
In Thy marred visage any grace;
But now the beauty of Thy face
In radiant vision dawns on me.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, meyɛɛ furafo!
Menntum ennhu W'enyim adom;
Afei enyido adzehu ma
Muhu W'enyim ne hyerɛn fɛɛfɛw n'.
Mebubu mo mpokyerɛ mu.

MHB 373
2 . Lord, I was deaf: I could not hear
The thrilling music of Thy voice;
But now I hear Thee and rejoice,
And all Thine uttered words are dear.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewuradze, meyɛɛ tsitsifo!
Menntum anntse Wo ndze dɛɛdɛw n';
Afei metse dza eka enyigye m',
Medze dɛw tsie nsɛmpa a ekaa n' nyina.

MHB 373
3 . Lord, I was dumb: I could not speak
The grace and glory of Thy Name;
But now, as touched with living flame,
My lips Thine eager praises wake.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, meyɛɛ mum ma
Menntum ammbɔ Wo dzin no dawur;
Afei ogya aka m'ano,
Mebue m'ano yi Wo ayɛw.

MHB 373
4 . Lord, I was dead: I could not stir
My lifeless soul to come to Thee;
But now, since Thou hast quickened me,
I rise from sin’s dark sepulcher.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ewuradze, muwui koraa!
Me kra enntum ammba Wo nkyɛn;
Afei dze, enyan me kra ma
Mefi adakamaa sum mu.

MHB 373
5 . Lord, Thou hast made the blind to see,
The deaf to hear, the dumb to speak,
The dead to live; and lo, I break
The chains of my captivity !	 ~ 	5 
. Ɔwo ama nyifurafo ehu adze,
Etsiw tse, emum so kasa,
Ewufo nyan; na afei dze

MHB 374
1 . Jesus hath died and hath risen again,
Pardon and peace to bestow;
Fully I trust Him; from sin’s guilty stain
Jesus saves me now.

    Jesus saves me now!
    Jesus saves me now!
    Yes, Jesus saves me all the time,
    Jesus saves me now!
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS ewu na ɔasan asoɛr bio,
Fakyɛ, asomdwee asan aba;
Motwer No dɛ oboguar mo ho bɔn;
Jesus gye me nkwa.
      Jesus gye m' sesei!
      Jesus gye m' sesei!
      Nyew, Jesus gye me nkwa daa nyina,
      Jesus gye m' sesei!.
Jesus gye me nkwa.

MHB 374
2 . Sin’s condemnation is over and gone,
Jesus alone knoweth how;
Life and salvation my soul hath put on;
       Jesus saves me now.
	 ~ 	2 
. M'afɔbu efi mo do kɔ koraa,
Jesus nko na onyim siantsir;
Me kra ahyɛ nkwa nye nkwagye atar;
Jesus gye me nkwa.

MHB 374
3 . Jesus is stronger that Satan and sin,
Satan to Jesus must bow,
Therefore I triumph without and within;
       Jesus saves me now.
	 ~ 	3 
. Jesus yɛ dzen kyɛn Satan nye bɔn koraa,
Satan bɔkotow Jesus,
Dɛm ntsi midzi konyim wɔ beebiara;
Jesus gye me nkwa.

MHB 374
4 . Sorrow and pain may beset me about,
Nothing can darken my brow;
Battling in faith I can joyfully shout:
Jesus saves me now. 	 ~ 	4 
. Awerɛhow nye yaw botwa m' ho ehyia,
Worunntum mma m'enyi mmbɔ;
Medze enyigye bɛtsea m' gyedzi mu,

MHB 375
1 . NOW I have found the ground wherein
Sure my soul’s anchor may remain -
The wounds of Jesus, for my sin
Before the world’s foundation slain;
Whose mercy shall unshaken stay,
When heaven and earth are fled away.
	 ~ 	1 . Afei menya asaase pa a 
Medze me kra sekyɛ bɔto;
Jesus Ne pira a mo bɔn ntsi
Wɔdze piraa N' wiadze ahyɛse n';
Sor na asaase twam' kɔ mpo a,
N' ehumbɔbɔr betsim hɔ daa.
Ɔadɔ m' ɔdɔ a ɔmmbɔ adze da.

MHB 375
2 . Father, Thine everlasting grace
Our scanty thought surpasses far,
Thy heart still melts with tenderness,
Thy arms of love still open are
Returning sinners to receive,
That mercy they may taste and live.
	 ~ 	2  
. Egya, W'adom a onnyi eiwiei 
Ɔbor hɛn adwen do koraa;
W'abaatanyɛ mmbɔ adze da.
Wo dɔ abaw no mu da hɔ.
Regye nnuhofo ma wɔaasɔ
Mbɔbɔrhu ahwɛ enya nkwa.

MHB 375
3 . O Love, thou bottomless abyss,
My sins are swallowed up in thee!
 Covered is my unrighteousness,
 Nor spot of guilt remains on me,
While Jesu’s blood, through earth and skies
’Mercy, free, boundless mercy!’ cries.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔdɔ, bun a onnyi ntuadze, 
Mo bɔn nyina ayew wo mu!
Ɔakata mo mumuyɛ do,
Afɔdzi biara nnyi mo do,
Jesus bɔgyaa tseam' kodu wim',
Mbɔbɔrhu, mbɔbɔrhu koraa!

MHB 375
4 . With faith I plunge me in this sea,
Here is my hope, my joy, my rest;
Hither, when hell assails, I flee,
I look into my Saviour’s breast;
Away, sad doubt, and anxious fear!
Mercy is all that’s written there.
	 ~ 	4 
. Medze gyedzi dɔ bun yi mu, 
M'ahomgye, dɛw na enyidar ny' 'i;
Sɛ hɛll tsiw m' a muguan ba ha
Moto m'enyi hwɛ m'Agyenkwa:
Ekyingye nye suro mfi hɔ:
Mbɔbɔrhu nko na ɔwɔ ha.

MHB 375
5 . Though waves and storms go o’er my head,
Though strength, and health, and friends be gone,
Though joys be withered all and dead,
Though every comfort be withdrawn,
On this my steadfast soul relies -
Father, thy mercy never dies!
	 ~ 	5 
. Ehum nye asorɛkye tu bɔ m', 
Ahoɔdzen ny e adɔfo pa m',
Me dɛw nsubura nyinaa sa,
Awerɛkyekyer nyina kɔ mpo a.
Iyi nko na me kra bɔtwer,-
Egya, wo mbɔbɔrhu nnwu da.

MHB 375
6 . Fixed on this ground will I remain,
Though my heart fail, and flesh decay;
This anchor shall my soul sustain,
When earth’s foundations melt away;
Mercy’s full power I then shall prove,
Loved with an everlasting love.	 ~ 	6 
. Sɛ mo honam yi prɔw mpo a, 
Mirimmfi gyinabew yi do;
Sekyɛ yi nko bɛgye me kra,
Ber a wiadze fapem etwam':
Ber no m'bohu adom mbordo n',

MHB 376
1 . THOU great mysterious God unknown,
Whose love hath gently led me on,
Even from my infant days,
Mine inmost soul expose to view,
And tell me if I ever knew
Thy justifying grace.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME a Wo ho nsɛm yɛ esumasɛm,
Wo dɔ no egya m' berɛww ara,
Fi mo mbofraber mu,
Da me kra edzi ma onhu,
Na kyerɛ me kra ma no so onhu
W'adom a obu bem no.
Ntsena m'akoma m' daa.  Amen.

MHB 376
2 . If I have only known Thy fear,
And followed with a heart sincere
Thy drawings from above,
Now, now the further grace bestow,
And let my sprinkled conscience know
Thy sweet forgiving love.
	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ Wo ho hu nko na minyim,
Na m'akoma edzi W'ekyir,
Nye sor kwankyerɛ nko a,
Afei dze, ma W'adom no nhu
Me tsebea a ɔatsew ho no,
Nhu Wo fakyɛ dɔ no.

MHB 376
3 . Short of Thy love I would not stop,
A stranger to the gospel hope,
The sense of sin forgiven;
I would not, Lord, my soul deceive,
Without the inward witness live,
That antepast of heaven.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mirinngyaa, gyedɛ mehu W' dɔ,
Meyɛ hɔho wɔ 'sɛmpa n' mu,
Fakyɛ ho enyidar n' mu;
Ewuradze, menndaadaa me kra,
Mennya mo mu dasefo a,
N-kyɛ mennya sor da.

MHB 376
4 . If now the witness were in me,
Would He not testify of Thee
In Jesus reconciled?
And should I not with faith draw nigh,
And boldly Abba, Father, cry,
And know myself Thy child?
	 ~ 	4 
. Wo ho dasefo wɔ mo mu a,
Ana nkyɛ ɔnnkɛkyerɛ nye w'
Abɔ m', Jesus mu?
Ana memmfa gyedzi nntwe mmpin,
Nntsea m' 'hoɔdzen m'; Abba, Egya!
Munnhu dɛ meyɛ W' ba?

MHB 376
5 . Whate’er obstructs Thy pardoning love,
Or sin or righteousness, remove,
Thy glory to display;
Mine heart of unbelief convince,
And now absolve me from my sins,
And take them all away.
	 ~ 	5 
. Dza osiw Wo fakyɛ dɔ kwan,
Sɛ bɔn a, yi fi hɔ koraa,
Ma enyimnyam nkyerɛ;
Ma akoma kyingyefo ngye ndzi,
Na hwim me fi bɔn mu koraa,
Na fa ne nyina kɔ.

MHB 376
6 . Father, in me reveal Thy Son,
And to my inmost soul make known
How merciful Thou art:
The secret of Thy love reveal,
And by Thine hallowing Spirit dwell
For ever in my heart.	 ~ 	6 
. Egya, da Wo Ba no edzi
Mo mu, na ma me kra ntse nka
Dɛ 'yɛ mbɔbɔrhufo,
Wo dɔ esumasɛm, da n' edzi
Na ma Wo Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn no

MHB 377
1 . How can a sinners know
 His sins on earth forgiven?
How can our gracious Saviour show
My name inscribed in heaven?
	 ~ 	1 . ƆBƆN bɛyɛ dɛn ehu
Dɛ oenya bɔnfakyɛ?
M'Agyenkwa bɛyɛ dɛn akyerɛ dɛ
Ɔakyerɛw me dzin wɔ sor?
Yetsia N'anamɔn mu.    Amen.

MHB 377
2 . What we have felt  and seen
With confidence we tell,
And publish to the sons of men
The signs infallible.
	 ~ 	2 
. Dza yɛatse nka, yeehu n'
Na yɛpaa mu yɛka,
Yɛbɔ n' dawur kyerɛ adasa,
Nokwar asɛnkyerɛdze n'.

MHB 377
3 . We who in Christ believe
That He for us hath died,
We all his unknown peace receive,
And feel his blood applied.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hɛn a yɛgye Christ dzi
Dɛ owui maa hɛn nyina,
Hɛn a yenya N'asomdwee no,
Wɔdze N' bɔgyaa asera hɛn.

MHB 377
4 . Exults our rising soul,
Disburdened of her load,
And swells unutterably full
Of glory and of God.
	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn kra nya ahosepɛw 
Dɛ ɔasoɛ n'adzesoa,
Na ɔhyehyɛ noho kɛse
Wɔ Nyame enyimnyam mu.

MHB 377
5 . His love, surpassing far
The love of all beneath,
We find within our hearts, and dare
The pointless darts of death.
	 ~ 	5 
. No dɔ sō sen wiadze
No mu dɔ nyinara;
Yɛtse n' hɛn akoma mu ntsi
Yennsuro wu egyan biara.

MHB 377
6 . Stronger than death and hell
The mystic power we prove;
And, conquerors of the world, we dwell
In heaven, who dwell in love.
	 ~ 	6 
. Ɔyɛ dzen sen owu
Nye samanadze nyina;
Yedzi konyim wɔ wiadze mu,
Yɛtse dɔ mu wɔ sor.

MHB 377
7 . His Spirit to us He gave,
And dwells in us we know;
The witness in ourselves we have,
And all its fruits we show.
	 ~ 	7 
. Ɔdze No Sunsum mae,
Yenyim, ɔtsena hɛn mu,
Na odzi dase wɔ hɛn mu,
Yɛda N'aba edzi.

MHB 377
8 . Whate’er our pardoning Lord
Commands ,we gladly do;
And guided by His sacred word,
We  all His steps pursue.	 ~ 	8 
. Dza hɛn Wura hyɛ hɛn n',
Yɛdze enyigye yɛ;
N'asɛmpa krɔnkrɔn no kyerɛ hɛn;

MHB 378
1 . ETERNAL Sun of righteousness,
Display Thy beams divine,
And cause the glory of Thy face
Upon my heart to shine.
	 ~ 	1 . 'DOMANKOMA Tsenenee Ewia,
Yi Wo sor hyerɛn no kyerɛ,
Na ma W'enyim ne nyam kɛse n'
Nhyerɛn m'akoma mu.
Na meedzi dɛw wɔ sor.   Amen.

MHB 378
2 . Light, in Thy light, oh, may I see,
Thy grace and mercy prove,
Revived, and cheered, and blest by Thee,
The God of pardoning love.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma munhu kan wɔ Wo kan n' mu,
Nye W'adom mbɔbɔrhu n';
Kenyan, gye m'enyi, hyira me,
Ɔdɔ fakyɛ Nyame.

MHB 378
3 . Lift up Thy countenance serene,
And let Thy happy child
Behold, without a cloud between,
The Father reconciled.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma W'enyim hyerɛn no do daa,
Na Wo ba nnya enyigye;
Mma mununkum biara mmbotwa
Ɔnye Nyametsir N' ntamu.

MHB 378
4 . That all-comprising peace bestow,
On me through grace forgiven;
The joys of holiness below,
And then the joys of heaven.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Ma Wo fakyɛ adom no do
Ma minnya asomdwee,
Ma minnya krɔnkrɔn ho dɛw,

MHB 379
1 . THE people that in darkness lay,
In sin and error’s deadly shade,
Have seen a glorious gospel day
In Jesu’s lovely face displayed.
	 ~ 	1 . NKORƆFO a wɔtse sum mu no
Wɔ owu bɔn nwinwin ase no,
Ehu 'nyimnyam asɛmpa da n'
Wɔ Jesus enyim fɛɛfɛw no.
Yɛma sor enyigye do kɛse.

MHB 379
2 . Thou only, Lord, the work hast done,
And bared Thine arm in all our sight;
Hast made the reprobates Thine  own,
And claimed the outcasts as Thy right.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewuradze, Wo nko edzi dwuma n',
Atserɛw Wo nsamu wɔ hɛn enyim
Edze abɔn ayɛ Woara Wodze
Hɔn a woriyi hɔn tokyen Wodze a.

MHB 379
3 . Thine arm alone, almighty Lord,
To us the great  salvation brought,
Thy Word, Thy all-creating Word,
That spake at first the world from nought.
	 ~ 	3 
. Tumfo Ewuradze, Wo nsa
Na edze ama hɛn nkwagye,
W'asɛm a ɔbɔɔ adze nyina n'
Bɔɔ wiadze asɔpɔn no ara.

MHB 379
4 . For this the saints lift up their voice,
And ceaseless praise to Thee is given;
For this the hosts above rejoice;
We raise the happiness of heaven.	 ~ 	4 
. Ahotsewfo ma hɔn ndze do
Tow ayɛyi ndwom ma Wo daa;
Iyi ntsi sor dɔm dzi ehurusi,

MHB 38
1 . FATHER of heaven, whose love profound
A ransom for our souls hath found,
Before Thy throne we sinners bend;
To us Thy portioning love extend.
	 ~ 	1 . Ɔsor Egya a Wo dɔ kɛse n'
Abɔ werdam ama hɛn kra,
Abɔn yɛkotow W' egua enyim;
Wo bɔnfakyɛ dɔ n' fa dom hɛn.

MHB 38
2 . Almighty Son, incarnate Word,
Our Prophet, Priest Redeemer. Lord,
Before Thy throne we sinners bend;
To us Thy saving grace extend.
	 ~ 	2 . Ba Tumfo, Asɛm a ɔbrae, 
Hɛn Nkɔnhyɛnyi, Sɔfo, Pomfo,
Abɔn yɛkotow W' egua enyim;
Wo nkwagye adom n', fa dom hɛn.

MHB 38
3 .  Eternal Spirit, by whose breath
The soul is raised from sin and death.
Before Thy throne we sinners bend:
To us Thy quickening power extend.	 ~ 	3 . Sunsum Bɛkyebo a W' ahom ma 
Wɔgye kra fi bɔn nsa na wum',
Abɔn yɛkotow W' egua enyim;
Wo nkwahwea tum no, fa dom hɛn.

MHB 38
4 . Thrice Holy: Father, Spirit. Son;
Mysterious Godhead, Three in One,
Before Thy throne we sinners bend;
Grace, pardon, life to us extend.   Amen.
	 ~ 	4 . Krɔnkrɔn mprɛnsa, Egya, Sunsum Ba; 
Nyametsir nwanwa, Ɔkorsa,
Abɔn yɛkotow W' egua enyim;
Adom, fafir, nkwa, fa dom hɛn.    Amen.

MHB 380
1 . I WILL sing the wondrous story
Of the Christ who died for me;
How He left His home in glory,
For the cross on Calvary.
      Yes, I’ll sing the wondrous story
      Of the Christ who died for me
      Sing it with the saints in glory,
      Gathered by the crystal sea.
	 ~ 	1 . Mobɔtow anwanwasɛm no 
Christ owui maa me N'asɛm n';
Mbrɛ ofir N' enyimnyam fie hɔ,
Bae bowui wɔ Calvary, 

   Nyew, m'bɔtow anwanwasɛm no 
   Christ owui maa me N'asɛm n'; 
   Menye ahotsewfo bɔtow, 
   Menye ahotsewfo bɔtow, 
   Wɔ ahwehwɛ po no ho. 
Akɔ mbrɛ m'adɔfo wɔ.

MHB 380
2 . I was lost; but Jesus found me
Found the sheep that went astray;
Raised me up and gently led me
Back into the narrow way.
	 ~ 	2 
. Meyewee; na Jesus hwehwɛɛ me- 
'Hun No guan a ɔtɔɔ gon n';
Ɔmaa mo do kaa me berɛww
Dze me baa nkwa kwan no mu,

MHB 380
3 . I was bruised; but Jesus healed me:
Faint was I from many a fall;
Sight was gone, and fears possessed me:
But He freed me from them all.
	 ~ 	3 
. M-posuow na asehwe pii: 
Maa motɔɔ akɔtɔmborɔnsa;
M'enyi do siiw m', hu kitsaa me:
Jesus gye m' ne nyina mu,

MHB 380
4 . Days of darkness still come o’er me;
Sorrow’s paths I often tread:
But the savior still is with me,
By His hand I’m safely led.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mbusu mber da ho ba mo do; 
Menantsew yaw kwan mu dze.
Naaso Agyenkwa bɛn me daa
Ogya me, obesi yie.

MHB 380
5 . He will keep me till the river
Rolls its waters at my feet;
Then He’ll bear me safely over,
Where the loved ones I shall meet.	 ~ 	5 
. Ɔbɔweɔn me ara ekodu 
Esutsen no nkɔnkɔnoa;
Na ɔama mo do etwa sɔnn

MHB 381
1 . I AM not skilled to understand
What God hath willed, what God 
    hath planned;
I only know that at His right hand
Is One Who is my Savior!
	 ~ 	1 . MONNKOTUM atse dza Nyame 
Ahyehyɛ dɛ onsi ase,
Dza minyim nye dɛ m'Agyenkwa
Gyina Nyame N'abanyimfa.
Nye m'Agyenkwa a owui maa m'.

MHB 381
2 . I take God at His word indeed;
Christ died for sinners”—this I read;
For in my heart I find a need
Of Him to be my Saviour!
	 ~ 	2 
. Megye Nyame na N'asɛm to m';
M'akenkan dɛ Christ wui gyee me;
Metse nka wɔ m'akoma m' dɛ
No ho hia m' dɛ m'Agyenkwa.

MHB 381
3 . And was there then no other way
For God to take?I cannot say,
I only bless Him, day dy day,
Who saved me through my Saviour.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ana kwan fofor bi nnyi hɔ a
Nyame bɛfa do? Munntum nnka;
Ndaase na medze ma No daa,
Dɛ m'Agyenkwa a ɔagye me.

MHB 381
4 . That He should leave His place on high
And come for sinful man to die,
You count it strange? So once did I,
Before I knew my Saviour!
	 ~ 	4 
. Ogyaa Ne tsenabea wɔ sor,
Baa bowui gyee ndzebɔnyɛfo;
Ɔyɛ w' nwanwa? Ɔnntse dɛm mma m'
'Siandɛ mehu m'Agyenkwa.

MHB 381
5 . And O, that He fulfilled may see
The travail of His soul in me,
And with His work contented be,
As I with my dear Saviour!
	 ~ 	5 
. Ao, nkyɛ owie ne nyina yɛ a,
Oeehu Ne kra awoko mo mu!
M'enyi agye N'edwuma ho n',
M'enyi aagye m'Agyenkwa ho!

MHB 381
6 . Yea, living, dying, let me bring
My strength, my solace from this Spring;
That He Who lives to be my King
Once died to be my Saviour.	 ~ 	6 
. N-yew, sɛ metse ase o, muwu o,
M'awerɛkyekyer mfi yi mu,
Dɛ Nyia ɔtse ase dɛ me Hen n'

MHB 382
1 . LET Him to whom we now belong
His sovereign right assert,
And take up every thankful song
And every loving heart.
	 ~ 	1 . MA Nyia afei yɛyɛ Nedze n'
Nda No tum edzi nkyerɛ,
Na ɔngye ndaase ndwom nyina, 
Na akoma dɔfo nyina.
Ne nyina yɛ Wodze koraa.   Amen.

MHB 382
2 . He justly claims us for his own,
Who bought us with a price;
The Christian lives to Christ alone,
To Christ alone he dies.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔkyerɛ dɛ yɛyɛ Nedze,
Ɔtɔɔ hɛn aboɔdzen;
Christiannyi tse ase ma Christ nko,
Owu so ma Christ nko.

MHB 382
3 . Jesus, Thine own at last receive,
Fulfil our hearts’ desire,
And let us to thy glory live,
And in thy cause expire.
	 ~ 	3 
. Jesus, gye W'ankasa Wodze n',
Yɛ akoma n' apɛdze,
Na ma yɛntsena mma W'enyimnyam,
Yenwu W'edwuma mu.

MHB 382
4 . Our souls and bodies we resign;
With joy we render thee
Our all, no longer ours, but Thine
To all eternity.    Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Yɛdze hɛn kra nye nyimpadua
Ma Wo enyigye mu;
Dza yɛwɔ biara nnyɛ hɛndze,

MHB 383
1 . BEING of beings, God of love!
To thee our hearts we raise:
Thy all-sustaining power we prove,
And gladly sing thy praise.
	 ~ 	1 . ABƆDZE Wura, Ɔdɔ Nyame,
Yɛdze hɛnho ma Wo;
Yɛda Wo tum kɛse m' edzi,
Yɛtow W'ayɛyi ndwom.
Aatsena Nyame mu.

MHB 383
2 . Thine, wholly thine, we long to be:
Our sacrifice receive;
Made, and preserved, and saved by thee,
To thee ourselves we give.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛpɛ dɛ yɛyɛ Wodze koraa;
Gye hɛn afɔrbɔdze;
Ɔwo na ebɔɔ hɛn, gye hɛn nkwa,
Yɛdze hɛnho ma Wo.

MHB 383
3 . Heavenward our every wish aspires;
 For all thy mercies’ store,
The sole return thy love requires
Is, that we ask for more.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sor ndzɛmba na yɛper hwehwɛ;
Dza W'ehumbɔbɔr kyerɛ,
Dɛ Wo dɔ beberee ekyir n',
Yebisa bi ka ho.

MHB 383
4 . For more we ask; we open then
 Our hearts to embrace thy will;
Turn, and revive us, Lord, again,
With all thy fulness fill.
	 ~ 	4 
. Yeribisa dɛ ma hɛn bio;
Yebue hɛn akoma mu,
Ewuradze, kenyan hɛn nyina,
Fa W'amayɛ n' ma hɛn.

MHB 383
5 . Come, Holy Ghost, the Saviour’s love
Shed in our hearts abroad;
So shall we ever live, and move,
And be, with Christ in God.	 ~ 	5 
. Ewuradze Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, bra,
Bra hɛn akoma mu,
Ama daa nyina yɛnye Christ

MHB 384
1 . MY soul, through my Redeemer’s care,
Saved from the second death I feel,
My eyes from tears of dark despair,
My feet from falling into hell. 
	 ~ 	1 . Me kra nam mo Pomfo no do, 
Efi owu mprɛnu no nsa;
Woeyi m'enyi wɔ nyinsuwa mu,
Woeyi m'anan so efi hɛll.
Na me kra nyina ehyira No.

MHB 384
2 . Wherefore to him my feet shall run,
My eyes on his perfections gaze,
My soul shall live for God alone,
And all within me shout his praise.	 ~ 	2 
. Dɛm ntsi m'boguan makɔ No hɔ, 
M'enyiwa bɔhwɛ N'ahoɔfɛw,
Me kra bɛtsena ama No nko,

MHB 385
1 . Jesus, I fain would find
Thy zeal for God in me,
Thy yearning pity for mankind,
Thy burning charity.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, morohwehwɛ
Wo Nyame dͻ no mu,
W’ehumbͻbͻr ma adasa,
Nye W’ayamuyie no.

MHB 385
2 . In me thy Spirit dwell;
In me thy mercies move:
So shall the fervour of my zeal
Be the pure flame of love.	 ~ 	2 
. Wo Sunsum tse mo mu;
W’ehumbͻbͻr nkenyan m’.
Dɛm na mo mbͻdzembͻ nyina
Bedzɛw wͻ mo mu daa.

MHB 386
1 . O Thou who camest from above,
The pure celestial fire to impart
Kindle a flame of sacred love
On the mean altar of my heart.
	 ~ 	1 . O, Ɔwo a ifi sor bae  
Edze gya krɔnkrɔn n' rebɛma,
Sɔ dɔ a ho tsew ne gya no
Wɔ m'akoma afɔrmbukyia do.
Wɔ wum' ma afɔrbɔ n' edzi mu.

MHB 386
2 . There let it for Thy glory burn
With inextinguishable blaze,
And trembling to its source return,
In humble prayer and fervent praise.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma ɔndzew hɔ mma W' enyimnyam 
Dɛ ne framee no onndum da;
Ɔmfa ahopopo nsan bio,
Wɔ ayɛyi na mpaabɔ mu.

MHB 386
3 . Jesus, confirm my heart’s desire
To work and speak and think for thee;
Still let me guard the holy fire,
And still stir up thy gift in me.
	 ~ 	3 
. Jesus, hyɛ dza m'akoma pɛ ma 
Ɔnyɛ edwuma, nkasa, ndwen mma Wo,
Ma menda ho nweɔn gya krɔnkrɔn n',
Nkenyan W'akyɛdze wɔ mo mu.

MHB 386
4 . Ready for all Thy perfect will,
My acts of faith and love repeat,
Till death Thy endless mercies seal,
And make the sacrifice complete.	 ~ 	4 
. Mayɛ krado Wo pɛ nyinaa ho, 
M'besi gyedzi na dɔ ndwuma do,
Kodu dɛ W'dɔe bɛhyɛ ma

MHB 387
1 . My God! I know, I feel thee mine,
And will not quit my claim,
Till all I have is lost in thine
And all renewed I am.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME! Minyim, medze nye Wo,
Na minnkegyaa W' mu da,
Kɛpem dɛ dza mowɔ nyina
Yɛ W'dze na ayɛ m' fofor.
Na tsew mo ho korakora.   Amen.

MHB 387
2 . I hold thee with a trembling hand,
But will not let thee go,
Till steadfastly by faith I stand
And all thy goodness know.
	 ~ 	2 
. Medze nsa a ɔpopo suo Wo mu,
Na minnkegyaa W' ma aakɔ,
Gyedɛ migyina pintsinn gyedzi m',
Na muhu W'ayamuyie.

MHB 387
3 . Jesus, thine all-victorious love
Shed in my heart abroad;
Then shall my feet no longer rove,
Rooted and fixed in God.
	 ~ 	3 
. Jesus, Wo konyimdzi no a
Ihuee guu mo mu ntsi
M'anan nnkehihim ara bio;
Migyina pintsinn Nyame m'.

MHB 387
4 . O that in me the sacred fire
Might now begin to glow,
Burn up the dross of base desire,
And make the mountains flow!
	 ~ 	4 
. O nkyɛ gya krɔnkrɔn n' aahyɛ ase
Aadzɛw mo mu sesei,
Aahyew mo mu wiadze akɔndɔ
Na mbepɔw no efi hɔ.

MHB 387
5 . O that it now from heaven might fall,
And all my sins consume!
Come, Holy Ghost, for thee I call,
Spirit of burning, come!
	 ~ 	5 
. O nkyɛ eefi sor aatɔ sesei,
Aahyew mo bɔn nyina!
Bra, Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, mefrɛ Wo;
Ogya Sunsum e! Bra!

MHB 387
6 . Refining fire, go through my heart,
Illuminate my soul;
Scatter thy life through every part,
And sanctify the whole.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Ɔhyew-fi gya a! Dzɛw m'akoma m',
Hyerɛn me kra do, mesrɛ W';
Fa Wo nkwa petse mo mu nyina

MHB 388
1 . My Saviour, how shall I proclaim,
How pay the mighty debt I owe?
Let all I have, and all I am,
Ceaseless to all thy glory show.
	 ~ 	1 . M' Agyenkwa! m'bɛyɛ dɛn etua 
Me kaw kɛse a medze Wo yi?
Ma dza mowɔ na metse nyina,
Nkyerɛ W'enyimnyam nyina daapem.
Gu m'akoma do afebɔɔ. Amen.

MHB 388
2 . Too much to thee I cannot give;
Too much I cannot do for thee;
Let all thy love, and all thy grief,
Graven on my heart for ever be.
                      	Amen.	 ~ 	2  
. Munntum mma Wo kɛse biara; 
Munntum nndzi dwuma kɛse mma W';
Kyerɛw nndzi dwuma kɛse mma W';

MHB 39
1 . FATHER, in whom we live,
In whom we are, and move,
The glory, Power, and praise receive
Of Thy creating love.
Let all the angel throng
Give thanks to God on high;
While earth repeats the joyful song,
And echoes to the sky.
	 ~ 	1 . EGYA a yɛtse Wo mu,
Na yɛkeka hɛnho,
Yenya enyimnyam, tum na ayɛyi
Fi Wo dɔ a 'dze ma n' ho.
Wɔmma abɔfo nyina
Nda Nyame ase wɔ sor;
Na asaase ntow enyigye ndwom,
Na ɔngyegye wɔ sor.

MHB 39
2 . Incarnate Deity,
Let all the ransomed race
Render in thanks their lives to Thee.
For Thy redeeming grace.
The grace to sinners showed
Ye heavenly choirs proclaim,
And cry: Salvation to our God.
Salvation to the Lamb!
	 ~ 	2 . Nyame a bɛyɛɛ nyimpa,
Ma hɔn a wɔagye hɔn nyina 
M-fa hɔn nkwa nda Wo ase,
Wɔ W' adom a ɔgye nkwa;
Adom a 'dze maa abɔn n',
Sor adwontofo nka;
Hom ntsea m'; Nkwagye nka hɛn Nyame, 
Nkwagye nka Eguambaa n'.

MHB 39
3 . Spirit of Holiness.
Let all Thy saints adore
Thy sacred energy, and bless
Thine heart-renewing power.
Not angel tongues can tell
Thy Iove's ecstatic height,
The glorious joy unspeakable,
The beatific sight.
	 ~ 	3 . Sunsum a eyɛ krɔnkrɔn,
Ma W'ahotsewfo nyina
Ntonton W'adom krɔnkrɔn n', nhyira
Wo tum a ɔsakyer akoma.
Abɔfo nnkotum aka
Wo dɔ no krɔn kɛse n',
Enyimnyam dɛw a onnyi kabea,
Dza wohu a woehyira do.

MHB 39
4 . Eternal, Triune God!
Let all the hosts above,
Let all the sons of men, record
And dwell upon thy love.
When heaven and earth are fled
Before Thy glorious face,
Sing all the saints Thy love hath made
Thine everlasting praise. 	Amen.
	 ~ 	4 . Daapem 'Korsa Ewuradze,
Ma ɔsor dɔm nyina,
Ma nyimpa mba nyinara nkaa
Na wɔntsena Wo dɔ mu.
Sɛ ɔsor na asaase
Nya guan fi W'enyim a,
Ma ahotsewfo no nyinara 
Ntow Wo dɔ ho ndwom daa.  Amen.

MHB 390
1 . Give me the faith which can remove
And sink the mountain to a plain;
Give me the child-like praying love,
Which longs to build thy house again;
Thy love, let it my heart o’erpower,
And all my simple soul devour.
	 ~ 	1 . MA m' gyedzi a otutu nkokwaa,
Na ɔma ne nyinara da fɛmm;
Ma me mbofra dɔ akoma a
Ɔpɛ dɛ osi Wo fie fofor;
Wo dɔ mfa m'akoma ndɔmmum,
Ɔmfa me kra bɔbɔfo 'i koraa.
Nguan no ntsi hɔn Hwɛfo no wui.

MHB 390
2 . I would the precious time redeem,
And longer live for this alone:
To spend, and to be spent, for them
Who have not yet my Saviour known;
Fully on these my mission prove,
And only breathe, to breathe thy love.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mepɛ dɛ mofow ber pa a ɔsɛ m',
Matsena ase akyɛr yi ho;
Mahwer me mber pii wɔ hɔn a
Wonnyaa nnhun Agyenkwa pa n' ho;
Mibedzi dwuma yi prɛko,
M'ahomgu ayɛ Wo dɔ nko,

MHB 390
3 . My talents, gifts, and graces, Lord,
Into thy blessed hands receive;
And let me live to preach thy word,
And let me to thy glory live;
My every sacred moment spend
In publishing the sinner’s friend.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, medze me talɛnt
Akyɛdze nye adom san brɛ W',
Na ma menyɛ Wo 'sɛnkafo,
Na mentsena mma W'enyimnyam,
Memfa me mber nyinara nka
Abɔnfo Adamfo ho nsɛm.

MHB 390
4 . Enlarge, inflame, and fill my heart
With boundless charity divine:
So shall I all my strength exert,
And love them with a zeal like Thine;
And lead them to thy open side,
The sheep for whom their Shepherd died.	 ~ 	4 
. Fa ayamuyie a ɔmmbɔ adze
Bɔ m'akoma hyew, hyɛ no ma,
Ama medze m'akoma nyina
Nye nkenyan dɛ edze bɔdɔ hɔn
Medze hɔn aaba abɔhwɛ W' mfem';

MHB 391
1 . Thy life was given for me,
Thy blood, O Lord, was shed, 
That I might ransomed be,
And quickened from the dead:
Thy life was given for me;
What have I given for Thee?
	 ~ 	1 . Edze Wo nkwa maa me; 
Mo Wura, Wo bɔgyaa kyii
Ama aapon emi
Na meefi wum' masoɛr;
Edze Wo nkwa maa me:
'Midze, mama W' ebɛn?
Mo so, medze moho ma W' Amen.

MHB 391
2 . Thy Father’s home of light,
Thy rainbow-circled throne,
Were left for earthly night,
For wanderings sad and lone:
Yea, all was left for me;
Have I left aught for Thee?
	 ~ 	2 
. Igyaa Wegya fie kan n', 
W'ahengua abɔso n',
Baa asaase sum yi mu,
Bɔbɔɔ akwankwan 'werɛhowm':
Nyew, wɔdze ne nyina gyaa m'
Megyaa biribi ama Wo a?

MHB 391
3 . Thou Lord, hast borne for me 
More than my tongue can tell 
Of bitterest agony,
To rescue me from hell:
Thou suffer’dst all for me;
What have I borne for Thee?
	 ~ 	3  
. Mo Wura, dzi asɔw me ntsi 
Gyirama bi nnkotum ka;
Awerɛhow yerɛyerɛw
Ama eeyi m' efi hɛll;
Esɔɔw m'amandzehu:
Masɔw 'bɛn mama Wo?

MHB 391
4 . And Thou hast brought to me 
Down from Thy home above
Salvation full and free,
Thy pardon and Thy love:
Great gifts Thou broughtest me;
What have I brought to Thee?
	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔwo edze bɔnfakyɛ 
Na dɔ fi sor aba;
N-kwagye a odzi mu pii,
Edze ne nyina ama me;
Akyɛ me adze pii;
Mo so makyɛ W' ebɛn?

MHB 391
5 . O let my life be given,
My years for Thee be spent,
World-fetters all be riven,
And joy with suffering blent:
 Thou gav’st Thyself for me:
 I give myself to Thee.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Ao, ma memfa mo nkwa 
Ne nyinara memma,
Mumbubu mo mpokyerɛ
Memfa dɛw mfora yaw;
Edze Woho maa me:

MHB 392
1 . I bind unto myself today
The strong name of the Trinity,
By invocation of the same,
The Three in One, and One in Three.
	 ~ 	1 . NDƐ medze Ɔkorsa Nyame
Tum dzin no akyekyer moho,
Na medze noara mefrɛ No,
Ɔkorsa Nyame, Baasa Kor.
Nkwagye fir Ewuradze Christ.

MHB 392
2 . I bind this day to me for ever,
By power of faith, Christ’s Incarnation,
His Baptism in the Jordan river,
 His death on Cross for my salvation.
His bursting from the spiced tomb,
His riding up the heavenly way,
His coming at the day of doom,
I bind unto myself to-day.
	 ~ 	2 
. Dza mekyekyer ndɛ yi nko hɔ daa,
Wɔ gyedzi nye Christ Nyimpadua mu;
N'esubɔ wɔ Esutsen Jordan mu;
Ne mbeamudua do wu ma me nkwagye;
No mpuei fi owumaa no mu;
No sorkɔ kwan do akwantu;
Ne ba wɔ atsɛmbu da mu;
Medze kyekyer moho ndɛ da 'i.

MHB 392
3 . I bind unto myself to-day
The virtues of the star-lit heaven,
The glorious sun’s life-giving ray,
The whiteness of the moon at even.
The flashing of the lightning free,
The whirling winds’ tempestuous shocks,
The stable earth, the deep salt sea
Around the old eternal rocks.
	 ~ 	3 
. Medze yi kyekyer moho ndɛ ;
Nworaba a wɔhyerɛn wɔ sor,
Enyimnyam ewia n' n'ahoɔdzen nserɛmɛn
Bosoom a ɔpaa fitaa anafua,
Enyinam hyerɛn mber pa mu,
Ekyinehyia mframa a ɔwosow,
'Saasè a ɔda hɔ, na po nkyen a
Ɔnenam tsetse botan ho.

MHB 392
4 . I bind unto myself to-day
The power of God to hold and lead,
His eye to watch, his might to stay,
His ear to hearken to my need;
The wisdom of my God to teach,
His hand to guide, his shield to ward,
The word of God to give me speech,
His heavenly host to be my guard.
	 ~ 	4 
. Medze yi kyekyer moho ndɛ,
Nyame tum a ɔkyerɛ m' kwan,
N'enyiwa nweɔn, No tum nkora me;
N'asowa ntsie m'ehiasɛm,
Me Nyame nyansa nkyerɛkyerɛ me,
Ne nsa nkyerɛ m' kwan, ne kyɛm ngya m',
Nyame asɛm nkyerɛ me kasa
No sor dɔm tutuw no nweɔn me.

MHB 392
5 . Christ be with me, Christ within me,
Christ behind me, Christ before me,
Christ beside me, Christ to win me,
Christ to comfort and restore me,
Christ beneath me, Christ above me,
Christ in quiet, Christ in danger,
Christ in hearts of all that love me,
Christ in mouth of friend and stranger.
	 ~ 	5 
. Christ mbra me nkyɛn, ɔntsena mo mu,
Christ ndzi m'ekyir, ondzi m'enyim,
Christ ndzi me nkyɛn, ondzi mo do;
Christ nkyekye mo werɛ, nhyɛ m' dzen,
Christ wɔ m'ase, wɔ m'etsifi
Christ wɔ asomdwee nye mbusu mu,
Christ wɔ akoma a wɔdɔ m' mu
Christ wɔ nyɛnko nye anana anomu.

MHB 392
6 . I bind unto myself the Name,
The strong name of the Trinity,
By invocation of the same,
The Three in One, and One in Three,
Of whom all nature hath creation,
Eternal Father, Spirit, Word.
Praise to the Lord of my salvation:
Salvation is of Christ the Lord.
		Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Medze Dzin no kyekyer moho,
Ɔkorsa Dzin a ɔyɛ dzen,
Na mobɔ dzin noara mefrɛ
Ɔkorsa Nyame, Baasa kor,
Bɔadze a ɔbɔɔ adze nyina,
Ɔdomankoma Egya, Sunsum, Asɛm,
Ayɛyi nka mo Wura Agyenkwa,

MHB 393
1 . Give my heart to Thee,
O Jesus most desired;
And heart for heart the gift shall be,
For Thou my heart hast fired.
Thou hearts alone wouldst move,
Thou only hearts dost love;
	 ~ 	1 . MEDZE m'akoma ma Wo,
O Jesus a yɛpɛ W'!
Akoma nye akyɛdze no,
Ɔwo abɔ me kra hyew;
Ɔwo nko na puhim akoma,
Ɔwo nko na edɔ akoma
     M'bɔdɔ Wo dɛ mbrɛ edɔ me,
     O Jesus a yɛpɛ W'!
Wo nye me kra sumabew.

MHB 393
2 . I would love Thee as Thou lov’st me,
O Jesus most desired.
What offering can I make,
Dear Lord, to love like Thine;
That Thou, the Word, didst stoop to take
A human form like mine?
Give Me thy heart, my son“:
Lord, Thou my heart hast won;
	 ~ 	2 
. Afɔr bɛn na mo mbɔ
Mfa ndɔ W' dɛ mbrɛ etse?
Dɛ Ɔwo Asɛm n' brɛɛ adze faa
Nyimpadua dɛ emi medze;
'See m' dɛ fa w' akoma ma m',
Ewuradze, medze ma W'.

MHB 393
3 . Here finds my heart its rest,
Repose that knows no shock,
The strength of love that keeps it blest
In Thee, the riven Rock.
My heart, as girt around,
Her citadel hath found;	 ~ 	3 
. M'akoma enya ahomgye ha,
Ahomgye a ɔhaw nnyi m',
Ɔdɔ 'hoɔdzen a nhyira wɔ mu,
Wo, Botan a wɔapaa,
Na etwa moho ehyia,

MHB 394
1 . Just as I am, Thine own to be,
Friend of the young, who lovest me,
To consecrate myself to Thee,
O Jesus Christ, I come.
	 ~ 	1 . Mbrɛ metse yi ara, menyɛ Wodze, 
Mbofra adamfo a edɔ m',
Meretsew moho ama W', ntsi,
O Jesus Christ, maba.

MHB 394
2 . In the glad morning of my day,
My life to give, my vows to pay,
With no reserve and no delay,
With all my heart I come.
	 ~ 	2 
. Adzekyee pa akye m' yi, medze 
Mo nkwa ma, mufua me nsewdzim'
Mennkam hwee do, merenyɛ ekyim,
Medze m'akoma nyinaa aba.

MHB 394
3 . I would live ever in the light,
I would work ever for the right;
I would serve Thee with all my might;
Therefore, to Thee I come.
	 ~ 	3  
. Mebɛtsena Wo kan mu daa, 
Mebɛyɛ dza ɔtsen dabaa;
Medze m'ahom nyina bɔsom Wo,
Ntsi na maba wo hɔ 'i.

MHB 394
4 . Just as I am, young, strong, and free,
To be the best that I can be
For truth, and righteousness, and Thee,
Lord of my life, I come.	 ~ 	4 
. Mbrɛ metse yi ara, ahom wɔm' yi, 
Mepɛ maayɛ dansewa mapa
Wɔ nokwar na tsenenee ho ntsi
Mo nkwa Wura, maba.

MHB 395
1 . SAVIOUR, while my heart is tender,
I would yield that heart to Thee;
All my powers to Thee surrender,
Thine, and only Thine to be.
	 ~ 	1 . Ber a m'akoma yɛ mberɛw yi, 
M'Agyenkwa, migyaam' ma Wo;
M'ahoɔdzen nyina wɔ Wo nsam',
Ma ɔnyɛ Wo nko Wodze.
Ma Wo suban mbra mo do.	 Amen.

MHB 395
2 . Take me now, Lord Jesus, take me;
Let my youthful heart be Thine;
Thy devoted servant make me;
Fill my soul with love divine.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mo Wura Jesus, gye m' seseiara, 
Fa W'adom gya m'kwan nyinaram'
Ma menyɛ akowaa pa mma Wo
Na Nyame dɔ nhyɛ me ma.

MHB 395
3 . Send me, Lord, where Thou wilt send me,
Only do Thou guide my way;
May Thy grace through life attend me,
Gladly then shall I obey.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, mbrɛ epɛ n' soma m', 
Na mbom Woara kyerɛ me kwan;
Fa W'adom gya m' kwan nyinaram'
Na meetsie Wo enyigyem'.

MHB 395
4 . Let me do Thy will or bear it;
I would know no will but Thine:
Shouldst Thou take my life or spare it,
I that life to Thee resign.
	 ~ 	4 
. Dza m'bɛyɛ, dza ɔbɛba mo do, 
Ma omfir Wo nko Wo pɛm';
Iyi mo nkwa o, edze kyɛ m' o,
Mo nkwa no Woara Wodze a.

MHB 395
5 . Thine I am, O Lord, for ever
To Thy service set apart;
Suffer me to leave Thee never,
Seal Thine image on my heart.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Medze moho ma W' afebɔɔ, 
Mowɔ hɔ ma Wo som nko;
Mma mimmfi Wo nkyɛn ara da;

MHB 396
1 . LORD, in the fullness of my might,
I would for Thee be strong:
While runneth o’er each dear delight,
To Thee should soar my song.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, medze m'ahoɔdzen
Begyina ama Wo;
Ber a mowɔ enyigye mu yi,
Mo ndwom bɔfow ama W'.
Wo ahyɛse n' ho nnka!

MHB 396
2 . I would not give the world my heart,
And then profess Thy love;
I would not feel my strength depart,
And then Thy service prove.
	 ~ 	2 
. Meremmfa m'akoma mma wiadze,
Na m'ano akyerɛ Wo dɔ;
Moronnhwer m'ahoɔdzen ana 
Mayɛ W'edwuma no.

MHB 396
3 . I would not with swift-wingèd zeal
On the world’s errands go,
And labour up the heavenly hill
With weary feet and slow.
	 ~ 	3 
. Meremmfa ahoɔdzen mmper koraa
Mmfa wiadze akwan do,
Na medze mberɛwyɛ maafow
Ɔsor kokwaa n' nyaanyaa.

MHB 396
4 . O not for Thee my weak desires,
My poorer, baser part!
O not for Thee my fading fires,
The ashes of my heart!
	 ~ 	4 
. O meremmfa me pɛ tantan n'!
Dza ɔwɔ mo mu a ɔmmfata
Nye me gya a orudum no,
M'akoma mu nso mma W'!

MHB 396
5 . O choose me in my golden time,
In my clear joys have part!
For Thee the glory of my prime,
The fullness of my heart!
	 ~ 	5 
. O fa me ber a mesi nsifor
Nya me dɛw mu kyɛfa!
Nkyɛ medze enyimnyam ber yi,
Na m'akoma aama Wo!

MHB 396
6 . I cannot, Lord, too early take
The covenant divine;
O ne’er the happy heart may break
Whose earliest love was Thine !	 ~ 	6 
. O Ewuradze ahyɛmu krɔnkrɔn n',
Munnkotum afa n' sesei;
Mma dɛw akoma a medze dɔɔ

MHB 397
1 . LORD of life and King of Glory,
Who didst deign a child to be,
Cradled on a mother’s bosom,
Throned upon a mother’s knee:
For the children Thou hast given
We must answer unto Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . N-KWA Wura, enyimnyam Hen,
’Gyee too W’ do bɛyɛɛ abofra a
Wͻboabaa W’ ͻbaatan bo mu,
Edaa ͻbaatan serɛ do:
Mbofra a dze ama hɛn ntsi
Yɛwͻ anoyi bi ma W’.
Yeenya hͻn ho enyigye.

MHB 397
2 . Since the day the blessed mother
Thee, the world’s Redeemer, bore,
Thou hast crowned us with an honour
Women never knew before;
And, that we may bear it meetly,
We must seek Thine aid the more.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ofi ber a Ͻbaatan Siarfo n’
Woo Wo wiadze Pomfo no,
Asoa hɛn enyidzi ahenkyɛw a
Abaatan  nnhun n’ saso pɛn;
Yɛannhwehwɛ Wo mboa dzendzen a,
Dɛm enyidzi ’i bɛyɛ kwa.

MHB 397
3 . Grant us, then, pure hearts and patient,
That, in all we do or say,
Little souls our deeds may copy,
And be never lead astray;
Little feet our steps may follow
In a safe and narrow way.
	 ~ 	3 
. Dom hɛn akoma pa nye abotar,
Ma dza yɛyɛ, yɛka nyina
Mbofra aahwɛ ho eesua yɛ,
Mma wͻanntͻ gon ara da;
Wͻaahwɛ hɛn nantsew na woeesua
Anantsew kwan tséaba n’ mu.

MHB 397
4 . When our growing sons and daughters
Look on life with eager eyes,
Grant us then a deeper insight,
And new powers of sacrifice:
Hope to trust them, faith to guide them,
Love that nothing good denies.
	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ mbofra a woesi nsifor yi
’Bra yɛ fɛw hͻn enyi do a,
Dom hɛn awofo yi nyansa,
Nye afͻrbͻ fofor adwen:
Enyidar, gyedzi m’ akwankyérɛ,
Ͻdͻ a onnsiw ndzepa kwan.

MHB 397
5 . May we keep our holy calling
Stainless in its fair renown,
That, when all the work is over,
And we lay the burden down,
Then the children Thou hast given
Still may be our joy and crown.	 ~ 	5 
. Dwuma a afrɛ hɛn wͻ ho yi,
Ma yendzi do pɛpɛɛpɛr,
Ama yeewie dwuma yi dzi n’,
Na hɛn berɛ nyina abͻ adze n’,
Mbofra a edze maa hɛn no.

MHB 398
1 . When Thy soldiers take their swords,
When they speak the solemn words,
When they kneel before Thee here,
Feeling Thee, their Father, near:
These Thy children, Lord, defend,
To their help Thy Spirit send.
	 ~ 	1 . SƐ Wo nsordaafo bɔ ntoa,
Wɔka ntam na wosua a,
Sɛ wobu ntwɛr W'enyim ha,
Tse nka dɛ Egya bɛn hɔn a;
Ewuradze, bɔ W' mba ho ban,
Fa Wo Sunsum brɛ hɛn mboa.
Wondzi nokwar nkɔ ewiei.

MHB 398
2 . When the world’s sharp strife is nigh,
When they hear the battle- cry,
When they rush into the fight,
Knowing not temptation’s might:
These Thy children, Lord, defend,
To their zeal Thy wisdom lend.
	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ wiadze nkodzen bɛn a,
Wɔtse akodzi bi nka a,
Ma wɔkɔ ko ɔhar mu a,
Wobu nsɔhwɛ adzeba a,
Ewuradze, bɔ W' mba ho ban,
Dom hɔn nyansa wɔ nsiyɛ m'.

MHB 398
3 . When their hearts are lifted high
With success or victory,
When they feel the conqueror’s pride-
Lest they grow self- satisfied-
These Thy children, Lord, defend,
Teach their souls to Thee to bend.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ hɔn akoma ridzi dɛw
Wɔ konyim anaa enyigye mu,
Ma wɔyɛ ahantan a,
Mma wɔannyɛ bɔnnyiafyɛfo n',
Ewuradze, bɔ W' mba ho ban,
Kyerɛ hɔn ma wɔmbɛn Wo daa.

MHB 398
4 . When the vows that they have made,
When the prayers that they have prayed,
Shall be fading from their hearts;
When their first warm faith departs:
These Thy children, Lord, defend,
Keep them faithful to the end. Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Ber a hɔn nsew a woedzi,
Ber a hɔn mpaa a wɔabɔ
Bɛpa efi hɔn akoma mu n';
Ber a hɔn gyedzi bɛpa n',
Ewuradze, bɔ W' mba ho ban,

MHB 399
1 . WHAT shall I render to my God
For all his mercy’s store?
I’ll take the gifts he hath bestowed,
And humbly ask for more.
	 ~ 	1 . 'BƐN na memfa mma me Nyame
Wɔ N'ehumbɔbɔr ntsi?
M'bɛfa akyɛdze a ɔdze ama me n'
Na maserɛ N' fofor so.
Na yɛatow sor ndwom no.

MHB 399
2 . The sacred cup of saving grace
I will with thanks receive,
And all his promises embrace,
And to his glory live.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nkwagye adom kuraba krɔnkrɔn n',
Medze ndaase bɛgye,
Na m'bosuo N'anohoba m' dzen,
Na matsena N'enyimnyam m'.

MHB 399
3 . My vows I will to his great name
Before his people pay,
And all I have, and all I am,
Upon his altar lay.
	 ~ 	3 
. M'botua m'anohobadze no
Wɔ No nkorɔfo enyim,
Na dza mowɔ, na mbrɛ metse n',
Medze bɔ afɔr ma No.

MHB 399
4 . Thy lawful servant, Lord, I owe
To thee whatever is mine,
Born in thy family below,
And by redemption Thine.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ewuradze, W'akowaa pa nye me;
Dza mowɔ nyina Wodze a;
Wɔawo m' ato W'ebusua mu,
Na apon m' ayɛ Wodze.

MHB 399
5 . Thy hands created me, thy hands
From sin have set me free,
The mercy that has loosed my bands
Has bound me fast to thee.
	 ~ 	5 
. Wo nsa na ɔyɛɛ m', Wo nsa so na
Oeyi m' efi bɔn mu;
Ehumbɔbɔr a ɔgyee me n';
Adwer m' dzen wɔ Wo mu.

MHB 399
6 . The God of all-redeeming grace
My God I will proclaim,
Offer the sacrifice of praise,
And call upon his name.
	 ~ 	6 
. Nyame a ɔyɛ Pomfo, Domfo n',
Me Nyame a, mepaa m' ka;
M'bɔbɔ No ayɛyi afɔr,
Na afei m'bɔbɔ Ne dzin.

MHB 399
7 . Praise him, ye saints, the God of love,
 Who has my sins forgiven,
Till, gathered to the church above,
We sing the songs of heaven.	 ~ 	7 
. Adɔe Nyame a ɔdze m' ho akyɛ me n',
'Hotsewfo nyi N' ayɛw;
Kɛpem dɛ wɔaboa hɛn ano,

MHB 4
1 . From all that dwell below the skies 
 Let the Creator’s praise arise: 
 
 Hallelujah !
 
 Let the Redeemer’s name be sung 
 Through every land, by every tongue.
 
 Hallelujah ! 
	 ~ 	1 . WI n‘ase a ɔno dze nyina
Mma Bɔfo n‘ N'ayɛyi mfow sor: 
	Hallejuia !

Gyirama biara ntow Pomfo n'
Ne dzin ho ndwom wo beebiara:
	Halleluja !

MHB 4
2 . Eternal are Thy mercies, Lord; 
 Eternal truth attends Thy word: 
 
 Hallelujah !

 Thy praise shall sound from shore to shore, 
 Till suns shall rise and set no more. 
 
 Hallelujah !	 ~ 	2 . Nyame, W’ehumbɔbɔr tsim daa;
Onnyiewiei nokwar dwir W'asɛm: 
	Hallelujah!

W‘ayɛyi bɛgyegye mbea nyina,
Kɛpem dɛ ewia nnkɔtɔ bio:
	Halleluia!

MHB 40
1 . WE give immortal praise
To God the Fathers love,
For all our comforts here,
And better hopes above.
He sent his own eternal Son,
To die for sins that man had done.
	 ~ 	1 . YƐDZE daa ayɛyi
Ma Nyame Egya n' dɔ,
Hɛn ahotɔ wɔ ha,
Na enyidar pa wɔ sor.
Ɔsomaa No domankoma Ba,
Dɛ ombowu mma nyimpa n' bɔn.

MHB 40
2 . To God the Son belongs
Immortal glory too,
Who bought us with His blood
From everlasting woe;
And now He lives, and now He reigns,
And sees the fruit of all His pains.
	 ~ 	2 . Daa daa enyimnyam nka
Nyankopɔn Ne Ba no,
Nyia ofi daa yaw mu
 Ɔdze N' bɔgyaa tɔɔ hɛn;
Ɔtse ase afei, na odzi hen,
Na ohu Ne yaw nyina ho mfaso.

MHB 40
3 . To God the Spirit’s name
Immortal worship give,
Whose new-creating power
Makes the dead sinner live.
His work completes the great design,
And fills the soul with joy divine.
	 ~ 	3 . Nyame Sunsum dzin no
Na yɛsɔr no daa daa,
Nyia No tum fofor no
Ma tsease-ewu nya nkwa.
N'eduma wie nhyehyɛɛ kɛse n',
Na ɔma ɔkra nya enyigye.

MHB 40
4 . Almighty God, to Thee
Be endless honours done,
The undivided Three,
And the mysterious One.
Where reason fails, with all her powers,
There faith prevails and love adores.
	 ~ 	4 . 'Tumfo Nyame, yɛdze 
'Nyidzi a ɔmmbɔ adze ma W',
Baasa a wɔnnkyɛ mu no,
Baako a ɔyɛ nwanwa n'.
Sɛ adwen nntse biribi ase a,
Hɔ na gyedzi na dɔ dzi nyim.

MHB 400
1 . TAKE my life, and let it be
Consecrated, Lord, to Thee.
Take my moments and my days;
Let them flow in ceaseless praise.
	 ~ 	1 . Gye me bra, mo Wura, na ma  
Muntu nhyɛ Wo nsa koraa.
Gye me mber na ma me ndafua; 
Memfa nyi W' ayɛw daa daa.
M'bɛyɛ Wo nko Wodze daa.

MHB 400
2 . Take my hands, and let them move
At the impulse of Thy love.
Take my feet, and let them be
Swift and beautiful for Thee.
	 ~ 	2  
. Gye me nsa na ma ɔnyɛ 
Dza Wo dɔ nko bɛkyerɛ.
Gye m'anan na ma no ho 
Ɔnyɛ har, fɛɛfɛw mma Wo.

MHB 400
3 . Take my voice, and let me sing
Always, only, for my King.
Take my lips, and let them be
Filled with messages from Thee.
	 ~ 	3  
. Gye me ndze na ma daa daa 
Montow ndwom mma Woara.
Gye m'anofamfa na ma 
Ɔnhyɛ Wo nsɛmpa ara ma.

MHB 400
4 . Take my silver and my gold;
Not a mite would I withhold.
Take my intellect, and use
Every power as Thou shalt choose.
	 ~ 	4  
. Gye mo dwɛɛtɛɛ na sika: 
No mu wen mpo mennkɛfa.
Gye m 'adwen fa m'ahoɔdzen 
Yɛ dza Woara ehwɛ a ɔtsen.

MHB 400
5 . Take my will, and make it Thine;
It shall be no longer mine.
Take my heart, it is Thine own;
It shall be Thy royal throne.
	 ~ 	5  
. Gye me pɛ, yɛ n' Wodze nwiom: 
Ɔnnyɛ medze  ara bio.
Gye m'akoma,-Wodze ampa: 
Medze bɛyɛ W'ahengua.

MHB 400
6 . Take my love; my Lord, I pour
At Thy feet its treasure store.
Take myself, and I will be
Ever, only, all for Thee.	 ~ 	6  
. Gye mo dɔ, m'Ewuradze; 
Muhue gu W'ananadze.
Gye m'adzeadze nyinara;

MHB 401
1 . GOD’S trumpet wakes the slumbering world:
Now each man to his post!
The red cross banner is unfurled:
Who joins the glorious host?
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME abɛn nyan wiadze a ɔada;
'Biara ngyina n' dzibew ho!
Frankaa memen no rinyam o!
Woana dɔm 'nyimdzifo n'?
Ka atɔfo kuw no ho.

MHB 401
2 .  He who, in fealty to the truth,
And counting all the cost,
Doth consecrate his generous youth
He joins the noble host.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Nyia ɔgye nokwar no to mu,
Na obu ho nkontaa no,
Na ɔdze n' babun nyina ma no
Dɔm 'nyimnyam kuw no ampa.

MHB 401
3 . He who, no anger on his tongue,
 Nor any idle boast,
Bears steadfast witness against wrong
He joins the sacred host.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyia ɔnnka ebufuwsɛm no,
Na orunntuw noho no,
Na ɔkō tsia bɔn enyiber do n'
Na ɔdɔm krɔnkrɔn kuw no.

MHB 401
4 . He who, with calm undaunted will,
 Ne’er counts the battle lost,
But, though defeated, battles still
He joins the faithful host.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Nyia ɔkõ kɔ n'enyim daa nyina n',
Nnyim ɔkogu n'adzeban;
Ɔhwe ase mpo a ɔsoɛr na
Ɔkā nokwar kuw n' ho.

MHB 401
5 . He who is ready for the cross,
 The cause despised loves most,
And shuns not pain or shame or loss
He joins the martyr host.	 ~ 	5 
. Nyia ɔayɛ krado soa mbeamudua,
Dza ayɛ nkorɔfo ekyiwadze n',
Yaw, enyimguase nnyɛ n' asɛm n'

MHB 402
1 . FATHER of our fathers, living still 
In spite of dungeon, fire and sword,
O how our hearts beat high with joy 
Whene’er we hear that glorious word.

    Faith of our fathers! Holy faith !
    We will be true to Thee till death.
 	 ~ 	1 . HԐN egyanom gyedzi tsé ase daa,
Woennsuro ‘fiadze, ‘gya nye nkrantsee
O hɛn akoma dzi ehurusi 
Ber biara a yɛbɛtsé asɛm no.
     Hɛn egyanom gyedzi yɛ krͻnkrͻn,
     Yebosuo m ' dzen dzé ekesi wu m’.
Yɛdzé ayamuyie na abrabͻ pa.

MHB 402
2 .  Our fathers, chained in prisons dark,
Were still in heart and conscience free;
And blest would be their children’s fate,
Though they, like them, should die for thee.
	 ~ 	2 
. Egyanom daa ‘fiadze sunkamm m‘,
Naaso hͻn tsibowa emmbu hͻn fͻ;
Na nhyira bɛka hͻn mba so,
Dɛ hͻn so bowu dɛm ama W'.

MHB 402
3 . Faith of our fathers! God’s great power
Shall win all nations unto thee;
And through the truth that comes from God
Mankind shall then be truly free.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hɛn egyanom gyedzi! Nyame tum
Bɛgyé aman nyina ama Wo;
Nokwar a ofi Nyame hͻ m’ na
Aman nyina benya ahotͻ.

MHB 402
4 . Faith of our fathers we will love 
Both friend and foe in all our strife,
And preach thee, too, as love knows how,
By kindly words and virtuous life: 	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn egyanom gyedzi! Yɛbͻdͻ
Adͻfo nyé atamfo nyina;
Yɛbɛka W' ho asɛm wͻ dͻ mu,

MHB 403
1 . MY heart is fixed, eternal God,
Fixed on Thee:
And my immortal choice is made:
         Christ for me.
He is my prophet, priest, and king,
Who did for me salvation bring;
And while I’ve breath I mean to sing:
          Christ for me.
	 ~ 	1 . BƐKYEBO Nyame, m'akoma
Tsim Wo do;
Masan m' eyi apɛdze afebɔɔ;
Christ yɛ m' dze,
Ɔno nye mo Sɔfoe na m' Hen,
Ɔno na ɔdze mo nkwagye bae;
Ber a mugu a hom yi m' bɔtow;
Christ yɛ m' dze.
Christ yɛ m'dze.

MHB 403
2 . In Him I see the Godhead shine;
Christ for me.
He is the majesty Divine;
Christ for me.
The Father’s well-beloved Son,
co-partner of His royal throne,
Who did for human guilt atone;
            Christ for me.
	 ~ 	2 
. No m' muhu Nyametsir ne hyerɛn;
Christ yɛ m'dze,
Ɔno nye Ɔhempɔn Krɔnkrɔn no;
Christ yɛ m'dze,
Egya No Dɔba a ɔdɔ No,
Nyia ɔnye No bɔ mu dzi Hen,
Nyia ɔbɔɔ werdam maa adasa;
Christ yɛ m'dze.

MHB 403
3 . In pining sickness, or in health,
Christ for me.
In deepest poverty or wealth,
Christ for me.
And in that all-important day,
When I the summons must obey,
And pass from this dark world away,
                Christ for me.	 ~ 	3 
. Yarba mu nye ahoɔdzen mu,
Christ yɛ m'dze,
Ohia na ahonya mu so
Christ yɛ m'dze,
Na dɛm dapɔn da nyina mu,
Ber a mibenya mo sor frɛ no,
M'befi sum wiadze yi mu no,

MHB 404
1 . HOW blest is life if lived for Thee,
My loving Saviour and my Lord:
No pleasures that the world can give
Such perfect gladness can afford.
 	 ~ 	1 . MO Wura, ɔbra a wɔbɔ 
Ma Wo no ɔyɛ nhyira pii;
Ɔkyɛn enyigye biara a
Wiadze yi botum dze ama.
Na W'enyim hyerɛn ehyira me.

MHB 404
2 . To know I am Thy ransomed child,
Bought by Thine own most precious blood.
And from Thy loving hand to take
 With grateful heart each gift of good;
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔma muhu dɛ meyɛ W' ba a
Edze W' bɔgyaa soronko atɔ m',
Na Wo nsamu nko na medze
Ndaase gye akyɛdze pa biara.

MHB 404
3 . All day to walk beneath Thy smile,
Watching Thine eye to guide me still,
To rest at night beneath Thy care,
Guarded by Thee from every ill;
	 ~ 	3 
. Menam W'enyimtsewee mu daa,
W'enyi n amedze hwɛ m'akwan m';
Anafua nda m' 'Wo na hwɛ m' do,
Na kora me fi mbusu mu.

MHB 404
4 . To feel that though I journey on
 By stony paths and rugged ways,
Thy blessed feet have gone before,
And strength is given for weary days.
	 ~ 	4 
. Akwan aboabo nyina mu,
Mobɔ mbɔdzen dze kɔ m'enyim;
Wo nhyira anamɔn dzi m'enyim,
Ɔma m' ahoɔdzen wɔ 'bra nda m'.

MHB 404
5 . Such love shall ever make me glad,
Strong in Thy strength to work or rest,
Until I see Thee face to face,
And in Thy light am fully blest.	 ~ 	5 
. Dɛm dɔ yi ma m'enyigye daa,
Nye ahoɔdzen a medze som Wo,
Kodua dɛ mubohu W'enyim,

MHB 405
1 . GOD be in my head,
And in my understanding;
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME, tsena me tsir m'
Ɔnye me ntseasee so mu.
Nye ber a m'befi wiadze.  Amen.

MHB 405
2 . God be in mine eyes,
And in my looking;
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyame, tsena m'enyiwa m'
Nye m'adzehwɛ mu.

MHB 405
3 . God be in my mouth,
And in my speaking;
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyame, tsena m'anomu 
Nye me kasaa mu.

MHB 405
4 .  God be in my heart,
And in my thinking;
	 ~ 	4 
. Nyame, tsena m'akoma m'
Nye m'adwen so mu.

MHB 405
5 .  God be at mine end,
And at my departing.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Nyame mbra m'ewiei mu,

MHB 406
1 . MY God, I am Thine;
What a comfort divine,
What a blessing to know that my Jesus is mine!
In the heavenly Lamb
Thrice happy I am,
And my heart it doth dance at the sound of His name.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME, meyɛ W'dze;
Akomatɔm' bɛn a!
Nhyira bi a menya dɛ Jesus yɛ medze a!
Sor Eguambaa N' mu
M'enyi gye mprɛnsa,
Metse Ne ndze a m'akoma dzi ehurusi.
Sor hɔ wɔ Jesus No dɔ nwanwa no mu.

MHB 406
2 . True pleasures abound
In the rapturous sound;
And whoever hath found it hath paradise found.
My Jesus to know,
And feel His blood flow,
‘Tis life everlasting, ’tis heaven below.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Enyigye pa wɔ
Ne ndze dɛɛdɛw n' mu;
Nyia oenya No n' oedu Paradise ampa,
Muhu Jesus a,
Metse bɔgya n' nka,
Ɔyɛ onnyiewie nkwa na sor dɛw wɔ ase ha.

MHB 406
3 . Yet onward I haste
To the heavenly feast:
That, that is the fullness; but this is the taste;
And this I shall prove,
Till with joy I remove
To the heaven of heavens in Jesus’s love.	 ~ 	3 
. Menantsew hwiihwii
Kɔ sor aponto ase;
Ɔno nye emudzi; ne dɛw no so dze,
Mobɔsɔ mahwɛ;
M'bohu dɛ mbrɛ ɔtse,

MHB 407
1 . HOW happy are they
Who the Saviour obey,
And have laid up their treasure above.
Tongue cannot express
The sweet comfort and peace
Of a soul in its earliest love.
	 ~ 	1 . HWƐ enyigye a woenya!
Hɔn a Agyenkwa tsie hɔn,
Na wɔapɛ egyapadze egu sor,
Tegyirama nntum nnka
Ahotɔ nye asomdwee;
Ɔkra a oenya dɔ fofor ahyɛse.
Dɛ gyama Nyame emudzi ahyɛ m' ma.

MHB 407
2 . That comfort was mine,
When the favour divine
I first found in the blood of the Lamb;
When my heart it believed,
What a joy it received,
What a heaven in Jesus’s name!
 	 ~ 	2 
. Dɛm ahotɔ n' yɛ m'dze,
Ber a minyaa enyimpa n'
Wɔ Eguambaa No bɔgyaa no mu;
M'akoma gyee no dzii,
Onyaa enyigye kɛse;
Jesus nko Ne dzin mu heaven bi a!

MHB 407
3 . Jesus all the day long
Was my joy and my song;
O that all His salvation may see!
He hath loved me, I cried,
He hath suffered, and died,
To redeem such a rebel as me.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Da mu nyina Jesus
Yɛɛ me dɛw nye mo ndwom;
Nkyɛ obiara eehu No nkwage! 
Metsea m' dɛ ɔadɔ me,
Oehu amandze ewu,
Dze apon emi etuatsewnyi.

MHB 407
4 . O the rapturous height
Of the holy delight
Which I felt in the life-giving blood!
Of my Saviour possessed
I was perfectly blessed
As if filled with the fulness of God.	 ~ 	4 
. Enyigye mbordo,
Krɔnkrɔn mu enyigye a
Metsee no nkwagye - bɔgya no mu a!
M'Agyenkwa dwiir mo do n',
Minyaa nhyira mbordo,

MHB 408
1 . MY God, the spring of all my joys,
The life of my delights,
The glory of my brightest days,
And comfort of my nights.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME, me dɛw no nsunyiwa,
N-kwa a m'enyi gye ho,
M'enyigye nda mu enyimnyam,
M'anago awerɛkyekyer.
Bɛma medzi konyim.

MHB 408
2 . In darkest shades, if Thou appear,
My dawning is begun;
Thou art my soul’s bright morning star,
And Thou my rising sun.
	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ ipue sum kadoo mu a,
Na m'adzekyee ahyɛ ase,
Me kra adzekyee woraba nye Wo,
M'anapawi nye Wo.

MHB 408
3 . The opening heavens around me shine
With beams of sacred bliss,
If Jesus shows His mercy mine
And whispers I am His.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sor hyerɛn bɔ mo ho aprɔw,
Ɔdze nhyira nserɛmɛn;
Jesus kyerɛ N'ehumbɔbɔr ma m',
'Wasa dɛ Nedze nye m'.

MHB 408
4 . My soul would leave this heavy clay
At that transporting word,
Run up with joy the shining way
To see and praise my Lord.
	 ~ 	4 
. Me kra betsin owu asɛm do
Efi dɛtse yi mu,
Ɔdze enyigye na mbirika
Bokohu Ewuradze enyim.

MHB 408
5 . Fearless of hell and ghastly death,
I’d break through every foe;
The wings of love and arms of faith
Would bear me conqueror through.	 ~ 	5 
. Munnsuro hɛll na munnsuro owu,
M'bɔbɔ atamfo egu;
Ɔdɔ nye gyedzi ntsaban no

MHB 409
1 . THE glory of the spring how sweet,
The new-born life how glad;
What joy the happy earth to greet
In new, bright raiment clad.
	 ~ 	1 . NSUNYIWA ne 'nyam dɛw a ɔyɛ a!
Nkwa fofor yɛ enyigye;
Asaase dze enyigye kyia
Mfunoma a oewuna fofor.
Yɛ m'akoma 'i fofor.  Amen.

MHB 409
2 . Divine Redeemer, Thee I bless;
I greet Thy going forth:
I love Thee in the loveliness
Of Thy renewèd earth.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Foforyɛfo krɔnkrɔn, mihyira W';
Mikyia W'edzifirii;
Modɔ Wo wɔ W'ahoɔfɛw mu
Wɔ mfunoma yi ho.

MHB 409
3 . But O these wonders of Thy grace,
These nobler works of Thine,
These marvels sweeter far to trace,
These new births more divine!
	 ~ 	3 
. W'adom mu enyigye nwanwa yi,
W'ebirɛmpɔn edwuma yi
Yɛ anwanwadze a yennhu mbrɛ ofi,
Awofofor krɔnkrɔn.

MHB 409
4 . This new-born glow of faith so strong,
This bloom of love so fair,
This new-born ecstasy of song,
And fragrancy of prayer.
	 ~ 	4 
. Gyedzi awofofor kan dzendzen,
Dɔ a ɔhyerɛn fɛɛfɛw yi,
Awofofor enyigye ndwom yi,
Yɛ mpaabɔ huanhuam nwionn.

MHB 409
5 . Creator Spirit, work in me
These wonders sweet of Thine;
Divine Redeemer, graciously
Renew this heart of mine.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Sunsum Bɔfo pa, yɛ mo mu
Wo dɛw anwanwadze 'i,
Foforyɛfo krɔnkrɔn, adom m'

MHB 41
1 . GOD is a name my soul adores,
The almighty Three, the eternal One:
Nature and grace with all their powers.
Confess the Infinite unknown.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME yɛ dzin a me kra tonton,
Etumfo Baasa, Bɛkyebo n',
Abɔdze na adom, hɔn tum nyina,
Ka onnyiewiei a wonnyim No.

MHB 41
2 . Thy voice produced the sea and spheres,
Bade the waves roar, the planets shine:
But nothing like Thyself appears
Through all these spacious works of Thine.
	 ~ 	2 . Wo ndze dze po na asaase bae,
Ma asorɛkye wor na nworaba hyerɛn,
Naaso Wo ndwuma nyina mu,
Biribiara nye Wo nnyɛ pɛr.

MHB 41
3 . Still restless nature dies and grows,
From change to change the creatures run:
Thy being no succession knows.
And all thy vast designs are one.	 ~ 	3 . Abɔdze da ho ara nyin, wu,
Abɔdze gu do sesa daa;
Santsen biara nnyim mbrɛ etse,
Wo nhyehyɛɛ akɛse yɛ kor.

MHB 41
4 . A glance of Thine runs through the globe,
Rules the bright worlds, and moves their frame;
Of light Thou form’st Thy dazzling robe,
Thy ministers are living flame.
	 ~ 	4 . W'enyiwa hwɛ wiadze nyina,
Idzi wiadze a ɔhyerɛn nyina do;
Edze kan yɛ efuradze,
W'asomfo nye ogyaframee.

MHB 41
5 . How shall polluted mortals dare
To sing Thy glory or Thy grace?
Beneath thy feet we lie afar,
And see but shadows of Thy face.
	 ~ 	5 . Adasa a hɛn ho egu fi yi
Besi dɛn atow W'ayɛyi?
Yɛda W'ananadze wɔ ekyir,
Yehu W'enyim wɔ sunsum mu.

MHB 41
6 . Who can behold the blazing light?
Who can approach consuming flame?
None but Thy wisdom knows Thy might.
None but Thy word can speak Thy name.	 ~ 	6 . Woana botum ahwɛ kan no?
Woana bɛbɛn gyaframee no?
