Wo nko na inyim W'ahoɔdzen,
W'asɛm ma otum bɔ Wo dzin.

MHB 410
1 . COME, ye that love the Lord,
And let your joys be known;
Join in a song with sweet accord,
While ye surround His throne:
Let those refuse to sing
Who never knew our God;
But servants of the heavenly King
May speak their joys abroad.
	 ~ 	1 . Nyame adɔfo, hom mbra 
Mbɛda hom dɛw edzi;
Hom nsuo m' ma yɛntow ndwom dɛɛdɛw 
Ngu N'ahengua ho aprɔw.
Nyia onnyim hɛn Nyame n'
Ɔanntow bi a ɔnnyɛ hwee;
Na Ɔsor Hen nkowaa dze otwar dɛ
Wɔda hɔn dɛw edzi.
Rokɔ sor man pa n' mu.

MHB 410
2 . The God that rules on high,
That all the earth surveys,
That rides upon the stormy sky,
And calms the roaring seas:
This awful God is ours,
Our Father and our love;
He will send down His heavenly powers,
To carry us above.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyame ɔsor Hen a  
N'enyi bɔ wiadze aprɔw,
Ɔnantsew ehum do wɔ wim',
Na ɔtseam' ma po taa dzinn n'-
Dɛm Nyame yi yɛ hɛndze 
Yɛ hɛn Egya dɔfo:
Ɔbɛma sor etumfo no
Abɔsoa hɛn akɔ.

MHB 410
3 . There we shall see His face,
And never, never sin;
There, from the rivers of His grace,
Drink endless pleasures in:
Yea, and before we rise
To that immortal state,
The thoughts of such amazing bliss
Should constant joys create.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hɔ yebohu N'enyim, 
Na yɛnnkɛyɛ bɔn da;
Hɔ yɛbɔnom daa enigye
Wɔ adom esutsen mu:
Nyew, ansaana yeetu
Yɛakɔ bɛkyebo mu n',
Dɛm eyiedzi ho adwendwen
Ma hɛn dɛw ntaataado.

MHB 410
4 . The men of grace have found
Glory begun below;
Celestial fruit on earthly ground
From faith and hope may grow:
Then let our songs abound,
And every tear be dry;
We are marching through Immanuel’s ground,
To fairer worlds on high.	 ~ 	4  
. Adom-mba ehu dɛ 
'Nyimnyam hyɛ ase wɔ ha
Sor eyiedzi fi gyedzi nye 
Enyidado mu ba:
Hom mma ogya n' nsian sesei,
Na yengyaa nyinsuwa kyi;
Yɛnam Immanuel asaasem'

MHB 411
1 . HEAD of Thy Church triumphant,
We joyfully adore Thee,
Till Thou appear, Thy members here
Shall sing like those in glory.
We lift our hearts and voices
With blest anticipation,
And cry aloud, And give to God
The praise of our salvation.
 	 ~ 	1 . Konyim Asɔr n 'Ewuradze, 
Yɛdze dɛw yi Wo ayɛw;
Yɛwɔ ha yi
Yɛbɔtow ndwom
Dɛ enyimnyammufo no, 
Yɛhyɛ ase ha ara 
Ma akoma na n-dze do
Kekam'  dzendzen
Yi Nyame ayɛw 
Wɔ hɛn n-kwahosan ntsi.
Dɛ eregye hɛn akɔ sor.

MHB 411
2 . The name we still acknowledge 
That burst our bonds in sunder,
And loudly sing,
Our conquering king,
In songs of joy and wonder.
In every day’s deliverance
Our Jesus we discover;
 ‘Tis He, ‘tis He
That smote the sea,  
And led us safely over !
	 ~ 	2  
. Yɛda fona fononoo mu yi 
Na yɛnam ogya mu yi 
Yehyira Wo dɔ a
Onyim hɛn nda 
Na daa ɔdze hɛn bɛn Wo. 
Yɛbɔ hɛn nsam' dzi ehurusi 
Wɔ W' enyimtsewee no mu;
Wo dɔ a ɔmaa 
Yɛyɛɛ Wodze n'
Bɔkora hɛn wɔ Wo nkyɛn daa.

MHB 411
3 .  While in affliction’s furnace,
And passing through the fire,
Thy love we praise, Which knows our days
And ever brings us nigher.
We clap our hands exulting
In Thine almighty favour;
The love divine Which made us Thine
Shall keep us Thine for ever.
 	 ~ 	3  
. Ɔwo nye Wo nkorɔfo nam 
Ngyigye n'esuyiriim';
Ebɛn hɛn yi 
Yennkosuro
Amandzehu gyatanaa. 
Wiadze nye bɔn nye abɔnsam 
Wonnkotum esi hɛn mpa;
Yɛnam Wo do
Bɛtsew hɔn mu
Na yɛatow konyim ndwom no.

MHB 411
4 . By faith we see the glory
To which Thou shalt restore us;
The Cross despise For that high prize
Which Thou hast set before us.
And if Thou count us worthy,
We each, as dying Stephen,
Shall see Thee stand
At God’s right hand,
To take us up to heaven.	 ~ 	4  
. Hɛn gyedzi hu enyimnyam a 
Edze bɔdom hɛn bio no;ɔ
Mbeamudua n' nnyɛ hwee
Akatua pa a
Edze esi hɛn enyim ntsi. 
Sɛ ndaamba yɛbɛfata a 
Yebohu Wo dɛ Stephen
Ohun Wo wɔ
Nyame nyimfa,

MHB 412
1 . WORSHIP, and thanks, and blessing,
And strength ascribe to Jesus!
Jesus alone
Defends His own,
When earth and hell oppress us,
Jesus with joy we witness
Almighty to deliver;
Our seals set to,
That God is true,
And reigns a King for ever.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆSOM, ndaase nye nhyira
Na, ahoɔdzen nyina fir Jesus!
Jesus nkotoo\nWowaw Nedze,
Wiadze nye hɛll fetsew hɛn a,
Otumfo bɛgye hɛn nkwa,
Yɛdze dɛw dzi Wo dase,
Yɛsɔw ano dɛ
Christ nokwafo,
Odzi Ne hen afebɔɔ.
Yɛtonton Wo afebɔɔ.

MHB 412
2 .  Omnipotent Redeemer,
Our ransomed souls adore Thee:
Our Saviour Thou,
We find it now,
And give Thee all the glory.
We sing Thine arm unshortened,
Brought through our sore temptation;
With heart and voice
In Thee rejoice,
The God of our salvation.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Otumfo na hɛn Pomfo,
Hɛn kra a apon hɔn sɔr Wo;
Agyenkwa nye W',
Afei yeehu,
Yɛdze enyimnyam ma Wo,
Yɛtow W'abasadzen a
Oyii hɛn nsɔhwɛ m' ho ndwom,
Dze enyigye ndze
Dzi W' mu ehurusi,
Hɛn nkwagye Nyame nye Wo.

MHB 412
3 . Thine arm hath safely brought us
A way no more expected,
Than when Thy sheep
Passed through the deep,
By crystal walls protected.
Thy glory was our rearward,
Thine hand our lives did cover,
And we, even we,
Have walked the sea,
And marched triumphant over.
 	 ~ 	3 
. W'abasa dze hɛn edu
Beebi a hɛn enyi nnda,
Yɛatra mbrɛ nguan n'
Twaa bun no a
Nsu fadum wowaaw hɔn no;
W'enyimnyam bɔɔ hɔn nkyidɔm,
Wo nsu na ɔkataa hɛn do,
Ma hɛn so dɛm
Eetwa po no,
Aanantsew mbanyin m' atra.

MHB 412
4 . The world, and Satan’s malice
Thou, Jesus, hast confounded;
And, by Thy grace,
With songs of praise
Our happy souls resounded.
Accepting our deliverance,
We triumph in Thy favour,
And for the love
Which now we prove
Shall praise Thy name for ever.	 ~ 	4 
. Wiadze nye abɔnsam enyitan n',
Jesus aka no ahyɛ,
Na N'adom ntsi
Daa yɛtow ndwom,
Ayɛyi ndwom dze ma Wo,
Yɛagye hɛn nkwagye ato m',
W'adom ntsi yedzi konyim,
Na Wo dɔ a
Hɛn nsa aka ntsi

MHB 413
1 . WHEN all Thy mercies, O my God,
My rising soul surveys,
Transported with the view, I’m lost
In wonder, love and praise.
	 ~ 	1 . O me Nyame, sɛ me kra hwɛ 
W'ehumbɔbɔr nyina a,
Bobor nye dɔ nye ayɛyi
Ɔhyɛ mo do koraa.
Wɔdze yi W' ayɛw wie!

MHB 413
2 . Unnumbered comforts to my soul
Thy tender care bestowed,
Before my infant heart conceived
From whence those comforts flowed.
	 ~ 	2 
. Eyiedzi pii a wɔnnkan na  
Wo dɔ dze nyɛɛn me kra.
Ansaana m'abofra koma
Hun nyia 'yiedzi n' fir no.

MHB 413
3 . Through hidden dangers, toils 
       and deaths,
It gently cleared my way;
And through the pleasing snares of vice,
More to be feared than they.
	 ~ 	3 
. Esian horow, fona na wu  
Ɔpae guu foo maa me,
Na dza ɔyɛ hu kyɛn yinom-
Akɔndɔbɔn n'efir.

MHB 413
4 . Ten thousand thousand 
        precious gifts
My daily thanks employ;
Nor is the least a cheerful heart,
That tastes those gifts with joy.
	 ~ 	4  
. Akyɛdze mpempem, ɔsom bo 
Gye me ndaase daa daa,
Na W'enyi sɔ 'koma a ɔdze 
Dɛw gye dɛm akyɛdze n'.

MHB 413
5 . Through every period of my life
Thy goodness I’ll pursue;
And after death, in distant worlds,
The glorious theme renew.
	 ~ 	5 
. Mo nkwa ne mber nyinaa mu 
W'adɔe na m'bɛtaa do:
Na muwu so a, 'kyirkyir wiadzem'
M'bɔtow W'ayɛyi bio.

MHB 413
6 . Through all eternity, to Thee
A grateful song I’ll raise;
But O eternity’s too short
To utter all Thy praise !	 ~ 	6  
. Mebɛma ayɛyindwom do ama W' 
Mbersantsen mfesantsen,
Na onnyiewiei mpo yɛ tsia dɛ,

MHB 414
1 . WE thank Thee, Lord, for this f  air earth,
The glittering sky, the silver sea;
For all their beauty, all their worth,
Their light and glory, come from Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, yɛda Wo ase
Wɔ asaase, wimu nye po nyina ntsi;
Fɛw a wɔyɛ, bo a wɔsom,
Hɔn kan nye enyimnyam fir Wo.
Wo mu yaasoɛr akɔ sor fie.  Amen.

MHB 414
2 . Thanks for the flowers that clothe 
       the ground,
The trees that wave their arms above,
The hills that gird our dwellings round,
As Thou dost gird Thine own with love.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛda Wo ase wɔ nhyiren
Nye asaase do ndua nyina ntsi;
Nkokwaa abɔ hɛn adan ho aprɔw,
Dɛ Wo dɔ etwa Wo dɔm ho ehyia.

MHB 414
3 . Yet teach us still how far more fair,
More glorious, Father, in Thy sight,
Is one pure deed, one holy prayer,
One heart that owns Thy Spirit’s might.
	 ~ 	3 
. Egya, kyerɛ hɛn na yenhu
Dza ɔyɛ fɛw wɔ W'enyi do;
Edwuma kor, m-paabɔ kor,
Akoma kor a sunsum wɔ m'.

MHB 414
4 .  So,while we gaze with thoughtful eye
On all the gifts Thy love has given,
Help us in Thee to live and die,
By Thee to rise from earth to Heaven.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ yɛdze adwen to ho hwɛ
Akyɛdze a edze ama hɛn a,
Ma yɛntsena, nwu wɔ Wo mu,

MHB 415
1 . SING praise to God who reigns above,
The God of all creation,
The God of power, the God of love,
The God of our salvation;
With healing balm my soul he fills,
And every faithless murmur stills:
To God all praise and glory.
 	 ~ 	1 . TOW ayɛyi ndwom ma sor Hen,
Abͻdze nyina Nyame,
Tum Nyame na ͻdͻ Nyame,
Na Hɛn nkwagye Nyankopͻn;
Ͻdze ngo sa me kra yarba,
Ma ekyingye nyina taa dzinn:
’Yɛyi, ’nyimnyam nka Nyame.
’Yɛyi, ’nyimnyam nka Nyame.

MHB 415
2 . What God’s almighty power hath made,
His gracious mercy keepeth;
By morning glow or evening shade
His watchful eye ne’er sleepeth;
Within the kingdom of His might,
Lo! all is just and all is right:
To God all praise and glory.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Dza Otumfo Nyame ayɛ n’,
N’adom ehumbͻbͻr kora do;
Fi anapa kan kodu ewimbir,
N’enyiwa a ͻweͻn nnda da;
No tum ahenman no mu no,
Hwɛ, biribiara yɛ tͻͻtsenn:
’Yɛyi, ’nyimnyam nkza Nyame.

MHB 415
3 . The Lord is never far away,
But, through all grief distressing,
An ever-present help and stay,
Our peace and joy and blessing;
As with a mother’s tender hand,
He leads his own, his chosen band:
To God all praise and glory.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze bɛn hɛn dabaa,
Ntsi amandzehu mu no,
Ͻnye hɛn wͻ hͻ, boa hɛn daa,
Ͻma hɛn asomdwee na nhyira;
Ͻdze ’baatan nsa kora Ne mba,
Ͻgyegye No nkorͻfo taataa:
’Yɛyi, ’nyimnyam nka Nyame.

MHB 415
4 . Thus, all my toilsome way along,
I sing aloud Thy praises,
That men may hear the grateful song
My voice unwearied raises;
Be joyful in the Lord, my heart;
Both soul and body bear your part:
To God all praise and glory. Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Dem ntsi me bra akwantu nyina mu,
M’bɛtsea m’ atow W’ayɛyi,
Ma nkorofo aatse W’enyisͻ ndwom,
Me ndze rinnhihirn ara da;
M’akoma dzi Ewuradze m’ ehurusi;
Ͻkra, nyimpadua nye hͻndze:

MHB 416
1 . LIFE and light and joy are found
In the presence of the Lord;
Life with richest blessing crowned,
Light from many fountains poured
Life and light and holy joy,
None can darken or destroy.
 	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE mu na nkwa,
Kan na enyigye fi ba;
Ɔbra nhyira ahyɛ ma,
Kan a ofi nsunyiwa pii m',
Nkwa na kan na dɛw krɔnkrɔn a
Obi nntum nnsɛɛ n' ara da.
No nkowaa nsa ayɛ no do.

MHB 416
2 . Bring to Him life’s brightest hours,
He will make them still more bright;
Give to Him your noblest powers,
He will hallow all your might;
Come to Him with eager quest,
You shall hear His high behest.
	 ~ 	2 
. Fa ɔbra mber fɛɛfɛw brɛ No,
Ɔbɛma ayɛ fɛw mbordo;
Fa w'ahom kakra n' ma No,
Ɔbɛtsew w'ahoɔdzen ho;
Fa w'ehiasɛm to N'enyim,
Na ɔbɛma wo w'ehiadze.

MHB 416
3 . All your questions large and deep,
All the open thoughts of youth,
Bring to Him and you shall reap
All the harvest of His truth;
You shall find in that great store
Largest love and wisest lore.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Wo nsɛmbisa akɛse nyina,
Mbabun adwendwen nyina,
Hom mfa mbrɛ N' na hom benya
No nokwar no ho ndɔbaa;
N'ahonyadze kɛse mu n',
Hom bohu dɔ na nyansa.

MHB 416
4 . Then when comes life’s wider sphere
And its busier enterprise,
You shall find Him ever near,
Looking with approving eyes,
On all honest work and true
His dear servants’ hands can do.	 ~ 	4 
. Dɛm na ɔbra akwan nyina
Na ndwuma ahorow nyina mu,
Hom bohu No dɛ ɔbɛn hɛn;
Ɔdze enyisɔ enyi repen
Ndwuma pa nyinara so a

MHB 417
1 . COME, Thou Fount of every blessing,
Tune my heart to sing Thy grace;
Streams of mercy never ceasing
Call for songs of loudest praise.
Teach me some melodious measure
Sung by flaming tongues above;
O the vast, the boundless treasure
Of my Lord’s unchanging love!
 	 ~ 	1 . BRA, Ɔwo nhyira nsubura,
Ma m'akoma ntow W'adom ndwom;
Ehumbɔbɔr nsu a ennwew da,
Gye W'ayɛyi ndwom kɛse,
Kyerɛ me ndwom dɛɛdɛw bi no a
Sor abɔfo ndze tow no;
Ne trɛ, no war, dza ɔsom bo,
Ɔfa m'Ewuradze dɔ ho.
Fi sor abangua do sɔw ano.  Amen.

MHB 417
2 . Here I raise my Ebenezer;
Hither by Thy help I’ve come;
And I hope, by Thy good pleasure,
Safely to arrive at home.
Jesus sought me when a stranger,
Wandering from the fold of God;
He, to rescue me from danger,
Interposed His precious blood.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Mema m'Ebenezer do dɛ
Ha na aboa me ebodu;
Na mowɔ awerɛhyɛmu dɛ
Ɔwo dze m' bodu fie sɔnn;
Meyewee fii Nyame nguan mu,
Na Jesus dze me baa fie;
Ɔgyee me fii mbusu mu so,
No bɔgyaa apata mo bɔn.

MHB 417
3 . O to grace how great a debtor
Daily I’m constrained to be!
Let that grace, Lord, like a fetter,
Bind my wandering heart to Thee:
Prone to wander, Lord, I feel it,
Prone to leave the God I love;
Take my heart, O take and seal it,
Seal it from Thy courts above!    Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Medze W'adom ho kaw kɛse,
Na m'bɛdze ho kaw afebɔɔ!
Ewuradze, ma dɛm adom no
Ndwer m'akoma mfam Wo ho;
M'akoma kyimafo n', metse nka dɛ
Ɔpɛ dɛ ofi Wo nkyɛn;
Gye m'akoma, O gye sɔw ano,

MHB 418
1 . AWAKE, our souls! Away, our fears!
let every trembling thought be gone!
Awake, and run the heavenly race,
And put a cheerful courage on.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN akra, hom nyan! Hɛn suro nhera!
Ma ahopopo adwen nkɔ!
Fa enyigye nye akokodur hyɛ
Na soɛr tu sor mbirika pa n'.
Botu dɛ wɔmmberɛ afa sor kwan do.

MHB 418
2 . True, ’tis a strait and thorny road,
And mortal spirits tire and faint;
But they forget the mighty God
That feeds the strength of every saint.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ampa, ɔkwan n' kyea, nsoɛ so wɔ m';
'Dasamba totɔ bahaw wɔ m',
Naaso hɔn werɛ fir dɛ Nyame
Na ɔma ahotsewfo ahoɔdzen.

MHB 418
3 . O mighty God, Thy matchless power
Is ever new and ever young,
And firm endures, while endless years
Their everlasting circles run.
	 ~ 	3 
. O Nyame kɛse! Wo tum no
Yɛ fofor, yɛ babun daa nyina,
Na otsim hɔ so afebɔɔ,
Mbersantsen, mfesantsen nyina.

MHB 418
4 . From Thee, the over flowing spring,
Our souls shall drink a fresh supply;
While such as trust their native strength
Shall melt away, and drop, and die.
	 ~ 	4 
. Nsu a ofi Wo hɔ pem daa no
Na hɛn akra bɔnom bi daa;
Hɔn a wɔtwer hɔn ahoɔdzen n'
Bɔtotɔ bahaw ewuwu.

MHB 418
5 . Swift as the eagle cuts the air,
We’ll mount aloft to Thine abode;
On wings of love our souls shall fly,
Nor tire along the heavenly road	 ~ 	5 
. Ntsɛntsɛm tse dɛ ɔkɔr twa wimu,
Na yɛdze bodu Wo fie hɔ;
Ɔdɔ ntsaban do na hɛn akra

MHB 419
1 . HAPPY are they, they that love God,
 Whose hearts have Christ confest,
Who by His cross have found their life,
And ’neath His yoke their rest.
	 ~ 	1 . HϽN a wͻdͻ Nyame enyi gye,
Hͻn a wͻpaa m’ ka dɛ
Christ mbeamudua agye hͻn no,
Nya Ne bérɛ m' ahomgye.
Hͻn ahomka enuadͻ m’.

MHB 419
2 . Glad is the praise, sweet are the songs,
When they together sing;
And strong the prayers that bow the ear
Of heaven’s eternal King.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ayɛyi ndwom no ͻyɛ dɛw,
Sɛ wͻbͻ mu tow dzé a;
Na mpaabͻ dzendzenndzen no ntsi,
Sor Hen n’ brɛ N’aso adze.

MHB 419
3 . Christ to their homes giveth His peace,
And makes their loves His own;
But ah, what tares the evil one
Hath in His garden sown.
	 ~ 	3 
. Christ ma hon efiefi m’ ’somdwee,
Na ͻfa hͻn dͻ n’ yɛ N’dze,
Naaso hwɛ mbrɛ ͻtamfo n’ edua
Nworahaban wo n’ turo m’!

MHB 419
4 . Sad  were our lot, evil this earth,
Did not its sorrows prove
The path whereby the sheep may find
The fold of Jesus’ love.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn asɛm yɛ yaw; bͻn wiadze yi
Annda N’awérɛhow kwan a
N-gua no bɛfa do akͻ
Jesus nguankuw, mu edzi.

MHB 419
5 . Then shall they know, they that love Him,
How all their pain is good;
And death itself cannot unbind
Their happy brotherhood.	 ~ 	5 
. Dɛm na hͻn a wͻdͻ N’ bohu
Mbrɛ hͻn yaw ho siar tse;
Na owu mpo nnkoturn atsetsew

MHB 42
1 . GOD, thou bottomless abyss!
Thee to perfection who can know?
O height immense! What words suffice
Thy countless attributes to show?
	 ~ 	1 . NYAMЀ a eyɛ bùn a onnyi ase!
Woana botum ehu W’ewiei?
Nsɛm bɛn na ɔbɛkyerɛ Wo krɔn
Na akyérɛ Wo suban nyina?

MHB 42
2 . Unfathomable depths thou art;
O plunge me in thy mercy’s sea!
Void of true wisdom is my heart;
With love embrace and cover me:
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔwo nye ebùn a wonndù ase;
Fa me hyɛ W’adom po no mu!
Nyansa mapa nnyi m’akoma m’;
Fa Wo dɔ no twa mo ho hyia.

MHB 42
3 . Eternity thy fountain was,
Which, like thee, no beginning knew;
Thou wast ere time began his race.
Ere glowed with stars the ethereal blue.
	 ~ 	3 . Wo bun no wɔ hɔ fi tsetse,
Ɔtse dέ Ɔwo, onnyi ahyɛse;
Ewɔ hɔ ansaana mber kὸraa
Na nworaba reba wiadze.

MHB 42
4 . Unchangeable, all-perfect Lord.
Essential life’s unbounded sea.
What lives and moves, lives by thy word;
It lives, and moves, and is from thee.
	 ~ 	4 . Ewùradze pà a ennsesa da,
N-kwa po a onnyi ewiei,
W’asɛm ma biribiara nkwa;
Ɔtsé ase, na ofi Wo hɔ.

MHB 42
5 . Greatness unspeakable is Thine,
Greatness, whose undiminished ray,
When short-lived worlds are lost, shall shine
When earth and heaven are fled away.	 ~ 	5 . Wo kɛseyɛ onnyi kabea,
Kɛseyɛ a sɛ adasa
Wiadze, sor nà asaase twa mù a,
Ɔbɛhyerɛn kɛse daa daa.

MHB 420
1 . O WHAT shall I do my Saviour to praise,
So faithful and true, so plenteous in grace,
So strong to deliver, so good to redeem
The weakest believer that hangs upon Him.
	 ~ 	1 . O MINSI dɛn nyi m'Agyenkwa ayɛw?
Ɔyɛ nokwafo ampa; No som dɔɔ so,
Ɔyɛ Ɔgyefo na Pomfo kɛse ma
Ɔbɔbɔfo biara a ɔtwer N'adom no.
Me Hen na m'Agyenkwa bɛyɛ me fofor.

MHB 420
2 . How happy the man whose heart is set free,
The people that can be joyful in Thee;
Their joy is to walk in the light of Thy face,
And still they are talking of Jesus’s grace.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Siarfo nye nyia n'akoma atɔ ne yamu!
Nkorɔfo a wobenyi enyigye wɔ Wo mu,
Hɔn enyigye nye dɛ wɔbɛnantsew W'enyim 
Na wɔbɛka Jesus N'adom no ho nsɛm.

MHB 420
3 . Their daily delight shall be in Thy name;
They shall as their right Thy righteousness claim;
Thy righteousness wearing, and cleansed by Thy blood,
Bold shall they appear in the presence of God.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Wobenya daa ahomka wɔ Wo dzin mu,
Wɔbefa Wo tsenenee dɛ hɔn kyɛfa,
Wɔbɛhyɛ W' tsenenee na W' bɔgyaa asan hɔnho,
Na wobopue Nyame enyim akokodur m'.

MHB 420
4 . For Jesus, my Lord, is now my defence;
I trust in His word, none plucks me from thence;
Since I have found favour, He all things will do;
My king and my saviour shall make me anew.	 ~ 	4 
. M'Agyenkwa Jesus nye me bambɔ pa;
Motwer N'asɛm ntsi mirimmfi Ne nkyɛn;
Menya N'enyim enyimpa ntsi ɔbɛyɛ biribia 'a;

MHB 421
1 . I AM so glad that our Father in heaven
Tells of His love in the Book He has given:
Wonderful things in the Bible I see;
This is the dearest, that Jesus loves me.
       I am so glad that Jesus loves me,
            Jesus loves even me.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆYƐ me dɛw pii dɛ hɛn sor Egya n'
Ka No dɔ ho nsɛm wɔ Nwoma no mu;
Muhu anwanwadze wɔ Nwoma no mu,
Dza ɔsom bo koraa nye dɛ Jesus dɔ me.
    ƆYƐ me dɛw pii dɛ Jesus dɔ me,
    Jesus dɔ emi so.
Dzi dase daa daa dɛ Jesus dɔ me.

MHB 421
2 . Though I forget Him, and wander away,
Still He doth love me wherever I stray;
Back to His dear loving arms I do flee,
When I remember that Jesus loves me
	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ mo werɛ fir No na mikyinkyin mpo a,
Beebiara a m'bɔkɔ n' ɔda ho dɔ me;
Mutu mbirika san kɔ No dɔ abaw m;
Ber a mekaa dɛ saana Jesus dɔ me.

MHB 421
3 . O if there’s only one song I can sing,
When in His beauty I see the great King,
This shall my song in eternity be,
O what a wonder that Jesus loves me.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ ndwom kor pɛr mpo na m'botum atow a,
Ber a m'bohu Ɔhen kɛse wɔ N'ahoɔfɛw m';
Onnyiewiei mu na mobɔtow ndwom yi,
Anwanwasɛm ndowm dɛ Jesus dɔ me.

MHB 421
4 . If one should ask of me: How can I tell?
Glory to Jesus, I know very well;
God’s Holy Spirit with mine doth agree,
Constantly witnessing: Jesus loves me.	 ~ 	4 
.Sɛ obi bisa me a, minsi dɛm nka?
Minyim, m'bɛka dɛ enyimnyam nka Jesus;
Nyame Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn nye me yɛ adwen,

MHB 422
1 . BLESSED assurance, Jesus is mine:
O what a foretaste of glory divine!
Heir of salvation, purchase of God;
Born of His Spirit, washed in His blood.

       This is my story, this is my song,
       Praising my Saviour all the day long;
	 ~ 	1 . Siar dasedzi- dɛ Jesus yɛ medze! 
Ao, Nyame enyimnyam nkahwɛ bɛn ny' i!
Nkwagye dzifo nye m', Nyame atɔdze;
No Sunsum awo m', bɔgyaa n' ahor m'.
 
  M'asɛm na mo ndwom ara nye yi, 
  Mekamfo m'Agyenkwa adzekyee nyina.
N'ayamuyie amee m', mahera No dɔm'.

MHB 422
2 .  Perfect submission, perfect delight,
Visions of rapture  burst on my sight;
Angels descending, bring from above
Echoes of mercy, whispers of love.
	 ~ 	2  
. Ahobrɛasdze koraa, enyigye koraa, 
Ahotsetɛ epue m'enyi do wora;
Abɔfo fi sor sian ba bɔbɔ
Mbɔbɔrhu na dɔ ho amandzɛɛ.

MHB 422
3 . Perfect submission, all is at rest,
I in my Saviour am happy and blest;
Watching and waiting, looking above,
Filled with His goodness, lost in His love.	 ~ 	3 
. Ahobrɛdze koraa, ne nyina adwe, 
Menya Agyenkwam' ahomka nye siar;
Moroweɔn, rotweɔn, m'enyi tua sor;

MHB 423
1 . I’VE found a Friend; O such a Friend!
 He loved me ere I knew Him;
He drew me with the cords of love,
And thus He bound me to Him;
And round my heart still closely twine
Those ties which nought can sever;
For I am His, and He is mine,
For ever and for ever.
	 ~ 	1 . MENYA Nyɛnko; O Nyɛnko bi a!
Ɔdɔɔ me ana muruhu N';
Ɔdze ɔdɔ ahoma twee me,
Dze me kyekyeer No ho pi,
Na m'akoma ne nkyehoma a
Hweeara nnkotum atsew mu;
Meyɛ Nedze, na ɔyɛ medze,
Mbersantsen, mfesantsen nyina.
Dabi! Meyɛ Nedze daa.

MHB 423
2 . I’ve found a Friend; O such a Friend!
He bled, He died to save me;
And not alone the gift of life,
But His own self He gave me.
Nought that I have my own I call,
I hold it for the Giver;
My heart, my strength, my life, my all
Are His and His for ever .
	 ~ 	2 
. Menya Nyɛnko; O Nyɛnko bi a!
Okyii bɔgya, wui gyee me;
Nnyɛ dɛ nkwa akyɛdze ara nko,
Na mbom ɔdze Noho maa m',
Dza mowɔ nyina n' Gyefo dze a;
Musuo mu ma Ɔmafo n';
M'akoma, 'hoɔdzen, mo nkwa, ne nyina
Yɛ Nedze, Nedze afebɔɔ.

MHB 423
3 . I’ve found a Friend; O such a Friend!
All power to Him is given,
To guard me on my onward course
And bring me safe to heaven.
Eternal glories gleam afar,
To nerve my faint endeavour;
So now to watch, to work, to war,
And then to rest for ever.
	 ~ 	3 
. Menya Nyɛnko; O Nyɛnko bi a!
Wɔdze tum nyina ama No,
Dɛ ɔnhwɛ mo do akwan nyina m',
Ɔmfa me nkodu sor sɔnn,
Bɛkyebo enyimnyam wɔ ekyirkyir,
'Ma m' aperdzi m' ahoɔdzen;
Ntsi m'bɔweɔn ayɛ edwuma
Edzi ako, ahom afebɔɔ.

MHB 423
4 . I’ve found a Friend; O such a Friend,
So kind, and true, and tender!
so wise a Counsellor and Guide,
So mighty a Defender!
From Him who loves me now so well
What power my soul shall sever?
Shall life or death? shall earth or hell?
No ! I am His for ever.	 ~ 	4 
. Menya Nyɛnko; O Nyɛnko bi a!
Yamuyiefo Nokwafo!
Pomfo nyansafo, Kwankyerɛfo;
Ɔyɛ Bambɔfo kɛse!
Tum bɛn na ɔbɛtsew me efi
Nyia ɔdɔ me dɛm yi ho?
Nkwa anaa owu, asaase na hɛll?

MHB 424
1 . O BLESS the Lord, my soul!
Let all within me join,
And aid my tongue to bless His name
whose favour are divine.
	 ~ 	1 . ME kra, hyira Ewuradze!
Dza ɔwɔ m' mu nyina nka ho,
Hom mboa ma m' gyirama nhyira Ne dzin,
Ɔno a N'adom fi sor.
Nokwar na adom mae.

MHB 424
2 . O bless the Lord, my soul!
Nor let His mercies lie
Forgotten in unthankfulness,
And without praises  die.
	 ~ 	2 
. Me kra, hyira Ewuradze!
Mma N'ehumbɔbɔr nntwa m'
Dɛ erennda No ase koraa,
Na nnwu dɛ otsiafo.

MHB 424
3 . ’Tis He forgives thy sins,
‘Tis He relieves thy pain,
‘Tis He that heals thy sicknesses,
And makes thee young again.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔno na ɔdze w' bɔn kyɛ w',
Na ɔma wo ahotɔ;
Ɔno na ɔsa wo yarba,
Na ɔma eyɛ babun bio.

MHB 424
4 . He fills the poor with good,
He gives the sufferers rest;
The Lord hath judgements for the proud
And justice for the oppressed.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔma ehiafo ndzepa,
Na ɔma afonafo ahomgye;
Hɛn Wura bobu abɔn atsɛn,
Na obedzi ama abrɛfo

MHB 424
5 . His wondrous works and ways
He made by Moses known;
But sent the world His truth and grace
By His beloved Son.	 ~ 	5 
. Ɔnam Moses do yii
N'akwan ndwuma nwanwa kyerɛe;
Mbom ɔnam No Dɔba do dze

MHB 425
1 . MY God, my King, 
Thy praise I sing,
My heart is all Thine own;
My highest powers, 
My choicest hours,
I yield to Thee alone.
 	 ~ 	1 . ME Nyame Hen,
M’beyi W’ ayɛw,
M’akoma yɛ Wodze,
Mo tum nyinara,
Mber pa nyinara
Medze ma Wo nkotoo.

MHB 425
2 . My voice awake, 
Thy part to take;
My soul the concert join;
Till all around Shall catch the sound,
And mix their hymns with mine.
	 ~ 	2 
. Me ndze soɛr daa
Ye w’afamudze;
Me kra, wo so ka ho;
Kɛpem dɛ obia’ a
Bɛtse ndwom no,
Na wͻnye me atow.

MHB 425
3 . But man is weak 
Thy praise to speak;
Your God, ye angels, sing;
’Tis yours to see, 
More near than we,
The glories of our King.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Nyimpa nnyi ahom,
Dɛ ͻbͻtow W’ ndwom;
Sor abͻfo, horn ntow N’ ndwom
Hom hu hɛn Hen
N’ enyimnyam no
Kyɛn dɛ mbrɛ hɛn yehu.

MHB 425
4 . His truth and grace 
Fill time and space;
As large His honors be,
Till all that live 
Their homage give,
And praise my God with me.	 ~ 	4 
. No nokwar na
N’adom tsim hͻ;
De mbrɛ N’enyimnyam tse,
Kɛpem dɛ akra
Nyina botwa ama N’,
Nye me eyi N’ayɛw.

MHB 426
1 .  YE servants of God, 
Your Master proclaim,
And publish abroad 
His wonderful name;
The name all-victorious 
Of Jesus extol:
His kingdom is glorious, 
And rules over all.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM Nyame nkowaa,
Hom nda hom Wura edzi,
Hom mbɔ N' dzin nwanwa n'
Wɔ mbea nyinara;
Jesus konyimdzi dzin n'
Hom mma do kɛse;
N'ahendzi yɛ enyimnyam,
'Dzi adze nyina do hen.
Na dɔ a onnyi ewiei.

MHB 426
2 . God ruleth on high,
 Almighty to save;
And still He is nigh, 
His presence we have;
The great congregation 
His triumph shall sing,
Ascribing salvation 
To Jesus our King.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Nyame dzi sor hen,
Otum dɛ ɔgye nkwa;
Ɔda ho bɛn hɛn,
Yɛtse Ne nka daa;
Dɔm kukuankoma no 
'Tow konyimdzi ndwom
Aka dɛ nkwagye dzi
Wɔ hɛn Hen Jesus.

MHB 426
3 . Salvation to God, 
Who sits on the throne!
Let all cry aloud, 
And honour the Son:
The praises of Jesus ,
The angels proclaim,
Fall down on their faces, 
And worship the Lamb.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Nkwagye nka Nyame a
Ɔtse ahengua n' do!
Hɔn nyina ntseatsea m',
Nhyɛ Ba n' enyimnyam;
Jesus N'ayɛyi no,
'Bɔfo bɔ n' dawur,
Dze hɔn enyim bom famu
Sɔr Eguambaa no.

MHB 426
4 . Then let us adore, 
And give Him His right,
All glory and power, 
All wisdom and might,
All honour and blessing,
 With angels above,
And thanks never-ceasing, 
And infinite love.	 ~ 	4 
. Wɔmma yɛnsɔr No,
Mfa Nedze mma No;
Enyimnyam na tum,
Nyansa na ahoɔdzen,
Enyidzi na nhyira;
Yɛnye sor abɔfo
Nda N' ase a ɔnnsa da,

MHB 427
1 . THROUGH all the changing scenes of life,
In trouble and in joy,
The praises of my God shall still
My heart and tongue employ.
	 ~ 	1 . Ɔbra n' adandan nyina mu, 
Ahokyer nye ahotɔm',
M' akoma nye me gyirama
Beyi me Nyame ayɛw
No so bɔhwɛ hom hia.

MHB 427
2 . Of His deliverance I will boast,
Till all that are distressed
From my example comfort take,
And charm their griefs to rest.
	 ~ 	2 
. M'botuw No nkwagye ho 'kodu 
Dɛ ahokyerfo nyina
Bɔhwɛ m' enya awerɛkyekyer,
Na hɔn yaw ahera.

MHB 427
3 . O magnify the Lord with me,
With me exalt His name;
When in distress to Him I called,
He to my rescue came.
	 ~ 	3  
. O nye me nhuhor Ewuradze, 
Ma yɛntonton Ne dzin,
Mefrɛɛ No m'ahokyer mu no,
Ɔbae beyii m' fiir mu.

MHB 427
4 .  The hosts of God encamp around
The dwellings of the just;
Deliverance He affords to all
Who on His succor trust.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Nyame no dɔmtutuw twa hyia 
Atseneneefo tsenabea;
Hɔn a wɔtwer No mboa nyina 
Ɔma hɔn No nkwagye.

MHB 427
5 . O make but trial of His love;
Experience will decide
How blest are they, and only they,
Who in His truth confide.
	 ~ 	5 
. O, bra bɔsɔ No dɔ no hwɛ, 
Na woana bohu dɛ
Hɔn a wɔtwer No nokwar no,
Hɔn na wɔyɛ esiarfo.

MHB 427
6 . Fear Him, ye saints, and you will then
Have nothing else to fear;
Make you His service your delight,
He’ll make your wants  His care.	 ~ 	6 
. Ahotsewfo, hom nsuro No, 
Na hom nnkosuro hwee bio;
Hom nyɛ No som hom enyigye,

MHB 428
1 . I’LL praise my Maker while I’ve breath;
And when my voice is lost in death,
Praise shall employ my nobler powers:
My days of praise shall ne’er be past,
While life, and thought, and being last,
Or immortality endures.
	 ~ 	1 . M' beyi mo Bɔfo ayɛw nkwaber m', 
Na ber a me ndze bɛyew wum no,
Medze tum kɛse bɛkamfo N':
M'ayɛyi nda nnkotwa mu da,
Nkwa na adwen na ahom wɔ hɔ 'i,
Anaa bɛkyebo wɔ do yi.
Anaa bɛkyebo wɔ do yi.

MHB 428
2 . Happy the man whose hopes rely
On Israel’s God! He made the sky,
And earth, and seas, with all their train;
His truth for ever stands secure;
He saves the oppressed, He feeds the poor,
And none shall find His promise vain.
	 ~ 	2 
. Siarfo nye nyia n'enyidar twer 
Israel Nyame! Ɔno yɛɛ wim'
Asaase, Po, nye dza ɔwɔm' nyina:
No nokwar tsim hɔ pintsinn daa;
Ɔgye afonafo, ɔhwɛ ehiafo,
Na N'anohoba nnyɛ gyan da.

MHB 428
3 . The Lord pours eyesight on  the blind;
The Lord supports the fainting mind;
He sends the labouring conscience peace;
He helps the stranger in distress,
The widow, and the fatherless,
And grants the prisoner sweet release.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze ma furafo hu adze; 
Osuo adwen a ɔatɔ bitsim'
Ɔma tsibowa a ɔnnda asomdwee;
Ɔboa hɔho wɔ fona mu,
Kunafo nye egyanka so
Na ɔdom daduanyi fahodzi.

MHB 428
4 . I’ll praise Him while He lends me breath;
And when my voice is lost in death,
Praise shall employ my nobler powers:
My days of praise shall ne’er be past,
While life, and thought, and being last,
Or immortality endures.	 ~ 	4 
. Mibeyi No ayɛw nkwaberm' 
Na ber a me ndze bɛyew wum' no,
Medze tum kɛse bɛkamfo N':
M'ayɛyi nda nnkotwa mu da,
Nkwa na adwen na ahom wɔ hɔ 'i,

MHB 429
1 . GOD of my life, through all my days
My grateful powers shall sound Thy praise;
My song shall wake with opening light,
And cheer the dark and silent night.
	 ~ 	1 . Mo nkwa Nyame, me nda nyina m’
‘M’ahoͻdzen nyina beyi W’ ayɛw;
Mo ndwom nye anapa kan bosoɛr,
Edzi ehurusi anago sum so.
Bɛgye mbersantsen ahenkyɛw n’.

MHB 429
2 . When anxious cares would break my rest,
And griefs would tear my throbbing breast,
Thy tuneful praises, raised on high,
Shall check the murmur and the sigh
	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ adwendwem sɛɛ m’ahomgye,
Na atseetsee ma m’akoma tu a,
Mebɛma W’ayɛyi ndwom do,
Na ͻbɛbrɛ mo nkrumsi adze.

MHB 429
3 . When death o’er nature shall prevail,
And all the powers of language fail,
Joy through my swimming eyes shall break,
And mean the thanks I cannot speak.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ owu dzi hɛn do konyim
Ma kasa na tum nyina bͻ adzé a,
Dɛw bohwira me nyinsuwa mu,
Akyérɛ me ndaase kɛse no.

MHB 429
4 . But O when that last conflict’s o’er,
And I am chained to earth no more,
With what glad accents shall I rise
To join the music of the skies!
 	 ~ 	4 
. Bér a aperdzi kɛse n’ bͻbͻ adze
Ma mennda ho nnyi wiadze bio n’,
Medze enyigye ndwom no daa
Bɛka ͻsor ndwom no ho daa.

MHB 429
5 . Soon shall I learn the exalted strains
Which echo through the heavenly plains;
And emulate, with joy unknown,
The glowing seraphs round the throne.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ͻrennkyɛr na mesua ndwom bi a
Wͻtow no wͻ sor man no mu,
Na medze dɛw a onnyi kabea esua
Seraph a wͻabͻ Wo ho aprͻw n’.

MHB 429
6 . The cheerful tribute will I give
Long as a deathless soul shall live;
A work so sweet, a theme so high,
Demands and crowns eternity.	 ~ 	6 
. Na mudu béa a murunnwu da hͻ a ,
Medze enyigye bɛkamfo ndwuma a
Ͻyɛ dɛw, ma nsɛm a ͻkrͻn so

MHB 43
1 . THERE is a book, who runs may read,
Which heavenly truth imparts,
And all the lore its scholars need,
Pure eyes and Christian hearts.
	 ~ 	1 . NWOMA wɔ hɔ a ɔsɛ akenkan,
Ɔkyerɛ ɔsor nokwar,
Nkyerɛkyerɛ a nyimdzefo hia,
Na akoma a no mu tsew.

MHB 43
2 . The works of God above. below,
Within us and around,
Are pages in that book, to show
How God himself is found.
	 ~ 	2 . Nyame ndwuma, ɔsor na ase,
Etwa hɛn ho ehyia,
Dɛm nwoma no mu nsɛm kyerɛ 
Mbrɛ yɛhwehwɛ Nyame.

MHB 43
3 . The glorious sky, embracing all,
Is like the Makers love,
Wherewith encompassed, great and small
In peace and order move.
	 ~ 	3 . Wimu fɛɛfɛw a etwa hɛn ho, 
Tse dɛ Bɔadze No dɔ,
Fua aksɛse na nkakraba
Sen komm na asomdwee m'.

MHB 43
4 . One name, above all glorious names,
With its ten thousand tongues
The everlasting sea proclaims.
Echoing angelic songs.
	 ~ 	4 . Dzin bi a ɔsen 'nyimnyam dzin nyina, 
Nye ngyirama ɔpedu,
Ɔdomankoma po tsea mu,
Ɔtow abɔfo ndwom.

MHB 43
5 . Two worlds are ours: tis only sin
Forbids us to descry
The mystic heaven and earth within,
Plain as the sea and sky.
	 ~ 	5 . Hɛn wiadze ahorow ebien;
Bɔn na esiw hɛn enyi, 
Mma yennyim sor na ase esumasɛm 
Pefee dɛ po na wimu.

MHB 43
6 . Thou, who hast given me eyes to see
And love this sight so fair.
Give me a heart to find out thee,
And read Thee everywhere.	 ~ 	6 . Ama m' enyi a medze hu adze, 
Na ɔsom me bo pii;
Ma m'akoma a wɔdze hwehwɛ W',
Na munhu W' beebiara.

MHB 430
1 . JESU, Thy boundless love to me
No thought can reach, no tongue declare;
O knit my thankful heart to Thee,
And reign without a rival there:
Thine wholly, Thine alone, I am,
Be Thou alone my constant flame.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, Wo dɔ kɛse a 'wɔ ma m',
Adwen biara nnso m', gyirama nnka;
Fa me ndaase akoma fam Wo ho,
Ɔwo nkotsee na dzi do hen;
Meyɛ Wodze, Wo nkotsee dze,
Wo so yɛ me daa gyaframee.
M'bɔbɔ akoradze krɔnkrɔn n' ho ban.

MHB 430
2 . O grant that nothing in my soul
May dwell, but Thy pure love alone;
O may Thy love possess me whole,
My joy, my treasure, and my crown.
Strange flames far from my heart remove;
My every act, word, thought, be love.
	 ~ 	2 
. O mma biribiara nntsena me kra m',
Gyedɛ Wo dɔ krɔnn no nkotsee;
O ma dɔ no mfa me koraa,
Me dɛw, m'ahodze, m'ahenkyɛw;
Yi anana gyafirim fi m'akoma m',
Me nyɛe, asɛm na adwen nyɛ dɔ.

MHB 430
3 . O Love, how cheering is Thy ray;
All pain before Thy presence flies,
Care, anguish, sorrow, melt away,
Where’er Thy healing beams arise:
O Jesu, nothing may I see,
Nothing desire, or seek, but Thee.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Ao, dɔ nserɛmɛn a ema nkwagye!
Yaw nyina fi W'enyim guan koraa;
Dadwen, 'hoguan na awerɛhow kɔ,
Beebiara a W'ayarsa kan hyerɛn;
Ao Jesu! Mma munnhu hwee koraa,
Nndɔ, nnhwehwɛ hwee dɛ Wo nkotoo.

MHB 430
4 . Unwearied may I this pursue,
Dauntless to the high prize aspire;
Hourly within my soul renew
This holy flame, this heavenly fire;
And day and night be all my care
To guard the sacred treasure there.	 ~ 	4 
. Ma mintsiw 'yi dɛ memmberɛ,
Memper nkenya akyɛdze kɛse n';
Dɔnhwer bia 'a sakyer gyaframee
Krɔnkrɔn na sor gya 'i wɔ me kra m';
Mber nyina me dadwen nye dɛ

MHB 431
1 . LOVE divine, all loves excelling,
Joy of heaven, to earth come down;
Fix in us Thy humble dwelling,
All Thy faithful mercies crown:
Jesu, Thou art all compassion,
Pure, unbounded love Thou art;
Visit us with Thy salvation, 
Enter every trembling heart.
 	 ~ 	1 . NYAME dɔ a ɔkyɛn dɔ nyina,
Sor enyigye, sian asaase do;
Yɛ Wo tsenabea wɔ hɛn mu,
Ma W'ehumbɔbɔr nhyɛ ma;
Jesu, eyɛ mbɔbɔrhu nko,
'Yɛ dɔ mapa a 'nnyi mbanano;
Fa Wo nkwagye bɛsera hɛn,
Hɛn akoma pa biara mu.
'Hobow, dɔ nye ayɛyi m'.

MHB 431
2 . Come, almighty to deliver, 
Let us all Thy life receive;
Suddenly return, and never,
Never more Thy temples leave:
Thee we would be always blessing,
Serve Thee as Thy hosts above,
Pray, and praise Thee without ceasing,
Glory in Thy perfect love.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Bra, Otumfo, bra bɛgye hɛn,
Ma hɛn nyina nya W'adom;
Bra awerɛfir m', mma nnsan bio,
Mma mmfi W'asɔrfi mu nnkɔ;
Ɔwo na yebehyira Wo daa,
Yɛasom Wo dɛ sor dɔm no,
Yɛabɔ mpaa, yɛakamfo Wo daa,
Enyimnyam ahyɛ W' dɔ ma.

MHB 431
3 . Finish  then Thy new creation,
Pure and spotless let us be;
Let us see Thy great salvation,
Perfectly restored in Thee;
Changed from glory into glory,
Till in heaven we take our place,
Till we cast our crowns before Thee,
Lost in wonder, love, and praise.	 ~ 	3 
. Wie abɔdze fofor nyina yɛ,
Yɛnyɛ esiarfo a yenndzi dzɛm;
Ma yɛnhwɛ Wo nkwagye kɛse n',
Wɔakora n' sɔnn wɔ Wo mu;
Fi enyimnyam m' akɔ enyimnyam mu
Kodu dɛ yɛbɛba sor,
Dze hɛn ahenkyɛw abɛkyerɛ W'

MHB 432
1 . HARK, my soul! It is the Lord;
‘Tis thy Saviour, hear His word;
Jesus speaks, and speaks to thee:
Say, poor sinner, lovs’t thou Me?
	 ~ 	1 . Me kra, tsie! Ewuradze a; 
W'Agyenkwa na ɔrekasa n';
Tsie Ne ndze; ɔreka dɛ,
Bɔnyɛnyi, ana 'dɔ M' a?
O, ma mondɔ Wo mbordo. Amen.

MHB 432
2 .  I delivered thee when bound,
And, when bleeding, healed thy wound;
Sought thee wandering, set thee right;
Turned thy darkness into light.
	 ~ 	2 
. 'Mi na megyee w' fii mpokyerɛm', 
Meyɛɛ wo pira edur;
Eyewee n', mohwehwɛɛ wo;
Memaa wo sum daan ekan.

MHB 432
3 . Can a women’s tender care 
Cease towards the child she bare?
Yes, she may forgetful be;
Yet will I remember thee.
	 ~ 	3 
. Na ɔbaatan n'abadaa 
Befi ne ba ho ara da?
Nyew, ɔyɛ a no werɛ befir n';
Emidze, m'bɛkaa wo daa.

MHB 432
4 .  Mine is an unchanged love,
Higher than the heights above,
Deeper than the depths beneath,
Free and faithful, strong as death.
	 ~ 	4 
. Emi Mo dɔ n' ɔnndan da, 
Ɔkrɔn kyɛn ɔsor m-po,
No mu dɔ kyɛn po no bun,
Ɔyɛ dzen, ɔkyɛn owu.

MHB 432
5 .  Thou shalt see My glory soon,
When the work of grace is done;
Partner of My throne shalt be;
Say, poor sinner, lov’st thou Me?
	 ~ 	5 
. Adom wie n'edwuma yɛ a, 
Ibohu M'enyimnyam ntsɛm;
Enye M'bɛtsena M'ahenguam';
Bɔnyɛnyi, ana 'dɔ M' a?

MHB 432
6 . Lord, it is my chief complaint 
That my love is weak and faint;
Yet I love Thee, and adore;
O for grace to love Thee more.    Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. M' Ewuradze, midzi yaw dɛ 
Mo dɔ yɛ mberɛw, ɔyɛ nwin,
Naaso modɔ, W', mosɔr Wo;

MHB 433
1 . THOU hidden love of God, whose height,
Whose depth unfathomed, no man knows,
I see from far Thy beauteous light,
Inly I sigh for Thy repose;
My heart is pained, nor can it be
At rest, till it finds rest in Thee.
 	 ~ 	1 . NYAME dɔ a ihuntsa; Wo krɔn,
Wo bun, dasanyi biara nnyim;
Muhu Wo kan fɛɛfɛw n' wɔ ekyir,
Mugu Wo tsenabea ho ahom;
M'akoma ridzi yaw; onnkenya
Ahotɔ, gyedɛ ɔhom Wo mu.
M'bɔsɔ Wo dɔ ahwɛ nyɛ me pɛ.

MHB 433
2 . Thy secret voice invites me still
The sweetness of Thy yoke to prove;
And fain I would: but though my will
Seems fixed, yet wide my passions rove;
Yet hindrances strew all the way;
I aim at Thee, yet from Thee stray.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wo ndze a osuma no kɔ do frɛ m'
Dɛ monsɔ Wo kɔndua no nhwɛ;
Nkyɛ mobɔsɔ ahwɛ, naaso
Me pɛ yɛ dɛ oetsim eso okyin;
Afei ndzɛmba pii siw me kwan;
M'enyi tsim W' do, naaso mayew.

MHB 433
3 . ’Tis mercy all, that Thou hast brought
My mind to seek her peace in Thee;
Yet, while I seek but find Thee not,
No peace my wandering soul shall see:
O when shall all my wanderings end,
And all my steps to Thee-ward tend!
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔwo dze mbɔbɔrhu aba dɛ
Memfa nhwehwɛ Wo mu asomdwee,
Na mohwehwɛ Wo a, munnhu Wo;
Me kra a orikyin nnya asomdwee;
M'ekyinkyin bɔbɔ adze dabɛn?
Nkyɛ meetutu anamɔn abɛn W'!

MHB 433
4 . Is there a thing beneath the sun 
That strives with Thee my heart to share?
Ah, tear it thence, and reign alone,
The Lord of every motion there!
Then shall my heart from earth be free,
When it hath found repose in Thee.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Ana biribi wɔ ase ha a
Ɔnye Wo per m'akoma ho?
Twa kyen na Wo nko dzi mu hen,
Yɛ dza ɔwɔ mo mu nyina Wura,
Dɛm na m'akoma nya ahotɔ,
Ber a ɔhom wɔ Wo mu sɔnn.

MHB 433
5 . O hide this self from me, that I
No more, but Christ in me, may live!
My vile affections crucify,
Nor let one darling lust survive!
In all things nothing may I see,
Nothing desire or seek, but Thee!
 	 ~ 	5 
. Yi iyi fi mo mu, ama
Maatsena ama Christ nko, na
Bɔ m'akɔndɔbɔn mbeamudua m',
Mma apɛdze bɔn kor mpo nnka;
Mma monnhwehwɛ adze biara,
Eso monndɔ hwee dɛ Ɔwo.

MHB 433
6 . Each moment draw from earth away
My heart, that lowly waits Thy call;
Speak to my inmost soul, and say,
I am thy Love, thy God, thy All!
To feel Thy power, to hear Thy voice,
To taste Thy love, be all my choice.  Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Aber nyinara twe m'akoma a
Ɔtweɔn Wo, frɛ no fi wiadze;
Kasa kyerɛ me kra na ka dɛ,
Wo Dɔfo, Wo Nyame nye Me!
M'bohu Wo tum, m'bɛtse Wo ndze,

MHB 434
1 . O LOVE divine, how sweet Thou art!
When shall I find my willing heart
All taken up by Thee?
I thirst, I faint, I die to prove
The greatness of redeeming love,
The love of Christ to me.
	 ~ 	1 . ONYAME dɔ, eyɛ dɛw ae!
Dabɛn na m'bohu m'akoma
Dɛ ɔyɛ Wodze koraa?
Nsukɔm dze m', motɔ bahaw, m'wu
Dze kyerɛ Wo dɔ kɛse a ɔpon me,
Christ dɔ a ɔwɔ ma me.
M'bɛtse Ayeforkun n' ndze.

MHB 434
2 . Stronger His love than death or hell;
Its riches are unsearchable;
The first-born sons of light
Desire in vain its depth to see,
They cannot reach the mystery.
The length, and breadth, and height.
	 ~ 	2 
. No dɔ yɛ m' dzen kyɛn ''wu nye hɛll,
N'ahonya no wonnyim ano;
Asɔpɔn kan mba no
Per kwa dɛ wobohu no bun n',
Wonntum nndu esumasɛm no ho,
No war, ne trɛ, no krɔn.

MHB 434
3 . God only knows the love of God;
O that it now were shed abroad
In this poor stony heart!
For love I sigh, for love I pine:
This only portion, Lord, be mine,
Be mine this better part!
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyame nko na onyim Nyame dɔ;
O kɛtseankyɛ wɔdze aapetse
Akoma - yi mu!
Ɔdɔ ntsi misi nkrum, mepen;
Ewuradze, Wo nko yɛ m' kyɛpɛn,
Eyɛ medze a na oye.

MHB 434
4 . O that I could for ever sit
Like Mary at the Master’s feet!
Be this my happy choice:
My only care, delight, and bliss,
My joy, my heaven on earth, be this
To hear the Bridegroom’s voice!	 ~ 	4 
. Kɛtseankyɛ maatsena mo Wura 
N'ananadze afebɔɔ dɛ Mary!
'Yi nye m'enyigyedze;
M'apɛdze, m'ahomka na siar,
Me dɛw, m'ahenman wɔ ase ha;

MHB 435
1 . LOVE is the key of life and death,
Of hidden heavenly mystery :
Of all Christ is, of all He saith,
          Love is the key.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆDƆ nye nkwa na owu saafee,
Ɔyɛ esumasɛm wɔ sor;
Mbrɛ Christ tse biara, dza ɔkae,
'Dɔ nye saafe.
Na modɔ Wo.

MHB 435
2 . As three times to His saint He saith, 
He saith to me, He saith to thee,
Breathing His grace-conferring breath :
          Lovest thou Me ?
	 ~ 	2 
. Dza ɔkaa kyerɛɛ ahotsewfo n',
Ɔka kyerɛ emi na ɔwɔ so;
Ogu N'adom ahom bisa dɛ,
Ana dɔ M' a?

MHB 435
3 . Ah, Lord, I have such feeble faith,
Such feeble hope to comfort me:
But love it is, is strong as death;
             And I love Thee.	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, me gyedzi gow,
M'enyidar nntum nnkyekye mo werɛ;
Mbom Wo dɔ yɛ dzen kyɛn owu;

MHB 436
1 . IT passeth knowledge, that dear love of Thine,
My Saviour, Jesus! Yet this soul of mine
Would of Thy love, in all its breadth and length,
Its height and depth, and everlasting strength,
             Know more and more.
	 ~ 	1 . Ɔtra n-hum', Wo dɔ a ho wɔ na n' a, 
M'Agyenkwa Jesus; naaso me kra yi
Ɔpɛ dɛ ohu Wo dɔ no mbordo,
Ne trɛ, no war, no krɔn, no bun, na ne dzen
A ɔyɛ nyinaa.
Bɛyɛ mo ndwom.

MHB 436
2 . It  passeth telling, that dear love of Thine,
My Saviour, Jesus! Yet these lips of mine
Would fain proclaim to sinners far and near
A love which can remove all guilty fear,
             And love beget.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔtra n-kaa, Wo dɔ a ho wɔ na n' a, 
M'Agyenkwa Jesus; naaso m'ano yi
Pɛ dɛ dɔ a otum yi afɔdzi suro,
Na ɔwo dɔ no, ɔka kyerɛ abɔn a
Wɔbɛn, wɔtwem'.

MHB 436
3 . It passeth praises, that dear love of Thine,
My Saviour, Jesus! Yet this heart of mine
Would sing that love, so full, so rich, so free,
Which brings a rebel sinner, such as me,
            Nigh unto God.
	 ~ 	3  
. Ɔtra ayɛyi, Wo dɔ a ho wɔ na n' a, 
M' Agyenkwa Jesus; naaso m'akoma yi
Ɔwɔ dɛ ɔkamafo dɔ a ɔhye, yɛ nwanwa a
Ɔdze mara mansotwenyi epin
Nyankopɔn nkyɛn n'.

MHB 436
4 . O fill me, Saviour, Jesus, with Thy love!
Lead, lead me to the living fount above;
Thither may I, in simple faith, draw nigh,
And never to another fountain fly,
           But unto Thee.
	 ~ 	4  
. Jesus Agyenkwa, fa Wo dɔ n' hyɛ m' ma! 
Gya m' ara, gya m' kɔ nkwa nsunyiwa n' ho;
Ma montɔ nkɔ noara ho wɔ gyedzim'
Na mma da biara pɛn onnkwetsir Wo
Mmfa beebi bio.

MHB 436
5 . And then, when Jesus face to face I see,
When at His lofty throne I bow the knee,
Then of His love, in all its breadth and length,
Its height and depth, its everlasting strength,
           My soul shall sing.	 ~ 	5 
. Na m'enyi nya bɔ m' Jesus enyim ma  
Minya ahengua n' enyim kotow da bi a,
Ber n', No dɔ no mbrɛ otwa pa nyina,
Ne trɛ, no war, no krɔn, no bun, na ne dzen

MHB 437
1 . My Jesus, I love Thee, I know Thou art mine,
For Thee all the pleasures of sin I resign;
My gracious Redeemer, my Saviour art Thou,
If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, ’tis now.
	 ~ 	1 . Me Jesus, modɔ W', minyim dɛ medze nye nye W', 
Wo ntsi migyaa bɔn ho enyigye nyinara;
Mo Pomfo domfo, m'Agyenkwa nye Woara,
Me Jesus, sɛ madɔ w' da a, ɔno nye ndɛ.
Me Jesus, sɛ madɔ W' da a, ɔno nye ndɛ.

MHB 437
2 . I love Thee because Thou hath first loved me,
And purchased my pardon on Calvary’s tree;
I love Thee for wearing the thorns on Thy brow,
If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, ’tis now.
	 ~ 	2 
. Modɔ W', osiandɛ 'Wo edzi kan adɔ m' 
Na epaa kyɛw maa m' wɔ Calvary dua no do;
Modɔ Wo wɔ nsoɛ kyɛw a esoae no ntsi,
Me Jesus, sɛ madɔ W' da a, ɔno nye ndɛ.

MHB 437
3 . I will love Thee in life, I will love Thee in death,
And praise Thee as long as Thou lendest me breath;
And say when the death dew lies cold on my brow,
If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, ’tis now.
	 ~ 	3  
. Mobɔdɔ W' wɔ nkwa mu, mobɔdɔ W' wɔ wum' 
Na meyi W' ayɛw ber a edom me nkwa,
Na ber a owu-bɔw egu mo do n', m'bɛse dɛ,
Me Jesus, sɛ madɔ W' da a, ɔno nye ndɛ.

MHB 437
4 . In mansions of glory and endless delight,
I’ll ever adore Thee and dwell in Thy sight;
I’ll sing with the glittering crown on my brow,
If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, ’tis now.	 ~ 	4 
. Enyimnyam adampanm' na daa enyigyem', 
Mobɔtontom Wo na matsena W'enyim daa;
M'bɔsoa ahenkyɛw hyɛnhyɛnn no atow ndwom.

MHB 438
1 . JESU, my Lord, my God, my All,
Hear me, blest Saviour, when I call;
Hear me, and from Thy dwelling-place
Pour down the riches of Thy grace:
       Jesu, my Lord, I thee adore,
       O make me love thee more and more.
	 ~ 	1 . JESU, mo Wura, me Nyankopɔn,
M'Agyenkwa, mefrɛ a tsie me;
Fi Wo tsenabea hɔ tsie me,
Wora W'adom no gu mo do;
     JESU, mo Wura, motonton Wo;
     O ma mondɔ Wo mbordo daa.
Ɔwo Gyefo Siarfo, yɛ medze.

MHB 438
2 . Jesu, too late I Thee have sought;
How can I love Thee as I ought?
And how extol Thy matchless fame,
The glorious beauty of Thy name?
	 ~ 	2 
. Jesu, mannhwehwɛ Wo ntsɛm koraa;
Minsi dɛn ndɔ Wo dɛ mbrɛ ɔse?
Minsi dɛn mma Wo nka ntahye,
W'enyimnyam dzin a ɔyɛ fɛw n'?

MHB 438
3 . Jesu, what didst Thou find in me,
That Thou hast dealt so lovingly?
How great the joy that Thou hast brought,
So far exceeding hope or thought!
 	 ~ 	3 
. Jesu, 'bɛn na ihun mo ho
Ma akyerɛ dɔ dɛm wɔ mo do?
Dɛw kɛse a edze abrɛ m' yi,
Ɔtra enyidar na adwen koraa.

MHB 438
4 . Jesu, of Thee shall be my song;
To Thee my heart and soul belong;
All that I have or am is Thine,
And Thou, blest Saviour, Thou art mine:   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Jesu, Ɔwo bɛyɛ mo ndwom;
M'akoma na me kra Wodze a;
Dza mowɔ na meyɛ Wodze a,

MHB 439
1 . O SAVIOUR, I have naught to plead,
In earth beneath or heaven above,
But just in my own exceeding need,
And Thy exceeding love.
	 ~ 	1 . O AGYENKWA, minnyi hwee ka,
Asaase yi do anaa sor,
Ka me hia kɛse yi nko ho,
Nye Wo dͻ a onnyi kabea ’i.

MHB 439
2 . The need will soon be past and gone,
Exceeding great, but quickly o’er;
The love unbought is all Thine own,
And lasts for evermore.	 ~ 	2 
. Me hia rennkyɛr na etwa mu,
Ͻso dze naaso ͻrennkyɛr,
Dͻ a wͻnntͻ yi yɛ Wo nko dze.
Ͻwͻ hͻ afebͻͻ ara.

MHB 44
1 . THE spacious firmament on high.
With all the blue ethereal sky.
And Spangled heavens, a shining frame,
The unwearied sun from day to day,
Doth his Creator’s power display;
And publishes to every land
The work of an almighty hand.
	 ~ 	1 . WIMU tɛtɛr a ɔwɔ sor,
Ɔsor dubir fɛɛfɛw dɛm yi,
 Ɔsorsor a wɔahyehyɛ n' hyɛnhyɛnn, 
Kyerɛ hɔn abɔase kɛse no.
Ewia a osi do aber nyina,
Da no Bɔfo tum no edzi;
Na ɔma wiadze mbea nyina hu
Otumfo Ne nsaano edwuma.

MHB 44
2 . Soon as the evening shades prevail,
The moon takes up the wondrous tale.
And nightly to the listening earth
Repeats the story of her birth:
While all the stars that round her burn.
And all the planets in their turn.
Confirm the tidings, as they roll,
And spread the truth from pole to pole.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔnnkyɛr na ewimbir sum aba,
Bosoom suo anwanwasɛm n' mu,
Na anafua si n'awoo nsɛm do 
Ma asaase a oritsie,
Ber a nworaba nyina rehyerɛn;
Na odu okyinnworaba do a, 
Ber a wokyin n', wɔka asɛmpa no, 
Wɔdze nokwar n' kɔ wiadze nyina.

MHB 44
3 . What though in solemn silence all
Move round the dark terrestrial ball;
What though nor real voice nor sound
Amid their radiant orbs be found:
In reason’s ear they all rejoice.
And utter forth a glorious voice.
For ever singing as they shine:
The hand that made us is divine!   Amen	 ~ 	3 . Wimu abɔdze nyina yɛ komm 
Twa hɛn asaase ho hyia dɛn, 
Ndze anaa dede bi nnyi hɔ a, 
Obi wɔ hɔn mu a ɔtse;
Wodzi dɛw wɔ dza ɔfata ho,
Na wɔdze enyimnyam ndze paa m' ka;
Ber a wɔhyerɛn n', wɔtow ndwom daa;
Nsa a ɔyɛɛ hɛn no yɛ krɔnkrɔn!

MHB 440
1 . FAR off we need not rove
To find the God of love;
In His providential care,
Ever intimately near,
All His various works declare,
God, the bounteous God is here.
	 ~ 	1 . ONNHIA dɛ yekyin pii
Hwehwɛ ɔdɔ Nyame;
Ne hwɛ pa a ɔhwɛ hɛn ntsi,
Nkitahodzi pa no ntsi,
No ndwuma pa nyina kyerɛ dɛ
Ɔdomfo Nyame bɛn hɛn.
Ɔwo nko na yɛbɔdɔ W'.

MHB 440
2 . We live, and move, and are,
Through His preserving care;
He doth still in life maintain
Every soul that moves and lives;
Gives us back our breath again,
Being every moment gives.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛtse ase, kɔ ba a,
Na N'adom ara ntsi a;
Ɔda ho hwɛ ɔkra biara a
Ɔtse ase, kɔ na ɔba;
Na ɔdze hɛn nkwa ma hɛn bio
Ɔdze ma hɛn aber biara.

MHB 440
3 . Who live O God in Thee,
Entirely Thine should be:
Thine we are, a heaven-born race,
Only to Thy glory move,
Thee with all our powers we praise,
Thee with all our being love.	 ~ 	3 
. Nyame, nyia ɔtse Wo mu n',
Ɔnyɛ Wodze koraa;
Yɛyɛ Wodze na sor mba,
Yɛtɔ kɔ W'enyimnyam ho,
Yɛdze hɛn tum yi W' ayɛw,

MHB 441
1 . RICHES unsearchable
In Jesu’s love we know;
And pleasures, springing from the well
Of life, our souls o’erflow.
	 ~ 	1 . AHONYA mapa bi '
Wͻ Jesus No dͻ mu;
Na ndzepa fi nkwa bura n’ mu
Bobu hɛn akra do.
Na Jesus hɛn Nyɛnko.

MHB 441
2 . The Spirit we receive
Of wisdom, grace, and power;
And always sorrowful we live,
Rejoicing evermore.
	 ~ 	2 
. Sunsum a yenya no ma
Adom, nyansa, na turn;
Na yɛtse awérɛhow mu a,
Yedzi dɛw afebͻͻ.

MHB 441
3 . Angels our servants are,
And keep in all our ways,
And in their watchful hands they bear
The sacred sons of grace:
	 ~ 	3 
. Hɛn asomfo nye abͻfo;
Wͻsom hɛn akwan nyina mu,
Na wͻkora adorn mba krͻnn
Wͻ hͻn nsa a ͻweͻn mu.

MHB 441
4 . Unto that heavenly bliss
They all our steps attend;
And God Himself our Father is,
And Jesus is our Friend.	 ~ 	4 
. Wͻweͻn hɛn anamͻn nyina
Kͻ sorsor nhyira no mu;
Nyame Noara yɛ hͻn Egya.

MHB 442
1 . HAPPY the heart where graces reign,
Where love inspires the breast;
Love is the brightest of the train,
And perfects all the rest.
	 ~ 	1 . AKOMA a adom wɔ m' enyi gye
Bea a ɔdɔ hyɛ koko ma;
Ɔdɔ na ɔhyerɛn kɛse,
Na ɔma nkaa dzi mu.
Ekohu Nyame enyim.

MHB 442
2 . Knowledge, alas, ’tis all in vain,
And all in vain our fear;
Our stubborn sins will fight and reign,
If love be absent there.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyimdzee nyinara so yɛ gyan 
Na hɛn suro so yɛ gyan;
Hɛn bɔn adaaben per dzi hen,
Sɛ ɔdɔ nnyi hɔ bio a.

MHB 442
3 . ’Tis love that makes our cheerful feet
In swift obedience move:
The devils know, and tremble too;
But Satan cannot love.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔdɔ na opia hɛn anamɔn
Enyigye ahorɛadze m';
Mbɔnsam nyim na hɔn ho popo;
Mbom Satan dze onnyi dɔ.

MHB 442
4 . This is the grace that lives and sings,
When faith and hope shall cease;
’Tis this shall strike our joyful strings
In the sweet realms of bliss.
	 ~ 	4 
. Adom yi na ɔbɔtow ndwom,
Ber a gyedzi enyidar asa;
Iyi m' yɛbɔtow enyigye ndwom
Wɔ siar man dɛɛdɛw n' mu.

MHB 442
5 . Before we quite forsake our clay,
Or leave this dark abode,
The wings of love bear us away
To see our smiling God.	 ~ 	5 
. Ansaana yɛbɔpow dɛtse,
Efi sum m' akɔ sor n',
Ɔdɔ atsaban bɔsoa hɛn

MHB 443
1 . LOVED with everlasting love,
Led by grace that love to know;
Spirit, breathing from above,
Thou hast taught me it is so.
O this full and perfect peace!
O this presence so divine!
In a love which cannot cease
I am His, and He is mine.
	 ~ 	1 . WƆADƆ me ɔmmbɔadze dɔ,
Adom akyerɛ hɛn kwan;
Sunsum a ɔhom fi sor no
Akyerɛ me dɛ dɛm na ɔtse,
Asomdwee a ho tsew, dzi mu 'i,
O atsenka krɔnkrɔn yi!
Wɔ dɔ a ɔnnsa da mu,
Meyɛ Nedze, ɔyɛ medze.
Meyɛ Nedze, ɔyɛ medze.

MHB 443
2 . Heaven above is softer blue,
Earth around is sweeter green;
Something lives in every hue,
Christless eyes have never seen:
Birds with gladder songs o’erflow,
Flowers with deeper beauties shine,
Since I know, as now I know,
I am His, and He is mine.
	 ~ 	2 
. Sor ahenman mu yɛ fɛw,
Asaase ahaabun yɛ fɛw;
Fua biara biribi wɔ m',
Nyia onnyim Christ enyi nnhu n' dɛm:
Nnoma enyigye ndwom bu do,
Nyiren fɛɛfɛw a ɔhyerɛn,
Dza minyim nye dɛ sesei
Meyɛ Nedze, ɔyɛ medze.

MHB 443
3 . His for ever, only His:
Who the Lord and me shall part?
Ah, with what a rest of bliss
Christ can fill the loving heart!
Heaven and earth may fade and flee,
First-born light in gloom decline;
But, while God and I shall be,
I am His, and He is mine.	 ~ 	3 
. Meyɛ Nedze afebɔɔ;
Woana bɛtsew m' na ɔno ntamu?
Ao, nhyira bi a Christ dze bɛma
Nyimpa a wɔwɔ dɔ mapa a!
Sor na ase botwa m' akɔ,
Asɔpɔn mba kan rudum;
Menye Nyame tse ase a,

MHB 444
1 . BELOVED, let us love :
Love is of God;
In God alone hath love 
Its true abode.
	 ~ 	1 . 'Dɔfo, hom mma yɛndɔ: 
Dɔ fir Nyame;
Ɔdɔ Ne tsenabew pa 
Wɔ Nyame mu.
Ɔdɔ hɛn no.

MHB 444
2 . Beloved, let us love :
For they who love, 
They only are His sons, 
Born from above.
	 ~ 	2 
. 'Dɔfo, hom mma yɛndɔ: 
Na hɔn a wɔdɔ n',
Hɔnara nko nye Ne mba a
Hɔn awoo fir sor.

MHB 444
3 . Beloved, let us love :
For love Is rest,
And he who loveth not,
Abides unblest.
	 ~ 	3 
. 'Dɔfo, hon mma yɛndɔ: 
Na dɔ yɛ ahomgye,
Na obiara a onyi dɔ no',
Ɔnnyɛ siarfo.

MHB 444
4 . Beloved, let us love :
In love is light, 
And he who loveth not, 
Dwelleth in night
	 ~ 	4 
. 'Dɔfo, hom mma yɛndɔ; 
Dɔm' na kan wɔ,
Na nyia onnyi dɔ no,
Ɔtse sum mu.

MHB 444
5 . Beloved, let us love :
For only thus 
Shall we behold that 
God Who loveth us.	 ~ 	5 
. 'Dɔfo, hom mma yɛndɔ: 
Na dɛm nkotoo
Na yebohu Nyame a

MHB 445
1 . THEE will I love, my strength, my tower,
Thee will I love, my joy, my crown,
Thee will I love with all my power,
In all Thy works, and Thee alone;
Thee will I love, till the pure fire
Fill my whole soul with chaste desire.
	 ~ 	1 . M'BƆDƆ W' m'ahoɔdzen, m'akoban,
M'bɔdɔ W' m'enyigye, m'ahenkyɛw,
Medze m'ahoɔdzen nyina bɔdɔ W'
Wo ndwuma nyina mu; Wo nko na
M'bɔdɔ Wo akɛpem dɛ gya
Krɔnkrɔn no bɛtsew me kra ho.
M'bɔdɔ Wo akɔ onnyiewiei m'.

MHB 445
2 . Ah, why did I so late Thee know,
Thee, lovelier than the sons of men!
Ah, why did I no sooner go
To Thee, the only ease in pain!
Ashamed, I sigh, and inly mourn,
That I so late to Thee did turn.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ao, dɛn ntsi na mennhu Wo ntsɛm?
'Santsen mu ahoɔfɛw mapa!
Ɔyɛ dɛn ntsi na mammba Wo
Hɔ ntsɛm? Ɔwo a ikum me yaw!
Medze enyito su me tsirmu
Dɛ mammba Wo hɔ ntsɛm koraa.

MHB 445
3 . In darkness willingly I strayed,
I sought Thee, yet from Thee I roved,
Far wide my wandering thoughts were spread,
Thy creatures more than Thee I loved;
And now if more at length I see,
’Tis through Thy light, and comes from Thee.
	 ~ 	3 
. Megyee enyim tɔɔ gon sum mu,
Mohwehwɛɛ Wo na mifii nkyɛn;
M'adwen kyinii kɔr ekyirkyir,
Modɔɔ W'abɔdze kyɛɛn Ɔwo;
Seseiara muhu biribi,
Wo kan mu na iyi fa ba.

MHB 445
4 . I thank Thee, uncreated Sun,
That Thy bright beams on me have shined;
I thank Thee, who hast overthrown
My foes, and healed my wounded mind;
I thank Thee, whose enlivening voice
Bids my freed heart in Thee rejoice.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ewia a wɔammbɔ W', meda W'ase
Dɛ Wo kan nserɛmɛn hyerɛn mo do;
Meda Wo ase dɛ aka
M'atamfo egu, asa m'adwen yar;
Meda Wo ase dɛ Wo ndze
Ma m'akoma nya fahodzi.

MHB 445
5 . Give to mine eyes refreshing tears,
Give to my heart chaste, hallowed fires,
Give to my soul, with filial fears,
The love that all heaven’s host inspires;
That all my powers, with all their might,
In Thy sole glory may unite.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ma m'enyiwa ntaataa nyinsu,
Ma gya krɔnkrɔn mfram m'akoma;
Fa Egya ho suro ma me kra,
Ɔdɔ a ɔhyɛ sor dɔm nyina nkuran;
Ama meetum nye hɔn nyina
Abɔ m' kor ahyɛ W' enyimnyam.

MHB 445
6 . Thee will I love, my joy, my crown,
Thee will I love, my Lord, my God;
Thee will I love, beneath Thy frown,
Or smile, Thy sceptre, or Thy rod;
What though my flesh and heart decay?
Thee shall I love in endless day!	 ~ 	6 
. M'bɔdɔ W', m'enyigye, m'ahenkyɛw,
M'bɔdɔ Wo, mo Wura, me Nyame;
Wo bo fuw me mpo a, m'bɔdɔ Wo
Eyerɛw W'ano anaa Wo poma o;
Kaansa mo honam yi prɔw mpo a,

MHB 446
1 . MY God, I love Thee- not because
I hope for heaven thereby,
Nor yet because who love Thee not
Are lost eternally.
	 ~ 	1 . ME Nyame, modɔ Wo, nnyɛ dɛ
M'enyi da heaven do bi,
Anaa nnyɛ dɛ hɔn a wɔnndɔ W'dze,
Wɔayew koraa ntsi bi a.
. Yaw na atseetsee beberebe
Na amandzehu mfifir,
Na owu mpo nyina me ntsi a,
'Mi a meyɛ Wo tamfo.

. O siarfo Jesus Christ, 'bɛn ntsi
Na onnyi dɛ modɔ W' yie?
Nnyɛ dɛ m'enyi da heaven do,
Anaa m'boguan efi hɛll.

. Nnyɛ dɛ m'enyi da biribi kwan,
Anaa merepɛ akyɛdze,
Na mbom dɛ mbrɛ Ɔwo adɔ me
Ɔdɔ mbordo, Ewuradze.

. Dɛmara na mo so m'bɔdɔ W',
Na matow W'ayɛyi,
'Siandɛ Ɔwo yɛ m' dɔ Nyame,
Na me Hen afebɔɔ.

MHB 446
2 .  Thou, O my Jesus, Thou didst me
Upon the Cross embrace;
For me didst bear the nails and spear,
And manifold disgrace,
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔwo me Jesus, Ɔwo tui
Baar m' mbeamudua no do;
'Mi ntsi na egyee mprɛgow na peaa
Nye enyimguase beberee n'.

MHB 447
1 . O LOVE, who formedst me to wear
The image of Thy Godhead here;
Who soughtest me with tender care
Through all my wanderings wild and drear:
        O Love, I give myself to Thee,
        Thine ever, only Thing to be.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆDƆ a ɔmaa minyaa nyamesu
Mfonyin hyɛɛ wɔ ase ha no, 
Ɔwo a adze abaatan dɔ hwehwɛɛ m'
Wɔ m'ekyinkyin nyinara mu.
    Ɔdɔ medze moho ma Wo,
    Mebɛyɛ Wo nko Wodze daa.
'Bɛma menya asetsena pa.

MHB 447
2 . O Love, of whom is truth and light,
The Word and Spirit, life and power,
Whose heart was bared to them that smite,
To shield us in our trial hour:
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔdɔ, Ɔwo yɛ nokwar na kan,
Asɛm na sunsum, nkwa na tum;
'Buee W'akoma too ewudzifo hɔ,
Dze agye hɔn wɔ hɔn nsɔhwɛ mu.

MHB 447
3 . O Love, who thus hast bound me fast,
Beneath that gentle yoke of Thine;
Love, who hast conquered me at last,
And rapt away this heart of mine:
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔdɔ, a akyekyer me pampee
Afam Wo kɔndua haahar ho,
Ɔdɔ a edzi mo do konyim
Na ehwim m'akoma efi hɔ.

MHB 447
4 . O Love, who once shalt bid me rise
From out this dying life of ours;
O Love, who once above yon skies
Shalt set me in the fadeless bowers	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔdɔ a da bi bɛma masoɛr
Efi dɛm wu asetsena yi mu,
Ɔdɔ a dakyee bi sor hɔ no,

MHB 448
1 . O LOVE that wilt not let me go,
I rest my weary soul in Thee:
I give Thee back the life I owe,
That in Thine ocean depths its flow
May richer, fuller be.
 	 ~ 	1 . ƆDƆ a onnketsie ma maakɔ,
Me kra a ɔaberɛ hom Wo mu;
Medze mo nkwa san ma Wo bio,
Ma ne mpemee wɔ Wo po bun mu n'
Eewie yie ampaara.
Ɔmmbɔ adze da befir.

MHB 448
2 . O Light that followest all my way,
I yield my flickering torch to Thee:
My heart restores its borrowed ray,
That in Thy sunshine’s blaze its day
May brighter, fairer be.
	 ~ 	2 
. Kan a odzi m'ekyir wɔ beebiara,
Medze me kandzea sunkamm ma W';
Wo kan hyerɛn m'akoma m' bio,
Ama W'ewia n' hyerɛnee wɔ m' mu n'
Aayɛ kɛsenara.

MHB 448
3 . O joy that seekest me through pain,
I cannot close my heart to Thee:
I trace the rainbow through the rain
And feel the promise is not vain,
That morn shall tearless be.
	 ~ 	3 
. Dɛw a enam yaw mu hwehwɛ me n',
Murunntum mmfa m'akoma nnsuma Wo;
Menam nsu m' hwehwɛ nyankontɔn,
Minyim dɛ anohoba n' nnyɛ gyan;
'Su bɔbɔ adze anapa.

MHB 448
4 . O Cross that liftest up my head,
I dare not ask to fly from Thee:
I lay in dust life’s glory dead,
And from the ground there blossoms red
Life that shall endless be.	 ~ 	4 
. Mbeamudua a ɔma me tsir do,
Murunntum nnguan mmfi Wo nkyɛn da;
Meda dɛtse m' owu enyimnyam m',
Na dɛtse n' mu na ɔbra fɛɛfɛw a

MHB 449
1 . O LORD, enlarge our scanty thought
To know the wonders Thou hast wrought;
Unloose our stammering tongues, to tell
Thy love immense, unsearchable.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, bue hɛn adwen mu
Ma yenhu W'anwanwa dwuma;
Sian hɛn dodow gyirama ma ɔnka
Wo dɔ kɛse a wɔnnhwehwɛ mu n'.
Owu na nkwa m' yɛyɛ Wodze.

MHB 449
2 . What are our works but sin and death,
Till Thou Thy quickening Spirit breathe;
Thou giv’st the power Thy grace to move:
O wondrous grace! O boundless love!
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn ndwuma yɛ bɔn na owu,
Kɛpem dɛ ebɔhom egu hɛn do;
Yɛanantsew Wo tum na adom mu,
Adom nwanwa! Dɔ a ɔnnsa da!

MHB 449
3 . How can it be, Thou heavenly King,
That Thou shouldst us to glory bring;
Make slaves the partners of Thy throne,
Decked with a never-fading crown?
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔyɛ dɛn yɛ dɛ ɔsor Hen,
Dɛ edze hɛn bɛma enyimnyam m'?
Yɛ nkowaa W'ahengua n' fafafo,
Yɛbɔsoa ahenkyɛw a ɔmmpa da?

MHB 449
4 . Hence our hearts melt, our eyes o’erflow,
Our words are lost; nor will we know,
Nor will we think of aught beside,
My Lord, my Love is crucified!
	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn akoma nan, yekyi nyinsu,
Yennyi hwee ka; yerunnhu so,
Yɛronndwen hwee so nnka ho koraa;
Mo Wura, mo Dɔ wɔabɔ N' mbeamudua m'.

MHB 449
5 . First-born of many brethren Thou;
To Thee, lo! all our souls we bow;
To Thee our hearts and hands we give:
Thine may we die, Thine may we live!   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Enuanom pii nua Panyin nye W',
Ɔwo nkotsee na yɛkotow W',
Yɛma akoma na nsa do ma W';

MHB 45
1 . MY soul, praise the Lord!
O God, Thou art great
In fathomless works
Thyself Thou dost hide.
Before Thy dark wisdom
And power uncreate.
Man's mind, that dare praise Thee,
In fear must abide.
	 ~ 	1 . ME kra, hyira Ewuradze!
O Nyame, esō;
Ndwuma akɛse mu
Na esuma Woho.
Wo sum nyansa n' enyim
Na tum a ennyɛe,
Adwen a ɔpɛ W' ayɛyi
Sɛ dɛ ɔtsena suro mu.

MHB 45
2 . This earth where we dwell.
That journeys in space,
With air as a robe
Thou wrappest around:
Her countries she tumeth
To greet the sun's face,
Then plungeth to slumber
In darkness profound.
	 ~ 	2 . Hɛn asaase yi a
Ɔkɔ aprɔw no
Na edze mframa 
Ayɛ n'efuradze:
Ɔwo akyekyer ho,
Ewia ma no mbo.
Na afei ɔdze hɔn
Kɔ sum mu kɛda.

MHB 45
3 . All seemeth so sure,
Yet nought doth remain:
Unending their change
Obeys Thy decree.
The valleys of ocean
Stand up a dry plain,
Thou whelmest the mountains
Beneath the deep sea.
	 ~ 	3 . Biribiara esi pi,
Naaso hwee nnkye bo:
Wɔsesa dabaa,
Wodzi Wo mbra do.
Epo no bun ase 
Yɛ asaase wewew,
Na ema mbepɔw so 
Kɛhyɛ po ase.

MHB 45
4 . The clouds gather rain
And melt o'er the land.
Then back to the sun
Are drawn by His shine:
Whereby the corn springeth
Through toll of man's hand.
And vineyards that gladden
His heart with good wine.
	 ~ 	4 . Mununkum tɔ nsu
Fɔw asaase do,
Ewia twe nsu no
San kɔ wimu bio:
Nyimpa ne berɛ do
Na eburow fifir,
Wenyin turo ma nsa pa,
Ma n'akoma enyigye.

MHB 45
5 . All beasts of the field
Rejoice in their life;
Among the tall trees
Are light birds on wing;
With strains of their music
The woodlands are rife;
They nest in thick branches
And welcome sweet spring.
	 ~ 	5 . M-bowadoma nyina
Enyi gye kwaamu;
Ndua atsentsen do
Na nnoma gyinagyina;
Wɔdze hɔn ndwom dɛɛdɛw
Hyɛ kwaa no mu ma;
Hɔn mberɛbuw wɔ mban mu
Dze tweɔn esusowber.

MHB 45
6 . Lo, there is Thy sea,
Whose bosom below
With creatures doth teem.
Above, the ships laden
With merchandise go,
Nor fear the wild waters,
Nor rage of rude wind.
	 ~ 	6 . Hwɛ, po na ɔda hɔ n',
No bun ase na
'Sunsum ebu do,
Bi wɔ abon na nsoɛ.
Hɔn sor na ahɛn pii
Dza eguadze kɔ;
Wonnsuro asorɛkye,
Anaa ehumtu.

MHB 45
7 . O God, Thou art great!
No greatness I see.
Except Thee alone,
Thy praise to record.
On all Thy works musing
My pleasure shall be;
Myjoy shall be singing:
My soul, praise the Lord!	 ~ 	7 . Nyame yɛ kɛse!
Munnhu kɛse bi,
Gyedɛ Wodze nko,
M'bɛka W'ayɛyi.
Medze daa enyigye
Susu W'edwuma ho;
M'enyi gye dɛ m'bɔtow:
Me kra, yi N'ayɛw!

MHB 450
1 . NOW let us see Thy beauty, Lord,
As we have seen before;
And by Thy beauty quicken us
To love Thee and adore.
	 ~ 	1 . MA yenhu Wo fɛw, Ewuradze,
Dɛ mbrɛ yeehu dada;
Ma W'ahoɔfɛw no nhyɛ hɛn dzen,
Ma yɛndɔ W', yɛnsɔr Wo.
Ɔyɛ ɔsor bra no.

MHB 450
2 . ’Tis easy when with simple mind
Thy loveliness we see,
To consecrate ourselves afresh
To duty and to Thee.
	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ yɛdze adwen brɛfo hwɛ a,
Yehu W'adɔyɛ no,
Ma yeetu hɛnho esi hɔ bio
Ama dwumadzi na Ɔwo.

MHB 450
3 . Our every feverish mood is cooled,
And gone is every load,
When we can lose the love of self,
And find the love of God.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ hɛn haw biara bɔ adze a,
Hɛn adzesoa fi hɔ;
Sɛ yetum yew hɛn ahodɔ a,
Yehu Nyame dɔ no.

MHB 450
4 . ’Tis by Thy loveliness we’re won
To home and Thee again,
And as we are Thy children true 
We are more truly men.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Wo dɔ kɛse na ɔtwe hɛn
Ba fie na Wo nkyɛn bio,
Na ber a yɛyɛ Wo nokwar mba n',
Ampa, yɛyɛ Wo mba.

MHB 450
5 . Lord, it is coming to ourselves
When thus we come to Thee;
The bondage of Thy loveliness
Is perfect liberty.
	 ~ 	5 
. Sɛ hɛn enyi ba hɛn ho do a,
Hɛn Wura, yɛba Wo hɔ;
Wo mpokyerɛ dɔ no yɛ hɛn
Fahodzi a odzi mu.

MHB 450
6 . So now we come to ask again
What Thou hast often given,
The vision of that loveliness
Which is the life of heaven.	 ~ 	6 
. Yɛsan ba bebisa Wo bio
Dza edze ma hɔn daa,
Wo dɔ kɛse ho nyikyerɛ no a

MHB 451
1 . I lift my heart to Thee, 
Saviour divine;
For Thou art all to me, 
And I am Thine;
Is there on earth a closer bond than this,
That my Belovèd’s mine, and I am His?
	 ~ 	1 . Mema m'akoma do 
Ma W', me Gyefo;
'Wo nye m'adze nyina,
Na Wodze nye m'
Ana nkabɔm' dzendzen bi kyɛn iyi:
Dɛ mo Dɔfo dze nye m', na ɔyɛ medze.
'Wo na Wo nkorɔfo bɔm' kor afebɔɔ. Amen.

MHB 451
2 . Thine am I by all ties; 
But chiefly Thine,
That through Thy sacrifice Thou, Lord, art mine.
By thine own cords of love, so sweetly wound,
Around me, I to Thee am closely bound.
	 ~ 	2 
. 'Kwan nyinam' Wodze nye m'; 
Na tsitsir dɛ,
Enam W'afɔrbɔ n' do
Eyɛ medze.
Wo dɔ nkyehoma n' adwer m' dɛɛdɛw bi,
Ɔdze me atakyer Wo ho dzendzen.

MHB 451
3 . To Thee, Thou dying Lamb, 
I all things owe;
All that I have, and am,
And all I know.
All that I have is now no longer mine,
And I am not mine own; Lord, I am Thine.
	 ~ 	3  
. M'afɔrbɔ Eguambaa, 
Medan Wo nwionn;
Dza mowɔm', meyɛm', na 
Minyim nyinam',
Dza mowɔ nyinara nnyɛ medze bio,
Mennda hɔ nndze moho; meyɛ Wodze.

MHB 451
4 . How can I, Lord, withhold 
Life’s brightest hour
From Thee; or gathered gold, or any power?
Why should I keep one precious thing from Thee;
When Thou hast given Thine own dear self for me?
	 ~ 	4  
. Mo Wura, meyɛ dɛn dze 
Biribi kam Wo?
Mber pa, anaa sika?
Anaa ahoɔdzen?
Medze dza ɔsom bo suma Wo dɛn,
Ber a 'Wo a esom bo 'dze Woho ama m'?

MHB 451
5 . I pray Thee, Savior, keep me in Thy love,
Until death’s holy sleep shall me remove
To that fair realm where, sin and sorrow o’er,
Thou and Thine own are one forevermore.
                                                    Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Gyefo, meserɛ Wo dɛ 
Kora m' Wo dɔ mu,
Kɛpem dɛ owu nda
Beyi m' akɔ
Man pa nom' mbrɛ bɔn nye yaw bɔ adze a

MHB 452
1 . What shall I do my God to love,
My Saviour, and the world’s, to praise?
Whose tenderest compassion move
To me, and all the fallen race,
Whose mercy is divinely free
For all the fallen race, and me!
	 ~ 	1 . M'BESI dɛn madɔ me Nyame,
Meyi wiadze Gyefo n' ayɛw?
N'ayamuhyehye ba mo do,
Na odu adasamba nyina do,
Na yeenya N'ehumbɔbɔr kwa,
Menye asehwefo nyina.
Na me bra akyerɛ W'enyimnyam.

MHB 452
2 . I long to know, and to make known,
The heights and depths of love divine,
The kindness thou to me hast shown,
Whose every sin was counted thine:
My God for me resigned his breath;
He died to save my soul from death.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mepɛ meehu na maatahye
No dɔ krɔnkrɔn n' no bun, no krɔn,
Ayamuyie a edze ayɛ me,
Emi a wɔdze mo bɔn soaa Wo;
Emi ntsi na me Nyame wui;
Owui dze gyee me kra fii 'wu m'.

MHB 452
3 . How shall I thank thee for the grace
On me and all mankind bestowed?
O that my every breath were praise!
O that my heart were filled with God!
My heart would then with love o’erflow,
And all my life thy glory show.	 ~ 	3 
. M'besi dɛn mada Wo ase,
Adom a edze maa adasa nyina 'i?
Nkyɛ akra nyina eeyi W' ayɛw!
O nkyɛ Nyame aahyɛ m'akoma m'!
Nkyɛ dɔ bobu m'akoma do,

MHB 453
1 . O my Saviour, hear me,
Draw me close to Thee;
Thou hast paid my ransom,
Thou hast died for me;
Now by simple faith I claim
Pardon through Thy gracious Name;
Thou, my Ark of safety,
Let me fly to Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . O M'AGYENKWA, tsie me,
Twe me fam Wo ho;
Ɔwo etua me kaw nyina,
Ɔwo ewu ama m';
Afei medze gyedzi gye
Adom fi W'adom dzin mu;
Ɔwo nye m' Guandɔbea,
Ma m' nguan mbra Wo hɔ.
Bɛtsena Afebɔɔ.

MHB 453
2 . O my Saviour, bless me,
Bless me while I pray;
Grant Thy peace to help me,
Take my fear away;
I believe Thy promise, Lord;
I will trust Thy holy Word;
Thou, my soul’s Redeemer,
Bless me while I pray.
 	 ~ 	2 
. O m'Agyenkwa, hyira me,
Morobɔ mpaa 'i hyira me
Ma W'adom no mboa me,
Na yi mo suro akwa;
Megye W'anohoba dzi,
M'bɔtwer W'asɛm krɔnkrɔn no;
Ɔwo me kra n' Gyefo,
Morobɔ mpaa 'i hyira me.

MHB 453
3 . O my Savssiour, love me,
Make me all Thine own;
Leave me not to wander
In this world alone;
Bless my way with light divine,
Let Thy glory round me shine;
Thou, my Rock, my Refuge,
Make me all Thine own.
 	 ~ 	3 
. O m'Agyenkwa, hyira me,
Fa me yɛ Wodze;
Mma nngyaa m' ma minnkyinkyin
Wɔ wiadze yi mu;
Fa Wo kan hyerɛn mo kwan mu,
Ma W'enyimnyam nhyerɛn mo ho;
Mo Botan, Guandɔbea,
Fa me yɛ Wodze.

MHB 453
4 . O my Saviour, guard me,
Keep me evermore!
Bless me, love me, guide me,
Till my work is o’er;
May I then, with glad surprise,
Chant Thy praise beyond the skies;
There with Thee, my Savior,
Dwell for evermore.	 ~ 	4 
. O m'Agyenkwa, kora me,
Kora me daa nyina;
Hyira m', dɔ me, kyerɛ m'kwan
Kɛpem m'edwuma asa;
Na afei medze enyigye
Bɔtow W'ayɛyi wɔ sor;
Hɔ menye m'Agyenkwa

MHB 454
1 . I WOULD commune with Thee, my God;
E’en to Thy seat I come;
I leave my joys, I leave my sins,
And seek in Thee my home.
	 ~ 	1 . ME Nyame, menye W' bɛkasa
Meba W' ahengua enyim;
Migyaa m'enyigye nye m' bɔn mu
Na medze W' yɛ me fie.
M'bohu Wo dɔ nyina.

MHB 454
2 . I stand upon the mount of God,
With sunlight in my soul;
I see the storms in vales beneath,
I hear the thunder’s roll.
	 ~ 	2 
. Migyina Nyame bepɔw no do,
Ewia hyerɛn me kra mu;
Metse n' wɔ ase dɛ ehum rutu
Na sor repaapaa mu.

MHB 454
3 . But I am calm with Thee, my God,
Beneath these glorious skies;
And to the height on which I stand
Nor storms nor clouds can rise.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mowɔ wiadze mu yi munnsuro
'Siandɛ menye W' wɔ hɔ;
Ɔsor beebi a migyina yi,
Ehum na fua nndu ha.

MHB 454
4 . O, this is life! oh, this is joy,
My God, to find Thee so;
Thy face to see, Thy voice to hear,
And all Thy love to know.	 ~ 	4 
. O n-kwa na enyigye nye
Dɛ mubohu Nyame!
M'bohu W'enyim, m'bɛtse Wo ndze,

MHB 455
1 .  As pants the hart for cooling streams
When heated in the chase,
So longs my soul, O God, for thee,
And thy refreshing grace.
	 ~ 	1 . Dɛ mbrɛ ɔtwe haahaw nsunwin ho 
Ber a oeguan afona n',
Dɛm na, me Nyame, me kra so
Haahaw hwehwɛ W'adom.
Wo daa nkwa nsunyiwa.

MHB 455
2 . For thee, my God, the living God,
My thirsty soul doth pine:
O when shall I behold thy face,
Thou majesty divine?
	 ~ 	2 
. Wo ho nsukɔm ɔdze me kra, 
O mo Nkwa Nyankopɔn,
Ao, dabɛn na m'bohu W'enyim
Me Nyame Hen Krɔnkrɔn!

MHB 455
3 .  God of my strength,how long shall I,
Like one forgotten,mourn?
Forlorn,forsaken,and exposed
To my oppressor’s scorn.
	 ~ 	3 
. Na mindzi mbɔɔ nkodu dabɛn 
M'ahoɔdzen Nyankopɔn?
Mayɛ ankonam, makɛhyɛ
M'atwetwesifo nsa,

MHB 455
4 . Why restless, why cast down, my soul?
hope still, and thou shalt sing
the praise of him who is thy God,
thy health’s eternal spring.	 ~ 	4 
. Me kra, bɛn yɛ wo ma abotow? 
Hyɛ nsi, na ibeyi
Ɔno a ɔyɛ wo Nyame ayɛw,

MHB 456
1 . FOR ever here my rest shall be,
Close to thy bleeding side;
This all my hope, and all my plea,
For me the Saviour died!
 	 ~ 	1 . Mobɔhom ha ara afebɔɔ 
Mbrɛ wo mfem' bɔgya n' wɔ;
M'enyidar, m'asɛm nyina nye yi,
Agyenkwa wui maa me.
Dɔ bɛhyɛ me kra ma.

MHB 456
2 . My dying Saviour, and my God,
Fountain for guilt and sin,
Sprinkle me ever with thy blood,
And cleanse, and keep me clean.
	 ~ 	2 
. M'Agyenkwa a 'ruwu, me Nyame, 
Bura a ehor bɔn fi,
Fa Wo bɔgyaa n' petse mo do
Ma mo ho ɔntsew krɔnn.

MHB 456
3 .  Wash me, and make me thus thine own,
Wash me, and mine thou art,
Wash me, but not my feet alone,
My hands, my head, my heart.
	 ~ 	3 
. Guar me, na ma menyɛ Wodze, 
Guar me, na yɛ medze 
Nnyɛ me nan nko, na me nsa ho,
Me tsirm', na m'akomam'.

MHB 456
4 . The atonement of thy blood apply,
Till faith to sight improve,
Till hope in full fruition die,
And all my soul be love.	 ~ 	4 
. Fa Wo nkabɔmu bɔgyaa n' ka me, 
Kodu dɛ m'bohu Wo,
Kodu dɛ m'enyidar bɛbam',

MHB 457
1 . Thou Shepherd of Israel, and mine,
The joy and desire of my heart,
For closer communion I pine,
I long to reside where thou art:
The pasture I languish to find
There all, who their Shepherd obey,
Are fed, on thy bosom reclined,
And screened from the heat of the day.
	 ~ 	1 . Israel Guanhwɛfo, na medze 
Me kra ne dɛw, n'ahwehwɛdze,
Mo 'koma haahaw hwehwɛ Wo,
Mo Kɔn dɔ dɛ menye Wo tsena;
Meper mehu mfunoma pa no,k
Mbrɛ hɔn a wotsie Guanhwɛfo n'
Wɔtwer Wo bom' na wodzidzi n',
Na ewia ne hyew nn-ka hɔn.
Mahyɛ W'akomam' afebɔɔ.

MHB 457
2 . Ah ! show me that happiest place,
The place of thy people’s abode,
Where saints in an ecstasy gaze,
And hang on a crucified God;
Thy love for a sinner declare,
Thy passion and death on the tree;
My spirit to Calvary bear,
To suffer and triumph with thee.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ao! kyerɛ me siar bea yi no do, 
Mbrɛ Wo nkorɔfo nyina tse,
Mbrɛ ahotsewfo dze dɛw hwɛ
Nyame a wɔabɔ N' mbeamudua mu n';
Da Wo dɔ nwanwa no edzi,
W'ahoguan, Wo wu wɔ dua n' do;
Fa me kra kɔ Calvary do,
Menye W' nhu amandze, ndzi konyim.

MHB 457
3 . ’Tis there, with the lambs of thy flock,
There only, I covet to rest,
To lie at the foot of the rock,
Or rise to be hid in thy breast;
’Tis there I would always abide,
And never a moment depart,
Concealed in the cleft of thy side,
Eternally held in thy heart.	 ~ 	3  
. Ha ara nko na m'enyi ber 
Dɛ menye Wo nguankuw bɔhom,
Dɛ m'bɛda botan no ase,
Anaa m'bosuma Wo bo mu;
Hɔ nko ara na m'bɛtsena daa,
Mirimmfi hɔ mmfir dabida,
M'bosuma Wo mfe mu hɔ Komm,

MHB 458
1 . LONG did I toil, and knew no earthly rest,
Far did I rove, and found no certain home;
At last I sought them in His sheltering breast,
Who opes His arms, and bids the weary come:
With Him I found a home, a rest divine,
And since then I am His, and He is mine.
