	 ~ 	1 . MOFONAA pii, mennya wiadze ahomgye;
Mikyinkyiin pii, mennya ahomgyebea;
Ekyir yi, minyaa no wɔ No bo mu,
Nyia obue Ne nsa ma bahatɔfo;
No mu na minyaa fie ahomgyebea;
Ofi hɔ n'meyɛ Nedze, na ɔyɛ m'dze.
M'bedzi mu mayɛ Nedze, ɔayɛ m'dze.

MHB 458
2 . The good I have is from His stores supplied,
The ill is only what He deems the best;
He for my Friend, I’m rich with naught beside,
And poor without Him, though of all possessed:
Changes may come, I take, or I resign,
Content, while I am His, while He is mine.
	 ~ 	2 
. Papa biara a mowɔ fir Noara;
Me haw no onyim dɛ oye ma me;
Me Nyɛnko nye No a, meyɛ sikafo;
Mowɔ adze nyina na ɔnnka m' ho a, midzi hia;
Nsakyer ba a, mepen do, anaa mopow,
Meyɛ Nedze, na ɔyɛ m'dze a mo bo dwe.

MHB 458
3 . Whate’er may change, in Him no change is seen,
A glorious Sun that wanes not nor declines;
Above the clouds and storms He walks serene,
And on His people’s inward darkness shines:
All may depart—I fret not, nor repine,
While I my Savior’s am, while He is mine.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nsesa biara ba a, Ɔno ɔnnsesa;
Ewia nyimnyamfo a n'ano nntɔ mu da;
Ɔnantsew fua na ehum do wɔ wimu,
Na ɔhyerɛn No nkorɔfo do sum mu;
Sɛ hɔn nyina kɔ mpo a, munnsuro da,
Ber a Gyefo n' yɛ medze, meyɛ Nedze.

MHB 458
4 . While here, alas! I know but half His love,
But half discern Him, and but half adore;
But when I meet Him in the realms above,
I hope to love Him better, praise Him more,
And feel, and tell, amid the choir divine,
How fully I am His, and He is mine.	 ~ 	4 
. Ha yi muhu No dɔ kumabaa bi,
Muhu No kakra, tonton No kakra;
Na sɛ muhu No wɔ sor man mu hɔ a,
Mobɔdɔ No yie, na masom No yie;
Na m'bɛka N'adwontofo krɔnkrɔn ho,

MHB 459
1 . TO the haven of thy breast,
O Son of man, I fly!
Be my refuge and my rest,
For O the storm is high!
Save me from the furious blast,
A covert from the tempest be!
Hide me, Jesus, till o’erpast
The storm of sin I see.
	 ~ 	1 . ONYIMPA Ba, Wo bo mu
Yɛ guandɔbea ma me,
Yɛ mo sumabea ahomgye,
'Siandɛ ehum no so;
Gye m' fi ehum dzendzen nsa;
Yɛ m'akatado wɔ ehum mu;
Jesus, fa me sie na ma
Bɔn ehum no mbɛsen.
Wo wu no ho mfaso.

MHB 459
2 . Welcome as the water-spring
To a dry, barren place,
O descend on me, and bring
Thy sweet refreshing grace;
O’er a parched and weary land
As a great rock extends its shade,
Hide me, Saviour, with thine hand,
And screen my naked head
	 ~ 	2 
. Megye Wo dɛ nsunyiwa
Wɔ asaase wewewdo,
O sian mo do, na brɛ me
W'akomatɔm' adom n',
Dɛ mbrɛ ɔbotantsim gye
Nwin wɔ asaase a etwie yi do;
Agyenkwa, fa me suma,
Kata m'etsikwaa 'i do.

MHB 459
3 . In the time of my distress
Thou hast my succour been,
In my utter helplessness
Restraining me from sin;
O how swiftly didst thou move
To save me in the trying hour!
Still protect me with thy love,
And shield me with thy power.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔwo nye mo Boafo pa
Wɔ m'ahokyer ber mu,
Enyidado sa koraa mpo a,
Egye me fi bɔn mu;
O mbrɛ isi twe me ntsɛm
Fi bɔn mu wɔ nsɔhwɛ ber mu a!
Kɔ do fa W' dɔ bɔ m' ho ban,
Fa tum kata mo do.

MHB 459
4 . First and last in me perform
The work thou hast begun;
Be my shelter from the storm.
My shadow from the sun;
Weary, parched with thirst, and faint,
Till thou; the abiding Spirit breathe,
Every moment, Lord, I want
The merit of thy death.	 ~ 	4 
. Dwuma a ahyɛ ase no,
Wie ne nyina wɔ mo mu;
Ehumtu ber m' kata m' do,
Gye mo sunsum fi ewia m';
Nsukɔm, berɛ na wu hyɛ m' do,
Kɛpem Sunsum bɔhom egu m' do,
Ewuradze, morohwehwɛ

MHB 46
1 . I SING the almighty power of God.
That made the mountains rise.
That spread the flowing seas abroad,
And built the lofty skies.
	 ~ 	1 . MOTOW Nyame tum ho ndwom,
Dza epegya mbepɔw n',
Dza ɔtserɛɛw po m' kɔr ekyirkyir n',
Na ɔyɛɛ wimu a ɔkrɔn.

MHB 46
2 . I sing the wisdom that ordained
The sun to rule the day;
The moon shines full at His command,
And all the stars obey.
	 ~ 	2 . Mohuhor nyansa no a ɔhyɛɛ
Ewia dɛ ondzi da do n';
Ɔhyɛ bosoom ma ɔhyerɛn,
Na nworaba nyina hyerɛn.

MHB 46
3 . I sing the goodness of the Lord.
That filled the earth with food;
He formed the creatures with His word,
And then pronounced them good.
	 ~ 	3 . M'kamfo Ewuradze N'ayamuyie a
Ɔmaa asaase edziban n';
Ɔdze N'asɛm yɛɛ mbowadoma,
Na ɔkaa dɛ ne nyina ye.

MHB 46
4 . Lord, how Thy wonders are displayed
Where’er I turn mine eye.
If I survey the ground I tread,
Or gaze upon the sky;
	 ~ 	4 . Ewuradze, 'kyerɛ W'anwanwandze
Beebi a medan m'enyi,
Sɛ mohwɛ asaase a menam do,
Anaa mohwɛ sor a.

MHB 46
5 . There’s not a plant or flower below
But makes Thy glories known.
And clouds arise and tempests blow
By order from Thy throne.
	 ~ 	5 . M-fuw na nhyiren nyinara
Da W'enyimnyam edzi,
Mununkum si na ehum tu a,
'Hyɛ mbra fi W'ahengua m'.

MHB 46
6 . God’s hand is my perpetual guard.
He guides me with His eye;
Why should I then forget the Lord,
Whose love is ever nigh?	 ~ 	6 . Nyame nsa gye m' taataa dabaa, 
Ɔdze N'enyi kyerɛ m' kwan;
Ebɛn ntsi na mo werɛ befir,
Nyame a No dɔ bɛn me?

MHB 460
1 . TALK with us, Lord, thyself reveal,
While here o’er earth we rove;
Speak to our hearts, and let us feel
The kindling of thy love.
	 ~ 	1 . Ewuradze, yi Woho kyerɛ hɛn, 
Ber a yekyin wiadze;
Kasa kyerɛ hɛn akoma,
Ma Wo dɔ ndzɛw hɛn mu.
Na menya heaven Wo mu.    Amen.

MHB 460
2 . With thee conversing, we forget
All time, and toil, and care;
Thy yoke is ease, thy burden light,
And thou, my God, art here!
 	 ~ 	2 
. 'Nye hɛn kasa a, hɛn werɛ fir 
Aber, ɔberɛ dadwen;
Dwuma yɛ ahomgye, yaw yɛ dɛw,
Ber a, Nyame, ebɛn hɛn.

MHB 460
3 . Here then, my God, vouchsafe to stay,
And bid my heart rejoice;
My bounding heart shall own thy sway,
And echo to thy voice.
	 ~ 	3 
. Bra me nkyɛn mbɔ, m'adom Nyame, 
Ma m'akoma ndzi dɛw;
Makoma bɔbɔ no mu adze
Ama W', oetsie Wo ndze.

MHB 460
4 . Thou callest me to seek thy face;
’Tis all I wish to seek;
To attend the whispers of thy grace,
And hear thee only speak.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ese m' dɛ monhwehwɛ W'enyim; 
Dza mohwehwɛ ara nye n';
Dɛ m'bohu W'enyimnyam no,
Matse Wo ndze mo mu.l

MHB 460
5 . Let this my every hour employ,
Till I thy glory see,
Enter into my Master’s joy,
And find my heaven in thee.	 ~ 	5  
. 'Yi nyɛ mo dwuma nkodu dɛ  
M'bohu W'enyimnyam no,
M'bɛhɛn mo Wura

MHB 461
1 . O for a closer walk with God,
A calm and heavenly frame;
A light to shine upon the road
That leads me to the Lamb.
 	 ~ 	1 . Ao, nkyɛ maatakyer Nyame ho, 
Meenya su a ɔdwe,
Kandzea ma ɔaakyerɛ kwan no a
Ɔdze m' kɔ Eguambaa n' nkyɛn.
Ɔdze m' kɔ Eguambaa n' nkyɛn.

MHB 461
2 . Where is the blessedness I knew
When first I saw the Lord?
Where is that soul-refreshing view 
Of Jesus and His word?
	 ~ 	2 
. Nhyira a ber a muhun Ewuradze n' 
Minyae no wɔ henfa?
Jesus ho yikyerɛ na N'asɛm
A muhunii n' wɔ hen?

MHB 461
3 . What peaceful hours I once enjoyed !
How sweet their memory still !
But they have left and aching void
The world can never fill.
	 ~ 	3 
. Asomdwee mber a mehu pɛn a! 
Mbrɛ ho nkaa dua yɛ dɛ a!
Na ndɛ me kra atɔ pan a 
Wiadze nntum nnhyɛ no ma.

MHB 461
4 . Return, O holy Dove, return,
sweet messenger of rest:
I hate the sins that made thee mourn,
And drove thee from my breast.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Ao, Ebubur Krɔnkrɔn, san bra, 
Ahomgye ho Bɔfoe,
Mikyir bɔn a opiraa Wo n',
Na ɔpaam Wo m'akomam'.

MHB 461
5 . The dearest idol I have known,
Whate’er that idol be,
Help me to tear it from thy throne,
And worship only thee.
 	 ~ 	5 
. Dza modɔ no mbordo biara, 
Mbrɛ no su tse biara,
Boa ma minyi n' W'ahengua ho,
Na monsom Wo nkotoo.

MHB 461
6 . So shall my walk be close with God,
Calm and serene my frame;
So purer light shall mark the road
That leads me to the Lamb.	 ~ 	6 
. Nna mebɛbɛn Nyankopɔn yie, 
Nna menya su a ɔdwe,
Nna kan mapa bɛkyerɛ kwan a

MHB 462
1 . I HUNGER and I thirst:
Jesu, my manna be;
Ye living waters, burst
Out of the rock for me.
	 ~ 	1 . Ɔkɔm na nsukɔm dze m'; 
Jesus yɛ m'edziban:
Nkwa esutsen, pem fi
Ɔbotan no mu ma m'.
Bɛtaa mo mu afebɔɔ.

MHB 462
2 . Thou bruised and broken Bread,
My life-long wants supply;
As living souls are fed,
O feed me, or I die.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔwo a eyɛ Paanoo, 
Ma m' daadaa edziban;
Dɛ mbrɛ enyɛn akra n',
Nyɛn m', ɔno mubowu.

MHB 462
3 . Thou true life-giving Vine,
Let me thy sweetness prove;
Renew my life with thine,
Refresh my soul with love.
 	 ~ 	3  
. Nokwar Wenyinaba, 
Ma monsɔ Wo dɛw nhwɛ;
Woara ma m' nkwa fofor,
Na fa dɔ nyɛn me kra.

MHB 462
4 . Rough paths my feet have trod
Since first their course began:
Feed me, thou Bread of God;
Help me, thou Son of Man.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ber a m'akwantu hyɛɛ ase 
Mbɔntankyim' na mekyin:
Sor Edziban, nyɛn me;
Nyimpa Ba, yɛ me boa.

MHB 462
5 . For still the desert lies
My thirsting soul before:
O living waters, rise
Within me evermore.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Sar da ho da m'enyim
Me kra haahaw nsu ho;
Nkwa esutsen, pem bra

MHB 463
1 . O JESUS CHRIST, grow thou in me,
And all things else recede;
My heart be daily nearer thee,
From sin be daily freed.
	 ~ 	1 . O JESUS Christ, nyin wɔ mo mu,
Dza aka nyina mpem adze;
Ma daa m'akoma ntwe mpin Wo,
Na omfi bɔn mu koraa.
Dɛ m'bɛsɛ Wo dzin daa.  Amen.

MHB 463
2 . Each day let thy supporting might
My weakness still embrace;
My darkness vanish in thy light,
Thy life my death efface.
	 ~ 	2 
. Dabiara ma dzenhyɛ ahoɔdzen
Nsuo me mberɛwyɛ mu;
Mo sum nguan nkɔ Wo kan no mu,
Wo nkwa nyi m' wu mfi hɔ.

MHB 463
3 . In thy bright beams which on me fall,
Fade every evil thought;
That I am nothing, thou art all,
I would be daily taught.
	 ~ 	3 
. Wo kan hyɛnhyɛn a ɔtɔ mo do
Nhwetse adwembɔn biara;
Ɔwo na eyɛ adze nyina,
Wɔbɛkyerɛ m' dabiara.

MHB 463
4 . More of thy glory let me see,
Thou holy, wise, and true!
I would thy living image be,
In joy and sorrow too.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma munhu W'enyimnyam n' mbordo,
Krɔnkrɔnyi, Nyansafo!
Mebɛyɛ Wo saso wɔ ha,
Enyigye na awerɛhow m'.

MHB 463
5 . Fill me with gladness from above,
Hold me by strength divine!
Lord, let the glow of thy great love
Through my whole being shine.
	 ~ 	5 
. Fa sor enyigye hyɛ me ma,
Fa sor ahoɔdzen suo m' mu!
Ewuradze, ma Wo dɔ kɛse n'
Nhyerɛn me nyimpadua mu.

MHB 463
6 . Make this poor self grow less and less,
Be thou my life and aim;
O make me daily, through thy grace,
More meet to bear thy name!  Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Ma mara mo su nyew mo mu,
Eyɛ m' nkwa na botae;
O W'adom no mma me mfata

MHB 464
1 . JESUS, the all-restoring Word,
My fallen spirit’s hope,
After Thy lovely likeness, Lord,
Ah! when shall I wake up?
 	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, Asɛm a ema nkwa,
Me kra hianyi enyidar,
Mo Wura, dabɛn na mobɔsoɛr 
Na mafa W'enyimnyam n'?
Nkesi onnyiewie mu.  Amen.

MHB 464
2 . Thou, O my God, Thou only art
The life, the truth, the way;
Quicken my soul, instruct my heart,
My sinking footsteps stay.
 	 ~ 	2 
. O Ɔwo me Nyame nkotoo,
Eyɛ Nkwa, Nokwar, Kwan;
Hyɛ me kra dzen, kyerɛ m'akoma
Ma muntum ngyina m' nan do.

MHB 464
3 . Of all Thou hast in earth below,
In Heav’n above, to give,
Give me Thy only love to know
In Thee to walk and live.
	 ~ 	3 
. Biribiara a ewɔ n' wɔ ase ha,
Anaa sor a, 'dze bɛma n',
Ma munhu Wo dɔ nkotoo no,
Mennantsew, ntsena Wo mu.

MHB 464
4 . Fill me with all the life of love,
In mystic union join
Me to Thyself and let me prove
The fellowship divine.
	 ~ 	4 
. Fa ɔdɔ bra hyɛ m' ma na minnya
Ɔsor nkitahodzi;
Twe me fam Wo ho, ma minyi
Sor nkitahodzi n' nkyerɛ.

MHB 464
5 . Open the intercourse between
My longing soul and Thee,
Never to be broke off again
To all eternity.         Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Ma kwan mapa bi mbɛda hɔ
Mma me kra na Ɔwo;
Na mma hɛn ntamu nntsetsew bio,

MHB 465
1 . OPEN, Lord, my inward ear,
 And bid my heart rejoice;
Bid my quiet spirit hear
Thy comfortable voice;
Never in the whirlwind found,
Or where earthquakes rock the place,
Still and silent is the sound,
The whisper of thy grace.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, bue m'asowa m' yie,
Ma m'akoma ndzi dɛw;
Ma mo sunsum brɛfo ntse
W'awerɛkyekye ndze a
Wɔnntse n' mframa dzendzen mu,
Na asaasewosow bea do n',
Wo ndze no da ho yɛ berɛww,
Dza ɔwasa adom n'.
Mbrɛ etse nyina medze a.  Amen.

MHB 465
2 . From the world of sin, and noise,
And hurry I withdraw;
For the small and inward voice
I wait with humble awe;
Silent am I now and still,
Dare not in thy presence move;
To my waiting soul reveal
The secret of thy love.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Motwe moho fi wiadze a
Dede na bɔn ahyɛ m' n' ho;
Medze ahopopo tweɔn
Wo ndze a ɔyɛ berɛww no;
Mayɛ komm wɔ W'enyim koraa
Mennsɛ dɛ mutu ntsen mpo;
Yi Wo dɔ a osuma n' kyerɛ
Me kra a ɔrotweɔn no.

MHB 465
3 . Thou didst undertake for me,
For me to death wast sold;
Wisdom in a mystery
Of bleeding love unfold;
Teach the lesson of thy cross,
Let me die, with thee to reign;
All things let me count but loss,
So I may thee regain.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Wɔtɔɔn me maa owu no,
Ɔwo gyinae wui maa m',
Nyansa yɛ esumasɛm a
Oyi ɔdɔ nwanwa kyerɛ;
Kyerɛ m' Wo mbeamudua ho esuasɛm n',
Ma menye Wo nwu, ndzi hen;
Ma mumbu adze nyina ahwerdze,
Ma menye W' eedzi hen.

MHB 465
4 . Show me, as my soul can bear,
The depth of inbred sin;
All the unbelief declare,
The pride that lurks within;
Take me, whom thyself hast bought,
Bring into captivity
Every high aspiring thought
That would not stoop to thee.
	 ~ 	4 
. Da mo bɔn nyina edzi,
Dɛ mbrɛ me kra botum;
Da ekyingye nye ahopɔw a
Ɔwɔ mo mu nyina edzi,
Fa emi a Ɔwoara atɔ m',
Na adwen biara ndɔmmum;
Dza ɔmmbrɛ noho adze mma W',
Ɔnngow noho nnkotow W'.

MHB 465
5 . Lord, my time is in thy hand,
My soul to thee convert;
Thou canst make me understand,
Though I am slow of heart;
Thine in whom I live and move,
Thine the work, the praise is thine;
Thou art wisdom, power, and love,
And all thou art is mine.	 ~ 	5 
. Ewuradze, me mber wɔ W' nsamu,
Dan me kra bra Wo hɔ;
Kaansa meyɛ nyaa akoma m' a,
Ɔwo bɛma m' ntseasee;
Wo mu na metse, kɔ ba,
Ndwuma, ayɛyi nyina Wodze a,
Eyɛ nyansa, tum na dɔ;

MHB 466
1 . MY soul, there is a country
Far beyond the stars,
Where stands a winged sentry
All skillful in the wars.
	 ~ 	1 . ME kra, ɔman bi wɔ hɔ,
Ɔwɔ nworaba ekyir hɔ,
Hɔ na ɔweɔmfo bi wɔ;
Onyim akodzi mapa.
Wo Nyame, Nkwa, Yarsa.

MHB 466
2 . There above noise, and danger,
Sweet peace sits crowned with smiles,
And One born in a manger
Commands the beauteous files.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Dede na mbusu nndu hɔ,
Sor hɔ asomdwee dzi hen;
Nyia wɔwoo No mbowadan m'
Na ɔkora adze nyina do.

MHB 466
3 . He is thy gracious Friend,
And - O my soul, awake!
Did in pure love descend,
To die here for thy sake.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔno nye w'adamfo pa,
Dɛm ntsi me kra, soɛr ɛ!
Ɔdze ɔdɔ mapa sianee
Bowuu wɔ ha maa me.

MHB 466
4 . If thou canst get but thither,
There grows the flower of peace,
The Rose that cannot wither,
Thy fortress and thy ease.
	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ ibenya hɔ akɔ a,
Asomdwee nhyiren wɔ hɔ,
Nhyiren a ɔrommpo da,
Ɔyɛ w'aban 'homfi.

MHB 466
5 . Leave then thy foolish ranges,
For none can thee secure
But one who never changes,
Thy God, thy life, thy cure.	 ~ 	5 
. Gyaa dza ɔbɔ wo ho ban no,
No mu biara nnkɛgye w';
Kor pɛr, Nyia ɔnnsakyer da,

MHB 467
1 . MY spirit longs for thee
Within my troubled breast,
Unworthy though I be
Of so divine a guest.
	 ~ 	1 . ME kra, rohwehwɛ Wo,
Me haw akom yi mu;
Ɔwɔ m' dɛ memmfata
'Hɔho krɔnkrɔn yi dze.
Mbɛhyɛ me pɛ ahenkyɛw! Amen.

MHB 467
2 .  Of so divine a guest
Unworthy though I be,
Yet has my heart no rest
Unless it come from thee.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔhɔho krɔnkrɔn yi,
Memmfata N' susuampa;
M'akoma nnya ahomgye,
Gyedɛ ofi Wo mu ba.

MHB 467
3 . Unless it come from thee,
In vain I look around;
In all that I can see
No rest is to be found.
	 ~ 	3 
. Gyedɛ ofi Wo nkyɛn ba,
Moto m'enyi a onnhu hwee;
Dza muhu nyina mu,
Minnya ahomgye biara.

MHB 467
4 . No rest is to be found
But in thy blessed love:
O let my wish be crowned,
And send it from above !  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Minnya ahomgye biara,
Gyedɛ Wo siar dɔ mu;
O ma womfi sor hɔ

MHB 468
1 . Nearer, my God, to Thee, 
Nearer to Thee!
E'en though it be a cross 
That raiseth me,
Still all my song shall be, 
Nearer, my God, to Thee. 
Nearer to Thee!
	 ~ 	1 . Wo nkyɛn ara, Nyame, 
Wo nkyɛn ara!
Kaansa mbeamudua mpo
Na ɔma mo do a,
Mo ndwom dabaa nye dɛ
Wo nkyɛn ara, Nyame,
Wo nkyɛn ara.
Wo nkyɛn ara!

MHB 468
2 . Though like the wanderer, 
The sun gone down,
Darkness be over me, 
My rest a stone.
Yet in my dreams I’d be 
Nearer, my God to Thee.
Nearer to Thee!
	 ~ 	2 
. Kaansa mirikyin mpo 
Ma wi akɔtɔ,
Ma adze so asa me,
Ma mesum bo a,
M'adaaso mu m'bepin
Wo nkyɛn ara, Nyame,
Wo nkyɛn ara.

MHB 468
3 . There let the way appear,
Steps unto Heaven;
All that Thou send'st
In me, in mercy given;
Angels to beckon me 
Nearer, my God, to Thee.
Nearer to Thee !
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma kwan m-bɛda hɔ a 
Wɔdze kɔ sor;
Dza edze ma m' nyina
Ehumbɔbɔr kwa;
Abɔfo refrɛfrɛ m'
Wo nkyɛn ara, Nyame,
Wo nkyɛn ara.

MHB 468
4 . Then, with my waking thoughts 
Bright with Thy praise,
Out of my stony griefs 
Bethel I’ll raise;
So by my woes to be
Nearer, my God, to Thee.
Nearer to Thee!
	 ~ 	4 
. Ber a m'enyi betsetsew n', 
M'beyi W' ayɛw;
M'bodua m'awerɛhow mu
M'esi Nyame fi;
Menam me yawm' m'bepin
Wo nkyɛn ara, Nyame,
Wo nkyɛn ara!

MHB 468
5 . Or, if on joyful wing
Cleaving the sky,
Sun, moon, and stars forgot,
Upward I’ll fly,
Still all my song shall be,
Nearer, my God, to Thee,
Nearer to Thee!	 ~ 	5 
. Sɛ so medze ahomka 
Mutu ba sor,
Mo werɛ fir wi, bosoom,
Ɔnye nworaba a,
Mo ndwom mber nyina nye dɛ,
Wo nkyɛn ara, Nyame,

MHB 469
1 . THAT mystic word of Thine, O sovereign Lord,
Is all too pure, too high, too deep for me;
Weary of striving, and with longing faint,
I breathe it back again in prayer to Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . DƆM Hen Ewuradze, W'esumasɛm no,
No ho tsew koraa, ɔkrɔn, no mu dɔ ma m';
Medzi aperper araa ma maberɛ,
Afei mohom dze ma Wo bio mpaabɔ m'.
Bra bɛtsena mo mu, na mentsena Wo mu.  Amen.

MHB 469
2 . Abide in me, I pray, and I in Thee;
From this good hour, O leave me never more.
Then shall the discord cease, the wound be healed,
The life-long bleeding of the soul be o’er.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mosɔr dɛ tsena mo mu na mentsena Wo m';
Fi mber pa yi mu mma mmfi me nkyɛn da!
Dɛm n' dzi atoto begyaa, mo kur bɛsa,
Na me kra bɔgyakyi nyinaɛ begyaa.

MHB 469
3 . Abide in me; o’ershadow by Thy love
Each half-formed purpose, and dark thought of sin;
Quench ere it rise, each selfish, low desire,
And keep my soul as Thine, calm and divine.
	 ~ 	3 
. Tsena mo mu na Wo dɔ nhyɛ mo do,
Na adwen afaafa nye adwembɔn nyina,
Pɛsɛankonya na ɔbra bɔn nyina tutu;
Na sie me kra botoo, ma ɔnyɛ Wodze.

MHB 469
4 . As some rare perfume in a vase of clay
Pervades with a fragrance not its own.
So, when Thou dwellest in a mortal soul,
All heaven’s own sweetness seems around it thrown.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mbrɛ eduhuam aboɔdzen bi wɔ toaba mu a
Ɔdze no huam saa dɛm toaba n' ber no,
Dɛmara na ber a etse ɔkra mu n',
Edze sor ndzepa na dɛw hyɛ mu ma.

MHB 469
5 . Abide in me; there have been moments blest
When I have heard Thy voice and felt Thy power;
Then evil lost its grasp,and passion, hushed,
Owned the divine enchantment of the hour.
	 ~ 	5 
. Tsena mo mu: minya nhyira ber yi,
Ber a metsee Wo ndze na muhun Wo tum;
Bɔn tui kɔree na akɔndɔbɔn guanee,
Na Nyame N'ahoɔfɛw no baa mo do.

MHB 469
6 . These but were seasons, beautiful are rare;
Abide in me, and they shall ever be;
Fulfil at once Thy precept and my prayer
Come and abide in me, and I in Thee.	 ~ 	6 
. Dɛm mber no yɛ mber fɛɛfɛw a ɔnntɔ ka;
Tsena mo mu na ɔbɛtsena hɔ afebɔɔ;
Ma Wo nhyehyɛɛ nye me mpaabɔ mbra mu;

MHB 47
1 . FATHER of all ’ whose powerful voice
Called forth this universal frame;
Whose mercies over all rejoice,
Through endless ages still the same:
	 ~ 	1 . EGYA a edze ndze kɛse
Frɛɛ dɛm wiadze yi ma ɔbae,
Yedzi dɛw, Wo mbɔbɔrhu ho:
Ɔtse dɛm daa na ɔnnsesa.

MHB 47
2 . Thou by Thy word upholdest all;
Thy bounteous love to all is showed.
Thou hear’st Thy every creature’s call,
And fillest every mouth with good.
	 ~ 	2 . W'asɛm na ɔma biribiara gyina;
Ekyerɛ Wo dɔ wɔ biara do,
Etse W'abɔdze biara su.
Ema obiara dza odzi.

MHB 47
3 . Giver and Lord of life, Whose power
And guardian care for all are free,
To thee, in fierce temptations hour,
From sin and Satan let us flee.
	 ~ 	3 . N-kwa Wura nye ne Mafo,
Ɔwo na ebɔ hɛn nyina ho ban,
Nsɔhwɛ ber huuhu yi mu so,
Gye hɛn fi bɔn na Satan nsa.

MHB 47
4 . Thine, Lord, we are, and ours thou art;
In us be all thy goodness showed.
Renew, enlarge, and fill our heart
With peace, and joy, and heaven, and God.
	 ~ 	4 . Ewuradze, eyɛ hɛndze,
Kyerɛ W'ayamuyie nyina wɔ hɛn do;
Fa asomdwee na sor enyigye
Hyɛ hɛn akoma m' ma ɔnyɛ fofor.

MHB 47
5 . Father, tis Thine each day to yield
Thy children’s wants a fresh supply;
Thou cloth’st the lilies of the field,
And hearest the young ravens cry
	 ~ 	5 . Egya, Wodze nye dɛ ema
Wo mbofra daa daa edziban;
Fura haban mu sukooko tam,
Na tsie n-konkoran hɔn su.

MHB 47
6 . On Thee we cast our care; we live
Through Thee, who know’st our every need:
O feed us with Thy grace, and give
Our souls this day the living bread.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Yɛdze hɛn dadwen to Wo do,
Ɔwo na inyim hɛn hia nyina;
O fa W'adom no nyɛn hɛn na 
Ma hɛn akra nkwa paanoo ndɛ. Amen.

MHB 470
1 . STILL with Thee, O my God,
I would desire to be;
By day, by night, at home, abroad,
I would be still with Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . MEPƐ dɛ menye Wo
Tsena O, Ewuradze;
Aber biara na bea biara,
Menye Wo bɛtsena.
Na wu m', menye Wo ntsena.  Amen.

MHB 470
2 . With Thee, when dawn comes in
And calls me back to care,
Each day returning to begin
With Thee, my God, in prayer.
	 ~ 	2 
. Me Nyame, ma menye W'
Monsoɛr nyɛ edwuma;
Sɛ dabiara resan aba a,
Menye W' hyɛ ase mpaabɔ m'.

MHB 470
3 . With Thee, amid the crowd
That throngs the busy mart,
To hear Thy voice' mid clamour loud,
Speak softly to my heart.
	 ~ 	3 
. Menye W' wɔ hɔ; dɔm a
Wɔyɛ gyegyeegye mma
Menntse Wo ndze no koraa ntsi,
Ka n' berɛww kyerɛ m'akoma.

MHB 470
4 . With Thee, when day is done,
And evening calms the mind;
The setting as the rising sun
With Thee my heart would find.
	 ~ 	4 
. Menye W' wɔ hɔ; sɛ da
Sa na ewimbir dwedwe m',
Ma witɔree yɛ dɛ wi puei a,
M'akoma bɔhwehwɛ Wo.

MHB 470
5 . With Thee ,when darkness brings
The signal of repose,
Calm in the shadow of Thy wings,
Mine eyelids I would close.
 	 ~ 	5 
. Ɔwo na sɛ adzesaa dze
Ahomgye brɛ hɛn a,
M'bɛhyɛ W'atsaban ase komm na
Maka m'enyi egu do.

MHB 470
6 . With Thee, in Thee, by faith
Abiding, I would be;
By day, by night, in life, in death,
I would be still with Thee.	 ~ 	6 
. Gyedzi mu ara na
Menye Wo bɛtsena;
Adzekyee, adzesaa nye nkwa

MHB 471
1 .  O GOD, my God, my all thou art!
Ere shines the dawn of rising day,
Thy sovereign light within my heart,
Thy all-enlivening power display.
	 ~ 	1 . O ME Nyame, Ͻwo yɛ m’dze:
Ansaana ewia rubopue no,
Wo tum ne kan hyérɛn m’akoma m’,
Na eda Wo tum nwanwa edzi.
Nyia Ͻwo gye no nndzi ͻkogu.

MHB 471
2 . For thee my thirsty soul doth pant,
While in this desert land I live;
And hungry as I am, and faint,
Thy love alone can comfort give.
	 ~ 	2 
. Me kra a nsukͻm dze n’ hwehwɛ Wo,
Ber a metse sar yi do yi no;
Kaansa ’kͻm dze m’, motͻ bitsi a,
Wo dͻ nko bɛkyekye mo werɛ.

MHB 471
3 . In a dry land, behold, I place
My whole desire on thee, O Lord;
And more I joy to gain thy grace,
Than all earth’s treasures can afford.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hwɛ, asaase pawee yi do,
Ewuradze, medze m’ho to W’ do;
M’enyi gye W’adom ho koraa sen
Wiadze egyapadze nyina.

MHB 471
4 . More dear than life itself, thy love
My heart and tongue shall still employ;
And to declare thy praise will prove
My peace, my glory, and my joy.
	 ~ 	4 
. M’akoma nye me ndze bɛkamfo
Wo dͻ a ͻkyɛn nkwa mpo no,
Na m’asomdwee, ’nyimnyam na dɛw
Bͻbͻ W’ayɛyi no dawur.

MHB 471
5 . In blessing thee with grateful songs
My happy life shall glide away;
The praise that to thy name belongs
Hourly with lifted hands I’ll pay.
	 ~ 	5 
. M’behyira Wo wͻ adwontow mu,
Ber a mo nkwa nda resa no;
Ntonton a ͻfata Wo dzin no
Na dͻnhwer nyina mubotua.

MHB 471
6 . Thy name, O God, upon my bed
Dwells on my lips, and fires my thought;
With trembling awe, in midnight shade,
I muse on all thy hands have wrought.
	 ~ 	6 
. O me Nyankopͻn, me mpa do
Wo dzin pue m’ano, hyɛ adwen ma;
Musuro, m’ ho popo anagosum m’,
Wo nsaano edwuma nwanwa ntsi.

MHB 471
7 .  In all I do I feel thine aid;
Therefore thy greatness will I sing,
O God, who bidd’st my heart be glad
Beneath the shadow of thy wing
	 ~ 	7 
. Dza meyɛ nyina m’ muhu Wo mboa;
Nyankopͻn, ‘Wo a emaa m’akoma
Dzii ehurusi wͻ W’atsaban ase,
M’bͻtow Wo kɛseyɛ ho ndwom.

MHB 471
8 .  My soul draws nigh and cleaves to thee:
Then let or earth or hell assail,
Thy mighty hand shall set me free;
For whom thou sav’st, he ne’er shall fail.	 ~ 	8 
. Me kra twe bɛn Wo, na ͻtar Wo,
Ntsi ma dza ͻbɛba biara mbra;
Wo tum nsa botwitwa agye me,

MHB 472
1 . COME in, O come! the door stands open now;
I knew Thy voice, Lord Jesus, it was Thou;
The sun has set long since, the storms begin;
’Tis time for Thee, my Savior, O come in!
 	 ~ 	1 . Bra, bɔsoɛ me! Mebue abow n' sesei; 
Mo Wura, minyim Wo ndze, dɛ Ɔwoara a.
Ewia atɔ dada na ehum reba;
Me Gyefo, ayɛ mbrɛ ebɔsoɛ me, bra!
Bɔsoɛ me, mo Wura Jesus, Woara bra! Amen.

MHB 472
2 . I seek no more to alter things, or mend,
Before the coming of so great a Friend;
All were at best unseemly, and ’twere ill
Beyond all else to keep Thee waiting still.
	 ~ 	2 
. Memmper bio dɛ m'bɛsakyer hweeara 
Ansaana Dɔfo kɛse yi aba:
Misiesie n' yie dɛn ara a, ɔmmfata;
Misianka W' kakra so a, ɔnnsɛ koraa.

MHB 472
3 . Then,as Thou art, all holiness and bliss,
Come in, and see my chanber as it is;
I bid Thee welcome boldly, in the name
Of Thy great glory and my want and Shame.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Mbrɛ etse n' ara, fa W'ahotsew nye dɛw 
Bra dan mu bɔhwɛ mbrɛ no mu tse ara;
W'enyimnyam kɛse na m'ahohia ntsi
Munnsuro dɛ m'bɛgye W' asoɛ me fi.

MHB 472
4 . Come, not to find, but make this troubled heart
A dwelling worthy of Thee as Thou art;
To chase the gloom, the terror, and the sin:
Come, all Thyself, yea come, Lord Jesus, in ! Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Bra, na nnyɛ dɛ ibohu m'akoma  
Dɛ mu tsew, na mbom bɛyɛ ma ɔmfata W';
Bɛpa mu bɔn nye sum nye suro nyina

MHB 473
1 . MY heart is resting, O my God
I will give thanks and sing;
My heart is at the secret source
Of every precious thing.
Now the frail vessel Thou hast made
No hand but Thine shall fill
For the waters of the Earth have failed,
And I am thirsty still.
	 ~ 	1 . M'AKOMA atɔ m' yamu, Nyame,
Mebɛda W' ase, matow ndwom;
Beebi a ndzepa nyina wɔ no,
Hɔ na m'akoma so wɔ,
Na kuraba a ɔwo awen yi,
Obiara nntum nnhyɛ n' ma;
'Siandɛ asaase do nsu
Nnyɛ hwee, nsukɔm dze me.
Ɔnnkɔbɔ adze da.

MHB 473
2 . I thirst for springs of heavenly life,
And here all day they rise
I seek the treasure of Thy love,
And close at hand it lies.
And a new song is in my mouth
To long loved music set
	 ~ 	2 
. Mo kɔn dɔ ɔsor nkwa nsu n',
Na ha daa nyina ɔpem;
Mohwehwɛ W' dɔ n'egyapadze n'
Na onnyi ekyir koraa;
Ndwom fofor wɔ m'anomu a
Wɔahyehyɛ n' ɔdɔ ndwom;
W'adom nyina ntsi enyimnyam
Nka Wo; minnyaa nnkaa nnhwɛe.

MHB 473
3 . Glory to Thee for all the grace
I have not tasted yet.
 Glory to Thee for strength withheld,
For want and weakness known
And the fear that sends me to Thy breast
For what is most my own.
I have a heritage of joy
That yet I must not see;
But the hand that bled to make it mine
Is keeping it for me.
	 ~ 	3 
. Enyimnyam na tum nka Wo,
Minnyi ahoɔdzen dɛ Ɔwo;
Na suro a ɔdze me bɛn Wo bo m' no n',
Dza ɔyɛ medze koraa n',
Mowɔ dɛw egyapadze bi a
Onnyi dɛ muhu mpo;
N-sa a okyii bɔgya maa me
No risie ama me.

MHB 473
4 . My heart is resting, O my God,
 My heart is in Thy care
I hear the voice of joy and health
Resounding everywhere.
“Thou art my portion,” saith my soul,
Ten thousand voices say,
And the music of their glad Amen,
Will never die away.	 ~ 	4 
. M'akoma atɔ me yamu, Nyame,
M'akoma wɔ Wo nsamu;
Metse enyigye na ahoɔdzen 
N-ka wɔ beebiara,
Me kra se, Ɔwo nye me kyɛfa!
Ɔpedu ndze ka dɛm,
Na hɔn enyigye Amen ndwom no

MHB 474
1 . STILL, still with Thee, when purple morning breaketh,
When the bird waketh, and the shadows flee;
Fairer than morning, lovelier than daylight,
Dawns the sweet consciousness, I am with Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . MENYE Wo wɔ hɔ ber a wimu rebaabaa,
Ber a anoma rinyan na sunsuma reyew;
Ɔyɛ fɛw kyɛn anapa, ɔyɛ fɛw kyɛn wigyinae,
Hyɛ m'adwen dɛw ma dɛ menye W' wɔ hɔ.
Adwen n' bɛda edzi, menye W' wɔ hɔ.   Amen.

MHB 474
2 . Alone with Thee, amid the mystic shadows,
The solemn hush of nature newly born;
Alone with Thee in breathless adoration,
In the calm dew and freshness of the morn.
	 ~ 	2 
. Menye Wo nko wɔ hɔ sunsuma no mu
Abɔdze fofor a ɔfata dzin n' mu;
Ɔwo nkotsee na minnkegyaa W' tonton da,
Wɔ anapa bɔsu nwinwin no mu.

MHB 474
3 . As in the dawning o’er the waveless ocean
The image of the morning star doth rest,
So in the stillness Thou beholdest only
Thine image in the waters of my breast.
	 ~ 	3 
. W'enyimnyam anapa woraba n' rohom
Wɔ anapa bɔw mu dɛ mbrɛ po ataa dzinn;
Na dɛm n-tsi kommyɛ yi mu na ihu
W'enyimdua wɔ m'akoma mu nsamu.

MHB 474
4 . Still, still with Thee, as to each newborn morning,
A fresh and solemn splendor still is given,
So does this blessèd consciousness, awaking,
Breathe each day nearness unto Thee and Heaven.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Meda ho nye W' wɔ hɔ dɛ anapa fofor 
Ɔda ho ma hɛn dza ɔyɛ ahomka;
Dɛmara na siar enyidahɔ yi rinyan,
Na daa ɔgye ahom bɛn Wo wɔ sor.

MHB 474
5 . When sinks the soul, subdued by toil, to slumber,
Its closing eye looks up to Thee in prayer;
Sweet the repose beneath the wings o’ershading,
But sweeter still to wake and find Thee there.
	 ~ 	5 
. Sɛ ɔberɛ ma 'kra tɔ nkom na ɔmem a,
N'enyiwa a oemua hwɛ Wo wɔ mpaabɔ m',
W'atsaban no nwin ase ahomgye yɛ dɛw,
Ɔyɛ dɛw mbordo dɛ m'bohu Wo hɔ.

MHB 474
6 . So shall it be at last, in that bright morning,
When the soul waketh and life’s shadows flee;
O in that hour, fairer than daylight dawning,
Shall rise the glorious thought-I am with Thee.	 ~ 	6 
. Dɛm na ewiei anapa kan mu no bɛyɛ,
Ber a ɔkra nyan na nkwa sunsuma etu kɔ;
Dɛm dɔnhwer n' m' 'bɛyɛ fɛw akyɛn anapa kan,

MHB 475
1 . I NEED Thee every hour,
Most gracious Lord;
No tender voice like Thine
Can peace afford.

      I need Thee, O I need Thee;
      Every hour I need Thee;
      O bless me now, my Savior,
            I come to Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . Mihia Wo Mber Nyina, 
Domfo Ewuradze;
Ndze bi nntse dɛ Wodze a,
Ɔma asomdwee. 

Mihia Wo, ao, mihia Wo, 
Mber nyina mihia Wo; 
M'Agyenkwa, Maba Wo hɔ, 
Hyira me sesei. 
Pon ne nyina ma m'.

MHB 475
2 . I need Thee every hour,
Stay Thou nearby;
Temptations lose their power 
When Thou art nigh.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mihia Wo mber nyina, 
Pinkyɛn me daa;
Ber a Ɔwo bɛn me n'
Mennyɛ bɔn da.

MHB 475
3 . I need Thee every hour,
In joy or pain;
Come quickly and abide, 
Or life is in vain.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mihia Wo mber nyina, 
Dɛw mu o, yaw mu o;
Bra ntsɛm bɛnye me ntsena,
Mma ɔbra annyɛ gyan.

MHB 475
4 . I need Thee every hour;
Teach me Thy will;
And Thy rich promises 
In me fulfill.	 ~ 	4  
. Mihia Wo mber nyina, 
Kyerɛkyerɛ m' Wo pɛ;
W'anohoba a ɔsom bo n'

MHB 476
1 . FROM trials unexempted
Thy dearest children are;
But let us not be tempted
Above what we can bear;
Exposed to no temptation
That may our souls o’erpower,
Be thou our strong salvation
Through every fiery hour. 
	 ~ 	1 . WO mba a edɔ hɔn kɛse n',
Hɔn so wohyia nkodzen;
Mma wɔnnsɔ hɛn nnhwɛ mma ɔmmbor
Dza yebotum asɔw;
Sɛ nsɔhwɛ a yetum gyina enyim,
Dza onndzi hɛn kra do nyim
Ba a, yɛ hɛn nkwagye dzendzen,
Wɔ ogya dɔnhwer mu.
Na yi bɔn fi hɔ koraa.  Amen.

MHB 476
2 . Ah ! leave us not to venture
Within the verge of sin;
Or if the snare we enter,
Thy timely help bring in;
And if thy wisdom try us
Till pain and woe are past,
Almighty Love, stand by us,
And save from first to last!
	 ~ 	2 
. Aa! Mma nngyaa hɛn mma yɛnnkɔ
Bɔn no nkɔnkɔnoa da;
Na sɛ yɛtɔ efir mu a,
Dom hɛn Wo mboa ber pa m',
Sɛ Wo nyansaa sɔ hɛn hwɛ a,
Kɛpem dɛ yaw botwa m' n',
Ɔdɔ kɛse, bɛn hɛn yie
Na gye hɛn mu biara.

MHB 476
3 . Fain would we cease from sinning
In thought and word and deed,
From sin in its beginning
We languish to be freed;
From every base desire,
Our fallen nature’s shame,
Jesus, we dare require
Deliverance in thy name.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛpɛ dɛ yegyaa bɔn yɛ,
Adwen, kasa na nyɛe m';
Yɛyɛ nyaa dɛ wɔgye hɛn 
Fi bɔn n'ahyɛse mu;
Akɔndɔbɔn biara mu,
Hɛn nyimpasu ne fɛr n',
Jesus, yɛserɛ dɛ gye hɛn
Fi mu wɔ Wo dzin mu.

MHB 476
4 . For every sinful action
Thou hast atonement made,
The rigid satisfaction
Thy precious blood has paid:
But take entire possession;
To make an end of sin,
To finish the transgression,
Most holy God, come in !  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Abɔ werdam ama hɛn 
Wɔ ndzeyɛɛ bɔn biara ho,
Mpatadze a odzi mu no,
Adehye bɔgya etua;
Na fa biribiara ndɔmmum;
Nyame krɔnkrɔn, bra mu!
Botwa emumuyɛ do,

MHB 477
1 . SON of God, if thy free grace
Again has raised me up,
Called me still to seek thy face,
And given me back my hope:
Still thy timely help afford,
And all thy loving kindness show:
Keep me, keep me, gracious Lord,
And never let me go!
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME Ba, sɛ W'adom no
Ama mo do bio dze a,
Ɔfrɛ m' dɛ monhwehwɛ Wo,
Na ɔama m' enyidar a,
Kɔ do ara dom m' Wo mboa pa,
Na kyerɛ m' W'ayamuyie nyina;
Domfo Ewuradze, kora me,
Na mma nngyaa m' mma monnkɔ!
Na mma nngya m' mma monnkɔ!  Amen.

MHB 477
2 . By me, O my Saviour, stand
In sore temptation’s hour;
Save me with thine outstretched hand,
And show forth all thy power;
O be mindful of thy word,
Thy all-sufficient grace bestow:
Keep me, keep me, gracious Lord,
And never let me go!
	 ~ 	2 
. O me Gyefo, gyina me nkyɛn 
Wɔ nsɔhwɛ dzendzen ber m';
Fa Wo nsa a atsen mu n' gye m',
Na kyerɛ Wo tum nyina;
O dwen W'asɔm no ho na
Hue W'adom mapa n' gu mo do;
Domfo Ewuradze, kora me,
Na mma nngyaa m' mma monnkɔ!

MHB 477
3 . Give me, Lord, a holy fear,
And fix it in my heart,
That I may from evil near
With timely care depart;
Sin be more than hell abhorred;
Till thou destroy the tyrant foe,
Keep me, keep me, gracious Lord,
And never let me go!
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, ma m' suro krɔnkrɔn
Na tsim no m'akoma m',
Ama medze ahwɛyie pa
Meeguan efi mfom ho,
Meekyir bɔn akyɛn hɛll mpo;
Kɛpem dɛ esɛɛ tamfo bawee n'
Domfo Ewuradze, kora me,
Na mma nngyaa m' mma monnkɔ!

MHB 477
4 . Never let me leave thy breast,
From thee, my Saviour, stray;
Thou art my support and rest,
My true and living Way;
My exceeding great reward,
In heaven above, and earth below:
Keep me, keep me, gracious Lord,
And never let me go !   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Mma mimmfi Wo bom' ara da
Monntɔ dɔnsuar, Gyefo;
Ɔwo nye m' Boafo na Ahom,
Nokwar, asetsena Kwan n';
M'akatua abɔso mapa,
Wɔ heaven na asaase do ha;
Domfo Ewuardze, kora me,

MHB 478
1 . JESUS, my Savior, Brother, Friend,
On Whom I cast my every care,
On Whom for all things I depend,
Inspire, and then accept, my prayer.
	 ~ 	1 . Jesus, me Gyefo, Nua, Nyɛnko, 
M'adwendwen nyina da Wo do;
Adze nyina mu medan Wo:
Woara hyehɛ na gye m'asɔr.
Motwer Wo nko a, nna migyina, Amen.

MHB 478
2 . If I have tasted of Thy grace,
The grace that sure salvation brings,
If with me now Thy Spirit stays,
And hovering hides me in His wings.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ W'adom a ɔma nkwagye n' 
Na menya masɔ bi mahwɛ,
Sɛ Woara Wo Sunsum nye m' tse
Na ɔdze N'atsaban kata m' do a:

MHB 478
3 . Still let Him with my weakness stay,
Nor for a moment’s space depart,
Evil and danger turn away,
And keep till He renews my heart.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Nna ma ɔnda ho ɔnhyɛ me dzen, 
Na mma onngyaa m' hɔ ara da,
Ma ɔmpa m' esian nye mbusu,
Onsie me kra ma ɔnyɛ fofor,

MHB 478
4 . When to the right or left I stray,
His voice behind me may I hear,
“Return, and walk in Christ Thy way,
Fly back to Christ, for sin is near.”
	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ mofom fi kwan pa nom' a, 
Ma mentse Ne ndze wɔ m'ekyir
Dɛ, San, bodua wo kwan Christ mu,
Guan kɔ Christ hɔ, na bɔn abɛn.

MHB 478
5 . His sacred unction from above
Be still my Comforter and Guide;
Till all the hardness He remove,
And in my loving heart reside.
	 ~ 	5  
. No ngo krɔnkrɔn a ofi sor 
Nda ho nkyekye mo werɛ, nkyerɛ m' kwan,
Nkɛpem dɛ m'akoma bɔgow
Na Noara dze dɔ bɛtsena mu.

MHB 478
6 . Jesus, I fain would walk in Thee,
From nature’s every path retreat;
Thou art my Way, my Leader be,
And set upon the rock my feet.
	 ~ 	6 
. Jesus, n-kyɛ 'nye m' aanantsew 
Na meefi honam akwan do;
'Wo nye mo Kwan, yɛ m' Kwankyerɛfo;
Fa me nan si botan no do.

MHB 478
7 . Uphold me, Savior, or I fall,
O reach me out Thy gracious hand
Only on Thee for help I call,
Only by faith in Thee I stand	 ~ 	7 
. Gyefo, tsen Wo nsa suo mo mu, 
Annyɛ n' dɛm a, nna mobɔhwe ase!
Wo nkotoo na musu frɛ Wo,

MHB 479
1 . FAINTING soul, be bold, be strong,
Wait the leisure of thy Lord;
Though it seem to tarry long,
True and faithful is His word:
On His word my soul I cast
He cannot Himself deny;
Surely it shall speak at last;
It shall speak, and shall not lie.
 Every one that seeks shall find,
	 ~ 	1 . 'KRA bahatɔfo, yɛ dzen,
Tweɔn W'Ewuradze Ne ber pa;
Kaansa N'asɛm kyɛr dɛn ara a,
Ɔyɛ nokwar na osi pi;
Medze me kra twer N'asɛm,
Onnkotwa abrɔdɔ da;
Asɛm n' bɛba m' ampaara
Orunntwa abrɔdɔ ara da.
Ebɔkɔ do ara agye m'.

MHB 479
2 . Every one that asks shall have
Christ, the Saviour of mankind,
Willing, able, all to save;
I shall His salvation see,
I in faith on Jesus call,
I from sin shall be set free,
Perfectly set free from all.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyia ɔhwehwɛ biara bohu,
Nyia obisa biara benya;
Christ, adasa Agyenkwa n',
Pɛ dɛ ɔgye nyimpa nyina nkwa;
Mubohu No nkwagye no,
Mefrɛ Jesus wɔ gyedzi m',
Ɔbɔpon me efi bɔn nyina m',
'Bɛgye m' koraa efi biribiara m'.

MHB 479
3 . Lord, my time is in Thine hand,
Weak and helpless as I am,
Surely Thou canst make me stand;
I believe in Jesu’s name:
Saviour in temptation Thou;
Thou hast saved me heretofore,
Thou from sin dost save me now,
Thou shalt save me evermore.	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, me mber wɔ W' nsamu;
Matɔ bahaw, yɛ mberɛw mpo a,
Ɔwo bɛma meegyina pirim;
'Mi megye Jesus dzin n' dzi,
Nsɔhwɛ mu Gyefo nye Wo,
Agye me nkwa dadaada;
Egye m' nkwa fi bɔn m' sesei,

MHB 48
1 . I SING the almighty power of God, 
 That made the mountains rise, 
 That spread the flowing seas abroad, 
 And built the lofty skies.
	 ~ 	1 . BƐKYEBO Nyame, sorsor mpo
W'ayamuyie no hyerɛn wɔ hɔ;
Wo nokwar tra mununkum no,
Dza ɔkata Wo nhyehyɛɛ enyim.

MHB 48
2 . I sing the wisdom that ordained 
 The sun to rule the day; 
 The moon shines full at His command, 
 And all the stars obey.
	 ~ 	2 . Wo pɛrpɛr gyina hɔ pintsinn
Dɛ mbepɔw a hɔn fapem etsim;
Wo nsaano edwuma yɛ nwanwa;
W'atsɛmbu dɔ dɛ po no bun.

MHB 48
3 . I sing the goodness of the Lord, 
 That filled the earth with food; 
 He formed the creatures with His word, 
 And then pronounced them good.
	 ~ 	3 . Dza 'dze ma no ye na ɔdɔɔ so, 
Ɔso nyimpa na mbowa nyina; 
Ehwɛ abɔdze nyina do,
Ahotsewfo dze yɛ soronko.

MHB 48
4 . Lord, how Thy wonders are displayed 
 Whereer I turn mine eye, 
 If I survey the ground I tread, 
 Or gaze upon the sky.
	 ~ 	4 . Nyame, W'adom no ho tsew koraa, 
Hɛn enyidar na awerɛkyekyer fi m'! 
Adam mba a wɔwɔ ɔhokyer mu 
Guan kɔ W'atsaban nwin ase.

MHB 48
5 . There's not a plant or flower below 
 But makes Thy glories known, 
 And clouds arise and tempests blow 
 By order from Thy throne.
	 ~ 	5 . N-kwa tse dɛ nsunyiwa a 
Ofi Ɔwo Ewuradze nkyɛn,
Na Wo kan mu hɛn akra hu 
Anohoba a ɔwɔ W'asɛm mu.

MHB 480
1 . AH ! Lord, with trembling I confess,
A gracious soul may fall from grace;
The salt may lose its seasoning power,
And never, never, find it more.
	 ~ 	1 . AA! EWURADZE, mepaa mu ka,
Adom mu ɔkra tum hwe ase;
N-kyen botum ayew ne dɛw,
Ma no ho nnkɛba mfaso bio.
Wɔ ahobrɛadze mu ɔdɔ mu.

MHB 480
2 .  Lest that my fearful case should be,
Each moment knit my soul to Thee;
And lead me to the mount above,
Through the low vale of humble love.	 ~ 	2 
. Mbrɛ ɔnnkɛba n' dɛm wɔ m'afamu n',
Fa me kra hyɛ Wo mu aber nyina,
Na gya m' kɔ sor bepɔw no do

MHB 481
1 . HARK, how the watchmen cry !
Attend the trumpet’s sound !
Stand to your arms, the foe is nigh,
The powers of hell surround:
Who bow to Christ’s command,
Your arms and hearts prepare !
The day of battle is at hand !
Go forth to glorious war !
	 ~ 	1 . TSIE mbrɛ aweɔmfo, n' si frɛ!
Dzi abɛn n' ne ndze do!
Hom nsoɛr mbɔ ntoa, tamfo n' abɛn,
Hom ntwa nyer hɛll no tum;
Hom a hom tsie Christ N'asɛm n',
Hom nsiesie hom akodze!
Akodzi da n' abɛn koraa!
Hom nkɔ enyimnyam ko n'!
Na hom nye M' edzi hen!

MHB 481
2 . Go up with Christ your Head,
Your Captain's footsteps see;
Allow your Captain, and be led
To certain victory.
All power to Him is given,
He ever reigns the same;
Salvation, happiness, and heaven
Are all in Jesu's name.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hom nye Sahen Christ nkɔ!
Hom nhwɛ Ɔhen N'anamɔn;
Hom ndzi N'ekyir ma ɔmfa hom nkɔ
Konyimdzi a ɔbɛba m',
Wɔdze tum nyina ama No,
Ɔda ho ara dzi hen;
Nkwagye, enyigye na heaven
Nyinara fir Jesus.

MHB 481
3 . Jesu's tremendous name
Puts all our foes to flight:
Jesus, the meek, the angry Lamb,
A Lion is in fight.
By all hell's host withstood
We all hell's host o'erthrow;
And conquering them, through Jesu's blood,
We still to conquer go.
	 ~ 	3 
. Jesus dzin nwanwa no
Ma hɛn atamfo nyina guan;
Jesus brɛfo, 'Guambaa dzendzen,
Ɔyɛ Gyata wɔ ɔko m',
Yɛnye hɛll dɔm dzi esi;
Yetu hɛll dɔm nyina gu;
Yedzi hɔn do Jesu bɔgyaa m',
Yebedzi konyim daa.

MHB 481
4 . Our Captain leads us on ;
He beckons from the skies,
And reaches out a starry crown,
And bids us take the prize :
Be faithful unto death,
Partake My victory ;
And thou shalt wear this glorious wreath,
And thou shalt reign with Me !	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn Sahen dzi hɛn kan;
Ɔto hɛn nsa fi sor,
Na ɔdze ahenkyɛw hyɛnn kyerɛ hɛn,
Ɔdɛ yɛngye akatua n';
Ndzi nokwar nkodu owu m',
Hom nye M' nkyɛ Mo konyim;
Na hom bɔbɔ enyimnyam abɔtsir n'

MHB 482
1 . HARK! ’tis the watchman’s cry,
“Wake, brethren, wake!”
Jesus our Lord is nigh;
Wake, brethren, wake!
Sleep is for sons of night;
Ye are children of the light,
Yours is the glory bright;
Wake, brethren, wake!
	 ~ 	1 . TSIE! Ɔweɔmfo n' ndze nye n';
'Nuanom, hom nyan!
Jesus Noara ɔabɛn;
Nuanom, hom nyan!
Sum mu mba na wɔda!
Homdze, hom yɛ kan mu mba;
'Nyimnyam hyɛnn n' yɛ homdze;
Nuanom, hom nyan!
Hom nyi N' ayɛw!

MHB 482
2 . Call to each wakening band,
Watch, brethren, watch!”
Clear is our Lord’s command;
Watch, brethren, watch!
Be ye as men that wait
Always at the Master’s gate,
E’en though He tarry late;
Watch, brethren, watch!
	 ~ 	2 
. Hom nse hɔn a wonyan dɛ;
'Nuanom, hom nweɔn!
Hɛn Wura N'asɛm pefee;
'Nuanom, hom nweɔn!
Hom nyɛ dɛ mbanyin a daa
Wɔtweɔn hɔn Wura N'abowano;
Kaansa ɔyɛ ekyim mpo a,
Nuanom, hom nweɔn!

MHB 482
3 . Heed we the Master's call :
Work, brethen, work !
There's room enough for all,
Work, brethren, work !
This vineyard of the Lord
Constant labour will afford;
He will your work reward :
Work, brethren, work !
	 ~ 	3 
. Yentsie hɛn Wura Ne frɛ;
Hom nyɛ edwuma!
Obia a benya bi ayɛ,
Hom nyɛ edwuma!
Edwuma wɔ Ewuradze
No wenyin turo m' dabaa;
Ɔbɛma hom akatua;
Hom nyɛ edwuma!

MHB 482
4 . Hear we the Saviour's voice,
“Pray, brethren, pray!”
Would ye His heart rejoice?
Pray, brethren, pray!
 Sin calls for ceaseless fear,
Weakness needs the Strong One near
Long as ye struggle here;
Pray, brethren, pray!
	 ~ 	4 
. Yentsie Gyefo Ne ndze;
'Nuanom, hom nsɔr!
Hom ndzi N'akoma m' dɛw,
'Nuanom, hom nsɔr!
Bɔn frɛfrɛ suro daapem,
Mberɛw hia dɛ Hoɔdzenfo n' bɛn;
Mber tsentsen a hom per ha 'i,
'Nuanom, hom nsɔr!

MHB 482
5 . Sound now the final chord,
Praise, brethren, praise !
Thrice holy is our Lord;
Praise, brethren, praise!
What more befits the tongues
Soon to lead the angels’ songs?
Whilst Heaven the note prolongs,
Praise, brethren, praise!	 ~ 	5 
. Afei hom mbɔ nsanku n',
Hom nyi N' ayɛw!
Ewuradze yɛ krɔnkrɔn,
Hom nyi N' ayɛw!
Ebɛn fata ngyirama a
Wɔbɔtow abɔfo ndwom n' bi?
Ber a sor dze ndwom no mu 'i,

MHB 483
1 . SURROUNDED by a host of foes,
Stormed by a host of foes within,
Nor swift to flee, nor strong to oppose,
Single, against hell, earth, and sin,
Single, yet undismayed, I am;
I dare believe in Jesu’s name.
	 ~ 	1 . ATAMFO etwa moho ehyia,
Fie atamfo abɔ mo ho aprɔw,
Munntum mmfi nsa, munntum nngyina enyim;
Mo nko nye hɛll, bɔn na asaase,
Mo nko ara naaso munnsuro;
Megye Jesu dzin midzi pi.
Megye Jesu dzin midzi pi.   Amen.

MHB 483
2 . What though a thousand hosts engage,
A thousand worlds, my soul to shake?
I have a shield shall quell their rage,
And drive the alien armies back;
Portrayed it bears a bleeding Lamb
I dare believe in Jesu’s name
	 ~ 	2 
. Dɔm mpempem ba mo do ntsi dɛn?
Wiadze pusow me kra ntsi dɛn?
Mowɔ akokyɛm a ɔbɔbɔ hɔn egu;
Obepia akofo n' akɔ ekyir;
Wohu Eguambaa bɔgyaa wɔ m' mu;
Megye Jesu dzin midzi pi.

MHB 483
3 . Me to retrieve from Satan’s hands,
Me from this evil world to free,
To purge my sins, and loose my bands,
And save from all iniquity,
My Lord and God from heaven he came;
I dare believe in Jesu’s name.
	 ~ 	3 
. M'Ewuradze Nyame fii sor bae
Dɛ ɔrebɛgye m' bɔn wiadze 'i, m',
Dɛ ɔrebɛgye m' Satan nsamu,
Abɔhor m' bɔn, eyi m' mpokyerɛ m',
Na ɔagye m' nkwa efi emumuyɛ m';
Megye Jesu dzin midzi pi.

MHB 483
4 . Salvation in his name there is,
Salvation from sin, death, and hell,
Salvation into glorious bliss,
How great salvation, who can tell!
But all he hath for mine I claim;
I dare believe in Jesu’s name.	 ~ 	4 
. N-kwagye wɔ Ne dzin m' papa,
N-kwagye fi bɔn, 'wu na hɛll,
N-kwagye a wɔdze kɔ dɛw mu;
N- kwagye kɛse a, wɔka n' dɛw?
Na megye dza ɔwɔ ma m' nyina;

MHB 484
1 . SOLDIERS of Christ, arise,
And put your armour on,
Strong in the strength which God supplies,
Through his eternal Son; strong in the Lord of Hosts,
And in his mighty power:
who in the strength of Jesus trusts
Is more that conqueror.
	 ~ 	1 . Christ nsordafo, hom nsoɛr, 
Hom mmia hom akodze,
Nyɛ dzen wɔ tum a Nyame nam
No domankoma Ba n' do ma n'
Nyɛ dzen Dɔm Ewuradzem'
Na No tum ahoɔdzenm'
Nyia ɔtwer Jesus N'ahoɔdzen n' yɛ
Konyimdzifo mbordo.
Ɔno a ɔyɛ hom Tsir n'.

MHB 484
2 . Stand then in his great might, 
with all his strength endued;
And take, to arm you for the fight,
The panoply of God. that, having all things done,
And all your conflicts past,
Ye may o’ercome, through Christ alone,
And stand entire at last.
	 ~ 	2  
. Hom ngyina No tum kɛsem' 
Mfa N'ahoɔdzen nyina nhyɛ
Na wɔmfa Nyame akodze n'
Mmia wɔ ɔko no mu;
Wɔayɛ adze nyina ewie n',
Na nkodzen abɔ adze n'
Hom nam Christ do eedzi konyim,
Ewiei n' hom eedzi mu.

MHB 484
3 . Stand then against your foes,
In close and firm array;
Legions of wily flends oppose
Throughout the evil day:
But meet the sons of night;
But mock their vain design,
Armed in the arms of heavenly light,
Of righteousness divine.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hom nsoɛr ntsia atamfo 
Wɔ mpu-na-mpu ko mu
Wɔnko ntsia mbɔnsam dɔmtutuw
Wɔ mbusu da nyinam'
Wɔnye sum mu mba nsi
Wɔnserew hɔn apam hun
Wɔmma ɔsor kan akodze
Ɔnye tsenenee nhyɛ hɔn.

MHB 484
4 . Leave no unguarded place,
No weakness of the soul;
Take every virtue, every grace,
And fortify the whole:
Indissolubly joined,
To battle all proceed;
But arm yourselves with all the mind
That was in Christ, your Head.	 ~ 	4 
. Mma hom nnto beebiara 
Pan, nnkyerɛ kra ne mberɛwyɛ
Wɔmfa papayɛ na adom
Mbɔ homho ban pirim;
Wɔmbɔm' nkyekyer nyɛ kor,
Hom nyina nduom akono;
Wɔmfa adwen a ɔwɔ Christ m' mmia,

MHB 485
1 . I’M not ashamed to own my Lord,
Or to defend his cause,
Maintain the honour of his word,
The glory of his cross.
	 ~ 	1 . Memmfɛr dɛ m'bɛgye mo Wura atom' 
Na maper N'edwuma ho,
Mesuo N'asɛm ho enyidzim',
Ne mbeamudua ho enyimnyam n'.

  (Mbeamudua ho, mbeamudua ho, mbrɛ 
  midzii kan muhun kan, 
  Na m'akoma n'adzesoa n' pirewii fii hɔ; 
  Hɔ na menam gyedzim' muhum adze, 
  Na afei m'ahom ka mo ho daa.) 
Ɔama me kra tsenabew.

MHB 485
2 . Jesus, my God, I know his name,
His name is all my trust;
Nor will he put my soul to shame,
Nor let my hope be lost.
	 ~ 	2  
. Jesus, me Nyame! minyim No, 
Ne dzin nye m'adze nyina;
Ɔnnkɛma me kra afɛr da
Na m'enyidar ayew.

MHB 485
3 . Firm as his throne his promise stands,
And he can well secure
What I’ve committed to his hands
Till the decisive hour.
	 ~ 	3 
. N'asɛm tsim hɔ dɛ N'ahengua 
Na obotum akora
Dza medze ahyɛ Ne nsa n' yie
Ekodu ekyir da n'.

MHB 485
4 . Then will he own my worthless name
Before his Father’s face,
And in the new Jerusalem
Appoint my soul a place.	 ~ 	4 
. Nna ɔbɛgye me dzin saa yi atom' 
Wɔ N'Egya N'enyim hɔ,
Na Jerusalem fofor n' mu

MHB 486
1 . ARM of the Lord, awake, awake!
Thine own immortal strength put on;
With terror clothed, hell’s kingdom shake,
And cast thy foes with fury down.
	 ~ 	1 . Soɛr, Ewuradze N'abasa, soɛr! 
Fa Wo bɛkyebo tum no hyɛ;
Esoɛr a, hɛll 'henman wosow,
W'atamfo gu ebiritsi.
Woedzi wu do nyim edu fie.

MHB 486
2 . As in the ancient days appear;
The sacred annals speak thy fame:
Be now omnipotently near,
To endless ages still the same.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Dɛ mbrɛ tsetse n' iyii Woho n'; 
Kyerɛw krɔnkrɔn bɔ Wo dzin dawur;
Ɔwo a ennsakyer ara da,
Fa W'ahentum kɛse n' bɛn hɛn.

MHB 486
3 . Thy arm, Lord, is not shortened now,
It wants not now the power to save;
Still present with thy people, thou
Bear’st them through life’s disparted wave.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, W'abaw du mbea nyina, 
No tum a ɔgye nkwa mmbɔ adze;
Eda ho nye Wo nkorɔfo tse
Egye hɔn fi ɔbra asorɛkyem'.

MHB 486
4 . By death and hell pursued in vain,
To Thee the ransomed seed shall come;
Shouting, their heavenly Zion gain,
And pass through death triumphant home.	 ~ 	4 
. Owu na hɛll betsiw, hɔn kwa, 
Wo hɔ na esiarfo n' bɛba;
Bɔbɔ se dɛ wɔahɛn Zion,

MHB 487
1 . COME on, my partners in distress,
My comrades through the wilderness,
Who still your bodies feel;
Awhile forget your griefs and fears,
And look beyond this vale of tears,
To that celestial hill.
 	 ~ 	1 . HOM mbra, m'ahohia mu mfɛfo,
Me ndamfo wɔ sar pra 'daa do,
Hom a hom tse wɔ hom wer m',
Hom ngyaa hom yaw na suro kakra,
Hom nhwɛ ntra nyinsuwa bɔnsa yi
Nkɔ sor kokwaa no ho.
Na Nyame yɛ adze nyina.

MHB 487
2 . Beyond the bounds of time and space,
Look forward to that heavenly place,
The saints’ secure abode:
On faith’s strong eagle-pinions rise,
And force your passage to the skies,
And scale the mount of God.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Hom nhwɛ kan ma ɔntra ber na bea,
Hom mma hom enyi nda sorsor kwan,
Ahotsewfo tsenabea n';
Hom ntsena gyedzi dzendzen ntsaban do,
Na hom mper hom kwan wɔ wimu,
Hom mfow Nyame bepɔw n'.

MHB 487
3 . Who suffer with our Master here,
We shall before his face appear,
And by his side sit down;
To patient faith the prize is sure,
And all that to the end endure
The cross, shall wear the crown.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hɛn a yɛnye Hɛn Wura hu amandze n',
Hɛn ara na yebopue N'enyim,
Na yɛatsena Ne nkyɛn so;
Abotar m' gyedzi nya akatua,
Na hɔn a wɔsoa mbeamudua kɔ ewiei n'
Na wɔbɛhyɛ ahenkyɛw n'.

MHB 487
4 .  Thrice blessed, bliss-inspiring hope!
It lifts the fainting spirits up,
It brings to life the dead;
Our conflicts here shall soon be past,
And you and I ascend at last,
Triumphant with our Head.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Ahotɔ enyidar yɛ siar koraa!
Ɔma akra a wɔatɔ bitsi do;
Ɔdze ewufo ba nkwa m';
Hɛn aperdzi ha bɔbɔ adze ntsɛm,
Na nkyii emi na ɔwo nye hɛn Hen
Bosoɛr konyimdzi mu.

MHB 487
5 . That great mysterious Deity
We soon with open face shall see;
The beatific sight
Shall fill heaven’s sounding courts with praise,
And wide diffuse the golden blaze
Of everlasting light.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ɔrennkyɛr bi, yɛdze enyikwaa
Bohu Ɔdomankoma esumadze n',
Dɛm ahoɔfɛdze n' dze
Ntonton bɛhyɛ sor abangua n' ma,
Na ɔama sika gya n' aasɔ
Na ɔadzɛw afebɔɔ.

MHB 487
6 . The Father shining on his throne,
The glorious co-eternal Son,
The Spirit, one and seven,
Conspire our rapture to complete;
And lo ! we fall before his feet,
And silence heightens heaven.
	 ~ 	6 
. Egya a ɔhyerɛn N'ahengua do n',
Ɔnye Ɔba nyimnyamfo na
Sunsum n' nye sor dɔm nyina
Wɔbɔ m' ma hɛn ahotɔ n' dzi mu;
Na hwɛ! Yetwa hwe N'ananadze,
Na kommyɛ hyɛ sor ma.

MHB 487
7 . In hope of that ecstatic pause,
Jesus, we now sustain the cross,
And at thy footstool fall;
Till thou our hidden life reveal,
Till thou our ravished spirits fill,
And God is all in all.	 ~ 	7 
. Jesus, hɛn enyidar wɔ ber n' ho n'
Boa hɛn ma yɛsoa asɛndua n',
Yetwa hwe W'ananadze;
Kɛpem dɛ eda hɛn bra edzi,
Ehyɛ hɛn sunsum berɛfo ma

MHB 488
1 . OFT in danger, oft in woe,
Onward, Christians, onward go;
Fight the fight, maintain the strife,
Strengthened with the bread of life.
	 ~ 	1 . MBUSU mu o, nye esian mu o,
Christianfo, hom nkɔ hom enyim;
Hom nkɔ do nko, mma hom nngyaa,
Nkwa Paanoo nhyɛ hom dzen daa.
Christian nsordaafo, hom nduom.

MHB 488
2 . Shrink not, Christains: will ye yield?
Will ye quit the painful field?
Will ye flee in danger’s hour?
Know ye not your Captain’s power?
	 ~ 	2 
. Christianfo, hom begyaa mu?
Hom boguan efi akono?
Hom boguan mbusu ber mu?
Hom nnyim hom Sahen No tum?

MHB 488
3 . Let your drooping hearts be glad;
March in heavenly armour clad:
Fight, nor think the battle long,
Soon shall victory tune your song.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hom mma hom akoma ndzi dɛw;
Hom mfa sor akodze nhyɛ nko;
Mma hom nndwen dɛ ɔko n' war;
Hom bɔtow konyim ndwom ntsɛm.

MHB 488
4 . Let not sorrow dim your eye,
Soon shall every tear be dry;
Let not fears your course impede,
Great your strength if great your need.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mma awerɛhow mmfura hom enyi,
Wɔbɛpepa nyinsuwa nyina;
Mma suro nntwe hom ekyir,
Hom benya ahoɔdzen kɛse.

MHB 488
5 . Onward, then, to glory move,
More than conquerors ye shall prove;
Though opposed by many a foe,
Christian soldiers, onward go.	 ~ 	5 
. Afei hom nkɔ enyim 'nyimnyam m',
Hom bɛsem nkonyimdzifo;
Hom behyia atamfo pii mpo a,

MHB 489
1 . WORKMAN of God! O lose not heart,
But learn what God is like;
And in the darkest battlefield
Thou shalt know where to strike.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME dwumayɛnyi! Mma mmpa abaw,
Na sua mbrɛ Nyame tse,
Na akono sunkamm no mu hɔ,
'Bohu mbrɛ 'besi ako.
Abrɔdɔ bɛyɛ bɔn.

MHB 489
2 . Thrice blest is he to whom is given
The instinct that can tell
That God is on the field, when He
Is most invisible.
	 ~ 	2 
. Osiarfo nye nyia wɔadom no
Akyɛdze a otum kyerɛ
Dɛ Nyame wɔ bea pɔtsee bi,
Wɔ ber a ohunta hɛn.

MHB 489
3 . For God is other than we think;
His ways are far above,
Far beyond reason’s height, and reached
Only by childlike love.
	 ~ 	3 
. 'Siandɛ Nyame kyɛn mbrɛ yɛdwen;
N'akwan bor hɛn nyimdzee;
Ɔbor hɛn ntseasee, na wɔdze
Mbofra dɔ du Ne nkyɛn.

MHB 489
4 . Then learn to scorn the praise of men,
And learn to lose with God;
For Jesus won the world through shame,
And beckons thee His road.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ntsi bu nyimpa nkamfoe nyimtsia,
Nye Nyame mbu n' anhwer;
Fɛr m' na Jesus dze nyaa wiadze,
Na ɔkyerɛ wo No kwan.

MHB 489
5 . For right is right, since God is God,
And right the day must win;
To doubt would be disloyalty,
To falter would be sin.	 ~ 	5 
. Nyame yɛ Nyame, papa ye,
Ɔwɔ dɛ da n' dzi mu;
Ekyingye bɛyɛ apawtwa,

MHB 49
1 . THY ceaseless, unexhausted love, 
 Unmerited and free, 
 Delights our evil to remove, 
 And help our misery.
	 ~ 	1 . WO dɔ a ɔmmpa da, na ɔnnsa da, 
Yɛmmfata so yenya;
Ɔpɛ dɛ oyi hɛn bɔn fi hɔ, 
Na ɔboa hɛn mbɔbɔryɛ.

MHB 49
2 . Thou  waitest to be gracious still; 
 Thou dost with sinners bear, 
 That, saved, we may thy goodness feel, 
 And all thy grace declare.
	 ~ 	2 . Etweɔn dɛ 'bɔkɔ do adom hɛn;
Etse abɔnfo ase;
Hɛn ɔgye m', yehu W'ayamuyie,
Yɛaka W'adom nyina.

MHB 49
3 . Thy goodness and thy truth to me, 
 To every soul, abound, 
 A vast, unfathomable sea, 
 Where all our thoughts are drowned.
	 ~ 	3 . Wo papayɛ na Wo nokwar
Dɔɔ so ma obiara,
Ɔtse dɛ po a wonnhu ase, 
Bea a hɛn nsusui nndu hɔ.

MHB 49
4 . Its streams the whole creation reach, 
 So plenteous is the store, 
 Enough for all, enough for each, 
 Enough for evermore.
	 ~ 	4 . No nsu du abɔdze nyina do, 
Na no nkorabea ebu do,
Ɔso hɛn nyina, ɔso obiara,
Ɔwɔ hɔ afebɔ.

MHB 49
5 . Faithful, O Lord, Thy mercies are, 
 A rock that cannot move 
 A thousand promises declare 
Thy constancy of love.
	 ~ 	5 . Owura, Wo mbɔbɔrhu tsim hɔ,
Botan a onnhinhim;
Anohoba mpempem kyerɛ
Dɛ Wo dɔ tsim hɔ daa.

MHB 49
6 . Throughout the universe it reigns, 
 Unalterably sure; 
 And while the truth of God remains, 
 The goodness must endure.	 ~ 	6 . Odzi hen wɔ wiadze nyina,
Ɔnnsesa, osi pi;
Na sɛ Nyame nokwar tsena hɔ a,
Papayɛ no betsim.

MHB 490
1 . FIGHT the good fight with all thy might;
Christ is thy Strength, and Christ thy Right;
Lay hold on life, and it shall be
Thy joy and crown eternally.
	 ~ 	1 . FA W'ahom nyina ko ɔko pa n';
Christ yɛ w'ahoɔdzen na wo tum;
Suo nkwa mu yie na ɔbɛyɛ
W'enyigye ahenkyɛw afebɔɔ.
Dɛ Christ yɛ w'adzeadze nyina.

MHB 490
2 . Run the straight race through 
      God’s good grace,
Lift up Thine eyes, and seek His face;
Life with its way before us lies,
Christ is the Path, and Christ the Prize.
	 ~ 	2 
. Dua Nyame N'adom do tu enguan n';
To w'enyi wimu hwɛ N'enyim,
N-kwa na ɔda w'enyim yi;
Christ yɛ ɔkwan na akatua.

MHB 490
3 . Cast care aside, upon thy Guide,
Lean, and His mercy will provide;
Lean, and the trusting soul shall prove
Christ is its Life, and Christ its Love.
	 ~ 	3 
. Tow dadwen kyen, twer wo Gyefo,
N'ehumbɔbɔr pii no bɛkyerɛ;
Tweɔn N' na wo gyedzi kra bohu
Dɛ Christ yɛ wo nkwa na wo dɔ.

MHB 490
4 . Faint not nor fear, His arms are near;
He changeth not, and thou art dear,
Only believe, and thou shalt see
That Christ is all in all to thee. 	 ~ 	4 
. Mma mmpa abaw, nnsuro; Ne nsa bɛn wo,
Ɔnnsesa da, esom No bo;
Gye dzi ara na ibohu

MHB 491
1 . CHRISTIAN, seek not yet repose;
Cast thy dreams of ease away;
Thou art in the midst of foes:
                   Watch and pray.
	 ~ 	1 . Christian! mma mmpɛ ahomgye ndɛ 
Tow w' ahomgye adaaso n' gu;
Ewɔ atamfo finimfin:
                   Weɔn na sɔr.
                   Weɔn na sɔr.

MHB 491
2 . Principalities and powers,
Mustering their unseen array,
Wait for thy unguarded hours:
	Watch and pray.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Etumfo nye akɛsefo 
Rotwe hɔn dɔm wɔ akono,
Wɔbɔkɔ wo ntoa awerɛfirm';
 	Weɔn na sɔr.

MHB 491
3 . Gird thy heavenly armour on,
Wear it ever, night and day;
Ambushed lies the evil one:
	Watch and pray.
	 ~ 	3  
. Fa wo sor akodze n' mia; 
Ma ɔnhyɛ wo daa nyina;
Ɔtamfo n' rehyɛ w' atsɛw:
                    Weɔn na sɔr.

MHB 491
4 . Hear the victors who o’ercame;
Still they mark each warrior’s way;
All with one sweet voice exclaim:
	Watch and pray.
	 ~ 	4 
. Tsie hɔn a woedzi konyim n'  
Wɔrohwɛ mbrɛ isi ko;
Hɔn nyina yɛ ano kor se:
                    Weɔn na sɔr.

MHB 491
5 . Hear, above all, hear thy Lord,
Him thou lovest to obey;
Hide within thy heart his word:
	Watch and pray.
	 ~ 	5 
. Nkanka tsie w' Ewuradze, 
Ɔno a edɔ dɛ itsie n';
Fa N'asɛm sie w'akomam':
                    Weɔn na sɔr.

MHB 491
6 . Watch, as if on that alone
Hung the issue of the day;
Pray that help may be sent down:
	Watch and pray.	 ~ 	6 
. Weɔn dɛ iyi ara nko 
Na ko n' nyina gyina do;
Sɔr ma womfi sor mbrɛ w' mboa:

MHB 492
1 . ’I THE good fight have fought’,
O when shall I declare?
The victory by my Saviour got
I long with Paul to share.
 	 ~ 	1 . DABƐN na m'bɛka dɛ
Mo so mako ko pa n'?
Konyimdzi a m'Agyenkwa nyae no,
Menye Paul wɔ m' kyɛfa.
'Hotsewfo n' dɛmara.

MHB 492
2 . O may I triumph so,
When all my warfare’s past!
And, dying, find my latest foe
Under my feet at last.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma mindzi konyim dɛm,
Ber a m'akodzi abɔ adze n',
Na muruwu a munhu me tamfo n'
Dɛ ɔda m'ananadze.

MHB 492
3 . This blessed word be mine,
Just as the port is gained
“Kept by the power of grace divine,
I have the faith maintained.“
	 ~ 	3 
. Nhyirasɛm yi nyɛ medze,
Ber a medu esuegya n';
Nyame tum no akora me yi,
Mesie gyedzi no yie.

MHB 492
4 . The apostles of my Lord,
To whom it first was given,
They could not speak a greater word,
Nor all the saints in heaven.	 ~ 	4 
. M'Ewuradze N'asomafo a 
Wodzii kan gyee asɛm no,
Wɔammfa asɛm biara annka ho,

MHB 493
1 . LOVE of love, and Light or light,
Heavenly Father all maintaining;
Wisdom hid in highest height,
To Thy creature fondly deigning;
Make wonderful and just,
Thou hast call’d my heart to trust,
 	 ~ 	1 . 'DƆ mu ɔdɔ, na kan mu Kan,
Ɔsor Egya a ehwɛ ne nyina;
Nyansa a wɔdze esuma sorsor,
Bɔadze, ɔwo na ayɛ no dɛm;
Bɔfo nwanwanyi, pɛrpɛr m'
Afrɛ m'akoma dɛ ɔntwer Wo.
Ma memfa ntwer Wo dabaa.

MHB 493
2 . What are life’s unnumbere’d cares,
Sorrow, torment, passing measure?
O’er my short-lived pains and fears
Surely ruleth Thy good pleasure,
Boundless is Thy love for me,
Boundless then my trust shall be.
 	 ~ 	2 
. N-kwa mu ndzɛmba nye bɛn?
'Werɛhow, ɔhaw a orutwa mu?
Wo ho dɛw pa dzi me bra m'
Ɔyaw na suro kumaabi do,
Dɔ a 'wɔ ma m' wɔnnto n' abaw;
M'awerɛhyɛm' so wonnsusu.

MHB 493
3 . Every burden weigheth light,
Since in Thee my hope abideth:
Sweetly bright my darkest night,
While on Thee my mind confideth.
Give Thy gift, I Thee implore,
Thee to trust for evermore	 ~ 	3 
. M'enyidar wɔ Wo mu ntsi
Adzesoa biara nnyɛ me dur;
M'anafua sum mpo hyerɛn,
Ber a m'adwen gyina Wo do,
Meserɛ W', dom me W'akyɛdze

MHB 494
1 . A SAFE stronghold our God is still,
A trusty shield and weapon;
He’ll keep us clear from all the ill
That hath us now o’ertaken.
The ancient prince of hell
Hath risen with purpose fell;
Strong mail of craft and power
He weareth in this hour;
On earth is not his fellow.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN Nyame yɛ abankɛse
Akokyɛm nye akodze,
Amandze aba hɛn do dze,
Naaso ɔgye No nkorɔfo,
Tamfo n' rohwehwɛ hɛn,
Ɔpɛ hɛn mbusu pa;
Na no tum so ɔso,
Ndaadaa pii na ɔdze ko
Obi nnsɛ no wiadze ha.
Onyame man tsim hɔ daa.

MHB 494
2 . With force of arms we nothing can,
Full soon were we down-ridden;
But for us fights the proper Man,
whom God himself hath bidden.
Ask ye, Who is this same?
Christ Jesus is his name,
The Lord Sabaoth’s Son;
He, and no other one,
Shall conquer in the battle.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyimpa ahoɔdzen dze osuar,
Ɔnnkyɛr na yɛahwe ase;
Hɛn Gyefo nye Ɔbarimba a
Nyame eyi N' esi hɔ,
Epɛ ehu Ne dzin?
Wɔfrɛ No Jesus Christ,
Edɔm Ewuradze
No domankoma Ba;
Ne nsamu na konyimdzi wɔ.

MHB 494
3 .  And were this world all devils o’er,
And watching to devour us,
We lay it not to heart so sore;
Not they can overpower us.
And let the prince of ill
look grim as e’er he will,
He harms us not a whit;
For why? his doom is writ;
A word shall quickly slay him.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ mbɔnsam ahyɛ wiadze ma
Rohwehwɛ amen hɛn a,
Mma hom mma hɛn bo nntu koraa
Wonnkutum afa hɛn do,
Ma abɔnsam no bo mfuw,
Ɔnyɛ n'enyim kusuww;
Onnkotum ayɛ hwee,
Woebu no fɔ dada;
Asɛm kor bɔhwe n' ase.

MHB 494
4 . God’s word, for all their craft and force,
One moment will not linger,
But, spite of hell, shall have its course;
“Tis written by his finger.
And though they take our life,
Goods, honour, children, wife,
Yet is their profit small;
These things shall vanish all:
The City of God remaineth.	 ~ 	4 
. Nyame N'asɛm no gyina hɔ,
Ndzebɔnyɛfo rinnyi da,
Hɛn Jesus na ɔka hɛn ho,
Ɔma hɛn sunsum m' ndzepa,
Na sɛ wɔfa hɛn nkwa,
Ahodze, anaa dzin a,
Wonnya ho mfaso da;
Yinom nyina botwa m';

MHB 495
1 . WHO puts his trust
In God most just
Hath built his house securely;
 He who relies
On Jesus Christ,
Heaven shall be his most surely:
Then fixed on Thee
My trust shall be,
For Thy trust cannot alter;
While mine Thou art,
Not death’s worst smart
Shall make my courage falter.
	 ~ 	1 . NYIA ɔtwer Nyame
Nokwafo no,
Oesi ne dan no petsee;
Nyia ɔdze n' ho to
Jesus Christ do n',
Heaven bɛyɛ n'adze pa;
Medze mo werɛ
Behyɛ Wo mu
'Siandɛ Wo nokwar n' nnsakyer;
Ber a 'yɛ medze 'i;
'Wu n' hu biara
Rennsakyer m'akokodur.
Kora m' asomdwee m' afebɔɔ

MHB 495
2 . Though fiercest foes
My course oppose,
A dauntless front I’II show them;
My champion Thou,
Lord Christ, art now,
Who soon shalt overthrow them!
And if but Thee
I have in me,
With Thy good gifts and Spirit,
Nor death nor hell,
I know full well,
Shall hurt me, through Thy merit.
	 ~ 	2 
. Kaansa atamfo
Si me mpa mpo a,
M'begyina hɔn enyim pintsinn;
Ewuradze Christ,
'Wo nye m' Sahen,
Ibedzi hɔn do konyim!
Na sɛ mowɔ,
'Wo wɔ mo mu a,
W'akyɛdze na Sunsum n' ntsi
Owu anaa hɛll,
Minyim pefee,
Runntum nnyɛ hwee, W'adom ntsi.

MHB 495
3 .  I rest me here
Without a fear
By Thee shall all be given
That I can need,
O Friend indeed,
For this life or for heaven.
O make me true,
My heart renew,
My soul and fresh deliver!
Lord, hear my prayer,
And in Thy care
Keep me in peace for ever.
	         Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Mohom wɔ ha,
Hwee mmbɔ me hu;
Ebɛma me dza mihia,
M'ehiadze nyina;
M'Adamfo pa,
N-kwa yi mu anaa heaven,
Ma mindzi mu,
Sesa m'akoma;
Gye m' kra na nyimpadua nkwa
Mo Wura, tsie me,
Na W'abaw mu,

MHB 496
1 . ETERNAL Beam of light divine,
Fountain of unexhausted love,
In whom the Father’s glories shine
Through earth beneath, and heaven above;
 	 ~ 	1 . ONNYIEWIEI kan a ofir Nyame,
Ɔdɔ a ɔmmbɔ adze nsunyiwa,
Wo mu na Egya N'enyimnyam hyerɛn
Wɔ adasa wiadze na sorsor.
Woana bɛhaw nyia epɛ agye n'?

MHB 496
2 . Jesu, the weary wanderer’s rest,
Give me thy easy yoke to bear,
With steadfast patience arm my breast,
With spotless love, and lowly fear.
	 ~ 	2 
. Jesu, kwanatunyi fonafo ahom,
Ma m' Wo kɔndua haahar monsoa;
Fa abotar na ɔdɔ mapa nye
Nyamesuro hyɛ m'akoma mu.

MHB 496
3 . Thankful I take the cup from thee,
Prepared and mingled by thy skill,
Though bitter to the taste it be,
Powerful the wounded soul to heal.
	 ~ 	3 
. Medze ndaase gye W' nsamu kuraba a
Woara na idzii mu edwin n',
Kaansa dza ɔwɔ m' yɛ wen dɛn ara a,
Ɔbɔ ɔkra pirafo esu pirim.

MHB 496
4 . Be thou, O Rock of ages, nigh!
So shall each murmuring thought be gone,
And grief, and fear, and care, shall fly,
As clouds before the midday sun. 
 Speak to my warring passions, “Peace!“
Say to my trembling heart, “Be still!“
Thy power my strength and fortress is,
For all things serve thy sovereign will.
	 ~ 	4 
. O Tsetse Bo, pinkyɛn me waa!
Ama adwen a ohwinwin na 
Yaw na suro nye dadwen aahera
Dɛ fua wɔ ewimbir wi enyim.

MHB 496
6 . O death ! where is thy sting ? Where now
Thy boasted victory, O grave?
Who shall contend with God? or who
Can hurt whom God delights to save?	 ~ 	6 
. Owu, wo bɔr wɔ hen? Na ɔwo
'Dakamaa, wo konyim wɔ hen?
Woana nye Nyame bedzi esi?

MHB 497
1 . TO the hills I lift mine eyes,
The everlasting hills;
Streaming thence in fresh supplies,
My soul the Spirit feels.
Will he not his help afford?
Help, while yet I ask, is given:
God comes down; the God and Lord
That made both earth and heaven.
	 ~ 	1 . M'BƐMA m'enyi do akyerɛ sor
Mahwɛ onnyiewiei mbepɔw n';
Ɔnam hɔ eyiedzi pa do
Me kra tse tse sunsum n' nka,
Aso ɔnnkɛyɛ me mboa?
Mibisa No mboa a, minya;
Nyame sian: Nyame a ɔyɛ Owura,
Na ɔbɔɔ asaase nye sor.
Fi ndɛ kesi daapem.

MHB 497
2 . Faithful soul, pray always; pray,
And still in God confide;
He thy feeble steps shall stay,
Nor suffer thee to slide:
Lean on thy Redeemer’s breast;
He thy quiet spirit keeps;
Rest in him, securely rest;
Thy watchman never sleeps. 
	 ~ 	2 
. 'Kra nokwafo, bɔ mpaa daa
Kɔ do ara twer Nyame;
Ɔbɛma w'anamɔn etsim,
Ɔronnhwɛ mma mmpatser;
Twer Wo Pomfo No bom' daa,
Ɔno ɔkora wo sunsum,
Mese w', hom wɔ No mu sɔnn;
Wo weɔmfo n' nnda ara da.

MHB 497
3 . Neither sin, nor earth, nor hell
Thy Keeper can surprise;
Careless slumbers cannot steal
On his all-seeing eyes;
He is Israel’s sure defence;
Israel all his care shall prove,
Kept by watchful providence,
And ever-waking love.
	 ~ 	3 
. Bɔn anaa asaase nye hɛll 
Rinndzi Wo weɔmfo do;
N-komtɔ gyangyan biara
Nnkowia N'enyiwa pɛnn n';
Ɔbɔ Israel ho ban pa;
Israel bɛkyerɛ N' hwɛdo pa n',
Ber a ɔweɔn hɔn daa yi;
Na No dɔ mmbɔ adze.

MHB 497
4 . See the Lord, thy Keeper, stand
Omnipotently near!
Lo! he holds thee by thy hand,
And banishes thy fear;
Shadows with his wings thy head;
Guards from all impending harms:
Round thee and beneath are spread
The everlasting arms.
	 ~ 	4 
. Hwɛ Ewuradze, wo weɔmfo n',
Otumfo no bɛn daa!
Ɔdze Ne nsa suo wo mu,
Na otu wo suro koraa;
'Dze Ne ntsaban kata w' do,
Bɔ wo ho ban fi ɔhaw mu;
Ɔdze ne nsa a ɔatserɛw mu
Wowaw wo daa nyina.

MHB 497
5 . Christ shall bless thy going out,
Shall bless thy coming in;
Kindly compass thee about,
Till thou art saved from sin;
Like thy spotless Master, thou,
Filled with wisdom, love, and power,
Holy, pure, and perfect, now,
Henceforth, and evermore.	 ~ 	5 
. Christ behyira wo nkɔree do,
Obehyira wo mbae do;
Obotwa wo ho ehyia,
Agye w' efi bɔn mu;
'Tse dɛ wo Wura krɔnkrɔnyi n'
Nyansa, dɔ, tum bɛhyɛ w' ma,
Krɔnkrɔn, 'hotsew na emudzi,

MHB 498
1 . ROCK of Ages, cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in Thee;
Let the water and the blood,
From Thy riven side which flowed,
Be of sin the double cure;
Cleanse me from its guilt and power.
 	 ~ 	1 . Tsetse Bo a wɔpaae maa me, 
Ma munguan nhunta Wo mu;
Ma nsu no nye bɛgya n' a
Ofi Wo mfem' repem no,
Ɔnyɛ bɔn edufanu,
Ɔmpa m' fɔ, ɔnsan mo ho.
Ma munguan nhunta Wo mu. Amen.

MHB 498
2 . Not the labours of my hands
Can fulfill Thy law’s demands;
Could my zeal no respite know,
Could my tears for ever flow,
All for sin could not atone:
Thou must save, and Thou alone.
 	 ~ 	2  
. Sɛ me nyinsu kyi daa mpo, 
Sɛ mo mbɔdzen nngow da mpo,
Yinom nnkotum bɔn wer tɔ;
Gyefo nye Wo nkotonoo:
Me nsam' nnyi akatua bi,
Metetar Wo mbeamudua n'.

MHB 498
3 . Nothing in my hand I bring,
Simply to Thy cross I cling;
Naked, come to Thee for dress;
Helpless look to Thee for grace;
Foul, I to the fountain fly;
Wash me, Saviour, or I die.
	 ~ 	3  
 . Menndze hweea'ra ba W'enyim.
Metetar Wo mbeamudu'a ara;
Meyɛ kwatserkwaa, fura m' tam;
Mennsɛ bi, mihia W'adom;
Fifo nye m' motɔ bura n'mu;
Gyefo, guar m' ɔno m'bowu.

MHB 498
4 . While I draw this fleeting breath,
When my eyelids close in death,
When I soar to worlds unknown,
See Thee on Thy judgment-throne,
Rock of ages, cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in Thee.   Amen.	 ~ 	4  
. Ber a muga ahomtsia yi, 
Ber a m'bɛka m'enyi egu do,
Ber a m'bɔsoɛr maba noho,
Ebohu W' W'ahengua do n',
Tsetse Bo a wɔpaae maa me,

MHB 499
1 . O SAFE to the Rock that is higher than I,
My soul in its conflicts and sorrows would fly,
So sinful, so weary, Thine. Thine, would I be,
Thou blest Rock of Ages, I’m hiding in Thee!
          Hiding in Thee, Hiding in Thee,
          Thou blest Rock of Ages, I'm hiding in Thee!
	 ~ 	1 . ME kra nam n'ahohia na awerɛhow m' botu
Akɔ Botan a ɔkrɔn kyɛn me n' hɔ sɔnn;
Bɔnyɛnyi a meyɛ mberɛw, m'bɛyɛ Wodze daa;
Ɔwo siar Tsetse Bo, musuma Wo mu!
   Musuma Wo mu! Musuma Wo mu daa!
   Ɔwo siar Tsetse Bo, Musuma Wo mu!
Na musuma Wo mu, o me kra n' Botan!

MHB 499
2 . In the calm of the noontide, in sorrow’s lone hour,
In times when temptation casts o’er me its power;
In the tempests of life, on its wide, heaving sea,
 Thou blest Rock of Ages, I'm hiding in Thee!
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ewiaber kɔnkɔnn no mu, ɔyaw dɔnhwer n,
Ber a nsɔhwɛ edzi mo do tum no mu;
Ɔbra mframadzen mu, ɔbra po asorɛkye
Ɔwo siar Tsetse Bo, musuma Wo mu!

MHB 499
3 . How oft in the conflict, when pressed by the foe,
I have fled to my refuge and breathed out my woe;
How often, when trials like sea billows roll,
Have I hidden in Thee, O Thou Rock of my soul.	 ~ 	3 
. Mpɛn pii wɔ ahohia n' mu, 'tamfo n' ahyɛ m' do,
Na meguan abɔdɔ W' ma mbusu ahera n',
Mpɛn pii a nsɔhwɛ pem dɛ asorɛkye n'

MHB 5
1 . Let all the world in every corner sing,
My God and King !
The heavens are not too high,
His praise may thither fly:
The earth is not too low,
His praises there may grow.
Let all the world in every corner sing,
   	My God and King !
	 ~ 	1 . HOM mma wiadze afanan nyina ntow.
Me Nyame Hen!
Ɔsor mpo nnkrɔn biara a
N'ayɛyi nnkodu hɔ;
Asaase nndɔ pii a
N'ayɛyi nnkɛtra hɔ.
Horn mma wiadze afanan nyina ntow.
Me Nyame, Hen!

MHB 5
2 . Let all the world in every corner sing:
My God and King !
The church with Psalms must shout.
No door can keep them out:
But above all, the heart
Must bear the longest part.
Let all the world in every corner sing,
   	My God and King !	 ~ 	2 . HOM mma wiadze afanan nyina ntow:
Me Nyame Hen!
Asɔr nkeka m'ntow ndwom,
Biribiara nntum nnsiw kwan:
Dza okyen ne nyina nye dɛ
Akoma a abotow mbordo;
Hom mma wiadze afanan nyina ntow:
Me Nyame, Hen!

MHB 50
1 . THE Lords my Shepherd, I' ll not want,  
 He makes me down to lie 
 In pastures green; He leadeth me 
 The quiet waters by.
	 ~ 	1 . Ewuradze nye mo Guanhwɛfo, 
Biribiara nnkehia m';
Ɔma meda mfunoma mu,
Ogya m' kɔ nsutaae ho.

MHB 50
2 . My soul he doth restore again, 
 And me to walk doth make 
 Within the paths of righteousness, 
 Een for His own names sake.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔdze me kra san ba nkwam' bio, 
Na ɔma menantsew
Ne ndzeyɛtsenenee kwan no mu,
Wɔ Noara Ne dzin ntsi.

MHB 50
3 . Yea, though I walk in deaths dark vale, 
 Yet will I fear no ill: 
 For Thou art with me, and thy rod 
 And staff me comfort still.
	 ~ 	3 . Nyew, sɛ menam wu bɔnsam' a, 
Munnsuro mbusu biara;
Osiandɛ 'nye m' nam, Wo poma
Na W' abaw hyɛ me dzen.

MHB 50
4 . My table Thou hast furnished 
 In presence of my foes; 
 My head Thou dost with oil anoint, 
 And my cup overflows.
	 ~ 	4 . Mo pon so Ɔwo ewie to 
Wɔ m' atamfo enyim;
Edze seradze asera me tsirm';
Mo kuraba ebu do.

MHB 50
5 . Goodness and mercy all my life 
 Shall surely follow me, 
 And in Gods house for evermore 
 My dwelling-place shall be.	 ~ 	5 . Yie na adɔe bɛka mo do, 
Mo nkwa mber nyinara,
Na medze Nyame fie bɛyɛ
Me tsenabew daa nyina.

MHB 500
1 . PEACE, doubting heart! my God’s I am:
Who formed me man, forbids my fear;
The Lord hath called me by my name;
The Lord protects, for ever near;
His blood for me did once atone,
And still he loves and guards his own.
 	 ~ 	1 . M'AKOMA, taa dzinn! Nyame dze nye m';
Ɔyɛɛ m' nyimpa, otu mo suro,
Ewuradze abɔ me dzinn afrɛ m';
Otwitwa gye m', ɔbɛn me daa;
No bɔgyaa bɔɔ m' werdam prɛko,
Na ɔda ho dɔ m' na ɔweɔn me.
Na ɔbɛtse ndze bi: Taa dzinn daa!

MHB 500
2 . When passing through the watery deep,
I ask in faith his promised aid,
The waves all awful distance keep,
And shrink from my devoted head;
Fearless their violence I dare;
They cannot harm, for God is there!
	 ~ 	2 
. Ber a menam nsubun mu no,
Mudua gyedzi m' bisa No mboa;
Asorɛkye n' bɔ kɔ kan ara yie,
Na ɔadwe fɛmm wɔ me tsir do;
Munnsuro ne begyabegyayɛ;
Nyame wɔ hɔ 'i ɔnnkɛhaw me.

MHB 500
3 . To Him mine eye of faith I turn,
And through the fire pursue my way;
The fire forgets its power to burn,
The lambent flames around me play;
I own his power, accept the sign,
And shout to prove the Saviour mine.
	 ~ 	3 
. Moto gyedzi enyiwa hwɛ No,
Menam 'gya m' ara kɔ m'enyim;
Ogya n' werɛ fir dɛ ɔbɛdzɛw,
Gyaframee no dzi mo ho agor;
Mowɔ No tum n' gyedɛ ahyɛnsew n',
Medze nkekam' fa ma me Gyefo n'.

MHB 500
4 . Still nigh me, O my Saviour, stand
And guard in fierce temptation’s hour;
Hide in the hollow of thy hand,
Show forth in me thy Saving power,
Still be thy arms my sure defence,
Nor earth nor hell shall pluck me thence.
 	 ~ 	4 
. O me Gyefo, gyina me nkyɛn daa!
Na weɔn me nsɔhwɛ dzendzen mu;
Fa me sie Wo nsa donkonn mu,
Kyerɛ Wo nkwagye tum wɔ mo do;
W'abasa ntwitwa ngye me daa,
'Saase nye hɛll nnkotum atsew m'.

MHB 500
5 . When darkness intercepts the skies,
And sorrow’s waves around me roll,
When high the storms of passion rise,
And half o’erwhelm my sinking soul ;
My soul a sudden calm shall feel,
And hear a whisper:  Peace; be still !	 ~ 	5
