. Ber a sum siw wi no enyi
Na awerɛhow asorɛkye ba mo do n', 
Ber a ɔhaw ehum tu mo do n',
Na ɔka me kra a ɔrodɔ n' hyɛ n'
Me kra benya akomatɔm' ntsɛm,

MHB 501
1 . PEACE, perfect peace, in this dark world of sin?
The blood of Jesus whispers peace within.
	 ~ 	1 . Asomdwee pa, wɔ bɔn wiadze yi mu? 
Jesus bɔgya ɔwasa asomdwee.
Jesus bɛfrɛ sor asomdwee mu.

MHB 501
2 . Peace, perfect peace, by thronging duties pressed?
To do the will of Jesus, this is rest.
	 ~ 	2 
. Asomdwee pa, dwumadzi akyer do yi? 
Ebɛyɛ Jesus Ne pɛ nye ahomgye.

MHB 501
3 . Peace, perfect peace, with sorrows surging round?
On Jesus’ bosom nought but calm is found.
	 ~ 	3 
. Asomdwee pa, yaw etwa ehyia hɛn yi? 
Jesus No bom' asomdwee ara nko.

MHB 501
4 . Peace, perfect peace, with loved ones far away?
In Jesus’ keeping we are safe and they.
	 ~ 	4  
. Asomdwee pa, adɔfo apetse yi? 
Jesus kora hɛn do yi, hwee nnkɛyɛ hɛn.

MHB 501
5 . Peace, perfect peace, our future all unknown?
Jesus we know, and He is on the throne.
	 ~ 	5 
. Asomdwee pa, yennyim hɛn ndaamba yi? 
Yenyim Jesus, na ɔtse ahengua n' do.

MHB 501
6 . Peace, perfect peace, death shadowing us and ours?
Jesus has vanquished death and all its powers
	 ~ 	6 
. Asomdwee pa, wu gyegye hɛn do yi? 
Jesus apansam wu na no tum nyina.

MHB 501
7 . It is enough: earth’s struggles soon shall cease,
And Jesus call us to heaven’s perfect peace.	 ~ 	7 
. Ao, ɔdɔɔ so, wiadze aperdzi rennkyɛr,

MHB 502
1 . OMNIPOTENT Lord, my Saviour and King,
Thy succour afford, Thy righteousness bring;
Thy promises bind thee Compassion to have;
Now, now let me find Thee Almighty to save. 
	 ~ 	1 . ABƆDZE nyina Tumfo, m'Agyenkwa Hen,
Fa Wo tsenenee bra na bɔboa hɛn;
W'anohoba hyɛ W' dɛ nya ayamuhyehye;
Ma munhu dɛ 'wɔ tum a ɔgye nkwa sesei.
Na Jesus bedzi hen wɔ m'akoma mu.

MHB 502
2 . Rejoicing, in hope, and patient in grief,
To Thee I look up For certain relief;
I fear no denial, no danger I fear,
Nor start from the trial, While Jesus is near. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Midzi dɛ enyidar m' nya yaw mu abotar,
Wo hɔ na mema m'enyi hwehwɛ mboa;
Minnya hwee, minndzi yaw, munnsuro mbusu,
Ber a Jesus bɛn me yi, nsɔhwɛ nnyi hɔ.

MHB 502
3 . I every hour In jeopardy stand;
But Thou art my power, and holdest my hand;
While yet I am calling, Thy succour I feel;
It saves me from falling, Or plucks me from hell.
	 ~ 	3 
. Dɔnhwer biara migyina esian mu;
Edze me nsamu ntsi mowɔ ahoɔdzen;
Ber a mugu do refrɛ 'i, metse Wo mboa nka;
Ɔgye m' fi asehwe m' anaa ohwim me fi hɛll.

MHB 502
4 . O who can explain this struggle for life
This travail and pain, this trembling and strife:
Plague, earthquake, and famine, and tumult, and war,
The wonderful coming Of Jesus declare.
	 ~ 	4 
. Woana botum akyerɛ nkwa m' aperper ase,
Ɔberɛ na yaw, ahopopo na ɔko?
Yardɔm, asaasewosow, kɔm nye ɔko
Kyerɛ nwanwa a Jesus Ne mbae no bɛyɛ.

MHB 502
5 . Yet God is above Men, devils, and sin,
My Jesus’s love The battle shall win;
So terribly glorious His coming shall be,
His love all-victorious Shall conquer for me.
	 ~ 	5 
. Nyame krɔn sen nyimpa, abɔnsam nye bɔn;
Me Jesus dɔ bedzi konyim ɔko n' mu;
Ne mbae bɛyɛ enyimnaym kɛse a ɔyɛ hu,
No dɔ mapa n' bedzi konyim ama me.

MHB 502
6 . He all shall break through; 
His truth and His grace
Shall bring me into The plentiful place,
Through much tribulation, through water and fire,
Through floods of temptation, and flames of desire.
	 ~ 	6 
. No nokwar nye adom bowura ne nyina mu,
Ɔdze m' bɔkɔ beebi a ndzɛmba pii wɔ;
M'befi amandzehu pii mu nye ogya mu,
Nsɔhwɛ, akɔndɔbɔn, ɔpɛ nye gyaframee m'.

MHB 502
7 . On Jesus, my power, till then I rely,
All evil before His presence shall fly;
When I have my Saviour, My sin shall depart,
And Jesus for ever Shall reign in my heart. 	 ~ 	7 
. Kapem da no Jesus na motwer no, 
Emumuyɛ nyina boguan efi N'enyim;
Ber a m'benya m'Agyenkwa n', mo bɔn boguan,

MHB 503
1 . GOD moves in a mysterious way
His wonders to perform;
He plants His footsteps in the sea,
And rides upon the storm.
	 ~ 	1 . Onyame dua kwan sunsum mu 
Na ɔyɛ N'anwanwadze;
Ɔdze N'anamɔn taataa pom',
Ɔko ehum do nantsew.
Ɔbɛkyerɛm' pefee.

MHB 503
2 . Deep in unfathomable mines
Of never-failing skill
He treasures up His bright designs,
And works His sovereign will.
	 ~ 	2 
. Asaase no bun mu noho, 
Ɔdze nyansa nwanwa
Kora Ne nhyehyɛɛ pa a ɔsom bo n',
Ɔyɛ dza Noara pɛ.

MHB 503
3 . Ye fearful saints, fresh courage take,
The clouds ye so much dread
Are big with mercy, and shall break
In blessings on your head.
	 ~ 	3 
. Esiarfo a hom suro, hom nnhyɛ ahom, 
Ifua a hom suro n' kɛse n',
Mbɔbɔrhu ma, na ɔbɛpaa
Nhyira egu hom do.

MHB 503
4 . Judge not the Lord by feeble sense,
But trust Him for His grace;
Behind a frowning providence
He hides a smiling face.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mma hom mmfa hom nyimpa-dwen mmbua 
Nyame, hom ntwer N'adom,
Ber a ɔaka N'enyim esi n'
Na N'ano serew hyɛm'

MHB 503
5 . His purposes will ripen fast,
Unfolding every hour;
The bud may have a bitter taste,
But sweet will be the flower
	 ~ 	5 
. No botae bɛber ntsɛmara, 
Ɔbɛhan mber nyina;
Kukuduuduw n' yɛ wen mpo a,
Nhyiren n' botu huam pa.

MHB 503
6 . Blind unbelief is sure to err,
And scan His work in vain;
God is His own interpreter,
And He will make it plain.	 ~ 	6 
. Kyingyenyi furafo twar dɛ ɔfom, 
Ɔnnkɛtse No ndwuma ase;
Nyame Noara tse N'adze ase,

MHB 504
1 . LEAVE God to order all thy ways,
And hope in Him whate’er betide ;
Thou’lt find Him in the evil days
Thy all-sufficient strength and guide :
Who trusts in God’s unchanging love 
Builds on the rock that nought can move.
	 ~ 	1 . MA Nyame nhwɛ W'akwan nyina,
Nya No m' enyidado ber nyina;
Da bɔn mu n 'bohu No dɛ
W'ahoɔdzen nye Kwankyerɛfo;
Nyia ɔtwer Nyame dɔ a ɔnnsakyer n'
Si dan wɔ botan a otsim hɔ do.
Ɔtwer N' mapa n' n'ehiadze do.

MHB 504
2 . Only thy restless heart keep still,
And wait in cheerful hope, content
To take whate’er His gracious will,
His all-discerning love, that sent;
Nor doubt our inmost wants are known
To Him who chose us for His own.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma w'akoma ntɔ wo yamu,
Ɔmfa enyidar abodwee ntweɔn,
Ngye biribiara a N'adom dze ma,
Dza No dɔ a ɔwɔ hɔ n' dze aba;
Onyim hɛn ehiadze nyina,
Ɔno a ɔafa hɛn ayɛ Nedze n'.

MHB 504
3 . Sing,pray,and swerve not from His ways,
But do thine own part faithfully;
Trust His rich promises of grace,
So shall they be fulfilled in thee :
God never yet forsook at need
The soul that trusted Him indeed.	 ~ 	3 
. Tow ndwom yɛ asɔr, mmfi N'akwan ho,
Yɛ w'afamudze nokwar mu ara;
Twer No bɔhyɛ a adom ahyɛ n' ma n',
Dɛm na obesi wo yie ama w';
Nyame mmbu N'enyi nngu ɔkra a

MHB 505
1 . O THOU to whose all-searching  sight
The darkness shineth as the light,
Search, prove my heart; it pants for thee!
O burst these bonds, and set it free! 
	 ~ 	1 . ƆWO a eyɛ enyiasombea na
Ema sum kebii hyerɛn dɛ kan,
Hwehwɛ m'akoma m', ɔper hwehwɛ W';
Bubu mpokyerɛ ma onya ahotɔ.
Gye m' kɔ Wo kokwaa a ɔkrɔn do.  Amen.

MHB 505
2 . Wash out its stains, refine its dross,
Nail my affections to the Cross;
Hallow each thought; let all within
Be clean, as Thou, my Lord, art clean.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hor mo ho nkekaa ma ɔnnhyerɛn,
Bɔ m'akɔndɔdze mbeamudua m';
Tsew m'adwen ho, na ma dza ɔwɔ m'
Ho ntsew dɛ mbrɛ mo Wura tse.

MHB 505
3 . When rising floods my soul o’erflow,
When sinks my heart in waves of woe,
Jesu, Thy timely aid impart
And raise my head, and cheer my heart
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ nsu munam me kra do mpo 
Na me kra mem asorɛkye mu a,
Jesus, ma Wo mboa mbra ntsɛmara,
Yi m' pue ma minnya akomatɔm'.

MHB 505
4 . Saviour, where’er Thy steps I see,
Dauntless, untired, I follow Thee;
O let Thy hand support me still,
And lead me to Thy holy hill !  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Gyefo, bea a muhu W'anamɔn,
Midzi W'ekyir, munnsuro, memberɛ;
O fa Wo nsa suo mo mu daa,

MHB 506
1 . MY spirit on Thy care,
Blest Saviour, I recline;
Thou wilt not leave me in despair,
For  thou art Love divine.
	 ~ 	1 . M'AGYENKWA, medze mo
Sunsum moto Wo do;
Irinngyaa me mma m'abaw mmpa,
'Siandɛ 'yɛ Nyame dɔ.
Mowɔ adze nyina.

MHB 506
2 . In Thee I place my trust,
On thee I calmly rest;
I know thee good, I know thee just,
And count thy choice the best.
	 ~ 	2 
. Medze m' werɛ hyɛ Wo mu,
Wo mu na mohom komm;
Minyim dɛ iye na etsen,
Na nyia asan mu eyi n' tsen.

MHB 506
3 . Whate’er events betide,
Thy will They all perform;
Safe in thy breast my head I hide,
Nor fear the coming storm.
	 ~ 	3 
. Dza obesi nyinara,
Wɔyɛ W'apɛdze nyina;
Medze me tsir to Wo bom' sɔnn,
Munnsuro ehum a obotu.

MHB 506
4 . Let good or ill befall,
It must be good for me;
Secure of having thee in all,
Of having all in thee	 ~ 	4 
. Ma yie anaa mbusu mbra,
Obesi yie ama me;
Minya Wo adze nyina mu a,

MHB 507
1 . COMMIT thou all thy griefs
And ways into His hands,
To His sure truth and tender care,
Who  heaven and earth commands.
	 ~ 	1 . FA w'awerɛhow nyina
Nye w'akwan hyɛ ne nsamu 
No nokwar krɔnn nye nhwɛdo pa m',
Ɔwɔ asaase nyina do.
Nka Wo dɔ nye hwɛpa n'.

MHB 507
10 . Still heavy is thy heart?
Still sink thy spirits down?
Cast off the weight, let fear depart,
Bid every care be gone.
	 ~ 	10 
. W'akoma da ho dzi yaw?
Wo sunsum abotow?
Tow adzesoa kyen, na ma suro nkɔ,
Ma dadwen nyina nkɔ.

MHB 507
11 . What though thou rulest not?
Yet heaven, and earth, and hell
Proclaim: God sitteth on the throne,
And ruleth all things well!
	 ~ 	11 
. Sɛ nkyɛ inndzi hen mpo ɛ?
Sor nye asaase nye hɛll
Tseam' dɛ: Nyame tse ahengua do,
Dzi ndzɛmba nyina do tum!

MHB 507
12 . Leave to His sovereign sway
To choose and to command;
So shalt thou wondering own His way
How wise, how strong His hand.
	 ~ 	12 
. Ogyaa N'ahentum n' hɔ,
Faa wiadze hyɛɛ N' bra ase;
Ama hom akobɔfo eehu
Ne nyansaa nye nsa dzen.

MHB 507
13 . Far, far above thy thought
His counsel shall appear,
When fully He the work hath wrought
That caused thy needless fear.
	 ~ 	13 
. N'egyinatu kɔ sorsor
Tra mbrɛ w'adwen bodu,
Ber a oewie edwuma yɛ pɛsɛɛ n',
Wɔ dza ɔbɔɔ w' hu gyangyan m'.

MHB 507
14 . Thou seest our weakness, Lord;
Our hearts are known to Thee:
O lift Thou up the sinking hand,
Confirm the feeble knee!
	 ~ 	14 
. Hɛn Wura, 'hu hɛn mberɛwyɛ,
Inyim hɛn akoma m' nsɛm;
O ma nsa a oenya abagura do,
Hyɛ nankoroma a agow dzen!

MHB 507
15 . Let us in life, in death,
Thy steadfast truth declare,
And publish with our latest breath
Thy love and guardian care.	 ~ 	15 
. Ma nkwa mu nye owu mu
Wo nokwar n' nda edzi
Yengu hɛn ahomsten a odzi ewiei,

MHB 507
2 . Who points the clouds their course,
Whom winds and seas obey,
He shall direct thy wandering feet,
He shall prepare thy way.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔno a ɔkyerɛ fua kwan,
Na ehum nye po tsie No n',
Ɔbɛtsentsen w'anamɔn kwan, 
Obesiesie w'akwan m'.

MHB 507
3 . Thou on the Lord rely,
So safe shalt thou go on;
Fix on His work thy steadfast eye,
So shall thy work be done.
	 ~ 	3 
. Fa woho twer Ewuradze,
Na w'abrabɔ aayɛ yie;
Fa w'enyi tsim N'edwuma do,
Ama wodze eewie yie.

MHB 507
4 . No profit canst thou gain
By self-consuming care;
To Him commend thy cause, His ear
Attends the softest prayer.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ehaw woho dɛn ara,
'Rinnya mfaso biara;
Fa w'ehiasɛm nyina to N'enyim,
Otsie mpaabɔ nyina.

MHB 507
5 . Thy everlasting truth,
Father, Thy ceaseless love,
Sees all thy children’s wants, and knows
What best for each will prove.
	 ~ 	5 
. Wo nokwar a ɔnnsa da n',
Egya, Wo dɔ a ɔmmbɔ adze n'
Nyim Wo mba nyina hɔn ehiadze,
Na dza oye ma hɔn.

MHB 507
6 . Thou everywhere hast sway,
And all things serve Thy might;
Thy every act pure blessing is,
Thy path unsullied light.
	 ~ 	6 
. Wo tum wɔ beebiara,
Ndzɛmba nyina hyɛ W'ase;
Wo ndzeyɛɛ yɛ nhyira ara nko,
W'akwan nyina yɛ kann.

MHB 507
7 . When Thou arisest, Lord,
What shall Thy work with-stand?
Whate,er Thy children want, Thou giv’st;
And who shall stay Thy hand?
	 ~ 	7 
. Ewuradze, sɛ esoɛr a,
'Bɛn nye W'edwuma begyina?
Dza Wo mba hia nyina edze ma;
Woana bɔbɔ W' nsa ekyir?

MHB 507
8 . Give to the winds thy fears;
Hope, and be undismayed:
God hears thy sighs, and counts thy tears,
God shall lift up thy head.
	 ~ 	8 
. Tow wo suro nyina kyen;
Nya enyidar, w'abaw nngura;
Nyame tse w' nkrumsi nye wo su,
Ɔbɛma w' tsir do sor.

MHB 507
9 . Through waves, and clouds, and storms
He gently clears thy way:
Wait thou His time; 
so shall this night
Soon end in joyous day.
	 ~ 	9 
. Mununkum nye ehum
Ɔbɔ kwan to m' ma wo;
Tweɔn Ne ber mu, na sum bɛpa,
Na adze akye enyigye m'.

MHB 508
1 . As helpless as a child who clings
Fast to his father’s arm,
And casts his weakness on the strength
That keeps him safe from harm:
So I, my Father, cling to Thee,
And thus I every hour
Would link my earthly feebleness
To Thine  almighty power.
	 ~ 	1 . DƐ mbrɛ abofra a ɔyɛ mberɛw 
Suo n'egya nsamu dzendzen n'
Na ɔdze ne mberɛwyɛ to ahoɔdzen a
Ɔgye no fi ɔhaw m' do n';
Dɛm na m'Egya, mutu bar Wo,
Dɛm na dɔnhwer biara
Medze me wiadze mberɛwyɛ yi 
To Wo tum ahoɔdzen do.
Ma mondɔ Wo mbordo.

MHB 508
2 . As trustful as a child who looks
Up in his mother’s face,
And all his little griefs and fears
Forgets in her embrace:
So I to Thee, my Saviour, look,
And in Thy face divine
Can read the love that will sustain
As weak  a faith as mine.
	 ~ 	2 
. Dɛ mbrɛ abofraba ɔtwer
Na ɔhwɛ ne na enyim no,
No werɛ fir ne yaw nye suro
Ber a ɔbɔ no kɔn ho komm n',
Dɛmara na mohwɛ m'Agyenkwa
W'enyim a atsew wann yi;
Muhu ɔdɔ a ɔhwɛ gyedzi
mberɛmberɛw tse dɛ medze 'i.

MHB 508
3 . As loving as a child who sits
Close by his parent’s knee,
And knows no want while he can have
That sweet society:
So sitting at Thy feet, my heart
Would all its love outpour,
And pray that Thou wouldst teach me, Lord,
To Love Thee more and more.	 ~ 	3 
. Dɛ mbrɛ abofra a ɔwɔ dɔ tse
No 'wofo ne nan do,
Ɔwɔ ahotɔ m' ntsi onnhia,
Osian fie pa no ntsi,
Dɛm na metse Wo nan ho yi
M'akoma bohue no dɔ;
Ewuradze, meserɛ dɛ kyerɛkyerɛ m'

MHB 509
1 . THE Galilean fishers toil 
All night and nothing take;
But Jesus comes-a wondrous spoil
 Is lifted from the lake.
Lord, when our labours are in vain, 
And vain the help of men,
When fruitless is our care and pain, 
Come, blessed Jesus, then!
	 ~ 	1 . GALILIE afarfo n' berɛe,
Anago n' woennya hwee;
Na Jesus bae ara pɛr na
Wɔpaa nam nyanyannyan,
Ewuradze, sɛ hɛn berɛ yɛ gyan,
Na nyimpa mboa yɛ gyan a,
Hɛn dadwen nye yaw nnsow aba a,
Bra! Jesus siarfo, bra!
Jesus, kasa asomdwee!  Amen.

MHB 509
2 . The night is dark, the surges fill 
The bark, the wild winds roar;
But Jesus comes; and all is still-
The ship is at the shore.
O Lord, when storms around us howl, 
And all is dark and drear,
In all the tempests of the soul, 
O blessed Jesus, hear!
	 ~ 	2 
. Ayɛ sum, asorɛkye robɔ
Hɛmba n', ehum rutu;
Na Jesus ba ma hɔ ataa dzinn,
Hɛmba n' edwir mpoano,
Ewuradze, ehum twa hɛn ho hyia a,
Na ayɛ sum, ma ayɛ hu a,
Ɔkra n'ehumtu n' nyina mu n',
Jesus siarfo, tsie hɛn!

MHB 509
3 . A frail one, thrice denying Thee, 
Saw mercy in Thine eyes ; 
The penitent upon the tree
Was borne to Paradise.
In hours of sin and deep distress, 
O show us, Lord, Thy face; 
In penitential loneliness,
O give us, Jesus, grace!
	 ~ 	3 
. Mberɛwyɛnyi mepaa Wo mprɛnsa,
'Nyaa W'enyim mbɔbɔrhu;
Nyia ɔsakyeer asɛndua do n'
Wɔdze n' kɔr Paradise,
Bɔn nye ahohia dɔnhwer mu n',
Christ, ma yenhu W'enyim;
Nnuho mu a aka hɛn nko n';
Jesus, ma hɛn adom.

MHB 509
4 . The faithful few retire in fear, 
To their closed upper room;
But, suddenly, with joyful cheer
They see their Master come.
Lord, come to us, unloose our bands, 
And bid our terrors cease;
Lift over us Thy blessed hands, 
Speak, holy Jesus, peace!  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Agyedzifo no dze suro
Kɔr aborɔsan no mu; 
Awerɛfir m', wɔdze enyigye kyiaa
Hɔn Wura a ɔaba hɔ no,
Ewuradze, beyi hɛn mpokyerɛ m',
Na ma hɛn suro ngyaa;
Fa siar nsa n' to hɛn etsifi,

MHB 51
1 . THE God of love my shepherd is, 
 And He that doth me feed; 
 while He is mine and I am His, 
 what can I want or need?
	 ~ 	1 . ƆDƆ Nyame nye m' Guanhwɛfo, 
Ɔno na ɔnyɛn me;
Ber a ɔyɛ medze n', meyɛ Nedze n',
Ebɛn na mibehia?

MHB 51
2 . He leads me to the tender grass, 
 where I both feed and rest; 
 Then to the streams that gently pass: 
 In both I have the best.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔdze me kɔ bea a sarmon wɔ,
Bea a midzidzi, mohom;
Afei nsu a ɔtsen bɔkɔɔ ho,
Minya dza oye wɔ hɔ.

MHB 51
3 . Or if I stray, He doth convert, 
 And bring my mind in frame, 
 And all this not for my desert, 
 But for his holy name.
	 ~ 	3 . Sɛ mofom kwan a, ɔtsen me,
 Ɔma m'adwen ba fie;
Nnyɛ dɛ ɔpɛ dɛ ogyaa me ntsi,
Ne dzin krɔnkrɔn no ntsi a.

MHB 51
4 . Yea, in death's shady black abode 
 Well may I walk, not fear; 
 For Thou art with me, and Thy rod 
 To guide, Thy staff to bear.
 	 ~ 	4 . Owu bɔnsa sunkamm no mu,
M'bɛfa mu a munnsuro,
Osiandɛ 'nye m'nam, Wo poma,
W'abaa bɛkyerɛ me kwan.

MHB 51
5 . Surely Thy sweet and wondrous love 
 Shall measure all my days; 
 And, as it never shall remove, 
 So neither shall my praise.	 ~ 	5 . Ampa, Wo dɔ dɛɛdɛw nwanwa n'
Bonsusu me nda nyina,
Na dɛ ɔronntwe no ho da n',
Mayɛyi rinngyaa da.

MHB 510
1 . AWAY, my needless fears,
And doubts no longer mine;
A ray of heavenly light appears,
A messenger divine.
	 ~ 	1 . MO suro, fi mo do kɔ,
Mennyɛ kyingyefo bio;
Sor kan atow nserɛmɛn epue,
Nyame bɔfo siarfo.
Bɔ m' yɛ edwuma ma me.

MHB 510
2 . Thrice comfortable hope,
That calms my troubled breast;
My Father’s hand prepares the cup,
And what he wills is best.
	 ~ 	2 
. Enyidado mprɛnsa,
Ma me akomatɔm';
M'Egya Ne nsa siesie kuraba n';
Nye dza onyim dɛ oye.

MHB 510
3 . If what I wish is good,
And suits the will divine;
By earth and hell in vain withstood,
I know it shall be mine.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ dza mepɛ yie na
Ɔyɛ Nyame apɛdze,
Sɛ asaase nye hɛll siw kwan mpo a,
Minyim dɛ ɔbɛyɛ m'dze.

MHB 510
4 . Still let them counsel take
To frustrate His decree,
They cannot keep a blessing back
By heaven designed for me. 
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma wɔnkɔ do ntu egyina
Mfa nsɛɛ No mom a ɔahyɛ n',
Worunntum nnsiw nhyira kwan da,
Wofi sor ahyehyɛ ama m'.

MHB 510
5 . Here then I doubt no more,
But in His pleasure rest,
Whose wisdom, love, and truth, and power,
Engage to make me blest.
	 ~ 	5 
. Afei menngye kyim bio,
Ne dɛw mu mohom komm,
Nyia Ne nyansaa, nokwar nye tum
Bɔ m' ma meyɛ siarfo.

MHB 510
6 . To accomplish His design
The creatures all agree;
And all the attributes divine
Are now at work for me.	 ~ 	6 
. Dza ɔahyehyɛ ato hɔ n',
Abɔdze nyina dzi do;
Na ɔsor ndzɛmba nyinara

MHB 511
1 . BEGONE, unbelief; my Saviour is near,
And for my relieve will surely appear:
By  prayer let me wrestle, and He will perform;
With Christ in the vessel,I smile at the storm.
	 ~ 	1 . FI mo do, ekyingye, m'Agyenkwa bɛn me,
Na m'ahotɔ ntsi ɔbɛba abɛgye m';
Me nam mpaabɔ mu meper na ɔbɛyɛ;
Menye Christ wɔ hɛn mu, meserew ehum.
Dɛm ber n' o, konyimdzifo ndwom bɛyɛ dɛw!

MHB 511
2 . Though dark be my way, since He is my Guide,
’Tis mine to obey, ’tis His to provide;
Though cisterns be broken and creatures all fail,
The word He has spoken shall surely prevail.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mo kwan mu yɛ sum, ɔyɛ m' kwankyerɛfo,
Medze nye setsie, Nedze nye ɔma;
Sɛ nsunyiwa tuetue na abɔdze hera a,
Asɛm a ɔaka n' dze otsim hɔ afebɔɔ.

MHB 511
3 . His love in time past forbids me to think
He’ll leave me at last in trouble to sink;
While each Ebenezer I have in review
Confirms His good pleasure to help me quite through
	 ~ 	3 
. No dɔ a ofi ahyɛse n' amma manndwen dɛ
Ewiei n' obegyaa m' ma meewu esuwu;
Ber a m'enyi tua m'Ebenezer ho yi,
Obesi n' pi dɛ ɔbɔboa m' akɔ ewiei.

MHB 511
4 . Why should I complain of want or  distress, 
Temptation or pain? He told me  no less; 
The heirs of salvation, I know from His word. 
Through much tribulation must follow their Lord.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔyɛ dɛn ntsi na muhwinwhin dɛm yi?
Nsɔhwɛ anaa yaw? Yi na ɔkaa kyerɛɛ m',
Minyim, N'asɛm ka dɛ nkwagye adzedzifo
Wɔnam nsɔhwɛ mu dzi hɔn Wura ekyir.

MHB 511
5 . Since all that I meet shall work for my good, 
The bitter is sweet, the medicine food; 
Though painful at present, ‘twill cease before long;
And then, O how pleasant the conqueror’s song!	 ~ 	5 
. 'Sinadɛ dza mihia nyina ye ma m' ntsi
Dza ɔyɛ wen yɛ dɛw, edur yɛ edziban;
Sesei dze ɔyɛ yaw, ɔnnkɛkyɛr na egyaa;

MHB 512
1 . LORD, as to Thy dear Cross we flee,
And plead to be forgiven, 
So let Thy life our pattern be,
And form our souls for heaven.
	 ~ 	1 . OWURA, yɛkɔ W'asɛndua ho
Kɛserɛ bɔnfakyɛ,
Ma Wo bra nyɛ hɛn fasusu,
Nsiesie hɛn kra mma sor.
Yendzi W'ekyir nkɔ sor.  Amen.

MHB 512
2 . Help us, through good report and ill, 
Our dally cross to bear; 
Like Thee to do our Father's will, 
Our brethren's grief to share.
	 ~ 	2 
. Boa hɛn, atsenka pa nye bɔn m',
Yɛnsoa hɛn mbeamudua daa;
Yɛnyɛ hɛn Egya Ne pɛ dɛ ɔwo,
Yɛnye enuanom nkyɛ yaw.

MHB 512
3 . Let grace our selfishness expel,
Our earthliness refine, 
And kindness in our bosoms dwell, 
As free and true as Thine.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma adom nku hɛn pɛsankonya,
Ntsew hɛn efisɛm nyina ho,
Na ma W' nokwar ayamuyie pii n'
Ntsena hɛn so hɛn mu.

MHB 512
4 . If joy shall at Thy bidding fly,
And grief's dark day come on, 
We, In our turn, would meekly cry: 
Father, Thy will be done I
	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ 'ma hɛn enyigye tu kɔ
Ma yaw sum da no ba a,
Hɛn so yɛbɛtsea m' mberɛw mu dɛ;
Egya, Wo pɛ nyɛ hɔ!

MHB 512
5 . Should friends misjudge, or foes defame, 
Or brethren faithless prove, 
Then, like Thine own, be all our aim 
To conquer them by love.
	 ~ 	5 
. Mfɛfoe ntɛnkyew, tamfo tom hɛn,
'Nuanom hɔn nokwar sa a,
Hɛn botae bɛyɛ dɛ Wodze n',
Yɛdze dɔ bedzi nyim.

MHB 512
6 . Kept peaceful in the midst of strife,
Forgiving and forgiven, 
O may we lead the pilgrim's life, 
And follow Thee to heaven.       Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Yɛbɛper enya asomdwee,
Yɛdze kyɛ enya fakyɛ;
O ma yɛmbɔ akwantufo bra,

MHB 513
1 . WHO fathoms the eternal thought?
Who talks of scheme and plan?
The Lord is God! He needeth not
The poor device of man.
	 ~ 	1 . WOANA susu ɔdomankoma adwen?
Mbrɛ osi hyehyɛ ndzɛmba?
Ewuradze nye Nyankopɔn!
Onnhia dasanyi apam.
No nhwɛdo na N' dɔ ho.

MHB 513
2 . Here in the maddening maze of things,
When tossed by storm and flood,
To one fixed ground my spirit clings;
I know that God is good!
	 ~ 	2 
. Ha a ndzɛmba ayɛ sakaa yi,
Nsuyirii na ehum haw hɛn 'i,
Mo sunsum gyina fakor pintsinn;
Minyim dɛ Nyame ye!

MHB 513
3 . I long for household voices gone,
For vanished smiles I long;
But God hath led my dear ones on,
And He can do no wrong.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mo kɔn dɔ fie ndze a etwa m',
Serew a menntse bio no;
Nyame dze m'adɔfo kɔ na
Nyame ɔnnyɛ mfomdo.

MHB 513
4 . I know not what the future hath
Of marvel or surprise,
Assured alone that life and death
His mercy underlies.

. And if my heart and flesh are weak
To bear an untried pain,
The bruised reed He will not break,
But strengthen and sustain.
	 ~ 	4 
. Minnyim ndaamba mu nsɛm koraa,
Nwanwa anaa ahobow a?
M'awerɛhyɛm' nye dɛ nkwa nye owu m'
N'ehumbɔbɔr dɔɔ so.

MHB 513
5 . No offering of my own I have,
Nor works my faith to prove;
I can but give the gifts He gave,
And plead His love for love.
	 ~ 	5 
. Sɛ m'akoma nye honam yɛ mberɛw
Dɛ ɔsoa yaw beberee a,
Ndzɛmbir a odzi dzɛm n' orummbu m';
Opirim na ɔhyɛ dzen mbom.

MHB 513
6 . And so beside the silent sea
I wait the muffled oar;
No harm from Him can come to me
On ocean or on shore.
	 ~ 	6 
. Minnyim m'ankasa m'afɔrbɔ
Na ndwuma a odzi m' dase;
Medze N'akyɛdze san ma No,
Meserɛ No dɔ dze adɔ.

MHB 513
7 . I know not where  His islands lift
Their fronded palms in air;
I only know I cannot drift
Beyond His love and care.	 ~ 	7 
. Dɛm ntsi po a ɔataa dzinn ho no,
Motweɔn osutwafo n';
Ɔnnkɛfa haw ato mo do,
Pomu anaa berano.

MHB 514
1 . HE that is down needs fear no fall,
He that is low no pride;
He that is humble ever shall
Have God to be his guide.
	 ~ 	1 . NYIA ɔda famu nnsuro asehwe,
'Bɔbɔfo nnyɛ ahantan;
Nyia ɔbrɛ noho adze no,
Nyame bɛkyerɛ no kwan.
Ɔkɔ mfesantsen nyina.

MHB 514
2 . I am content with what I have,
Little be it or much;
And, Lord, contentment still I crave,
Because Thou savest such.
	 ~ 	2 
. M'enyi sɔ dza mowɔ biara,
Osuar o, ɔdɔɔ so o;
Mepɛ Ewuradze mu abodwee,
'Siandɛ ɔgye nyia ɔtse dɛm.

MHB 514
3 . Fullness to such a burden is
That go on pilgrimage;
Here little, and hereafter bliss,
Is best from age to age.	 ~ 	3 
. Adzesoa durdur da hɔ ma
Hɔn a wɔyɛ akwantufo;
Ha kakraabi, nhyira wɔ ekyir,

MHB 515
1 . THY way, not mine, O Lord, 
However dark it be! 
Lead me by Thine own hand;
Choose out the path for me .
Smooth let it be or rough, 	. 
It will be still the best; 
Winding or straight, it leads 
Right onward to Thy rest. 
	 ~ 	1 . Wo kwan a; nnyɛ medze, 
Sɛ no mu kadoo mpo a,
Wankasa gye m' taataa;
Kyerɛ m' kwan a mundua mu.
No mu ye o, no mu muo o,
Ɔnoara na oye;
Ɔkyeakyea o, ɔtsen o,
Wɔdze kɔ W'ahomgyem'.
M'ahoɔdzen, m'adze nyina.	Amen.

MHB 515
2 . I dare not choose my lot; 
 I would not, if I might :
Choose Thou for me, My God 
So shall I walk aright. 
The kingdom that I seek 
Is Thine; so let the way  
That leads to it be Thine, 
Else I must surely stray.
	 ~ 	2  
. Mennkɛfa dza mepɛ; 
Wɔse m' mpo a mennkɛfa:
Mo Wura, Woara, fa ma m'
Na ɔayɛ kwan pa ama m'.
Ɔman a mohwehwɛ n'
Wodze a; na ma kwan a
Wɔdze kɔm' so nyɛ Wodze,
Ɔno m'bɔtɔ dɔnsuar.

MHB 515
3 . Take Thou my cup, and it 
With joy or sorrow fill 
As best to Thee may seem; 
Choose Thou my good and ill. 
Not mine, not mine the choice
In things or great or small;
Be Thou my Guide, my Strength, 
My Wisdom and my All.    Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Woara gye mo kuraba, 
Fa dɛw anaa yaw gum'
Dɛ mbrɛ ehwɛ a oye;
Yie o, bɔn o, fa ma m'.
Memmfa mara me pɛ
Woara yɛ m'kwangyafo

MHB 516
1 . WHEN we walk With the Lord 
In the light of His Word 
What a glory He sheds on our way !
While we do His  good will, 
He abides With us still
And With all Who will trust and obey. 

    Trust and obey, for there’s no  other way 
    To be, happy in Jesus,
    But to trust and obey.
	 ~ 	1 . Sɛ yɛnyé Ewuradze nam
N’asɛmpa kwan no mu a,
Enyimnyam a ͻhyérɛn hɛn kwan mu a!
Bér a yɛyɛ N’apɛdze,
Ͻnye hɛn tsena daa,
      Nye hͻn a wͻtwer No yɛ setsie.
      Twer N’, yɛ setsie, na kwan biara nnyi hͻ a
      Hɛn enyi bɛgye Jesus mu,
      Dɛ yɛtwer N’, yɛ setsie.
Mma nnsuro, twer N’, yɛ setsie ara.

MHB 516
2 . Not a shadow can rise,
Not a cloud in the skies 
But His smile quickly drives it away; 	. 
Not a doubt nor a fear 
Not a sigh nor a tear,
Can abide While we trust and obey.
	 ~ 	2 
. Sunsuma bi nnkͻsoɛr,
Mununkum rinnsi wimu a
Ne serew nnkͻhwetse n’ ntsɛmara;
Ekyingye anaa suro,
Awérɛhow na nyinsuwa
Rinngyina ber a yɛyɛ setsie.

MHB 516
3 . Not a burden we bear, 
Not a sorrow we share, 
But  our toil He doth richly repay; 
Not a grief nor a loss, 
Not a frown nor a cross,
But are blest if we trust and obey .
	 ~ 	3 
. Adzesoa a yɛsoa nyina,
Awérɛhow a yedzi.
Otua no mu biara ho kaw yie;
Yaw anaa adzehwer bi.
Muna anaa ͻhaw
Yɛ nhyira bér a yɛtwer, yɛ setsie.

MHB 516
4 . But we never can prove 
The delights of His love 
Until all on the altar we lay; 
For the favour He shows, 
And the joy He bestows, 
Are for them who will trust and obey.
	 ~ 	4 
. Naaso yerunntum nnkyérɛ
No dͻ ho enyigye,
Gyedɛ yɛdze n‘ nyina gu afͻr-pon n’ do;
Adom a ͻyɛ no.
Na dɛw a ͻma no,
Yɛ hͻn a wobetsie no hͻndze.

MHB 516
5 . Then in fellowship sweet 
We will sit at His feet, 
Or we’ll walk by His side in the way; 
What He says we will do, 
Where He sends we will go-
Never fear, only trust and obey	 ~ 	5 
. ‘Nyɛnkoyɛ dɛɛdɛw mu.
Yɛbɛtsena N’ananadze,
Yɛnye N’ besian anan wͻ kwan no mu;
Dza ͻka n’ yɛbɛyɛ,
Yɛbͻkͻ No soma n’.

MHB 517
1 . SIMPLY trusting every day, 
Trusting through a stormy way; 
Even when my faith is small, 
Trusting Jesus, that is all. 

      Trusting as the moments fly, 
      Trusting as the days go by, 
      Trusting Him whate’er befall, 
      Trusting Jesus, that is all.
	 ~ 	1 . MOTWER No daa nyinara,
Ehum rutu a, motwer No;
Sɛ me gyedzi suar dɛn ara a,
Motwer Jesus, noara nye n'.
Motwer Jesus, noara nye n'.

MHB 517
2 . Brightly doth His Spirit shine
Into this poor heart of mine: 
While He leads I cannot fall, 
Trusting Jesus, that is all. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Mber rutwa m' kɔ a motwer No,
Nda resen yi, motwer No,
Dza obesi bia 'a motwer No,
Motwer Jesus, noara nye n'.

MHB 517
3 . Singing, if my way be clear; 
Praying, if the path be drear; 
If in danger, for Him call; 
Trusting Jesus, that is all.
	 ~ 	3 
. No Sunsum hyerɛn fɛɛfɛw
Kɔ m'akoma bɔbɔfo yi m';
Ogya m' yi moronnhwe ase,
Motwer Jesus, noara nye n'.

MHB 517
4 . Trusting Him while life shall last, 
Trusting Him till earth be past, 
Till within the jasper wall; 
Trusting Jesus, that is all.	 ~ 	4 
. Kwan m' yɛ tɔɔtsen, a motow ndwom,
Kwan mu yɛ hu a, mobɔ mpaa;
Sɛ mbusu mu a, sufrɛ No;
Motwer Jesus, noara nye n'.

MHB 518
1 . JESU, priceless treasure,
Source of purest pleasure,
Truest Friend to me;
Ah! How long I’ve panted,
And my heart hath fainted,
Thirsting, Lord, for thee!
Thine I am, O spotless Lamb,
I will suffer nought to hide Thee,
Nought I ask beside thee.
	 ~ 	1 . JESU, akoradze a wɔnntɔ,
'Nyigye mapa farbaa,
Me nyɛnko brɛbo;
Ao! Meper hwehwɛ Wo,
M'akoma atɔ bitsi,
Wo ho nsukɔm dze m'!
Eguambaa krɔnn, meyɛ W'dze,
Mennkɛma kwan ma wɔdze W' esie,
Mimmbisa hwee nnka W' ho.
Jesu, akoradze a wɔnntɔ.

MHB 518
2 . In Thine arm I rest me;
Foes who would molest me
Cannot reach me here;
Though the earth be shaking,
Every heart be quaking,
Jesus calms my fear;
Sin and hell in conflict fell
With their bitter storms assail me:
Jesus will not fail me.
	 ~ 	2 
. W'abaw mu na mohom;
Atamfo a wɔhaw me
Nsa rennka me ha;
Asaase wosow mpo a,
Nyimpa nyina akoma tu a,
Jesus bɔ m' suro ham;
Bɔn nye hɛll nyina hwe ase,
Ehum dzendzen bunkam mo do a,
Jesus nnkɛpa me da.

MHB 518
3 . Hence, all fears and sadness!
For the Lord of gladness,
Jesus, enters in;
Those who love the Father,
Though the storms may gather,
Still have peace within;
Yea, whate’er I here must bear,
Still in Thee lies purest pleasure,
Jesu, priceless treasure!	 ~ 	3 
. Suro nye awerɛhow nyina
Wɔdze ma Ewuradze,
Jesus bɛhɛn mu;
Hɔn a wɔdɔ Egya no,
Sɛ ehum tu mpo a
Wɔwɔ asomdwee;
Biribiara a mosoa wɔ ha n',
Enyigye mapa wɔ Wo mu,

MHB 519
1 . THEE, Jesus, full of truth and grace,
Thee, Saviour, we adore,
Thee in affliction’s furnace praise,
And magnify Thy power.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, nokwafo ɔdomfo,
Agyenkwa, yɛsɔr Wo,
Amandzehu m' yeyi W' ayɛw,
Na Wo tum yɛ kɛse.
Ɔdɔ mapa ahyɛnsew n'.

MHB 519
2 . Thy power, in human weakness shown,
Shall make us all entire;
We now Thy guardian presence own,
And walk unburned in fire.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wo tum wɔ nyimpa mberɛwyɛ mu
Bɛyɛ hɛn nyina kor;
W'enyim a ɔkyerɛ hɛn kwan ntsi
Yɛnantsew gya mu sɔnn.

MHB 519
3 . Thee, Son of Man, by faith we see,
And glory in our Guide;
Surrounded and upheld by Thee,
The fiery test abide.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyimpa Ba, gyedzi mu yehu W',
Yetuw W'akwankyerɛ ho;
Abɔ hɛn ho aprɔw ehyia yi,
Yetum gyina ogya mu.

MHB 519
4 . The fire our graces shall refine,
Till, moulded from above,
We bear the character divine,
The stamp of perfect love. 	 ~ 	4 
. Adom bɛma ogya n' ayerɛw,
Na wɔayɛ hɛn fofor,
Ma yaasɛ ɔsor suban no,

MHB 52
1 . O LOVE of God, how strong and true; 
 Eternal, and yet ever new; 
 Uncomprehended and unbought, 
 Beyond all knowledge and all thought!
	 ~ 	1 . ONYAME dɔ, mbrɛ odua yɛ dzen a!
Ɔwɔ hɔ daa, na ɔnnsesa;
Wɔnntse ase na wɔdze ma kwa,
Ɔbor nyimdzee na adwen do!

MHB 52
2 . O heavenly love, how precious still, 
 In days of weariness and ill, 
 In nights of pain and helplessness, 
 To heal, to comfort, and to bless.
	 ~ 	2 . ɔsor dɔ, mbrɛ odua som bo a!
Wɔ 'berɛ na ɔyar nda mu,
Anago yaw na apensi mu;
Ekyekye hɛn werɛ, 'hyira hɛn.

MHB 52
3 . O wide-embracing, wondrous love; 
 We read thee in the sky above, 
 We read thee in the earth below, 
 In seas that swell and streams that flow.
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔdɔ nwanwa a ɔka hɛn fua,
Yɛkenkan wo wimu, ɔwɔ sor,
Yɛkenkan wo wɔ asaase famu,
Po a ɔtserɛw na nsu a ɔtsen mu.

MHB 52
4 . We read thee best in Him who came 
 To bear for us the cross of shame, 
 Sent by the Father from on high, 
 Our life to live, our death to die.
	 ~ 	4 . Yehu wo yie wɔ Nyia ɔbiaa
Bɔsoaa enyimguase mbeamudua n' mu,
Egya no somaa No fii sor,
Nye hɛn bɛtsenae, bowuu hɛn wu.

MHB 52
5 . We read thee power to bless and save 
 E'en in the darkness of the grave; 
 Still more in resurrection light 
 We read the fulness of Your might.
	 ~ 	5 . Yehu wo tum a ohyira, gye hɛn, 
Wɔ adakamaa no sum mu mpo; 
 Yehu w' bio wɔ 'wusoɛr kan mu,
Yehu wo tum no n'amayɛ.

MHB 52
6 . O love of God, our shield and stay 
 Through all the perils of our way; 
 Eternal love, in thee we rest, 
 For ever safe, for ever blest.	 ~ 	6 . Onyame dɔ, hɛn kyɛm boafo,
Hɛn abrabɔ m' mbusu nyina m'; 
 Bɛkyebo dɔ, wo mu yɛhom,
Yenya ahotɔ na nhyira daa.

MHB 520
1 . I BRING my sins to Thee,
The sins I cannot count,
That all may cleansed be
In Thy once-opened Fount.
I bring them, Saviour, all to Thee;
The burden is too great for me.
	 ~ 	1 . Medze mo bɔn brɛ Wo 
Dza munntum ano bu,
Ama aahor ne nyina
Wɔ bɔgya bura no mu.
M'Agyenkwa, medze ne nyina brɛ W';
No dur hyɛ me kra do dodow.
Medze brɛ Wo, me Hen, Gyefo.

MHB 520
2 . My heart to Thee I bring, 
The heart I cannot read;
A faithless, wandering thing, 
An evil heart indeed. 
I bring it, Saviour, now to Thee,
That fixed and faithful it may be.
	 ~ 	2 
. Medze m'akoma brɛ Wo, 
'Koma a minnyim mu nsɛm;
Kɔhwinyi, kobɔnyi n',
Akoma bɔn ampa.
M'Agyenkwa, medze hyɛ Wo nsa
Ma m'akoma nsi pi mma Wo.

MHB 520
3 . To Thee I bring my care, 
The care I cannot flee; 
Thou wilt not only share, 
But bear it all for me. 
O loving Saviour, now to Thee 
I bring the load that wearies me. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Medze m' dadwen brɛ Wo, 
Dadwen a munntum munnguan n'
Ama eesuo mo mu
Ama eeyi no hɔ.
M'Agyenkwa dɔfo, Wo nkyɛn na
Medze m'adzesoa yi meba.

MHB 520
4 . I bring my grief to Thee,
The grief I cannot tell;
No words shall needed be,
Thou knowest all so well,
I bring the sorrow laid on me,
O suffering Saviour, now to Thee.
	 ~ 	4 
. Medze me yaw brɛ Wo, 
Yaw a munntum nnka n' a;
Ɔnngye dɛ meka mpo,
Ɔnngye dɛ meka mpo,
Woara nyim ne nyina.
M'Agyenkwa a Woara so nyim yaw,
Medze m'awerɛhow brɛ Wo.

MHB 520
5 . My joys to Thee I bring,
The joys Thy love hath given,
That each may be a wing.
To lift me nearer heaven.
I bring them, Saviour, all to Thee;
For Thou hast purchased all for me.
	 ~ 	5 
. Medze me dɛw brɛ Wo, 
Dɛw a Wo dɔ dze ana m',
Dɛ memfa nyɛ atwer a 
Mofow mipinkyɛn Wo.
Gyefo, Woara tɔɔ ne nyina maa m';
Medze ne nyina gu W'enyim.

MHB 520
6 . My life I bring to Thee,
I would not be my own;
O Saviour, let me be
Thine ever, Thine alone,
My heart, my life, my all I bring
To Thee, my Saviour and my King. 	 ~ 	6  
. Medze mo nkwa brɛ Wo, 
Mennda ho nndze moho;
Gyefo, ma menya Wodze,
Wo nko Wodze daa nyina.
M'akoma, mo nkwa, m'adze nyina,

MHB 521
1 . I AM trusting Thee, Lord, Jesus,
Trusting only Thee;
Trusting Thee for full salvation,
	Great and free.
	 ~ 	1 . MOTWER Wo, Ewuradze Jesus,
Motwer Wo nkotoo,
Motwer Wo ma meenya nkwagye 
Kɛse kwa.
Na afebɔɔ.

MHB 521
2 . I am trusting Thee for pardon;
At Thy feet I bow;
For Thy grace and tender mercy, 
	Trusting now.
	 ~ 	2 
. Motwer Wo kotow W'ananadze
Serɛ bɔnfakyɛ;
W'adom nye ehumbɔbɔr kɛse n'
Na motwer.

MHB 521
3 . I am trusting Thee for cleansing
In the crimson flood;
Trusting Thee to make me holy 
	By Thy blood
	 ~ 	3 
. Motwer Wo ma aatsew mo ho
Wɔ bɔgya bura n' mu;
Motwer Wo ma aayɛ m' krɔnkrɔn,
Wo bɔgyaa m'.

MHB 521
4 . I am trusting Thee to guide me;
Thou alone shalt lead,
Every day and hour supplying 
	All my need.
	 ~ 	4 
. Motwer W' ma aayɛ m' Kwankyerɛfo,
Woara kyerɛ me kwan;
Daa na dɔnhwer nyinara m' ma m'
M'ehiadze.

MHB 521
5 . I am trusting Thee for power, 
Thine can never fail;
Words which Thou Thyself shalt give me 
	Must prevail.
	 ~ 	5 
. Motwer Wo ama meenya tum,
Irinngyaa me da;
Nsɛm a Woara dze bɛma me n'
Bedzi nyim.

MHB 521
6 . I am trusting Thee, Lord Jesus;
Never let me fall;
I am trusting Thee forever,
	And for all.	 ~ 	6 
. Motwer Wo, Ewuradze Jesus,
Mma monnhwe ase da;
Motwer Wo daa daa nyinara,

MHB 522
1 . I COULD not do without Thee,
O saviour of the lost,
Whose precious blood redeemed me
At such a tremendous cost;
Thy righteousness, Thy pardon
Thy precious blood must be
My only hope and comfort,
My glory and my plea.
	 ~ 	1 . SƐ 'nnka m' ho a, munntum nnyɛ hwee,
Hɔn a wɔayew hɔn Gyefo,
Ɔwo a Wo bɔgyaa a ɔsom bo n' 
'Dze apon emi dɛm yi;
Wo tsenenee, Wo fakyɛ,
Wo bɔgyaa a ɔsom bo n' nyɛ 
M'enyidar, m'awerɛkyekyer,
M'enyimnyam, na m'asɛm.
Na awasa dɛ, Mara a.  Amen.

MHB 522
2 . I could not do without Thee, 
I cannot stand alone, 
I have no strength or goodness, 
No wisdom of my own; 
But Thou, beloved Saviour, 
Art all in all to me, 
And weakness will be power 
If leaning hard on Thee. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ 'nnka m' ho a, munntum nnyɛ hwee,
Mo nko nnkotum egyina,
Minnyi ahom anaa ayamuyie,
Me nyansaa nnyɛ medze;
Na Ɔwo Agyenkwa Dɔfo dze
Eyɛ m'adze nyina,
Sɛ motwer Wo nkotoo a,
Mberɛwyɛ dan ahoɔdzen.

MHB 522
3 . I could not do without Thee, 
No other friend can read
The spirit’s strange deep longings, 
Interpreting its need;
No human heart could enter . 
Each dim recess of mine, 
And soothe, and calm it.
O blessed Lord, but Thine.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ 'nnka m' ho a, munntum nnyɛ hwee,
Nyɛnko biara nnyi hɔ a
Otum hu adze a me kra
Hwehwɛ na ɔatse ase,
Ɔdasanyi bi nnyi hɔ a,
Obohu m'akoma m' nsɛm
Na ɔakyekye mo werɛ
Dɛ Ewuradze nko.

MHB 522
4 . I could not do without Thee, 
For years are fleeting fast, 
And soon in solemn loneliness .
The river must be passed; 
But Thou wilt never leave me, 
And though the waves roll high,
 I know Thou wilt be near me, 
And whisper, It is I.	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ 'nnka m' ho a, munntum nnyɛ hwee,
M-fe rutwa m' ntsɛntsɛm,
Na ɔnnkɛkyɛr na m' nko rutwa
Esutsen n' awerɛhow m';
Sɛ asorɛkye n' bu dɛn ara a,
Ɔwo innkegya m' da,
Minyim dɛ ebɛbɛn me

MHB 523
1 . I WILL not let Thee go, Thou help 
in time of need:
Heap ill on ill,
I trust Thee still,
Even when it seems that Thou wouldst slay indeed,
Do as Thou wilt with me,
I yet will cling to Thee;
Hide Thou Thy face, yet: Help in 
time of need,
I will not let Thee go! 
	 ~ 	1 . MINNKEGYAA W' ma aakɔ! Ɔwo a
eyɛ hia da m' boafo;
Mbusu dɔɔ so a,
Motwer W' ara,
Kaansa ɔyɛ dɛ epɛ abɔ me a,
Yɛ me dza Woara pɛ,
Mebɛtetar Wo ara;
'Dze W'enyim huntsa mpo a, hia da m' boafo,
Minnkegyaa Wo ma aakɔ!
Minnkɛgyaa Wo ma aakɔ!

MHB 523
2 . I will not let Thee go. Should I forsake my bliss?
No, Thou art mine,
And I am Thine,
Thee will I hold when all things else I miss.
Though dark and sad the night,
Joy cometh with Thy light,
O Thou my Sun: should I forsake my bliss?
I will not let Thee go! 
	 ~ 	2 
. Mennkɛgyaa W' ma aakɔ! Ana me
nhyira mbɔ ,e a?
Dabi, 'yɛ m'dze,
Meyɛ Wodze;
Ndzɛmba nyina hwer m' mpo a, m' 
bɛtetar W',
'Nafua yɛ sum dɛn mpo a,
Wo kan dze enyigye ba;
Ɔwo a eyɛ m'Ewia, me nhyira mbɔ me a?
Minnkegyaa Wo ma aakɔ!

MHB 523
3 . I will not let Thee go, my God, my Life, my Lord:
Not death can tear
Me from His care,
Who for my sake His soul in death outpoured.
Thou diedst for love to me;
I say in love to Thee,
Even when my heart shall break,
my God, my life, my Lord,
I will not let Thee go!	 ~ 	3 
. Mennkɛma aakɔ! Me Nyame, mo
Nkwa, m'Ewuradze;
'Wu ruuntum nntsew m'
Ɔwo a emi ntsi ihuee Wo nkwa gui,
'Dɔ ntsi Ɔwo wui maa m';
Meka n' ɔdɔ m' kyerɛ Wo,
M'akoma tsew mpo a, me Nyame,
mo Nkwa, Wura,

MHB 524
1 . MY GOD, I thank Thee, who hast made
The earth so bright,
So full of splendour and of joy,
Beauty and light;
So many glorious things are here,
Noble and right.
	 ~ 	1 . ME Nyame, meda W' ase wɔ Wiadze fɛɛfɛw,
Ɔhyerɛn, no mu yɛ dɛw, yɛ kan,
Yɛ ahomka;
Ndzɛmba a ɔyɛ nwanwa pii wɔ ha,
Dza ɔkrɔn na oye.
Jesus No bom' n'.

MHB 524
2 . I thank Thee, Lord, that Thou hast made
Joy to abound,
So many gentle thoughts and deeds
Circling us round,
That in the darkest spot of earth
Some love is found.
	 ~ 	2 
. Meda W' ase dɛ ama yenya
Dɛw pii wɔ ha,
Adwen pa nye ndzeyɛɛ pa so
Ehyia hɛn ho,
Na wiadze beebi a ɔyɛ sum 
Ɔdɔ wɔ hɔ.

MHB 524
3 . I thank Theemore that all our  joy
Is touched with pain,
That shadows fall on brightest hours,
That thorns remain,
So that earth’s bliss may be our guide,
And not our chain.
	 ~ 	3 
. Meda W' ase dɛ dɛw nyina mu
Yaw so fam ho,
Dɛ wimu bunkam kan no do,
Nsoɛ so wɔ hɔ,
Ama wiadze dɛw akyerɛ hɛn kwan,
Na annkyekyer hɛn.

MHB 524
4 . I thank Thee, Lord, that Thou hast kept
The best in store:
We have enough, yet not too much
To long for more -
A yearning for a deeper peace
Not known before.
	 ~ 	4 
. Meda W' ase dɛ edze dza oye
Esie ama hɛn;
Yɛwɔ pii naaso ɔnndɔɔ so,
Yɛnnhwehwɛ bio;
Hɛn kɔn dɔ asomdwee mapa a
Ne saso nnka.

MHB 524
5 . I thank Thee, Lord, that here our souls,Though amply blest,
Can never find, although they seek,
A perfect rest,
Nor ever shall, until we lean
On Jesu’s breast.	 ~ 	5 
. Meda W' ase dɛ ha hɛn akra
Nya nhyira pii,
Naaso wonntum nnya ahomgye pa a 
Odzi mu koraa n',
Kodu dɛ wɔbɛba abɔtwer

MHB 525
1 . THROUGH the love of God our 
Saviour,
All, will be well;
Free and changeless is His favour,
All, all is well.
Precious is the blood that healed us;
Perfect is the grace that sealed us;
Strong the hand stretched forth to shield us, 
All must be well.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN Agyenkwa Nyame dɔ ntsi
Ɔbɛyɛ yie;
N'adom a ɔdze ma kwa, ɔnnsakyer,
Ne nyina ye;
N'adehye bɔgya sa hɛn yar;
N'adom kɛse sɔw hɛn ano;
Ne nsa a ɔwowaw hɛn n' yɛ dzen,
Ɔbɛyɛ yie.
Ɔbɛyɛ yie.

MHB 525
2 . Though we pass through tribulation.
All will be well;
Christ hath purchesd full salvation;
All, all is well:
Happy, still in God confiding;
Fruitful, if in Christ abiding;
Holy, through the Spirit’s guiding;
All must be well:
	 ~ 	2 
. Kaansa yɛnam ɔhaw mu mpo a,
Ɔbɛyɛ yie;
Christ atɔ hɛn nkwagye ewie,
Ne nyina ye;
Yedzi dɛw wɔ hɛn nkwagye ewie,
Yɛtse Christ mu a yɛsow aba,
Yɛyɛ krɔnkrɔn wɔ Sunsum mu;
Ɔbɛyɛ yie.

MHB 525
3 . We expect a bright to-morrow;
All will be well,
Faith can sing through days of sorrow,
All, all is well.
On our Father’s love relying,
Jesus every need supplying,
Then in living or in dying,
All must be well.	 ~ 	3 
. Hɛn enyi da adzekyee pa kwan,
Ɔbɛyɛ yie;
Gyedzi tow ndwom awerɛhow da mu,
Ne nyina ye;
Yɛdze hɛnho to Egya n' dɔ do,
Jesus ma hɛn dza yehia nyina,
Ntsi nkwa mu o, anaa owu mu o,

MHB 526
1 . O JESUS, I have promised
To serve Thee to the end;
Be Thou for ever near me,
My Master and my Friend:
I shall not fear the battle
If thou art by my side,
Nor wander from the pathway
If Thou wilt be my Guide.
	 ~ 	1 . O JESUS , mahyɛ bɔ dɛ
M'bɔsom Wo akɔ ewiei;
Ntsi pinkyɛn me daa nyina,
Mo Wura nye me Nyɛnko;
Murunnsuro ɔko no,
Sɛ ewɔ me nkyɛn a,
Sɛ Ɔwo yɛ me Kwankyerɛfo a,
Morommfom mmfi kwan n' mu.
Adom mfa ndzi W'ekyir.

MHB 526
2 . O let me feel thee near me:
The world is ever near;
I see the sights that dazzle,
The tempting sounds I hear;
My foes are ever near me,
Around me and within;
But, Jesus, draw Thou nearer,
And shield my soul from sin.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma mentse nka dɛ ebɛn me,
Wiadze bɛn me dabaa;
Muhu dza osiw enyiwa do,
Metse engyigye so nka;
M'atamfo bɛn me dabaa,
Wɔabɔ mo ho aprɔw;
Mbom Jesus, twe bɛn me, na
Gye me kra fi bɔn mu.

MHB 526
3 . O let me hear Thee speaking
In accents clear and still,
Above the storms of passion,
The murmurs of self-will;
O speak to reassure me,
To hasten or control;
O speak, and make me listen,
Thou Guardian of my soul.
	 ~ 	3 
. O ma mentse wo ndze dɛ
Rekasa krɔnkrɔnkrɔn,
Wɔ akɔndɔbɔn ehum mu
Na pɛ n'ehwinhwin mu;
Kasa ma minnya awerɛhyɛm',
Tsea m' anaa hom mo do;
O kasa ma mintsie Wo,
Ɔwo m' kra Kwangyafo.

MHB 526
4 . O Jesus, Thou hast promised,
To all who follow thee,
That where Thou art in glory
There shall Thy servant be;
And, Jesus, I have promised
To serve Thee to the end:
O give me grace to follow,
My Master and my Friend. Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Jesus, abɔ anohoba
Dɛ W'akadofo nyina
Mbrɛ etse enyimnyam mu n'
Na W'asomfo bɛba;
Na Jesus, mahyɛ bɔ dɛ
M'bɔsom Wo akɔ ewiei;
Mo Wura nye me Nyɛnko, ma m'

MHB 527
1 . SOMETIMES a light surprises
The Christian while he sings:
It is the Lord who rises
With healing in his wings;
When comforts are declining,
He grants the soul again
A season of clear shining,
To cheer it after rain.
	 ~ 	1 . KAN pue Christiannyi awora
Aber a ɔrotow ndwom;
Nyame na ɔdze 'yarsa tum
Botwa no ho hyia dɛm;
Ber a awerɛkyekyer repa n',
Ɔma awerɛhyɛm' bi
Bɛhɛn ɔkra no mu bio,
Na ɔma n' enyigye.
Otwar dɛ midzi dɛw.

MHB 527
2 . In holy contemplation,
We sweetly then pursue
The theme of God’s salvation,
And find it ever new.
Set free from present sorrow,
We cheerfully can say,
E’en let the unknown  to-morrow
Bring with it what it may:
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛnam adwen krɔnkrɔn do
Yɛdze enyigye hwehwɛ
Nyame No nkwagye ho asɛm,
Na yenya no fofor,
Woyi hɛn awerɛhow 'i mu a,
Yetum dze dɛw ka dɛ
Ɔkyena mpo a yennyim mu asɛm
Mfa dza ɔdze nam mbra.

MHB 527
3 . It can bring with it nothing
But He will bear us through;
Who gives the lilies clothing
will clothe his people too:
Beneath the spreading heavens
No creature but is fed;
And he who feeds the ravens
Will give His children bread.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔammfa hweeara mpo ammba a,
Obotwitwa hɛn hia m',
Nyia ofura 'sukooko tam n'
Bɛma hɛn efuradze;
Wi yantamm n'ase ha yi
Abɔdze biara mee;
Na Nyia ɔnyɛn wimu nnoma n'
Bɛyɛn No mbofra so.

MHB 527
4 . Though vine nor fig-tree neither
Their wonted fruit should bear,
Though all the fields should wither,
Nor flocks nor herds be there,
Yet, God the same abiding,
His praise shall tune my voice;
For, while in him confiding,
I cannot but rejoice.	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ wenyindua na adɔmba
Annsow aba a ohia n',
Sɛ haban mu nyina tɔ pan
Mbowa nnya edzidzibea a,
Nyame ankasa wɔ hɔ 'i dze,
N'ayɛyi bɛhyɛ m' ma,
Aber a metse No mu yi,

MHB 528
1 . In heavenly love abiding, 
No change my heart shall fear; 
And safe in such confiding, 
For nothing changes here. 
The storm may roar without me, 
My heart may low be laid, 
But God is round about me, 
And can I be dismayed? 
	 ~ 	1 . Metse sor man ho dɔ mu 'i, 
Munnsuro nsakyer biara;
M'awerɛhyɛmu yi dzi mu,
Biribiara nnsakyer ha;
Ehum botu abɔ m' ho aprɔw
M'akoma botu dze;
Na Nyame etwa moho ehyia 'i.
Ana m'bɛpa abaw?
Na ɔnye m' bɛnantsew.

MHB 528
2 . Wherever He may guide me, 
No want shall turn me back; 
My shepherd is beside me, 
And nothing can I lack. 
His wisdom ever waketh, 
His sight is never dim, 
He knows the way He taketh, 
And I will walk with Him. 
	 ~ 	2  
. Beebiara a obegya me n'. 
Hia biara nnkɛsan me;
Mo Guanhwɛfo wɔ me nkyɛn,
Na minnkehia hweeara;
Ne nyansaa tse hɔ daa daa,
N'enyi nnyɛ kusuww da;
Onyim kwan a ɔfa do,
Na menye N' bɛnantsew.

MHB 528
3 . Green pastures are before me, 
Which yet I have not seen; 
Bright skies will soon be o'er me, 
Where the dark clouds have been. 
My hope I cannot measure, 
My path to life is free, 
My Saviour has my treasure, 
And He will walk with me. 	 ~ 	3  
. Mfunoma wɔ m'enyim a, 
Emidze minnyae nnhunii,
Wimu bɛtsew kann wɔ mo do,
Wɔ mbrɛ nkyɛ fua ahyɛ  n';
M'enyidar munntum nnsusu,
Mo kwan da hɔ kɔ nkwan',
M'Agyenkwa esie m'akoradze

MHB 529
1 . O BLESED life! the heart at rest
When all without tumultuous seems-
That trusts a higher will, and deems
That higher will, not mine, the best.
	 ~ 	1 . O SIAR nkwa bi a!' Homgye wɔ hɔ
Ma akoma, ber a dwumadzi asa -
Nyia ɔtwer sor apɛdze na obu n'
Adze tsitsir kyɛn nyimpa n' pɛ.
Na ma siar nkwa yi nyɛ medze.   Amen.

MHB 529
2 . O blessed life! the mind that sees,
Whatever change the years may bring,
A mercy still in everything,
And shining through all mysteries.
	 ~ 	2 
. O siar nkwa bi a! Adwen a ohu
Mbɔbɔrhu wɔ biribiara mu,
Na ohu esumasɛm nyina mu,
Kaansa afe n' dze nsakyer ba mpo a.

MHB 529
3 . O blessed life! the soul that soars,
When sense of mortal sight is dim,
Beyond the sense-beyond to Him,
Whose love unlocks the heavenly doors.
	 ~ 	3 
. O siar nkwa bi a! 'Kra hu ndzɛmba m',
Ber a adasa enyiwa yɛ kusuww,
Ɔtra ntseasee du Nyame hɔ,
Nyia No dɔ buebue sor mbobow.

MHB 529
4 . O blessed life! heart, mind, and  soul,
From self-born aims and wishes  free,
In all at one with Deity,
And loyal to the Lord’s control.
	 ~ 	4 
. O siar nkwa bi a! Akoma, adwen, kra,
Nya nyimpa dwen na ɔpɛ m' 'hotɔ,
Wɔnye Nyame bɔ m' wɔ adze nyina m',
Na wɔhyɛ Ewuradze tum ase.

MHB 529
5 . O life, how blessed, how divine!
High life, the earnest of a  higher:
Savior, fulfil my deep desire,
And let this blessed life be mine.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. O mbrɛ Nyame m' nkwa dua yɛ siar a!
Sor nkwa mapa a enyi da kwan;
Agyenkwa, hyɛ me pɛ no ma,

MHB 53
1 . God is love : His mercy brightness
All the patch in which we rove;
Bliss He wakes, and woe He lightens :
God wisdom, God love.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME nye dɔ, N'adom da edzi,
Wɔ kwan a yɛfa do nyina m';
Okenyan siar ma sum dan kan,
Nyam' nye nyansa, Nyam' nye dɔ.

MHB 53
2 . Chance and change are busy ever; 
 Man decays and ages move; 
 But His mercy waneth never: 
 God is wisdom, God is love.
	 ~ 	2 . Ndzɛmba nyina rutwa m'akɔ;
Nyimpa sɛe na mber twa mu;
Naaso N'adom do nnhuan da koraa;
Nyam' nye nyansa, Nyam' nye dɔ.

MHB 53
3 . E' en the hour that darkest seemeth 
 Will His changeless goodness prove; 
 From the gloom His brightness streameth: 
 God is wisdom, God is love.
	 ~ 	3 . Ber ɔyɛ sum dodow mu mpo,
Ɔda ho kyerɛ N'ayamuyie;
Awerɛhow mu Ne kan hyerɛn: 
Nyam' nye nyansa, Nyam' nye dɔ.

MHB 53
4 . He with earthly cares entwineth 
 Hope and comfort from above; 
 Everywhere His glory shineth: 
 God is wisdom, God is love.	 ~ 	4 . Ɔdze enyidar a ɔwɔ sor
Afora wiadze dadwen;
Beebiara N'enyimnyam hyerɛn:
Nyam' nye nyansa, Nyam' nye dɔ.

MHB 530
1 . OFT I in my heart have said:
Who shall ascend on high,
Mount to Christ, my glorious Head,
To bring him from the sky?
Borne on contemplation’s wing,
Surely I shall find him there,
Where the angels praise their King,
And gain the morning-star .
	 ~ 	1 . Mber pii na maka n' mo mu; 
Dɛ, Woana bɔfow sor,
Akɛfa Ewuradze Christ,
Dze No esian famu?
Adwendwen dze me botu,
Ma mekohu Noara
Mbrɛ abɔfo yi No ayɛw,
Wonya adzekyee nwoaraba n'.
Asɛm no abɛn wo.

MHB 530
2 . Oft I in my heart have said:
Who to the deep shall stoop,
Sink with Christ among the dead,
From thence to bring Him up?
Could I but my heart prepare,
By unfeigned humility,
Christ would quickly enter there,
And ever dwell with me.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mber pii na maka n' mo mu: 
Woana besian bun n' mu,
Akɛfa Ewuradze Christ,
Efi ewufom' aba?
Medze nokwar mbrɛahoadze
Siesie m'akoma mu dze a,
Christ bɛhɛn mo mu hɔ ntsɛm,
Nye me abɛtsena daa.

MHB 530
3 . But the righteousness of faith
Hath taught me better things:
Inward turn thine eyes, it saith,
While Christ to me it brings;
Christ is ready to impart
Life to all, for life who sigh;
In thy mouth, and in thy heart,
The word is ever nigh.	 ~ 	3 
. Na gyedzi mu tsenenee n' 
Akyerɛ me ndzɛmba pa:
Ɔdze Christ rebrɛ me no;
Ɔse: Hwɛ N' w'akkomam',
Christ ayɛ krado dze nkwa
Rema nyia ɔhaahaw ho n';
W'anomu nye w'akoma mu

MHB 531
1 . LIGHT of the world, thy beams I bless;
On Thee, bright Sun of Righteousness,
My faith has fixed its eye;
Guided by Thee, through all I go,
Nor fear the ruin spread below,
For Thou art always nigh.
	 ~ 	1 . WIADZE Kan, mihyira Wo nserɛmɛn n';
Tsenenee Ewia, Wo nko do na
Me gyedzi enyi tsim;
Igya me 'i, mudua ne nyina m',
Munnsuro mbusu biara wɔ ha,
'Siandɛ ebɛn me da.
Eyɛ m' Gyafo afebɔɔ.

MHB 531
2 . Not all the powers of hell can fright
A soul that walks with Christ in light;
He walks, and cannot fall:
Clearly he sees, and wins his way,
Shining unto the perfect day,
And more than conquers all.
	 ~ 	2 
. Samanadze etumfo runntum mmpuw
Ɔkra a ɔnye Christ nam kan mu;
Ɔnantsew, ɔnnhwe ase;
Ohu adze kann, tsin no kwan do,
Ɔwɔw do hyerɛn kodu da pa n',
Odzi adze nyina do nyim.

MHB 531
3 . I rest in Thine almighty power;
The name of Jesus is a tower,
That hides my life above;
Thou canst, Thou wilt my Helper be:
My confidence is all in Thee,
The faithful God of love.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mohom Wo tum kɛse n' ase;
Jesus Ne dzin yɛ abantsentsen,
Ɔkora me kra wɔ sor;
Onnkegyaa dɛ ɔyɛ mo Boafo;
Mo werɛ nyina hyɛ Wo mu,
Dɔ Nyame nokwafo.

MHB 531
4 . Wherefore, in never-ceasing prayer,
My soul to Thy continual care
I faithfully commend;
Assured that Thou through life shalt save,
And show Thyself beyond the grave
My everlasting Friend.	 ~ 	4 
. Dɛm ntsi, mobɔ mpaa daa nyina,
Mepra m'akoma m' tu me kra
Hyɛ Wo nsamu dabaa;
Minyim dɛ ɔbra yi m' 'bɛgye m' nkwa,
Na owu ekyir so akyerɛ me dɛ

MHB 532
1 . LET everlasting glories crown
Thy head, my Saviour and my Lord;
Thy hands have brought salvation down,
And writ the blessing in Thy word.
	 ~ 	1 . WƆMFA onnyiewiei enyimnyam nhyɛ Wo
Ahenkyɛw, m'Agyenkwa na m' Wura;
'Dze nkwagye fi sor esian famu,
Na akyerɛw nhyira n' wɔ W'asɛm mu.
W'asɛmpa n' kyekyer m'akoma ho.

MHB 532
2 . In vain our trembling conscience seeks
Some solid ground to rest upon;
With long despair our spirit  breaks,
Till we apply to Thee alone.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn ahopopo tsibowa hwehwɛ
Tsintsimbea pa bi ahom hɔ;
Abagura ntsi hɛn sunsum gow,
Kodu dɛ yɛba Wo nko hɔ.

MHB 532
3 . How well Thy blessed truths agree;
How wise and holy Thy commands;
Thy promises, how firm they be;
How firm our hope and comfort  stands !
	 ~ 	3 
. Mbrɛ Wo siar nokwar dua saa a! 
W'ahyɛdze yɛ nyansa na krɔnn,
Mbrɛ W'anohoba nyina dua tsim a!
Hɛn enyidar na awerɛkyekyer tsim.

MHB 532
4 . Should all the forms that men devise
Assault my faith with treacherous art,
I’d call them vanity and lies,
And bind Thy gospel to my heart. 	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ nyimpa nhyehyɛɛ bɔn nyinara
Ko dzendzen tsia me gyedzi mpo a,
Ɔyɛ gyan na akohwi; medze

MHB 533
1 . PRAYER is the soul's sincere desire,
Uttered or unexpressed, 
The motion of a hidden fire 
That trembles In the breast.
	 ~ 	1 . MPAABƆ nye ɔkra n'akɔndɔdze,
Wɔka anaa wɔnnka a,
Ɔyɛ nsumaa m'ogya a ɔdzɛw a
Ɔwosow akoma m'.
Hɛn Wura, kyerɛ hɛn mpaabɔ.  Amen.

MHB 533
2 . Prayer Is the burden of a sigh,
The falling of a tear, 
The upward glancing of an eye 
When none but God is near.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mpaabɔ yɛ nkrumsi dzendzen bi a
Ɔyɛ nyinsuwakyi,
Enyi a otua sor, mbrɛ obi mmbɛn,
Gyedɛ Nyame nkotsee.

MHB 533
3 . Prayer is the simplest form of speech 
That Infant lips can try; 
Prayer the sublimest strains that reach 
The  majesty on high.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mpaabɔ yɛ kasa mberɛw bo a 
Mbofra ano mpo tum ka;
Mbaabɔ yɛ ndwom dɛɛdɛw na odu
Sor Tumfo no enyim.

MHB 533
4 . Prayer Is the contrite sinner's voice 
Returning from his ways, 
While angels In their songs rejoice, 
And cry : Behold he prays!
	 ~ 	4 
. Mpaabɔ yɛ ɔbɔn a ɔasan efi
N'akwan bɔn ho ne ndze;
Abɔfo dze dɛw tow hɔn ndwom,
Tsea m' dɛ: Hwɛ, ɔrosɔr!

MHB 533
5 . Prayer is the Christian's vital breath, 
The Christian's native air, 
His watchword at the gates of death; 
He enters heaven with prayer.
	 ~ 	5 
. Mpaabɔ yɛ Christian n'ahom pa,
Christian man no mu mfar,
Tum a ɔdze hɛn owu abotsen m';
Ɔdze mpaabɔ hɛn sor;

MHB 533
6 . O Thou by whom we come to God, 
The Life, the Truth, the Way! 
The path of prayer Thyself hast trod : 
Lord! teach us how to pray.     Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Ɔwo a yedua W' do hu Nyame,
N-kwa Nokwar na Ɔkwan n'!
Woara edua mpaabɔ kwan no do;

MHB 534
1 . JESUS, Thou sovereign Lord of all,
The same through one eternal day,
Attend Thy feeblest followers’ call,
And O instruct us how to pray!
Pour out the supplicating grace,
And stir us up to seek Thy face.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, adasa Wura tumfo,
Ɔwo a nnsakyer dabiarada,
Tsie Wo mba mberɛyɛfo hɛn frɛ,
Na kyerɛ hɛn mbrɛ yensi mbɔ mpaa!
Hue mpaabɔ adom no gu hɛn do,
Na kenyan hɛn ma yɛnhwehwɛ W'.
Na mma mmfa nkaa no so nnkam hɛn.

MHB 534
2 . We cannot think a gracious thought,
We cannot feel a good desire,
Till Thou, who call’dst a world from nought,
The power into our hearts inspire:
The promised Intercessor give,
And let us now Thyself receive.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yennkotum adwen adwen pa bi,
Yennkenya ɔpɛ pa bi, gyedɛ
Ɔwo a efrɛɛ wiadze fii hun mu n'
Dze Wo tum n' kenyan hɛn akoma,
Ma anohoba Ntamugyinafo n' mbra,
Na ma yennya Woara sesei.

MHB 534
3 . Come in Thy pleading down
To us who for Thy coming stay;
Of all Thy gifts we ask but one,
We ask the constant power to pray:
Indulge us, Lord, in this request;
Thou canst not then deny the rest.	 ~ 	3 
. Dua Wo ntotɔserɛ Sunsum n' do
Bra hɛn a yɛrotweɔn Wo mbae n' nkyɛn;
Yɛserɛ W'akyɛdze n' mu kor pɛr,
Tum a wɔdze sɔr aber biara;
Yeewura, dom hɛn ebisadze yi,

MHB 535
1 . FROM every stormy wind that
 blows,
From every swelling tide of woes,
There is a calm, a sure retreat;
’Tis found beneath the mercy-seat.
	 ~ 	1 . EHUM kɛse biara a otu,
Na ɔhaw asorɛkye biara a obu n',
Ɔbrɛ adze; guandɔbea mapa,
Wɔ ehumbɔbɔr egua n' ase.
Enyimnyam ka mbɔbɔrhu egua n'.

MHB 535
2 . There is a place where Jesus sheds
The oil of gladness on our heads,
A place than all beside more sweet;
It is the blood-stained mercy-seat.
	 ~ 	2 
. Bea bi wɔ hɔ a Jesus hue
Enyigye ngo gu hɛn tsir do,
Bea a hɔ yɛ dɛw sen mbea nyina;
Mbɔbɔrhu bɔgya egua n' ase.

MHB 535
3 . There is a spot where spirits blend,
And friend holds fellowship with friend;
Though sundered far, by faith they  meet
Around one common mercy-seat.
	 ~ 	3 
. Bea bi wɔ hɔ a esunsum saa,
Na anyɛnkofo hyia fɛkuwbɔ m';
Wɔmmbɛn, naaso wohyia gyedzi m'
Wɔ ehumbɔbɔr egua kor n' ho.

MHB 535
4 . There, there on eagle-wing we soar,
And time and sense seem all no  more; 
And heaven comes down our souls  to greet,
And glory crowns the mercy-seat.	 ~ 	4 
. Hɔ, yɛdze ɔkɔr ntsaban tu,
Na mber nye adwen nnyi hɔ bio;
Na sor sian bɛyɛ hɛn akra etuu,

MHB 536
1 . MY GOD, is any hour so sweet
From blush of morn to evening star,
As that which calls me to Thy feet,
	The hour of prayer?
	 ~ 	1 . ME Nyame , ber bi wɔ anapa
Kodu ewimbir a ɔyɛ dɛw sen
Ber a efrɛ m' ba W'ananadze,
M-paabɔ ber n'.
Mpaabɔ m' ma Wo.

MHB 536
2 . Blest is that tranquil hour of  morn,
And blest that hour of solemn  eve,
When, on the wings of prayer  upborne,
The world I leave.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nhyira aka anapa asomdwee ber,
Na ewimbir nhyira ber krɔnn no,
Ber a mudua mpaabɔ ntsaban do 
Gya wiadze hɔ.

MHB 536
3 . For then a day-spring shines on me,
Brighter than morn’s ethereal glow;
And richer dews desend from Thee 
	Than earth can know.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ber 'i na anapawi tow nserɛmɛn a
Ɔsen anapa ewia hyerɛn gu m' do,
Na ahomka bɔsu a ofi Wo hɔ
Kyɛn wiadze dze.

MHB 536
4 . Then is my strength by Thee renewed;
Then are my sins by Thee forgiven;
Then dost Thou cheer my solitude
	With hopes of Heaven.
	 ~ 	4 
. Inu m'ahoɔdzen mu fofor;
Na edze mo bɔn nyina kyɛ m';
Na edze sor enyidar kyekye
Ankonam werɛ.

MHB 536
5 . No words can tell what blest relief, 
There for my every want I find; 
wnat strength for warfare, balm for grief; 
	What peace of mind.
	 ~ 	5 
. Kasa bi nntum nnkyerɛ siar ahomka n',
Hɔ minya m'ebisadze nyina;
Ɔko mu ahoɔdzen, yaw mu edur;
Asomdwee bɛn a!

MHB 536
6 . Hushed is each doubt, gone every  fear;
My spirit seems in heaven to  stay;
And e’en the penitential tear
	Is wiped away.
	 ~ 	6 
. Ekyingye bɔm, suro nyina tu;
Mo sunsum pɛ akɔtsena sor;
Na m'awerɛhow mu nyinsuwakyi
So mpo pepa.

MHB 536
7 . Lord, till I reach yon blissful shore,
No privilege so dear shall be,
As thus my inmost soul to pour
	In prayer to Thee.	 ~ 	7 
. Kɛpem dɛ m'bodu enyigye n' mu n',
Eyiedzi bi nnyi hɔ a ɔkyɛn
Dɛ muhue me kra ntunadze nyina

MHB 537
1 . ’Tis not to ask for gifts alone,
I kneel in prayer before His throne ; 
 But, seeking fellowship divine,
I feel His love, and know it mine.
 When I can pray.
	 ~ 	1 . ME Nyame , ber bi wɔ anapa
Kodu ewimbir a ɔyɛ dɛw sen
Ber a efrɛ m' ba W'ananadze,
M-paabɔ ber n'.
Mpaabɔ m' ma Wo.

MHB 537
2 . ‘Tis prayer that makes my spirit strong 
To do the right and fear the wrong, 
To know the peace of sins forgiven, 
To breathe the atmosphere of heaven;
	To live, I pray.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nhyira aka anapa asomdwee ber,
Na ewimbir nhyira ber krɔnn no,
Ber a mudua mpaabɔ ntsaban do 
Gya wiadze hɔ.

MHB 537
3 . I ought to pray, because my voice
Can make the Father’s heart
rejoice;
He loves His child, and He will meet
And hold communication sweet
      With one who prays.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ber 'i na anapawi tow nserɛmɛn a
Ɔsen anapa ewia hyerɛn gu m' do,
Na ahomka bɔsu a ofi Wo hɔ
Kyɛn wiadze dze.

MHB 537
4 . Therefore I seek my God and raise
My grateful thanks, my fervent praise;
While evil pasion and deceit
Will vanish when before His feet
        I kneel to pray.
	 ~ 	4 
. Inu m'ahoɔdzen mu fofor;
Na edze mo bɔn nyina kyɛ m';
Na edze sor enyidar kyekye
Ankonam werɛ.

MHB 537
5 . And if, great Father, when I pray,
Thy answer can be only Nay,
Still Thou wilt comfort me and
bless With vision of Thy righteousness:
        Help me to pray.	 ~ 	5 
. Kasa bi nntum nnkyerɛ siar ahomka n',
Hɔ minya m'ebisadze nyina;
Ɔko mu ahoɔdzen, yaw mu edur;
Asomdwee bɛn a!

MHB 538
1 . WHAT a friend we have in Jesus,
All our sins and griefs to bear!
What a privilege to carry
Everything to God in prayer!
O what peace we often forfeit,
O what needless pain we bear,
All because we do not carry
Everything to God in prayer!
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS yɛ hɛn nyɛnko pa bi a
Hɛn yaw na bɔn da no do!
Yɛwɔ yiedzi bi dɛ yɛdze
Nsɛm nyina ma Ewuradze mpaabɔ m',
Mber pii yɛyew hɛn asomdwee,
Mber pii yehu amandze gyan,
Siantsire nyina nye dɛ yɛmmfa
Nsɛm nyina mma Ewuradze mpaabɔ m'!
Ibenya akomatɔm'.

MHB 538
2 . Have we trials and temptations?
Is there trouble anywhere?
We should never be discouraged:
Take it to the Lord in prayer.
Can we find a friend so faithful,
Who will all our sorrows share?
Jesus knows our every weakness:
Take it to the Lord in prayer!
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛwɔ ahohiahia nye nsɔhwɛ?
Ana ɔhaw bi wɔ hɔ?
Mma yinom nnhyɛ hɛn abagura,
Yɛmfa mma Ewuradze mpaabɔ m',
Yebenya nyɛnko nokwafo a
Ɔnye hɛn dzi yaw dɛ Oyi?
Jesus nyim hɛn mberɛwyɛ biara;
Ka kyerɛ No wɔ mpaabɔ m'.

MHB 538
3 . Are we weak and heavy-laden,
cumbered with a load of care?
Precious Saviour still our refuge,
take it to the Lord in prayer;
Do thy friends despise, forsake thee?
Take it to the Lord in prayer;
In His arms He’ll take and shield thee.
Thou wilt find a solace there.	 ~ 	3 
. Ana yɛahaw, hɛn kɔn ebu?
Yɛso dadwen durdur bi a?
Gyefo mapa n' yɛ guandɔbea;
Fa kɛma No wɔ mpaabɔ m',
Wo mfɛfo pow w', wommbu wo bi a?
Fa ma Ewuradze mpaabɔ m';
N'abasa bɔbɔ wo ho ban,

MHB 539
1 . LORD, teach us how to pray  aright,
With reverence and with fear;
Though dust and ashes in Thy sight,
We may, we must draw near.
	 ~ 	1 . Hɛn Wura, kyerɛ hɛn ma yɛnsɔr yie, 
Yɛmfia enyindzi na suro:
Kaansa yɛyɛ dɛtse na nso a,
Otwar dɛ yɛbɛn Wo.
Yɛasɔr dɛ mbrɛ ɔsɛ.

MHB 539
2 . We perish if we cease from prayer;
O grant us power to pray!
And when to meet Thee we prepare,
Lord, meet us by the way.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yegyaa sɔr a na yeedzi emia: 
Dom hɛn tua ma yɛnsɔr!
Na yɛroboa hɛnho nye W' ehyia a,
Ewuradze, hyia hɛn kwan.

MHB 539
3 . Give deep humanity; the sense
Of godly sorrow give;
A strong desiring confidence
To hear Thy voice and live;
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma hɛn ahobrɛadze ɔnye 
Bɔn ho nnuho krɔnkrɔn,
Awerɛhyɛmu dzendzen a ɔma
Yɛtse Wo ndze nya nkwa.

MHB 539
4 . Faith in the only sacrifice
That can for sin atone;
To build our hopes, to fix our eyes,
On Christ, on Christ alone;
	 ~ 	4 
. Dom hɛn gyedzi wɔ Afɔr a 
No nko tum pata bɔn n';
Ma yɛmfa enyidar enyi
Ntsim Christ n-ko ara do.

MHB 539
5 . Patience to watch, and wait, and  weep,
Though mercy long delay;
Courage our fainting souls to keep
And trust Thee, though Thou slay.
	 ~ 	5 
. Abotar a 'kyɛr dɛn ara a 
Ɔweɔn, ɔtweɔn na osu;
Mbanyinndam a osie hɛn kra
Na 'ruku n' mpo a ɔtwer Wo.

MHB 539
6 . Give these, and then Thy will be  done:
Thus strengthened with all might,
We, through Thy Spirit and Thy Son
Shall pray, and pray aright.	 ~ 	6 
. Ma hɛn yi, na Wo pɛ nyɛ hɔ, 
Ma, yɛahyɛ dzen dɛm no,
Yeedua Wo Sunsum nye W' Ba do

MHB 54
1 . MY soul, repeat His praise 
 Whose mercies are so great, 
 Whose anger is so slow to rise, 
  So ready to abate.
	 ~ 	1 . ME kra, tsi N'ayɛyi m'
N'ehumbɔbɔr dɔ sō,
Na ɔfa ebufuw nyaa na
No bo dwe ntsɛmara.

MHB 54
2 . God will not always chide; 
 And when His strokes are felt, 
  His strokes are fewer than our crimes, 
 And lighter than our guilt.
	 ~ 	2 . Nyame nnka enyim daa;
Na sɛ ɔtwe aso mpo a,
Asotwe no suar sen hɛn bɔn,
Onndu hɛn afɔdzi.

MHB 54
3 . High as the heavens are raised 
 Above the ground we tread, 
 So far the riches of His grace 
 Our highest thoughts exceed.
	 ~ 	3 . Dɛ mbrɛ ɔsor krɔn koraa
Sen wiadze a yɛnam do n',
Dɛmara na N'adom so tse;
Ɔbor hɛn adwen do.

MHB 54
4 . The pity of the Lord 
 To those that fear His Name 
 Is such as tender parents feel; 
 He knows our feeble frame.
	 ~ 	4 . Ewuradze ayamuhyehye
Wɔ hɔ ma hɔn a wosuro N', 
Ɔtse dɛ awofo baatanyɛ,
Onyim hɛn adwen do.

MHB 54
5 . Our days as are the grass,  
 Or like the morning flower; 
 If one sharp blast sweep o’er the field, 
 It withers in an hour.
	 ~ 	5 . Hɛn nda tse dɛ nkyɛkyɛr
Anaa anapa nhyiren;
Sɛ ehum kɛse tu fa efuw do a,
Ɔnnkyɛr na akyenkyen.

MHB 54
6 . But Thy compassions, Lord, 
 To endless years endure; 
 And children’s children ever find 
 Thy words of promise sure.    Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Naaso Wo mbɔbɔrhu
Tsim hɔ mfe a ɔmmbɔ adze;
Na mbasantsen nyina bohu dɛ
W'anohoba n' si pi.   Amen.

MHB 540
1 . COME, my soul, thy suit prepare,
Jesus loves to answer prayer;
He Himself has bid thee pray,
Therefore will not say thee nay.
	 ~ 	1 . ME kra, fa wo nsɛm nyina bra,
Jesus dɔ dɛ ɔma mbuae;
Ɔnoara na ɔse bɔ mpaa,
Dɛm ntsi ɔnnkɛse W' oho.
Gya m' kɔ m'akwantu ewiei.  Amen.

MHB 540
2 . Thou art coming to a King:
Large petitions with thee bring;
For his grace and power are such,
None can ever ask too much.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ereba Ɔhen enyim;
Fa w'ebisadze nyina bra;
N'adom nye No tum dɔɔ so,
Ebisadze biara nnso.

MHB 540
3 . With my burden I begin:
Lord, remove this load of sin;
Let Thy blood, for sinners spilt,
Set my conscience free from guilt.
	 ~ 	3 
. Medze m'adzesoa hyɛ ase;
Ewuradze, yi mo bɔn yi;
Ma Wo bɔgyaa a 'huee maa abɔn n'
Mpon me tsibowa mfi bɔn mu.

MHB 540
4 . Lord, I come to thee for rest;
Take possession of my breast;
There Thy blood-bought right  maintain,
And without a rival reign.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ewuradze, mepɛ ahomgye;
Fa m'akoma ndɔmmum nwionn;
Ma ɔnye Wo bɔgyaa atɔdze,
Wo nkotoo na dzi mu hen.

MHB 540
5 . While I am a pilgrim here,
Let Thy love my spirit cheer;
As my Guide, my Guard, my friend,
Lead me to my journey’s end.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Meyɛ kwantunyi wɔ ha 'i,
Wo dɔ n' nhyɛ mo sunsum dzen;
Mo Kwankyerɛfo na Nyɛnko,

MHB 541
1 . PRAY, without ceasing pray,
Your Captain gives the word;
His summons cheerfully obey,
And call upon the Lord:
To God your every want
In instant prayer display;
Pray always; pray, and never faint;
Pray, without ceasing pray !
	 ~ 	1 . BƆ mpaa, kɔ do ara,
Wo Sahen na ɔka yi;
Fa enyigye yɛ setsie ma No,
Na su frɛ W'Ewuradze;
Fa w'ehiadze brɛ No,
Bɔ mpaa ka kyerɛ Nyame;
Bɔ mpaa daa;mma mmpa abaw da;
Bɔ mpaa, kɔ do ara!
Abɛfa 'nyimdzifo n'.

MHB 541
2 . In fellowship, alone,
To God with faith draw near,
Approach His courts, besiege His throne
With all the powers of prayer:
Go to His temple, go,
Nor from His altar move;
Let every house His worship know,
And every heart His love.
	 ~ 	2 
. Dua fɛkuwbɔ mu nko,
Twe bɛn Nyame gyedzi m',
Fa tum a ɔwɔ mpaabɔ mu
Kɔ N'abangua enyim,
Kɔ N'asɔrdan no mu,
Mmfi N'afɔrmbukyia enyim;
Ma efiefi nyina nhu No som,
Na akoma nyina nhu No dɔ.

MHB 541
3 . Pour out your souls to God,
And bow them with your  knees,
And spread your hearts and hands abroad,
And pray for Zion’s peace;
Your guides and brethren bear
For ever on your mind;
Extend the arms of mighty prayer,
In grasping all mankind.
	 ~ 	3 
. Fa wo kra ma Nyame,
Fa w' kra kotow N'enyim,
Tserɛw w'akoma nye wo nsamu
Serɛ asomdwee ma Zion;
Kaa w'akwankyerɛfo
Nye wo nuanom nyina;
Tserɛw wo mpaabɔ abasa mu,
Ka adasamba nyina fua.

MHB 541
4 . From strength to strength go on,
Wrestle, and fight, and pray,
Tread all the powers of darkness down,
And win the well-fought day;
Still let the Spirit cry
In all His soldiers: Come!
Till Christ the Lord descend from  high,
And take the conquerors home.	 ~ 	4 
. Kɔ kan ahoɔdzen mu,
Aperper mu bɔ mpaa,
Tsia sum mu etumfo hɔn do,
Na dzi konyim wɔ ko m';
Ma Sunsum n' nkeka mu
Mfrɛ nsordaafo no mbra, 
Kodu dɛ Christ fi sor besian

MHB 542
1 . JESUS, my strength, my  hope,
On Thee I cast my care,
With humble confidence look up,
And know Thou hear’st my  prayer.
Give me on Thee to wait,
Till I can all things do,
On Thee, almighty to create,
Almighty  to renew.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, m'enyidado,
Me dadwen da Wo do,
Mbrɛhoadze mu na mohwɛ Wo,
Minyim dɛ etsie m' mpaabɔ,
Ma montweɔn Wo nkotoo,
Na meetum adze nyina yɛ
Wɔ Wo mu, Ɔwo ebɔɔ adze nyina,
Eyɛɛ adze nyina fofor.
Bɛba Wo dɔ pa n' mu.

MHB 542
2 . I want a godly fear,
A quick-discerning eye
That looks to Thee when sin is  near,
And sees the tempter fly:
A spirit still prepared,
And armed with jealous care,
For ever standing on its guard
And watching unto prayer.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mepɛ nyamesuro,
Enyiwa a ohu adze,
Ɔhwɛ Wo ber a bɔn abɛn,
Ɔma gyigyefo n' guan;
Sunsum ayɛ krado,
Ɔdze nhwɛyie bɔ ban,
Ogyina n'aweɔmber mu pi,
Mpaabɔ mu daa nyina.

MHB 542
3 . I want a true regard,
A single, steady aim,
Unmoved by threatening or reward,
To Thee and Thy great name;
A jealous, just concern
For Thine immortal praise;
A pure desire that all may learn
And glorify Thy grace.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mepɛ adwen pa bi a
Ogyina hɔ pintsinn,
Onnsuro hwee, ɔmmpɛ akatua,
Gyina ma Wo dzin kɛse n';
Ɔtwe W'ayɛyi a
Onnyi ewiei ho nyinkun,
Dze pɛ pa ahwehwɛ, esua dɛ
Wɔnkamfo W'adom no.

MHB 542
4 . I rest upon Thy word;
The promise is for me;
My succour and salvation, Lord,
Shall surely come from Thee:
But let me still abide,
Nor from my hope remove,
Till Thou my patient spirit guide
Into Thy perfect love.	 ~ 	4 
. Medan W'asɛm pa no,
Anohoba n' yɛ m' dze;
M'ekyigyina nkwagye, Ewuradze,
Fi Wo nkotoo hɔ ba;
Na mingyina dzen yie,
M'enyidar dɛmara,
Kodu dɛ edze mo sunsum

MHB 543
1 . HEAR Thou my prayer, O Lord,
And listen to my cry:
Remember now Thy faithful word,
And graciously reply.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, tsie m' mpaabɔ 
Na tsie mo sufrɛ so,
Kaa W'asɛm a ɔyɛ nokwar no,
Minya mbuae adom mu ara.
Me tsir do fi ngyigye m'.  Amen.

MHB 543
2 . Do not in judgment rise
Thy servant’s life to scan;
For righteous in Thy spotless eyes
Is found no living man. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Mma mmfa atsɛmbu mmba koraa,
Mma nnhwɛ W'akowaa abrabɔ m';
Wɔ W'enyiwa mu, tsenenee
Nnyi adasamba mu.

MHB 543
3 . I stretch my longing hands
Towards Thy holy place,
With soul athirst, like weary lands,
For Thy refreshing grace.
	 ~ 	3 
. Metsen me nsa kyerɛ
Wo krɔnkrɔn-bea hɔ no,
Nsukɔm dze me kra dɛ asaase a
Etwee hwehwɛ W'adom.

MHB 543
4 . Haste Thee, O Lord, I pray,
My failing heart to save.
Hide not Thy face: I droop as they
That sink into the grave.
	 ~ 	4 
. O Ewuradze, bra ntsɛm
Bɛgye m'akoma fa,
Mma nnhunta na morohwe ase
Dɛ ɔkra a ɔahwe owumaa m'.

MHB 543
5 . Thy mercy’s early light
My faith desires to see;
O let me walk before Thy sight!
I lift my soul to Thee.
 	 ~ 	5 
. Me gyedzi per ahwɛ
W'ehumbɔbɔr kan no;
Ma mennantsew W'enyim kan mu!
Medze me kra ma Wo.

MHB 543
6 . Let Thy good Spirit lead
My feet in righteous ways;
And for Thy name’s sake, Lord, my 
head
Above my troubles raise. Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Ma Wo Sunsum nkyerɛ
M'anamɔn tsenenee akwan;
Na Ewuradze, Wo dzin ntsi ma

MHB 544
1 . ETERNAL Light! Eternal Light!
How pure the soul must be,
When, placed within Thy searching sight,
It shrinks not, but with calm delight,
Can live, and look on Thee!
	 ~ 	1 . Bɛkyebo Kan! Bɛkyebo Kan! 
Mbrɛ kra ho wɔ dɛ ɔtsew
Wɔ W'enyim a, Ehuntahunii;
Ɔmmpem adze, mbom ɔdze dɛw
Tum gyina na ɔhwɛ Wo.
Bɛtsena bɛkyebo Kanm'.

MHB 544
2 . The spirits that surround Thy throne
May bear the burning bliss;
But that is surely theirs alone,
Since they have never, never known
A fallen world like this.
	 ~ 	2 
. W'ahengua ho esunsum dze 
Tum sɔw siar hyɛnn no;
Na hɔn nko na hɔn su tse dɛm,
Osiandɛ wonnhum bɔn wiadze a
Ɔtse dɛ iyi pɛn.

MHB 544
3 . O how shall I, whose native sphere
Is dark, whose mind is dim,
Before the Ineffable appear,
And on my naked spirit bear
The uncreated beam?
	 ~ 	3  
. Ao, m'bɛyɛ dɛn na 'mi a wɔawo m' 
Sum mu, m'adwen kusuww,
Metum mepue, Nyame, Wenyim,
Na mo sunsum kwatserkwaa yi
Asɔw nserɛmɛn hyɛnn no?

MHB 544
4 . There is a way for man to rise
To that sublime abode:
An offering and a sacrifice,
A Holy Spirit’s energies,
An Advocate with God-
	 ~ 	4 
. Kwan bi wɔ hɔ ma nyimpa dɛ 
Ɔdze fow kɔ sor fie;
Afɔr bi a wɔabɔ ama hɛn,
Nyame enyim Twitwagyefo,
Sunsum krɔnkrɔn No tum.

MHB 544
5 . These, these prepare us for the sight
Of holiness above:
The sons of ignorance and night
May dwell in the eternal light
Through the eternal Love!	 ~ 	5 
. Yinom na wɔyɛ hɛn krado 
Ma sor krɔnkrɔnyɛ no;
Sum mu mba a yɛyɛ atɔbɔ
Nam domankoma Dɔ no do,

MHB 545
1 . O DISCLOSE Thy lovely face!
Quicken all my drooping powers;
Gasps my fainting soul for grace,
As a thirsty land for showers;
Haste, my Lord, no more delay,
Come, my Saviour, come away!
	 ~ 	1 . YI W'enyim fɛɛfɛw n' kyerɛ m'!
Kenyan m'ahoɔdzen a agow;
Dom me kra a ɔatɔ bitsi
Dɛ asaase wesee hia nsu n',
Sian bra, m'Ewuradze, mma nnkyɛr,
Bra, m'Agyenkwa, bra ntsɛntsɛm!
Yɛ m' nokwafo kodu ewiei.  Amen.

MHB 545
2 . Well Thou know’st I cannot rest
Till I fully rest in Thee,
Till I am of Thee possessed,
Till from every sin set free,
All the life of faith I prove,
All the joy and heaven of love.
	 ~ 	2 
. Woara nyim dɛ munntum nnhom,
Gyedɛ mohom wɔ Wo mu,
Gyedɛ wosow wɔ mo mu,
Gyedɛ migyaa bɔn yɛ koraa,
Gyedɛ 'hyɛ m'abrabɔ ma,
Minya sor dɔ dzi dɛw.

MHB 545
3 . With me O continue, Lord !
Keep me, or from Thee I fly;
Strength and comfort from Thy word
Imperceptibly supply,
Hold me till I apprehend,
Make me faithful to the end.  Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. O Ewuradze, nye me nkɔ!
'Nye me ntsena amma meennguan;
W'asɛm nhyɛ m' dzen wɔ mo mu;
Minya awerɛkyekyer mo mu;
Suo me nsamu ma munhu Wo,

MHB 546
1 . COME, Saviour, Jesus, from above!
Assist me with Thy heavenly grace;
Empty my heart of earthly love,
And for Thyself prepare the place.
	 ~ 	1 . Agyenkwa Jesus, fi sor bra! 
Fa W'adom krɔnkrɔn n' bɔboa me:
Pra wiadze dɔ fi m'akomam'
Na siesie mu fa ma Woho.
Na megyaa ndzɛmba nkaa nyinam'.

MHB 546
2 . O let Thy sacred presence fill,
And set my longing spirit free!
Which pants to have no other will,
But day and night to feast on Thee.
	 ~ 	2 
. O, ma Wo krɔnkrɔnyɛ nhyɛ n' ma  
Na mo sunsum no kɔn ndɔ Wo!
Ewia o, anago, o, me pɛ kor
Nye dɛ minya Wo midzi mee.

MHB 546
3 . That path with humble speed I’ll seek,
Where my Saviour’s footsteps shine;
Nor will I hear, nor will I speak,
Of any other love but Thine.
	 ~ 	3 
. Kwan a m'Agyenkwa, W'anamɔn 
Hyerɛn mu n', nna m'boduam' mbrɛhoadzem';
Minnketsie na mennkɛka dɔ
Fofor bi ho asɛm dɛ Wodze n'.

MHB 546
4 . Henceforth may no profane delight
Divide this consecrated soul;
Possess it Thou, who hast the  right,
As Lord and Master of the whole.
	 ~ 	4  
.	Me kra a metu mahyɛ Wo nsa 'i,
