Mma enyigye huhuw nnyam' kyɛpɛn:
Woara fa, na Ewɔ ho kwan
Dɛ akoma n' nyina No Wura.

MHB 546
5 . Thee I can love, and Thee alone,
With pure delight and inward bliss:
To know Thou tak’st me for Thine  own,
O what a happiness is this!
	 ~ 	5 
. Ɔwo nko ara na mutum, 
Medze enyigye krɔnn dɔ Wo;
Egyigye kɛse bɛn nye yi
Dɛ muhu dɛ edze m' yɛ Wodze!

MHB 546
6 . Nothing on earth do I desire,
But Thy pure love within my breast;
This, only this, will I require,
And freely give up all the rest. 	 ~ 	6 
. Moronnhwehwɛ wiadze 'i mu hwee 
Dɛ Wo dɔ krɔnn n' wɔ m'akomam':
Iyiara nko na m'bɔhwehwɛ

MHB 547
1 . THE thing my God doth hate
That I no more may do,
Thy creature, Lord, again create,
And all my soul renew.
	 ~ 	1 . ADZE a me Nyame kyir
Biara mennkɛyɛ bio,
Ewuradze, bɔ W'abɔdze bio
Yɛ me kra yi fofor.
Nyina ma wɔ mo mu bio.  Amen.

MHB 547
2 . My soul shall then, like Thine,
Abhor the thing unclean,
And, sanctified by love divine,
For ever cease from sin. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Me kra tse dɛ Wodze n',
Okyir adze a ho nntsew,
Na ɔsor dɔ n' atsew no ho
Ma oegyaa bɔn yɛ koraa.

MHB 547
3 . That blessed law of Thine,
Jesus, to me impart;
The Spirit’s law of life divine,
O write it in my heart!
	 ~ 	3 
. Wo nhyira mbrasɛm no,
Jesus, ma me nsa nka,
Sunsum no sor nkwa mbrasɛm no,
Kyerɛw wɔ m'akoma m'.

MHB 547
4 . Implant it deep within,
Whence it may ne’er remove,
The law of liberty from sin,
The perfect law of love. 
	 ~ 	4 
. Dua no mo mu ma ɔndɔ,
Mma onntutu nngu da,
Na bɔn nkoasom ndan fahodzi,
Ɔdɔ mapa mbrasɛm n'.

MHB 547
5 . Thy nature be my law,
Thy spotless sanctity,
And sweetly every moment draw
My happy soul to Thee.
	 ~ 	5 
. Wo su nyɛ me mbrasɛm,
W'ahotsew krɔnkrɔn no;
Fa dɛw twe me kra enyigye m'
Mber nyina bɛn Woho.

MHB 547
6 . Soul of my soul remain !
Who didst for all fulfil,
In me, O Lord, fulfil again
Thy heavenly Father’s will !   Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Me kra ne kra tsim
Ɔwo a ehyɛ ne nyina ma,
Ewuradze, hyɛ Egya Ne pɛ

MHB 548
1 . ALL things are possible to him
That can in Jesu’s name believe:
Lord, I no more Thy truth blaspheme,
Thy truth I lovingly receive;
I can, I do believe in Thee,
All things are possible to me. 
	 ~ 	1 . Adze nyinaa ne yɛ nnyɛ dzen mma  
Nyia otum gye Jesu dzin dzi;
Munngu Wo nokwar n' ho fi bio,
Mo Wura, megye n' dɔ mu ara;
Mutum, megye Wo dzi ampa,
Adze nyinaa ne yɛ nnyɛ dzen mma m'.
Adze nyina ne yɛ nnyɛ dzen mma m'.

MHB 548
2 . The most impossible of all
Is, that I e’er from sin should cease;
Yet shall it be, I know it shall:
Jesus, look to Thy faithfulness!
If nothing is too hard for Thee,
All things are possible to me.
	 ~ 	2 
. Dza ɔyɛ dzen sen adze nyina 
Nye dɛ m'begyaa bɔn yɛ koraa;
Naaso ne yɛ nnyɛ dzen, minyim:
Jesus, hwɛ Wo nokwaredzi no!
Sɛ biribiara nnyɛ dzen mma Wo a,
Adze nyina ne yɛ nnyɛ dzen mma m'

MHB 548
3 . Though earth and hell the word  gainsay,
The word of God can never fail;
The Lamb shall take my sins away,
’Tis certain, though impossible;
The thing impossible shall be,
All things are possible to me. 
	 ~ 	3  
. Asaase nye hɛll gye kyim mpo a, 
Nyame N'asɛm nnkotwa apaw da;
Eguambaa n' beyi mo bɔn koraa,
Ampa, sɛ ɔyɛ dzen mpo a;
Dza ɔyɛ dzen mpo ɔbɛyɛ;
Adze nyina ne yɛ nnyɛ dzen mma m'.

MHB 548
4 . All things are possible to God,
To Christ, the power of God in  man,
To me, when I am all renewed,
When I in Christ am formed  again,
And witness, from all sin set free,
All things are possible to me. 	 ~ 	4 
. Adze nyina Nyame yɛ ma ɔyɛ, 
Christ so, nyimpam' Nyame tum no,
Mo so, wɔayɛ m'fofor koraa n',
Wɔayɛ m' fofor wɔ Christ mu no,
Midzi dase n', mefi bɔn nsa n',

MHB 549
1 . LORD, that I may learn of Thee,
Give me true simplicity;
Wean my soul, and keep it low.
Willing Thee alone to know.
 	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, ma musua Wo,
Ma menyɛ ahobrɛadze koraa,
Ma me kra mbrɛ noho adze,
Ma m'enyi ntsim Wo nko do.
Nye onnyiewiei nkwa m'akoma m'.   Amen.

MHB 549
2 . Let me cast my reeds aside,
All that feeds my knowing pride,
Not to man, but God submit,
Lay my reasonings at Thy feet;
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma mingyaa me pɛ nsi nkyɛn, 
Mingyaa m'ahantan nyina,
Mingyaa moho mma Nyame,
Mfa m'adwen nto W'ananadze.

MHB 549
3 . Of my boasted wisdom spoiled,
Docile, helpless, as a child,
Only seeing in Thy light,
Only walking in Thy might. 
	 ~ 	3 
. M'ahantan nyansa nyɛ kwa,
Menyɛ botoo dɛ abofra,
Munhu adze wɔ Wo kan mu,
Mennantsew W'ahoɔdzen mu.

MHB 549
4 . Then infuse the teaching grace,
Spirit of truth and righteousness;
Knowledge, love divine, impart,
Life eternal, to my heart.   Amen. 	 ~ 	4 
. Ma minnya W'adom nkyerɛkyerɛ,
Nokwar na tsenenee sunsum;
Minnya nyimdze nye sor dɔ,

MHB 55
1 . LORD God, by whom all change is wrought, 
 By whom new things to birth are brought, 
 In whom no change is known; 
 Whatever Thou dost, whate er Thou art, 
 Thy people still in Thee have part; 
 Still, still Thou art our own.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE nsakyer nyina wura
Adze nyina eyɛ no fofor,
Ͻwo ennsakyer       da;
Mbrɛ eyɛ biara, mbrɛ etse biara,
Wo nkorͻfo wɔ Wo mu kyɛfa,
Eda ho yɛ hɛndze.

MHB 55
2 . Ancient of Days, we dwell in Thee; 
 Out of Thine own eternity 
 Our peace and joy are wrought; 
 We rest in our eternal God, 
 And make secure and sweet abode 
 With Thee, who changest not.
	 ~ 	2 . Mbersantsen Panyin, yɛtse W’ mu;
Wo mfesantsen mu na yenya
Hɛn asomdwee na dɛw;
Yɛhom wͻ hɛn daa Nyame mu,
Yɛtsena dwudwoodwɔ, asomdweem’,
Wͻ Ͻwo a ennsakyer da m’.

MHB 55
3 . Spirit, who makest all things new, 
 Thou leadest onward; we pursue 
 The heavenly march sublime. 
 Neath Thy renewing fire we glow, 
 And still from strength to strength we go, 
 From height to height we climb.
	 ~ 	3 . Sunsum a ‘yɛ adze nyina fofor,
Ͻwo dzi kan, yedzi ekyir,
Hɛn sor akwantu mu.
Wo nkenyan gya hɛn ma yɛhyerɛn,
Na yɛdze ahoͻdzen kͻ enyim,
Yɛkͻ do dzi konyim.

MHB 55
4 . Darkness and dread we leave behind; 
 New light, new glory still we find, 
 New realms divine possess; 
 New births of grace new raptures bring; 
 Triumphant, the new song we sing, 
 The great Renewer bless.
	 ~ 	4 . Yɛgya sum na suro wͻ ekyir,
Yenya kan fofor na enyimnyam,
Yenya ahenman fofor;
‘Dze adom awoo na mpuei fofor ba;
Yɛtow konyimdzi ndwom fofor
Hyira Foforyɛnyi n’.

MHB 55
5 . To Thee we rise, in thee we rest; 
 We stay at home, we go in quest, 
 Still Thou art our abode. 
 The rapture swells, the wonder grows, 
 As full on us new life still flows 
 From our unchanging God.	 ~ 	5 . Yɛsoɛr na yɛhom wͻ Wo mu,
Yɛtsena fie, yepue  kͻhwehwɛ;
Yɛda ho tse Wo mu.
Dɛw na ahodwuruw yɛ kɛse;
Ͻma yenya nkwa fofor fi
Nyame a ennsakyer da hͻ.

MHB 550
1 . O FOR a heart to praise my God,
A heart from sin set free,
A heart that always feels Thy blood
So freely shed for me.
	 ~ 	1 . Ao, nkyɛ meenya 'koma a bɔn nnyim  
Dze eyi Nyame ayɛw!
Dza ɔtse Wo bɔgyaa no tum,
Bɔgya a wɔkae gui maa m'.
Wo dzin a ɔyɛ Dɔ n'.   Amen.

MHB 550
2 . A heart resigned, submissive, meek, 
My great Redeemer’s throne,
Where only Christ is heard to speak,
Where Jesus reigns alone:
	 ~ 	2 
. Akoma a ɔdwe, bɔbɔfo, 
Mo Pomfo N'ahengua,
Mbrɛ Christ n-ko na ɔkasa,
Mbrɛ Jesus nko dzi hen.

MHB 550
3 . A humble, lowly, contrite heart,
Believing, true, and clean;
Which neither life nor death can part
From  Him that dwells within:
	 ~ 	3  
. Akoma brɛfo a ɔtwer Wo, 
Nokwafo a no mu tsew;
'Koma a nkwa anaa wu nntum mmpaa
Mmfi nyia ɔtsem' no ho.

MHB 550
4 . A heart in every thought renewed,
And full of love divine;
Perfect and right and pure and  good,
A copy, Lord, of Thine.
	 ~ 	4 
. Akoma a ɔasakyer koraa, 
Na Nyame dɔ ahyɛm' ma;
Odzi mu, na no mu tsew koraa,
Nyame, ɔnye Wo sɛ!

MHB 550
5 . Thy nature, gracious Lord, impart;
Come quickly from above;
Write Thy new name upon my  heart,
Thy new, best name of Love.  Amen.	 ~ 	5  
. Ewuradze, fa Wo suban ma m'! 
Ma me nsa nka sesei!
Kyerɛw dzin fofor n' m'akoma do,

MHB 551
1 . O LORD, how happy should we be
If we could leave our cares to Thee,
If we from self could rest,
And feel at heart that One above,
In perfect wisdom, perfect love,
Is working for the best.
	 ~ 	1 . SƐ yɛdze hɛn dadwen to W' do a;
Ewuradze, nkyɛ yebedzi dɛw;
Sɛ yɛsakyer hɛn su a,
Yɛtse hɛn akoma m' dɛ Obi wɔ sor,
Ɔyɛ nyansabuakwa nye ɔdɔ,
Ɔreyɛ edwuma pa.
Wɔnsɔ asomdwee nhwɛ.

MHB 551
2 . How far from this our daily life,
Ever disturbed by anxious strife,
By sudden wild alarms.
O could we but relinquish all
Our earthly props, and simply fall
On Thine Almighty arms
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔbra a yɛbɔ daa yi ntamu twe,
Ɔsɛɛ asomdwee awerɛfir m' daa,
Nkekam' a ɔma abagura,
O nkyɛ yeetum apow ne nyina!
Dza yɛtwer no wiadze nyina,
Dze aahyɛ Wo tum nsamu.

MHB 551
3 . Could we but kneel and cast our load,
E’en while we prayer,upon our God,
Then rise with lightened cheer,
Sure that the Father, Who is nigh
To still the famished raven’s when cry,
Will hear, in that we fear.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ yɛkotow dze hɛn adzesoa
Gu Nyame enyim mpaabɔ mu,
Na yɛdze enyigye soɛr.
Yenyim dɛ Egya no ɔbɛn,
Ɔma akonkoran gyaa su a,
Yesuro N' ntsi obetsie hɛn.

MHB 551
4 . Lord, make these faithless hearts of ours
Thy lessons learn from birds and flowers:
Make them from self to cease,
Leave all things to a Father’s will,
And taste, before Him lying still,
E’en in affliction, peace.	 ~ 	4 
. Nyame, ma hɛn akoma kyingyefo 'i
Nsua mfi nnoma nye nhyiren hɔ;
Na wɔmpow hɔnho koraa,
Wongyaa ndzɛmba nyina mma Egya n' pɛ,
Na wɔwɔ N'enyim ɔhaw mu n',

MHB 552
1 . JESUS, all-atoning Lamb,
Thine, and only Thine, I am:
Take my body, spirit, soul;
Only Thou possess the whole.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, bɔn mpata Guambaa,
Wodze a, Wo nko Wodze nye m';
Fa mo honam, sunsum, kra,
Ne nyina yɛ Wo nko dze.
Onnyi ewiei nnyi nhwehwɛmu.

MHB 552
2 . Thou my one thing needful be;
Let me ever cleave to Thee;
Let me choose the better part;
Let me give Thee all my heart. 
	 ~ 	2 
. M'ehiadze kortsee nye Wo,
Ma mentetar Wo afebɔɔ;
Ma memfa no mu dza oye,
Memfa m'akoma mma Wo.

MHB 552
3 . Fairer than the sons of men,
Do not let me turn again,
Leave the fountain-head of bliss,
Stoop to creature-happiness.
	 ~ 	3 
. Adasa mu dansewa,
Mma me nnsan m'ekyir nkɔ bio,
Mimmfi nhyira esutsen ho,
Monnkotow enyigye bɔn mu.

MHB 552
4 . Whom have I on earth below ?
Thee, and only Thee, I know;
Whom have I in heaven but Thee ?
Thou art all in all to me.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mowɔ woana wɔ ase ha?
Wo nkotsee ara na minyim,
Mowɔ woana sor dɛ Wo?
Eyɛ m'adze nyinara.

MHB 552
5 . All my treasure is above,
All my riches is Thy love:
Who the worth of love can tell ?
Infinite, unsearchable! 	 ~ 	5 
. M'akoradze nyina wɔ sor,
M'ahodze nyina nye W' dɔ;
Woana tum twa dɔ no bo?

MHB 553
1 . COME, Holy Ghost, all-quickening  fire!
Come, and my hallowed heart inspire,
Sprinkled with the atoning blood;
Now to my soul Thyself reveal,
Thy mighty working let me feel,
And know that I am born of God. 
	 ~ 	1 . SIAN, Sunsum Krͻnkrͻn gya a ema nkwa!
Sian bͻhom gu m’akoma mu,
Mpata bͻgya apetse do n' mu;
Yi Woho kyerɛ mo sunsum,
Mentse Wo tum adzeyɛ nka,
Munhu dɛ Nyankopͻn awo m’.
Me bra a fi nnyi ho nyɛ ayɛyi.  Amen.

MHB 553
2 . Humble, and teachable, and mild,
O may I, as a little child,
My lowly Master’s steps pursue!
Be anger to my soul unknown,
Hate, envy, jealousy, be gone;
In love create Thou all things new.
	 ~ 	2 
. Membrɛ moho adze ngye nkyérɛkyérɛ;
O ma menyɛ abofra a ͻdwe,
Ntsiatsia mo Wfira n’anamon mu!
Mma me kra nnhu W’ebufuwhyew,
'Nyitan, ’nyiber, nyinkuntwe nkͻ;
Ͻdo m’ na yɛ ndzɛmba fofor.

MHB 553
3 . Let earth no more my heart divide,
With Christ may I be crucified,
To Thee with my whole soul aspire;
Dead to the world and all its toys,
Its idle pomp, and fading joys,
Be Thou alone my one desire!
	 ~ 	3 
. Mma wiadze nye W’ nnkyɛ m’akoma,
Wͻmbͻ emi nye Christ mbeamudua m’.
Me kra nyina per hwehwɛ Wo;
Munwu mma wiadze mu ndzɛmba,
Nkotompn nye enyigye hun,
Wo nkotoo nyɛ m’apɛdze pa.

MHB 553
4 . My will be swallowed up in Thee;
Light in Thy light still may I see,
Beholding Thee with open face;
Called the full power of faith to prove,
Let all my hallowed heart be love,
And all my spotless life be praise.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Na Woara hye m‘apɛdze do;
Munhu kan a ͻwͻ Wo kan mu.
Memfa enyimtsewee nhwɛ Wo;
Wͻafrɛ m' dɛ menkyérɛ W‘ gyedzi tum,
Ma m’akoma a ho tsew nyɛ ͻdͻ,

MHB 554
1 . O COME and dwell in me,
Spirit of power within!
And bring the glorious liberty
From  sorrow, fear, and sin.
	 ~ 	1 . SUNSUM a ema tum,
O bra bɛtsena mo mu!
Fa enyimnyam fahodzi no bra,
Fi yaw, suro nye bɔn mu.
Kɔ me nhyira m' afebɔɔ. Amen.

MHB 554
3 . Hasten the joyful day
Which shall my sins consume,
When old things shall be passed  away,
And all things new become.
	 ~ 	3 
. Bɔn yarba no n'aba n',
Apɔwmudzen Sunsum, yi;
Krɔnkrɔnyɛ a odzi mu Sunsum, 
Ɔdɔ Sunsum mapa.

MHB 554
4 . I want the witness, Lord,
That all I do is right,
According to Thy will and word,
Well-pleasing in Thy sight.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma ehurusi da n' mbra ntsɛm
Mbɛhyew mo bɔn nyina,
Da a ndzɛmba dadaw botwa mu,
Na adze nyina ayɛ fofor.

MHB 554
5 . I ask no higher state;
Indulge me but in this,
And soon or later then translate
To my eternal bliss.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Ewuradze, dzi m' dase
Dɛ dza meyɛ no ye,
Dɛ mbrɛ Wo pɛ nye W'asɛm kyerɛ,
Ɔyɛ W' enyisɔ koraa.

MHB 555
1 . WHEN, my Saviour, shall I be
Perfectly resigned to Thee?
Poor and vile in my own eyes,
Only in Thy wisdom wise:
	 ~ 	1 . AGYENKWA, ber bɛn ara na
M'begyaa moho ama Wo nwionn?
Hianyi a mennsɛ hwee enyi do,
Na ' wo bu me onyansafo.
Ahobrɛadze dɔ n' bun tse.  Amen.

MHB 555
2 . Only Thee content to know,
Ignorant of all below,
Only guided by Thy light,
Only mighty in Thy might! 
	 ~ 	2 
. Wo nko na mepɛ meehu,
Minnyim wiadze yi mu hwee
Wo kan nko na ɔkyerɛ me kwan,
Wo tum nko na ɔhyɛ me dzen.

MHB 555
3 . So I may Thy Spirit know,
Let Him as He listeth blow;
Let the manner be unknown,
So I may with Thee be one.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nkyɛ meehu Wo Sunsum No,
Ɔmfa me nyɛ dza ɔpɛ;
Sɛ minnyim ɔkwan no mpo a,
Dɛm na menye W' bɛyɛ kor.

MHB 555
4 . Fully in my life express
All the heights of holiness,
Sweetly let my spirit prove
All the depths of humble love.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Makyerɛ m'abrabɔ mu yie,
Krɔnkrɔn no krɔn nyinara,
Ma mo sunsum nkyerɛ mbrɛ

MHB 556
1 . DEEPEN the wound Thy hands
 have made
In this weak, helpless soul;
Till mercy, with its balmy aid,
Descends to make me whole. 
	 ~ 	1 . BUR pirakùr a Wo nsa atow no
Wɔ kra bɔbɔfo yi m’;
Kodu dέ ehumbɔbɔr besian,
Bɔboa m’ ma meedzi mu.
Na dɔ mapa no bun.   Amen.

MHB 556
2 . The sharpness of Thy two-edged  sword
Enable me to endure;
Till bold to say: My hallowing  Lord
Hath wrought a perfect cure. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Wo nkrantseѐ anofaenu ne ndam
Ɔma mutum gyina;
Medze ‘kokὸdur bɛkà dɛ
Ewùradzѐ asa me yar.

MHB 556
3 . I see the exceeding broad command,
Which all contains in one:
Enlarge my heart to understand
The mystery unknown. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Muhù ahyɛdzѐ a ɔsὸ mbordὸ a
 Wɔakà ne nyina abɔ m’;
Bue m’akoma mu ma mentse
Esùmaɛm n’ ase yie.

MHB 556
4 . O that with all Thy saints I might
By sweet experience prove
What is the length, and breadth, and height,
And depth, of perfect love !  Amen. 	 ~ 	4 
. Nkyɛ menye W’ahotsewfo no
Aasɔ Wo suahù ahwɛ!
Ne tsentsen, ne trɛ nye no krɔn,

MHB 557
1 . What is our calling’s glorious  hope
But inward holiness?
For this to Jesus I look up,
I calmly wait for this.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN frɛ enyidado no nye bɛn?
Dɛ hɛn mu bɛyɛ krɔnn;
'Yi ntsi mohwɛ Jesus Noara,
Medze abotar tweɔn yi.
Bra mu, Ewuradze, bra!    Amen.

MHB 557
2 . I wait, till He shall touch me clean,
Shall life and power impart,
Give me the faith that casts out sin
And purifies the heart.
	 ~ 	2 
. Motweɔn dɛ ɔbɛtsew mo ho,
Dze nkwa tum bɛma me,
'Bɛma m' gyedzi a ɔbɔ bɔn gu,
Na ɔtsew akoma mu.

MHB 557
3 . This is the dear redeeming grace,
For every sinner free;
Surely it shall on me take place,
The chief of sinners, me.
	 ~ 	3 
. Iyi nye adom a ɔgye hɛn nkwa,
Dze kyɛ abɔnfo kwa;
Ampaara ɔbɛyɛ dɛm ama m',
Ndzebɔnyɛfo hen nye m'.

MHB 557
4 . From all iniquity, from all,
He shall my soul redeem;
In Jesus I believe, and shall
Believe myself to Him.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔbɔpon me efi emumuyɛ
Beberee nyina mu koraa;
Mowɔ gyedzi wɔ Jesus mu,
Medze moho ma No.

MHB 557
5 . When Jesus makes my heart His home,
My sin shall all depart;
And lo, He saith: I quickly come,
To fill and rule thy heart.
	 ~ 	5 
. Jesus yɛ m'akoma ne fie a,
Mo bɔn nyina bɔkɔ;
Na tsie, ɔse; Mereba ntsɛm,
Ebedzi w'akoma m' hen.

MHB 557
6 . Be it according to Thy word!
Redeem me from all sin;
My heart would now receive Thee, Lord,
Come in, my Lord, come in !  Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Yɛ no dɛ mbrɛ W'asɛm no tse!
Pon me fi bɔn nyina m',
Afei m'akoma bɛgye Wo;

MHB 558
1 . SAVIOUR from sin, I wait to prove
That Jesus is Thy healing  name;
To lose, when perfected in love,
Whate’er I have, or can, or am.
I stay me on Thy faithful word:
The servant shall be as his Lord.
	 ~ 	1 . ABϽN Gyefo, morotweͻn akyérɛ
De Jesus dzin nye m’ayarsa;
’Dͻ ewie n‘edwuma yɛ n’, mepɛ ahwer
Dza mowͻ, tum yɛ, na meyɛ.
W’asɛm na ͻma metse nkwa mu,
Akowaa bɛyɛ dɛ no Wura.
Mentsena ase, nwu mma Wo nko.  Amen.

MHB 558
2 . Answer that gracious end in me
For which thy precious life was given;
Redeem from all iniquity,
Restore, and make me meet for heaven:
Unless thou purge my every stain,
Thy suffering and my faith are vain.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wo nkwa a ͻsom bo a dze mae no
Kyérɛ adorn n’ase wͻ mo mu;
Yi me fi emumuyɛ nyina m’;
Ma me dzibew. memfata sor:
Gyedɛ tsew mo ho fi nyina m’,
Wo yaw nye me gyedzi yɛ kwa.

MHB 558
3 . Didst thou not die that I might live
No longer to myself, but thee,
Might body, soul, and spirit give
To him who gave himself for me?
Come then, my Master, and my God,
Take the dear purchase of thy blood.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ana ennwu ma maatséna ase?
Menntse ase mma moho bio,
Nyimpadua, ͻkra, nye sunsum,
Medze ma Wo a ’dze woho maa me n’;
Fa adzeson a edze W’bͻgyaa tͻe n’,
Bra, mo Wura nye me Nyankopͻn.

MHB 558
4 . Thy own devoted servant claim
For thy own truth and mercy’s sake;
Hallow in me thy glorious name;
Me for Thine own this moment take,
And change, and throughly purify;
Thine only may I live and die.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Wo nokwar nye mbͻbͻrhu ntsi
Gye W'akowaa yɛ Woara Wodze;
Tsew W'enyimnyam dzin ho mo mu;
Fa m' yɛ Wo nko Wodze ndɛ ara,
Sesa m' na ma mo ho ntsew koraa;

MHB 559
1 . COME, O my God, the promise  seal,
This mountain, sin, remove;
Now in my gasping soul reveal
The virtue of Thy love. 
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME, bɔsɔw bɔhyɛ n' ano
Dwuruw bɔn kokwaa yi gu;
Ma kra a ɔatɔ bitsi yi
Nkyerɛ Wo dɔ ne ndam.
'Dɔ mapa nye asomdwee.

MHB 559
2 . I want thy life, Thy purity,
Thy righteousness, brought in;
I ask, desire, and trust in Thee,
To be redeemed from sin.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mepɛ Wo bra na W' krɔnkrɔnyɛ,
Wo tsenenee mbra mo mu;
Mibisa, hwehwɛ, atwer Wo,
Ma wɔaapon m' efi bɔn m'.

MHB 559
3 . Anger and sloth, desire and pride,
This moment be subdued;
Be cast into the crimson tide
Of my Redeemer’s blood!
	 ~ 	3 
. Bɔ ebufuw, 'nyihaw na ntsɛn ham,
Womfi hɔ dɛm ber yi m';
Wonkogu mo Pomfo bɔgyaa a
Orubu asorɛkye n' mu!

MHB 559
4 . Saviour, to Thee my soul looks up,
My present Saviour thou!
In all the confidence of hope,
I claim the blessing now.
	 ~ 	4 
. Agyenkwa, me kra tsim Wo do,
Me mprempren Gyefo nye W'!
Awerɛhyɛm' enyidar nyina m',
M'bisa nhyira sesei.

MHB 559
5 . ’Tis  done! Thou dost this moment save,
With full salvation bless;
Redemption through Thy blood I have,
And spotless love and peace. 	 ~ 	5 
. Woewiei yɛ! Ber yi, gye hɛn nkwa,
Fa nkwagye hyira hɛn;
Menya Wo bɔgyaa mu nkwagye,

MHB 56
1 . SWEET is the memory of Thy grace, 
 My God, my heavenly King; 
 Let age to age Thy righteousness 
 In sounds of glory sing.
	 ~ 	1 . W'ADOM ho nkaakaa no yɛ dɛw, 
Me Nyame, mo sor Hen, 
Ma Wo tsenenee fi ber to ber 
Ntow enyimnyam ho ndwom.

MHB 56
2 . God reigns on high, but not confines 
 His bounty to the skies: 
 Through the whole earth His goodness shines, 
 And every want supplies.
	 ~ 	2 . Nyame dzi hen wɔ sor naaso 
N'adɔe no nntsena hɔ nko: 
N'ayamuyie hyerɛn wiadze nyina,
Ɔma ehiadze nyina.

MHB 56
3 . With longing eyes the creatures wait 
 On Thee for daily food; 
 Thy liberal hand provides them meat, 
 And fills their mouths with good.
	 ~ 	3 . Abɔdze nyina hwɛ Wo kwan,
Ma aama hɔn daa edziban; 
W'ayamuyie nsa no ma hɔn nam, 
 Dze ndzepa hyɛ hɔn anomu.

MHB 56
4 . How kind are Thy compassions, Lord, 
 How slow Thine anger moves; 
 But soon He sends His pardoning word, 
 To cheer the souls He loves.
	 ~ 	4 . Ewuradze yɛ ayamuhyehye, 
N'ebufuw so yɛ nyaa;
Ɔnnkyɛr na ɔdze ne fakyɛ asɛm
Ma ɔkra a ɔdɔ n' n'enyi gye.

MHB 56
5 . Creatures, with all their endless race, 
 Thy power and praise proclaim; 
 But we, who taste Thy richer grace, 
 Delight to bless Thy Name.	 ~ 	5 . Abɔdze, mbasantsen nyina, 
Kamfo W', yi Wo tum ayɛw; 
Hɛn a yenya W'adom kɛse no, 
Dze dɛw hyira Wo dzin.

MHB 560
1 . JESUS hath died that I might live,
Might live to God alone,
In Him eternal life receive,
And be in spirit one.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS wui na maatsena ase
Ama Nyame nkotoo,
No mu na minya onnyiewiei nkwa;
Yɛayɛ kor sunsum mu.
Bea a ewɔ n' yɛ heaven.

MHB 560
2 . Saviour, I thank Thee for the grace,
The gift unspeakable!
And wait with arms of faith to embrace,
And all Thy love to feel. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Agyenkwa, meda adom 'i ho ase,
Akyɛdze a onnyi kabea!
Metserɛw gyedzi abaw m' yɛ W' ettu,
Na metse Wo dɔ nka.

MHB 560
3 . My soul breaks out in strong desire
The perfect bliss to prove;
My longing heart is all on fire
To be dissolved in love.
	 ~ 	3 
. Me kra enya pɛ dzendzen a
Ɔtweɔn sɔ nhyira no hwɛ;
M'akoma a ɔhyew ekitsa n'
Hwɛ kwan dɛ ɔbɛnan dɔ m'.

MHB 560
4 . Give me Thyself - from every boast,
From every wish set free;
Let all I am in Thee be lost,
But give Thyself to me.
	 ~ 	4 
. Fa Woho ma m' ma mingyaa ntuw
Nye ɔpɛ huhuw mu;
Mbrɛ metse biara nyew Wo mu,
Na fa Woho ma me.

MHB 560
5 . Thy gifts, alone, cannot suffice
Unless Thyself be given;
Thy presence makes my paradise,
And where Thou art is heaven.	 ~ 	5 
. W'akyɛdze no nko mmee me koraa,
Gyedɛ Woara ka ho;
W'enyim yɛ me paradize sɔnn,

MHB 561
1 . FATHER of Jesus Christ, my Lord,
My Saviour, and my Head,
I trust in Thee, whose powerful word
Hath raised Him from the dead.
	 ~ 	1 . M'EWURADZE Jesus Christ N'Egya,
M'Agyenkwa nye me Tsir,
Motwer Nyia Wo tum asɛm no
Onyaan No fii ewufo m' n'.
Na ɔka dɛ otum yɛ!

MHB 561
2 . Eternal life to all mankind
Thou hast in Jesus given;
And all who seek, in Him shall find
The happiness of heaven.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ama adasamba onnyiewiei nkwa,
Ne nyina wɔ Jesus mu;
Na hɔn a wɔhwehwɛ No nyina
Nya enyigye wɔ sor.

MHB 561
3 . Faith in Thy power Thou seest I have,
For Thou this faith hast wrought;
Dead souls Thou callest from their  grave,
And speakest  worlds from nought.
	 ~ 	3 
. Me gyedzi wohu wɔ W' tum mu,
Na gyedzi yi fir Wo;
Efrɛ ewufo fi adakamaa m',
Wiadzi fi W'asɛm m' ba.

MHB 561
4 . In hope, against all human hope,
Self-desperate, I believe;
Thy quickening word shall raise  me up,
Thou shalt thy Spirit give.
	 ~ 	4 
. Enyidado hun m' enyidar,
Nyimpa - hun, megye dzi;
Wo nkenyan asɛm hyɛ me dzen,
Edze W' Sunsum bɛma m'.

MHB 561
5 . Faith, mighty faith, the promise sees,
And looks to that alone;
Laughs at impossibilities,
And cries, It shall be done !	 ~ 	5 
. Gyedzi na anohoba no hwɛ,
No nkotoo na ɔhwɛ;
Ɔserew ndzɛmba a ne yɛ yɛ dzen,

MHB 562
1 . GOD of all power, and truth, and grace,
Which shall from age to age endure,
Whose word, when heaven and  earth shall pass,
Remains and stands for ever  sure;
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME a Wo tum, nokwar na adom,
Betsim mbersantsen, mfesantsen,
Sor na ase twa mu kɔ mpo a,
N'asɛm betsim hɔ daa nyina.
Wo dɔ a odzi mu n' ne Caanan

MHB 562
2 . That I Thy mercy may proclaim,
That all mankind Thy truth may  see,
Hallow Thy great and glorious  name,
And perfect holiness in me.
	 ~ 	2 
. N-kyɛ maabɔ W'adom dawur
Ma adasa eehu Wo nokwar n'!
Tsew W'enyimnyam dzin kɛse n' ho,
Krɔnkrɔnyɛ ndzi mu wɔ mo mu.

MHB 562
3 . Purge me from every evil blot;
M y idols all be cast aside;
Cleanse me from every  sinful   thought,
From all the fifth of self and pride.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hohor mo bɔn biara fi hɔ;
Totow m'ehonyi nyinara gu;
Tsew mo ho fi adwembɔn biara m',
Fi efifidze na ahopɔw m'.

MHB 562
4 . Give me a new, a perfect heart,
From doubt, and fear, and sorrow  free;
The mind which was in Christ  impart,
And let my spirit cleave to thee.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma m'akoma fofor a odzi mu,
Mimfi ekyingye, suro na yaw nsa;
Ma me adwen a nna Christ wɔ n' bi,
Na mo sunsum ntakyer Wo ho.

MHB 562
5 . O that I now, from sin released,
Thy word may to the utmost  prove,
Enter into the promised rest,
The Canaan of Thy perfect love !   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Ao, nkyɛ afei meefi bɔn nsa,
W'asɛm no aaba mu pefee,
Maahɛn anohoba ahomgye m'!

MHB 563
1 . LORD, I believe a rest remains
To all Thy people known,
A rest where pure enjoyment reigns,
And Thou art loved alone:
	 ~ 	1 . MO Wura, megye dzi dɛ ahomgye
Wɔ hɔ ma Wo nkorɔfo;
Ahomgye a dɛw mapa dzi m' hɛn
Na Wo ho dɔ wɔ mu.
Wɔ asaase do anaa sor.

MHB 563
2 . A rest, where all our souls desire
Is fixed on things above;
Where fear, and sin, and grief  expire,
Cast out by perfect love. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Ahomgye a ɔyɛ hɛn kra apɛdze
Gyina sor ndzɛmba do,
Mbrɛ suro, bɔn nye yaw nyina wu,
'Dɔ mapa tu go koraa.

MHB 563
3 . O that I now the rest might know,
Believe, and enter in!
Now, Saviour, now the power bestow,
And let me cease from sin.
	 ~ 	3 
. O nkyɛ meehu dɛm ahomgye n',
Me gyedzi aakɔ mu!
Afei m'Agyenkwa, fa tum ma m',
Na ma mingyaa bɔn yɛ.

MHB 563
4 . Remove this hardness from my  heart,
This unbelief remove;
To me the rest of faith impart,
The Sabbath of Thy love.
	 ~ 	4 
. Dza ɔyɛ dzen mfi m'akoma m',
Na ekyingye yi mfi hɔ;
Gyedzi a aka no fa ma me
Wɔ dɔ ahomgye n' mu.

MHB 563
5 . I would be Thine, thou know’st  I would,
And have thee all my own;
Thee, O my all-sufficient Good!
I want, and Thee alone.
	 ~ 	5 
. M'bɛyɛ Wodze, Woara nyim dɛm,
Medze W' ayɛ me dze;
O m'adze pa a ɔsom mo bo,
Wo nko na mohwehwɛ.

MHB 563
6 . Thy name to me, thy nature grant;
This, only this be given:
Nothing beside my God I want,
Nothing in earth or heaven. 	 ~ 	6 
. Wo dzin ama menya Wo su;
Iyi nko dze, fa ma m';
Memmpɛ hwee dɛ me Nyankopɔn,

MHB 564
1 . FATHER, I dare believe
Thee merciful and true:
Thou wilt my guilty soul forgive,
My fallen soul renew.
	 ~ 	1 . Egya, megye dzi pi 
Dɛ eyɛ mbɔbɔrhufo:
'Bɛsan me kra fɔdzifo n' ho,
Na ayɛ me fofor.
Hoa m' dɛ esukwankyɛba.

MHB 564
2 . Come then for Jesu’s sake,
And bid my heart be clean;
An end of all my troubles make,
An end of all my sin.
	 ~ 	2  
. Dɛm a, Jesus ntsi, bra, 
Ma m'akoma mu ntsew:
Botwa mo fona nyina do,
Na ma mingyaa bɔn yɛ.

MHB 564
3 . I will, through grace, I will,
I do, return to Thee;
Take, empty it, O Lord, and fill
My heart with purity.
	 ~ 	3 
. Adom do na menam 
Mesan meba Wo hɔ:
Ewuradze, to m'akoma pan
Na krɔnkrɔnyɛ nhyɛ n' ma.

MHB 564
4 . For power I feebly pray:
Thy kingdom now restore,
To-day, while it is called to-day,
And I shall sin no more.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mosɔr mberɛw mu serɛ tum, 
Hyɛ W'ahendzi no ma
Ndɛ a wɔfrɛ no n-dɛ yi,
Na mennkɛyɛ bɔn bio.

MHB 564
5 . I cannot wash my heart,
But by believing Thee,
And waiting for Thy blood to impart
The spotless purity.
	 ~ 	5 
. Munntum nnhor m'akoma, 
Gyedɛ megye Wo dzi,
Na motweɔn Wo bɔgyaa a ɔma 
Wansayɛ krɔnkrɔn no.

MHB 564
6 . While at Thy cross I lie,
Jesus, the grace bestow,
Now Thy all-cleansing blood apply,
And I am white as snow.	 ~ 	6  
. Meda W'asɛndua ase 'i, 
Jesus, dom me W'adom.
Fa Wo bɔgyaa a ɔhor bɔn no

MHB 565
1 . I KNOW that my Redeemer lives,
And ever prays for me;
A token of His love He gives,
A pledge of liberty.
	 ~ 	1 . Minyim dɛ mo Pomfo tse ase, 
Na ɔsɔr ma me daa nyina;
Ɔma No dɔ ho sɛnkyerɛdze,
Eyiedzi ahobadze a.
Na ahomgye afebɔɔ hwɛ.

MHB 565
2 . I find him lifting up my head,
He brings salvation near,
His presence makes me free indeed,
And He will soon appear.
	 ~ 	2 
. Muhu N' dɛ ɔrema me tsir do, 
Ɔdze nkwagye abɛn ha,
W'enyim yɛ me dehye ampaara,
Na ɔnnkɛkyɛr na ɔaba.

MHB 565
3 . He wills that I should holy be;
What can withstand his will?
The counsel of His grace in me
He surely shall fulfil.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔpɛ dɛ meyɛ hotsewnyi; 
'Bɛnadze siw Ne pɛ kwan?
N'adom pamfo a ɔwɔ mo mu n'
Ɔbɛhyɛ m' ma ampaara

MHB 565
4 . Jesus, I hang upon Thy word;
I steadfastly believe
Thou wilt return and claim me, Lord,
And to thyself receive.
	 ~ 	4  
. Jesus W'asɛm na midzi do; 
Me gyedzi nyina nye dɛ
Mo Wura, ebɛsan na agye m',
Ama Woara Woho.

MHB 565
5 . When God is mine, and I am His,
Of paradise possessed,
I taste unutterable bliss
And everlasting rest.	 ~ 	5 
. Minya Nyame, meyɛ Nedze a, 
Nna menya paradise,
Mosɔ nhyira a onnyi kabea

MHB 566
1 . GOD of all-redeeming grace,
By Thy pardoning love compelled,
Up to Thee our souls we raise,
Up to Thee our bodies yield:
Thou our sacrifice receive,
Acceptable through Thy Son,
While to Thee alone we live,
While we die to Thee alone.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME, adom nyina Pomfo,
Wo fakyɛ dɔ no hyɛ hɛn
Ma yɛma hɛn kra do ma W',
Yɛdze hɛn nyimpadua ma W';
Gye hɛn afɔrbɔdze yi fa,
Yɛdze fa Wo Ba no do,
Yɛtse ase ma Wo nkotoo,
Sɛ yewu, a yewu ma Wo.
Wɔnkyerɛw hɛn akoma pon do! Amen.

MHB 566
2 . Meet it is, and just, and right,
That we should be wholly Thine,
In Thine only will delight,
In Thy blessed service join:
O that every work and word
Might proclaim how good Thou art,
Holiness unto the Lord
Still be written on our heart !   Amen.	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔfata na ɔtsen na oye,
Dɛ yɛbɛyɛ Wo nko dze,
Wo mu nko na hɛn enyi gye,
Yɛnka Wo nhyira som ho;
Nkyɛ edwuma nye asɛm biara
Aabɔ W' papayɛ dawur;
Krɔnkrɔnyɛ nka Ewuradze.

MHB 567
1 . IN full and glad surrender
I give myself to Thee.
Thine utterly and only,
And evermore to be.
	 ~ 	1 . ENYIGYE mapa mu na 
Medze moho ma Wo;
Wo nkotoo Wodze koraa,
M'bɛyɛ Wo nko dze daa.
Me Hen, mindzi W' nokwar.  Amen.

MHB 567
2 . O Son of God, Who lov’st me,
I will be Thine alone;
And all I have and all I am,
Shall henceforth be Thine own.
	 ~ 	2 
. O Nyame Ba edɔ me,
M'bɛyɛ Wo nko Wodze;
Dza mowɔ nye dza meyɛ,
Ofi ndɛ m'bɛyɛ W'dze.

MHB 567
3 . Reign over me, Lord Jesus;
O make my heart Thy throne:
It shall be Thine, dear Saviour,
It shall be Thine alone.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze Jesus, yɛ m' hen,
Yɛ m'akoma W'ahengua;
M'Agyenkwa, ɔyɛ Wodze,
'Bɛyɛ Wo nko Wodze.

MHB 567
4 . O come and reign, Lord Jesus,
Rule over everything;
And keep me always loyal
And true to Thee, my King.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. O Jesus, bra bedzi hen,
Dzi biribiara do hen;
Ma menyɛ setsie daa daa,

MHB 568
1 . SINCE the Son hath made me free,
Let me taste my liberty;
Thee behold with open face,
Triumph in Thy saving grace,
Thy great will delight to prove,
Glory in Thy perfect love.
	 ~ 	1 . MENYA Ɔba n' nsamu fahodzi 'i,
Ma monsɔ m' fahodzi nhwɛ;
Memfa m'enyiwa nhwɛ Wo,
Ndzi nyim wɔ nkwa adom mu;
Mfa enyigye nkyerɛ Wo pɛ n',
Enyimnyam wɔ dɔ mapa m'.
Tsena m'akoma m' afebɔɔ. Amen.

MHB 568
2 . Abba, Father, hear Thy child,
Late in Jesus reconciled;
Hear, and all the graces shower,
All the joy, and peace, and power,
All  my Saviour asks above,
All  the life and heaven of love.
	 ~ 	2 
. Abba, Egya, tsie Wo ba,
Ka me bɔ m' wɔ Jesus mu;
Tsie na petse adom nhyira n',
Wɔ dɛw, asomdwee nye tum m';
M'Agyenkwa, serɛ wɔ sor ma m',
Nkwa na sor dɔ nyinara.

MHB 568
3 . Heavenly Adam, Life divine,
Change my nature into thine!
Move and spread throughout my soul,
Actuate and fill the whole!
Be it I no longer now
Living in the flesh, but Thou.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔsor Adam, ɔsor Nkwa,
Dan mo su ma ɔnsɛ Wodze;
Hɛn me kra nyinara mu,
Hyɛ no dzen na hyɛ no ma;
Ɔnyɛ dɛ menntse honam m'
Na mbom mentse Wo mu.

MHB 568
4 . Holy Ghost, no more delay;
Come, and in Thy temple stay;
Now Thine inward witness bear,
Strong, and permanent, and clear;
Spring of life, Thyself impart,
Rise eternal in my heart.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, mma nnyɛ ekyim;
Bra bɛtsena W'asɔrfi mu;
Dzi dase mo sunsum mu,
Ɔnyɛ dzen na ontsim hɔ;
N-kwa nsunyiwa, hue ma m',

MHB 569
1 . THINE forever!  God of Love,
Hear us from Thy throne above; 
Thine forever may we be, 
Here and in eternity.
	 ~ 	1 . Wodze daa! Ɔdɔ Nyame, 
Fi sor W'ahenguam tsie hɛn;
Yɛnyɛ Wodze afebɔɔ,
Wɔ ha na mbersantsen nyinam'.
Ewuradze, gya hɛn kɔ sor.

MHB 569
2 . Thine forever! Lord of Life,
Shield us through our earthly Strife:
Thou, the Life, the Truth, the Way, 
Guide us to the realms of day.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wodze daa! n-kwa Wura, 
Kora hɛn wɔ bra aperdzim';
Wo nye Nkwa n', Nokwar n' na Kwan n',
Gya hɛn kɔ kan man no mu.

MHB 569
3 . Thine forever! O, how blest 
They who find in Thee their rest! 
Saviour, Guardian, Heavenly Friend, 
O defend us to the end! 
	 ~ 	3 
. Wodze daa! Ao, esiarfo 
Bɛn nye hɔn a wɔhom Wo mu!
Gyefo, Weɔmfo, Sor Nyɛnko,
Ao, twitwa gye hɛn kɔ ewiei!

MHB 569
4 . Thine forever! Shepherd, keep 
These Thy frail and trembling  sheep; 
Safe alone beneath Thy care, 
Let us all Thy goodness share.
	 ~ 	4 
. Wodze daa! Oguanhwɛfo, 
Wo nguan a wɔyɛ mberɛw;
Woara kora hɔn yie,
Fa W'ayamuyie dom hɛn nyina.

MHB 569
5 . Thine forever! Thou our Guide, 
All our wants by Thee supplied, 
All our sins by Thee forgiven, 
Lead us, Lord, from earth to heaven.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Wodze daa! hɛn Kwangyefo, 
Ema hɛn dza yehia nyina,
Hɛn bɔn nyina edze kyɛ hɛn,

MHB 57
1 . IN all my vast concerns with Thee, 
 In vain my soul would try 
 To shun thy presence, Lord, or flee 
 The notice of Thine eye.
	 ~ 	1 . MENYE Wo ntamu dwumadzi mu n'. 
Ɔyɛ dzen ma me kra,
Dɛ obotum esuma efi
W'enyim a innhu no.

MHB 57
2 . Thy all-surrounding sight surveys 
 My rising and my rest, 
 My public walks, my private ways, 
 The secrets of my breast.
	 ~ 	2 . W'enyi bɔ wiadze nyina aprɔw, 
Hu mo soɛr na me nda,
Me bagua m' na mo nsumaa m' asɛm
Na m'akoma mu nsɛm.

MHB 57
3 . My thoughts lie open to Thee, Lord, 
 Before theyre formed within 
 And, ere my lips pronounce the word, 
 Thou knowst the sense I mean.
	 ~ 	3 . Owura, inyim mo nsusui, 
Ansaana madwen mpo; 
Na m'bobue m'ano akà 
asɛm no, 
Inyim dza mepɛ akyerɛ.

MHB 57
4 . O wondrous knowledge, deep and high; 
 Where can a creature hide? 
 Within Thy circling arms I lie, 
 Beset on every side.
	 ~ 	4 . Nyimdzee nwanwa a ɔdɔ, ɔkrɔn;
Hen na abɔdze bosuma?
Meda W'abaw a atserɛw mu do;
Etwa mo ho ehyia.

MHB 57
5 . So let Thy grace surround me still, 
 And like a bulwark prove, 
 To guard my soul from every ill, 
 Secured by sovereign love.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 . N-tsi ma W'adom n'ntwa mo ho, 
Na ɔmbɔ mo ho ban,
Na wo dɔ kɛse no nkora
Me kra mfi mbusu ho.    Amen.

MHB 570
1 . HOLY, and true, and righteous Lord,
I wait to prove thy perfect will;
Be mindful of Thy gracious word,
And stamp me with Thy Spirit’s  seal.
	 ~ 	1 . KRƆNKRƆN nye tsenenee Wura,
Mobɔtweɔn masɔ Wo pɛ ahwɛ;
Kaa dza W'adom asɛm no se,
Fa Wo Sunsum no hyɛ me nsew.
Munhu dɛ Christ yɛ adze nyina.

MHB 570
2 . Confound, o’erpower me by Thy  grace,
I would be by myself abhorred;
All might, all majesty, all praise,
All glory, be to Christ my Lord.
	 ~ 	2 
. W'adom nhyɛ m' fɛr, mfa me ndɔmmum,
M'bekyir mankasa mo suban;
Tum, akɛseyɛ, ayɛyi,
Enyimnyam nka m'Ewuradze Christ.

MHB 570
3 . Now let me gain perfection’s height,
Now let me into nothing fall,
Be less than nothing in Thy sight,
And feel that Christ is all in all.   Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Ma minnya emudzi a ɔkrɔn,
Afei mma monnhwe ase hwee ho;
Mma monntɔ sin wɔ W'enyim da,

MHB 571
1 . BLESSED are the pure in heart,
They have learned the angel art,
While on earth in heaven to be,
God, by sense unseen, to see. 
Cleansed from sin’s offensive stain,
Fellowship with him they gain;
Nearness, likeness to their Lord,
Their exceeding great reward. 
	 ~ 	1 . NHYIRA nye hɔn a hɔn akὸma m’ tsew,
Woesuà abɔfo hɔn ndzeyɛɛ,
Wɔ asaase do nye sor,
Wohu Nyamé a wonnhu no,
Wɔahor hɔn ho bɔn nkekãã,
Wonya No mu fɛkuwbɔ;
Aka kùmaa wɔato hɔn Wùrà a
Ɔyɛ hɔn mfaso kɛse n'.
Nam Sunsum no mù ayɛ kor.

MHB 571
2 . Worshipping in spirit now,
In His inner court they bow-
Bow before the brightening veil,
God’s own radiance through it hail.
 Serious, simple of intent,
Teachably intelligent,
Rapt, they search the written word
Till His very voice is heard.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wɔsom wɔ sunsum mu ndɛ
Kotow No N'abangua do;
Nkataenyim hyɛnhyɛn n’ enyim,
Nyame N’enyim hyérɛn dua mu.
Wɔwɔ ’nyiber, ‘wɔdwe,
Nkyérɛkyérɛ mu mbadwembafo.
Wɔhwehwɛ Kyérɛwsɛm no mu
Kodu dɛ wɔtse Ne ndze.

MHB 571
3 . In creation Him they own,
Meet him in its haunts, alone;
Most amidst its Sabbath calm,
Morning  light and evening balm. 
Him they still through busier life
Trust in pain and care and strife;
These like clouds o’er noontide  blaze,
Temper, not conceal His rays.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Abɔdze m’ ɔyɛ hɔndze.
. Wohyia N’ wɔ N‘abangua do;
Tsitsir wɔ N‘ahomgye mu,
Adzekyee nye ewimbir.
Wɔtwer N’ abrabɔ nyina m’.
Yaw, dadwen nà akodzi mu;
’Yinom tse dέ ewiaber fua
Gyegye wo Ne hyerɛn mu.

MHB 571
4 . Hallowed thus their every breath:
Dying they shall not see death.
With the Lord in Paradise,
Till, like His, their bodies rise.  
Nearer than the seraphim
In their flesh shall saints see Him,
With the Father, in the Son,
Through the Spirit, ever one.	 ~ 	4 
. Hɔn ahomgu nyina ho tsew:
Owu, worunnhu bi da,
Wɔnye Owùra wɔ paràdisé,
Kesi wunyan da no mu.
Na wɔbɛbɛn seraphfo,
Ahotsewfo bohu No,
Egya n’ wɔ Ne Ba no mu,

MHB 572
1 . BEHOLD the servant of the Lord!
I wait Thy guiding eye to feel,
To hear and keep Thy every word,
To prove and do Thy perfect will,
Joyful from my own works to cease,
Glad to fulfil all righteousness.
	 ~ 	1 . HWƐ, emi Ewuradze N'akowaa!
Motweɔn ehu W'akwankyerɛ,
Etsie, esie W'asɛm biara,
Asɔ Wo pɛ ahwɛ na mayɛ,
Dze dɛw egyaa mara mo ndwuma,
Dze enyigye ahyɛ tsenenee nyina ma.
Ntsena ase nwu nhyɛ W' enyimnyam.  Amen.

MHB 572
2 . Me, if Thy grace vouchsafe to use,
Meanest of all thy creatures, me,
The deed, the time, the manner  choose,
Let all my fruit be found of  Thee;
Let all my works in Thee be  wrought,
By thee to full perfection brought. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Emi a memmfata W'abɔdze m',
Sɛ W'adom pɛ dɛ ɔdze m' yɛ edwuma a,
Woara kyerɛ dwuma n', ber n', na yɛbea n',
Ma m'aba nyina mfir Wo mu;
Ma mindzi mo dwuma nyina Wo mu,
Na fa m' du emudzi mapa m'.

MHB 572
3 . My every weak, though good design,
O’errule, or change, as seems Thee meet;
Jesus, let all my work be Thine!
Thy work, O Lord, is all complete,
And pleasing in Thy Father’s sight;
Thou only hast done all things  right.
	 ~ 	3 
. Me mberɛwyɛ nhyehyɛɛ n', sɛ oye mpo a,
Bɔ gu, sesa n' dɛ mbrɛ ehwɛ a oye,
Jesus, ma mo ndwuma nyina nyɛ W'dze!
Ewuradze, Wo ndwuma nyina dzi mu,
Na ɔsɔ Ɔwo Egya W'enyi,
Wo nko na ayɛ adze nyina yie.

MHB 572
4 . Here then to Thee Thy own I leave;
Mould as thou wilt thy passive clay;
But let me all thy stamp receive,
But let me all thy words obey,
Serve with a single heart and eye,
And to thy glory live and die.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Afei medan W'adze ma Wo,
Wen Wo dɛtse pɔtɔɔ 'i mbrɛ epɛ;
Mbom ma minya Wo nsewhyɛ no, 
Ma mindzi W'asɛm biara do,
Mfa akoma na enyi kor nsom,

MHB 573
1 . O GOD, what offering shall I give
To Thee, the Lord of earth and skies?
My spirit, soul, and flesh receive,
A holy, living sacrifice:
Small as it is, ’tis all my store;
More shouldst thou have, if I had  more.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME, sor na asaase Wura,
Ebɛn afɔr na mombɔ mma W'?
Mo sunsum, kra na honam, gye
Nyikan afɔrbɔ krɔnkrɔn no;
Osuar dze, m'adze nyina nye n';
Mowɔ n' pii a, nkyɛ medze bɛma W'.
M'edwuma nye dɛ m'beyi W' ayew.

MHB 573
2 . Now, O my God, Thou hast my soul,
No longer mine, but Thine I am;
Guard Thou Thine own, possess it whole,
Cheer it with hope, with love inflame;
Thou hast my spirit, there display
Thy glory to the perfect day.
	 ~ 	2 
. Afei, Nyame, me kra yɛ W'dze,
Ɔnnyɛ m'dze bio, meyɛ Wodze;
Weɔn Woara W'dze, yɛ n' Wodze nwionn,
Ma enyidado na dɔ mfram;
Gye mo sunsum, ma W'enyimnyam
Nhyerɛn mu nkɛpem da a m'bedzi mu.

MHB 573
3 . Thou hast my flesh, Thy hallowed shrine,
Devoted solely to Thy will;
Here let Thy light for ever shine,
This house still let Thy presence fill;
O source of life; live, dwell, and move
In me, till all my life be love!
	 ~ 	3 
. W'asɔrfi krɔnn n' atsew mo ho,
Etu esi hɔ ama Wo pɛ;
Ma Wo kan nhyerɛn daa wɔ ha,
Bra bɛhyɛ fie ha daa nyina;
Nkwa Mafo, tsena mo mu, nunu m'
Kɛpem dɛ dɔ bɛhyɛ me ma.

MHB 573
4 . Send down Thy likeness from above,
And let this my adorning be;
Clothe me with wisdom, patience, love,
With lowliness and purity,
Than gold and pearls more precious  far,
And brighter than the morning star.
	 ~ 	4 
. Soma Wo su n' ma omfi sor mbra,
Na ma ɔnyɛ m'ahyehyɛdze;
Fa nyansa, abotar na ɔdɔ fura m',
Mbrɛhoadze na ahotsew a no bo
Kyɛn sika na mbota koraa,
Na ɔhyerɛn kyɛn anapa nworaba.

MHB 573
5 . Lord, arm me with Thy Spirit’s might,
Since I am called by Thy great name;
In thee let all my thoughts unite,
Of all my works be Thou the aim:
Thy love attend me all my days,
And my sole business be Thy praise.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Dɛ wodze W' dzin kɛse n' frɛ me 'i,
Fa W' Sunsum hoɔdzenfo n' kora me;
Mo nsusui nyina mbɔ m' wɔ mo mu,
Mo ndwuma nyina mu n' yɛ mo botae;
Wo dɔ no ngya m' me mber nyina,

MHB 574
1 . FATHER, Son, and Holy Ghost,
One in Three, and Three in One,
As by the celestial host,
Let thy will on earth be done;
Praise by all to thee be given,
Glorious Lord of earth and heaven.
	 ~ 	1 . EGYA, Ba, Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn,
Ɔkorsa, Ebiasa kor,
Wɔnyɛ Wo pɛ asaase do,
Dɛ mbrɛ sor dɔm yɛ n' ara;
Nkorɔfo nyina nyi W' ayɛw,
Sor nye asaase enyimnyam Wura.
Sor nye asaase enyimnyam Wura.  Amen.

MHB 574
2 . Vilest of the sinful race,
Lo!I answer to Thy call;
Meanest vessel of Thy grace,
Grace divinely free for all,
Lo!I Come to do Thy will,
All Thy counsel to fulfill.
	 ~ 	2 
. Emi m' yɛ dzebɔnyɛnyi,
Hwɛ! Megye Wo frɛ no do,
W'adom kuraba a ɔmmfata m',
Nyame adom so obiara do;
Hwɛ! Meba bɛyɛ Wo pɛ,
Midzi W'afotu nyina do.

MHB 574
3 . If so poor a worm as I 
May to Thy great glory live,
All my actions sanctify,
All my words and thoughts receive;
Claim me for Thy service, claim
All I have and all I am.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hianyi, sunsuma tse dɛ emi,
Metsena ma W'enyimnyam a,
Tsew me ndzeyɛɛ nyina ho,
Gye me nsɛm na m'adwen nyina;
Fa me, fa me yɛ W'edwuma,
Dza mowɔ, metse nyina.

MHB 574
4 . Take my soul and body’s powers;
Take my memory, mind, and will,
All my goods, and all my hours,
All I think, or speak, or do;
Take my heart, but make it new.
	 ~ 	4 
. Gye me kra na nyimpadua;
Gye m'adwendwen na me pɛ,
Me ndzɛmba na me mber nyina;
Dza minyim, metse nka nyina,
Dza modwen, meka, meyɛ;
Gye m'akoma na yɛ n' fofor.

MHB 574
5 . Now, O God, Thine own I am,
Now I give Thee back Thine own;
Freedom, friends, and health, and fame
Consecrate to Thee alone:
Thine I live, thrice happy I;
Happier still if  Thine I die.
	 ~ 	5 
. Afei, Nyame, meyɛ W'dze,
Medze W'adze san ma Wo,
Fahodzi, mfɛfo nye dzin,
Metsew ho ma Wo nkotoo,
Metse ase ma W', m'enyi gye;
Muwu ma Wo a, enyigye nko.

MHB 574
6 . Father, Son, and Holy Ghost,
One in Three, and Three in One,
As by the celestial host,
Let Thy will on earth be done;
Praise by all to Thee be given,
Glorious Lord of earth and heaven.  Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Egya, Ba, Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn,
Ɔkorsa, Ebiasa kor,
Wɔnyɛ Wo pɛ asaase do,
Dɛ mbrɛ sor dɔm yɛ n' ara;
Nkorɔfo nyina nyi W' ayɛw,

MHB 575
1 . SERVANT of all, to toil for man
Thou didst not, Lord, refuse;
Thy majesty did not disdain
To be employed for us.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, ammpow dɛ ebɛyɛ
Nyimpa nyina akowaa na afona;
Ammfɛr dɛ edze W'ahentum n'
Bɛba abɔsom hɛn.
M'akoma da ho wɔ W' nkyɛn.

MHB 575
2 . Son of the carpenter, receive
This humble work of mine;
Worth to my meanest labour give,
By  joining it to Thine.
	 ~ 	2 
. Duadwimfo n' Ba, gye m'edwuma
Tootooba a ɔnnsɛ hwee 'i;
Twe mo ndwuma a ɔmmfata 'i bata
Wodze n' ho ma ɔnsom bo.

MHB 575
3 . End of my every action Thou,
In all things Thee I see;
Accept my hallowed labour now,
I do it unto Thee.	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔwo nye dza m'yɛ nyina n'ewiei,
Muhu W'nko wɔ adze nyina m';
Afei gye mo ndwuma krɔnn yi,
Midzi ma Woara nko.

MHB 575
4 . Thy bright example I pursue,
To Thee in all things rise;
And all I think,or speak,or do
Is one  great sacrifice.
	 ~ 	4 
. Meka W' fasusu papa n' do
Abɛn W' adze nyina m';
Dza modwen, meka, meyɛ nyina
Yɛ afɔr kɛse kor.

MHB 575
5 . Careless though outward cares I go,
From all distraction free;
My hands are but engaged below,
My heart is still with Thee.	 ~ 	5 
. Mudua haw na atseetsee mu sɔnn,
Biribiara nntwe m' ekyir;
Ha 'i me nsa dzi dwuma ma Wo,

MHB 576
1 . BE it my only wisdom here
To serve the Lord with filial fear,
With loving gratitude;
Superior sense may I display,
By shunning every evil way,
And  walking in the good.
	 ~ 	1 . MA m'adwen nyina wɔ ha nyɛ dɛ
Medze suro na ɔdɔ, ndaase
M'bɔsom Ewuradze dɛ ɔba;
Mobɔpow akwan bɔn nyina,
Akyerɛ dɛm adwen mu piw yi,
Maanantsew papa n' mu.
Na munhu ɔsor kwan. Amen.

MHB 576
2 . O may I still from sin depart!
A wise and understanding heart,
Jesus, to me be given;
And let me through Thy Spirit know
To glorify my God below,
And find my way to heaven.   Amen.	 ~ 	2 
. Ao! Ma mimfi bɔn ho mfi ara,
Jesus, nkyɛ ama me nyansa
Na ntseasee akoma;
Ma mundua Wo Sunsum mu nhu
Mbrɛ m'bɛhyɛ W' enyimnyam wɔ ha,

MHB 577
1 . O LOVING Lord, who art for ever seeking
Men of Thy mind, intent to do thy will,
Strong in Thy strength, Thy power and grace bespeaking;
Faithful to Thee, through good 
      report and ill -
	 ~ 	1 . DƆYƐFO Ewuradze, Ɔwo a dabaa rohwehwɛ
Wo nkorɔfo a wɔper ayɛ wopɛ,
Hɔn ahoɔdzen fir W', wɔka W' tum na adom kyerɛ;
Papa mu o, bɔn mu o, wonntwa W' abrɔdɔ.
Yendzi nokwar mma hɛnho na Ewuradze.  Amen.

MHB 577
2 . To Thee we come, and humbly make confession,
Faithless so oft, in thought and word and deed,
Asking that we may have, in true possession,
Thy free forgiveness in the hour of need.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛba Wo hɔ, na mberɛw mu yɛka hɛn bɔn,
Hɛn gyedzi suar wɔ adwen, kasa na nyɛe m',
Yɛserɛ Wo, ma yenhu ampaara dɛ yenya
W'adom fakyɛ wɔ ahokyer ber mu.

MHB 577
3 . In duties small be Thou our inspiration,
In large affairs endue us with Thy might;
Through faithful service cometh full salvation;
So may we serve, Thy will our chief delight.
	 ~ 	3 
. Dwumadzi nkakraba m', Woara kenyan hɛn,
Dwumadzi akɛse m' so fa W' tum hyɛ hɛn;
Yɛsom nokwar mu a, na yenya nkwagye,
Yɛnsom W' dɛm, yendzi dɛw dɛ yɛyɛ W' pɛ.

MHB 577
4 . Not disobedient to the heavenly  vision,
Faithful in all things, seeking not reward,
Then, following Thee, may we fulfil our mission,
True to ourselves, our brethren, and our Lord.
			Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Mma yɛnnyɛ akɔmpew wɔ sor nyikyerɛ no ho,
Yendzi nokwwar daa, yemmbisa akatua,
Yedzi W'ekyir 'i, ma yɛnhyɛ hɛn somdwuma ma,

MHB 578
1 . A charge to keep I have, 
A God to glorify,
A never-dying soul to save,
And fit it for the sky:
	 ~ 	1 . Asodzi da mo do
Dɛ miyi Nyame ayɛw,
Megye me kra a onnwu da nkwa,
Na mema ɔsɛ sor.
M'bowu wu a onnyi ewiei.

MHB 578
2 . To serve the present age,
My calling to fulfill:
O may it all my powers engage
To do my Master’s  will! 
	 ~ 	2 
. Mosom mbersantsen yi, 
Midze dwuma a wɔahyɛ m',
Ao, nkyɛ medze m'ahom nyina 
Maayɛ mo Wura Ne pɛ!

MHB 578
3 . Arm me with jealous care,
As in Thy sight to live,
And O, Thy servant, Lord, prepare 
A strict account to give!
	 ~ 	3 
. Fa nhwɛyie bɔ me ban 
Ma mentsena dɛ ihu m';
Na, mo Wura, siesie Wo somfo
Na meebu nkontaa pa.

MHB 578
4 . Help me to watch and pray,
And on Thyself rely,
Assured, if I my trust betray,
I shall forever die.	 ~ 	4 
. Boa m' ma monweɔn, monsɔr, 
Na montwer Wo nkotoo
Minyim dɛ mogor m'edwuma ho a,

MHB 579
1 . SAVIOUR, Thy dying love 
Thou gavest me,
Nor should I aught withhold, 
My Lord, from Thee.
In love my soul would bow, 
My heart fulfill its vow,
Some offering bring Thee now, 
Something for Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . Gyefo, Ɔwo, dɔ ntsi 
Iwui maa me,
Ɔmmfata dɛ medze,
Hweeara kam Wo;
Dɔm', me kra bɔkotow W',
M'akoma edzi ne nsew do,
Na ɔabɔ afɔr bi,
Ama W' sesei.
Ɔnyɛ Wodze.

MHB 579
2 . At the blest mercy seat 
Pleading for me,
My feeble faith looks up, Jesus, to Thee:
Help me the cross to bear, 
Thy wondrous love declare,
Some song to raise, or prayer- 
Something for Thee.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mbɔbɔr egua n' enyim 
Idzi ma me,
Jesus, me gyedzi to
N'enyi hwɛ Wo:
Boa m' ma monsoa mbeamudua n',
Mombɔ Wo dɔ n' dawur,
Montow ndwom, mbɔ mpaa bi
Mma Wo sesei.

MHB 579
3 . Give me a faithful heart, 
Likeness to Thee.
That each departing day
henceforth may see
Some work of love begun,
Some deed of kindness done,
Some wanderer sought and won- 
Something for Thee.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma m' nokwar 'koma a, 
Ɔsɛ Wodze N',
Na dabiara  a otwam'
Eehu me dɛ
Mahyɛ dɔ dwuma bi ase,
Mayɛ ayamuyie bi,
Matwe kobɔnyi bi,
Medze ama W'.

MHB 579
4 . All that I am and have, 
Thy gifts so free,
In joy, in grief, through life, 
O Lord, for Thee!
And when Thy face I see,
 My ransomed soul shall be
Through all eternity, 
something for Thee.	 ~ 	4 
. Dza mowɔ o, mbrɛ metse o, 
W' akyɛdze kwa,
Dɛw mu o, yaw mu o, mo Wura,
Wodze nye me.
Na muhu W'enyim a,
Me kra a wɔapɔn no yi,
Mbersantsen nyina mu,

MHB 58
1 . THE Lord Jehovah reigns; 
 His throne is built on high, 
 The garments He assumes 
 Are light and majesty: 
 His glories shine with beams so bright, 
 No mortal eye can bear the sight.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE dzi hen;
N'ahengua si ɔsor,
Atar a ɔhyɛ no
Yɛ kan na ahentum:
N'enyimnyam hyerɛn dɛ ekan,
Dasanyi biara nntum nnhwɛ kan n'.

MHB 58
2 . The thunders of His hand 
 Keep the wide world in awe; 
 His wrath and justice stand 
 To guard his holy law; 
 And where His love resolves to bless, 
 His truth confirms and seals the grace.
	 ~ 	2 . Ne nsamu aprandaa
Ma wiadze nyina bɔ hu;
N'ebufuw na tsenenee
Weɔn Ne mbra krɔnkrɔn no;
Na mbrɛ No dɔ pɛ dɛ ohyira n'.
No nokwar si adom no pi.

MHB 58
3 . Through all His mighty works 
 Amazing wisdom shines, 
 Confounds the powers of hell, 
 And breaks their dark designs; 
 Strong is His arm, and shall fulfil 
 His great decrees and sovereign will.
	 ~ 	3 . Nyansa nwanwa hyerɛn 
No ndwuma akɛse mu; 
Ɔsɛɛ hɛll etumfo
Na hɔn sum ndwuma nyina; 
Ne basa dzen ma Ne nhyehyɛɛ 
Na N'apɛdze nyina yɛ hɔ.

MHB 58
4 .  And will this sovereign King 
 Of Glory condescend? 
 And will He write His name 
 My Father and my Friend? 
 I love His name, I love His word  
 Join all my powers to praise the Lord.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Enyimnyam Hen kɛse
Yi bɛbrɛ No ho adze?
Na ɔakyerɛw Ne dzin dɛ
M'Egya na m' Adamfo?
Modɔ Ne dzin, modɔ N'asɛm.
M'ahoɛdzen nyina nkamfo
Ewuardze! Amen.

MHB 580
1 . DISMISS me not Thy service, Lord,
But train me for Thy will;
For even I, in fields so broad,
Some duties may fulfill;
And I will ask for no reward,
Except to serve Thee still.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, mma mmpam m'
W'edwuma ho,
Mbom kyerɛ me W' apɛdze;
Mo so dɛm yi maayɛ biribi
Wɔ Wo kwaa tɛtɛr 'i mu;
Na mbɔsom Wo daa nyinara,
Minnkebisa akatua.
Meserɛ W', mma nnyi m' tokyen.

MHB 580
2 . How many serve, how many more
May to the service come;
To tend the vines, the grapes to store,
Thou dost appoint for some;
Thou hast Thy young men at the war,
Thy little ones at home.
	 ~ 	2 
. Pii wɔsom Wo, dodowara so
Na otwar dɛ wɔbɔsom W',
Ema binom tsɛw wenyindua,
Binom tsetsew aba n',
Wo mberantsɛ gyina akono,
Wo mbɔtoaba wɔ fie.

MHB 580
3 . All works are good, and each is  best
As most it pleases Thee;
Each worker pleases when the rest
He serves in charity;
And neither man nor work unblest
Wilt Thou permit to be.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ndwuma nyina ye, biara ye koraa,
Sɛ ɔsɔ W'enyi dze a;
Dwumayɛnyi biara a ɔdze dɔ som
Ne mfɛfo n' sɔ W'enyi;
Ennhyira amma nyimpa na dwuma
Biara ho kwan a, onngyina.

MHB 580
4 . Our Master all the work hath done
He asks of us today;
Sharing his service, every one
Share too His Sonship may:
Lord, I would serve and be a son;
Dismiss me not, I pray.	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn Wura, dwuma biara a edzi n',
'Pɛ dɛ hɛn so yɛyɛ;
Yɛnye N' yɛ edwuma, ama obiara so 
Nye N' aakyɛ N'abayɛ n';
Ewuradze, mbɔsom, maayɛ ba;

MHB 581
1 . YE servants of the Lord,
Each in his office wait,
Observant of His heavenly word,
And watchful at his gate.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM Ewuradze nkowaa,
Obiara mfua n'edwuma m',
Hom a hom dzi No sor asɛm do
Nweɔn Nyame N'abow no.
Wɔ abɔfo dɔm no mu.

MHB 581
2 . Let all your lamps be bright,
And trim the golden flame;
Gird up your loins as in His sight,
For aweful is his name.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hom mma hom nkandzea nhyerɛn
Hom nkeka n' framee n' yie,
Hom mbɔ hom ntoa ngyina N'enyim,
Ne dzin no yɛ nwanwa.

MHB 581
3 . Watch: ’tis your Lord’s command,
And while we speak, He’s  near;
Mark the first signal of his hand,
And ready all appear.
	 ~ 	3 
. Weɔn: dɛm na hɛn Wura se,
Yɛkasaa a, ɔbɛn hɛn;
Hom nhyɛ Ne nsa nsɛnkyerɛdze n' nsew,
Hom nyina nyɛ ntsɛm mpue.

MHB 581
4 . O happy servant he,
In such a posture found!
He shall his Lord with rapture see,
And be with honour crowned.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔsomfo, homkanyi
Nye onyia ɔsom dɛm!
Ɔdze dɛw bohu n'Ewuradze,
Na ɔahyɛ N'enyimnyam.

MHB 581
5 . Christ shall the banquet spread
With His own royal hand,
And raise that faithful servant’s  head
Amid the angelic band.	 ~ 	5 
. Christ Noara N'ahensa
Na ɔdze bɔto pon no,
Ɔama akowaa nokwafo n' tsir do,

MHB 582
1 . Brightly beams our Father’s mercy 
From His lighthouse evermore, 
But to us He gives the keeping 
Of the lights along the shore. 

   Let the lower lights be burning! 
   Send a gleam across the wave! 
   Some poor, fainting, struggling seaman 
   You may rescue, you may save. 

	 ~ 	1 . HƐN Egya N'adom fi Ne kan
Fadum no m' hyerɛn hyɛnhyɛnn daa;
Na hɛndze ɔdze mpoano ha
Nkandzea no ahyɛ hɛn nsa.
Rehara wɔ sum no mu.

MHB 582
2 . Dark the night of sin has settled, 
Loud the angry billows roar; 
Eager eyes are watching, longing, 
For the lights along the shore. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Wɔmma ase nkandzea no ndzɛw,
Mma ne hyerɛn ntra asorɛkye;
Ma aagye brɛfo bɔbɔfo bi a
Oridzi aper po do no nkwa.

MHB 582
3 . Trim your feeble lamp, my brother, 
some poor sailor tempest-tossed, 
Trying now to make the harbour, 
In the darkness may be lost. 	 ~ 	3 
. Bɔn anago kadoo no etwa m',
Po asorɛkye bɔ dzendzen;
Pii roweɔn, rotweɔn, rohwehwɛ
Eehu mpoano nkandzea no.

MHB 583
1 . HOW blessèd, from the bonds of sin
And earthly fetters free,
In singleness of heart and aim,
Thy servant, Lord, to be;
The hardest toil to undertake
With joy at Thy command,
The meanest office to receive
With meekness at Thy hand;
	 ~ 	1 . IFI bɔn wiadze mpokyerɛ mu a,
Mbrɛ odua yɛ dɛw a!
M'besi akoma na adwen tadua,
Ayɛ Ewuradze akowaa;
Edze enyigye bɛyɛ edwumason
Biara a ɔbɛhyɛ wo,
'Dze ahobrɛadze bɛyɛ edwumaba
Biara a edze bɛma m'.
Esiarfo bɛtsena daa.

MHB 583
2 . With willing heart and longing  eyes
To watch before Thy gate,
Ready to run the weary race,
To bear the heavy weight;
No voice of thunder to expect,
But follow calm and still:
For love can easily divine
The One Belovèd’s will.
	 ~ 	2 
. Medze ɔpɛ na enyigye
Bɔweɔn W'aponkɛse,
Mayɛ krado dɛ m'besi empire n',
Masoa dza ɔyɛ dur n';
'Nnkɛtse apranaa biara mbɔm',
'Bɛka N' do bɔkɔɔ ara;
Ɔdɔ nko na obotum akyerɛ
Ɔdɔfo N'apɛdze.

MHB 583
3 . Thus may I serve Thee, gracious Lord,
Thus ever Thine alone,
My soul and body given to Thee,
The purchase Thou hast won;
Through evil or through good  report
Still keeping by Thy side :
And by  life or death, in this poor flesh,
Let Christ be magnified.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma monsom dɛm, Domfo Ewuradze,
Wo nko ara Wodze daa,
Medze me kra na honam ma W',
Ɔwoara W'atɔdze a;
Atsenka pa anaa bɔn mu a,
Menye W' bɛnantsew ara;
Nyimpadua yi m' nkwa mu o, wu mu o,
Menhyɛ Christ enyimnyam.

MHB 583
4 . How happily the working days
In this dear service fly,
How rapidly the closing hour,
The time of rest, draws nigh,
When all the faithful gather home,
A joyful company;
And ever where the Master is
Shall His blest servants be.	 ~ 	4 
. Mbrɛ dwumadzi ber wɔ som yi mu
Ɔnnkyɛr na oetwa m' kɔ a!
Ɔpon ber no ba ntsɛmara,
Ahomgye ber bɛn ntsɛm,
Na anokwafo dzi ehyia wɔ fie,
Ahomkafo ehyiadzi,
Owura Ne nkyɛn na No nkowaa

MHB 584
1 . THOU, Jesu, Thou my breast inspire,
And touch my lips with hallowed fire,
And loose a stammering infant’s tongue;
Prepare the vessel of Thy grace,
Adorn me with the robes of praise,
And mercy shall be all my song:
Mercy for all who know not God,
Mercy for all in Jesu’s blood,
Mercy, that earth and heaven transcends;
Love, that o’erwhelms the saints in  light,
The length, and breadth, and depth, and height
Of love divine, which never ends! 
	 ~ 	1 . O JESU, kenyan m'akoma,
Fa gya krɔnn ka m'anofamfa,
Siansian abɔtoaba gyirama;
Na siesie W'adom kuraba,
Fa ayɛyi egudo ntar n' hyehyɛ m',
Mo ndwom nyina bɛyɛ ehumbɔbɔr;
Obiara a onnyim Nyankopɔn,
Hɔn a Jesu bɔgyaa atɔ hɔn,
Ehumbɔbɔr a ɔtra sor na ase;
Dɔ a no war, trɛ, no bun, no krɔn,
Obunkam kan m' esiarfo do,
Nyame dɔ a ɔnnsa ara da.
Ndzi dɛw mbordo, na mondɔ Wo.

MHB 584
2 . A faithful witness of Thy grace,
Well may I fill the allotted space,
And answer all Thy great design;
Walk in the works by thee prepared;
And find annexed the vast reward,
The crown of righteousness divine.
When I have lived to Thee alone,
Pronounce the welcome word:  Well done!
And let me take my place above,
Enter into my Master’s joy,
And all eternity employ
In praise, and ecstasy, and love.
                                      Amen.	 ~ 	2 
. Fa m' hyɛ beebi a epɛ, menyɛ
W'adom n' ho nokwar dasefo,
Mindzi dza ahyehyɛ nyina do,
'Nantsew edwuma a Woara ahyehyɛ n' mu;
Ma akatua pa n' aayɛ medze,
Ɔsor tsenenee ahenkyɛw no,
Matsena ase ama Wo nko ara n',
Nkuranhyɛsɛm dɛ: Mbo-na-yɛ!
Na mentsena Wo nkyɛn wɔ sor,
Menhɛn mo Wura N'enyigye mu,
Onnyiewiei nyina minyi W' ayɛw,

MHB 585
1 . RISE UP, O men of God!
Have done with lesser things;
Give heart and mind and soul and strength
To serve the King of kings.
	 ~ 	1 . Nyame asomfo, hom nsoɛr! 
Hom n-tow nsɛmhun ngu!
Hom mfa 'koma, adwen, ndamyɛ
Mbɔsom ahemfo Hen!
Nyame asomfo, hom nsoɛr!

MHB 585
2 . Rise up, O men of God!
The kingdom tarries long;
Bring in the day of brotherhood,
And end the night of wrong.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyame asomfo, hom nsoɛr! 
N'ahendzi ekyim dodow;
Hom mma enuadɔ nda edzi,
Na sum nye manso nkɔ.

MHB 585
3 . Rise up, O men of God!
The church for you doth wait,
Her strength unequal to her task;
Rise up and make her great.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyame asomfo, hom nsoɛr! 
Asɔr no rotweɔn hom;
N'edwuma so ma n'hoɔdzen;
Hom nsoɛr, hom nhyɛ no dzen.

MHB 585
4 . Lift high the cross of Christ!
Tread where His feet have trod;
As brothers of the Son of Man
Rise up, O men of God !	 ~ 	4 
. Hom mma Christ mbeam'dua n'do! 
Hom ntsia N'ananɔm m;
Onyimpa Ba, hom Nua n', dzi kan:

MHB 586
1 . Stay, Master, stay upon this heavenly hill:
A little longer, let us linger still;
With all the mighty ones of old beside,
Near to the aweful Presence still abide;
Before the throne of light we trembling stand,
And catch a glimpse into the spirit-land.
	 ~ 	1 . TWEƆN, Owura, tweɔn wɔ kokwaa yi do ha;
Tsintsim na nye hɛn ntsena ha kakra;
Yɛnye tsetsemba akatakyi nyina
Bɛtsena Nyame bea nwanwa yi do;
Begyina ahopopo m' wɔ kan ahengua enyim,
Abɔ nkɔtsen ahwɛ sunsum wiadze n'.
Na nyi ɔsom No yie n' bɛn No kɛse.

MHB 586
2 . Stay, Master, stay! We breathe a purer air;
This life is not the life that waits us there:
Thoughts, feelings, flashes, glimpses come and go;
We cannot speak them - nay, we do not know;
Wrapped in this cloud of light we seem to be
The thing we fain would grow – eternally.
	 ~ 	2 
. Tweɔn, Owura, tweɔn! Yɛgye mfar pa wɔ ha;
Nnyɛ asetsena a ɔrotweɔn hɛn hɔ n' nye yi;
Adwen, atsenka, nyina dzi akɔnaaba;
Yennkotum aka ho asɛm, yennyim koraa;
Awɔw na kan kyekyer hɛn ma yɛhwɛ
Abɔ nkɔtsen ahwɛ sunsum wiadze n'.

MHB 586
3 . No, saith the Lord, the hour is past, we go;
Our home, our life, our duties lie below.
While here we kneel upon the mount of prayer,
The plough lies waiting in the furrow there.
Here we sought God that we might know his will;
There we must do it, serve Him, seek him still.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze se, Dabi, ber apa ho;
Yɛnkɔ hɛn fie, 'bra na edwuma wɔ ase,
Yebu ntwɛr wɔ mpaabɔ koko do ha n',
Edwumadze wɔ ase hɔ rotweɔn hɛn,
Ha 'i yɛhwehwɛ Nyame ma yeehu N' pɛ;
Hɔ yɛyɛ N' pɛ, som No, hwehwɛ N' ara.

MHB 586
4 . If man aspires to reach the throne of God,
O’er the dull plains of earth must lie the road:
He who best does his lowly duty here,
Shall  mount the highest in a nobler sphere:
At God’s own feet our spirits seek their rest,
And he is nearest Him who serves Him best.	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ nyimpa per du Nyame ahengua n' ho a,
Kwan n' da asaase kusuww yi do ha ara;
Nyia ɔyɛ ne famu ha edwuma dɛ mbrɛ ɔsɛ n',
Wɔbɔkrɔn n' kɛse wɔ sor ahenman m';
Hɛn akra hwehwɛ ahom Nyame N'ananadze,

MHB 587
1 . O LORD of every lovely thing,
The Maker of them all,
Who from the winter’s gloomy  wing 
Dost shed the splendours of the  spring,
 On Thy great name we call.
	 ~ 	1 . O NDZEPA nyina Ewuradze!
Hɔn nyinara Bɔfo,
Ɔwo a ɔpɛber kɛsɛɛ ekyir n'
Etɔ nsu ma nduadzewa fifir,
Yɛbɔ Wo dzin kɛse n'.
Bɔbɔ m' epue W' fie hɔ.

MHB 587
2 .With flowers that through the valleys teach
Thy love and truth divine,
With streams that sing, and hills
that preach, With waves that laugh on every  beach, 
We praise Thee we are Thine.
	 ~ 	2 
. Idua mbɔnsa m' nhyiren do kyerɛ hɛn
Wo sor dɔ na nokwar;
Yɛnye nsu a ɔwor, nkokwaa na
Asorɛkye weɔɔ weɔɔ nyina bɔ m'
Kamfo dɛ yɛyɛ W'dze.

MHB 587
3 . Not The alone because from Thee
 Our life and breath we hold ; 
But Thine because in Christ we see
The grace that sets our spirits free,
And for the truth makes bold.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nnyɛ dɛ yɛyɛ W'dze nko 'siandɛ
Hɛn nkwa na ahom fir Wo;
Yɛyɛ W'dze 'siandɛ adom a ɔyɛ
Hɛn esunsum adehye n' wɔ Christ mu,
Hyɛ hɛn dzen ma nokwar n'.

MHB 587
4 . Count us amongst the radiant choir
That sounds Thy name abroad,
Set in our hands the heavenly lyre,
With songs of love our hearts inspire.
 The mighty love of God.
	 ~ 	4 
. Kan hɛn for a esiarfo no a
Wɔbɔ W' dzin ho dawur n',
Fa sor nsanku kurakura hɛn nsamu,
Na fa ɔdɔ ndwom hyɛ akoma ma,
Nyame dɔ kɛse no a.

MHB 587
5 . Until with those who toiled and dreamed
To build Thy kingdom here,
With those the world hath ne’er esteemed,
With all the hosts of Thy redeemed,
We in Thy home appear.	 ~ 	5 
. Kodu dɛ yɛnye hɔn a wɔberɛe
Tsim W'ahendzi wɔ ha,
Hɔn a wɔyɛ wiadze ntɔmpamu,
Na dɔm a apon hɔn nyina,

MHB 588
1 . AWAKE, awake to love and work,
The lark is in the sky;
The fields are wet with diamond dew,
The worlds awake to cry
Their blessings on the Lord of  life,
As He goes meekly by.
	 ~ 	1 . Nyan, soɛr, yɛ dɔ na edwuma, 
Nnoma asoɛr rusu,
Bɔsu atɔ egu nhaban do,
Wiadze nyina asoɛr
Rihyira, Nkwa Wura Ne Mafo
Ɔhobrɛadzefo No.
Na dza ɔbɛba nyina.

MHB 588
2 . Come, let thy voice be one with theirs,
Shout with their shout of praise;
See how the giant sun soars up,
Great lord of years and days!
So let the love of Jesus come,
And set thy soul ablaze
	 ~ 	2 
. Bra, ma wo ndze mfora hɔn dzem', 
Ka mu bi yi N' ayɛw;
Hwɛ mbrɛ ewia a ofir tsetse,
Asoɛr rehyerɛn dzendzen!
Dɛm na ma Jesus dɔ m'bɔsɔ
Gya wɔ w' akoma mu.

MHB 588
3 . To give and give, and give again,
What God hath given thee;
To spend thyself nor count the  cost,
To serve right gloriously
The God Who gave all worlds that  are,
And all that are to be.	 ~ 	3 
. Fa ma, fa ma, fa ma ara, 
Dza Nyame dze ama wo n';
Hwer woho mma mmbu ho nkontaa,
Enyimnyamm' ara som
Onyame a ɔmaa wiadze yi

MHB 589
1 . GO, labour on: spend, and be  spent,
Thy joy to do the Father’s will:
It is the way the Master went;
Should not the servant tread it still?
	 ~ 	1 . Yɛ edwuma; hwer, ma woho nkɔm', 
Fa dɛw yɛ w'Egya N'edwuma;
Kwan a wo Wura duaa mu nye n';
Na 'wo, somfo, na ennkɛfa do?
Ne ndze esuom dɛ, Hwɛ, mereba!

MHB 589
2 . Go, labour on; ’tis not for nought,
ThY  earthly loss is heavenly  gain:
Men heed thee, love thee, praise thee not;
The Master praises; what are  men?
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛ ara, ɔnnkɛyɛ gyam bi, 
Dza 'yew n' ha n', fa n' mfaso wɔ sor:
Nɛndze nnkamfo w', mmpɛ w', wommbu w' bi;
Owura pen wo; nyimpa nye bɛn?

MHB 589
3 . Go, labour on while it is day;
The world’s dark night is hastening on;
Speed, speed thy work, cast sloth away;
It is not thus that souls are won.
	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛ ara, ber a kan wɔ do yi, 
Wiadze edwumayɛ ber resa:
Mma nnyɛ akwadwerɛ, yɛ w'edwuma ntsɛm;
Wonnsi n' dɛm twe sunsum ekyir.

MHB 589
4 . Men die in darkness at thy side,
Without a hope to cheer the  tomb:
Take up the torch and wave it  wide,
The torch that lights time’s  thickest gloom.
	 ~ 	4 
.  Sum ruku nɛndze a wɔnye W' tse, 
Dɛ wonnyi enyidar wɔ wum';
Ma gya no do, na ka n' kɛse,
Gya a ɔma mbrɛ sum wɔ yɛ kan n'.

MHB 589
5 . Toil on, faint not, keep watch and  pray;
Be wise the erring soul to win;
Go forth into the world’s highway,
Compel the wanderer to come in.
Toil on, and in thy toil rejoice;
For toil comes rest, for exile home;
Soon shalt thou hear the Bridegroom’s voice,
The midnight peal :Behold, I come !	 ~ 	5 
. Yɛ ara, mma mberɛ, weɔn na sɔr, 
Wɔdze nyansa twe kra ekyir;
Sir wiadze bra ne tsempɔn yim'
Pon akobɔfo ma wɔmbra.

MHB 59
1 . GOOD Thou art, and good Thou dost, 
 Thy mercies reach to all, 
 Chiefly those who on Thee trust, 
 And for Thy mercy call; 
 New they every morning are; 
 As father when their children cry, 
 Us thou dost in pity spare, 
 And all our wants supply.
	 ~ 	1 . IYE na eyɛ dza oye,
Ihu obiara mbɔbɔr,
Nkanka hɔn a wɔtwer Wo, Hwehwɛ Wo mbɔbɔrhu;
Anapa wɔyɛ fofor
Dɛ egyanom ber a hɔn mba su, 
Wo mbɔbɔrhu mu 'dze kyɛ, Hɛn ehiadze nyina 'dze ma.

MHB 59
2 . Mercy o er thy works presides; 
 Thy providence displayed 
 Still preserves, and still provides 
 For all Thy hands have made; 
 Keeps with most distinguished care 
 The man who on Thy love depends; 
 Watches every numbered hair, 
 And all his steps attends.
	 ~ 	2 . Mbɔbɔrhu hwɛ Wo ndwuma do; 
Dza 'dze ma hɔn da edzi,
'Da ho kora do na 'dze ma, 'Dza Wo nsa ayɛ nyina;
Edze ahwɛyie kora hɔn do,
Nyia ɔdze noho to Wo dɔ do n', 
 Eweɔn ne tsinhwi nyina,
Ehwɛ n'anamɔn nyina.

MHB 59
3 . Who can sound the depths unknown 
 Of Thy redeeming grace; 
 Grace that gave Thine only Son 
 To save a ruined race? 
 Millions of transgressors poor 
 Thou hast for Jesus sake forgiven, 
 Made them of Thy favour sure, 
 And snatched from hell to heaven.
	 ~ 	3 . Woana botum esusu
Wo nkwagye adom no? 
Adom a ɔmaa Wo Ba kor n' Bae dɛ ɔbɛgye abɔn.
M-bratofo m-pempem,
Jesus ntsi edze akyɛ hɔn,
Hɔn nsa aka W'adom ampa,
Agye hɔn efi hɛll.

MHB 59
4 . Millions more Thou ready art 
 To save, and to forgive; 
 Every soul and every heart 
 Father, now accept of mine, 
 Which now, through Christ, I offer Thee; 
 Tell me now, in love divine, 
 That Thou hast pardoned me.	 ~ 	4 . Epɛ dɛ egye mpempem bio, 
Na edze aakyɛ hɔn;
Ebɛgye ɔkra biara,
'Bɛgye nyimpa biara:
Egya, afei gye medze a
Menam Christ do dze ma Wo no; 
Afei ka n' ɔdɔ m' kyerɛ me 
Dɛ edze akyɛ me.

MHB 590
1 . FORTH in Thy name, O Lord, I go,
My daily labor to pursue,
Thee, only Thee, resolved to know
In all I think or speak or do.
	 ~ 	1 . Ewuradze, Wo dzinm' na misim', 
Mikedzi me daa daa dwuma,
Wo nko na mesua dɛ m'bɔhwɛ W'
Wɔ dza modwen, meka, meyɛm'.
Memfam Wo ho nnantsew nkɔ sor.

MHB 590
2 . The task Thy wisdom hath assigned
O let me cheerfully fulfill,
In all my works Thy presence find,
And prove Thy acceptable will.
	 ~ 	2  
. Edwuma a Wo nyansaa akyerɛ n' 
Ao, ma mempra mo mu nyina nyɛ,
Munhu Wo mo ndwuma nyinam',
Na menyɛ Wo pɛ a ɔsɛ n'.

MHB 590
3 . Thee may I set at my right hand, 
Whose eyes my inmost substance see, 
And on at Thy command, 
And offer all my works to Thee.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma memfa Wo ngyina me nyimfa, 
'Wo a W'enyi tua mo mu nyina,
Na mindzi dwuma a ebɛkyerɛ m',
Muntu mo ndwuma nyina nhyɛ Wo nsa.

MHB 590
4 . Give me to bear Thy easy yoke, 
And every moment watch and pray, 
And still to things eternal look, 
And hasten to Thy glorious day:
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma monsoa Wo kɔndua harhar n' 
Na ber biara mohweɔn, monsɔr,
Na monhwɛ bɛkyebo ndzɛmba,
Nyɛ ntsɛm ndu W'enyimnyam da n' mu.

MHB 590
5 . For thee delightfully employ
whate’er Thy bounteous grace hath given,
And run my course with even joy,
And closely walk with Thee to heaven.	 ~ 	5 
. Biribiara a W'adom dze akyɛ m' 
Ma memfa nsom Wo enyigyem',
Na memfa dɛw nsi m'empire,

MHB 591
1 . Believe not those who say
The upward path is smooth,
Lest thou should stumble in the way,
And faint before the truth.
	 ~ 	1 . MMA nngye hɔn a wɔse sor
Kwan no yɛ trontrom n' nndzi;
Annyɛ a efintsiw kwan no mu,
Na atɔ akɔtɔmborɔnsa.
Mpo a, ebɛnadze mbɔ a?

MHB 591
2 . It is the only road
Unto the realms of joy;
But he who seeks that blest abode
Must all his powers employ.
	 ~ 	2 
. Noara nye kwan kor a
Wɔdze kɔ ahomka bea n';
Nyia ɔpɛ siar bea n' akɔ no
Mfa n'ahom nyina mper.

MHB 591
3 . Arm-arm thee for the fight!
Cast useless loads away;
Watch through the darkest hours of night;
Toil through the hottest day.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mia w'akodze hyia ko n',
Tow adzesoa gyangyan gu,
Weɔn adzesaa sum kadoo mu;
Na berɛ ewia ketee.

MHB 591
4 . To labour and to love,
To pardon and endure,
To lift thy heart to God above,
And keep thy conscience pure-
	 ~ 	4 
. Yɛ edwuma na yɛ dɔ,
Fa kyɛ, sɔw adze nyina 
Ma w'akoma do ma sor Nyame,
Wo tsibowa so nyɛ krɔnn.

MHB 591
5 . Be this thy constant aim,
Thy hope, thy chief delight;
What matter who should whisper blame
Or who should scorn or slight.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ma 'yi nyɛ w' botae daa,
W'enyidar, wo dɛw kor;
Wɔwasa toa w', mmbu w' bi, hyɛ w' fɛr

MHB 592
1 . I HOPED that with the brave and strong
My portioned task might lie;
To toil amid the busy throng,
With purpose pure and high:
But God has fixed another part,
And He has fixed it well;
I said so with my breaking heart,
When first this trouble fell.
	 ~ 	1 . M'ENYI daa kwan dɛ mibenya
Kyɛfa wɔ 'hoɔdzenfo m';
Medze botae a ho tsew, ɔkrɔn
Bɔfora mbɔdzembɔfo m';
Nyame ahyehyɛ kwan kor so,
Na ɔahyehyɛ no yie;
Medze yaw akoma kaa dɛm
Ber a dɛm ɔhaw yɛ bae.
Ma monsom Wo sesei.

MHB 592
2 . These weary hours will not be lost,
These days of misery,
Theses nights of darkness, tempest-tossed,
Can I but turn to Thee,
With secret labour to sustain
In patience every blow,
To gather fortitude from pain,
And holiness from woe.
	 ~ 	2 
. Dɛm ɔfona ber yi nnkɛyew,
Awerɛhow nda 'i mmfi hɔ;
Anago sum, ehumtu ber m',
Wo nkyɛn na mebɛba.
Abotar mu mobɔsɔw 'bra
Mu ekuturku nyina;
M'benya akokodur wɔ yaw mu,
Na krɔnnyɛ wɔ mbusu m'.

MHB 592
3 . If Thou shouldst bring me back to life,
More bumble I should be,
More wise, more strengthened for strife
More apt to lean on Thee;
Should death be standing at the gate,
Thus should I keep my vow:
But, Lord whatever be my fate,
O let me serve Thee now !   Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ edze me san ba nkwa m' bio a,
Mebɛbrɛ moho adze;
Ɔko mu mibenya nyansa
Na ahoɔdzen atwer Wo,
Sɛ owu gyina abowano a,
M'bedzi mo bɔhyɛ do;
Dza ɔbɛba mo do biara,

MHB 593
1 . O’ER the harvest reaped or lost
Falls the eve; our tasks are over:
Purpose crowed or purpose crossed
None may mar and none recover.
Now, o merciful and just,
Trembling lay we down the trust;
Slender fruit of thriftless day,
Father, at Thy feet we lay.
	 ~ 	1 . NDƆBAA n' yɛ bafuu o, mpɛpɛw o,
Adze sa, na edwuma bɔ adze;
Yedu botae n' ho o, yenndu o,
Obi nntum nsɛɛ, na obi nnyɛ n' yie.
Mbɔbɔrhufo tseneneenyi,
Yɛdze dza 'dze maa hɛn n' brɛ W';
Da mu aba kakraba n',
Yɛdze gu W'ananandze.
Beebi a Ewuradze ka hɛn bɔ m'.

MHB 593
2 . Yea, but Thou, o Judge and Lord,
Yea, but Thou, o strong and holy,
Take, and in Thy bosom stored,
By the pure hands changing wholly,
Turn to gold the things of naught,
Failing deed and failing thought:
Love, how faint, yet love, we give;
Thou within Thee make it live.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyew, 'Wo Ewuradze Tsɛmbuafo,
Nyew, 'Wo krɔnkrɔnyi hoɔdzenfo,
Edze esie Wo bo mu no,
Fa Wo nsa krɔnkrɔn no sakyer
Ndzeyɛɛ na adwembɔn; ɔnyɛ
Dza omuo nyina ma ɔndan sika;
Yɛdze hɛn dɔ a ɔyɛ mberɛw 'i
Ma W', ma ɔaatsena ase Wo mu.

MHB 593
3 . Gracious task our heart shall bear
Now, for sweeter call has found us:
Airs of home and days that were
Wind re-woven chains around us;
By the hearthstone, whence we came,
Love shall trim her gentle flame,
Kindling new from undefiled
Ancient altars of the child.
	 ~ 	3 
. Afei, yɛatse frɛ dɛɛdɛw 'i
Hɛn akoma bɛyɛ adom edwuma n';
Fie mframa pa na nda pa n'
Bɛkyekyer hɛn abɔ mu bio;
Mbukyia a yefii ho bae no,
Ɔdɔ gya bɛfram mu bio
Ekenyan hɛn mbofra dɔ n',
Ma yeenya kan fofor bi.

MHB 593
4 . Brothers, whom the wider life
Summons to a man’s endeavour,
Bear our blessing to the strife,
Comrades once and comrades ever:
Yours and ours, one saving star,
Here and on your fields afar,
Lightens from beside the throne,
Where the one Lord makes us one.	 ~ 	4 
. Enuanom, hom a abrabɔ
Nkodzen twe hom dzi dwuma no,
Ɔma yenya no mu nhyira;
Yɛyɛ anyɛnkofo daa daa;
Ha na ekyirkyir mbew kor no,
Hɛn nkwagye woraba kor na
Ofi ahengua n' ho hyerɛn

MHB 594
1 . LORD,in the strength of grace, 
With a glad heart and free, 
Myself, my residue of days, 
I consecrate to Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, W'adom tum n'
Na medze akoma pa
Mutu moho, me nda nkaa nyina,
Dze hyɛ Wo nsa koraa.
M'bɔsom me Nyame nko.

MHB 594
2 . Thy  ransomed  servant,  
Restore to Thee Thy own; 
And, from this moment, 
live or die To serve my God alone.	 ~ 	2 
. W'akowaa a apon me yi,
Medze Woara W'dze ma W',
'Fitsi ndɛ metse ase o, muwu o,

MHB 595
1 . GOD of almighty love,
By whose sufficient grace
I lift my heart to things above,
And humbly seek thy face:
	 ~ 	1 . ƆDƆ kɛse Nyame,
W'adom mbordo no ntsi,
Mema akoma do ma sor ndzɛmba
Na mohwehwɛ W'enyim.
Ewɔ nyina hyɛ me ma.  Amen.

MHB 595
2 . Through Jesus Christ the Just
My faint desires receive,
And let me in thy goodness trust
And to thy glory live.
	 ~ 	2 
. Jesus Christ tseneneenyi,
Tsie m'ebisadze yi,
Na ma montwer W'ayamuyie no,
Ntsena ase nhyɛ W' enyimnyam

MHB 595
3 . Whate’er I say or do,
Thy glory be my aim;
My offerings all be offered through
The ever-blessed name.
	 ~ 	3 
. Monhwehwɛ W'enyimnyam
Wɔ dza meka, meyɛ m';
Mundua dabaa siar dzin no do
Mombɔ m'afɔr nyina.

MHB 595
4 . Jesu, my single eye
Be fixed on thee alone:
Thy name be praised on earth, on high;
Thy will by all be done.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma memfa m'enyi ntsim
Jesu, Wo nko Wo do;
Wonhyira Wo dzin wɔ sor na ase,
Wɔnyɛ W' apɛdze so.

MHB 595
5 . Spirit of faith, inspire
My consecrated heart;
Fill me with pure, celestial fire,
With all Thou hast and art.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Gyedzi Sunsum, kenyan
M'akoma a medze ahyɛ W' nsa;
Sor gya, fa krɔnkrɔnyɛ na dza

MHB 596
1 . MAKE me a captive, Lord,
And then I shall be free;
Force me to render up my sword,
And I shall conqueror be.
I sink in life’s alarms
When by myself I stand;
Imprison me within Thine arms,
And strong shall be my hand.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME, yɛ m' daduanyi,
Afei m'benya ahotɔ;
Hyɛ m' ma mingyaa me nkrantsee mu,
Ama meedzi konyim,
Sɛ mo nko migyina 
Ɔbra n'ehum men me,
Sɛ meda W'abaw mu dze a,
Mo ho bɛyɛ me dzen.
Na oenya Wo mu nkwa.

MHB 596
2 . My heart is weak and poor
Until it master find;
It has no spring of action sure -
It varies with the wind.
It cannot freely move,
Till Thou has wrought its chain;
Enslave it with Thy matchless love,
And deathless it shall reign.
	 ~ 	2 
. M'akoma yɛ mberɛw,
Kɛpem dɛ obohu n' Wura;
Ɔnnyi ndzeyɛɛ pa ho awerɛhyɛm';
