Ɔnye mframa sesa,
Onnyi ne fahodzi,
Gyedɛ atsew no mpokyerɛ m';
Yɛ n' akowaa wɔ Wo dɔ a ɔnnsa n' mu,
Na obedzi hen wɔ nkwa m'.

MHB 596
3 . My power is faint and low
Till I have learned to serve;
It wants the needed fire to glow,
It wants the breeze to nerve;
It cannot drive the world,
Until itself be driven;
Its flag can only be unfurled
When Thou shalt breathe from heaven.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mo tum yɛ har, yɛ mberɛw,
Kɛpem dɛ mesua som;
Ɔhwehwɛ dɛ onya gya a ɔdzɛw,
Ɔpɛ mframa a ɔma ahom;
Onntum nndzi wiadze enyim,
Gyedɛ wɔdze n' bodu;
Wobotum ehim ne frankaa n'
Ber a ebɔhom efi sor.

. Me pɛ nnyɛ medze bi,
Gyedɛ eyɛ n' Wodze;
Sɛ obohu W'adom ahengua enyim a,
Ɔsɛ dɛ ogyaa nedze m';
Ogyina hɔ pintsinn,
Wɔ ɔko dzendzen mu,
Ber a ɔatwer Wo koko mu sɔnn,

MHB 597
1 . TEACH ME, my God and King,
in all things thee to see;
And what I do in anything
to do it as for thee.
	 ~ 	1 . ME Nyame Hen, kyerɛ m'
Munhu W' wɔ biribiara m',
Na biribiara a mebɛyɛ no,
Ɔwo na meyɛ ma W'.
No ho wɔ mfaso pa.

MHB 597
2 . A man that looks on glass,
on it may stay his eye;
Or if he pleaseth, through it pass,
And then the heaven espy.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyimpa a ɔhwɛ ahwehwɛ m' n',
No do na n'enyi tsim;
Anaa sɛ ɔpɛ mpo a, ohwira m',
Ma ntsi ohu heaven.

MHB 597
3 . All may of thee partake:
Nothing can be so mean,
which, with this tincture, For thy sake,
Will not grow bright and clean.
	 ~ 	3 
. Obiara tum dze W' yɛ a,
Biribiara nnkɛyɛ gyan,
Dza ɔnye W' bɔ awɛ n', Wo ntsi
Ɔbɛhyerɛn na n' ho atsew.

MHB 597
4 . A servant with this clause
Makes drudgery divine;
Who sweeps a room, as for thy laws,
Makes that and the action fine.
	 ~ 	4 
. Akowaa a ɔtse dɛm no
Bɛyɛ edwumadzen;
Nyia ɔpra dan m' wɔ Wo mbra ntsi n',
No dwumadzi n' dzi mu.

MHB 597
5 . This is the famous stone
that turneth all to gold;
For that which God doth touch and own,
cannot for less be told.	 ~ 	5 
. Iyi nye ɔbo a agye dzin a
Ɔdan adze nyina mfutuw n';
Dza Nyame suo m' yɛ Nedze no,

MHB 598
1 . HOLY LAMB, who thee confess,
Followers of thy holiness,
Thee they ever keep in view,
Ever ask, what shall we do?
Governed by Thy only will,
All Thy words we would fulfil,
Would in all Thy footsteps go,
Walk as Jesus walked below.
	 ~ 	1 . 'GUAMBAA krɔnkrɔn, W'esuafo
Dzi Wo ho dase pa ara,
Daa hɔn enyi da Wo do,
Wobisa dɛ: Yɛnyɛ dɛn?
Wo pɛ kor a ɔhwɛ hɛn do ntsi
Yebedzi Wo nsɛm nyina do,
Na yɛbɛfa W'akwan do,
Yɛbɛnantsew dɛ mbrɛ eyɛe.
Yebowu dɛ mbrɛ Ɔwo wui n'.

MHB 598
2 . While Thou didst on earth appear,
Servant to Thy servants here,
Mindful of Thy place above,
All Thy life was prayer and love.
Such our whole employment be,
Works of faith and charity;
Works of love on man bestowed,
Secret  intercourse with God.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ber a ipuei wɔ asaase do n',
Eyɛɛ Somfo maa Wo nkowaa;
Edween Wo sor ahenman ho,
Wo bra yɛɛ mpaabɔ nye dɔ,
Dɛm na hɛn dwumadzi nyina tse,
Gyedzi na adzeyɛ ndwuma;
Ekyerɛɛ nyimpa ɔdɔ ndwuma
Na Nyame m' nkitahodzi.

MHB 598
3 . Early in the temple met,
Let us still our Saviour  greet;
Nightly to the mount repair,
Join our praying pattern there.
There by wrestling faith obtain
Power to work for God again,
Power His image to retrieve,
Power,  like Thee, our Lord, to live. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Hom mma yenkyia hɛn Agyenkwa
'Napatutu wɔ asɔrfi m';
Yɛnkɔ bepɔw n' do anafua,
Nkɛka hɛn Wura ho wɔ hɔ.
Yɛmper nnya gyedzi mfa nyɛ
Nyame N'edwuma wɔ hɔ,
Nye tum a yɛdze nya No su,
Na Wo tum a yɛdze tsena ase.

MHB 598
4 . Vessels, instruments of grace,
Pass we thus our happy days
’Twixt the mount and multitude,
Doing or receiving good;
Glad to pray and labour on,
Till our earthly course is run,
Till we, on the sacred tree,
Bow the head and die like thee.	 ~ 	4 
. Yɛdze adom ho ndzɛmba
Twa hɛn enyigye mber mu,
Wɔ nkokwaa na dɔm tutuw m;
Yɛyɛ papa, yɛgye bi;
Yɛdze dɛw bɔ mpaa, yɛ edwuma
Kɛpem dɛ hɛn bra bɔ adze,
Kɛpem dɛ dua krɔnkrɔn n' ho

MHB 599
1 . SOW in thy morn thy seed,
At eve hold not thine hand;
To doubt and fear give thou no heed,
Broadcast it o’er the land.
	 ~ 	1 . DUA W'aba n' anapa,
Yɛ ntsɛm ewimbir no;
Mma mma suro na ekyingye kwan,
Bɔ n' dawur wɔ mbea nyina.
Sor bɛtsea m': Buber fie.

MHB 599
2 . Beside all waters sow,
The highway furrows stock,
Drop it where thorns and thistles grow,
Scatter it on the rock. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Dua n' wɔ esu nkyɛnkyɛn,
Kwantsempɔn ho nsaase m';
Gu no wɔ nsoɛ na ndzɛmbir mu,
Petse no botan do.

MHB 599
3 . The good, the fruitful ground,
Expect not here nor there;
O’er hill and dale, by plots ’tis found:
Go forth then , every where. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Mma nnhwehwɛ asaase pa
Wɔ ha anaa noho;
Wohu no nkokwaa na mbɔnsa m';
Kɔ do gu n' beebiara.

MHB 599
4 . And duly shall appear,
In verdure, beauty, strength,
The tender blade, the stalk, the ear,
And the full corn at length.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mbrɛ ɔtse biara obefir;
Ahoɔfɛw na ahoɔdzen m';
Ɔbɔwowɔ, oenyin afa mba,
Na afei ɔayɛ eburow-mu.

MHB 599
5 . Thou canst not toil in vain;
Cold, heat, and moist, and dry,
Shall foster and mature the grain
For  garners in the sky.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ennkɛberɛ egu kwa da;
Awɔw, 'hyew, nsu na ewia
Bɔbɔ m' ma aba n' eedzi mu
Ama sor edwumayɛfo n'.

MHB 599
6 . Thence, when the glorious end,
The day of God is come,
The angel-reapers shall descend,
And heaven cry : Harvest home!	 ~ 	6 
. Ber a Nyame N'enyimnyam
Da no bodu hɔ no,
Abɔfo edwumafo n' besian,

MHB 6
1 . Eternal Power, whose high abode
Becomes the grandeur of a God,
Infinite lengths beyond the bounds
Where stars resolve their little rounds!
	 ~ 	1 . DOMANKOMA ! Wo sor tsebea
Yɛ fɛw dɛ mbrɛ osɛ Nyame:
Ɔtra wimuwimu n'ekyir noho.
Mbrɛ nworaba wɔkɔ aprɔw.

MHB 6
2 . There while the first archangel sings,
He hides his face behind his wings,
And ranks of shining thrones around
Fall worshiping, and spread the ground.
	 ~ 	2 . Bɔfopanyin rotow W'Ndwom a.
N'enyim suma n'atsaban mu;
Ahotsewfo a woetwa ehyia.
Bom famu wɔ hɔ nyina som Wo.

MHB 6
3 . Lord, what shall earth and ashes do?
We would adore our Maker, too;
From sin and dust to Thee we cry,
The Great, the Holy, and the High !
Earth from afar has heard Thy fame,
	 ~ 	3 . Nyame, dɛtse na nso nyɛ dɛn?
Hɛn so yɛbɔsom hen Bɔfo:
Yefi bɔn na huntuma m'frɛ Wo
Kɛse, Kronkronyi, Abɔso.

MHB 6
4 . Earth from afar has heard Thy fame, 
And babes have learnt to lisp Thy name; 
But O the glories of Thy mind 
Leave all our soaring thoughts behind!
	 ~ 	4 . Wɔatse Wo nka wɔ ekyirkyir,
Mbɔtoaba esua Wo dzin bɔ;
Na Wo nyansaa N'enyimnyam no
Ma hen adwen nyina tɔ sin.

MHB 6
5 . God is in heaven, and men below; 
Be short our tunes, our words be few; 
A sacred reverence checks our songs, 
And praise sits silent on our tongues.	 ~ 	5 . Nyame wo sɔr, nyimpa wɔ ase,
Hɛn ndwom nyɛ tsia, na hɛn nsɛm nsuar,
Wo ho enyidzi sianka hɛn ndwom,
Hɛn ayɛyi ka hɛn anomu.

MHB 60
1 . ERE God had built the mountains, 
 Or raised the fruitful hills; 
 Before He filled the fountains 
 That feed the running rills; 
 In me, from everlasting, 
 The wonderful I AM 
 Found pleasures never wasting, 
 And Wisdom is my name.
	 ~ 	1 . ANSAANA Nyam' bɔɔ mbepɔw,
Nkoko na no do ndua;
Ɔhyɛɛ nsubura amaama,
Ɔpem kɔ nsutsen mu;
Ofi tsetse wɔ mo mu n',
Ɔnwanwanyi MARA
Nyaa enyigye a odzi mu,
Na Nyansa nye me dzin.

MHB 60
2 . When, like a tent to dwell in, 
 He spread the skies abroad, 
 And swathed about the swelling 
 Of oceans mighty flood, 
 He wrought by weight and measure 
 And I was with him then; 
 Myself the Fathers pleasure, 
 And mine, the sons of men.
	 ~ 	2 . Ber a ɔtserɛɛw ɔsor mu no,
Tse dɛ ntamadan no,
Na ɔbɔ po yantamm ho ban,
Siiw po esuyirii ano.
Na osusuu ndzɛmba no,
Nna menye No wɔ hɔ;
Emi nye Egya n' enyigye,
Nyimpa mba yɛ medze.

MHB 60
3 . Thus Wisdom's words discover 
 Thy glory and Thy grace, 
 Thou everlasting lover 
 Of our unworthy race: 
 Thy gracious eye surveyed us 
 Ere stars were seen above; 
 In wisdom Thou hast made us, 
 And died for us in love.
	 ~ 	3 . Dɛm na Nyansa nsɛm hwehwɛ 
W'enyimnyam na W'adom; 
Hɛn a yɛmmfata yi mpo, 
W'adom enyi no hun hɛn
'Nsaana wohum nworaba;
Nyansa mu na ayɛ hɛn
Na dɔ m' na 'wui maa hɛn.

MHB 60
4 . And couldst Thou be delighted 
 With creatures such as we, 
 Who, when we saw Thee, slighted 
 And nailed Thee to a tree ? 
 Unfathomable wonder, 
 And mystery divine; 
 The voice that speaks in thunder 
 Says: Sinner, I am  thine !	 ~ 	4 . Ana W'enyi gyè abɔdze a
Wɔtse dɛ hɛn so ho?
Hɛn a yehum Wo yemmbu W' bi n',
Yɛsɛɛn Wo wɔ dua do?
Nwanwa a wonnhu ano,
Ɔsor esumasɛm;
Aprandaa ndze bɔbɔ mu,
Dɛ ɔbɔn, meyɛ wodze.

MHB 600
1 . O MASTER, let me walk with Thee
In lowly paths of service free;]
Thy secret; help me bear
The strain of toil, the fret of care;
Help me the slow of heart to move
By some clear winning word of love;
Teach me the wayward feet to stay,
And guide them in the homeward way.
	 ~ 	1 . Ao, mo Wura, ma menye W' nnantsew 
Som dwumadzi mbrɛadze kwan mu;
Kyerɛ m' W'esumasɛm, boa m' ma monsɔw,
Dwumadzi ne yaw, dadwen no dur;
Boa me ma memfa dɔ kasa
Mpuhim akoma nyaanyaa bi:
Kyerɛ me ma mingya akobɔfo,
Memfa hɔn nsi sor kwan no mu.
                                               Amen.

MHB 600
2 . Teach me Thy patience; still with Thee
In closer, dearer company,
In work that keeps faith sweet and strong,
In trust that triumphs over wrong,
In hope that sends a shining ray
Far down the future’s broadening way,
In peace that only Thou canst give,
With thee, O Master, let me live!  Amen.	 ~ 	2 
. Kyerɛ m' W'abotar; ma menda ho 
Ntsena Wo fɛkuwbɔ dɛɛdɛwm',
Dwumadzi a ɔhyɛ gyedzi dzen,
Awerɛhyɛm' a odzi bɔn do,
Enyidar a ɔtow nserɛmɛn
Dze hyerɛn nda a ɔreba kwan mu,
Asomdwee a Wo nko ara dze ma,
Mo Wura, ma menye Wo nnantsew mu.

MHB 601
1 . THEY who tread the path of 
      labour follow where my feet have trod;
They who work without complaining
      do the holy will of God;
Nevermore thou needest seek Me;
      I am with thee everywhere;
Raise the stone and thou shalt
      find me; cleave the wood and  I am there. 
	 ~ 	1 . HƆN a wɔyɛ edwuma no,
Wotsiatsia M'anamɔn mu;
Hɔn a wɔyɛ edwuma a wɔnnkasa n';
Wɔyɛ Nyame N' pɛ krɔnkrɔn;
Onnhia dɛ ebɔhwehwɛ M' bio,
Mowɔ wo nkyɛn beebiara;
Pirew ɔbo n' na ibohu Me,
Paa dua n' mu na mowɔ hɔ.
Paa dua n' mu na mowɔ hɔ.

MHB 601
2 .  Where the many toil together, 
        there I am among my own;
Where the tired workman sleepeth, 
        there I am with him alone;
I, the peace that passeth knowledge,
        dwell amid the daily strife;
I, the Bread of heaven, am broken
        in the sacrament of life. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Bea a dɔm yɛ edwuma bɔ mu n'
Na mowɔ mo nkorɔfo mu;
Bea a odwumayɛfo aberɛ ada n',
Na menye no nko wɔ hɔ.
Emi Asomdwee a ɔtra nyimdzee n',
Meka hom ho wɔ nkodzen m',
Emi nye ɔsor Paanoo a
Wɔdze M' ma nkwa sakramɛnt.

MHB 601
3 . Every task, however simple, sets
      the soul that does it free;
Every deed of love and mercy 
      done to man, is done to Me.
Nevermore thou needest seek Me;
       I am with thee everywhere;
Raise the stone and thou shalt find Me; 
       cleave the wood and I am there. 	 ~ 	3 
. Mbrɛ edwuma biara tse no,
Ma ɔkra a ɔyɛ n' fahodzi;
Dɔ na ehumbɔbɔr a wɔkyerɛ
Ma nyimpa n', wɔyɛ ma Me.
Onnhia dɛ ebɔhwehwɛ M' bio;
Mowɔ Wo nkyɛn beebiara;
Pirew ɔbo n' na ibohu me,

MHB 602
1 . FATHER, I know that all my life
Is portioned out for me,
And the changes that are sure to come
I do not fear to see;
But I ask Thee for a present mind,
Intent on pleasing Thee. 
 	 ~ 	1 . M'egya, minyim me bra nyina 
Akyekyɛm' ama me,
Na nsakyer a otwar dɛ ɔba n'
Munnsuro dɛ m'bohu;
Dza meserɛ nye adwendahɔ a
Ɔper sɔ W'enyi daa.
Yɛ adehyedzi koraa.

MHB 602
2 . I ask Thee for a thoughtful love,
Through constant watching wise,
To meet the glad with joyful smiles,
And wipe the weeping eyes,
And a heart at leisure from itself
To soothe and sympathize. 
 	 ~ 	2 
. Meserɛ Wo adwendwen ɔdɔ a 
Ɔyɛ aweɔn ho nyansa,
Dze ma ahomkafo enyigye,
Pata nyinsuwakyifo;
Ɔnye 'koma a ɔpow noho
Na ɔtse ma binom so.

MHB 602
3 . I would not have the restless will
That hurries to and fro,
Seeking for some great thing to do
Or secret thing to know;
I would be treated as a child,
And guided where I go. 
 	 ~ 	3 
. Monnhwehwɛ ɔpɛ ɔnnda hɔ komm, 
Odzi akɔnaaba,
Ɔhwehwɛ akɛsedze ɔayɛ
Na oehu esumasɛm;
Mepɛ dɛ meyɛ abɔtoaba a
Woara gye me taataa.

MHB 602
4 . Wherever in the world I am,
In whatsoe’er estate,
I have a fellowship with hearts
To keep and cultivate,
And a work of lowly love to do
For the Lord on whom I wait. 
	 ~ 	4 
. Wiadze mu mbrɛ m'bɛfa biara, 
No mu dzibew biara,
Menye nkorɔfo edzi nkitaho a
Meper ara ma oeenyin,
Na medze ahobrɛadze nye dɔ
Mayɛ Mo Wura edwuma.

MHB 602
5 . I ask Thee for the daily strength 
To none that ask  denied,
And a mind to blend with outward  life,
Still keeping at Thy side,
Content to fill a little space
If Thou be glorified.
	 ~ 	5 
. Meserɛ daadaa ahoɔdzen a 
Yebisa a hɛn nsa ka n'; 
Ɔnye adwen a onnhwinhwin
Na ɔka Woara ho daa;
Ɔdan mbrɛ mahyɛ W' enyimnyam
Mepen som biara do.

MHB 602
6 . In a service which Thy will  appoints
There are no bonds for me;
For my inmost soul is taught the  truth
That makes Thy children free;
And a life of self-renouncing love
Is a life of liberty. 	 ~ 	6 
. Som biara a Wo pɛ kyerɛ me no 
Mennyɛ ho akɔmpew;
Na me kra ehu nokwar n' a
Ɔyɛ Wo mba adehye n';
Na ɔdɔ etuhoakyɛ bra

MHB 603
1 .  JESUS, let all Thy lovers shine
Illustrious as the sun:
And, bright with borrowed rays divine,
Their glorious circuit run.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, ma W'adɔfo nyina nhyerɛn 
Wɔnhyerɛn fɛɛfɛw dɛ ewia,
Wɔmfa Nyame ewia nserɛmɛn
Ntu hɔn enyimnyam kwan n'.
Nkodu emudzi da n'.

MHB 603
2 . Beyond the reach of mortals, spread
Their light where’er they go;
And heavenly influences shed
On all the world below.
	 ~ 	2 
. Beebiara mbrɛ nyimpa wɔ no
Wɔmma hɔ nyina nhyerɛn;
Na ɔsor ahoɔdzen nyina
Nkata ase ha nyina.

MHB 603
3 . As the bright Sun of righteousness,
Their healing wings display;
And let their luster still increase
Unto the perfect day.	 ~ 	3 
. Dɛm tsenenee ewia hyɛnhyɛn no,
Ntserɛw hɔn 'yarsa ntsaban m'
Na hɔn enyim hyerɛn ntahye

MHB 604
1 . FILL Thou my life, O Lord my God,
In every part with praise,
That my whole being may proclaim
Thy being and Thy ways.
	 ~ 	1 . O EWURADZE, me Nyankopɔn,
Fa ayɛyi hyɛ m' bra ma,
Ama me nyimpa-mu aakyerɛ
Wo subea nye W'akwan.
Menye W' abɔ fɛkuw.

MHB 604
2 .  Not for the lip of praise alone,
Nor e’en the praising heart,
I ask, but for a life made up
Of praise in every part:
	 ~ 	2 
. Nnyɛ m'anofamfa ara nko bi,
Na nnyɛ m'akoma nko,
Na mbom, mibisa abrabɔ bi a
Ayɛyi ahyɛ mu ma.

MHB 604
3 .  Praise in the common things of life,
Its goings out and in;
Praise in each duty and each deed,
However small and mean.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ntonton wɔ adze biara mu,
No kɔsu, ne basu,
Dwumadzi na ndzeyɛɛ suar dɛn mpo a,
'Twar dɛ yeyi W'ayɛw.

MHB 604
4 . Fill every part of me with praise;
Let all my being speak
Of Thee and of Thy love, O Lord,
Poor though I be, and weak.
	 ~ 	4 
. Fa ayɛyi hyɛ mo mu nyina,
Me nyimpadua nkasa
Mfa Wo dɔ na Wo ho, mo Wura,
Kaansa mennsɛ bi mpo a.

MHB 604
5 .  So shalt Thou, Lord, from me, e’en me,
Receive the glory due,
And so shall I begin on earth
The song for ever new.
 	 ~ 	5 
. Mo Wura, ama mo so dɛm yi
Maahyɛ Wo enyimnyam;
Na dɛm na m'bɛhyɛ ase wɔ ha
Matow W'ayɛyi ndwom n'.

MHB 604
6 . So shall no part of day or night
From sacredness be free;
But all my life, in every step,
Be fellowship with Thee.	 ~ 	6 
. Dɛm ntsi adzekyee na adzesaa nyina
'Twar dɛ meyɛ krɔnkrɔn,
Ama manamɔntu biara m'

MHB 605
1 . JESUS, the gift divine I know,
The gift divine I ask of thee;
That living water now bestow -
Thy Spirit and thyself, on me;
Thou, Lord, of life the fountain art;
Now let me find thee in my heart.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, Nyame akyɛdzé a minyim,
Mibisa Wo sor akyɛdze n’;
Hue nkwa nsu gu mo do sesei,
Ͻnye Wo Sunsum na Wo su;
Ewuradze, Ͻwo nye nkwa nsunyiwa n'
Afei ma munhu W' m'akoma m’. '
Wͻ ahosan pa na ͻdͻ mu.

MHB 605
2 . Thee let me drink, and thirst no more
For drops of finite happiness;
Spring up, O well, in heavenly power,
In streams of pure perennial peace,
In joy that none can take away,
In life which shall for ever stay.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma monnom W’ mma nsukͻm nndze m’ bio,
Enyigyé a ͻkye ho nsu no a;
O nkwa nsu, pem bra wͻ sor ntum m’,
Wͻ esutsen a ͻyɛ daa asomdwee m,’
Wͻ dɛw a obiara nnkotum agye m’,
Wͻ ͻbra a obetsim afebͻͻ m’.

MHB 605
3 . Father, on me the grace bestow,
Unblamable before thy sight,
Whence all the streams of mercy flow;
Mercy, thy own supreme delight,
To me, for Jesu’s sake, impart,
And plant thy nature in my heart.
	 ~ 	3 
. Egya hue adorn gu mo do
No ma mindzi bem wͻ W‘enyim,
Bea a 'humbͻbͻr ’sutsen fi pem,
Ehumbͻbͻr, W'apɛdze pa n’,
Jesus dzin mu ntsi fa ma me
Na dua Wo su wͻ m‘akoma m’.

MHB 605
4 . Thy mind throughout my life be shown,
While, listening to the sufferer’s cry,
The widow’s and the orphan’s groan,
On mercy’s wings I swiftly fly,
The poor and helpless to relieve,
My life, my all, for them to give.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mo nkwa nda nyina m' munhu W’adwen.
Bér a metsé abͻbͻfo hͻn su,
Ekunafo, ngyanka, hͻn nkrumsi.
Mutu ehumbͻbͻfo ntsaban do
Kɛgye ehiafo na abͻbͻfo.
Dze mo nkwa, m’adze nyina ma hͻn.

MHB 605
5 . Thus may I show the Spirit within,
Which purges me from every stain;
Unspotted from the world and sin,
My faith’s integrity maintain;
The truth of my religion prove
By perfect purity and love.	 ~ 	5 
. Dɛm na m‘bɛkyérɛ sunsum a ͻwͻ m’ mu.
Ͻtsew mo ho fi bͻn ho koraa.
Wonnhu no wͻ bͻn wiadze yi m’.
Otsim me gyedzi ne nyansaa;
Ͻma m' som no nokwar da edzi

MHB 606
1 . COME, all whoe’er have set
Your faces Zion-ward,
In Jesus let us  meet,
And praise our common Lord;
In Jesus let us still go on,
Till all appear before his throne. 
	 ~ 	1 . Hom a hom enyi tsim 
Zion kwan do, hom mbra,
Wɔmma yɛnyɛ kor nyi
Hɛn Wura No ayɛw;
Wɔmma yentu ntsen Jesus mu
Nkɛpem dɛ yebopue N'enyim.
Hɔ hɛn akwantu bɔbɔ adze.

MHB 606
2 . Nearer, and nearer still,
We to our country come,
To that celestial hill,
The weary pilgrim’s home,
The new Jerusalem above,
The seat of everlasting love. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Mber nyina yɛda ho 
Tow kɔ hɛn man no ho,
Kɔ sor kokwaa no ho
Kwantunyi fonafo fie;
Sor Jerusalem fofor no
Ɔdomankoma dɔ fie no.

MHB 606
3 . The peace and joy of faith
Each moment may we feel;
Redeemed from sin and wrath,
From earth, and death, and hell,
We to our Father’s house repair,
To  meet our elder Brother there.
	 ~ 	3  
. Ma daa nyina yennya 
Gyedzi ho asomdwee,
Dɛ woeyi hɛn efi
Bɔn, wiadze, wu, na hɛllm';
Hɛn yɛbɔkɔ hɛn Egya fie,
Hɔ yeekehyia hɛn Nua panyin n'.

MHB 606
4 .  Our Brother, Saviour, Head,
Our all in all, is he;
And in his steps who tread,
We soon his face shall see;
Shall see him with our glorious friends,
And then in heaven our journey ends. 	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn Nua, Agyenkwa, Tsir 
Ɔyɛ hɛn adze nyin;
Hɛn a yɛka No do n'
Yebohu N'enyim ntsɛm,
Ɔno nye hɛn nsɛfo esiarfo n';

MHB 607
1 . O GOD of Bethel, by Whose hand
Thy people still are fed,
Who through this weary pilgrimage
Hast all our fathers led.
	 ~ 	1 . Bethel Nyame, 'Wo a Wo nkorɔfo 
Dan Wo na wonya dzi;
Ɔwò a igyaa tsetse mpanyin
Hɔn akwantu nyinam'.
Na kyɛpɛn afebɔɔ.  Amen.

MHB 607
2 . Our vows, our prayers, we now present
Before Thy throne of grace;
God of our fathers, be the God
Of their succeeding race.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛdze nsewdzi na mpaabɔ ba 
W'adom ahengua enyim;
Hɛn egyaam Nyame, yɛserɛ Wo, yɛ
Hɔn mba so hɛn Nyame.

MHB 607
3 . Through each perplexing path of life
Our wandering footsteps guide;
Give us each day our daily bread,
And raiment fit provide.
 	 ~ 	3  
. Ɔbra n'akwan nyinara mu 
Gye hɛn anamɔn taataa;
Ma hɛn hɛn daadaa edziban
Na hɛn efuradze so.

MHB 607
4 . O spread Thy covering wings around
Till all our wanderings cease,
And at our Father’s loved abode
Our souls arrive in peace.
	 ~ 	4  
. O trɛ W'atsaban wɔ hɛn do 
Kɔ hɛn akwantu ewiei,
Na hɛn akra eetum edu
Hɛn Egya fie asomdweem'.

MHB 607
5 . Such blessings from Thy gracious hand
Our humble prayers implore;
And Thou shalt be our chosen God,
And portion evermore.	 ~ 	5 
. Dɛm n-hyira na yɛserɛ 
Fi W'adom n-samu;
Yɛdze Wo yɛ hɛn Nyankopɔn

MHB 608
1 . CAPTAIN of Israel’s host and guide,
Of all who seek the land above ,
Beneath Thy shadow we abide,
The cloud of Thy protecting love;
Our strength, Thy grace; our rule,
Thy word our end the glory of the Lord
 	 ~ 	1 . Israel akodɔm Sahen, 
Sor akwantufo hɔn kwangyafo,
Wo nwinwin ase na yɛtse,
Wo dɔ mununkum kata hɛn do;
Hɛn tum, W'adom; hɛn mbra, W'asɛm;
Hɛn ewiei, Ewuradze N'enyimnyam.
Ber a ɔdɔ kɛse bɛn hɛn.

MHB 608
2 . By Thine unerring spirit led,
We shall not in the desert stray,
We shall not full direction need,
Nor miss our providential way;
As far from danger as from fear,
While love almighty love is near.	 ~ 	2 
. Dɛ Wo Sunsum gya hɛn yi dze, 
Yɛnnkɔfom kwan wɔ sar yi do;
Yennhia dɛ daa wɔkyerɛ hɛn kwan,
Yɛnnkɔfom hɛn Nyame kwan no;
Mbusu nye suro bɔkɔ ekyir,

MHB 609
1 . SAVIOUR, like a shepherd lead us;
much we need Thy tender care;
In Thy pleasant pastures feed us,
for our use Thy folds prepare:
Blessèd Jesus, 
Thou hast bought us, Thine we are.
 	 ~ 	1 . GYEFO, gya hɛn dɛ Guanhwɛfo;
Yehia Wo nhwɛdo pa no;
Nyɛn hɛn wɔ W'edzidzibea do;
Isiesie hɛn ma W'edwuma;
Jesus Siarfo,
Atɔ hɛn, yɛyɛ Wodze.
Adɔ hɛn, kɔ do dɔ hɛn.

MHB 609
2 . We are Thine, Thou dost befriend us;
Be the Guardian of our way;
Keep Thy flock, from sin defend us,
Seek us when we go astray:
Blessèd Jesus
Hear, us when we praise and pray.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛyɛ Wodze, fa hɛn nyɛnko,
Yɛ hɛn kwan mu Kwankyerɛfo;
Kora Wo nguankuw, gye hɛn fi bɔn m',
Sɛ yɛfom kwan a, hwehwɛ hɛn:
Jesus Siarfo,
Yɛkamfo W', sɔr Wo a, tsie hɛn.

MHB 609
3 . Thou hast promised to receive us, 
poor and sinful though we be;
Thou hast mercy to relieve us, 
Grace to cleanse, and power to free:
Blessèd Jesus, 
Early let turn to Thee.
	 ~ 	3 
. Abɔ anohoba a 'bɛgye hɛn,
Yɛyɛ abɔn na abɔbɔfo a
'Wɔ ehumbɔbɔr a edze gye hɛn
Na adom a ɔtsew hɛn ho;
Jesus Siarfo,
Ma yɛnyɛ ntsɛm mbra Wo hɔ.

MHB 609
4 . Early let us seek Thy favour;
Early let us do Thy will;
Gracious Lord, our only Saviour,
With Thyself our bosoms fill: 
Blessèd Jesus,
Thou hast loved us- love us still.	 ~ 	4 
. Ma yɛnhwehwɛ W'enyimpa ntsɛm,
Ma yɛnyɛ ntsɛm nyɛ Wo pɛ;
Domfo Ewuradze, hɛn Agyenkwa,
Bra na bɛhyɛ hɛn mu ma;
Jesus Siarfo,

MHB 61
1 . EARTH, with all thy thousand voices, 
 Praise in songs the eternal King;  
 Praise His name, whose praise rejoices 
 Ears that hear and tongues that sing 
 Lord, from each far-peopled dwelling 
 Earth shall raise the glad acclaim; 
 All shall kneel, Thy greatness telling, 
 Sing Thy praise and bless Thy name.
	 ~ 	1 . ASAASE, fa wo ndze mpempem, 
Tow ndwom yi Bɛkyebo ayɛw; 
Yi N'ayɛw, Nyia aso tsie No,
Tɛkyerɛma dze dɛw tow N' ndwom; 
Asaase dze n'enyigye ndwom
Fi ekyirkyir, mbrɛ nyimpa tse,
Bɔkotow aka W'akɛseyɛ,
Atow W'ayɛyi, ehyira W' dzin.

MHB 61
2 . Come and hear the wondrous story, 
 How our mighty God of old, 
 In the terrors of his glory, 
 Back the flowing billows rolled: 
 Walled within the threatening waters, 
 Free we passed the upright wave; 
 Then was joy to Israel's daughters, 
 Loud they sang his power to save.
	 ~ 	2 . Hom mbetsie anwanwasɛm no,
Mbrɛ tsetse Nyame tumfo a
Ɔdaa N'enyimnyam edzi no,
Ɔmaa asorɛkye saan ekyir,
Ɔmaa po nsu daan afasu,
Ɔmaa yɛfaa po bun mu;
Israel mbabaa dzii ehurusi,
Tontoon tum a ɔdze gye nkwa.

MHB 61
3 . Bless the Lord, who ever liveth; 
 Sound His praise through every land, 
 Who our dying souls reviveth, 
 By whose arm upheld we stand. 
 Now upon this cheerful morrow 
 We Thine altars will adorn, 
 And the gifts we vowed in sorrow  
 Pay on joys returning morn.
	 ~ 	3 . Nyia ɔtse ase, hyira Ewuradze; 
Hom nyi N'ayɛw wɔ mbea nyina, 
Ɔdze hɛn akra san ba nkwa mu,
Ne basa suo hɛn mu gyina. 
Yɛdze enyigye dze hɛn afɔr
Bogu W'afɔrmbukyia do,
Anohoba a yɛbɔɔ n' yaw mu n',
Yɛdze dɛw tua n' anapa.

MHB 61
4 . Come, each faithful soul, who fearest 
 Him who fills the eternal throne: 
 Hear, rejoicing while thou hearest, 
 What our God for us hath done; 
 When we made our supplication, 
 When our voice in prayer was strong, 
 Straight we found his glad salvation; 
 And his mercy fills our tongue.	 ~ 	4 . Ɔkra biara a osuro Nyia ɔtse
Ahengua do no Ne mbra n',
Ɔmfa enyigye mbetsie dza
Nyame ayɛ ama hɛn ntotɔserɛ;
Ber a yɛdze hɛn ndze do wɔ mpaabɔ m', 
Yehun N'enyigye nkwagye no,
Yɛkamfo No mbɔbɔrhu.

MHB 610
1 . LEADER of faithful souls, and Guide
Of all that travel to the sky,
Come and with us, even us, abide,
Who would on Thee alone rely,
On Thee alone our spirits stay,
While held in life’s uneven way. 
	 ~ 	1 . Agyedzifo hɔn Kwankyerɛfo a  
lgya sor akwantufo kwan,
Bra na enye hɛn so mbɛtsena,
Yɛpɛ yɛatwer Wo nkotonoo,
Dze hɛn sunsum adan Wo nko
Ber a yɛnam ɔbra kwan mu.
Yeekehyia hɛn Sahen wɔ sor.

MHB 610
2 . Strangers and pilgrims here below,
This earth, we know, is not our place;
And hasten through the vale of woe,
And, restless to behold Thy face,
Swift to our heavenly country move,
Our everlasting home above. 
	 ~ 	2  
. Ahɔho nye amamforafo, 
Wiadze ha ɔnnyɛ hɛn tsenabew;
Na yetwa mbusu bɔnsa yim',
Yɛper dɛ yebohu W'enyim,
Yɛpɛ ntsɛm yeedu hɛn kurom',
Hɛn domakoma fie wɔ sor.

MHB 610
3 . We have no abiding city here,
But seek a city out of sight;
Thither our steady course we steer,
Aspiring to the plains of light,
Jerusalem, the saints’ abode,
Whose founder is the living God. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Yennyi mantsimadze wɔ ha,
Yɛhwɛ kurow a wonnhu no kwan;
Yɛhom do nantsew kɔ noho,
Yereper yeedu kan mbew no do,k
Jerusalem kurow krɔnkrɔn a ɔ
Tsease Nyame ɔkyekyeree n'.

MHB 610
4 . Patient the appointed race to run,
This weary world we cast behind;
From strength to strength we travel on
The new Jerusalem to find;
Our labour this, our only aim,
To find the new Jerusalem. 
	 ~ 	4 
. Yɛdze abotar tu empire n', 
Yegya fona wiadze 'i ekyir:
Fi ahoɔdzenm' kɔ ahoɔdzenm',
Hwehwɛ Jerusalem fofor n';
Hɛn mbɔdzembɔ nyina nye dɛ,
Yenya Jerusalem fofor n'.

MHB 610
5 . Through Thee, who all our sins hast borne,
Freely and graciously forgiven,
With songs to Zion we return,
Contending for our native heaven;
That palace of our glorious King,
We find it nearer while we sing. 
	 ~ 	5 
. 'Wo a asoa hɛn bɔn nyina kɔ, 
Na adom hɛn bɔnfakyɛ kwa,
Yɛnam Wo do kɔ hɛn sor fie,
Yɛdze adwontow yɛsan Zion;
Hɛn 'nyimnyam Hen N'ahenkurow no,
Yɛrotow ndwom nna ɔrebɛn hɛn.

MHB 610
6 . Raised by the breath of love divine,
We urge our way with strength renewed;
The church of the first-born to join,
We travel to the mount of God,
With joy upon our heads arise,
And meet our Captain in the skies. 	 ~ 	6 
. Nyame dɔ ne mfar ma hɛn do
Nu hɛn ahoɔdzen mu kɔ kan
Yɛrokɔ Nyame bepɔw n' do
Yɛakɔdɔm mbakan Asɔr no,
Yɛdze dɛw bɛyɛ abɔtsir

MHB 611
1 . LEAD us, heavenly Father, lead us
O’er the world’s tempestuous sea;
Guard us, guide us, keep us, feed us,
For we have no help but Thee;
Yet possessing every blessing
If our God our Father be.
	 ~ 	1 . Gya hɛn, ɔsor Egya, gya hɛn 
Wɔ wiadze po pramee do,
Gya hɛn, weɔn hɛn, kora hɛn, nyɛn hɛn,
Yennyi boafo dɛ Wo nko,
Naaso yɛwɔ nhyira nyinak
Sɛ Nyame ne hɛn Egya a.
Hwere rennsɛɛ hɛn asomdwee.

MHB 611
2 . Saviour, breathe forgiveness o’er us;
All our weakness Thou dost know;
Thou didst tread this earth before us,
Thou didst feel its keenest woe;
Lone and dreary, faint and weary,
Through the desert Thou dost go.
	 ~ 	2 
. Agyenkwa, fa hɛn bɔn kyɛ hɛn; 
Hɛn mberɛwyɛ nyina Ɔwo nyim;
'Wo dzii hɛn kan nantseew wiadze,
'Wo tsee no mu yaw wenwen;
Eyɛɛ ankonam, dze berɛ,
Na fona kyiin sar no do.

MHB 611
3 . Spirit of our God, descending,
Fill our hearts with heavenly joy,
Love with every passion blending,
Pleasure that can never cloy;
Thus provided, pardoned, guided,
Nothing can our peace destroy.	 ~ 	3 
. Hɛn Nyame Sunsum a 'risian, 
Fa sor dɛw hyɛ 'koma ma,
Na yɛmfa ɔdɔ mbɔ dɔ mu,
Wɔ enyigye a ɔnnsɛɛ dam',
Edom, dze kyɛ, weɔn hɛn yi dze,

MHB 612
1 . LEAD, kindly Light, amid the encircling gloom
      Lead Thou me on!
The night is dark, and I am far from home;
      Lead Thou me on!
Keep Thou my feet; I do not ask to see
The distant scene: one step enough for me.
	 ~ 	1 . Gya m', Kan dɔyɛfo wɔ sum a etwa ehyia yim' 
Gya m' ara kɔ!
'Nago n' yɛ sum, menye fie ntam' so war;
Gya m' ara kɔ!
Weɔn m'anamɔn, mimmbisa dɛ munhu
Mbrɛ kan hɔ tse, namɔn kor ara ma m'.
M'bohu hɔn bio dɛ wɔreserew kyerɛ m'.

MHB 612
2 .  I was not ever thus, nor prayed that Thou
       Shouldst lead me on.
I loved to choose and see my path, but now 
       Lead Thou me on!
I loved the garish day, and, spite of fears,
Pride ruled my will: Remember not past years.
	 ~ 	2  
. Nkyɛ menntse dɛm, monnsɔɔr pɛn dɛ Woara 
Gya m' ara kɔ.
Nkyɛ mefa mo kwan, na muhum', afei
Woara gya m' ara kɔ!
Modɔɔ apɔmpɔmpɛ, na musuro mpo a,
Ntsɛn hyɛɛ me ma, mma nnkaa mfe a-etwam' kɔ.

MHB 612
3 . So long Thy power hath blest me, sure it still
       Will lead me on
O’er moor and fen, o’er crag and torrent, till
       The night is gone;
And with the morn those angel faces smile, 
which I have loved long since, and lost awhile.	 ~ 	3 
. Wo tum ehyira me dze, ɔbɛda ho 
Egya m' akɔ
Atra sar, abo na nsu, 'kɛpem dɛ
Sum yi bɛpa;
Na adze kye a, adɔfo a mayew hɔn n'

MHB 613
1 . LEAD us, O Father, in the paths of peace;
Without Thy guiding hand we go astray,
And doubts  appal, and sorrows still increase;
Lead us through Christ, the true and living way.
	 ~ 	1 . O EGYA, gya hɛn wɔ asomdwee akwan mu;
Wo nsa enngya hɛn abamba a, yɛtɔ gon,
'Kyingye tu hɛn bo, 'werɛhow yɛ kɛse;
Gya hɛn Christ mu, nokwar, nkwa na kwan no.
Kɛpem dɛ hɛn bra bedzi mu Wo mu.   Amen.

MHB 613
2 . Lead us, O Father, in the paths of truth;
Unhelped by Thee, in error’s name we grope,
While passion stains, and folly dims our youth,
And age comes on, uncheered by faith or hope.
 	 ~ 	2 
. O Egya, gya hɛn wɔ nokwar akwan m';
Ammboa hɛn a, yɛtotɔ mfom abaw m',
Akɔndɔ na nsɛmfun sɛɛ hɛn mbabun,
Mpanyinyɛ a gyedzi na enyidar nnyi m' ba.

MHB 613
3 . Lead us, O Father, in the paths of right;
Blindly we stumble when we walk alone,
Involved in shadows of a darksome night,
Only with Thee we journey safely on.
 	 ~ 	3 
. O Egya, gya hɛn wɔ akwan pa no mu;
Sɛ hɛn nko nam a, yefintsiw enyifura m',
Sɛ yɛnam anafua sum kebii mu a;
Wo nkotsee na yɛnye W' tu hɛn kwan sɔnn.

MHB 613
4 . Lead us, O Father, to Thy heavenly rest,
However rough and steep the path may be,
Through joy or sorrow, as Thou deemest best,
Until our lives are perfected in Thee.	 ~ 	4 
. O Egya, gya hɛn kɔ sor ahomgye m',
Mbrɛ kwan n' bun na ne tantan tse biara,
Dɛw anaa yaw mu, dɛ mbrɛ ehwɛ a oye;

MHB 614
1 . HEAVENLY Father, Thou halt brought us
Safely to the present day,
Gently leading on our footsteps,
Watching o’er us all the way. 
Friend and Guide through life’s long journey,
Grateful hearts to Thee we bring ; 
But for love so true and changeless 
How shall we fit praises sing ?
	 ~ 	1 . SOR Egya, Ɔwo na edze hɛn
Aba ndɛ da yi mu sɔnn;
Ekyerɛ hɛn anamɔn kwan berɛww,
Ehwɛ hɛn do wɔ hɛn kwan m'.
Ɔbra m' Damfo na Kwankyerɛfo,
Yɛdze ndaase akoma brɛ W';
Sɛ nnyɛ Wo dɔ a ɔnnsakyer no a,
Nkyɛ yebesi dɛn akamfo W'?
Nye hɛn nkɔ onnyiewiei kan mu.  Amen.

MHB 614
2 . Mercies new and never-failing
Brightly shine through all the past, 
Watchful care and loving-kindness
Always near from first to last, 
Tender love, divine protection
Ever with us day and night ; 
Blessings more than we can number
Strow  the path with golden light.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mbɔrbɔrhu bi a ɔnnkɛpa da
Hyerɛn yie wɔ dza etwa m' mu,
Nhwɛdo mapa na ayamuyie 'dɔ
Bɛn hɛn fi ahyɛse kɔ ewiei,
Ɔdɔ na ntwitwagye mapa 
Wɔ hɛn nkyɛn daa daa nyina;
Nhyira a ɔdɔɔ so a yenntum nnkan
Dze kan hyɛnn ba hɛn kwan mu.

MHB 614
3 . Shadows deep have crossed 
      our pathway ;
We have trembled in the storm ;
Clouds have gathered round so darkly 
That we could not see Thy form :
Yet Thy love hath never left us 
In our griefs alone to be,
And the help each gave the other 
Was the strength that came from Thee.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Isum kebii aba hɛn kwan mu,
Hɛn ho apopo wɔ ehum n' mu;
Mununkum etwa hɛn ho ehyia sunkamm
Ma yennhu Wo su mbrɛ ɔtse:
Naaso Wo dɔ n' nngyaa hɛn hɔ dɛ 
Ankonam wɔ hɛn yaw m' da,
Na mboa a obiara dze maa n' nkyɛnko n'
Yɛ ahoɔdzen a ofir Egya W' nkyɛn

MHB 614
4 . Many that we loved have left us, 
 Reaching first their journey’s end ;
Now they wait to give us welcome, 
Brother, sister, child, and friend.
When at last our journey’s over, 
And we pass away from sight,
Father, take us through the darkness 
Into everlasting light.     Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Nkorɔfo a yɛdɔɔ hɔn kɔ gya hɛn,
Edzi kan wɔ akwantu ewiei;
Wɔrotweɔn ama hɛn akɔaba,
'Nuanom, mba na ndamfo so.
Sɛ ewiei hɛn akwantu n' bɔ adze
Na yɛyew fi enyi do a,
Egya, fa hɛn dua sum kebii m'

MHB 615
1 . GUIDE me, O Thou great Jehovah,
Pilgrim through this barren land;
I am weak but Thou art mighty;
Hold me with Thy powerful hand:
Bread of heaven!
Feed me now and evermore.
 	 ~ 	1 . Gya m', O gya m', Jehovah tumfo, 
Kwantunyi a menam sar do;
Meyɛ mberɛw, 'wo yɛ hoɔdzenfo;
Fa Wo tum nsa n' suo mo mu;
Sor edziban!
Nyɛn me ndɛ na mber nyina.
Na medze m'bɛma Wo daa.

MHB 615
2 . Open Thou the crystal fountain,
Whence the healing stream shall flow;
Let the fiery cloudy pillar
Lead me all my journey through:
Strong deliverer!
Be Thou still my help and shield.
	 ~ 	2  
. Bue nsunyiwa hyɛnhyɛnn n' sesei, 
Mbrɛ yarsa nsu fi pem no;
Ma ogya na mununkum fadum
Ngya m' m'akwantu nyina mu:
Gyefo tumfo!
Yɛ mo mboa na me kyɛm daa.

MHB 615
3 . When I tread the verge of Jordan;
Bid my anxious fears subside;
Death of deaths, and hell’s destruction,
Land me safe on Canaan’s side:
Songs of Praises 
I will ever give to Thee.	 ~ 	3 
. Na mudu Jordan nkɔnkɔnoa a, 
Bɔ mo suro ham ma ɔnhera;
Wu no kumfo, hɛll ne sɛɛfo,
Fa me kodu Canaan sɔnn.
Ayɛyindwom

MHB 616
1 . THROUGH the night of doubt and sorrow,
Onward goes the pilgrim band,
Singing songs of expectation,
Marching to the promised  land.
	 ~ 	1 . EKYINGYE na awerɛhow anafua m',
Kwantufo kuw no pem do,
Wɔtow enyidar ndwom ahorow
Dze kɔ bɔhyɛ asaase do.
Ɔberɛ na sum bɔbɔ adze.

MHB 616
2 . Clear before us through the darkness
gleams and burns the guiding light;
Brother clasps the hand of brother,
Stepping  fearless through the night.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yehu kan a ɔkyerɛ hɛn kwan no
Wɔ hɛn enyim anafuasum m';
Onua suo no nua ne nsamu
'Kododur m' dua sum no mu.

MHB 616
3 . One the light of God’s own presence
O’er His ransomed people shed,
Chasing far the gloom and terror,
Brightening all the path we tread:
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyame N' kan wɔ hɛn ho yɛ kor,
Ɔhyerɛn wɔ No nkorɔfo do;
Ɔpam sum na suro kɔ ekyir,
Ɔhyerɛn wɔ hɛn kwan mu.

MHB 616
4 . One the object of our journey,
One the faith which never tires,
One the earnest looking forward,
One the hope our God inspires:
	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn akwantu botae yɛ kor,
Hɛn gyedzi a ɔmmbɔ adze yɛ kor,
Dza hɛn enyi da kwan yɛ kor,
'Nyidar kor a ofir Nyame.

MHB 616
5 . One the strain that lips of thousands
Lift as from the heart of one;
One the conflict, one the peril,
One the march in God begun:
	 ~ 	5 
. M-pempem hɔn ntseamu n' yɛ kor
Dɛ mbrɛ ofi akoma kor mu;
Aperdzi kor na mbusu kor,
Nyame m' nserabɔ kor hyɛ ase.

MHB 616
6 . One the gladness of rejoicing
On the far eternal shore,
where the one almighty Father
Reigns  in love for evermore.
	 ~ 	6 
. Ekyirkyir onnyiewiei mpoano
No mu dɛw na osebɔ kor,
Hɔ na Egya tumfo kor no
Dzi hen wɔ dɔ m' afebɔɔ.

MHB 616
7 . Onward, therefore, pilgrim brothers,
Onward with the Cross our aid!
Bear its shame, and fight its battle,
Till we rest beneath its shade.
 	 ~ 	7 
. Hom nkɔ do, 'nuanom akwantufo,
Hom mfa mbeamudua no nduom!
Mma hom mmfɛr, hom nko ɔko no
Nkɛpem dɛ yɛbɔhom nwin m'.

MHB 616
8 . Soon shall come the great awaking,
Soon the rending of the tomb;
Then the scattering of all shadows,
And  the end of toil and gloom.	 ~ 	8 
. Ɔnnkɛkyɛr, wɔsoɛr da n' bɛba
Na woebuebue ndakamaa;
Afei sunsum nyina bɔhwetse,

MHB 617
1 . BRIGHTLY gleams our banner, 
Pointing to the sky,
Waving  on Christ’s soldiers 
To their home on high.
Marching through the desert,
Gladly thus we pray,
Still with hearts united
Singing  on our way.
     Brightly gleams our banner,
     Pointing to the sky,
     Waving on Christ’s soldiers 
     To  their home on high.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN frankaa kan hyerɛn,
Na ɔkyerɛ sor,
'Nyam ma Christ nsordaafo
Dze kɔ hɔn sor fie.
Yɛdze enyigye bɔ mpaa
Bɔ nsera wɔ sar n' do.
Yɛdze akoma kor
Tow ndwom wɔ hɛn kwan m'.
Nyɛ ndwom a ɔmmbɔ adze

MHB 617
2 . Jesus, Lord and Master, 
At Thy sacred feet,
Here, with hearts rejoicing, 
See Thy children meet.
Often have we left Thee,
Often gone astray;
Keep us, mighty Savior,
In  the narrow way.
	 ~ 	2 
. HƐN frankaa kan hyerɛn,
Na ɔkyerɛ sor,
'Nyam ma Christ nsordaafo
Dze kɔ hɔn sor fie.

MHB 617
3 . All our days direct us
In the way we go;
Lead us on victorious
Over every foe:
Bid Thine angels shield us
When the storm-clouds lower;
Pardon Thou and save us
In the last dread hour.
	 ~ 	3 
. Jesus, Ewuradze,
W'ananadze ha
Wo mba a woridzi dɛw
Etwa ehyia ha.
Mpɛn pii na yeefi W' nkyɛn
Na yɛatɔ dɔnsuar;
Kora hɛn, Agyenkwa tumfo,
Wɔ kwan tseabaa n' mu.

MHB 617
4 . Then with saints and angels
 May we join above, 
Offering prayers and praises 
At Thy  throne of love.
When the march is over,
Then comes rest and peace,
Jesus in His beauty,
Songs  that never cease.	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn nda nyina m' kyerɛ hɛn
Kwan a yɛmfa do;
Gya hɛn konyim mu ara
Wɔ atamfo nyina do;
W'abɔfo nwowaw hɛn
Ber a mbusu abɛn;
Fa kyɛ hɛn na gya hɛn
Wɔ da bɔn no mu.

MHB 618
1 . O HAPPY band of pilgrims,
If onward ye will tread,
With Jesus as your fellow,
To Jesus as your Head!
 	 ~ 	1 . ENYIGYE akwantufo kuw,
Sɛ hom bɔkɔ hom enyim a,
Hom mfa Jesus ndzi hom kan,
Mma Jesus nyɛ hom Tsir.
Bɛma hom dza ɔsom bo.

MHB 618
2 . O happy if ye labour
As Jesus did for men:
O happy if ye hunger
As Jesus hungered then.
	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ hom fona ma nkorɔfo dɛ
Jesus a, hom dzi dɛw;
Sɛ kɔm dze hom dɛ Jesu a,
Ɔno hom so dzi dɛw.

MHB 618
3 . The Cross that Jesus carried,
He carried as your due:
The crown that Jesus weareth,
He weareth it for you.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Mbeamudua a Jesus soae no,
Hom ara ntsi na ɔsoae;
Ahenkyɛw a Jesus soae no,
Hom ara ntsi na ɔsoae.

MHB 618
4 . The faith by which ye see Him,
The hope in which ye yearn,
The love that through all troubles
To Him alone will turn,
	 ~ 	4 
. Gyedzi a hom dze hu No n',
Enyidar a hom dze per n',
Ɔdɔ a ɔhaw dan hwɛ No nko n'
Bɛsan akɔ No nko hɔ.

MHB 618
5 . The trials that beset you,
The sorrows ye endure,
The manifold temptations
That death alone can cure:
	 ~ 	5 
. Nkodzen a ɔhaw hom adwen,
Awerɛhow a hom dzi no,
Nsɔhwɛ beberee a hom kɔ mu n',
'Wu nko na otum twa do.

MHB 618
6 . What are they but his jewels
Of right celestial worth?
What are they but the ladder
Set up to heaven on earth?
	 ~ 	6 
. Ebɛnadze na ɔsom bo dɛ
N'egudze a ɔwɔ sor hɔ n'?
Ebɛnadze na ɔkyɛn
Atwer a wɔfow kɔ sor?

MHB 618
7 . O happy band of pilgrims,
Look upward to the skies,
Where such a light affliction
Shall win you such  a prize.	 ~ 	7 
. Enyigye akwantufo kuw,
Hom mma hom enyi do sor,
Hɔ na hom haw kakra yi

MHB 619
1 . FORWARD! be our watchword,
Steps and voices joined;
Seek the things before us,
Not a look behind;
Burns the fiery pillar 
At our army’s head;
Who shall dream of shrinking, 
By our Captain led?
    Forward through the desert,
    Through the toil and fight;
    Jordan flows before us,
    Zion beams with light.
 	 ~ 	1 . WONDUOM! Hɛn asɛm nye n';
'Namɔn na ndze mbɔ m',
Hwehwɛ dza ɔwɔ enyim,
Yenntwa hɛn kɔn 'kyir;
Ogya fadum no dzɛw
Dzi nsordaafo kan;
Hɛn Sahen dzi enyim yi,
Woana bɔbɔ hwea?
Hom mfa sar n' do nkɔ enyim,
Wɔ fona nye ɔko m';
Jordan pem wɔ hɛn enyim,
Zion ne kan hyerɛn.
Hom kan man no mu.

MHB 619
2 . Glories upon glories
Hath our God prepared,
By the souls that love Him
 One day to be shared;
Eye hath not beheld them
Ear hath never heard,
Nor of these hath uttered
Thought or speech a word.
   Forward, ever forward,
   Clad in armour bright,
   Till the veil be lifted, 
   Till our faith be sight.
	 ~ 	2 
. Enyimnyam mbordo koraa
Na Nyame esiesie,
Da kor ɔdze bɛma
Akra a wɔdɔɔ No n';
Enyi nnhun hɔn pɛn mpo,
Asowa nntsee da,
Wɔnnkaa hɔn ho asɛm,
Wɔnndween hɔn ho so,
Hom nduom, hom nkɔ hom enyim!
Hom nhyɛ akontar hyɛnn
Nkɛpem dɛ woyi enyim a
Yehu hɛn gyedzi.

MHB 619
3 . Far o’er yon horizon 
Rise the city towers,
Where our God abideth; 
That fair home is ours:
Flash the gates with jasper,
Shine the gates with gold,
Flows the gladdening river,
Shedding joys untold.
    Thither, onward, thither,
    In the Spirit’s might;
    Pilgrims to your country, 
    Forward into light.	 ~ 	3 
. Borɔ ekyirkyir noho
Kuropɔn abantsen pue
Mbrɛ hɛn Nyame tse no;
Fie fɛɛfɛw n' hɛndze a;
Nhwehwɛ mbobow ara nko,
Sika hyerɛn n'abrɔn m',
Ahomka esutsen pem
Dze dɛw a wɔnnka ba.
Hom nduom, hom nkɔ hom enyim!
Wɔ Sunsum No tum m';
Akwantufo, hom nkɔ

MHB 62
1 . O LOVE, how deep, how broad, how high! 
 It fills the heart with ecstasy 
 That God, the Son of God, should take 
 Our mortal form, for mortals sake.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆDƆ, mbrɛ osi dɔ, tserɛw ɔkrɔn!
Ɔdze dɛw hyɛ akoma ma,
Dɛ Nyame Ba, Nyame bɛfa
Hɛn nyimpadua wɔ nyimpa ntsi.

MHB 62
2 . He sent no angel to our race, 
 Of higher or of lower place, 
 But wore the robe of human frame, 
 Himself, and to this lost world came.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔannsoma ɔbɔfo biara
Wɔ bea a ɔkrɔn anaa osuar,
Nankasa faa hɛn nyimpadua,
Ɔbaa wiadze a ayew yi mu.

MHB 62
3 . For us he was baptized and bore 
 His holy fast, and hungered sore; 
 For us temptations sharp he knew; 
 For us the tempter overthrew.
	 ~ 	3 . Wɔbɔɔ no esu wɔ hɛn ntsi,
Odzii mbuada, ɔkɔm dzee No;
Hɛn ntsi ohyiaa nsɔhwɛ yaayaw,
Ɔkaa sɔhwɛfo n' gui maa hɛn.

MHB 62
4 . For us He prayed, for us He taught, 
 For us His daily works He wrought: 
 By words and signs and actions thus 
 Still seeking, not Himself, but us.
 	 ~ 	4 . Ɔbɔɔ mpaa maa hɛn, kyerɛkyerɛɛ hɛn, 
Ɔyɛɛ Ne daa edwuma maa hɛn:
No dwumadzi, Ne nsɛnkyerɛdze,
Ne nsɛm nyina mu, ɔhwehwɛɛ hɛn.

MHB 62
5 . For us to wicked men betrayed, 
 Scourged, mocked, in purple robe arrayed, 
 He bore the shameful cross and death, 
 For us at length gave up his breath.
	 ~ 	5 . Woyii No hyɛɛ abɔnfo nsa,
Wɔkaa No mpire, dzii No ho fɛw,
Ɔsoaa 'nyimguase mbeamudua,
Hɛn ntsi oguu ohomtsen, wui.

MHB 62
6 . For us he rose from death again; 
 For us He went on high to reign; 
 For us He sent His Spirit here 
 To guide, to strengthen, and to cheer.
	 ~ 	6 . Ɔsoɛɛr fii wu mu bio maa hɛn;
Ɔfowee kɔr sor ma odzi hen;
Ɔsomaa No Sunsum brɛɛ hɛn
Dɛ ongya hɛn na ɔnhyɛ hɛn dzen.

MHB 62
7 . To him whose boundless love has won 
 Salvation for us through His Son, 
 To God the Father, glory be, 
 Both now and through eternity.  Amen.	 ~ 	7 . Nyia No dɔ nnyi mbanano agye
Nkwagye ama hɛn Ne Ba mu;
Enyimnyam nka Nyame Egya,
Sesei na nfesantsen nyina. 	  Amen.

MHB 620
1 . WHO would true valour see,
Let him come hither;
One here will constant be,
Come wind, come weather;
There’s no discouragement
Shall make him once relent
His first avowed intent
To be a pilgrim.
	 ~ 	1 . NYIA ɔpɛ akokodur n',
Ɔmbra enyim mbɔhwɛ;
Onyia no begyina daa,
Ehum na aahow mbra;
Abagura bi nnyi hɔ a
Ɔbɛma oeegyaa sua,
No suakan dɛ ɔbɛyɛ
Ɔkwantunyi no.
Ayɛ kwantunyi.

MHB 620
2 . Whoso beset him round
With dismal stories,
Do but themselves confound;
His strength the more is.
No lion can him fright.
He’ll with a giant fight,
But he will have the right
To be a pilgrim.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɔn a wɔkeka nsɛmbɔn
Twa no ho aprɔw n',
Wogu hɔn enyim ase,
N'ahoɔdzen mu piw,;
Gyata bi nnkopuw no,
Ɔnye ɔkraban bɔko,
Na obenya ndzinoa dɛ
Ɔyɛ kwantunyi.

MHB 620
3 . Hobgoblin nor foul fiend
Can daunt his spirit;
He knows he at the end
Shall life inherit.
Then, fancies, fly away;
He’ll  fear what men say;
He’ll labour night and day
To be a pilgrim.	 ~ 	3 
. Sunsum bɔn bi nnyi hɔ a
Obogura n'abaw;
Onyim dɛ ewiei no
Obenya daa nkwa.
Nsusuhum nyina boguan;
Onnkosuro dza wɔka
Ɔbɛyɛ edwuma ber nyina

MHB 621
1 . JESUS the good Shepherd is;
Jesus died the sheep to save;
He is mine, and I am His;
All I want in him I have,
Life, and health, and rest, and food,
All the plenitude of God. 
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS yε Oguanhwεfo pa;
Jesus wui gyee nguan no nkwa;
Ɔyε m’dze, meyε Nedze;
Dza mihia No mu n’ minya,
N-kwà ahomgye edziban, ’
Nyame mu ndzepa biara.
Wo sor fie a ɔwɔ hɔ daa!

MHB 621
2 . Jesus loves and guards His own;
Me in verdant pastures feeds;
Makes me quietly lie down,
By the streams of comfort leads:
Following Him where’er He goes,
Silent joy my heart o’erflows. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Jesus dɔ nà ɔweɔn Nedze,
Ɔnyεn m’ ’dzidzflaea pa do,
Ɔma me da famu dzinn,
Ogya m’ kɔ abodwee nsu ho:
Menye No kɔ beebiara a,
M’akoma mu dεw bu do.

MHB 621
3 . He in sickness makes me whole,
Guides into the paths of peace;
He revives my fainting soul,
Stablishes in righteousness;
Who for me vouchsafed to die,
Loves me still-I know not why! 
	 ~ 	3 
. Meyar a ɔma metsé apɔw,
Ogya me kɔ asomdwee mu;
Okenyan me kré a ɔahaw,
Ɔma tsénenee tsim mo mu;
Ɔno a obowui gyee me n’,
Ɔda ho dɔ m’ - menntsé ase!

MHB 621
4 . Love divine shall still embrace,
Love shall keep me to the end;
Surely all my happy days
I shall in Thy temple spend,
Till I to Thy house remove,
Thy eternal house above ! 	 ~ 	4 
. Nyame dɔ bεda ho efua m’,
Ɔda bohwε m’ do akɔ ewiei;
M’enyigye nda nyinara
Mibedzi no W’asɔrfi m’,
Kεpem dε m’botù aba W’ fie,

MHB 622
1 . Show me the way, O Lord,
And make it plain;
I would obey Thy Word,
Speak yet again;
I will not take one step until I know
Which way it is that Thou wouldst have me go.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, kyerɛ m' kwan
Ma ɔnda hɔ;
Mibetsie W'asɛm no,
San si do bio;
Munntu anamɔn kor gyedɛ muhu
Kwan kor a Ɔwoara bɛkyerɛ me.
M'awerɛkyekyer, Agyenkwa, Kwangyafo?

MHB 622
2 . O Lord, I cannot see!
Vouchsafe me light:
The mist bewilders me,
Impedes my sight:
Hold Thou my hand, and lead me by Thy side;
I dare not go alone: be Thou my Guide.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewuradze, munnhu adze,
Yɛ kan ma me;
Fua no tu m'akoma,
Munnhu adze:
Suo me nsamu na ma mindzi Wo nkyɛn,
Mma mo nko monnkɔ, yɛ me Kwangyafo.

MHB 622
3 . I will be patient, Lord,
Trustful and still;
I will not doubt Thy Word;
My hopes fulfil:
How can I perish, clinging to Thy side,
My Comforter, my Saviour,and my Guide? 	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, abotar m'
M'bɔtwer, etsim;
Menngye W'asɛm ho kyim,
M'enyidar tsim;
Metar Wo ho a mebɛyɛ dɛn ahera,

MHB 623
1 . I DARED not hope that Thou
Wouldst deign to come
And make this lowly heart of mine Thy home,
That Thou wouldst  deign, O King of kings, to be
E’en for one hour a sojourner in me:
Yet art Thou always here to help, and bless,
And lift the load of my great sinfulness.
	 ~ 	1 . MENYE annda dɛ ebɛba abɛfa
M'akoma bɔbɔfo 'i ayɛ Wo fie,
Dɛ Ɔwo ahemfo Hen bɛba abɔsoɛ
Mo mu edzi bɛyɛ dɔnhwer kor mpo;
Naaso ewɔ ha daa dɛ ibehyira m',
Aboa m' na eyi mo bɛn adzesoa n'.
Mbom eweɔn Wo tsenabea wɔ m'akoma m'.

MHB 623
2 . I dared not ever hope for such a Guide
To walk with me my faltering steps beside,
To help me when I fall, and, when I stray,
Constrain me gently to the better way :
Yet art Thou always at my side to be
A Counsellor and Comforter to me.
	 ~ 	2 
. M'enyi annda dɛ m'benya W' Kwankyerɛfo,
Ma aagye m' taataa, atsentsen m'anamɔn;
Sɛ mohwe ase a, suo mo mu, motɔ gon a,
Gya m' nkakrankakra kɔ kwan pa no mu.
Naaso ewɔ me nkyɛn aber biara,
Eyɛ me Pamfo na Werɛkyekyefo.

MHB 623
3 . I do not always go where Thou dost lead,
I do not always thy soft whispers heed;
I follow other lights, and , in my sin,
I vex with many a slight my Friend within :
Yet dost thou not, though grieved, from me depart,
But guardest still Thy place within my heart.	 ~ 	3 
. Monnkɔ mbrɛ Ɔwo gya me daa nyina,
Mennyɛ aso mma Wo ndze a ewasa m' no;
Meka kan afofor bi do, na mo bɔn m',
Kakraabi na mehyɛ m' Nyɛnko ebufuw;
Naaso idzi yaw mpo a, inngya me hɔ,

MHB 624
1 . JESUS, still lead on,
Till our rest be won,
And, although the way be cheerless,
We will follow calm and fearless,
Guide us by Thy hand 
To our fatherland.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, dzi hɛn kan,
Ma yennya ahomgye,
Na kwan no nnyɛ enyigye mpo a,
Yɛbɛka W' do berɛww a yennsuro;
Fa Wo nsa gya hɛn
Kɔ hɛn Egya fie.
Bodu hɛn Egya fie.  Amen.

MHB 624
2 . If the way be drear,
If the foe be near,
Let no faithless fears o’ertake us,
Let not love and hope forsake us,
For through many a foe 
To our home we go.
	 ~ 	2 
.  Sɛ kwan yɛ hu dɛn,
Sɛ atamfo bɛn a,
Mma suro gyangyan bi mmen hɛn,
Mma ɔdɔ na enyidar mmbɔ hɛn;
Yɛnam atamfo m'
Kɔ hɛn efiefi.

MHB 624
3 . When we seek relief 
From a long felt grief;
When temptations come alluring,
Make us patient and enduring;
Show us that bright shore 
Where we weep no more.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ber a yɛper ahotɔ
Fi yaw dzendzen mu,
Ber a nsɔhwɛ fofor hyɛ hɛn do n',
Owura, ma hɛn abotar ndzi mu,
Kyerɛ hɛn bea hyɛnhyɛnn a
Yennsu wɔ hɔn bio n'.

MHB 624
4 .  When sweet earth and skies
Fade before our eyes;
When through death, we look to heaven,
And our sins are forgiven,
From Thy bright abode,
Call us home to God.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ber a 'saase na wimu
Yew hɛn enyi do n',
Ber a yɛnam 'wu m' hwɛ heaven kwan
Na wɔdze hɛn bɔn nyina akyɛ hɛn, 
Fi Wo kan man n' mu
Frɛ hɛn Nyame fie.

MHB 624
5 . Jesus, still lead on, 
Till our rest be won;
Heavenly Leader, still direct us,
Still support, control, protect us,
Till we safely stand 
In our fatherland. Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Jesus, dzi hɛn kan,
Ma yennya ahotɔ;
Sor Kandzifo, kɔ do gya hɛn,
Wowaw, weɔn hɛn, kyekye hɛn werɛ, 
Kɛpem dɛ hɛn nyina

MHB 625
1 . I To the hills will lift mine eyes,
From whence doth come mine aid;
My safety cometh from the Lord,
Who heaven and earth hath made.
	 ~ 	1 . MEMA m'enyi do hwɛ mbepɔw n',
Hɔ na mo mboa fi ba;
Me bambɔ fi Ewuradze hɔ ba,
Ɔno a ɔbɔɔ sor na ase.
Nyame bɔhwɛ afebɔɔ.  Amen.

MHB 625
2 . Thy foot He’ll not let slide, nor will
He slumber that thee keeps:
Behold, He that keeps Israel,
He slumbers not, nor sleeps.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔremma w'anan mm-patser,
Na ɔronntɔ nkom so:
Hwɛ, Nyia ɔhwɛ Israel do no,
Ɔnntɔ nkom, na ɔnnda.

MHB 625
3 . The Lord thee keeps; the Lord thy shade
On thy right hand doth stay:
The moon by night thee shall not smite,
Nor yet the sun by day.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze nkora w' No nwin ase,
Ongyina w'abanyimfa;
Bosoom nnkɛsɛɛ wo anafua,
Ewia nnsɛɛ w' adzekyee.

MHB 625
4 . The Lord shall keep thy soul; He shall
Preserve thee from all ill:
Henceforth thy going out and in
God keep for ever will.	 ~ 	4 
. Ewuradze bɔkora wo kra do,
Ɔbɔhwɛ wo yar ber m';
Ɔdzekɔ 'i w'edzifir na mbae

MHB 626
1 . I WANT a principle within 
Of jealous, godly fear,
A sensibility of sin, 
A pain to feel it near. 
	 ~ 	1 . MOROHWEHWƐ nyamesuro
Nhyehyɛɛ bi wɔ mo mu,
Ɔnye bɔn ho adwendahɔ a
Ɔma metse ne yaw.
Bɔgya a ɔma ahosan.

MHB 626
2 . I want the first approach to feel 
Of pride or wrong desire,
To catch the wandering of my will, 
And quench the kindling fire.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mepɛ kwan a m'bɛfa do metu
N-tuw na akɔndɔbɔn,
Medze esiw 'kwankwambɔ pɛ kwan,
Medze bodum bɔn gya.

MHB 626
3 . That I from Thee no more may part, 
No more Thy goodness grieve,
 The filial awe, and fleshly heart, 
The tender conscience give.
	 ~ 	3 
. Dɛ monnkɔtɔ dɔnsuar mmfi W' hɔ n',
Mennka W'ayamuyie fi n',
Ma m' etsidaa wansawansa
Na enyidahɔ akoma.

MHB 626
4 . Quick as the apple of an eye, 
O God, my conscience make;
Awake my soul when sin is nigh, 
And keep it still awake.
	 ~ 	4 
. Nyame, ma m'adwendahɔ nyɛ
Dza obiara enyi gye ho;
Na nyan me kra, ber a bɔn abɛn,
N'enyi do ntsetsew no.

MHB 626
5 . O may the least omission pain
My reawakened soul,
And drive me to that blood again 
Which makes the wounded whole.    	 ~ 	5 
. O nkyɛ me kra a wɔatsetse n' yie 'i
Eehu dza ofura adwen,
Ɔaatwe m' akɔ bɔgya no ho,

MHB 627
1 . HOW happy every child of grace,
Who knows his sins forgiven!
This earth, he cries, is not my place,
I seek my place in heaven!
A country far from mortal sight;
Yet O by faith I see
The land of rest, the saints’ delight,
The heaven prepared for me. 
	 ~ 	1 . MBRƐ adom ba a enyi si gye
Wɔ no bɔnfakyɛ ho a!
Osu dɛ: Me fie nnyi ase ha,
Meper me fier wɔ sor!
Ɔman a nyimpa enyi nnhu,
O menam gyedzi m' hu;
'Homgye man, 'hotsewfo enyigye,
Heaven a woesiesie ama m'.
Hyɛ hɛn nyimpadua ma.

MHB 627
2 . A stranger in the world below,
I calmly sojourn here;
Nor can its happiness or woe
Provoke my hope or fear:
Its evils in a moment end,
Its joys as soon are past;
But O the bliss to which I tend
Eternally shall last. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Meyɛ hɔho wɔ wiadze ha,
'Hobrɛadze m' mosoɛ ha;
No mu enyigye na fona
Nnkenyan enyidar na suro;
Mber tsiabaa siw n'adzesɛɛ ano,
No mu dɛw twa mu ntsɛm;
O mbom ahomka a meka do n'
Betsim hɔ afebɔɔ.

MHB 627
3 . To that Jerusalem above
With singing I repair;
While in the flesh, my hope and love,
My heart and soul, are there:
There my exalted Saviour stands,
My merciful High-priest,
And still extends His wounded hands
To take me to his breast. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Jerusalem a ɔwɔ sor hɔ n',
Menam adwontow m' kɔ hɔ;
Metse ase yi, m'enyidar, dɔ,
M'akoma, kra, wɔ hɔ.
M'Agyenkwa a wɔakrɔn N' gyina hɔ,
Sɔfo mbɔbɔrhufo,
Ɔda ho tsen N'epir nsa n'
Twe me kɔ No bomu.

MHB 627
4 . O what a blessed hope is ours,
While here on earth we stay,
We more than taste the heavenly powers,
And antedate that day:
We feel the resurrection near,
Our life in Christ concealed,
And with His glorious presence here
Our earthen vessels filled.	 ~ 	4 
. O hɛn enyidar yɛ nhyira dɛ!
Ber a yɛwɔ asaase 'i do,
Ɔkyɛn dɛ yɛka sor tum hwɛ,
Na yɛtwe dɛm da n' bɛn;
Yɛtse dɛ wusoɛr na abɛn,
Hɛn bra hyɛ Christ No mu,
N'enyimnyam fɛɛfɛw a ɔwɔ ase ha n'

MHB 628
1 . YE that do your Master’s will, 
Meek in heart, be meeker still : 
Day by day your sins confess, 
Ye that walk in righteousness : 
Gracious souls in grace abound, 
Seek the Lord, whom ye have found.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM a hom yɛ hom Wura Ne pɛ,
Hom akoma nyɛ botoo daa;
Dabiara hom nka hom bɔn,
Hom a hom nantsew tsenenee mu;
Akra pa a hom wɔ adom mu,
Hom nhwehwɛ hom Ewuradze.
Kɛpem dɛ hom hu N'enyim

MHB 628
2 . Sing ye happy souls, that press 
Toward the height of holiness; 
All His promises receive,
All the grace He hath to give; 
Follow on, nor slack your pace 
Till ye see His glorious face.	 ~ 	2 
. Akra a hom enyi gye mper
Nkɔ sor a ɔyɛ krɔnkrɔn no;
Hom ngye N'anohoba no,
Nye adom a ɔwɔ dze ma;
Hom nka do, mma wɔnngow mu,

MHB 629
1 . ALL as God wills, who wisely heeds
To give or to withhold,
And knoweth more of all my needs
Than  all my prayers have told.
	 ~ 	1 . DZA Nyame nyansafo pɛ ayɛ,
Ɔbɛma, anaa ɔnnkɛma,
Na onyim m'ehiadze nyina yie
Sen dza me mpaabɔ ka.
Mu dze ma dɛm da no.

MHB 629
2 . Enough that blessings undeserved
Have marked my erring track;
That, wheresoe’er my feet have swerved,
His chastening turned me back.
	 ~ 	2 
. Dem nhyira a memmfata yi
Ahyɛ mo mfom kwan n' nsew;
Na beebiara a matɔ dɔnsuar n',
Ne ntsea san me ekyir.

MHB 629
3 . That more and more a providence
Of love is understood,
Making the springs of time and sense
Sweet with eternal good;
 	 ~ 	3 
. Dem ɔdɔ mu ndzepa piigyan n',
Ntseasee wɔ mu koraa;
Okenyan mber ɔnye adwen
Wɔ eyiedzi dɛɛdɛw m'.

MHB 629
4 . That death seems but a covered way
Which  opens into light
Wherein no blinded child can stray
Beyond the Father’s sight;
	 ~ 	4 
. Owu yɛ dɛ kwan bi a oesiw,
Na obue kɔ kan mu,
Na ɔba onyifurafo biara
Nntɔ gon mmfi Egya enyim.

MHB 629
5 . That care and trial seem at last,
Through memory’s sunset air,
Like mountain ranges overpast,
In  purple distance fair;
	 ~ 	5 
. Afei 'hwɛyie na nkodzen ba,
Nam witɔree m' nkaakaa
Dɛ mbrɛ wohu mbepɔw wɔ ekyir
Ber a wɔatra edu bea pa.

MHB 629
6 . That all the jarring notes of life
Seem blending in psalms,
And all the angles of its strife
Slow rounding into calm. 
 	 ~ 	6 
. Abrabɔ mu dede nyina
Bɔ mu yie wɔ ndwom mu,
Na abrabɔ aperdzi bea nyina
Yɛ berɛww taa dzin koraa.

MHB 629
7 . And so the shadows fall apart,
And so the west winds play;
And all the windows of my heart
I open to the day.	 ~ 	7 
. Afei sunsum hyɛ ase pa,
Ma anee mframa so bɔ;
Na mubue m'akoma nyina

MHB 63
1 . Eternal depth of love divine, 
 In Jesus, God with us, displayed; 
 How bright Thy beaming glories shine! 
 How wide Thy healing streams are spread!
	 ~ 	1 . ONYAME dɔ a no bun nnyi ase, 
Jesus mu Nyame da edzi;
Hwɛ mbrɛ W'enyimnyam hyerɛn pa!
W'ayarsa nsu pem mbea nyina!

MHB 63
2 . With whom dost Thou delight to dwell? 
 Sinners, a vile and thankless race; 
 O God, what tongue aright can tell 
 How vast Thy love, how great Thy grace!
	 ~ 	2 . Epɛ nye woananom atsena?
Ndzebɔnyɛfo, bɔnnyiayɛfo: 
Onyankopɔn, tɛkyerɛma bɛn 
Botum akyerɛ Wo dɔ na adom?

MHB 63
3 . The dictates of Thy sovereign will 
 With joy our grateful hearts receive: 
 All Thy delight in us fulfill 
 Lo ! all we are to Thee we give
	 ~ 	3 . Dɛw mu yɛdze akoma m' ndaase 
Gye dza Wo dɔ pɛ ka kyerɛ hɛn,
Fa W' enyigye nyina ma hɛn, 
Yɛdze hɛnho nyina ma Wo.

MHB 63
4 . To Thy sure love, Thy tender care, 
 Our flesh, soul, spirit, we resign:  
 O fix Thy sacred presence there, 
 And seal the abode for ever Thine!
	 ~ 	4 . Yɛdze hɛn honam, 'kra, sunsum, 
Hyɛ Wo dɔ nye W'ayamuyie nsa:
O ma Wo krɔnkrɔnyɛ ntsena hɔ,
Na sɔw hɛn ano dɛ Wodze.

MHB 63
5 . O King of Glory! Thy rich grace 
 Our feeble thought surpasses far; 
 Yea, even our sins, though numberless, 
 Less numerous than Thy mercies are.
	 ~ 	5 . Enyimnyam Hen, W'adom kɛse n'
Bor hɛn adwen no do koraa;
Hɛn bɔn mpo dɔɔ so dɛn ara a,
W'ehumbɔbɔr bor ne nyina do.

MHB 63
6 . Still, Lord, Thy saving health display, 
 And arm our souls with heavenly zeal; 
 So fearless shall we urge our way 
  Through all the powers of earth and hell.   	 ~ 	6 . Ewuradze, da Wo nkwagye edzi,
Ma hɛn akra Wo sor ahoɔdzen;
Na yennsuro dɛ yɛkɔ enyim,
Wɔ asaase na hɛll etumfo m'.

MHB 630
1 . O GRANT us light, that we may know
The wisdom Thou alone canst give;
That truth may guide where’er we go,
And virtue  bless where’er we live.
	 ~ 	1 . O MA hɛn kan, ama yeehu
Nyansa a Wo nko tum dze ma no;
Ama nokwar aakyerɛ hɛn kwan,
Na nhyira aaba beebi a yɛbɛtsena.
Dze kɔ fie a 'wu nnyi m' afebɔɔ.    Amen.

MHB 630
2 . O grant us light, that we may see,
Where error lurks in human lore,
And turn our doubting minds to Thee,
And love Thy simple Word the more.
	 ~ 	2 
. O ma hɛn kan, ama yeehu
Esintɔ a ɔwɔ nyimpa n' nyimdzee m',
Hɛn adwen a ohinhim n' yaadan ama W',
Yaadɔ W'asɛm pa no yie daa.

MHB 630
3 . O grant us light, that we may learn
How dead is life from Thee apart;
How sure is joy for all who turn
To Thee an undivided heart.
	 ~ 	3 
. O ma hɛn kan, ama yeesua
Dɛ bra a 'Wo nnkaho n' yɛ owu;
Hɔn a wɔdze akoma a osi pi
Ba Wo hɔ n', yeehu hɔn dɛw pa.

MHB 630
4 . O grant us light, in grief and pain,
To lift our burdened hearts above,
And count the very cross a gain,
And bless our Father’s hidden Love.
 	 ~ 	4 
. O ma hɛn kan, 'werɛhow na yaw m',
Yɛmma hɛn akoma a ɔaberɛ n' do,
'Dze eehu dɛ mbeamudua n' yɛ mfaso,
Na yeehyira No dɔ a osuma n'.

MHB 630
5 . O grant us light, when, soon or late
All earthly scenes shall pass away,
In Thee to find the open gate
To deathless home and endless day.
                                          Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. O ma hɛn sesei; ndaamba
Wiadze abrabɔ nyina twa mu a,
Yeehu abow a woebue n' wɔ Wo mu

MHB 631
1 . WALK in the light: so shalt thou know
That fellowship of love
His Spirit only can bestow,
Who reigns in light above.
	 ~ 	1 . NANTSEW kan n' mu: na ibohu 
Ɔdɔ fɛkuwbɔ no a
No Sunsum nko tum dze ma no
Nyia odzi hen sor wɔ kan m'.
Nyame Noara nye Kan.

MHB 631
2 . Walk in the light: and thou shalt find
Thy heart made truly His,
Who dwells in cloudless light enshrined,
In whom no darkness is.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nantsew kan n' mu: na ibohu 
Dɛ w'akoma ayɛ N'dze koraa,
Nyia ɔtse kan a fua biara nnyi m' mu
Sum biara nnyi No mu.

MHB 631
3 . Walk in the light: and thou shalt own
Thy darkness passed away,
Because that Light has on thee shone,
In which is perfect day.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nantsew kan n' mu: na ibohu 
Dɛ wo sum etwa m' kɔ,
'Siandɛ dɛm kan n' ahyerɛn wo ho,
No mu na da pa wɔ.

MHB 631
4 . Walk in the light: and e’en the tomb
No fearful shade shall wear;
Glory shall chase away its gloom,
For Christ has conquered there.
	 ~ 	4 
. Nantsew kan n' mu: na 'wumaa mpo
Nnkenya sum bi ama w';
Enyimnyam bɛpepa no sum,
Christ edzi nyim wɔ do.

MHB 631
5 . Walk in the light: and thine shall be
A path, through thorny, bright;
For God, by grace, shall dwell in thee,
And God himself is Light.	 ~ 	5 
. Nantsew kan n' mu: wodze bɛyɛ
Kwan a nsoɛ wɔ m' mpo a, ɔhyerɛn;
Adom ntsi Nyame bɛtsena w' mu,

MHB 632
1 . BE Thou my Vision, O Lord of my heart;
Naught be all else to me, save that Thou art-
Thou my best thought, by day or by night,
Waking or sleeping, Thy presence my light.
	 ~ 	1 . M'AKOMA Wura, yɛ dza osi m'enyi do;
Minnyi biribiara bio, gyedɛ Wo nko
'Dzekyee anaa adzesaa, Ɔwo, nye m'adwen pa,
Minyan anaa meda a, Ɔwo yɛ m' kan.
Yɛ dza osi m'enyi do nyinara Wura.

MHB 632
2 . Be Thou my Wisdom, and Thou my true Word;
I ever with Thee and Thou with me, Lord;
Thou my great Father, I Thy true son;
Thou in me dwelling, and I with Thee one.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛ m' Nyansaa, Ɔwo m'Asɛm nokwafo;
Mowɔ Wo nkyɛn, Ewuradze, 'nye m' wɔ hɔ;
Eyɛ m' Egya kɛse, meyɛ W' ba pa;
Sɛ etse mo mu a, menye Wo yɛ adze kor.

MHB 632
3 . Be Thou my battle-Shield, Sword for the fight,
Be Thou my dignity, Thou my delight;
Thou my soul’s Shelter, Thou my high Tower:
Raise Thou me heavenward, O Power of my power.
 	 ~ 	3 
. .Ɔko no mu, yɛ m'akokyɛm na peaa,
Yɛ m'enyimpa, Ɔwo yɛ dza mepɛ;
Eyɛ m' kra n' tsenabew, yɛ m'abantsentsen,
O mo Tumfo, pegya me kɔ heaven.

MHB 632
4 . Riches I heed not, nor man’s empty praise,
Thou mine Inheritance, now and always:
Thou and Thou only, first in my heart,
High King of Heaven, my Treasure Thou art.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mennka ahonya anaa ayɛyi hun do,
Eyɛ m'egyapadze, sesei na daa;
Wo nko na idzi kan wɔ m'akoma m',
Heaven Ɔhempɔn, eyɛ m'akoradze.

MHB 632
5 . High King of Heaven, my victory won,
May I reach Heaven’s joys, O bright Heaven’s Sun!
Heart of my own heart, whatever befall,
Still be my Vision, O Ruler of all.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Heaven Ɔhempɔn, nsa aka konyimdzi n',
Ma minnya sor, heaven Ewia hyɛnhyɛn n'
M'akoma Wura, dza ɔbɛma biara,

MHB 633
1 . O King of mercy, from Thy throne on high
Look down in love, and hear our humble cry.
	 ~ 	1 . O adom Hen, fi sor ahengua n' do 
Fa dɔ hwɛ na tsie hɛn mbɔbɔr su.
Na fa hɛn du hɛn sor fi nom' sɔkyee. Amen.

MHB 633
2 .  Thou tender Shepherd of the blood-bought sheep,
Thy feeble wandering flock in safety keep.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Hwɛfo pà a edze bɔgya tɔɔ Wo nguan, 
Kora Wo nguankuw a wɔnnkyɛr kwan fom.

MHB 633
3 . O gentle Saviour, by Thy death we live;
To contrite sinners life eternal  give.
 	 ~ 	3 
. O Pomfo pa, Wo wu mu na agye hɛn: 
Ma abɔn awerɛhofo daa nkwa.

MHB 633
4 . Thou art the Bread of heaven, on Thee feed;
Be near to help our souls in time of need.
 	 ~ 	4  
. Sor Edziban, yɛdze Wo nyɛn hɛnho: 
Pin bɔboa hɛn akra hɛn hia ber mu.

MHB 633
5 . Thou art the mourner’s Stay, the sinner’s Friend,
Sweet Fount of joy and blessings without end.
 	 ~ 	5 
. Apatasu, ndzebɔnyɛfo Dɔfo, 
Edɛw na siar nsunyiwa a ɔnnsa da.

MHB 633
6 . O come and cheer us with Thy heavenly grace;
Reveal the brightness of Thy glorious face.
 	 ~ 	6 
. Ao, fa sor adom kyekye hɛn werɛ; 
Yi W'enyim fɛɛfɛw n' enyimnyam kyerɛ.

MHB 633
7 . In cooling cloud by day, in fire by night,
Be near our steps, and make our darkness light.
 	 ~ 	7 
. Adzekyeem' mununkum, adzesaam' ogya, 
Bɛn hɛn na dan hɛn sum ma ɔnyɛ kan.

MHB 633
8 . Go where we go, abide where we abide,
In life, in death, our Comfort, Strength and  Guide.
	 ~ 	8  
. Nye hɛn nnantsew, nye hɛn kwan daa daa, 
Hɛn nkwam' na wum' Werɛkyekyer, Tum, Gyafo.

MHB 633
9 . O lead us daily with Thine eye of love,
And bring us safely to our home above.  Amen.	 ~ 	9  
. Fa Wo dɔ enyi n' gya hɛn kwan daa daa,

MHB 634
1 . WILL your anchor hold in the storms of  life,
When the clouds unfold their wings of strife?
When the strong tides lift, and the cables strain,
Will your anchor drift, or firm remain?
  We have an anchor that keeps the soul
  Steadfast and sure while the billows roll;
  Fastened to the Rock which cannot  move,
  Grounded firm and deep in the Saviour’s love!
	 ~ 	1 . WO kra sekyɛ botum ɔbra n'ehum,
Ber a nsuframa dzendzen robɔ yi?
Ma asorɛkye dzendzen retsetsew nhama m',
Wo sekyɛ betsim, anaa obegyina dzen?
   Sɛ ɔbra pram, ma asorɛkye bu a,
   Dɛm sekyɛ yi kora hɛn kra pintsinn;
   Ɔmontan ɔbotantsim a onnhim,
   Na otsim hɔ pintsinn wɔ Gyefo No dɔ m'.
Ibodwir sɔkyee wɔ ɔsor mpoano hɔ?

MHB 634
2 . Will your anchor hold in the straits of fear?
When the breakers roar and the reef is near;
While the surges rave, and the wild winds blow,
Shall the angry waves then your barque o’erflow?
 	 ~ 	2 
. Wo sekyɛ botum egyina suro ber mu
Ehumtu kɛse nye abotar enyim?
Ber a po nye mframa tu hɔn tsir gu do n',
Ana nsu bɛpram ebunkam wo hɛmba?

MHB 634
3 . Will your anchor hold in the floods of death ,
When the waters cold chill your latest breath?
On the rising tide you can never fail,
While your anchor holds within the veil.
	 ~ 	3 
. Wo sekyɛ botum wu n'esuyirii?
Ber a nsu nwinwin twa w'ahomtsia do?
Asorɛkye dzen mu mpo eronntɔ bahaw
'Siandɛ wo sekyɛ tsim enyidar man n' mu.

MHB 634
4 . Will your eyes behold through the morning light
The  city of gold and the harbour bright?
Will you anchor safe by the heavenly shore,
When life’s storms are past for evermore?	 ~ 	4 
. W'enyiwa bohu anapa kan fɛɛfɛw n'
Zion sika kurow na ahɛndwirii hyɛnhyɛn n'
Ber a ɔbra n'ehum bɔbɔ adze nwionwion n',

MHB 635
1 . JESU, my Truth, my Way,
My sure, unerring Light,
On Thee my feeble soul I stay,
Which Thou wilt lead aright. 
	 ~ 	1 . JESU, mo N'okwar, Kwan,
Me kan a ennyew da,
Mo bͻn anamͻn tsim Wo do, .
’Wo begya m’ abamba.
Na fa m’ kͻ Nyame fie.  Amen.

MHB 635
2 . My Wisdom and my Guide,
My Counselor Thou art;
O never let leave Thy side,
Nor from Thy paths depart! 
	 ~ 	2 
. Me Nyansaa, Kwankyérɛfo
Ͻwo yɛ mo Pomfo,
O mma mimmfi Wo nkyɛn ara da
Anaa W’akwan so do!

MHB 635
3 . Teach me the happy art
In all things to depend
On Thee; O never, Lord, depart,
But love me to the end!
	 ~ 	3 
. Kyérɛkyerɛ m’ enyigyadze
Na mendan W’ adze nyina m;
O m'Ewuradze, mma nngyaa me da,
Mbom, dͻ me kͻ ewiei!

MHB 635
4 . Through fire and water bring
Into the wealthy place;
And teach me the new song to sing,
When perfected in grace.
	 ~ 	4 
. Fa me dua ogya na nsu m,’
Kodu ahonya bea hͻ;
Kyérɛ me ndowm fofor ma montow
Ber a mo ho astew adom m’.

MHB 635
5 . O make me all like Thee,
Before I hence remove!
Settle, confirm, and stablish me,
And build me up in love.
	 ~ 	5 
. O yɛ m’ dɛ Ͻwo ara,
’Saana meetu efi ha!
Gye me to m’ na ma mentséna ha
Na siesie me wͻ dͻ m’.

MHB 635
6 . Let me Thy witness live,
When sin is all destroyed;
And then my spotless soul receive,
And take me home to God.
		Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Ma mentséna ndzi W’ dase
Ber a bͻn nyina asé etu n;
Gye me kra a nkekaa nnyi ho no,

MHB 636
1 . LIGHT of the world, Faint were our weary feet
With wandering far;
But Thou didst come, our lonely heart to greet,
Our Morning Star;
And Thou didst bid us lift our gaze on high,
To see the glory of the glowing sky.
 	 ~ 	1 . WIADZE kan, hɛn anan a agogow n' hinhim
Wɔ ekyinkyin pii m',
Naaso 'bekyiaa hɛn akoma bɔbɔfo n',
'Napa Woraba;
Emaa yɛmaa hɛn enyi do tsim sor
Dze hwɛɛ ewia hyɛhyɛnn no n'enyimnyam.
Kɔ W'onnyiewie kan na dɔ fie no mu.

MHB 636
2 . In days long past we missed our homeward way,
We could not see;
Blind were our eyes, our feet were bound to stray:
How blind to Thee!
But Thou didst pity, Lord, our gloomy plight;
And Thou didst touch our eyes,
and give them sight.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Tsetseber a etwa m' n', yɛyeew hɛn fie kwan;
Nna yennhu adze;
Hɛn enyi furae, hɛn anamɔn tɔɔ dɔnsuar;
Yeennhu Wo koraa!
Na Ɔwo Ewuradze hun hɛn mbɔbɔr;
Wo nsa kaa hɛn enyi ma obuebuei.

MHB 636
3 . Now hallelujahs rise along the road
Our glad feet tread;
Thy love hath shared our sorrow’s
Heavy load;
There’s light o’erhead :
Glory to Thee whose love hath led us on,
Glory for all the great things Thou hast done. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Sesei Alleluia gyegye hɛn kwan m' 
Enyigye mu;
Wo dɔ eyi hɛn yaw na adzesoa duudur
Kan wɔ hɛn enyim;
Enyimnyam nka Wo, Ɔwo a W' dɔ agye hɛn,
'Nyimnyam nka W' wɔ ndzɛmba akɛse a ayɛ ntsi.

MHB 636
4 . Where is death’s sting, where, 
grave, thy victory,
Where all the pain,
Now that thy King the veil that
hung o’er thee
Hath rent in twain?
bid us come
To light and love, in Thine eternal home.	 ~ 	4 
. Owu hwirom na 'wumaa konyim wɔ hen?
Yaw nyina wɔ hen?
Ber a twamutam a ɔkata wo do n' wo Hen 
Atsew mu yi?
Wiadze kan, yɛtse dɛ Ɔwo refrɛ hɛn

MHB 637
1 . THE sands of time are sinking;
The dawn of Heaven breaks;
The summer morn I’ve sighed for,
The fair, sweet morn awakes.
Dark, dark hath been the midnight;
But day-spring is at hand,
And glory, glory dwelleth
In Immanuel’s land.
	 ~ 	1 . BER n'anhwea no remen ntsɛm
Heaven adzekyee n' yi enyim;
Wi puei ber a m'enyi daa kwan,
Da pa dɛɛdɛw n' aba,
Esuom yɛɛ sum dodoodow;
Adzekyee kan abɛn ,
Na enyimnyam mapa wɔ
Immanuel Ne man m'.
Immanuel Ne man m'.

MHB 637
2 . The King there in His beauty,
Without a veil is seen;
It were a well spent journey,
Though seven deaths lay between:
The Lamb with His fair army, 
Doth on Mount Zion stand,
And glory, glory dwelleth
In Immanuel’s land.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Hen n' wɔ N'ahoɔfɛw m' wɔ hɔ n',
Yehun N'enyim petee;
'Kwantu a odzi mu na yetui,
Sɛ 'wu esuom wɔ mu mpo a;
Eguambaa n' nye N' nsordaafo
Gyina kokwaa Zion do,
Na enyimnyam mapa wɔ
Immanuel Ne man m'.

MHB 637
3 .  O Christ! He is the fountain,
The deep, sweet well of love;
The streams of earth I’ve tasted 
More deep I’ll drink above;
There to an ocean fullness 
His mercy doth expand,
And glory, glory dwelleth 
In Immanuel’s land.
	 ~ 	3 
. O Christ, Ɔwo yɛ fapem
'Dɔ bura fɛɛfɛw a ɔdɔ;
Manom wiadze esu ahorow,
M'bɔnom papa wɔ Sor;
Na po yantamm bi w hɔ a
N'ehumbɔbɔr n' pem wɔ m',
Na enyimnyam mapa wɔ
Immanuel Ne man m'.

MHB 637
4 . With mercy and with judgment 
My web of time He wove,
And aye, the dews of sorrow 
Were lustered with His love;
I’ll bless the hand that guided,
I’ll bless the heart that planned,
When throned where glory dwelleth 
In Immanuel’s land.	 ~ 	4 
. Ehumbɔbɔr nye atsɛmbu m'
Ɔwo awen me mber
Na ampa, awerɛhow bɔsu n',
Wo dɔ n' pepaa no koraa;
M'benyira nsa a ogyaa me no,
M'behyira akoma a ɔhyehyɛe,
Ber a wɔahyɛ N' enyimnyam wɔ

MHB 638
1 . TO God, the only wise,
Our Saviour and our King,
Let all the saints below the skies
Their humble praises bring.
 	 ~ 	1 . NYAME Nyansabuakwa,
Hɔn Hen nye Agyenkwa,
Abɔfo a wɔwɔ ase ha
Mfa hɔn ayɛyi mbrɛ Wo.
Wɔaka N'anwanwadze.

MHB 638
2 . ’Tis His almighty love,
His counsels and His care,
Preserve us safe from sin and death,
And every hurtful snare.
 	 ~ 	2 
. No dɔ kokroko na 
N'apam nye N' nhwedo pa
Kora hɛn sɔnn fi bɔn na owu mu,
Na efirsua yaayaw mu.

MHB 638
3 . He will present our souls
Unblemished and complete,
Before the glory of his face,
With joys divinely great.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔbɔkora hɛn akra
Na ɔatsew ho nwionnwionn,
Wɔ N'enyim enyimnyam no mu,
Wɔ sor enyigye pa m'.

MHB 638
4 . Then all the chosen seed
Shall meet around the throne,
Shall bless the conduct of His grace,
And make His wonders known.	 ~ 	4 
. Aba a wɔasan mu eyi n'
Behyia wɔ ahengua n' ho;
Wobehyira N'adom nwanwa n',

MHB 639
1 . CHRIST, who knows all his sheep,
Will all in safety keep;
He will not lose His blood, 
Nor intercession :
Nor we the purchased good 
Of His dear passion.
	 ~ 	1 . CHRIST a onyim No nguan nyina
Bɔhwɛ hɛn nyina do sɔnn;
No bɔgyaa no anaa
N'amandzehu no
Rennyɛ kwa ara da,
Dɛ ɔtɔɔ hɛn ntsi n'.
Na Ɔwo atɔ no.

MHB 639
2 . I know our God is just, 
To Him we wholly trust;
All that I have, and am, 
And all we hope for:
All’s sure and seen to Him, 
Which I here grope for.
	 ~ 	2 
. Minyim me Nyame tsen,
Ɔno na motwer No;
Dza mowɔ, meyɛ nyina
M'enyindado nyina
Dza mekeka hwɛ n' ha
Yɛ nokwar pefee.

MHB 639
3 . Lord Jesus, take my spirit,
I trust Thy life and merit;
Take home this wandering sheep,
For Thou hast sought it:
This soul in safety keep,
For Thou hast brought it.	 ~ 	3 
. Jesus, gye mo sunsum,
Motwer Wo bra na su;
Fa 'guan yi kɔ fie na
Ahwehwɛ n' biara;
Kora ɔkra yi do sɔnn

MHB 64
1 . PRAISE to the Lord, the Almighty, 
 the King of creation; 
 O my soul, praise Him, for He is thy 
 health and salvation; 
 All ye who hear, 
 Brother and sisters draw near, 
 Praise Him in glad adoration.
	 ~ 	1 . Ayɛyi nka Ewuradze, Tumfo, abɔdze nyina hen; 
O me kra, yi N' ayɛw, Ɔno nye w' ahom na nkwagye;
Hom a hom tse,
Enuaam na nkyerɛbaa, hom mbra,
Hom ntonton No enyigye mu.

MHB 64
2 . Praise to the Lord, who doth prosper 
        thy work and defend thee; 
  Surely His goodness and mercy here 
        daily attend thee: 
  Ponder anew 
 What the Almighty can do, 
 If with His love He befriend thee.
	 ~ 	2 . Ayɛyi nka Ewuradze a otu w' edwuma 
    mpon, weɔn wo,
Ampaara Ne yie nye N' adom ka wo do daa wɔ ha:
Dwen ho bio hwɛ
Dza Otumfo No tum yɛ,
Sɛ ɔdze No dɔ fa w' nyɛnko a.

MHB 64
3 . Praise to the Lord, who, when  
         tempests their warfare are waging, 
 Who, when the elements madly  
         around thee are raging, 
 Biddeth them cease, 
 Turneth their fury to peace,  
 Whirlwinds and waters assuaging.
	 ~ 	3 . Ayɛyi nka Ewuradze, ɔno a ehumtuber no mu, 
Ɔno na ber a abɔdze nyina etwa ayer wo no,
Ɔma wogyaa,
Begyabegyayɛ taa dzinn,
Ɔma ehum na po yɛ komm n'.

MHB 64
4 . Praise to the Lord, who when  
         darkness of sin is abounding,  
 Who, when the godless do triumph,  
         all virtue confounding, 
 Sheddeth His light, 
 Chaseth the horrors of night, 
 Saints with His mercy surrounding.
	 ~ 	4 . Ayɛyi nka Ewuradze, ɔno a ber a bɔn na sum agye, 
Ɔno na abosonsɔrfo dzi nyim mmbu papayɛ bi a
Ne kan hyerɛn,
Pam sum mu ewurkadze,
N' adom bɔ esiarfo ho ban.

MHB 64
5 . Praise to the Lord ! O let all that is 
          in me adore Him ! 
 All that hath life and breath, come 
          now with praises before Him ! 
  Let the Amen 
  Sound from His people again: 
 Gladly for aye we adore Him.    Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Ayɛyi nka Ewuradze! Ao, dza ɔwɔ mo mu 
     nyina ntonton N'!
Dza wɔwɔ nkwa nye ahom m-fa ayɛyi mbra N' enyim!
Wɔmma Amen
Ngyegye bio wɔ nkorɔfom'
Yɛtonton No enyigyem' daa.

MHB 640
1 . SUNSET and evening star,
And one clear call for me!
And may there be no moaning of the bar,
When I put out to sea,
But such a tide as moving seems asleep,
Too full for sound and foam,
When that which drew from out 
the boundless deep
Turns again home.
	 ~ 	1 . WITƆREE, 'wimbir woraba,
Na frɛ kor a wɔdze afrɛ m'!
Na asorɛkye a orubu n' bɛda fɛmm,
Ber a migyina po enyim n;
Asorɛkye a orubu a ɔtse dɛ ɔada n',
Ɔnnkɛkyerɛ hwee koraa,
Ber a dza opuei fii bun yantamm no mu
San kɔ n'anan m'.
M'bohu Sutwafo n' enyim.

MHB 640
2 . Twilight and evening bell,
And after that the dark!
And may there be no sadness of farewell
When I embark;
For though from out our bourne
of Time and Place
The flood may bear me far,
I hope to see my Pilot face to face
When I have  cost the bar.	 ~ 	2
