. Serɛmen na ewimbir dɔn n',
Na afei n'ekyir sum no!
Na mma wɔmmfa awerɛhow nngya me kwan
Ber a mesi m' no,
Kaansa yefi bea na ber yi mu mpo a,
Nsuyirii n' dze m'bɔkɔ ekyir,
Ber a mefi wiadze yi mu n', minyim dɛ

MHB 641
1 . WHILE ebbing nature grieves,
My God, my portion be,
Until the hour which gives
My spirit unto Thee.
When flesh and life decline,
Stretch out Thy hand and take
My nature into Thine,
Till I in Thee awake.
	 ~ 	1 . BER a ’werɛhow ahyɛ mo do ’I,
Me Nyame yɛ m’ kyɛfa
Kodu dͻnhwér a ͻdze
Mo sunsum bɛma Wo n’.
Ber a honam na nkwa agow,
Tsen Wo nsa mu na gye
Me kra to W’abaw mu
Kodu dɛ minyan Wo m’.
O ewiei n’ mma mmpa hɛn!

MHB 641
2 . The morning sun will glow,
The evening light will die;
So change the lights below,
They never change on high.
Friend turns from friend his face,
One mourns upon the shore;
But from Thy holy place
Thy sons go our no more.
	 ~ 	2 
. Anapa wi bɛhyérɛn
Ewimbir kan bͻtͻ m’,
Dɛm na ase ha kan n’ tse,
Sor dze n’ ͻnnsesa da;
Nyɛnko nnhwɛ nyɛnko enyim,
Kor dzi yaw wͻ mpoano;
Wo mba dze wommpue mmfi
Wo bea krͻnkrͻn no do.

MHB 641
3 . The cloud broods o’er us still;
We hope, yet fear to fall;
We long toward yonder hill
Whence comes the help of all:
It glimmers through the night
The dead have overpast
To Thee the dawning Light;
O fail us not at last !  Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Mununkum kata hɛn do;
Yennsuro asehwe biara,
Yɛpɛ edu koko n’ do,
Hͻ na mboa pii fi ba:
Ͻhyérɛn wͻ anafua ber m’,
Ewufo twa m’, ba W’ hͻ,
Ͻwo a ayɛ anapa kan;

MHB 642
1 . WHEN on my day of life the night is falling,
And in the winds, from unsunned spaces blown,
I hear far voices out of darkness calling
My feet to paths unknown.
	 ~ 	1 . BER a adzesaa rotɔ mo nkwa da do,
Na ehum tu bea a ewia mmbɔ wɔ hɔ n'
Metse ndze ekyirekyir sum mu refrɛ
M'anan kɔ bea a minnyim.
M'benya nkwa a mo kɔn dɔ n'.   Amen.

MHB 642
2 . Be near me when all else is from me drifting—
Earth, sky, home’s pictures, days of shade and shine,
And kindly faces to my own uplifting
The love which answers mine.
	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ biribiara rifi mo ho akɔ a, bɛn me,
Asaase, wi, fie ndzɛmba, sum na kan
Na enyimtsewee a ɔma me nkenyan,
Ɔdɔ a ɔgye mo do.

MHB 642
3 . I have but Thee, my Father; let Thy Spirit
Be with me then to comfort and uphold;
No gate of pearl, no branch of palm I merit,
Nor street of shining gold.
	 ~ 	3 
. Dza mowɔ nye Ɔwo Egya; ma Wo Sunsum
Nka mo ho nkyekye mo werɛ, nsuo mo mu;
Memmfata ahodze pa abow, memmfata berɛw,
Anaa sika abrɔn.

MHB 642
4 . Suffice it if—my good and ill unreckoned,
And both forgiven through Thy abounding grace—
I find myself by hands familiar beckoned
Unto my fitting place.
	 ~ 	4 
. Oye ma m', me papa na bɔn wɔnnkan;
Na ɔnam W'adom pii do ntsi edze kyɛ,
Na muhu Wo dɛ' roto nsa afrɛ me
Akɔ tsenabew a ɔsɛ m'.

MHB 642
5 . There, from the music round about me stealing
I fain would learn the new and holy song,
And find at last, beneath Thy trees of healing,
The life for which I long.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Ndwom dɛɛdɛw a asaasaa do wɔ hɔ a metse n',
Me bɛpɛ esua ndwom fofor krɔnkrɔn n' tow,
Na ewiei n' W'ayarsa ndua no ase no

MHB 643
1 . WHEN this passing world is done,
When has sunk yon glaring sun,
When we stand with Christ in glory,
Looking o’er life’s finished story,
Then, Lord, shall I fully know,
Not till then, how much I owe.
 	 ~ 	1 . SƐ wiadze yi twa mu wie a ,
Sɛ ewia a ɔhyerɛn yi tɔ mu a,
Yɛnye Christ gyina enyimnyam m',
Mohwɛ ɔbra n'ewiei mu nsɛm a,
Dɛm ber n' ankasa na m'bohu
Kaw a medze W', Ewuradze.
Ma mo dɔ nkyerɛ kaw a medze W'.

MHB 643
2 . When I stand before the throne,
Dressed in beauty not my own,
When I see Thee as Thou art,
Love Thee with unsinning heart,
Then Lord, shall I fully know,
Not till then, how much I owe.
	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ mibegyina ahengua enyim
Hyɛ atar fɛɛfɛw a ɔnnyɛ m'dze,
Sɛ muhu W' dɛ mbrɛ Ɔwo tse a,
Medze akoma a bɔn nnyi m' bɔbɔ W',
Dɛm ber n' ankasa na m'bohu
Kaw a medze W', Ewuradze.

MHB 643
3 . When the praise of Heaven I hear,
Loud as thunders to the ear,
Loud as many waters’ noise,
Sweet as harp’s melodious voice,
Then, Lord, shall I fully know,
Not till then, how much I owe.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ metse heaven ayɛyi
Ngyegyee dzendzen wɔ m'asomu,
Tse dɛ esu dzendzen n' dede,
Ne dɛw tse dɛ sanku ndze a,
Dɛm ber n' ankasa na m'bohu
Kaw a medze W', Ewuradze.

MHB 643
4 . Chosen not for good in me,
Wakened up from wrath to flee,
Hidden in the Savior’s side,
By the Spirit sanctified,
Teach me, Lord, on earth to show,
By my love, how much I owe.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Wɔammpaw m' wɔ me papa ntsi,
Wonyaan m', munguan mfi ebufuw m',
Dɛ munsuma me Gyefo nkyɛn,
Fa Sunsum no tsew mo ho,
Nyame, kyerɛ m' asaase 'i do,

MHB 644
1 . THOU Judge of quick and dead,
Before whose bar severe,
With holy joy, or guilty dread,
We all shall soon appear:
Our cautioned souls prepare
For that tremendous day,
And fill us now with watchful care,
And stir us up to pray.
	 ~ 	1 . NKWA na 'wu Tsɛmbuafo,
W'atsɛmbu bea enyim
Enyigye krɔnn anaa afɔdzi mu,
Yebehyia m' ntsɛmara;
Woesiesie hɛn akra ama
Da kɛse a ɔtse dɛm n',
Fa ahwɛyie a ɔsɛ hyɛ ma,
Kenyan hɛn ma yɛnsɔr.
Ahomgye a onnyi ewiei.  Amen.

MHB 644
2 . To pray, and wait the hour,
That awful hour unknown,
When, robed in majesty and power,
Thou shalt from heaven come down,
The immortal Son of Man,
To judge the human race,
With all Thy Father’s dazzling train,
With  all Thy glorious grace.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛbɔ mpaa dze tweɔn da n',
Dɔnhwer huuhu a wonnyim,
Ber a ehyɛ ahentar na tumdzi n',
Bɛsan efi sor aba ha,
Bɛkyebo, Egya Ne Ba n',
Bobu nyimpa nyina atsɛn,
Enye Egya n' No sor dɔm nyina
'Dze W'enyimnyam adom nyina.

MHB 644
3 . O may we thus be found
Obedient to his word,
Attentive to the trumpet’s sound,
And  looking for our Lord.
O may we thus ensure
Our lot among the blest;
And watch a moment to secure
An everlasting rest.     Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. O ma wonhu hɛn dɛ
W'asɛm ho setsiefo,
Yɛnyɛ aso pɛnn mma abɛn no,
Na yɛrohwehwɛ hɛn Wura;
O ma yɛmper yennya
Dodow mfora esiarfo n',
Na yɛnweɔn ara dɛ yebenya

MHB 645
1 . THAT day of wrath, that dreadful day
When Heaven and earth shall pass away:
What power shall be the sinner’s stay?
How shall he meet that dreadful day?
	 ~ 	1 . EBUFUW da no a ɔyɛ hu n',
Ber a sor na asaase botwa m' no,
Bɔn no tum benya egyinaanan a?
Yebesi dɛn ehyia da huuhu n'?
Kaansa sor na asaase twa m' mpo a.  Amen.

MHB 645
2 . When, shriveling like a parchèd scroll,
The flaming heavens together roll,
When louder yet, and yet more dread,
Swells the high trump that wakes the dead.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔsor dze gyaramee wodow
Dɛ nwoma bi a wɔabobɔw,
Dede na nkekamu huuhu
Kenyan abɛn a onyan ewufo n'.

MHB 645
3 . O ! on that day, that wrathful day,
When man to judgment wakes from clay,
Be Thou the trembling sinner’s stay,
Though heaven and earth shall pass away.
		        Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. O dɛm da n', dɛm enyiber da n',
Ber a yefi dɛtse m' kɔ atsɛmbu m' n,
O Christ yɛ abɔn kyirtaafo

MHB 646
1 . DAY of wrath! O day of mourning!
See fulfilled the prophet’s warning,
Heaven and earth to ashes burning.
	 ~ 	1 . Ebufuw da! Ao, nyinsuwa da! 
Dza nkɔnhyɛfo kae n' abam',
Sor nye asaase rotɔ nso.
		Amen.

MHB 646
10 . Faint and weary Thou hast sought me,
On the cross of suffering bought me;
Shall such grace be vainly brought me?
	 ~ 	10  
. Eku Woho ara ahwehwɛ m', 
Atɔ m' wɔ fona mbeamudua n' do;
Aso dɛm adom yi nyɛ gyan?

MHB 646
11 . Righteous Judge; for sin’s pollution
Grant Thy gift of absolution,
Ere that day of retribution.
	 ~ 	11 
. Ɔtsɛmbuafo tseneenyi, 
Dom hɛn brafi ho bɔnfakyɛ,
Ansaana werdzi da n' aso.

MHB 646
12 . Guilty, now I pour my moaning,
All my shame with anguish owning;
Spare, O God, Thy suppliant groaning.
	 ~ 	12  
. Midzii fᴐ; medze nyinsuwa gye
M'enyimguasebra nyina tom';
Nyame, meserɛ W', fa mo ho kyɛ m'.

MHB 646
13 . Thou the sinful woman savedst,
Thou the dying thief forgavest,
And to me a hope vouchsafest.
	 ~ 	13 
. Egyee ɔbaa dzebɔnyɛnyi n', 
Edze wifo n' no bɔn kyɛɛ no,
Mo so ama menya enyidar.

MHB 646
14 . Worthless are my prayers and sighing;
Yet, good Lord in grace complying,
Rescue me from fire undying.
Save me from the wrath undying.
	 ~ 	14  
. Me mpaabɔ na mo mbɔɔ nnsɛ  hwee,
Naaso, Nyame, kyerɛ W'adom
Na gye m' fi onnyiewiei gya n' mu.

MHB 646
15 . With Thy favoured sheep  O place me,
Nor among the goats abase me,
But to Thy right hand upriase me.
	 ~ 	15  
. Ao, fa me ka Wo nguantsen n' ho, 
Mma mmpem m' adze nnka mberɛkyi n' ho,
Mbom ma m' do si W'abanyimfa.

MHB 646
16 . Low I kneel, with heart-submission;
See like ashes, my contrition;
Help me in my last condition.
	 ~ 	16  
. Mifi m'akoma mu bu ntwɛr, 
Hwɛ, mo nnuho ayɛ dɛ nso;
Sɛ m'ewiei to m' a, ɔno boa m'.

MHB 646
17 . Ah, that day of tears and mourning!
From the dust of earth returning,
Man for judgement must prepare him.
	 ~ 	17  
. Mewu o! Su na ewuotwa da n' a! 
Nyimpa fi huntumam' reba n' a,
Onsiesie noho mma atsɛmbu.

MHB 646
18 . Spare, O God, in mercy spare him.
Lord, all pitying, Jesu blest,
Grant us Thine eternal rest !   Amen.	 ~ 	18  
. Ao, Nyame, hu n' mbɔbɔr na gyaa n',
Tse ma hɔn a Jesus ehyira,
Dom hɛn W'ahomgye a onnyiewiei.

MHB 646
2 . O what fear man’s bosom rendeth,
When from heaven the Judge descendeth,
On whose sentence all dependeth.
	 ~ 	2 
. Akomatu a ogura nyimpa, 
Ber a Tsɛmbuafo n' fi sor besian,
Ɔno a ɔka a, obi nnka bi.

MHB 646
3 . Wondrous sound the trumpet flingeth,
Through earth’s sepulchres it ringeth,
All before the throne it bringeth.
	 ~ 	3 
. Totorobɛnto ndze huhu, 
Ɔgyegye ndakamaa nyinam'
Rotwe dɔm nyina kɔ asɛndzii.

MHB 646
4 . Death is struck and nature quaking
All creatures now awaking,
To the Judge their answer making.
	 ~ 	4 
. Wɔatsea Wu, wiadze rowosow, 
Abɔdze nyina rinyanyan,
Eyi ano akyerɛ Tsɛmbuafo n'.

MHB 646
5 .  Lo! The Book, exactly worded,
Wherein all hath been recorded:
Thence shall  judgement be awarded.
	 ~ 	5 
. Hwɛ, bukuu no mu nsɛm si pi, 
Wɔ dza wɔakyerɛw n' mu nyina ho,
Ɔno na wɔdze bobu atsɛn.

MHB 646
6 . When the Judge His seat attaineth
And each hidden deed arraigneth,
Nothing  unvenged remaineth.
 	 ~ 	6 
. Sɛ Tsɛmbuafo n' tsena N'eguam' 
Na esumasɛm biara da edzi a,
Obiara nnkɛfa noho gyan.

MHB 646
7 . What shall I, frail man, be pleading,
Who for me be interceding,
When the just are mercy needing?
	 ~ 	7  
. Emidze m'beyi m'ano dɛn? 
Woana no obotwitwa agye m'
Ber a anokwafo mpo hia adom?

MHB 646
8 . King of majesty tremendous,
Who dost free salvation send us,
Fount of pity, then befriend us.
	 ~ 	8 
. Hen a W'ahentum krɔn mbordo, 
Ɔwo a ebɔ werdam ma hɛn, 
Tsema Wura, pinkyɛn hɛn ɛ.

MHB 646
9 . Think, good Jesu, my salvation
Caused Thy wondrous Incarnation;
Leave me not to reprobation.
	 ~ 	9  
. Hwɛ Jesus pa, mo nkwangye ntsi 
Na ebɛbraa adasa mu;
Mma nnto me seraha mma bɔn.

MHB 647
1 . LORD, it belongs not to my care
Whether I die or live;
To love and serve Thee is my share,
And this Thy grace must give.
	 ~ 	1 . Ewuradze, ɔnnyɛ 'mi m'asɛm 
Muwu anaa metse ase o;
M'afamudze nye m'bɔdɔ W', masom W'
Yi gyedɛ W'adom ma.
Na menya N' bɛkɛtsena.

MHB 647
2 . If life be long, I will be glad
That I may long obey;
If short, yet why should I be sad
To welcome endless day?
	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ nkwa war a, m' enyi bɛgye 
Ama maasom Wo akyɛr,
Tsia so a, bɛn ntsi na m'bedzi mbɔɔ
Dɛ m'botu akɔ onnyiewieim'?

MHB 647
3 . Christ leads me through no darker rooms
Than He went through before;
He that unto God’s kingdom comes
Must enter by this door.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Christ ɔmmfa m' ndua mbrɛ hɔ yɛ sum 
Sen mbrɛ Noara koduae n';
Nyia ɔba Nyame ahenman mu n'
Gyedɛ ɔfa abow yim'.

MHB 647
4 . Come, Lord, when grace has made me meet
Thy blessed face to see;
For if Thy work on earth be sweet,
What will Thy glory be?
	 ~ 	4  
. Bra, Mo Wura, sɛ adom ma mesɛ 
Dɛ muhu W'enyim a;
Na W'asaase edwuma yɛ dɛw a,
W'enyimnyam bɛyɛ dɛ dɛn?

MHB 647
5 . Then I shall end my sad complaints,
And weary sinful days,
And join with the triumphant saints
That sing my Savior’s praise.
	 ~ 	5  
. Na m'botwa mo suhuhun do, 
Na fona na bɔn ndafua,
Makɔdɔm esiarfo a wɔtow
Jehovah N'ayɛyi.

MHB 647
6 .  My knowledge of that life is small,
The eye of faith is dim;
But ’tis enough that Christ knows all,
And I shall be with Him.	 ~ 	6 
. Me nyimdzee wɔ hɔ bra n' ho suar, 
Gyedzi enyi yɛ kusuww;
Na ɔdɔɔ so dɛ Christ nyim Ne nyina,

MHB 648
1 . AWAY with our sorrow and fear!
We soon shall recover our home,
The city of saints shall appear,
The day of eternity come:
From earth we shall quickly remove,
And mount to our native abode,
The house of our Father above,
The palace of angels and God.
	 ~ 	1 . YI hɛn awerɛhow na hu akwa!
Ɔnnkɛkyɛr na yeenya hɛn fie n',
Ahotsewfo man no bɛba,
Onnyiewiei da no so bɛba;
Yebefi asaase yi do ntsɛm,
Na yeetu akɔ hɛn ndamfo do,
Hɛn Egya fie a ɔwɔ sor hɔ;
Abɔfo na Nyame ahemfie.
Na wɔhyerɛn wɔ sor 'nyimnyam mu.

MHB 648
2 . Our mourning is all at an end,
When, raised by the life-giving Word,
We see the new city descend,
Adorned as a bride for her Lord;
The city so holy and clean,
No sorrow can breathe in the air;
No gloom of affliction or sin,
No shadow of evil is there.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn suhuhun nyina ano botwa,
Sɛ n-kwasɛm no kenyan hɛn a,
Yehu kurow fofor n' no mpuei dɛ
Ayefor a wɔahyehyɛ ama n' Wura;
Kuropɔn krɔnkrɔn a no mu tsew yie,
Awerɛhow biara nnyi hɔ koraa 
Na atseetse anaa bɔn nnyi hɔ,
Sunsum fi biara so nnyi hɔ.

MHB 648
3 . By faith we already behold
That lovely Jerusalem here;
Her walls are of jasper and gold,
As crystal her buildings are clear;
Immovably founded in grace,
She stands as she ever hath stood,
And brightly her Builder displays,
And flames with the glory of God.
	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛnam hɛn gyedzi do ehu
Jerusalem enyigyebea;
N'afasu yɛ jasper na sika,
N'adan ne hyerɛn ma noho tsew;
Adom n' mma ne fapem nnhinhim,
Osi hɔ dɛ mbrɛ ɔtse a ahyɛse n',
Ne dansifo no da no edzi n',
Nyame N'enyimnyam hyerɛn hɔ.

MHB 648
4 . No need of the sun in that day,
Which never is followed by night,
Where Jesus’ beauties display
A pure and a permanent light:
The Lamb is their light and their sun,
And lo! by reflection they shine,
With Jesus ineffably one,
And bright in effulgence divine.	 ~ 	4 
. Ewia ho nnkehia dɛm da no,
Osiandɛ 'nafuasum nnyi hɔ,
Bea a Jesus N'ahoɔfɛw hyerɛn n',
Kan mapa wɔ hɔ dabaa no,
Eguambaa n' nye hɔn kan na ewia,
Na hwɛ, kan mu na ɔma wɔnye
Jesus hyerɛn krɔnkrɔn mu,

MHB 649
1 . THERE is a land of pure delight,
Where saints immortal reign;
Infinite day excludes the night,
And pleasures banish pain.
	 ~ 	1 . Man bi wɔ hɔ a dɛw mapa wɔm', 
Ahotsewfo dzim' hen;
Adzekyee nko, adze nnsa da,
Hɔ enyigye tu yaw.
Runntu hɛn bo wɔ hɔ.

MHB 649
2 . There everlasting spring abides,
And never-withering flowers;
Death, like a narrow sea, divides
This heavenly land from ours.
	 ~ 	2  
. Hɔ na nhaban wuna dabaa. 
Na hɔ nhiren nnyam da;
Wu tse dɛ po tseabaa a, otwa
Sorman na hɛndze yi ntamu.

MHB 649
3 . Sweet fields beyond the swelling flood
Stand dressed in living green;
So to the Jews old Canaan stood,
While Jordan rolled between.
	 ~ 	3  
. Nhaban huanhuam wɔ esuegya hɔ 
Woewuna dukuduku;
Dɛm na Jewfo hun Canaan ma n'
Dɛ Jordan pem twa ntamu.

MHB 649
4 . But timorous mortals start and shrink
To cross this narrow sea,
And linger, shivering on the brink,
And fear to launch away.\
	 ~ 	4 
. Na adasa suro bɔ piriw dɛ 
Wobotwa po tseabaa n',
Wɔbɔ ngyangyan wɔ esukɔn do,
Wosuro dɛ wobepia.

MHB 649
5 . O could we make our doubts remove,
Those gloomy thoughts that rise,
And see the Canaan that we love
With unbeclouded eyes:
	 ~ 	5  
. Ao, nkyɛ yeeyi ekyingye akwa, 
Na adwen kusukusu n',
Na yɛdze enyi a do tsew eehu
Canaan a yɛdɔ no.

MHB 649
6 . Could we but climb where Moses stood,
And view the landscape o’er,
Not Jordan’s stream, nor death’s cold flood,
Should fright us from the shore !	 ~ 	6 
. Nkyɛ yaafow mbrɛ Moses kegyinae n', 
Na yaankwɛ noho mbew n',
Jordan esu anaa owu nwin,

MHB 65
1 . O GOD of God, in whom combine,
The heights and depths of love divine,
With thankful hearts to Thee we sing;
To Thee our longing souls aspire,
In fervent flames of strong desire:
Come, and Thy sacred unction bring.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME a ofir Nyame, ifua
Onyame dɔ no krɔn, no bun, 
Yɛdze ndaase akoma tow W' ndwom, 
Hɛn akoma haahaw hwehwɛ Wo,
Dɛ ogya a ɔredzɛw dzendzen;
Bra, fa Wo ngo krɔnkrɔn no bra.

MHB 65
2 . O powerful Love, to thee we bow;
Object of all our wishes Thou,
Our hearts are naked to Thine eye;
To Thee, who from the eternal throne
Cam’st emptied of Thy glory down,
For us to groan, to bleed, to die.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔdɔ Tumfo, yɛkotow Wo, 
Hɛn ahwehwɛdze nyina nye Wo, 
Hɛn akoma da W'enyim adagyaw, 
Igyaa Wo daa ahengua no hɔ; 
Too W'enyimnyam pan wɔ ase ha. 
Penee, kyii bɔgya, wui maa hɛn.

MHB 65
3 . Grace we implore: when billows roll,
Grace is the anchor of the soul:
Grace every sickness knows to heal;
Grace can subdue each fond desire,
And patience in all pain inspire.
However rebellious nature swell.
	 ~ 	3 . Yɛserɛ adom wɔ asorɛkye mu.
Adom nye ɔkra ne sekyɛ,
Adom na ɔsa yar nyina,
Adom brɛ apɛdze nyina adze,
Sɛ wiadze tsew etua mpo a,
Ɔma hɛn abotar yaw mu.

MHB 65
4 . Be heaven, e’en now, our souls abode,
Hid be our life with Christ in God,
Our spirit, Lord, be one with Thine;
Let all our works in Thee be wrought.
And filled with Thee be all our thought,
Till in us Thy full likeness shine.        Amen.	 ~ 	4 . Ma sor nyɛ hɛn kra tsenabea ndɛ,
Yɛnka Christ ho nsuma Nyame m',
Hɛn sunsum nye Nyame dze mbɔ m',
Yɛnyɛ hɛn edwuma nyina Wo mu,
Hɛn nsusui nyina ngyina Wo do,
Kesi dɛ Wo su hyerɛn hɛn mu.

MHB 650
1 . JERUSLEM, my happy home,
Name ever dear to me!
when shall my labours have an end,
In joys, and peace, and thee?
	 ~ 	1 . Jerusalem, m'ahomka fie, 
Dzin a ɔsom me bo,
M'edwuma bɔbɔ adze dabɛn
Wɔ wo siar asomdweem'?
Da n' na m'bohu wo dɛw.

MHB 650
2 . When shall these eyes thy heaven-built walls
And pearly gates behold,
Thy bulwarks with salvation strong,
And streets of shining gold?
	 ~ 	2 
. Dabɛn na m'enyiwa bohu 
W'afasu nye mbotsen?
N-kwagye ahyɛ w'aban dzen,
W'abrɔn mu hyerɛn sika.

MHB 650
3 . There happier bowers than Eden’s bloom,
Nor sin nor sorrow know:
Blest seats, through rude and stormy scenes
I onward press to you. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Ehɔ nhyiren n' kyɛn Eden turem'; 
Na bɔn nye yaw nnyi hɔ:
Menam abo nye ehum do
Per kɔ siar bea yi do.

MHB 650
4 . Why should I shrink at pain and woe,
Or feel at death dismay?
I’ve Canaan’s goodly land in view,
And realms of endless day. 
	 ~ 	4 
. Ebɛn ntsi na m'bosuro mbusu, 
Anaa wu mbɔ me hu?
M'enyi da Canaan man pa n' do,
Mbew a adze nnsa do da.

MHB 650
5 . Apostles, martyrs, prophets, there
Around my Saviour stand;
And soon my friends in Christ below
will join the glorious band.
	 ~ 	5  
. Asomafo, atɔfo, nkɔnhyɛfo, 
Abɔ Agyenkwa ho aprɔw;
Na ɔnnkɛkyɛr so na m'adɔfo
Akɔdɔm 'nyimnyam kuw n'.

MHB 650
6 . Jerusalem, my happy home,
My soul still pants for thee !
Then shall my labours have an end,
When I thy joys shall see.	 ~ 	6 
. Jerusalem, mahomka fie, 
Me kra per hwehwɛ wo!
Da n' na m'dwuma bɔbɔ adze,

MHB 651
1 . HARK ! hark, my soul ! Angelic songs are swelling
O’er earth’s green fields and Ocean’s wave-beat shore:
How sweet the truth those blessèd strains are telling
Of that new life when sin shall be no more !

          Angels of Jesus, angels of light,
          Singing to welcome the pilgrims of the night !
	 ~ 	1 . TSIE! Me kra, tsie! Sor abɔfo ndwom ruhur
Wɔ kwaamu ɔnye mpoano nyinara;
Nokwar bi a dɛm ndwom no rowasa a,
Wɔ nkwa fofor a bɔn biara nnyi mu bio!
   Jesus abɔfo, kan abɔfo,
   Rotow ndwom ama akwantufo akɔaba!
Na ɔbra mu sum no pa ɔdɔ mu.

MHB 651
2 . Onward we go; for still we hear them singing: 
Come, weary souls, for Jesus bids you come;
And through the dark, its echoes sweetly ringing, 
The music of the gospel leads us home.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛkɔ hɛn enyim, yɛda ho tse hɔn ndwom no,
Akra a hom aberɛ, Jesus frɛ dɛ hom mbra!
Ndwom no gyegye dɛɛdɛw wɔ hɔ sum no mu,
Asɛmpa ndwom no dze hɛn rokɔ fie.

MHB 651
3 .  Far, far away, like bells at evening pealing,
The voice of Jesus sounds o’er land and sea, 
And laden souls, by thousands meekly stealing,
Kind Shepherd, turn their weary steps to Thee. 
 	 ~ 	3 
. Jesus Ne ndze gyegye asaase na po do,
Dɛ ewimbir dɔn a wɔrobɔ n' ekyirekyir,
Akra mpempen a wɔso adzesoa aberɛ;
Oguanhwɛfo pa, frɛ hɔn bra Wo nkyɛn.

MHB 651
4 . Rest comes at length; though life
be long and dreary, 
the day must dawn, and darksome night be past;
Faith’s journeys end in welcome to the weary, 
And heaven, the heart’s true home, will come at last. 
	 ~ 	4 
. Ahomgye ba; sɛ ɔbra war, yɛ basaa mpo a,
Adzekyee n' twar dɛ ɔba ma sum pa;
Gyedzi akwantu bɔ adze wɔ akɔaba-ma mu,
Na ɔkra n' nsa ka heaven, ne fie mapa n'.

MHB 651
5 .  Angels, sing on, your faithful watches keeping;
Sing us sweet fragments of the songs above, 
Till morning’s joy shall end the night of weeping, 
And life’s long shadows break in cloudless love.	 ~ 	5 
. Abɔfo, hom ntow ndwom, ber a hom roweɔn yi,
Hom ntow sor ndwom dɛɛdɛw no nkyerɛ hɛn,
Kɛpem dɛ anapa dɛw bɛpam anafua su,

MHB 652
1 . BRIEF life is here our portion,
Brief sorrow, short-lived care;
The life that knows no ending,
The tearless life, is there.
O happy retribution!
Short toil, eternal rest;
For mortals and for sinners,
A mansion with the blest!
	 ~ 	1 . Hɛn nkwaber yɛ tsia wɔ ha 
Yaw tsia, adwendwen tsia
Nkwa a ɔmmbɔ adze da,
Nyinsu nnyim' wɔ noho,
Ao, ndzinoa a ɔyɛ dɛw
Fona tsia, ahomgye daa;
Adasa ndzebɔnyɛ
Nye esiarfo bɛtsena.
Na 'bɛyɛ afebɔɔ.

MHB 652
2 . That we should look, poor wanderers,
To have our home on high!
That worms should seek for dwellings
Beyond the starry sky!
And now we fight the battle,
But then shall wear the crown
Of full and everlasting,
And  passionless renown. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Akobɔfo abɔbɔfo a, 
Yebenya fi wɔ sor!
Nsaamaa a yɛrohwehwɛ kobew
Wɔ nworaba n'ekyir!
Ndɛ dze yɛwɔ akono,
'Kyena na yɛso ahenkyɛw
A, odzi mu afebɔɔ
Na ne fɛw mmpa ara da.

MHB 652
3 . And how we watch and struggle,
And now we live in hope,
And Zion in her anguish
With Babylon must cope;
But He whom now we trust in
Shall then be seen and known,
And they that know and see Him
Shall have Him for their  own.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sesei dze yɛroweɔn, yɛreper, 
Yɛtse enyidadom',
Zion wɔ dɛ n'ahoguam'
Ɔnye Babylon si;
Na nyia sesei yɛtwer No n'
Ndaamba yebohu N' kann,
Hɔn a wonyim N' na Wohu N'
Benya N' ayɛ hɔndze.

MHB 652
4 . O sweet and blessed country,
The home of God’s elect!
O sweet and blessed country,
Jesu, in mercy bring us
To that dear land of rest,
Who art, with God the Father
And Spirit,  ever blest.
.      .      .      .
	 ~ 	4 
. Ao, enyigye na siar man, 
Nyame Ne mpamufo fie!
Ao, enyigye na siar man,
Akoma kɔn dɔ W', hwɛ W' kwan!
Jesu, mbɔbɔrhum' ara
Fa hɛn kɔ ahomgye bea n',
Ɔwo a 'nye Nyame Egya
Na Sunsum n' woehyira hom.

MHB 652
5 .  JERUSALEM the golden,
With milk and honey blessed,
Beneath thy contemplation
Sink heart and voice oppressed.
I know not, O I know not,
What  joys await  there,
What radiancy of glory,
What bliss beyond compare! 
	 ~ 	5 
. Jerusalem sika kurow, 
Numfonsu na wo ma
Wo ho adwendwen no ma
Akoma na ndze bɔm
Minnyim ara, ao, minyim
Dɛw a ɔrotweɔn hɛn hɔ,
Enyimnyam a ɔhyerɛn
Nhyira a ɔnntɔ ka.

MHB 652
6 . They stand, those halls of Zion,
All jubilant with song,
And bright with many an angel
And all the martyr throng;
The Prince is ever in them;
The daylight is serene;
The pastures of the blessed
Are decked in glorious sheen. 
	 ~ 	6 
. Zion asa n' nyina mu 
'Nyigye ndwom ahyɛ n' ma,
Abɔfo hyirenn na atɔfo
Ahyɛ mpemdo wɔ hɔ,
Ɔhenba n' tse hɔn finimfin
Adzekyee kan n' tsew wann;
Na esiarfo edzidzibea n'
Ayɛ nomanoma fɛɛfɛw.

MHB 652
7 . There is the throne of David,
And there, from care released,
The song of them that triumph,
The shout of them that feast;
And they who with their Leader,
Have conquered in the fight,
For ever and for ever
Are clad in robes of white. 
	 ~ 	7 
. David n'ahenguan n' si hɔ; 
Hɔ na konyimdzifo a
Woefi dadwen nsa bɔ se,
Na apontofo tow ndwom
Hɔn a wɔnye hɔn Sahen
Ako edzi konyim n'
Mbersantsen mfesantsen nyina
Woewuna hɔn ntar fitaa.

MHB 652
8 . Strive, man, to win that glory;
Toil, man, to gain that light;
Send hope before to grasp it,
Till hope be lost in sight.
Exult, O dust and ashes;
The Lord shall be thy part:
His only, His for ever
Thou shalt be, and thou art. 	 ~ 	8 
. Nyimpa, per nya enyimnyam n'; 
Ku wo ntsin nya kan no;
Ma enyidar ndzi kan nkosuom'
Kyerɛ ɔyew W'enyi do,
Dzi dɛw, ao, dɛtse na nso,
Nyame bɛyɛ wodze;
Nedze nye w', No nko Nedze

MHB 653
1 . SWEET place: sweet place alone!
The court of God most high,
The heaven of heavens, the throne
Of spotless majesty!

    O happy place! When shall I be
    My God, with Thee, To see Thy face? 
	 ~ 	1 . BEA a hɔ yɛ dɛw nko!
Nyame a ɔwɔ sor abangua,
Ɔsor mu sor ahengua,
W'ahentum no dzi mu.
    Enyigye bea! O dabɛn na
    M'bohu me Nyankopɔn enyim?
Mibenya me nhyira.

MHB 653
2 . There dwells my Lord, my King,
Judged here unfit to live;
There angels to Him sing,
And lowly homage give.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mo Wura, me Hen tse hɔ,
Memmfata hɔ tsena,
Hɔ, abɔfo tow ndwom
Butuw famu, kotow No.

MHB 653
3 . The patriarchs of old
There from their travels cease;
The prophets there behold
Their longed-for Prince of Peace.
	 ~ 	3 
. Tsetse mpanyimfo no
Kowiee hɔn akwantu n' hɔ;
Nkɔnhyɛfo no hun hɛn
Asomdwee Hen enyim.

MHB 653
4 . The Lamb’s apostles there
I might with joy behold;
The harpers I might hear
Harping on harps of gold.
	 ~ 	4 
. Medze enyigye bohu
Eguambaa N'asomafo,
M'betsie nsankubɔfo n'
Wɔ sika nsanku do.

MHB 653
5 . The faithful martyrs, they
Within those courts are found;
All clothed in pure array,
Their scars with glory crowned.
	 ~ 	5 
. Atɔfo anokwafo n'
Wɔ abangua no do,
Wɔhyɛ n-tar fitaa
'Nyimnyam hyɛ hɔn etua ma.

MHB 653
6 . Jerusalm  on high
My song and city is,
My home whene’er I die,
The  centre of my bliss.	 ~ 	6 
. Ɔsor Jerusalem
Nye mo ndwom na mo kurow;
Na mo wu ekyir no,

MHB 654
1 . THE homeland! The homeland!
The land of the free-born;
There’s no night in the homeland,
But aye the fadeless morn;
I’m sighing for the homeland,
My heart is aching here;
There’s no pain in the homeland,
To which I’m drawing near.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆSOR fie! Ɔsor fie!
Adehye-mba hɔn fie;
Adzesaa so nnyi ɔsor fie,
Mbom anapa a ɔmmpa a;
M'enyi akɛda ɔsor fie,
M'akoma dzi yaw wɔ ha;
Wonndzi yaw biara wɔ hɔ,
Merebɛn ho kakra.
Wɔ dɔ a onnyi ewiei mu.  Amen.

MHB 654
2 . My Lord is in the homeland,
With angels bright and fair;
There’s no sin in the homeland,
And no temptation there;
The voices of the homeland
Are ringing in my ears,
And when I think of the homeland,
My eyes are filled with tears.
	 ~ 	2 
. M'Ewuradze wɔ ɔsor fie,
'Nye N'abɔfoe wɔ hɔ;
Na bɔn bi nnyi ɔsor fie
Na nsɔhwɛ so nnyi hɔ;
Ndze bi a ofi sor fie
Rowosow m'asowa mu;
Na sɛ modwen ɔsor fie ho a,
Nyinsu hyɛ m'enyiwa ma.

MHB 654
3 . For those I love in the homeland
Are calling me away
To the rest and peace of the homeland,
And the life beyond decay:
For there’s no death in the homeland,
There is no grief above:
Christ bring us all to the homeland 
Of His  eternal love.  Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Hɔn a modɔ hɔn wɔ sor fie
Refrɛfrɛ me akɔ hɔ;
Ahomgye na asomdwee wɔ sor fie,
Na bra a ɔnnsɛɛ ara da;
Na owu bi nnyi sor fie hɔ,
Awerɛhow so nnyi hɔ;
Christ nye hɛn nkɔ ɔsor fie

MHB 655
1 . JERUSALEM, my happy home,
When shall I come to thee?
When shall my labors have an end?
Thy joys when shall I see?
	 ~ 	1 . JERUSALEM, m'ahomka fie!
M'bɛba wo hɔ dabɛn?
M'awerɛhow bɔbɔ adze dabɛn?
Dabɛn na m'bohu
Ne fafafo so daa.    Amen.

MHB 655
10 . There Magdalene hath left her moan,
And cheerfully doth sing
With blessèd saints, whose harmony
In every street doth ring.
	 ~ 	10 
. Magdalene egyaa n'apensi
Na ɔtow ndwom dɛw, m' wɔ hɔ,
Ɔnye ahotsewfo a hɔn ndwom
Yɛ dukuu wɔ abrɔn mu n'.

MHB 655
11 .Jerusalem, Jerusalem, 
God grant me once to see
Thy endless joys and of the same
Partaker  aye to be.   Amen.	 ~ 	11 
. Jerusalem, Jerusalem,
Nyame mboa ma munhu
Wo dɛw a ɔmmbɔ adze n', na menyɛ

MHB 655
2 . O happy harbour of the saints!
O sweet and pleasant soil!
In thee no sorrow may be found,
No grief, no care, no toil.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ahotsewfo ahomka mpoano!
O dɛw na ahotɔ bea!
Wo mu dze awerɛhow nnyi hɔ,
Yaw, dadwen na berɛ nnyi m'.

MHB 655
3 . Thy walls are made of precious stones,
Thy bulwarks diamonds square;
Thy gates are of right orient pearl,
Exceeding rich and rare;
 	 ~ 	3 
. W'afasu yɛ sika abotan,
W'aban yɛ ndɛnkyɛmbo;
Wo mbotsen yɛ man pa m' ndzepa,
Ahodze a ho yɛ na.

MHB 655
4 . Thy turrets and thy pinnacles
With carbuncles do shine
Thy very streets are paved with gold
Surpassing clear and fine.
	 ~ 	4 
. W'adan no srɔnsrɔmbea biara
Kandzea hyɛnhyɛnn hyerɛn do;
W'abɔntsen yɛ sika mfutuw,
Ɔyɛ fɛw, odzi mu.

MHB 655
5 . Thy vineyards and thy orchards are
Most beautiful and fair,
Full furnished with trees and fruits
Most wonderful and rare.
	 ~ 	5 
. Wo w'enyinaba na nduaba kwa
Yɛ ahomka dodow;
Ndua na nduaba pa ahyɛ mu ma,
Ɔyɛ nwanwa dodow.

MHB 655
6 . Thy gardens and thy gallant walks
Continually are green,
There grow such sweet and pleasant flowers
As nowhere else are seen.
 	 ~ 	6 
. Wo turo ahorow na mfuwa
Yɛ ebunebun daa;
Nhyiren huanhuam fɛɛfɛw wɔ hɔ,
Hɔn saso nnyi beebi.

MHB 655
7 . Quite through the streets with silver sound
The flood of life doth flow;
Upon whose banks on every side
The wood of life doth grow.
 	 ~ 	7 
. W'abrɔn a dwetɛ gyegye mu n',
N-kwa esutsen pem m' weɔɔ;
Ne nkyɛnkyɛn, afa na afa nyina,
N-kwa dua wuna wusuww.

MHB 655
8 . Thy saints are crowned with glory great,
They see God face to face;
They triumph still, they still rejoice,
Most happy is their case.
	 ~ 	8 
. W'ahotsewfo hyɛ 'nyam 'henkyɛw,
'Hu Nyame enyim na enyim;
Wodzi nyim ara, wodzi dɛw ara,
Wɔwɔ ahomka m' daa.

MHB 655
9 . There David stands with harp in hand
As master of the quire,
Ten thousand times that man were blest
That might this music hear.
 	 ~ 	9 
. David dze ne sanku m' wɔ hɔ
Dɛ adwontow kuw panyin;
Nyia ɔbɛtse hɔn ndwom no bi n'
Woehyira n' mbɔho piigyan.

MHB 656
1 . AROUND the throne of God in heaven
Thousands of children stand,
Children whose sins are all forgiven,
A holy, happy band,

     Singing: Glory, glory, glory!
	 ~ 	1 . MBOFRA mpempem etwa ehyia
Nyame N'ahengua enyim,
Mbofra a wɔahor hɔn ho bɔn nyina,
Ahotsewfo fɛkuw.
     Wɔtow : 'Nyimnyam
     'nyimnyam, 'nyimnyam!
Na wogyina Eguambaa enyim n'.

MHB 656
2 . In flowing robes of spotless white
See everyone arrayed,
Dwelling in everlasting light
And joys that never fade.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hwɛ wɔhyɛ ntar pa fitaa bi a
Nkekaa biara nnyi mu,
Wɔtse daa daa kan na dɛw a
Ɔmmpa ara da mu.

MHB 656
3 . What brought them to the world above,
That heaven so bright and fair,
Where all is peace, and joy, and love?
How came those children there?
	 ~ 	3 
. Mframa bɛn bɔɔ hɔn kɔr sor hɔ?
Sor a pɛrpɛr tsim hɔ daa,
Bea a asomdwee, dɛw na dɔ nsu pem;
Mbofra 'i sii dɛn kɔr hɔ.

MHB 656
4 . Because the Savior shed His blood
To wash away their sin;
Bathed in that pure and precious flood,
Behold them white and clean,
	 ~ 	4 
. Agyenkwa N' bɔgyaa a okyii no
Hohoor hɔn ho fi no:
Woguar adehye nsu krɔnn no mu;
Hwɛ, hɔn ho atsew fitaa!

MHB 656
5 . On earth they sought the Savior’s grace,
On earth they loved His Name;
So now they see His blessèd face,
And stand before the Lamb,	 ~ 	5 
. Wɔtse ase n', wɔhwehwɛɛ Agyenkwa
N'adom, wɔdɔɔ Ne dzin,
Ntsi na ndɛ wohu N' siar enyim n',

MHB 657
1 . FOR those we love within the veil,
Who once were comrades of our way,
We thank Thee, Lord; for they have won
To cloudless day;
 	 ~ 	1 . Hɔn a wu ntwamutam suma hɔn n', 
Hɛn 'gyafo a nkyɛ wɔka hɛn ho n',
Woedu sor adzekyee mu ntsi
Yɛda W' ase.
Nyina yɛ kor.

MHB 657
2 . And life for them is life indeed,
The splendid goal of earth’s strait race;
And where no shadows intervene
They see Thy face.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɔn nkwa no yɛ n-kwa ampa, 
Woedu empiresi n'ewiei,
Afei wohu W'enyim petee:
Hwee nnsiw hɔn kwan.

MHB 657
3 . Not as we knew them any more,
Toil worn, and sad with burdened care-
Erect, clear eyed, upon their brows
Thy Name they bear.
 	 ~ 	3  
. Dɛ mbrɛ yehun hɔn wɔ fonam' 
Na ahohia mu n', wɔnntse dɛm bio:
Hɔn enyi hu adze kann: Wo dzin
Wɔ hɔn pɔw do.

MHB 657
4 . Free from the fret of mortal years,
And knowing now Thy perfect will,
With quickened sense and heightened joy
They serve Thee still.
 	 ~ 	4  
. Kɔdaann-da efi hɔn do koraa, 
Na woehu W'apɛdze nyina;
Wɔdze dɛw a yennyim wɔ ha 
Som Wo daa daa.

MHB 657
5 . O fuller, sweeter is that life,
And larger, ampler is the air:
Eye cannot see nor heart conceive
The glory there;
	 ~ 	5 
. O nkwa a ɔahyɛ hɔn amaama a! 
Sor mframa a wɔgye n' yɛ dɛw;
Enyigye n' bor hɛn adwen do;
Onnyi kabea.

MHB 657
6 . Nor know to what high purpose Thou
Dost yet employ their ripened powers,
Nor how at Thy behest they touch
This life of ours.
	 ~ 	6 
. Edwuma so a seesei wɔyɛ n', 
Dza ɔsɛ nyimdzee a oedzi mu a,
Na dza ema wɔyɛ ma hɛn
Yenntum yennhu.

MHB 657
7 . There are no tears within their eyes;
With love they keep perpetual tryst;
And praise and work and rest are one,
With Thee, O Christ.	 ~ 	7 
. Wonnkyi nyinsuwa hɔ ara bio, 
Dɔ nko na wɔdze edzi ehyia;
Sor hɔ dwuma, nkamfo, ahomgye

MHB 658
1 . FOR ever with the Lord!
Amen, so let it be:
Life from the dead is in that word,
Tis immoratality.
Here in the body pent,
Absent from Him I roam,
Yet night pitch my moving tent
A day’s march near home.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE Wo nkyɛn ara!
Amen; ma ɔnyɛ hɔ;
'Wu mu nkwa wɔ dɛm asɛm no m'
Yɛ bɛkyebo nkwa pa;
Metse honam mu yi,
Mikyima fi Ne nkyɛn,
Anago biara misi me
Ntamadan bɛn Ne fie.
Ewuradze, Wo nkyɛn ara!

MHB 658
2 . My Father’s house on high,
Home of my soul, how near
At times to faith’s foreseeing eye
Thy golden gates appear!
Ah! then my spirit faints
To reach the land I love,
The bright inheritance of saints,
Jerusalem above.
	 ~ 	2 
. M'Egya fie a ɔwɔ sor,
Me kra fie a ɔbɛn,
Ma gyedzi enyiwa pa nhu
Wo sika mbobow no!
Afei me kra reper
Dɛ obodu man a modɔ n',
'Hotsewfo egyapadze a ɔhyerɛn,
Ɔsor Jerusalem.

MHB 658
3 . For ever with the Lord !
Father , if ’tis Thy will,
The promise of that faithful word
Even here to me fulfill.
Be Thou at my right hand,
Then can I never fail;
Uphold  thou me,  and I shall stand;
Fight, and I must prevail.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, Wo nkyɛn ara!
Egya, ɔyɛ Wo pɛ a,
Ma me nsa nka anohoba n',
Asɛm no mu dze no.
Gyina me nsa nyimfa
Na monnkɔhwe ase;
Suo mo mu na mibegyina
Ko m' na m'bedzi konyim.

MHB 658
4 . So when my latest breath
Shall rend the veil in twin,
By death I shall escape from death
And life eternal gain.
Knowing as I am known,
How shall I love that throne:
For ever with the Lord ! 	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ m'ahomgu bɔ adze a,
Tsew nkataenyim no mu a,
Menam owu mu benya nkwa,
N-kwa a onnyi ewiei.
Dɛ mbrɛ metse 'i ara,
M'bɛyɛ dɛn adɔ asɛm n'
Na daa maka n' ahengua enyim?

MHB 659
1 . O DAY of rest and gladness,
O day of joy and light,
O balm of care and sadness,
Most beautiful, most bright!
On thee the high and lowly,
Sing: Holy, holy, holy,
Sing Holy, Holy, Holy,
To the great God Triune. 
	 ~ 	1 . AHOMGYE na enyigye da,
O dɛw na ekan da,
Dadwen na awerɛhow edur,
Ɔyɛ fɛw na ɔhyerɛn;
Wo mu, akɛse na nkuma
Bɔ m' mfesantsen nyina
Tow: Krɔnkrɔn, Krɔnkrɔn, Krɔnkrɔn
Ma Ɔkorsa Nyame.
Ma Ɔwo, Baasa Kor.  Amen.

MHB 659
2 . On thee, at the creation,
The light first had its birth;
On thee for our salvation,
Christ rose from depths of earth;
On thee our Lord victorious
The Spirit sent from heaven:
And thus on thee most glorious
A triple light was given.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wo mu na abɔdze mu no,
Wodzii kan yɛɛ ekan;
Wo mu na hɛn nkeagye ntsi
Christ soɛree fii nda mu;
Wo mu, hɛn konyimdzi Wura
Somaa Sunsum n' fii sor,
N-tsi nyimnyamfo, Wo mu
Na emaa kan mprɛnsa.

MHB 659
3 . To-day on weary nations
The heavenly manna falls;
To holy convocations
The silver trumpet calls,
Where gospel light is glowing
With pure and radiant beams,
And living water flowing
With soul-refreshing streams.
 	 ~ 	3 
. N-dɛ sor manna tɔ wɔ
Aman a wɔaberɛ do;
Dwetɛ totorobɛnto no
Frɛ nhyiamu krɔnkrɔn n' wɔ 
Beebi a asɛmpa kan no 
Da kan ne nserɛmɛn edzi,
Na nkwa nsu pem wɔ hɔ dɛ
N-su a ɔdwedwe akra.

MHB 659
4 . New graces ever gaining
From this our day of rest,
We reach the rest remaining
To  spirits of the blest.
To Holy Ghost be praises,
To Father, and to Son;
The Church her voice upraises
To thee, blest Three in One.  Amen. 	 ~ 	4 
. Yenya adom fofor daa
Fi ahomgye da yi mu,
Hɛn nsa ka ahomgye a ɔyɛ 
Akra a woehyira hɔn n' dze;
Ayɛyi nka Egya, Ɔba
Nye Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn no;
Asɔr no ma ne ndze do

MHB 66
1 . O GOD of all grace 
 Thy goodness we praise; 
 Thy Son Thou hast given to die in our place.  
 He came from above 
 Our curse to remove; 
 He hath loved, He hath loved us, because He would love. 
	 ~ 	1 . ADOM nyina Nyame,
Yɛkamfo W'adɔe,
Edze Wo Ba ama dɛ ombowu mma hɛn.
Ofi ɔsor bae,
Ribeyi hɛn ndom;
Ɔadɔ, ɔadɔ hɛn osiandɛ ɔpɛ ɔdɔ.

MHB 66
2 . Love moved Him to die, 
 And on this we rely; 
 He hath loved, He hath loved us:  
 we cannot tell why; 
 But this we can tell, 
 He hath loved us so well 
 As to lay down His life to redeem 
 us from hell. 
He hath ransomed our race; 
 O how shall we praise 
 Or worthily sing Thy unspeakable grace?  
 Nothing else will we know 
 In our journey below, 
 But singing Thy grace to Thy paradise go.
 	 ~ 	2 . Ɔdɔ gyaa N' ma owui,
Hɛn enyi da 'yi do,
 Ɔadɔ, ɔadɔ hɛn, yennkotum atse ase,
Yebotum aka 'yi,
 Ɔadɔ hɛn kɛse,
Dɛ ɔdze No nkwa too hɔ gyee hɛn fii hɛll.

MHB 66
4 . Nay, and when we remove 
 To Thy presence above, 
 Our heaven shall be still to sing of thy love. 
 We all shall commend 
 The love of our Friend, 
 For ever beginning what never shall end.	 ~ 	4 . Na sɛ yefi ha
Pue W'enyim wɔ sor,
Hɛn sor bɛyɛ Wo dɔ ho ndwom ara nko,
Hɛn nyina bɛkamfo,
Hɛn Nyɛnko No dɔ,
Dza wɔhyɛ ase no rommbɔ adze da.

MHB 660
1 . THIS is the day of light:
Let there be light today;
O Dayspring, rise upon our night,
And chase its gloom away.
	 ~ 	1 . N-dɛ yɛ ekan da; 
Nyame, ma kan mbra ndɛ;
Hɛn Anapawi, hyerɛn hɛn do,
Na pam hɛn sum nyina.
Wɔndɔ Wo, wɔnsom Wo

MHB 660
2 . This is the day of rest:
Our failing strength renew;
On weary brain and troubled breast
Shed Thou Thy freshening dew.
 	 ~ 	2 
. N-dɛ yɛ ahomgye da; 
Hyɛ hɛn ahoɔdzen mu;
Hue Wo bɔw nwinwin no ma hɛn,
Dwedwe 'koma a ɔahaw,

MHB 660
3 . This is the day of peace:
Thy peace our spirits fill;
Bid Thou the blasts of discord cease,
The waves of strife be still.
 	 ~ 	3 
. N-dɛ yɛ asomdwee da; 
Fa W'asomdwee ma hɛn;
Ma mansotwe nyina mbɔ adze 
Ma wongyaa n-tokwaa.

MHB 660
4 . This is the day of prayer:
Let earth to heaven draw near;
Lift up our hearts to seek Thee there,
Come down to meet us here.
 	 ~ 	4  
. N-dɛ yɛ mpaabɔ da: 
Ma asaase mpinkyɛn sor;
Ma hɛn akoma nhwehwɛ Wo,
Bra behyia hɛn wɔ ha

MHB 660
5 . This is the first of days:
Send forth Thy quickening breath,
And wake dead souls to love and praise,
O Vanquisher of death!   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. N-dɛ yɛ mpaabɔ da: 
Bɔ mfar a ɔma nkwa;
Na nyan akra a woewuwu ma

MHB 661
1 .  COME, let us with our Lord arise,
Our Lord who made both earth and skies;
Who died to save the world He made,
And rose triumphant from the dead;
He rose, the Prince of life and peace,
And stamped  the day for ever His.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM mbra ma yɛnye hɛn Wura nsoɛr,
Hɛn wura a ͻyɛɛ asaase na wimu;
Owui gyee wiadzé a ͻbͻe no
Na ͻsoɛɛr konyim mu fii wu m’,
N-kwa nyé asomdwee Hen scarce
Na ͻdze da no yɛɛ Nedze daa.
Hom nka N'ayɛyi na dͻ nko.    Amen.

MHB 661
2 . This is the day the Lord has made,
That all may see His love displayed,
May feel His resurrection’s power,
And rise again, to fall no more,
In perfect righteousness renewed,
And fill with all the life of God.
	 ~ 	2 
. Iyi nye da a Ewuradzé ayɛ
Ma obiara eehu No dͻ no,
Atse No wusoɛr tum no nka
Na ͻaasoɛr a ͻnnhwé ase bio;
Wͻayɛ N' fofor wͻ tsenenee mu,
Na Nyame nkwa ahyɛ no ma.

MHB 661
3 . Then let us render Him his own,
With solemn prayer approach the throne,
With meekness hear the gospel word,
Wth thanks His dying love record;
Our joyful hearts and voices raise,
And fill His court with songs of praise.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hom mma yɛmfa Nedze mma No,
Yɛmfa mpaabͻ mbɛn ahengua n’
Mfa ahobrɛadze ntsie asɛmpa n’,
Mfa ndaase mma ͻdͻ a ͻdze wui n’;
Yɛma hɛn akoma na ndze do
Dzé ayɛyi ndwom kͻ abangua n' do.

MHB 661
4 . Honour and praise to Jesus pay
Throughout His consecrated day;
Be all in Jesu's praise employed,
Nor leave a single moment  void;
With utmost care the time improve,
And only breathe His praise and love.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. ’Nyidzi na ayɛyi nka Jesus,
Ne da krͻnkrͻn yi mu nyina;
Obia’a ntow Jesus N'ayɛyi;
Mma wonngyaa ber kakraabi mpo,
Ma iyi nkͻ do ber nyina;

MHB 662
1 . SWEET is the sunlight after rain,
And sweet the sleep which follows pain,
And sweetly steals the Sabbath rest
Upon the world’s work-wearied breast. 
	 ~ 	1 . EWIA ekyir nsutɔ yɛ dɛw,
Na yaw ekyir n-da yɛ dɛw;
Ahomgye da dze ahom dɛɛdɛw
Ba wiadze a ɔaberɛ do.
Ma yɛntsena gyedzi mu nwu.

MHB 662
2 . Of heaven the sign of earth the calm;
The poor man’s birthright, and his balm;
God’s witness of celestial things;
A sun with healing in its wings. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Sor 'sɛnkyerɛdze, asaase asomdwee,
Hianyi kyɛfa, na akyenkyendur;
Nyame dase, sor ndzɛmba ho;
Ewia wɔ ayarsa wɔ no mu.

MHB 662
3 . New rising in this gospel time,
And in its sevenfold light sublime,
Blest day of God! we hail its dawn,
To gratitude and worship drawn. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Nkyenan fofor wɔ asɛmpa 'i mu
Na ne kan m-pɛn esuon mu,
Nyame nhyira da! Yehua ne kan,
Ɔdze ndaase na ɔsom ba.

MHB 662
4 . O nought of gloom and nought of pride
Should with the sacred hours abide;
At work for God, in loved employ,
We lose the duty in the joy. 
	 ~ 	4 
. Kusuww nye ahantan biara
Nnkotum nye ber krɔnkrɔn atsena;
Yɛyɛ Nyame edwuma ɔdɔ mu,
Yɛyew edwuma no dɛw mu.

MHB 662
5 . Breathe on us, Lord! our sins forgive,
And make us strong in faith to live:
Our utmost, sorest need supply,
And make us strong in faith to die. Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Ewuradze, hom gu hɛn do
Ma yengyina pintsinn wɔ dɔ mu,
Na ma hɛn hɛn ehiadze daa

MHB 663
1 . LIGHT of Light, enlighten me,
Now anew the day is dawning;
Sun of grace, the shadows flee,
Brighten Thou my Sabbath morning;
With Thy joyous sunshine blest,
Happy is my day of rest!
	 ~ 	1 . KAN a ofir kan, bue m'enyi,
Afei adze rekye fofor;
Adom Ewia, pam sum no;
Ma m'Ahomgye da anapa nhyerɛn
W'enyigye nhyira ewia n',
M'ahomgye da yɛ enyika.
M'bɔhom Wo dɔ mu ara nko.

MHB 663
2 . Fount of all our joy and peace,
To Thy living waters lead me;
Thou from earth my soul release,
And with grace and mercy feed me;
Bless Thy word, that it may prove
Rich in fruits that  Thou dost love.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn dɛw na asomdeee bura,
Gya me kɔ Wo nkwa esu ho;
Ɔwo gye m' kra fi wiadze;
Fa adom na mbɔbɔrhu nyɛn 
Hyira W'asɛm do ma ɔnsow
Aba bafuu nkyerɛ Wo dɔ.

MHB 663
3 . Kindle Thou the sacrifice
That upon my lips is lying;
Clear the shadows from my eyes,
That, from every error flying,
No strange fire may in me glow
That Thine altar doth not know.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɔ W'afɔr no a ɔda
M'anomu no mu ogya no;
Yi m'enyi do sum fi hɔ
Ma meegyaa mfomdo biara yɛ,
Mma ogya fofor bi nndzɛw
Mo mu a W'afɔrmbukyia nnyim.

MHB 663
4 . Let me with my heart to-day,
Holy, holy, holy singing,
Rapt awhile from earth away,
All my soul to Thee upbringing,
Have a foretaste inly  given
How they worship Thee in heaven.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma memfa m'akoma ntow
Krɔnkrɔn, Krɔnkrɔn, Krɔnkrɔn n-dɛ
Ntwe m'ho mfi wiadze kakra;
Na me kra ntow mbra Wo hɔ sor
M'bɔsɔ mbrɛ wosi som Wo
Wɔ sor tsenabea hɔ no nhwɛ

MHB 663
5 . Rest in me, and I in Thee,
Build a paradise within me;
O reveal Thyself to me,
Blessèd Love, who diedst to win me;
Fed from Thine exhaustless urn,
Pure and bright my lamp shall burn.
	 ~ 	5 
. Hom mo mu, mowɔ Wo mu,
Hyehyɛ paradise wɔ mo mu;
O yi Woho kyerɛ me,
Ɔdɔ siarfo a iwui gyee me,
Wo toa mu ngo a ɔnnsa da n'
Bɛma me kandzea adzɛw daa.

MHB 663
6 . Hence all care, all vanity,
For the day to God is holy;
Come, Thou glorious majesty,
Deign to fill this temple lowly;
Naught today my soul shall move
Simply resting in Thy love.	 ~ 	6 
. Dadwen nye egyangyandze nyina
Nyɛ da no krɔnkrɔn mma Nyame;
Bra, Otumfo nyimyamfo,
Na bɛhyɛ asɔrdan yi ma;
Me kra nnkehinhim n-dɛ,

MHB 664
1 . O HOW blest the hour, Lord Jesus,
When we can to Thee draw near,
Promises so sweet and precious
From Thy gracious lips to hear.
	 ~ 	1 . O EWURADZE Jesus, ber a
Yɛtwe bɛn Wo n' yɛ nhyira,
Yɛtse anohoba dɛɛdɛw pii a
Ɔsom bo fi W'anomu.
Ne dɛw nye ne kan pa no.

MHB 664
2 . Be with us this day to bless us,
That we may not hear in vain;
With the saving truths impress us,
Which the words of life contain.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ka hɛn ho ndɛ na hyira hɛn,
Amma yaannyɛ gyan wɔ mu;
Ma yenhu nkwagye nokwar no,
Abrabɔ mu n-sɛm no.

MHB 664
3 . Open Thou our minds, and lead us
Safely on our heavenward way;
With the lamp of truth precede us,
That we may not go astray.
	 ~ 	3 
. Bue hɛn adwen na mu na gya hɛn.
Sɔkyee kɔ hɛn sor kwan do;
Nokwar kandzea no ndzi hɛn kan
Na amma yaanntɔ dɔnsuar.

MHB 664
4 . Make us gentle, meek, and humble,
And yet bold in doing right:
Scatter darkness, lest we stumble;
Men walk safely in the light.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma hɛn ɔdwe na ahobrɛadze,
Eso yɛnyɛ dza ɔtsen;
Pam isum amma yeemmfintsiw;
Nyimpa nantsew sɔnn kan mu.

MHB 664
5 . Lord, endue Thy word from heaven
With such light, and love, and power,
That in us its silent leaven
May work on from hour to hour.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ma hɛn ɔdwe na ahobrɛadze,
Eso yɛnyɛ dza ɔtsen;
Pam isum amma yeemmfintsiw;
Nyimpa nantsew sɔnn kan mu.

MHB 664
6 . Give us grace to bear our witness
To the truths we have embraced;
And let others both their sweetness
And their quickening virtue taste.  Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Ma hɛn adom ma yɛngye dase
Wɔ nokwar a yeesuo m' no ho;
Na ma binom so n-sɔ nhwɛ,

MHB 665
1 . SWEET is the work, my God, my King,
To praise Thy name, give thanks and sing;
To show your love by morning light,
And talk of all your truth at night.
	 ~ 	1 . ME NYAME, me Hen, W'ayɛyi
Ndaase, adwontow ho edwuma yɛ dɛw;
Wɔkyerɛ Wo dɔ anapa kan,
Wɔka Wo nokwar anafua.
Wɔ dɛw bɛkyebo wiadze n' mu.

MHB 665
2 . Sweet is the day, the first and rest,
No mortal cares disturb my breast:
O may  my heart in tune be found,
Like David’s harp of joyful sound !
	 ~ 	2 
. Ahomgye da krɔnkrɔn yɛ dɛw,
Adwendwen biara nnhaw mo bo;
O ma m'akoma ntow ndwom dɛ
David sankutsen dɛɛdɛw no.

MHB 665
3 . My heart shall triumph in the Lord,
And bless His works, and bless His word:
Thy works of grace, how bright they shine !
how deep Thy counsels, how divine !
	 ~ 	3 
. M'akoma dzi nyim Ewuradze m'
Na oehyira No ndwuma nye N'asɛm;
Mbrɛ W'adom ndwuma si hyerɛn a!
W'afotu mu dɔ, no ho tsew.

MHB 665
4 . And I shall share a glorious part,
When grace has well refined my heart,
And fresh supplies of joy are shed,
Like holy oil to cheer my head.
	 ~ 	4 
. Na m'benya enyimnyam kyefa
Ber a adom atsew m'akoma ho,
Na menya enyigye fofor,
Dɛ ngo krɔnkrɔn asera me tsirmu.

MHB 665
5 . Then shall I see, and hear, and know
All I desired and wished below;
And every power find sweet employ
In that eternal world of joy. 	 ~ 	5 
. Afei mobohu na matse
Dza mohwehwɛ wɔ ha nyina,
Na abɔdze nyina benya enyigye

MHB 666
1 . WE rose to-day with anthems sweet
To sing before the mercy seat,
And ere the darkness round us fell
We bade the grateful vespers swell. 
	 ~ 	1 . Yɛdze adwontow hyɛɛ ase ndɛ, 
Wɔ mbɔbɔr ahengua n' enyim;
Ansaana 'nafua sum bɛba n',
Yɛtow ewimbir ndaase ndwom.
Na yensuasua N' yɛnye N' nsɛ daa. Amen.

MHB 666
2 . Whate’er has risen from heart sincere,
Each upward glance of filial fear,
Each true resolve, each solemn vow,
Jesus our Lord! accept them now. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Dza ofir nokwar akomam', 
Enyidzi suro a wɔdze hwɛ W',
Sua a yesua, n-tam a yɛka,
Hɛn Wura Jesus, pen do gye.

MHB 666
3 . Whate’er beneath Thy searching eyes
Has wrought to spoil our sacrifice,
Mid this sweet stillness while we bow,
Jesus our Lord! forgive us now. 
	 ~ 	3  
. Dza W'enyi ehwiram' ehu 
Dɛ ogu hɛn afɔr ho fi n',
Yɛakotow komm wɔ W'enyim yi,
Hɛn Wura Jesus, fa kyɛ hɛn.

MHB 666
4 . O teach us erring souls to win,
And hide their multitude of sin,
To tread in Christ’s long-suffering way,
And grow more like Him day by day.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Kyerɛ hɛn ma yɛngye akra nkwa, 
Na yɛnkata bɔn mpempem do,
Yensi Christ Ne penkyɛr kwan n' mu,

MHB 667
1 . THE day Thou gavest, Lord, is ended,
The darkness falls at Thy behest;
To Thee our morning hymns ascended,
Thy praise shall sanctify our rest.
	 ~ 	1 . Hɛn Wura, da a 'dze kyɛɛ hɛn n' asa, 
Sum etsin W'asɛm do rehyɛ;
Yɛtoow hɛn anapa ndwom maa Wo
W'abɔdzin bɛtsew hen nda ho.
Ibedzi adze nyina do hen.

MHB 667
2 . We thank Thee that Thy Church unsleeping,
While earth rolls onward into light,
Through all the world her watch is keeping,
And rests not now by day or night.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ndaase nka W' dɛ W' Asɔr risi pi, 
Ber a wiadze rokɔ kan mu;
W' Asɔr roweɔn wɔ wiadze nyina,
Ɔnngye n' ahom dabiara pɛn.

MHB 667
3 . As o’er each continent and island
The dawn leads on another day,
The voice of prayer is never silent,
Nor dies the strain of praise away.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Aber a 'napawi hyerɛn ka 
N-kurow a wɔda ham' na pom',
Asɔryɛ ndze ɔda ho ara,
Ayɛyindwom ɔmmbɔ adze da.

MHB 667
4 . The sun that bids us rest is waking
Our brethren ’neath the western sky,
And hour by hour fresh lips are making
Thy wondrous doings heard on high.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ewia rinyan hɛn enuanom a 
Wɔtse anee ber a yɛadeda;
Dɔnhwer nyina ano fofor ma
Wɔtse Wo nyɛe nwanwa n' wɔ sor.

MHB 667
5 .  So be it, Lord; Thy throne shall never,
Like earth’s proud empires, pass away;
Thy kingdom stands, and grows for ever,
Till all Thy creatures own thy sway.	 ~ 	5 
. Ɔnyɛ dɛm daa, hɛn Wura; W'ahengua 
Nnkotwam' da dɛ amansuon tum;
W'ahenman betsim hɔ akɛpem dɛ

MHB 668
1 . ANGEL voices, ever singing
Round Thy throne of light,
Angel harps, for ever ringing,  
Rest not day or night;
Thousands only live to bless Thee, 
And confess Thee 
Lord of might.
	 ~ 	1 . Sor abɔfo ndze nye nsanku 
Twa W'ahengua ho,
Wɔwosow n-dwom dɛɛdɛw a
Ɔmmbɔ adze ara da;
M-pempem na wohyira Wo
Dɛ tum nyina 
Ewuradze.
San dze ma W'.    Amen.

MHB 668
2 . Thou Who art beyond the farthest
Mortal eye can scan,
Can it be that Thou regardest songs of sinful man?
Can we know that Thou art near us 
And wilt hear us?
Yea, we can.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔwo a ewɔ sorsor noho 
Mbrɛ nyimpa nntum nnhu n',
Aso abɔn yɛtow ndwom a,
Ɔwo 'bu no bi?
Na yetum hu dɛ ebɛn hɛn
Na itsie hɛn?
Nyew, yetum.

MHB 668
3 . Yea, we know That Thou rejoicest 
O’er each work of Thine;
Thou didst ears and hands and voices 
For Thy praise design;
Craftsman’s art and music’s measure
 For Thy pleasure
All combine.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyew, yenyim dɛ idzi ehurusi 
Wɔ W'edwinsa ho;
Eyɛɛ asowa na nsa na kɔmɛr
Dze maa W'ayɛyi;
Dwimfo nyansa, sanku ne dɛw,
Ne nyina bɔm' ma W'
Enyigye.

MHB 668
4 . In Thy house, great God, today we offer
Of Thine own to Thee,
And for Thine acceptance proffer,
All unworthily,
Hearts and minds, and hands and voices 
In our choicest
Psalmody.
	 ~ 	4  
. Tumfo Nyame, Woara Wodze 
Na yɛdze brɛ Wo,
Ɔmmfata dze, naaso yɛserɛ
Dɛ gye n' dɛmara:
'Koma, adwen, nsa, na kɔmɛr,
Yɛdze bɔm' wɔ
Hɛn ndwom pam'.

MHB 668
5 . Honour, glory, might and merit
Thine shall ever be,
Father, Son, and Holy Spirit,
Blessed Trinity.
Of the best that Thou hast given
Earth and Heaven
Render Thee.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Tum nye enyidzi nye enyimnyam. 
Bɛyɛ Wodze daa,
Egya, Ba, na Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn,
Ɔkorsa siarfo.
Dza edze ama no mu mapa n',
Na sor na ase

MHB 669
1 . DEAR Lord and Father of mankind,
Forgive our foolish ways;
Re-clothe us in our rightful mind;
In purer lives thy service find,
In deeper  reverence praise.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE pa, adasa Egya,
Fa hɛn m-fom kyɛ hɛn;
Ma hɛn adwen a ɔfata
Wɔ abrabɔ krɔnkrɔn som mu,
Wɔ enyidzi ayɛyi mu.
Yɛntse Wo ndze tseaa no.

MHB 669
2 . In simple trust like theirs who heard,
Beside the Syrian sea,
The gracious calling of the Lord,
Let us, like them, without a word
Rise up and follow Thee.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛntwer Wo tse dɛ hɔn a wɔtsee
Wɔ Syrian epo ho n',
Ewuradze N'adom frɛ no;
Mma hɛn so yɛnnka asɛm biara,
Na yɛnsoɛr ndzi W'ekyir.

MHB 669
3 . O Sabbath rest by Galilee!
O calm of hills above,
Where Jesus knelt to share with Thee
The silence of eternity,
Interpreted by love!
	 ~ 	3 
. O Galilee ahomgye da
O mbepɔw do kommyɛ,
Mbrɛ Jesus buu n-kotodwe!
Na ɔkaa onnyiewiei ho nsɛm,
Ɔdze ɔdɔ kyerɛɛ ase!

MHB 669
4 . With that deep hush subduing all 
Our words and works that drown 
The tender whisper of Thy call, 
As noiseless let Thy blessing fall
As fell Thy manna down. 
	 ~ 	4 
. Dɛ kommyɛ a no mu dɔ no
Bor hɛn nsɛm nye ndwuma do;
Wo frɛ a ɔwasa bɔkɔɔ no,
Dɛm na ma Wo nhyira no ngu
Dɛ Wo manna tɔe no.

MHB 669
5 . Drop Thy still dews of quietness, 
Till all our strivings cease; 
Take from our souls the strain and stress, 
And let our ordered lives confess 
The beauty of  Thy peace. 
	 ~ 	5 
. Ma Wo bɔsu nkɔ do nsosɔ
Nkɛpem hɛn aperdzi ewiei!
Yi hɛn akra adzesoa no,
Na hɛn bra a ahyehyɛ ama hɛn nka
W'asomdwee ne fɛw no.

MHB 669
6 . Breathe through the heats of our desire
Thy coolness and Thy balm; 
Let sense be dumb, let flesh retire; 
Speak trough the earthquake, wind, and fire, 
O still small voice of calm !     Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Gu ahom gu hɛn apɛdze do,
Wo kommyɛ eduyɛ mu,
Adwen ntaa dzinn, honam nyɛ komm;
'Saasewosow, ehum nye gya m'

MHB 67
1 . O GOD, of good the unfathomed Sea! 
 Who would not give his heart to Thee?  
 Who would not love Thee with his might? 
 O Jesus, Lover of mankind, 
 Who would not his whole soul and mind, 
 With all his strength, to Thee unite?
	 ~ 	1 . EPO pa a no mu dɔ Nyame!
Woana nnkɛfa n'akoma ama W'?
Na ɔnnkɛfa n'ahoɔdzen adɔ W'?
O Jesus, adasa Dɔfo,
Woana nnkɛpɛ dɛ ɔdze ne kra,
N'adwen, n'ahoɔdzen bata W' ho?

MHB 67
2 . Thou shin’st with everlasting rays; 
 Before the insufferable blaze 
 Angels with both wings veil their eyes: 
 Yet free as air Thy bounty streams 
 On all thy works; Thy mercy’s beams 
 Diffusive as Thy sun’s arise.
	 ~ 	2 . Wo hyerɛn no mmbɔ adze da
Wɔ gya a ɔnnhyehye enyim;
'Bɔfo dze ntsaban bua hɔn enyim. 
Naaso W'adɔe tse dɛ mframa,
Ɔbɔ fa Wo ndwuma nyina do,
Ɔhwetse ber a W'ewia pue.

MHB 67
3 . Astonished at Thy frowning brow, 
 Earth, hell, and heaven’s strong pillars bow 
 Terrible majesty is Thine. 
 Who then can that vast love express 
 Which bows Thee down to me, who less 
 Than nothing am, till Thou art mine?
	 ~ 	3 . Imuna a, ahodwuruw ma
'Saase, hɛll na sor edum hinhim;
Tum a ɔyɛ hu yɛ Wodze,
Woana botum akyerɛ ɔdɔ a
Ɔtwe Wo bɛn emi dɛm yi,
Kesi dɛ ebɛyɛ medze?

MHB 67
4 . High throned on heaven’s eternal hill, 
 In number, weight, and measure still 
 Thou sweetly orderest all that is: 
 And yet Thou deign’st to come to me, 
 And guide my steps, that I, with Thee 
 Enthroned, may reign in endless bliss.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔwo a idzi hen wɔ sorsor
Wɔ ndzɛmba na adze nyina do;
Edze dɛw hyɛ hɔn nyinara m',
Naaso 'pɛ dɛ eba me nkyɛn. 
Na gya m' taataa dɛ menye Wo
Bedzi hen dɛw mu afebɔɔ.

MHB 67
5 . Fountain of good! All blessing flows 
 From Thee; no want Thy fullness knows: 
 What but Thyself canst Thou desire? 
 Yet, self-sufficient as Thou art, 
 Thou dost desire my worthless heart; 
 This, only this, dost Thou require.
 	 ~ 	5 . Bura pa! Nhyira nyina pem
Fi Wo hɔ; W'amayɛ nnyim hia,
Ebɛnadze na Ɔwo hwehwɛ?
Naaso hweeara mpo nnhia Wo da;
M'akoma a ɔmmfata yi,
Iyi ara na ehwehwɛ.

MHB 67
6 . Primeval Beauty! in Thy sight 
 The first-born, fairest sons of light 
 See all their brightest glories fade: 
 What then to me Thine eyes could turn- 
 In sin conceived, of woman born- 
 A worm, a leaf, a blast, a shade?
 	 ~ 	6 . Tsetsentsetredee Ɔhoɔfɛfo!
Kan mba a hɔn ho yɛ fɛw, mbakan
Hu Wo a, hɔn 'nyimnyam hyerɛn pa:
W'enyi bɛyɛ dɛn aba mo do,
Ɔbaa ba a wonyinseen n' bɔn mu, 
Sunsuma, ahataw nye nwin?

MHB 67
7 . Hell’s armies tremble at Thy nod, 
 And trembling own the Almighty God, 
 Sovereign of earth, hell, air, and sky: 
 But who is this that comes from far, 
 Whose garments rolled in blood appear? 
 ’Tis God made man, for man to die!
	 ~ 	7 . Sɛ ebɔ Wo tsir adze ara a,
Hɛll nsordaafo hɔn ho popo; 
Wonyim yie dɛ Nyame Tumfo
Nye asaase, hɛll na sor Hen:
Woana n'atar m'bɔgya nye yi?

MHB 67
8 . O God, of good the unfathomed Sea! 
 Who would not give his heart to Thee? 
 Who would not love Thee with his might? 
 O Jesus, Lover of mankind, 
 Who would not his whole soul and mind, 
 With all his strength, to Thee unite?	 ~ 	8 . Nyame pa, epo a no mu dɔ!
Woana nnkɛfa n'akoma ama W'? 
Woana nnkɛfa no tum adɔ W'?
O Jesus, adasa Dɔfo,
Woana nnkɛfa ne kra adɔ W'?
N'adwen, 'hoɔdzen bata Wo ho.

MHB 670
1 . JESUS, Thou soul of all our joys,
For whom we now lift up our voice
And all our strength exert,
Vouchsafe the grace we humbly claim,
Compose into a thankful frame,
And tune Thy people’s heart.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, hɛn enyigye nyina,
Ɔwo a yɛma hɛn ndze do ma W',
Yɛdze hɛn ahoɔdzen ma W',
Ma adom a yɛserɛ ahobrɛadze mu
N-dan nyɛ ndaase ara nko,
Na ɔnsesa Wo nkorɔfo.
Ɔsor ndwom a ɔmmbɔ adze n'.

MHB 670
2 . While in the heavenly work we join,
Thy glory be our whole design,
Thy glory, not our own:
Still let us keep our end in view,
And still the pleasing task pursue,
To please our God alone.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛbɔ m' yɛ ɔsor edwuma yi,
W'enyimnyam no nyɛ hɛn botae;
W'enyimnyam, nnyɛ hɛndze,
Yɛnkɔ do n-hwɛ hɛn ewiei.
Yɛnkɔ do ndzi dwuma a ɔsɔ enyi,
Na aasɔ Nyame nko enyi.

MHB 670
3 . The secret pride, the subtle sin,
O let it never more steal in,
To offend Thy glorious eyes,
To desecrate our hallowed strain,
And make our solemn service vain,
And mar our sacrifice.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mma ahantan, enyitsew bɔn
Nnwiawia hɔnho mmba mu mmbɛsɛɛ,
Mmbɛhyɛ Wo ebufuw;
Onngu hɛn adwontow ho fi,
Na wɔmma hɛn som no nnyɛ gyan,
Na wɔnnsɛɛ, hɛn afɔrbɔ.

MHB 670
4 . With calmly reverential joy,
O let us all our lives employ
In setting forth Thy love;
And raise in death our triumph higher,
And sing with all the heavenly choir
That endless song above !  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. O ma hɛn nkwa nda nyinara
Yɛmfa kommyɛ dɛw a fɛr wɔ m'
Nda Wo dɔ no edzi;
Yɛmma hɛn konyim do wɔ wu m'!
Yɛnye ɔsor dɔm nyina ntow ndwom,

MHB 671
1 . SING Alleluia forth in duteous praise,
O citizens of Heaven, and sweetly raise
                       An endless Alleluia!
	 ~ 	1 . Hom ntow Alleluia nkyerɛ hom ndaase, 
Ao, ɔsor mba, hom mfa ndze dɛɛdɛw nhur
Alleluia a ɔmmbɔ adze.
Alleluia a ɔmmbɔ adze.

MHB 671
2 . The Holy city shall take up your strain,
And with glad songs resounding wake again
                       An endless Alleluia!
	 ~ 	2 
. Kuro krɔnkrɔn no bɛgye hom ndwom no do, 
Na wɔdze ehurusi ndwom enyan
Alleluia a ɔmmbɔ adze.

MHB 671
3 . There, in one grand acclaim, forever ring
The strains which tell the honor of your King,
                       An endless Alleluia!
 	 ~ 	3 
. Hɔ na hom bɔbɔm' atow afebɔɔ, 
Ndwom a ɔkyerɛ hom Hen N'enyimnyam,
Alleluia a ɔmmbɔ adze.

MHB 671
4 . This is rest for weary ones brought back,
This is glad food and drink which none shall lack,
                       An endless Alleluia!
	 ~ 	4 
. Iyi nye afonafo hɔn ahomgye, 
Edziban na nsu a obi nnkehia,
Alleluia a ɔmmbɔ adze.

MHB 671
5 .  While Thee, by Whom were
All things made, we praise
For ever, and tell out in sweetest lays
                       An endless Alleluia!
	 ~ 	5 
. Bɔadze a eyɛ adze nyina Yɛfo, 
Yɛdze ndwom bɔ de yi W' ayɛ afebɔɔ
Alleluia a ɔmmbɔ adze.

MHB 671
6 . To Thee, Eternal son, our voices sing;
With them, O Holy Ghost, to Thee we bring
                      An endless Alleluia !	 ~ 	6  
. Ɔdomankoma Ba, yɛma hɛn ndze do ma W'; 
Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, hɛn nyina bɔm' tow Wo

MHB 672
1 . SAVIOUR, blessèd Saviour, 
Listen while we sing;
Hearts and voices ringing 
Praises to our King:
All we have to offer, 
All we hope to be,
Body, soul, and spirit, 
All we yield to Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . GYEFO, Agyenkwa siarfo;
Tsie hɛn adwontow;
Hɛn akoma na ndze da m'
Yi hɛn Hen ayɛw,
Dza yɛwɔ ma W' biara,
Yɛwɔ enyidar dɛ
Nyimpadua, kra, sunsum,
Yɛdze ne nyina ma W'.
Hɛn Hen N'ayɛyi m'.

MHB 672
2 . Nearer, ever nearer, 
Christ, we draw to Thee,
Deep in adoration
Bending low the knee.
Thou for our redemption,
Cam’st on earth to die;
Thou, that we might follow,
Hast gone up on high.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn enyim ara na, Christ,
Yɛba dze bɛn Wo;
Yɛsɔr Wo enyidzi m',
Na yɛkotow Wo,
Osian hɛn nkwagye ntsi
Ɔwo 'bae bowui;
Edzi hɛn enyim kan
Wɔ sor dɛ yɛmfa W'.

MHB 672
3 . Clearer still and clearer 
Dawns the light from Heaven,
In our sadness bringing 
News of sin forgiven;
Life has lost its shadows, 
Pure the light within;
Thou hast shed Thy radiance 
On a world of sin.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔsor kandzea no pue
Hɛn enyim hyɛnn ara,
Ɔdze fakyɛ ho nsɛm
Pam hɛn awerɛhow;
Abrabɔ sum ahera,
Kan hyerɛn hɛn mu;
Edze Wo kan ahyerɛn
Hɛn bɔ wiadze 'i do.

MHB 672
4 . Onward, ever onward,
Journeying o’er the road
Worn by saints before us,
Journeying on to God;
Leaving all behind us,
May we hasten on,
Backward never looking 
Till the prize is won.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Yɛkɔ hɛn enyim ara
Wɔ hɛn akwantu n' mu,
Kwan a 'hotsewfo duaa m'
Dzii kan Nyame fie;
Yengyaa wiadze ekyir,
Yɛmpem nkɔ kan ara;
Yennkobu hɛn kɔn 'kyir,
Na yeenya ahenkyɛw n'.

MHB 672
5 . Higher, then, and higher, 
Bear the ransomed soul,
Earthly toils forgetting,
Savior, to its goal;
Where in joys unthought of, 
Saints with angels sing,
Never weary, raising
Praises to their King.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Gyefo, gya akra a apon hɛn
Ma yɛnkɔ sor ara;
Hɛn werɛ mfir wiadze fona,
Yɛmbɛn hɛn ahenman n',
Bea a 'hotsewfo, abɔfo,
Bɔ m' tow ndwom dɛw mu;
Wɔmmberɛ, wɔmmfona ara wɔ

MHB 673
1 . SUMMER suns are glowing
Over land and sea;
Happy light is flowing,
Bountiful and free.
Everything rejoices
In the mellow rays;
All earth’s thousand voices
Swell the psalm of praise.
	 ~ 	1 . ESUSOW ewia robɔ 
Po nye asaase do;
Enyigye kan rehyerɛn
A wɔdze ma kwa.
Biribiara ridzi dɛw
Wɔ kan fɛɛfɛw mu;
Wiadze ndze mpempem nyina
Tow ayɛyi ndwom.
Kɛpem da a onnyi ewiei.

MHB 673
2 . God’s free mercy streameth
Over all the world,
And His banner gleameth,
Everywhere unfurled.
Broad and deep and glorious,
As the heaven above,
Shines in might victorious
His eternal love.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyame No mbɔbɔrhu
Wɔ wiadze nyina,
Na Ne frankaa rihim
Wɔ mbea nyinara,
Ɔtserɛw, ɔyɛ enyimnyam,
Ɔtse dɛ ɔsor
Ne bɛkyebo dɔ no,
Ɔhyerɛn konyimdzi m'.

MHB 673
3 . Lord, upon our blindness
Thy pure radiance pour;
For Thy loving-kindness
Make us love Thee more.
And when clouds are drifting
Dark across our sky,
Then, the veil uplifting,
Father, be Thou nigh.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, hue Wo kan
Gu hɛn enyifura do;
Osian W'ayamuyie ntsi
Ma yɛndɔ W' mbordo.
Na mununkum boa ano
Tumm wɔ sor mpo a,
Yi nkataenyim n' fi hɔ,
Egya, twe bɛn hɛn.

MHB 673
4 . We will never doubt Thee,
Though thou veil thy light:
Life is dark without Thee,
Death with Thee is bright.
Light of Light, shine o’er us
On our pilgrim way;
Go Thou still before us
To the endless day.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Wo kan enyim siw mpo a,
Yɛnnkɛgye Wo kyim;
Ennka ho a ɔbra yɛ sum;
Wo mu owu mpo hyerɛn.
Kan mu Kan, hyerɛn hɛn do
Hɛn akwantu mu;
Kɔ do dzi hɛn enyim

MHB 674
1 . O LOVE Divine! Whose constant beam
Shines on the eyes that will not see,
And waits to bless us, while we dream
Thou leav’st us when we turn from Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . O NYAME Dɔ! Wo daa nserɛmɛn
Hyerɛn enyiwa a onnhu adze do,
Na ihyira hɛn wɔ adaaso m',
Yɛdan Wo gya a, Wo so gyaa hɛn.
Fa Wo dɔ sɛɛ hɛn apɛdze.

MHB 674
2 . All souls that struggle and aspire,
All hearts of prayer, by Thee are lit;
And, dim or clear, Thy tongues of fire
On dusky tribes and centuries sit.
	 ~ 	2 
. Akra a wɔper hwehwɛ W' nyina
Ikenyan akoma a ɔbɔ mpaa;
Sum mu o, kan mu o, Wo gyirama gya n'
Sisi ebusua nye aman do.

MHB 674
3 . Nor bounds nor clime nor creed
Thou know’st,
Wide as out need Thy favours fall;
The white wings of the Holy Ghost
Stoop unseen o’er the heads of all.
	 ~ 	3 
. Innyim ɔhe ɔnye gyedzi,
W'adom tsen du obiara do;
Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn n'atasaban no,
Gyina etsir nyinara do.

MHB 674
4 . Truth, which the sage and prophet saw,
Long sought without, but found within,
The law of love beyond all law,
The life  o’erflooding  death and sin.
	 ~ 	4 
. Nokwar a nkɔnhyɛfo hunii no,
Wɔhwehwɛe, wohum wɔ hɔn mu;
Ɔdɔ mbra a ɔbor mbra nyina do,
Abrabɔ bunkam wu, bɔn do.

MHB 674
5 . Shine, Light of God! Make broad Thy scope
To all who sin and suffer; more
And better than we dare to hope
Make with Thy love out longings poor.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Hyerɛn, Nyame Kan! Yi Woho edzi
Kyerɛ hɔn a wohu amandze nyina;
Ma ɔnkyɛn dza hɛn enyi da do n',

MHB 675
1 . JESUS, where’er Thy people meet,
There they behold Thy mercy-seat;
Where’er they seek thee Thou art found,
And every place is hallowed ground.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, bea a Wo nkorɔfo hyia nyina,
Wohu W'ehumbɔbɔr egua hɔ;
Bea a wɔhwehwɛ Wo, wohu Wo,
Na beebiara yɛ krɔnkrɔn bea.
Bɛfa akoma mpem yɛ Wodze.

MHB 675
2 . For Thou, within no walls confined,
Inhabitest the humble mind;
such ever bring Thee when thy come,
And, going, take Thee to their home.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔwo a wonntum nnsiw Wo kwan,
Etse ahobrɛadze akoma m';
Wɔdze Wo ba beebi a wɔba,
Wɔdze Wo kɔ hɔn efiefi.

MHB 675
3 . Dear Shepherd of Thy chosen few,
Thy former mercies here renew;
Here to our waiting hearts proclaim
The sweetness of thy  saving name.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hɔn a woeyi hɔn hɔn Hwɛfo pa,
Yɛ Wo kan mbɔrbɔrhu fofor,
Wo nkwagye dzin a ɔyɛ dɛw n',
Hɛn akoma paa mu ka wɔ ha.

MHB 675
4 .  Here may we prove the power of prayer,
To strengthen faith and sweeten care,
To teach our faint desires to rise,
And bring all heaven before our eyes.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Yɛbɔsɔ mpaabɔ tum ahwɛ,
Ahyɛ gyedzi nye nhwɛdo dzen;
Akyerɛkyerɛ hɛn apɛdze a abotow
Ma yeehu dza ɔwɔ sor nyina.

MHB 675
5 . Lord, we are few, but Thou art near,
Nor short Thine  arm, nor deaf thine ear;
O rend the heavens, come quickly down,
And make a thousand hearts thine own !   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Owura, yesuar naaso Ɔwo bɛn,
Wo nsa nnyɛ tsia, W'aso nnsiwii;
O fi ɔsor bra famu ntsɛm,

MHB 676
1 . GREAT is the Lord our God,
And let His praise be great;
He makes His churches His abode,
His most delightful seat.
 	 ~ 	1 . Hɛn Nyame yɛ Kɛse, 
N'ayɛyi nyɛ kɛse;
Ɔyɛ N'asɔrasɔr Ne fie,
N' egua a N'enyi gye mu.
Na hɔ yɛanhwehwɛ ɔgye.

MHB 676
2 . These temples of His grace,
How beautiful they stand!
The honours of our native place,
And bulwarks  of our land.
 	 ~ 	2 
. N'adom Asɔrfi horow, 
Mbrɛ wodua yɛ fɛw a!
Hɛn asaase do enyidzi,
Hɛn man twitwagyefo.

MHB 676
3 . In Zion God is known
A refuge in distress;
How bright has his salvation shone
Through all her palaces !
 	 ~ 	3 
. Zion na wonyim dɛ 
Nyame yɛ guansumabew;
Mbrɛ No nkwagye esi ahyerɛn
Wɔ n'ahemfie nyina a.

MHB 676
4 . In every new distress
We’ll to His house repair;
We’ll think upon his wondrous grace,
And seek deliverance there. 	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔhaw fofor biaram'! 
Yɛbɛkɛhyɛ Ne fie;
Yɛbɔdwen N'adom nwanwa n' ho,

MHB 677
1 . WE love, the place, the O God,
Wherein Thine honour dwells;
The joy of Thine abode
All earthly joy excels.  
	 ~ 	1 . Nyame, Yɛdɔ Wo Fie, 
Mbrɛ W'enyidzi wɔ no;
Wo tsenabea no mu dɛw
Kyɛn wiadze dɛw nyina.
Na yaasom Wo sor hɔ.    Amen.

MHB 677
2 . It is the house of prayer, 
Wherein Thy servants meet; 
And Thou, O Lord, art there,
Thy chosen flock to greet. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔyɛ m-paabɔ fie, 
Mbrɛ Wo nkowaa dzi ehyia;
Na 'Wo, Ewuradze,
Eba behyira Wo mba.

MHB 677
3 . We love the word of life, 
The word that tells of peace, 
Of comfort in the strife 
And joys that never cease. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛdɔ n-kwasɛm no; 
Ɔma hɛn asomdwee,
Nye dzenhyɛ wɔ ko mu,
Nye dɛw a ɔmmbɔ adze.

MHB 677
4 . We love to sing below
Of mercies freely given; 
But O we long to know 
The triumph song of heaven ! 
	 ~ 	4 
. Yɛdɔ dɛ yɛtow ndwom 
Kamfo Wo mbɔbɔrhu;
Na mbom yɛpɛ yeesua
Ɔsor konyimdzi ndwom.

MHB 677
5 . Lord Jesus, give us grace, 
On earth to love Thee more, 
In heaven to see Thy face, 
And with Thy saints adore.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Hɛn Wura Jesus, dom hɛn 
Ma yɛndɔ Wo mbordo,
Na ndaamba yeebohu

MHB 678
1 . LORD of the worlds above,
How pleasant and how fair
The dwellings of Thy love,
Thy earthly temples, are!
To Thine abode
My heart aspires,
With warm desires
To see my God.
 	 ~ 	1 . Sor wiadze horow Nyame, 
Mbrɛ Wo dɔ tsenabea
Na ase ha asɔrfi
Dua yɛ fɛw yɛ ahomka a!
M'akoma per
Ba Wo tsebea
Ama oeehu
Me Nyankopɔn.
Siarfo mprɛnsa.

MHB 678
2 . O happy souls that pray
Where God delights to hear!
O happy men that pay
Their constant service there!
They praise Thee still,
And happy they
Who love the way 
To Zion’s hill !
 	 ~ 	2  
. Ao, akra esiarfo na  
Wɔsɔr bea a Nyame tsie,
Ao, esiarfo nye hɔn 
A wɔsom wɔ hɔ daa!
Wɔtonton Wo,
Wɔyɛ esiarfo
Hɔn a wɔfow
Zion kokwaa n'!

MHB 678
3 . They go from strength to strength,
Through this dark vale of tears,
Till each o’ercomes at length,
Till each in heaven appears:
O glorious seat!
Thou God, our King,
Shalt thither bring
Our willing feet.
 	 ~ 	3  
. Wofi ahomm' kɔ ahom mu, 
Wɔ nyinsu bɔnsa yim',
Kɛpem dɛ obiara dzi nyim,
Kɛpem dɛ obiara pue sor,
'Nyimnyam egua!
Hɛn Hen Nyame
Dze hɛn pɛ anan
Dze bodu hɔ.

MHB 678
4 . God is our sun and shield,
Our light and our defence;
With gifts His hands are filled,
We draw our blessings thence:
He shall bestow
Upon our race
His saving grace,
And glory too.
 	 ~ 	4  
. Nyame nye hɛn 'kokyɛm, 
Hɛn kan na akoban;
Ne nsamu akyɛdze ma,
Yenya hɛn nhyira fir mu
Ɔbɔdom hɛn
Nkorɔfo nyina
Nkwagye adom,
Nye enyimnyam so.

MHB 678
5 . The Lord his people loves;
His hand no good withholds
From those His heart approves,
From holy, humble souls:
Thrice happy he,
O Lord of Hosts,
Whose spirit trusts
 Alone in thee ! 	 ~ 	5 
. Nyame dɔ No nkorɔfo, 
Hɔn a wɔsɔ N'enyi n'
Akra krɔnkrɔn botoo n',
Ɔnnkan hɔn Ne ndzepa:
Nyia ne kra twer
Dɔm Ewuradze 
Wo nkotoo n', yɛ

MHB 679
1 . PLEASANT are Thy courts above,
In the land of light and love;
Pleasant are Thy courts below,
In this  land of sin and woe.
O, my spirit longs and faints
For the converse of Thy saints,
For the brightness of Thy face,
For Thy fullness, God of grace!
 	 ~ 	1 . Wo sor abangua yɛ fɛw, 
Wɔ kan na dɔ man no mu;
Ha so W'abangua yɛ fɛw,
Wɔ bɔn na mbusu man yim'
Ao, mo sunsum no kɔn dɔ
W'asɔrmba hɔn fɛkuwbɔ,
W'enyim ne hyerɛn fɛɛfɛw n',
W'amayɛ n', Adom Nyame!
O mo Wura, hue gu mo do.   Amen.

MHB 679
2 . Happy birds that sing and fly
Round Thy altars, O most High!
Happier souls that find a rest
In a heavenly Father’s breast!
Like the wandering dove that found
No repose on earth around,
They can to their ark repair,
And enjoy it ever there.
 	 ~ 	2  
. Abɔso Nyame, nnoma a 
Wosu kyin Wo fie, woewie!
Na akra a wɔhom sor Egya
No bom' no, woewie dodow!
Wɔtse dɛ ebubur n' a
Oennya 'saase do sibea n',
Wɔsan kɔ hɔn hɛn no mu,
Hɔ na hɔn enyi gye daa.

MHB 679
3 . Happy souls! Their praises flow
In this vale of sin and woe;
Waters in the desert rise,
Manna feeds them from the skies.
On they go from strength to strength,
Till they reach Thy throne at length,
At Thy feet adoring,
Who hast led them  safe through all.
	 ~ 	3  
. Woewie ampa! hɔn ayɛyi 
Pem mbusu bɔnsa 'i mu mpo;
N-su pue sar do ma hɔn,
Edziban fi sor nyɛn hɔn.
Wofi ahom mu kɔ ahom mu,
Dze kodu W'ahengua n' ho;
W'anan ho na wobom som,
'Wo a agye hɔn ne nyinam'.

MHB 679
4 . Lord, be mine this prize to win,
Guide me through a world of sin;
Keep me by Thy saving grace;
Give me at Thy side a place.
Sun and shield alike Thou art;
Guide and guard my erring heart:
Grace and glory flow from Thee;
Shower, O shower them, Lord, on me! Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Mo Wura, ma muntu ehu dɛm: 
Gya m' twa bɔn wiadze yi mu;
Fa W'adom no suo mo mu,
Ma minnya kwan wɔ Wo nkyɛn.
M'ewia nye me kyɛm nye 'Wo;
Gya mo mfom 'koma 'i, weɔn no;
Adom nye enyimnyam fir Wo;

MHB 68
1 . NONE is like Jeshuruns God, 
 So great, so strong, so high 
 Lo! He spreads His wings abroad, 
 He rides upon the sky: 
 Israel is His first-born son; 
 God, the Almighty God, is thine; 
 See him to thy help come down, 
 The excellence divine.
	 ~ 	1 . OBI nnsɛ Jeshurun Nyame,
No ho yɛ dzen, ɔkrɔn;
Hwɛ! Ɔtserɛw Ne ntsaban mu,
Ɔnantsew wɔ wimu!
Israel ɔnye N'abakan;
'Tumfo Nyame yɛ wodze,
Ofi sor robɔbor wo,
Nyame a bor adze nyina do.

MHB 68
2 . Thee the great Jehovah deigns 
 To succour and defend; 
 Thee the eternal God sustains, 
 Thy Maker and thy Friend: 
 Israel, what hast thou to dread? 
 Safe from all impending harms, 
 Round thee and beneath are spread 
 The everlasting arms.
	 ~ 	2 . Jehovah Kɛse pɛ dɛ
Ɔboa na ɔgye wo;
Daa Nyankopɔn wowaw wo,
Wo Bɔfo, wo Nyɛnko;
Israel ɔbɛn na isuro?
Mbusu biara rennhaw wo,
Abasa a ɔwɔ hɔ daa n',
Aka wo efua yie.

MHB 68
3 . God is thine; disdain to fear 
 The enemy within: 
 God shall in thy flesh appear, 
 And make an end of sin; 
God the man of sin shall slay, 
 Fill thee with triumphant joy; 
 God shall thrust him out, and say: 
 Destroy them all, destroy !
	 ~ 	3 . Nyame yɛ wodze; mma nnsuro
'Tamfo a ɔwɔ wo mu;
Nyame bɛba wo honam m',
Ma bɔn aabɔ adze;
Nyame bɛsɛɛ ɔbɔnfo n',
Ama wo konyimdzi m' dɛw; 
Nyame bɛpam n' na ɔaka
Dɛ, Sɛɛ hɔn, sɛɛ hɔn nyina!

MHB 68
4 . All the struggle then is o er, 
 And wars and fightings cease; 
 Israel then shall sin no more,  
 But dwell in perfect peace: 
 All his enemies are gone; 
 Sin shall have in him no part; 
 Israel now shall dwell alone, 
 With Jesus in his heart.
	 ~ 	4 . Aperdzi nyina abɔ adze,
Akokoeko egyaa;
Israel nnkɛyɛ bɔn bio da,
Na ɔbɛtsena asomdwee mu;
N'atamfo nyinara kɔ,
Bɔn nnyi kyɛfa wɔ no mu,
Israel nko bɛtsena hɔ a
Jesus wɔ n'akoma m'.

MHB 68
5 . Blest, O Israel, art thou! 
 What person is like thee? 
 Saved from sin, by Jesus, now  
 Thou art and still shalt be; 
 Jesus is thy seven fold shield, 
 Jesus is thy flaming sword; 
 Earth, and hell, and sin, shall yield 
 To Gods almighty Word.	 ~ 	5 . Israel woehyira wo!
Ɔman bɛn nye wo sɛ?
Jesus agye w' efi bɔn m',
Ennkɛtsena bɔn mu bio,
Jesus nye w' kyɛm mpɛm esuon;
W'afowa a gya wɔ ano,
Nyame Tumfo Asɛm bedzi
Wiadze, bɛn na hɛll do.

MHB 680
1 . GLAD was my heart to hear
My old companions say:
Come, in the house of God appear,
For ’tis an holy day. 
	 ~ 	1 . M'akoma dzii ehurusi 
Dɛ me mfɛfo see dɛ,
Bra ma yɛnkɔ Nyame Ne fie;
Afahyɛ da nye ndɛ.
Nyame mma N'asomdwee!  Amen.

MHB 680
2 . Our willing feet shall stand
Within the temple door,
While young and old, in many a band,
Shall throng the sacred floor. 
	 ~ 	2  
. Hɛn anan bɛyɛ ntsɛm 
Ahɛn asɔrdan nom'
Ber a mobra na mpanyin pii
Rehyɛ som-bea no ma.

MHB 680
3 . Thither the tribes repair,
Where all are wont to meet,
And joyful in the house of prayer
Bend at the mercy-seat. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Ebusua wɔtɔ dɛ 
Wɔbɔ punkum ba ha;
Ehumbɔbɔr egua n'enyim
Wɔdze dɛw kotow hɔ.

MHB 680
4 .  Pray for Jerusalem,
The city of our God;
The Lord from heaven be kind to them
That love the dear abode! 
 	 ~ 	4 
. Sɔr ma Jerusalem, 
Nyankopɔm ahenkurow n';
Nyame ntɔ Ne nhyira ngu hɔn a
Wɔdɔ Ne fie papa.

MHB 680
