5 . Within these walls may peace
And harmony be found;
Zion, in all thy palaces
Prosperity abound! 
 	 ~ 	5  
. Ha 'i dze wɔmma koryɛ 
Na asomdwee ntsintsim daa;
Zion, ahonya pii nhyehyɛ
W'ahemfi amaama.

MHB 680
6 . For friends and brethren dear,
Our prayer shall never cease;
Oft as they meet for worship here,
God send his people peace! 	 ~ 	6 
. Hɛn afɛ nye enuanom 
Nnkɛpa hɛn mpaayim' da;
Wohyiam' asɔryɛm' ara pem a

MHB 681
1 . GOD of mercy, God of grace,
Show the brightness of thy face;
Shine upon us, Saviour, shine,
Fill Thy Church with light divine;
And Thy saving health extend
Unto earth’s remotest end.
	 ~ 	1 . MBƆBƆRHU nye adom Nyame,
Da W'enyim ne hyerɛn edzi;
Hyerɛn hɛn do, Gyefo, hyerɛn,
Ma Wo kan nhyerɛn W'asɔr mu,
Ma Wo nkwagye ahoɔdzen
Ondu wiadze beebiara.
Bɛtsena dɛw na dɔ kor mu.

MHB 681
2 . Let the people praise Thee, Lord;
Be by all that live adored;
Let the nations shout and sing
Glory to their Saviour King;
At Thy feet their tribute pay,
And Thy holy will obey.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma nkorɔfo no nyi W' ayɛw,
Hɔn a wɔtse ase ntonton Wo;
Ma aman no ntsea m' ntow ndwom,
Enyimnyam nka Hen Gyefo!
Mfa hɔn adwontow mbra W'enyim,
Wobetsie Wo pɛ krɔnkrɔn n'.

MHB 681
3 . Let the people praise Thee, Lord;
Earth shall then her fruits afford;
God to man his blessings give,
Man to God devoted live;
All below, and all above,
One in joy and light and love.   Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Ma nkorɔfo no nyi W' ayɛw,
Na asaase bɔsow n'aba,
Nyame behyira nyimpa;
Nyimpa dze n' ho ma Nyame;
Ase mba nye ɔsorfo nyina

MHB 682
1 . God of pity, God of grace, 
When we humbly seek Thy face, 
Bend from Heav’n, Thy dwelling place; 
Hear, forgive, and save. 
	 ~ 	1 . MBƆBƆRHU nye adom Nyame,
'Hobrɛadze m' yɛhwɛ W'enyim,
Fi ɔsor Wo tsenabea
    Tsie, fa kyɛ, gye nkwa.
Tsie, fa kyɛ, gye nkwa.  Amen.

MHB 682
2 . When we in Thy temple meet, 
Spread our wants before Thy feet, 
Pleading at Thy mercy seat, 
Look from Heaven and save. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Yehyia W'asɔrdan no mu
Dze dza yehia ba W'enyim,
Serɛ wɔ W' mbɔbɔr egua enyim;
   Fi ɔsor gye hɛn.

MHB 682
3 . When Thy love our hearts shall fill, 
And we long to do Thy will, 
Turning to Thy holy hill, 
Lord, accept and save. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Wo dɔ hyɛ akoma ma,
Na yɛpɛ ayɛ Wo pɛ;
Wɔkɔ W' koko krɔnkrɔn n' do,
  Owura, suo m', gye nkwa.

MHB 682
4 . Should we wander from Thy fold, 
And our love to Thee grow cold, 
With a pitying eye behold; 
Lord, forgive and save. 
	 ~ 	4 
. Yɛman fi Wo nguankuw ho
Na hɛn dɔ ma Wo yɛ nwin a,
Fa mbɔbɔr enyi hwɛ hɛn;
  Fa kyɛ na gye nkwa.

MHB 682
5 . Should the hand of sorrow press, 
Earthly care and want distress, 
May our souls Thy peace possess; 
Jesus, hear and save. 
	 ~ 	5 
. Awerɛhow nsa mia hɛn,
Wiadze haw hiahia hɛn ho;
Ma hɛn kra nnya W'asomdwee;
  Jesus, gye hɛn nkwa.

MHB 682
6 . And, whate’er our cry may be, 
When we lift our hearts to Thee, 
From our burden set us free; 
Hear, forgive, and save. Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Mbrɛ hɛn sufrɛ tse biara,
Yɛma hɛn akoma do ma W' a,
Yi hɛn adzesoa fi hɔ!

MHB 683
1 . LO, God is here! Let us adore,
And own how dreadful is this  place!
Let all within us feel his power,
And silent bow before His face;
Who know His power, His grace who prove,
Serve Him with awe, with reverence love.
	 ~ 	1 . HWƐ, Nyame wɔ ha! Yɛntonton N'
Na yenhu dɛ bea yi yɛ hu!
Dza ɔwɔ hɛn mu nyina ntse No tum,
Wɔmbɔ hɔn mu adze komm N'enyim;
Hɔn a wonyim No tum, N'adom
Dze suro som No, dze enyidzi dɔ N'.

Ogya a ɔhyew na okenyan

MHB 683
2 . Lo, God is here! Him day and night
The united choirs of angels sing;
To Him, enthroned above all height,
Heaven’s host their noblest praises bring:
Disdain not, Lord, our meaner song,
Who praise Thee with a stammering tongue.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hwɛ, Nyame wɔ ha! Ɔno na
Abɔfo adwontofo tow N' ndwom,
Ɔno na wɔakrɔn N' ɔsorsor;
Ɔsor dɔm dze ayɛyi ma N',
Ewuradze, mma mmpow hɛn ndwom no,
Gyirama a ɔdodow yi W' ayɛw.

MHB 683
3 . Being of beings! May our praise
Thy courts with grateful fragrance fill;
Still may we stand before Thy face,
Still hear and do thy sovereign will;
To Thee may all our thoughts arise,
Ceaseless, accepted sacrifice.
	 ~ 	3 
. Atseasefo mu Ɔtseasenyi,
Hɛn ayɛyi mfow ndu Wo nkyɛn, 
Ma yɛnda ho ngyina W'enyim,
Yɛnda ho ntse, yɛnyɛ Wo pɛ;
Hɛn adwen nyina mbra Wo do,
Mma nngyaa dɛ egye hɛn afɔr.

MHB 683
4 . As flower their opening leaves display,
And glad drink in the solar fire,
So may Thy influence us inspire;
Thou Beam of the eternal Beam,
Thou purging Fire, Thou quickening Flame. 
		    Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Dɛ mbrɛ nhyiren paa na ɔgye
Ewia ne hyew enyigye mu n',
Ma hɛn nsa nka Wo kan biara,
Na ma Wo tum no nkenyan hɛn;
Eyɛ bɛkyebo kan mu Kan,

MHB 684
1 . JESUS, stand among us
In Thy risen power;
Let this time of worship
Be a hallowed hour.
	 ~ 	1 . Jesus, fa wusoɛr tum n' 
Gyina hɛn finimfin;
Ma hɛn asɔryɛ yi
Ɔnyɛ mber krɔnkrɔn.
Bɛkyebo da n' kwan.   Amen.

MHB 684
2 . Breathe the Holy Spirit
Into every heart;
Bid the fears and sorrows
From each soul depart.
	 ~ 	2  
. Hue Wo Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn 
Gu akoma nyina do;
Tu suro na yaw fi
Akra nyina mu.

MHB 684
3 . Thus with quickened footsteps
We’ll pursue our way,
Watching for the dawning
Of each eternal day.   Amen.	 ~ 	3  
. Na yebemia mu dzen 
Yeetu hɛn kwan yi,
Dɛ hɛn enyiwa da

MHB 685
1 . STAND up and bless the Lord,
Ye people of His choice;
stand up, and bless the Lord your God,
With heart and soul and voice.
 	 ~ 	1 . HOM nsoɛr nhyira Ewuradze,
Hom nyimpa a woeyi hom,
Hom nsoɛr mfa akoma, kra nye ndze
Nhyira Ewuradze, Nyakopͻn.
Ofi ndɛ nye daa nyina.

MHB 685
2 . Though high above all praise,
Above all blessing high,
Who would not fear His holy name,
And laud and magnify?
	 ~ 	2 
. Ͻsén ayɛyi nyina dze,
Ͻbor nhyira nyina do dze;
Woana na onnkosuro Ne dzin,
Nnyi N’ aysw, nnkamfo No?

MHB 685
3 . O for the living flame
From His own altar brought,
To touch our lips, our mind inspire,
And wing to heaven our though.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Nkyɛ ogya a onndum da
Fi N’afͻrmbukyia do
Aaka hɛn ano, ekenyan hɛn,
Dze hɛn adwen eetsim sor!

MHB 685
4 . There, with begin regard.
Our hymns He deigns to hear;
Though unrevealed to mortal sense,
Our spirits feel Him near.
	 ~ 	4 
. Hͻ ͻbrɛ N’aso adze
Dze tsie ndwom a yɛtow;
Onnyi Noho nnkyérɛ nyimpa dze,
Hɛn sunsum tse Ne nka.

MHB 685
5 . God is our strength and song,
And His salvation ours;
Then be His love in Christ proclaimed
with all our ransomed powers.
 	 ~ 	5 
. Nyame nye hɛn ahoͻdzen,
No nkwagye yɛ hɛndze;
Yɛdze hɛn ahoͻdzen nyina
Bɛka No dͻ ho asɛm.

MHB 685
6 . Stand up, and bless the Lord,
The Lord your God adore;
stand up, and bless His glorious name
Henceforth for evermore.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Hom nsoͻɛ nhyira Ewuradze,
Hom ntonton Ewuradze;
Hom nsoɛr nhyira N’enyimnyam dzin n’,

MHB 686
1 . LIFT up your hearts! We lift them, Lord, to Thee;
Here at Thy feet none other may we see;
Lift up your hearts! E’en so, with one accord,
We lift them up, we lift them to the Lord,
	 ~ 	1 . HOM mma hom akoma do! Yɛma do ma Wo;
Yennyi obi bio wɔ Wo nan adze;
Hom mma hom akoma do! Yɛbɔ mu ma do,
Yɛma do, yɛma do ma Ewuradze!
Yɛma do, yɛma do ma Ewuradze!

MHB 686
2 . Above the level of the former years,
The mire of sin, the slough of guilty fears,
The mist of doubt, the blight of love’s decay,
O Lord of light, lift all our hearts to-day.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛma do kɔ sor sen mfe a abɛsen n',
Bɔn a ogu hɛn ho fi, suro a ɔhyɛ hɛn do,
Ekyingye bɔw nye dɔ aprɔw mu,
Kan Wura, yɛma hɛn akoma do ndɛ.

MHB 686
3 . Above the swamps of subterfuge and shame,
The deeds, the thoughts, that honour may not name,
The halting tongue that dares not tell the whole,
O Lord of Truth, lift every Christian soul!
 	 ~ 	3 
. Akɔhwi nye enyiwa atɛkyɛ,
Ndzeyɛɛ nye nsusui a ɔnnhyɛ enyimnyam,
Tɛkyerɛma a ɔdodow asɛnka ho,
Nokwar Wura, yi Christianfo fi mu.

MHB 686
4 . Lift every gift that Thou Thyself hast given;
Low lies the best till lifted up to heaven:
Low lies the bounding heart, the teeming brain,
Till, sent from God, they mount to God again.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma akyɛdze biara a edze ama no do;
Adze pa da famu a, gyedɛ wɔama do,
Akoma nye adwen a wɔakyekyer da famu,
Nyame dze mae, na ɔsan kɔ Ne nkyɛn.

MHB 686
5 . Then, as the trumpet-call in after years:
Lift up your hearts, rings pealing in our ears,
Still shall those hearts respond,with full accord:
We lift them up, we lift them to the Lord!	 ~ 	5 
. Afei, ekyir yi totorobɛnto hɛn a,
Hom mma hom akoma do! Ɔgyegye hɛn asomu;
Akoma nyina bɔbɔ mu agye do;

MHB 687
1  . I BOW in silence at Thy feet ; 
Come to my soul and make it meet 
To hold divine communion sweet,
My Lord, my life, my all.
 	 ~ 	1 . MOBϽ mo mu adze komm W’enyim,
Bra na besiesie me kra na
Ͻmfata dɛ odzi sor edziban,
Mo Wura, nkwa, m’adze nyina.
Mo Wura, nkwa, m’adze nyina.

MHB 687
2 . Thou know’st the evil thoughts within,
That make it hard for me to win 
The victory over self and sin,
My Lord, my life, my all.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ͻwo nyim mo mu adwembͻn,
Ͻmma munntum minndzi nyim koraa,
Wͻ nankasa ͻnye bͻn do;
Mo Wura, nkwa, m’adze nyina.

MHB 687
3 . Thou too art man and knowest all 
That would my love from Thee recall;
Wilt Thou be near me, lest I fall,
My Lord, my life, my all.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Wo so yɛ nyimpa, nyim ne nyina,
Ͻbɛkaa me dɛ edͻ me;
Bɛn me, annyɛ a m’bͻhwease;
Mo Wura, nkwa, m’adze nyina.

MHB 687
4 . I have no power save Thine alone,
Help me to make this heart Thine own,	 
Rule Thou my life, there find Thy throne,
My Lord, my life, my all.
	 ~ 	4 
. Minnyi tum ka Wodze nko ho,
Boa ma memfa m’akoma mma Wo;
Dzi me bra do, fa yɛ ahengua,
Mo Wura, nkwa, m’adze nyina.

MHB 687
5 . I bow in silence at Thy feet,
Hear Thou the prayer which I repeat, 
O make my sacrifice complete,
My Lord, my life, my all.
	         Amen. 	 ~ 	5 
. Mobͻ mo mu adze komm W’enyim;
Tsie me mpaabͻ a misi do yi; 
O ma m’afͻrbͻ yi ndzi mu,

MHB 688
1 . O GOD our Father, who dost make us one,
Heart bound to heart, in love of Thy dear Son,
Now as we part and go our several ways,
Touch every lip, may every voice be praise -
 	 ~ 	1 . NYAME hɛn Egya, Ɔwo ayɛ hɛn kor,
Akoma fam akoma ho, wɔ Wo Dɔba n' mu;
Yeridzi mpaa m' na obiara akɔ no kwan,
Ma ano na ndze biara nyi W' ayɛw.
Dɛ ɔsor nhyira hyɛ ase wɔ ha.

MHB 688
2 . Praise for the fellowship that here we find,
The fellowship of heart and soul and mind,
Praise for the bonds of love and brotherhood,
Bonds wrought by Thee, who makest all things good.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ayɛyi nka Wo hɛn fɛkuwbɔ ntsi,
Akoma, kra, nye adwen fɛkuwbɔ;
Ayɛyi nka Wo, ɔdɔ nuayɛ ntsi,
Koryɛ a ndzepa Wura edze ba n' ntsi.

MHB 688
3 . Lord, make us strong, for Thou alone dost know
How oft we turn our faces from the foe;
How oft, when claimed by dark temptation’s hour,
We lose our hold on Thee, and of Thy power.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Owura, hyɛ dzen na Wo nko na inyim,
Inyim mber a yeguan fi atamfo enyim;
Mpɛn dodow a yɛkɔ sum mu nsɔhwɛ mu n',
Yɛyew Wo tum nye W' nsa aɔda hɛn do.

MHB 688
4 . Go with us, Lord, from hence; we only ask
That Thou be sharer in our daily task;
So, side by side with Thee, shall each one know
The blessedness of heaven begun below.	 ~ 	4 
. Ewuradze, ofi ndɛ kɔ nye hɛn nkɔ,
Ka hɛn ho wɔ hɛn daa dwumadzi mu;
Ber a eka hɛn ho n' obira bohu

MHB 689
1 . AT even, ere the sun was set,
The sick, O Lord, around Thee lay;
O in what divers pains they met!
O with what joy they went away! 
	 ~ 	1 . 'EWimbir ansaana wi rotɔ n' 
Ewuradze, nna ayarfo gu W' nkyɛn;
Ao, yaw horow bɛn nna ɔannka hɔn!
Ao, dɛw bɛn nna wɔammfa annkɔ!
Na W'ehumbɔbɔbɔrm' sa hɛn yar.

MHB 689
2 . Once more ’tis eventide, and we,
Oppressed with various ills, draw near;
What if Thy form we cannot see?
We know and feel that Thou art here. 
 	 ~ 	2 
. Bio, edu 'wimbir, na hɛn so 
Yɛdze yarba horow twe pin;
Sɛ Yennhu wo mpo a, ɔyɛ dɛn?
Yenyim na yɛtse dɛ 'wɔ ha.

MHB 689
3 . O Saviour Christ, our woes dispel:
For some are sick, and some are sad,
And some have never loved thee well,
And some have lost the love they had; 
	 ~ 	3 
. Agyenkwa Christ, pam hɛn mbusu, 
Na binom abɔm,
Na binom nndɔɔ W' nokwar mu pɛn,
Binom so ayew dɔ a wonyae.

MHB 689
4 . And some have found the world is vain,
Yet from the world they break not free;
And some have friends who give them pain,
Yet have not sought a friend in Thee.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Binom hu dɛ wiadze yɛ gyan, 
Naaso wonntum mmfi wiadze nsa;
Binom hɔn mfɛfo how hɔn werɛ,
Naaso wɔmmfaa Ɔwo nnyɛɛ nyɛnko.

MHB 689
5 . And all, O Lord, crave perfect rest,
And to be wholly free from sin;
And they who fain would serve Thee best
Are conscious most of wrong within. 
 	 ~ 	5 
. Ewuradze hɔn nyina serɛ ahomgye, 
Na wobefi bɔn mu koraa;
Hɔn a wɔper asom Wo yie n'
Nna wohu bɔn a ɔwɔ hɔn mu.

MHB 689
6 . O Saviour Christ, Thou too art man;
Thou hast been troubled, tempted, tried;
Thy kind but searching glance can scan
The very wounds that shame would hide. 
 	 ~ 	6 
. Agyenkwa Christ, Nyimpa nye W' so; 
Wɔatseetsee Wo, wɔasɔ W' ahwɛ;
Ema Wo dɔ enyi do a, ihu
Epirakur a fɛr dze rusuma n'.

MHB 689
7 . Thy touch has still its ancient power;
No word from Thee can fruitless fall:
Hear in this solemn evening hour,
And in Thy mercy heal us all.    Amen.	 ~ 	7 
. Wo nsaano wɔ tum dɛ tsetse n', 
W'anomusɛm biara nnkefir gyan;
Ewimbir bɔw nwinwin yim' tsie,

MHB 69
1 . This, this is the God we adore, 
 Our faithful, unchangeable  Friend; 
 Whose love is as great as His power, 
 And neither knows measure nor end
	 ~ 	1 . Oyi nye Nyame a yɛsɔr No n', 
Hɛn Dɔfo pa a ɔnnsakyer da n',
No dɔ so dɛ No tum kɛse n',
Onnyi mbanano, nnyi ewiei.

MHB 69
2 . 'Tis Jesus, the first and the last, 
 Whose spirit shall guide us safe home; 
 We ll praise Him for all that is past, 
 And trust Him for all  that is to come.	 ~ 	2 . Jesus, Kandzifo, Kyirdzifo n', 
No Sunsum dze hɛn bodu fie;
Yeyi N' ayɛw wɔ dza etwam',
Yɛtwer No wɔ dza ɔreba.

MHB 690
1 . OUR day of praise is done,
The evening shadows fall;
But pass not from us with the sun,
True Light that lightenest all!
 	 ~ 	1 . HԐN ayɛyi da asa,
Ewimbir sum aba,
Na sɛ ewia tͻ a, mum mmfi hɛn nkyɛm;
Adze nyina m’ nokwar kan.
Aabͻ m’ W’ayɛyi mu.

MHB 690
2 . Around the throne on high,
Where night can never be,
The white-robed harpers of the sky
Bring ceaseless hymns to Thee.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ͻsor ahengua no ho.
Mbrɛ adze nnsa da no,
Nsankubͻfo hyɛ ntar fitaa,
Tow Wo ndwom daa nyina.

MHB 690
3 .  Too faint our anthems here;
Too soon of praise we tire;
But O the strains, how full and clear,
Of that eternal choir!
 	 ~ 	3 
. Hɛn adwontow ya mberɛw,
Yɛbérɛ ayɛyi mu ntsɛm;
Na sor adwontofo no dze
Hͻn ndwom dzi mu, yɛ dɛw.

MHB 690
4 . Yet, Lord, to Thy dear will,
If Thou attune the heart,
We in Thine angels’ music still
May bear our lower part.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Naaso Ewuradze, Ͻwo pɛ
Dɛ edan hɛn Akoma a,
Hɛn so yɛbͻtow ndwom kakra
Aka abͻfo ndwom ho.

MHB 690
5 . ’Tis Thine each soul to calm,
Each wayward thought reclaim,
And make our life a daily psalm
Of glory to Thy Name.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ͻwo na edwedwé akra,
Na etwé etuatsewfo nyina,
Na ema ayɛyi hyɛ hɛn bra ma,
Dze hyɛ Wo dzin enyimnyam.

MHB 690
6 .  A little while, and then
Shall come the glorious end,
And songs of angels and of men
In perfect praise shall blend.	 ~ 	6 
. Aka kumaa bi ma
Enyimnyam ewiei no aba,
Ma abͻfo na nyimpa hͻn ndwom

MHB 691
1 . SAVIOUR, again to Thy dear name we raise
With one accord our parting hymn of praise;
We stand to bless Thee ere our worship cease,
Then, lowly kneeling, wait Thy word of peace.
	 ~ 	1 . AGYENKWA, yɛma Wo dzin pa n’ do bio
Akoma kor m’ yɛtow hɛn mpaamudzi ayɛyi;
Yegyina hͻ hyira Wo ansaana yɛapon,
Na yɛkotow tweͻn W’asomdweesɛm no.
Ewuradze, frɛ hɛn kͻ W’asomdwee mu.

MHB 691
2 . Grant us Thy peace upon our homeward way;
With Thee began, with Thee shall end, the day;
Guard Thou the lips from sin, the hearts from shame,
That in this house have called upon Thy name.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ma hɛn W’asomdwee bér a yɛrokͻ fie,
Yɛdze Wo hyɛɛ ase, na yɛdze W’ bowie;
Hɛn ano nnka bͻn, hɛn enyim nngu ase,
Na ofie yi mu na yeabͻ Wo dzin.

MHB 691
3 . Grant us Thy peace, Lord, through the coming night,
Turn Thou for us its darkness into light;
From harm and danger keep Thy children free,
For dark and light are both alike to Thee.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma hɛn W’asomdwee, wͻ anafua yi mu,
Dan sum no ma ͻnye ekan mma hɛn,
Gye Wo mba fi ͻhaw nye mbusu mu,
Na sum nye kan nyina yɛ pɛr W’enyim.

MHB 691
4 .  Grant us Thy peace throughout our earthly life,
Our balm in sorrow, and our stay in strife;
Then, when Thy voice shall bid our conflict cease,
Call us, O Lord, to Thine eternal peace.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Ma hɛn W’asomdwee hɛn asetsena mu,
Hɛn awerɛhow mu na hɛn aperdzi mu,
Afei, ber a Wo ndze ma akodzi bͻ adze,

MHB 692
1 . O SAVIOUR, bless us ere we go;
Thy word into our minds instill;
And make our lukewarm hearts to glow
With lowly love and fervent will.
     Through life’s long day and death’s dark night,
     O gentle Jesus, be our light. 
	 ~ 	1 . AGYENKWA, hyira hɛn ana yɛakɔ;
Fa W'asɛm hyɛ hɛn adwen mu;
Na ma akoma mu nkenyan,
Ahobrɛadze dɔ na pɛ pa.
   Wɔ nkwa adzekyee nye wu sum mu,
   O Jesus brɛfo, yɛ hɛn kan.
'Wo nye hɛn Jesus, hɛn adze nyina.

MHB 692
2 . The day is gone, its hours have run,
And Thou hast taken count of all-
The scanty triumphs grace hath won,
The broken vow, the frequent fall.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Da no asa, ne mber etwa m',
Na Ɔwo nyim no mu nsɛm nyina;
Konyim kakra a adom dze bae n',
Oebu anohoba do, ahwe ase.

MHB 692
3 . Grant us, dear Lord, from evil ways
True absolution and release;
And bless us, more than in past days,
With purity and inward peace.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Owura, gye hɛn fi akwan bɔn do,
Fakyɛ turodoo nye ɔgye;
Fa ahotsew nye asomdwee
Hyira hɛn ma ɔnsen nda no a etwa m'.

MHB 692
4 . Do more than pardon: give us joy,
Sweet fear and sober liberty,
And loving hearts without alloy
That only long to be like Thee.
	 ~ 	4 
. Fa kyɛ mbordo, ma hɛn dɛw,
Suro mapa ɔnye fahodzi,
Na dɔ akoma a nkekae nnyi mu,
Dza ɔpɛ dɛ ɔnye Wo sɛ.

MHB 692
5 . For all we love, the poor, the sad,
The sinful, unto Thee we call;
O let Thy mercy make us glad;
Thou art our Saviour and our all.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Yɛfrɛ hɛn adɔfo nyina brɛ Wo
Ehiafo, 'werɛhofo, abɔn;
Ma W'ehumbɔbɔr n' mma hɛn dɛw,

MHB 693
1 . LORD, dismiss us with Thy blessing, 
Fill our hearts with joy and peace;
Let us each, Thy love possessing, 
Triumph in redeeming grace;
O refresh us, 
Traveling through this wilderness. 
 	 ~ 	1 . Nyame, fa Wo nhyira gya hɛn kwan, 
Dom hɛn dɛw na asomdwee;
Ma ankorankor yennya Wo dɔ
Mfa ndzi nkwagye adom ho dɛw;
Ao, hyɛ hɛn dzen
Wɔ bra sar akwantu yim'.
Yeehu W' hɛn nkyɛn afebɔɔ.    Amen.

MHB 693
2 . Thanks we give and adoration.
For Thy Gospel’s joyful sound;
May the fruits of Thy salvation 
In our hearts and lives abound; 
May Thy presence
With us evermore be found.   Amen.	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛdze ndaase na ntonton ma W' 
Wɔ Wo nsɛmpa dɛɛdɛw n' ho;
Nkyɛ Wo nkwangye no ho aba
Asow hɛn akoma nye bram';
Nkyɛ Woara so

MHB 694
1 . LORD, Thou hast been our dwelling place
In every generation;
Thy people still have known Thy grace,
And blessed Thy consolation;
Through every age Thou heardst our cry;
Through every age we found Thee nigh,
Our Strength and our Salvation.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, ayɛ hɛn tsenebea
Wɔ mbasantsen nyina mu;
Wo nkorɔfo da ho hu W'adom,
Woehyira W'awerɛkyekyer;
Etsie hɛn sufrɛ ber biara,
Yehu dɛ ebɛn ber biara,
Hɛn ahoɔdzen nye hɛn nkwagye.
Daa, afebɔɔ, afebɔɔ.

MHB 694
2 . Our cleaving sins we oft have wept,
And oft Thy patience provèd;
But still Thy faith we fast have kept;
Thy Name we still have loved;
And Thou hast kept and loved us well,
Hast granted us in Thee to dwell,
Unshaken, unremovèd.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛtɔ dɛ yesu hɛn bɔn ho,
Yɛyɛ dze akyerɛ W'abotar,
Naaso yɛda ho kura W' gyedzi m'
Yɛda ho dɔ Wo dzin no;
Na akora hɛn na adɔ hɛn yie,
'Ma hɛn kwan dɛ yɛntsena Wo mu,
Na yennhinhim, yenntutu.

MHB 694
3 . Lord, nothing from Thine arms of love
Shall Thine own people sever:
Our helper never will remove,
Our God will fail us never.
Thy people, Lord, have dwelt in Thee:
Our dwelling-place Thou still wilt be
For ever and for ever.	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, biribiara nnkotum
Agye W' nkorɔfo efi Wo nsamu,
Hɛn Boafo nnkefi hɔ ara da;
Nyame nnkedzi hɛn huambɔ,
Wo nkorɔfo atsena Wo mu;
'Bɛda ho ayɛ hɛn tsenabea

MHB 695
1 . PRAISE,  Lord,for Thee in Zion waits;
Prayer shall besiege Thy temple gates;
All flesh shall to Thy throne repair,
And find through Christ salvation there.
	 ~ 	1 . AYƐYI rotweɔn Wo Zion,
Mpaabɔ bɛhyɛ W'asɔrdan ma;
Nyimpa nyina bɛba W'egua ho,
Enya Christ mu nkwagye wɔ hɔ.
Na ma yɛnsow aba Wo mu.

MHB 695
2 . Our spirits faint, our sins prevail;
Leave not our trembling hearts to fail:
O Thou that hearest prayer, descend,
And still be found the sinner’s friend.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn sunsum fɔn, hɛn bɔn dzi nyim,
Mma hɛn ahopopo akoma nnsuro;
Ɔwo a itsie mpaabɔ, sian bra
Bɛyɛ ndzebɔnyɛfo nyɛnko.

MHB 695
3 . How blest Thy saints; how safely led;
How surely kept; how richly fed!
Savior of all in earth and sea,
How happy they who rest in Thee!
	 ~ 	3 
. W'ahotsewfo n' woehyira hɔn,
Wɔakora hɔn do, wɔnyɛn hɔn daa;
Asaase nye po nyina Agyenkwa,
Hɔn a wɔdan Wo nya enyigye.

MHB 695
4 . Thy hand sets fast the mighty hills,
Thy voice the troubled ocean stills;
Evening and morning hymn Thy praise,
And earthy Thou bounty wide displays.
	 ~ 	4 
. Wo nsa na edze yɛɛ mbepɔw,
Wo ndze taa po asorɛkye dzinn;
'Napa, 'wimbir, woyi W'ayɛw,
Emaa asaase yii no ndɔbaa.

MHB 695
5 . The year is with Thy goodness crowned,
Thy clouds drop wealth the world around;
Through Thee the deserts laugh and sing,
And nature smiles and owns her King.
	 ~ 	5 
. W'ayamuyie ahyɛ afe n' mu ma,
Wo mununkum tɔ asaase do nsu,
Wo mu sar pradada tow ndwom,
Abɔdze serew, ohu ne Hen.

MHB 695
6 . Lord, on our souls Thy Spirit pour;
The moral waste within restore;
O let Thy love our spring-tide be,
And make us all bear fruit to Thee.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Hue Wo Sunsum gu hɛn akra do;
Fa abrabɔ pa san ma hɛn;
O ma Wo dɔ no nkenyan hɛn,

MHB 696
1 . CHILDREN of the heavenly King,
As ye journey, sweetly sing;
Sing your Savior’s worthy praise,
Glorious in His works and ways
	 ~ 	1 . HOM a hom yɛ ɔsor Hen mba,
Hom ntow ndwom hom akwantu mu;
Hom ntow hom Agyenkwa ayɛyi,
Enyimnyam wɔ No ndwuma m'.
Na yebedzi W'ekyir daa.

MHB 696
2 . We are traveling home to God,
In the way the fathers trod;
They are happy now, and we
Soon their happiness shall see.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yerutu kwan akɔ Nyame nkyɛn,
Ɔkwan a egyanom faa do n'.
Hɔn enyi agye sesei,
Ɔnnkɛkyɛr na yeehu yi.

MHB 696
3 . Shout, ye little flock, and blest;
You on Jesus’ throne shall rest;
There your seat is now prepared,
There your kingdom and reward.
	 ~ 	3 
. Okuw ketseaba, hom ntsea m',
Hom mbɔhom Jesus Ne nkyɛn,
Woesiesie hom ngua wɔ hɔ,
Hom ahenman nye akatua.

MHB 696
4 . Lift your eyes, ye sons of light;
Zion’s city is in sight;
There our endless home shall be,
There our Lord we soon shall see.
	 ~ 	4 
. Hom mma hom enyi do, kan mba;
Zion kurow da hom enyim,
Hɔ, ɔbɛyɛ hɛn fie daa,
Yebohu hɛn Wura ntsɛm.

MHB 696
5 . Fear not, brethren; joyful stand
On the borders of your land;
Jesus christ, your Father’s Son,
Bids you underdismayed go on.
	 ~ 	5 
. Enuanom, hom nyina mfa
Dɛw ngyina hom ahe do;
Jesus Christ, hom Egya Ne Ba n'
Hyɛ hom dɛ hom nkɔ kan ndam m'.

MHB 696
6 . Lord, obedient we would go,
Gladly leaving all below;
Only Thou our Leader be;
And we will still follow Thee.	 ~ 	6 
. Ewuradze, yetsie kɔ kan,
Dze dɛw gya ne nyina wɔ ha,
Wo nko ara dzi hɛn bano

MHB 697
1 . BLEST are the humble souls that see
Their emptiness and poverty;
Treasures of grace to them are given,
And crowns of joy laid up in Heaven.
	 ~ 	1 . NHYIRA nye akra abrɛfo a
Wohu hͻn hia dɛ wͻnnsɛ hwee;
Wͻama hͻn adom akyɛdze,
Nye dɛw ahenkyɛw a ͻwͻ sor.
'Nyimnyam, dɛw nye hͻn akatua.

MHB 697
2 . Blest are the men of broken heart,
Who mourn for sin with inward smart;
The blood of Christ divinely flows,
A healing balm for all their woes.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nhyira nye hͻn a hͻn akoma ebubu,
Bͻn ntsi wodzi yaw wͻ hͻn mu;
Christ No bͻgyaa krͻnkrͻn pem dɛ
Ayarsa ma hͻn yaw nyinara.

MHB 697
3 . Blest are the souls that thirst for grace,
Hunger and long for righteousness;
They shall be well supplied, and fed
With living streams and living bread.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nhyira nyé akra a wͻhwehwɛ adorn;
’Kͻm nye nsukͻm wo tsénenee ntsi,
Wͻdze nkwa nsu nye edziban
Bɛmema hͻn ama wͻaamee.

MHB 697
4 . Blest are the pure, whose hearts are clean
From the defiling powers of sin;
With endless pleasure they shall see
The God of spotless purity.
	 ~ 	4 
. Nhyira nye akomamutsewfo,
Woefi bͻn no tum no ase;
Wodze enyigyé a onnyi ewiei
Bohu Nyamé a ͻyɛ krͻnkrͻn.

MHB 697
5 . Blest are the sufferers who partake
Of pain and shame for Jesus’ sake;
Their souls shall triumph in the Lord;
Glory and joy are  their reward.	 ~ 	5 
. Nhyira nye amandzehufo,
Jesus ntsi wohu amandze;
Hͻn kra bedzi nyim Nyame mu.

MHB 698
1 . ABIDE among us with Thy grace,
Lord Jesus, evermore;
Nor let us e’er to sin give place,
Nor grieve Him we adore.
 	 ~ 	1 . OWURA Jesus, fa W‘adom no
Bɛtséna hɛn mu afebͻͻ,
Na mma yɛmma bͻn kwan koraa,
Na yɛnnhow Wo werɛ.
Kora hɛn Wo mu nokwar m'.    Amen.

MHB 698
2 . Abide among us with Thy word,
Redeemer whom we love;
Thy help and mercy here afford,
And life with Thee above.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Fa W’asɛm bɛtsena hɛn mu.
Pomfo a yɛdͻ Wo;
Ma hɛn Wo mboa nye mbͻbͻrhu
Na tsenabew wͻ sor.

MHB 698
3 . Abide among us with Thy ray,
O Light that lighten’st all,
And let Thy truth preserve our way,
Nor suffer us to fall.
	 ~ 	3 
. Fa Wo kan bɛtsena hɛn mu,
Kan a ͻhyérɛn hɛn do,
Na ma Wo nokwar nkyérɛ hɛn kwan,
Na amma yaannhwé ase.

MHB 698
4 . Abide with us to bless us still,
O bounteous Lord of peace;
With grace and power our spirit fill,
Our faith and love increase.
	 ~ 	4 
. ’Nye hɛn ntsena na hyira hɛn,
Asomdwee Ewuradze;
Adom na tum aahyɛ hɛn ma,
To hɛn gyedzi na dͻ m’.

MHB 698
5 .  Abide among us as our shield,
O Captain of Thy host,
That to the world we may nut yield,
Nor e’er forsake our post.
	 ~ 	5 
. Bɛtsena hɛn mu dɛ hɛn kyɛm,
Dzi Wo dͻm do Ͻsahen,
Na yeenngyaa hɛnho amma wiadze,
Na yemmfi hɛn gyinabew.

MHB 698
6 .  Abide with us in faithful love,
Our God and Saviour be;
Thy help at need, Oh let us prove,
And keep us true to Thee.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Bɛtséna hɛn mu wͻ dͻ mapa m’,
Yɛ hɛn Nyamé Agyenkwa;
Yɛnkyerɛ Wo mboa wͻ ahokyer mu,

MHB 699
1 . GREAT is our redeeming Lord
In power, and truth, and grace;
Him, by highest heaven adored,
His church on earth doth praise:
In the city of our God,
In His holy mount below,
Publish, spread His name abroad,
And all his greatness show. 
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN Pomfo, Wura yɛ kɛse,
Tum, nokwar nye adom mu;
Ɔsorsorfo tonton N' daa,
N'asɔrmba yi N' ayɛw.
Hɛn Nyankopɔn kurow no mu,
Bepɔw krɔnkrɔn a ɔwɔ ase n',
Hom mfa Ne dzin no ntahye,
Hom nda N' kɛseyɛ edzi.
Wɔ mfesantsen nyin m'.

MHB 699
2 . For Thy loving-kindness, Lord,
We in Thy temple stay;
Here Thy faithful love record,
Thy saving power display:
With Thy name Thy praise is known,
Glorious Thy perfections shine;
Earth’s remotest bounds shall own
Thy works are all divine. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewuradze, W'adɔyɛ ntsi
Yɛtsena W'asɔrdan mu,
Ha Wo nokwar dɔ no da
Wo nkwagye tum edzi;
Wo dzin ma yeyi W'ayɛw,
Na W'emudzi no hyerɛn,
Wiadze nyina bɛgye ato m',
Wo ndwuma yɛ krɔnkrɔn.

MHB 699
3 . See the Gospel Church secure,
And founded on a rock;
All her promises are sure;
Her bulwarks who can shock?
Count her every precious shrine;
Tell, to after-ages tell,
Fortified by power divine,
The church can never fail. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Hwɛ, Asɛmpa Asɔr n' tsim hɔ,
Na osi botan do;
N'anohoba yɛ nokwar,
Woana behim N'aban?
Kan no sombea a ɔsom bo;
Ka kyerɛ nkyirmba so bi.
Nyame tum abɔ ho ban,
Asɔr no ronnhwe ase.

MHB 699
4 . Zion’s God is all our own,
Who on his love rely;
We His pardoning love have known,
And live to Christ, and die:
To the new Jerusalem
He our faithful guide shall be:
Him we claim, and rest in him,
Through all eternity. 	 ~ 	4 
. Zion Nyame yɛ hɛndze,
Hɛndze, yɛtwer No dɔ;
Yeehu Ne fakyɛ dɔ no,
Yɛtse ase, wu ma Christ:
Ɔbɛyɛ hɛn Kwankyerɛfo
'Kɔ Jerusalem fofor m';
Yɛgye N', na yɛhom No mu,

MHB 7
1 . O HEAVENLY King, look down from above; 
Assist us to sing Thy mercy and love: 
So sweetly overflowing, so plenteous the store, 
Thou still art bestowing, and giving us more.
	 ~ 	1 . O ƆSORSOR Hen, fi sor hwɛ famu ha,
Boa hen yɛntow W'ehumbɔbɔor nye dɔ,
Ɔrepem dɛ osunsuan ebunkam hɛn do,
Naaso gu do ara dze pii kã hɛn ho.

MHB 7
2 . God of our life, we hallow Thy name; 
Our business and strife is Thee to proclaim. 
Accept our thanksgiving for creating grace; 
The living, the living shall show forth Thy praise.
	 ~ 	2 . Hen nkwa Nyankopɔn, yɛtsew Wo dzin ho;
Hɛn edwuma nye dɛ yɛper tahye Wo dzin,
Gye hɛn ndaase wo adom a edze bɔɔ hɛn,
Atseasefo nyina bɛkyere W'ayɛyi.

MHB 7
3 . Our Father and Lord, almighty art Thou; 
Preserved by Thy word, we worship Thee now; 
The bountiful donor of all we enjoy, 
Our tongues ,to Thine honour, and lives we employ.
	 ~ 	3 . Hɛn Egya, hɛn Wura, eyɛ Otumfo,
W'asɛm a akora hɛn ntsi na yɛrosor yi;
Ndzepa a yenya nyina fi Wo nko hɔ ba,
Hɛn gyirama na hɛn nkwa yɛdze bɔsom Wo.

MHB 7
4 . But O above all Thy kindness we praise, 
Form sin and from thrall which saves the lost race; 
Thy Son Thou hast given the world to redeem, 
And bring us to heaven whose trust is in Him.
	 ~ 	4 . Dza ɔkyen ne nyina, yetow W’ayamuyie.
Agye wiadze a ayew efi bɔn na yaw m'.
Edze Wo Ba abɔ werdam apon wiadze,
De omfa hen a yetwer No mbra hen sor fie.

MHB 7
5 . Wherefore of Thy love we sing and rejoice, 
With angels above we lift up our voice: 
Thy love each believer shall gladly adore, 
For ever and ever, when time is no more.
             Amen	 ~ 	5 . Wo dɔ ntsi yɛtow ndwom dzi ehurusi.
Yɛnye sor abɔfo ma hɛn ndze do;
Agyedzifo nyina bɔtonton Wo dɔ
Mbersantsen mfesantsen a ɔmmbɔ adze da

MHB 70
1 . ALL my hope on God is founded; 
 He doth still my trust renew, 
 Me through change and chance He guideth, 
 Only good and only true. 
 God unknown, 
 He alone 
 Calls my heart to be His own.
	 ~ 	1 . M'ENYIDAR wɔ Nyankopɔn mu;
Ɔyɛ me gyedzi fofor,
Ogya m' fa ɔbra adandan mu,
Oye na ɔyɛ nokwafo.
Wonnyim No,
No nkotoo,
Ɔfrɛ m'akoma Nedze.

MHB 70
2 . Pride of man and earthly glory, 
 Sword and crown betray His trust: 
 What with care and toil He buildeth, 
 Tower and temple fall to dust. 
 But God’s power,  
 Hour by hour, 
 Is my temple and my tower.
	 ~ 	2 . Nyimpa ahantan na n'enyimnyam, 
Afowa na ahenkyɛw sɛɛ no;
Ɔdze berɛ tow abantsentsen
Na ne nyina bubu gu famu,
Nyame tum,
Ber nyina nye
m'asɔrdan na abantsentsen.

MHB 70
3 . God’s great goodness aye endureth, 
 Deep His wisdom, passing thought: 
 Splendor, light and life attend Him, 
 Beauty springeth out of nought. 
 Evermore 
 From His store 
 New-born worlds rise and adore.
	 ~ 	3 . Nyame N'ayamuyie wɔ hɔ daa,
Ne nyansaa bor adwen do:
Enyimnyam, kan na nkwa fir no,
Ahoɔfɛw mapa fir no.
Afebɔɔ
Na No mu
Aman fofor soɛr som No.

MHB 70
4 . Daily doth the Almighty Giver 
 Bounteous gifts on us bestow. 
 His desire our soul delighteth, 
 Pleasure leads us where we go. 
 Love doth stand  
 At His hand; 
 Joy doth wait on His command.
	 ~ 	4 . Otumfo Mafo no ma hɛn 
Ndzepa pii daa nyinara,
Hɛn akra enyi gye Ne pɛ ho,
'Nyigye gya hɛn bea a yɛkɔ.
No mu na
Ɔdɔ gyina;
Ɔma enyigye gyina.

MHB 70
5 . Still from man to God eternal 
 Sacrifice of praise be done, 
 High above all praises praising 
 For the gift of Christ His Son. 
 Christ doth call 
 One and all: 
 Ye who follow shall not fall.	 ~ 	5 . Adasa nkɔ do ara daa,
Mfa ayɛyi afɔrbɔ 
Mma ɔdomankoma Nyame,
 Wɔ Christ a ɔdze No mae,
Jesus frɛ
Obiara:
Nyia otsie No nnhwe ase.

MHB 700
1 . WHO in the Lord confide,
And feel His sprinkled blood,
In storms and hurricanes abide,
Firm as the mount of God:
Steadfast, and fixed, and sure,
His Zion cannot move:
His faithful people stand secure
In  Jesu’s guardian love. 
	 ~ 	1 . NYIA no werɛ hyɛ Nyame m',
Na ɔtse bɔgya no tum n',
Gyina pintsinn wɔ ehumtu ber m'
Dɛ Nyame Ne bepɔw:
Onnhinhim, osi pi,
Ne Zion nnkodwuruw da;
N'agyedzifo gyina pintsinn
Wɔ Jesu No dɔ mu.
Na dɔ hɔn kɔ ewiei.

MHB 700
2 . As round Jerusalem
The hilly bulwarks rise,
So God protects and covers them
From all their enemies.
On every side He stands,
And for his Israel cares;
And safe in His almighty hands
Their souls for ever bears. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Dɛ mbrɛ nkokwaa etwa
Jerusalem ho ehyia n',
Dɛm na Nyame bɔ hom ho ban
Fi atamfo nyina nsamu;
Ogyina akwan nyina m',
Twitwa gye N' Israel,
Na No tum nsamu na ɔdze
Hɔn akra sie afebɔɔ.

MHB 700
3 . But let them still abide
In Thee, all-gracious Lord,
Till every soul is sanctified
And perfectly restored:
The men of heart sincere
Continue to defend;
And do them good, and save them here,
And love them to the end.	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze Domfo, ma
Wɔnda ho ntsena Wo mu,
Nkɛpem dɛ akra nyina ho bɛsan,
Na woedzi mu koraa;
Akomamutseweefo nyina
Kɔ do bɔ hɔn ho ban;
Yɛ hɔn yie, gye hɔn nkwa wɔ ha,

MHB 701
1 . THE Church’s one foundation
Is Jesus Christ her Lord;
She is His new creation
By water and the Word;
From heaven He came and sought her
To be His holy bride;
With His own blood He bought her,
And for her life He died.
	 ~ 	1 . Asɔr ne fapem kortoo 
Nye Jesus Christ hɛn Wura;
Ɔnam nsu nye N'asɛm do
Yɛɛ n' N'abɔdze fofor.
Ofi sor bɔhwehɛɛ no.
Yɛɛ n' N'ayefor krɔnkrɔn.
Ɔdze No bɔgyaa tɔɔ no
No nkwa ntsi na owui.
Yɛnye W' mbɛtsena sor hɔ.  Amen.

MHB 701
2 . Elect from every nation,
Yet one o’er all the earth,
Her charter of salvation
One Lord, one faith, one birth,
One holy Name she blesses,
Partakes one holy food,
And to one hope she presses,
With every grace endued
	 ~ 	2 
. Wɔpaam' yii n' aman nyinam', 
Naaso ɔyɛ Asɔr kor.
No nkwagye tum ɔnye yi-
Wura kor, gyedzi kor,
Dzin krɔnkrɔn kor na ohyira;
N'edziban krɔnkrɔn kor,
Enyidar kor na ɔper ho,
Adom nyina wɔ mu.

MHB 701
3 . Though with a scornful wonder
Men see her sore oppressed,
By schisms rent asunder,
By heresies distressed;
Yet saints their watch are keeping,
Their cry goes up: How long
And soon the night of weeping
Shall be the morn of song.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ mpo nyimpa si atwetwe 
Hwɛ N'ahokyer kɛse,
Dɛ mpaapaam' atsetsew mu
Nkyerɛkyerɛ bɔn tseetsee N' a,
Ahotsewfo n' weɔn, wosu
Dɛ, ondu da bɛn ara?
Anago su n' nnkyɛkyɛr na
Ɔadan anapa ndwom.

MHB 701
4 . Mid toil and tribulation,
And tumult of her war,
She waits the consummation
Of peace forevermore,
Till, with the vision glorious
Her longing eyes are blest,
And the great Church victorious
Shall be the Church at rest.
	 ~ 	4 
. Berɛ nye amandzehu mu, 
N'akodzi dede n' mu,
Ɔtweɔn daadaa asomdwee a
Ɔmmbɔ adze n' n'emudzi n',
Kɛpem dɛ n'enyi bohu
'Nyimnyam enyidado n',
Na Asɔr konyimdzifo no
Bɛhɛn n' ahomgye mu.

MHB 701
5 . Yet she on earth hath union
With God the Three in One,
And mystic sweet communion
With those whose rest is won,
O happy ones and holy!
Lord, give us grace that we,
Like them, the meek and lowly,
on high may dwell with Thee.    Amen	 ~ 	5 
. Na ɔwɔ wiadze yi, ɔnye 
Ɔkorsa Nyame bɔm',
Na ɔnye hɔn a wɔrohom
Dzi nkitaho dɛɛdɛw.
O ahotsewfo esiarfo!
Ewuradze, dom hɛn,
Dɛ abrɛfo yinom, ma

MHB 702
1 . CHRIST  is our corner-stone,
on him alone we build;
with His true saints alone
The courts of heaven are filled:
On His great love our hopes we place
Of present grace and joys above.
	 ~ 	1 . CHRIST hɛn kutuwdo - bo,
No nko do na yɛtow;
N'ahotsewfo nko hyɛ
Sor abanguado ma;
Yɛdze hɛn enyidar na enyigye
Hyɛ No dɔ na adom mu sesei.
Wɔbɛfrɛ hɔn akɔ ahomgye m'.  Amen.

MHB 702
2 . O then with hymns of praise
These hallowed courts shall ring;
Our voices we will raise
The Three in One to sing,
And thus proclaim in joyful song,
Both loud and long, that glorious name.
	 ~ 	2 
. O dɛm ayɛyi ndwom 'i
Bɔwosow abangua 'i do;
Yɛbɛma hɛn ndze do
Atow Ɔkorsa ndwom,
Dɛm na yɛdze N'enyimnyam dzin n'.
Bɔtow ndwom a ohur daa nyina.

MHB 702
3 . Here, gracious God, do Thou
For evermore draw nigh;
Accept each faithful vow,
And mark each suppliant sigh;
In copious shower
on all who pray
Each holy day
Thy blessings pour.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔdomfo Nyankopɔn,
Twe penkyɛn hɛn mber nyina
Gye nokwar nsew biara,
Na hyɛ nkrumsi so nsew;
Hue Wo nhyira gu mpaabɔ do
Wɔ da krɔnkrɔn biara no mu.

MHB 702
4 . Here may we gain from heaven
The grace which we implore;
And may that grace, once given,
Be with us evermore,
Until that day when all the blest
To endless rest are called away.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Adom a yebisa n'
Wɔmfa mfi sor mbrɛ hɛn;
Sɛ hɛn nsa nya ka dze a,
Ɔnye hɛn ntsena afebɔɔ,
Nkodu da no a esiarfo nyina

MHB 703
1 . CITY of God, how broad and far
Outspread thy walls sublime!
The true thy chartered freemen are
Of every age and clime.
	 ~ 	1 . Nyame kurow mbrɛ odua so 
Na n' afasu war a!
'Nokwafo nye W' adehye dɔm,
Wɔ mbew na mber nyinam'.
Bɛkyebo kurow si do n'.

MHB 703
2 . One holy Church, one army strong;
One steadfast, high intent,
One working band, one harvest song,
One King omnipotent
	 ~ 	2 
. Asɔr krɔnkrɔn kor, nkodɔm kor, 
Botae a ɔkrɔn kor,
Dwumadzi kuw kor, ndɔbaa ndwom kor,
Ɔhen Otumfo kor.

MHB 703
3 . How purely hath thy speech come down
From man’s primeval youth!
How grandly hath thine empire grown
Of freedom, love and truth!
	 ~ 	3  
. Ofitsi nyimpa n' ahyɛse 
Mbrɛ W' asɛm esi edwir n'!
Mbrɛ W' aman esi atserɛw
Wɔ ahotɔ na dɔm' a!

MHB 703
4 . How gleam thy watch fires-through the night
With never-fainting ray!
How rise thy towers, serene and bright
To meet the dawning day!
	 ~ 	4 
. Mbrɛ Wo gya si dzɛw anago 
Dze weɔn na ɔnnhwer a!
W' akoban hyerɛn sunm' ara
Dze kɛpem adzekyee.

MHB 703
5 . In vain the surge’s angry shock,
In vain the drifting sands;
Unharmed upon the eternal Rock
The eternal City stands.	 ~ 	5  
. Asorɛkye bu akɛse kwa, 
Anhwea dwurudwuruw gyan;
Onntum mmpuhim botantsim a

MHB 704
1 . BY the holy hills surrounded,
On her firm base securely founded,
Stands fast the city of the Lord:
None shall rend her walls asunder;
On her men look with fear and wonder,
And mark who here keeps watch and ward.
He slumbers not, nor sleeps,
Who His loved Israel keeps.
Hallelujah!
Happy the race
Who through Gods grace
Shall have in her their dwelling place!
	 ~ 	1 . AKOKO a ho tsew etwa ehyia,
Ne fapem no tsim hɔ pintinn daa,
Ewuradze ahenkurow no tsim hɔ;
Wonnkotum edwuruw n'afasu;
Mbanyin dze asuro na nwanwa hwɛ no,
Na wɔhyɛ nyia ɔweɔn no nsew.
Nyia ɔhwɛ Israel no,
Ɔnntɔ nnkom na ɔnnda,
Halleluja!
Enyigye dɔm\nNye hɔn a adom n'
Bɛba hɔn tsenabea mu daa daa!
Na enyigye kɛse tsim hɔ daa.

MHB 704
2 . Zion's gates Jehovah loveth,
And with especial grace approveth;
He maketh fast her bolts and bars;
Those who dwell in her he blesses,
And comforts them in their distresses
Who cast on him their griefs and cares.
How wonderful the grace
With which He doth embrace
All His people!
City of God,
How sweet the abode
On which such blessings are bestowed!
	 ~ 	2 
. Jehova dɔ Zion n'apon!
Na ɔdze adom nwanwa gye to m';
Na ɔdze ndadze hin ekyir,
Ohyira hɔn a wɔtse no mu,
Ɔkyekye hɔn werɛ ber a wɔabɔm,
Na wɔdze yaw, dadwen gu N' do n',
Adom a ɔdze fua
No nkorɔfo nyinara n',
Ɔyɛ nwanwa!
Nyame ahenkurow,
Enyigye bea a,
Hɔ na dɛm nhyira nyina wɔ!

MHB 704
3 . Taught in thee is a salvation
Unknown to every other nation;
There great and holy things are heard;
In the midst of thee abiding,
Enlightening, comforting and guiding,
Thou hast the Spirit, and the Word;
There breathing peace around
Is heard the joyful sound,
Grace and mercy!
How sweet that is,
Which here speaks peace,
There crowns with everlasting bliss.	 ~ 	3 
. N-kwagye a aman pii nnyim no,
Zion no nko mu na wɔkyerɛ:
Hɔ, wɔtse dza ɔso, yɛ krɔnkrɔn;
Ber a Wo nkorɔfo tse wo mu no,
Etsentsen hɔn, kyekye hɔn werɛ,
Ewɔ Sunsum na Asɛm no;
Asomdwee bɔ hɔ aprɔw,
Na wɔtse ndwom dɛɛdɛw,
Nya adom tsema,
Ɔyɛ dɛw ma!
Ɔma asomdwee

MHB 705
1 . GOD is the refuge of His saints,
When storms of sharp distress invade;
Ere we can offer our complaints,
Behold Him present with His aid !
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME yɛ sumabew ma Ne mba,
Sɛ ehum a ɔyɛ dzen tu mpo a;
Ansaana yɛka hɛn ayawdzi n',
Hwɛ ɔwɔ hɛn nkyɛn roboa hɛn!
Woetsim n' wɔ No nokwardzi do.

MHB 705
2 . Let mountains from their seats be hurled
Down to the deep, and buried there,
Convulsions shake the solid world,
Our faith shall never yield to fear.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma mbepɔw ntutu mfi hɔn mbea
Mbra bun mu na wonsie hɔn hɔ;
Asaase dzendzen no nwosow,
Hɛn gyedzi nnkosuro hwee koraa.

MHB 705
3 . Loud may the troubled ocean roar;
In sacred peace our souls abide;
While every nation, every shore,
Trembles, and dreads the swelling tide.
	 ~ 	3 
. Po woree no bɛyɛ dede,
Hɛn akra tsena asomdwee krɔnn mu;
Ber a aman na mpoano nyimpa
Ho popo, suro asorɛkye kɛse n'.

MHB 705
4 . There is a stream, whose gentle flow
Makes glad the city of our God,
Life, love, and joy, still guiding through,
And watering our divine abode.
	 ~ 	4 
. Esu bi wɔ hɔ a ne mpemee
Ma hɛn Nyame man enyigye;
Nkwa, dɔ na enyigye gu do pem,
Fow kɔ hɛn man krɔnkrɔn no mu.

MHB 705
5 . This sacred stream, Thy vital word,
Thus all our raging fear controls;
Sweet peace Thy promises afford,
And give new strength to fainting souls.
	 ~ 	5 
. Dɛm esu krɔnkrɔn n', W'asɛnhia n',
Ɔhyɛ hɛn suro dzendzen do;
Asomdwee a Wo bɔyhɛ n' dze ma n'
Ma ɔkra a ɔagow ahoɔdzen bio.

MHB 705
6 . Zion enjoys her Monarch’s love,
Secure against a threatening hour;
Nor can her firm foundations move,
Built on His faithfulness and power.	 ~ 	6 
. Zion dzi ne Hen N' dɔ ho dɛw,
Ɔgye n' fi dɔnhwer huuhu n' mu;
Ne fapem dzendzen n' nnokobubu,

MHB 706
1 . GLORIOUS things of thee are spoken,
Zion, city of our God;
He, whose word cannot be broken,
Formed thee for His own abode.
On the Rock of Ages founded,
What can shake thy sure repose?
With salvation’s walls surrounded,
Thou may’st smile at all thy foes.
	 ~ 	1 . Wɔka wo ho enyimnyam nsɛm, 
Zion, hɛn Nyame Ne man;
Nyia ɔnnsan N' asɛm no kyekyeer
Wo dɛ No kurow a ɔtsenam'.
Tsetse Bo no nye wo fapem,
Ebɛn botum awosow w'?
N-kwagye yɛ wo ho afasu;
Ebɛserew w' atamfo.
Zion mba nko na wonya

MHB 706
2 . See, the streams of living waters,
Springing from eternal love,
Well supply thy sons and daughters,
And all fear of want remove:
Who can faint, while such a river
Ever flows their thirst to assuage?
Grace which, like the Lord, the giver,
Never fails from age to age.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hwɛ, n-kwa nsu a ofi Nyame 
Ne daadaa dɔ mu pem no
Ma wo mba wɔmee, na oyi
Hia ho suro fi hɔn do.
Woana na ɔbɔtɔ bitsi
Wɔ dɛm esutsen yi ho?
Adom a ɔpem daa nyina
Wo Nyame dze dom wo daa.

MHB 706
3 . Saviour, if in Zion’s city
I, through grace, a member am, 
Let the world deride or pity,
I will glory in Thy name:
Fading is the sinner’s pleasure,
All his boasted pomp and show;
Solid joys and lasting treasure
None but Zion’s children know.	 ~ 	3 
. M' Agyenkwa, menam W' adom do 
Mofora Zion mamfom' a,
Ma wiadze nsi me atwetwe,
Ɔno mpo bɛyɛ mo ntuw,
Wiadze nye no mu enyigye
Nye ahokyerɛ resen.
Enyigye nye ahonya a otsim

MHB 707
1 . O THOU not made with hands,
not  throned above the skies,
nor walled with shining walls,
nor framed with stones of price,
More bright than gold or gem,
God’s own Jerusalem.
	 ~ 	1 . ϽWO wͻammfa nsa annyɛ W’,
Eso wͻannkrͻn wo sor,
Wͻanntow w’aban hyɛnhyɛnn,
Wͻnndzé aboͻdzen bo yɛ w';
Ehyerɛn sen sika,
Nyame N’ Jerusalem.
Nyame N’ Jerusalem.   Amen.

MHB 707
2 . Where’er the gentle heart 
Finds courage from above;
Where’er the heart forsook 
Warms with the breath of love;
Where faith bids fear depart,
City of God, thou art.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ber a akoma brɛfo,
Benya sor ’kokodur n’,
Mbrɛ akoma apa n’,
Onya nkenyan fi ͻdͻ m’
Ber a gyedzi apam suro n’;
Eyɛ Nyame N’ kuropͻn.

MHB 707
3 . Thou art where’er the proud
In humbleness melts down;
Where self itself yields up;
Where martyrs win their crown;
Where faithful souls possess
Themselves in perfect peace.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewͻ beea a ahopͻw
Dan yɛ ahobrɛadze,
Bea a suban yɛ botoo n’;
Bea a atͻfo nya ahenkyɛw,
Bea a agyedzifo nyina
Nya asomdwee mapa.

MHB 707
4 . Where in life’s common ways
With cheerful feet we go;
Where in his steps we tread,
Who trod the way of woe;
Where he is in the heart,
City of God, thou art.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ͻbra n’akwan horow mu,
Yɛdzé enigye nantsew;
Hɛn a yeduaa mbusu mu n’,
Yetsia N’anamͻn mu,
Ber a ͻwͻ akoma biara mu n’;
Nya Nyame N’ kuropͻn.

MHB 707
5 . Not throned above the skies,
Nor golden-walled afar,
But where Christ’s two or three
In His name gathered are,
Be in the midst of them,
God’s own Jerusalem.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. ϽWo a wͻannkrͻn w’ wͻ sor.
Wͻanntow w’aban ekyirkyir,
Na bér a beenu, baasa
Ehyia mu wͻ Christ mu n’,
Tsena hͻn finimfim,

MHB 708
1 . WE love Thy Kingdom, Lord,
The house of Thine abode
The Church our blest Redeemer saved
  With His own precious blood.
	 ~ 	1 . OWURA, yɛdͻ Wo man,
Ofie a etse mu no.
Asͻr a hɛn Pomfo n’ dze N’ bͻgyaa a
Ͻsom bo gyee sii hͻ n'.
Na dɛw kɛse wͻ sor.

MHB 708
3 . For her our tears shall fall, 
 For her our prayers ascend,
To her our cares and toils be given, 
Till toils and cares shall end.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ͻno ntsi yebosu
Na hɛn mpaabͻ edu sor;
Yɛdze hɛn haw, hɛn bérɛ bɛma n’
’Kodu dɛ ͻbͻbͻ adze.

MHB 708
4 . Beyond our highest joy
 We prize her heavenly ways, 
 Her sweet communion, solemn vows. 
Her hymns of love and praise.
	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn dɛw mbordo ekyir n’,
Yebu no sor akwan,
Ne nkitahodzi anohoba,
No dͻ, ayɛyi ho ndwom n’.

MHB 708
5 . Jesus, Thou Friend divine,
 Our Saviour, and our King,
Thy hand from every snare and foe
 Shall great deliverance bring.
	 ~ 	5 
. Jesus, Nyɛnko krͻnkrͻn,
Hɛn Gyefo na hɛn Hen,
Wo nsa bɛgye hɛn yie efi
Atamfo nyé efir mu.

MHB 708
6 . Sure as Thy truth shall last, 
To Zion shall be given
The brightest glories earth can yield,
 And brighter bliss of heaven.	 ~ 	6 
. Dɛ Wo nokwar tsim hͻ n’,
Asaasé enyimnyam pa n’,
Wͻdze ne nyina bɛma Zion,

MHB 709
1 . AND are we yet alive, 
And see each other’s face? 
Glory and thanks to Jesus give 
For his almighty grace!
	 ~ 	1 . Yɛda ho yɛtse nkwam'? 
Yeehu hɛn enyim bio?
Christ N' adom a ɔapon hɛn ntsi
Hom mma yenyi N' ayɛw.
Dza aka n'- yemmbu no hwee

MHB 709
2 . Preserved by power divine 
To full salvation here, 
Again in Jesus’ praise we join, 
And in His sight appear.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyame tum akora hɛn 
Wɔ nkwagye a odzi mum';
Yɛbɔm' bio wɔ Christ N' ayɛyim',
Yedzi N' enyim ehyia.

MHB 709
3 . What troubles have we seen, 
What conflicts have we passed, 
Fightings without, and fears within,
Since we assembled last!
	 ~ 	3 
. Mbusu pii a yeehu a! 
Akodzi a yeeduam' a!
Guado ɔko', na hɛn mu hu' a!,
Fitsi dɛ yehyiaa nkan n'.

MHB 709
4 . But out of all the Lord 
Hath brought us by His love: 
And still He doth His help afford, 
And hides our life above.
	 ~ 	4  
. Ewuradze No dɔ 
Agye hɛn ne nyinam',
Na ɔda ho dze No mboa ma hɛn
Na osie hɛn nkwa wɔ sor.

MHB 709
5 . Then let us make our boast 
Of His redeeming power, 
Which saves us to the uttermost, 
Till we can sin no more:
	 ~ 	5 
. Dɛm a hom mma yentuw 
No nkwagye tum no mu,
Tum a ɔgye hɛn nkwa koraa
Kɛpem dɛ yeetua bɔn.

MHB 709
6 . Let us take up the cross 
Till we the crown obtain; 
And gladly reckon all things loss, 
So we may Jesus gain.	 ~ 	6 
. Hom mma yɛmfa mbeamudua n' 
Na yeenya ahenkyɛw n';
Sɛ yebenya Jesus Noara a

MHB 71
1 . WE come unto our Fathers God: 
 Their Rock is our salvation; 
 The eternal arms, their dear abode, 
 We make our habitation; 
 We bring Thee, Lord, the praise they brought; 
 We seek Thee as Thy saints have sought 
 In every generation.
	 ~ 	1 . YƐBA hɛn egyanom Nyame nkyɛn; 
Hɔn Botan nye hɛn nkwagye; 
Daa abasa nye hɔn tsenabea, 
Yɛdze yɛ hɛn tsenabea,
Yedze hɛn ayɛyi brɛ Wo,
Yɛhwehwɛ W' dɛ ahotsewfo n'. 
Wɔ mbasantsen nyina mu.

MHB 71
2 . The fire divine their steps that led 
 Still goeth bright before us; 
 The heavenly shield around them spread 
 Is still high holden oer us; 
 The grace those sinners that subdued, 
 The strength those weaklings that renewed, 
 Doth vanquish, doth restore us.
	 ~ 	2 . Onyame gya a odzii hɔn kan n'
Da ho hyerɛn dzi hɛn kan;
Ɔsor kyɛm a ɔnweɔɔn hɔn no 
Da ho so kata hɛn do;
Adom a ɔbrɛɛ abɔnfo adze,
Ahoɔdzen a ɔhyɛɛ mberɛwyɛ dzen, 
Da ho dzi nyim, hyɛ hen dzen.

MHB 71
3 . The cleaving sins that brought them low 
 Are still our souls oppressing; 
 The tears that from their eyes did flow 
 Fall fast, our shame confessing; 
 As with Thee, Lord, prevailed their cry, 
 So our strong prayer ascends on high 
 And bringeth down Thy blessing.
	 ~ 	3 . Bɔn a ɔbrɛɛ hɔn adze no
Da ho hyɛ hɛn kra do ndɛ; 
Nyinsuwa a wokyii n' nyinara, 
Yɛdze enyito ka hɛn bɔn; 
Dɛ mbrɛ itsiee hɔn sufrɛ no, 
Dɛm na hɛn mpaabɔ fow kɔ sor, 
Na ɔdze Wo nhyira ba.

MHB 71
4 . Their joy unto their Lord we bring; 
 Their song to us descendeth: 
 The Spirit Who in them did sing 
 To us His music lendeth; 
 His song in them, in us, is one; 
 We raise it high, we send it on,  
  The song that never endeth.
	 ~ 	4 . Yɛdze hɔn dɛw brɛ hɔn Wura;
Hɔn ndwom sian ba hɛn so nkyɛn; 
Sunsum a ɔtoow ndwom wɔ hɔn mu n', 
Ɔdze No ndwom so ma hɛn;
Yɛnye hɔn tow ndwom kor ara;
Yɛma do, yɛdze kɔ sorsor,
Ndwom a ɔmmbɔ adze da.

MHB 71
5 . Ye saints to come, take up the strain, 
 The same sweet theme endeavour: 
 Unbroken be the golden chain; 
 Keep on the song for ever; 
 Safe in the same dear dwelling-place, 
 Rich with the same eternal grace, 
 Bless the same boundless giver.	 ~ 	5 . Ahotsewfo a hom reba nyina,
Hom nkɔ do ntow ndwom dɛɛdɛw;
Mma hom nngyaa ndwom n' tow ara da; 
Hom nkɔ do ntow afebɔɔ;
Hom wɔ ahotɔ wɔ hom tsenabea,
Adom a onnyi ewiei wɔ ha,
Hyira Nyia ɔma mbordo n'.

MHB 710
1 . BRETHREN in Christ, and well-beloved,
To Jesus and His servants dear,
Enter and show yourselves approved;
Enter, and find that God is here.
	 ~ 	1 . NUANOM na adɔfo wɔ Christ mu,
Hom ho hia Jesus na No dɔm;
Hom mbra mbɛda hom ho edzi,
M'bohu dɔ Ewuradze wɔ ha.
Hɛn sor ahotɔ a onnyi kasu.

MHB 710
2 . Welcome from earth: lo, the right hand
Of fellowship to you we give;
With open hearts and hands we stand,
And you in Jesu’s name receive.
	 ~ 	2 
. Akɔaba fi asaase do;
Yɛyɛ hom etuu fɛkuwbɔ mu;
Ofi akoma mapa mu,
Na hom ngye no Jesus dzin mu.

MHB 710
3 . Jesu, Thyself in love reveal:
Are we not met in Thy great name ?
Thee in the midst we wait to feel,
We wait to catch the spreading flame.
	 ~ 	3 
. Jesus, yi Woho kyerɛ wɔ dɔ m';
Ana yennhyiaa W' dzin nwanwa n' mu?
Yɛtweɔn hɛn Wura wɔ hɛn finimfin,
Ogyaframee no na yɛtweɔn.

MHB 710
4 . Thou God that answerest by fire,
The Spirit of burning now impart;
And let the flames of pure desire
Rise from the altar of our heart.
	 ~ 	4 
. Nyame a edze ogya kasa,
Ma ogya a ɔdzɛw Sunsum mfir edzi,
Ma ɔpɛ krɔnkrɔn gyaframee
Mfi hɛn akoma afɔrmbukyia n' do.

MHB 710
5 . Truly our fellowship below
With Thee and with the Father is:
In Thee eternal life we know,
And heaven’s unutterable bliss.	 ~ 	5 
. Ampa, koryɛ a ofir Egya n'
Nam Wo do baa asaase do;
Onnyiewiei nkwa wɔ W' mu, na ma

MHB 711
1 . HOW pleasant, how divinely fair,
O Lord of Hosts, Thy dwellings are!
With strong desire my spirit faints
To meet  the assemblies of Thy saints.
	 ~ 	1 . O EWURADZE, Wo sor tsenabea
Ne fɛw, ne dɛw na no nwanwa a!
Me kra dzi aper tɔ bitsi
Dze hyia W'ahotsewfo kuw no.
Abɔsom ɔsom pa m' wɔ hɔ

MHB 711
2 . Blest are the saints that sit on high,
Around Thy throne of majesty;
Thy brightest glories shine above,
And all their work is praise and love.
	 ~ 	2 
. N-hyira nye ahotsewfo a 
Wotwa ahengua ho wɔ sorsor;
W'enyimnyam kɛse m' hyerɛn sor hɔ
Dze dɔ yi Wo ndwuma ayɛw.

MHB 711
3 . Blest are the souls that find a place
Within the temple of Thy grace;
Here they behold Thy gentler rays,
And seek Thy face, and learn Thy praise.
	 ~ 	3 
. N-hyira nye akra a wohu bea 'i
Wɔ W'adom asɔrfi yi mu;
Hɔ wohu Wo hyerɛn fɛɛfɛw no,
Hwehwɛ W'enyim, sua W'ayɛyi.

MHB 711
4 . Blest are the men whose hearts are set
To find the way to Zion’s gate;
God is their strength, and through the road
They lean upon their helper God.
	 ~ 	4 
. N-hyira nye hɔn a hɔn akoma
Hwehwɛ Zion abowano kwan;
Nyame nye hɔn ahoɔdzen pa,
No kwan do na wɔtwer No mboa.

MHB 711
5 . Cheerful they walk with growing strength,
Till all shall  meet in heaven at length.
Till all before Thy face appear,
And join in nobler worship there.	 ~ 	5 
. Wɔnam enyigye na ahoɔdzen m'
Kodu dɛ yebehyia ahenman m',
Kɛpem dɛ yebɛba W'enyim

MHB 712
1 . BLEST be the dear uniting love, 
That will not let us part; 
Our bodies may far off remove, 
We still are one in heart.
	 ~ 	1 . NHYIRA nyé ͻdͻ a ͻka hɛn bͻ m’,
Dza ͻmma yɛmmpaa mu n’,
Hɛn honandua fi hɛn ho mpo a,
Yɛyɛ kor wͻ akoma m’.
Nkwa anaa ’wu nntum mmpaa m’.

MHB 712
2 . Joined in one spirit to our Head,
Where he appoints we go; 
And still in Jesu’s footsteps tread, 
And show His praise below.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛnye Egya n’ yɛ sunsum kor
Yɛkͻ beebi a ͻkyérɛ,
Yetsiatsia Jesu N’anamͻn m’,
Kyerɛ N’enyimnyam wͻ ha.

MHB 712
3 . O may we ever walk in Him, 
And nothing know beside, 
Nothing desire, nothing esteem, 
But Jesus crucified!
	 ~ 	3 
. O ma yenye N’ nnantséw afebͻͻ
Dɛ yennyim hweeàra bio,
Yɛnndwendwen hwee, mmbu hwee, gyedɛ
Jesus Ne mbeamudua n’ nko.

MHB 712
4 . Closer and closer let us cleave
To His beloved embrace;
Expect His fullness to receive,
And grace to answer grace.
	 ~ 	4 
. Hom mma yɛntwe mboa ano yie
Wͻ N’abasa n’ ase;
Hɛn enyi nda N'emudzi kwan,
Adom ngu adom do.

MHB 712
5 . Partakers of the Saviour’s grace, 
The same in mind and heart, 
Nor joy, nor grief, nor time, nor place, 
Nor life, nor death can part.	 ~ 	5 
. Agyenkwa n’ N’adom m‘ kyɛfafo,
Adwen. akoma m’ koryɛ.
Edɛw na yaw, aber anaa bea.

MHB 713
1 . LET us join-’tis God commands-
Let us join our hearts and hands;
Help to gain our calling’s hope,
Build we each the other up:
Still forget the things behind,
Follow christ in heart and mind,
Toward the mark unwearied press,
Seize the crown of righteousness.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAMƐ hyɛ hɛn dɛ yɛmbͻ m’
Yɛnkà akoma na nsa mbͻ m’;
Yennya hɛn frɛ ho enyidar,
Yɛmboaboa hɛnho nkorkor;
Hɛn werɛ mfir dza etwa mu,
Mfa akomà, adwen ndzi Christ ekyir
Mper nko botae no ho pɛɛ
Nkɛfa nokwàr ahenkyɛw no.
Nyame, yemmbisa hwee bio.

MHB 713
2 . While we walk with God in light,
God our hearts doth still unite;
Dearest fellowship we prove,
Followship in Jesu’s love;
Sweetly each, with each combined,
In the bonds of duty joined,
Feels the cleansing blood applied,
Daily feels that Christ hath died.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛnye Nyame nam kan mu a,
Nyame ka hɛn akoma bͻ mu a;
Yɛyɛ anyɛnkofo pa,
Jesus dͻ mu anyɛnkofa:
Dɛw mu na yɛkà bͻ mu,
Na yɛdze dzi hɛn dwuma,
Yɛtse bͻgyà à ͻtsew hɛn ho m’,
Daa yɛtse dɛ Christ ewu.

MHB 713
3 . Still, O Lord. our faith increase,
Cleanse from all unrighteousness:
Thee the unholy cannot see;
Make, o make us meet for Thee!
Every vile affection kill,
Root out every seed of ill,
Utterly abolish sin,
Write Thy law of love to love within.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyame, hyɛ hɛn gyedzi dzen,
Hor hɛn ho dza ͻnntsen nyina m’;
Ͻwo nntum nnhwɛ dza ͻnntsen;
O ma yɛmfata mma Wo!
Ku akͻndͻbͻn biara,
Tu aba bͻn biarà ase,
Gu bͻn nyinà ase koraa,
Kyérɛw Wo dͻ mbra wͻ hɛn mu.

MHB 713
4 . Hence may all our actions flow,
 Love the proof that Christ we know;
Mutual love the token be,
Lord, that we belong to Thee :
Love, Thine image, Love imparts!
Stamp it on our face and heart !
Only love to us be given !
Lord, we ask no other heaven.	 ~ 	4 
. ’Fi ndɛ ma hɛn ndzeyɛɛ nyina
Nkyerɛ dͻ dɛ yenyim Christ;
Ma dͻ no nyɛ asɛnkyérɛdze.
Dɛ yɛyɛ Wodzé, Ewuradze:
Fa Wo dͻ suban n’ ma hɛn.
Tsim n‘wͻ hɛn enyim nà akoma m’!
Ma hɛn Wo dͻ no nkotoo!

MHB 714
1 . HE wants not friends that hath Thy love,
And may converse and walk with Thee,
And with Thy saints here and above,
With whom for ever I must be.
	 ~ 	1 . NYIA ɔwɔ Wo dɔ no nnhia ndamfo,
Ɔnye Wo nantsew dzi nkɔmbɔ;
Menye W'ahotsewfo nyina
Bɔbɔ awɛ sesei na daa.
Woana bɛtsew me efi W' dɔ ho?

MHB 714
2 . In the communion of the saints
Is wisdom, safety, and delight;
And when my heart declines and faints,
It’s raised by their heat and light!
	 ~ 	2 
. Ahotsewfo nkitahodzi m'
Wɔ nyansa, 'tsidaa na enyigye;
M'akoma yɛ mberɛw, motɔ bahaw a,
Hɔn hyew na kan wɔma mo do.

MHB 714
3 . As for my friends, they are not lost;
The several vessels of Thy fleet,
Though parted now, by tempests tost,
Shall safely in the haven meet.
	 ~ 	3 
. M'ayɛnkofo dze, wɔnnyewee;
W'ahɛn a ɔdɔɔ so pii no,
Sɛ ehum bɔ hɔn petse mpo a,
Wobehyia m' sɔkyee berano.

MHB 714
4 . Still we are centred all in Thee,
Members, though distant, of one Head;
In the same family we be,
By the same faith and spirit led.
	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn nyina da ho ara tse Wo mu,
Yɛapetse mpo a, yɛyɛ Wodze,
Yɛwɔ ebusua noara mu,
Gyedzi, Sunsum kor kyerɛ hɛn kwan.

MHB 714
5 . Before Thy throne we daily meet,
As joint petitioners to Thee;
In spirit we each other greet,
And shall again each other see.
	 ~ 	5 
. W'ahengua enyim na daa yehia,
Na yɛbɔ m' totɔ serɛ Wo;
Yekyiakyia hɛnho sunsum mu,
Yebohu hɛnho nkorkor bio.

MHB 714
6 . The heavenly hosts, world without end,
Shall be my company above;
And Thou, my best and surest Friend,
Who shall divide me from Thy love?	 ~ 	6 
. Ɔsor dɔm no nyina bɛyɛ 
M'aanyɛnkofo daa daa nyina,
Na Ɔwo me Nyɛnko mapa;

MHB 715
1 . FOR the might of Thine arm we bless Thee, 
       our God, our Father’s God.
Thou hast kept Thy pilgrim people by the 
      strength of Thy staff and rod:
Thou hast called us to the journey which
      faithless feet ne’er trod;
For the might of Thine arm we bless 
      Thee our God, our father’s God.
	 ~ 	1 . W'ABASA dzen ntsi yehyira Wo, hɛn egyanom Nyame;
Ɔwo dze Wo poma na W'abaa abɔ 
W'akwantufo ho ban;
Ɔwo afrɛ hɛn akɔ kwan a ekyingyefo enntu da ho;
W'abasa dzen ntsi yehyira Wo, hɛn egyanom Nyame.
W'abasa dzen ntsi yehyira Wo, hɛn egyanom Nyame.

MHB 715
2 . For the love of Christ constraining, 
       that bound their hearts as one;
For the faith in truth and freedom in 
       which their work was done;
For the peace of God’s evangel
       wherewith their feet were shod;
For the might of Thine arm we bless 
      Thee our God, our father’s God.
	 ~ 	2 
. Christ No dɔ a osiw kwan, ka akoma bɔ mu no ntsi,
Nokwar gyedzi na fahodzi a wɔdze yɛɛ hɔn edwuma ntsi,
Nyankopɔn Nsɛmpa n'asomdwee a wɔdze nantsewee ntsi,
W'abasa dzen ntsi yehyira Wo, hɛn egyanom Nyame.

MHB 715
3 . We are watchers of a beacon
        whose light must never die;
We are guardians of an altar
       that shows Thee ever nigh;
We are children of Thy freedom
       who sleep beneath the sod;
For the might of Thine arm we bless Thee, 
       our God, Our father’s God.
	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛyɛ kandzea bi a onndum da ho aweɔmfo mapa;
Yɛyɛ afɔrmbukyia ho ahwɛdofo a ebɛn hɛn;
Yɛyɛ Wo fahodzi mba a yɛdeda famu;
W'abasa dzen ntsi yehyira Wo, hɛn egyanom Nyame.

MHB 715
4 . May the shadow of Thy presence
       around our camp be spread;
Baptize us with the courage Thou
       gavest to our dead;
O keep us in the pathway their
       saintly feet have trod;
For the might of Thine arm we
       bless Thee our God, our father’s God.	 ~ 	4 
. Ma W'enyim no sunsuma no ntwa hɛn mpasuar no ho nyia;
Fa akokodur a edze maa ewuakɔr no bɔ hɛn esu;
O fa hɛn dua kwan a W'ahotsewfo duaa mu no mu;

MHB 716
1 . THOU God of truth and love,
We seek Thy perfect way,
Ready Thy choice to approve,
Thy providence to obey:
Enter into Thy wise design,
And sweetly lose our will in Thine.
	 ~ 	1 . NOKWAR na dͻ Nyame,
Yɛhwehwɛ W’akwan pa;
Yɛgye Wo pɛ to mu,
Yɛyɛ setsie ma Wo:
Bɛhɛn Wo nyansaa kwan no mu,
Yengyaa hɛn pɛ mma Wo dɛw mu.
Fa hɛn kͻ hɛn Pomfo No bo m’.

MHB 716
2 . Why hast Thou cast our lot
In the same age and place,
And why together brought
To see each other’s face;
To join with loving sympathy,
And mix our friendly souls in Thee ?
	 ~ 	2 
. ’Bɛn ntsi na edze hɛn
Aba ha ber yi mu?
’Bɛn ntsi na ’dze hɛn aba
Dɛ yenhu hɛn enyim?
Yɛdze dͻ na tsema ka bͻ m’
Ma yaabͻ mu kor wͻ Wo mu?

MHB 716
3 . Didst Thou not make us one,
That we might one remain,
Together travel on,
And bear each other’s pain;
Till all Thy utmost goodness prove,
And rise renewed in perfect love?
	 ~ 	3 
. Ana annyɛ hɛn kor,
Dɛ yɛmbͻ mu kor daa,
Yaabͻ mu anantsew,
Yaatsé obiara ne yaw;
Ama yeehu Wo papayɛ,
Na yaasoɛr ͻdͻ emudzi mu?

MHB 716
4 . Then let us ever bear
The blessed end in view,
And join, with mutual care,
To fight our passage through;
And kindly help each other on,
Till all receive the starry crown.
	 ~ 	4 
. Dɛm a horn mma hɛn enyi ‘
Ntsim siar ewiei no do,
Na yɛmbͻ mu yɛmper,
Yɛnko nkͻ hɛn enyim;
Yɛmfa ayamuyie mboa hɛnho,
Dɛ yebenyà ahenkyɛw hyɛnhyɛnn n’.

MHB 716
5 . O may Thy Spirit seal
Our souls unto that day,
With all Thy fullness fill,
And then transport away:
Away to our eternal rest,
Away to our Redeemer’s breast.    Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. O ma Wo Sunsum nsͻw
Hɛn akra ano da no,
Fa W’amayɛ dom hɛn,
Na fa hɛn fi ha kͻ
Hɛn onnyiewie ahomgye mu,

MHB 717
1 . HELP  us to help each other, Lord,
Each other’s cross to bear,
Let each his friendly aid afford,
and feel his brother’s care.
	 ~ 	1 . O EWURADZE, boa hɛn ma
Yɛmboa hɛnho nkorkor;
Ma obiara mboa ne nyɛnko,
Yennya tsema mma hɛnho.
Eedzi dɛw wɔ heaven.

MHB 717
2 . Help us to build each other up,
 Our little stock improve;
Increase our faith, confirm our hope,
And perfect us in love.
	 ~ 	2 
. Boa hɛn ma yɛmboa hɛn mfɛfo,
Kakra a yɛwɔ nyɛ yie;
Gyedzi na enyidar nsi pi,
Yendzi mu wɔ dɔ mu.

MHB 717
3 . Up into Thee, our living Head,
Let us in all things grow,
Till Thou hast made us free indeed,
And spotless here below.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hɛn Wura tseasefo, ma yɛmbɛn W',
Adze nyina m' yennyin,
Nkɛpem dɛ asan hɛn ho koraa,
Ma nkekaa nnyi hɛn ho.

MHB 717
4 . Then, when the mighty work is wrought,
Receive Thy ready bride; 
Give Us in heaven a happy lot 
With all the sanctified.    Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Na edwumason bɔ adze a,
Fa W'ayefor kɔ fie;
Ma yɛnye ahotsewfo nyina

MHB 718
1 . JESUS, we look to thee,
Thy promised presence claim; 
Thou in the midst of us shalt be,
Assembled in thy name.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, yehwɛ Woara,
Yɛgye W’anohoba n’;
Ͻwo bɛba hɛn finimfin,
Sɛ yehyia Wo dzin mu a.
Enyidar dͻ mapa m’. Amen.

MHB 718
2 . Thy name salvation is,
Which here we come to prove;
Thy name is life and health and peace
And everlasting love.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛrébɛgyé ato m’ wͻ ha
Dɛ Wo dzin yɛ nkwagye;
Wo dzin yɛ nkwa na asomdwee,
Ͻyɛ onnyiewiei dͻ.

MHB 718
3 . We meet, the grace to take
Which thou hast freely given;
We meet on earth for thy dear sake,
That we may meet in heaven.
	 ~ 	3 
. Yehyia gye adom a 
Ͻwo dzé ama hɛn kwa n’;
Wo ntsi na yehyia mu ase ha,
Ama yeehyia heaven.

MHB 718
4 . Present we know thou art,	
But O thyself reveal!
Now, Lord, let every bounding heart
The mighty comfort feel.
	 ~ 	4 
. Yenyim dɛ ewͻ ha,
O yi Woho edzi kyérɛ!
Afei, Ewuradze, ma akoma
Biara nnya awérɛkyekyer.

MHB 718
5 . O may thy quickening voice
The death of sin remove;
And bid our inmost souls rejoice
In hope of perfect love !       Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Ma Wo ndzé a okenyan n’
Nyi owu n’ bͻn mfi hͻ nkͻ;
Na ma hɛn akra enyi ngye

MHB 719
1 . SEE, Jesu, Thy disciples see,
The promised blessing give;
Met in Thy name, we look to Thee,
Expecting to receive.
	 ~ 	1 . HWԐ Jesu, hwɛ W’esuafo no,
Pon W’anohoba no;
Yeehyia Wo dzin m’ rohwɛ Wo kwan,
Ma Wo nhyira no mbra.
Emi a muwui maa wo!

MHB 719
2 . Thee we expect, our faithful Lord,
Who in Thy name are joined;
We wait, according to Thy word,
Thee in the midst to find.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛtweͻn W’, Ewuradze nokwafo,
Yɛbͻ m’ kor wͻ Wo dzin m';
Yɛtweͻ, dɛ mbrɛ W’asɛm no tse n’,
Dɛ yebohu W’ hɛn ntamu.

MHB 719
3 . With us Thou art assembled here;
But O Thyself reveal!
Son of the living God, appear!
Let us Thy presence feel.
	 ~ 	3 
. Enye hɛn ehyia mu wͻ ha;
Ewuradze, yi W’ho kyérɛ!
Tseasefo Nyame Ba, pue ha!
Ma yɛntse W’ nka wͻ ha.

MHB 719
4 . Whom now we seek, O may we meet!
Jesus, the crucified,
Show us Thy bleeding hands and feet,
Thou who for us hast died.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma yenhu Nyia yehwehwɛ no!
Jesus a wokum Wo,
Fa Wo nsa, W’anan m’ bͻgya n’ kyérɛ,
Ͻwo a hɛn ntsi iwui.

MHB 719
5 . Cause us the record to receive,
Speak, and the tokens show-
O be not faithless, but believe
In Me, who died for you !	 ~ 	5 
. Ma hɛn nsa nka kyerɛwsɛm no,
Kasa na kyérɛ biribi;
Mma nnye okyingyefo, gye Me dzi,

MHB 72
1 . BEGIN, my soul, some heavenly theme; 
 Awake, my voice, and sing 
 The mighty works, or mightier name, 
 Of our eternal King.
 	 ~ 	1 . ME kra, hyɛ ɔsor ndwom bi ase;
Me ndze, nyan na tow ndwom,
Hɛn domankoma Hen n' ndwuma akɛse, 
Ne dzin kɛse ho ndwom.

MHB 72
2 . Tell of His wondrous faithfulness, 
 And sound His power abroad; 
 Sing the sweet promise of His grace, 
 The quickening word of God.
	 ~ 	2 . Ka No nokwar nwanwa n' ho asɛm, 
Na ma No tum ntahye;
Tow N'adom anohoba ho ndwom,
Nyame nkenyan asɛm n'.

MHB 72
3 . Proclaim salvation from the Lord, 
 For wretched, dying men: 
 His hand hath writ the sacred word 
 With an immortal pen. 
	 ~ 	3 . Bɔ Ewuradze nkwagye n' dawur
Ma akɔhweaban a woruwu:
Ɔdze akyerɛw dze dua a ɔnnsɛɛ da, 
Akyerɛw asɛm krɔnkrɔn n'.

MHB 72
4 . Engraved as in eternal brass, 
 The mighty promise shines; 
 Nor can the powers of darkness rase 
 Those everlasting lifes.
	 ~ 	4 . N'anohoba kɛse n' hyerɛn 
Dɛ ɔwɔ ayewa do;
na sum m' 'tumfo nnkotum apepa
Akyerɛw a ɔwɔ hɔ daa n'.

MHB 72
5 . His every word of grace is strong 
 As that which built the skies 
 The voice that rolls the stars along 
 Speaks all the promises.
	 ~ 	5 . N'adom asɛm biara yɛ dzen
Tse dɛ dza ɔdze bɔɔ sor;
N-dze a ɔdandan nworaba no,
Ka anohaba nsɛm nyina.

MHB 72
6 . Now shall my fainting heart rejoice 
 To know Thy favour sure: 
 I trust the all-creating voice, 
 And faith desires no more.	 ~ 	6 . M'akoma a atɔ bahaw dze dɛw
Hu dɛ W'adom tsim hɔ;
Motwer ndze a ɔbɔɔ adze nyina,
Na onnhia gyedzi bio.

MHB 720
1 . CHRIST from whom all blessings flow,
Perfecting the saints below,
Hear us, who Thy nature share,
Who Thy mystic body are.
	 ~ 	1 . Christ a nhyira nyina fir Wo, 
Ema ahosewfo dzi mu,
Tsie hɛn a Wo su sɛ hɛn,
Yɛyɛ Wo honam nwanwa n'.
Christ yɛ adze nyinam' adze nyina.

MHB 720
2 . Join us, in one spirit join,
Let us still receive of Thine;
Still for more on Thee we call,
Thou who fillest all in all
	 ~ 	2 
. Ka hɛn ho wɔ sunsum korm', 
Ma yɛnda ho nya Wodze n';
Yɛba bebisa mbordo,
Ɔwo a ehyɛ adze nyina ma.

MHB 720
3 . Move and actuate, and guide:
Divers gifts to each divide;
Placed according to Thy will,
Let us all our work fulfill;
	 ~ 	3 
. Kenyan, nunu na gya hɛn  
Kyɛn ankorankor akyɛdze,
Wɔahyehyɛ n' dɛ mbrɛ epɛ,
Ma hɛn ndwuma nyina nhyɛ ma.

MHB 720
4 . Sweetly may we all agree,
Touched with loving sympathy:
Kindly for each other care;
Every member feel its share.
	 ~ 	4 
. Dɛw mu ara yɛnyɛ kor 
Yennya tsema mma hɛnto:
Na yɛmboa hɛnho nkorkor;
Obiara nyɛ n'afamudze.

MHB 720
5 . Love like death, hath all destroyed,
Rendered all distinctions void; 
Names and sects, and parties fall:
Thou, O Christ, art all in all.	 ~ 	5  
. Ɔdɔ tse dɛ wu, ɔasɛɛ 
Mpaapaamu na adehyesɛm nyina
Edzin, ekuw nyina gu

MHB 721
1 . JESUS, united by Thy grace
And each to each endeared,
With confidence we seek Thy face,
And know our prayer is heard.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, W'adom no ka hɛn bɔ m'
Na yɛdodɔ hɛnho a,
Yɛdze awerɛhyɛm' hwehwɛ W'enyim,
Yenyim dɛ itsie hɛn asɔr.
O ma yɛnsɔr dɛm daa.   Amen.

MHB 721
2 . Still let us own our common Lord,
And bear Thine easy yoke,
A band of love, a threefold cord,
Which never can be broke.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma yɛnda ho nnya hɛn Nyame,
Yɛnsoa W' kɔndua haahar n',
Ɔdɔ ahoma mbɔho ebisa a 
Wonnkotum atsew mu.

MHB 721
3 . Make us into one spirit drink;
Baptize into Thy name;
And let us always kindly think
And sweetly speak, the same. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma yɛnnom nkɔ sunsum kor mu;
Bɔ hɛn esu wɔ Wo dzin m';
Na daa yɛndwen ahobrɛadze m',
Na dua dɛw mu kasa.

MHB 721
4 . Touched by the loadstone of Thy love,
Let all our hearts agree,
And ever towards each other move,
And ever move towards Thee.
	 ~ 	4 
. Wo dɔ a ɔtwetwe hɛn bɛn Wo n'
Ma yenya akoma kor;
Ma daa yɛntwetwe mbɛn hɛnho,
Na yɛntwe mbɛn Wo daa.

MHB 721
5 . To Thee, inseparably joined,
Let all our spirits cleave;
O may we all the loving mind
That was in Thee receive.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ka hɛn sunsum nyina fam Wo ho,
Mma mpaapaamu mmba da;
O ma hɛn nyina nnya Wo mu
Ɔdɔ ho adwen no daa.

MHB 721
6 . This is the bond of perfectness,
Thy spotless charity;
O let us still we pray possess
The mind that was in Thee.    Amen.
	 ~ 	6 
. Iyi nye nkabɔm' pa a ho tsew,
W'adɔyɛ a fi nnyi ho;
Ma yennya adwen a ɔwɔ Wo mu n',

MHB 722
1 . LIFT up your hearts to things above,
Ye followers of the Lamb,
And join with us to praise His love,
And glorify His name.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM mfa akoma ngyina sor ndzɛmba do,
’Guambaa N’akadofo,
Hom nsuo m’ ma yɛntonton No dͻ,
Yɛnhyɛ Ne dzin enyimnyam.
Kͻ do; yebehyia m’ hͻ.

MHB 722
2 . To Jesu’s name give thanks and sing,
Whose mercies never end:
Rejoice! rejoice! The Lord is king;
The King is now our friend!
	 ~ 	2 
. Hom ntow ndwom, ndaase m’ mma Ne dzin,
Ͻno a N’adom mmbͻ adze:
Dzi dɛw! Dzi dɛw! ‘Wuradze yɛ ͻhen;
Ͻhen n’ yɛ hɛn Nyɛnko!

MHB 722
3 . We, for His sake, count all things loss;
On earthly good look down;
And joyfully sustain the cross,
Till we receive the crown.
	 ~ 	3 
. ’No ntsi biribiara yɛ ahwerdze;
Yemmbu wiadze ’i mu hwee.
Yɛsoa mbeamudua no wͻ enyigye m’ ,
Gyedɛ yeenya ahenkyɛw n’.

MHB 722
4 . O let us stir each other up,
Our faith by works to approve,
By holy, purifying hope,
And the sweet task of love.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma yenkenyan hɛnho nkorkor,
Hɛn ndwuma nkyérɛ hɛn gyedzi,
Yendua krͻnkrͻn enyidado m’,
Nà ͻdͻ dɛɛdɛw ndwuma do.

MHB 722
5 . You on our minds we ever bear,
Whoe’er to Jesus bow;
Stretch out the arms of faith and prayer,
And lo, we reach you now.
	 ~ 	5 
. Yɛkͻ do dwen wo ho daa daa,
Ͻwo a ekotow Jesus;
Tsérɛw wo gyedzi na mpaabͻ abaw m’,
Na hwɛ, yɛabɛn w’ sesei.

MHB 722
6 . Mercy and peace your portion be,
To carnal minds unknown,
The hidden manna, and the tree
Of life, and the white stone.
	 ~ 	6 
. Wodze nyɛ ehumbͻbͻr, asomdwee,
Ondu adwen nyina mu,
Mannà a wͻdzé esuma na nkwa dua n’,
Ͻnyé ͻbo fitaa no.

MHB 722
7 . The blessings all on you be shed,
Which God in Christ imparts;
We pray the Spirit of our Head
Into your faithful hearts.
	 ~ 	7 
. Wͻmfa nhyira nyina mma wo,
Dza Nyame na Christ ma;
Yɛsérɛ dɛ hen Hen No Sunsum
Mbra akoma nokwafo m’.

MHB 722
8 . Live till the Lord in glory come,
And wait His heaven to share:
Our Saviour now prepares our home:
Go on; we’ll meet you there.	 ~ 	8 
. Tweͻn dɛ Ewuradze bɛbà enyimnyam m’.
Tweͻn nya heaven m’ kyɛfa;
Hɛn Pomfo n’ risiesie hɛn fie:

MHB 723
1 . O GOD of our forefathers, hear,
And make Thy faithful mercies known;
To Thee through Jesus we draw near,
Thy suffering, well beloved Son,
In whom Thy smiling face we see,
In whom Thou art well-pleased with me.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN tsetse egyanom Nyame, tsie,
Ma yenhu W' nokwar ehumbɔbɔr n',
Yɛnam Jesus No mu bɛn Wo,
Wo Dɔba a oruhu amandze n',
No m' na yehu W'enyim fɛɛfɛw n',
No mu na menam sɔ W'enyi.
W'ahenman mbra akoma biara m'.  Amen.

MHB 723
2 . With solemn faith we offer up,
And spread before Thy glorious eyes,
That only ground of all our hope,
That precious, bleeding sacrifice,
Which brings Thy grace on sinners down,
And perfects all our souls in one.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛdze awɔse gyedzi bɔ afɔr,
Yɛma do kyerɛ W'enyimnyam n',
Hɛn enyidar nyina n' kutuwdo - bo n',
Bɔgyahue afɔrbɔ a ɔsom bo n',
Ɔdze W'adom brɛ abɔn wɔ ase,
Ɔma hɛn akra nyina bɔ m' dzi mu.

MHB 723
3 . Acceptance through His only name,
Forgiveness in His blood, we have;
But more abundant life we claim
Through Him who died our souls to save,
To sanctify us by His blood,
And fill with all the life of God.
	 ~ 	3 
. Wɔnam Ne dzin m' nko gye hɛn to m',
No bɔgyaa m' yenya bɔnfakyɛ,
Yɛnam No do bisa nkwa pa,
Ɔno a owui dze gyee hɛn akra,
Ɔdze No bɔgyaa tseew hɛn ho,
Na ɔdze Nyame bra hyɛ hɛn ma.

MHB 723
4 . Father, behold Thy dying Son,
And hear the blood that speaks above;
On us let all Thy grace be shown,
Peace, righteousness, and joy, and love,
Thy kingdom come to every heart,
And all Thou hast, and all Thou art.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Egya, hwɛ Wo Ba a oruwu n',
Na tsie bɔgya a ɔkasa sor n';
Na ma W'adom nyin mbra hɛn do;
Asomdwee, tsenenee, dɛw na dɔ,
Dza ewɔ nyina, na mbrɛ etsie biara,

MHB 724
1 . JESUS, Lord of life and glory,
Bend from heaven Thy gracious ear;
While our waiting souls adore Thee,
Friend of helpless sinners, hear:
            By Thy mercy, 
    O deliver us, good Lord!
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, nkwa nà enyimnyam Wura,
Brɛ W’adom aso n’ edze daa,
Bér a hɛn akra rotweͻn asͻr Wo ’i,
Abͻnfo adamfo, tsie hɛn:
      Ewuradze pa,
      Fa W’ehumbͻbor gye hɛn!
Mfa W’ nyɛ enyidar na tsénabea.

MHB 724
2 . From the depths of nature’s blindness,
From the hardening power of sin,
From all malice and unkindness,
From the pride that lurks within:
	 ~ 	2 
. Fi wiadze enyifura bͻn n’ mu,
Fi bͻn a epirim no tum mu,
Fi ewurkadze na etsiͻdzen mu,
Fi akoma m’ ahokyérɛ mu:

MHB 724
3 . When temptation sorely presses,
In the day of Satan’s power,
In our times of deep distresses,
In each dark and trying hour:
	 ~ 	3 
. Bér a nsͻhwɛ mu ayɛ dzen no,
Ma Abͻnsam kyérɛ no tum no,
Wͻ hɛn ahohia ber no mu,
Dͻnhwér a ͻyɛ sum, yɛ dzen mu:

MHB 724
4 . When the world around is smiling,
In the time of wealth and ease,
Earthly joys our hearts beguiling,
In the day of health and peace:
	 ~ 	4 
. Bér a wiadze nyina resérew no,
Ahonya na asetséna pa m’,
Hɛn akoma twe bɛn wiadze dɛw n’,
Wͻ ahoͻdzen na asomdwee da m’:

MHB 724
5 . In the weary hours of sickness,
In the times of grief and pain,
When we feel our mortal weakness,
When all human help is vain:
	 ~ 	5 
. Yarba dͻnhwér a ͻyɛ bérɛ mu,
Ͻhaw na ͻyaw ber mu,
Ber a yɛtse honam mberɛwyɛ,
Ber a abͻdze mboa yɛ kwa n’:

MHB 724
6 . In the solemn hour of dying,
In the aweful judgement day,
May our souls, on Thee relying,
Find thee still our Rock and stay	 ~ 	6 
. Owu dͻnhwer mu kommyɛ mu n’,
Atsɛmbu da huuhu mu n’.
Ma hɛn akra, bér a wͻtwer Wo no,

MHB 725
1 . LORD, in this Thy mercy’s day,
Ere it pass for aye  away,
Humbly at Thy feet we pray.
	 ~ 	1 . HԐN Wura, W'ehumbͻbͻr da  ‘i,
Ansaanà obotwa m’ akͻ n’,
Yɛhwe W’anànadze sͻr Wo.
Dom hɛn W'atsaban ase tséna.

MHB 725
2 . Holy Jesu, grant us tears,
Fill us with heart-searching fears,
Ere that awful doom appears.
	 ~ 	2 
. Jesus krͻnn, pa hɛn nyinsu,
Fa akoma m' suro hyɛ hɛn mà:
Ansaana da huuhu n’ aba.

MHB 725
3 . Lord, on us Thy Spirit pour,
Kneeling lowly at Thy door,
Ere it close for evermore.
	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛkotow W'abow ekyir yi,
Hue Wo Sunsum gu hɛn do,
Ansaana atow m’ afehͻͻ.

MHB 725
4 . By Thy night of agony,
By Thy supplicating cry,
By Thy willingness to die,
	 ~ 	4 
. W’ahoyera anago n'.
Wo nkotͻserɛ su no ntsi.
Dɛ epɛ dɛ ’bowu n’ ntsi.

MHB 725
5 . By Thy tears of bitter woe
For Jerusalem below,
Let us not Thy love forgo.
	 ~ 	5 
. Wo nyinsu wenwen a ikyii
Maa Jerusalem ha n’ ntsi,
Mma mma Wo dͻ no mmbͻ hɛn.

MHB 725
6 . Jugde and Saviour of our race,
When we see Thee face to face,
Grant usneath Thy wings a place.  Amen. 	 ~ 	6 
. Hɛn Tsɛmbuafo na Gyefo,
Yehu W' enyim na enyim a,

MHB 726
1 . SAVIOUR, when in dust to Thee
Low we bow the adoring knee;
