When, repentant, to the skies
Scarce we lift our weeping eyes:
O by all Thy pains and woe
Suffered once for man below,
Bending from Thy throne on high,
Hear our solemn litany. 
	 ~ 	1 . GYEFO, wɔ huntuma mu na
Yɛdze nkotoserɛ sɔr Wo;
Ber a nnuhofo yenntum mma
Hɛn nyinsuwa enyi nnhwɛ sor;
O yaw na mbusu a edze
Hun amandze maa nyimpa ntsi,
Bɔ W' mu adze fi ahengua enyim,
Tsie hɛn mbɔbɔr nkotɔserɛ.
Wɔ hɛn mbɔbɔr nkotɔserɛ m'

MHB 726
2 . By Thy helpless infant years;
By Thy life of want and tears;
By Thy fasting and distress
In the savage wilderness,
By the dread mysterious hour
Of the insulting  tempter’s power:
Turn, O turn a favouring eye,
Hear our solemn litany.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wo mbofraber m' botooyɛ,
Wo hia na nyinsu bra ntsi,
W'ahokyer yaayaw nda no,
Wo mbusu sar no do ntsi,
Osian dɔnhwer huuhu no a
Satan sɔɔ W' hwɛ wɔ mu n' ntsi,
Dan, O dan W'adɔe enyi n',
Tsie hɛn mbɔbɔr nkotɔserɛ.

MHB 726
3 . By the sacred grief that wept
O’er the grave where Lazarus slept,
By the gracious tears that flowed
Over Salem’s loved abode;
By the mournful word that told
Treachery lurked within Thy fold,
From Thy seat above the sky,
Hear our solemn litany.
	 ~ 	3 
. Yaw krɔnkrɔn a 'dze kyii nyinsu
Wɔ Lazarus ne nda do ntsi,
Nkuranhyɛ nyinsu a ɔpemee
Guu Salem do tsenabea n',
Adwembɔn a osii W' nkorɔfo ntamu
Ma hɔn enyim towee ntsi,
Fi Wo sor tsenabea hɔ 
Tsie hɛn mbɔbɔr nkotɔserɛ.

MHB 726
4 . By Thine hour of dire despair,
By Thine agony of prayer,
By the cross, the nail, the  thorn,
Piercing spear and torturing scorn;
By the gloom that veiled the skies
O’er the dreadful sacrifice:
Listen to our humble cry,
Hear our solemn litany.
	 ~ 	4 
. W'abawpa dɔnhwer no ntsi,
Na W'ahoguan mpaabɔ ntsi,
Mbeamudua, mprɛgow na nsoɛ n' ntsi,
Peaa ne yaw na enyimtsiabu,
Sum kebii a ɔhyɛɛ no ntsi,
W'afɔrbɔ huuhu no ntsi
Tsie hɛn mbrɛhoadze sufrɛ,
Tsie hɛn mbɔbɔr nkotserɛ.

MHB 726
5 . By thy deep expiring groan,
By the sealed sepulchral stone,
By the vault whose dark abode
Held in vain the rising God:
O from earth to heaven restored,
Mighty God, re-ascended Lord,
Listen, listen to the cry
Of our solemn litany.    Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Pen dzendzen a ɔdze W' kɔr wu m',
Ɔbo adakamaa no ntsi,
Samanadze sunkamm a oenntum
Enndzi Nyame a ɔsoɛree do n';
O Nyame Tumfo a wɔdze W'
Fi asaase do asan kɔ sor,
Ewuradze, tsie, tsie hɛn su

MHB 727
1 . JESUS, with Thy Church abide,
Be her Savior, Lord, and Guide,
While on earth her faith is tried:
We beseech Thee, hear us.
	 ~ 	1 . Jesus, 'nye W' Asɔr ntsena, 
Yɛ n' Agyenkwa, Wura, Gyafo;
Wɔrosɔ ne gyedzi ahwɛ n',
Yɛserɛ Wo, tsie hɛn.
Yɛserɛ Wo, tsie hɛn.    Amen.

MHB 727
2 . Keep her life and doctrine pure:
Grant her, patient, to endure,
Trusting in Thy promise sure:
We beseech Thee, hear us.
	 ~ 	2  
. Tsew ne bra na nkyerɛkyerɛ ho; 
Dom n' abotar ma ɔnsɔw
Na ɔntwer W' anohoba n',
Yɛserɛ Wo, tsie hɛn.

MHB 727
3 . May her voice be ever clear,
Warning of a judgment near,
Telling of a Savior dear:
We beseech Thee, hear us.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma ne ndze nyɛ wansa daa; 
Ɔmbɔ nkaa wɔ atsɛmbu ho;
Ɔnka Agyenkwa pa ho nsɛm,
Yɛserɛ Wo, tsie hɛn.

MHB 727
4 . All her fettered powers release;
Bid our strife and envy cease;
Grant the heavenly gift of peace:
We beseech Thee, hear us.
	 ~ 	4 
. Tsetsew ne nkyehoma mu; 
Tseam ma ko na 'nyiber ngyaa;
Dom no ɔsor asomdwee n',
Yɛserɛ Wo, tsie hɛn.

MHB 727
5 . May she guide the poor and blind,
Seek the lost until she find,
And the broken-hearted bind:
We beseech Thee, hear us.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ongya ehiafo na efurafo, 
Nda ho nhwehwɛ dza ayew n',
Ɔnkyekyer 'koma bobɔe,
Yɛserɛ Wo, tsie hɛn.

MHB 727
6 . May her lamp of truth be bright;
Bid hear bear aloft its light
Through the realms of heathen night:
We beseech Thee, hear us.
	 ~ 	6 
. No nokwar kanea n' nhyerɛn; 
Ɔmma ne kan n' do wɔ sor
Wɔ abosom-man sum mu.
Yɛserɛ Wo, tsie hɛn.

MHB 727
7 . May she holy triumphs win,
Overthrow the hosts of sin,
Gather all the nations in:
We beseech Thee, hear us.   Amen.	 ~ 	7 
. Ma ne nyimdzi nyɛ krɔnkrɔn; 
Ɔnka bɔn no dɔm nyina ngu;
Ɔmboa aman nyina ngu;

MHB 728
1 . O GOD of mercy, God of might,
In love and pity infinite,
Teach us, as ever in Thy sight,
To live our life to Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . MBƆBƆRHUFO, Nyame Tumfo!
Wo dɔ na tsema nnyi ewiei!
Kyerɛkyerɛ hɛn wɔ W'enyim daa ma
Yɛmbɔ hɛn bra mma Wo.
Behyia m' wɔ sor ahenman m'.  Amen

MHB 728
2 . And Thou Who cam’st  on earth to die,
That fallen man might live thereby,
O hear us, for to Thee we cry
In hope, O Lord, to Thee.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔwo a 'bowuu wɔ asaase 'i do
Ma nyimpa aafa do enya nkwa,
O tsie hɛn, 'Wo na yesu frɛ W'
Enyidado m', Nyame.

MHB 728
3 . Teach us the lesson Thou hast taught,
To feel for those Thy blood hath bought;
That every word and deed and thought
May work a work for Thee.
	 ~ 	3 
. Kyerɛkyerɛ hɛn Wo nkyerɛkyerɛsɛm no,
Yɛntse mma hɔn a W' bɔgyaa atɔ hɔn,
Ma asɛm, ndzeyɛɛ, adwen biara
Aayɛ edwuma ama Wo.

MHB 728
4 . For all are brethren, far and wide,
Since Thou, O Lord, for all hast died:
Then teach us, whatsoe’er betide,
To love them all in Thee.
	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn nyina yɛ enuanom wɔ wiadze,
Dɛ Ɔwo iwuu maa hɛn ntsi;
Kyerɛ hɛn, mbrɛ ɔtse biara,
Ma yɛndɔ hɔn Wo mu.

MHB 728
5 . In sickness, sorrow, want, or care,
Whate’er it be, ’tis ours to share;
May we, when help is needed, there
Give help as unto Thee.
	 ~ 	5 
. Yarba m', yaw mu, ohia m', dadwen m',
Mbrɛ ɔtse biara, ɔyɛ hɛndze;
Ma yɛmboa bea a wohia mboa no,
Dɛ yɛdze rema Wo.

MHB 728
6 . And may Thy Holy Spirit move
All those who live, to live in love,
Till Thou shalt greet in Heaven above
All those who live to Thee.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Na ma Wo Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn no
Nka hɔn a wɔtsena dɔ mu nyina,
Kodu dɛ hɔn a wɔtse Wo mu

MHB 729
1 . LORD of our life, and God of our salvation,
Star of our night, and Hope of every nation,
Hear and receive Thy church’s supplication,
           Lord God Almighty.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN Wura, nye hɛn nkwagyefo Nyankopɔn,
Hɛn anago woraba nye aman enyidar,
Tsie na gye W'asɔr hɔn mbɔbɔr nkotɔserɛ,
Ewuradze Tumfo.
Wo heaven asomdee. Amen.

MHB 729
2 . See round Thine ark the hungry billows curling;
See how Thy foes their banners are unfurling;
Lord, while their darts envenomed they are hurling,
             Thou canst preserve us.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hwɛ ehum dzendzen a otwa
W'Ahyɛm'-daka n' ho,
Hwɛ mbrɛ W'atamfo si tserɛw hɔn frankaa mu;
Ewuradze, ber a wɔtow hɔn bɔwema n',
'Botum akora hɛn.

MHB 729
3 . Lord, Thou canst help when earthly armor faileth;
Lord, Thou canst save when sin itself assaileth;
Lord, o’er Thy rock nor death nor hell prevaileth;
              Grant us Thy peace, Lord.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyame, wiadze akodze sa a, 'botum aboa;
Nyame, bɔn ruku hɛn a, 'botum agye nkwa;
Nyame, Wo botan do, 'wu anaa hɛll nnyi tum;
Dom hɛn W'asomdwee.

MHB 729
4 . Grant us Thy help till backward they are driven;
Grant them Thy truth, that they may be forgiven;
Grant peace on earth, or after we have striven,
                Peace in Thy heaven.      Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Dom hɛn Wo mboa ma atamfo nsan hɔn ekyir,
Dom hɔn Wo nokwar ama wɔdze aakyɛ hɔn;
Ma asaase asomdwee, na hɛn aperdzi ekyir no,

MHB 73
1 . MY God, how wonderful Thou art. 
 Thy majesty, how bright! 
 How beautiful Thy mercy-seat, 
 In depths of burning light!
	 ~ 	1 . Me Nyame, mbrɛ 'dua yɛ nwanwa a 
W' ahentum ne hyerɛn a!
Wo mbɔbɔrhu egua n' ne fɛw a
Wɔ kan a ɔhyerɛn mu!

MHB 73
2 . How dread are Thine eternal years,  
 O everlasting Lord, 
 By prostrate spirits day and night 
 Incessantly adored!
	 ~ 	2 . Wo mfe a ɔmmbɔ adze n' no hu a, 
Domankoma Ewuradze,
Esunsum wotwa hwe W' enyim
Tonton Wo daa nyina.

MHB 73
3 . How beautiful, how beautiful, 
 The sight of Thee must be, 
 Thine endless wisdom, boundless power, 
 And awful purity!
	 ~ 	3 . Mbrɛ odua yɛ fɛw, yɛ fɛw a, 
Dɛ yebohu W' enyim
Wo nyansaa bun n', Wo tum kɛse n'
Nyame W' ahotsew nwanwa.

MHB 73
4 . O how I fear Thee, living God, 
 With deepest, tendest fears, 
 And worship Thee with trembling hope 
 And penitential tears!
	 ~ 	4 . Ao Nyame, mbrɛ misi suro Wo a, 
Suro a no mu dɔ,
Na medze ahopopo enyidar,
Nnuhu nyinsu som Wo!

MHB 73
5 . Yet I may love Thee too, O Lord, 
 Almighty as Thou art, 
 For Thou hast stooped to ask of me 
 The love of my poor heart.
	 ~ 	5 . Ma mo so maadɔ W', Ewuradze, 
Ɔwo a 'yɛ Tumfo yi,
Abɔ Wo mu adze ebisa
M' akoma brɛfo no dɔ.

MHB 73
6 . No earthly father loves like Thee; 
 No mother, e’er so mild, 
 Bears and forbears as Thou hast done 
 With me, Thy sinful child.
	 ~ 	6 . Egya bi nnyɛ dɔ dɛ Ɔwo; 
Na bi nndwe dɛ Ɔwo,
Wonnyi abotar dɛ mbrɛ ewɔ n'
Emi babɔn yi ho.

MHB 73
7 . Father of Jesus, love is reward, 
 what rapture will it be 
 Prostrate before Thy throne to lie, 
 And gaze, and gaze on Thee.	 ~ 	7 . Jesus N' egya, dɔ n' akatua, 
Na enyigye bɛn a
Dɛ m' botwa ahwe W' ahengua enyim,
Mahwɛ Wo, na mahwɛ W' !

MHB 730
1 . FATHER of everlasting grace,
Thy goodness and Thy truth we praise,
Thy goodness and Thy truth we prove;
Thou hast, in honour of Thy Son,
The gift unspeakable sent down,
The Spirit of life,  and power, and love.
	 ~ 	1 . ADOM a onnsa da Egya,
Yɛkamfo W‘adͻe na nokwar.
Yɛkyérɛ: W’adͻyɛ nye nokwar,
Wo Ba n' N'enyidzi ntsi ama
Akyɛdzé a onnyi kabeà esian.
N-kwa Sunsum, tum nye ͻdͻ.
		Amen.

MHB 730
2 . Send us the Spirit of Thy Son,
To make the depths of Godhead known,
To make us share the life divine;
Send Him the sprinkled blood to apply,
Send Him our souls to sanctify
And show and seal us ever Thine.
	 ~ 	2 
. Fa Wo Ba n' No Sunsum brɛ hɛn
Ma woeehu Nyametsir n' no bun.
Na yeenya Wo nkwa n‘ mu kyefa;
Soma N' ma ͻmbɛpɛtse bͻgya n',
Soma N' mà ͻmbɛtsew hɛn akra ho,
Ma ͻnkyérɛ, nsͻw hɛn ano dɛ W‘dze daa.

MHB 730
3 . So shall we pray, and never cease,
So shall we thankfully confess
Thy wisdom, truth, and power, and love;
With joy unspeakable adore,
And bless and praise Thee evermore,
And serve Thee as Thy hosts above:
	 ~ 	3 
. Dɛm na yɛbͻ mpaa, yenngyaa da.
Na yɛdze ndaase kà hɛn bͻn.
Wo nymsaa, nokwar, tum na dͻ n';
Yɛdze dɛw a onnyi kabeà aasͻr,
Na yeehyira W', yoeyi W' ayɛ daa,
Yaasom W’ dɛ mbrɛ Wo sor dͻm som W'.

MHB 730
4 . Till, added to that heavenly choir,
We raise our songs of triumph higher,
And praise Thee in a bolder strain,
Out-soar the first-born seraph’s flight,
And sing, with all our friends in light,
Thy everlasting love to man.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Yɛbͻfora sor adwontofo kuw n’,
Yɛama bɛn konyimdzi ndwom n' do
Kɛse na yeeyi Wo ayɛw,
Yeetu akͻ sor akyɛn nkan seraph,
Na yenye kan m’ 'nyɛnkofo nyina
Aatow Wo dͻ à onnyi ewiei ho ndwom.

MHB 731
1 . O CHRIST, our God, who with Thine own hast been,
Our spirits cleave to Thee, the Friend unseen.
	 ~ 	1 . O CHRIST, hɛn Nyamé a nye Wo nkobrͻfo tse,
Hɛn sunsum twe bɛn Wo, Dͻfo a wonnhu W’.
Na akatua a onnyi mbanano afebͻͻ.

MHB 731
2 . Vouchsafe that all who on Thy bounty feed
May heed Thy love, and prize Thy gifts indeed.
	 ~ 	2 
. Dom ma hͻn a wonya dzi fi Wo dͻ m’
Ntsie Wo dͻ na wombu W’akyɛdze bi.

MHB 731
3 . Make every heart that is Thy dwelling-place
A watered garden filled with fruits of grace
	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛ akoma biara a ͻyɛ Wo tsénabea n’
Turo a adom nduadzewa ayɛ mu ma.

MHB 731
4 . Each holy purpose help us to fulfill;
Increase our faith to feed upon Thee still.
	 ~ 	4 
. Boa hɛn ma yɛnyɛ hɛn botae krͻnkrͻn,
To hɛn gyedzi mu na bɛnyɛn hɛn daa.

MHB 731
5 . Illuminate our minds, that we may see
In all around us holy  signs of Thee.
	 ~ 	5 
. Hyérɛn hɛn adwen m’ ma yenhu W’ nsɛnkyérɛdze
Krͻnkrͻn a wͻabͻ hɛn ho aprͻw nyina.

MHB 731
6 . And may such witness in our lives appear,
That all may know Thou hast been with us here.
	 ~ 	6 
. Na ma dem dasedzi yi mpue hɛn bra m’,
Ma obiara eehu dɛ Ͻwo nye hɛn atséna.

MHB 731
7 . So shalt Thou be for ever, loving Lord,
Our Shield and our  exceeding great reward.	 ~ 	7 
.  Dɛm na Dͻfo Nyame bɛyɛ hɛn kyɛm

MHB 732
1 . SWEETLY the holy hymn
Breaks on the morning air:
Before the world with smoke is dim
We meet to offer prayer.
	 ~ 	1 . YƐTSE ndwom krɔnkrɔn no
Wɔ anapa bɔw yi mu;
Ansaana bɔn hyɛ wiadze sum n',
Yehyira na yɛbɔ mpaa.
Na obedzi dwuma ampaara.

MHB 732
2 . While flowers are wet with dews,
Dew of our souls, descend:
Ere yet the sun the day renews,
O Lord, Thy Spirit send!
	 ~ 	2 
. Ber a 'bɔw wɔ nhyirɛn do yi,
Hɛn akra no bɔw, sian famu;
Ansaana ewia befir bio no
Hɛn Wura, ma W' Sunsum mbra!

MHB 732
3 . Upon the battle-field,
Before the fight begins,
We seek, O Lord, Thy sheltering shield,
To  guard us from our sins.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ yɛwɔ akono a,
Ansaana ko n' hyɛ ase n',
Hɛn Wura, yebisa W'akokyɛm n',
Dɛ ɔnkora hɛn mfi hɛn bɔn m'.

MHB 732
4 . Ere yet our vessel sails
Upon the stream of day
We plead, O Lord, for heavenly gales
To speed us on our way.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ber a hɛn hɛmba nnyaa mmfow
Da yi ne baka yi,
Ewuradze, yɛserɛ W' sor aahow
Ma ɔdze hɛn aakɔ ntsɛm.

MHB 732
5 . On the lone mountain side,
Before the morning’s light,
The Man of sorrows wept and cried,
And rose refreshed with might.
	 ~ 	5 
. Bepɔw n' nkyɛn-famu komm,
Ansaana wi bopue n',
Yaw Nyimpa sui na ɔkaa mmɔn,
Dze tum soɛɛr ahoɔdzen mu.

MHB 732
6 . O hear us then, for we
Are very weak and frail;
We make the Saviour’s Name our plea,
And surely must prevail.	 ~ 	6 
. Sɛ dɛm a, na tsie hɛn a
Yɛyɛ mberɛw, nnyi ahoɔdzen;
Hɛn ebisadze nye Gyefo N' dzin,

MHB 733
1 . JESUS, Sun of righteousness, 
Brightest beam of love divine, 
With the early morning rays, 
Do Thou on our darkness shine, 
And dispel with purest light 
All our night.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, Ewia Tsenenee,
Ͻdɔ nsérɛmɛn a ehyérɛn sor,
Enyé anapawi hyerɛn,
Hyerɛn hɛn sum kebii do,
Na ma hɛn kan a mu tsew
’Nafua nyina.
Fié afebͻͻ. 	Amen.

MHB 733
2 . As on drooping herb and flower 
Falls the soft refreshing dew, 
Let Thy Spirit’s grace and power 
All our weary souls renew; 
Showers of blessing over all 
Softly fall.
	 ~ 	2 
. Dɛ mbrɛ daa bͻsu tͻ gu
’Hataw na nhyirén a oeguan do n’,
Ma W’ Sunsum N’adom na tum n’
Nkenyan hɛn akrà a wͻabotow n’;
Nhyira mpetséma ntͻ hɛn mu

MHB 733
3 . Like the sun’s reviving ray, 
May Thy love with tender glow 
All our coldness melt away, 
warm and cheer us forth to go, 
Gladly serve thee and obey 
All the day.
	 ~ 	3 Biara do.
. Ma Wo do bɛtɛɛ no nyɛ,
Dɛ ewia ne kan nkenyan,
Nyi hɛn awͻw nyinara nkͻ,
Mbͻ hɛn hyew, nkyekye hɛn werɛ,
Yɛmfa enyigye nsom W’, ntsie Wo
Daa nyina.

MHB 733
4 . O our only Hope and Guide, 
Never leave us nor forsake;
Keep us ever at thy side
Till the eternal morning break;
moving on to Zion’s hill,
Homeward still.    Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn Enyidar na Kwankyérɛfo,
Mma mmpa hɛn na nngyaa hɛn da
Kora hɛn wͻ Wo nkyɛn daa daa
Kodu adzekyeé a onnyi ewiei.
Yɛako Zion koko n’ do.

MHB 734
1 . JESUS, meek and gentle,
Son of God most high,
Pitying, loving Savior,
Hear Thy children’s cry.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, botooyɛnyi,
Ɔsor Nyame Ba,
Ehumbɔbɔr Agyenkwa,
Tsie Wo mba hɔn su.
Tsie Wo mba hɛn su.  Amen.

MHB 734
2 . Pardon our offenses,
Loose our captive chains,
Break down every idol
Which our soul detains.
	 ~ 	2 
. Fa hɛn mfom 'horow kyɛ hɛn,
Yi hɛn fi mpokyerɛ m',
Bubu ehonyi biara a 
Hɛn akra da ho dze m'.

MHB 734
3 . Give us holy freedom,
Fill our hearts with love;
Draw us, holy Jesus,
To the realms above.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma hɛn fahodzi krɔnn,
Hyɛ hɛn akoma dɔ ma
Jesus krɔnkrɔn, twe hɛn
Bɛn sor ahenman mu.

MHB 734
4 . Lead us on our journey,
Be Thyself the way
Through our earthly darkness
To the heavenly day.
	 ~ 	4 
. Dzi hɛn kan hɛn akwantu m',
Yɛ Woho ɔkwan n'
Wɔ wiadze sum kapee m'
Kodu sor afebɔɔ.

MHB 734
5 . Jesus, meek and gentle,
Son of God most high,
Pitying, loving Savior,
Hear Thy children’s cry.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. JESUS, botooyɛnyi,
Ɔsor Nyame Ba,
Ehumbɔbɔr Agyenkwa,

MHB 735
1 . WHEN the weary, seeking rest,
To Thy goodness flee;
When the heavy-laden cast
All their load on Thee;
When the troubled, seeking peace,
On Thy Name shall call;
When the sinner, seeking life,
At Thy feet shall fall:

       Hear then in love, O Lord, the cry,
       In Heaven, Thy dwelling place on high.
	 ~ 	1 . BER a bérɛfo hwehwɛ ahomgye n’,
Oguan kͻ W’ yiedzi m’,
Bér a ’dzesoafo tow adzesoa
Nyina gu W’enyim;
Bér a hͻn a wͻahaw pɛ asomdwee n’
Wͻbͻbͻ Wo dzin;
Bér a abͻnfo hwehwɛ nkwa,
Twa hwe W’anànadze n’:
    O Ewuradze, ͻdͻ m ’ ara,
    Fi Wo sor tsénabea do tsie hͻn.
Ba W’adom eguà enyim n’:    Amen.

MHB 735
2 . When the child, with grave fresh lip,
Youth, or maiden fair;
When the agèd, weak and grey,
Seek Thy face in prayer;
When the widow weeps to Thee,
Sad and lone and low;
When the orphan brings to Thee
All his orphan woe:
	 ~ 	2 
. Bér a abofra dzé anofamfa,
Mbaabun a wͻyɛ fɛw; 
Nkͻdaa na mberwa a wͻagow,
Dze mpaabͻ hwehwɛ W’;
Bér a kunefo ’wérɛhonyi
Bͻbͻfo su kyérɛ W’;
Bér a egyanka dze ne nsɛm
Nyina ba W’enyim no:

MHB 735
3 . When the worldling, sick at heart,
Lifts his soul above;
When the prodigal looks back
To his Father’s love;
When the proud man, in his pride,
Stoops to seek Thy face;
When the burdened brings his guilt
To Thy throne of grace:Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Wiadzenyi akoma m’ yarfo
Ma ne kra do sor;
Bér a ’dzesɛɛfo bu n’ kͻn ekyir
Hwɛ n’Egya No dͻ n’;
Bér a ’hokyérɛnyi fi no ntuw m’
Kotow hwehwɛ Wo n’;
Ber a dzebͻnyɛnyi dze n’ bͻn

MHB 736
1 . SHEPHERD divine, our wants relieve
In this our evil day, to all Thy tempted followers give
The power to watch and pray.
	 ~ 	1 . Guanhwɛfo pa, dom hɛn Wo mboa 
Wɔ hɛn mbusu nda yim',
Tum a wɔdze weɔn, wɔdze sɔr,
Fa ma Wo mba nyina.
Wɔ adzehu nye ayɛyim'.  Amen.

MHB 736
2 . Long as our fiery trials last,
Long as the cross we bear,
O let our souls on Thee be cast
In never-ceasing prayer !
	 ~ 	2 
. Ber a yɛda ho da nsɔhwɛm', 
Ber a yɛso mbeamudua 'i,
Ma yɛmfa hɛn kra nto Wo do
Wɔ mpaabɔ a ɔmmbɔ adzem'.

MHB 736
3 . The Spirit of interceding grace
Give us in faith to claim;
To wrestle till we see Thy face,
And know Thy hidden name.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma yendua gyedzim' hɛn nsa nka 
M-paabɔ sunsum no;
Yemmia ndzi ako gyedɛ yehu
W' enyim nye Wo dzin pa n'.

MHB 736
4 . Till Thou Thy perfect love impart,
Till Thou Thyself bestow,
Be this the cry of every heart:
I will not let thee go-
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma 'koma biara nsu nka dɛ: 
Minnkegyaa Wo ma akɔ,
Gyedɛ ama m' dɔ a odzi mu,
Na edze Woho akyɛ m'.

MHB 736
5 . I will not let Thee go, unless
Thou tell Thy name to me,
with all Thy great salvation bless,
and make me all like Thee.
	 ~ 	5 
. Minnkegyaa Wo ma akɔ gyedɛ 
Ebɔ Wo dzin kyerɛ m',
Na egye me kra nkwa nwionn nwionn,
Ma meyɛ dɛ Ɔwo.

MHB 736
6 . Then let me on the mountain-top
Behold Thy open face,
Where faith in sight is swallowed up,
And prayer in endless praise.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Ekyir no ma munhu W' enyim 
Wɔ kokwaa n' etsifi,
Mbrɛ wɔmen gyedzi nye mpaabɔ

MHB 737
1 . JESU, to Thee our hearts we lift-
May all our hearts with love o’erflow-
With thanks for Thy continued gift,
That still Thy precious name we know,
Retain our sense of sin forgiven,
And wait for all our inward heaven. 
	 ~ 	1 . JESU, yɛma hɛn akoma do ma W';
Ma ɔdɔ mbu hɛn akoma nyina do,
Yɛda W' ase, daa akyɛdze n' ntsi 
Yɛda ho nyim W' dzin a ɔsom bo n',
Yenyim dɛ edze hɛn bɔn kyɛ hɛn 
Na yɛtweɔn heaven a ɔwɔ hɛn mu n'.
Akɛtsena 'nyimnyam ahengua n' do.  Amen.

MHB 737
2 . What mighty troubles hast Thou shown
Thy feeble, tempted followers here!
We have through fire and water gone,
But saw Thee on the floods appear,
But felt Thee present in the flame,
And shouted our Deliverer’s name.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔhaw kɛse bi a edze akyerɛ
W'ekyirdzifo a wɔasɔ hɛn ahwɛ a!
Yeedua ogya na nsu nyina mu,
Yehun dɛ epue nsuyirii mu,
Yɛtsee nka dɛ 'gyina gyaframee m',
Na yɛkaa m' bɔɔ hɛn Pomfo N' dzin.

MHB 737
3 . All are not lost or wandered back;
All have not left Thy chuch and Thee;
There are who suffer for Thy sake,
Enjoy Thy glorious infamy
Esteem the scandal of the cross,
And only seek divine applause.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hɛn nyina nnyewee, yɛnnsaan hɛn ekyir,
Yɛnndan W'asɔr na Ɔwo nngyae;
Binom wohu 'nyimguase n' bi,
Hɔn enyi gye W'enyimnyam ho,
Wobu mbeamudua 'nyimguase n' bi,
Wɔhwehwɛ nkamfo a ofir Egya n'.

MHB 737
4 . Thou who hast kept us to this hour,
O keep us faithful to the end:
When, robed with majesty and power,
Our Jesus shall from heaven descend.
His friends and confessors to own,
And seat us on His glorious throne.    Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔwo a ahwɛ hɛn do ebodu ndɛ,
Ma yɛnyɛ 'nokwafo nkɔ ewiei;
Wɔdze ahentum ntar hyɛ hɛn a,
Hɛn Jesus besian abɛfa
N'anyɛnkofo na adasefo,

MHB 738
1 . REVIVE Thy work, O Lord,
Thy mighty arm make bare;
Speak with the voice that wakes the dead,
And make Thy people hear.
Revive Thy work, O lord,
While here to Thee we bow;
Descend, O gracious lord, descend!
 O come and bless us now.
	 ~ 	1 . Kenyan W' edwuma yi, 
Ewuradze, kyerɛ Wo tum;
Bɔ Wo ndze a onyan ewufom',
Na ma Wo nkorɔfo ntse.
    Kenyan W' edwuma yi, 
    Ber a yɛkotow Wo yi, 
    Sian, ao Ewuradze domfo, sian! 
    Bra behyira hɛn sesei. 
Na nhyira n' aka hɛn.

MHB 738
2 . Revive Thy work, O Lord,
Create soul-thirst for Thee;
And hungering for the Bread of Life
O may our spirits be.
	 ~ 	2  
. Kenyan W' edwuma yi, 
Ma akra nhwehwɛ nkwa-su n':
O ma hɛn esunsum kɔn ndɔ
N-kwa edziban no!

MHB 738
3 . Revive Thy work, O Lord,
Exalt Thy precious name;
And, by the Holy Ghost, our love
For Thee and Thine inflame.
	 ~ 	3 
. Kenyan W' edwuma yi, 
Krɔn W' enyimnyam dzin no;
Wo sunsum mma hɛn dɔ m-fram
Mma W' nye Wo mba nyina.

MHB 738
4 . Revive Thy work o lord:
Give power unto Thy word;
Grant that Thy blessed Gospel may
In living faith be heard.
	 ~ 	4 
. Kenyan W' edwuma yi, 
Ma W' asɛm no nnya tum;
Ma wɔmfa enyikan gyedzi ntsie
W' asɛmpa a nhyira wɔm' n'.

MHB 738
5 . Revive Thy work, O Lord,
Give refreshing showers;
The glory shall be all Thine own,
The blessing, Lord, be ours.	 ~ 	5 
. Kenyan W' edwuma yi, 
Tɔ Pentecost bɔw no;
Na enyimnyam no bɛyɛ Wodze,

MHB 739
1 . OUR Father, hear our longing prayer.
And help this prayer to flow,
The humble thoughts, which are Thy care,
May live in us and grow.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN Egya, tsie hɛn mpaabɔ yi,
Boa ma mpaabɔ yi mpem,
Na ma adwen brɛfo a ofir Wo n',
Mbɛtsena hɛn mu na onyin.
Brɛfo a ɔtwer Wo mu.  Amen.

MHB 739
2 . For lowly hearts shall understand
The peace, the calm delight
Of dwelling in Thy heavenly land,
A pleasure in Thy sight.
	 ~ 	2 
. Akoma brɛfo no bɛtse
'Somdwee na dɛw n' ase,
Dza ɔwɔ Wo sor asetsena mu
'Homka wɔ W'enyi do.

MHB 739
3 . Give us humility, that so,
Thy reign may come within.
And when Thy children homeward go,
We too may enter in.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma hɛn ahobrɛadze ama
W'ahendzi aaba hɛn mu,
Na sɛ Wo mba no rokɔ fie a,
Hɛn so yaakɔ hɔ bi.

MHB 739
4 . Hear us, our Saviour! Ours Thou art,
Though we are not like Thee;
Give us Thy spirit in a heart
Large, lowly, trusting, free.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Gyefo tsie hɛn! Yɛyɛ Wodze,
Sɛ yɛnntse dɛ Ɔwo mpo a;
Fa Wo Sunsum n' hyɛ akoma

MHB 74
1 . PRAISE to the Holiest in the height, 
 And in the depth be praise: 
 In all His words most wonderful; 
 Most sure in all His ways.
	 ~ 	1 . AYƐYI nka sor Krɔnkrɔnyi,
Wonyi N'ayɛw wɔ ase:
Ne nsɛm a ɔyɛ nwanwa nyina m',
N'akwan nyina tsim hɔ.

MHB 74
2 . O loving wisdom of our God! 
 When all was sin and shame, 
 A second Adam to the fight 
 And to the rescue came.
	 ~ 	2 . O hɛn Nyame Ne nyansa dɔ,
Bɔn na enyimguase mu,
Adam a ɔtɔ do ebien bae
Bɛgyee hɛn nyina fii mu.

MHB 74
3 . O wisest love! that flesh and blood 
 Which did in Adam fail, 
 Should strive afresh against the foe, 
 Should strive and should prevail.
	 ~ 	3 . Nyansa dɔ! Honam, bɔgya a
'Hwee famu wɔ Adam mu n',
Bɛsan nye tamfo no aper,
Bɛper edzi konyim.

MHB 74
4 . And that a higher gift than grace 
 Should flesh and blood refine, 
 God’s Presence, and His very Self 
 And Essence all-divine.
	 ~ 	4 . Akyɛdze kɛse a ɔkyen adom
Ntsew honam, bɔgya ho;
Nyame ankasa nye No su
Na odzi dɛm dwuma n'.

MHB 74
5 . O generous love! that He, who smote, 
 In Man for man the foe, 
 The double agony in Man 
 For man should undergo.
	 ~ 	5 . Ɔdɔ ayamuyie nye yi,
Dɛ Nyia ɔsɛɛ tamfo n'
Nyimpa n'amandzehu mprɛnu n',
Noara so duaa mu bi.

MHB 74
6 . And in the garden secretly, 
 And on the Cross on high, 
 Should teach His brethren, and inspire 
 To suffer and to die.
	 ~ 	6 . Nsumaa mu, wɔ turo no mu,
Na mbeamudua no do so,
Ɔkyerɛɛ No nuamom, hyɛɛ hɔn dzen, 
Wɔ amandzehu na wu m'.

MHB 74
7 . Praise to the Holiest in the height, 
 And in the depth be praise: 
 In all His words most wonderful; 
 Most sure in all His ways.	 ~ 	7 . Ayɛyi nka sor Krɔnkrɔnyi,
Wonyi N'ayɛw wɔ ase:
Ne nsɛm a ɔyɛ nwanwa nyina m',
N'akwan nyina tsim hɔ.

MHB 740
1 . FATHER of all, to Thee
With loving hearts we pray,
Through Him, in mercy given,
The Life, the Truth, the Way;
From Heaven, Thy throne, in mercy shed
Thy blessings on each bended head.
	 ~ 	1 . NYIMPA nyinà Egya, yɛdze
Dͻ akoma bͻ Wo mpaa,
’Nam Nyià ama N’ mbͻbͻrhu,
Nkwa, nokwar ͻkwan do;
Fi sor ahengua do hue W’adom
Na Wo nhyira N’ gu hɛn etsir do.
		Amen.

MHB 740
2 . Father of all, to Thee
Our contrite hearts we raise,
Unstrung by sin and pain,
Long voiceless in Thy praise;
Breathe Thou the silent chords along,
Until they tremble into song.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyimpa nyinà Egya, yɛdze
Akomà a yaw ahyɛ n’ mà,
Bͻn na yaw biara nnyi m’,
Tow Wo ayɛyi ndwom;
Hom Wo mfar no gu hɛn mu daa,
Ma yɛmfa ntow ndwom pa mma Wo.

MHB 740
3 . Father of all, to Thee
We breathe unuttered fears,
Deep-hidden in our souls,
That have no voice but tears;
Take Thou our hand, and through the wild
Lead gently each trustful child.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyimpa nyinà Egya, yɛdze
Suro a ommpue gu ahom
Fi hɛn akoma bun mu,
Ͻnnkasa, nyinsu nko;
Suo hɛn nsamu twa mbusu bea mu,
Egya, gyà ͻba biara a ͻtwer Wo.

MHB 740
4 . Father of all, may we
In praise our tongues employ,
When gladness fills the soul
With deep and hallowed joy;
In storm and calm give us to see
The path of peace which leads to Thee.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Nyimpa nyinà Egya, yɛdze
Hɛn ngyirama yi W’ ayɛw,
Bér a dɛw hyɛ hɛn akra mà
Nà enyigyé a no mu dͻ;
Ehum nà aahow mu ma yenhu
Asomdwee kwàn a ͻdze ba W' nkyɛn.

MHB 741
1 . WE have not known Thee as we ought,
Nor learned Thy wisdom, grace and power;
The things of earth have filled our thought,
And trifles of the passing hour:
Lord, give us light Thy truth to see,
And make us wise in knowing Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . YENNHUN Wo dɛ mbrɛ ɔfata,
Yennsuaa W'adom, nyansa na tum;
Wiadze egyapadze na ber yi m'
Ndzɛmba ahyɛ hɛn adwen ma;
Ewuradze, ma yenhu W' nokwar n;
Yɛ hɛn enyansafo ma yenhu W'.
Nhu W'enyim na yɛnsom W' wɔ hɔ.  Amen

MHB 741
2 . We have not feared Thee as we ought,
Nor bowed beneath Thine awful eye,
Nor guarded deed, and word, and thought,
Remembering that God was nigh:
Lord, give us faith to know Thee near,
And grant the grace of holy fear.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yensuroo Wo dɛ mbrɛ ɔfata,
Yɛmmbɔɔ hɛn mu adze wɔ W'enyim,
Yɛnnkoraa ndzeyɛɛ, kasa na adwen,
Ber a yɛkaa dɛ Nyame bɛn hɛn;
Ewuradze, ma yenhu dɛ ebɛn,
Na ma hɛn suro mapa ho adom.

MHB 741
3 . We have not loved Thee as we ought,
Nor cared that we are loved by Thee;
Thy presence we have coldly sought,
And feebly longed Thy face to see:
Lord, give a pure and loving heart
To feel and know the love Thou art.
	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛnndɔɔ Wo dɛ mbrɛ ɔfata,
Na ammfa hɛn ho dɛ Ɔwo dɔ hɛn;
Yɛnnhwehwɛɛ bɛn a ebɛn hɛn n' yie,
Hɛn kɔn nndɔ yie dɛ yebohu W';
Ewuradze, ma hɛn akoma a m' tsew
Ma yenhu dɛ Ɔwo nye ɔdɔ n'.

MHB 741
4 . We have not served Thee as we ought,
Alas, the duties left undone,
The work with little fervor wrought,
The battles lost or scarcely won!
Lord, give the zeal, and give the might,
For Thee to toil, for Thee to fight.
	 ~ 	4 
. Yɛnnsoom Wo dɛ mbrɛ ɔfata,
Ebei! Yɛannyɛ hɛn asɛdze no,
Edwuma n' so yɛayɛ n' bi-na-bi,
Yeedzi 'kogu; hɛn konyim nnye!
Ewuradze, ma hɛn mbanyinndam,
Yɛmfona mma W', yɛnko mma Wo.

MHB 741
5 . When shall we know Thee as we ought,
And fear and love and serve aright?
When shall we, out of trial brought,
Be perfect in the land of light?
Lord, may we day by day prepare
To see Thy face and serve Thee there.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Ber bɛn na yebohu Wo yie,
Yeesuro Wo, yɛasom Wo yie?
Wobeyi hɛn nsɔhwɛ m' ber bɛn
Ma yeedzi mu kan asaase n' do?
Hɛn Wura, ma daa yɛnyɛ ahoboa,

MHB 742
1 . THY kingdom come-on bended knee
The passing ages pray;
And faithful souls have yearned to see
On earth that kingdom’s day.
	 ~ 	1 . YԐBϽϽ mpaa dɛ W’ahendzi mbra,
Mfe a etwa m’ yebuu ntwɛr;
Akrà anokwafo pɛ ehu
Ahendzi n’ saase do.
Nyame anohoba da n’.

MHB 742
2 . But the slow watches of the night
Not less to God belong,
And for the everlasting right
The silent stars are strong.
	 ~ 	2 
. Naaso anafua weͻn nyaa no,
Onnye mma Nyame koraa,
Na komm nworaba no yɛ dzen
Ma kyɛfa afebͻͻ.

MHB 742
3 . And lo, already on the hills
The flags of dawn appear;
Gird up your loins, ye prophet souls,
Proclaim the day is near:
	 ~ 	3 
. Hwɛ, wͻwͻ akoko n’ do dada,
Adzekyee mfrankaa pue,
Nkͻnhyɛfo, hom mbͻ hom asen do,
Hom nkà dɛ da n’ abɛn:

MHB 742
4 . The day in whose clear-shining light 
All wrong shall stand revealed,
When justice shall be throned in might,
And every hurt be healed;
	 ~ 	4 
. Da no a ne kan bɛhyerɛn petee n’,
Bͻn nyina bɛdà edzi,
Ber a pɛrpɛr betsim hͻ pintsinn,
Na yaw biarà efi hͻ.

MHB 742
5 . When knowledge, hand in hand with peace
Shall walk the earth abroad-
The day of perfect righteousness,
The promised day of God.	 ~ 	5 
. Nyimdzee nye asomdwee bͻ mu a,
Nà okyin wiadze do hyia;
Tsenenee a odzi mu da no,

MHB 743
1 . NOT for our sins alone
Thy mercy, Lord, we sue;
Let fall Thy pitying glance
On our devotions too-
What we have done for Thee,
And what we think to do.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆNNYƐ hɛn bɔn nko ntsi
Na yɛserɛ W' mbɔbɔrhu;
Fa W' mbɔbɔrhu enyi
Hwɛ hɛn adzeserɛ yi
Wɔ dza yɛayɛ ama Wo
Na dza yɛdwen ho yɛ.
Yɛ no dɛ mbrɛ epɛ.

MHB 743
2 . The holiest hours we spend
In prayer upon our knees,
The times when most we deem
Our songs of praise will please,
Thou searcher of all hearts,
Forgiveness pour on these.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛdze mber krɔnkrɔn no
Bu nkotodwe bɔ mpaa,
Mber a yesusu dɛ
Hɛn ndwom bɔsɔ W'enyi
Ɔwo a 'hwehwɛ akoma m',
Dom hɔn W'ehumbɔbɔr.

MHB 743
3 . And all the gifts we bring,
And all the vows we make,
And all the acts of love
We plan for Thy dear sake, 
Into Thy pardoning thought,
O God of mercy, take.
	 ~ 	3 
. Na akyɛdze a yɛdze brɛ W',
Anohoba a yɛbɔ
Ɔdɔ ndwuma nyina a
Ɔwo ntsi yɛhyehyɛ n',
Ehumbɔbɔr Nyame,
Fa kɔ adwendwen mu.

MHB 743
4 . And most, when we, Thy flock,
Before Thine altar bend,
And strange, bewildering thoughts
with those sweet moments blend,
By Him whose death we plead,
Good Lord, Thy help extend.
	 ~ 	4 
. Nkanka hɛn Wo nguan kuw
Ba W'afɔrmbukyia enyim a,
Na adwenbɔn a ɔyɛ hu 
Nye mber dɛɛdɛw dzi afora a,
Nyia a owui ntsi yɛserɛ W',
Dɛ Owura pa, boa hɛn.

MHB 743
5 . Bow down Thine ear and hear:
Open Thine eyes and see:
Our very love is shame,
And we must come to Thee
To make it of Thy grace,
what Thou wouldst have it be.	 ~ 	5 
. Brɛ W'aso adze na tsie,
Bue W'enyiwa na hwɛ;
Hɛn dɔ yɛ enyimguase;
Ɔsɛ dɛ yɛba W' nkyɛn,
Yɛyɛ n' dɛ W'adom tse,

MHB 744
1 . O HAPPY day that fixed my choice
On Thee, my Savior and my God!
Well may this glowing heart rejoice,
And tell its raptures all abroad.

     Happy day! happy day!
     When Jesus washed my sins away;
     He taught me how to watch and pray,
     And live rejoicing every day;
     Happy day! Happy day!
     When Jesus washed my sins away.
	 ~ 	1 . Ahomka da ɔnye da n' a 
Medze moho maa m' Agyenkwa!
Ɔsɛ dɛ mo 'koma dzi dɛw
Na ɔka ne dɛw kyerɛ aman.

  Ahomka da! ahomka da! 
  Da a Jesus hoor mo ho bɔn nyina 
  Ɔkyerɛɛ m' dɛ monweɔn na monsɔr 
  Na mindzi dɛw aber nyina 
  Ahomka da! ahomka da! 
  Da a Jesus hoor mo ho bɔn nyina! 
M' behyira me kra wɔ nsew yi ho.

MHB 744
2 . O happy bond, that seals my vows
To Him Who merits all my love!
Let cheerful anthems fill His house,
While to that sacred shrine I move.
	 ~ 	2  
. Siar n-hyehyɛɛ! ɔsɔw nsew a 
Midzii kyerɛɛ mo Dɔfo n' ano!
Ber a meba N' asɔrfim' yi,
Wɔmma ayɛyindwom nhyɛ hɔ ma.

MHB 745
1 . All praise to our redeeming Lord,
Who joins us by His grace;
And bids us, each to each restored,
Together seek His face.
	 ~ 	1 . WϽNKAMFO hɛn pomfo Ewuradze,
N’adom kà hɛn bͻ mu,
Ͻhyɛ hɛn nyina dɛ yɛnyɛ kor;
Yɛbͻ m’ hwehwɛ N’enyim.
Enyi bɛgye mbordo.

MHB 745
2 . He bids us build each other up;
And, gathered into one,
To our high calling’s glorious hope
We hand in hand go on.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ͻhyɛ hɛn dɛ yɛmboa hɛnho;
Na yɛbͻ mu yɛ kor,
Hɛn enyidar frɛ a ͻkrͻn,
Yetu anamͻn kͻ enyim.

MHB 745
3 . The gift which He on one bestows,
We all delight to prove;
The grace through every vessel flows,
In purest streams of love.
	 ~ 	3 
. Akyɛdzé a ͻdze ma nkorkor n’,
Yɛdze dͻ bͻsͻ ahwɛ;
Adom pem fa kuraba biara m’,
Wͻ dͻ esu a odzi mu m’.

MHB 745
4 . Even now we think and speak the same,
And cordially agree;
Concentred all, through Jesu’s  name,
In perfect harmony.
	 ~ 	4 
. M-po yɛdwen, ka asɛm kor,
Na nokwar mu yɛpen;
Nam Jesus dzin mu ba fakor.
Wͻ koryɛ a odzi mu m’.

MHB 745
5 . We all partake the joy of one,
The common peace we feel,
A peace to sensual minds unknown,
A joy unspeakable.
	 ~ 	5 
. Yɛbͻ m’ yenya enyigye kor,
Tse asomdwee kor nkà,
Asomdweé a wͻnntse n’ adwen mu.
Dɛw a onnyi kabea.

MHB 745
6 .  And if our fellowship below
In Jesus be so sweet,
What height of rapture shall we know
When round His throne we meet.	 ~ 	6 
. Sɛ hɛn anyɛnkoyɛ wͻ famu ha
Wͻ Jesus mu yɛ dɛw a,
Yehyia mu ahengua no ho a,

MHB 746
1 . I AM Thine, O Lord; I have heard Thy voice,
And it told Thy love to me;
But I long to rise in the arms of faith,
And be closer drawn to Thee.

    Draw me nearer, nearer, blessed Lord,
    To the cross where Thou hast died:
    Draw me nearer, nearer, nearer, blessed Lord, 
    To Thy precious, bleeding side.
	 ~ 	1 . OWURA, Wodze nye m’; matse Wo ndze,
Na ͻkàa Wo dͻ kyerɛɛ me;
Naaso mo kͻn dͻ dɛ mosoɛr gyedzi m’,
Na wͻbͻtwe me abɛn Wo.
   Twe me bɛn ho, bɛn ho siar Ewuradze;
   Kͻ mbeamuduà à iwui wͻ do n’ ho;
  Twe me bɛn ho, bɛn ho, siàr Ewuradze,
  Kͻ W’epirakur à ͻsom bo n ’ ho.
Kɛpem dɛ m’bͻhom Wo mu.

MHB 746
2 . Consecrate me now to Thy service, Lord,
By the power of grace divine;
Let my soul look up with a steadfast hope,
And my will be lost in Thine.
	 ~ 	2 
. Owura, tsew mo ho ma Wo som sesei.
Fa W’adom tum krͻnkrͻn no:
Ma me kra mfà enyidado a otsim hͻ.
Na me pɛ bɛhyɛ Wodze m’.

MHB 746
3 . O the pure delight of a single hour
That before Thy throne I spend,
When I kneel in prayer, and with
Thee,  my God,
I commune as friend with friend.
	 ~ 	3 
. O mber kakraabi no mu enyigyé a
Midzi wͻ W’ahengua enyim,
Menye W’ me Nyame, bu ntwɛr we mpaabͻ m’,
Dɛ nyɛnko nye nyɛnko hyia.

MHB 746
4 . There are depths of love, that I cannot know
Till I cross the narrow sea;
There are heights of joy that I may not reach
Till I rest in peace with Thee.	 ~ 	4 
. Ͻdͻ ebun wͻ hͻ a munnkontum ehu,
Gyedɛ mutwa po tseàa no;
Dɛw nkokwaa wͻ hͻ a munnkotum edu

MHB 747
1 . ALL thanks to the Lamb,
Who gives us to meet:
His love we proclaim,
His praises repeat;
We own Him our Jesus,
Continually near
To pardon and bless us,
And perfect us here.
	 ~ 	1 . NDAASE nkà Eguambaà a
Ͻma yehyia mu:
Yɛka N’ dͻ ho asɛm,
Yɛtow N’ayɛyi;
Jesus yɛ hɛndze daa,
Ͻbɛn hɛn dabaa,
Dze mfom kyɛ na ohyira hɛn,
Na ͻma yedzi mu.
’Nyidzi na ayɛyi.

MHB 747
2 . In Him we have peace,
In Him we have power,
Preserved by His grace
Throughout the dark hour,
In all our temptation
He keeps us to prove
His utmost salvation,
His fullness of love.
	 ~ 	2 
. No mu wͻ asomdwee,
No mu yɛwͻ tum,
N’adom no kora hɛn
Wͻ anago sum no m’;
Hɛn nsͻhwɛ nyina mu no,
Ͻkora hɛn ma
Yehu No nkwagye na
No dͻ a odzi mu.

MHB 747
3 . Through pride and desire
Unhurt we have gone,
Through water and fire
In Him we went on;
The world and the devil
Through him we o’ercame,
Our Saviour from evil,
For ever the same. 
	 ~ 	3 
. ’Homado na ͻpɛ m’
Yeedua yi mu sͻnn;
Yefaa nsu na ogya m’ n’,
Ͻno nà ͻgyee hɛn;
Wiadze nɛ abͻnsam nsamu
Yedzi nyim we N’ mu;
Ͻyɛ hɛn Gyefo pa,
Ͻtse dɛm daapem.

MHB 747
4 . O what shall we do
Our Saviour to love?
To make us anew,
Come, Lord, from above:
The fruit of Thy passion,
Thy holiness give,
Give us the salvation
Of all that believe. 
	 ~ 	4 
. O yɛbɛyɛ dɛn
Yeedua hɛn Agyenkwa n’?
Nyame, fi sor bra
Bɛyɛ hɛn fofor:
Ma hɛn W’ayamuhyehye
Na krͻnkrͻnyɛ aba,
Ma hɛn nkwagye no a
Obiara gye dzi n’.

MHB 747
5 . Pronounce the glad word,
And bid us be free;
Ah! Hast Thou not, Lord,
A blessing for me?
The peace Thou hast given
This moment impart,
And open Thy heaven n	
Of love in my heart.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ka enyigyesɛm n’ kyerɛ,
Na yɛ hɛn adehye;
Sɛ nnyɛ Ͻwo Ewuradze a,
Me nhyira fi hen?
Asomdweé a edzé ama n’,
Ma me bi sesei,
Na bue Wo dͻ ahenman n’
Wͻ m’akoma mu.

MHB 747
6 . Come, Jesus, and loose
The stammerer’s tongue,
And teach even us The spiritual song;
Let us without ceasing 
Give thanks for Thy grace,
And glory, and blessing,
And honour, and praise. 
	               Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Christ, bra na besian
Dodopo gyirama,
Na kyerɛ hɛn so
Sunsum mu ndwom no;
Mma yenngyaa ara da dɛ
Yɛda W’adom ase,
Nye enyimnyam, na nhyira,

MHB 748
1 . COME, and let us sweetly join
Christ to praise in hymns divine;
Give we all, with one accord,
Glory to our common Lord.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM mbra na yɛmbͻ m’ yenyi
Christ ayɛw wͻ adwontow mu;
Hɛn nyina mbͻ mu nyɛ kor,
Mfà enyimnyam mma Ewuradze.
Yɛnye N’ dzi hen wͻ dͻ mu.

MHB 748
2 . Hands, and hearts, and voices raise;
Sing as in the ancient days;
Antedate the joys above,
Celebrate the feast of love.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛmma nsa, akoma nye ndze do
Yɛntow ndwom dɛ tsetseber n’,
Yɛmfà adwen ntsim sor dɛw do,
Ndzi ͻdͻ afahyɛ no.

MHB 748
3 . Strive we, in affection strive;
Let the purer flame revive,
Such as in the martyrs glowed,
Dying champions for their God.
	 ~ 	3 
. Yedzi aper wͻ dͻ mu;
Ma ogyaframee no nkenyan
Dɛ mbrɛ ͻyɛɛ wͻ atͻfo n’ mu,
Wowui maa hͻn Nyankopͻn.

MHB 748
4 . We, like them, may live and love;
Called we are their joys to prove,
Saved with them from future wrath,
Partners of like precious faith.
	 ~ 	4 
. Yɛbɛtséna, adͻ dɛ hͻn,
Dɛ yɛnda hͻn dɛw edzi;
Wͻagye hɛn nyina wͻ ebufuw m’,
Yɛnye hͻn bͻ m’, gyedzi kor m'.

MHB 748
5 . Sing we then in Jesu’s name,
Now as yesterday the same;
One in every time and place,
Full for all of truth and grace.
	 ~ 	5 
. Yɛntow ndwom Jesus dzin mu,
Dɛ mbrɛ ͻtse wͻ ndeda;
Yɛyɛ kor wͻ beebiara,

MHB 748
6 . We for Christ, our Master, stand,
Lights in a benighted land:
We our dying Lord confess;
We are Jesu’s witnesses. 
	 ~ 	6 Nokwar nyé adom ahyɛ hɛn mà.
. Yegyina ma Christ, hɛn wura,
Kan ma wiadze a ntseasee nnyi m':
Yedzi hɛn Wura ho dase;
Yedzi dase ma Jesus.

MHB 748
7 . Witnesses that Christ hath died,	
We with Him are crucified;
Christ hath burst the bands of death,
We his quickening Spirit breathe.
	 ~ 	7 
. Yedzi dase, Christ ewu,
Wͻabͻ hɛn nye N’ mbeamudua m’;
Christ atsew wu hu no mu,
Yɛhom Ne nkenyan Sunsum m’.

MHB 748
8 . Christ is now gone up on high,
Thither all our wishes fly;
Sits at God’s right hand above,
There with him we reign in love.	 ~ 	8 
. Afei Christ afow kͻ sor,
Hɛn apɛdze nyina kͻ hͻ;
Ͻtse Nyankopͻn nyimfa,

MHB 749
1 . COME, let us use the grace divine,
And all, with one accord,
In a perpetual covenant join
Ourselves to Christ the Lord:
	 ~ 	1 . HOM mbra ma yɛmfa Nyamé adom,
Hɛn nyina nyɛ ano kor,
Yɛmbͻ m’ yɛnye hɛn Christ nyɛ kor
Yendzi ahyɛmu afebͻͻ:
Kora hɛn kodu da no.              Amen.

MHB 749
2 . Give up ourselves, through Jesu’s power,
His name to glorify;
And promise, in this sacred hour,
For GOD to live and die.
	 ~ 	2 
. Jesu tum m’ , yɛdze hɛnho ma W’,
Hyɛ Ne dzin enyimnyam;
Yɛhyɛ bͻ dͻnhwer krͻnkrͻn yi m’,
Yɛatséna, yeewu Nyame m'.

MHB 749
3 . The covenant we this moment make
Be ever kept in mind:
We will no more our God forsake,
Or cast his words behind.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ahyɛmu a yeridzi dem ber yi,
Yemfa nsie hɛn adwen m’ daa:
Yɛnnkapa hɛn Nyamé ara bio,
Yennkegya N'asɛm ekyir.

MHB 749
4 . We never will throw off His fear
Who hears our solemn vow;
And if Thou art well pleased to hear,
Come down, and meet us now.
	 ~ 	4 
. Yennkegyaa Nyià a otsie hɛn nsewdzi n’
No ho suro n’ ekyir,
Na sɛ epɛ dɛ itsie hɛn a,
Sian, behyia hɛn sesei.

MHB 749
5 . To each the covenant blood apply,
Which takes our sins away;
And register our names on high,
And keep us to that day.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Fa ahyɛm' bͻgya n’ ka obiara ho,
Ma onyi hɛn bͻn nyina nkͻ;
Na kyerɛw hɛn edzin Wͻ sor,

MHB 75
1 . FATHER, whose everlasting love 
 Thy only Son for sinners gave, 
 Whose grace to all did freely move, 
 And sent Him down the world to save:
	 ~ 	1 . EGYA a Wo dɔ a onnyi ewiei
Dze Wo Ba kortsee n' maa abɔn,
W'adom a edze ma kwa no,
'Somaa No bɛgyee wiadze nkwa.

MHB 75
2 . Help us Thy mercy to extol, 
 Immense, unfathomed, unconfined; 
 To praise the Lamb who died for all, 
 The general Saviour of mankind.
	 ~ 	2 . Boa ma yɛnkamfo W'mbɔbɔrhu,
Ɔso, dɔ, ɔwɔ mbea nyina;
Yɛnkamfo Eguambaa a owui maa hɛn,
Adasa nyina Agyenkwa.

MHB 75
3 . Thy undistinguishing regard 
 Was cast on Adams fallen race 
 For all Thou hast in Christ prepared 
 Sufficient, sovereign, saving grace.
	 ~ 	3 . Nyiyimu a ennyɛ no da n',
Edze sii Adam asehwefo do,
Na esiesie nkwagye adom a, odzi mu,
Ama obiara wɔ Christ mu.

MHB 75
4 . The world He suffered to redeem; 
 For all He hath the atonement made; 
 For those that will not come to Him 
 The ransom of His life was paid.
	 ~ 	4 . Ohun amandze dze gyee wiadze, 
Na ɔpataa maa obiara;
Ɔdze No nkwa so bɔɔ afɔr
Maa hɔn a wɔmmpɛ aba Ne nkyɛn

MHB 75
5 . Arise, O God, maintain Thy cause! 
 The fullness of the Gentiles call; 
 Lift up the standard of Thy cross, 
 And all shall own Thou diedst for all.	 ~ 	5 . Nyame, soɛr ma W'asɛm do,
Na frɛ amanaman nyina;
Ma Wo mbeamudua frankaa no do,
Na Wo wu n' bɛyɛ adasa dze.

MHB 750
1 . O God, how often hath Thine ear
To me in willing mercy bowed !
While worshipping Thine altar near,
Lowly I wept, and strongly vowed;
But ah! The feebleness of man!
Have I not vowed and wept in vain?
	 ~ 	1 . O NYAME, mpɛn pii na atse m’ su,
Na enam ehumbͻbͻr m’ etsie m’!
Bér a morosͻr W’afͻrmbukyia ho n’,
Musuu bͻkͻͻ, mehyɛɛ bͻ bi,
Na aa! Onyimpa ne mbérɛwyɛ a!
Mennhyɛɛ bͻ na munnsuu gyan bi?

MHB 750
2 . Return, O Lord of hosts, return! 
Behold Thy servant in distress;
My faithlessness again I mourn;
Again forgive my faithlessness;
And to Thine arms my spirit take,
And bless me for the Saviour’s sake.
	 ~ 	2 
. San W’ekyir, dͻm Ewuradze, san!
Hwɛ W’akowaà a n’abaw egura;
Musu me gyedzi a minnyi ntsi;
Bio, fa kyɛ m’ dɛ minnyi gyedzi;
Mo sunsum nsan mbɛda W’abaw m’,
Na Agyenkwa no ntsi, hyira me.

MHB 750
3 . In pity of the soul Thou lov’st,
Now bid the sin Thou has’st expire;
Let me desire what Thou approv’st
Thou dost approve what I desire;
And Thou wilt deign to call me Thine,
And I will dare to call Thee mine.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mbͻbͻr a ihu ͻkra a edͻ n’ ntsi,
Sesei pam bͻn a ikyir n’ ma ͻnkͻ;
Ma menyɛ dza Ͻwo egye to m’,
Ͻwo nà egye dza mepɛ to m’;
Ͻwo bɛpɛ dɛ efrɛ m’ Wodze,
Mobͻbͻ mbͻdzén afrɛ W’ medze.

MHB 750
4 . This day the covenant I sign,
The bond of sure and promised peace;
Nor can I doubt its power divine,
Since sealed with Jesu’s blood it is:
That blood I trust, that blood alone,
And make the covenant peace mine own.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ndɛ da ’i, megyé ahyɛmudzi n’ moto m’.
Bͻhyɛ nà asomdwee nkyekyeree n’;
M’adwen nnkɛyɛ m’ nàà, No tum ho,
Wͻdze Jesu bͻgyaa asͻw ano ’i.
Bͻgyà a motwer, dɛm bͻgya n’ nko,
Me nsa nkà ahyɛmudzi n’asomdwee n '

MHB 750
5 . But, that my faith no more may know
Or change, or interval, or end,
Help me in all Thy paths to go,
And gladden me with answer mild,
And commune, Father, with Thy child.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Dɛ me gyedzi nnkohu nsakyer,
Mber ntamu, anaa ewiei bio n’,
Boa m’ ma mennantsew W’akwan mu,
Na tsie me ndze sesei, dɛ daa n’,
Na fa mbuae pa hyɛ m’akoma m' dɛw,
Nà Egya, ’nye W’ Ba ndzi nkitaho.
		Amen.

MHB 751
1 . SEE  Israel’s gentle Shepherd stand
With all-engaging charms;
Hark! how He calls the tender lambs,
And folds them in His arms.
	 ~ 	1 . Hwɛ mbrɛ Israel Guanhwɛfo 
Esi dze dɔ gyina hɔ;
Tsie! ɔrefrɛ m- bɔtoaba,
Ɔreyɛ hɔn etuu.
Hɛn mba so nyɛ Wodze.   Amen.

MHB 751
2 . Permit them to approach, He cries,
Nor scorn their humble name;
For ’twas to bless such souls as these
The Lord of Angels came.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔse, Hom ngyaa hɔn ma wɔmbra, 
Mma hom mmbu hɔn 'nyimtsia!
Osian akra yinom n-tsi
Na Ewuradze bae.

MHB 751
3 . We bring them, Lord, in thankful hands,
And yield them up to Thee;
Joyful that we ourselves are Thine,
Thine let our offspring be.   Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. O, Ewuradze, ndaasem' ara 
Na yɛdze hɔn brɛ Wo,
Yedzi dɛw dɛ yɛyɛ Wodze,

MHB 752
1 . BLESSED Jesus, here we stand,
Met to do as Thou hast spoken;
And this child, at Thy command,
Now we bring to Thee, in token
That to Christ it here is given,
For of such shall be His heaven.
	 ~ 	1 . SIARFO Jesus, yegyina ha, 
Yeehyia m’ dɛ mbrɛ Ͻwo kae no;
Yɛdze dɛm abofra yi brɛ W’,
Dɛ mbrɛ ahyɛ hɛn dɛ yɛnyɛ n’,
Christ, yɛdze no ma W’ wͻ ha dɛm,
Yinom dɛm na wͻsɛ W’ heaven.
		Amen.

MHB 752
2 . Therefore hasten we to Thee;
Take the pledge we bring, o take him;
Let us here Thy glory see,
And in tender pity make him never,
Thine on earth, and Thine for ever.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ntsi yɛyɛ ntsɛm ba Wo hͻ:
O gye bͻhyɛ a yɛdze ba yi; 
Yenhu W’enyimnyam wͻ ha,
Na mbeberhu mapa mu ya n'
Wo ba sesei na mma nngyaa n’ da,
Yɛ n’ Wodze wͻ ha, na afebͻͻ.

MHB 752
3 . Now upon Thy heart it lies,
What our hearts so dearly treasure;
Heavenward lead our burdened sighs,
Pour Thy blessing without measure;
Write the name we now have given,
Write it in the book of Heaven.  Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Afei ͻda W’akoma mu.
Dza hɛn akoma pɛ no yie; 
Gyaa hɛn haw ho nkrumsi n’ sor;
Wo nhyira a wonnsusu no;
Kyerɛw dzin a yɛdze ama W’ sesei n’,
Kyerɛw n’ wͻ heaven buukuu no mu.

MHB 753
1 . FRIEND of the home, as when in Galilee
The mothers brought their little ones to Thee,
So we, dear Lord, would now the children bring,
And seek for them the shelter of Thy wing.
	 ~ 	1 . FIE Nyɛnko, dɛ mbrɛ osii Galilee ma
Abaatan dze hɔn mbɔtoaba brɛɛ Wo n',
Dɔ Ewuradze, hɛn so yɛdze mbofra 'i ba,
Na yɛpɛ dze hɔn ahyɛ W'astaban ase.
Wɔ sor, o Christ, ber a wiadze nda asa n'.  Amen.

MHB 753
2 . Thine are they, by Thy love’s eternal claim,
Thine we baptize them in the threefold Name;
Yet not the sign we trust, Lord, but the grace
That in Thy fold prepared the lambs a place.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wɔyɛ Wodze wɔ Wo dɔ a onnyi ewiei m',
Yenuma hɔn wɔ Nyame Ɔkorsa dzin mu:
Yɛnntwer nsɛmkyerɛdze, mbom Nyame N'adom n',
Ama eesiesie bea ama Wo nguambaa.

MHB 753
3 . Lord, may Thy Church, as with a mother’s care,
For Thee the lambs within her bosom bear;
And grant, as morning grows to noon, that they
Still in her love and holy service stay.
 Draw through the child the parents nearer Thee,
Endue their home with growing sanctity;
And gather all, by earthly homes made one,
In Heaven, O Christ, when earthly days are done.  Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, W'asɔr nyɛ dɛ ɔbaatan n' dɔ,
Ontur nguambaa yi wɔ no bom' mma Wo;
Na dom hɔn sɛ anapa twa m' ma ewia pue a,
Wɔnkɔ do ntsena dɔ na som krɔnkrɔn mu.

MHB 754
1 . STAND, soldier of the cross,
Thy high allegiance claim,
And vow to hold the world but loss
For thy Redeemer’s Name.
	 ~ 	1 . Ɔkofo, soɛr gyina, 
Suo Christ mbeamudua n' mu;
Fa wo Pomfo dzin ka ntam dɛ
Apow wiadze ndzɛmba
Hɔn gyedzi bedzi nyim!

MHB 754
2 . Arise, and be baptized,
And wash thy sins away;
Thy league with God be solemnized,
Thy faith avouched today.
	 ~ 	2 
. Soɛr ma wonnuma wo- 
Wɔnhor wo ho bɔn nyina;
'Nye wo Nyankopɔn ndzi ahyɛmu,
Ndɛ to wo gyedzi dzin.

MHB 754
3 . No more thine own, but Christ’s-
With all the saints of old,
Apostles, seers, evangelists,
And martyr throngs enrolled-
	 ~ 	3 
. Ndɛ Christ akowaa nye wo 
Wɔkan wo fora esiarfo n',
Ndɛ edɔm tsetse nkɔnhyɛfo n',
Na asomafo n' na atɔfo n'.

MHB 754
4 . In God’s whole armor strong,
Front hell’s embattled powers:
The warfare may be sharp and long,
The victory must be ours.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma Nyame akodze nyina 
Nhyɛ w' dzen; 'nye abɔnsam nko:
Ɔsa n' bɛyɛ dzen, ɔbɛkyɛr,
Na otwar dɛ yedzi nyim.

MHB 754
5 . O bright the conqueror’s crown,
The song of triumph sweet,
When faith casts every trophy down
At our great Captain’s feet !	 ~ 	5 
. Konyim abɔtsir n' a! 
Sor ndwom dɛɛdɛw bi n' a!
Yi na Sahen n' dze ma hɔn a

MHB 755
1 . LORD Jesus Christ, our Lord most dear,
As Thou wast once an infant here,
So give this child of Thine, we pray,
Thy grace and blessing day by day:

       O holy Jesus, Lord Divine,
       We pray Thee guard this child of Thine.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN Ewuradze pa Jesus Christ,
Ɔwo yɛɛ obofra pɛn wɔ ha,
Yɛserɛ Wo, ma W'abofra yi
Wo nhyira na W'adom dabiara.
       O Jesus krɔnkrɔn, Sor Ewuradze,
       Yɛserɛ Wo, weɔn W'abofra yi.

MHB 755
2 . As in Thy heavenly kingdom, Lord,
All things obey Thy sacred word,
Do Thou Thy mighty succour give,
And shield this child by morn and eve.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewuradze, Wo sor Ahenman mu n',
Ndzɛmba nyina tsie W'asɛm krɔnkrɔn n',
Osian dɛm ntsi ma hɛn Wo mboa,
Na kora abofra yi mber nyina.

MHB 755
3 . Their watch let angels round him keep
Where’er he be, awake, asleep;
Thy holy Cross now let him bear,
That he Thy crown with saints may wear.  Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Ma abɔfo nweɔn n' ntwa no ho nhyia
Beebiara, oenyan o, ɔada o;
Ma ɔnsoa Wo mbeamudua krɔnkrɔn n',
Ɔnye ahotsewfo aasoa ahenkyɛw n'. Amen.

MHB 756
3 BREAD of the world in mercy broken;
Wine of the soul in mercy shed,
By whom the words of life were spoken,
And in whose death our sins are dead:
Look on the heart by sorrow broken,
Look on the tears by sinners shed,
And be thy feast to us the token
that by thy grace our souls are fed..	 ~ 	3 WIADZE paanoo a wobubuu n' adom m',
Ɔkra wenyin a wokyii n' mbɔbɔrm';
Ɔwo na ekaa nkwa asɛm no,
Ɔwo ewu ma hɛn bɔn ewu;
Hwɛ akoma a yaw epira no,
Hwɛ nyinsu a ndzenbɔnyɛfo kyi,
Ma, W'edziban nyɛ nsɛnkyerɛdze

MHB 757
1 . Spread the table of the Lord,
Break the bread and pour the wine; 
Gathered at the sacred board, 
We would taste the feast divine.
	 ~ 	1 . WƆNTSERƐW Ewuradze pon no m',
Bubu paanoo na hue nsa n',
Yeehyia pon krɔnkrɔn no ho,
Yebedzi sor edziban no.
Yɛdze ɔpɛ pa bɔsom Wo.

MHB 757
2 . Saints and martyrs of the faith
To the Cross have turned their eyes, 
Sharing, in their life and death, 
That eternal sacrifice.
	 ~ 	2 
. Gyedzi m', 'hotsewfo atɔfo,
Adan hɔn enyi ahwɛ mbeamudua n',
Wɔwɔ afɔrbɔ yi m' kyɛfa,
Hɔn nkwa na hɔn wu mu nyina.

MHB 757
3 . Humbly now our place we claim 
In that glorious company, 
Proud confessors of the name, 
Breaking bread, O Christ,  with Thee.
	 ~ 	3 
. 'Hobrɛadze m' yɛper kyɛfa
Wɔ enyimnyam kuw no mu,
Dze dzin no hoahoa hɛnho;
O Christ, yɛnye W' bu paanoo n'.

MHB 757
4 . By the memory of Thy love,
To the glory of the Lord, 
Here we raise Thy Cross above, 
Gird us with Thy Spirit's sword.
	 ~ 	4 
. Wo dɔ ho nkaakaa no ntsi,
Yɛma mbeamudua n' do wɔ sor,
Dze hyɛ Ɔwo Nyame enyimnyam;
Fa W' Sunsum afowa twa hɛn ho.

MHB 757
5 . Guided by Thy mighty hand,
All Thy mind we would fulfil, 
Loyal to Thy least command, 
Serving Thee with steadfast will.	 ~ 	5 
. Wo tum nsa n' gya hɛn abamba ''i,
Yɛbɛhyɛ W'adwen nyin ama;
Yebedzi W' mbra biara do,

MHB 758
1 . I AM not worthy, holy Lord, 
That Thou shouldst come to me; 
Speak but the word : 
one gracious word Can set the sinner free.
	 ~ 	1 . Ewuradze Krɔnkrɔn, memmfata 
Dɛ 'Wo 'bɛba mo hɔ,
Kasa ara: ka adomsɛm kor, 
Na me kra ho bɛsan.
Bɛyhɛ m'akoma ma. Amen.

MHB 758
2 . I am not worthy; cold and bare 
The lodging of my soul; 
How canst Thou deign to enter there? 
Lord, speak, and make me whole.
	 ~ 	2  
. Memmfata: me kra mu tsenabew 
Yɛ nwinwin, yɛ nkɔnkɔw;
Ebɛyɛ dɛn ahɛn mu hɔ?
Kasa, na m'bɛtse apɔw.

MHB 758
3 . I am not worthy; yet, my God, 
How can I say Thee nay, Thee, 
who didst give Thy flesh and blood 
My ransom-price to pay?
	 ~ 	3  
. Memmfata dze; na m'bɛyɛ dɛn 
Mesiw me Nyame kwan?
Ɔwo a Wo honam nye bɔgyaa
Edze tɔɔ nkwa maa me.

MHB 758
4 . O come, In this sweet morning hour, 
Peed me with food divine; 
And fill with all Thy love and power 
This worthless heart of mine. 
		Amen.	 ~ 	4  
. Obra! Anapa *bɔw yi mu 
Fa Woho bɛnyɛn me;
Fa Wo dɔ nye Wo tum nyina

MHB 759
1 . AND now, O Father, mindful of the love
That bought us, once for all, on Calvary’s tree,
And having with us him that pleads above,
We here present, we here spread forth to thee
That only offering perfect in Thine eyes,
The one true, pure, immortal sacrifice.
	 ~ 	1 . Afei hɛn Egya yɛrekaa Wo dɔ n', 
Dɔ a ɔtɔɔ hɛn prɛko wɔ mbeamudua n' do n';
Na hɛn sor Dzimafo n' so wɔ ha yi,
Yɛtrɛ hɛn afɔrbɔdze mu ma Wo,
Afɔrbɔdze a no nko fata W'enyim,
Jesus, nokwar afɔrbɔdze a otsim.
nkyɛn da.   Amen.

MHB 759
2 . Look, Father, look on His anointed face,
And only look on us as found in Him;
Look not on our misusings of Thy grace,
Our prayer so languid, and our faith so dim:
For lo! between our sins and their reward
We set the Passion of thy Son our Lord.
	 ~ 	2 
. Jesus a wɔasera No n' na hwɛ N'enyim, 
Ehwɛ hɛn a, hwɛ hɛn wɔ Christ no mu;
Mma nnhwɛ hɛn dɛ yeetsiatsia W'adom do;
Mma nnhwɛ hɛn mpaabɔ nye gyedzi nwinwin n':
Na hwɛ! hɛn mfom nye hɔn ho akatua,
Wo Ba, hɛn Wura, N'amandzehu so ntam'.

MHB 759
3 . And then for those, our dearest and our best,
By this prevailing presence we appeal;
O fold them closer to Thy mercy’s breast,
O do Thine utmost for their soul’s true weal;
From tainting mischief keep them white and clear,
And crown Thy gifts with strength to persevere.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hɔn so a yɛdɔ hɔn kyɛn adze nyina n', 
Yedua Christ do yɛtotɔ serɛ ma hɔn;
O fa W'ehumbɔbɔr fua hɔn Wo bom',
Bɔ mbɔdzen nyina hɔn kra ne yie ho;
Sie hɔn krɔnn fi emumuyɛ nkekaa ho,
Fa dzenhyɛ wie dwuma n' ma wɔnkɔ kan.

MHB 759
4 . And so we come: O draw us to Thy feet,
Most patient Saviour, who canst love us still;
And by this food, so aweful and so sweet,
Deliver us from every touch of ill:
In thine own service make us glad and free,
And grant us never more to part with Thee.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. N-tsi yɛaba; twe hɛn pin W'anan ho, 
Agyenkwa pa a yɛafom mpo a edɔ hɛn;
Edziban dɛɛdɛw mu yɛ hu yi,
Dua do yi hɛn fi mbusu nyina ho:
Ma hɛn dɛw na fahodzi Wo som mu,
Na mma nngya hɛn mma yemmfi Wo

MHB 76
1 . THE King of love my Shepherd is, 
 Whose goodness faileth never; 
 I nothing lack if I am His 
 And He is mine for ever.
	 ~ 	1 . Ɔdɔ Hen nye mo Guanhwɛfo, 
N' ayamuyie mmpa ara da;
Meyɛ Nedze ma ɔyɛ medze aba,
Mirinnhia hweeara da.

MHB 76
2 . Where streams of living water flow 
 My ransomed soul He leadeth 
 And where the verdant pastures grow 
 With food celestial feedeth.
 	 ~ 	2 . Mbrɛ nkwa esutsen fi pem no, 
Hɔ na ogya me kra kɔ,
Ɔdze sor edziban nyɛn me
Wɔ mbrɛ m-funoma wɔ no.

MHB 76
3 . Perverse and foolish oft I strayed; 
 But yet in love He sought me, 
 And on His shoulder gently laid, 
 And home rejoicing brought me.
	 ~ 	3 . M-ber pii na mikyiin bɔn mu, 
Na ɔdze dɔ hwehwɛɛ me;
Ɔdze me too Ne batsir do
Dze me baa fie edɛw mu.

MHB 76
4 .  In death’s dark vale I fear no ill 
 With Thee, dear Lord, beside me; 
 Thy rod and staff my comfort still, 
 Thy cross before to guide me.
	 ~ 	4 . Owu bɔnsam' munnsuro mbusu, 
Ber a, mo Wura, ebɛn me;
W' abaw na Wo poma hyɛ m' dzen,
Na Woara idzi m' enyim.

MHB 76
5 . Thou spread'st a table in my sight; 
 Thy unction grace bestoweth; 
 And O what transport of delight 
 From Thy pure chalice floweth!
	 ~ 	5 . 'Wo na eto pon wɔ m' enyim; 
Ihue adom gu mo do;
Ao, enyigye bɛn na ofi
Wo kuraba mu bu do!

MHB 76
6 .  And so through all the length of days 
 Thy goodness faileth never; 
 Good Shepherd, may I sing Thy praise 
 Within Thy house for ever! Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Dɛm na W' ayamuyie mmpa ara da, 
Mo nkwa nda nyinara mu;
Mo Guanhwɛfo pa, ma montow
W' ayɛyi wɔ Wo fie daa!   Amen.

MHB 760
1 . SAVIOUR, and can it be
That Thou shouldst dwell with me?
From Thy high and lofty throne,
Throne of everlasting bliss,
Will Thy majesty stoop down
To so mean a house as this?
	 ~ 	1 . GYEFO, na ɔbɛyɛ dɛ
Ebɛtsena emi mo mu?
Ifi W'ahengua pa do,
'Hengua a nhyira wɔ ho afebɔɔ 'i,
Obirɛpɔn ''bɔto W'ho famu
Abɛhɛn dɛm fie yi mu?
Bɛhɛn fie yi mu tsew ho.  Amen.

MHB 760
2 . I am not worthy, Lord,
So foul, so self-abhorred,
Thee, my God, to entertain
In this poor polluted heart:
I so frail and full of sin,
All my nature cries: Depart!
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewuradze, memmfata,
Mo ho yɛ nkɔw yie!
Dɛ me Nyame, megye Wo
Wɔ akoma a aprɔw yi mu:
'Mi bɔnyɛnyi kohwinyi;
M'abrabɔ ka mu dɛ: Gya m' hɔ.

MHB 760
3 . Yet come, Thou heavenly Guest,
And purify my breast;
Come, Thou great and glorious King,
While before thy cross I bow;
With Thyself salvation bring,
Cleanse the house by entering now.   Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Na bra, Ɔwo a fi sor,
Na bɛtsew mo bo ho;
Bra, Ɔwo ''nyimnyam Hen pa,
Ber a mokotow Wo mbeamudua ''i,
Woara fa Wo nkwagye n' bra,

MHB 761
1 . JESUS, we thus obey
Thy last and kindest word;
Here in thine own appointed way
We come to meet Thee, Lord.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, yetsie W'asɛm,
W'ewiei na adɔyɛ asɛm;
Wɔ Wo mber pa mu wɔ ha no,
Hɛn Wura, yɛba bheyia W'.
Frankaa no wɔ hɛn do.  Amen.

MHB 761
2 . Our hearts we open wide, 
To make the Saviour room;
And lo, the Lamb, the Crucified,
The sinner’s Friend, is come.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yebua hɛn akoma m',
Ma Agyenkwa n' aaba m',
Na hwɛ! Eguambaa a wokum No n',
Abɔn adamfo n' aba.

MHB 761
3 . Thy presence makes the feast;
Now let our spirits feel
Thy glory not to be expressed,
The joy unspeakable.
	 ~ 	3 
. Wo mbae ma hɛn enyigye:
Ndɛ ma hɛn sunsum ntse
Enyimnyam a onnyi kabea,
Enyigye a wɔnnka mpo:

MHB 761
4 . With high and heavenly bliss
Thou dost our spirits cheer;
Thy house of banqueting is this 
And Thou hast brought us here.
	 ~ 	4 
. Edze ahenman mu dɛw
Kyekye hɛn akra werɛ.
Fie yi yɛ W'apontu fie pa,
Na edze hɛn aba ha.

MHB 761
5 . Now let our souls be fed
With manna from above,
And over us Thy banner spread 
Of everlasting love.    Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. O fa sor edziban
Nyɛn hɛn akra dabaa,
Na tserɛw Wo dɔ a onnyi ewiei

MHB 762
1 . IN memory of the Saviour’s love
We keep the sacred feast,
Where every humble, contrite heart
Is made a welcome guest
	 ~ 	1 . Agyenkwa no dɔ ho nkaa ntsi 
Na yɛaba pon yi ho:
Ha na Jesus to nsa dze frɛ
Hɔn a woenu hɔnho.
Na yɛsɔ hwɛ wɔ ha.

MHB 762
2 . By faith we take the bread of life
With which our souls are fed,
The cup in token of His blood
That was for sinners shed.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛnam gyedzim' fa nkwa paano 
Yɛdze nyɛn hɛn akra;
Yɛnom wenyin dze kaa bɔgya a
Ogui maa abɔn no.

MHB 762
3 . Under His banner thus we sing
The wonders of His love,
And thus anticipate by faith
The heavenly feast above.   Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Ha na yɛtow ndwom yɛkamfo 
Jesus N'anwanwa dɔ;
Da bi sor aponto edziban

MHB 763
1 . ACCORDING to Thy gracious word,
  In meek humility,
This will I do, my dying Lord,
  I will remember Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . Dɛ mbrɛ W'adom Asɛm no tse, 
Ahobrɛadzem' ara
Yi na m'bɛyɛ, m'Ewuradze a
'Ruwu, mebɛkaa Wo.
Jesus, ɔyɛ a kaa me.

MHB 763
2 . Thy body, broken for my sake,
  My bread from heaven shall be;
Thy testamental cup I take,
  And thus remember Thee.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wo honam a 'mi ntsi wobui n' 
Bɛyɛ mo sor paanoo;
W'ahyɛmudze kuraba n' na megye,
Ma medze makaa Wo.

MHB 763
3 . When to the cross I turn mine eyes
  And rest on Calvary,
O Lamb of God, my sacrifice,
  I must remember Thee-
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ medan m'enyi hwɛ mbeamudua n' 
Na mohom Calvary hɔ a
Nyame Egumba e, m'afɔrdze e,
Otwar dɛ mekaa Wo.

MHB 763
4 . Remember Thee and all Thy pains,
  And all Thy love to me;
Yea, while a breath, a pulse remains,
 I will remember Thee.
	 ~ 	4 
. M'bɛkaa W' ɔnnye Wo fona nyina, 
Nye Wo dɔ a adɔ m' nyina 
Nyew ber a ahom kakra wɔ hɔ 'i
M'bɛda ho ara makaa W'.

MHB 763
5 . And when these failing lips grow dumb
  And mind and memory flee,
When Thou shalt in Thy kingdom come,  
Jesus, remember me.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Na aber a mobɔtɔ mmum 
Na adwen na nkaa bɛhera n'
Ber a 'nam W'ahendzim' bɛba n'

MHB 764
1 . AUTHOUR of life divine,
Who hast a table spread,
Furnished with mystic wine
And everlasting bread,
Preserve the life Thyself hast given,
And feed and train us up for Heaven.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆSOR n-kwa Mafo,
Ɔwo a ''dze sunsum m' nsa
Na onnyiewiei paanoo,
Ato hɛn pon nwanwa,
Kora nkwa a edze ama hɛn no,
Nyɛn hɛn, tsetse hɛn ma heaven.
Dɛm na yehu W'enyim petee. Amen.

MHB 764
2 . Our needy souls sustain
With fresh supplies of love,
Till all Thy life we gain,
And all Thy fullness prove,
And, strengthened by Thy perfect grace,
Behold without a veil Thy face.  Amen.	 ~ 	2 
. Hyɛ hɛn akra ehiafo dzen
Wɔ ɔdɔ fofor koraa mu;
Ber a yenya Wo nkwa no,
Na yehu W'emudzi n',
Na W'adom mapa ahyɛ hɛn dzen n',

MHB 765
1 . COME, Thou everlasting Spirit,
Bring to every thankful mind
All the Saviour’s dying merit,
All His sufferings for mankind:
	 ~ 	1 . BRA, Ɔwo Sunsum bɛkyebo,
Ma Agyenkwa N' wu ho siar
Na N'adasa ho amandzehu n',
Mbra adwen a ɔwɔ nkaa biara m'.
Ma emi na ɔkra bia 'a nya Christ.   Amen.

MHB 765
2 . True recorder of His passion,
Now the living faith impart,
Now reveal His great salvation,
Preach his gospel to our heart.
	 ~ 	2 
. No dɔ ho Kyerɛwfo nokwafo,
Petse gyedzi a otsim hɔ daa n';
Da No nkwagye kɛse n' edzi,
Bɔ N' nsɛmpa n' dawur kyerɛ hɛn.

MHB 765
3 . Come,Thou witness of His dying;
Come, remembrancer divine,
Let us feel Thy power, applying
Christ to every soul, and mine.    Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Bra, o No wu ho Dasefo;
Bra, Ɔwo sor Kaakaafo,
Ma yɛntse Wo tum ne nka, na

MHB 766
1 . BE known to us in breaking bread,
But do not then depart;
Saviour, abide with us, and spread
Thy table in our heart.
	 ~ 	1 . Ma yenhu W' ber a yeridzidzi, 
Na mma nn-dan hɛn nngya;
Agyenkwa, nye hɛn ntsena, na to
Wo pon hɛn 'koma mu.
Nyɛ hɛn edziban daa.   Amen.

MHB 766
2 . There sup with us in love divine;
Thy body and Thy blood,
That living bread, that heavenly wine,
Be our immortal food.  Amen.	 ~ 	2  
. Enye hɛn ndzidzi Nyame dɔm'; 
Wo honam na bɔgyaa,
N-kwa paanoo, sor wenyin no,

MHB 767
1 . Come, Holy Ghost, Thine influence shed,
And realize the sign ;
Thy life infuse into the bread,
Thy power into the wine.
	 ~ 	1 . SUNSUM Krɔnkrɔn, bɛhyɛ hɛn do,
Na yenhu nsɛnkyerɛdze;
Ma Wo nkwa mbra paanoo no mu,
Wo tum nhyɛ nsa no mu.
Nhɛn nokwar akoma biara m'. Amen.

MHB 767
2 . Effectual let the tokens prove
And made, by heavenly art,
Fit channels to convey Thy love
To every faithful heart.  Amen.	 ~ 	2 
. Ma nsɛnkyerɛdze 'i nda edzi petee,
Na ma ɔmfa sor kwan do;
Siesie akwan ma wɔmfa W' dɔ n'

MHB 768
1 . O BREAD to pilgrims given,
O Food that angels eat,
O Manna sent from heaven,
For heaven-born natures meet,
Give us, for Thee long pining,
To eat till richly filled;
Till, earth’s delights resigning,
Our every wish is stilled.
	 ~ 	1 . O AKWANTUFO paanoo,
Edziban a abɔfo dzi,
O Manna a ofi sor ba
Ma hɔn a hɔn awoo fo sor, 
Fa ma hɛn, hɛn enyi da kwan
Dɛ yebedzi amee,
'Kodu wiadze enyigye ewiei,
Hɛn pɛ nyina bɔbɔ adze.
Yeehu W'enyim ne hyerɛn n'. Amen.

MHB 768
2 . O water, life-bestowing,
Forth from the Saviour’s heart
A fountain purely flowing,
A fount of love Thou art:
O let us, freely tasting,
Our burning thirst assuage;
Thy sweetness, never wasting,
Avails from age to age.
	 ~ 	2 
. O Nsu, ɔwo a ema nkwa,
Fi Agyenkwa n' N'akoma m',
N-subura krɔnn a ɔpem,
Eyɛ ɔdɔ nsubura,
O ma hɛn so nsɔ Wo nhwɛ,
Na dwedwe hɛn nsukɔm;
Wo dɛw no nnsa ara da,
Ɔwɔ hɔ afebɔɔ.

MHB 768
3 . Jesus, this feast receiving,
We Thee unseen adore;
Thy faithful word believing,
We take, and doubt no more:
Give us, Thou true and loving,
On earth to live in thee;
Then, death the veil removing,
Thy glorious face to see.    Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Jesus, yɛgye edziban yi,
'Wo a yennhu W; yehuhor W';
Yɛgye Wo nokwasɛm dzi,
Yɛgye, yɛnngye kyim bio:
Nokwafo dɔyɛfo, dom hɛn,
Yɛntsena Wo mu wiadze;
Sɛ owu twamu tam rifi hɔ a,

MHB 769
1 . BREAD of Heaven on Thee I feed,
For Thy flesh is meat indeed:
Ever may our souls be fed
With this true and living Bread;
Day by day with strength supplied,
Through the life of Him Who died.
	 ~ 	1 . Sor paano a enyɛn me, 
'Wo 'yɛ edziban ampa:
Ma nokwar nkwa paano yi
Nyɛn me kra daa daa nyina;
Ɔwo a iwui na etse ase,
Minnya Wo mu ahoɔdzen daa.
Ma mintsim wo mu pintsinn. Amen.

MHB 77
1 . What shall I do my God to love, 
 My loving God to praise 
 The length, and breadth, and height to prove, 
 And depth of sovereign grace ?
	 ~ 	1 . Minsi dɛn mondɔ me Nyame, 
Minsi dɛn nyi N' ayɛw?
Minsi dɛn nhu N' adom no war,
Ne trɛ, no krɔn, no bun?

MHB 77
2 . Thy sovereign grace to all extends, 
 Immense and unconfined; 
 From age to age it never ends; 
 It reaches all mankind.
	 ~ 	2 . W' adom tsen du obiara do, 
Na onnyi mbanano;
Ɔto adasamba nyina;
Ɔwɔ hɔ afebɔɔ.

MHB 77
3 . Throughout the world its breadth is known, 
 Wide as infinity; 
 So wide it never passed by one, 
 Or it had passed by me.
	 ~ 	3 . Odu wiadze tɛtɛr nyina, 
Ne trɛ nnyi mbanano;
Ɔtrɛ ma onngya baako mpo,
N-kyɛ ɔpaa mo ho.

MHB 77
4 . My trespass was grown up to heaven; 
 But far above the skies, 
 In Christ abundantly forgiven, 
 I see thy mercies rise.
	 ~ 	4 . Mo mfom nyinii dur sorsor no; 
W' ehumbɔbɔr traa hɔ;
Christ no mu edoom me fakyɛ,
Fakyɛ a wɔnnto n' abaw.

MHB 77
5 . The depth of all-redeeming love 
 what angel tongue can tell? 
 O may I to the utmost prove 
 The gift unspeakable.
	 ~ 	5 . Sor abɔfo bɛn botum akyerɛ 
Wo nkwagye dɔ n' no bun?
W' akyɛdze a onnyi kabea yi,
Ao, ma monsɔ monhwɛ.

MHB 77
6 . Come quickly, gracious Lord, and take 
 Possession of Thine own; 
 My longing heart vouchsafe to make 
 Thine everlasting throne.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 . Bra ntsɛm, adom Ewuradze, 
Bɛfa Woara Wodze;
W' adaworom, bɛyɛ m' akoma
W' ahengua afebɔɔ.     Amen.

MHB 770
1 . JESUS, to Thy table led,
Now let every heart be fed
With the true and living Bread.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, yɛaba Wo pon ho,
Fa nkwa paanoo mapa no
Nyɛn akoma biara sesei.
Wɔ kan na man pa no mu.    Amen.

MHB 770
2 . While in penitence we kneel,
Thy sweet presence let us feel,
All Thy wondrous love reveal.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛdze nnuho kotow ha 'i,
Ma yenhu W'enyim fɛɛfɛw n',
Yi Wo dɔ nwanwa n' kyerɛ hɛn.

MHB 770
3 . While on Thy dear cross we gaze,
Mourning o’er our sinful ways,
Turn our sadness into praise.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ber a yɛhwɛ W'asɛndua yi,
'Ridzi mbɔɔ wɔ hɛn bɔn ho 'i,
Ma hɛn awerɛhow ndan ayɛyi.

MHB 770
4 . When we taste the mystic wine,
Of Thine outpoured blood the sign,
Fill our hearts with love divine.
	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ yɛnom wenyin nwanwa a
Ɔkyerɛ Wo bɔgyaa a ihuee a,
Fa sor dɔ n' hyɛ hɛn akoma m'.

MHB 770
5 . Draw us to Thy wounded side,
Whence there flowed the healing tide;
There our sins and sorrows hide.
	 ~ 	5 
. Twe hɛn bɛn W'epirakur ho,
Mbrɛ 'yarsa nsu fi pem no,
Hɔ hɛn bɔn na yaw suma.

. Ma Wo pira nsa n' nkyerɛ hɛn kwan
Nkodu W'ahengua no ho,

MHB 770
6 . From the bonds of sin release,
Cold and wavering faith increase;
Lamb of God, grant us Thy peace.
	 ~ 	6 
. Gye hɛn fi bɔn no mpokyerɛ m',
Hɛn gyedzi nwinwin ndzi mu,
'Guambaa, ma hɛn W'asomdwee.

MHB 771
1 . VICTIM divine, Thy grace we claim,
While thus Thy precious death we show;
Once offered up, a spotless Lamb,
In Thy great temple here below,
Thou didst for all mankind atone,
And standest now before the throne.
	 ~ 	1 . 'MANDZEHUNYI, yɛgye W'adom,
Ber a yɛkyerɛ Wo wu a ɔsom bo n',
'Guambaa krɔnn a wɔdze W' mae prɛko,
Eyɛɛ mpata maa adasa nyina
Wɔ W'asɔrfi m' wɔ asaase ha,
Na igyina ahengua n' enyim.
Na yenhu W'ankasa wɔ ha.  Amen.

MHB 771
2 . Thou standest in the holy place,
As now for guilty sinners slain:
The blood of sprinkling speaks, and prays,
All prevalent for helpless man;
Thy blood is still our ransom found,
And spreads salvation all around.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔwo gyina krɔnkrɔnbea ha,
Ber a woekum Wo ama abɔn;
Bɔgya petsee n' kasa, bɔ mpaa,
Na ɔwɔ hɔ ma nyimpa abrɛfo;
Wo bɔgyaa n' da ho ara pon hɛn
Na ɔka nkwagyesɛm wɔ mbea nyina.

MHB 771
3 . We need not now go up to heaven,
To bring the long-sought Saviour down;
Thou art to all already given,
Thou dost even now Thy banquet crown:
To every faithful soul appear,
And show Thy real presence here.    Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Onnhia dɛ yɛbɔkɔ heaven
Akɛfa Agyekwan n' aba ha;
'Dze Woho ama obiara dada,
W'aponto ase na wɔakrɔn Wo:
Yi Woho kyerɛ akra nokwafo,

MHB 772
1 . HERE, O my Lord, I see Thee face to face;
Here would I touch and handle things unseen;
Here grasp with firmer hand eternal grace,
And all my weariness upon thee lean.
	 ~ 	1 . O Ewuradze, ha na muhu W'enyim, 
Ha na mepɛ mesuo dza wonnhu mu;
Morohwehwɛ menya Nyame N'adom,
Na medze me berɛ mato Wo do.
Na yɛsɔ ne dɛw hwɛ ase ha yi.

MHB 772
2 . Here would I feed upon the Bread of God,
Here drink with thee the royal Wine of heaven;
Here would I lay aside each earthly load,
Here taste afresh the calm of sin forgiven.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ha na m'bedzi Onyame edziban, 
Na menye Wo anom ɔsor wenyin;
Na medze m'adzesoa mato n-kyɛn
Na makaa Wo fakyɛ ne dɛw no bio.

MHB 772
3 . This is the hour of banquet and of song;
This is the heavenly table spread for me;
Here let me feast, and feasting, still prolong
The hallowed hour of fellowship with Thee.
	 ~ 	3 
. Edzidzi na adwontow aber nye yi, 
Ɔsor pon na wɔato ama me yi.
Ma menye Wo mbɔ mu yendzidzi ha,
Na enye me ndzi nkitaho dɛɛdɛw.

MHB 772
4 . I have no help but Thine; nor do I need
Another arm save Thine to lean upon;
It is enough, my Lord, enough indeed;
My strength is in thy might, thy might alone.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔnnkyɛr na wɔakata nsɛnkyerɛdze n' do: 
Aponto n' etwam'; dɔ no dze nntwam' da.
Woyi paano na wenyin no kɔ mpo a
'Wo, hɛn Kyɛm na Ewia, ebɛn hɛn daa.

MHB 772
5 . Mine is the sin, but Thine the righteousness:
Mine is the guilt, but thine the cleansing
Here is my robe, my refuge, and my peace;
Thy Blood, Thy righteousness, O Lord my God!
	 ~ 	5 
. Minnyi mboa bi dɛ Wo nko Wodze no, 
Na onnhia mpo dɛ motwer obi so.
M'Ewuradze, Woara dɔɔ so ma me,
Wo tum n-ko ara nye m'ahoɔdzen.

MHB 772
6 . Feast after feast thus comes and passes by,
Yet, passing, points to the glad feast above,
Giving sweet foretaste of the festal joy,
The Lamb’s great bridal feast of bliss and love.	 ~ 	6  
. Mber pii na yɛaba W'edzidziase: 
Ne nyina kyerɛ hɛn sor dze kɛse no,
Sor edziban a da bi yebedzi

MHB 773
1 . BY Christ redeemed, in Christ restored,
We keep the memory adored,
And show the death of our dear Lord
Until He come.
	 ~ 	1 . Christ abɔ werdam apon hɛn, 
No ho nkaabɔdze na yɛyɛ yi;
Yɛkyerɛ hɛn Wura No wu kɛpem
Da a ɔbɛba.
Da a ɔbɛba.

MHB 773
2 . His body, broken in our stead,
Is here in this memorial bread,
And so our feeble love is fed
Until he come.
	 ~ 	2 
. No honam a wobui maa hɛn 
Wɔ nkaabɔ paano yi mu ha,
Ɔno na ɔnyɛn hɛn dɔ kɛpem
Da a ɔbɛba.

MHB 773
3 . The drops of His dread agony,
His life-blood shed for us, we see;
The wine shall tell the mystery
Until He come.
	 ~ 	3 
. Bɔgya a oruwu a okyii no 
Wenyin yi yɛ ho sɛnkyerɛdze.
Yɛbɔnom ara akɛpem
Da a ɔbɛba.

MHB 773
4 . And thus that dark betrayal night
With the last advent we unite,
By one blest chain of loving rite,
Until He come.
	 ~ 	4 
. Anago bɔn a wonyii N' mae n' 
Na Ne mbae a odzi ekyir no
Yɛdze dɔ nyɛbea bɔm' kɛpem
Da a ɔbɛba.

MHB 773
5 . O blessed hope! With this elate,
Let not out hearts be desolate,
But strong in faith, in patience wait
Until He come.	 ~ 	5 
. O, asɛm pa a ɔhyɛ hɛn dzeen!  
Ɔma hɛn akomatɔmu.
Hom mma yengyina dzen nkɛpem

MHB 774
1 . O GOD of love, to Thee we bow,
And pray for these before Thee now,
That, closely knit in holy vow,
They may be in Thee one.
	 ~ 	1 . O ƆDƆ Nyame, yɛkotow W',
Na bɔ mpaa ma hɔn a wɔaba ha 'i,
Wɔaka abɔ m' wɔ nsewdzi krɔnkrɔn m',
Ma wɔnye Wo nyɛ kor.
Hɔn a Ɔwo yɛ hɔn kor n'.

MHB 774
2 . When days are filled with pure delight,
When paths are plain and skies are bright,
Walking by faith and not by sight,
May they be in Thee one.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ber a enyigye pa ahyɛ nda mu n',
Ber a akwan m' da hɔ na wimu yɛ kann,
Wɔnam gyedzi m', nnyɛ dza wonnhu m',
Ma wɔnye Wo nyɛ kor.

MHB 774
3 . When stormy winds fulfill Thy will,
And all their good seems turned to ill,
Then, trusting in Thee completely, still
May they be in Thee one.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ ehum hyɛ hɔn pɛ ma a,
Na hɔn ndzepa nyinara sɛɛ a,
Na wɔgye Wo dzi koraa ntsi,
Ma wɔnye Wo nyɛ kor.

MHB 774
4 . Whate’er in life shall be their share
Of quickening joy or burdening care,
In power to do and grace to bear,
May they be in Thee one.
	 ~ 	4 
. Dza ɔwɔ ɔbra m' bɛyɛ hɔndze,
Enyigye anaa dadwen mu o,
Tum a wɔdze yɛ, adom a wɔdze sɔw o.
Ma wɔnye Wo nyɛ kor.

MHB 774
5 . Eternal love ,with them abide;
In Thee for ever may they hide,
For even death cannot divide
Those whom Thou makest  one	 ~ 	5 
. Onnyiewiei Dɔ, enye hɔn ntsena;
Fa hɔn sie Wo mu afebɔɔ,
Na owu mpo nnkotum atsew hɔn mu,

MHB 775
1 . THE voice that breathed o’er Eden, 
That earliest wedding-day, 
The primal wedding blessing, 
It hath not passed away.
	 ~ 	1 . N-dze a wɔtsee wɔ Eden 
Ayerhyia kan n-dze n',
Asɔpɔn awar nhyira n'
Ɔda ho ara wɔ hɔ.
N' Ayefor no bɔsoɛr.

MHB 775
2 . Still in the pure espousal 
Of Christian man and maid 
The Holy Three are with us, 
The threefold grace is said.
	 ~ 	2 
. Christian ɔbaa na barimba 
So rokɔ awar a,
Nyame Ɔkorsa wɔm' bi,
Na yɛserɛ Ne nhyira:

MHB 775
3 . For dower of blessèd children, 
For love and faith’s sweet sake, 
For high mysterious union 
Which naught on earth may break.
	 ~ 	3 
. Dɛ ɔndom hɔn m-ba pa, 
Nye dɔ na nokwardzi,
Na ɔndom hɔn koryɛ bi a
Biribiara nntum mmpa mu.

MHB 775
4 . Be present, O our Father, 
To give away this bride 
As Thou gavest Eve to Adam, 
A helpmate at his side.
	 ~ 	4  
. Sor Egya, Woara bɛfa, 
Ayefor yi ma awar,
Dɛ mbrɛ 'dze Eve maa Adam,
Fii noara ne mfem' no.

MHB 775
5 . Be present, gracious Saviour, 
To join their loving hands,
As Thou didst bind two natures 
In Thine eternal bands.
	 ~ 	5 
. Agyenkwa domfo, bra na 
Bɛka hɔn bɔm' ɔdɔm',
Dɛ mbrɛ edze su ebien
Bɔɔm' wɔ Woara Wo mu n'

MHB 775
6 . Be present, Holy Spirit, 
To bless them as they kneel, 
As Thou for Christ, the Bridegroom, 
The heavenly Spouse dost seal.
	 ~ 	6 
. Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, behyira hɔn, 
Ber a wɔrobɔ mpaa yi,
Dɛ mbrɛ ehyira Christ N'Asɔr
Ma ɔyɛ N'Ayefor n'.

MHB 775
7 . O spread Thy pure wing o’er them, 
Let no ill power find place, 
When onward through life’s journey 
Their hallowed path they trace.
	 ~ 	7  
. Tserɛw W'atsaban wɔ hɔn do, 
Pa hɔn mbusu nyina,-
Ber a worutu anamɔn
Ba W'afɔrmbukyia ho,

MHB 775
8 . To cast their crowns before Thee, 
In perfect sacrifice, 
Till to the home of gladness 
With Christ’s own Bride they rise. 	 ~ 	8  
. Dze hɔn 'nyimnyam abɔtsir 
Abɔbɔ Wo afɔr,-
Kɛpem dɛ wɔnye Agyenkwa

MHB 776
1 . O FATHER all creating,
Whose wisdom, love and power
First bound two lives together
In Eden’s primal hour,
To-day, to these Thy children
Thine earliest gifts renew:
A home by Thee made happy,
A love by Thee kept true.
	 ~ 	1 . Egya, adze nyina Yɛfo, 
Wo nyansaa, tum na dɔ
Dzii kan dze akra ebien bɔɔm'
Wɔ Eden ture mu;
N-dɛ fa nkan n' akyɛdze n'
Ma Wo mbofra yi so,
Ofi a W'asomdwee wɔ mu,
Ɔdɔ a nokwardzi wɔm'.
Yɛ dɔ a ɔmmbɔ adze da.

MHB 776
2 . O Saviour, guest most bounteous
Of old in Galilee,
Vouchsafe to-day Thy presence
With these who call on Thee;
Their store of earthly gladness
Transform to heavenly wine,
And teach them, in the tasting,
To know the gift is Thine.
