	 ~ 	2 
. Gyefo a ekɔr Galilee 
Ayeforase hɔ,
N-dɛ so fa enyimpa ma
Hɔn a wɔfrɛ Wo yi:
Ma hɔn wiadze enyigye
Ɔndan sor enyingye
Na wɔsɔ hwɛ a, ma wonhu
Dɛ Woara W'akyɛdze a.

MHB 776
3 . O Spirit of the Father, 
On them from above,
So mighty in Thy pureness,
So tender in Thy love,
That guarded by Thy presence,
From sin and strife kept free,
Their lives may own Thy guidance,
Their hearts be ruled by Thee.
	 ~ 	3 
. O Nyame Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, 
Ɔwo a Wo dɔ yɛ dzen,
W'ahotsewee so dzi mu,
Fi sor gu hɔn do ahom,
Ama Woara wowaw hɔn
Fi ntokwaa ho n-tsi,
Hɔn bra aakyerɛ dɛ 'Wo na 
Ehyɛ hɔn 'koma do.

MHB 776
4 . Except Thou build it, Father,
The house is built in vain;
Except Thou, Saviour, bless it,
The joy will turn to pain:
But nought can break the union
Of hearts in Thee made one;
And love Thy spirit hallows
Is endless love begun.	 ~ 	4 
. Egya, Woara ennsi dan yi a, 
Wɔnnkɛfa edu beebi;
Gyefo, Woara ennhyira do a,
Hɔn dɛw bɛdan hɔn yaw;
Na hweeara nnkotum asɛɛ
Awar a ehyira do;
Ɔdɔ a Wo Sunsum tsew ho

MHB 777
1 . O PERFECT Love, all human thought transcending,
Lowly we kneel in prayer before Thy throne,
That theirs may be the love which knows no ending,
Whom Thou forevermore dost join in one.
	 ~ 	1 . O ƆDƆ mapa, ebor nyimpa adwen do,
Yɛkotow W'ahengua enyim na yɛserɛ
Dɛ hɔn a eka hɔn bɔ m' afebɔɔ yi
Nnya ɔdɔ a no do nntwa da biara da.
Dza ɔdze onnyiewiei dɔ na nkwa ba.  Amen.

MHB 777
2 . O perfect Life, be Thou their full assurance
Of tender charity and steadfast faith,
Of patient hope and quiet, brave endurance,
With childlike trust that fears nor pain nor death.
	 ~ 	2 
. O N-kwa mapa, yɛ hɔn awerɛhyɛm' koraa,
Ayamuyie mapa na gyedzi a otsim,
Abotar enyidar, 'kokodur a ɔsɔw berɛ,
Awerɛhyɛmu a onnsuro yaw na owu.

MHB 777
3 . Grant them the joy which brightens earthly sorrow,
Grant them the peace which calms all earthly strife;
And to life’s day the glorious unknown morrow
That dawns upon eternal love and life.    Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Dom hɔn dɛw a ɔsesa wiadze awerɛhow,
Dom hɔn asomdwee a ɔdwedwe 
wiadze haw;
Ma hɔn nkwa nda mu enyimnyam adzekyee,

MHB 778
1 . HOW beauteous are their feet
Who stand on Zion’s hill;
Who bring salvation in their tongues,
And words of peace reveal !
	 ~ 	1 . HƆN a wogyina Zion ho n',
Mbrɛ hɔn anan ho yɛ fɛw a!
Wɔka nkwagye nsɛmpa no daa,
Na wɔda asomdwee edzi.
Hɛn Gyefo na Nyame

MHB 778
2 . How cheering is their voice,
How sweet the tidings are!
Zion, behold thy Saviour King;
He reigns and triumphs here.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɔn ndze ma awerɛkyekyer,
Hɔn nsɛm so ne dɛw a!
Zion, hwɛ W'Agyenkwa Ɔhen no;
Odzi Hen, dzi nyim ha.

MHB 778
3 . How blessed are our ears
That hear this joyful sound,
Which kings and prophets waited for,
And sought, but never found.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mbrɛ woesi ehyira hɛn aso a!
Ɔtse dɛ ndze dɛɛdɛw a
Nkɔnhyɛfo na ahemfo tweɔnee,
Na wɔhwehwɛe a woennhu n'.

MHB 778
4 . How blessed are our eyes
That see this heavenly light,
Prophets and kings desired long,
But died without the sight.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mbrɛ woehyira hɛn enyiwa a
Ohu dɛm sor kan yi a!
Nkɔnhyɛfo na ahemfo peer ho,
Na wowui a woennhu.

MHB 778
5 . The watchmen join their voice,
And tuneful notes employ;
Jerusalem breaks forth in songs,
And deserts learn the joy.
	 ~ 	5 
. Aweɔmfo n' dze ndze kor,
Maa ndwom dɛdɛɛdɛw do;
Jerusalem so ma ndwom do,
Sardofo tse ne dɛw n'.

MHB 778
6 . The Lord makes bare His arm
Through all the earth abroad:
Let all the nations now behold
Their Saviour and their God.	 ~ 	6 
. Ewuradze tserɛw N'abaw m'
Wɔ wiadze nyina do;
Wɔmma wiadze nyinara nhu

MHB 779
1 . COME, Holy Ghost, our souls inspire,
And lighten with celestial fire;
Thou the anointing Spirit art,
Who dost Thy sevenfold gifts impart:
	 ~ 	1 . SUNSUM Krɔnkrɔn, tsena hɛn kra mu,
Na ma Wo gya mfi sor nhyerɛn;
Edze sunsum ngo sera hɛn,
Na ema akyɛdze horow.
    Egya, Ɔba, nye Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn!  Amen.

MHB 779
2 . Thy blessed unction from above
Is comfort, life, and fire of love; 
Enable with perpetual light
The dullness of our blinded sight:
	 ~ 	2 
. W'adom ngohuam a ofi sor
Yɛ awerɛkyekyer, nkwa na dɔ;
Na Wo kan a onndum da no
Nhyerɛn hɛn do, ɔmpa hɛn sum.

MHB 779
3 . Anoint and cheer our soiled face
With the abundance of Thy grace:
Keep far our foes, give peace at home;
Where Thou art Guide no ill can come.
	 ~ 	3 
. Fa W'adom mbordo n oma hɛn,
Ɔnsera hɛn, ɔntsew hɛn enyim;
Pam atamfo, ma asomdwee;
Mbrɛ ewɔ mbusu nntum mmba hɔ.

MHB 779
4 . Teach us to know the Father, Son,
And Thee, of both, to be but One;
That through the ages all along
This, this may be our endless song:

     All praise to Thy eternal merit,
     O Father, Son, and Holy Spirit !     Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Kyerɛ hɛn ma yenhu dɛ Egya n'
Ɔnye Ɔba n' nye Wo yɛ kor;
Ama ber a onnyi ewiei mu
Iyi nko aayɛ hɛn daa ndwom, -
     Ayɛyi nka Wo dzin mbersantsen;

MHB 78
1 . How shall I sing that majesty 
 which angels do admire? 
 let dust in dust and silence lie; 
 sing, sing, ye heavenly choir. 
 Thousands of thousands stand around 
 Thy throne, O God most high; 
 Ten thousand times ten thousand sound 
 Thy praise; but who am I ?
	 ~ 	1 . M'BƐYƐ dɛn atow ahentum a
Abɔfo pɛ ho n' ndwom?
Huntuma m' huntuma nyɛ komm;
Ma sor adwontofo ntow,
Mpempem gyina W'ahengua ho,
O ɔsorsor Nyame;
Ɔpedu tow W'ayɛyi ndwom,
Na mo so nye woana?

MHB 78
2 . Thy brightness unto them appears; 
 whilst I Thy footsteps trace 
 A sound of God comes to my ears, 
 But they behold Thy face. 
 They sing because Thou art their Sun; 
 Lord, send a beam on me; 
 For where heaven is but once begun 
 There alleluias be.
	 ~ 	2 . Wo hyerɛn da edzi ma hɔn;
Mitsin W'anamɔn do a,
Metse Nyame ndze wɔ m'asomu, 
Hɔn dze, wohu W'enyim,
'Yɛ hɔn Ewia ntsi wɔtow ndwom;
Tow nserɛmɛn to mo do,
Na beebi a heaven hyɛ ase n',
Alleluia wɔ hɔ.

MHB 78
3 . Enlighten with faith is light my heart, 
 Inflame it with loves fire; 
 Then shall I sing and bear a part 
 With that celestial choir. 
 I shall, I  fear, be dark and cold, 
 With all my fire and light; 
 Yet when Thou dost accept their gold, 
 Lord, treasure up my mite.
	 ~ 	3 . Ma gyedzi kan nhyerɛn m'akoma m',
Ma 'gya dɔ nsɔ wɔ mu;
Ma menye sor adwontofo
Aabɔ m' aatow Wo ndwom,
Musuro, mowɔ kan na gya nyina,
Dɛ m'bɛyɛ sum, na nwin;
Sɛ 'regye hɔn sika mfutuw a,
Gye mo so me dwɛɛtɛɛ.

MHB 78
4 . How great a being, Lord, Is Thine, 
 Which doth all beings keep! 
 Thy knowledge is the only line 
 To sound so vast a deep. 
 Thou art a sea without a shore, 
 A sun without a sphere; 
 Thy time is now and evermore 
 Thy place is everywhere.	 ~ 	4 . Ewuradze, mbrɛ idua so a,
Ekora abɔdze nyina!
Wo nyimdzee nkotoo na otum
Susu po n' trɛ na bun,
Ɔwo nye po a onnyi mpoano,
Ewia a onnyi ɔhe;
Ewɔ hɔ sesei nye daa nyina,
Na ewɔ beebiara.

MHB 780
1 . MASTER, speak! Thy servant heareth,
Waiting for Thy gracious word,
Longing for Thy voice that cheereth;
Master, let it now be heard.
I am listening, Lord, for Thee;
What hast Thou to say to me? 
	 ~ 	1 . MO Wura Kasa! W'akowaa ritsie,
Morotweɔn W'adom asɛm no,
Mo kɔn dɔ W'akomatɔm' ndze,
Mo Wura, Ma mentse n' sesei,
Mo Wura, mayɛ aso ritsie W',
Ewɔ bɛn ka kyerɛ me?
O mo Wura, kasa kyerɛ me!

MHB 780
2 . Speak to me by name, O Master,
Let me know it is to me;
Speak, that I may follow faster,
With a step more firm and free,
Where the Shepherd leads the flock
In the shadow of the Rock.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mo Wura, bɔ me dzin na kasa,
Ama meehu dɛ enye m';
Frɛ m' na medze anan haahar
Bɛka W' do ahotɔ m' akɔ
Bea a 'Guanhwɛfo n' dzi nguan enyim,
Wɔ Botan no nwin ase.

MHB 780
3 . Master, speak! Though least and lowest,
Let me not unheard depart;
Master, speak! for oh, Thou knowest
All the yearning of my heart,
Knowest all its truest need;
Speak, and make me blest indeed.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mo Wura, kasa! Mennsɛ bi mpo a,
Sɛ enntsee me ndze a, mma monnkɔ;
Mo Wura kasa! Na Woara nyim
M'akoma n'akɔndɔdze;
Woara nyim n'ehiadze nyina,
Kasa na hyira m' prɛko.

MHB 780
4 . Master, speak: and make me ready,
 When Thy voice is truly heard,
With obedience glad and steady
  Still to follow every word
I am listening, Lord, for Thee;
Master, speak, O speak to me! Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Mo Wura, kasa! Na yɛ m' krado,
Sɛ metse Wo ndze ampa a;
Setsie mu na enyigye mu,
Ma mindzi W'asɛm ekyir;
Mo Wura, mayɛ aso ritsie,

MHB 781
1 . LORD, speak to me that I may SPEAK
In living echoes of Thy tone;
As Thou has sought, so let me SEEK
Thine erring children lost and lone.
	 ~ 	1 . Ewuradze, kasa kyerɛ me, 
Ma munsusu Wo do nkasa;
Ahwehwɛ me yi ma mo so
Monhwehwɛ Wo mba a wɔayew no.
                                   Amen.

MHB 781
2 . O lead me, Lord, that I may lead
The wandering and the wavering feet;
O feed me, Lord, that I may feed
Thy hungering ones with manna sweet.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mo Wura, gya me kwan ma mo so 
Mingya W'akobɔfo taataa;
O nyɛn me ma mo so memfa
Manna mma hɔn a kɔm dze hɔn.

MHB 781
3 . O strengthen me, that while I stand
Firm on the rock, and strong in Thee,
I may stretch out a loving hand
To wrestlers with the troubled sea.
	 ~ 	3 
. O hyɛ me dzen ama ber a 
Migyina pintsinn wɔ Wo mu n',
Maatsen me nsa ama hɔn a
Woridzi aper wɔ bra po do.

MHB 781
4 . O teach me, Lord, that I may teach
The precious things Thou dost impart;
And wing my words, that they may reach
The hidden depths of many a heart.
	 ~ 	4 
. Kyerɛkyerɛ m' na meetum makyerɛ 
N-dzɛmba pa a ada n' edzi;
Ma m'anosɛm n-hwira ndu
Akoma pii ase noho.

MHB 781
5 . O give Thine own sweet rest to me,
That I may speak with soothing power
A word in season, as from Thee,
To weary ones in needful hour.
	 ~ 	5 
. Fa W'asomdwee dɛɛdɛw n' ma me, 
Ma minnya nyansa memfa nka
Asomdwee nsɛm nkyerɛ Wo mba
Asonafo wɔ mbusu mber mu.

MHB 781
6 . O fill me with Thy fullness, Lord,
Until my very heart overflow
In kindling thought and glowing word,
Thy love to tell, Thy praise to show.
	 ~ 	6  
. Mo Wura, fa Wo mayɛ no ma m', 
Kodu dɛ m'akoma bu do,
Ma memfa ndam mombɔ dawur,
Menka Wo dɔ, minyi W' ayɛw.

MHB 781
7 . O use me, Lord, use even me,
Just as Thou wilt, and when, and where,
Until Thy blessèd face I see,
Thy rest, Thy joy, Thy glory share.    Amen.	 ~ 	7 
. Fa me yɛ dɛ Woara 'pɛ, 
Aber nyina na bea biara,
Kodu dɛ mubohu W'enyim
Wɔ ahomgye, dɛw, na enyimnyam ma.

MHB 782
1 . SHINE Thou upon us, Lord, 
True Light of men, to-day;
And through the written word 
Thy very self display;
That so from hearts which burn
 With gazing on Thy face,
The little ones may learn 
The wonders of Thy grace.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, hyerɛn hɛn do,
Ɔwo, adasamba Kan;
Dua Wo kyerɛwsɛm do
Yi Woho kyerɛ hɛn ndɛ;
Na yɛhwɛ W'enyim a
Hɛn akoma dzɛw ntsi
Nkɔkowaba nam hɛn do
Eesua W'adom nwanwa n'.
Aatwe Wo mba nyina.    Amen.

MHB 782
2 . Breathe Thou upon us, Lord, 
Thy Spirit’s living flame,
That so with one accord
 Our lips may tell Thy name;
Give Thou the hearing ear,
 Fix Thou the wandering thought,
That those we teach may hear
The great things Thou hast wrought.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewuradze, hue Sunsum
Gyaframee n' gu hɛn do,
Ma yɛdze ano kor
Yaabɔ Wo dzin dawur.
Ma Wo mba aso pa,
Ma hɔn adwen ontsim,
Na hɔn nyina eehu
Ndzɛmba akɛse a ayɛ.

MHB 782
3 . Speak Thou for us, O Lord,
In all we say of Thee;
According to Thy Word 
Let all our teaching be;
That so Thy lambs may know 
Their own true Shepherd’s voice,
Where’er He leads them go,
And in His love rejoice.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hɛn Wura, kasa ma hɛn,
Dza yɛka nyina mu,
Ma dza yɛkyerɛ nyɛ dɛ
Mbrɛ W'asɛm tse ara;
Ama nguambaa aatse
Hɔn Guanhwɛfo n' Ne ndze,
Na wɔaaka No do daa,
Na woeedzi No mu dɛw.

MHB 782
4 . Live Thou within us, Lord;
 Thy mind and will be ours;
Be Thou beloved, adored, 
And served with all our powers;
That so our lives may teach 
Thy children what Thou art,
And plead, by more than speech, 
For Thee with every heart.    Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn Wura, tsena hɛn mu;
Ma hɛn W'adwen no bi;
Ma yɛmfa hɛn ahom
Nyina ndɔ Wo, nsom Wo;
Na hɛn bra aakyerɛ
Wo mbofra mbrɛ etse,
Na yɛdze hɛn suban

MHB 783
1 . SHALL I, for fear of feeble man,
The Spirit’s course in me restrain?
Or, undismayed, in deed and word
Be a true witness for my Lord?
	 ~ 	1 . NA nyimpa a ɔyɛ mberɛw ho suro
Besiw sunsum a ɔwɔ mo mu n' kwan?
Ana me ndzeyɛɛ na kasa
Kyerɛ dɛ meyɛ m' Wura dasefo?
Mutum ne nyina yɛ Wo dzin m'.

MHB 783
2 . SavioUr of men, Thy searching eye
Doth all my inmost thoughts descry;
Doth aught on earth my wishes raise,
Or the world’s pleasures, or its praise?
	 ~ 	2 
. Adasa Agyenkwa, Enyiasombea,
Ihu mo mu adwen nyinara;
'Bɛn na mohwehwɛ wɔ wiadze,
No mu enyigye anaa ayɛyi a?

MHB 783
3 . The love of Christ doth me constrain
To seek the wandering souls of men;
With cries, entreaties, tears, to save,
To snatch them from the gaping grave.
	 ~ 	3 
. Christ dɔ n' hyɛ me ma mohwehwɛ
Nyimpa akra a wɔatɔ dɔnsuar;
Metsea m', dze su na ntotɔserɛ
Hwim hɔn fi adakamaa mu.

MHB 783
4 . My life, my blood, I here present,
If for Thy truth they may be spent:
Fulfill Thy sovereign counsel, Lord;
Thy will be done, Thy Name adored:
	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ W' nokwar ntsi mo bɔgyaa na
Nkwa ho wɔ mfaso a, medze ma W';
Ewuradze, ma Wo tsirmpɔw mbra m',
Wo pɛ nyɛ hɔ, ayɛyi nka W' dzin.

MHB 783
5 . Give me Thy strength, O God of power;
Then let winds blow, or thunders roar,
Thy faithful witness will I be:
’Tis fixed; I can do all through Thee!	 ~ 	5 
. Ma m' W'ahoɔdzen, Nyame Tumfo,
Nkyii ma aahow mbɔ, nsenaman mbobɔ m';
Mbɛyɛ W' dasefo nokwafo;

MHB 784
1 . WHAT shall we offer our good Lord,
Poor nothings, for his boundless grace?
Fain would we His great name record,
And worthily set forth His praise.
	 ~ 	1 . AFƆR bɛn na hɛn atɔbɔ
Dze ma hɛn Wura, wɔ N'adom ntsi?
Yɛbɔbɔ Ne dzin kɛse no,
Na yeeyi N'ayɛw dɛ mbrɛ ɔsɛ.
Dɛ edum, na yennkefi hɔ bio.

MHB 784
2 . Great object of our growing love,
To whom our more than all we owe,
Open the fountain from above,
And let it our full souls o’erflow.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔwo a yɛdɔ W' mbordo daa daa,
Ɔwo a esen hɛn adze nyina,
Bue sor nsunyiwa gu hɛn do,
Ma ɔnhyɛ hɛn akra amaama, mbu do.

MHB 784
3 . So shall our lives Thy power proclaim,
Thy grace for every sinner free;
Till all mankind shall learn Thy name,
Shall all stretch out their hands to Thee.
	 ~ 	3 
. Dɛm na hɛn bra bɔbɔ W' tum na
W'adom a 'dze kyɛ abɔn kwa n' dawur,
Kodu dɛ adasa bohu W'dzin,
Na wɔatsen hɔn nsa nyina ama W'.

MHB 784
4 . Open a door which earth and hell
May strive to shut, but strive in vain;
Let Thy word richly in us dwell,
And let our gracious fruit remain.
	 ~ 	4 
. Bue abow a wiadze nye hɛll
Per dɛn ara a, wonnkotum atow mu;
Ma W'asɛm ngye ntaa wɔ hɛn mu;
Na hɛn adom aba ntsena hɔ.

MHB 784
5 . O multiply the sower’s seed!
And fruit we every hour shall bear,
Throughout the world thy gospel spread,
Thy everlasting truth  declare.
	 ~ 	5 
. O ma ogufo n'aba n' ndɔr!
Na yɛbɔsow aba mber nyina;
Ma W'asɛmpa n' mpetse wiadze,
Yɛmbɔ Wo daa nokwar n' dawur.

MHB 784
6 . We all, in perfect love renewed,
Shall know the greatness of Thy power,
Stand in the temple of our God
As pillars, and go out no more. 	 ~ 	6 
. Wo dɔ mapa ayɛ hɛn fofor n',
Yebohu W' kɛseyɛ no tum n'
Yegyina hɛn Nyame N'asɔrfi m'

MHB 785
1 . JESUS, if we aright confess
Our heartfelt poverty,
We own the conscious want of grace
Itself a gift from Thee;
And who our poverty retain,
More gifts we shall receive,
Multiplied grace and blessings gain,
And all a God can give.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, sɛ yɛka hɛn akoma m'
Ehiasɛm kyerɛ Wo a,
Yehu dɛ yehia adom a
Ɔyɛ akyɛdze a ofir Wo;
Hɛn a yenyim hɛn mberɛwyɛ no,
Yebenya akyɛdze pii,
Yebenya adom nye nhyira mbordo,
Ne nyina Nyame dze ma.
Na fa W' dɔ hyɛ hɔn ma.  Amen.

MHB 785
2 . Our scanty stock as soon as known,
Our insufficiency
For feeding famished souls we own,
And bring it, Lord, to Thee;
Our want received into Thy hand
Shall rich abundance prove ,
Answer the multitude’s demand,
And fill them with Thy love.      Amen.	 ~ 	2 
. Yenyim dɛ dza yɛwɔ suar koraa,
Yenyim hɛn esintɔ dɛ
Yenntum nnyɛn akra a kɔm dze hɔn;
Ewuradze, yɛdze brɛ W';
Yɛdze hɛn ehiadze gu W' nsamu a,
Ɔyɛ ahonya mbordo;
Yɛ ɔdodow ebisadze ma hɛn,

MHB 786
1 . LORD, grant us, like the watching five,
To wait Thy coming, and to strive
Each one her lamp to trim ;
And, since the oil Thou dolt impart,
Pour daily grace into each heart,
Lest any lamp grow dim.
	 ~ 	1 . OWURA, ma yɛnweɔn dɛ beenum n',
Yɛntweɔn Wo mbaa, na obiara
Mper nkeka ne kandzea;
Na osiandɛ ngo a ofi Wo hɔ no
Wora adom daa gu akoma biara m' ntsi,
Kandzea biara mmonsom.
Ama yaahwɛ W'enyim.

MHB 786
2 . May we not wait in selfish sloth, 
But mingle prayer and work, that both 
May trim the shining light ;
So from the midnight of their sin 
May many, with us, enter in, 
To banquet in Thy sight.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mma yɛnntsena pɛsɛankonya m',
Mbom yɛmfa asɔryɛ mfora edwumayɛ,
Ama kandzea n' aadzɛw;
Na pii efi hɔn bɔn sum kadoo m' n',
Wɔnye hɛn aabɔ mu epue
W'enyim aponto ase.

MHB 786
3 . We would not come alone, dear Lord, 
To Thy great feast, and at Thy board 
In rapture sit and gaze ;
But bring the lost, the sick, the lone, 
The little ones to be Thine own,
And look into Thy face.	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, nnyɛ hɛn nko bɛba
W'aponto kɛse no ase,
Abɛtsena dɛw m' ahwɛ W',
Yɛdze akobɛɔfo, ayarfo,
Ankonam na mbofra brɛ Wo,

MHB 787
1 . LORD of the harvest, hear
Thy needy servants cry:
 Answer our faith’s effectual prayer,
And all our wants supply.
	 ~ 	1 . N-dɔbaa Ewuradze, tsie 
Wo nkowaa ehiafo hɛn su;
Tsie hɛn gyedzi mu mpaabɔ yi
Na dom hɛn dza yehia.
Wo dɔ a onnyi ewiei n'!

MHB 787
2 . On Thee we humbly wait;
Our wants are in Thy view :
The Harvest truly, Lord, is great:
The labourers are few.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛtweɔn Wo mbɔbɔr mu; 
Inyim hɛn hia nyina:
Ampa dɛ n-dɔbaa no so,
Na edwumafo no suar.

MHB 787
3 . Convert, and send forth more
Into Thy Church abroad;
And let them speak Thy word of power,
As workers with their God.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sakyer wobinom so 
Na soma hɔm W'asɔr mu
Ma wɔnka Wo tum kasa no
Dɛ 'Wo nye hɔn wɔ hɔ

MHB 787
4 . Give the pure gospel word,
The word of general grace;
Thee let them preach, the common Lord,
The Saviour of our race.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma wɔnka W'asɛmpa a 
Adom ahyɛ no ma n',
Wɔnkyerɛ dɛ 'Wo nye Ewuradze,
Adasamba Gyefo.

MHB 787
5 . O let them spread Thy name,
Their mission fully prove,
Thy universal grace proclaim,
Thy all-redeeming love !	 ~ 	5 
. Ma wɔntrɛ Wo dzin mu, 
Ma wɔmfata hɔn frɛ,
Wɔmbɔ W'adom kɛse no mu,

MHB 788
1 . DISPOSER Supreme, And Judge of the earth,
Who choosest for Thine the weak and the poor;
To frail earthen vessels and things of no worth
Entrusting Thy riches, which aye shall endure:
	 ~ 	1 . DOMFO Abɔso, wiadze Tsɛmbuafo,
Ɔwo a efa mberɛwyɛ nye ehiafo yɛ W'dze;
Efa dɛtse nkuraba hun na ebubudze
Na ehyehyɛ hɔn Wo ndzepa a ɔmmpa ara da.
Ɔafrɛ hɛn sum mu ma yeehu N'enyimnyam!

MHB 788
2 . Those vessels soon fail, though full of thy light,
And at Thy decree are broken and gone;
Then brightly appeareth Thy truth in its might,
As through the clouds riven the lightnings have shone.
	 ~ 	2 
. Kaansa Wo kan hyɛ m' mpo a, nkuraba n' nnkyɛr pa,
Wotsin Wo mom do bubu, na woetwa m';
Afei Wo nokwar kan no pue n'ahoɔdzen m'
Dɛ mbrɛ enyinam nyinam mununkum mu no.

MHB 788
3 . Like clouds are they borne to do Thy great will,
And swift as the winds about the world go;
The fire of thy presence their spirits doth fill,
They thunder, they lighten, the waters o’erflow.
	 ~ 	3 
. Dɛ mbrɛ mununkum kyin yɛ Wo pɛ kɛse n'
Na mframa dzendzen bɔ wiadze ho aprɔw n',
Asɛm n' dze Ne nyansaa hyɛ hɔn sunsum ma,
Wɔbobɔ mu, wɔhyerɛn, na wobu do.

MHB 788
4 . Their sound goeth forth : Christ Jesus is Lord !
The Satan doth fear, his citadels fall :
As when the dread trumpets went forth at Thy word,
And one long blast shattered the Canaanite's wall.
	 ~ 	4 
. Wɔbɔ hɔn ndze m' Jesus Christ nye Ewuradze!
Ntsi Satan bɔ hwea, n'aban dwuruw gu famu,
Dɛ mbrɛ ekasae ma totorobɛnto hɛnee
Ara a Canaan afasu dwuruwii no.

MHB 788
5 . Then loud be their trump, and stirring their sound,
To route us, O Lord, from slumber of sin;
The lights Thou hast kindled in darkness around,
O may they illumine our spirits within! 
	 ~ 	5 
. Afei ma totorobɛnto n' nhɛn dzendzen,
Ewuradze, ma onnyan hɛn mfi bɔn nda m';
Nkandzea a Ɔwo asosɔ wɔ hɛn sum mu n',
O ma ɔnhyerɛn wɔ hɛn esunsum mu!

MHB 788
6 . All honour and praise, dominion and might,
To God Three in One eternally be;
Who round us hath shed His marvellous light,
And called us from darkness His glory to see!	 ~ 	6 
. 'Nyimnyam, ayɛyi, tumdzi na ahoɔdzen nyina
Nka Nyame Ebiasa kor afebɔɔ;
Ɔama Ne kan nwanwa n' ahyerɛn hɛn ho,

MHB 789
1 . FORGET them not, O Christ, who stand
Thy vanguard in the distant land.
	 ~ 	1 . CHRIST, mma W' werɛ mmfir
W'adɔntsen dɔm a
Woridzi ako wɔ amanadze.
Wɔwɔ ehum asaase do ntsena.

MHB 789
2 . In flood, in flame, in dark, in dread,
Sustain, we pray, each lifted head.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛserɛ W', kora na ma hɔn tsir do,
Wɔ nsuyirii, gya, sum na suro m'.

MHB 789
3 . Exalt them over every fear,
In peril come Thyself more near.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hyɛ hɔn dzen wɔ suro biara m',
Na Woara bɛn hɔn wɔ mbusu m'.

MHB 789
4 . Thine is the work they strive to do,
Their foes so many, they so few.
	 ~ 	4 
. W'edwuma na wɔper ayɛ,
Wosuar, na atamfo no dɔɔ so.

MHB 789
5 . Be with Thine own, thy loved, Who stand,
Christ’s vanguard, in the storm-swept land.	 ~ 	5 
. Christ, 'nye W'akofo adɔfo a

MHB 79
1 . PRAISE ye the Lord! 'Tis good to raise 
 Your hearts and voices in His praise: 
 His nature and His works invite 
 To make this duty our delight.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM nyi Ewuradze ayɛw, oye dɛ 
Hom ma akoma na ndze do kamfo N';
No su na No ndwuma gya hɛn ma 
Yɛdze enyigye yi N' ayɛw.

MHB 79
2 . He formed the stars, those heavenly flames, 
 He counts their numbers, calls their names; 
 His wisdoms vast, and knows no bound, 
 A deep where all our thoughts are drowned.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔyɛɛ nworaba a wɔhyerɛn wɔ sor,
'Kan hɔn dodow, bɔ hɔn edzin;
Ne nyansaa so, onnyi ewiei,
Bun kɛse a hɛn nsusui yew mu.

MHB 79
3 . Sing to the Lord! Exalt Him high, 
 Who spreads His clouds along the sky; 
 There He prepares the fruitful rain, 
 Nor lets the drops descend in vain.
	 ~ 	3 . Hom ntow ndwom mfa nkrɔn Ewuradze!
Ɔtserɛw No mununkum mu wɔ sor; 
Hɔ na ɔhyehyɛ nyankonsu,
Anaa ɔmma nsu nngu famu kwa.

MHB 79
4 . He makes the grass the hills adorn, 
 And clothes the smiling fields with corn; 
 The beasts with food His hands supply, 
 And the young ravens when they cry.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔdze sar kata akoko do,
Na eburow hyɛ hɛn kwa amaama; 
Ne nsa ma mbowadoma edziban,
Na ɔnyɛn nnoma nyina so.

MHB 79
5 . What is the creatures skill or force? 
 The sprightly man, or warlike horse? 
 The piercing wit, the active limb? 
 All are too mean delights for Him.
	 ~ 	5 . Ebɛn na abɔdze tum yɛ?
Nyimpa ahoɔdzen anaa mpɔnkɔ? 
Nyansa anaa ahoɔdzen so ɛ?
Yinom nyina nnka hwee wɔ N'enyim.

MHB 79
6 . But saints are lovely in his sight, 
 He views his children with delight; 
 He sees their hope, He knows their fear, 
 And looks, and loves His image there.	 ~ 	6 . 'Hotsewfo dze, wɔsɔ N'enyi,
Ne mba ho yɛ no enyigye;
Onyim hɔn 'nyidar, hɔn suro,
Ɔhwɛ, na ɔdɔ Ne saso hɔ.

MHB 790
1 . LOOK from Thy sphere of endless day,
O God of mercy and of might,
In pity look on those who stray,
Benighted in this land of light.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME mbɔbɔrhufo tumfo,
Fi Wo sor bea a adze nnsa hɔ n'
Na fa tsimberɛw frɛ hɔn a wɔayew,
Wɔnam sum mu no, bra kan mu.
Ma ndze aafow sor aakyerɛ W'ayɛyi

MHB 790
2 . In peopled vale, in lonely glen,
In crowded mart by stream or sea,
How many of the sons of man
Hear not the message sent from Thee.
	 ~ 	2 
. Beebi a dɔm wo anaa ho atɔ pan,
Dɔmtutuw a wɔwɔ nsuano, nkurow m',
Nyimpa dodow pii na wɔnntsee
Asɛmpa no a edze ma hɛn n'.

MHB 790
3 . Send forth Thy heralds, Lord, to call
The thoughtless young, the hardened old,
A scatterd homeless flock, till all
Be gathered to Thy peaceful fold.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, ma W'asomfo mfrɛ
Mberantsɛ atam, nkɔdaa akomapirimfo,
Nguankuw a wɔapetse, ma hɔn nyina 
Mbɛka W'asomdwee nguankuw n' ho.

MHB 790
4 . Send them Thy mighty Word to speak,
Till faith shall dawn and doubt depart,
To awe the bold, to stay the weak,
And bind and heal the broken heart.
	 ~ 	4 
. Soma ma wɔnkɛka W'asɛm n'
Ma gyedzi aaba ma ekyingye aakɔ,
Bɔn eetu ma mberɛwyɛnyi eetsim,
Na akoma bobɔe aahyɛ dzen.

MHB 790
5 . Then all these wastes, a dreary scene,
On which with sorrowing eyes we gaze,
Shall grow with living waters green,
And lift to heaven the voice of praise.	 ~ 	5 
. Afei nsaase a woetwie nyina
Dza yɛhwɛ a ɔgye hɛn awerɛhow n',
Nkwa nsu bɛma efuw ahaebun,

MHB 791
1 . JESUS, Thy wandering sheep behold!
See, Lord, with tenderest pity see
The sheep that cannot find the fold,
Till sought and gathered in by Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . Wɔabɔ akwankwan kɔ ekyirkyir,
Wɔdze yaw, ɔberɛ nye ɔkɔm kɔ;
Wonnyi guanhwɛfo pa a ɔkyerɛ
Ayarfo a wɔayɛ mberɛw no kwan.
Na wonyi W'ehumbɔbɔr ayɛw.

MHB 791
2 . Lost are they now, and scattered wide,
In pain, and weariness, and want;
With no kind shepherd near to guide
The sick, and spiritless, and faint.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔwo na ayɛ Guanhwɛfo no,
Guanhwɛfo pa a apon Wo nguan;
Boa hɔn ano na ma hɔn edziban,
Na asɔfo a asan mu eyi hɔn.

MHB 791
3 . Thou, only Thou, the kind and good
And sheep-redeeming Shepherd art:
Collect Thy flock, and give them food,
And  pastors after Thine own heart.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma W'asɛnkafo n' adom nsɛm,
Ma woeenya etsiefo piinara;
Asɛnkafo a wɔkyerɛ abɔnfo
Kwan ba nkwagye bɔgya no ho.

MHB 791
4 . Give the pure word of general grace,
And great shall be the preachers’ crowd;
Preachers, who all the sinful race
Point to the all-atoning blood.
	 ~ 	4 
. Bue hɔn ano, ma hɔn anotsewee
Ma hɔn totorobɛnto ndze,
Wɔmfa mfrɛ adasa mbra nkwagye m',
Wɔ Nyia owui maa hɔn n' ho gyedzi m'.

MHB 791
5 . Open their mouth, and utterance  give;
Give them a trumpet-voice, to call
On all the world to turn and live,
Through faith in Him who died for all.
	 ~ 	5 
. W'enyimnyam nko na wɔnhwehwɛ;
O ma ɔdɔ mbu do hɔn akoma m',
Ma wɔngye ndzi na wɔmpaa m' nka,

MHB 792
1 . LORD, if at Thy command
The word of life we sow,
Watered by Thy almighty hand,
The seed shall surely grow:
	 ~ 	1 . Hɛn Wura, sɛ W'asɛm ntsi 
Yedua n-kwasɛm n' a,
Wo tum nsa no gugu do yi
Aba no befifir.
Mma ɔsor dɛw kɛse n'.

MHB 792
2 . The virtue of Thy grace
A large increase shall give,
And multiply the faithful race
Who to Thy glory live.
	 ~ 	2  
. W'adom ne ndam ara 
Na ɔbɛma ndɔbaa pii,
Na ɔadɔr agyedzifo a 
Wɔtse ma W'enyimnyam.

MHB 792
3 . Now then the ceaseless shower
Of gospel blessings send,
And let the soul-converting power
Thy ministers attend.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nsɛmpa n' ne nhyira nsu n', 
Ma ɔntɔ mma hɛn daa,
Ma tum a ɔsakyer akra n'
Ɔmbra W'asɔfoe do.

MHB 792
4 . On multitudes confer
The heart-renewing love,
And by the joy of grace prepare
For fuller joys above.	 ~ 	4  
. Ma ɔdodowara 
Nnya dɔ a ɔdan 'koma n',
Ma W'adom ne dɛw nsiesie hɔn

MHB 793
1 . LORD of the living harvest
That whitens o’er the plain,
Where angels soon shall gather
Their sheaves of golden grain,
Accept these hands to labor,
These hearts to trust and love,
And deign with them to hasten
Thy  kingdom from above.
	 ~ 	1 . OWURA a Wo ndɔbaa 'nyikan
Kata asaase do,
Bea a abɔfo boaboa hɔn 
Ndɔbaa a wɔaber ano,
Gye nsa yi yɛ W'edwuma,
Ma hɛn akoma ntwer W', ndɔ W',
Dua hɔn do ma W'ahendzi
Mfi sor noho mbra ntsɛm.
Sesei nye daa nyina.   Amen.

MHB 793
2 . As labourers in Thy vineyard,
Lord, send them out to be,
Content to bear the burden
Of weary days for Thee.
Constant to ask no wages
When Thou shalt call them home,
But to have shared the travail
Which makes Thy kingdom come.
	 ~ 	2 
. Soma hɔn Wo wenyin turo m',
Dɛ wɔyɛ W'apaafo n',
Wɔpɛ dɛ wɔsoa ndzesoa
Wɔ ɔberɛ nda mu ma Wo,
Owura, sɛ frɛ hɔn ba fie a,
Wɔnnkɛgye akatua koraa,
Ma wɔaakyɛ 'fona no a
Ɔma W'ahendzi ba n'.

MHB 793
3 . Be with them, God the Father,
Be with them, God the Son,
And God the Holy Spirit,
Eternal Three in One!
Make them a royal priesthood,
Thee rightly to adore
And fill them with Thy fullness 
Now and evermore.   Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Nyame Egya, nye hɔn ntsena,
Nyame Ɔba, nye hɔn ntsena,
Nyame Sunsum, nye hɔn ntsena;
Onnyiewiei Ɔkorsa!
Yɛ hɔn asɔfo adehye,
Ma wɔmfa nsom Wo yie,
Fa W'amayɛ hyɛ hɔn ma,

MHB 794
1 . ETERNAL Son, eternal Love,
Take to Thyself Thy mighty power;
Let all earth’s sons Thy mercy prove,
Let all Thy saving grace adore.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆDOMANKOMA Ɔba, Ɔdɔ a ɔkye,
Woara fa Wo tum kɛse no;
Ma adasa nhu W'ehumbɔbɔr,
Ma wonhu Wo nkwagye adom.
W'enyimnyam a ɔmmpa da bɛhyerɛn.

MHB 794
2 . The triumphs of Thy love display,
In every heart reign Thou alone,
Till all Thy foes confess Thy sway,
And glory ends what grace began.
	 ~ 	2 
. Kyerɛ Wo dɔ no konyimdzi no,
Wo nko dzi hen akoma biara m'.
Kodu dɛ atamfo bɛtse W' tum,
Ma enyimnyam eewie adom edwuma n'.

MHB 794
3 . Spirit of grace, and health, and power,
Fountain of light and love below,
Abroad Thy healing influence shower,
O’er all the nations let it flow.
	 ~ 	3 
. Adom Sunsum na ahoɔdzen tum,
Kan nsunyiwa nye dɔ wɔ asaase,
Fa W'ayarsa tum no petse
Ma ɔmpem aman nyina do.

MHB 794
4 . Inflame our hearts with perfect love,
In us the work of faith fufil;
So not heaven’s host shall swifter move
Than we on earth, to do Thy will.
	 ~ 	4 
. Sɔ ɔdɔ mapa gya wɔ hɛn akoma m',
Gyedzi ndwuma nda edzi hɛn mu;
Amma sor dɔm aannyɛ W'edwuma
Ntsɛntsɛm annsen hɛndze wɔ ha.

MHB 794
5 . Blessing and honour, praise and love,
Co-equal, co-eternal Three,
In earth below, and heaven above,
By all thy works be paid to thee!
	 ~ 	5 
. Tease, Ɔkorsa 'Tsipɛmfo
Sor na asaase, wo ndwuma nyina
Mfa nhyira nyidzi, ntonton na ɔdɔ
Nsom Wo aber nyinara daa.

MHB 794
6 . Thrice HOLY ! Thine the kingdom is,
The power omnipotent is Thine;
And when created nature dies,
Thy never-ceasing glories shine.	 ~ 	6 
. W'ahendzi yɛ Krɔnn mprɛnsa,
Tum nyinara so yɛ Wodze;
Sɛ abɔdze nyina twa m' kɔ a,

MHB 795
1 . O CHURCH of God, arise,
And take thy lamp of love, 
The light that never dies
On earth, in heaven above!
	 ~ 	1 . O NYAME N'asɔr, soɛr;
Fa Wo dɔ kandzea no,
Kandzea a onndum ara da
Wɔ asaase do nye sor.
Dɛ ɔhen na sɔfo.

MHB 795
2 . With wisdom and with truth
Keep quick and straight the flame,
The light of love and youth, 
To save a world of shame.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Fa nyansa na nokwar
Huw gya n' ma ɔndzɛw hoo,
Ɔdɔ na mbabun kan
Mpam wiadze m' fɛr mfi hɔ.

MHB 795
3 . Rebuke the devil’s mart,
The souls in prison release, 
Bind up the broken heart,
Give joy and mirth and peace!
	 ~ 	3 
. Twuw abɔnsam enyim,
Yi akra fi efiadze,
Kyekyer akoma bobɔe
Ma dɛw na asomdwee.

MHB 795
4 . Whatever things are fair,
Whatever things are just,
Go, make them free as air
And plenteous as the dust !
	 ~ 	4 
. Adze biarà à ɔyɛ fɛw,
Adze biara a ɔtsen,
Ma ɔnyɛ fow dɛ mframa,
Ɔndɔɔso dɛ huntuma!

MHB 795
5 . In every dark place
Let radiant warmth be shed, 
Till in each dreary face
The joy of God is read.
	 ~ 	5 
. Beebiara a sum wɔ no,
Tow kan nserɛmɛn gu hɔ,
Kɛpem dɛ enyim a esuam
Bohu Nyame enyigye.

MHB 795
6 . Tell every man on earth,
The greatest and the least,
Love called him from his birth
To be a king and priest.	 ~ 	6 
. Se dasanyi biara,
'Birɛmpɔn nye kɔhweaban,
Dɛ ɔdɔ frɛɛ no awoo m'

MHB 796
1 . LORD, Thy ransomed Church is waking
Out of slumber far and near,
Knowing that the morn is breaking 
When the Bridegroom shall appear;
Waking up to claim the treasure 
With Thy precious life-blood bought,
And to trust in fuller measure
All Thy wondrous death hath wrought.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, W'asɔr a apon no
Rinyan fi nda m' mbea nyina a 
Wonyim dɛ adzekyee reba a
Okumfor n' beyi N'enyim;
Worinyan agye akoradze a
'Dze W' bɔgyaa a ɔsom bo tɔe n',
Na wɔatwer wo dwumason a
W'anwanwa wu no edzi.
Ewuradze, fa W' nkowaa kɔ fie.   Amen.

MHB 796
2 . Praise to Thee for this glad shower,
Precious drops of latter rain;
Praise, that by Thy Spirit’s power 
 Thou halt quickened us again;
That Thy gospel’s priceless treasure 
Now is borne from land to land,
And that all the Father’s pleasure 
Prospers in Thy pierced hand.
	 ~ 	2 
. Gye W'ayɛyi nka wɔ Wo nsu ntsi,
Ekyir nsutɔ a ɔsom bo;
Yeyi Wo ayɛw dɛ Wo Sunsum
Tum no ekenyan hɛn bio;
Dɛ W'asɛmpa akoradze mapa n'
Wɔso dze rokɔ mbeambea,
Dɛ Egya n' N'apɛdze dzi mu.
Wɔ Wo nsamu epiratwa no mu.

MHB 796
3 . Praise to Thee for saved ones yearning	 
O’er the lost and wandering throng;
Praise for voices daily learning 
To upraise the glad new song;
Praise to Thee for sick ones hasting 
Now to touch Thy garment’s hem;
Praise for souls believing, tasting 
All Thy love has won for them.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ayɛyi nka Wo wɔ esiarfo a
Wɔper hwehwɛ hɔn a wɔayew,
Yɛtonton Wo dɛ ndze bi sua
W'ayɛyi ndwom no fofor;
Ntonton nka W'ayarfo a wɔper
Suo W'atar ano ndwow m' ntsi,
Yɛtonton Wo, hɔn a wɔagye edzi,
Ehu Wo dɔ enyadze n' ntsi.

MHB 796
4 . Set on fire our heart’s devotion 
With the love of Thy dear name;
Till o’er every land and ocean
Lips and lives Thy Cross proclaim:
Fix our eyes on Thy returning, 
Keeping watch till Thou shalt come,	
Loins well girt, lamps brightly burning;
Then, Lord, take Thy servants home.	
		 Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Fa Wo dzin ho dɔ no sɔ gya
Wɔ hɛn akoma nyina mu;
Kesi dɛ aman nyinara,
Bɛgye Wo mbeamudua no;
Ma hen enyi ntsim Wo mbeamudua n' do;
Nweɔn nkesi dɛ ebɛba,
Yɛabɔ asen do, asɔ nkandzea hoo;

MHB 797
1 . ONCE again, dear Lord, we pray
For the children far away,
Who have never even heard
Name of Jesus, sweetest word.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, yɛbɔ mpaa bio
Ma mbofra a wɔwɔ ekyirkyir,
Hɔn a wɔnntsee Wo dzin mpo da,
Jesus dzin dɛɛdɛw n' pɛn koraa.
Kyerɛɛ Wo fakyɛ nkwagye dɔ n'.

MHB 797
2 . Little lips that Thou hast made,
’Neath the far-off temple’s shade
Give to gods of wood and stone
Praise that should be all Thine own.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nkɔkoaba a ama hɔn ano
Gyina ekyirkyir asɔrdan mu,
Nwin ase, dze W'ayɛyi n'
Ma ndua, abosom nye abotan.

MHB 797
3 . Little hands, whose wondrous skill
Thou hast given to do Thy will,
Offerings bring, and serve with fear
Gods that cannot see or hear.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nsa nkakraba a edze ama
Hɔn dɛ wɔmfa nyɛ Wo pɛ n',
Wɔdze suro som, bɔ afɔr
Ma abosom a wonnhu, wɔnntse.

MHB 797
4 . Teach them, O Thou heavenly King,
All their gifts and praise to bring
To Thy Son, who died to prove
Thy forgiving, saving love.	 ~ 	4 
. O sor Hen, kyerɛkyerɛ hɔn ma
Wɔmfa akyɛdze nye ayɛyi
Mbrɛ Wo Ba a obowui dze

MHB 798
1 . FAR round the world  Thy children sing their song:
From East and West  their voices sweetly blend,
Praising the Lord in whom  young lives are strong,
Jesus our Guide, our Hero, and our Friend.
	 ~ 	1 . WO mba tow hɔn ndwom wɔ wiadze nyina:
Hɔn ndze bɔ m' dɛɛdɛw fi anee na boka;
Wohuhor Ewuradze a ɔma mbofra ahoɔdzen,
Jesus, hɛn Kwankyerɛfo, Sahen, Nyɛnko.
Jesus, hɛn Kwankyerɛfo, Sahen, Nyɛnko.

MHB 798
2 . Where Thy wide ocean, wave on rolling wave,
Beats through the ages, on each island shore,
They praise their Lord, whose hand alone can save,
Whose sea of love surrounds them evermore.
	 ~ 	2 
. Beebiara a Wo po asorɛkye bu
Gu nsupɔw mpoano mfesantsen nyina n';
Wohuhor hɔn Wura a nkwagye wɔ N' nko asɛm m',
Ɔno a No dɔ po etwa hɔn ho ehyia.

MHB 798
3 . Thy sun-kissed children  on earth’s spreading plain,
Where Asia’s rivers  water all the land,
Sing, as they watch  Thy fields of glowing grain,
Praise to the Lord who feeds them with His hand.
	 ~ 	3 
. Wo mba a ewia hyerɛn hɔn do wiadze mu,
Mbrɛ Asia esutsen fɔw asaase nyina do,
Wohuw ndwom ber a hɔn haban eyi ndɔbaa;
Ayɛyi nka Ewuradze a ɔnyɛn hɔn.

MHB 798
4 . Still there are lands where none have seen Thy face,
Children whose hearts have never shared Thy joy;
Yet Thou wouldst pour on these Thy radiant grace,
Give Thy glad strength to every girl and boy.
	 ~ 	4 
. Aman pii wɔ hɔ a bi nnhun W'enyim pɛn,
Mbofra akoma nnsɔɔ Wo dɛw nnhwɛɛ pɛn,
Naaso bohue W'adom egu hɔn nyina do;
Ma nkataasia na mberantsɛ W'ahoɔdzen.

MHB 798
5 . All round the world let children sing Thy song:
 East and West their voices sweetly blend,
Praising the Lord in whom young lives are strong,
Jesus our Guide, our Hero, and our Friend.	 ~ 	5 
. Ma mbofra ntow Wo ndwom wɔ wiadze nyina,
Hɔn ndze bɔ m' dɛɛdɛw, fi anee na boka;
Wohuhor Ewuradze a ɔma mbofra ahoɔdzen,

MHB 799
1 . THE fields are all white,	
And the reapers are few;
 We children are willing, 
But what can we do
To work for our Lord in His harvest?
	 ~ 	1 . BUBER no edu
Na edwumayɛfo no suar;
Hɛn mbofra dze yɛpɛ, 
Na yebesi dɛn\nAyɛ hɛn Wura No twadwuma yi bi?
Yɛayɛ hɛn Wura No twadwuma yi bi.

MHB 799
2 . Our hands are so small
And our words are so weak;
We cannot teach others;
 then shall we seek
To work for our Lord in His harvest?
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn nsa susuar koraa,
Hɛn asɛnka yɛ mberɛw,
Yenntum nnkyerɛ binom;
Yɛyɛ dɛn hwehwɛ,
Yɛyɛ hɛn Wura No twadwuma yi bi.

MHB 799
3 . We’ll work by our prayers,
By the offerings we bring,
By small self-denials;
The least little thing
May work for our Lord in His harvest:
	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛbɔbɔ mpaa aboa,
Yɛbɛma bi dze aboa;
Yɛbɛpa hɛnho ekyir;
Kakra a yɛbɛyɛ n'
Bɔboa hɛn Wura No twadwuma yi bi.

MHB 799
4 . Until by and by,
As the years pass, at length
We too may be reapers,
And go forth in strength,
To work for our Lord in His harvest.	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔbɛyɛ bɛyɛ n'
Na mfe rutwa m' kɔ no,
Hɛn so bɛyɛ etwafo,
Yɛakɔ enyim ahoɔdzen m'

MHB 8
1 . O worship the king, 
All glorious above; 
O gratefully sing 
His power and His love: 
Our shield and defender, 
The ancient of days,
Pavilioned in splendour, 
And girded with praise.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM nkotow Hen nyimnyamfo a ɔwɔ sor;
Mfa ndaase nkamfo No tum nye No dɔ;
Hɛn kyɛm nye hɛn Gyefo, Mbersantsen Panyin,
Ahoɔfɛw nye No buw, ayɛyi abɔ N' do.

MHB 8
2 . O tell of His might, 
O sing of His grace, 
Whose robe is the light, 
Whose canopy space; 
His chariots of wrath 
The deep thunder-clouds form, 
And dark is His path 
On the wings of the storm.
	 ~ 	2 . Hom ntow No tum nye N'adom so ho ndwom:
N'atar nye ekan, No buw pretetee;
N'ebufuw tseaseanam hye senaman fua tum,
No kwan yɛ sum wɔ ehum atsaban do.

MHB 8
3 . The earth with its store 
Of wonders untold, 
Almighty! Thy power 
Hath founded of old.
Hath stablished it fast 
By a changeless decree, 
And round it hath cast, 
Like a mantle, the sea.
	 ~ 	3 . Asaase nye N'anwanwadze a wɔnnka:
Otumfo! Wo tum bɔɔ adze fi tsetse;
Nam 'mom a wɔnndan n' da etsim no pintsinn,
Na edze epo abᴐ no ho abᴐmprᴐw.

MHB 8
4 . Thy bountiful care 
What tongue can recite?
It breathes in the air,
It shines in the light, 
It streams from the hills, 
It descends to the plain, 
And sweetly distils
In the dew and the rain.
	 ~ 	4 . W'ayamúyie no gyirama hɛn botúm aká?
Ogú ahom wɛ wimú, ɔhyerɛn kan mu;
Ofi akoko do pem siansian sar mu,
Na ɔsɔw fénemfénem wɔ bɔw nye
nyankom mu.

MHB 8
5 . Frail children of dust, 
And feeble as frail,
In Thee do we trust, 
Nor find Thee to fail; 
Thy mercies how tender, 
How firm to the end, 
Our Maker, Defender, 
Redeemer, and Friend!
	 ~ 	5 . Huntuma m' mbá a yɛnnkye so yɛyɛ mbérɛw,
Hɛn wérɛ hyɛ Wo mu, W'ayamúyie
mmpada;
Mbrɛ W'adom dua gow a otsim hɔ dú ewiei,
Hɛn Bɔfo, hɛn Gyefo, Pomfo na Dɔfo!

MHB 8
6 . O measureless Might! 
Ineffable Love!
While angels delight 
To hymn Thee above, 
The humbler creation, 
Though feeble their lays, 
With true adoration 
Shall lisp to Thy praise.	Amen.
	 ~ 	6 . Tum a wonnsusu! Dɔ a onnyi kabea!
Mbér a abɔfo dzé enyigye tow ndwom no,
Abɔdzé adedafamú so nam hɛn mbérɛwyɛ m'
Bɔtonton Wo atow ndwom eyi W' ayaw!
				   Amen.

MHB 80
1 . THEE will I praise with all my heart, 
 And tell mankind how good Thou art, 
 How marvellous Thy works of grace; 
 Thy name I will in songs record, 
 And joy and glory in my Lord, 
 Extolled above all thanks and praise.
	 ~ 	1 . MEDZE m'akoma bɛkamfo Wo, 
Maka W'ayamuyie akyerɛ adasa; 
Mbrɛ W'adom ndwuma yɛ nwanwa a! 
Medze ndwom bɛkamfo Wo dzin,
M'bedzi dɛw wɔ m'Ewuradze mu,
M'bɛda W'ase, makamfo Wo.

MHB 80
2 . The Lord will save His people here; 
 In times of need their Help is near 
 To all by sin and hell oppressed; 
 And they that know Thy name will trust 
 In Thee, who to Thy promise just, 
 Hast never left a soul distressed.
	 ~ 	2 . Ewuradze bɛgye No nkorɔfo,
Ɔboa hɔn wɔ ahokyer ber m',
Hɔn a bɔn nye hɛll ahyɛ hɔn do,
Hɔn a wonyim Wo n'bɔtwer Wo, 
Ɔwo a idzi W'anohoba do
Nnkɛma ɔkra biara ho akyer n'.

MHB 80
3 . The Lord is by His judgments known; 
 He helps His poor afflicted one, 
 His sorrows all he bears in mind; 
 The mourner shall not always weep, 
 Who sows in tears in joy shall reap, 
 With grief who seeks with joy shall find.
	 ~ 	3 . Wɔdze Ewuradze atsɛmbu hu No;
Ɔboa bɔbɔfo a ohu amandze:
Onyim n'awerɛhow nyina;
Ɔwerɛhonyi nnkɛka mmɔn daa,
Nyia ɔdze su dua dze dɛw bobu,
Nyia ɔdze yaw hwehwɛ dze dɛw hu.

MHB 80
4 . A helpless soul that looks to thee  
 Is sure at last Thy face to see, 
 And all Thy goodness to partake 
 The sinner who for Thee doth grieve, 
 And longs, and labours to believe, 
 Thou never, never wilt forsake.	 ~ 	4 . Ɔkra bɔbɔfo a ɔhwɛ Wo
Otwar dɛ ohu W'enyim ara,
Na ne nsa ka W'adɔe nyina;
Dzebɔnyɛnyi a osu hwehwɛ W',
Nyia ɔhwehwɛ dɛ ɔgye dzi n',
Innkegyaa no dabiara da.

MHB 800
1 . SAVIOUR , quicken many nations,
Fruitful let Thy sorrows be;
By Thy pains and consolations
Draw the Gentiles unto Thee:
Of Thy Cross the wondrous story
Be to all the nations told; 
Let them see Thee in Thy glory
And Thy mercy manifold.
	 ~ 	1 . AGYENKWA, kenyan amanaman,
Ma W'awerԑhow nsow aba,
Ma Wo yaw nye awerԑkyekyer
Ntwe amanamamfo mbrԑ Wo,
Wɔnka Wo mbeamudua ho nsԑm 
Nwanwa n' nkyerԑ aman nyina;
Na wonhu Wo W'enyimnyam mu 
Nye Wo mbɔbɔrhu beberee n'.
Eguambaa, W'enyimnyam ndwom.  Amen.

MHB 800
2 . Far and wide, though all unknowing,
Pants for Thee each mortal breast;
Human tears for Thee are flowing,
Human hearts in Thee would rest:
Thirsting, as for dews of even, 
As the new-mown grass for rain,
Thee they seek as God of heaven,
Thee as Man for sinners slain.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nkorɔfo a wonnyim Wo wɔ
Ekyirkyir nyina kɔn dɔ Wo;
Adasa kyi nyinsuwa wɔ W' ho,
Adasa pԑ W' mu ahomgye;
Wo ho nsukɔm dze hɔn mbordo
Dԑ sar a woetwa n' 'mon hia nsu n',
Wɔhwehwԑ Wo dԑ sor Nyame
Dԑ Nyia wokum N' maa abɔn.

MHB 800
3 . Saviour, Lo! The isles are waiting,
Stretched the hand and strained the sight,
For Thy Spirit, new creating,
Love’s pure flame, and wisdom’s light;
 the word, and of the preacher
Speed the foot, and touch the tongue,
Till on earth by every creature 
Glory to the Lamb be sung.    Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Agyenkwa, hwԑ! Nsupruw rotweɔn,
Atsen hɔn nsa, agyen hɔn enyi,
Rohwԑ Wo Sunsum ndwumafor n';
Rema ɔdɔ gya dzԑw, nyansa hyerԑn;
Ka asԑm n', ma ɔsԑnkafo n',
Ahoɔhar, ka ne gyirama
Kodu dԑ abɔdze nyina bɔtow

MHB 801
1 . FROM Greenland’s icy mountains,
From India’s coral strand,
Where Afric’s sunny fountains
Roll down their golden sand,
From many an ancient river,
From many a palmy plain,
They call us to deliver
Their land from error’s chain.
	 ~ 	1 . GREENLAND nkokwaa nwinwim n' do,
India adantse abo ho,
Ebibiman, mbea a nsu pem
Fefa anhwea pii do so;
Fi tsetse esutsen pii mu,
Fi mbԑ asaase do,
Wɔfrԑ hԑn dԑ yenkeyi
Hɔn aman mfi mfom mpokyerԑ m'.
Bԑsan ebedzi hen, dԑw m'.  Amen.

MHB 801
2 . Can we, whose souls are lighted
With wisdom from on high,
Can we to men benighted
The lamp of life deny?
Salvation! O salvation!
The joyful sound proclaim,
Till each remotest nation
Has learned Messiah’s name.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ana hԑn a sor nyansa
Eguar hԑn akra yi
Botum dze nkwa kan n' akam
Nyimpa a wɔtse sum mu?
N-kwagye o, nkwagye nye yi;
Hom mpaa m' nka enyigyesԑm n'
Nkodu dԑ aman nyina
Bohu Messiah N' dzin.

MHB 801
3 . Waft, waft, ye winds, his story,
And you, ye waters, roll,
Till, like a sea of glory,
It spreads from pole to pole;
Till o’er our ransomed nature
The Lamb for sinners slain,
Redeemer, King, Creator,
In bliss returns to reign.   Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Mframa, hom mbɔ N'asԑm n' nkɔ,
Na hom nsu, hom mpem daa,
Nkɔ nkodu wiadze n'ano
Dԑ enyimnyam po bun;
Kԑpem dԑ Eguambaa a wokum
No maa abɔn nyina n'
Pomfo, Ɔhen Bɔfo no,

MHB 802
1 .  THE heavens declare Thy glory, Lord,
In every star Thy wisdom shines;
But when our eyes behold thy word,
We read Thy name in fairer lines.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, sor kyerԑ W'enyimnyam,
Wo nyansa hyerԑn woraba biara m';
Sԑ hԑn enyi bɔ W'asԑm n' do a
Yԑkenkan Wo dzin n'enyigye m'.
Ma W'asԑm ngye m' taataa nkɔ sor.  Amen.

MHB 802
2 . The rolling sun, the changing light,
And night and day, Thy power confess;
But the blest volume Thou hast wirt
Reveals Thy justice and Thy grace.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ewia a ɔhyerԑn, kan a odzi ndan,
'Nago na adzekyee ka W' tum kyerԑ,
Mbom Wo nhyira Nwoma a akyerԑw no
Kyerԑ Wo tsenenee na W'adom.

MHB 802
3 . Sun, moon, and stars convey Thy praise
Round the whole earth, and never stand;
So, when thy truth began its race,
It touched and glanced on every land.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewia, bosoom, na nworaba nngyaa
W'ayԑyi wɔ wiadze mu da;
Ntsi Wo nokwar hyԑԑ ase kyinii n'
Okodur aman nyina mu.

MHB 802
4 . Nor shall Thy spreading gospel rest
Till through the world Thy truth has run;
Till Christ has all the nations blest
That see the light or feel the sun.
 	 ~ 	4 
. W'asԑmpa no bԑtserԑw araa
Ma wiadze nyina eehu Wo nokwar n',
Kԑpem dԑ Christ behyira aman nyina a 
Kan anaa wi pue wɔ hɔ no.

MHB 802
5 . Great Sun of Righteousness, arise,
Bless the dark world with heavenly light;
Thy Gospel makes the simple wise,
Thy laws are pure, Thy judgements right.
	 ~ 	5 
. Tsenenee Ewia kԑse, pue,
Fa sor kan hyira sum wiadze yi,
W'asԑmpa n' bue ntsetsekwaa enyi,
Wo mbra yԑ krɔnn W'atsembu tsen!

MHB 802
6 .  Thy noblest wonders here we view,
In souls renewed and sins forgiven:
Lord, cleanse my sins, my soul renew,
And make Thy word my guide to heaven.	 ~ 	6 
. Eyԑ akra afofor dze bɔn kyԑ
Ma yehu Wo tum kԑse no,
Mo Wura, pepa m' bɔn, yԑ m' fofor,

MHB 803
1 . THOU, whose almighty word
Chaos and darkness heard,
And took their flight;
Hear us, we humbly pray,
And where the gospel day
Sheds not its glorious ray,
Let there be light.
 	 ~ 	1 . BEGYABEGYA na sum
Tsee Wo tum asԑm no,
Na woguanee;
Yԑserԑ Wo, tsie hԑn,
Na beebiara a asԑmpa
Ne nserԑmԑn nnhyerԑn hɔ n',
Ma hɔ nyԑ kann.
Ma hɔ nyԑ kann.

MHB 803
2 . Thou, who didst come to bring
on Thy redeeming wing
Healing and sight,
Health to the sick in mind,
Sight to the inly blind,
O now to all mankind
Let there be light!
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔwo a edze ayarsa
Na adzehu gyee hԑn
W'atsaban do,
'Maa adamfo adwen m' tseew hɔn,
Efurafo hun adze,
Afei ma Wo kan nhyerԑn Adasa do.

MHB 803
3 . Spirit of truth and love,
Life-giving, holy Dove,
Speed forth Thy flight:
Move on the water’s face,
Spreading the beams of grace,
And in earth’s darkest place
Let there be light!
	 ~ 	3 
. Nokwar na dɔ Sunsum,
Nkwa Mafo, Ebubur Krɔnn,
Tu faa bra ntsԑm;
Butuw nsu no enyi
Tow adom nserԑmԑn no,
Wiadze sum kebii n' mu
Ma hɔ nyԑ kann.

MHB 803
4 . Blessed  and holy Three,
Glorious Trinity,
Grace, love, and Might,
Boundless as ocean’s tide
Rolling in fullest pride,
Through the earth far and wide
Let there be light !   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Siarfo, Ɔkorsa Krɔnkrɔn,
Enyimnyam Ɔkorsa!
W'adom, dɔ tum n',
Tse dԑ popramee a 
Obubu n'asorԑkye,
Wɔ wiadze afanan nyina

MHB 804
1 . SPREAD , O spread, thou mighty Word,
Spread the kingdom of the Lord,
Wheresoe’er His breath has given,
Life to beings meant for Heaven.
	 ~ 	1 . TSERƐW O asԑm tumfo tserԑw,
Tserԑw Ewuradze ahenman n' mu;
Beebiara a N'adom esiesie
N-kwa ama ɔsorfo.
Wo kan n' hyerԑn na woesuro Wo.  Amen.

MHB 804
2 . Word of life, most pure and strong,
Lo! for Thee the nations long,
Spread, till from its dreary night
All the world awakes to light.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nkwasԑm krɔnn a ɔyԑ dzen
Aman nyina kɔn dɔ Wo;
Tserԑw, ma sum kebii no mpa,
Na ma kan nhyerԑn wiadze.

MHB 804
3 . Up! the ripening fields ye see,
Mighty shall the harvest be;
But the reapers still are few,
Great the work they have to do.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Soԑr hwԑ! Haban no reber
Ndɔbaa no bԑyԑ kԑse,
Etwafo no suar dodow,
Edwuma a wɔbԑyԑ no so.

MHB 804
4 . Lord of harvest, let there be
Joy and strength to work for Thee,
Till the nations, far and near,
See Thy light, and learn Thy fear.	 ~ 	4 
. Otwa edwuma no Wura, ma hԑn
Dԑw na ahoɔdzen nyԑ W'edwuma,
Kԑpem dԑ aman nyina bohu

MHB 805
1 . CHRIST for the world, we sing:
The world to Christ we bring
With loving zeal;
The poor, and them that mourn,
The faint and overborne,
Sin-sick and sorrow-worn,
Whom Christ doth heal.
 	 ~ 	1 . YƐDZE Christ kyerԑ wiadze;
Yԑdze wiadze brԑ Christ,
Wɔ dɔ nsiyԑ m';
'Hiafo na mbɔɔdzifo
Mberԑwyԑfo, nkrumsifo,
Ayarfo, 'werԑhofo a,
Christ sa hɔn yar.
Dze hɔn maa Christ.

MHB 805
2 . Christ for the world we sing:
The world to Christ we bring
With fervent prayer;
The wayward and the lost,
By restless passions tossed,
Redeemed at countless cost
From dark despair.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛdze Christ kyerԑ wiadze;
Yԑdze wiadze brԑ Christ
Wɔ mpaabɔ mu;
Akobɔfo a wɔyewee,
Hɔn a nna wonnyi etsidaa n',
Wɔpoon hɔn aboɔdzen
Fii enyidɔ mu.

MHB 805
3 . Christ for the world we sing:
The world to Christ we bring
With one accord;
With us the work to share,
With us reproach to dare,
With us the cross to bear
For Christ our Lord.
	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛdze Christ kyerԑ wiadze;
Yԑdze wiadze brԑ Christ
Wɔ ɔnosԑԑ kor m';
Wɔnye hԑn yԑ edwuma n',
Wɔnye hԑn ka asԑm no,
Nye hԑn soa mbeamudua n'
Ma hԑn Wura Christ.

MHB 805
4 . Christ for the world we sing:
The world to Christ we bring
with joyful song;
The new-born souls, whose days,
Reclaimed from error’s ways,
Inspired with hope and 	 ~ 	4 
. Yԑdze Christ kyerԑ wiadze,
Yԑdze wiadze brԑ Christ,
Wɔ enyigye ndwom m';
Hɔn a wɔawo hɔn fofor n,
Wɔtwee hɔn fii bɔn mu,
Enyidar na ayԑyi m'

MHB 806
1 . LET  the song go round the earth:
Jesus Christ is Lord,
Sound His praises, tell His worth,
Be His Name adored;
Every clime and every tongue
Join the grand, the glorious song.
 	 ~ 	1 . MA ndwom no ndu wiadze nyina;
Jesus Christ yԑ Owura;
Tow N'ayԑyi, bɔ dawur,
Ntonton nka Ne dzin.
Ɔman na gyirama biara
Mbɔ m' ntow enyimnyam ndwom no.
Mbersantsen na mfesantsen.   Amen.

MHB 806
2 . Let the song go round the earth,
From the eastern sea,
Where the daylight has its birth,
Glad, and bright, and free;
China’s millions join the strains,
Waft them on to India’s plains.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma ndwom no ndu wiadze nyina;
Omfi boka pomu,
Beebi a adzekyee hyԑ ase,
Dԑw, kan na ahotɔ m';
China dɔmpepe nsuo m' bi,
Mfa nkodu India mbew do.

MHB 806
3 . Let the song go round the earth,
Lands where Islam’s sway
Darkly broods o’er home and hearth,
Cast their bonds away;
Let His praise from Afric’s shore
Rise and swell her wide lands o’er.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Ma ndwom no ndu wiadze nyina;
Beebi a Kramosom
Agye ntaa wɔ fie nyina m';
Twitwa hɔn mpokyerԑ m'
N'ayԑyi mfi Ebibirim pomu
Mfow nkodu ne mbew nyina do.

MHB 806
4 . Let the song go round the earth,
Where the summer smiles,
Let the notes of holy mirth
Break from distant isles;
Inland forests, dark and dim,
Snow-bound coasts give back the hymn.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma ndwom no ndu wiadze nyina;
Bea a hyewber yԑ dԑw n',
Ma ndwom krɔnkrɔn no mu nsԑm
Ngyegye ekyirekyir;
Kwaa tuntu sunkamm nyina mu 
Na mpoano so ngye ndwom n' do.

MHB 806
5 . Let the song go round the earth:
Jesus Christ is King,
With the story of His worth,
Let the whole world ring;
Him creation all adore
Evermore and evermore.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Ma ndwom no ndu wiadze nyina,
Jesus Christ yԑ Hen,
Wiadze nyina mfa no ho nsԑm 
Mbɔ Ne dzin dawur;
Abɔdze nyina nsɔr No,

MHB 807
1 . AND let our bodies part,
To different climes repair;
Inseparably joined in heart
The friends of Jesus are.
	 ~ 	1 . Ma hɛn honam ndzi mpaa 
Nkɔ mbew horow do mpo;
Jesus N'adɔfo dze, dabaa
Hɔn akoma yɛ kor.

MHB 807
2 .  Jesus, the corner-stone,
Did first our hearts unite,
And still he keeps our spirits one,
Who walk with him in white.
	 ~ 	2 
. Jesus na odzii kan 
Dze hɛn akoma bɔɔm';
Hɛn a yɛnye N' nantsew fufuwn'
Ɔma yɛka koryɛm'.

MHB 807
3 . O let us still proceed
In Jesu’s work below;
And, following our triumphant Head,
To farther conquests go.
	 ~ 	3 
. O wɔmma yɛnkɔ do 
Wɔ Jesus N'edwumam';
Asɔr ne Tsir konyimdzifo n',
Yɛnka No do ndzi nyim.

MHB 807
4 .  The vineyard of their Lord
Before His labourers lies;
And lo! we see the vast reward
Which waits us in the skies.
	 ~ 	4 
. Christ no wenyin ture n' 
Saw n'edwumafo enyim;
Na hwɛ! akatua kɛse no 
Da sor hɔ rotweɔn hɛn.

MHB 807
5 . O let our heart and mind
Continually ascend,
That haven of repose to find
Where all our labours end:
	 ~ 	5 
. O hɛn 'koma nye adwen 
N-da ho ara mfow sor,
Nkɔhwɛ hɛn ahomgye bea no,
Mbrɛ hɛn fona bɔ adze.

MHB 807
6 .  Where all our toils are o’er,
Our suffering and our pain!
Who meet on that eternal shore,
Shall never part again.
 	 ~ 	6 
. Hɔ dwumadzen nyina, 
Nye amandzehu nye yaw
Wotwa do wɔ siar mpoano hɔ;
Hɔ yehyia a yɛmmpaam' bio.

MHB 807
7 . O happy, happy place,
Where saints and angels meet,
There we shall see each other’s face,
And all our brethren greet.
	 ~ 	7 
. Ahomka bea dɛɛdɛw, 
Hɔ na abɔfo hyia hɛn,
Hɔ yebohu hɛn enyim bio,
Na yeekyiakyia hɛnho.

MHB 807
8 . The church of the first-born;
We shall with them be blest,
And, crowned with endless joy, return
To our eternal rest. 	 ~ 	8  
. Abakamfo Asɔr, 
Hɔn nhyira n' yebenya,
Na yɛdze dɛw ayɛ abɔtsir
Yɛakɔ sor ahomgyem'.

MHB 808
1 . SPEED Thy servants, Saviour, speed them,
Thou art Lord of winds and waves;
They were bound, but thou hast freed them,
Now they go to free the slaves;
Be Thou with them:
’Tis  Thine arm alone that saves.
	 ~ 	1 . AGYENKWA pa, bɔ Wo nkowaa hyew
'Wo nye ehum na asorԑkye Wura:
Wɔdaa mpokyerԑ m', Ɔwo siaan hɔn,
Wɔrokɔpon nkowaa binom so;
Ka hɔn ho daa,
W'abasa nko na ɔgye nkwa.
Beyi Wo nkotoo ayԑw.   Amen.

MHB 808
2 . Friends, and home, and all forsaking,
Lord, they go at Thy command;
As their stay Thy promise taking,
While they traverse sea and land;
O be with them!
Lead them safely by the hand.
	 ~ 	2 
. Woegyaa nyԑnko, fie na ebusua,
Ewuradze, Ɔwo na asoma hɔn;
W'anohoba na ogya hɔn,
Ber a wotwa po na asaase;
O ka hɔn ho!
Woara gya hɔn dwudwoodwo.

MHB 808
3 . When they reach the land of strangers,
And the prospect dark appears,
Nothing seen but toils and dangers,
Nothing felt but doubts and fears,
Be Thou with them,
Hear their sighs, and count their tears.
	 ~ 	3 
. Wodu anana asaase do,
Ma enyidar yԑ bisiww,
Wonnhu hwee dԑ berԑ na mbusu,
Wɔnntse hwee dԑ ekyingye suro a,
Ka hɔn ho daa,
Tsie hɔn nkrumsi, kaa hɔn su.

MHB 808
4 . Where no fruit appears to cheer them,
And they seem to toil in vain,
Then in mercy, Lord, draw near them,
Then their sinking hopes sustain;
Thus supported,
Let their zeal revive again.
	 ~ 	4 
. Sԑ wɔnnsow aba biara,
Na hɔn fona reyԑ ayԑ gyan a,
Ewuradze, twe bԑn hɔn mbɔbɔr m',
Na ma hɔn enyidar ngyina;
Na ahyԑ hɔn dzen n',
Kenyan hɔn nsiyԑ no bio.

MHB 808
5 . In the midst of opposition,
Let them trust, O Lord, in Thee;
When success attends their mission,
Let Thy servants humbler be;
Never leave them,
Till Thy face in heaven they see:
	 ~ 	5 
. Sԑ wɔwɔ atamfo finimfin a,
Ewuradze, ma wɔntwer Wo,
Sԑ konyim ba hɔn dwumadzi mu a,
Ma Wo nkowaa mbrԑ hɔnho adze,
Mma nngya hɔn ekyir,
Kԑpem dԑ wohu W', wɔ sor.

MHB 808
6 . There to reap in joy for ever
Fruit that grows from seed here sown,
There to be with Him who never
Ceases to preserve His own,
And with gladness
Give the praise to Him alone.    Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Hɔ na wobohu dza woduaa n'
Wɔ asaase do n' afebɔɔ,
Hɔ na wɔnye Wo bԑtsena daa,
Ɔwo a ekora Wo nkowaa sɔnn;
Na wɔdze dԑw

MHB 809
1 . I CANNOT tell why He whom angels worship,
Should set His love upon the sons of men,
Or why, as Shepherd, He should seek the wanderers,
To bring them back, they know not how or when.
But this I know, that He was born of Mary
When Bethlehem’s manger was His only home,
And that He lived at Nazareth and labored,
And so the Saviour, Saviour of the world is come.
	 ~ 	1 . MURUNNTUM nnkyerԑ siantsir a Nyia abɔfo sɔr N',
Dze No dɔ bɔto hɔ ama nyimpa mba,
Anaa ɔyԑ 'Guanhwԑfo n' ɔhwehwԑ hɔn a wɔayew,
Mber na mbrԑ wɔdze hɔn bԑsan wonnyim,
Minyim 'yi mbom dԑ Ɔbaabun Mary woo No,
Bethlehem nguambuw mu ara nye Ne fie,
Na dԑ ɔtsenaa Nazareth yԑԑ edwuma,
Dԑm ntsi na Agyenkwa n', wiadze
Agyenkwa no aba.
Afei dze Agyenkwa, wiadze Agyenkwa no yԑ Hen!

MHB 809
2 . I cannot tell how silently He suffered,
As with His peace He graced this place of tears,
Or how His heart upon the cross was broken,
The crown of pain to three and thirty years.
But this I know, He heals the brokenhearted,
And stays our sin, and calms our lurking fear,
And lifts the burden from the heavy laden,
For yet the Savior, Savior of the world is here.
	 ~ 	2 
. Murunntum nnkyerԑ mbrԑ osii hun amandze komm,
Dze n'asomdwee bԑhyԑԑ nyinsuwa bea 'i 'nyam,
Anaa mbrԑ wobubuu n'akoma mbeamudua n' do
Ɔsoaa yaw ahenkyԑw n' mfe eduasa ebiasa.
Minyim 'yi mbom dԑ ɔsa akoma pirafo yar,
Ɔpepa hԑn bɔn na otu hԑn suro;
Oyi afonafo hɔn adzesoa durdur kyen;
'Yi ntsi na Agyenkwa n', wiadze Agyenkwa no wɔ ha.

MHB 809
3 . I cannot tell how He will win the nations,
How He will claim His earthly heritage,
How satisfy the needs and aspirations
Of East and West, of sinner and of sage.
But this I know, all flesh shall see His glory,
And He shall reap the harvest He has sown,
And some glad day His sun shall shine in splendor
When He  the Savior, Savior of the world is known.
	 ~ 	3 
. Murunntum nnkyerԑ mbrԑ obesi atwe wiadze,
Mbrԑ obesi enya wiadze egyapadze,
Mbrԑ ɔbԑyԑ apapa na abɔn hɔn ehiadze,
Boka na anee hɔn ahwehwԑdze,
Minyim 'yi mbom dԑ akra nyina bohu N'enyimnyam,
Na obohu dza Ɔnoara oduae no,
Na da bi N'ewia bԑhyerԑn 'nyimnyam mu,
Ber a ɔno Agyenkwa n', wiadze Agyenkwa no wobohu N'.

MHB 809
4 . I cannot tell how all the lands shall worship,
When, at His bidding, every storm is stilled,
Or who can say how great the jubilation
When all the hearts of men with love are filled.
But this I know, the skies will thrill with rapture,
And myriad, myriad human voices sing,
And earth to Heaven, and Heaven to earth, will answer:
At last the Savior, Savior of the world is King!	 ~ 	4 
. Murunntum nnkyerԑ mbrԑ wiadze nyina bɔsom N',
Ber a ɔkasa a, ehum biara taa dzinn,
Anaa nyia obotum akyerԑ dԑw kԑse no,
Ber a dɔ ahyԑ nyimpa nyina akoma mu ma.
Minyim 'yi mbom dԑ dԑw bԑhyԑ wimu nyina ma
Na nyimpa ahorow ndze a atow ndwom bi;
Asaase na sor beyi hɔn ano nkorkor;

MHB 81
1 . NOT what these hands have done
can save this guilty soul;
Not what this toiling flesh has borne
can make my spirit whole.
	 ~ 	1 . DZA me nsa ayɛ biara
Nnkotum agye me kra;
Fona a nyimpadua afa m' biara n', 
Ɔnnkɛma meedzi mu.

MHB 81
2 . Not what I feel or do
Can give me peace with God;
Not all my prayers, and sighs, and tears
Can bear my awful load
	 ~ 	2 . Dza metse nka, meyɛ
Nnkɛma m' Nyame asomdwee;
Me mpaa, apensi na nyinsu,
Nnkotum asoa m'adzesoa.

MHB 81
3 . Thy work alone, O Christ,
Can ease this weight of sin;
Thy blood alone, O Lamb of God,
Can give me peace within.
	 ~ 	3 . Christ, W'edwuma nko,
Botum eyi bɔn yi;
Nyame Eguambaa, Wo bɔgyaa nko
Bɛma meenya asomdwee.

MHB 81
4 . Thy love to me, O God,
Not mine, O Lord, to Thee,
Can rid me of this dark unrest,
And set my spirit free.
	 ~ 	4 . Wo dɔ a edze dɔ me,
Nnyɛ dza medze dɔ Wo,
Na ɔbɛma meenya ahotɔ,
Na me kra eenya ahomgye.

MHB 81
5 . Thy grace alone, O God,
To me can pardon speak;
Thy power alone, O Son of God,
Can this sore bondage break.
	 ~ 	5 . O Nyame Ba, Wo tum nko 
Botum dze m' bɔn akyɛ m';
O Nyame Ba, Wo tum nko ara
Botum ebubu mpokyerɛ 'i.

MHB 81
6 . I bless the Christ of God,
I rest on love divine,
And with unfaltering lip and heart,
I call this Saviour mine.	 ~ 	6 . Mihyira Nyame Ne Christ,
Motwer Onyame dɔ,
Medze nokwar akoma nye ano
Mefrɛ No M'Agyenkwa.

MHB 810
1 . FATHER, let Thy kingdom come,
Let It come with living power;
Speak at length the final word,
Usher in the triumph hour.
	 ~ 	1 . EGYA, ma W'ahendzi mbra,
Ma ɔmfa n-kwa tum mbra;
Kasa, ka ewiei asԑm n',
Na ma konyim ber no mbra.
Obiara n'akoma mu.   Amen.

MHB 810
2 . As it came in days of old,
In the deepest hearts of men, 
When Thy martyrs died for Thee, 
Let it come, O God, again!
	 ~ 	2 
. Mbrԑ tsetseber do ɔbae n'
Wɔ nyimpa akoma mu pԑԑ n',
Ber a ahotsewfo wui maa Wo,
O Ewuradze, ma ɔmbra bio.

MHB 810
3 . Tyrant thrones and Idol shrines,
Let them from  their  place  be hurled : 
Enter on Thy better reign, 
Wear the crown of Thine own World.
	 ~ 	3 
. Abosomfie ahengua do
Na ma wɔntow hɔn mfi daa;
Bra mu wɔ W'ahendzi pa m'
Soa Wo wiadze ahenkyԑw n'.

MHB 810
4 . O what long, sad years have gone, 
Since  Thy  Church  was  taught this prayer  
O what eyes have watched and wept 
For the dawning everywhere
	 ~ 	4 
. O awerԑhow mber bԑn 'i!
Wɔkyerԑ W' asɔr dԑm mpaabɔ 'i,
Enyi a aweɔn ''bԑn a!
Dԑ obodwir beebiara.

MHB 810
5 . Break, triumphant day of God!
Break at last, our hearts to cheer; 
Throbbing souls and holy songs 
Wait to hail Thy dawning here.
	 ~ 	5 
. Pue, Nyame N' konyimdzi da,
Pue ma hԑn akoma ndzi dԑw;
Ndwom krɔnkrɔn na aberԑfo dze
Rotweɔn Wo mbae wɔ ha nyina.

MHB 810
6 . Empires, temples, sceptres, thrones- 
May they all for God be won; 
And, tn every human heart, 
Father, let Thy kingdom come ! 
		Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Ahenman, asɔrdan, tumdzi;
Ewuradze bԑma nsa aka;
Egya, ma W'ahendzi mbra

MHB 811
1 . THY Kingdom come, O God,
Thy rule, O Christ, begin;
Break with Thine iron rod
The tyrannies of sin.
	 ~ 	1 . O Twearammpon Nyame, 
Ma W'ahendzi no mbra,
O Christ, ma W'abaw do
Bubu ɔbɔn no tum.
Pue, na mma nntɔ ara da. 	Amen.

MHB 811
2 . Where is Thy reign of peace,
And purity, and love?
When shall all hatred cease,
As in the realms above?
	 ~ 	2 
. W'ahendzi a asomdwee 
Nye dɔ wɔ mu n' wɔ hen?
Dabɛn na enyitan
Bɔbɔ adze wɔ ha?

MHB 811
3 . When comes the promised time
That war shall be no more
Oppression, lust, and crime
Shall flee Thy face before?
 	 ~ 	3 
. W'anohoba n' wɔ hen 
Dɛ mber bi rebɛba a
Akodzi nye brafun
Boguan efi W'enyim?

MHB 811
4 . We pray Thee, Lord, arise,
And come in Thy great might;
Revive our longing eyes,
Which languish for Thy sight.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ewuradze yɛserɛ Wo, 
Ma Woho do na bra
Wo tum kɛse no mu,
Na ma hɛn enyi ngye.

MHB 811
5 . Men scorn Thy sacred Name,
And wolves devour Thy fold;
By many deeds of shame
We learn that love grows cold.
	 ~ 	5 
. Nyimpa mmbu Wo dzin bi, 
Mbataku kyer Wo nguan;
Pii wɔyew Wo ho dɔ,
Wɔbɔ 'nyimguasebra.

MHB 811
6 . O’er heathen lands afar
Thick darkness broodeth yet:
Arise, O Morning Star,
Arise, and never set !   Amen.	 ~ 	6  
. Abosonsɔr dze sum 
Agye aman pii do;
O Anapa Nworaba,

MHB 812
1 . GOD is working His purpose out,
     as year succeeds to year:
God is working His purpose out,
     and the time is drawing near
Nearer and nearer draws the time
     the time that shall surely be,
When the earth shall be filled
     the glory of God, as the waters 
     cover the sea.
 	 ~ 	1 . NYAME reda Ne tsirmpɔw edzi,
fi mber to mber nyina,
Nyame reda tsirmpɔw edzi
na mber bi rebԑn daa;
Nkakra nkakra mber no rebԑn 
Ɔkyԑr dԑn ara a ɔbԑba,
Aber a Nyame N'enyimnyam bԑhyԑ
asaase ma, dԑ mbrԑ nsu ahyԑ po ma no.
ma, dԑ mbrԑ nsu hyԑ po ma no.

MHB 812
2 . From utmost east to utmost west,
     where e’er man’s foot hath trod,
By the mouth of many messengers
    goes forth the voice of God:
Give ear to me, ye continents- ye isles, 
    give ear to me,
That the earth may be filled with
    the glory of God, as the waters 
    cover the sea.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ofi boka kɔ anee noho beebi a
nyimpa etsia n',
Asomafo pii hɔn ano na wɔtse Nyame Ne ndze:
Asaasetam na nsupruw, hom nyina nyԑ aso mma me,
Ama Nyame N'enyimnyam aahyԑ asaase ma, 
dԑ mbrԑ nsu hyԑ po ma no.

MHB 812
3 . What can we do to work God’s work,
     to prosper and increase
The brotherhood of all mankind
     the reign of the Prince of Peace?
What can we do to hasten the time
     the time that shall surely be,
When the earth shall be filled with
     the glory of God, as the waters 
     cover the sea?
	 ~ 	3 
. Yԑbԑyԑ dԑn ayԑ Nyame N'edwuma ma
aayԑ yie eetu mpon,
Nyimpa nyina bԑyԑ kor-Asomdwee Hen
bedzi Hen?
Ebԑn na yԑbԑyԑ ma mber n' epua?
kwan biara m' ɔbԑba mu,
Aber a Nyame N'enyimnyam bԑhyԑ
asaase ma, dԑ mbrԑ nsu hyԑ po ma no.

MHB 812
4 . March we forth in the strength of
      God with the banner of Christ 
      unfurled,
That the light of the glorious
      gospel of truth may shine 
      throughout the world:
Fight we the fight with sorrow and
      sin, to set their captives free,
That the earth may be filled with
      the glory of God, as the waters 
      cover the sea.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Yԑbɔbɔ nsera akɔ kan atserԑw Christ Ne
frankaa m' wɔ N'ahoɔdzen m',
Ama asԑmpa n'enyimnyam kan no
aahyerԑn wɔ wiadze nyina:
Yԑnye bɔn na awerԑhow bɔko
dze agye adaduafo,
Ama Nyame N'enyimnyam aahyԑ asaase 
ma, dԑ mbrԑ nsu hyԑ po ma no.

MHB 812
5 . All we can do is nothing worth
      unless God blesses the deed;
Vainly we hope for the harvest-tide,
      till God gives life to the seed;
Yet nearer and nearer draws the
      time- the time that shall surely be,
When the earth shall be filled with
      the glory of God, as the waters 
      cover the sea.	 ~ 	5 
. Dza yebotum ayԑ nnsԑ hwee, gyedԑ
Nyame hyira do.
Kwa ara na yԑtweɔn buber, kԑpem
dԑ Nyame ma aba n' nkwa;
Naaso mber no rupua ho-mber a
Ɔkyԑr dԑn ara a ɔbԑba mu n',
Aber a Nyame N'enyimnyam ahyԑ asaase

MHB 813
1 . THE Lord will come and not be slow;
His footsteps cannot err;
Before Him righteousness shall go,
His royal harbinger.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE bԑba, ɔnnkԑkyԑr,
N'anamɔn nnkɔfom da;
Tsenenee bedzi N'enyim ara
Dԑ adehye kwambɔfo.
Na Wo nko yԑ Nyame.

MHB 813
2 . Truth from the earth, like to a flower,
Shall bud and blossom then;
And justice, from her heavenly bower,
Look down on mortal men.
	 ~ 	2 
. Asaase nokwar tse dԑ nhyiren,
Ɔbɔbɔ na ɔapaa;
Na pԑrpԑr fi ahenman n' nwin mu,
Ahwԑ nyimpa wɔ ase.

MHB 813
3 . Rise, God, judge thou the earth in might,
This wicked earth redress;
For Thou art he who shalt by right
The nations all possess.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, soԑr wɔ Wo tum mu
Bu wiadze atsԑn pa,
Ɔwo na ewɔ ho kwan dԑ
Efa wiadze aman nyina.

MHB 813
4 . The nations all whom Thou hast made
Shall come, and all shall frame
To bow them low before thee, Lord,
And glorify Thy name.
	 ~ 	4 
. Aman a Ɔwo yԑe nyina bԑba
Abɔbɔ hɔn mu adze
Ama Ɔwo Ewuradze,
A ahyԑ Wo dzin enyimnyam.

MHB 813
5 . For great Thou art, and wonders great
by Thy strong hand are done:
Thou in thy everlasting seat
Remainest God alone.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Kԑse nye Wo, wɔ anwanwadze m',
Wo nsa dzendzen no yԑ;
'Wo etse W'ahengua m' afebɔɔ,

MHB 814
1 . HEAD of Thy church, whose Spirit fills
And flows through every faithful soul,
Unites in mystic love, and seals
Them one, and sanctifies the whole:
	 ~ 	1 . W'ASƆR ne tsir a Sunsum n' hyԑ n' ma,
Na ɔpem agyedzifo akra mu,
Ɔka hɔn bɔ m' wɔ anwanwa dɔ;
Nsɔwano kor mu, tsew hɔn ho.
Na ma wiadze nyina nhu Wo dzin.  Amen.

MHB 814
2 . Come, Lord ! Thy glorious Spirit cries;
And souls beneath the altar groan:
Come, Lord,’ the bride on earth replies,
And perfect all our souls in one.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewuradze, Wo Sunsum frԑ Wo,
Na akra a wogu afɔr pon ase pen;
W'ayefor n' so se Ewuradze bra,
Na hԑn akra eedzi mu, ayԑ kor.

MHB 814
3 . Pour out the promised gift on all,
Answer the universal : Come!
The fullness of the Gentiles call,
And take Thine ancient people home.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Hue bɔhyԑ akyԑdze n' ma obiara,
Yi amanaman frԑ n' ano. Bra!
Amanamanfo hɔn frԑ n' gye do;
Na fa Wo tsetse dɔm kɔ fie.

MHB 814
4 . To Thee let all the nations flow,
Let all obey the gospel word;
Let all their suffering Saviour know,
Filled with the glory of the Lord.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma aman nyina mpem mbra Wo hɔ,
Ma obiara ndzi asԑmpa n' do;
Agyenkwa hu hɔn berԑ nyina,
Nyame N'enyimnyam ahyԑ W' ma.

MHB 814
5 . O for Thy truth and mercy’s sake
The purchase of Thy passion claim !
Thine heritage, the nations, take,
And cause the world to know Thy name.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Wo nokwar na ehumbɔbɔr ntsi
Gye hɔn a iwui maa hɔn no!
Fa aman nyina yԑ W'egyapadze;

MHB 815
1 . HILLS of the North, rejoice,
River and mountain-spring,
Hark to the advent voice,
Valley and lowland, sing:
Though absent long, your Lord is nigh;
He judgment brings and victory.
	 ~ 	1 . KWAAMU nkokwaa hom ndzi dԑw,
Esutsen, mbepɔw m' nsu,
Hom ntsie ndze a ɔreba n';
Mbɔnsa, asaase ntow ndwom;
Sԑ hom Ewuradze kyԑree a, ɔabԑn;
Ɔdze atsԑmbu na konyim nam.
Yԑreba abedzi hen wɔ wo mu.

MHB 815
2 . Isles of the southern seas,
Deep in your coral caves
Pent be each warring breeze,
Lulled be your restless waves:
He comes to reign with boundless sway,
And makes your wastes His great highway.
	 ~ 	2 
. Pomu afamu esupruw,
Hom abotu nyina mu,
Mframadzen nyina ntaa dzinn;
Hom asorԑkye dzen n' ntaa dzinn:
Ɔdze tum kԑse bedzi hen,
Na asaase hun ayԑ N'atsempɔn.

MHB 815
3 . Lands of the East, awake,
Soon shall your sons be free;
The sleep of ages break,
And rise to liberty:
On your far hills, long cold and gray,
Has dawned the everlasting day.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Boka nsaase hom nnyan,
Hom mba bԑyԑ adehye;
Hom mfi tsetse nda n' mu,
Nsoԑr nkɔ fahodzi mu;
Onnyiewiei da no enya epue
Wɔ ekyirkyir awɔw nkokwaa n' do.

MHB 815
4 . Shores of the utmost West,
Ye that have waited long,
Unvisited, unblest,
Break forth to swelling song;
High raise the note, that Jesus died,
Yet lives and reigns-the Crucified.
	 ~ 	4 
. Anee mpoano ahorow,
Hom a hom atweɔn akyԑr,
Nsera na nhyira abɔ hom,
Hom mbɔ m' ntow ndwom kԑse;
Hom mpaa mu ntow dԑ Jesus wui,
Nyia wokum No n' tse ase dzi hen.

MHB 815
5 .  Shout, while ye journey home;
Songs be in every mouth;
Lo, from the North we come,
From East, and West, and South.
City of God, the bond are free;
We come to live and reign in thee.	 ~ 	5 
. Ber a hom rokɔ fie yi,
Hom mu biara ntow ndwom;
Hwԑ yefi Kwaamu, Boka,
Anee, Pomu na yԑaba;
Nyame Kurow, yԑayԑ adehye,

MHB 816
1 . THE Son of God goes forth to war,
A kingly crown to gain;
His blood-red banner streams afar:
Who follows in His train?
Who best can drink his cup of woe,
Triumphant over pain,
Who patient bears his cross below,
He follows in His train.
 	 ~ 	1 . NYAME Ba no kɔ akono,
Dԑ obenya ahenkyԑw;
No bɔgyaa frankaa nyam fi ekyir.
Woana fa No kwan do?
Nyia ɔnom mbusu kɔɔpow no,
Dzi konyim wɔ yaw do,
Ɔdze abotar soa ne mbeamudua n'
Bԑfa No kwan no do.
Yԑmfa mfa hɔn kwan do.  Amen.

MHB 816
2 . The martyr first, whose eagle eye
Could pierce beyond the grave,
Who saw his Master in the sky,
And called on Him to save;
Like him, with pardon on his tongue
In midst of mortal pain,
He prayed for them that did the wrong:
Who follows in his train?
  	 ~ 	2 
. Sԑmpa tɔfo a odzi kan no 
Hunii traa adakamaa n',
Ohun no Wura wɔ sorsor,
Na ɔfrԑԑ N' dԑ ɔngye n' nkwa;
Ɔno na akyԑpa wɔ n'ano
Wɔ n'amandzehu mu n',
Ɔsɔree maa abɔnfo no;
Woana bԑfa N' kwan n' do?

MHB 816
3 . A glorious band, the chosen few
On whom the Spirit came,
Twelve valiant saints, their hope they knew,
And mocked the cross and flame;
They met the tyrant’s brandished steel,
The lion’s gory mane,
They bowed their necks the death to feel:
Who follows in their train?
	 ~ 	3 
. Enyimnyam kuw a wɔasan mu eyi a
Sunsum no dwiir hɔn do n'
Hun 'hotsewfo duebien n' 'nyidar,
Wɔtwee esԑndua na gya n';
Wohyiaa etsiɔdzenfo afowa,
Gyinaa ngyata enyim,
Wɔbrԑԑ hɔn kɔn adze maa owu;
Woana fa hɔn kwan do?

MHB 816
4 .  A noble army, men and boys,
The matron and the maid,
Around the Saviour’s throne rejoice,
In robes of light arrayed.
They climbed the steep ascent of heaven,
Through peril, toil, and pain:
O God, to us may grace be given
To follow in their train.	 ~ 	4 
. 'Kofo kuw, mpanyin, na mbofra,
Mbaapɔn na mbaawa so,
Wodzi Gyefo ahengua n' ho dԑw,
Wɔhyehyԑ ntar fitaa;
Wɔfoow ahenman bepɔw srɔnsrɔm n',
Wɔ mbusu, fona na yaw mu,
O Nyame, ma hԑn adom ma

MHB 817
1 . FLING out the banner! let it float
Skyward and seaward, high and wide;
The sun that lights its shining folds,
The cross, on which the Savior died.
	 ~ 	1 . WONYAM frankaa no! Wͻntsérɛw mu,
Wimu na pomu na tɛtɛr m;,
Ewia bɛhyérɛn n’ mbobͻwee do.
Mbeamuduà a Agyenkwa tͻr do n’.
Yedzi nyim wͻ nsewhyɛ no nko mu.

MHB 817
2 . Fling out the banner! Angels bend
In anxious silence o’er the sign;
And vainly seek to comprehend
The wonder of the Love Divine.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wonyam frankaa no ! Abͻfo
Kotow ahyɛnsew n’ kommyɛ mu:
Wͻper kwa atse Nyame Dͻ
No nwanwa kɛse no ase.

MHB 817
3 . Fling out the banner! heathen lands
Shall see from far the glorious sight,
And nations crowding to be born
Baptize their spirits in its light.
	 ~ 	3 
. Wonyam frankaa no! Wiadzefo
Bohu N’enyimnyam no wͻ ekyir;
Aman pii a wͻper hͻn awoe ho n‘,
Bonuma hͻn akra wͻ n’ kan mu.

MHB 817
4 . Fling out the banner! let it float
Skyward and seaward, high and wide,
Our glory, only in the cross;
Our only hope, the Crucified!
	 ~ 	4 
. Wonyam frankaa no! Wͻntsérɛw mu.
Wimu na pomu ne tɛtɛr m’:
Hɛn enyimnyam nye mbeamudua n’ nko;
Hɛn enyidar nko nye Nyia wͻsɛɛn N’.

MHB 817
5 . Fling out the banner! wide and high,
Seaward and skyward, let it shine;
Nor skill, nor might, nor merit ours;
We conquer only in that sign.	 ~ 	5 
. Wonyam frankaa no! Ma ͻnkrͻn ntsérɛw,
Wͻmma ͻnhyérɛn, nkͻ sor na pomu:
Yennyi nyimdzee, ahom na tum;

MHB 818
1 . HAPPY the souls to Jesus joined,
And saved by grace alone;
Walking in all thy ways, we find
Their heaven on earth begun.
	 ~ 	1 . AKRA a adom dze hɔn aba
Jesus mu n' wɔ enyigye!
Wɔnam N'akwan mu a, wonya hɔn
Heaven wɔ asaase.
Behyia Wo wɔ wimu hɔ

MHB 818
2 . The church triumphant in Thy love,
Their mighty joys we know;
They sing the Lamb in hymns above,
And we in hymns below.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Yenyim konyim asɔr n' hɔn dԑw
Wɔ Wo dɔ kԑse n' mu;
Wɔtow Eguambaa N' ndwom wɔ sor,
Yԑyԑ dԑm wɔ ase ha.

MHB 818
3 . Thee in thy glorious realm they praise,
And bow before Thy throne,
We in the kingdom of Thy grace:
The kingdoms are but one.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Wɔntonton Wo enyimnyam mu,
Twa hwe W'ehengua enyim;
Yԑkamfo W' wɔ W'adom ahenman m',
Ahenman no yԑ kor.

MHB 818
4 . The holy to the holiest leads;
From hence our spirits rise,
And whoso in Thy statutes treads
Shall meet Thee in the skies.	 ~ 	4 
. Igya hԑn kɔ krɔnkrɔn bea n' do,
Hɔ na hԑn sunsum fi;
Nyia otsiatsia W'anamɔn mu n'

MHB 819
1 . FORTH rode the knights of old
With armour gleaming bright,
By noble deeds and actions bold
To fight for God and right.
To lay the tyrant low,
 To set the captive free,
 The hosts of evil to o’erthrow
By might of purity.
	 ~ 	1 . AKOFO n' dze akodze
Hyԑnhyԑnn kɔr akono,
Wo akokodur na ndzeyԑԑ pa m',
Kɔkoe maa Nyankopɔn.
Wɔbrԑԑ otsiɔdzennyi adze,
Dze poon adaduafo,
Dze tutuu mbɔnsandɔm guu koraa,
Wɔ ahotsew tum mu.
Na afowa tu hɔn sa.

MHB 819
2 . A vision flamed above,
A voice within spoke clear,
The symbol of Christ’s mighty love
Shone radiant and near.
Then, burning with desire,
By zeal and love possessed,
The knights of old with heart afire
Rode out upon the quest.
	 ~ 	2 
. 'Nyido adzehu hyerԑnee,
Ndze bi kasae hɔn mu,
Christ No dɔ kԑse n'ahyԑnsew n'
Hyerԑԑn fԑԑfԑw wɔ hɔn enyim.
Afei pԑpa dzendzen,
Ndamyԑ na dɔ kitsaa,
Tsetse akofo dɔm yi ma
Wɔhoom do kɔr kan.

MHB 819
3 . In every age the same,
From hut and princely ball,
The pilgrim knights who bear His name
Have followed at His call.
Now each with glory crowned.
And waiting on His will,
They stand His splendid throne around
And serve more nobly still.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔtse dԑm ber biara,
Fi pata na ahemfie,
'Kwantufo a Ne dzin da hɔn do n'
Edzi Ne frԑ ekyir.
