Enyimnyam aka hɔn,
Na wɔrotweɔn Ne pԑ m';
Woetwa N'ahengua ho ehyia,
Wɔda ho ara som yie.

MHB 819
4 . Still, still the vision glows,
Still calls the voice divine ;
Still sink the weak, oppressed by foes, 
 And still the captives pine ;
Still loyal to their Lord,
With zeal and patience shod,
With shield of faith and mystic sword,
Go forth the knights of God.	 ~ 	4 
. 'Nyido adzehu n' hyerԑn daa,
Nyame ndze n' da ho frԑ,
'Tamfo n'da ho hyԑ abɔbɔfo,
'Daduafo da ho pen;
Wɔdze nsi na abotar,
Gyina ma hɔn Wura,
Nyame akofo dze gyedzi kyԑm

MHB 82
1 . HARK the glad sound! the Saviour comes,
The Saviour promised long:
Let every heart prepare a throne,
And every voice a song.
	 ~ 	1 . TSIE enyigye ndze! Agyenkwa aba, 
Nyia wɔbɔɔ N' ho dawur n';
Ma akoma biara ngye No ntsena m'
Na ndze biara ntow ndwom.

MHB 82
2 . He comes the prisoners to release,
In Satan’s bondage held;
The gates of brass before Him burst.
The iron fetters yield.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔba bɛgye adaduafo
Fi abɔnsam ndɔmmum mu;
Ayewa mbobow bue N'enyim,
Ndadze mpokyerɛ bubu.
.

MHB 82
3 . He comes the broken heart to bind,
The bleeding soul to cure,
And with the treasures of His grace
To enrich the humble poor
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔbɛkyekye akoma a ebubu,
Ɔbesa ɔkra yar;
 Ɔdze N'adom akoradze no
Bɛma hianyi brɛfo.

MHB 82
4 . Our glad hosannas, Prince of Peace,
Thy welcome shall proclaim;
And heaven’s eternal arches ring
With Thy beloved name.	 ~ 	4 . Asomdwee Hen, hɛn hosanna,
Yɛdze ma W' akɔaba,
Na ɔsor abangua wosow,
Dze Wo dzin a ɔyɛ dɔ n'.

MHB 820
1 . WHO is on the Lord’s side?
Who will serve the King?
Who will be His helpers,
Other lives to bring?
Who will leave the world’s side?
Who will face the foe?
Who is on the Lord’s side?
 Who for Him will go? 
By Thy call of mercy, by Thy grace divine,
We are on the Lord’s side;
Saviour, we are Thine !
	 ~ 	1 . WOANA wɔ Ewuradze afa?
Woana bɔsom Ɔhen n'?
Woana bԑyԑ No mboa,
Atwetwe akra ama N'?
Woana bɔpow wiadze,
Ako etsia tamfo n'?
Woana wɔ Ewuradze afa?
Woana bɔkɔ ama N'?
W'ehumbɔbɔr frԑ n' ntsi,
W'adom nwanwa n' ntsi,
Yewɔ W'afa, Gyefo,
Yԑyԑ Wodze daa.
Yԑyԑ Wodze daa.

MHB 820
2 .  Jesus, Thou hast bought us,
Not with gold or gem,
But with Thine own life blood,
For Thy diadem;
With Thy blessing filling
Each who comes to Thee,
Thou hast made us willing,
Thou hast made us free.
By Thy grand redemption,
By Thy grace divine, 
We are on the Lord’s side;
Saviour, we are Thine.
	 ~ 	2 
. Jesus enndze sika
Na dwetԑ tɔɔ hԑn;
Mbom W'adehye bɔgya n'
Ayԑ hԑn ahenkyԑw,
Ewora nhyira nsu gu
Nyia ɔba Wo hɔ n' do,
Ama yeenya pԑ bi,
Ayԑ hԑn adehye.
Wo dɔ a ɔapon hԑn ntsi,
W'adom nwanwa n' ntsi,
Yewɔ W'afa Gyefo,
Yԑyԑ Wodze daa.

MHB 820
3 .  Fierce may be the conflict,
Strong may be the foe,
 But the King’s own army
None can overthrow;
Round His standard ranging,
Victory is secure,
For His truth unchanging
Makes the triumph sure.
Joyfully enlisting,
By Thy grace divine,
We are on the Lord’s side;
Saviour, we are Thine.
  	 ~ 	3 
. Sԑ ɔko n' y hu mpo a,
'Tamfo n' yԑ dzen mpo a,
Ɔhen N'akofo n' dze,
'Biara runntum hԑn.
Yedzi N'ekyir yi dze,
Konyimdzi wɔ hԑn;
No nokwar a ɔnnsakyer n'
Ma hen awerԑhyԑm'.
Yԑdɔm W'akafo no,
W'adom nwanwa n' ntsi,
Yewɔ W'afa Gyefo,
Yԑyԑ Wodze daa.

MHB 820
4 . Chosen to be soldiers
In an alien land,
Chosen, called, and faithful,
 For our Captain’s band,
In the service royal
Let us not grow cold;
Let us be right loyal,
Noble, true, and bold. 
Master, Thou wilt keep us,
By Thy grace divine,
Always on the Lord’s side,
Savior always  Thine.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Wɔayԑ hԑn nsordaafo
Wɔ ananabea ha;
Yԑyԑ agyedzifo ma
Hԑn Sahen No kuw.
Adehyesom no mu,
Mma yԑnnyԑ nwin da;
Hom mma yengyina pintsinn,
Nokwar m', 'kokodur m'.
Hԑn Wura, ebɔkora, hԑn,
W'adom nwanwa n' ntsi,
Yԑwɔ W'afa, Gyefo;

MHB 821
1 . STAND up, stand up for Jesus, 
Ye soldiers of the cross;
Lift high His royal banner, 
It must not suffer loss.
From victory unto victory
His army shall He lead,
Till every foe is vanquished, 
And Christ is Lord indeed.
	 ~ 	1 . Hom ngyina, hom ngyina mma Jesus! 
Mbeamudua ho nsordaafo;
Hom mma N'ahen-frankaa n' do;
Onnyi dɛ ofi nsa
Obedzi No dɔm kan fi
Konyimm' akɔ konyimm'
Kyerɛ wɔka atamfo nyina hyɛ
Ma Christ dzi hen ampa.
Bedzi hen afebɔɔ.

MHB 821
2 . Stand up, stand up for Jesus, 
The trumpet call obey;
Forth to the mighty conflict, 
In this His glorious day.
Ye that are brave now serve Him
Against unnumbered foes;
Let courage rise with danger,
And strength to strength oppose.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hom ngyina, hom ngyina mma Jesus! 
Hom ntsie abɛn ne frɛ;
Hom nduom ɔko kɛse n' mu
Wɔ N'enyimnyam da yim'!
Mbarimba, afei hom nsom no
Mfa ntsia atamfo dɔm n'
Hom mfa ndam ngyina mbusu ano,
Hom ntutu dɔm nka dɔm.

MHB 821
3 . Stand up, stand up for Jesus 
Stand in His strength alone : 
The arm of flesh will fail you;
Ye dare not trust your own. 
Put on the Christian's armour,
And watching unto prayer, 
Where duty calls, or danger,
Be never wanting there.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hom ngyina, hom ngyina mma Jesus! 
Hom ngyina N'ahoɔdzen nkom'
Honam abaw bɛpa hom;
Mma hom nntwer hombo da.
Hom nhyɛ Christian akontar,
Na hom nweɔn asɔryɛm',
Edwumayɛ mu o, mbusu mu o
Mma hom nntwa abrɔdɔ.

MHB 821
4 . Stand up, stand up for Jesus 
The strife will not be long; 
This day the noise of battle, 
The next the victor's song. 
To him that overcometh
A crown of life shall be; 
He with the King of 
Glory Shall reign eternally.	 ~ 	4 
. Hom ngyina, hom ngyina mma Jesus! 
Aperdzi no rennkyɛr 
Ndɛ dze ɔko mu dede
'Kyena konyimdzifo ndwom a 
Nyia obedzi konyim no
Wɔbɛma n' nkwa ahenkyɛw
Ɔnye enyimnyam Hen no

MHB 822
1 . ONWARD, Christian soldiers, 
Marching as to war,
With the cross of Jesus 
Going on before.
Christ, the royal Master, 
Leads against the foe;
Forward into battle 
See His banners go!
      
   Onward, Christian soldiers,
   Marching as to war,
   With the cross of Jesus
   Going on before.
 	 ~ 	1 . Christian n-sordaafo, 
Hom nduom akono!
Jesus Ne mbeamudua n'
Dzi hɛn enyim kan.
Hɛn Hen Christ etu sa 
Roko tsia tamfo n',
Hom nduom n-seraban do,
Hom nhwɛ ne mfrankaa n'.
  
    Christian n-sordaafo, 
    Hom nduom akono! 
    Jesus Ne mbeamudua n' 
    Dzi hɛn envim kan. 
Bɔtow afebɔɔ.

MHB 822
2 . At the sign of triumph 
Satan’s host doth flee;
On then, Christian soldiers, 
On to victory!
Hell’s foundations quiver
At the shout of praise;
Brothers lift your voices,
Loud your anthems raise.
	 ~ 	2  
. Yɛma Ne frankaa n' do a, 
Abɔnsam dɔm gu;
Dɛm a Christ akofo,
Hom nkedzi konyim!
Yɛbɔ se yi ayɛw a,
Hɛll fapem wosow;
Enuanom, hom ntow ndwom,
Hom mma hom ndze do.

MHB 822
3 . Like a mighty army 
Moves the church of God; 
Brothers, we are treading 
Where the saints have trod.
We are not divided, 
All one body we,
One in hope and doctrine,
One in charity.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyame N'asɔr tse dɛ 
Dɔm a wɔyɛ dzen:
Yɛnam ahotsewfo
Hɔn anamɔn mu.
Hɛn mu nnyi mpaapaamu,
Yɛyɛ adze kor.
Hɛn botae, hɛn nkyerɛkyerɛ
Hɛn dɔ nyina kor.

MHB 822
4 . Crowns and thrones may perish,
Kingdoms rise and wane,
But the church of Jesus 
Constant will remain.
Gates of hell can never
Gainst that church prevail;
We have Christ’s own promise,
And that cannot fail.
	 ~ 	4  
. Ahengua botutu, 
Ahenman etwam',
Na Jesus N'asɔr dze
Betsim afebɔɔ;
Samanadze akoban
Runntum ahyɛ do:
Christ Noara na ɔkae,
N'asɛm so yɛ hɔ.

MHB 822
5 . Onward then, ye people!
Join our happy throng;
Blend with ours your voices
In the triumph song.
Glory, laud and honor
Unto Christ the King!
This through countless ages
Men and angels sing.	 ~ 	5 
. Mo nkorɔfo e, hom mbɔdɔm 
Egyigye kuw yi;
Hom mfa hom ndze mbɔto
Hɛn konyim ndwom yim':
Enyimnyam na nkamfo
N-ka hɛn Hen Christ!
Yi nyimpa na abɔfo

MHB 823
1 . OUR life is hid with Christ in God ;
Our Life shall soon appear,
And shed His glory all abroad
In all His members here.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN nkwa suma Christ mu wɔ Nyame m',
Hԑn nkwa bopue ntsԑntsԑm,
Eeyi N'enyimnyam akyerԑ mbeambea,
Wɔ no nkorɔfo nyina m'.
Ndwen mpirenyimadze no ho.

MHB 823
2 . Our souls are in His mighty hand,
And He shall keep them still;
And you and I shall surely stand
With Him on Zion’s hill.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hԑn akra kitsa No tum nsamu,
Ɔbɔkora hɔn daa;
Emi na ɔwo begyina Ne nkyԑn
Wɔ Zion bepɔw do.

MHB 823
3 . O what a joyful meeting there !
In robes of white arrayed,
Palms in our bands we all shall bear,
And crowns upon our head.
 	 ~ 	3 
. O enyigye nhyiamu bԑn a!
Yebowuna ntar fitaa,
Ekitsa mberԑnkɔnson daa,
Na yԑasoa ahenkyԑw.

MHB 823
4 . Then let us lawfully contend,
And fight our passage through :
Bear in our faithful minds the end,
 And keep the prize in view.	 ~ 	4 
. Afei yԑmfa no dԑm wɔ mbra m'
Na yԑnko nkɔ hԑn enyim;
Yԑnkaa ewiei no hԑn adwen nu

MHB 824
1 . COME, let us join our friends above
That have obtained the prize,
And on the eagle wings of love
To joys celestial rise:
Let all the saints terrestrial sing
With those to glory gone;
For all the servants of our King,
In earth and heaven, are one.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM mma yɛnye sor adͻfo a
Woenya akyɛdze n’ mbͻ m',
Yɛmfa ͻkͻr dͻ atsaban do
Yentu nkͻ sor dɛw mu:
Wͻmma ahotsewfo nye hͻn a,
Wͻkͻ ’nyimnyam m' ntow ndwom,
Na hɛn Hen N’asomfo a wͻwͻ
Sor na ase nyina yɛ kor.
Bɛfa hɛn kͻ heaven.    Amen.

MHB 824
2 . One family we dwell in him,
One church, above, beneath,
Though now divided by the stream,
The narrow stream of death:
One army of the living God,
To his command we bow;
Part of his host have crossed the flood,
And part are crossing now.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ebusua kor a yɛtse No mu.
Sor nyé ase Asͻr kor,
Mbom sesei, esutsen twa hɛn ntamu,
Owu esutsen tséabea n’;
Nyame tseasefo nsordaafo a
Yɛhyɛ No tum ase;
No dͻm no bi etwa esupramee,
Bi so gu do rutwa.

MHB 824
3 . Ten thousand to their endless home
This solemn moment fly;
And we are to the margin come,
And we expect to die;
Even now by faith we join our hands
With those that went before;
And greet the blood-besprinkled bands
On the eternal shore.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Mpem du rokͻ onnyiewie fie’,
Dɛm awͻse ber yi;
Na hɛn so yɛaba berano,
Na hɛn enyi da owu kwan;
Sesei mpo yɛnyé edzikamfo n'
To nsa wͻ gyedzi mu,
Kyià ekuw a bͻgye atsew hͻn ho
Wͻ onnyiewiei mpoano.

MHB 824
4 . Our spirits too shall quickly join,
Like theirs with glory crowned,
And shout to see our Captain’s sign,
To hear his trumpet sound.
O that we now might grasp our guide !
O that the word were given !
And land us all in heaven.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn so hɛn akra bͻkͻ ekɛka
'Nyimnyamfo akra no ho,
Yɛatsea mu Sahen N’ahyɛnsew n’ ho,
Ber a yɛatse N’abɛn ndze n’;
O nkyɛ yeesuo Kwangyafo n’ mu!
Nkyɛ wͻama hɛn asɛm no!
Dͻm Ewuradze, paa asorɛkye n' mu bra,

MHB 825
1 . THE saints of God! their conflict past
And life’s long battle won at last,
No more they need the shield or sword,
They cast them down before their Lord:
O happy saints! for ever blest,
At Jesus’ feet how safe your rest!
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME ahotsewfo, hɔn haw etwa m',
Woedzi konyim wɔ ɔbra ko yi m',
Wonnhia kyɛm na nkrantsee biara;
Wobubu mu gu hɔn Wura enyim;
O 'hotsewfo a woehyira hɔn,
Jesu N'anan ase na wɔhom.
Atsena paradise ahomgye m'.  Amen.

MHB 825
2 . The saints of God! their wanderings done,
No more their weary course they run,
No more they faint, no more they fall,
No foes oppress, no fears appal:
O happy saints! for ever blest
In that dear home how sweet your rest!
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyame ahotsewfo ewie kyin,
Wonntu fona mbirika bio,
Wɔnntɔ bitsi, wɔnnhwe ase bio,
'Tamfo nnhyɛ hɔn do, suro nnyi hɔ;
O 'hotsewfo a woehyira hɔn,
Wɔhom yie wɔ dɛm fie pa n' mu.

MHB 825
3 . The saints of God! life’s voyage o’er,
Safe landed on that blissful shore,
No stormy tempest now they dread,
No roaring billows lift their head:
O happy saints! for ever blest,
In that calm haven of your rest.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyame ahotsewfo bra abɔ adze,
Wodwir berɛww wɔ 'nyigye mpoano,
Wonnsuro ehum dzendzen no bio,
'Sorɛkye dzendzen biara nnyi hɔ;
O 'hotsewfo a woehyira hɔn,
Wɔhom yie wɔ asomdwee bea n' do.

MHB 825
4 . O God of saints, to thee we cry;
O Saviour, plead for us on high;
O Holy Ghost, our guide and friend,
Grant us thy grace till life shall end;
That with all saints our rest may be
In that bright Paradise with thee.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. 'Hotsewfo Nyame, yesu frɛ W';
O Agyenkwa, dzi ma hɛn sor;
Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, Gyafo, Nyɛnko,
Fa W'adom boa hɛn kesi ewiei;
O 'hotsewfo a woehyira hɔn,

MHB 826
1 . O GOD, to whom the faithful dead
Still live, united to their Head,
Their Lord and ours the same:
For all thy saints, to memory dear,
Departed in thy faith and fear,
We bless thy holy name. 
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME, agyedzifo a woewu
Da ho ara nye hɔn Tsir tse ase,
Yɛnye hɔn wɔ Wura kor;
Yehyira Wo dzin krɔnkrɔn no
Wɔ W'ahotsewfo a woefi mu,
Wɔ Wo gyedzi na suro m' ntsi.
Wɔ hɛn Pomfo no ntsi.   Amen.

MHB 826
2 . By the same grace upheld, may we
So follow those who followed thee,
As with them to partake
The full reward of heavenly bliss:
Merciful Father! grant us this
For our Redeemer’s sake.	 ~ 	2 
. Adom kor a okura hɛn no mu
Yentsiw hɔn a wodzii W'ekyir no,
Na yɛnye hɔn aakyɛ
Ɔsor dɛw akatua kɛse n';
Mbɔbɔrhu Egya, dom hɛn yi

MHB 827
1 . THEIR names are names of kings 
Of heavenly line ;
The bliss of earthly things
They did resign.
	 ~ 	1 . HƆN edzin yɛ ahemfo edzin,
'Sor adehye a;
Wiadze ndzepa mu dɛw n',
Wɔpoow ne nyina.
Hɔn ahomgye n' bi.  Amen.

MHB 827
2 . Chieftains they were, who warred
With sword and shield ;
Victors for God the Lord
On foughten field.
 	 ~ 	2 
. 'Hemfo a wɔdze nkrantsee
Na akokyɛm koe;
Nyame N' nkonyimdzifo
Wɔ akono.

MHB 827
3 . Sad were their days on earth,
‘Mid hate and scorn,
A life of pleasure’s dearth,
A death forlorn ;
	 ~ 	3 
. Hɔn wiadze nda yɛɛ yaw
Wɔ ɔtan yerɛyerɛw m',
Ɔbra a enyigye nnyi m',
Na owu ara nko.

MHB 827
4 . Yet blest that end in woe,
And those sad days;
Only man’s blame below;
Above-God’s praise.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Mbusu n' mpo nhyira wɔ mu
Dɛ yaw nda n' so;
Nyimpa afɔbu wɔ ase;
Sor Egya n' ayɛyi a.

MHB 827
5 . A city of great name
Is built for them,
Of glorious golden fame- 
Jerusalem !
 	 ~ 	5 
. Wɔakyekyer kuropɔn bi
Dze ama hɔn;
Ɔwɔ enyimnaymm kɛse,
Jerusalem!

MHB 827
6 . Redeemed with precious blood
From death and sin,
Sons of the Triune God,
They enter in.
	 ~ 	6 
. Adehye bɔgya gyee n'
Fii 'wu na bɔn m',
Ɔkorsa Nyame mba,
Hɛn mu kɔ fie.

MHB 827
7 . So doth the life of pain
In glory close ;
Lord God, may we attain
Their grand repose.   Amen. 	 ~ 	7 
. Dɛm na abrabɔ yaayaw n'
Wowie n' 'nyimnyam m';
Hɛn Wura, ma hɛn nsa nka

MHB 828
1 . TEN thousand times ten thousand
In sparkling raiment bright,
The armies of the ransomed saints
Throng up the steeps of light;
’Tis finished, all is finished, 
Their fight with death and sin;
Fling open wide the golden gates,
And let the victors in.
	 ~ 	1 . 'HOTSEWFO nsordaafo ɔpedu,
Ɔpedu wɔapon hɔn
Hyehyɛ hɔn ntar hyirenn rofow
Kan bepɔw tsentsen no;
Owu na bɔn ho akodzi no
Woewie ko ampaara;
Hom mbuebue sika mbotsen no,
Ma nkonyimdzifo n' mbra m'.
Ɔhen Ba Agyenkwa, bra. Amen.

MHB 828
2 . What rush of Hallelujahs
Fills all the earth and sky!
What ringing of a thousand harps 
Bespeaks the triumph nigh!
O day, for which creation
And all its tribes were made;
O joy, for all its former woes
A thousand-fold repaid!
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔhyew do hallelujah ahyɛ 
Asaase na ɔsor ma!
N-sankutsen apem robɔ 
Dze kyerɛ konyim a abɛn n'!
O dɛm da yi ntsi na wɔbɔɔ
Wiadze na nyimpa nyina!
O dɛw a oetua fona dadaw
Nyina kaw pem mbɔho!

MHB 828
3 . O then what raptured  greetings
On Canaan’s happy shore;
What knitting severed friendships up, 
Where partings are no more!
Then eyes with joy shall sparkle, 
That brimmed with tears of late;
Orphans no longer fatherless, 
Nor widows desolate.
	 ~ 	3 
. Dɛw nkyiakyia bi a obesi
Canaan enyika mpoano a!
'Nyɛnkoyɛ a no mu atsetsew,
Bɔfrɔm bio a onnkogu!
Na enyiwa a nyinsu hyɛ n' ma n'
Dze dɛw bɛhyerɛn da no;
Ngyanka benya hɔn egyanom,
'Kunafo werɛ nnkɔhow.

MHB 828
4 . Bring near Thy great salvation, 
Thou Lamb for sinners slain;
Fill up the roll of Thine elect, 
Then take Thy power, and reign;
Appear, Desire of nations, 
Thine exiles long for home;
Show in the heaven Thy promised sign;
 Thou Prince and Savior, come.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Fa Wo nkwagye kɛse no bɛn,
Eguambaa a bɔn ntsi iwui;
Hyehyɛ hɔn a afrɛ hɔn n' nyina ma
Na fa Wo tum dzi hen,
Aman nyina Ahwehwɛdze, bra,
Wo ndɔmmumfo afe fie;
W'anohoba ahyɛnsew n' mpue wimu;

MHB 829
1 . HARK! the song of jubilee,
Loud as mighty thunders’ roar,
Or the fullness of the sea,
When it breaks upon the shore:
Hallelujah! for the Lord
God omnipotent shall reign;
Hallelujah! let the word
Echo round the earth and main.
	 ~ 	1 . TSIE! Mfeduonum 'fahyɛ ndwom;
Ne dede tse dɛ aprandaa;
Anaa po a ɔapram kɛse
Bu asorɛkye bogu mpoano,
Hallelujah! Ewuradze
Nyame Tumfo bedzi hen;
Hallelujah! Ma asɛm no
Ntahye wiadze nyinara.
Christ m' Nyame, yɛ adze kor.

MHB 829
2 . Hallelujah! hark! the sound
From the depths unto the skies,
Wakes above, beneath, around,
All creation’s harmonies;
See Jehovah’s banner furled,
Sheathed His sword; He speaks; ’tis done!
And the kingdoms of this world
Are the kingdoms of His Son.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Hallelujah! Tsie! Ndze no a
Ofi bun mu kɔ wimu no,
Nyan abɔdze nyinara,
Wɔ sor, ase beebiara 
Wɔabobɔw Gyefo frankaa n';
Ɔnntwe nkrantsee; ɔka a ɔba m';
Na wiadze yi mu ahenman
Nyina yɛ Ne Ba N'ahenman.

MHB 829
3 . He shall reign from pole to pole
With illimitable sway;
He shall reign, when, like a scroll
Yonder heavens have passed away:
Then the end; beneath His rod
Man’s last enemy shall fall;
Hallelujah! Christ in God,
God in Christ, is all in all.	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔdze tum a onnyi mbanano,
Bedzi hen wɔ mbea nyina;
Sɛ ɔsor bobɔw kɔ mpo a
Ɔbɔkɔ do eedzi hen;
Ewiei n', dasanyi n' tamfo n'
Bɔhwe ase wɔ N' poma ase;
Hallelujah! Nyame m' Christ,

MHB 83
1 . OF the Father’s love begotten 
Ere the worlds began to be,
He is Alpha and Omega, 
He the source, the ending He,
Of the things that are, that have been,
And that future years shall see,
Evermore and evermore.
	 ~ 	1 . EGYA No dɔ na ɔwoo No
Ansaana wiadze reba,
Ɔno nye Alpha na Omega,
Ɔyɛ ahyɛse na ewiei;
Sesei ndzɛmba na dza etwa m'
Na mfe a ɔreba nyina,
Afebɔɔ na afebɔɔ.

MHB 83
2 . By His word was all created;
He commanded and ’twas done;
Earth and sky and boundless ocean,
Universe of three in one,
All that sees the moon’s soft radiance,
All that breathes beneath the sun.
Evermore and evermore
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔdze N'asɛm bɔɔ adze nyina;
Ɔhyɛɛ dɛ ɔmbra na ɔbae;
Asaase, ɔsor na po nyina,
Ka bɔ mu yɛ wiadze kor;
Ndzɛmba a wohu bosoom hyerɛn, 
Na dza wɔhom wi yi ase,
Afebɔɔ na afebɔɔ.

MHB 83
3 . This is He Whom seers in old time 
chanted of with one accord,
Whom the voices of the prophets 
Promised in their faithful word;
Now He shines, the long-expected;
Let creation praise its Lord, 
Evermore and evermore.
	 ~ 	3 . Oyi na tsetse adzehufo
Bɔɔ anosɛɛ toow No ho ndwom;
Nyia nkɔnhyɛfo no dze hɔn ndze
Kaa No ho asɛm nokwar mu;
Afei Nyia enyi daa N'kwan n' hyerɛn;
Ma abɔdze nyi Ewuradze ayɛw,
Afebɔɔ na afebɔɔ.

MHB 83
4 . Now let old and young uniting
Chant to thee harmonious lays;
Maid and matron hymn Thy glory,
Infant lips their anthems raise,
Boys and girl together singing
With pure heart their song of praise.
Evermore and evermore
	 ~ 	4 . Afei mpanyin na mbofra nyina
Nka mbɔ m' ntow Wo ndwom dɛɛdɛw;
'Baawa na no wura nyi' W'ayɛw,
Mbofra so ntow W'ayɛyi,
Mbanyimba, mbasiaba mbɔ m' ntow, 
Mfa akoma pa nyi W' ayɛw,
Afebɔɔ na afebɔɔ.

MHB 83
5 . O ye heights of heaven adore Him; 
Angel hosts, His praises sing;
All dominions, bow before Him, 
And extol our God and King;
Let no tongue on earth be silent,
Every voice in concert sing
Evermore and evermore.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Ɔsorsor, hom ntonton No;
Abɔfo dɔm nyi N'ayɛw;
Etumfo nyina nkotow No,
Hom nkrɔn hɛn Nyame Hen no;
Mma tɛkyerɛma biara nnyɛ komm,
Ma ndze nyinara ntow ndwom,
Afebɔɔ na afebɔɔ.   Amen.

MHB 830
1 . HARK! the sound of holy voices,
Chanting at the crystal sea,
Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Lord, to Thee;
Multitude, which none can number,
Like the stars in glory stand
Clothed in white apparel, holding 
Palms of victory in their hand.
 	 ~ 	1 . TSIE! Ahotsewfo hɔn ndze da m',
Gyegye po hyɛnhyɛn no ho:
Alleluja! Alleluja!
Alleluja nka Ewuradze.
Dɔntutum a wonntum nnkan hɔn
Dɛ nworaba gyina 'nyimnyam mu;
Woewuna fitaa na wokitsa
Konyimdzi ho mberɛnkɔnson.
Na Nyame Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn.  Amen.

MHB 830
2 . They have come from tribulation,
And have washed their robes in blood,
Washed them in the blood of Jesus;
Tried they were, and firm they stood;
Mocked, imprisoned, stoned, tormented,
Sawn asunder, slain with sword;
They have conquered death and Satan
By the might of Christ the Lord.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wofi ahohia mu aba,
Wɔahor hɔn ntar bɔgya n' mu,
Jesus bɔgyaa n' atsew hɔn ho;
Wɔsɔɔ hɔn hwɛe, wogyinaa dzen;
Wɔsereew hɔn guu fiadze,
Siiw hon abo, paa hɔn seradaa;
Wɔnam Christ No tum do woedzi
Owu na Satan do nyim.

MHB 830
3 . Marching with Thy cross their banner,
They have triumphed, following
Thee, the Captain of salvation,
Thee, their Savior and their King.
Gladly, Lord, with Thee they suffered;
Gladly, Lord, with Thee they died;
And by death to life immortal
They were born and glorified.
	 ~ 	3 
. Wɔdze Wo mbeamudua bɔɔ nsera;
Woedzi W'ekyir edzi konyim,
Ɔwo a eyɛ nkwagye Sahen,
Hɔn Agyenkwa na hɔn Hen.
Ao, Ewuradze, enyigye m' na
Wɔnye W' berɛɛ na wɔnye W' wui!
Wɔnam owu do enya daa nkwa,
Wɔawo hɔn enyimnyam mu!.

MHB 830
4 . God of God, the One-begotten,
Light of light, Immanuel,
In Whose body joined together
All the saints forever dwell;
Pour upon us of Thy fullness
That we may forevermore
God the Father, God the Son, and
God the Holy Ghost adore.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Nyame mu Nyame, Ba kortoo,
Kan mu Kan, Immanuel,
Wo nyimpadua mu na dabaa
Ahotsewfo bɔ mu tsenae.
Hue W'amayɛ no gu hɛn do,
Ama daa nyina yaasɔr
Nyame Egya, Nyame Ɔba

MHB 831
1 . GIVE me the wings of faith to rise
Within the veil, and see
The saints above, how great their joys,
How bright their glories be.
 	 ~ 	1 . Ma m' gyedzi ntsaban na muntu 
Nkɔ fua n' mu hɔ nkɔhwɛ
Sor esiarfo hɔn dɛw kɛse n',
Mbrɛ hɔn 'nyimnyam hyerɛn pa.
Kyerɛ dɛm sor kwan n' ara

MHB 831
2 . Once they were mourners here below,
And  poured out cries and tears:
They wrestled hard, as we do now,
With sins, and doubts, and fears.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ber bi nna wogyam wɔ ase ha, 
Na wɔkaa m' kyii nyinsu;
Wɔnye bɔn, ekyingye na suro
Dzii aper dzen dɛ hɛn so.

MHB 831
3 .  I asked them whence their victory came
They, with united breath:
Ascribed their conquest to the lamb,
Their triumph to his death.
	 ~ 	3 
. M'bisa dɛ hɔn konyim n' fir hen? 
Hɔn nyina bɔ mu ka dɛ
Hɔn konyimdzi fir Eguambaa n',
Hɔn konyim fir No wu.

MHB 831
4 .  They marked the footsteps that he trod,
His zeal inspired their breast;
And following their incarnate God,
Possess the promised rest.
	 ~ 	4 
. Wɔhyɛɛ mbrɛ otsiatsiae no nsew; 
No ndwuma hyɛɛ hɔn nkuran,
Na wɔkaa Nyame- nyimpa N' do
Nyaa anohoba ahomgye n'.

MHB 831
5 . Our glorious Leader claims our praise
For his own pattern given;
While the long cloud of witnesses
Show the same path to heaven.	 ~ 	5 
. Hɛn kandzifo hia hɛn nkamfo 
Wɔ Ne fasusu ntsi;
Na adasefo mununkum no

MHB 832
1 . FOR all the saints, who from their labours rest,
Who thee by faith before the world confessed,
Thy Name, O Jesus, be forever blest.
                                        Alleluia!
	 ~ 	1 . Ahotsewfo a apon hɔn edwuma a 
Wiadze enyim wɔbɔɔ Wo dzin no ntsi,
O Jesus, nhyira nka Wo dzin daa daa.
                             Alleluia!
                            Alleluia!

MHB 832
2 . Thou wast their Rock, their Fortress and their Might;
Thou, Lord, their Captain in the well fought fight;
Thou, in the darkness drear, their one true Light.
		Alleluia!
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɔn Bontan, Aban, Ahoɔdzen, nye 'Wo, 
Eyɛɛ hɔn Sahen wɔ nkodzen no mu;
Sum kadoo no mu hɔn nokwar kan kor.
                             Alleluia!

MHB 832
3 . O may thy soldiers, faithful, true, and bold,
Fight as the saints who nobly fought of old,
And win, with them the victor’s crown of gold.
		Alleluia!
	 ~ 	3  
. O ma Wo nkowaa anokwafo wɔnko 
M-barimbam' dɛ tsetse ahotsewfo n',
Ama wɔnye hɔn eenya ahenkyɛw no!
                            Alleluia!

MHB 832
4 . O blest communion, fellowship divine!
We feebly struggle, they in glory shine;
All are one in thee, for all are Thine.
		Alleluia!
	 ~ 	4 
. Siar nkitaho bit! fɛkuwbɔ krɔnkrɔn! 
Yɛper mberɛwm', wɔhyerɛn enyimnyam mu;
Naaso wɔnye hɛn bɔm' yɛ kor Wo mu.
                             Alleluia!

MHB 832
5 . And when the strife is fierce, the warfare long,
Steals on the ear the distant triumph song,
And hearts are brave, again, and arms are strong.
		Alleluia!
	 ~ 	5 
. Sɛ aperdzi n' yɛ dzen, ko n' war m-po a, 
Konyim ndwom no fi 'kyirekyir du asomu,
Ma akoko yɛ dur, abaw hyɛ dzen.
                             Alleluia!

MHB 832
6 . The golden evening brightens in the west;
Soon, soon to faithful warriors comes their rest;
Sweet is the calm of paradise the blessed.
		Alleluia!
	 ~ 	6 
. Witɔree dze sika hyerɛn wim' guann, 
Ɔnnkyɛr na akofo enya ahomgye.
Wohu siar Paradise no mu dɛw no.
                             Alleluia!

MHB 832
7 . But lo! there breaks a yet more glorious day;
The saints triumphant rise in bright array;
The King of glory passes on his way.
		Alleluia!
	 ~ 	7 
. Hwɛ! enyimnyam da bi so ɔreba a, 
Ahotsewfo n' bɔsoɛr konyimdzi mu,
Enyimnyam Hen no bopue No kwan do.
                             Alleluia!

MHB 832
8 . From earth’s wide bounds, from ocean’s farthest coast,
Through gates of pearl streams in the countless host,
And singing to Father, Son and Holy Ghost:
		Alleluia!	 ~ 	8 
. Dɔm kukuankoma fi wiadze nyina 
Dze ndwom bɛpem bota mbotsen no mu,
Woeyi Egya, Ba, nye Sunsum ayɛw;

MHB 833
1 . WHAT are these arrayed in white,
Brighter than the noon-day sun?
Foremost of the sons of light,
Nearest the eternal throne?
These are they that bore the cross,
Nobly for their Master stood;
Sufferers in his righteous cause,
Followers of the dying God. 
	 ~ 	1 . Woanam' wɔhyɛ futuw yi, 
Wɔhyerɛn sen wigyinae mpo 'i?
Kan no mu mba a wodzi kan,
Wɔbɛn Nyame N'ahengua 'i?
Yinom na wɔsoaa mbeamudua n',
Wodzii Christ ho dase pa,
Hɔn Wura N'asɛ ntsi wowui,.
Wɔkaa Nyame a owu n' do n'.
Ɔdze dɔ bɛhyɛ hɔn ma.

MHB 833
2 . Out of great distress they came,
Washed their robes by faith below
In the blood of yonder Lamb,
Blood that washes white as snow:
Therefore are they next the throne,
Serve their Maker day and night;
God resides among his own,
God doth in his saints delight.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wofir fona kɛsem' bae, 
Wɔdze gyedzi hoor hɔn ntar
Wɔ Eguambaa n' bɔgyaa mu,
Bɔgya a ɔma ahosan krɔnn:
N-tsi wɔbɛn ahengua n',
Na wɔsom hɔn Wura daa daa,
Nyame ko No nkorɔfo mu.
Nyame pɛ N'apapafo.

MHB 833
3 . More than conquerors at last,
Here they find their trials o’er;
They have all their sufferings past,
Hunger now and thirst no more;
No excessive heat they feel
From the sun’s directer ray,
In a milder clime they dwell,
Region of eternal day. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Wɔkyɛn ekonyimdzifo, 
Ha na hɔn nsɔhwɛ asa;
Hɔn berɛ nyina etwam',
Kɔm na nsukɔm nnyi hɔ bio;
Wɔnntse ɔhyew a ɔyɛ dzen a
Ofir ewia ne mfirii no mu,
Wɔtse ahomka mbew no mu,
Domankoma bea no do.

MHB 833
4 . He that on the throne doth reign,
Them the Lamb shall always feed,
With the tree of life sustain,
To the living fountains lead;
He shall all their sorrows chase,
All their wants at once remove,
Wipe the tears from every face,
Fill up every soul with love. 	 ~ 	4 
. Nyia ɔtse ahengua n' do n', 
Bɛnyɛn hɔn aber nyina,
Dze nkwadua no bɛnyɛn hɔn,
Dze hɔn bɔkɔ nkwa nsu n' ho;
Bɛpa hɔn mbusu nyina,
Nye hɔn ehiadze biara,
Ɔbɛpepa hɔn nyinsuwa.

MHB 834
1 . ABOVE the clear blue sky,
In Heaven’s bright abode,
The angel host on high
Sing praises to their God;
Hallelujah! 
They love to sing
To God their King:
Hallelujah!
	 ~ 	1 . WIMU kan no ekyir
Ahenman ne kan n' mu,
Sor abɔfo dɔm no
Tow Nyame N'ayɛyi,
Hallelujah!
Wɔdɔ Ɔhen,
Nyame adwontow,
Hallelujah!
Hallelujah!

MHB 834
2 . But God from infant tongues
On earth receiveth praise;
We then our cheerful songs 
In sweet accord will raise:
Hallelujah!
We too will sing
To God our King;
Hallelujah!
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyame gye ase ha
Mbofraba hɔn ayɛyi;
Afei yɛbɔbɔ mu
Atow hɛn enyigye ndwom,
Hallelujah!
Yɛbɔtow ndwom
Ama Nyame,
Hallelujah!

MHB 834
3 . O blessèd Lord, Thy truth
In love to us impart,
And teach us in our youth
To know Thee as Thou art.
Hallelujah! 
Then shall we sing
To God our King:
Hallelujah!
 	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze Siarfo,
Fa w' nokwar n' ma hɛn dɔ m',
Kyerɛ hɛn wɔ hɛn mbabun m',
Yenhu Wo dɛ mbrɛ etse,
Hallelujah!
Yɛbɔtow ndwom
Ama Nyame,
Hallelujah!

MHB 834
4 . O may Thy holy Word
Spread all  the world around;
And all with one accord
Uplift the joyful sound:
Hallelujah! 
All then shall sing
To God their King 
Hallelujah!	 ~ 	4 
. O nkyɛ W'asɛm krɔnkrɔn n'
Aatahye wiadze nyina,
Hɔn nyina aayɛ ano kor
Aama dɛw ndze no do:
Hallelujah!
Yɛbɔtow ndwom
Ama Nyame,

MHB 835
1 . WHEN, his salvation bringing,
To Zion Jesus came,
The children all stood singing
Hosanna to his name;
Nor did their zeal offend him.
But, as he rode along,
He let them still attend him,
And smiled to hear their song:
 	 ~ 	1 . JESUS dze nkwagye reba n'
Zion hɔ na ɔbae,
Mbofraba nyina soɛree
Wɔtoow Hosanna maa N'.
Hɔn ho annyɛ No ebufuw
Na ɔtse abowa do n',
Ɔmaa wɔkaa No do ara:
Hɔn ndwom yɛɛ N' enyigye.
So bɛma Ewuradze.

MHB 835
2 . And, since the Lord retaineth
His love for children still,
Though now as King he reigneth
On Zion’s heavenly hill,
We’ll flock around his banner,
Who sits upon the throne,
And cry aloud ’Hosanna’
To David’s royal son
	 ~ 	2 
. Na osiandɛ Ewuradze
Da ho dɔ mbofra ntsi,
Kaansa n-dɛ odzi hen
Wɔ sor Zion m-po a,
Yɛbɔfɔr Ne frankaa ho,
Ɔhen Jesus frankaa n',
Na yɛatsea n' dɛ, Hosanna 
N-ka David ne Ba.

MHB 835
3 . For, should we fail proclaiming
Our great Redeemer’s praise,
The stones, our silence shaming,
Would their Hosannas raise.
But shall we only render
The tribute of our words?
No, while our hearts are tender,
They, too, shall be the Lord’s.	 ~ 	3 
. Osiandɛ sɛ hɛn yeenntum 
Yɛannkamfo hɛn Pomfo a,
Abo bɔtow Hosanna
Ahyɛ hɛn enyito.
Na aso hɛn ano nko
Na yɛdze bɔsom No?
Dabi? Yɛdze hɛn akoma

MHB 836
1 . HOSANNA, loud hosanna,
The little children sang;
Through pillared court and temple,
The lovely anthem rang.
To Jesus, Who had blessed them,
Close folded to His breast,
The children sang their praises,
The simplest and the best.
	 ~ 	1 . MBOFRA nkumaa tseaa mu toow
Hosanna enyigye mu;
Ahemfie na asɔrfi mu,
Ndwom dɛɛdɛw no gyegyee;
Jesus a ohyiraa hɔn,
Fuaa hɔn No bomu no,
Mbofra n' toow ayɛyi ndwom maa N',
Ndwom bɔkɔɔ a odzi mu.
Wɔ N'enyim 'nyigye n' mu.  Amen.

MHB 836
2 . From Olivet they followed,
’Midst an exultant crowd,
Waving the victor palm branch,
And shouting clear and loud.
Bright angels joined the chorus,
Beyond the cloudless sky:
Hosanna in the highest,
Glory to God on high!
	 ~ 	2 
. Wofi Olivet kaa No do,
Wɔ enyigye dɔm no mu,
Wohiim konyim mberɛnkɔnson,
Wɔyɛɛ dede kɛse.
Abɔfo hyirenn toow bi,
Wɔ wimu kann n' ekyir,
Hosanna ɔwɔ sorsor!
'Nyimnyam nka sor Nyame.

MHB 836
3 . Fair leaves  of silvery olive
They strewed upon the ground,
Whilst Salem’s circling mountains
Echoed the joyful sound.
The Lord of men and angels
Rode on in lowly state,
Nor scorned that little children 
Should on His bidding wait.
	 ~ 	3 
. Wɔtotow Olive ndubaa
Fɛɛfɛw pii guu famu,
Na hɔn ndwom dɛɛdɛw gyeyee
Salem mbepɔw no do.
Nyimpa na abɔfo Wura
Tse abowa do kɔr bɔkɔɔ,
Na ɔammpow dɛ mbofraba
Bɛpem edzi N'ekyir.

MHB 836
4 . Hosanna in the highest!
That ancient song we sing,
For Christ is our Redeemer,
The Lord of heaven our King.
O may we ever praise Him
With heart and life and voice,
And in His blissful presence 
Eternally rejoice!	 ~ 	4 
. Hosanna wɔ ɔsorsor!
Yɛtow tsetse ndwom no;
Na Christ nye hɛn Pomfo no,
'Sor Wura nye hɛn Hen:
O wɔmma yɛmfa akoma,
Nkwa na ndze nyi N' ayɛw,
Na yendzi dɛw daa nyina,

MHB 837
1 . CHILDREN of Jerusalem
Sang the praise of Jesus’ Name:
Children, too, of modern days
Join to sing the Saviour’s praise.

      Hark !  While infant voices sing,
      Loud hosannas to our King
	 ~ 	1 . Jerusalem mbofraba 
Toow Jesus N'ayɛyindwom;
Ndɛ mber yi mbofraba so
Bɔm' tow Gyefo N'ayɛyi:
Tsie! mbofra kekam' dzendzen 
Dɛ, Hosanna nka hɛn Hen.
Ma Hosanna ngyigye wim'.

MHB 837
2 . We are taught to love the Lord,
We are taught to read His Word;
We are taught the way to Heaven:
Praise for all to God be given.
	 ~ 	2  
. Wɔkyerɛ hɛn Ewuradze dɔ, 
Wɔkyerɛ hɛn N'asɛm kenkan,
Wɔkyerɛ hɛn ɔsor do kwan:
Yi ntsi yeyi Nyame ayɛw.

MHB 837
3 . Parents, teachers, old and young,
All unite to swell the song;
Higher and yet higher rise,
Till hosannas fill the skies.	 ~ 	3 
. Abaatan na akyerɛkyerɛfo, 
Mpanyin na mbofra nhur ndwom n';
Wɔmma do kɛsenara

MHB 838
1 . JESUS high in glory
Lend a listening ear;
When we bow before thee
Children’s praises hear
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, fi enyimnyam m'
Yɛ aso ma hɛn:
Yebu ntwɛr wɔ W'enyim a,
Tsie mbofra ayɛyi.
Agyenkwa, yɛaba!

MHB 838
2 . Though thou art so holy
Heaven’s almighty king
Thou wilt stoop to listen
When thy praise we sing
	 ~ 	2 
. Kaansa eyɛ krɔnn mpo a,
Heaven Hen tumfo,
Yɛtow W'ayɛyi ndwom a,
Ebɔkotow etsie.

MHB 838
3 . We are little children
Weak and apt to stray;
Savior guide and keep us
In the heavenly way.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mbofraba nkumaa a
Yɛyɛ mberɛw, yɛfom;
Gyefo, wowaw kora hɛn,
Wɔ heaven kwan mu.

MHB 838
4 . Save us lord from sinning;
Watch us day by day
Help us now to love thee;
Take our  sins away
 	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn Wura, gye hɛn fi bɔn m',
Hwɛ hɛn do daa daa;
Boa hɛn ma yɛndɔ Wo,
Yi hɛn bɔn fi hɔ.

MHB 838
5 . Then when thou shalt call us
To our heavenly home
We will gladly answer
Savior lord we come.	 ~ 	5 
. Afei, sɛ efrɛ hɛn
Kɔ hɛn ɔsor fie a,
Yɛbɛgye do dɛw mu;

MHB 839
1 . THERE’S a friend for little children
Above the bright blue sky,
A Friend who never changeth,
Whose love will never die:
Unlike our friends by nature,
Who change with changing years;
This Friend is always worthy
The precious name he bears.
	 ~ 	1 . NYƐNKO bi wɔ hɔ ma mbofra
Wɔ sor fua kan n' ekyir,
Nyɛnko a ɛnnsakyer da,
No dɔ so mmbɔ adze da,
Ɔnntse dɛ nyimpa m' ndamfo a
Wɔnye mber sesa no,
Nyɛnko 'i som bo aber biara,
Ɔwɔ dzin mapa bi.
Ma ne nyina nyɛ homdze

MHB 839
2 . There’s a home for little children
Above the bright blue sky,
Where Jesus reigns in glory,
A home of peace and joy:
No home on earth is like it,
Nor can with it compare;
For everyone is happy,
Nor could be happier, there.
	 ~ 	2 
. Fie bi wɔ hɔ ma mbofraba
Wɔ sor fua kan n' ekyir,
Hɔ, Jesus dzi hen 'nyimnyam m',
Asomdwee na dɛw fie.
Fie bi nntse dɛm wɔ ase ha,
Anaadɛ ɔnye n' bɛsɛ;
'Siandɛ obiara wɔ enyigye a
Onnkehia enyigye bio.

MHB 839
3 . There’s a song for little children
Above the bright blue sky,
A song that will not weary,
Though sung continually:
A song which even angels
Can never, never sing;
They know not Christ as Saviour,
But worship him as King.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ndwom bi wɔ hɔ ma mbofraba
Wɔ sor fua kan n' ekyir,
Ndwom a wɔtow no dodow mpo a 
Ɔnnkɔfon obiara,
Ndwom a ɔsor abɔfo mpo
Nnkotum atow ara da;
Wonnyim Christ dɛ Agyenkwa,
Mbom wɔsom No dɛ Ɔhen.

MHB 839
4 . There’s a robe for little children
Above the bright blue sky;
And a harp of sweetest music,
And palms of victory.
All, all above is treasured,
And found in Christ alone:
Lord, grant thy little children
To know thee as their own.	 ~ 	4 
. Atar bi wɔ hɔ ma mbofra
Wɔ sor fua kan n' ekyir
Na sanku a ɔbɔ ndwom dɛɛdɛw
Na konyim mberɛnkɔnson,
Ne nyina som bo wɔ sor,
Na wohu n' Christ mu nko;
O hom mbra, mbofraba pa,

MHB 84
1 . ALL glory, laud, and honour
To Thee, Redeemer, King,
To whom the lips of children
Made sweet hosannas ring !
	 ~ 	1 . Enyimnyam nye ntonton nka 
Wo, hɛn Hen Agyenkwa,
Ɔwo a mbofra ndze dɛɛdɛw,
Toow Hosanna maa Wo!

MHB 84
2 . Thou art the King of Israel,
Thou David’s royal Son,
who in the Lord’s name comest,
The King and blessed One.
     All glory-
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔwo nye Israel Hen, 
Ɔhen David ne Ba a
Enam Ewuradze dzin mu
Reba dɛ hɛn siar Hen.
	Enyimnyam nye¬—

MHB 84
3 . The company of angels
Are praising Thee on high,
And mortal men and all things
Created make reply.
        All glory-
	 ~ 	3 . Abɔfo dɔm nyinara 
Kamfo Wo Nyame manm':
Nyimpa nye abɔdze nyina
Bɔ ose gye hɔn do.
	Enyimnyam nye¬—

MHB 84
4 . The people of the Hebrews
with palms before thee went;
Our praise, and prayer and anthems
Before Thee we present.
             All glory-
	 ~ 	4 . Hebrewman mu nkorɔfo dze 
Mberɛnkɔnson huaa Wo;
Hɛn so yɛdze ayɛyi
Nye mpaabɔ ba W' enyim.
	Enyimnyam nye¬—

MHB 84
5 . To Thee before Thy passion
They sang their hymns of praise:
To Thee now high exulted
Our melody we raise.
             All glory-
	 ~ 	5 . Irikehyia mbusu no, 
Wɔtoow ndwom yii W' ayɛw;
N- dɛ a wɔakrɔn Wo sor yi,
Hɛn so yehuhor Wo.
	Enyimnyam nye¬—

MHB 84
6 . Thou didst accept their praises;
Accept the prayers we bring,
who in all good delightest,
Thou good and gracious King.
           All glory-          Amen.	 ~ 	6 .  Egyee Jewfo ayɛyi; 
Gye hɛn so hɛn mpaabɔ,
Ɔhen dɔyɛfo, yamuyiefo a
Ndzepa nyina yɛ W' fɛw. 
 	Enyimnyam nye¬—

MHB 840
1 . GOD my Father, loving me,
Gave his Son, my friend to be:
Gave his Son, my form to take,
Bearing all things for my sake.
	 ~ 	1 . M'EGYA Nyame dɔɔ me no,
Ɔmaa Ne Ba yɛɛ m' nyɛnko;
'Maa Ne Ba faa mo frɔdɔɔ,
Soaa adze nyina wɔ me ntsi.
Monkɔ mbrɛ Woara bɛkyerɛ.

MHB 840
2 . Jesus still remains the same
As in days of old he came;
As my brother by my side,
Still he seeks my steps to guide.
	 ~ 	2 
. Jesus da ho tse dɛm daa
Dɛ mbrɛ ɔbae tsetseber do n';
Dɛ mo nua a ɔbɛn me daa,
Da ho per weɔn m'anamɔn.

MHB 840
3 . How can I repay thy love,
Lord of all the hosts above?
What have I, a child, to bring
Unto thee, thou heavenly King?
	 ~ 	3 
. M'besi dɛn etua Wo dɔ kaw,
Ɔsor dɔm nyina Wura?
Emi abofra, mowɔ 'bɛn
Brɛ Ɔwo hɛven Ɔhen?

MHB 840
4 . I have but myself to give:
Let me to thy glory live;
Let me follow, day by day,
Where thou showest me the way.	 ~ 	4 
. Medze moho nyina ma Wo:
Ma me ntsena mma W'enyimnyam,
Ma menka Wo do daa nyina,

MHB 841
1 . JESUS, Friend of little children,
Be a friend to me;
Take my hand, and ever keep me
Close to Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS mbofraba hɔn nyɛnko,
Yɛ mo so m' nyɛnko
Suo me nsamu na daa twe me
Pin Wo nkyɛn.
Kesi ewiei.    Amen.

MHB 841
2 . Teach me how to grow in goodness,
Daily as I grow;
Thou hast been a child, and surely
Thou dost know.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Kyerɛ m' ma minyin papayɛ m'
Ber a mirinyin yi;
Wo so ayɛ abofra pɛn ntsi
Inyim ampa.

MHB 841
3 . Step by step O lead me onward,
Upward into youth;
Wiser, stronger, still becoming
In Thy truth.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nkakrankakra, gya me kɔ kan
Wɔ ɔbabunyɛ mu;
Ma munhu nyansa, nnya ahoɔdzen
Wo nokwar m'.

MHB 841
4 . Never leave me, nor forsake me;
Ever be my friend;
For I need Thee, from life’s dawning
To its end. Amen	 ~ 	4 
. Mma nngyaa m' eso mma mmpa me da,
Yɛ me Nyɛnko daa,
'Siandɛ mihia W' fi bra ahyɛse

MHB 842
1 . GENTLE Jesus, meek and mild,
Look upon a little child;
Pity my simplicity,
Suffer me to come to Thee.
 	 ~ 	1 . JESUS brɛfo a edwe,
Kyea W'enyi hwɛ W'abofra;
Hu mo botooyɛ mbɔbɔr,
Ma me kwan membra Wo hɔ.
Christ, Krɔnkrɔn Ba n', wɔ mo mu.

MHB 842
2 . Fain I would to Thee be brought,
Gracious  Lord, forbid it not;
In the kingdom of Thy grace
Give me, dearest God, a place
	 ~ 	2 
. Mepɛ dɛ wɔdze m' brɛ Wo;
Adom Wura, mma nnsiw kwan,
Ma W'abɔtoaba yi kwan,
Wɔ W'adom ahenman n' mu.

MHB 842
3 . Fain I would be as Thou art;
Give me Thine obedient heart;
Thou art pitiful and kind,
Let me have Thy loving mind
	 ~ 	3 
. Mepɛ dɛ meyɛ dɛ Ɔwo;
Ma m' Wo mbrɛhoadze akoma,
'Wo yɛ dɔ, yɛ mbɔbɔrhu;
Ma minnya Wo dɔ adwen no.

MHB 842
4 . Let me, above all, fulfill
God my heavenly Father’s will;
Never His good Spirit grieve;
Only to His glory live.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ne nyina ekyir ma menyɛ
M'Egya a ɔwɔ sor Ne pɛ,
Ma No Sunsum pa eenndzi yaw
Mentsena ase mma N'enyimnyam.

MHB 842
5 . Lamb of God, I look to Thee;
Thou shalt my Example be;
Thou art gentle, meek, and mild;
Thou wast once a little child.
	 ~ 	5 
. Nyame Eguambaa, mohwɛ Wo;
Ɔwo bɛyɛ m' fasusu,
Ɔwo yɛ brɛfo a edwe,
Ɔwo so ayɛ abofra pɛn.

MHB 842
6 . Thou didst live to God alone;
Thou didst never seek Thine own;
Thou Thyself didst never please:
God was all Thy happiness.
	 ~ 	6 
. Ɔwo tsenaa ase maa Nyame;
Annhwehwɛ Wo nko W'dze da;
Wo nko W' yieyɛ ennhia Wo da;
Nyame nko nye W'ahomka.

MHB 842
7 . Loving Jesus, gentle Lamb,
In Thy gracious hands I am;
Make me, Savior, what Thou art,
Live Thyself within my heart.
	 ~ 	7 
. Dɔfo Jesus, 'Guambaa pa,
Mehyɛ W'adom nsamu ara;
Agyenkwa, yɛ m' dɛ mbrɛ etse,
Bra bɛtsena m'akoma mu.

MHB 842
8 . I shall then show forth Thy praise,
Serve Thee all my happy days;
Then the world shall always see
Christ, the holy Child, in me.	 ~ 	8 
. Dɛm na m'bɛkyerɛ W'ayɛyi,
Masom Wo m'enyigye nda m';
Na ber nyina wiadze bohu

MHB 843
1 . IN our dear Lord’s garden,
Planted here below,
Many tiny flowerets
In sweet beauty grow.
 	 ~ 	1 . HƐN Wura dɔfo turo mu,
Wɔ asaase ha,
Nhyiren nkumaa pii nyin
Wɔ ahoɔfɛw mu.
Yɛnyɛ W'edwuma bi.

MHB 843
2 . Christ, the loving Gardener,
Tends these blossoms small;
Loves the little lilies
As the cedars tall.
	 ~ 	2 
. Christ, dɔfo turo Hwɛfo
Hwɛ nhyiren nkumaa no;
'Dɔ nsukookoo nkumaa
Na ndua akɛse so.

MHB 843
3 . Nothing is too little
For His gentle care;
Nothing is too lowly
In His love to share.
	 ~ 	3 
. Biribiara nnsuar pii a
Ɔremma N' nsa nnka;
Biribi nnyɛ tokyen
Ma ɔnndɔ no bi !

MHB 843
4 . Jesus loves the children,
Children such as we;
Blest them when their mothers
Brought them to His knee.
	 ~ 	4 
. Jesus dɔ mbofra no,
Mbofra tse dɛ hɛn;
Ohyiraa hɔn ber a nanom
Dze hɔn kɛmaa No n'.

MHB 843
5 . Jesus calls the children,
Bids them come and stand
In His pleasant garden,
Watered by His hand.
	 ~ 	5 
. Jesus frɛ mbofraba n'
Dɛ wɔmbra N'enyim,
Wɔ No turo fɛɛfɛw n' mu,
Noara gugu do.

MHB 843
6 . Lord, Thy call we answer
take  us in Thy care;
Train us in Thy garden,
In Thy work to share.	 ~ 	6 
. Hɛn Wura, yɛgye W' frɛ do,
Gye hɛn hwɛ hɛn do,
Tsetse hɛn Wo turo n' mu,

MHB 844
1 . JESUS, tender Shepherd, hear me;
Bless Thy little lamb to-night;
Through the darkness be Thou near me;
Keep me safe till morning light.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS Guanhwɛfo pa, tsie me;
Hyira W'eguambaa anafua yi;
Anago sum yi mu bɛn me;
Kora me sɔnn ma adze nkye.
Menye W'bɛtsena hɔ enyigye m'.  Amen.

MHB 844
2 . All this day thy hand has led me,
And I thank Thee for Thy care;
Thou hast clothed me, warmed and fed me,
Listen to my evening prayer.
	 ~ 	2 
. Adzekyee yi, Wo nsa akyerɛ m' kwan,
Meda W' ase dɛ ahwɛ m',
Ɔwo efura m' tam, anyɛn me,
Tsie m'ewimbir mpaabɔ yi.

MHB 844
3 . Let my sins be all forgiven;
Bless the friends I love so well;
Take me, when I die, to Heaven,
Happy there with Thee to dwell.				             Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Ma bɔn nyina fa kyɛ m' koraa;
Hyira 'nyɛnkofo a modɔ hɔn;
Sɛ muwu a, fa me kɔ heaven,

MHB 845
1 . GOD make my life a little light
Within the world to glow;
A little flame that burneth bright,
Wherever I may go.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME nyɛ m' bra kan kakraba a
Ɔdzɛw wɔ wiadze ha;
Gya kakraba a ɔdzɛw hyɛnhyɛnn, 
Beebiara a mobɔkɔ.
Nyame akwan nwanwa do.

MHB 845
2 . God make my life a little flower
That giveth joy to all,
Content to bloom in native bower,
Although the place be small.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyame nyɛ m' bra nhyiren kakraba a
Ɔbɛma obiara dɛw;
N'enyi sɔ dɛ ɔhyerɛn wɔ fie,
Kaansa bea no suar mpo a.

MHB 845
3 . God make my life a little song
That comforteth the sad
hat helpeth others to be strong,
And makes the singer glad.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyame nyɛ m' bra ndwom kakraba a
Ɔkyekye ayarfo werɛ,
Na ɔboa nkorɔfo ma wɔyɛ dzen,
Na ɔma nyia ɔtow enyigye.

MHB 845
4 . God make my life a little staff
Whereon the weak may rest,
That so what health and strength I have
May serve my neighbors best.
	 ~ 	4 
. Nyame nyɛ m' bra poma kakraba a
Mberɛwyɛfo bɔtwer,
Ama mo mpɔw na m'ahom nyina
Aaboa me mfɛfo yie.

MHB 845
5 . God make my life a little hymn
Of tenderness and praise,
Of faith, that never waxeth dim,
In all His wondrous ways.	 ~ 	5 
. Nyame nyɛ m' bra ndwom kakraba a
'Yɛyi na ɔdwe ahyɛ m' ma,
Dza ɔma gyedzi a onnhinhim,

MHB 846
1 . LORD, when we have not any light,
And mothers are asleep;
Then through the stillness of the night,
Thy little children keep.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, sɛ adze sa ara
Na hɛn nanom deda a,
Anafua sum kommyɛ no mu,
Hwɛ Wo mbɔtoaba do.
Wɔ hɛn Egya no ntsi.

MHB 846
2 . When shadows haunt the quiet room,
Help us to understand
That Thou art with us through the gloom,
To hold us by the hand.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ber a sum ahyɛ dan komm no mu no,
Boa hɛn ma yenhu dɛ
Enye hɛn wɔ hɔ sum no mu,
Na ibosuo hɛn nsamu.

MHB 846
3 . And though we do not always see
The holy angels near,
O may we trust ourselves to Thee,
Nor have one foolish fear.
	 ~ 	3 
. Kaansa nnyɛ aber biara na
Yehu Abɔfo n' mpo a,
O ma yɛmfa hɛnho nhyɛ W' nsa,
Na mma yennsuro hwee.

MHB 846
4 . So in the morning may we wake,
When wakes the kindly sun,
More loving for our Father’s sake
To each unloving one.	 ~ 	4 
. Dɛm na yɛbɔsoɛr anapa,
Ber a 'napawi rupue,
Dɛ yɛwɔ dɔ mema hɛnho

MHB 847
1 . O JESUS we are well and strong,
And we can run about and play;
But there are children who are sick,
And have to lie in bed all day.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, yɛtse apɔw wɔ ahoɔdzen,
Na yetum tu mbirika dzi agor;
Yarba rehaw mbofra binom
Ma da biara wɔda mpa mu.
Mbofra a hɔn werɛ ahow, rofona.   Amen.

MHB 847
2 . We thank Thee for health and strength;
And loving Lord, we pray Thee bless
The children who are weak and ill
And suffer pain and weariness.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn apɔwmudzen ntsi yɛda W' ase,
Yɛserɛ W', Egya dɔfo, hyira
Mbofra a wɔayɛ mberɛw na wɔyar,
Na wɔtse yaw, hu amandze.

MHB 847
3 . Lord, give us thoughtful, loving hearts,
Show us kind deeds which may be done
By us, for Jesu’s sake, to help
Some sad or suffering little one.
		Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Fa dɔ akoma a ɔdwen ma hɛn,
Kyerɛ hɛn dza yɛnyɛ nkyerɛ dɔ,
Jesus dzin mu dɛ yɛdze roboa

MHB 848
1 . HUSHED was the evening hymn,
The temple courts were dark,
The lamp was burning dim
Before the sacred ark
When suddenly a voice divine
Rang through the silence of the shrine.
	 ~ 	1 . EWIMBER som ekyir,
Asɔrfi sunkamm no m'
Krɔnkrɔn 'daka n'enyim
Kanea n' ayɛ munsumm,
Awerɛfir mu ara na
Nyame Ne ndze ɔgyegyee hɔ.
Nokwar a wɔdze esie enyansafo n'.

MHB 848
2 . The old man, meek and mild,
The priest of Israel, slept;
His watch the temple child,
The little Levite, kept;
And what from Eli’s sense was sealed
The Lord to Hannah’s son revealed.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Nna akɔdaa brɛfo,
Israel sɔfo n' ada;
Levinyi kakraba n'
Roweɔn asɔrfi m' hɔ:
Na dza ohuntaa Eli no,
Ewuradze yii kyerɛ Hannah ba n'.

MHB 848
3 . O give me Samuel’s ear,
The open ear, O Lord,
Alive and quick to hear
Each whisper of thy word,
Like him to answer at thy call,
And to obey thee first of all.
	 ~ 	3 
. O Ewuradze, ma me
Samuel asomkyɛn a
No mu yɛ har, ɔtse
W'ano wasa biara;
Emi so m'bɛgye Wo frɛ do,
Na m'bedzi kan metse Ɔwo.

MHB 848
4 . O give me Samuel’s heart,
A lowly heart that waits
Where in thy house thou art
Or watches at thy gates,
By day and night, a heart that still
Moves at the breathing of thy will.
	 ~ 	4 
. O ma m' Samuel akoma,
Akoma brɛfo a ɔtweɔn 
W'asɔrfi mbrɛ ewɔ mu
Anaa ɔweɔn W'abow;
Adzekyee na adzesaa akoma a
Otsin Wo pɛ do dzi dwuma.

MHB 848
5 . O give me Samuel’s mind,
A sweet, unmurmuring faith,
Obedient and resigned
To thee in life and death,
That I may read with childlike eyes
Truths that are hidden from the wise.	 ~ 	5 
. O ma m' Samuel adwen;
Gyedzi pa a onnhwinhwin,
Ɔyɛ setsie ma Wo,
Wɔ nkwa na owu mu,
Na medze abofra enyiwa eehu

MHB 849
1 . FATHER, lead me day by day
Ever in Thine own sweet way;
Teach me to be pure and true,
Show me what I ought to do.
	 ~ 	1 . EGYA, dzi m'enyim dabaa,
Memfa Wo kwan pa no do;
Kyerɛ m' ma mindzi nokwar daa,
Menyɛ dza ɔwɔ dɛ meyɛ.
Ber a ahotsewfo dzi dɛw.

MHB 849
2 . When in danger, make me brave;
Make me know that thou canst save;
Keep me safe by thy dear side;
Let me in thy love abide.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma m' akokodur mbusu m',
Munhu dɛ Ɔwo tum gye nkwa;
Kora me sɔkyee wɔ Wo nkyɛn;
Ma mentsena Wo dɔ mu.

MHB 849
3 . When I’m tempted to do wrong,
Make me steadfast, wise, and strong;
And, when all alone I stand,
Shield me with thy mighty hand.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ mokɔ bɔn nsɔhwɛ mu a,
Ma mingyina pintsinn nyansa m';
Na sɛ ɔka mo nko a,
Fa Wo tum n' bɔ mo ho ban.

MHB 849
4 . When my heart is full of glee,
Help me to remember thee,
Happy most of all to know
That my Father loves me so.
	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ dɛw hyɛ m'akoma ma a,
O boa me ma menkaa Wo,
Ma mindzi dɛw kɛse bi,
Dɛ Ɔwo m'Egya, dɔ me.

MHB 849
5 . When my work seems hard and dry,
May I press on cheerily;
Help me patiently to bear
Pain and hardship, toil and care.
	 ~ 	5 
. Sɛ m'edwuma yɛ dzen a,
Ma monkɔ do dɛw mu ara,
Boa ma memfa abotar nsoa
Amandze, 'haw na dadwen.

MHB 849
6 . May I see the good and bright
When they pass before my sight;
May I hear the heavenly voice
When the pure and wise rejoice.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Gyinabew nyinara mu,
Ma munhu dza oye nyina,
Ma mentse ɔsor n-dze

MHB 85
1 . COME, let us join our cheerful songs
with angels round the throne;
Ten thousand thousand are their tongues,
But all their joys are one.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM mbra ma yɛnye abɔfo ntow
Ndwom ntwa ahengua no ho;
Hɔn gyirama no yɛ mpempem mpo a,
Hɔn dɛw n' dze ɔyɛ kor.

MHB 85
2 . Worthy the Lamb that died, they cry,
To be exalted thus;
worthy the Lamb, our hearts reply,
For He was slain for us.
	 ~ 	2 . Wɔka dɛ Eguambaa a owui n' fata
Dɛ wɔbɔkrɔn No dɛm;
Hɛn akoma so ka dɛ ɔfata,
'Siandɛ wokum N' maa hɛn.

MHB 85
3 . Jesus is worthy to receive
Honour and power divine;
And blessings, more than we can give,
Be, Lord, for ever Thine.
	 ~ 	3 . Enyimnyam na sorsor tumdzi
Fata hɛn Jesus Christ;
Na nhyira a ɔkyɛn dza yɛma n'
Nka Ewuradze afebɔɔ.

MHB 85
4 . The whole creation join in one
To bless the sacred name
Of Him that sits upon the throne,
And to adore the Lamb.	 ~ 	4 . Abɔdze nyina bɔ m' kor hyira 
Nyia ɔtse ahengua n' do
Ne dzin krɔnkrɔn no, na wɔhyɛ 
Eguambaa n' enyimnyam.

MHB 850
1 . LOOKING upward every day,
Sunshine on our faces;
Pressing onward every day
Toward the heavenly places;
 	 ~ 	1 . HƐN enyi da sor daa nyina,
Ewia hyerɛn hɛn enyim;
Yɛwɔw do daa nyinara
Dze hɛn enyim tsim heaven.
Kuropɔn krɔnkrɔn n' mu.  Amen.

MHB 850
2 . Growing every day in awe,
For Thy Name is holy;
Learning every day to love
With a love more lowly;
	 ~ 	2 
. Yenyim daa nyina wɔ suro m'
Wo dzin krɔnkrɔn no ntsi;
Yesua daa dɛ yɛbɔdɔ
Wɔ ɔdɔ bɔkɔɔyɛ mu.

MHB 850
3 . Walking every day more close
To our Elder Brother;
Growing every day more true
Unto one another;
	 ~ 	3 
. Daa nyina yɛbɔ m' nantsew
Wɔ hɛn Nua panyin N' nkyɛn;
Yenyin daa wɔ nokwardzi m',
Dze ma hɛnho nkorkor.

MHB 850
4 .  Every day more gratefully
Kindnesses receiving,
 Every day more readily
Injuries forgiving.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Daa nyina ndaase mu ara,
Yɛgye W'ayamuyie pii,
Daa nyinara yɛpen do
Dze mfom kyekyɛ hɛnho.

MHB 850
5 . Lord, so pray we every day:
Hear us in Thy pity,
That we enter in at last
To the holy city.  Amen	 ~ 	5 
. Ewuradze, daa yɛsɔr dɛ,
Tsie hɛn Wo mbɔbɔrhu m',
Ama ewiei no yaaba

MHB 851
1 . ALL things bright and beautiful,
All creatures great and small,
All things wise and wonderful,
The Lord God made them all.
	 ~ 	1 . Dza ɔyɛ fɛw na ɔhyerɛn, 
Abɔdze nyinara,
'Nyansadze na anwanwadze,
Nyame yɛɛ ne nyina.
Dza ɔyɛ fɛw—

MHB 851
2 . Each little flower that opens,
Each little bird that sings,
He made their glowing colours,
He made their tiny wings.
           All things-
	 ~ 	2 
. N-hyiren biara a ɔpae, 
Nyame maa n' ahoɔfɛw;
Anomaba a ɔtow ndwom,
Nyame yɛɛ ne ntɛkyerɛ.
Dza ɔyɛ fɛw—

MHB 851
3 . The purple-headed mountain,
The river running by,
The sunset, and the morning
That brightens up the sky.
           All things-
	 ~ 	3 
. Bepɔw a osi habanm', 
'Sutsen a ɔda ho,
N-woraba na bosoom,
Adzekyee na adzesaa.
Dza ɔyɛ fɛw—

MHB 851
4 . The cold wind in the winter,
The pleasant summer sun,
The ripe fruits in the garden,
He made them every one.
            All things-
	 ~ 	4 
. N-su a ɔtɔ esusow, 
Ewia a ɔpae pɛber,
N-duaba a ɔsow ndua do,
Na hamu edziban.
Dza ɔyɛ fɛw—

MHB 851
5 . He gave us eyes to see them,
And lips that we might tell
How great is God almighty,
Who has made all things well:
              All things-	 ~ 	5 
. Enyiwa wɔ hɔ ma yeehu, 
Ano so ma yaaka,
Dɛ saa Nyame yɛ tumfo,
Ɔayɛ adze nyina yie.

MHB 852
1 . ALL things which live below the sky,
Or move within the sea,
Are creatures of the Lord most High,
And brothers unto me.
	 ~ 	1 . ABƆDZE a wɔwɔ wi n'ase
Anaa wɔnenam pomu,
Wɔyɛ ɔsor Hen N'abɔdze
Na mo so mo nuanom.
Mberɛwyɛfo bambɔfo.  Amen.

MHB 852
2 . I love to hear the robin sing,
Perched on the highest bough;
To see the rook with purple wing
Follow the shining plough.
	 ~ 	2 
. Modɔ dɛ metse anoma a
Osi dua do no su;
Dɛ daa muhu nnoma fɛɛfɛw 
Tu faa kyin wɔ wimu.

MHB 852
3 . I love to watch the swallow skim
The river in his flight;
To mark, when day is growing dim,
The glow-worm’s silvery light;
	 ~ 	3 
. Modɔ dɛ mohwɛ esunoma
Ber a otu kyin nsu enyi;
Modɔ dɛ muhu tutugya,
Ne kandzea adzesaaber.

MHB 852
4 . The sea-gull whiter than the foam,
The fish that dart beneath;
The lowing cattle coming home;
The goats upon the heath.
	 ~ 	4 
. Nsuborɔkɔ a ɔhoa sakoo,
Nam a okyinkin nsuadze;
Anantwi a worusu ba fie,
Mpɔnkye a wogu efuw mu.

MHB 852
5 . Beneath his heaven there’s room for all;
He gives to all their meat;
He sees the meanest sparrow fall
Unnoticed in the street.
 	 ~ 	5 
. Hɛn nyina wɔ kyɛfa Ne wiadze m';
Ɔnyɛn obiara daa,
Ohu ɔsorɔm tantan a ɔatɔ
Kwan mu a obiara nnhu n'.

MHB 852
6 .  Almighty Father, King of kings,
The Lover of the meek,
Make me a friend of helpless things,
Defender of the weak.  Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Egya Tumfo, ahenfo Hen,
Botooyɛfo hɔn Dɔfo,
Yɛ m' ndzɛmba a wɛnnsɛ bi nyɛnko,

MHB 853
1 . A little child may know
Our Father's name of love;
'Tis written o'er the earth below
And on the sky above. 
	 ~ 	1 . ABOFRA botum ehu
Hɛn Egya No dɔ dzin no;
Wɔakyerɛw n' famu asaase ha,
Na wimu so wɔ sor.
Ne nyina kyerɛ m' dɛ ɔbɛn.

MHB 853
2 . Around me when I look,
His handiwork I see;
This world is like a picture book
To teach His love to me.
	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ mohwɛ moho hyia a,
Muhu Ne nsaano edwuma;
Wiadze tse dɛ mfonyin buukuu,
Ɔkyerɛ me Ne dzin no.

MHB 853
3 . The thousand little flowers
Within our garden found,
The rainbow and the soft spring showers,
And every pleasant sound. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Yehu nhyiren nkumaa
Apem wɔ hɛn turo mu 
Nyankontɔn na esusom nsu,
Yɛtse ngyegyee dɛɛdɛw.

MHB 853
4 . The birds that sweetly sing,
The moon that shines by night;
With every tiny living thing
Rejoicing in the light, 
	 ~ 	4 
. Nnoma a wosu dɛɛdɛw 
Bosoom a ɔhyerɛn anafua,
Ɔma abɔdze nkakraba
Mpo dzi dɛw wɔ kan n' mu.

MHB 853
5 . And every star above,
Set in the deep blue sky,
All tell me that our God is love
And tell me He is nigh.	 ~ 	5 
. Na woraba biara a,
Ɔwɔ wimu wɔ sorsor,
Ne nyina kyerɛ m' dɛ Nyame yɛ dɔ,

MHB 854
1 . IT is a thing most wonderful,
Almost too wonderful to be,
That God’s own Son should come from heaven,
And die to save a child like me.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆYƐ anwanwadze mapa,
Na ɔyɛ nwanwa mbordo mpo,
Dɛ Nyame Ba befi sor aba,
Ebowu agye abofra dɛ emi.
Kɛpem dɛ m'bohu W' dɛ mbrɛ etse.

MHB 854
2 . And yet I know that it is true:
He chose a poor and humble lot,
And wept and toiled and mourned and died
For love of those who loved him not.
	 ~ 	2 
. Naaso minyim dɛ ɔyɛ ampa,
Ɔfaa abrɛfo na ehiafo,
Osui, berɛe, kaa mmɔn na owui
Maa hɔn a wɔanndɔ No ara da.

MHB 854
3 . I sometimes think about the Cross,
And shut my eyes, and try to see
The cruel nails and crown of thorns,
And Jesus crucified for me.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔyɛ a modwen mbeamudua n' ho,
Mumua m'enyi, per dɛ m'bohu
'Tsirmuɔdzen mprɛgow na nsoɛ kyɛw n',
Jesu a wɔbɔɔ N' mbeamudua m' maa me n'.

MHB 854
4 . But even could I see him die,
I could but see a little part
Of that great love which, like a fire,
Is always burning in his heart.
	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ mpo m'bohu mbrɛ ɔyɛɛ wui a,
Ɔdɔ kɛse a ɔdzɛw dɛ ogya,
Wɔ N'akoma mu dabaa no,
Ne fa kumaabi na m'bohu.

MHB 854
5 . I cannot tell how he could love
A child so weak and full of sin;
His love must be most wonderful,
If he could die my love to win.
	 ~ 	5 
. Murunntum nnka mbrɛ osii dɔɔ 
Afra a ɔyɛ mberɛw na bɔn fa n';
Sɛ owui dze tɔɔ mo dɔ ampa a,
Na No dɔ no yɛ nwanwa ampa.

MHB 854
6 . It is most wonderful to know
His love for me so free and sure;
But ’tis more wonderful to see
My love for him so faint and poor.
	 ~ 	6 
. Ɔyɛ nwanwa dɛ No dɔ a ɔwɔ,
Ma me n' wɔnntɔ na odzi mu;
Na ɔyɛ nwanwa pii dɛ mo dɔ a
Mowɔ ma No suar, yɛ mberɛw.

MHB 854
7 . And yet I want to love thee, Lord;
O light the flame within my heart,
And I will love thee more and more,
Until I see thee as thou art.	 ~ 	7 
. Naaso me pɛ dɛ modɔ Wo Owura;
O sɔ gya no wɔ m'akoma m'
Na m'bɔdɔ Wo mbordo, mbordo,

MHB 855
1 . I LOVE to think, though I am young,
My Saviour was a child;
That Jesus walked this earth along,
With feet all undefiled.
 	 ~ 	1 . MUSUAR 'so modɔ dɛ modwen,
Nna m'Agyenkwa yɛ afra;
Dɛ Jesus dze krɔnkrɔnyɛ pa
Nantseew 'saase yi do.
Ara, o bra me nkyɛn.   Amen.

MHB 855
2 . He kept His Father’s word of truth,
As I am taught to do;
And while He walked the paths of youth,
He walked in wisdom too.
	 ~ 	2 
. Osiee N'Egya No nokwar nsɛm,
Wɔkyerɛ m' dɛ menyɛ dɛm;
Kaansa ɔbɔɔ mbabun bra mpo a,
Ɔnantseew nyansa m' so.

MHB 855
3 . I love to think that He who spake
And made the blind to see,
And called the sleeping dead to wake,
Was once a child like me.
	 ~ 	3 
. Modɔ dɛ modwen, Nyia ɔkasaa
Buee enyifurafo enyi,
Na onyaan hɔn a wɔdaa ewufu nda n',
Yɛɛ abofra dɛ emi.

MHB 855
4 . That He who wore the thorny crown,
And tasted death’s despair,
Had a kind mother like my own,
And knew her love and care.
	 ~ 	4 
. Dɛ Nyia ɔsoaa nsoɛ ahenkyɛw,
Na ɔsɔɔ owu hwɛe no,
Nyaa ena pa bi tse dɛ medze 'i,
Ohun no hwɛ na n' dɔ.

MHB 855
5 .  I know ‘twas all for love of me
That He became a child,
And left the heavens, so fair to see,
And trod earth’s pathway wild.
	 ~ 	5 
. Minyim dɛ dɔ a ɔdɔ me ntsi
Na ɔbɛyɛɛ abofra,
Na ogyaa heaven bea fɛɛfɛw n',
Bɛfaa wiadze akwan do.

MHB 855
6 . Then, Saviour, who wast once a child,
A child may come to Thee;
And O in all Thy mercy mild,
Dear Saviour, come to me!  Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Afei Gyefo a eyɛɛ abofra pɛn,
Afra tum ba Wo nkyɛn;
Na m'Agyenkwa Dɔfo, mbɔbɔr m'

MHB 856
1 . I LOVE to hear the story
Which angel voices tell,
How once the King of Glory
Came down on earth to dwell.
I am both weak and sinful,
But this I surely know,
The Lord came down to save me,
Because he loved me so.
	 ~ 	1 . Modɔ dɛ metse nsɛm a 
Abɔfo ndze ka no,
Dɛ enyimnyam Hen n' mber bi
Ɔbɛtsenaa asaase do.
Bɔnyɛnyi a meyɛ mberɛw so,
Na 'yi minyim petee
Dɛ, Ewuradze bae bɛgyee m' nkwa.
Osiandɛ ɔdɔ m' kɛse.
Osiandɛ ɔdɔ m' kɛse.

MHB 856
2 . I’m glad my blessed Saviour
Was once a child like me,
To show how pure and holy
His little ones might be;
And if I try to follow
His footsteps here below,
He never will forget me,
Because he loves me so.
	 ~ 	2 
. M' Agyenkwa siarfo bɛyɛɛ 
Abɔdomaba dɛ emi,
Ma ɔaakyerɛ No nkɔkowaba
Krɔnkrɔnyɛ mu akwan;
Na sɛ mobɔ ho mbɔdzen
Tsiatsia N' anamɔnm' a,
Ɔnnkɔtow m' akyen ara da
Osiandɛ ɔdɔ m'kɛse.

MHB 856
3 . To sing his love and mercy
My sweetest songs I’ll raise;
And though I cannot see him,
I know he hears my praise;
For he himself has promised
That even I may go
To sing among His angels,
Because he loves me so.	 ~ 	3 
. No mbɔbɔrhu nye No dɔ n', 
M' bɔtow ho ndwom dɛɛdɛw;
Muhu N' a ɔnnyɛ mpo a, minyim
Dɛ ɔtse m' ayɛyi.
Na ɔabɔ m' anohoba
Ayamuyiem' dɛ monkɔ
Menkɛnye abɔfo ntow ndwom,

MHB 857
1 . GOD has given us a Book full of stories
Which was made for His people of old,
It begins with the tale of a garden,
And ends with the city of gold.
	 ~ 	1 . Nyame ama hɛn Buukuu a nsɛm ahyɛ mu ma,
Wɔyɛɛ maa tsetseber do nyimpa,
Ɔdze turo bi mu nsɛm hyɛ ase kyerɛw,
Na ɔdze sika kuropɔn wie.
Asɛm a ɔyɛ dɛw kyɛn ne nyina.

MHB 857
2 . But the best is the story of Jesus,
Of the Babe with the ox in the stall,
Of the song that was sung by the angels,
The most beautiful story of all.
	 ~ 	2 
. Dza odzi mu yie nye Jesus ho nsɛm,
Abɔdoma a ɔnye nantwi hyɛ buw m',
Na ndwom a abɔfo towee wɔ No ho,
Nye nsɛm a ɔyɛ dɛw kyɛn ne nyina.

MHB 857
3 . There are stories for parents and children,
For the old who are ready to rest,
But for all who can read them or listen,
The story of Jesus is best.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nsɛm wɔ hɔ ma awofo na mbofra,
Mpanyin a wɔayɛ krado dɛ wɔhom,
Na hɔn a wotum kenkan na hɔn a wotsie n',
Jesus ho asɛm na odzi mu yie.

MHB 857
4 . For it tells how He came from the Father,
His far-away children to call,
To bring the lost sheep to their Shepherd,
The most beautiful story of all.	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔka mbrɛ osii fii Egya n' hɔ bae,
Bɛfrɛɛ Ne mba a wɔwɔ ekyirekyir,
Ɔdze nguan a wɔayew bɛbrɛ hɔn Wura n',

MHB 858
1 . TELL me the stories of Jesus
I love to hear;
Things I would ask him to tell me
If he were here;
Scenes by the wayside,
Tales of the sea,
Stories of Jesus,
Tell them to me.
	 ~ 	1 . Ka Jesus ho n-sɛm kyerɛ m', 
Mepɛ metsie;
Ndzɛmba a nkyɛ mibebisa No,
Sɛ ɔwɔ ha a:
Ɔkwan nkyɛn ndzɛmba,
Epo do nsɛm,
Jesus No ho nsɛm,
Ka kyerɛ me.
Ka kyerɛ me.

MHB 858
2 .  First let me hear how the children
Stood round his knee;
And I shall fancy his blessing
Resting on me;
Words full of kindness,
Deeds full of grace,
All in the love-light
Of Jesus’ face.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma mindzi kan ntse mbrɛ mbofra 
Kɔbɔɔ N' aprɔw;
Na emi so me nsa bɛka
Ne nhyira n' bi.
Ayamuyie kasa,
Adom ndzeyɛɛ,
Dze ɔdɔ hyerɛɛn
Jesus N' enyim.

MHB 858
3 . Tell how the sparrow that twitters
On yonder tree
And the sweet meadow-side lily
May speak to me;
ive me their message,
For I would hear
How Jesus taught us
Our Father’s care.
	 ~ 	3 
. Kyerɛ m' enyinyandze a osii 
Ture no mu n';
Na mbeamudua n' a wɔdze kum
M' Agyenkwa no:
Ne yaw na Ne dɛw,
Dɛ mbrɛ wɔyɛ
Jesus No ho nsɛm n',

MHB 859
1  ONCE in royal David’s city
Stood a lowly cattle shed,
Where a mother laid her baby
In a manger for his bed:
Mary was that mother mild,
Jesus Christ her little child.
 	 ~ 	1 . David ahenkurowm' prɛko bi, 
Nantwibuw tantan bi mu,
Ɔbaatan dedaa ne ba bi
Wɔ mbowa dzidzidaka mu.
Mary nye ɔbaatan pa n',
Jesus Christ ɔnye ne Ba n'.
Kɔ mbrɛ Ɔnoara oedu n'.

MHB 859
2 . He came down to earth from heaven,
Who is God and Lord of all,
And his shelter was a stable,
And his cradle was a stall;
With the poor, the scorned, the lowly,
Lived on earth our Saviour holy.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyame, adze nyina Wura, 
Fi sor siaan asaase do;
M-bowadan ɔnye No dɔbea,
Ne dabew nye mpɔnkɔbuw,
Hɛn Agyenkwa Krɔnkrɔnnyi
Ɔnye abɔbɔfo tsenaa ase.

MHB 859
3 . And, through all his wondrous childhood,
He would honour and obey,
Love and watch the lowly maiden
In whose gentle arms he lay:
Christian children all must be
Mild, obedient, good as he.
	 ~ 	3 
. No mbofraber nwanwa nyina 
Ɔyɛɛ enyidzi na setsie;
Ɔdɔe, ɔweɔn ne na brɛfo a
Ɔdaa n' abaw mu foo n' yie.
Christian mbofra nyɛ setsie,
Wɔndwe, nyɛ pa dɛ mbrɛ ɔyɛe.

MHB 859
4 . For he is our childhood’s pattern,
Day by day like us he grew;
He was little, weak and helpless,
Tears and smiles like us he knew.
And he feeleth for our sadness,
and he shareth in our gladness.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mbofra hɛn fasusu nye No, 
Onyinii dɛ hɛnara,
Kakrabaa, m-berɛmberɛw;
Osui, serewee dɛ hɛnara;
Ntsi hɛn yaw ɔtse ma hɛn,
Na hɛn dɛw onyam' kyɛpɛn.

MHB 859
5 . And our eyes at last shall see him,
through his own redeeming love;
For that Child who seemed so helpless
Is our Lord in heaven above;
And he leads his children on
To the place where he is gone.	 ~ 	5 
. Ɔnam No nkwagye dɔ no do 
Da bi hɛn enyi bohu N'
Osiandɛ abofra fɛɛfɛw n'
Nye Ewuradze a ɔwɔ sor;
Na ogya No mbofra kwan

MHB 86
1 . STRONG Son of God, immortal Love,
Whom we, that have not seen Thy face,
By faith, and faith alone, embrace,
Believing where we cannot prove;
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME Ba tumfo, daa Ɔdɔ, 
Ɔwo na hɛn yennhu W'enyim,
Yɛdze gyedzi nko suo Wo mu,
Yɛgye dza yenntum nntse ase dzi.

MHB 86
2 . Thou wilt not leave us in the dust:
Thou madest man, he knows not why,
He thinks he was not made to die;
And Thou hast made him: Thou art just.
	 ~ 	2 . Innkegyaa hɛn wɔ huntuma m';
Ebɔɔ nyimpa, ɔnntse W' ase; 
Ɔdwen dɛ wɔammbɔ n' dɛ ombowu;
Naaso ebɔɔ n', Ɔwo etsen.

MHB 86
3 . Thou seemest human and divine,
The highest, holiest manhood, Thou:
Our wills are ours, we know not how:
Our wills are ours, to make them Thine.
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔwo yɛ nyimpa na Nyame,
Eyɛ nyimpa krɔnkrɔn, ekrɔn; 
Yɛdze hɛn pɛ, yɛnntse ase;
Yɛdze hɛn pɛ nyina ma Wo.

MHB 86
4 . Our little systems have their day:
They have their day and cease to be:
They are but broken lights of Thee,
And Thou, O Lord, art more than they.	 ~ 	4 . Hɛn nhyehyɛɛ nyina wɔ hɔn mber;
Wodzi hɔn mber na wotwa m' kɔ; 
Wɔyɛ Wo kan ho gyansenama,
Na Ɔwo, Ewuradze so sen hɔn.

MHB 860
1 . AWAY in a manger, no crib for a bed,
The little Lord Jesus laid down His sweet head.
The stars in the bright sky looked down where He lay,
The little Lord Jesus asleep on the hay.
	 ~ 	1 . Akɔkowaba Jesus ennya adasoe; 
Wɔdedaa N' wɔ mbowa edzidzidaka mu.
N-woraba fi sorsor hyerɛɛn mbrɛ ɔda no,
Nna Jesus ada komm wɔ efuw no do.
Na tsew hɛn ho ama yaafata Wo nkyɛn.

MHB 860
2 . The cattle are lowering, the Baby awakes,
But little Lord Jesus no crying He makes,
I love Thee Lord Jesus ! Look down from the sky
And stay by my side until morning is nigh.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Anantwi no sui na Ɔba no nyanee, 
Naaso, hwɛ, oennsu, na mbom ɔdaa hɔ komm.
O Jesus, modɔ Wo; fi sor hwɛ mo do,
Tsena me nkyɛn araa kodu adzekyee.

MHB 860
3 . Be near me Lord Jesus; I ask Thee to stay,
Close by me for ever , and love me , I pray.
Bless all the dear children in Thy tender care
And fit us for heaven, to live with Thee there.	 ~ 	3  
. Ewuradze Jesus, meserɛ Wo dɛ 
Bɛn me nkyɛn na dɔ me aber nyinara,
Hyira mbofra nyina wɔ W' abaatan dɔ mu,

MHB 861
1 . O COME little children, I pray ye come all,
And join with the shepherds at Bethlehem’s stall;
There see what the Father, to do us delight,
Hath sent to the earth on this glorious night.
 	 ~ 	1 . O MBOFRABA, meserɛ hom dɛ hom nyina mbra,
Hom mbɛka Bethlehem nguanhwɛfo no ho;
Hom nhwɛ dza hɛn Egya pɛ dɛ hɛn enyi gye ntsi
Ɔdze aba asaase do 'nyimnyam anafua 'i.
O hom nye abɔfo ntow ndwom, nye hɔn ndzi dɛw.

MHB 861
2 . O bow, little children, O bend low and pray,
With little hands folded thank God, as did they;
Sing lustily, children, with glad tuneful voice,
O sing with the angels, and like them rejoice!	 ~ 	2 
. O hom mbɔ hom mu adze nkotow na hom nsɔr,
Hom nka hom nsa mfua, nda Nyame ase dɛ hɔn;
Mbofra, hom mfa sanku ndze ntow ndwom dɛw mu,

MHB 862
1 . WISE men seeking Jesus,
Travelled from afar,
Guided on their journey
By a beauteous star.
 	 ~ 	1 . 'NYANSAFO n' paar Jesus,
Wotuu kwan fi ekyir,
Woraba fɛfɛɛfɛw bi
Gyaa hɔn akwantu n' mu.
Ɔtsena hɛn akoma m'.

MHB 862
2 . But if we desire Him,
He is close at hand;
For our native country
Is our Holy Land.
	 ~ 	2 
. Na sɛ yɛhwehwɛ No a,
Ɔbɛn hɛn koraa;
Hɛnara hɛn man yi yɛ
Hɛn Asaase Krɔnkrɔn.

MHB 862
3 . Prayerful souls may find Him
By our quiet lakes,
Meet Him on our hillsides
When the morning breaks.
	 ~ 	3 
. Akra a wɔsɔr bohu N'
Hɛn esutaae ho,
Wobehyia N' nkokwaa do,
Ber a adze rekye.

MHB 862
4 . In our fertile cornfields
While the sheaves are bound,
In our busy markets
Jesus may be found.
	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn mburokwa mu, ber a
Yɛaboaboa eburow no;
Hɛn eguadzibea hɔɔ do,
Wotum hu Jesus.

MHB 862
5 . Fishermen talk with Him
By the great North Sea,
As the first disciples
Did in Galilee.
	 ~ 	5 
. Afarfo nye N' kasa
Wɔ Etsifo Po do,
Dɛ mbrɛ nkan esuafo n'
Yɛe wɔ Galilee n'.

MHB 862
6 . Every peaceful village
In our land might be
Made by Jesu’s presence
Like sweet Bethany.
	 ~ 	6 
. Jesus ba hān asomdwee
Kuroba biara mu a,
Ne mbae no dan no ma
Ɔyɛ Bethany.

MHB 862
7 . He is more than near us,
If we love Him well;
For He seeketh ever
In our hearts to dwell.	 ~ 	7 
. Sɛ yɛdɔ No yie ampa a,
Ɔbɛn hɛn koraa;
'Siandɛ ɔhwehwɛ daa dɛ

MHB 863
1 . THE Shepherds had an Angel,
The Wise Men had a star,
But what have I, a little child,
To guide me home from far,
Where glad stars sing together
And singing angels are?
 	 ~ 	1 . NGUANHWƐFO n' nyaa ɔbɔfo,
'Nyansafo n' nyaa woraba:
Ebɛn na emi abofra mowɔ?
Obegya m' efi ekyir akɔ fie?
Bea a dɛw nworaba tow ndwom bɔ m',
Na abɔfo so tow ndwom?
Wɔ sorsor noho nyina.

MHB 863
2 . Lord Jesus is my Guardian,
So I can nothing lack;
The lambs lie in His bosom
Along life’s dangerous track
The wilful lambs that go astray,
He bleeding fetches back.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mo Wura Jesus nye m' hwɛfo,
Dɛm ntsi mirinnhia hwee:
Ɔbra basaa yi nyina mu,
Nguambaa no gu No bomu;
Nguambaa asokyewfo a wɔfom yew n',
Okyi bɔgya twe hɔn.

MHB 863
3 . Those Shepherds through the lonely night
Sat watching by their sheep,
Until they saw the heavenly host
Who neither tire nor sleep,
All singing ’Glory glory,
In festival they keep.
	 ~ 	3 
. Dɛm nguanhwɛfo no tsenaa
Ase esuom weɔɔn hɔn nguan,
Kesii dɛ wohum sor dɔm no a
Wɔmmberɛ annda na mbom
Wɔtoow Enyimnyam, Enyimnyam,
Dze dzii afahyɛ no.

MHB 863
4 . Christ watches me, His little lamb,
Cares for me day and night,
That I may be His own in heaven:
So angels clad in white
Shall sing their ’Glory glory,’
For my sake in the height.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Christ hwɛ N'eguambaa kumaa mo do,
Ɔhwɛ m' do aber biara,
Ma maayɛ Nedze wɔ heaven:
'Bɔfo a woenwuna fitaa
Bɔtow hɔn ndwom, Enyimnyam, 'nyimnyam,
Wɔ me ntsi wɔ sorsor.

MHB 863
5 . Lord,bring me nearer day by day;
Till I my voice unite,
And sing my ’Glory glory’
With angels clad in white;
All ’Glory glory’ given to Thee
Through all the heavenly height.	 ~ 	5 
. Ewuradze, fa m' bɛn Wo ho daa,
Kɛpem dɛ me ndze bɔfora
'Bɔfo a wɔayɛ fitaa ndze
Na yɛatow enyimnyam,
Enyimnyam nyina yɛdze ama Wo,

MHB 864
1 . REMEMBER all the people
Who live in far-off lands
In strange and lovely cities
Or roam the desert sands,
Or farm the mountain pastures
Or till the endless plains
Where children wade through rice-fields
And watch the camel trains.
 	 ~ 	1 . KAA nyimpa nyina a wɔtse
Ekyirekyir nsaase do,
Wɔ nkuropɔn nwanwa fɛɛfɛw m',
Anaa wokyin anhwea m',
Wɔyɛ kua wɔ nkokwaa do,
Nye nsaase a ɔda famu do,
Bea a mbofra nenam emo fuw m',
Hwɛ efupɔnkɔ a wɔsen.
Na wɔaba N'adom mu.

MHB 864
2 . Some work in sultry forests
Where apes swing to and fro,
Some fish in mighty rivers,
Some hunt across the snow.
Remember all God’s children,
Who yet have never Heard
The truth that comes from Jesus,
The glory of His Word.
	 ~ 	2 
. Binom yɛ edwuma kwaa tuntu m',
Bea a ndow dzi afow sian,
Binom nu nam nsu akɛse m,
Yɛ ha 'sukwankyɛba m';
Kaa Nyame Ne mba nyina a
Wonnyaa mpo nntsee nokwar a 
Ofi Jesus hɔ ba no,
N'asɛm n'enyimnyam no.

MHB 864
3 . God bless the men and women
Who serve Him overseas;
God raise up more to help them
To set the nations free,
Till all the distant people
In every foreign place
Shall understand His kingdom,
And come into His grace.	 ~ 	3 
. Nyame nhyira mbanyin na mbaa a
Wɔsom No wɔ po ekyir;
Nyame mfrɛ pii nka hɔn ho
Ma amanaman eenya fahodzi,
Kɛpem dɛ ekyirekyirfo a
Wɔwɔ ananabea n'
Bɛtse N'ahenman n' ase,

MHB 865
1 . I THINK, when I read that sweet story of old,
When Jesus was here among men,
How He called little children as lambs to His fold,
I should like to have been with them then;
I wish that His hands had been placed on my head,
That His arms had been thrown around me,
And that I might have seen His kind look when He said,
“Let the little ones come unto Me!”
	 ~ 	1 . MEKENKAN asɛm dadaw dɛɛdɛw bi no a,
Ɔfa mbrɛ Jesus wɔ wiadze n'
Osii frɛɛ mbofraba kaa No nguaakuw ho no a,
Me yamu ara a nkyɛ mekaa hɔn ho;
Me yamu a nkyɛ ɔdze Ne nsa too me tsir do,
Na ɔtserɛɛw Ne nsa mu baam me,
Hom mma mbofra no mbra Me nkyɛn no!.

. Naaso sesei mpaabɔ m' m'bɔkɔ n'ananadze,
Na makɛserɛ N' No dɔ no bi;
Na sɛ nokwar m' mohwehwɛ N' yie ase ha a,
M'bohu No atse Ne ndze wɔ sor,
Bea fɛɛfɛw no a ɔakɔ rikesiesie dze ama
Hɔn a woeguar hɔn dze hɔn bɔn akyɛ hɔn n';
Na mbofra papa pii rihyia mu wɔ hɔ,
Yinom na ahenman n' yɛ hɔndze.

. Naaso mpempem a wokyin hwehwe ase,
Nntsee dɛm ɔsor fie no nka;
Mepɛ dɛ wohu dɛ kwan wɔ hɔ ma hɔn nyina,
Na dɛ Jesus ato nsa afrɛ hɔn.
Mokɔn dɔ 'nyimnyam ber no mu dɛw no,
Dza ɔyɛ dɛw, ɔhyerɛn, dzi mu,
Ber a mbofra pa a wofi wiadze nyina 
Bokogu N' bomu na oehyira hɔn n'.

MHB 866
1 . WHEN mothers of Salem, 
Their children brought to Jesus,
The stern disciples drove them back 
And bade them to depart:
But Jesus saw them ere they fled 
And sweetly smiled and kindly said,
Suffer little children to come unto Me.
	 ~ 	1 . BER a Salem abaatan
Dze hɔn mba kɔr Jesus hɔ n',
N'esuafo n' dze ebufuw see hɔn dɛ 
Wonfi hɔ wɔnkɔ.
Na Jesus hun hɔn ntsɛmara,
Na ɔyerɛɛw N'ano na ɔsee hɔn dɛ,
Wɔmma mbofraba no kwan ma wɔmbra
Me nkyɛn.
W'nkyɛn.

MHB 866
2 . How kind was our Saviour 
To bid those children welcome!
But there are many thousands 
Who have never heard His Name;
Dear saviour hear us when we pray
That they may hear thee to them say:
Suffer the little children to come unto Me.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn Agyenkwa n' kyerɛɛ ɔdɔ
Dɛ ɔyɛɛ mbofra n' eetuu;
Na mpempem bi so wɔ hɔ a
Hɔndze wɔnntsee Ne dzin no;
Agyenkwa pa, yɛsɔr a tsie hɛn,
Ama ese hɔn dɛ, Wɔmma 
Mbofraba no mbra Me nkyɛn a, wɔaatse.

MHB 866
3 . And  soon may the heathen
Of every tribe and nation
Fulfill Thy blessed Word and cast 
Their idols all away;
O shine upon them from above 
And show Thyself a God of love,
Teach them, dear savior, to come unto Thee.	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔnnkɛkyɛr na aman nyina
Do abosonsɔrfo eetsie
Na woeedzi W'asɛm no do
Aatow hɔn abosom egu;
O fi sor hyerɛn wɔ hɔn do;
Yi Woho kyerɛ dɛ ɔdɔ Nyame;
Agyenkwa pa, kyerɛ hɔn ma wɔmbra

MHB 867
1 . DAY by day we magnify thee,
When, as each new day is born,
On our knees at home, we bless thee
For the mercies of the morn.
	 ~ 	1 . Daa daa nyina yɛtonton Wo, 
Ber a adze akye bio,
Yebu ntwɛr wɔ fie hyira Wo,
Wɔ adzekyeem' adom ho.
Yɛrotweɔn Wo da n' asomdweem'.

MHB 867
2 . Day by day we magnify thee,
When our hymns in school we raise,
Daily work begun and ended
With the daily voice of praise.
	 ~ 	2 
. Daa daa nyina yɛtonton Wo, 
Ber a yeetu hɛn ndwom wɔ skuul,
Dabaa yɛdze W' ayɛyi hyɛ
Dwumadzi ase, yɛdze wie.

MHB 867
3 . Day by day we magnify thee
In our hymns before we sleep;
Angels hear them, watching by us,
Christ’s dear lambs all night to keep.
 	 ~ 	3  
. Daa daa nyina yɛtonton Wo, 
Wɔ hɛn ndwomm' ana yɛada;
Abɔfo tsie, wɔweɔn hɛn,
Christ no nguambaa anago nyina.

MHB 867
4 . Day by day we magnify thee,
Not in words of praise alone;
Truthful lips and meek obedience
Show thy glory in Thine own.
	 ~ 	4
