. Daa daa nyina yɛtonton Wo, 
Nnyɛ ayɛyi nsɛm mu nko;
Nokwardzi na setsie mu so
Yɛkyerɛ Woara W' enyimnyam.

MHB 867
5 . Day by day we magnify thee,
When for Jesus’ sake we try
Every wrong to bear with patience,
Every sin to mortify.
 	 ~ 	5  
. Daa daa nyina yɛtonton Wo, 
Dɛ ɔnam Jesus ara ntsi
Yɛdze abotar sɔw mfom nyina,
Na yeku ɔbɔn biara.

MHB 867
6 . Day by day we magnify thee,
Till our days on earth shall cease,
Till we rest from these our labours,
Waiting for thy day in peace.	 ~ 	6  
. Daa daa nyina yɛtonton Wo, 
Gyedɛ hɛn nda bɔ adze,
Gyedɛ yɛhom fi hɛn berɛm',

MHB 868
1 . LORD and Savior, true and kind,
Be the Master of my mind;
Bless, and guide, and strengthen still
All my powers of thought and will.
	 ~ 	1 . AGYENKWA pa nokwafo,
Gye m'adwen na dzi do tum;
Nyansa na pɛ a mowɔ no,
Hyira do, yɛ do kwangyafo.
Ama W'edwuma na Woara. Amen.

MHB 868
2 . While I ply the scholar’s task,
Jesus Christ, be near, I ask;
Help the memory, clear the brain,
Knowledge still to seek and gain.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ber a murusua nwonma yi
Jesus Christ, meserɛ W', bɛn me,
Kaakaa me, bue m'adwen mu,
Monhwehwɛ nyimdzee mminya.

MHB 868
3 . Here I train for life’s swift race;
Let me do it in Thy grace;
Here I arm me for life’s fight;
Let me do it in Thy might.
	 ~ 	3 
. Na mowɔ ɔbra ntsetsee ase;
Ma menyɛ no W'adom mu;
Moroboa m' ho ama ɔbra akodzi;
Ma menyɛ no Wo tum mu.

MHB 868
4 . Thou hast made me mind and soul;
I for Thee would use the whole:
Thou hast died that I might live;
All my powers to Thee I give.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔwo ama m' adwen na ɔkra;
Medze bɛyɛ edwuma ama Wo:
Ɔwo wui ma maatsena ase;
M'ahom nyina medze ma Wo.

MHB 868
5 . Striving, thinking, learning, still,
Let me follow thus Thy will,
Till my whole glad nature be
Trained for duty and for Thee.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Meper, m'adwendwen, mo sua m',
Ma mindzi Wo pɛ no do,
Kɛpem dɛ mibedzi mu

MHB 869
1 . PRAISE to our God. who with love never swerving
Guides our endeavours, enfolds us from harm,
Peace and prosperity, past our deserving,
 Showering upon us with bountiful arm.
	 ~ 	1 . AYƐYI nka Nyame a ɔdze dɔ a ɔnnkyea
Dzi hɛn enyim wɔ hɛn dwumadzi m' fi ɔsɛɛ mu;
Ohue asomdwee na ahonya a yɛmmfata,
Dua N'ayamuyie nsa mu ma hɛn daa.
Ka hɛn bɔ m' wɔ gyedzi na akoma mu.  Amen.

MHB 869
2 . Gone are the labours, the joy, and the sorrow ;
Lo, at the end we draw near to adore,
Ere our full life is begun on the morrow,
Childhood behind us and manhood before.
	 ~ 	2 
. Edwumayɛ, dɛw na awerɛhow etwa m';
Hwɛ, ewiei no, yɛtwe bɛn Wo, sɔr Wo,
Sesei a hɛn ndaamba abrabɔ nnyaa mmbaa yi;
Mbofrasɛm etwa m', na mpanyinyɛ wɔ kan.

MHB 869
3 . Shepherd of souls, o door of salvation,
 Keep Thou Thy flock in Thine infinite care,
Fold them as one in their last adoration,
Ere in the distance divided they fare.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Akra Guanhwɛfo, O nkwagye abotsen,
Fa Wo nhwɛdo a ɔnnsakyer no hwɛ Wo nguan,
Ka hɔn hɔ m' dɛ mbrɛ wɔyɛɛ dze sɔɔr Wo no,
Ansaana hɔn ntamu atsetsew ndaamba.

MHB 869
4 . Though nevermore in one place all may gather,
Though in life’s battle we struggle apart,
One be our Saviour, and One be our Father,
Bind us together in faith and in heart.
		Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Kaansa hɛn nyina nnkehyia mu wɔ fakor bio,
Kaansa ɔbra akodzi m' tsetsew mpo a,
Hɛn Gyefo yɛ kor, na, hɛn Egya yɛ kor,

MHB 87
1 . JESUS comes with all his grace,
Comes to save a fallen race:
Object of our glorious hope,
Jesus comes to lift us up.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS dze N'adom nyina ba, 
Ɔbɛgye asehwefo;
Hɛn 'nyimnyam enyidado,
Jesus ba bɛma hɛn do.

MHB 87
2 . Let the living stones cry out;
Let the sons of Abraham shout;
Praise we all our lowly King,
Give Him thanks, rejoice, and sing.
	 ~ 	2 . Ma enyikan abo nsea m',
Ma Abraham mba mbɔ ose;
Yenyi hɛn Hen brɛfo ayɛw,
Nda N' ase, ndzi dɛw, ntow ndwom.

MHB 87
3 . He hath our salvation wrought,
He our captive souls hath bought,
He hath reconciled to God,
He hath washed us in His blood.
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔayɛ hɛn nkwagye ho edwuma, 
Ɔafa hɛn akra ndɔmmum,
Ɔdze hɛn abrɛ Nyame,
Ɔdze No bɔgyaa ahor hɛn.

MHB 87
4 . We are now His lawful right,
Walk as children of the light;
We shall soon obtain the grace,
Pure in heart, to see his face.
	 ~ 	4 . Afei yɛyɛ Nedze koraa,
Hom nnantsew dɛ ekan mba;
Ɔnnkɛkyɛr na yeenya adom,
Akoma pa, ma yeehu No.

MHB 87
5 . We shall gain our calling’s prize;
After God we all shall rise,
Filled with joy, and love, and peace,
Perfected in holiness.	 ~ 	5 . Yɛbenya hɛn frɛ akatua;
Yebedzi Nyame ekyir,
Enyigye, dɔ na asomdwee,
Krɔnkrɔnyɛ bɛhyɛ hɛn ma.

MHB 870
1 . LORD, behold us with thy blessing
Once again assembled here:
Onward be our footsteps pressing
In thy love and faith and fear;
Still protect us
By thy presence ever near.
	 ~ 	1 . Ewuradze, fa Wo nhyira dom hɛn, 
Yebehyia mu bio wɔ ha;
Ma yentu anamɔn nkɔ kan
Wɔ Wo dɔ, gyedzi na surom';
Bɔ hɛn ho ban
Dɛ ebɛn hɛn daa nyina.

MHB 870
2 . For thy mercy we adore thee,
For this rest upon our way;
Lord, again we bow before thee,
Speed our labours day by day;
Mind and spirit
With thy choicest gifts array.
	 ~ 	2 
. W' ehumbɔbɔr ho yɛsɔr Wo, 
Edze dom hɛn kwan nyinam',
Nyame yetwa hwe W' enyim bio
Ma hɛn edwuma nkɔ do daa
Ma hɛn sunsum
Na adwen nnya W' akyɛdze pa.

MHB 870
3 . Keep the spell of home affection
Still alive in every heart;
May its power, with mild direction,
Draw our love from self apart,
Till thy children
Feel that thou their Father art.  Amen.
*         *        *       *      *
               Dismissal.
	 ~ 	3  
. Ma fidua mu enuadɔ ntsim 
Akoma biara mu daa,
No tum nkyerɛkyerɛ hɛn ma
Yenyi pɛsɛankonya akwa
Ndu dɛ Wo mba
Bohu dɛ hɔn Egya nye W'.
    
       Mpaamudzi

MHB 870
4 . Lord, dismiss us with Thy blessing
Thanks for mercies past receive;
Pardon all, their faults confessing;
Time that’s lost may all retrieve;
May Thy children
Ne’er again Thy Spirit grieve.
	 ~ 	4 
. Nyame fa Wo nhyira gya hɛn kwan,
Yɛda ase na ehumbɔbɔr;
Fa nnuhofo nyina mfom kyɛ hɔn;
Wonnya mber mfa ntsen dza asɛɛ n'
Na mma Wo mba
Mmfom Wo Sunsum ara bio.

MHB 870
5 . By Thy kindly influence cherish
All the good we here have gained;
May all taint of evil perish,
By Thy mightier power restrained;
Seek we ever
Knowledge pure and love un-feigned.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ma Wo Sunsum pa no nkenyan 
Ndzepa biara a yeenya n' ha,
Na dza ndzebɔn dze na nyina nsɛɛ,
Fa Wo tum kɛse n' siw ano,
Na yɛmper daa
Nnya nyimdzee na dɔ mapa.

MHB 870
6 . Let Thy Father-hand be shielding 
All who here shall meet no more ;
May their seed-time past be yielding
Year by year a richer store ;
Those returning
Make more faithful than before.   Amen.	 ~ 	6  
. Egya baatan, kora hɔn a 
Worinnhyia mu bio wɔ ha;
Ma dza woedua n' nsow aba pa
Bafuu ofi ber to ber;
Hɔn a wɔresan n'
Nnyɛ anokwafo nsen nkan' n'.  Amen.

MHB 871
1 . IN our work and in our play,
Jesus, ever with us stay;
May we always strive to be
True and faithful unto Thee.

     Then we truthfully can sing,
     We are children of the King.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN dwumadzi na hɛn agodzi m',
Jesus, 'nye hɛn ntsena daa;
Aber nyina yɛmbɔ mbɔdzen
Ndzi nokwar, ngyina mma Wo.
     Dɛm n' na yebotum atow dɛ
     Yɛyɛ ɔhen no Ne mba.
Hɛn dwumadzi na hɛn agodzi m'.

MHB 871
2 . May we in Thy strength subdue
Evil tempers, words untrue,
Thoughts impure, and deeds unkind,
All things hateful to Thy mind.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma yendua Wo tum do nhyɛ
Ebufuw na atorsɛm do,
Adwembɔn na ndzeyɛɛ bɔn,
Nye dza Ɔwo kyir nyina so.

MHB 871
3 . Jesus, from Thy throne above
Deign to fill us with Thy love,
So that all around may see
We belong, dear Lord. to Thee.
	 ~ 	3 
. Jesus, fi W'ahengua do
Fa Wo dɔ no hyɛ hɛn ma,
Ama obiara eehu dɛ 
Nyame pa, yɛyɛ Wodze.

MHB 871
4 . Children of the King are we!
May we loyal to Him be;
Try to please Him every day,
In our work and in our play.	 ~ 	4 
. Yɛyɛ Ɔhen no Ne mba,
Hom mma yendzi nokwar mma N',
Na yɛnsɔ N'enyi daa daa,

MHB 872
1 . WE bless thee oh Lord, for all this common life
Can give to rest and joy admist its strife;
For earth and trees and seas and clouds and springs;
For work and all the lessons that it brings.
	 ~ 	1 . YEHYIRA Wo, Nyame, dɛ dɛm bra yi ara
Tum ma ahomgye na dɛw wɔ no kō mu;
Asaase, ndua, po, fua na nsunyiwa ntsi
Edwuma na adzesua biara a ɔdze ba ntsi.
Onntwa m' da, Mbra a Otumfo Dɔ ahyɛ no.   Amen.

MHB 872
2 . For Pisgah gleams of newer, fairer truth,
Which ever ripening still renews our youth;
For fellowship with noble souls and wise,
Whose hearts beat time to music of the skies;
	 ~ 	2 
. Dɛ hɛn Pisgah ma hɛn nokwar fofor a,
Mber rokɔ n' ɔma mbahun foforyɛ;
Dɛ yɛnye nyimdzefo na enyansafo a
Wɔtse sor ndwom ngyegyee yɛ fɛkuwbɔ.

MHB 872
3 . For each achievement human toil can reach;
For all the patriots win, and poets teach;
For the old light that gleams on history’s page
For the new  hope that shines on each new age.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyimpa berɛ mu enyadze biara ntsi;
Dza amandɔfo yɛ na akyerɛwfo ka ntsi,
Wɔ dadaw kan a ɔda tsetsesɛm edzi ntsi,
'Nyidar fofor a mber danee dze ba ntsi.

MHB 872
4 . May we to these our lights be ever true,
Find hope and strength and joy forever new,
To heavenly visions still obedient prove,
The Eternal law writ by the Almighty love!
		Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Yendzi nokwar mma hɛn nkandzea yinom,
Nnya 'nyidar, 'hoɔdzen na dɛw fofor daa,
Nyɛ 'setsie mma ɔsor ndzɛmba nko daa,

MHB 873
1 . THOU gracious God, whose mercy lends
The light of home, the smile of friends,
Our gathered flock Thine arms enfold
As in the peaceful days of old.
 	 ~ 	1 . Nyame dɔyɛfo a W'ehumbɔbɔr 
Dom hɛn fie kan na enuadɔ,
Fa hɛn nguankuw gu W' abaw mu,
Dɛ mbrɛ eyɛɛ n' tsetsebaado n'.
M-berantsen nyinara mu.    Amen.

MHB 873
2 . Wilt thou not hear us while we raise
In sweet accord of solemn praise
The voices that have mingled long
In joyous flow of mirth and song?
	 ~ 	2 
. N-dze a yɛdze tow ndwom yɛserew, 
Ma hɛn fie yɛ enyigye yi,
Yɛdze tow ndwom yi Wo ayɛw a,
Aso, Ewuradze, innketsie hɛn?

MHB 873
3 . For all the blessings life has brought,
For all its sorrowing hours have taught,
For all we mourn, for all we keep,
The hands we clasp, the loved that sleep.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔbram' nhyira na awerɛhow ntsi, 
Enyigye a wɔtse ase n-tsi,
Nye hɔn a woewu nyina ntsi,
Yɛda W' ase, hɛn Egya pa.

MHB 873
4 . The noontide sunshine of the past,
These brief, bright moments fading fast,
The stars that gild our darkening years,
The twilight ray from holier spheres.
	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn mber pam' dɛw a etwam' ntsi, 
Enyigye a yɛwɔm' sesei ntsi,
Hɛn bra n' ewimbir mu kan ntsi,
Yɛda W' ase hɛn Egya pa.

MHB 873
5 . We thank thee, Father; let thy grace
Our loving circle still embrace,
Thy mercy shed its heavenly store,
Thy peace be with us evermore. Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Ma W' adom mbɔ hɛn ho aprɔw, 
Ma W' ehumbɔbɔr mbra hɛn do,
Ma W' asomdwee ntsena hɛn nkyɛn

MHB 874
1 . AWAY with our fears!
The glad morning appears
When an heir of salvation was born!
From Jehovah I came,
For his glory I am,
And to him I with singing return.
	 ~ 	1 . YI hɛn suro kɔ!
'Nyigye da no a wɔwoo
Nkwagye dzifo bi n' aba ampa!
Mifi Jehovah mu,
Na mehyɛ N' enyimnyam,
Na medze adwontow san so kɔ N' hɔ.
Na meetu ne nyina esi hɔn ama No.

MHB 874
2 . I sing of thy grace,
From my earliest days
Ever near to allure and defend;
Hitherto thou hast been
My preserver from sin,
And I trust thou wilt save to the end.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mekamfo W'adom
Dɛ ofi m'ahyɛse n'
Ɔabɛn, atwe me, abɔ m' ho ban;
Ɔwo agye m' bɔn mu
Ara dze ebodu ndɛ 
Na minyim dɛ edze m' bodu ewiei.

MHB 874
3 . O the infinite cares,
And temptations, and snares,
Thy hand hath conducted me through!
O the blessings bestowed
By a bountiful God,
And the mercies eternally new!
	 ~ 	3 
. O daa daa dadwen,
Nsɔhwɛ, na mfir horow
Wo nsa egya me abamba afa mu!
O nhyira beberee na 
Domfo Nyame dze ama,
Ɔnye mbɔbɔrhu a ɔyɛ fofor daa.

MHB 874
5 . What a mercy is this,
What a heaven of bliss,
How unspeakably happy am I!
Gathered into the fold,
With thy people enrolled,
With thy people to live and to die!

. All honour and praise
To the Father of grace,
To the Spirit, and Son, I return!
The business pursue
He hath made me to do,
And rejoice that I ever was born.
	 ~ 	5 
. Medze enyidzi na
'Yɛyi ma adom Egya,
Ɔba no na Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn no;
Edwuma a ohia no,
Ɔahyɛ me ma mayɛ,
Na midzi dɛw pii dɛ wɔwoo me.

MHB 874
6 . In a rapture of joy
My life I employ,
The God of my life to proclaim;
’Tis worth living for this,
To administer bliss
And salvation in Jesus’s name.
	 ~ 	6 
. Medze dɛw kɛse
Tu me bra nyina dze
Bɔ me Nyankopɔn No ho dawur;
Ɔsɛ dɛ meyɛ 'yi,
Dɛ medze ma Jesus
Ne dɛw na No nkwagye no tahye.

MHB 874
7 . My remnant of days
I spend in his praise,
Who died the whole world to redeem:
Be they many or few,
My days are his due,
And they all are devoted to him. 	 ~ 	7 
. Mo nkwa nda a aka n',
Medze beyi N' ayɛw;
Ɔno na owui gyee wiadze nyina;
Mbrɛ me nda tse biara,
Odzi wɔ m' Pomfo no,

MHB 875
1 . O HAPPY home, where Thou art loved the dearest,
Thou loving Friend and Saviour of our race,
And where among the guests there never cometh
One who can hold such high and honored place!
 	 ~ 	1 . Ahomka fi nye mbrɛ wɔdɔ wo kɛse, 
'Wo, Nyɛnko pa, adasa Agyenkwa,
Na wɔdze Wo tsena mpanyin tsenabea
Wɔ ahɔho a wɔba hɔ nyina mu.
Ɔdɔ na asomdwee domankoma fi n'.

MHB 875
2 . O happy home, where two in heart united
In holy faith and blessed hope are one,
Whom death a little while alone divideth,
And cannot end the union here begun!
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ahomka fi nye mbrɛ beenu abɔ mu 
Ayɛ kor gyedzi na enyidar mu,
Ma owu nkotoo na otum paa hɔn mu,
Na ɔno mpo nntum nnsɛɛ koryɛ n' koraa.

MHB 875
3 . O happy home, whose little ones are given
Early to Thee, in humble faith and prayer,
To Thee, their Friend, who from the heights of Heaven
Guides them, and guards with more than mother’s care!
 	 ~ 	3 
. Ahomka fi nye bea a wɔdze no mu mba 
Hyɛ Wo nsa wɔ gyedzi nye mpaabɔ mu,
Na Ɔwo, hɔn Damfo, ifi sor weɔn hɔn,
Na ehwɛ hɔn do kyɛn mbrɛ na bɔhwɛ.

MHB 875
4 . O happy home, where each one serves Thee, lowly,
Whatever his appointed work may be,
Till every common task seems great and holy,
When it is done, O Lord, as unto Thee!
 	 ~ 	4 
. Ahomka fi nye mbrɛ obiara som Wo 
Ahobrɛadze mu wɔ no dwumadzim',
Dze kodu dɛ fam' dwuma nyina ho tsew,
Dɛ wɔdze rema Wo, Ewuradze.

MHB 875
5 . O happy home, where Thou art not forgotten,
Where joy is overflowing, full and free,
O happy home, where every wounded spirit
Is brought, Physician, Comforter, to Thee—
	 ~ 	5  
. Ahomka fi nye beebi a werɛ mmfir Wo 
Ber a enyigye na dɛw abor do;
Ahomka fim' na wɔdze sunsum pirafo
Brɛ Wo, Duyɛfo, Werɛkyekyefo.

MHB 875
6 . Until at last, when earth's day's work is ended,
All meet Thee in the blessed home above,
From whence Thou camest, where Thou hast ascended,
Thy everlasting home of peace and love !	 ~ 	6  
. Dze kɛpem dɛ sɛ wiadze dwumadzi sa a, 
Hɔn nyina behyia Wo wɔ sor fi n' mu,
Mbrɛ ifir bae, na efowee kɔree no,

MHB 876
1 . OMNIPRESENT God, whose aid
No one ever asked in vain,
Be this night about my bed,
Every evil thought restrain;
Lay thy hand upon my soul,
God of my unguarded hours;
All my enemies control,
Hell, and earth, and nature’s powers.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME a ewɔ mbea nyina
Na eboa hɔn a wɔdan Wo,
Anafua 'i bra me mpa ho
Besi adwembɔn nyina mpa;
Fa Wo nsa to me kra do,
Ɔwo m' mbusu ber Nyame,
Dzi m'atamfo, hɛll, wiadze
Na abɔdze mu tum nyina do.
Asomdwee m'.    Amen.

MHB 876
2 . Loose me from the chains of sense,
Set me from the body free,
Draw with stronger influence
My unfettered soul to thee;
In me, Lord, Thyself reveal,
Fill me with a sweet surprise:
Let me thee when waking feel,
Let me in thy image rise.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yi me fi wiadze akɔndɔ m',
Ma m' honam mu fahodzi,
Fa tum pa kɛse twe me
Kra fam Woara Wo ho daa;
Mo Wura, yi Woho kyerɛ me.
Fa dɛw ahobow hyɛ m' ma,
Sɛ minyan a, ma mentse W' nka,
Ma monsoɛr Wo su no mu.

MHB 876
3 . Let me of thy life partake,
Thy own holiness impart,
O that I might sweetly wake
With my Saviour in my heart!
O that I might know thee mine!
O that I might thee receive!
Only live the life divine,
Only to thy glory live!
 	 ~ 	3 
. Ma minnya Wo nkwa m' kyɛfa,
Wo krɔnkrɔnyɛ n', ma me bi,
Kɛtseankyɛ meehu n' yie dɛ
M'Agyenkwa aba m'akoma m'!
Na meehu Wo dɛ medze,
Kɛtseankyɛ maayɛ W' etuu!
Maabɔ sunsum mu bra nko
Dze ahyɛ Wo nko enyimnyam.

MHB 876
4 . Or if thou my soul require
Ere I see the morning light,
Grant me, Lord, my heart’s desire,
Perfect me in love to-night;
Finish thy great work of love,
Cut it short in righteousness,
Fit me for the realms above,
Change, and bid me die in peace.
	           Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Eso sɛ ihia me kra
Ansaana adze akye a,
Mo Wura, ma m' kra n'apɛdze,
Dɛ m'bedzi mu dɔ m' 'nafua 'i;
Wie Wo dɔ dwuma kɛse n',
Twa no tsia wɔ tsenenee mu,
Ma memfata sor noho,
Sakyer m' na munwu

MHB 877
1 . HOW do Thy mercies close me round!
For ever be Thy name adored!
I blush in all things to abound;
The servant is above his Lord!
	 ~ 	1 . MBRƐ Wo mbɔbɔrhu si fua m' a!
Wɔntonton Wo dzin afebɔɔ!
Mefɛr dɛ m'bɔkrɔn wɔ bra mu,
Akowaa bi a ɔkyɛn no Wura!
Ɔtwer Wo turodoo daa no.

MHB 877
2 . Inured to poverty and pain,
A suffering life my Master led;
The Son of God, the Son of man,
He had not where to lay his head.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ohia na yaw tsɛɛ mo Wura,
Na amandzehu bra nko na ɔbɔe;
Nyankopɔn Ba, Nyimpa Ba no,
Ennya Ne tsir mpo tobew da.

MHB 877
3 . But, lo, a place he hath prepared
For me, whom watchful angels keep;
Yea, he himself becomes my guard,
He smooths my bed, and gives me sleep.
	 ~ 	3 
. Naaso hwɛ, oesiesie beebi
Ama me, na abɔfo weɔn me;
Ampa, Noara gya m' abamba,
Siesie me mpa na ɔma meda.

MHB 877
4 . Jesus protects; my fears, begone!
What can the Rock of ages move?
Safe in Thy arms I lay me down,
Thy everlasting arms of love.
	 ~ 	4 
. Jesus weɔn me; mo suro, kɔ!
Ebɛn puhim Tsetse Botan n'?
Wo domankoma dɔ abaw no mu
Medze moho to hɔ da sɔnn.

MHB 877
5 . While Thou art intimately nigh,
Who, who shall violate my rest?
Sin, earth, and hell I now defy;
I lean upon my Saviour’s breast.
	 ~ 	5 
. Ber a ewɔ me nkyɛn dɛm yi,
Woana botum asɛɛ me nda?
Muhoro bɔn, wiadze na hɛll mpo;
Motwer m'Agyenkwa No bo mu.

MHB 877
6 . I rest beneath the Almighty’s shade,
My griefs expire, my troubles cease;
Thou, Lord, on whom my soul is stayed,
Wilt keep me still in perfect peace.
 	 ~ 	6 
. Mohom Tumfo n' No nwin ase,
Mo nkrumsi pa, me haw so twa;
Ɔwo mo Wura a me kra twer Wo n'
Bɔkora m' asomdwee mapa m'.

MHB 877
7 . Me for Thine own Thou lov’st to take,
In time and in eternity;
Thou never, never wilt forsake
A helpless soul that trusts in thee.	 ~ 	7 
. Edɔ dɛ efa m' yɛ Wodze,
Sesei na daapem nyina so;
Ɔwo nnkɛpa 'kra bɔbɔnyi a

MHB 878
1 . O GOD, our help in ages past,
Our hope for years to come,
Our shelter from the stormy blast,
And our eternal home:
	 ~ 	1 . Nyame hɛn mboa mber a ɔasen, 
Hɛn ndaamba enyidar,
Hɛn sumabew wɔ ehumtu ber,
Hɛn domankoma fi.
Yɛ hɛn fi a onnyi ewiei.   Amen.

MHB 878
2 . Under the shadow of Thy throne
Thy saints have dwelt secure;
Sufficient is Thine arm alone,
And our defence is sure.
	 ~ 	2 
. W' ahengua no no nwim ase 
Na yɛbɛda ho ahyɛ;
W' abaw no nko mpo ɔdɔɔ so,
Obotwitwa agye hɛn.

MHB 878
3 . Before the hills in order stood,
Or earth received her frame,
From everlasting Thou art God,
To endless years the same.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ansaana wɔreyɛ nkokwaa, 
Mbrɛ Wonnyae mmbɔɔ wiadze
Ofi tsetse eyɛ Nyame,
Eyɛ so afebɔɔ.

MHB 878
4 .  A thousand ages in Thy sight
Are like an evening gone;
Short as the watch that ends the night
Before the rising sun.
	 ~ 	4 
. M-fe apem yɛ W' enyi do 
Dɛ da kor a ɔasen,
Ɔyɛ tsia dɛ anago sum
Na anapa kan ehyiae.

MHB 878
5 . The busy tribes of flesh and blood,
With all their cares and fears,
Are carried downward by the flood,
And lost in following years.
	 ~ 	5 
. Adasamba a wɔtse wiadze 
Na hɔn dadwen nyina,
Ɔnnkyɛr biara na wɔapem kɔ,
Wɔayew hɛn enyi do.

MHB 878
6 . Time, like an ever-rolling stream,
Bears all its sons away;
They fly forgotten, as a dream
Dies at the opening day.
	 ~ 	6 
. M-ber soa ne mba nyina kɔ 
Dɛ esu a ɔrepem;
Wɔhera dɛ mbrɛ adaaso hera
Ber a adze rekye.

MHB 878
7 . O God, our help in ages past,
Our hope for years to come,
Be thou our guard while troubles last,
And our eternal home.   Amen.	 ~ 	7 
. Nyame hɛn mboa mber a ɔasen, 
Hɛn ndaamba enyidar,
Yɛtse nkwa mu yi wowaw hɛn,

MHB 879
1 . GOD save our gracious King,
Long live our noble King,
God save the King!
Send him victorious,
Happy and glorious,
Long to reign over us:
God save the king.
	 ~ 	1 . Nyame ngye hɛn Hen pa, 
Hɛn Hen kunyin nnyin nkyɛr,
Nyame ngye Ɔhen!
Ɔmma n' konyimdzi daa,
Ahomka nye enyimnyam,
Ma ɔnhwɛ ɔman do nkyɛr;
Nyame ngye Ɔhen!
Nyame ngye Ɔhen!

MHB 879
2 . Thy choicest gifts in store
On him be pleased to pour,
Long may he reign.
May he defend our laws,
And ever give us cause
To sing with heart and voice,
God save the King!	 ~ 	2 
. Wo nsam' nhyira papa n', 
Kyɛw nye yi, wora gu no do
Ondzi hen nkyɛr,
Nkyɛ ɔaawowaw hɛn mbra,
Ma daa hɛn so yɛdze
'Koma na dɛw yaatow

MHB 88
1 . WE know, by faith we surely know,
The Son of God is come,
Is manifested here below,
And makes our hearts his home:
To us He hath, in gracious love,
An understanding given,
To recognise Him from above
The Lord of earth and heaven.
	 ~ 	1 . YƐNAM gyedzi do nyim ampa,
Nyame Ba no aba,
Ɔada Noho edzi wɔ ha,
Na Ɔtse hɛn akoma m';
Ɔnam N'adom nye No dɔ mu 
Ama hɛn nyina ntseasee, 
Dɛ yɛnhwɛ ɔsor nhu No dɛ 
Sor nye asaase Wura.

MHB 88
2 . The self-existing God supreme,
Our Saviour we adore,
Fountain of life eternal, Him
We worship evermore:
Out of His plenitude receive
Ineffable delight,
And shall through endless ages live
Triumphant in His sight.	 ~ 	2 . Yɛtonton Nyame Otumfo, 
Ɔno a obi ammbɔ No, 
Ɔno nye daa nkwa nsunyiwa, 
Yɛsɔr No daa nyina;
N'amayɛ no mu na yenya
Enyigye a ɔnnsa da,
Yɛbɛtsena ase wɔ N'enyim dɛ 
Nkonyimdzifo daa nyina.

MHB 880
1 . GOD bless our native land!
May heaven’s protecting hand
Still guard our shore:
May peace her power extend,
Foe be transformed to friend,
And Britian’s rights depend
On war no more.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME nhyira hɛn man,
No sor bambɔ nsa no
Nhyira hɛn mpoano;
Asomdwee mu ntserɛw.
Ɔtamfo ndan nyɛnko,
Na Ghanaman yiedzi
Eenntsim ɔko do.
Wɔ wiadze ha.

MHB 880
2 . O Lord, our monarch bless
With strength and righteousness
Long may he reign:
His heart inspire and move
With wisdom from above;
And in a nation’s love
His throne maintain.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyame, fa ahoɔdzen na
Pɛrpɛr ma Ɔmampanyin;
Ma n' tum n'aber m';
Fa nyansa kɛse fi
Sor nunu n'adwen daa,
Na ɔman no ndɔ no
Wɔ n'aber do.

MHB 880
3 . May just and righteous laws
Uphold the public cause,
And bless our isle:
Home of the brave and free,
Thou land of liberty,
We pray that still on thee
Kind heaven may smile.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma pɛrpɛr na mbra pa
Ntsim n'amambu ber mu,
Hyira hɛn man;
Adehye, konyim man,
Fahodzi asaase,
Yɛsɔr dɛ sor Nyame
Nserew nkyerɛ wo.

MHB 880
4 . Nor on this land alone,
But be God’s mercies known
From shore to shore:
Lord make the nations see
That men should brothers be,
And form one family
The wide world o’er.	 ~ 	4 
. Nnyɛ hɛn man yi nko bi;
Nyame mbɔbɔrhu no,
Nka mbea nyina;
Nyame mma aman n' nhu dɛ
Wɔyɛ enuanom, ampa,
Na wɔbɔ ebusua kor,

MHB 881
1 . LORD, while for all mankind we pray,
Of every clime and coast,
O hear us for our native land,
The land we love the most.
 	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, ber a yɛrosɔr ma
Wiadze nyimpa nyina yi,
Tsie hɛn wɔ hɛn awobea ntsi,
Bea a yɛdɔ n' mbordo no.
Dɛ ne daapem Nyɛnko.  Amen.

MHB 881
2 . Our father s’ sepulchres are here,
And here our kindred dwell,
Our children too: how should we love
Another land so well?
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn egyaam ndakamaa wɔ ha,
Ha na hɛn nkorɔfo tse;
Hɛn mba so: na yebesi dɛn
Adɔ beebi kyɛn ha?

MHB 881
3 . O guard our shores from every foe;
With peace our borders bless;
With prosperous times our cities crown,
Our fields with plenteousness.
	 ~ 	3 
. Bɔ hɛn ahe ho ban ma hɛn,
Na dom hɛn asomdwee;
Ma hɛn nkurow nya prɔmprɔmyɛ,
Hɛn mfudze nyɛ bafuu.

MHB 881
4 . Unite us in the sacred love
Of knowledge, truth, and Thee;
And let our hills and valleys shout
The songs of liberty.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Dua nyimdzee nye nokwar ho dɔ m'
Ka hɛn na Ɔwo bɔ mu;
Na ma hɛn mbepɔw na mbɔnsa
Mbɔ m' nhuhor fahodzi.

MHB 881
5 . Lord of the nations, thus to Thee
Our country we commend;
Be Thou her Refuge and her Trust
Her everlasting Friend.     Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Aman nyina Ewuradze;
Hɛn man hyɛ Wo nsamu;
Ma onsuma Wo mu, ntwer Wo,

MHB 882
1 . REJOICE, O land, in God thy might,
His will obey, Him serve aright;
For Thee the saints uplift their voice:
Fear not, O land, in God rejoice.
	 ~ 	1 . 'SAASE, dzi dɛw wo tum Nyame m',
Yɛ setsie ma No, som no yie,
'Wo na ahotsewfo bɔ ndze ma W';
'Saase nnsuro, dzi dɛw Nyame m'.
Na sie No nokwar no daa daa.   Amen.

MHB 882
2 . Glad shalt thou be, with blessing crowned,
With joy and peace thou shalt abound;
Yea, Love with thee shall make His home
Until thou see God’s kingdom come.
	 ~ 	2 
. W'enyi bɛgye na nhyira aka w';
Wo dɛw na asomdwee bobu do,
Nyew, ɔdɔ nye wo bɛtsena
Kesi sor Ahenman ne mbae.

MHB 882
3 . He shall forgive thy sins untold:
Remember thou His love of old;
Walk in His way, His word adore,
And keep His truth for evermore.
		Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔdze wo bɔn pii no bɛkyɛ w',
Kaa No dɔ a ofi tsetse no,
Fa N'akwan do, kamfo N'asɛm,

MHB 883
1 . JUDGE eternal, throned in splendour,
Lord of lords and King of kings,
With Thy living fire of judgement
Purge this realm of bitter things;
Solace all its wide dominion
With the healing of Thy wings.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆHEN domankoma tsɛmbuafo,
Ewuraam Wura 'hemfo Hen,
Fa W'atsɛmbu gya nyikamfo n',
Hyew man yi mu dza omuo no;
Fa W'atsaban mu yarsa no
Numa n'amantam nyina.
Tsew ahenman mba no ho. Amen.

MHB 883
2 . Still the weary folk are pining
For the hour that brings release;
And the city’s crowded clangour
Cries aloud for sin to cease;
And the homesteads and the woodlands
Plead in silence for their peace.
	 ~ 	2 
. Abɔbɔfo n' da ho rohwɛ
Ahotɔ dɔnhwer no kwan;
Na nkuropɔn m' begyabegya
No retsea mu dɛ bɔn ngyaa;
Na efiefi nye ndɔtɔ ase
Totɔ serɛ asomdwee.

MHB 883
3 .  Crown, O God, thine own endeavour;
Cleave our darkness with thy sword;
Feed the faithless and the hungry
With the richness of Thy word;
Cleanse the body of this empire
Through the glory of the Lord.  Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Nyame, sɔw W'edwuma n' ano,
Fa nkrantsee paa hɛn sum mu:
Fa W'asɛm ne mayɛ no mee
Wiadzefo a kɔm dze hɔn no;
Fa Ewuradze enyimnyam n'

MHB 884
1 . BEFORE Thy throne, O God, we kneel;
ive us a conscience quick to feel,
A ready mind to understand
The meaning of Thy chastening hand;
Whate’er the pain and shame may be,
Bring us, O Father, nearer Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . YEBU ntwɛr wɔ W'ahenguan' enyim,
Ma hɛn tsibowa ma yɛmfa nhu,
Na adwen-har ma yɛmfa ntse
W'asotwe nsa no ase yie;
Sɛ yaw na fɛr no tse dɛn mpo a,
Hɛn Egya, twe hɛn bɛn Wo nkyɛn.
'Hotsewfo, nokwar, nyimdzefo.  Amen.

MHB 884
2 . Search out our hearts and make us true,
Wishful to give to all their due;
From love of pleasure, lust of gold,
From sins which make the heart grow cold,
Wean us and train us with Thy rod;
Teach us to know our faults, O God.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hwehwɛ akoma m' ma hɛn nokwar,
Yɛmfa obiara ne kyɛfa mma n';
Yemfi enyigyedze akɔndɔbɔn m',
Yemfi bɔn a ɔma akoma yɛ mberɛw m';
Twe hɛn, na fa Wo poma no
Kyerɛ hɛn na yenhu hɛn mfom.

MHB 884
3 . For sins of heedless word and deed,
For pride ambitious to succeed;
For crafty trade and subtle snare
To catch the simple unaware;
For lives bereft of purpose high,
Forgive, forgive, O Lord, we cry.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hɛn kasaa na ndzeyɛɛ no bɔn,
Mpirenyim ho apɛbiakyerɛ;
Enyitsew bɔn a wɔfa do
Daa dze bu ekotobɔfo;
Na hɛn bra a no botae nn-hyerɛn,
Hɛn Wura, yɛserɛ, fa n' nyina kyɛ hɛn.

MHB 884
4 . Let the fierce fires, which burn and try,
Our inmost spirits purify:
Consume the ill; purge out the shame;
O God! be with us in the flame;
A newborn people may we rise,
More pure, more true, more nobly wise.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Ma gya dzendzen a ɔpo kra n'
Ntsew hɛn bɔbew mu sunsum ho:
Hyew bɔn na tu enyimguase ase;
O Nyame! Ka hɔn ho ogya n' mu;
Ma yempue dɛ nyimpa fofor,

MHB 885
1 . REJOICE today with one accord,
Sing out with exultation;
Rejoice and praise our mighty Lord,
Whose arm hath brought salvation;
His works of love proclaim
The greatness of His Name;
For He is God alone
Who hath His mercy shown;
Let all His saints adore Him!
 	 ~ 	1 . HOM mfa akoma kor ndzi dɛw ndɛ,
Hom mfa dɛw kɛse ntow ndwom,
Ndzi dɛw, nyi hɛn Wura tumfo ayɛw,
Nyia N'abasa ama nkwagye n',
No dɔ dwuma no bɔ
Ne kɛseyɛ dawur;
No nkotsee nye Nyame a,
Ɔakyerɛ No mbɔbɔrhu;
Wɔmma N'ahotsewfo nsɔr N'.
Wɔmma N'ahotsewfo nsɔr N'.  Amen.

MHB 885
2 . When in distress to Him we cried,
He heard our sad complaining;
O trust in Him, whate’er betide,
His love is all sustaining;
Triumphant songs of praise
To Him our hearts shall raise;
Now every voice shall say,
“O praise our God always”;
Let all His saints adore Him!
	 ~ 	2 
. Mbusu ber mu yesui frɛɛ No n',
Otsiee hɛn mbɔbɔr su no,
Dza osi biara mu, hom ntwer No.
No dɔ ma yetsim bra mu;
Yefi akoma m' bɔtow
Konyimdzi ndwom ama N';
Sesei ndze nyina nse dɛ,
Wonyi hɛn Nyame ayɛw,
N'ahotsewfo nyi N' ayɛw.

MHB 885
3 . Rejoice today with one accord,
Sing out with exultation;
Rejoice and praise our mighty Lord,
Whose arm hath brought salvation;
His works of love proclaim
The greatness of His Name;
For He is God alone
Who hath His mercy shown;
Let all His saints adore Him.   Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. HOM mfa akoma kor ndzi dɛw ndɛ,
Hom mfa dɛw kɛse ntow ndwom,
Ndzi dɛw, nyi hɛn Wura tumfo ayɛw,
Nyia N'abasa ama nkwagye n',
No dɔ dwuma no bɔ\nNe kɛseyɛ dawur;
No nkotsee nye Nyame a,
Ɔakyerɛ No mbɔbɔrhu;

MHB 886
1 . TO Thee our God we fly
For mercy and for grace;
O hear our lowly cry,
And hide not thou Thy face.
        O Lord, stretch forth thy mighty hand,
        And guard and bless our fatherland.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME, yɛba bɛgye
W'adom mbɔbɔrhu no;
O tsie hɛn mbɔbɔr su,
Na mmfa W'enyim nnsuma!
     Ewuradze, tsen Wo nsa kɛse n',
     Kora hɛn awobea Ghana.
Hɛn Nyame gyedɛ Ɔwo.   Amen.

MHB 886
2 . Arise, O Lord of Hosts,
Be jealous for Thy name,
And drive from out our coasts
The sins that put to shame:
	 ~ 	2 
. O Dɔm Ewuradze, soɛr;
Twe Wo dzin ho nyinkun,
Na pam bɔn a ɔhyɛ fɛr n'
Fi hɛn man yi nyina m'.

MHB 886
3 . Thy best gifts from on high
In rich abundance pour,
That we may magnify
And praise thee more and more:
	 ~ 	3 
. Hue W'akyɛdze etsitsir n'
Fi sor dɛ nhyira pii,
Ama yeehuhor Wo,
Eeyi Wo ayɛw mbordo.

MHB 886
4 . The powers ordained by thee
With heavenly wisdom bless;
May they thy servants be,
And rule in righteousness:
	 ~ 	4 
. Hɔn a ama hɔn tum no,
Fa sor nyansa ma hɔn,
Ma wɔnyɛ W'asomfo,
Mbu man tsenenee mu.

MHB 886
5 . The Church of Thy dear Son
Inflame with love’s pure fire,
Bind her once more in one,
And life and truth inspire:
	 ~ 	5 
. Fa dɔ ne gya krɔnn no
Nunu Wo Ba N' Asɔr n';
Kyekyer hɔn bɔ mu bio,
Na nkwa na nokwar mbra.

MHB 886
6 . The pastors of Thy fold
With grace and power endue,
That faithful, pure, and bold,
They may be pastors true:
	 ~ 	6 
. Fa adom na tum hyehyɛ 
Wo nguankuw do asɔfo,
Ma hɔn gyedzi nye ndam
Ma wɔnyɛ asɔfo pa.

MHB 886
7 . O let us love Thy house,
And sanctify Thy day,
Bring unto Thee our vows,
And loyal homage pay:
	 ~ 	7 
. O ma yɛndɔ Wo fie
Na yɛntsew Wo da ho,
Mfa hɛn anohobadze
Nye hɛn 'nyidzii mbrɛ Wo.

MHB 886
8 . Give peace, Lord, in our time;
O let no foe draw nigh,
Nor lawless deed of crime
Insult Thy majesty:
	 ~ 	8 
. Ma hɛn asomdwee, hɛn ber mu',
Mma tamfo biara mmbɛn,
Mma yɛmmfa emumuyɛ
Nngu W'ahentum ho fi.

MHB 886
9 . Though weak and wayward, still
Thy people, Lord, are we;
And for our God we will
None other have but Thee.
	         Amen.	 ~ 	9 
. Yɛyɛ mberɛw, tsew etua,
Naaso yɛyɛ Wodze;
Yɛnnkɛfrɛ 'biara dɛ

MHB 887
1 . GOD of our fathers, unto Thee
Our fathers cried in danger’s hour,
And then Thou gavest them to see
The acts of Thine almighty power.
They cried to Thee, and Thou didst hear;
They called on Thee, and Thou didst save;
And we their sons today draw near
Thy name to praise, Thy help to crave.
      Lord God of Hosts, uplift Thine hand,
       Protect and bless our fatherland.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN egyanom Nyame, Ɔwo na
Hɛn egyanom sui frɛɛ W' mbusu m',
Na Ɔwo maa wohun Wo tum nsa n'
N'anwanwandze a otum yɛ no.
Wosui tɔɔ Wo do, na itsiei;
Wɔfrɛɛ Wo, na egyee hɔn nkwa:
Ndɛ, hɔn mba so, yɛtwe bɛn Wo 
Yi Wo dzin ayɛw, serɛ Wo mboa.
     Dɔm Ewuradze, ma Wo nsa do,
     Bɔ hɛn man ho ban, hyira hɛn.
Nyina do wɔ wiadze nyina. Amen.

MHB 887
2 . Thine is the majesty, O Lord,
And Thine dominion over all;
When Thou commandest, at Thy word
Great kings and nations rise or fall.
For eastern realms, for western coasts,
For islands washed by every sea,
The praise be given, O God of hosts,
Not unto us, but unto Thee.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewuradze, ahentum n' Wodze a,
Na idzi ndzɛmba nyina do;
Sɛ Ɔwo ehyɛ a, ahemfo na
Aman soɛr anaa wɔhwe ase.
Ma boka nye anee nsupruw
Nyina so mbɔ m' ntow ayɛyi
Mma Wo, dɔm Nyankopɔn kunyin,
Nnyɛ hɛn bi à a na mbom Ɔwoara a.

MHB 887
3 . If in Thy grace Thou shouldst allow
Our fame to wax through coming days,
Still grant us humbly, then as now,
Thy help to crave, Thy Name to praise.
Not all alike in speech or birth,
Alike we bow before Thy throne;
One fatherland throughout the earth
Our Father’s noble acts we own.   Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Sɛ W'adom bɛma yɛahyerɛn
Wɔ ndaamba ber bi a ɔreba a,
Ɔno yɛserɛ Wo, boa hɛn
Ma yɛnhwehwɛ W' mboa, ntonton Wo:
Yɛnnsɛ wɔ kasa na awoo mu,
Mbom yɛbɔ m' som W'ahengua enyim,
Na hɛn Egya Ne nyɛe dzi hɛn

MHB 888
1 . O KING of kings, O Lord of hosts, whose throne is lifted high
Above the nations of the earth, the armies of the sky,
The spirits of perfected saints may give their nobler songs
And we, Thy children, worship Thee, to Whom all praise belongs.
	 ~ 	1 . O AHEMFO Hen na dɔm Wura a
W'ahengua Wɔ sorsor,
Na ɔtra asaase do aman nyina,
Ɔsor nsordaafo no,
Hɔn a woedzi mu n' hɔn esunsum
Na wotum tow Wo ndwom,
Na hɛn, Wo mba so yɛsom Wo a,
Ayɛyi nyina yɛ W'dze.
Da a ɔmmbɔ adze no mu.

MHB 888
2 . Thou who didst lead Thy people forth and make the captive free,
Hast drawn around our native land the curtain of the sea,
To make another holy place, where golden lamps should shine,
And human hearts keep loving watch around the ark divine.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔwo a edze Wo nkorɔfo fiir edzi
Na igyaa adaduafo;
Edze po ato hɛn asaase
Yi n'anaafo afamu ara,
Na ayɛ ha dɛ bea krɔnkrɔn,
Bea a sika nkanea hyerɛn,
Na nyimpa akoma dze dɔ weɔn
Apam adaka no.

MHB 888
3 . Thou Who hast sown the sky with stars, and set Thy thoughts in gold,
Hast crowned our nation’s life, and ours, with blessings manifold;
Thy mercies have been numberless; Thy love, Thy grace, Thy care,
Were wider than our utmost need, and higher than our prayer.      Amen.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔwo a edze nworaba apetse wimu,
Dze ada W'adwen edzi,
Na edze adom pii abɔ hɛn man
Yi abɔtsir mapa;
Wo mbɔbɔrhu, yenntum yɛnnkan!
Wo dɔ, W'adom, nhwɛdo;
'Yinom bor hɛn hia nyina do,
Ɔtra hɛn mpaabɔ mpo.

MHB 888
4 . O King of kings, O Lord of hosts, our fathers’ God and ours!
Be with us in the future years; and if the tempest lowers,
Look through the cloud with light of love, and smile our tears away
And lead us through the brightening years to Heaven’s eternal day.	 ~ 	4 
. O ahemfo Hen, dɔm Wura,
Egyaam na hɛn Nyame
Ka hɛn ho; na sɛ ehum bi
Rubotu hɛn ndaamba a,
Ma Wo dɔ n' nhwira mununkum n' mu,
Mpepa hɛn nyinsuwa,
Gya hɛn fa mber pa m' kɔ heaven

MHB 889
1 . GOD of our fathers, known of old,
Lord of our far-flung battle line,
Beneath whose awful hand we hold
Dominion over palm and pine
Lord God of Hosts, be with us yet,
Lest we forget—lest we forget!
	 ~ 	1 . EGYAAM Nyame a ifi tsetse,
Hɛn akodzi mpasuar do Sahen,
Wo tumdzi ase na yedzi nyim,
Eehum na aaham nyinara do;
Dɔm Ewuradze, ka hɛn ho,
Amma hɛn werɛ eemmfir da!
Ewuradze, dom hɛn tsia yinom.

MHB 889
2 . The tumult and the shouting dies;
The captains and the kings depart:
Still stands Thine ancient sacrifice,
A humble and a contrite heart.
Lord God of Hosts, be with us yet,
Lest we forget—lest we forget!
	 ~ 	2 
. Gyigyeegye na ntseamu n' bɔ adze,
Supifo na ahemfo no kɔ;
Wo tsetse afɔr no tsim hɔ,
Akoma a abobɔ na abotow.
Dɔm Ewuradze, ka hɛn ho,
Amma hɛn werɛ eemmfir da!

MHB 889
3 .  Far-called, our navies melt away;
On dune and headland sinks the fire:
Lo, all our pomp of yesterday
Is one with Nineveh and Tyre!
Judge of the Nations, spare us yet,
Lest we forget—lest we forget!
 	 ~ 	3 
. Hɛn nsordaafo kɔ akono
Kodum anhwea m' na akoko do gya;
Naaso hɛn ndeda hyerɛpɛɛ nyina
Tse dɛ Nineveh na Tyre dze n'!
Aman Tsɛmbuafo, fa kyɛ hɛn,
Amma hɛn werɛ eemmfir da!

MHB 889
4 . If, drunk with sight of power, we loose
Wild tongues that have not Thee in awe,
Such boastings as the Gentiles use,
Or lesser breeds without the Law
Lord God of Hosts, be with us yet,
Lest we forget—lest we forget!
	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ hɛn eyiedzi kɔ hɛn tsir mu,
Ma dɛm ntsi yɛhyɛ ase horan.
Dɛ mbrɛ ɔyɛ a aman nkaa no a,
Wɔnnto hɛn koraa mpo n' yɛ n';
Dɔm Ewuradze, ka hɛn ho,
Amma hɛn werɛ eemmfir da!

MHB 889
5 . For heathen heart that puts her trust
In reeking tube and iron shard,
All valiant dust that builds on dust,
And guarding, calls not Thee to guard,
For frantic boast and foolish word
Thy mercy on Thy people, Lord!   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Na abosonsɔr akoma a
Ɔtwer ndadze etur na nkrantsee,
Mbanyinndam hun a onntum nngyina,
Na ɔroweɔn a ɔmmfa Wo nnweɔn,
Ntuw gyangyan na nkwanseasɛm so -

MHB 89
1 . CHRIST, of all my hopes the ground,
Christ, the spring of all my joy,
Still in Thee may I be found,
Still for Thee my powers employ
	 ~ 	1 . CHRIST, m'enyidado fapem, 
Christ, me dɛw no nsubura,
Ma menda ho ntsena WO mu; 
Memfa m'ahoɔdzen nsom WO.

MHB 89
2 . Let Thy love my heart inflame,
Keep Thy fear before my sight,
Be Thy praise my highest aim,
Be Thy smile my chief delight,
	 ~ 	2 . Ma Wo dɔ n' ndzɛw m' akoma m', 
Fa Wo ho suro hyɛ mo mu;
W'ayɛyi nyɛ mo botae,
W'anoyerɛw nyɛ m'enyigye.

MHB 89
3 . When affliction clouds my sky,
And the wintry tempests blow,
Let Thy mercy-beaming eye
Sweetly cheer the night of woe.
	 ~ 	3 . 'Mandzehu ba m'akwan mu, 
Na ɔbra n'ehum tu me a,
Ma W'ehumbɔbɔr enyiwa n'
Nhyɛ me nkuran wɔ sum ber mu.

MHB 89
4 . When new triumphs of Thy name
Swell the raptured songs above,
May I feel a kindred flame,
Full of zeal, and full of love.
	 ~ 	4 . Konyimdzi fi Wo dzin m' ba
Bɛhyɛ sor dɛw ndwom no ma a, 
Ma mentse nka bi wɔ m' mu, 
Dwumadzi nye dɔ nhyɛ m' ma.

MHB 89
5 . Life’s best joy, to see Thy praise
Fly on wings of gospel light,
Leading on millennial days,
Scattering all the shades of night.
	 ~ 	5 . 'Bra ne dɛw, m'bɛkamfo Wo, 
Wo nsɛmpa bɛhyɛ m'ano; 
Wo kan no m'bɔsɔ n' daa nyina, 
Na m'botu sum ndwuma nyina.

MHB 89
6 . Fountain of o’erflowing grace,
Freely from Thy fullness give;
Till I close my earthly race,
May I prove it Christ to live.
	 ~ 	6 . Adom mbordo nsunyiwa, 
Ma minnya dza mihia kwa; 
Kɛpem mewie adasa bra n',
Menkyerɛ dɛ metse ma Christ.

MHB 89
7 . Firmly trusting in Thy blood,
Nothing shall my heart confound;
Safely shall I pass the flood,
Safely reach Immanuel’s ground.
	 ~ 	7 . Motwer Wo bɔgyaa n' ampa, 
Biribi nnkɛhaw m'akoma; 
M'botwa nsuyirii no sɔnn,
M'bodua 'Manuel bea n' do sɔnn.

MHB 89
8 . Thus, O thus, an entrance give
To the land of cloudless sky;
Having known it Christ to live,
Let me find it gain to die.	 ~ 	8 . Dɛm a, bue me abow no, 
Ma monkɔ kan bea no do;
Mehu dɛ m'tse ma Christ yi,
Munhu dɛ owu yɛ m' mfaso.  Amen.

MHB 890
1 . LIFT up your heads, ye mighty gates,
Behold, the King of Glory waits,
The King of kings is drawing near,
The Saviour of the world is here.
Life and salvation doth he bring,
Wherefore rejoice and gladly sing.
 We praise Thee, Father, now,
 Creator, wise art Thou!
 	 ~ 	1 . APONKƐSE, hom mbuebue yie,
Hom nhwɛ, enyimnyam Hen n' rotweɔn!
Ahemfo Hen no rotwe bɛn,
Wiadze Agyenkwa no wɔ ha;
Nkwa na nkwagye na ɔdze nam,
Ntsi hom ndzi dɛw na hom ntow ndwom.
Egya, yeyi W' ayɛw,
Bɔadze, nyansfo nye W'.
Na yɛdze ma Wo dzin.  Amen.

MHB 890
2 . The Lord is just, a helper tried,
Mercy is ever at His side;
His kindly crown is holiness;
His sceptre, pity in distress;
The end of all our woe He brings,
Wherefore the earth is glad and sings.
We praise Thee, Saviour, now,
Mighty in deed art Thou!
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewuradze yɛ pɛrpɛr boafo,
Ɔyɛ mbɔbɔrhu daa nyina,
Krɔnkrɔnyɛ nye N'ahenkyɛw daa,
Mbɔbɔrhu nye N'ahempoma
Ɔdze hɛn mbusu n'ewiei nam,
Ntsi wiadze dze enyigye tow ndwom,
Egya, yeyi W' ayɛw,
Ɔwo a eyɛ etumdze.

MHB 890
3 . O Blest the land, the city blest,
Where Christ the ruler is confest!
O happy hearts and happy homes,
To whom this King in triumph comes!
The cloudless Sun of joy He is,
Who bringeth pure delight and bliss.
O Comforter Divine,
 What boundless grace is Thine!
	 ~ 	3 
. O nhyira nye asaase na kurow a 
Wɔbɔ Ɔhen Christ no Ne dzin,
O siar nye akoma na fidua a
Dɛm konyimdzi Hen yi ba mu!
Ɔno nye dɛw, Ewia ketee a
Ɔdze enyigye mapa nam.
Sunsum Werɛkyekyefo,
W'adom dɔɔ sō, ampa.

MHB 890
4 . Fling wide the portals of your heart,
Make it a temple set apart
From earthly use, for heaven’s employ,
Adorned with prayer, and love, and joy;
So shall your Sovereign enter in,
And new and nobler life begin.
To Thee, O God, be praise,
For word and deed and grace.
	 ~ 	4 
. Bue w'akoma n' apon n' petee,
Yɛ n' asɔrfi a woeyi esi
Nkyɛn ama sor dwumadzi nko,
Na mpaabɔ, dɔ na dɛw aahyɛ n' ma;
Dɛm n' na Ɔwo Hen no bɛhɛn mu,
Na bra fofor kɛse aahyɛ ase.
Nyame, Ɔwo na ayɛyi 
Nka W' kasa na nyɛe mu.

MHB 890
5 . Redeemer, come, we open wide
Our heart to Thee; here, Lord, abide!
Thine inner presence let us feel,
Thy grace and love in us reveal,
Thy Holy Spirit guide us on,
Until the glorious goal is won.
Eternal praise and fame
We offer to Thy name.  Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Pomfo, bra, yebue hɛn akoma
Petee ma Wo dɛ tsena mu!
Ma yɛntse Wo nka dɛ ewɔ m';
Da W'adom dɔ n' edzi, hɛn mu,
Ma Wo Sunsum no ndzi hɛn kan,
Kesi dɛ yebenya botae n'.
Ayɛyi a ɔmmbɔ adze

MHB 891
1 . KING of the City Splendid,
Eternal in the height,
May all our country’s cities
be holy in Thy sight;
Cleansed from the deeds of darkness
Cities of light.
	 ~ 	1 . KUROW fɛɛfɛw no ne Hen,
Wimu man a otsim hɔ daa,
Nkyɛ hɛn nkurow nyina aayɛ
Krɔnkrɔn wɔ W'enyi do,
Wɔaasan efi sum ndwuma ho
Aayɛ kan nkurow!
Nyame wɔ hɔ!

MHB 891
2 . Teach love to gladden children
That know not childhood’s mirth,
Wronged of their rights—no beauty
In their scant reach of earth;
To hope’s large sunshine give them
A second birth.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Mbofra a wonnyi dɛw bi dzi n',
Kyerɛ dɔ fa ma hɔn;
Woeyiyi hɔn ndzinoa ntsi
Fɛw bi nnyi hɔ ma hɔn;
Wo hɔn fofor kɔ ndaamba
Enyidar n' ho.

MHB 891
3 . Lord, end the spell of passion,
Break Thou the drunkard’s lure:
Thou art the one Physician
The human heart to cure;
The wavering will to strengthen,
Foul life make pure.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma etutuwpɛ mbɔ adze,
Tu asabokwafo bɔr;
Ɔwo nye Duyɛfo kor a
Esa akoma yarba,
Ema adwen ntanta si pi,
Na etsen brafun.

MHB 891
4 . Give joy to all the joyless,
Song’s voice to sorrows dumb,
May light invade with blessing
Each dark and deathly slum;
Into earth’s realms of horror
Thy Kingdom come!
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma nkrumsifo nyina dɛw,
Na awerɛhofo ntow ndwom;
Ma kan nhyerɛn nsaaba biara a
Sum na wu ahyɛ hɔ mā n';
Ma W'ahendzi no nsian mbra
Bɔn mpasuar do.

MHB 891
5 . Soon may our country’s cities
Thy robe of glory wear;
Each place of toil a temple,
Each house a home of prayer;
Each city’s name of beauty
The Lord is there !	 ~ 	5 
. Mma ɔnnkyɛr na ma hɛn nkurow
Nhyɛ W'enyimnyam ntar no;
Ma edwumabea nyɛ asɔrfi,
Fie biara mpaabɔ fie;
Kurow biara nya ahoɔfɛw;

MHB 892
1 . ETERNAL Ruler of the ceaseless round
Of circling planets singing on their way;
Guide of the nations from the night profound
Into the glory of the perfect day;
Rule in our hearts, that we may ever be
Guided and strengthened and upheld by Thee.
 	 ~ 	1 . ONNYIEWIEI Nyame a idzi hen wimu na
Nsaase do, na wɔtow ndwom ma Wo daa,
Ɔwo a igya aman abamba fi sum
Kebii mu kɔ enyimnyam da kɛse n' mu;
Dzi hen hɛn akoma mu, ama yeenya
W'akwankyerɛ, W'ahoɔdzen na Wo mboa.
Dza ohia nye yebohu dɛ yɛsom Wo.

MHB 892
2 . We are of Thee, the children of Thy love,
The brothers of thy well-beloved Son;
Descend, O Holy Spirit, like a dove,
Into our hearts that we may be as one:
As one with thee, to whom we ever tend;
As one with him, our Brother and our Friend.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yefi Wo mu, Wo dɔ n' mu mba nye hɛn,
Na Wo dɔ Ba kortoo no No nuanom;
O Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, sian dɛ ebubur
Bra hɛn akoma mu, ama yaayɛ kor,
Dɛ mbrɛ yɛnye Wo a yɛhwɛ W' no yɛ no;
Na yɛnye hɛn Nua, hɛn Nyɛnko yɛ no.

MHB 892
3 . We would be one in hatred of all wrong,
One in our love of all things sweet and fair,
One with the joy that breaketh into song,
One with the grief that trembles into prayer,
One in the power that makes Thy children free
To follow truth, and thus to follow thee.
	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛbɛyɛ kor ako etsia bɔn nyina,
Ayɛ kor dɔ m' wɔ dza oye nyina ho;
Ayɛ kor wɔ dɛw a ɔma adwontow mu,
Ayɛ kor wɔ nkrum a ɔba mpaabɔ mu,
Ayɛ kor wɔ tum a ɔma adehyehyɛ m',
Ma yeetsin nokwar do, eedzi W'ekyir.

MHB 892
4 . O clothe us with Thy heavenly armour, Lord,
Thy trusty shield, Thy sword of love divine;
Our inspiration be Thy constant word;
We ask no victories that are not Thine:
Give or withhold, let pain or pleasure be;
Enough to know that we are serving Thee.	 ~ 	4 
. Ewuradze, fa W'sor akodze hyɛ hɛn,
Nye kyɛm na Sunsum dɔ nkrantsee no so;
Ma W'asɛm no nnunu hɛn 'ber nyina;
Yɛnnserɛ konyimdzi biara a ommfir Wo,
Ma hɛn, fa kam hɛn; ma dɛw anaa yaw;

MHB 893
1 . O YE who taste that love is sweet,
Set waymarks for all doubtful feet 
That stumble on in search of it.
 	 ~ 	1 . O HOM a hom ehu dɛ dɔ yɛ dɛw,
Hom nyɛ akwankyerɛ mma 'kyingyefo a
Wofintsiw kwan do hwehwɛ dɔ n'.
Aahyerɛn na wɔabɔdɔm hom.

MHB 893
2 . Sing notes of love : that some who hear
Far off, inert, may lend an ear,
Rise up and wonder and draw near.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hom ntow dɔ ho ndwom ama nyia
Ɔbɛtse n' ekyirekyir n' eetsie,
Aasoɛr, aadwendwen, aatwe abɛn.

MHB 893
3 . Lead lives of love ; that others who
Behold your life may kindle too
With love, and cast their lot with you.	 ~ 	3 
. Hom mbɔ dɔ ho bra, daa ma hɔn a
Wohu hom bra n' hɔn so dze dɔ

MHB 894
1 . FATHER, who on man dost shower
Gifts of plenty from Thy dower,
To Thy people give the power
All Thy gifts to use aright.
	 ~ 	1 . EGYA a ihue akyɛdze pii
Fi W'akorae ma nyimpa mba,
Ma Wo nkorɔfo tum amma
Wɔannsɛɛ W'akyɛdze no kwa.
Nyame Egya kɛse, tsie hɛn.   Amen.

MHB 894
2 . Give pure happiness in leisure,
Temperance in every pleasure,
Holy use of earthly treasure,
Bodies clear and spirits bright.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma enyigye pa ahomgye mu,
Ahohyɛdo wɔ enyigye m'
Yɛmfa ha ndzɛmba nyɛ papa,
Hɛn ho ntsew, hɛn sunsum nhyerɛn.

MHB 894
3 . Lift from this and every nation
All that brings us degradation;
Quell the forces of temptation;
Put Thine enemies to flight.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Yi dza ɔsan hɛn adze fi
Ɔman yi nye aman nyina mu;
Dwedwe nsɔhwɛ no bɔr ano,
Ma W'atamfo mfi hɔ nguan.

MHB 894
4 . Be with us, Thy strength supplying,
That with energy undying,
Every foe of man defying,
We may rally to the fight.
	 ~ 	4 
. Kā hɛn ho, ma hɛn W'ahoɔdzen,
Ama yɛdze ahoɔdzen a ɔnnsā 
Eehyia hɛn atamfo biara
Na yeegyina kō no mu.

MHB 894
5 . Thou Who art our Captain ever,
Lead us on to great endeavour;
May Thy Church the world deliver:
Give us wisdom, courage, might.
 	 ~ 	5 
. Ɔwo a eyɛ hɛn Sahen daa,
Dzi hɛn enyim wɔ nkodzen mu,
Ma W'Asɔr ngye wiadze nsi hɔ;
Ma hɛn nyansa na ahoɔdzen.

MHB 894
6 . Father, who has sought and found us,
Son of God, whose love has bound us,
Holy Ghost, within us, round us 
Hear us, Godhead infinite.  Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Egya a ahwehwɛ hɛn ehu hɛn,
Nyame Ba a Wo dɔ akyekyer hɛn,
Sunsum a ewɔ hɛn mu, hɛn nkyɛn,

MHB 895
1 . WHERE cross the crowded ways of life,
Where sound the cries of race and clan
Above the noise of selfish strife,
We hear Thy voice, O Son of Man.
	 ~ 	1 . BEEBI a ɔbra akwan hyia,
Beebi a nyimpa horow sū,
Adasa gyigyeegye nyina m'
Yɛtse Wo ndze, O Nyimpa Ba.
So nam enyimnyam mu aba.

MHB 895
2 .  In haunts of wretchedness and need,
On shadowed thresholds dark with fears,
From paths where hide the lures of greed,
We catch the vision of Thy tears.
	 ~ 	2 
. Mbɔbɔrwa na ohia mpasuar do,
Sum akwan a suro wɔ do,
Akwan a emim etsim do,
Mbea yi na yehu Wo nyinsu.

MHB 895
3 . From tender childhood’s helplessness,
From woman’s grief, man’s burdened toil,
From famished souls, from sorrow’s stress,
Thy heart has never known recoil.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mbofraber mberɛwyɛ nyina m'
Mbaa su, na mbanyin fona mu,
Nye akra a wɔato bahaw so,
W'akoma mmfii yinom ho da.

MHB 895
4 . The cup of water given for Thee,
Still holds the freshness of Thy grace;
Yet long these multitudes to see
The sweet compassion of Thy face.
	 ~ 	4 
. Nsu a wɔdze ma wɔ Wo dzin mu,
Da W'adom no foforyɛ edzi;
Naaso dɔmpepe rohwehwɛ
W'enyim fɛɛfɛw noara ahwɛ.

MHB 895
5 . O Master, from the mountainside
Make haste to heal these hearts of pain;
Among these restless throngs abide;
O tread the city’s streets again.
	 ~ 	5 
. O hɛn Wura, fi bepɔw n' do
Ntsɛmara bɛsa 'yinom yar;
Bɛnye ahoperfo yi ntsena,
Bɛnantsew hɛn abrɔn mu bio.

MHB 895
6 . Till sons of men shall learn Thy love
And follow where Thy feet have trod,
Till, glorious from Thy Heaven above,
Shall come the city of our God.	 ~ 	6 
. Kesi dɛ yebosua Wo dɔ n',
Na yeedzi W'ekyir W'akwan do,
Na hɛn Nyankopɔn Kurow no

MHB 896
1 . NOW praise we great and famous men ,
The fathers named in story;
And praise the Lord who now as then ,
Reveals in man His glory.
	 ~ 	1 . AFEI yeyi ekunyin ayɛw,
Egyanom a wɔgyee hɔn dzin;
Na yɛkamfo Ewuradze no a
Ɔkyerɛ N'enyimnyam nyimpa m'.
Ɔkyerɛ N'enyimnyam nyimpa m'.

MHB 896
2 . Praise we the wise and brave and strong,
Who graced their generation; 
Who helped the right. and fought the wrong,
And made our folk a nation.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛkamfo enyansafo nà abràn a,
Wɔhyɛɛ hɔn dɔm enyimnyam;
Woyinom boaa ndzepa, tsiaa bɔn,
Dze maa nkorɔfo yɛɛ ɔman.

MHB 896
3 . Praise we the great of heart and mind,
The singers sweetly gifted.
Whose music like a mighty wind
The souls of men uplifted.
	 ~ 	3 
. Yeyi ekunyin nyinara
Na adwontofo so ayɛw;
Hɔn ndwom pegyaa akra kɔr sorsor,
Tse dɛ mframa dzendzen bi.

MHB 896
4 . Praise we the peaceful men of skill
Who builded homes of beauty,
And, rich in art, made richer still
The brotherhood of duty.
	 ~ 	4 
. Yeyi edwimfo a wosisii
Adan fɛɛfɛw so ayɛw,
Wodzii edwin mapa, nam dɛm
Kaa edwumayɛfo bɔɔ mu.

MHB 896
5 . Praise we the glorious names we know;
And they-whose names have perished,
Lost in the haze of long ago
In silent love be cherished.
	 ~ 	5 
. Yehuhor edzin a yɛkaa,
Na hɔn a ɔnam mber ntsi
Yenntum nnkaa hɔn no so nyina,
Yembu hɔn ɔdɔ kɛse mu.

MHB 896
6 . In peace their sacred ashes rest,
Fulfilled their day’s endeavour;
They blest the earth, and they are blest
Of God and man, for ever.
	 ~ 	6 
. Hɔn mbiew rohom asomdwee mu,
Woewie hɔn edwuma yɛ;
Wohyiraa asaase wɔ hɔn bra m',
Nyame na adasa ehyira hɔn.

MHB 896
7 . So praise we great and famous men,
The fathers, named in story,
And praise the Lord who now as then,
Reveals in man His glory.	 ~ 	7 
. Dɛm ntsi yeyi ekunyin ayɛw,
Egyanom a wɔgyee hɔn dzin;
Na yɛkamfo Ewuradze no a

MHB 897
1 . WHAT service shall we render thee
O Fatherland we love?
What gift of hand, or heart, or brain
May our devotion prove?
The coming age invokes our aid,
Thy voice of old inspires;
Shall we, thy sons and daughter, be
Less worthy than our sires?
	 ~ 	1 . YENSI dɛn nsom wo yie papa,
Hɛn Awobea a yɛdɔ wo?
'Bɛn na hɛn nsa, akoma na adwen
Bɛyɛ akyerɛ hɛn dɔ?
Ndaamba regye hɛn mboa daa daa,
Wo tsetse ndze n' pia hɛn;
Ana hɛn Wo mba nye mbabaa
Nnkɛfata dɛ hɛn egyaam?
Ɔkyekyer aman nyina.

MHB 897
2 . The service of the commonwealth
Is not in arms alone;
A nobler chivalry shall rise
That war has ever known;
Glad rivalries in arts of peace,
True ministries of life,
Shall supersede the arts of war
And calm our feverish strife.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nnyɛ akodzi nko na yɛnam do
Som anyɛnkoyɛman no;
Akodzi a ɔkrɔn kɛse kyɛn dza
Yenyim n' sesei bɛba;
Asomdwee ho ndwuma m' empiresi,
'Brabɔ m' nyimpa ho som
Yinom bɛhyɛ akodzi anan mu,
Adwedwe hɛn aperdzi.

MHB 897
3 . Too long the pagan rule of force
Has held the world in thrall,
Too long the clash of arms has drowned
The higher human call.
O comrades, seek a nobler quest!
O keep a worthier tryst!
The laws of hate have had their day;
Proclaim the laws of Christ!
	 ~ 	3 
. Mber tsentsen na bɔn tum afa
Wiadze nyina ndɔmmum,
Mber tsentsen na akodzi amen
Dasanyi n' frɛ a mu dɔ.
O m'afɛ, hom nhwehwɛ dza ɔkrɔn!
Hom mfua dza ɔsom bo m'!
Ɔtan ne mber etwa mu kɔ:
Hom mbɔ Christ mbra dawur.

MHB 897
4 . Lord of the nations, far and near,
Send forth Thy quickening breath,
Equip us for the tasks of life,
Save us from deeds of death:
Enlist us in Thy ranks to fight
Fair freedom’s holy war,
Whose battle-cry is Brotherhood,
Far-flung from shore to shore.	 ~ 	4 
. Aman nyina Ewuradze, soma
Wo nkwa mframa n' sesei,
Siesie hɛn ma nkwa ho ndwuma,
Gye hɛn fi owu ndwuma m';
Fa hɛn ka W'akodɔm no ho,
Yɛnko nyɛ adehye,
Akofrɛ no nye Enuadɔ a

MHB 898
1 . ONCE to every man and nation,
comes the moment to decide,
In the strife of truth with falsehood,
for the good or evil side;
Some great cause, some great decision,
offering each the bloom or blight,
And the choice goes by forever,
’Twixt that darkness and that light.
 	 ~ 	1 . BER wɔ hɔ ma nyimpa na aman
Dɛ wɔfa adwen pa bi,
Wɔ nokwar na ator akodzi n' mu,
Dɛ wɔfa papa anaa bɔn;
Nyankopɔn Ne Christ no, anaa
Apam bi a ɔkyerɛ siar anaa ndom;
Na sum anaa kan n' ne nyii no a
Otwa mu a, ɔnnsan mmba bio da.
Rohwɛ Nankasa N' dze do.

MHB 898
2 . Then to side with truth is noble,
When we share her wretched crust,
Ere her cause bring fame and profit,
And ’tis prosperous to be just;
Then it is the brave man chooses ,
While the coward stands aside,
Till the multitude make virtue
Of the faith they had denied.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ yɛgye nokwar nwen no
Ber a yennhun ne nhyira a,
Na yebohu siar a ɔdze nam,
Na pɛrpɛr mu prɔmprɔmyɛ;
Ber n' na ɔkatakyi bɛyɛ adwen
Na okotoo begyina nkyɛn,
Kesi dɛ ɔdodow n' bohu dɛ
Gyedzi a wɔapow no ho hia.

MHB 898
3 . By the light of burning martyrs,
Christ, Thy bleeding feet we track
Toiling up new Calvaries ever
With the cross that turns not back,
New occasions teach new duties;
Time makes ancient good uncouth,
They must upward still and onward,
Who would keep abreast of truth.
	 ~ 	3 
. Atɔfo a wɔrehyew hɔn kan n' m',
Christ, yehu W' bɔgyaa anamɔn
Dɛ ɔdze mbeamudua pii rotow
Kɔ kan ridzi ako daa.
Mber fofor kyerɛ asodzi fofor,
Mber sɛɛ dza wɔagye ato mu,
Na hɔn a wɔnye nokwar besian n'
Wɔ dɛ wɔtow kɔ kan daa.

MHB 898
4 . Though the cause of evil prosper,
Yet the truth alone is strong;
Though her portion be the scaffold,
And upon the throne be wrong;
Yet that scaffold sways the future,
And behind the dim unknown,
Standeth God within the shadow,
Keeping watch above His own.	 ~ 	4 
. Bɔn ne pɛ bɛyɛ prɔmprɔm dze,
Naaso nokwar na otsim;
Kaansa ne kyɛfa nye ɔsɛntwer,
Na bɔn tse ahengua do mpo a,
Ɔsɛntwer n' bɔwosow ndaamba,
Nyame so wɔ sum n' ekyir
Rohwɛ dza yennyim nyina mu,

MHB 899
1 . LAND of our Birth, we pledge to thee
Our love and toil in the years to be;
when we are grown, and take our
 As men and women With our race.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN Awobea, yɛdze hɛn dɔ
Na berɛ sua ma wo ber nyina;
Ber a yeenyin na yeesi do
Dɛ mbanyin na mbaa wɔ hɛn man m'.
Sua ma wo mbersantsen nyina.

MHB 899
2 . Father in heaven, Who lovest all,
O help Thy children When they call;
That they may build from age to age,
An undefiled heritage.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn sor Egya a edɔ obiara,
O boa Wo mba ber a wɔfrɛ;
Ma wɔaakyekyer ɔman krɔnkrɔn
Wɔ mbersantsen nyinara mu.

MHB 899
3 . Teach us to bear the yoke in youth,
With steadfastness and careful truth;
That, in our time, Thy grace may give 
The truth whereby the nations live.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Kyerɛ hɛn yɛnsoa kɔndua n' mbabun m',
Yɛmfa mbɔdzembɔ, nokwardzi;
Ma hɛn ber mu aadom Wo nkowaa
Nokwar a ɔma aman gyina.

MHB 899
4 . Teach us to rule ourselves alway,
Controlled and cleanly night and day;
That we may bring, if need arise,
No  maimed or worthless sacrifice.
	 ~ 	4 
. Kyerɛ hɛn ma yendzi hɛnho do,
'Hohyɛdo na ahotsew m' ber nyina,
Ma yɛdze enyikan afɔrbɔ
Eepue W'enyim ber a ɔsɛ mu.

MHB 899
5 . Teach us to look, in all our ends,
On Thee for Judge, and not our friends;
That we, with Thee, may walk uncowed
By fear or favour of the crowd.
	 ~ 	5 
. Kyerɛ hɛn ma nyina m' yɛnhwɛ Wo
Dɛ Tsɛmbuafo, na nnyɛ nyimpa a,
Ama yɛnye Wo aanantsew a
Yenkosuro nyimpa, nnhwɛ hɔn enyim.

MHB 899
6 . Teach us the strength that cannot seek,
By deed or thought, to hurt the weak;
That, under Thee, we may possess
Man’s strength to succour man’s distress.
	 ~ 	6 
. Kyerɛ hɛn ahoɔdzen a wɔmmfa nnsisi
'Bɔbɔfo, wɔ ndzeyɛɛ na adwen m',
Ama yɛhyɛ W'ase n' yeenya
Mbanyinndam dze ahyɛ nyimpa ma.

MHB 899
7 . Teach us delight in simple things,
And mirth that has no bitter springs;
Forgiveness free of evil done,
And love to all men ’neath the sun
	 ~ 	7 
. Ma hɛn enyi ngye ndzɛmba nkumaa ho,
Ndzi dɛw a ommfi binom yaw mu,
Yɛmfa hɛn mfom nkyekyɛ hɛnho,
Na yɛndɔ adasamba nyina!

MHB 899
8 . Land of our Birth, our faith, our Pride,
For Whose dear sake our fathers died;
O Motherland, we pledge to thee,
 Head , heart, and hand through the years to be.	 ~ 	8 
. Hɛn Awobea, yɛdze wo tuw;
Wo yieyɛ ntsi na hɛn egyaam wui;
Yɛdze hɛn tsir, akoma, nsa,

MHB 9
1 . O WORSHIP the Lord in the beauty of holiness! 
Bow down before him, His glory proclaim; 
With gold of obedience and incense of lowliness, 
Kneel and adore Him: the Lord is His name.
	 ~ 	1 . O SƆR Ewuradze wɔ krɔnkrɔnyɛ fɛɛfɛw mu
Kotow N'enyim, bɔ N'enyimnyam dawur; 
Fa setsie mapa ɔnye mbrɛhoadze huanhuam,
Kotow huhor No, Ne dzin nye Ewuradze.

MHB 9
2 . Low at His feet lay thy burden of carefulness, 
High on His heart He will bear it for thee, 
Comfort thy sorrows, and answer thy prayerfulness, 
Guiding thy steps as may best for thee be.
	 ~ 	2 . Fa w'adwendwen adzesoa to N'ananadze, 
Ɔbɔsoa ama wo wɔ N'akoma mu,
Ɔbɛkyekye wo werɛ, na oetsie wo mpaabɔ, 
Na oegya w' taataa dɛ.mbrɛ oye ma w'.

MHB 9
3 . Fear not to enter His courts in the slenderness 
Of the poor wealth thou wouldst reckon as Thine: 
Truth in its beauty, and love in its tenderness: 
These are the offerings to lay on His shrine.
	 ~ 	3 . Mma nnsuro dɛ ebɛhɛn N'abangua do hɔ, 
Dɛ ahodze a ewɔ no suar ntsi:
Afɔrbɔdze a wɔdze gu N'afɔrmbukyia do 
Nye nokwar fɛɛfɛw na ɔdɔ mapa.

MHB 9
4 . These, though we bring them in trembling and fearfulness, 
He will accept for the name that is dear; 
Mornings of joy give for evenings of tearfulness, 
Trust for our trembling, and hope for our fear.
	 ~ 	4 . Yinom, sɛ yɛdze ba suro na ahopopo m' mpo a, 
Ɔbɛgye wɔ dzin a ɔsorn bo no ntsi; 
Ɔbɛpepa hɛn nyinsu, ɔama yeedzi dɛw, 
Oetu hɛn suro, ɔarna hɛn awerɛhyɛm'.

MHB 9
5 . O worship the Lord in the beauty of holiness! 
Bow down before Him, His glory proclaim; 
With gold of obedience and incense of lowliness, 
Kneel and adore Him, the Lord is His name.
		Amen.	 ~ 	5 . O sɔr Ewuradze wɔ krɔnkrɔnyɛ fɛɛfɛw mu!
Kotow N'enyim, bɔ N'enyimnyam dawur;
Fa setsie mapa ɔnye mbrɛhoadze huanhuam,
Kotow huhor No, Ne dzin nye Ewuradze.
Amen.

MHB 90
1 . OBJECT of my first desire,
Jesus, crucified for me;
All to happiness aspire,
Only to be found in Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . M'APƐDZE a odzi kan,
Jesus a owui maa me;
Enyigye a mohwehwɛ, 
Wo mu nko na mubohu.

MHB 90
2 . Thee to praise, and Thee to know, 
Constitute our bliss below;
Thee to see, and Thee to love,
Constitute our bliss above.
	 ~ 	2 . M'beyi W' ayɛw, m'bohu Wo,
Ɔno nye me nhyira wɔ ha;
M'bohu Wo na madɔ Wo,
Ɔnyɛ me nhyira wɔ sor.

MHB 90
3 . Lord, it is not life to live,
If Thy presence Thou deny;
Lord, if Thou Thy presence give,
’Tis no longer death  to die.
	 ~ 	3 . Ewuradze mohwer Wo a,
M'abrabɔ rinnkesi hwee, 
Ewuradze, sɛ minya Wo a,
Minyim dɛ munnkowu da.

MHB 90
4 . Source and giver of repose,
Singly from Thy smile it flows,
Peace and happiness are Thine;
Mine they are, if Thou art mine
	 ~ 	4 . Ahomgye nyina Mafo,
Ofi Wo serew mu nko, 
Asomdwee na dɛw fir Wo;
Minya Wo a, 'bɛyɛ medze.

MHB 90
5 . Let me but Thyself possess -
Total sum of happiness - 
Real bliss I then shall prove,
Heaven below and heaven above. Amen.	 ~ 	5 . Meserɛ Wo, ma minnya Wo;
Ɔwo nye enyigye nyina;
Mibenya enyigye mapa,
Wɔ asaase ha na sor. Amen.

MHB 900
1 . I VOW to thee, my country, all earthly things above,
entire and whole and perfect, the service of my love:
the love that asks no question, the love that stands the test,
that lays upon the altar the dearest and the best;
the love that never falters, the love that pays the price,
the love that makes undaunted the final sacrifice.
	 ~ 	1 . ME man, medze famu ha ndzɛmba a odzi mu na ɔkrɔn
No mu tsitsir kɛse a ɔyɛ mo dɔ som hyɛ wo bɔ,
Ɔdɔ a ɔnnyɛ nyiyiano, na ɔsɔw nsɔhwɛ nyina,
Na ɔdze dza ɔsom bo na oye nko bɔ afɔr,
Ɔdɔ a ɔmmpa ara da, ɔdɔ a otua kaw nyina,
Ɔdɔ a onnsuro dɛ ɔdze noho botwa akyer mpo.
No suban nye botooyɛ, n'akwan yɛ asomdwee.

MHB 900
2 . And there’s another country, I’ve heard of long ago,
Most dear to them that love her, most great to them that know;
We may not count her armies, we may not see her King;
Her fortress is a faithful heart, her pride is suffering;
And soul by soul and silently her shining bounds increase,
And her ways are ways of gentleness and all her her paths are peace.	 ~ 	2 
. Na ɔman kor bi so wɔ hɔ a matse nka dada,
Ɔsom bo kɛse ma n'adɔfo, na afei ɔso;
Yɛnnkɛkan n'akofo, na yennkohu ne Hen da;
N'akoban nye nokwar akoma, ne dɛw nye ɔhaw;
Na nkakrankakra, wɔ kommyɛ mu, ne mamfoe dɔr,

MHB 901
1  . GOD the all-terrible! King, who ordainest
Great winds thy clarions, the lightnings thy sword,
Show forth thy pity on high where thou reignest:
Give to us peace in our time, O Lord;
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME a Wo ho yɛ hu! Ɔhen a ehyɛ ma
Ehum yɛ W' mbɛn, na enyinam Wo nkrantsee;
Fi sor W'ahendzi bea kyerɛ ayamuhyehye,
Ewuradze, ma hɛn asomdwee hɛn ber m'.
'Somdwee nka aman, 'yɛyi nka Ewuradze.

MHB 901
2 . God the All –merciful! Earth hath forsaken
Thy  way of blessedness, slighted Thy word;
Bid not Thy wrath in its terrors awaken;
Give to us peace in our time, O Lord.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nyame a eyɛ tsimbɔbɔr! Wiadze apow
Wo siar kwan n', etsiatsia W'asɛm no do;
Mma mma W'ebufuw huuhu no nnosɛr hɛn do,
Ewuradze, ma hɛn asomdwee hɛn ber m'.

MHB 901
3 . God the All-righteous One! Man hath defled Thee;
Yet to eternity standeth Thy word;
Falsehood and wrong shall not tarry beside Thee;
Give to us peace in our time, O Lord.
	 ~ 	3 
. Tsenenee Nyame! Yeehur Wo bo kɛse,
Naaso W'asɛm tsim hɔ kesi daapem;
Ator na mfom nnkotum atsena Wo nkyɛn;
Ewuradze, ma hɛn asomdwee hɛn ber m'.

MHB 901
4 . God All-wise! By the fire of Thy chastening,
Earth shall to freedom and truth be restored;
Through the thick darkness Thy Kingdom is hastening;
Thou wilt give peace in Thy time, O Lord.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Nyansabuakwa Nyame! W'enyimka n' ne gya m'
Wiadze bedzi n' ho do; nokwar etsim,
W'ahendzi no nam sum kebii mu rebɛn;
Ewuradze bɛma asomdwee ber yi m'.

MHB 901
5 . So shall Thy children in thankful devotion
Laud Him who saved them from peril abhorred,
Singing in chorus from ocean to ocean:
Peace to the nations and praise to the Lord	 ~ 	5 
. Dɛm no na Wo mbofra dze ɔsom ndaase
Bɛma Nyia ɔgyee hɔn fii mbusu mu n',
Wɔbɔtow ndwom fi mpoano kesi mpoano,

MHB 902
1 . ALL glory to God in the sky,
And peace upon earth be restored!
O Jesus, exalted on high,
Appear our omnipotent Lord!
Who, meanly in Bethlehem born,
Didst stoop to redeem a lost race,
Once more to thy creatures return,
And reign in thy kingdom of grace.
	 ~ 	1 . ENYIMNYAM nka Nyame wɔ wimu,
Na asomdwee ntsim wɔ asaase do!
O Jesus Wo a wɔakrɔn Wo sor,
Bra bɛyɛ hɛn Wura tumfo!
'Wo a wɔwoo W'hianyi Bethlehem,
Na 'gyee wiadze a ɔayew no nkwa,
O san bra W'abɔdze nkyɛn bio;
Dzi hen W'adom ahenman n' mu.
Na wentwiwentwi nnkɛhaw hɛn.

MHB 902
2 .  When Thou in our flesh didst appear,
All nature acknowledged thy birth;
Arose the acceptable year,
And heaven was opened on earth;
Receiving its Lord from above,
The world was united to bless
The giver of concord and love,
The Prince and the author of peace.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ebaa nyimpa honandua mu n',
Abɔdze nyina peen W'awoo do;
Enyisɔ afe no nyae bae,
Na heaven so buei ma asaase;
Wiadze a oenya no sor Wura n'
Dze adwensaa kor bɔɔ mu tontoon
Amandwee na dɔ Mafo no,
Asomdwee Wura nye Ɔhen no.

MHB 902
3 . O wouldst thou again be made known!
Again in thy Spirit descend,
And set up in each of Thine own
A kingdom that never shall end.
Thou only art able to bless,
And make the glad nations obey,
And bid the dire enmity cease,
And bow the whole world to thy sway.
	 ~ 	3 
. O nkyɛ wɔama woeehu Wo bio!
Sian wɔ Wo Sunsum su n' mu bio,
Na bɛkyekyer wɔ W'akowaa
Biara m' onnyiewiei ahenman;
Wo nkotoo na itum hyira
Na ema siar aman tsie Wo,
Na ema ɔtan bɔ adze,
Na ema wiadze dzi W'ekyir.

MHB 902
4 . Come then to thy servants again,
Who long thy appearing to know;
Thy quiet and peaceable reign
In mercy establish below;
All sorrow before thee shall fly,
And anger and hatred be o’er,
And envy and malice shall die,
And discord afflict us no more.	 ~ 	4 
. Ntsi bra Wo nkowaa a wɔrepɛ
Ehu Wo mbae no hɔn nkyɛn bio,
Dua mbɔbɔrhu do fa kyekyer
Wo kommyɛ asomdwee man no;
Awerɛhow boguan W'enyim,
Na ebufuw na tan abɔ adze;
Enyiber na adwembɔn bowu,

MHB 903
1 . O GOD of love, O King of peace,
Make wars throughout the world to cease;
The wrath of sinful man restrain:
Give peace, O God, give peace again.
	 ~ 	1 . O ƆDƆ Nyame, 'somdwee Hen,
Ma ko mbɔ adze wiadze nyina:
Siw nyimpa bɔn ebufuw kwan,
O Nyankopɔn, ma asomdwee bio.
O Nyankopɔn, ma asomdwee bio.

MHB 903
2 . Remember, Lord, thy works of old,
The wonders that our fathers told;
Remember not our sin’s dark stain:
Give peace, O God, give peace again.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewuradze, kaa Wo tsetse ndwuma n',
Anwanwadze a hɛn egyaam kae n',
Mma nnkaa hɛn bɔn ne nkekaawa n',
O Nyankopɔn, ma asomdwee bio.

MHB 903
3 . Whom shall we trust but thee, O Lord?
Where rest but on thy faithful word?
None ever called on thee in vain:
Give peace, O God, give peace again.
	 ~ 	3 
. Woana na yɛngye n' ndzi dɛ Ɔwo?
Yɛntwer ebɛn dɛ Wo nokwasɛm n'?
Obi mmfrɛɛ Wo nngyinaa gyan da;
O Nyankopɔn, ma asomdwee bio.

MHB 903
4 . Where saints and angels dwell above,
All hearts are knit in holy love;
O bind us in that heavenly chain:
Give peace, O God, give peace again.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Bea a 'hotsewfo na abɔfo wɔ n',
Akoma nyina bɔ mu wɔ dɔ m';
Fa sor nkyehoma n' ka hɛn bɔ m',

MHB 904
1 . BEHOLD, the mountain of the Lord
In latter days shall rise
On mountain-tops, above the hills,
And draw the wondering eyes.
 	 ~ 	1 . HOM nhwɛ, Ewuradze bepɔw no
Bɔkrɔn ekyir nda n' mu
Akyɛn akoko no nyina,
Na nkorɔfo ahwɛ.

MHB 904
2 . To this the joyful nations round,
All tribes and tongues, shall flow;
Up to the hill of God, they’ll say,
And to his house, we’ll go.
	 ~ 	2 
. Aman nye kasa horow pii
Dze dɛw bɛpem akɔ
Nyame bepɔw n' do ase dɛ,
Ne fie na yɛbɔkɔ.

MHB 904
3 . The beam that shines from Zion’s hill
Shall lighten every land;
The King who reigns in Salem’s towers
Shall all the world command.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Kan a ofi Zion bepɔw do n'
Bɛhyerɛn aman nyina pii do;
Nyia odzi hen wɔ Salem 'bansor n'
Bɛyɛ aman nyina Hen.

MHB 904
4 . Among the nations He shall judge;
His judgements truth shall guide;
His sceptre shall protect the just,
And quell the sinner’s pride.
	 ~ 	4 
. Obobu aman ntamu atsɛn,
Nokwar bɛkyerɛ no kwan,
N'ahempoma bɛma bambɔ,
Esi ɔbɔn no mpa.

MHB 904
5 . No strife shall rage, nor hostile feuds 
Or mar the peaceful years;
To ploughshares men shall beat their swords,
To pruning-hooks their spears.
	 ~ 	5 
. Aperdzi na manso biara
Nnkɛba asomdwee ber no m',
Wɔdze hɔn nkrantsee bɔbɔ nsɔw,
Na mpeaa so ayɛ ndar.

MHB 904
6 . No longer hosts, encountering hosts,
Shall crowds of slain deplore;
They hang the trumpet in the hall,
And study war no more.
	 ~ 	6 
. Akodɔm nnkehyia akodɔm bi,
Na asafo dɔm nnkɔtɔr;
Wɔdze akobɛn bɛsɛn ban ho,
Wonnkosua akodzi bio.

MHB 904
7 .  Come then, O house of Jacob, come
To worship at His shrine;
And, walking in the light of God,
With holy beauties shine.	 ~ 	7 
. Afei Jacob fifo, hom mbra
Mbɔsom N' krɔnkrɔn-bea do,
Na hom nam Nyame kan no mu n',
Hom ahyerɛn ahoɔfɛw mu.

MHB 905
1 . Ring out the grief that saps the mind,
For those that here we see no more,
Ring out the feud of rich and poor,
Ring in redress to all mankind.
 	 ~ 	1 
. Hom nhotse nkrumsi nyina ngu,
Hom nwosow mma ewuakɔr so;
Hom nwosow ntu hia ne haw nkɔ,
Hom nwosow mfrɛ dɛw mma adasa.
Hom nwosow mma Christ a ɔreba n'.

MHB 905
2 . Ring out a slowly dying cause,
And ancient forms of party strife;
Ring in the nobler modes of life,
With sweeter manners, purer laws.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Hom nhotse dza etwa mu ngu,
Nye tsetse aperdzi nyina;
Hom nwosow mfrɛ abrabɔ ho siar,
Ndzeyɛɛ pa, nye ɔbra pa a odzi mu.

MHB 905
3 . Ring out false pride in place and blood,
The civic slander and the spite;
Ring in the love of truth and right,
Ring in the common love of good.
	 ~ 	3 
. Hom nwosow ntu guasohantan
Nye dza ɔhyɛ fɛr nyina so;
Hom nwosow mfrɛ ɔdɔ nokwar a ɔtsen,
Hom nwosow ma yie ho dɔ mbra.

MHB 905
4 . Ring out old shapes of foul disease,
Ring out the narrowing lust of gold;
Ring out the thousand wars of old,
Ring in the thousand years of peace.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Hom nhotse koannkɔ yar mfi hɔ,
Nye sikanyiber nyina so!
Hom nhotse ntokwaw dadaw n' gu,
Hom nwosow mfrɛ mfe apem asomdwee.

MHB 905
5 . Ring in the valiant man and free,
The larger heart, the kindlier hand;
Ring out the darkness of the land,
Ring in the Christ that is to be.  	 ~ 	5 
. Hom nwosow mfrɛ adehye abran
Nye ebirɛmpɔn na ayamuyiefo;
Hom nwosow ntu hɛn man no sum,

MHB 905
7    RING out, wild bells, to the wild sky,
   The flying cloud, the frosty light;
   The year is dying in the night;
   Ring out, wild bells, and let him die.
	 ~ 	7 NDƆMBA, hom nwosow ngu wimu,
Nkyerɛ mununkum nye awɔw;
Afe n' rokɔ ewiei anafua 'i,
Ndɔmba, hom nwosow ngya no kwan.

MHB 906
1 . LORD Christ, when first Thou 
       cam’st to men,
Upon a Cross they bound Thee;
And mocked Thy saving Kingship then
By thorns with which they crowned Thee :
And still our wrongs may weave Thee now	
New thorns to pierce that steady brow,
And robe of sorrow round Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . OWURA Christ, ebaa nyimpa nkyɛn n'
Wɔkyekyeer Wo mbeamudua do:
Sii Ɔwo ɔgye-ahentum n' atwetwe,
Na wɔsoaa Wo nsoɛ ahenkyɛw;
Sesei so hɛn bɔn da ho wen
Nsoɛ fofor wowɔ W'enyi ekyir
Na ɔdze nyinsu atar hyɛ Wo.
Dɛ yɛdze wie Wo nkwagye n'.

MHB 906
2 . O awful love which found no room
In life where sin denied Thee,
The power which crucified Thee, 
Till not a stone was left on stone, 
And all a nation’s pride o’erthrown
Went down to dust beside Thee.
	 ~ 	2 
. O ɔdɔ nwanwa a oennya kwan
Biara wɔ bra bɔn mu no;
Ɔdze W' bɔkɔ wu dze, na ebɛfa
Do edzi Wo kumfo n' do
Kesi dɛ ɔbo nnkɛda ɔbo do,
Na ɔman biara ahopɔw bogu
Dɛ huntuma wɔ W'enyim.

MHB 906
3 . New advent of the love of Christ,
Shall we again refuse Thee,
Till in the night of hate and war
We perish as we lose Thee ? 
From old unfaith our souls release 
To seek the Kingdom of Thy peace,
By which alone we choose Thee.
	 ~ 	3 
. Christ No dɔ a asan aba bio,
Ana yɛnsan mpow Wo bio
Nkesi dɛ ɔtan na ɔko sum no m'
Yɛbɔhwer Wo na yɛ ahera?
Gye hɛn fi ekyingye dadaw n' mu,
Ma yɛnhwehwɛ W'asomdwee man n',
Ama hɛn nsa aaka Wo.

MHB 906
4 . O wounded hands of Jesus, build 
In us Thy new creation;
Our pride is dust, our vaunt is stilled, 
We wait Thy revelation :
O love that triumphs over loss,
We bring our hearts before Thy Cross,
To finish Thy salvation.	 ~ 	4 
. O Jesus, Wo nsa a wopirae n',
Nyɛ W'adzebɔ n' bio hɛn mu;
Hɛn ntsɛn dɛtse a, hɛn ntuw egu,
Na yɛrotweɔn Wo nyikyerɛ;
O dɔ a odzi nkogu do nyim,
Hɛn akoma ba Wo Dua n' enyim,

MHB 907
1 . ALMIGHTY Father, who dost give
The gift of life to all who live,
Look down on all earth’s sin and strife
And lift us to a nobler life.
	 ~ 	1 . TUM nyina Egya, Ɔwo a edze
Nkwa akyɛdze ma atseasefo kwa,
Kyea W'enyi hwɛ bɔn na aperper,
Na fa hɛn kɔ bra a ɔkrɔn mu.
Bɔn no tum a egu no do .  Amen.

MHB 907
2 . Lift up our hearts, O King of Kings,
To brighter hopes and kindlier things,
To visions of a larger good,
And holier dreams of brotherhood.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ahemfo Hen, krɔn hɛn akoma
Kɔ dza ɔhyerɛn na oye ho;
Eyiedzi kɛse ho mfonyin
Nye enuadɔ krɔnn ho enyisun.

MHB 907
3 . Thy world is weary of its pain,
Of selfish greed and fruitless gain,
Of tarnished honour, falsely strong,
And all its ancient deeds of wrong.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Wo wiadze ne yaw n' ekitsa n',
Emim na mfaso a onnsi kwaa;
Enyidzi a no ho egu fi,
Na ne tsetse bɔn ndwuma no.

MHB 907
4 . Hear thou the prayer thy servants pray
Uprising from all lands to-day
And, o’er the vanquished powers of sin,
O bring Thy great salvation in.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Tsie mpaa a Wo nkowaa robɔ no
Aman nyina mu ndɛ da yi,
Na ma W' nkwagye kɛse n' mbɛpram

MHB 908
1 . LIFE of ages, richly poured,
Love of God, unspent and free,
Flowing in the prophet’s word,
And the people’s liberty.
	 ~ 	1 . TSETSE nkwa a wohuee guu weɔɔ,
Nyame dɔ a ɔnnsa, wɔnntɔn a
Ɔpem kwa wɔ nkɔnhyɛsɛm
Na adasa hɔn fahodzi m'.
Na adasa hɔn fahodzi m'.

MHB 908
2 . Never was to chosen race
That unstinted tide confined
Thine is every time and place,
Fountain sweet of heart and mind.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wɔannkam adze biara do
Amma hɔn a woeyi hɔn n' nko;
Mber na mbea nyina dzi wɔ Wo,
Akoma na adwen pa n' bura.

MHB 908
3 . Breathing in the thinker’s creed,
Pulsing in the hero’s blood,
Nerving noblest thought and deed,
Freshening  time with truth and good.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mbadwemba nyinara na
Akatakyi mpo twer Wo, 
Ema adwen na ndzeyɛɛ pa,
'Dze nokwar na yie bɔ hyew.

MHB 908
4 . Consecrating art and song,
Holy book and pilgrim way,
Quelling strife and tyrant wrong,
Widening  freedom’s sacred sway.
	 ~ 	4 
. Etsew edwindzi na ndwom na
Kyerɛwsɛm na akwantu so ho,
Isiw aperdzi na bɔn kwan,
Na 'bue kwan ma fahodzi.

MHB 908
5 . Life of ages, richly poured,
Love of God, unspent and free,
Flowing in the prophet’s word,
And the people’s liberty.	 ~ 	5 
. Tsetse nkwa a wohuee guu weɔɔ,
Nyame dɔ a ɔnnsa, wɔnntɔn a 
Ɔpem kwa wɔ nkɔnhyɛsɛm

MHB 909
1 . WHEN wilt thou save the people?
O God of mercy, when?
The people, Lord, the people,
Not thrones and crowns, but men!
Flowers of thy heart, O God, are they;
let them not pass like weeds away
Their heritage a sunless day
God save the people!
 	 ~ 	1 . MBƆBƆRHU Nyame, dabɛn
Na ebɛgye adasa?
Ewuradze, ɔyɛ nyimpa,
Nnyɛ ahengua na ahenkyɛw,
Na wɔyɛ W'akoma ho nhyiren;
Na mma wonnwu dɛ nkyɛkyɛr kwa,
Na mma sum kebii mmpram hɛn do,
Nyame ngye adasa!
Nyame ngye adasa?

MHB 909
2 . Shall crime bring crime forever,
Strength  aiding still the strong?
Is it thy will, O Father, 
That men shall toil for wrong? 
No, say thy mountains; No, thy skies;
Man’s clouded sun shall brightly rise,
And songs be heard, instead of sighs,
God save the people!
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ana bɔn bɔwo bɔn daa?
Na abran ho ayɛ dzen daa?
Egya, ɔyɛ Wo pɛ dɛ 
Nyimpa bɛhyɛ bɔn ma?
Wo mbepɔw na wimu se dabi!
Nyimpa n'ewia bɛhyerɛn bio,
