Na ndwom, nnyɛ nkrum, na wɔbɛtse;
Nyame ngye adasa!

MHB 909
3 . When wilt thou save the people?
O God of mercy, when?
The people, Lord, the people!
Not thrones and crowns, but men!
God save the people; Thine they are,
Thy children as thy angels fair;
From vice, oppression and despair,
God save the people !	 ~ 	3 
. Mbɔbɔrhu Nyame, dabɛn
Na ebɛgye adasa?
Ewuradze, nyimpa yi nye
W'akoma ho nhyiren!
Wɔyɛ Wo mba dɛ abɔfo n' pɛr;
Nyame, gye nyimpa, wɔyɛ W'dze,
Fi bɔn, nhyɛdo, na abawpa mu,

MHB 91
1 . ALL hail the power of Jesu’s name;
Let angels prostrate fall;
Bring forth the royal diadem
To crown Him Lord of all.
	 ~ 	1 . Nkorɔfo nyina nhua Jesus dzin; 
Abɔfo nhwe No fam';
Wɔmfa ahenkyɛw no mbra mbɔsoa N',
Na wɔnhyɛ N' abɔso Hen.

MHB 91
2 . Crown Him, ye martyrs of our God,
Who from His altar call;
Extol Him in whose path ye trod,
And crown Him Lord of all.
	 ~ 	2 . 'Sɛmpa n' ho atɔfo, hom nhua N' 
Wɔ N' afɔrmbukyia n' do;
Hom nhua nyia hom tsia N' anamɔnm'
Na hom nhyɛ N' abɔso Hen.

MHB 91
3 . Ye seed of Israel’s chosen race,
Ye ransomed from the fall,
Hail Him who saves you by His grace,
And crown him Lord of all.
	 ~ 	3 . Israel mbasantsen, hom a 
Woeyi hom asehwem',
Hom nhua nyia ɔdze N' adom gye hom n',
Na hom nhyɛ N' abɔso Hen.

MHB 91
4 . Sinners ! Whose love can ne’er forget
The wormwood and the gall;
Go spread your trophies at His feet,
And crown Him Lord of all.
	 ~ 	4 . Bɔnyɛfo, mma hom werɛ mmfir 
Bɔwen na bɔwema n';
Hom mfa hom asadze nkɔ nkɛma N',
Na hom nhyɛ N' abɔso Hen.

MHB 91
5 . Let every tribe and every tongue
Before Him prostrate fall,
And shout in universal song
The crowned Lord of all.
	 ~ 	5 . Ebusua na ngyirama nyina, 
Wontwa nhwehwe N' enyim;
Na hɔn nyina wɔntow ndwom nhua
Nyia wɔahyɛ N' abɔso Hen.

MHB 91
6 .  O that with yonder sacred throng
We at His feet may fall,
Join in the everlasting song,
And crown him Lord of all!	 ~ 	6 . Ao, nkyɛ yɛnye sor dɔm yeetwa 
Yɛahwehwe N' ananadze,
Yeekua ho ma wɔaatow daa ndwom n',
Na yaahyɛ N' abɔso Hen!

MHB 910
1 . THESE things shall be: a loftier race 
Than e’re the world hath known shall rise 
With flame of freedom in their souls, 
And light of knowledge in their eyes. 
 	 ~ 	1 . 'YINOM besi : Ɔsantsen a
Wiadze nnhun hɔn saso, dzedze
Fahodzi gya wɔ hɔn akra m',
Na nyimdzee kan wɔ hɔn enyim.
Ber a asaase bɛyɛ heaven n'.

MHB 910
2 . They shall be gentle, brave, and strong 
To spill no drop of blood, but dare 
All that may plant man’s lordship firm 
On earth and fire, and sea, and air. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Wɔbɛyɛ akofo bɔkɔɔ,
Wɔnnkɛka bɔgya bi, na mbom
Wɔbɛfa gya m', pomu, na wimu
Etsia nyimpa wiadze tumdzi.

MHB 910
3 . Nation with nation, land with land, 
Inarmed shall live as comrades free; 
In every heart and brain shall throb 
The pulse of one fraternity. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Aman nye aman bɛtsena daa
Wɔ asomdwee mu dɛ anyɛnkofo,
Na dɔ bɛka akoma biara,
Na wɔatse amema hɔnho.

MHB 910
4 . Man shall love man, with heart as pure 
And fervent as the young-eyed throng 
Who chant their heavenly psalms before 
God’s face with undiscordant song. 
	 ~ 	4 
. Nyimpa dze akoma krɔnn bɔdɔ
No nua, na wɔdze ndamyɛ tum
Atow ɔsorsor ndwom dɛɛdɛw,
Wɔ Nyankopɔn enyim daa daa.

MHB 910
5 . New arts shall bloom of loftier mould 
And mightier music thrill the skies, 
And every life shall be a song, 
When all the earth is paradise. 	 ~ 	5 
. Edwindze pii na obopue,
Ba ndwom dehye ahyɛ wimu ma,
Na ndwom bɛhyɛ obiara mu,

MHB 911
1 . O BROTHER man, fold to thy heart thy brother!
Where pity dwells, the peace of God is there;
To worship rightly is to love each other,
Each smile a hymn, each kindly deed a prayer.
	 ~ 	1 . DASANYI, fua wo nyɛnko nyimpa wo bom'!
Bea a tsema wɔ n' Nyame asomdwee wɔ hɔ;
Ɔsom pa nye dɛ hom rododɔ homho,
Serew yɛ ndwom, papayɛ so yɛ asɔr.
Na no nso mu oedua asomdwee dua no.

MHB 911
2 . For he whom Jesus loved has truly spoken:
The holier worship which He deigns to bless
Restores the lost, and binds the spirit broken,
And feeds the widow and the fatherless.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Nyia Jesus dɔɔ no n' akasa nokwar mu:
Som krɔnkrɔn a ɔsɔ N'enyi daa nye dɛ
Edze dza ayew san ba na ekyekye werɛ,
Na enyɛn ekunafo na ngyanka.

MHB 911
3 . Follow with reverent steps the great example
Of Him Whose holy work was doing good;
So shall the wide earth seem our Father’s temple,
Each loving life a psalm of gratitude.
	 ~ 	3 
. Fa enyidzi kɛse tsin Nyia N'edwuma
Krɔnn nye papayɛ n' ne fasusu do,
Ama wiadze aayɛ hɛn Egya N'asɔrfi,
Na dɔ abrabɔ aayɛ ndaase ndwom.

MHB 911
4 . Then shall all shackles fall; the stormy clangor
Of wild war music o’er the earth shall cease;
Love shall tread out the baleful fire of anger,
And in its ashes plant the tree of peace.	 ~ 	4 
. Na mpokyerɛ bobubu, na wiadze ha
Ɔsatu ndwom gyigyeegye so begyaa;
Ɔdɔ botutu ebufuw ne gya egu,

MHB 912
1 . TURN back, O man, forswear thy foolish ways.
Old now is earth, and none may count her days.
Yet thou, her child, whose head is crowned with flame,
Still wilt not hear Thine inner God proclaim,
“Turn back, O man, forswear thy foolish ways.”
	 ~ 	1 . O NYIMPA, san w'ekyir, pow w'akwan bɔn n';
Wiadze yi rutwa mu, ne mber asa,
Naaso Ɔwo a ewɔ kan abɔtsir no
'Da ho nntse dza wo Nyame ka no dɛ,
O nyimpa, san w'ekyir, pow w'akwan bɔn n'.
Asaase ndzi mu, adasa nyɛ kor.

MHB 912
2 . Earth might be fair, and all men glad and wise.
Age after age their tragic empires rise,
Built while they dream, and in that dreaming weep:
Would man but wake from out his haunted sleep,
Earth might be fair and all men glad and wise.
	 ~ 	2 
. Bi a wiadze yɛ fɛw, na nyimpa tse dɛw m';
Mber nyina hɔn aman nyin ma ɔsɛɛ;
Wɔkyekyeer aman fi osu adaaso mu;
O nkyɛ nyimpa eenyan efi ne nda m'!
Ma asaase eedzi mu, nyimpa eehu nyansa.

MHB 912
3 . Earth shall be fair, and all her people one:
Nor till that hour shall God’s whole will be done.
Now, even now, once more from earth to sky,
Peals forth in joy man’s old undaunted cry—
“Earth shall be fair, and all her folk be one.	 ~ 	3 
. Wiadze bɛyɛ yie, na nyimpa ayɛ kor;
Gyedɛ 'yi ba na Nyame N' pɛ n' wɔayɛ;
Sesei mpo nyimpa nnsuro dɛ ɔtsea mu
Wɔ dɛw mu fi asaase kɔ sor dɛ;

MHB 913
1 . WITH the sweet word of peace
We bid our brethren go;
Peace as a river to increase,
And ceaseless flow.
	 ~ 	1 . ASOMDWEE dɛɛdɛw na
Yɛdze gya hɛn nuaam kwan;
Asomdwee nyir dɛ esutsen,
Mma ɔnnwew da.
Dze hɛn bɔbɔ m'.

MHB 913
2 . With the calm word of prayer
We earnestly commend
Our brethren to Thy watchful care,
Eternal Friend!
	 ~ 	2 
. Mpaabɔ ndze bɔkɔɔ na
Yɛdze tu hɛn nuanom
'Nyiber do hyɛ Wo nhwɛdo nsa,
Daapem Nyɛnko.

MHB 913
3 . With the dear word of love
We give our brief farewell;
Our love below, and Thine above
With them shall dwell.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔdɔsɛm tsiaa bi na
Yɛdze ma nantsew yie;
Famu ha hɛn dɔ, na sor Wodze n'
Nye hɔn bɛtsena.

MHB 913
4 . With the strong word of faith
We stay ourselves on Thee,
That Thou, O Lord, in life and death
Their help shall be!
	 ~ 	4 
. Gyedzisɛm dzendzen do
Na yɛnam dze twer Wo;
Dɛ Ɔwo Ewuradze bɛyɛ hɔn
Mboa nkwa na wu m'.

MHB 913
5 . Then the bright word of hope
Shall on our parting gleam,
And tell of joys beyond the scope
Of earth-born dream.
	 ~ 	5 
. Na enyidado mapa
Bɛhyerɛn hɛn do ampa,
Na ɔama dɛw a ɔbor wiadze
Enyisun do.

MHB 913
6 . Farewell; in hope and love,
In faith and peace and prayer,
Till He Whose home is ours above
Unite us there.	 ~ 	6 
. Da yie, enyidado dɔ,
Gyedzi, asomdwee, mpaabɔ m';
Kodu dɛ Nyia Ne fie wɔ sor

MHB 914
1 . GOD be with you till we meet again, 
By His counsels guide, uphold you, 
With His sheep securely fold you: 
God be with you till we meet again
 	 ~ 	1 . NYAME nye wo ntsena; yebehyia m' bio,
Mfa N'apam ngya wo, nsuo wo mu,
Mfa wo nka No nguan ho nsie yie,
Nyame nye wo ntsena, yebehyia m' bio.
Nyame nye wo ntsena; yebehyia m' bio.

MHB 914
2 . God be with you till we meet again,
’Neath His wings protecting hide you, 
Daily manna still provide you: 
God be with you till we meet again. 
 	 ~ 	2 
. Nyame nye wo ntsena; yebehyia m' bio,
Mfa W' nhyɛ No bomu mbɔ wo ho ban,
Ɔmma wo daa daa edziban,
Nyame nye wo tsena, yebehyia m' bio.

MHB 914
3 . God be with you till we meet again, 
When life’s perils thick confound you, 
Put His arms unfailing round you: 
God be with you till we meet again. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyame nye wo ntsena; yebehyia m' bio,
Sɛ ɔbra m' mbusu kyekyer wo a,
Ɔmfa N'abaw mbɔ wo ho ban,
Nyame nye wo tsena, yebehyia m' bio.

MHB 914
4 . God be with you till we meet again,
Keep love’s banner floating o’er you, 
Smite death’s threatening wave before you: 
God be with you till we meet again ! 	 ~ 	4 
. Nyame nye wo ntsena; yebehyia m' bio,
Onyam dɔ frankaa wɔ wo do,
Mbɔ owu mpuw mfi w'enyim daa,

MHB 915
1 . FAHTER, who art alone
Our Helper and our Stay;
O hear us! as we plead
For loved ones far away;
And shield with Thine almighty hand
Our wanderers by sea and land.
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN Egya a Wo nko ara
Nye hɛn boafo daa daa,
Tsie hɛn, ber a yɛsɔr
Ma adɔfo a wɔadɔ mu,
Na fa W'abaw dzendzen no gye
Po na asaase do akwantufo.
Wɔ sor Egyaman no mu hɔ.

MHB 915
2 . For Thou, our Father God,
Art present everywhere,
And bendest low Thine ear
To catch the faintest prayer,
Waiting rich blessings to bestow 
On all Thy children here below.
	 ~ 	2 
. 'Siandɛ Ɔwo hɛn Egya,
Ewɔ mbea nyinara,
Na ebrɛ W'aso adze
Tsie mpaabɔ bɔkɔɔ mpo,
Na etweɔn ara so hyira
Wo mba a wɔwɔ ase ha nyina.

MHB 915
3 . O compass with Thy love
The daily path they tread!
And may Thy light and truth
Upon their hearts be shed;
That, one in all things with Thy will,
Heaven’s peace and joy their souls may fill.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Fa Wo dɔ no numa
Beebi a wɔnam biara,
Ma Wo kan na nokwar
Ngu hɔn akoma do,
Na sɛ hɔn pɛ nye Wodze sɛ a,
Ma hɔn so asomdwee na dɛw.

MHB 915
4 . Guard them from every harm
When dangers shall assail,
And teach them that Thy power
Can never, never fail;
We cannot with our loved ones be,
But trust them, Father, unto Thee.
	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ mbusu bɛn hɔn a
Yi hɔn fi ne nyina m';
Na kyerɛ hɔn dɛ Wo
Tum no nnkɛpa ara da;
Yennkotum akɔ mbrɛ wɔwɔ,
Naaso yɛdze hɔn hyɛ Wo nsa.

MHB 915
5 . We all are travellers here 
Along life’s various road,
Meeeting and parting oft
Till  we shall mount to God;
At home at last, with those we love,
Within the fatherland above.	 ~ 	5 
. Yɛyɛ ɔbra n'akwan
Do akwantufo wɔ ha,
Yehyia, dzi mpaam', kesi
Dɛ yɛkɔ Nyame hɔ;
Yɛnye hɛn adɔfo bɛtsena

MHB 916
1 . HOLY Father, in thy mercy
Hear our anxious prayer:
Keep our loved ones, now far distant,
’Neath thy care.
	 ~ 	1 . KRƆKRƆN Egya, mbɔbɔr mu ara
Tsie hɛn mpaabɔ yi;
Hɛn adɔfo a woetu kwan no,
Hwɛ hɔn do.
Bɛn Wo ho.

MHB 916
2 . Jesus, Saviour, let thy presence
Be their light and guide;
Keep, O keep them, in their weakness,
At thy side.
	 ~ 	2 
. Agyenkwa Jesus, twe bɛn hɔn,
Ma hɔn kan kwankyerɛ;
Hɔn mberɛwyɛ mu fa hɔn sie
Wo nkyɛn daa.

MHB 916
3 . When in sorrow, when in danger,
When in loneliness,
In thy love look down and comfort
Their distress.
	 ~ 	3 
. Awerɛhow na mbusu mu,
Ma obi nnkɔ mmba no,
Wo dɔ mu, hwɛ kyekye hɔn werɛ 
Hɔn haw mu.

MHB 916
4 . May the joy of thy salvation
Be their strength and stay;
May they love and may they praise thee
Day by day.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Na ma Wo nkwagye ho dɛw no
Nyɛ hɔn mboa na ahom;
Ma wɔndɔ Wo, nyi Wo ayɛw
Daa nyina.

MHB 916
5 . Holy Spirit, let thy teaching
Sanctify their life;
Send thy grace, that they may conquer
In the strife.
 	 ~ 	5 
. Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, ma Wo nkyerɛkyerɛ
Ntsew hɔn abrabɔ ho;
Dom hɔn ma wondzi konyim daa
Wɔ ɔko n' mu.

MHB 916
6 . Father, Son, and Holy Spirit,
God the One in Three,
Bless them, guide them, save them, keep them
Near to thee.       Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Egya, Ɔba, Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn,
Ɔkorsa Nyame,
Hyira hɔn, gya hɔn abamba

MHB 917
1 . ETERNAL Father, strong to save,
whose arm doth bind the  restless wave,
who bidd’st the mighty ocean deep
its own appointed limits keep:
O hear us when we cry to thee
For those in peril on the sea.
	 ~ 	1 . DAA daa Egya, Ɔwo a egye nkwa,
Ɔwo a W'abaw si asorɛkye ban,
Ɔwo a ehyɛ po mma onnyir nntra
Bea a Ɔwo ahyɛ no biara do :
O sɛ yesu frɛ Wo ma hɔn a
Worihyia mbusu po do a, tsie hɛn !
Asaase na po do mma Wo.

MHB 917
2 . O Saviour, whose almighty word
The winds and waves  submissive heard,
who walkedst on the foaming deep,
and Calm amid its rage didst sleep:
O hear us when we cry to thee
for those in peril on the sea.
	 ~ 	2 
. Agyenkwa, Ɔwo a mframa na
Asorɛkye yɛɛ setsie maa Wo,
Ɔwo a enantseew po bun enyi,
Na edaa ne gyigyeegye mu mpo:
O sɛ yesu frɛ Wo ma hɔn a
Worihyia mbusu po do a, tsie hɛn!

MHB 917
3 . O Sacred Spirit, who didst brood
upon the chaos dark and rude,
Who bad’st its angry tumult cease,
And gavest light ,and life,and peace:
O hear us when we cry to thee
for those in peril on the sea.
	 ~ 	3 
. O Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, Ɔwo a nkan n'
Ibutuuw sum kebii n' enyi,
Ɔwo a emaa ogyaa weɔweɔɔ yɛ
Na emaa kan, nkwa na asomdwee:
O sɛ yesu frɛ Wo ma hɔn a
Worihyia mbusu po do a, tsie hɛn.

MHB 917
4 . O Trinity of love and power,
our brethren shield in danger’s hour;
from rock and tempest, fire and foe,
protect them wheresoe’er they go:
thus evermore shall rise to thee
glad hymns of praise from land and sea.	 ~ 	4 
. O dɔ na tum nyina Ɔkorsa,
Kora hɛn dɔm do, mbusu mu;
Beebi a wɔwɔ biara gye hɔn,
Abo, ehum, gya na ɔtan mu,
Na wɔntow dɛw ayɛyi ndwom

MHB 918
1 . O LOVE divine, that stooped to share
Our sharpest pang, our bitterest tear!
On Thee we cast each earth-born care;
We smile at pain while Thou art near.
	 ~ 	1 . O NYAME dɔ a ebaa bɔsɔɔw
Hɛn yaw na hɛn nyinsu wɔ ha,
Yɛtow hɛn dadwen gu Wo do;
Sɛ Ɔwo bɛn a, yennsuro yaw.
Ɔwo bɛn hɛn a, yennsuro yaw.

MHB 918
2 . Though long the weary way we tread,
And sorrow crown each lingering year,
No path we shun, no darkness dread,
Our hearts still whispering, “Thou art near!”
 	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ hɛn kwan no war dɛn ara
Na awerɛhow hyɛ hɛn mber ma a,
Hɛn hyɛber na sum mpo yɛmmpow;
Hɛn akoma se : Ɔwo bɛn hɛn.

MHB 918
3 . When drooping pleasure turns to grief,
And trembling faith is changed to fear,
The murmuring wind, the quivering leaf,
Shall softly tell us Thou art near!
	 ~ 	3 
. Sa enyigye tsiaa dan yɛ nkrumsi,
Na gyedzi a ohim dan suro a,
Mfar na haban a ohinhim mpo
Bɔwasa dɛ : Ɔwo bɛn hɛn.

MHB 918
4 . On Thee we fling our burdening woe,
O Love divine, forever dear!
Content to suffer while we know,
Living and dying, Thou art near!	 ~ 	4 
. Yɛtow hɛn ndzesoa gu Wo do,
Ɔwo Nyame dɔ a emmpa ara da;
Nkwa mu o, 'wu mu o, sɛ yehu dɛ;

MHB 919
1 . THINE arm, O Lord, in days of old
Was strong to heal and save;
It triumphed o’er disease and death,
O’er darkness and the grave:
To thee they went, the blind, the dumb,
The palsied and the lame,
The leper with his tainted life,
The sick with fevered frame.
 	 ~ 	1 . O EWURADZE, Wo nsa saa yar,
Gyee nkwa tsetsebaado;
Odzii yarba na 'wu, na sum,
Na wumaa do konyim daa.
Ɔwo na efurafo, nye emum,
Ndwedweefo nye mpakye
Na akwatafo nyinara so
Pemee baa Wo hɔ daa.
Nyina nyi W' ayɛw daa.

MHB 919
2 . And lo, thy touch brought life health,
Gave speech and strength sight;
And youth renewed and frenzy calmed
Owned thee, the Lord of light:
And now, O Lord, be near to bless,
Almighty as of yore,
In crowded street, by restless couch,
As by Gennesaret’s shore.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Hwɛ, Wo nsa maa nkwa na mpɔwmudzen,
Obuee ano na enyi,
Maa abran foforyɛ, dedaa adwen,
Ma ɔgyee Wo kan no;
Sesei, Ewuradze, twe bɛn,
Fa Wo tum n' hyira hɛn,
Abrɔn mu na yar mpa ho dɛ
Mbrɛ osii Genesaret n'.

MHB 919
3 . Be thou our great deliverer still,
thou Lord of life and death;
retore and quicken, soothe and bless,
with thine almighty breath:
to hands that work, and eyes that see,
give wisdom’s heavenly lore,
that whole and sick, and weak and strong,
may praise thee evermore.   Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Kɔ do ara yɛ hɛn Pomfo,
Ɔwo nkwa na owu Wura;
Fa W'ahom kɛse no dwedwe,
Ma do si, na hyira.
Fa sor nyansa no ma hɔn a
Wɔfona, wohu Wo n',
Ma ahoɔdzenfo, na ayarfo

MHB 92
1 . JESUS! the name high over all,
In hell, or earth ,or sky;
Angels and men before it fall,
And devils fear and fly.
	 ~ 	1 . Jesus dzin bɔ adze nyina do, 
Wɔ hɛll, nye ase, nye sor,
Abɔfo na nyimpa kotow n',
Na mbɔnsam fi enyim guan.

MHB 92
2 . Jesus! the name to sinners dear,
The name to sinners given;
It scatters all their guilty fear,
It turns their hell to heaven.
	 ~ 	2 . Jesus! dzin a ɔyɛ abɔn dɛw, 
Dzin a wɔdze akyɛ abɔn;
Ɔhotse hɔn suro nyina,
Na ɔdan hɔn hɛll yɛ heaven.

MHB 92
3 . Jesus! the prisoner’s fetters breaks,
And bruises Satan’s head;
Power into strengthless souls it speaks,
And life into the dead.
	 ~ 	3 . Jesus! otu adaduafo apo, 
Otsia abɔnsam tsir do;
Ɔdze tum hyɛ nyia onnyi ahom,
Na ɔma ewufo nkwa.

MHB 92
4 . O that the world might taste and see
The riches of His grace!
The arms of love that compass me
Would all the world embrace.
	 ~ 	4 . Ao, nkyɛ N' adom ahonya no 
Wiadze nyina aasɔ ahwɛ!
N-kyɛ No dɔ abaw n' bofua
Adasamba nyina.

MHB 92
5 . His only righteousness I show,
His saving grace proclaim;
’Tis all my business here below
To cry : Behold the Lamb !
	 ~ 	5 . Ne tsenenee na No nkwagye 
Na mobɔ no dawur,
M' edwuma nye dɛ mekam' dɛ,
Wɔnhwɛ Eguambaa no!

MHB 92
6 . Happy, if with my latest breath
I might but gasp His Name;
Preach Him to all, and cry in death:
Behold, behold the Lamb !	 ~ 	6 . Edɛw bɛn na nkyɛ ɔbɛyɛ, 
Dɛ mo wumpa no do,
Mobɔbɔ Ne dzin na matseam'
Dɛ, Wɔnhwɛ Eguambaa n'!

MHB 920
1 . THOU to whom the sick and dying
Ever came, nor came in vain,
Still with healing word replying
To the wearied cry of pain,
Hear us, Jesu, as we meet
Suppliants at thy mercy-seat.
 	 ~ 	1 . ƆWO a ayarfo na hɔn a woruwu
Baa Wo hɔ, na wɔammba n' kwa,
Na eda ho dze 'yarsa kasa
Dwedwe akoma a wɔwɔ yaw,
Yɛaba W'egua n' enyim yi,
Jesus, mbɔbɔr mu, tsie hɛn.
Wɔ W'atsɛmbugua n' enyim.  Amen.

MHB 920
2 . Every care, and every sorrow,
Be it great, or be it small,
Yesterday, to-day, to-morrow,
When, where’er  it may befall,
Lay we humbly at Thy feet,
Suppliant at Thy mercy-seat.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛdze dadwen na awerɛhow,
Akɛse na nkumaa so,
Bɔ m' ba W'enyim aber biara a
Wɔtsetsew totɔ hɛn do n'.
Yɛba W'ahengua n'enyim
Ntotɔserɛ mu ara.

MHB 920
3 . Still the weary, sick, and dying
Need a brother’s, sister’s, care,
On thy higher help relying
May we now their burden share,
Bringing all our offerings meet
Suppliants at thy mercy-seat.
	 ~ 	3 
. 'Bahatɔfo, ayarfo na
Hɔn a woruwu hia ahwɛfo,
Yɛtwer Wo sor mboa kɛse n' yi,
Ma yɛngye hɔn ndzesoa no,
Mfa hɛn ayɛyɛdze mbra,
Ntotɔserɛ mu ara.

MHB 920
4 . May each child of Thine be willing,
Willing both in hand and heart,
All the law of love fulfilling,
Ever comfort to impart;
Ever bringing offerings meet
Suppliant to thy mercy-seat.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Ma Wo ba pa biara nnya pɛ
Wɔ ndzeyɛɛ na akoma mu
Mfa ndzi ɔdɔ ho mbra no do,
Wɔnkyerɛ awerɛkyekyer,
Mfa ayɛyɛdze mbra,
Ntotɔserɛ mu ara.

MHB 920
5 . So may sickness, sin, and sadness
To thy healing power yield,
Till the sick and sad, in gladness,
Rescued, ransomed, cleansed, healed,
One in thee together meet,
Pardoned at thy  judgement-seat.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Ma yardɔm na hɛn awerɛhow
Ntu, W'ayarsa tum n' enyim,
Kesi dɛ nyinsukyifo n' na
Hɔn a wɔapon hɔn nyina
Dze dɛw bɔbɔ mu ehyia

MHB 921
1 . FROM thee all skill and science flow,
All pity, care, and love,
All calm and courage, faith and hope:
O pour them from above.
And part them, Lord, to each and all,
As each and all shall need,
To rise, like incense, each to thee,
In noble thought and deed.
	 ~ 	1 . NYIMDZEE, na suahu nyina so,
Ayamuhyehye na dɔ,
Ne nyina fi Wo nkyɛn nko ba,
O hue, 'yinom fi sor;
Na afei, Ewuradze, kyekyɛ n'
Dɛ mbrɛ hia horow tse,
Ama woeetu hua ama Wo
Wɔ adwen na nyɛe pa mu.
Nnkɛsɛɛ paradise bio.

MHB 921
2 . And hasten, Lord, that perfect day
When pain and death shall cease,
And thy just rule shall fill the earth
With health and light and peace.
When ever blue the sky shall gleam,
And ever green the sod,
And man’s rude work deface no more
The paradise of God.	 ~ 	2 
. Na Ewuradze, ma da n' a
Yaw na 'wu botwa n' mbra,
Ber n' na Wo pɛrpɛrdzi bɛma
Apɔwmudzen, kan, 'somdwee;
Wimu bɛtsew nwann wɔ mbea nyina,
Na kwaa bɛyɛ tumm daa,
Na dasanyi ne ndzebɔn no

MHB 922
1 . O THOU before Whose presence
Nought evil may come in,
Yet Who dost look in mercy
Down on this world of sin,
O give us noble purpose 
To set the sin bound free,
And Christ-like tender pity 
To seek the lost for Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . Krɔnkrɔn Nyame a w' enyim 
Atantandze remmba,
Naaso edze mbɔbɔrhu
Ehwɛ bɔn wiadze yi;
Ma hɛn akɔndɔ pa ma
Yembubu bɔn mpokyerɛm',
Ma hɛn Christ mbɔbɔrhu ma
Yɛmpɛ hɔn a wɔayew.
O Ɔkorsa Krɔnkrɔn!    Amen.

MHB 922
2 . Our foe is fierce and subtle;
The forces at his hand
With woes that none can number
Despoil the pleasant land;
All they who war against them,
In strife so keen and long,
Must in their Saviour’s  armour
Be stronger than the strong.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn tamfo n' yɛ nyitsewfo; 
No dɔm so ho yɛ hu
Ɔdze mbusu piinara
Sɛɛ hɛn asaase pa;
Hɔn a wɔko tsia hɔn no
Wɔ ɔko dzendzen no mu n',
Wɔ dɛ wɔyɛ dzen mbordo
Wɔ Christ akodze mu.

MHB 922
3 . 'Tis Thou wrought among us 
The great things that we see!
For things that are we thank Thee,
And for the things to be.
For bright hope that confirmeth
Uplifting faint hands and feeble knees,
To strive beneath Thy blessing 
For greater things than these.
 	 ~ 	3 
. 'Wo na ayɛ wɔ hɛn mu 
Ndwuma akɛse a yehu 'i,
Yɛda W' ase dza ayɛ,
Ɔnye dza ebɛyɛ;
Yɛda W' ase wɔ enyidar
A ɔhyɛ hɛn nsa dzen,
Ma yɛper hwehwɛ nhyira a
Ɔkyɛn dza hɛn nsa aka.

MHB 922
4 . Lead on, O Love and Mercy, 
O Purity and Power!
Lead on till peace eternal 
Shall close this battle-hour:
Till all who prayed and struggled
To set their brethren free,
In triumph meet to praise Thee, 
Most holy Trinity.   Amen.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ahotsew na Mbɔbɔrhu 
Na Dɔ na Tum Nyame e!
Dzi kan kodu dɛ ko yi
Ɔbɔ adze asomdwee mu.
Na hɔn a wɔdze mpaabɔ
Peer gyee hɔn enuanom
Dze konyindwom behyia Wo

MHB 923
1 . WE give Thee but Thine own, 
Whate’er the gift may be;
All that we have is Thine alone,
A trust, O Lord, from Thee.
 	 ~ 	1 . Dza yɛdze ma W' biara, 
Hɛn Wura, Woara Wodze a;
Dza yɛwɔ nyina yɛ Wodze:
Edze maa hɛn esie.
Yɛyɛ ma Woara.

MHB 923
2 . May we Thy bounties thus
As stewards true receive,
And gladly, as Thou blessest us,
To Thee our first-fruits give.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ma yɛngye W' akyɛdze 
Dɛ ahwɛdofo pa,
Dɛ mbrɛ ihyira hɛn n', yɛmfa dɛw,
Mfa hɛn ndɔbaa mbrɛ Wo.

MHB 923
3 . O hearts are bruised and dead,
And homes are bare and cold,
And lambs for whom the Shepherd bled,
Are straying from the fold.
 	 ~ 	3 
. 'Koma pii abobɔ, 
Hia wɔ efi pii mu,
Na nguambaa pii a Guanhwɛfo n'
Wui maa hɔn n' atɔ gon.

MHB 923
4 . To comfort and to bless,
To find a balm for woe,
To tend the lone and fatherless
Is angels’ work below.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Ebɛkyekye werɛ, 
'Behyira abɔbɔfo,
Bɔhwehwɛ ankonam nye ngyanka,
Iyi nye nyamesom.

MHB 923
5 . The captive to release,
To God the lost to bring,
To teach the way of life and peace—
It is a Christ-like thing.
	 ~ 	5  
. Ebɛgye adaduafo, 
'Dze abɔn bɛbrɛ Nyame,
'Bɛkyerɛ nkwa na asomdwee kwan n',
Yɛ Christianyɛ ampa.

MHB 923
6 . And we believe Thy word,
Though dim our faith may be;
Whate'er for Thine we do, 
O Lord, We do it unto Thee.	 ~ 	6 
. Hɛn gyedzi yɛ mberɛw dze, 
So yɛgye W' asɛm dzi;
Nyame, dza yɛyɛ ma Wo mba,

MHB 924
1 . CHRIST, whose glory fills the skies,
Christ, the true, the only light,
Sun of Righteousness, arise,
triumph o’er the shades of night;
Dayspring from on high, be near;
Daystar, in my heart appear.
	 ~ 	1 . Christ, W' enyimnyam hyɛ wim' ma, 
Christ, Wo nko nye nokwar kan,
Ndzeyɛtsenenee Ewia, pue,
Hyɛ anago sum nyina do;
Sor Adzekyee, bra me nkyɛn
Hyerɛn m' akomam', yɛ hɔ kann.
Kodu da a onnyi ewiei n' mu.

MHB 924
2 . Dark and cheerless is the morn
unaccompanied by thee;
Joyless is the day’s return,
Till thy mercy’s beams I see,
Till they inward light impart,
Glad my eyes, and warm my heart.
	 ~ 	2 
. Annka adzekyee ho ammba a, 
Nna da n' nyina ayɛ awerɛhow;
Metse sum nye mbusu mu,
Kɛpem dɛ W' ehumbɔbɔr
Hyerɛn dze dɛw hyɛ mo mu,
Na ɔbɔ m' akoma mu hyew.

MHB 924
3 . Visit then this soul of mine,
Pierce the gloom of sin and grief;
Fill me, Radiancy divine,
Scatter all my unbelief;
More and more thyself display,
Shining to the perfect day.	 ~ 	3 
. Dem ntsi bra bɛsera me kra; 
Pa bɔn nye awerɛhow sum no;
Nyame kan, hyɛ mo mu ma;
Pa m' ekyingye nyinara;
Da Woho edzi mbordo ara

MHB 925
1 . THE star of morn has risen:
O Lord, to thee we pray;
O uncreated Light of Light,
      Guide thou our way.
	 ~ 	1 . ANAPA woraba epue :
Ewuradze, yɛserɛ Wo,
Kan a ofi kan a obi annyɛ Wo,
Kyerɛ hɛn kwan.
Ma ɔnye Wo nwie.

MHB 925
2 . Sinless be tongue and hand,
And innocent the mind,
Let simple truth be on our lips,
      Our hearts be kind.
	 ~ 	2 
. Gyirama na nsa ho ntsew,
Na adwen mu nyɛ wansann,
Ma nokwar no nda hɛn ano,
Yɛnyɛ adɔyɛ.

MHB 925
3 . As the swift day rolls on,
Still, Lord, our Guardian be,
And keep the portals of our hearts
      From evil free.
	 ~ 	3 
. Adzekyee resen yi,
Kɔ do yɛ hɛn Hwɛfo;
Ewuradze, kora hɛn akoma
Sɔnn fi bɔn mu.

MHB 925
4 . Grant that our daily toil
May to thy glory tend;
And as our hours begin with thee,
      So may they end.	 ~ 	4 
. Ma yendzi hɛn dwuma
Daa nhyɛ Wo enyimnyam;
Na sɛ hɛn mber nye Wo hyɛ ase a,

MHB 926
1 . MY Father, for another night
Of quiet sleep and rest,
For all the joy of morning light,
Thy holy name be blest.
 	 ~ 	1 . M'EGYA, anafua fofor so
Mu nda na ahomgye pa,
Na anapa kan ho dɛw nyina ntsi
Nhyira nka Wo dzin krɔnkrɔn n'.
Fa tsenenee akwan do.

MHB 926
2 . Now with the new-born day I give
Myself anew to thee,
That as thou willest I may live,
And what thou willest be.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Mutu moho ka da fofor
Yi ho dze hyɛ Wo nsa,
Dɛ me bra nyɛ dɛ dza Ɔwo pɛ,
Na ma Wo pɛ nyɛ hɔ.

MHB 926
3 . Whate’er I do, things great or small,
Whate’er I speak or frame,
Thy glory may I seek in all,
Do all in Jesus’ name.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Kɛse na kumaa a m'bɛyɛ n' ndɛ,
Dza m'bɛka na m'bɔdwen.
Ma memfa nhyɛ Wo enyimnyam
Wɔ Jesus Ne dzin mu .

MHB 926
4 . My Father, for his sake, I pray,
Thy child accept and bless;
And lead me by thy grace to-day
In paths of righteousness.	 ~ 	4 
. M'Egya, Wo dzin ntsi na mosɔr,
Gye W'abofra, hyira no.
Na ndɛ dua W'adom do gya m'

MHB 927
1 . O TIMELY happy, timely wise,
Hearts that with rising morn arise!
Eyes that the beam celestial view,
Which evermore makes all things new! 
	 ~ 	1 . AKOMA a wɔgye wi nyan,
Na enyiwa a wohu sor kan no a
Ɔyɛ adze nyina fofor n',
Nya enyigye, yɛ enyansafo.
Na yɛrosɔr n' yeepinkyɛn Wo daa.

MHB 927
2 . New every morning is the love
Our wakening and uprising prove;
Through sleep and darkness safely brought,
Restored to life, and power, and thought. 
 	 ~ 	2 
. 'Napa biara dɔ a onyan hɛn
Na ɔma yɛsoɛr no yɛ fofor;
Ɔdze hɛn twa nda na sum sɔnn
San ba nkwa, tum na nyansa mu.

MHB 927
3 . New mercies each returning day
Hover around us while we pray;
New perils past, new sins forgiven,
New thoughts of God, new hopes of heaven. 
 	 ~ 	3 
. Adzekyeenyim biara a yɛsɔr n',
Mbɔbɔrhu fofor kyin hɛn ho;
Mbusu pa, yenya bɔnfakyɛ,
Nyame ho adwen, sor enyisun.

MHB 927
4 . If on our daily course our mind
Be set to hallow all we find,
New treasssures still of countless price
God will provide for sacrifice. 
	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ hɛn daa daa dwumadzi mu
Yɛtsew dza yɛyɛ biara ho a,
Nyame bɛma hɛn ndzepa a ɔsom
Bo pii ma yɛdze aabɔ N'afɔr.

MHB 927
5 . Old friends, old scenes, will lovelier be,
As more of heaven in each we see:
Some softening gleam of love and prayer
Shall dawn on every cross and care. 
	 ~ 	5 
. 'Nyɛnkofo na mbea adadaw
Sakyer yɛ dɛ heaven ma hɛn;
Dɔ na mpaabɔ kan bi bɛhyerɛn
Hɛn amandzehu biara do.

MHB 927
6 . The trivial round, the common task,
Will furnish all we ought to ask;
Room to deny ourselves; a road
To bring us, daily, nearer God. 
	 ~ 	6 
. Hɛn nkukubɔ, hɛn dwumadzi,
Bɛma hɛn dza yehia nyina;
Yebenya kwan apa hɛnho,
Na ɔama daa yaabɛn Nyame.

MHB 927
7 . Only, O Lord, in thy great love
Fit us for perfect rest above;
And help us, this and every day,
To live more nearly as we pray.   Amen.	 ~ 	7 
. Ewuradze, Wo dɔ kɛse n' mu,
Siesie hɛn ma sor ahomgye n';
Na boa hɛn ndɛ na daa nyina

MHB 928
1 . MORNING comes with light all-cheering,
Shades of night have fled apace;
Sources of light, by Thine appear-ing,
From our minds all darkness chase:
 Thou hast blest us in our sleep;
Through the day direct and keep.
	 ~ 	1 . ANAPA dze enyigye kan ba,
Anago sum eguan kɔ;
Kan ne farbaa, 'ma Wo mpuei no
Mpam sum nyina mfi hɛn adwen mu.
Ɔwo ehyira hɛn wɔ hɛn nda m';
Da yi m' kyerɛ hɛn kwan, kora hɛn.
Yɛnsɔ W'enyi wɔ enyigye m'.  Amen.

MHB 928
2 . Earth refreshed Thy praise is sounding,
All Thy works Thy glory sing;
May our hearts, with love abound-ing,
Gratefully their tribute bring:
Thou hast taught the birds their lays;
Teach our hearts to sing Thy praise.
	 ~ 	2 
. Asaasè a enyan riyi W' ayɛw,
Wo ndwuma nyina tow
W'enyimnyam,
Ma hɛn akoma a dɔ ebu do no,
Mfa hɔn ayɛdze mbra enyigye m'.
Ɔwo akyerɛ nnoma ndwon,
Ma hɛn akoma nnyi W' ayɛw.

MHB 928
3 . All day long to praise Thee help us,
And to strive against all sin;
Finding all our help in Jesus,
Who for us the fight did win:
He was tempted here below,
And doth all our weakness know.
	 ~ 	3 
. Boa hɛn ma yenyi W' ayɛw daa,
Na yɛnko ntsia bɔn nyina;
Yennya hɛn mboa nyina mfi Jesu m',
Ɔno a odzii konyim maa hɛn;
Wɔsɔɔ No hwɛɛ wɔ ase ha,
Na onyim hɛn mberɛwyɛ nyina.

MHB 928
4 . Man goes to his work till evening
Brings again the needed rest;
Grant that we, Thy grace receiving,
May in all we do be blest;
And wherever we may be
Find our joy in pleasing Thee.
	          Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Nyimpa yɛ edwuma du ewimbir a,
Ahomgye a yehia san ba;
Dom hɛn ma yɛngye W'adom no,
Yennya nhyira wɔ dza yɛyɛ m';
Na bea biara a yɛwɔ no,

MHB 929
1 . Come, my soul, thou must be waking;
Now is breaking 
O’er the earth another day;
Come to Him Who made this splendour;
See thou render 
All thy feeble powers can pay.
 	 ~ 	1 . ME kra, bra, soɛr fi wo nda mu;
Adzekyee no
Dze da fofor so reba;
Bra Nyia ɔyɛɛ adze fɛɛfɛw n' nkyɛn,
Hwɛ, fa W'ahom
Kakraba n' nyina tua kaw.
Ndzɛmba nyina edzi petee.

MHB 929
2 . Gladly hail the sun returning; 
Ready burning
Be the incense of thy powers;
For the night is safely ended,
God hath tended 
With His care thy helpless hours.
	 ~ 	2 
. Fa dɛw hyia ewia a ɔreba n';
Ma w' ahoɔdzen
Nduhuam nyɛ krado ntu hua;
'Nafua sum no etwa mu kɔ,
Edaa hatsee n',
Nyankopɔn hwɛɛ wo do sɔnn.

MHB 929
3 . Pray that He may prosper ever
Each endeavour 
When Thine aim is good and true;
But that He may ever thwart thee,
And convert thee,
when thou evil wouldst pursue.
	 ~ 	3 
. Sɔr ma ɔmma dzi mu daa wɔ
Akwan nyina mu;
Ɔmma wo mbɔdzen ndzi mu;
Mbom sɛ epɛ aka bɔn do a,
Ɔnsɛɛ w'akwan,
Nsakyer wo mfa w' nyɛ Nedze.

MHB 929
4 . Think that He thy ways beholdeth;
He unfoldeth 
Every fault that lurks within;
He the hidden shame glossed over
Can discover
And discern each deed of sin.
	 ~ 	4 
. Hu dɛ ɔhwɛ w'akwan mu daa,
Ɔda mfom a
Ɔhyɛ hɛn mu biara edzi;
'Nyimguasedze a wɔakata do n'
Oyi to gua,
Na ɔhwehwɛ bɔn biara mu.

MHB 929
5 . Mayest thou on life’s last morrow,
Free from sorrow, pass away in slumber sweet:
And, released from death’s dark sadness,
Rise in gladness 
That far brighter Sun to greet.
	 ~ 	5 
. Wo nkwa mber da a odzi ekyir n',
'Werɛhow apa n',
Ntwa mu wɔ nda dɛɛdɛw mu;
Na efi owu nyinsu sum mu n',
Aasoɛr dɛw mu
Eekehyia Ewia hyɛnhyɛɛn no.

MHB 929
6 .Our God’s bounteous gifts abuse not,
Light refuse not, but His Spirit’s voice obey;
Thou with Him shalt dwell, beholding
Light unfolding 
All things in unclouded day.	 ~ 	6 
. Mma nnsɛɛ hɛn Nyame akyɛdze,
Na mma mmpow kan,
Mbom tsie No Sunsum Ne ndze;
Enye N' bɛtsena, na ibohu
Mbrɛ kan reda

MHB 93
1 . To the Name of our salvation,
Laud and honour let us pay,
Which for many a generation
Hid in God’s foreknowledge lay,
But with holy exultation
We may sing aloud to-day.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM mma yɛmfa ayɛyi, 'nyidzi, 
Mma hɛn nkwagye dzin pa no,
Dza mfesantsen a etwa m' no 
Wɔdze siee Nyame mu no,
Naaso yɛdzi enyigye krɔnkrɔn
Yɛatsea mu yɛatow ndwom ndɛ.

MHB 93
2 . Jesus is the Name we treasure,
Name beyond what words can tell;
Name of gladness, Name of pleasure,
Ear and heart delighting well;
Name of sweetness passing measure,
Saving us from sin and hell.
	 ~ 	2 . Jesus nye dzin a ɔsom hɛn bo,
Dzin a yenntum nnkyerɛ ase; 
Enyigye dzin, enyika dzin,
Aso na akoma dzi dɛw;
Dzin dɛɛdɛw a ɔbor nsusui,
Ɔgye hɛn fi bɔn na hɛll.

MHB 93
3 . 'Tis the Name for adoration,
Name for songs of victory,
Name for holy meditation
In this vale of misery,
Name for joyful veneration
By the citizens on high.
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔyɛ dzin a wɔdze tonton,
Wɔdze tow konyimdzi ndwom,
Dzin a wɔdze bɔ mpaa krɔnkrɔn 
Wɔ awerɛhow bɔnsa yi m',
Dzin a sorfo dze enyidzi
Kotow som enyigye mu.

MHB 93
4 . 'Tis the Name that whoso preacheth
Speaks like music to the ear;
Who in prayer this Name beseecheth
Sweetest comfort findeth near;
Who its perfect wisdom reacheth
Heavenly joy possesseth here.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔyɛ Dzin a sɛ wɔbɔ a,
Ɔyɛ dɛw ndwom wɔ asomu;
Nyia ɔdze Dzin yi kotow serɛ 
Nya awerɛkyekye dɛɛdɛw;
Nyia odu ne nyansaa mapa ho n'
Nya sor enyigye n' wɔ ha.

MHB 93
5 . Jesus is the Name exalted
Over every other name;
In this name, whene’er assaulted,
We can put our foes to shame:
Strength to them who else had halted,
Eyes to blind, and feet to lame.
	 ~ 	5 . Jesus nye Dzin a wɔakrɔn no 
Wɔ edzin nyinara mu;
Sɛ obi ka hɛn a, Dzin yi mu
Yegu tamfo n'enyim ase;
Ɔhyɛ hɔn a wonntum nnantsew,
Efurafo, na mpakye dzen.

MHB 93
6 . Therefore we in love adoring
This most blessed Name revere,
Holy Jesu, Thee imploring
So to write it in us here
That, hereafter heavenward soaring,
We may sing with Angels there.	 ~ 	6 . Dɛm ntsi yɛdze ɔdɔ tonton
Dzin a wodzi no nyi yi;
Jesus krɔnkrɔn, yɛserɛ Wo,
Kyerɛw W' dzin wɔ hɛn mu wɔ ha,
Ama yefi ha fow sor a,
Yɛnye abɔfo aatow ndwom.	  Amen.

MHB 930
1 . O LORD of life, thy quickening voice
Awakes my morning song;
In gladsome words I would rejoice
That I to thee belong.
 	 ~ 	1 . O NKWA Wura, Wo nkenyan ndze n'
Ma motow anapa ndwom;
Medze enyigye nsɛm bedzi dɛw
Dɛ meyɛ Wodze daa.
Ma mada wɔ Wo mu.

MHB 930
2 . I see thy light, I feel thy wind;
The world, it is thy word;
Whatever wakes my heart and mind,
Thy presence is, my Lord.
	 ~ 	2 
. Muhu Wo kan, metse W' mframa,
Wiadze yi yɛ W'asɛm;
Dza onyan m'akoma na m'adwen nye
W'enyim nhunii, Ewuradze.

MHB 930
3 . Therefore I choose my highest part,
And turn my face to thee;
Therefore I stir my inmost heart
To worship fervently.
	 ~ 	3 
. Dɛm ntsi mefa dza ɔkrɔn no' na,
Medan m'enyi kyerɛ Wo,
Dɛm ntsi mikenyan m'akoma
Dze som ahokeka mu.

MHB 930
4 . Lord, let me live and will this day,
Keep rising from the dead;
Lord, make my spirit good and gay,
Give me my daily bread.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ewuradze, ma mentsena nkwa m' na
Monkɔ do nsoɛr mfi owu m';
Mo Wura, ma m' sunsum enyi ngye,
Ma m' daa daa edziban.

MHB 930
5 . Within my heart speak, Lord, speak on,
My heart alive to keep,
Till comes the night, and, labour done,
In thee I fall asleep.	 ~ 	5 
. Ewuradze, kasa m'akoma m'
Ma onya ahokeka;
Kesi dɛ sum na ɔpon bɛba,

MHB 931
1 . AWAKE, my soul, and with the sun
Thy daily stage of duty run;
Shake off dull sloth, and joyful rise
To pay thy morning sacrifice.
	 ~ 	1 . Me kra, yɛ ntsɛm nye ewia nnyan 
N-si mu ntu wo daadaa kwan;
Sun akwadwer to nkyɛn na soɛr
Fa dɛw bɔ w' anapa afɔr.
Egya, Ɔba, Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn!    Amen.

MHB 931
2 . Redeem Thy misspent moments past,
And live this day as if thy last;
Improve thy talent with due care;
For the great day thyself prepare.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Mber a asɛɛ n' kwa hyɛ ananm'; 
Bɔ bra dɛ ndɛ owu nam kwanm';
Kɔ kan kora akyɛdze a Nyame ama n';
Siesie woho ma atsɛmbu da n'.

MHB 931
3 . Let all Thy converse be sincere,
Thy conscience as the noonday clear;
For God’s all seeing eye surveys
Thy secret thoughts, thy words and ways.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Fa nokwar ka w' asɛm biara; 
Mma wo tsibowa mmbu w' atsɛn da;
Nyame enyi hu mbea nyina do
Hyɛ nsumaam' adwen nye nyɛe nsew;

MHB 931
4 . Wake, and lift up thyself, my heart,
And with the angels bear thy part,
Who all night long unwearied sing
High praise to the eternal King.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Me kra, nyan na ma woho do, 
Fa woho bɔ abɔfo ho,
Na hɔndze, anago nyina
Wɔtow ndwom ma Ɔsor Hen daa.

MHB 931
5 . All praise to thee, who safe hast kept,
And hast refreshed me whilst I slept.
Grant, Lord, when I from death shall wake,
I may of endless life partake.
 	 ~ 	5 
.	Ayɛyi nka W', Ɔwo a esie m' 
Na ama m' ahomgye a ɔwɔ ndam':
Sɛ mifi wum' so minyan a
Ma mo so me nsa nka daa nkwa.

MHB 931
6 . Lord, I my vows to thee renew;
Disperse my sins as morning dew;
guard my first springs of thought and will,
and with thyself my spirit fill.
	 ~ 	6 
. Mobɔ W' anohoba fofor: 
Ma mo bɔn ntwamm' dɛ bɔsu nkɔ,
Woara weɔn m' adwen nsunyiwa,
Fa Wo Sunsum hyɛ me kra ma.

MHB 931
7 . Direct, control, suggest, this day,
All I design or do or say;
That all my powers, with all their might,
In thy sole glory may unite.
	 ~ 	7 
. M' adwen, me nsɛm, nye me ndeyɛɛ- 
Woara dzi ne nyina do ndɛ,
Na dza mowɔ na dza mutum
Nyina aabɔm' wɔ Wo nkamfom'.

MHB 931
8 . Praise God, from whom all blessings flow,
Praise him, all creatures here below,
Praise him above, angelic host,
Praise Father, Son and Holy Ghost.
	 ~ 	8 
. Ayɛyi nka Nyame dɔyɛfo; 
Asaasemba, hom nkamfo No;
Sor abɔfo hom so ntonton N',

MHB 932
1 . O SPLENDOUR of God’s glory bright,
Who bringest forth the light from Light;
O Light, of light the fountain-spring;
O Day, our days illumining;
 	 ~ 	1 . O NYAME, enyimnyam hyɛnn n' ne fɛw,
Ɔwo a edze kan fi kan m' ba;
O kan mu Kan, kan nsunyiwa,
O Da a ɔma nda nyina kan.
Egya n' dzi mu wɔ Ba no mu.

MHB 932
2 . O Thou true Sun ,on us Thy glance
Let fall in royal radiance,
The Spirit’s sanctifying beam
Upon our earthly senses stream.
	 ~ 	2 
. 'Wo nokwar Ewia, ma W'ahentum
Hyerɛn nwanwa n' ngyegye hɛn do;
Sunsum N'ahosan nserɛmɛn no
Nhyerɛn hɛn nyimpasu no do.

MHB 932
3 . The Father, too, our prayers implore,
Father of glory evermore;
The Father of all grace and might,
To banish sin from our delight:
	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛdze hɛn ntotɔserɛ so ba
Daapem enyimnyam Egya N'enyim,
Adom na tum nyina Egya n',
Dɛ ɔmpam hɛn mfi bɔn ho enyigye m'.

MHB 932
4 . To guide whate’er we nobly do,
With love all envy to subdue,
To make ill-fortune turn to fair,
And give us grace our wrongs to bear.
  *    *      *    *	 ~ 	4 
. Ongya hɛn wɔ papayɛ mu,
Ma yɛmfa ɔdɔ nka enyiber nhyɛ,
Ɔmma sasabɔn ndan nyɛ siar,
Na yennya adom ngye hɛn mfom nto m'.

MHB 932
5 . Our mind be in His keeping placed,
Our body true to Him and chaste,
Where only faith her fire shall feed,
To burn the tares of satan’s seed.
 	 ~ 	5 
. Hɛn adwen-nhyɛ Noara Ne nsamu,
Hɛn honam ho ntsew ndzi N' nokwar;
Na gyedzi gya n' na ɔndzɛw hɔ 
Na ɔnhyew Satan no Nworahaban n'.

MHB 932
6 . And Christ to us for food shall be,
From Him our drink that welleth free,
The Spirit’s wine, that  maketh whole,
And, mocking not, exalts the soul.
	 ~ 	6 
. Na Christ bɛyɛ hɛn edziban,
Hɛn nsu fi No hɔ bɛpem kwa,
Sunsum m' wenyin a ɔhyɛ ma n',
Onnsi atwetwe, na ɔma kra n' do.

MHB 932
7 . Rejoicing may this day go hence,
Like virgin dawn our innocence,
Like fiery noon our faith appear,
Nor know the gloom of twilight drear.
	 ~ 	7 
. Ma yɛmfa dɛw nhyɛ da yi ase,
Hɛn nwansann nsɛ anapahema,
Hɛn gyedzi ndzɛw dɛ wigyinae,
Na nkrumsi bi mmba witɔree.

MHB 932
8 . Morn in her rosy car is borne;
Let Him come forth, our perfect Morn,
The Word in God the Father one,
The Father perfect in the Son.
		Amen.	 ~ 	8 
. Anapa-wi epue kɔɔ dɛ nhyiren;
Ma hɛn Anapa-wi mapa n' mbra;
Asɛm no a ɔnye Egya n' yɛ kor n',

MHB 933
1 . AT thy feet, O Christ, we lay
Thine own gift of this new day;
Doubt of what it holds in store
Makes us crave Thine aid the more;
Lest is prove a time of loss,
Mark it, Saviour, with thy Cross.
	 ~ 	1 . O CHRIST, yɛdze W'akyɛdze
Da fofor yi hyɛ Wo nsa;
Dza ɔdze nam no yennyim
Ntsi yehia Wo mboa mbordo;
Agyenkwa, fa W' mbeamudua n'
Hwɛ do, mma ɔannyɛ ɔsɛɛ ber.
Yeeyi W' Christ hɛn Nyame ayɛw.

MHB 933
2 . If it flow on calm and bright,
Be thyself our chief delight;
If it bring unknown distress,
Good is all that thou canst bless;
Only, while its hours begin,
Pray we, keep them clear of sin.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Sɛ ɔyɔ bɔkɔɔ fɛɛfɛw a,
Woara yɛ hɛn dɛw farbaa;
Sɛ ɔdze haw bi nam so a
Dza ihyira do n' nyina yɛ yie;
Dza yɛserɛ nye dɛ ofi
N'ahyɛse n' mma yɛnnyɛ bɔn.

MHB 933
3 . We in part our weakness know,
And in part discern our foe;
Well for us, before Thine eyes
All our danger open lies;
Turn not from us, while we plead
Thy compassions and our need.
	 ~ 	3 
. Yenyim hɛn me m' bi,
Na yenyim hɛn tamfo n' so, 
Ɔdɔɔ so mpo ma hɛn dɛ
W'enyi tua hɛn mbusu nyina;
Yɛreserɛ Wo yi, mma nnkam hɛn
Wo tsema na dza yehia.

MHB 933
4 . Fain would we thy word embrace,
Live each moment on thy grace,
All our selves to thee consign,
Fold up all our wills in Thine,
Think and speak and do and be
Simply that which pleases thee.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ao, nkyɛ yeefua W'asɛm mu,
Yaatsena W'adom no mu daa!
Yeetu hɛnho ahyɛ Wo nsamu
Dze hɛn pɛ nyina ahyɛ W' pɛ ase;
Aadwen, aakasa, aayɛ dza
Ɔbɔsɔ W'enyi ara nko.

MHB 933
5 . Hear us, Lord, and that right soon;
Hear, and grant the choicest boon
That thy love can e’er impart,
Loyal singleness of heart:
So shall this and all our days,
Christ our God, show forth thy praise.	 ~ 	5 
. Ewuradze, tsie hɛn ntsɛm;
Tsie na ma hɛn akyɛdze
Kɛse a Wo dɔ dze ma n',
Nokwar akoma a ɔhwɛ W' nko,
Ma ndɛ na hɛn nkwa nda nyina

MHB 934
1 . ALL praise to Him Who dwells in bliss,
Who made both day and night;
Whose throne is darkness, in the abyss
Of uncreated light.
	 ~ 	1 . AYƐYI nka Nyia ɔtse dɛw mu,
Nyia ɔbɔɔ kan na sum no;
N'ahengua yɛ sum wɔ maa a
Wɔammbɔ no bun no mu.
Na yehyira Siarfo n'.   Amen.

MHB 934
2 . Each thought and deed His piercing eyes
With strictest search survey;
The deepest shades no more disguise
Than the full blaze of day.
	 ~ 	2 
. N'enyi hwira m' paapaa adwen
Na nyɛe biara m' kofee;
Sum kebii mu dze mpo da edzi
N'enyim dɛ ewia ketee.

MHB 934
3 . Whom Thou dost guard, O King of kings,
No evil shall molest;
Under the shadow of Thy wings,
Shall they securely rest.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ahemfo Hen, nyia Ɔwo gya no n',
Mbusu biara nnhaw no;
Wo ntsaban no nwin no ase
Na wɔbɔhom hɔ sɔnn.

MHB 934
4 . Thy angels shall around their beds
 Their constant stations keep;
Thy faith and truth shall shield their heads,
For Thou dost never sleep.
	 ~ 	4 
. W'abɔfoe botwe hɔn mpa ho
Ehyia anweɔn hɔn ndaa m',
Wo gyedzi na nokwar bɔweɔn
Hɔn, 'siandɛ Ɔwo nnda.

MHB 934
5 . May we, with calm and sweet repose,
And heavenly thoughts refreshed,
Our eyelids with the morn’s unclose,
And bless the Ever-blessed. Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Na sɛ ahomgye na adwen papa
Ma yenya foforyɛ a,
Yɛnye adzekyee no tsew hɛn enyi

MHB 935
1 . FATHER Divine, I come to Thee,    
I yield, a captive, to Thy sway, 
That love's gold chain may set me free 
For all the burden of the day.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆSOR Egya , maba Wo hɔ,
Mohwe W'enyim dɛ daduanyi,
Ama Wo dɔ no aagye me
Wɔ da yi mu adzesoa ase.
Na hɛn nda bɛyɛ heaven nda.

MHB 935
2 . I come not to avoid my care,
I come not to desert the strife;
I come to seek new strength to bear,
I fly to find new power for life.
	 ~ 	2 
. Memmba dɛ muruguan m'asodzii,
Memmba dɛ muruguan aperdzi n';
Merebɛgye ahom fofor dze asɔw,
Rohwehwɛ tum fofor abɔ bra.

MHB 935
3 . Many there be that seek Thy face
To meet the hour of parting breath, 
But 'tis for earth I need Thy grace 
Life is more solemn still than death.
	 ~ 	3 
. Pii na wɔhwehwɛ W'enyim pa n'
Dze ekehyiahyia hɔn wu da,
Mbom mihia W'adom wiadze 'i mu,
N-kwasɛm mu yɛ dur kyɛn owu.

MHB 935
4 . When morning gilds the porch of day, 
I feel so vile amid the glow 
That I should faint, didst Thou not say: 
I make thee whiter than the snow.
	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ anapa kan gyegye wimu,
Ne kan yi mo ho fi edzi
Ma mennsɛ bi a, ana nnse dɛ:
Morohoa w' sen sukwankyɛba?

MHB 935
5 . When noontide brings Its work to all, 
I find my task so hard to be, 
That I should sink, didst Thou not call: 
My strength Is perfected in Thee.
	 ~ 	5 
. Sɛ ewia ketee hyɛ modo,
Ma nkukubɔ yɛ dzen dodow
Ma nkyɛ meremem a ennka dɛ;
Wo mu na m'ahoɔdzen dzi mu.

MHB 935
6 . When darkness leads the world to rest, 
The silent burden of the night Would crush, 
but for Thy message blest : 
At evening time there shall be light.
	 ~ 	6 
. Sɛ sum dze wiadze kɔ ndaa mu a,
Kommyɛ a ɔba n' mu yɛ dur ma,
Nkyɛ ɔbɛhaw naaso ese
Kan bɛba 'wimbirbaa mu no.

MHB 935
7 . O may these streams of golden light 
To all my desert way be given, 
Till faith Itself is lost in sight, 
And days on earth be days of heaven.	 ~ 	7 
. O ma kan ne ngyegyee hyɛnn no
Ntow nhyɛ m'akwan nyina do daa,
Kesi dɛ gyedzi nnkotua enyi

MHB 936
1 . O GLADSOME Light, O grace
of God the Father’s face,
the eternal splendour wearing;
celestial, holy, blest,
our Saviour Jesus Christ,
Joyful in thine appearing.
	 ~ 	1 . ENYIGYE, Kan Nyame
Egya n' N'enyim adom,
Ewuna onnyiewiei ahoɔfɛw;
Ɔsornyi, krɔnn, siarfo,
Hɛn Gyefo Jesus Christ,
Yɛdze dɛw hwɛ Wo mpuei kwan.
Wobohuhuor Wo daa daa.

MHB 936
2 . Now, ere day fadeth quite,
We see the evening light,
Our wonted hymn outpouring;
Father of might unknown,
Thee, his incarnate Son,
And Holy Spirit adoring.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ansaana wimu bomua
Yehu ewimbir kan n',
Yehyia tow hɛn ndowm dɛɛdɛw;
Dze kamfo tum Egya,
Ɔwo Ne Ba a ɔwoo n' n',
Na Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn no so.

MHB 936
3 . To thee of right belongs
All praise of holy songs,
O Son of God, Life-giver;
Thee, therefore, O Most High,
The world doth glorify,
And shall exalt for ever.	 ~ 	3 
. Wo nko na ayɛyi ndwom
Krɔnkrɔn nyina yɛ Wodze,
O Nyame Ba, nkwa Mafo,
Dɛm ntsi Ɔwo sorsornyi,
Wiadze hyɛ Wo enyimnyam,

MHB 937
1 . HAIL, gladdening Light, of his 
      pure glory poured
Who is the immortal Father, 
      heavenly, blest,
Holiest of holies, Jesus Christ 
      our Lord.
Now we are come to the sun’s 
      hour of rest,
	 ~ 	1 . WONHUA N'enyimnyam kan a ɔma akomatɔm'!
Ɔno a ɔyɛ bɛkyebo Egya siarfo,
Krɔnkrɔn mu, Krɔnkrɔn Jesus Christ hɛn Wura
Afei yɛaba 'wimbir ahomgye ber mu.
Dɛm ntsi W'enyimnyam ahyɛ wiadze nyina ma.

MHB 937
2 . The lights of evening round us 
      shine,
We hymn the Father, Son, and Holy 
     Spirit divine.
Worthiest art thou at all times 
     to be sung
With undefiled tongue,
Son of our God, giver of life, alone:
Therefore in all the world thy 
    glories, Lord, they own.	 ~ 	2 
. Ewimbir nkandzea hyerɛn hɛn do,
Yɛtow Egya na Ɔba nye Sunsum 
Krɔnkrɔn n' ndwom,
Efata dɛ daa yɛdze gyirama krɔnn
Tow ndwom kamfo Wo',
Ɔwo hɛn Nyankopɔn Ba nkwa Mafo;

MHB 938
1 . FATHER, in high heaven dwelling,
May our evening song be telling
Of thy mercy large and free;
Through the day thy love hath fed us,
Through the day thy care hath led us,
With divinest charity.
 	 ~ 	1 . EGYA a etse sorsor wɔ wimu
Ma hɛn ewimbir ndwom a yɛrotow yi
Nyi W' mbɔbɔrhu kɛse n' nkyerɛ:
Wo dɔ n'anyɛn hɛn ndɛ da yi,
Wo nhwɛdo dze sor ayamuyie pii
Edzi hɛn enyim hɛn bra m'.
Ɔwo Ɔkorsa daa siarfo.  Amen.

MHB 938
2 . This day’s sins, O pardon, Saviour!
Evil thoughts, perverse behaviour,
Envy, pride and vanity;
From the world, the flesh, deliver,
Save us now, and save us ever,
O thou Lamb of Calvary!
 	 ~ 	2 
. Gyefo, fa ndɛ bɔn nyina kyɛ,
Adwembɔn, nyɛe basabasa,
Enyiber, ntsɛn na ahantan;
O Ɔwo Calvary Eguambaa,
Yi hɛn fi wiadze na honam m',
Gye hɛn nkwa a sesei na daa.

MHB 938
3 . From enticements of the devil,
From the might of spirits evil,
Be our shield and panoply;
Let thy power this night defend us,
And a heavenly peace attend us,
And angelic company.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛ hɛn akokyɛm na hɛn akontar,
Tsia abɔnsam ndaadaa ɔnye
Esunsum bɔn nyina hɔn tum;
Wo tum nwowaw hɛn anafua yi
Na ma sor asomdwee nka hɛn
Na abɔfo so nsian hɛn do.

MHB 938
4 . Whilst the night-dews are distilling,
Holy Ghost, each heart be filling
With thine own serenity;
Softly let our eyes be closing,
Loving souls on thee reposing,
Ever-blessed Trinity.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Anafua bɔw rososɔ yi,
Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, ma Wo kommyɛ n'
Nhyɛ akoma biara mu,
Ma yemmua hɛn enyi bɔkɔɔ,
Na ma hɛn akra nhom Wo nko mu,

MHB 939
1 . THE sun is sinking fast,
The daylight dies;
Let love awake, and pay
Her evening sacrifice.
 	 ~ 	1 . EWIA rokɔtɔ ntsɛm,
Adze resa;
Ma dɔ nda no ho edzi
Mbɔ n'ewimbir afɔr.
Wo so yɛ medze daa.   Amen.

MHB 939
2 . As Christ upon the cross
His head inclined,
And to his Father’s hands
His parting soul resigned;
 	 ~ 	2 
. Christ sɛɛn mbeamudua no do n',
Ɔbɔɔ N' tsir adze,
Na ɔdze Ne kra hyɛɛ
N'Egya Ne nsamu yie.

MHB 939
3 . So now herself my soul
Would wholly give
Into his sacred charge
In whom all spirits live;
 	 ~ 	3 
. Dɛm ara na m' kra so
Dze noho nyina
Hyɛ Krɔnkrɔnnyi Ne nsa,
Nyia esunsum nyina tse n' mu.

MHB 939
4 . So now beneath his eye
Would calmly rest,
Without a wish or thought
Abiding in the breast;
 	 ~ 	4 
. Afei Egya N'enyim
Na m'bɔhom komm,
Monnkɔdwen hweeara ho,
Ber a meda No bomu n'.

MHB 939
5 . Save that his will be done,
Whate’er betide;
Dead to herself, and dead
In him to all beside.
 	 ~ 	5 
. Ne pɛ na ɔnyɛ hɔ,
Mbrɛ obesi bia 'a;
Oewu ama Noho,
Ndzɛmba nyina bɛn No.

MHB 939
6 . Thus would I live: yet now
Not I, but he,
In all his power and love,
Henceforth alive in me.
 	 ~ 	6 
. Dɛm na m'bɛtsena ase
Na nnyɛ emi a,
No tum no dɔ nyina
Tse ase mo mu ndɛ.

MHB 939
7 . One sacred Trinity,
One Lord divine,
Thine may I ever be,
And thou for ever mine.   Amen.	 ~ 	7 
. Ɔkorsa Krɔnkrɔn kor,
Ewuradze kor,
Mebɛyɛ Wodze daa,

MHB 94
1 . NONE  other Lamb, none other Name,
None other, hope in heaven or earth or sea,
None other hiding-place from guilt and shame,
None beside Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . Eguambaa bi, nkwagye dzin bi, 
Enyidar bi nnyi sor anaa ase,
Fɔdzi nye fɛr ho guansumabew bi nnyi,
Dɛ Wo nkotoo.

MHB 94
2 . My faith burns low, my hope burns low;
Only my heart’s desire cries out in me,
By the deep thunder of its want and woe,
Cries out to Thee.
	 ~ 	2 . Me gyedzi suar, m' enyidar suar, 
M' akoma ne hia nye no mbusu nko
Na ɔbɔ mu dɛ senaman wɔ mo mu
Kekam' frɛ Wo.

MHB 94
3 . Lord, Thou art life, though I be dead;
Love’s fire Thou art, however cold I be:
Nor heaven have I, nor place to lay my head,
Nor home, but Thee.	 ~ 	3 . Kaansa muwu a, Ɔwo yɛ nkwa; 
Meyɛ nwim mpo a, mo Wura, dɔ ne gya nye W'
Minnyi etsidaa, minnyi fie biara so
Gyedɛ Woara.

MHB 940
1 . THE radiant morn hath passed away,
And spent too soon her golden store;
The shadows of departing day
Creep on once more.
	 ~ 	1 . Anapawi hyɛnhyɛnn n' etwam' 
Ɔahwer ne hyɛnhyɛnn nyina ntsɛm
Adzesaa no sunsuma retsen
Prɛko so bio.
Yɛ abɔso Hen.

MHB 940
2 . Our life is but an autumn day,
Its glorious noon how quickly past!
Lead us, O Christ, thou living Way,
Safe home at last.
 	 ~ 	2  
. Hɛn nkwa tse dɛ ɔpɛber da 
N' enyimnyam wi n' twam' ntsɛmara
Gya hɛn, O Christ, 'Wo a eyɛ nkwa,
Kodu fie sɔnn.

MHB 940
3 . O by thy soul-inspiring grace
Uplift our hearts to realms on high;
Help us to look to that bright place
Beyond the sky,
 	 ~ 	3 
. Fa W' adom a ɔhyɛ kra nkuran n' 
Twe hɛn 'koma kɔ sor man ho;
Boa hɛn ma yɛmfa hɛn enyi
Ntsim sor man n' do.

MHB 940
4 . Where light and life and joy and peace
In undivided empire reign,
And thronging angels never cease
Their deathless strain;
	 ~ 	4 
. Mbrɛ kan na dɛw na asomdwee 
Bɔ mu yɛ kor dzi hen wɔ hɔ n',
Nna sor abɔfo nngyaa hɔn ndwom
Tow ara da n'.

MHB 940
5 . Where saints are clothed in spotless white,
And evening shadows never fall,
Where thou, eternal Light of Light
Art Lord of all.	 ~ 	5 
. Mbrɛ ahotsewfo hyɛ ntar fitaa n' 
Na ewimbir sunsuma ngye hɔ da n'
Mbrɛ 'Wo ɔdomankoma Kan mu kan

MHB 941
1 . LORD Jesus, in the days of old
Two walked with thee in waning light;
And love’s blind instinct made them bold
To crave thy presence through the night.
As night descends, we too would pray:
O leave us not at close of day!
 	 ~ 	1 . OWURA Jesus, tsetsebaado
Beenu nye W' nantseew 'wimbir bi,
Dɔ nwanwa mapa hyɛɛ hɔn ndam
Ma wɔserɛɛ W' dɛ nye hɔn ntsena.
Adze resa yi hɛn so serɛ W'
Dɛ mma nngyaa hɛn witɔree yi.
Wo nkyɛn ahwɛ W', enya ahomka.

MHB 941
2 . Did not their hearts within them burn?
And, though their Lord they failed to know,
Did not their spirits inly yearn?
They could not let the Stranger go.
Much more must we who know thee pray:
O leave us not at close of day!
	 ~ 	2 
. Ana hɔn akoma ammfram?
Na kaansa woennhu hɔn Wura mpo a,
Hɔn esunsum ho ammper hɔn?
Woenntum amma Hɔho n' annkɔ.
Hɛn a yenyim Wo sɔr mbordo
Dɛ mma nngyaa hɛn da n'ewiei yi.

MHB 941
3 . Perchance we have not always wist
Who has been with us by the way;
Amid day’s uproar we have missed
Some word that thou hast had to say.
In silent night, O Saviour dear,
We would not fail thy voice to hear.
	 ~ 	3 
. Bi a hɛn so mber pii no yennhu
Nyia ɔnye hɛn anantsew kwan do;
Ɔbra ne begyabegyayɛ m'
Yɛanntse dza ewɔ ka kyerɛ hɛn
Anafua kɔnkɔnnkɔn no mu,
Dɔfo Ewuradze, yɛbɛtse W' ndze.

MHB 941
4 . Day is far spent, and night is nigh;
Stay with us, Saviour, through the night;
Talk with us, touch us tenderly,
Lead us to peace, to rest, to light;
Dispel our darkness with thy face,
Radiant with resurrection grace.
	 ~ 	4 
. Wi asen, adzesaa abɛn;
Agyenkwa, 'nye hɛn ntsena anafua 'i;
'Nye hɛn nkasa, fa W' nsa ka hɛn,
Gya hɛn kɔ asomdwee na kan mu;
W'enyim a wusoɛr adom wɔ mu n'
Mfa ne hyerɛn no mpam hɛn sum.

MHB 941
5 . Nor this night only, blessed Lord,
We, every day and every hour,
Would walk with thee Emmaus-ward
To hear thy voice of love and power;
And every night would by thy side
Look, listen, and be satisfied.	 ~ 	5 
. Owura siarfo, nnyɛ anafua 'i nko,
Yɛnye Wo bɛnantsew daa daa,
Abɔ namɔn akɔ Emmaus
Eketsie Wo dɔ na tum ndze n',
Na anafua biara yɛatsena

MHB 942
1 . SUN of my soul, thou Saviour dear,
It is not night if thou be near:
O may no earth-born cloud arise
To hide thee from thy servant’s eyes.
	 ~ 	1 . Gyefo dɔfo, me kra n' ewia, 
Ɔwo 'bɛn a, adze nnsa da;
O mma mununkum biara mmfi fam'
Nn-suma W' mmfi W' akowaa enyiwam'!
Wɔ sorsor Wo dɔ no bun mu.

MHB 942
2 . When the soft dews of kindly sleep
My wearied eyelids gently steep,
Be my last thought, how sweet to rest
For ever on my Saviour’s breast.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ber a enyikom aka me 
Dɛ bɔsu a ogu asaase do,
N-da refa m' a, m' adwen nyɛ
Dɛ Christ bom' nda n' ɔbɛyɛ dɛw!

MHB 942
3 . Abide with me from morn till eve,
For without thee I cannot live;
Abide with me when night is nigh,
For without thee I dare not die.
	 ~ 	3 
. Bra begya m' kwan fi ahema, 
Na innyi hɔ a, munntum mmbɔ bra;
Adze sa so a nye me bɛtsena:
Musuro owu sɛ innyi hɔ a.

MHB 942
4 . If some poor wandering child of thine
Have spurned to-day the voice divine,
Now, Lord, the gracious work begin;
Let him no more lie down in sin.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Wo ba bi a ɔafom kwan wɔ hɔ a 
N-dɛ so oetsia W' asɛm do a,
Adom dwuma n' nhyɛ ase ber yim';
Mma ɔnnda ho ara nnda bɔn mu.

MHB 942
5 . Watch by the sick; enrich the poor
With blessings from thy boundless store;
Be every mourner’s sleep to-night
Like infant’s slumbers, pure and light.
	 ~ 	5 
. Hwɛ ayarfo do; ma ehiafo 
Nhyira a ofi W' adom mbordo;
Hɔn a awerɛhow atɔ hɔn do,
Wɔnda dɛ mbɔtoaba berɛww.

MHB 942
6 . Come near and bless us when we wake,
Ere through the world our way we take;
Till in the ocean of thy love
We lose ourselves in heaven above.	 ~ 	6 
. Yenyan a, bra na behyira hɛn 
Ansaana yeesim' etu kwan,
Ekodu dɛ hɛn nkwa yi ayew

MHB 943
1 . GLORY to thee, my God, this night
for all the blessings of the light;
keep me, O keep me, King of Kings,
beneath thy own almighty wings.
	 ~ 	1 . 'NYIMNYAM nka Wo, me Nyankopɔn,
Wɔ da yi mu nhyira no ntsi;
Ahemfo Hen, fa m' sie anafua 'i
Wo ntsaban kɛse no ase.
'Ba na Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn n' ayɛw.

MHB 943
2 . Forgive me, Lord, for thy dear Son,
the ill that I this day have done,
that with the world, myself, and thee,
I, ere I sleep, at peace may be.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewuradze, Wo dɔ Ba no ntsi
Fa da yi mu mo mfom kyɛ me,
Ama meenya asomdwee kɛse 
Ber a morokɔ ndaa mu yi.

MHB 943
3 . Teach me to live, that I may dread
the grave as little as my bed;
teach me to die, that so I may
rise glorious at the aweful day.
	 ~ 	3 
. Kyerɛ me ma mombɔ bra dɛ
Munnsuro owu kwan biara do;
Kyerɛ me owu pa n'akwan,
Ma ewiei no meenyan dɛw mu.

MHB 943
4 . O may my soul on thee repose,
and may sweet sleep mine eyelids close,
sleep that may me more vigorous make
to serve my God when I awake.
	 ~ 	4 
. O ma me kra nhom wɔ Wo mu,
Na ma nda pa ndeda me yie,
Ma onsiesie mo honandua
Ma maasom me Nyankopɔn yie.

MHB 943
5 . If in the right I sleepless lie,
My soul with heavenly thoughts supply;
Let no ill dreams disturb my rest,
No powers of darkness me molest.
	 ~ 	5 
. Sɛ anafua yi menntum annda a,
Fa adwen pa fi sor dwir me kra;
Mma mma adaaso bɔn bi nnhaw me,
Na sum mu etumfo bi nntsiw me.

MHB 943
6 . O may I always ready stand
With my lamp burning in my hand;
May I in sight of heaven rejoice,
Whene’er I hear the Bridegroom’s voice.
	 ~ 	6 
. O ma menyɛ krado daa daa,
Dɛ me kandzea so dze me nsamu;
Muhu sor a, ma m'enyi ngye,
Ber a m'bɛtse Kumfor n' Ne ndze n'.

MHB 943
7 . All praise to thee in light arrayed,
Who light Thy dwelling-place hast made;
A boundless ocean of bright beams
From Thy all-glorious Godhead streams.
 	 ~ 	7 
. Ayɛyi nka Wo, kan Wura,
Ɔwo a ayɛ kan Wo tsenabea;
Ngyegyee hyɛnhyɛn pem fi Wo nkyɛn,
Enyimnyam nyina Nyame Tsir no.

MHB 943
8 . Praise God, from whom all blessings flow,
praise him, all creatures here below,
praise him above, angelic host,
praise Father, Son, and Holy Ghost. Amen.	 ~ 	8 
. Wonyi Nyame domfo n' ayɛw,
Asaase mba, hom nyi N' ayɛw,
Ɔsor mba hom so nyi Egya,

MHB 944
1 . NOW the day is over, 
Night is drawing nigh. 
Shadows of the evening 
Steal across the sky. 
	 ~ 	1 . Adze resa ampa 
Ewimbir aba,
Na enyimkan rudum,
Ma wim' reyɛ sum.
Daa, hɛn Nyankopɔn.   Amen.

MHB 944
2 . Now the darkness gathers,
Stars their watches keep. 
Birds and beasts and flowers 
Soon will be asleep. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Isum rehyɛ ampa, 
Nworaba rupuepue,
Nnoma, mbowa nye nhyiren
Bɛdeda sesei.

MHB 944
3 . Jesus, give the weary 
Calm and sweet repose; 
With Thy tenderest blessing 
May their eyelids close. 
	 ~ 	3  
. Jesus, fa Wo nsa to 
Hɔn a wɔaberɛ do;
Na fa Wo nhyira pa
Dom hɔn ma wɔnda.

MHB 944
4 . Grant to little children 
Visions bright of Thee; 
Guard the sailors tossing 
On the angry sea. 
	 ~ 	4  
. Dom mbofra nkakraba 
Ma wonhu Wo daa;
Hɔn a wɔwɔ po do,
Woara hwɛ hɔn do.

MHB 944
5 . Comfort every Sufferer 
Watching late in pain; 
Those who plan some evil
From their sin restrain. 
 	 ~ 	5 
. Hɔn so a wonntum nnda, 
Hyɛ hɔn dzen daa daa;
Hɔn a wɔdwendwen bɔn,
Dan hɔn na twe hɔn.

MHB 944
6 . Through the long night-watches 
May Thine angels spread 
Their White Wings above me. 
Watching round my bed. 
	 ~ 	6 
. W' abɔfo mpa m' mbusu 
Anago yi mu,
Wɔmfa hɔn atsaban
M-bɔ mo ho ban.

MHB 944
7 . When the morning wakens. 
Then may I arise 
Pure and fresh and sinless 
In Thy holy eyes. 
 	 ~ 	7 
. Ao, fa mo bɔn kyɛ me, 
Na ma adze nkye me
Dɛ m' akoma mu tsen
Na mo ho yɛ dzen.

MHB 944
8 . Glory to the Father, 
Glory to the Son, 
And to Thee blest Spirit. 
Whilst all ages run.    Amen. 	 ~ 	8 
. Enyimnyam nka Egya, 
Enyimnyam nka Ba,
Nye 'Wo, Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn,

MHB 945
1 . THE night is come, wherein at last we rest;
God order this and all things for the best:
Beneath His blessing fearless we may lie.
	Since He is nigh.
	 ~ 	1 . ANAFUA a yɛdze da hom n' aba bio,
Nyankopɔn mma ndzɛmba nyina nyɛ yie:
Yɛnda Ne nhyira a suro nnyi m' no ase,
' Siandɛ ɔbɛn hɛn.
Sesei na daa.   Amen.

MHB 945
2 . Drive evil thoughts and spirits far away;
Master, watch o’er us till the dawn-ing day,
Body and soul alike from harm de-fend,
	Thine angel send.
	 ~ 	2 
. Pam adwembɔn na sunsum bɔn kɔ ekyir;
Hɛn Wura, weɔn hɛn kesi adzekyee,
Bɔ honam na kra ho ban tsia mbusu,
Soma W'abɔfoe n'.

MHB 945
3 . Let holy prayers and thoughts our latest be;
Let us awake with joy still close to Thee,
In all things serve Thee, in each deed and thought
	Thy praise be sought.
	 ~ 	3 
. Tsew hɛn mpaabɔ na hɛn adwendwen ho,
Ma yennyan dɛw mu dɛ yɛwɔ Wo nkyɛn,
Yɛnsom Wo ndzɛmba nyina mu na adwen m'
Yenyi W' ayɛw.

MHB 945
4 . Give to the sick as Thy beloved sleep,
And help the captive, comfort those who weep,
Care for the widows’ and the orphans’ woe,
	Keep far our foe.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ma ayarfo Woara Wo nda pa no,
Dom adaduafo, fua nyinsukyifo;
Hwɛ ekunafo na ngyanka hɔn hia,
Ka tamfo n' gu.

MHB 945
5 . For we have none on whom for  help to call
Save Thee, O God in heaven, who car’st for all,
And wilt forsake them never, day or night,
Who love Thee right.
	 ~ 	5 
. 'Siandɛ yennyi boafo koraa
Ka Wo sor Nyankopɔn hɛn Hwɛfo n' ho;
Ɔwo nnkɛpa W'adɔfo dabiara,
Kan o, sum o.

MHB 945
6 . Father, Thy name be praised, Thy kingdom come,
Thy will be wrought as in our heavenly home;
Keep us in life, forgive our sins, deliver
	Us now and ever.     Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Han Egya, ayɛyi nka W', W'ahendzi mbra,
Wɔnyɛ Wo pɛ Wɔ ha dɛ sor ara;
Kora hɛn do, fa hɛn bɔn kyɛ hɛn, gye hɛn,

MHB 946
1 . NOW all the woods are sleeping,
And night and stillness creeping
O’er city, man, and beast;
But thou, my heart, awake thee,
To prayer awhile betake thee,
And praise thy Maker ere thou rest.
	 ~ 	1 . AFEI ndua nyina ada
Na sum na fooyɛ repram
Nkurow na mbowa do;
Na 'wo, m'akoma dze, nyan
Na bɔ mpaa yie aber yi,
Yi w' Bɔfo ayɛw ansaana ada.
Na wɔabɔ hom ho ban daa daa.

MHB 946
2 . The last faint beam is going,
The golden stars are glowing
In yonder dark-blue deep;
And such the glory given
When called of God to heaven,
On earth no more we pine and weep.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ewia kan a aka n' rokɔ,
Na nworaba rupuepue
Wɔ wimu na ekyirkyir;
Na sɛ wɔfrɛ w' kɔ sor a,
Nyame mma w' enyimnyam ma
Innsi nkrum bio wɔ wiadze ha.

MHB 946
3 . Now thought and labour ceases,
For night the tired releases
And bids sweet rest begin:
My heart, there comes a morrow
Shall set thee free from sorrow
And all the dreary toil of sin.
	 ~ 	3 
. Adwendwen na berɛ bɔ adze,
'Siandɛ adzesaa gya abrɛfo
Na ɔma hɔn ahomgye :
M'akoma, ber bi reba a
Ibefi awerɛhow na
Bɔn ho nkowaasom nyina mu.

MHB 946
4 . My Jesus, stay Thou by me,
And let no foe come nigh me,
Safe sheltered by Thy wing;
But would the foe alarm me,
O let him never harm me,
But still Thine angels round me sing!
	 ~ 	4 
. Me Jesus, tsena me nkyɛn,
Na mma 'tamfo bi mmbɛn me,
Wo ntsaban ase m' wɔ nkwa;
Sɛ 'tamfo no bɔ m' mpuw a,
Mma ɔnnhaw m' kwan biara do,
Ma W'abɔfoe ntow ndwom ntwa m' ho.

MHB 946
5 . My loved ones, rest securely,
From every peril surely
Our God will guard your heads;
And happy slumbers send you,
And bid His hosts attend you,
And golden armed watched o’er your beds.	 ~ 	5 
. M'adɔfo, hom ho ndwe hom,
Hɛn Nyankopɔn bɛgye hom
Efi mbusu nyina m',
Na ɔama hom ahomgye,
Na N'abɔfoe aweɔn hom,

MHB 947
1 . ERE  I sleep, for every favour 
This day showed By my God, 
I will bless my saviour. 
	 ~ 	1 . Ansaana m' bɛda n', yie biara 
Me Nyame
Ayɛ m' ndɛ,
M' bɛda m' Agyenkwa ase.
Enyansafo no ho.

MHB 947
2 . O my Lord, what shall I render  
To Thy name,  still the same,
Merciful and tender? 
 	 ~ 	2 
. Mo Wura, memfa ndaase bɛn mma 
Wo dzin a
Ɔnnsesa n'
Mbɔbɔrhufo, dɔfo?

MHB 947
3 . Thou hast ordered all my goings,
In Thy name 
Heard me pray
Sanctified my doings.
 	 ~ 	3  
. M' ekyinkyin nyinam' 'Wo na 'gya m' 
Wɔ Wo kwanm',
Tsiee m' asɔr,
Saan me nyɛe nyina ho.

MHB 947
4 . Leave me not, but ever love me
Let Thy peace  
Be my bliss 
Till Thou  hence remove me.
 	 ~ 	4 
. Mma nndan me nngya na dɔ me daa; 
W' Asomdwee
Nyɛ me nhyira,
Nkodu dɛ 'beyi me ha.

MHB 947
5 . Thou my rock, my guard my tower
Safely keep, 
While I sleep
Me, with all Thy power.
 	 ~ 	5 
. Mo botan, mo weɔmfo, m' aban, 
Kora m' sɔnn,
Ber a mada,
Fa Wo tum nyinara.

MHB 947
6 . So, whene’er in death I slumber
Let me rise 
With the  wise
Counted in their number.	 ~ 	6  
. Meka m' enyi gu do wum' a, 
Ma monsoɛr
Dɛ meka

MHB 948
1 . ABIDE with me; fast falls the eventide;
The darkness deepens; Lord with me abide.
When other helpers fail and comforts flee,
Help of the helpless, O abide with me.
	 ~ 	1 . Enye me ntsena! onwim ano rotɔ; 
Sum regye, Ewuradze, nye me ntsena!
Aboafo pa, na akyekyewerɛfo sa a,
Onnyibi-ne-bi-a-ɔba, enye m' ntsena!
N-kwam' o, owum' o, enye me ntsena!

MHB 948
2 . Swift to its close ebbs out life’s little day;
Earth’s joys grow dim; its glories pass away;
Change and decay in all around I see;
O Thou who changest not, abide with me.
	 ~ 	2 
. N-kwa da ketseaba yi rotwe kɔ; 
Wiadze dɛw repa; n' enyimnyam resen;
N-sakyer na ɔsɛɛ nko ara na muhu;
Ao, 'Wo a ennsakyer da, enye me ntsena.

MHB 948
3 . I need Thy presence every passing hour.
What but Thy grace can foil the tempter’s power?
Who, like Thyself, my guide and stay can be?
Through cloud and sunshine, Lord, abide with me.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mihia Wo me nkyɛn aber nyinara, 
W' adom n-ko na ɔka siamfo hyɛ;
Gyafo nye Taafo wɔ hen ka Wo ho?
Isum o, ekan o, enye me ntsena.

MHB 948
4 . I fear no foe, with Thee at hand to bless;
Ills have no weight, and tears no bitterness.
Where is death’s sting? Where, grave, thy victory?
I triumph still, if Thou abide with me.
	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ menye Wo nam a, munnsuro hwee; 
Ɔyaw nnyɛ durdur, na nyinsu nnyɛ wen:
Owu, wo bɔr na wo konyim wɔ hen?
Mo konyim wɔ do daa, sɛ 'Wo nye m' tse a.

MHB 948
5 . Hold Thou Thy cross before my closing eyes;
Shine through the gloom and point me to the skies.
Heaven’s morning breaks, and earth’s vain shadows flee;
In life, in death, O Lord, abide with me!	 ~ 	5 
. Murumua m' enyi a, yi Wo mbeamudua n' kyerɛ m'; 
Hyerɛn wɔ sum mu, kyerɛ m' ɔsor do kwan;
Ɔsor rehyerɛn, wiadze kusuww repa;

MHB 949
1 . BEHOLD us, Lord, a little space
From daily tasks set free,
And met within this holy place
To rest awhile with thee.
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, hwɛ, mber tsiabaa bi 
Yefi daa ɔberɛ mu,
Behyia wɔ Wo krɔnkrɔn-bea ha,
Bɔhom kakra, Wo nkyɛn.
Nye edwuma yɛ adze kor.

MHB 949
2 . Around us rolls the ceaseless tide
Of business, toil, and care,
And scarcely can we turn aside
For one brief hour of prayer.
	 ~ 	2 
. Edwuma, ɔberɛ na atseetsee
Twa hɛn ho hyia daa daa,
Na ɔyɛ dzen ma hɛn dodow;
Yennya mber mpo mmbɔ mpaa.

MHB 949
3 . Yet these are not the only walls
Wherein thou may’st be sought;
On homeliest work thy blessing falls,
In truth and patience wrought.
	 ~ 	3 
. Naaso nnyɛ ha nko nye bea a
Wɔdze hwehwɛ Wo wɔ;
Wo nhyira gu famu famu dwuma a
Wodzi n' nokwar m' so do.

MHB 949
4 . Thine is the loom, the forge, the mart,
The wealth of land and sea,
The worlds of science and of art,
Revealed and ruled by thee.
	 ~ 	4 
. Dwumadze ahorow nyina,
Nsaase pa m' 'gyapadze,
'Bɔdze ho nyimdzee na edwindze
Da Wo nhwɛdo edzi.

MHB 949
5 . Then let us prove our heavenly birth
In all we do and know,
And claim the kingdom of the earth
For thee, and not thy foe.
 	 ~ 	5 
. Dɛm a yɛnda hɛn sor awoo
Edzi dza yɛyɛ nyina m',
Na yɛmper wiadze ahendzi mma W'
Na nnyɛ W'atamfo no a.

MHB 949
6 . Work shall be prayer, if all be wrought
As thou wouldst have it done,
And prayer, by thee inspired and taught,
Itself with work be one.	 ~ 	6 
. Dwuma a wodzi no Wo pɛ do n'
Bɛyɛ dɛ mpaabɔ daa,
Na mpaabɔ a Woara akyerɛ n'

MHB 95
1 . JESUS, Sun and Shield art Thou,
Sun and Shield for ever.
Never canst Thou cease to shine,
Cease to guard us, never.
Cheer our steps as on we go,
Come between us and the foe.
	 ~ 	1 . JESUS, eyɛ Ewia na Kyɛm, 
Kyɛm na Ewia afebɔɔ, 
Innkegyaa dɛ ehyerɛn da, 
Innkegyaa hɛn nweɔn da. 
Sɛ yɛrokɔ a pia hɛn, 
Gye hɛn fi atamfo nsamu.

MHB 95
2 . Jesus, Bread and Wine art Thou,
Wine and Bread for ever.
Never canst Thou cease to feed
Or refresh us, never.
Feed us still on bread divine,
Drink we still of heavenly wine.
	 ~ 	2 . Jesus, 'yɛ Paanoo na Nsa, 
Paanoo na Nsa afebɔɔ,
Innkegyaa dɛ 'nyɛn hɛn daa,
Na ehyɛ hɛn dzen daa.
Kɔ do ma hɛn sor paanoo, 
Yɛnkɔ do nnom sor n-sa.

MHB 95
3 . Jesus, Love and life art Thou,
Life and Love for ever.
Ne’er to quicken shalt Thou cease,
Or to love us, never.
All of life and love we need
Is in Thee, in Thee indeed.
	 ~ 	3 . Jesus eyɛ Dɔ na Nkwa, 
Nkwa na ɔdɔ afebɔɔ.
Innkegyaa dɛ ikenyan hɛn,
Innkegyaa dɛ edɔ hɛn.
N-kwa na ɔdɔ a yehia nyina
Wɔ Wo mu, wɔ Wo mu ampa.

MHB 95
4 . Jesus, Peace and Joy art Thou,
Joy and Peace for ever.
Joy that fades not, changes  not,
Peace that leaves us never.
Joy and peace we have in Thee,
Now and through eternity.
	 ~ 	4 . Jesus yɛ Asomdwee na Dɛw,
Dɛw na Asomdwee afebɔɔ.
Dɛw a ɔmmpa, ɔnnsesa,
Asomdwee a onngyaa hɛn.
Yɛwɔ W' mu dɛw na asomdwee, 
Seseiara na afebɔɔ.

MHB 95
5 . Jesus, Song and Strength art Thou,
Strength and Song for ever.
Strength that never can decay,
Song that ceaseth never.
Still to us this strength and song,
Through eternal days prolong.	 ~ 	5 . Jesus yɛ Ndwom na Ahoɔdzen,
Ndwom na Ahoɔdzen afebɔɔ.
Ahoɔdzen a ɔnnsa da,
Ndwom a ɔmmbɔ adze da,
Ma ahoɔdzen na ndwom yi
N-hyɛ hɛn dzen daa nyina.

MHB 950
1 . BLEST are the pure in heart,
For they shall see our God;
The secret of the Lord is theirs,
Their soul is Christ’s abode.
	 ~ 	1 . Nhyira nka akomamutsewfo, 
Wobohu hɛn Nyame;
Nyame esumadze yɛ hɔndze
Hɛn kra yɛ Christ ne fi.
Asɔrfi a ɔsɛ Wo.

MHB 950
2 . The Lord, who left the sky
Our life and peace to bring,
And dwelt in lowliness with men,
Their pattern and their King;
	 ~ 	2  
. Ewuradze a ofii sor 
Brɛɛ hɛn nkwa na asomdwee,
Nye nyimpa bɛtsenaa botooyɛm',
Yɛɛ Fasusu na Hen-

MHB 950
3 . Still to the lowly soul
He doth himself impart,
And for his dwelling and his throne
Chooseth the pure in heart.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔda ho dze Noho 
Ma ɔkra brɛfo no;
Na ɔdze N' ahengua no ma
Akoma a no mu tsew.

MHB 950
4 . Lord, we thy presence seek;
may ours this blessing be;
give us a pure and lowly heart,
a temple meet for thee.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Ewuradze, yɛrohwehwɛ W' 
Ma nhyira yi nyɛ hɛndze.
Ma hɛn akoma a ɔbotow,

MHB 951
1 . THE DAY is past and over; 
All thanks, O Lord, to Thee;
We pray Thee now that sinless
The hours of dark may be: 
O Jesu, keep me in Thy sight,
And guard me through the coming night.
	 ~ 	1 . NDƐ da yi enya etwa m' kɔ;
Hɛn Wura, yɛda W' ase;
Yɛsɔr dɛ mma yɛnnyɛ bɔn
Biara dɛm sumber yi.
O Jesu, ma yengyina W'enyim,
Na adzesaa yi mu kora hɛn.
Na gye hɛn fi ne nyina mu.  Amen.

MHB 951
2 . The joys of day are over; 
We lift our heart to Thee,
And ask Thee that offenceless   
The hours of dark may be:   
O Jesu, make their darkness  light,
And guard me through the coming night.
	 ~ 	2 
. Da n' ne dɛw etwa mu kɔ :
Hɛn akoma ba Wo hɔ;
Yɛserɛ W' dɛ mma ɔhaw bi mmba
Dɛm sum ndɔnhwer yi mu.
O Jesu, ma hɔn sum nyɛ kan,
Na adzesaa yi mu kora hɛn.

MHB 951
3 . The toils of day are over:  
We raise the hymn to Thee 
And ask that free from peril  
The hours of dark may be:
O Jesu, keep me in Thy sight,
And guard me through the coming night.
	 ~ 	3 
. Da yi mu fona etwa m',
Yɛtow hɛn ndwom ma Wo,
Yɛserɛ W' dɛ mma mbusu bi
Nnsi sum ndɔhwer yi mu;
O Jesu, ma yengyina W'enyim,
Na adzesaa yi mu kora hɛn.

MHB 951
4 . Be Thou my soul’s preserver,  
For Thou alone dost know  
How many are the perils  
Through which I have to go:
O loving Jesu, hear my call,
And guard and save me from them all.
		     Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Yɛ hɛn akra korafo,
'Siandɛ Ɔwo na inyim
Mbusu pii a ɔrotweɔn hɛn
Wɔ mfikyir abrɔn mu.
O Jesu dɔyɛfo, tsie hɛn.

MHB 952
1 . GOD the Father! be Thou near,
Save from every harm to-night;
Make us all thy children dear,
In the darkness be our light. 
	 ~ 	1 . NYANKOPƆN Egya, bɛn hɛn,
Gye hɛn ɔhaw m' 'nafua yi;
Yɛ hɛn nyina Wo dɔ mba,
Sum no mu yɛ kan ma hɛn.
Ewuradze, tsew hɛn sum do!.  Amen.

MHB 952
2 . God the Saviour! be our peace,
Put away our sins to-night;
Speak the word of full release,
Turn our darkness into light. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Agyenkwa, yɛ hɛn asomdwee,
Yi hɛn bɔn anafua yi;
Ka fahodzi asɛm no
Dan hɛn sum ma ɔnyɛ kan.

MHB 952
3 .  Holy Spirit, deign to come,
Sanctify us all to-night;
In our hearts prepare thy home,
Turn our darkness into light. 
 	 ~ 	3 
. Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn, pen na bra
Bɛtsew hɛn ho anafua yi;
Bɛyɛ hɛn akoma Wo fie;
Dan hɛn sum ma ɔnyɛ kan.

MHB 952
4 . Holy Trinity! be nigh;
Mystery of love adored,
Help to live, and help to die;
Lighten all our darkness, Lord!  Amen. 	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔkorsa Krɔnkrɔn, bɛn hɛn;
Dɔ nwanwa a yɛkamfo Wo,
Abrabɔ m' na 'wu m' boafo,

MHB 953
1 . O LORD, who by Thy presence hast made light
The heat and burden of the toilsome day,
Be with me also in the silent night,
Be with me when the daylight fades away. 
	 ~ 	1 . EWURADZE, Ɔwo a ipue ma dwumadzi m'
Ɔhyew na adzesoa brɛ adze koraa,
Enye mo so ntsena anafua kɔnn yi mu,
Sɛ ewia rokɔtɔ a, nye me ntsena.
Nyina mo werɛ mfir wɔ nda pa m'.   Amen.

MHB 953
2 . Fraught with rich blessing, breathing sweet repose,
The calm of evening settles on my breast;
If Thou be with me when my labours close,
No more is needed to complete my rest. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewimbir dzinn a nhyira ahyɛ n' ma,
Dze ahomgye dɛɛdɛw bi gu mo do;
M'edwuma bɔ adze na eka mo ho a,
M'etsidaa benya edzi mu wɔ Wo mu.

MHB 953
3 . Come then, O Lord, and deign to be my guest.
After the day’s confusion, toil, and din,
O come to bring me peace, and joy, and rest,
To give salvation, and to pardon sin. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Afei, Ewuradze, bra bɛyɛ m' Hɔhoe,
Dafua mu fona na dede ekyir no;
O ma minnya asomdwee, dɛw nye ahomgye,
Brɛ m' nkwagye, na fa mo bɔn nyina kyɛ me.

MHB 953
4 . Bind up the wounds, assuage the aching smart
Left in my bosom from the day just past,
And let me on a Father’s loving heart
Forget my griefs, and find sweet rest at last.  Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Kyekyer epirakur, na dwedwe yaw a
Aka mo bom' wɔ da a etwa m' yi ho n',
Na menda Egya N'bomu dɛ me yaw,

MHB 954
1 . ANOTHER year is dawning,
Dear Master, let it be
In working or in waiting, 
Another year with Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . AFE fofor reba bio,
Hɛn Wura pa, ma ɛnyɛ
Afe kor so a wɔdze
Yɛ edwuma, dze tweɔn Wo.
Na asaase nyina so.   Amen.

MHB 954
2 . Another year of mercies, 
Of faithfulness and grace,
Another year of gladness 
An the shining of Thy face;
 	 ~ 	2 
. Afe fofor a mbɔbɔrhu,
Gyedzi na adom wɔ mu,
Afe fofor a W'enyim hyerɛn,
Ma dɛw ahyɛ no ma.

MHB 954
3 . Another year of progress, 
Another year of praise,
Another year of proving 
Thy presence all the days:
	 ~ 	3 
. M-pontu afe fofor a
Ayɛyi ahyɛ ma, 
Afe a ɔma wohu
Wo daa daa nyina no.

MHB 954
4 . Another year of service, 
Of witness for Thy love,
Another year of training 
For holier work above.
	 ~ 	4 
. Afe fofor a wodze som,
Dze dzi W' dɔ ho dase;
Afe fofor a wɔdze sua
Sor edwuma krɔnn yɛ.

MHB 954
5 . Another year is dawning,
Dear Father, let it be
On earth, or else in heaven,
Another year for Thee.   Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Afe fofor reba bio,
Hɛn Wura pa, ma ɔnyɛ
Afe fofor mma Wo sor

MHB 955
1 . STANDING at the portal
Of the opening year,
Words of comfort meet us,
Hushing every fear;
Spoken thru the silence
By our Savior’s voice,
Tender, strong and faithful,
Making us rejoice.

    Onward, then, and fear not,
    Children of the day;
    For His Word shall never,
    Never pass away.
