 	 ~ 	1 . YEGYINA afe fofor
Abobow ano,
Yehyia awerɛkyekyer nsɛm a
Otu suro nyina,
Hɛn Egya Ne ndze no
Na ɔka no wɔ
Gyedzi ahoɔdzen mu
Dze ma hɛn enyigye.
    Hom nkɔ kan, mma hom nnsuro
    Adzekyee mba nyina :
    N'asɛm runntwa mu da,
    Orunntwa mu da.
Afe a ɔreba 'i.

MHB 955
2 . I, the Lord, am with thee,
Be thou not afraid;
I will help and strengthen
Be thou not dismayed.
Yea, I will uphold thee
With My own right hand;
Thou art called and chosen
In My sight to stand.
 	 ~ 	2 
. 'Mi Ewuradze nye w' wɔ hɔ,
Mma nnsuro ara da;
Mobɔboa w' ahyɛ w' dzen,
Mma w'abaw nngura!
Medze Me nsa nyimfa
Mubosuo wo mu;
Wɔasan mu eyi wo dɛ
'Begyina M'enyim.

MHB 955
3 . For the year before us,
O what rich supplies!
For the poor and needy
Living streams shall rise;
For the sad and sinful
Shall His grace abound;
For the faint and feeble
Perfect strength be found.
 	 ~ 	3 
. N-dzepa a wɔahyehyɛ
Afe a ɔreba yi m'!
Nkwa nsu bopue ama
'Bɔbɔfo ehiafo;
N'adom bobu do ama
Abɔn abɔbɔfo.
Bahatɔfo benya
Ahoɔdzen mapa.

MHB 955
4 . He will never fail us,
He will not forsake;
For His eternal covenant
He will never break.
Resting on the promise,
What have we to fear ?
God is all-sufficient
For the coming year.	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔremmpa hen ara da
Orinngyaa hɛn so;
N'onnyiewiei ahyɛmu no,
Orummbu do da!
Yɛtwer N'anohoba a,
'Bɛn na yebosuro?
Nyankopɔn so dze ma

MHB 956
1 . COME, let us anew
Our journey pursue,
Roll round with the year,
And never stand still till the Master appear. 
	 ~ 	1 . Hom mbra ma yentu 
Hɛn kwan yi fofor
Yɛnye afe yi nkyin,
Na mma yenngyina kyerɛ hɛn Wura aba.
Hɛn me dɛw mu na tsena M' ahengua no do.

MHB 956
2 . His adorable will
Let us gladly fulfil,
And our talents improve,
By the patience of hope, and the labour of love. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Hom ma yɛmfa dɛw 
Yɛnyɛ N' apɛdze,
Yɛmfa abotar
Na dɔ dwumadzi nsi hɛn adom no pi.

MHB 956
3 . Our life is a dream
Our time as a stream
Glides swiftly away,
And the fugitive moment refuses to stay. 
	 ~ 	3  
. Hɛn nkwa yɛ adaaso; 
Hɛn mber tse dɛ nsu a
Ɔrepem hwew hwew
Na mber kobɔnyi no nngyina ara pɛn.

MHB 956
4 . The arrow is flown,
The moment is gone;
The millennial year
Rushes on to our view, and eternity’s here. 
	 ~ 	4 
. Wɔatow egyen no, 
M-ber no ɔkɔ;
Apem afe no
Ɔrobɔto hɛn, na onnyiewiei aba.

MHB 956
5 . O that each in the day
Of His coming may say:
I have fought my way through,
I have finished the work Thou
didst give me to do! 
	 ~ 	5 
. Ao, nkyɛ biara aaka 
Da a ɔbɛba n' dɛ,
Mako ɔko pa n'
Dwuma a edze maa me n' mewie ne nyina yɛ.

MHB 956
6 . O that each from his Lord
May receive the glad word:
Well and faithfully done;
Enter into My joy, and sit down on  My throne !	 ~ 	6 
. Ao, nkyɛ biara aatse, 
No Wura reka n' dɛ:
M-bo, ayɛ n' yie

MHB 957
1 . FATHER, let me dedicate 
All this year to Thee,
In whatever worldly state 
Thou wilt have me be:
Not from sorrow, pain or care, 
Freedom dare I claim;
This alone shall be my prayer: 
Glorify Thy Name.
	 ~ 	1 . EGYA, ma muntu afe yi
Nyina nsi hɔ mma W',
Ɔbra mu gyinabew biara a 
Epɛ dɛ mokɔ m',
Awerɛhow, yaw na haw;
Me mpaabɔ ara nye dɛ
'Nyimnyam nka Wo dzin.
Hyɛ W' dzin enyimnyam.   Amen.

MHB 957
2 . Can a child presume to choose 
Where or how to live?
Can a Father’s love refuse 
All the best to give?
More Thou givest every day 
Than the best can claim,
Nor withholdest aught that may 
Glorify Thy Name.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ana abofra botum akyerɛ
Mbrɛ obesi abɔ bra?
Aso Egya bi n' dɔ bɔpow
Dɛ ɔyɛ dza oye nyina?
Dza yebisa no daa no
Ema ma ɔbor do,
Emmbra hɛn dɛ yɛka dɛ
Enyimnyam nka W' dzin.

MHB 957
3 . If in mercy Thou wilt spare 
Joys that yet are mine;
If on life, serene and fair, 
Brighter rays may shine;
Let my glad heart, while it sings,
Thee in all proclaim,
And, whate’er the future brings, 
Glorify Thy Name.
	 ~ 	3 
. Mbɔbɔrhu ntsi sɛ ebɛma
M'enyigye atweɔn;
Sɛ 'kan nserɛmɛn bi bɛhyerɛn
'Bra do asomdwee mu a;
M'enyigye akoma ntow W' ndwom 
Akwan nyina mu;
Na dza ndaamba dze nam nyina,
Nhyɛ W' dzin enyimnyam.

MHB 957
4 .  If Thou callest to the cross, 
And its shadow come,
Turning all my gain to loss, 
Shrouding heart and home;
Let me think how Thy dear son 
To His glory came,
And in deepest woe pray on:
Glorify Thy Name.   Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Sɛ efrɛ m' ba mbeamudua n' ho,
Na no sunsuma n' ba,
Na mohwer m'adze nyina,
M'akoma na fie mpo a,
Ma mondwen mbrɛ Wo Ba n' sii
Baa N'enyimnyam mu,
Na mbusu m' monkɔ do nsɔr :

MHB 958
1 . O GOD, the Rock of Ages,
Who evermore hast been,
What time the tempest rages,
Our dwelling place serene:
Before Thy first creations,
O Lord, the same as now,
To endless generations,
The everlasting Thou!
	 ~ 	1 . O NYAME, Tsetse Botan,
Ɔwo a ewɔ hɔ daa
Ehumtuber mu nyina
Hɛn asomdwee guandɔbea :
Ansaana erobɔ wiadze
Etse dɛm sesei so,
Mbersantsen nyinara mu,
Bɛkyebo Woara a.
Dɛ po a onnyi mpoano.

MHB 958
2 . Our years are like the shadows
On sunny hills that lie,
Or grasses in the meadows
That blossom but to die:
A sleep, a dream, a story
By strangers quickly told,
An unremaining glory
Of things that soon are old.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn mfe tse dɛ esunsum a
Wi tow gu akoko do,
Anaa nkyɛkyɛr mu nsensan a
Onyin prɔmprɔm dze wu :
Nda, adaaso, kodzi bi a
Ahɔho tow no ntsɛm,
Ndzɛmba a ɔyɛ dadaw ntsɛm
N'enyimnyam a ɔnnkye.

MHB 958
3 . O Thou, who dost not slumber,
Whose light grows never pale,
Teach us aright to number
Our years before they fail;
On us Thy mercy lighten,
On us Thy goodness rest,
And let Thy Spirit brighten
The hearts Thyself hast blessed.
 	 ~ 	3 
. O Ɔwo a enntɔ nkom nnda,
Na Wo kan so nnhyɛ sum,
Kyerɛ hɛn, yɛnkan hɛn nda yie 
Ansaana mfe n' ahwer.
Wo mbɔbɔrhu nhyerɛn hɛn do
Wo ayamuyie nye hɛn ntsena
Na ma Wo Sunsum nhyerɛn 
Akoma a ehyira no n' mu.

MHB 958
4 . Lord, crown our faith’s endeavor
With beauty and with grace,
Till, clothed in light for ever,
We see Thee face to face:
A joy no language measures,
A fountain brimming o’er,
An endless flow of pleasures,
An ocean without shore.	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn Wura, fa fɛwyɛ na adom
Bɔ hɛn gyedzi abɔtsir,
Kɛpem dɛ kan mu, afebɔɔ
Yebohu W' enyim na enyim:
Enyigye a wonnsusu
Tse dɛ bura a ebu do
Enyigye a ɔpem afebɔɔ

MHB 959
1 . SING to the great Jehovah’s praise;
All praise to Him belongs;
Who kindly lengthens out our days
Demands our choicest songs.
	 ~ 	1 . HOM ntow Jehovah N'ayɛyi,
Nkamfo nyina dzi wɔ N';
Ɔno a ɔma hɛn nda mu war,
Hɛn ndwom pa no fata N'.
Yɛdze bɔ afɔr ma Wo.

MHB 959
2 . His providence hath brought us through
Another various year;
We all with vows and anthems new
Before our God appear.
	 ~ 	2 
. Ɔahwɛ hɛn do dze hɛn etwa
Afe kor so no mu;
Hɛn nyina dzedze ndwom fofor
Befir Nyame N'enyim.

MHB 959
3 . Father, Thy mercies past we own,
Thy still continued care;
To thee presenting, through Thy Son,
Whate’er we have or are.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Egya, ehu hɛn mbɔbɔr pɛn;
Na 'da ho hwɛ hɛn;
Mbrɛ yɛtse, dza yɛwɔ biara,
Yedua Christ do dze ma W'.

MHB 959
4 . Our lips and lives shall gladly show
The wonders of Thy love,
While on in Jesus’ steps we go
To see Thy face above.
	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn ano na hɛn bra bɛka
Wo dɔ n'anwanwadze;
Yɛnam Jesus N'anamɔn mu
Bohu W'enyim wɔ sor.

MHB 959
5 . Our residue of days or hours
Thine, wholly Thine, shall be;
And all our consecrated powers
A sacrifice to Thee.	 ~ 	5 
. Hɛn nda ne nkaase yɛ Wodze,
Ne nyina yɛdze ma W';
Hɛn tum biara yetu si nkyɛn,

MHB 96
1 . JOIN all the glorious names
Of wisdom, love, and power,
That ever mortals knew,
That angels ever bore;
All are too mean to speak His worth,
Too mean to set our Saviour forth.
	 ~ 	1 . KA enyimnyam edzin nyina, 
Nyansa, dɔ na tum bɔ m'.
Dza adasa nyim no,
Dza ɔda abɔfo do;
Iyinom nyina nntum nnkyerɛ 
Dɛ mbrɛ hɛn Agyenkwa no tse.

MHB 96
10 . Should all the hosts of death,
And powers of hell unknown,
Put their most dreadful forms
Of rage and malice on,
I shall be safe; for Christ displays
Superior power  and guardian grace.	 ~ 	10 . Sɛ owu ɔnye hɛll,
Na hɔn etumfo nyina
Dze ebufuw kɛse bi
Na enyitan hyia me mpo a,
Christ N'adom na No tum no so
Sen hɔndze ntsi hwee nnkɛyɛ me.

MHB 96
2 . But O what gentle means,
What condescending ways,
Doth our Redeemer use,
To teach His heavenly grace;
My soul, with joy and wonder see
What forms of love He bears for thee !
	 ~ 	2 . Naaso hɛn Pomfo no
Nam ahobrɛadze kwan
Do na ɔkyerɛ hɛn,
Mbrɛ No sor adom tse;
Me kra dze dɛw na nwanwa hwɛ 
Ɔdɔ a ɔdze dɔ hɛn no!

MHB 96
3 . Arrayed in mortal flesh
The Covenant Angel stands,
And holds the promises
And pardons in His hands;
Commissioned from His Father’s throne
To make His grace to mortals known.
	 ~ 	3 . Ahyɛmu Ɔbɔfo no,
Ɔaba wɔ honam mu,
Okura anohoba
Na fakyɛ wɔ Ne nsamu;
Wɔhyɛɛ N' fii N'Egya ahengua do
Dɛ ɔnka N'adom nkyerɛ adasa.

MHB 96
4 . Great Prophet of my God,
My tongue would bless Thy name:
By Thee the joyful news
Of our salvation came;
The joyful news of sins forgiven,
Of hell subdued, and peace with heaven.
	 ~ 	4 . Nyame No Nkɔnhyɛnyi,
M'ano behyira Wo dzin:
Ɔwo na 'dze nkwagye
Enyigyesɛm no bae;
Bɔnfakyɛ ho enyigyesɛm,
Edzii hɛll do; sor wɔ asomdwee.

MHB 96
5 . Be Thou my Counsellor,
My pattern, and my Guide;
And through this desert land
Still keep me near Thy side:
O let my feet ne’er run astray,
Nor rove, nor seek the crooked way !
	 ~ 	5 . Bɛyɛ mo Fotufo,
Mo Nhwɛdo, me Gyefo;
Sar do akwantu yi mu,
Ma membɛn Wo nkyɛn daa:
Mma m'anamɔn mmfom kwan ara da, 
Na memmfa kwan kɔntɔnkye do!

MHB 96
6 . I love my Shepherd’s voice;
His watchful eye shall keep
My wandering soul among
The thousands of His sheep:
He feeds his flock, He calls their names,
Bears  in His ten tender lambs.
	 ~ 	6 . Mo Guanhwɛfo Ne ndze
Na mepɛ dɛ metse;
N'enyi bɔ mo ho aprɔw,
Kora me No nguankuw mu;
Ɔnyɛn No nguan, 'bɔ hɔn edzin, 
Tur No nguambaa wɔ N'abaw mu.

MHB 96
7 . Jesus, my great High-priest,
Offered His blood and died;
My guilty Conscience seeks
No sacrifice beside;
His powerful blood did once atone,
And now it pleads before the throne.
	 ~ 	7 . Jesus Sɔfopanyin
Dze N' bɔgyaa bɔgyaa bɔɔ afɔr; 
Me tsibowa fɔdzifo
Nnhwehwɛ afɔrbɔ bio;
No bɔgyaa no pataa prɛko, 
Na ɔserɛ ahengua n' enyim.

MHB 96
8 . O Thou almighty Lord,
My conqueror and my King,
Thy sceptre and Thy sword,
Thy reign of grace, I sing;
Thine is the power: behold I sit
In willing bonds before Thy feet.
	 ~ 	8 . Otumfo Ewuradze,
Mo Konyimdzifo, Hen,
Motow W'adom, W'afowa,
Na W'ahempoma ho ndwom;
Ɔwo nye Tumfo, medze m' pɛ 
Tsena Wo nan adze dɛ akowaa.

MHB 96
9 . Now let my soul arise,
And tread the tempter down:
My Captain leads me forth
To conquest and a crown:
March on, nor fear to win the day,
Though death and hell obstruct the way.
	 ~ 	9 . Afei ma me kra nsoɛr
Ntsia ɔsɔhwɛfo do:
Me Sahen n' dzi m'enyim,
Ma m' Konyim na ahenkyɛw:
Kɔ w'enyim, mma nnsuro, dzi nyim,
Owu na hɛll siw wo kwan mpo a.

MHB 960
1 .  JOIN, all ye ransomed sons of grace,
The holy joy prolong,
And shout to the Redeemer’s praise
A solemn midnight song. 
	 ~ 	1 . ADOM mba a wɔapon hom nyina,
Hom nhur dɛw krɔnkrɔn no,
Hom mbɔ ose nyi Pomfo N' ayɛw,
Ntow dasu mu ndwom krɔnn.
Dze kehyia No wɔ wimu.

MHB 960
2 . Blessing, and thanks, and love, and might
Be to our Jesus given,
Who turns our darkness into light,
Who turns our hell to heaven. 
 Thither our faithful souls He leads,
	 ~ 	2 
. Nhyira, ndaase, ɔdɔ na tum,
Wɔmfa mma hɛn Jesus,
Ɔno na ɔdan hɛn sum yɛ kan,
Na ɔdan hɛn hɛll hɛven.

MHB 960
3 . Thither He bids us rise,
With crowns of joy upon our heads,
To meet him in the skies. 	 ~ 	3 
. Hɔ na ogya hɛn gyedzi akra kɔ,
Hɔ na ɔma yɛsoɛr,
Hyɛ hɛn enyigye ahenkyɛw

MHB 961
1  . ACROSS the sky the shades of night
This New Year’s Eve are fleeting,
We come to Thee, the Life, and Light,
In solemn worship meeting;
And as the year’s last hours go by,
We lift to Thee our earnest cry,
Once more Thy love entreating.
	 ~ 	1 . AWƆBER anago fua sum no
Rutwa m' sen wɔ wimu,
Yɛba Wo nkyɛn, N-kwa na Kan,
Behyia wɔ som krɔnkrɔn mu,
Ber a afe n' ewiei reba yi,
Yɛma hɛn ndze do su frɛ Wo,
Totɔ serɛ Wo dɔ n' bio.
Heaven bɛgye hɛn esie.

MHB 961
2 . Before the cross subdued we bow,
To Thee our prayers addressing;
Recounting all Thy mercies now,
And all our sins confessing;
Beseeching Thee this coming year
To hold us in Thy faith and fear,
And crown us with Thy blessing.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yɛkotow Wo mbeamudua n'enyim,
Yɛdze hɛn mpaabɔ ba W' nkyɛn,
Rekaa W'adom nyina sesei
Na yɛka hɛn bɔn to gua
Reserɛ Wo afe a ɔreba yi
Dɛ yɛntsena Wo gyedzi na suro m'
Na fa Wo nhyira no ma hɛn.

MHB 961
3 . We gather up in this brief hour
The memory of Thy mercies;
Thy wondrous goodness, love and power
Our grateful song rehearses:
For Thou hast been our Strength and Stay
In many a dark and dreary day
Of sorrow and reverses.
	 ~ 	3 
. Yeehyia dɔnhwer tsiaba yi mu
Rekaakaa W'ehumbɔbɔr n',
Hɛn ndaase ndwom gye W'ayamuyie
Wo dɔ na W' tum ho dase :
'Siandɛ ayɛ hɛn ahoɔdzen na mboa
Wɔ sum na ɔhaw da no mu,
Ɔhaw na abɛbrɛsɛ nyina m'.

MHB 961
4 . Then, O great God, in years to come,
Whatever fate betide us,
Right onward through our journey home
Be Thou at hand to guide us;
Nor leave us till at close of life,
Safe from all perils, toil, and strife,
Heaven shall receive and hide us	 ~ 	4 
. Nyame kɛse, dɛm a, mfe a ɔreba n',
Dza ɔbɔto hɛn biara,
Hɛn fiekɔ akwantu no mu,
Gya hɛn taataa nye hɛn nkɔ
Na mma nngyaa hɛn ɔbra n'ewiei,
Gye hɛn sɔnn wɔ haw na aperdzi m'

MHB 962
1 . COME, ye thankful people, come,
Raise the song of harvest home:
All is safely gathered in,
Ere the winter storms begin;
God, our maker, doth provide
For our wants to be supplied:
Come to God’s own temple, come;
Raise the song of harvest home!
	 ~ 	1 . NDAASEFO nyina, hom mbra,
Hom mfa ndɔbaa ndwom mbra fie:
Ndzɛmba nyina ayɛ krado,
Ansaana ɔpɛber ehum tu n'
Nyame hɛn Bɔfo Noara
Bɛma dza yehia nyina.
Hom mbra Nyame N'asɔrfi m',
Hom nhur ndɔbaa afahyɛ ndwom n'.
Hom mfa ndɔbaa afahyɛ ndwom n'.   Amen.

MHB 962
2 . All this world is God’s own field,
Fruit unto His praise to yield;
Wheat and tares therein are sown,
Unto joy or sorrow grown;
First the blade, and then the ear,
Then the full corn shall appear:
Wholesome  grain and pure may be.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wiadze nyina yɛ Nyame N' kwa a
Ɔsow ayɛyi aba ma N',
'Wifua na nworahaban wɔ m';
Wɔdze enyigye anaa yaw nyin,
Wonyin nkakrankakra ara
Na afei ɔsow aba.
Ewuradze, boa ma yɛnyɛ
Aba pa a no ho tsew.

MHB 962
3 . For the Lord our God shall come,
And shall take His harvest home;
From His field shall in that day
All offences purge away;
Give His angle charge at last
In the fruit ears to store
In His garner evermore.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze Nyame bɛba
Dze No ndɔbaa akɔ fie;
Ɔbɛhyew bɔn nyinara
Wɔ Ne haban m' dɛm da no;
Ɔbɛhyɛ N'abɔfoe ma
Wɔahyew nworahaban no nyina;
Na aba pa no nyina dze
Wɔdze bɛhyɛ san do daa.

MHB 962
4 . Even so, Lord, quickly come;
Bring Thy final harvest home:
Gather Thou Thy people in,
There, for ever purified,
In Thy garner to abide:
Come, with all Thine angles, come,
Raise the glorious harvest-home!
free from sorrow, free from sin:
all upon the golden floor
praising thee for evermore:
come, with all Thine angels come,
Raise the glorious  harvest-home!
		Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Dɛm a, Ewuradze, bra ntsɛm;
Fa ewiei ndɔbaa n' bra fie,
Boaboa Wo nkorɔfo ano bra m',
Yi hɔn fi yaw na bɔn mu;
Tsew hɔn ho wɔ hɔ da nyina
Ma wɔntsena Wo siar fie,
Enye W' abɔfoe nyina mbra,

MHB 963
1 . WE plough the fields, and scatter
The good seed on the land,
But it is fed and watered
By God’s almighty hand;
He sends the snow in winter,
The warmth to swell the grain,
The breezes, and the sunshine,
And soft, refreshing rain.

         All good gifts around us
         Are sent from heaven above;
        Then thank the Lord, O thank the Lord,
        For all his love.
	 ~ 	1 . YƐDƆW nhaban, yɛpe aba a
Oye gu asaase do,
Na Nyame tumfo Ne nsa
Ɔtɔ nsu gugu do;
Ɔma hɛn nsu wɔ duaber
Ɔma ɔhyew huhur aba n',
Ɔbɔ mframa, ofir ewia
Na ɔtɔ nyankonsu.
    'Kyɛdze pa a etwa hɛn ho n',
    Wɔ dze fi sor ma hɛn:
    Da Ewuradze ase, O da N'ase,
    Wɔ N' dɔ nyina ntsi.
Ɔyɛ hɛn ndaase akoma.

MHB 963
2 . He only is the maker
Of all things near and far;
He paints the wayside flower,
He lights the evening star;
The winds and waves obey him,
By Him the birds are fed;
Much more to us, His children,
He gives our daily bread.
	 ~ 	2 
. No nko na ɔyɛ ndzɛmba a
Wɔbɛn, wɔ ekyir nyina Yɛfo,
Ogu nhyiren wɔ kwan nkyɛn,
Ɔsɔ anago nworaba;
Mframa na asorɛkye tsie No,
Ɔno na ɔnyɛn nnoma;
Na akantam hɛn, Ne mba,
Ɔma hɛn edziban daa.

MHB 963
3 .  We thank Thee then, O Father,
For all things bright and good,
The seed-time and the harvest,
Our life, our health, our food.
Accept the gifts we offer
For all Thy love imparts,
And, what Thou most desirest,
Our humble, thankful hearts.
	            Amen.	 ~ 	3 
. Egya, yɛda Wo ase
Wɔ ndzepa nyina ho,
Duaber na buber, hɛn nkwa,
Apɔwmudzen, na edziban;
Gye akyɛdze a yɛdze aba
Wɔ Wo dɔ nyina ntsi,
Na dza ehwehwɛ kɛse a

MHB 964
1 . TO Thee, O Lord, our hearts we raise
In hymns of adoration,
To Thee bring sacrifice of praise
With shouts of exultation:
Bright robes of gold the fields adorn,
The hills with joy are ringing,
The valleys stand so thick with corn
That even they are singing.
	 ~ 	1 . Yɛma hɛn akoma do tow, 
N-tonton ndwom ma W' Wura,
Yɛdze hɛn dɛw afɔr brɛ Wo
Wɔ dɛw esebɔm' ara;
Harban ahyehyɛ sika ntar
Mbepɔw dze dɛw rowosow
Mbɔnsam' ayɛ eburow ma
Ma hɔn so wɔrotow ndwom.
Woehyira do m-prɛnsa.

MHB 964
2 . And now, on this our festal day,
Thy bounteous hand confessing,
Upon Thine altar, Lord, we lay
The first-fruits of thy blessing:
By thee the souls of men are fed
With gifts of grace supernal;
Thou who dost give us earthly bread;
Give us the bread eternal.
	 ~ 	2 
. N-dɛ hɛn afahyɛ da yim', 
Yɛkaa Wo nsaano ayamuyie n',
Wo nhyira ndɔbaa-kan ndaase n',
Nna yɛdze gu W' enyim no
Adom akyɛdze soronko n'
Edze nyɛn hɛn nkorɔfo akra;
'Wo a 'ma hɛn asaase paanoo,
Ma hɛn onnyiewiei paanoo.

MHB 964
3 . We bear the burden of the day,
And often toil seems dreary;
But labour ends with sunset ray,
And rest comes for the weary:
May we, the angel-reaping o’er,
Stand at the last accepted,
Christ’s golden sheaves for evermore
To garners bright elected.
	 ~ 	3  
. Yɛsɔw adzekyee yim' fona, 
Yɛberɛ hɛn dwumadzi mu;
Na wi tɔ a, edwuma sa,
Ma nyia ɔaberɛ n' nya ahomgye
Sɛ abɔfo buber n' wie a,
N-kyɛ ekyir n' yaafata
Christ sika efiefi no a
Wɔdze kɔ asan fɛɛfɛw do n'.

MHB 964
4 . O blessed is that land of God,
Where saints abide for ever;
Where golden fields spread far and broad,
Where flows the crystal river:
The strains of all its holy throng
With ours to-day are blending;
Thrice blessed is that harvest-song
Which never hath an ending.	 ~ 	4 
. Nyame Ne bea a apapafo 
Tse do no woehyira do,
Mbrɛ sika haban kɛse wɔ,
Na esutsen hyɛnhyɛn pem.
Dɔm krɔnkrɔ nyina hɔn ndwoma no
Ndɛ ɔnye hɛndze asaa;
Buber ndwom a ɔmmbɔ adze n'

MHB 965
1 . THE spring again is here,
Life wakes from winter’s gloom;
In field and forest far and near
Sweet opening flowerets bloom.
	 ~ 	1 . ESUSOW aba bio,
Nkwa fir 'pɛber m' epue;
Mfikyir na kwaamu nyinara
Nhyiren apaa fɛɛfɛw.
W'esusuowber nwanwa m'.

MHB 965
2 . O mystery strange and sweet,
That life so dumbly bound
Should rise, our thankful gaze to reet,
And break from underground.
	 ~ 	2 
. O esumasɛm nwanwa,
Dɛ nkwa a osumae no
Bopuei efi asaase mu
Ehyia hɛn n-daase.

MHB 965
3 . The morn is fresh and bright,
The slow dark hours depart:
Let days unstained and pure delight
Bring sunshine to the heart.
	 ~ 	3 
. 'Napa kan a eyɛ fɛw,
Anago sum apa;
Ma nda pa a enyigye ahyɛ m' ma
Nhyerɛn hɛn akoma mu.

MHB 965
4 . Lord, touch our careless eyes;
New life, new ardour bring,
That we may read Thy mysteries,
The wonder of Thy spring.	 ~ 	4 
. Ewuradze, bue hɛn enyi;
Ma hɛn n-kwa fofor,
Ma yeehu W'esumasɛm wɔ

MHB 966
1 . EARTH below is teeming,
Heaven is bright above;
Every brow is beaming
In the light of love;
Every eye rejoices,
Every thought is praise;
Happy hearts and voices
Gladden nights and days.
	 ~ 	1 . FAMU ha asaase ayɛ ma,
Sor so ahyerɛn;
Obiara reserew
Wɔ 'dɔ kan no mu;
Nyimpa nyina dzi dɛw,
'Yɛyi ahyɛ adwen ma;
Dɛw akoma nye ndze
Ma da biara dɛw.
Boa hɔn ano, gye hɔn.

MHB 966
2 . Every youth and maiden,
On the harvest plain,
Round the waggons laden
With their golden grain,
Swell the happy chorus
On the evening air,
Unto Him who o’er us
Bends with constant care.
	 ~ 	2 
. Abran a worutwa ndɔbaa
Wɔ haban mu nyina,
Na wɔtwe eburoguanee
Fi kwa mu kɔ fie,
Suo mu tow ayɛyi ndwom
Wɔ witɔree ber,
Dze ma Nyia daa nyina
Ɔkora hɛn do n'.

MHB 966
3 . For the sun and showers,
For the rain and dew,
For the happy hours
Spring and summer knew;
For the golden autumn
And its precious stores,
For the love that brought them
Teeming to our doors.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ɔnam ewia na nsu,
Nsutɔree na bɔw
Na esusow na ɔpɛ m'
Dɛw aber no ntsi,
Ɔnam buber no mu
Ndɔbaa bafuu n' ntsi,
Ɔnam dɔ a ɔtwee yinom
Baa hɛn pon ano ntsi.

MHB 966
4 . Earth’s broad harvest whitens
In a brighter sun
Than the orb that lightens
All we tread upon.
Send our labourers,Father,
Where fields ripening wave;
And the nations gather,
Gather in and save.       Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Wiadze ndɔbaa rinyin
Wɔ ewia kɛse a
Ɔkyɛn dza ɔma hɛn kan
Wiadze nyina mu n' mu;
Egya, ma edwumafo
Nkɔ mbea a edwuma n' wɔ;
Na boaboa aman n' ano,

MHB 967
1 . NOW the year is crowned with blessing
As we gather in the grain;
And,our grateful thanks express-ing.
Loud we raise a joyous strain.
Bygone days of toil and sadness
Cannot now our peace destroy;
For the hills are clothed with glad-ness,
And the valleys shout for joy.

    To the Lord their first-fruits bringing
    All His thankful people come,
    To the Father praises singing
    For the joy of harvest home.
	 ~ 	1 . AFEI woehyira afe no
Ber a yebu eburow no :
Yɛma hɛn enyigye ndwom do.
Dze kyerɛ hɛn ndaase so,
Ɔberɛ nye awerɛhow nda a etwa m'
Runntum nnsɛɛ hɛn asomdwee,
'Siandɛ enyigye ahyɛ akoko do,
Na mbɔnsa tsea mu dzi dɛw.
   Ewuradze No nkorɔfo nyina
   Dze nduaba kan brɛ N' ndaase m';
   Yɛtow ayɛyi ma Egya no
   Wɔ buber mu enyigye ntsi.
Yi dze, bubuer runntwa m' da.

MHB 967
2 . In the spring the smiling meadows
Donned their robes of living green,
As the sunshine chased the shadows
Swiftly o’er the changing scene;
In the summer-time the story
Of a riper hope was told;
Then the rich autumnal glory
Decked the fields in cloth of gold.
	 ~ 	2 
. M-fuw nyina dzii ehurusi,
Nhaban nyina yɛɛ ahaebun,
Ber a ewia tsiiw sunsuma
Ɔhar do wɔ adandan ber m;
Buber no mu wɔkaa asɛm a
Ɔfa buber enyidar ho :
Afei ɔbɛsɛber mu enyimnyam
Dze sika furaa asaase.

MHB 967
3 . Shall not we,whose hearts are swelling
With the thought of former days,
Sing a joyous song foretelling
Future gladness, fuller praise?
For the cloud the bow retaineth
With its covenant of peace.
That, as long as earth remaineth,
Harvest-time shall never cease.	 ~ 	3 
. Ana hɛn a hɛn akoma
Da nda a etwa mu no ho n'
Nnkɔtow ayɛyi ndwom akyerɛ
Enyigye a ɔbɛba daakye?
Mununkum ho asomdwee ahyɛmu
Ntsi na nyankontɔn wɔ hɔ,
Mber tsentsen a asaase wɔ hɔ

MHB 968
1 . YES, God is good-in earth and sky,
From ocean depths and spreading wood,
Ten thousand voices seem to cry: 
God made us all and God is good.
	 ~ 	1 . Nyew, Nyame ye- wɔ sor na ase 
Epo no bun mu na kwaa mu,
Ndze ɔpedu retsea mu dɛ
Nyame bɔɔ hɛn, na Nyame ye.
Ɔma yɛtow dɛ Nyame ye.

MHB 968
2 . The sun that keeps his trackless way, 
And downward pours his golden flood, 
Night’s sparkling hosts, all seem to say .
In accent clear, that God is good. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewia a ɔnam ne kyenan do, 
Na ɔtow ne nserɛmɛn gu ase ha,
Wimu anago dɔm hyɛnhyɛnn n' nyina
Tsea mu dɛ Nyame ye.

MHB 968
3 . The merry birds prolong the strain, 
Their song with every spring renewed;
And balmy air, and falling rain,
Each softly whispers : God is good.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nnoma dze dɛw gye ndwom no do, 
Wɔtow n' fofor afe biara,
Mframa pa a ɔbɔ na nyankom
Wɔsa berɛww dɛ Nyame ye.

MHB 968
4 . I hear it in the rushing breeze;	
The hills that have for ages stood,
The echoing sky and roaring seas, 
All well the chorus : God is good. 
 	 ~ 	4 
. Metse n' wɔ mframa a ɔrobɔm', 
Ɔnye tsetse mbepɔw no do,
Sor  a ɔpaapaam', po a ɔwor
Hɔn nyinaa gye do dɛ Nyame ye.

MHB 968
5 . Yes, God is good, all nature says, 
By God’s own hand wit speech endued;
And man, in louder notes of praise, 
Should sing for joy that God is good. 
 	 ~ 	5 
. Nyew, Nyame ye, abɔdze ka 
Dɛ mbrɛ Nyame ama kasahom;
Nyimpa mfa ayɛyi mbordo
Ntow ndwom dɛw mu dɛ Nyame ye.

MHB 968
6 . For all Thy gifts we bless Thee, Lord, 
But chiefly for our heavenly food; 
Thy pardoning grace, Thy quickening word, 
These prompt our song, that God is good.	 ~ 	6 
. Nyame yɛda W' adom ase, 
Nkanka hɛn sor edziban ho;
W' adom fakyɛ, Wo nkwasɛm no,

MHB 969
1 . O LORD of heaven and earth and sea,
To Thee all praise and glory be.
How shall we show our love to Thee,
	who givest all?
	 ~ 	1 . SOR, asaase na po Wura,
Ayɛyi na enyimnyam nka Wo;
Yensi dɛn nyi hɛn dɔ nkyerɛ Wo,
Ɔwo Ɔmafo?
Ema ne nyina.

MHB 969
2 .  The golden sunshine, vernal air,
Sweet flowers and fruit, thy love declare;
When harvests ripen, Thou art there,
	Who givest all.
	 ~ 	2 
. Wo dɔ ma ewia kan, mframa pa
Nhyiren huanhuam na nduaba pii;
Bea a ndɔbaa ber no, hɔ na Ɔwo
Ɔmafo n' wɔ.

MHB 969
3 . For peaceful homes, and healthful days,
For all the blessings earth displays,
we owe Thee thankfulness and praise,
	Who givest all.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Hɛn asomdwee na hɛn apɔwmudzen
Nye asaase do nhyira nyina ntsi
Yɛdze W' ndaase na ayɛyi kaw,
'Wo a ema ne nyina.

MHB 969
4 . Thou didst not spare Thine only Son,
But gav’st him for a world undone,
And freely with that blessed One
	Thou givest all.
	 ~ 	4 
. Annkam hɛn Wo Ba kortoo no,
Edze No maa wiadze a asɛɛ,
Na edze adze nyina kaa Siarfo
No ho dze mae.

MHB 969
5 . Thou giv’st the  Spirit’s blessed dower,
Spirit of life and love and power,
And dost His sevenfold graces shower
	Upon us all.
	 ~ 	5 
. Emaa hɛn Sunsum n' Ne nhyira,
No nkwa, No dɔ, ɔnye No tum;
Ihuee N'adom mbɔho esuon n'
Guu hɛn nyina do.

MHB 969
6 . For souls redeemed, for sins forgiven,
For means of grace and hopes of heaven,
Father, what can to Thee be given,
	Who givest all.	 ~ 	6 
. Akra a wɔapon hɔn, bɔnfakyɛ
Adom kwan na sor enyidar ntsi,
Ayɛyi nyina nka Wo Egya a

MHB 97
1 . O FILIAL Deity,
Accept my new-born cry;
See the travail of Thy soul,
Saviour, and be satisfied;
Take me now, possess me whole,
Who for me, for me, hast died.
	 ~ 	1 . NYAME Dɔyɛfo,
Gye m'abɔdoma sufrɛ,
Hwɛ Wo kra n'aperdzi no,
Agyenkwa, na onnya etsidaa;
Fa me sesei, fa me koraa,
Ɔwo na iwui maa me.

MHB 97
2 . Of life thou art the tree,
I know, I feel it now;
Faint and dead no more I droop:
Thou art in me; Thy supplies,
Every moment springing up,
Into life eternal rise.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔwo nye nkwa Nsunyiwa,
Minyim, metse nka ndɛ
Wu na bahatɔ mmbɔ m' hu:
Ewɔ mo mu; dza ema n',
Ofifir aber biara,
Kɔ nkwa a onnyiewie mu.

MHB 97
3 . Thou the good Shepherd art,
From Thee I ne’er shall part;
Thou my keeper and my Guide,
Make me still Thy tender care;
Gently lead me by Thy side,
Sweetly in Thy bosom bear.
	 ~ 	3 . Ɔwo nye Guanhwɛfo n',
Merenndan mmfi Wo ho;
Mo Hwɛfo na me Gyafo,
Kɔ do ara hwɛ mo do;
Gya me bɔkɔɔ wɔ Wo nkyɛn,
Tur m' enyigye m' wɔ Wo bo m'.

MHB 97
4 . Thou art my daily Bread;
O Christ, Thou art my Head;
Motion, virtue, strength, to me,
Me Thy living member, flow;
Nourished I, and fed by Thee,
Up to Thee in all things grow.
	 ~ 	4 . Ɔwo nye m' daa Paanoo;
O Christ, Ɔwo nye m' Tsir;
Ma m' ahoɔdzen na ndzepa,
Emi a meyɛ W'akowaa yi;
Enyɛɛn m', maa me edziban,
Ndzɛmba nyina nyin wɔ Wo mu.

MHB 97
5 . Prophet, to me reveal
Thy Father’s perfect will;
Never mortal spake like Thee,
Human prophet like divine;
Loud and strong their voices be,
Small, and still, and inward Thine.
	 ~ 	5 . Nkɔnhyɛnyi, yi W'Egya
Ne pɛ pa kyerɛ me;
Ɔdasanyi bi nnkasaa
Dɛ Ɔwo a ifi sor yi;
Wɔdze ndze dzendzen tseatea m',
Kumabaa nyina yɛ Wodze.

MHB 97
6 . On Thee, my Priest, I call,
Thy blood atoned for all;
Still the Lamb as slain appears,
Still Thou stand’st before the throne,
Ever offering up my prayers,
These presenting with Thine own
	 ~ 	6 . Mo Sɔfoe, mefrɛ Wo,
Wo bɔgyaa gye obiara;
Eguambaa a wokum Wo,
Igyina ahengua n'enyim,
Edze me mpaabɔ nye Ɔwo
Woara Wodze serɛ ma m'.

MHB 97
7 . Jesu, Thou art my King,
From Thee my strength I bring;
Shadowed by Thy mighty hand,
Saviour, who shall pluck me thence?
Faith supports; by faith I stand,
Strong in Thy omnipotence.	 ~ 	7 . Jesus, eyɛ me Hen,
M'ahoɔdzen nyina fir Wo;
Sɛ Wo nsa kata mo do a,
Woana botum ehwim me?
Menam gyedzi do gyina,
Meyɛ dzen wɔ Wo tum n' mu.

MHB 970
1 . HEAR US, O Lord, from heaven, Thy dwelling-place:
Like them of old, in vain we toil all night,
Unless with us Thou go, who art the light;
Come then, O Lord, that we may see Thy face.
	 ~ 	1 . Hɛn Wura, fi Wo sor tsenabew do tsie hɛn: 
Dɛ tsetsemba n' hɛn so yɛfona kwa,
Gyesɛ Ɔwo a eyɛ Kan n' nye hɛn kɔ;
Bra, Ewuradze, ama yeehu W' enyim.
Hɛn so yaaka Wo sor ndɔbaa no ho.   Amen.

MHB 970
2 . Thou, Lord, dost rule the raging of the sea,
When loud the storm and furious is the gale:
Strong is Thine arm; our little barques are frail:
Send us Thy help; remember Galilee.
	 ~ 	2  
. Ewuradze 'Wo na 'dzi po a ɔwor do, 
Ber a oetutu ne tsir sgu do n':
W' abaw yɛ dzen, hɛn ahɛn yɛ mberɛw,
Kaa Galilee, na fa Wo mboa ma hɛn.

MHB 970
3 . Our wives and children we commend to Thee:
For them we plough the land and plough the deep;
For them by day the golden corn we reap,
By night the silver harvest of the sea.
	 ~ 	3 
. Yɛdze hɛn fifo nyina hyɛ Wo nsa: 
Hɔn ntsi na yɛdɔw haban, yenu po,
Hɔn ntsi na dabaa yebu eburow pa,
Na 'nafua yebu pom' ndɔbaa fɛɛfɛw n'.

MHB 970
4 . We thank Thee, Lord, for sunshine, dew, and rain,
Broadcast from heaven by Thine almighty hand -
Source of all life, unnumbered as the sand -
Bird, beast, and fish, herb, fruit, and golden grain.
	 ~ 	4 
.	Yɛda W' ase na ewia, bɔsu, nyankom, 
Wo tum n-sa no dze fir sor petse;-
Nnoma, mbowa, nam, nhaban, aba, nye eburow:
N-kwa horow nyina Farbaa nye 'Wo.

MHB 970
5 . O Bread of Life, Thou in Thy word hast said:
Who feeds in faith on me shall never die!
In mercy hear Thy hungry children’s cry:
Father, give us this day our daily bread!
	 ~ 	5 
. N-kwa Paanoo, aka n' W' asɛm mu dɛ: 
Nyia ɔfa Wo dzi gyedzim' n' onnkowu da!
Fa ehumbɔbɔr tsie Wo mba hɛn sufrɛ:
Ma hɛn ndɛ so hɛn daadaa edziban.

MHB 970
6 . Sow in our hearts the seeds of Thy dear love,
That we may reap contentment, joy, and peace;
And when at last our earthly labours cease,
Grant us to join Thy harvest home above.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Dua Wo dɔ pa n' n' aba wɔ hɛn 'komam', 
Na yeebu abodwee na akomatɔm'.
Na ndaamba sɛ hɛn dwuma bɔ adze a,

MHB 971
1 . A GLADSOME hymn of praise we sing,
And thankfully we gather,
To bless the love of God above,
Our everlasting Father.
       In Him rejoice with heart and voice,
       Whose glory fadeth never,
       Whose providence is our de-fence,
       Who lives and loves for ever.
	 ~ 	1 . YƐDZE dɛw tow ayɛyi ndwom,
Na yɛdze ndaase hyia mu,
Yehyira Nyame dɔ a ɔwɔ sor;
Hɛn domankoma Egya.
     Yɛdze akoma nye ndze dzi dɛw
     Ma Nyia N'enyimnyam mmpa da,
     Nyia Ne nhyehyɛɛ nye hɛn bambɔ,
     Nyia ɔtse ase afebɔɔ.
Ho anwanwansɛm daa daa.

MHB 971
2 . From shades of night He calls the light,
And from the sod the flower;
From every cloud His blessings break,
In sunshine or in shower.
	 ~ 	2 
. Na ɔfrɛ kan fi sum kebii mu,
Na nhyiren so fi dɛtse mu;
Ne nhyira fi mununkum m' ba
Wɔ ewia anaa nsutɔ mu.

MHB 971
3 . Full in His sight His children stand,
By His strong arm defended;
And He whose wisdom guides the world,
Our footsteps hath attended.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ne mba gyinagyina N'enyim,
N'abasa bɔ hɔn ho ban;
Nyia Ne nyansaa hwɛ wiadze do,
Atsentsen hɛn anamɔn.

MHB 971
4 . For nothing falls unknown to
Him-Or care or joy or sorrow;
And He whose mercy ruled the past,
Will be our stay to-morrow.
	 ~ 	4 
. Biribiara nntɔ famu a onnyim,
Anaa dɛw anaa awerɛhow;
Na Nyia ndeda ohun mbɔbɔr n',
Bɛka hɛn ho ɔkyena.

MHB 971
5 . Then praise the Lord with one accord,
To His great name give glory,
And His never-changing love
Repeat the wondrous story.	 ~ 	5 
. Hom mma yɛmfa akoma kor
Nyi Ne dzin kɛse n' ayɛw,
Na yɛnka N' dɔ a ɔnnsesa da

MHB 972
1 . Here, Lord, we offer Thee all that is fairest, 
    Bloom from the garden, and flowers from the field; 
    Gifts for the stricken ones, knowing Thou carest 
    More for the love than the wealth that we yield. 
	 ~ 	1 . HƐN Wura, yɛdze dza ɔyɛ fɛw nyina ma Wo,
Hɛn turo m' na hɛn haban mu nhyiren,
Akyɛdze a yɛdze ma ayarfo, yenyin dɛ
Ɔwo dwen dɔ n' ho kyɛn sika a yɛma.
Ma hɔn awerɛhow ndan enyigye.

MHB 972
2 . Send, Lord, by these to the sick and the dying, 
    Speak to their hearts with a message of peace; 
    Comfort the sad, who in weakness are lying;
    Grant the departing a gentle release. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn wura, fa iyinom kɛma ayarfo nyina
Ka asomdweesɛm gu hɔn akoma mu;
Kyekye hɔn a wɔayɛ mberɛw n' hɔ werɛ
Ma hɔn a woruwu nkɔ asomdwee m'.

MHB 972
3 . Raise, Lord, to health those again who have sickened, 
    Fair be their lives as the roses in bloom; 
    Give of Thy grace to the souls Thou hast quickened, 
    Gladness for sorrow, and brightness for gloom. 


	 ~ 	3 
. Ewuradze, ma hɔn a wɔayar nsoɛr bio,
Ma hɔn abrabɔ nyɛ fɛw dɛ nhyiren;
Fa W'adom ma akra a ama hɔn nkwa nyina

MHB 973
1 . REJOICE for a brother deceased,
Our loss is his infinite gain;
A soul out of prison released, 
And freed from its bodily chain;
With songs let us follow his flight, 
And mount with his spirit above,
Escaped to the mansions of light, 
And lodged in the Eden of love.
	 ~ 	1 . Wondzi dɛw mma onua a oewu yi, 
No wu yi yɛ no mfaso kɛse,
Woeyi ne kra wɔ efiadze,
Woeyi no honam mpokyerɛ n' mu;
Wɔmma yɛmfa ndwom nka no do,
Yɛnye no sunsum mfow ɔsor,
Oefi nsa kɔ kan man no mu,
Ɔakɛtsena dɔ Eden no mu.
Ɔnnkɔbɔ adze dabiara pɛn.

MHB 973
2 . Our brother the haven hath gained,
Out-flying the tempest and wind, 
His rest he hath sooner obtained,
And left his companions behind, 
Still tossed on a sea of distress,
Hard tolling to make the blest shore, 
Where all is assurance and peace,
And sorrow and sin are no more.
	 ~ 	2 
. Hɛn nua edu ahɛndwirii hɔ, 
Ɔatsew ehum nye aahow no mu,
Tsiabaa yi ne nsa aka n' ahomgye,
Ɔadan n' afrɛ egya ekyir.
Hɔn wɔda ho da fona pom',
Reper edu siar mpoano hɔ,
Beebi mbrɛ asomdwee nko wɔ,
Na bɔn nye yaw nn-yi hɔ bio.

MHB 973
3 . There all the ship's company meet 
Who sailed with the Saviour beneath, 
With shouting each other they greet, 
And  triumph o'er  trouble  and death; 
The voyage of life's at an end, 
The mortal affliction Is past; 
The age that In heaven they spend 
For ever and ever shall last.	 ~ 	3 
. Hɔ na ahɛn dɔm nyina hyia, 
Hɔn a wɔnye Agyenkwa nantseew ha n',
Wɔbɔ se wokyiakyia hɔnho,
Na wodzi fona nye wu do nyim:
Ɔbra n' akwantu n' abɔ adze;
Honam n' ahohia no etwam';
M-ber a wodzi n' wɔ sor no,

MHB 974
1 . God of the living, in Whose eyes
Unveiled Thy whole creation lies,
All souls are Thine, we must not say
That those are dead who pass away;
From this our world of flesh set free,
We know them living unto Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . ATEASEFO Nyame, Ɔwo a
'Bɔdze nyina da W'enyim adagyaw,
Akra nyina yɛ W'dze, yɛnnka dɛ
Hɔn a woewu no ayew koraa;
Woefi hɛn honam wiadze yi m',
Yenyim dɛ wɔtse ase ma Wo.
Aatsena ama Wo daa nyina.  Amen.

MHB 974
2 . Released from earthly toil and strife,
With Thee is hidden still their life;
Thine are their thoughts, their works, their powers,
All Thine, and yet most truly ours;
For well we know, where’er they be,
Our dead are living unto Thee.
	 ~ 	2 
. Woenya asaase do fona m' 'homgye,
Wɔdze hɔn esuma Wo mu;
Hɔn adwendwen, ndwuma, tum, yɛ Wodze,
Wɔyɛ Wodze, hɛn so hɛndze a;
Yenyim dɛ bea a wɔwɔ biara
Hɛn ewufo no tse ase ma Wo.

MHB 974
3 . Thy Word is true, Thy will is just;
To Thee we leave them, Lord, in trust;
And bless Thee for the love which gave
Thy Son to fill a human grave;
That none might fear that world to see
Where all are living unto Thee.
 	 ~ 	3 
. W'asɛm yɛ nokwar, Wo pɛ tsen,
Yɛdze hɔn hyɛ Wo nsa gyedzi m';
Yehyira Wo wɔ ɔdɔ a ogyaa W'
Ma Wo Ba bɛdaa 'wumaa mu,
Amma obiara ennsuor dɛ
Hɔn nyina tse ase wɔ Wo mu.

MHB 974
4 . O Giver unto man of breath,
O Holder of the keys of death,
O Quickener of the life within,
Save us from death, the death of sin;
That body, soul, and spirit be
For ever living unto Thee !    Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Ɔwo a edze ahom ma nyimpa,
Ɔwo a ikitsa owu nsaafee,
Ɔwo a ikenyan nkwa hɛn mu,
Gye hɛn fi owu na bɔn mu :
Na honam, ɔkra na sunsum

MHB 975
1 . WHEN the day of toil is done,
when the race of life is run,
Father, grant Thy wearied one
Rest for evermore.
	 ~ 	1 . Ber a dwumadzi da asa n', 
Ber a bra 'mpiresi abɔ adze n!
Egya, dom Wo ba fonafo
Ahomgye afebɔɔ.
Nkwa ara afebɔɔ.  Amen.

MHB 975
2 . When the strife of sin is stilled,
When the foe within is killed,
Be thy gracious word fulfilled-
Peace for evermore.
 	 ~ 	2  
. Ber a bɔn nkodzen abɔ adze n', 
Ber a woeku kra mu tamfo n',
W' adom asɛm no nhyɛ ma-
Asomdwee afebɔɔ.

MHB 975
3 . When the darkness melts away
At the breaking of the day,
Bid us hail the cheering ray-
Light for evermore.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Ber a sum no enya apa n' 
Ma enyim atsetsew no,
Ma yenhuahua dɛw kan no-
Kan ara afebɔɔ.

MHB 975
4 . When the heart by sorrow tried
Feels at length its throbs subside,
Bring us, where all tears are dried,
Joy for evermore.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ber a yaw atsɛ akoma 
Ma afei oegyaa tow no,
Fa hɛn kɔ mbrɛ nyinsu nnyi n',
Dɛw ara afebɔɔ.

MHB 975
5 . When for vanished days we yearn,
Days that never can return,
Teach us in thy love to learn
Love for evermore.
 	 ~ 	5  
. Ber a yɛrodwen nda a yɛasɛɛ n' ho, 
Nda a ɔrennsan mmba bio n',
Wo dɔm' kyerɛkyerɛ ma yensua
Dɔ ara afebɔɔ.

MHB 975
6 . When the breath of life is flown,
When the grace must claim its own,
Lord of life, be ours thy crown-
Life for evermore.   Amen.	 ~ 	6 
. Ber a nkwahwea etu kɔ n', 
Ber a wumaa regye nedze n',
Nkwa Wura, yɛnsoa W' ahenkyɛw n'-

MHB 976
1 . NOW the labourer’s task is o’er, 
Now the battle-day is past;
Now upon the farther shore
Lands the voyager at last:

     Father, in Thy gracious keeping 
     Leave we now Thy servant sleeping.
	 ~ 	1 . Ɔsomfo yi apon ndɛ, 
Oewie ɔko pa no ko;
Afei ɔkwantunyi no
Edu esuegya noho: 
Egya, yɛdze Wo ba a ɔada 
Hyɛ W' abaatan dɔ n-sa n' mu. 
Yɛhwɛ wusoɛr da no kwan:

MHB 976
2 . There the tears of earth are dried, 
There its hidden things are clear;
There the work of life is tried 
By a juster Judge than here.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Hɔ na hɛn nyinsuwa bɔ adze; 
Hɔ na wɔkyerɛ hɛn ase;
Hɔ na ɔsɛndzifo pa n'
Hwɛ hɛn bra nyinara mu:

MHB 976
3 . There the Shepherd, bringing home
Many a lamb forlorn and strayed,
Shelters each, no more to roam,
Where the wolf can ne’er invade. 
	 ~ 	3 
. Hɔ na Guanhwɛfo no dze 
Nguambaa no a wɔayew ba fie,
Ɔkora hɔn wɔ bea a
Pataku n' nnkotum aba:

MHB 976
4 . There the penitents who turn
To the cross their dying eyes,
All the love of Christ shall learn
At His feet in paradise.  
	 ~ 	4   
. Hɔn a ɔasakyer wɔ ha, 
Na wɔhwɛ mbeamudua no n',
Wohu Jesus dɔ n' kɛse
Wɔ Ne nkyɛn wɔ Paradise:

MHB 976
5 . There no more the powers of hell
Can prevail to mar their peace;
Christ the Lord shall guard them well,
He Who died for their release.
	 ~ 	5 
. Hɔ na sum mu etumfo 
Nsa nnkɛka ara da;
Ewuradze Christ bɔweɔn hɔn,
Ɔno a owui gyee hɔn nkwa:

MHB 976
6 . Earth to earth, and dust to dust!
Calmly now the words we say;
Left behind, we wait in trust
For the resurrection day. 	 ~ 	6 
. Fa nkɔ fam', n-so nkɔ nsom'! 
Yɛhyɛ dzen na yɛka yi;
Hɛn so yɛdze enyidar

MHB 977
1 . SAFE home, safe home in port!
Rent cordage, shattered deck,
Torn sails, provisions short,
And only not a wreck;
But oh! the joy upon the shore
To tell our voyage perils o’er!
	 ~ 	1 . YEEDU fie mpoano sɔnn,
Ntaampee homa tsewee,
'Bradaa tsewee, edziban
Sae, naaso hɛn no ammbɔ;
Engyigye a ɔbaa mpoano hɔ a!
Ber a yɛkaa akwantu mu nsɛm.
Ɔhen n' apepa nyinsuwa nyina.

MHB 977
2 . The prize, the prize secure!
The athlete nearly fell;
Bare all he could endure,
And bare not always well;
But he may smile at troubles gone
Who sets the victor-garland on.
	 ~ 	2 
. Yeenya 'mpirenyimadze !
Nkyɛ enguantunyi n' rohwe ase;
Ɔfaa ɔhaw nyina mu,
Ɔammfa n' ho tɔtrɔtɔ :
Nyia ɔbɔ konyim abɔtsir no
Serew ber a ɔhaw etwa m' no.

MHB 977
3 . No more the foe can harm:
No more of leaguered camp,
And cry of night alarm,
And need of ready lamp;
And yet how nearly he had failed
How nearly had that foe prevailed!
 	 ~ 	3 
. 'Tamfo n' nntum nnyɛ hwee bio,
Ɔnnkɔtoa hɛn nseraban,
'Nafua ntseam' nnyi hɔ bio,
Yennkehia ɔweɔn kandzea;
Naaso nkyɛ ɔreyɛ ahwe ase,
Nkyɛ ɔtamfo n' reyɛ edzi nyim.

MHB 977
4 . The exile is at home:
O nights and days of tears,
O longings not to roam,
O sins and doubts and fears;
What matters now grief’s darkest day?
The King has wiped those tears away.	 ~ 	4 
. Ndɔmmumnyi n' edu fie:
'Nafua na adzekyee osu a !
Yɛmmpɛ ekyinkyin bio !
Bɔn, 'kyingye, na suro a.
Awerɛhow sum no yɛ ebɛn?

MHB 978
1 . WHEN our heads are bowed with woe,
When our bitter tears o’erflow,
When we mourn the lost, the dear,
Jesu, Son of David, hear. 
 	 ~ 	1 . Ber a mbusu abrɛ hɛn adze, 
Ber a hɛn nyinsu abor do;
Yerigyam dɔfo a ɔayew n',
Jesu, Mary Ba, tsie hɛn.
Jesu, Mary Ba, tsie hɛn.

MHB 978
2 . When the heart is sad within
With the thought of all its sin,
When the spirit shrinks with fear,
Jesu, Son of David, hear. 
	 ~ 	2 
. Ber a hɛn akoma ridzi yaw, 
Wɔ no bɔn ho adwen ntsi,
Ber a suro ekitsa hɛn n',
Jesu, Mary Ba, tsie hɛn.

MHB 978
3 . Thou our throbbing flesh hast worn,
Thou our mortal griefs hast borne,
Thou hast shed the human tear;
Jesu, Son of David, hear. 
 	 ~ 	3  
. 'Wo abyɛ hɛn honam yi bi. 
'Wo asoa hɛn yaw nyina,
'Wo esu dɛ nyimpa pɛn,
Jesu, Mary Ba, tsie hɛn.

MHB 978
4 . Thou hast bowed the dying head,
Thou the blood of life hast shed,
Thou hast filled a mortal bier;
Jesu, Son of Mary, hear. 	 ~ 	4  
. 'Wo abɔ Wo tsir adze ewu, 
'Wo ekyi n-kwa bɔgya,
'Wo ada fundaka mu,

MHB 979
1 . OUR Father, by whose servants
Our house was built of old,
Whose hand hath crowned her children
With blessing manifold,
For thine unfailing mercies
far-strewn along our way,
with all who passed before us, 
we praise Thy Name to-day.
 	 ~ 	1 . HƐN Egya a tsetseber no
W'asomfo sii dan yi,
Ɔwo a Wo nsamu nhyira pii
Dze egu Wo mba do.
W'ehumbɔbɔr a ɔnnsa da n'
Akyerɛ wɔ hɛn kwan do.
Yɛnye hɔn a woedzi hɛn kan
Yi Wo dzin ayɛw ndɛ.
Dze yi Wo dzin ayɛw.

MHB 979
2 . The changeful years unresting
Their silent course have sped, 
New comrades ever bringing
In comrades’ steps to tread;
And some are long forgotten,
Long spent their hopes and fears;
Safe rest they in thy keeping, 
Who changest not with years.
	 ~ 	2 
. Nsakyer mfe a onngyina da n'
Dze twitwi etwa m' dzinn;
Mfɛfo dze afofor so
Rebɛka fɛkuw n' ho:
Hɛn werɛ efir binom,
Hɔn 'nyidar hɔn suro so,
Ɔwo a ennsesa da no
Wɔrohom wɔ Wo mu.

MHB 979
3 .  They reap not where they labored;
We reap what they have sown;
Our harvest may be garnered
By ages yet unknown.
The days of old have dowered us
With gifts beyond all praise;
Our Father, make us faithful
To serve the coming days.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Wommbu hɔn berɛ mu aba,
Yebu dza woedua no;
Hɛn ndɔbaa dze wobobu n'
Wɔ mfe a yennyae nnhunii m'!
Tsetse mba dze akyɛdze pii a
Yenntum nnkamfo ama hɛn;
Hɛn Egya, ma yɛnsom wɔ nda a
Ɔreba n' nokwar mu.

MHB 979
4 . Before us and beside us,
Still holden in thine hand
A cloud unseen of witness,
Our elder comrades stand:
One family unbroken,
We join, with one acclaim, 
One heart, one voice uplifting,
To glorify Thy Name.	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn enyim na hɛn nkyɛn nyina
'Da ho kura hɛn Wo nsamu,
Adasefo mununkum a
Yennhu hɔn gyina hɔ :
Yɛyɛ ebusua kortsee,
Yɛbɔ m' dze osebɔ,
Dze akoma kor na ndze kor

MHB 98
1 . THOU hidden Source of calm repose,
Thou all-sufficient Love Divine,
My help and refuge from my foes,
Secure I am, if Thou art mine:
And lo! from sin, and grief, and shame,
I hide me, Jesus, in Thy name.
	 ~ 	1 . ƆWO a ahomgye nyina fir Wo,
Nyame Dɔ a ɔso 'biara do,
Mo mboa na mo guandɔbea nye W',
Meyɛ Wodze a, mowɔ ahotɔ: 
Mifi bɔn, yaw na enyito mu,
Jesus, musuma Wo dzin mu.

MHB 98
2 . Thy mighty name salvation is,
And keeps my happy soul above;
Comfort it brings, and power, and peace,
And joy, and everlasting love:
To me, with Thy dear name, are given
Pardon, and holiness, and heaven.
	 ~ 	2 . Wo dzin kɛse no yɛ nkwagye, 
Ɔma me kra sor enyigye;
Ɔma minya awerɛkyekyer,
Asomdwee, dɛw na onnyiewiei dɔ;
Wo dzin a ɔsom bo no ma me
Fakyɛ na krɔnkrɔn na sor.

MHB 98
3 . Jesus, my all in all Thou art;
My rest in toil, my ease in pain,
The medicine of my broken heart,
In war my peace, in loss my gain,
My smile beneath the tyrant’s frown,
In shame my glory and my crown:
	 ~ 	3 . Jesus, eyɛ m'adze nyina;
Me berɛ ne yaw mu ahomgye,
M'akoma a ebubu n'edur,
Ɔko mu na minya asomdwee,
Wɔhyɛ mo do a, ema meserew;
M'enyiwu enyimnyam nye Wo.

MHB 98
4 . In want my plentiful supply,
In weakness my almighty power,
In bonds my perfect liberty,
My light in Satan’s darkest hour,
In grief my joy unspeakable,
My life in death, my heaven in hell.	 ~ 	4 . Me hia mu ema me mbordo,
Me mberɛw mu eyɛ m'ahoɔdzen ,
Mo mpokyerɛ m' ema m' fahodzi;
Satan no sum mu ema m' kan,
Minya dɛw wɔ awerɛhow mu,
Minya nkwa 'wu m', me hɛll dan heaven.

MHB 980
1 . O LIGHT, from age to age the same,
O ever-living Word,
Here have we felt Thy kindling flame,
Thy voice within have heard.
	 ~ 	1 . KAN a ifi tsetse 'nnsakyer,
O Asɛm tseasefo,
Yɛatse Wo gy aa asɔ ne nka,
Yɛatse Wo ndze hɛn mu.
Hɔn nye su nyina mu pɔn.

MHB 980
2 . Here holy thought and hymn and prayer
Have winged the Spirit’s powers,
And made these walls divinely fair,
Thy temple, Lord, and ours.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Adwen krɔnkrɔn, ndwom nye mpaabɔ
Dze Sunsum tum aba,
Ama fasu yi ayɛ fɛw,
Hɛn na Ɔwo hɛn asɔrfi.

MHB 980
3 . What visions rise above the years;
What tender memories throng,
Till the eye fills with happy tears,
The heart with happy song.
	 ~ 	3 
. Nyikyerɛ bi a ɔba mfe no mu a!
Nkaakaa pa bi a ɔba a!
Kɛpem dɛ enyiwa dze dɛw su
Ma akoma tow ndwom dɛw m'.

MHB 980
4 . Vanish the mists of time and sense;
They come, the loved of yore,
And one encircling providence
Holds all for evermore.
	 ~ 	4 
. Mber na ntseasee mu bɔw tu kɔ;
Adɔfo a woetwa m' ba;
Na adom kor a etwa hɛn ho ehyia
Kura hɔn nyina m' afebɔɔ.

MHB 980
5 . O not in vain their toil who wrought
To build faith’s freer shrine;
Nor theirs whose steadfast love and thought
Have watched the fire divine.

. Burn, holy Fire, and shine more wide!
While nations rise and fall,
Faith, hope, and charity abide,
The heart and soul of all.	 ~ 	5 
. Hɔn a wɔberɛɛ toow gyedzi fapem
No ammberɛ kwa ara da;
Dɛmara so na hɔn a wɔdze
Dɔ weɔɔn sor ogya n' yɛe!

MHB 981
1 . CHRIST is the foundation
Of the house we raise;
Be its walls salvation,
And its gateways praise:
May its threshold lowly
To the Lord be dear;
May the hearts be be holy
That shall worship here.
	 ~ 	1 . CHRIST nye ofi yi a
Yesi yi fapem;
N'afasu nyɛ nkwagye
N'apon ayɛyi;
Na ma n'apongua yi
Nsom bo mma Ewuradze;
Ma akoma a wɔsom ha
No mu nyɛ krɔnkrɔn.
Hɔn nyina Ewuradze.   Amen.

MHB 981
2 . Here the vow be sealèd
By Thy Spirit,Lord;
Here the sick be healèd,
And the lost restored;
Here the broken-hearted
Thy forgiveness prove;
	 ~ 	2 
. Ewuradze, Wo Sunsum
Nsɔw anohoba ano;
'Yarfo mbɔ esu wɔ ha,
Wonhu hɔn a wɔayew;
Ha na akoma a abobɔ
Nnya Wo bɔnfakyɛ;
'Nyɛnkofo a wɔatsetsew m'
Nka mbɔ m' bio wɔ ɔdɔ m'.

MHB 981
3 . Here the friends long parted
Be restored to love.
Here may every token
Of Thy presence be;
Here may   chains be broken,
Prisoners here set free;
Here may light illumine
Every soul of Thine,
Lifting up the human
Into the divine.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma Wo ho nsɛnkyerɛdze
Nyina nda edzi;
Ha mpokyerɛ mbubu,
'Daduafo nkɔ kwa;
Ha ma ekan nhyerɛn
Wɔ kra biara do,
Ompegya adasa
Nkɔ Sunsum no mu.

MHB 981
4 . Here may God the Father,
Christ the Saviour-Son,
With the Holy Spirit,
Be adored as One;
Till the whole creation
At Thy footstool fall,
And in adoration
Own Thee Lord of all.     Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Ha wɔntonton Egya,
Christ, Ɔba, Agyenkwa n',
Ɔnye Sunsum Krɔnkrɔn n';
Dɛ wɔyɛ adze kor;
Kɛpem dɛ abɔdze nyina
Bɔhwe W'ananadze,
Na wɔɔatonton Wo dɛ

MHB 982
1 . FATHER of men, in Whom are one
All humankind beneath Thy sun,
Stablish our work in Thee begun.
Except the house be built of Thee,
In vain the builder’s toil must be:
O strengthen our infirmity.
	 ~ 	1 . EGYA, Wo mu na adasamba a
Wɔwɔ wiadze nyina bɔm' yɛ kor,
Ma dwuma a yɛahyɛ ase Wo mu ntsim.
Sɛ woara ennsi dan no a
Adansifo no berɛ kwa;
Hyɛ hɛn dzen hɛn mberɛwyɛ mu !
Nhɛn sor fɛkuwbɔ mu afebɔ.   Amen.

MHB 982
2 . Man lives not for himself alone,
In others’ good he finds his own.
Life’s worth in fellowship is known.
We, friends and comrades on life’s way,
Gather within these walls to pray:
Bless Thou our fellowship to-day.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Nyimpa nntse ase mma no nko ho,
Ɔwɔ dɛw wɔ nkorɔfo yie ho;
Fɛkuwbɔ m' na yehu ɔbra pa.
Hɛn bra yi mu anyɛnkofo
Hyia dan yi mu ha yɛbɔ mpaa;
Hyira hɛn fɛkuwbɔ do ndɛ.

MHB 982
3 . O Christ, our Elder Brother, who
By serving man God’s will didst do,
Help us to serve our brethren, too.
Guide us to seek the things above,
The base to shun, the pure approve,
To live by Thy free law of love.
 	 ~ 	3 
. O Christ, hɛn Nua panyin, Ɔwo a
Esoom nyimpa, yɛɛ Nyame N' pɛ,
Boa ma hɛn so nsom hɛn nuanom.
Gya hɛn ma yentsiw sor ndzɛmba,
Yengyaa adzehun, mpɛ ndzepa.
Yɛntsena ase Wo dɔ mbra mu.

MHB 982
4 . In all our work, in all our play,
Be with us, Lord, our Friend, our Stay;
Lead onward to the perfect day:
Then may we know, earth’s lesson o’er,
With comrades missed or gone before,
Heaven’s fellowship for evermore.
		Amen.	 ~ 	4 
. Hɛn dwumadzi na agor nyina m',
Hɛn Wura, hɛn Nyɛnko, yɛ hɛn ahom;
Dzi hɛn enyim kan kɔ da pa n' mu :
Ber n' ma yenhu dɛ ɔbra abɔ adze,
Yɛnye mfɛfo a woedzi hɛn kan,

MHB 983
1 . Be with us, gracious Lord, to-day;
This house we dedicate to Thee:
O hear Thy servants as they pray,
And let Thine ear attentive be!
	 ~ 	1 . KA hɛn nkyɛn ndɛ, adom Ewuradze;
Yetu ofi yi si hɔ ma Wo;
Tsie Wo nkowaa ber a yɛrosɔr yi,
Na ma W'asowa mbra hɛn do.
Na ha nyɛ ɔsor abobow.

MHB 983
2 . Within these walls let holy peace,
Let love and truth be always found;
May burdened hearts and sweet release,
And souls with richest grace be crowned.
 	 ~ 	2 
. Ma wonhu asomdwee krɔnkrɔn,
Dɔ na nokwar wɔ ha daa daa;
Ma akoma berɛfo ahomgye;
Na esiarfo n' soa hɔn ahenkyɛw.

MHB 983
3 . May here be heard the suppliant’s sigh,
The weary enter into rest;
Here may the contrite to Thee cry,
And waiting souls be richly blessed.
	 ~ 	3 
. Ma wontsie ebisafo nkrumsi,
Na aberɛfo so nya ahomgye;
Ma abrɛfo nsu mfrɛ Wo wɔ ha,
Na hɔn a wɔtweɔn n' nnya nhyira.

MHB 983
4 . Here when the gospel sound is heard,
And here proclaimed the saving name,
May hearts be quickened, moved and stirred,
And souls be kindled into flame.
	 ~ 	4 
. 'Ha, wɔtse asɛmpa n' ne nka
Na wɔbɔ nkwagye dzin no a,
Ma akoma mbɔ hyew nkɔ hɔn kan
Na akra nkyer gya n' ne mframee.

MHB 983
5 . Here may the dead be made to live,
The dumb to sing, the deaf to hear;
And do Thou to the humble give
Pardon and peace instead of fear.
	 ~ 	5 
. 'Ha wɔmma ewufo nnya nkwa bio,
Mum nkasa, etsitsifo ntse asɛm,
Na mbrɛhoadzefo mma hɔn
Fakyɛ na asomdwee a suro nnyi m'.

MHB 983
6 . Make this, O Lord, Thine own abode;
Thy presence in these courts be given;
Be this, indeed, the house of God,
And this in truth the gate of Heaven.	 ~ 	6 
. Ma iyi nyɛ Woara W'atsenae,
Ma W'enyim no nka abangua yi m',
Ma iyi nyɛ Nyame Ne fie

MHB 984
1 . O THOU Whose hand hath brought us
Unto this joyful day,
Accept our glad thanksgiving,
And listen as we pray;
And may our preparation
For this day’s service be
With one accord to offer
Ourselves, O Lord, to Thee.
	 ~ 	1 . O ƆWO a Wo nsa dze hɛn
Aba dɛw da yi mu,
Gye hɛn enyigye ndaase yi,
Tsie hɛn, ber a yɛsɔr no;
Na ma ndɛ da yi som ho
Ahoboa a yɛyɛe no,
Ntu hɛnho nyina, pɛ kor mu,
Mma Wo, O Ewuradze.

MHB 984
2 . For this Thy house we praise Thee,
Reared at Thine own command,
For every generous spirit,
And every willing hand;
And now within Thy temple
Thy glory let us see,
For all its strength and beauty
Are nothing without Thee.
	 ~ 	2 
. Dan a yɛnam W'asɛm do esi
Yi, yeyi W'ayɛw wɔ
Ayamuyie ndzeyɛɛ pa
Na mboa a yenyae nyina ho;
Afei W'asɔrfi yi mu,
Ma yenhu W'enyimnyam,
'Siandɛ Ɔwo nnyi mu a ne fɛw
Na ne kɛse nnyɛ hwee.

MHB 984
3 . And oft as here we gather,
And hearts in worship blend,
May truth reveal its power,
And fervent prayers ascend;
Here may the busy toiler
Rise to the things above;
The young, the old, be strengthened,
And all men learn Thy love.
 	 ~ 	3 
. Ber a yehyia ha biara,
Na akoma bɔ mu som n',
Ma nokwar nda no tum edzi,
Na mpaa dzendzen mfow sor;
'Ha na ma nkukubɔnyi
Nnyan nhwehwɛ dza ɔkrɔn,
Mbofra, mpanyin nnya ahoɔdzen 
Na nyimpa nsua Wo dɔ.

MHB 984
4 . And as the years roll onward,
And strong affections twine,
And tender memories gather
About this sacred shrine,
May this its chief distinction,
Its glory, ever be,
That multitudes within it
Have found their way to Thee.
	 ~ 	4 
. Ber a mber pem kɔ enyim no,
Na ɔdɔ kyekyer hɛn no,
Na nkaa dɛɛdɛw soɛr dura
Bea krɔnkrɔn yi ho no,
Ma n'enyidzi kɛse no 
Nyɛ n'enyimnyam dabaa,
Dɛ dɔm a wohyia wɔ mu n'
Enya ehu Wo nkyɛn kwan.

MHB 984
5 . Lord God, our fathers’ helper,
Our joy, and hope, and stay,
Grant now a gracious earnest
Of many a coming day.
Our yearning hearts Thou knowest;
We wait before Thy throne:
O come, and by thy  presence
Make this new house Thine own.
		Amen.	 ~ 	5 
. Ewuradze, egyaam boafo,
Hɛn dɛw, 'nyidar, na tum,
Ma hɛn nda a ɔreba n' ho
Ndam na nsiyɛ ho adom,
Inyim hɛn akoma apensi;
Yɛtweɔn W'ahengua enyim :
O bra, na ewɔ ha no,

MHB 99
1 . HOW sweet the name of Jesus sounds
In a believer’s ear!
It soothes his sorrows, heals his wounds,
And drives away his fear.
	 ~ 	1 . Mbrɛ Jesus ne dzin dua yɛ dɛw 
Wɔ gyedzinyi asom' a!
Otu ne ya, yɛ ne yar edur,
Na otu no suro nyina.

MHB 99
2 . It makes the wounded spirit whole,
And calms the troubled breast;
’Tis manna to the hungry soul,
And to the weary rest.
	 ~ 	2 . Ɔbɔ sunsum a oepira esu, 
Na ɔdwe akoma a ɔahaw,
Edziban ma sunsum a kɔm dze n',
Ahomgye ma fonafo.

MHB 99
3 . Dear name! the Rock on which I build,
My Shield and hiding-place,
My never-failing treasury filled
With boundless stores of grace!
	 ~ 	3 . Dzin pa! Botan a motow do, 
Me kyɛm na mo sumabew,
M' egyapadze a ɔmmpa da,
Adom na ɔahyɛ n' ma!

MHB 99
4 . Jesus, my Shepherd, Brother, Friend,
My Prophet, Priest, and King,
My Lord, my Life, my Way, my End,
Accept the praise I bring.
	 ~ 	4 . Jesus, mo Guanhwɛfo, mo Nua 
Mo Sɔfoe na me Hen,
Mo Wura , mo Nkwa, mo Kwan, m' Ewiei,
Bra bɛgye m' ayɛyi.

MHB 99
5 . Weak is the effort of my heart,
And cold my warmest thought;
But when I see Thee as thou art,
I’ll praise Thee as I ought.
	 ~ 	5 . Mo mbɔdzembɔ ɔyɛ mberɛw, 
M' akoma yɛ wɔɔwɔw;
Na ber a m' bohu W' dɛ mbrɛ Ɔwo tse n',
M' beyi W' ayɛw dɛ mbrɛ ɔsɛ.

MHB 99
6 . Till then I would Thy love proclaim
With every fleeting breath;
And may the music of Thy name
Refresh my soul in death.	 ~ 	6 . Kɛpem da n' na m' bɛka Wo dɔ no 
Medze nkwahwea tsiabaa 'i;
Na ma Wo nsanku dzin dɛɛdɛw n'
Ɔnhom me kra wɔ wum'.     Amen.
